I can ask it to play a particular show. if the show is on Netflix it will play on Netflix, if the show is on Hulu it will play on Hulu. It pretty much knows what to do. I can ask it to pause. And then ask it to play. I can ask it to backup or skip minutes. Which is really great when I step out of the living room for the kitchen & realize I should have paused. The Dot can hear me from the other room. I can ask it to skip episodes or go back episodes. When the credits are playing at the end of the episode, I can tell it to skip to go right to the next. I have spent hours without touching my remote. It could also work my Vizio smart TV, but I decided against it, because the 4K Fire Sticks apps movies & shows look phenomenally better than the smart apps. I have also used it to set alarms. "Alexa set an alarm for 45 minutes" while I am cooking or something. It's great. You have access to all the prime music & the Dot Speaker itself is pretty good. I have Amazon unlimited, so I have access to pretty much any music you can imagine. Just ask & she shall play. Good for play music in the background while you're cleaning or something. Every morning I asked what the weather report is & I get a much more detailed report than Google ever did on my phone. If it's going to snow that day I can ask how much snow and she'll tell me. I've actually spent time sitting & asking Alexa questions. She is so knowledgeable, that you could almost have a conversation with her. Lol. If someone's over just for fun I'll ask her to tell a joke & she's set to a Jimmy Fallon joke. So Jimmy Fallon will tell one. It's cool. This thing works a million times better than I thought it would oh, and I thought it would work pretty damn good.

reviews.reviewTitle: Junk DO NOT BUY, can't handle home automation. Weakest link is the system!
reviews.reviewText: Only works when it feels like it. Everything will work from the apps. But dot just decides to not work at all, work one or two lights. Junk. Amazon needs to get these to work. Can't return so I am stuck with trash. I have automated so much of my home and spent a lot of money doing it and the dot is the weakest link. If you are going to automate your home I would not recommend using alexa at all. think it is still beta junk! Support is useless!

reviews.reviewTitle: It can't call 911, which makes it worthless.
reviews.reviewText:
I called Amazon before ordering. Couldn't get a straight answer. Now it's here, and it can't call 911. That's the only thing I cared about. Anything else it can do is worthless. If I'm not injured, my phone can already do everything this can except the smart home crap, and seriously, people are too lazy to push a button?? This could have been life saving tech and it isn't unless you have a landline or VOIP and yet another gadget to connect. I am so disgusted with this thing!
I am looking into the VOIP thing and the connect gadget, but the level of complication, cost, and inconvenience makes this completely unsuitable for many seniors and leaves me wondering why this crippled tech is so popular in the first place. Clearly intended for people who love to talk out loud to inanimate things and get a kick out of telling a robot to play music...

Took this hockey puck thing out of the box and almost immediately it began to attract dirt and dog fur. Everything just clings to it; especially the rubber bottom. Also, I'm not really sure what it's supposed to do. It didn't come with any instructions so it's basically what it looks like, a hockey puck.
After leaving this review Amazon contacted me immediately to basically tell me I had no idea what I was talking about and push just how great their product is. It's not. Even Amazon doesn't think very highly of this thing. After I paid $50 for it they're basically giving it away now! I feel like I've been scammed!

Improvement over Dot 2? I guess.
It's louder, but in an effort to provide more bass they made it sound muffled.

You would think a large company spending millions of dollars on a project would hire audiophiles that can tell whether this thing is ready for market or not.

They need to put an EQ in the app so we can set these things up to preference.

I love the form factor and the mics are working well, but the sound makes me feel like I'm going deaf.

I have a $12 Bluetooth speaker that sounds better.
I own 7 Alexa speakers, so I do like the product, but I have to hook up my computer speakers to it to use this one.

Also, I can't use this one in my car like I do my Dot 2 because of the new power plug they put on it. I can't plug it into USB to power it and I also can't hook it up to my portable battery power booster to carry it around the house anymore so I have to use my old Dot 2 for that.

Amazon, listen to your customers!!!

Thursday Jan.3, 2019 a few days after this review posted....
I just found out that the Alexa app has an EQ now that I didn't know about.
It could have more adjustments and more gain, but now at least I can make it sound less muddy so I'm happier now.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love the sound quality and nee look of this version
reviews.reviewText:
Great sound from such a small device. Location selection can make a huge difference in sound quality and voice recognition. Placing near a wall / metal objects can cause echoes which can confuse alexa or distort the sound quality.
Some apps are great. Others need improvement. Depends what you are using the smart device for and the product support associated with the external device.
Voice recognition works great, even with kids still learning to speak. Our little one is able to request his favorite children's song without a problem

reviews.reviewTitle: Bad distortion after playing for few minutes
reviews.reviewText:
I own 1st generation Echo and Tap and decided to give this a try to use in other rooms.
I was able to play from Amazon Music with no issue. However, there was a bad static after a few minutes of playing music. I reset it by unplugging it and plugging in back on and the distortion went away for a few minutes but came back again.
Also paired it with my phone via bluetooth and played music from iTunes. Same problem, after few minutes, there was bad distortion.

reviews.reviewerName: The Shopper Formerly Known as R. Seward
reviews.reviewText:
This is defiantly an upgrade from the 2nd gen. Echo Dot, both aesthetically and technically. The sound quality is much improved, enough so that it could be adequate as a speaker for small spaces such as a bathroom, office, or small bedroom, but it's still not going to blow you away or anything. That said, most people buying a Dot aren't looking for a "music player" and probably plan to pair it with a more capable speaker.
I can't really comment on how it's improved in any other ways, as I haven't done any comparison's other than the obvious mentioned above; but, it works as expected and I'm happy with my purchase.

reviews.reviewTitle: THE APP YOU NEED IS NOT READILY AVAILABLE.
reviews.reviewText: THE AMAZON DOT APP IS NOT READILY AVAILABLE FROM AMAZON.. YOU WILL HAVE TO SEARCH YOUR WINDOWS 10 SYSTEM OR FIND SOMETHING FOR YOUR MAC.. YOU CAN JOIN AND PAY A WEBSITE THAT MAKES THEIR LIVING SHOWING YOU HOW TO USE THE DOT AND THEY WILL LET YOU DOWNLOAD THE SOFTWARE FOR THE DOT FOR PC OR MAC.. THE APP FOR THIS SHOULD BE ON AMAZON & TAKE ABOUTR 1 MINUTE TO DOWNLOAD AND IN 5 MINUTES OR LESS YOU SHOULD BE UP AND RUNNING.. i WILL NOT JOIN OR PAY A SPECIAL WEBSITE TO GIVE ME THE APP AND SHOW ME HOW TO USE THIS DOT.. THIS SHOUD ALL BE FREE ON AMAZON. I WILL ALSO NOT SPEND 1/2 AN HOUR ON THE PHONE WITH AN AMAZON EXPERT JUST TO DOWNLOAD THE APP AND BE INSTRUCTED ON WHAT TO DO NEXT.. THIS ANOTHER POOR PRODUCT FROM AMAZON THAT IS CONFUSING & FRUSTRATING FOR THE CONSUMER, BUT MAKES A LOT OF MONEY FOR AMAZON..

Alexa didn't responded when ask for simple command, even the ones on instruction. I will say Alexa .... the light will come on, in a second it will turn off. or I will give the command super fast before the unit when to sleep mode.. and no respond. very frustrating to deal with this crap. I send it back. if you want to get frustrated, then buy this unit.

Gen 3 has problems. I had received a Gen 2 from a neighbor as a birthday gift. Something I didn't know I needed and I love having Alexa answer questions, give me the news, play music, etc. Now, Gen 2 came with problems since it was a gift. Somehow it stopped working because amazon thought it was stolen (although they never came out and told me that) and it took the neighbor to straighten it out. As a long-time customer of amazon, it was the first time I've ever had problems with amazon.

Anyway, we enjoyed having the dot that I kept in my bedroom since that's where my home office is located. When I saw the Gen 3 on sale, I decided to purchase one. I moved the Gen 2 to the front room where my husband could enjoy music, ask questions, etc.

At first, the Gen 3 was great. Loved everything about it and it worked fine. Then the speaker started to sound muffled. Alexa sounded like she had a lisp (sorry for those reading this who have lisps). Then the news briefing would give the weather, announce the next story and stop. After talking with support, I sent it back and ordered a replacement, which I was assured would not have the speaker problems or lapse in stopping during news briefings. I received the replacement, set it up, and guess what! Although the speaker seemed ok, the news briefings stopped working. Contacted support and was told it needed an update that would take 3-5 hours! OK. Update took place (in the background so I didn't have to do anything). It started working and all was good with the world (well actually we know not all is good with the world, but all was good with the world of Alexa in our bedroom.

Guess what started happening again? Yep, Alexa will tell the weather then will stop. I go into the other room to hear my news briefing. This morning it didn't work, I tried again just now and it gave me one story after the news (an update). It's just not right and I would not recommend purchasing Gen 3 until amazon gets these bugs straightened out. Gen 2 never had these problems. I guess an updated product is not necessarily a better product.

I said I was not going to call support again, but why should I pay for something that does not work as it should?

Much improvement over the last gen in sound quality. I currently own 5 different echo devices and use the dot for the bathroom but the second gen was a little underwhelming during a shower. But, that is no longer an issue. Now if we can just get some decent 3rd party wall or socket mounts for this thing and I'll be set.

reviews.reviewTitle: Is being too smart a good thing?
reviews.reviewText:
I ordered the 3-pack Echo Dot Gen 3. When setting up the first one, I plugged it in and the blue ring lighted up for a minute and it announced that the setup was complete. I tried a few commands and they total worked. I was a bit spooked, because I did not get to use my Alexa app to set up wifi for the Dot, including typing in my network password, and it just did find the network and got in by itself! More spooking thing was that when I looked at Alexa app on my iPhone, it shows 3 new Echo Dots, all following the naming convention of my other two Echo Dots (2nd Gen) and the Echo (2nd Gen) without me even touching the Alexa app at that point; yet, all of them showing that they are "offline", including the one that had already been set up and working to my commands; the information such as time zone was missing, and network information was also missing. It also knows my exact address, instead of just my internet provider's location as in the case for my Echo Dot 2nd Gen and the Echo. I think somehow my order information (with shipping address) got programmed into the Echo Dot 3rd Gen, but the way it "automatically" connected to my wifi without password really concerns me - I hope Amazon would see this and provide me with a logical answer.

On the product itself, I love the Echo Dot 3rd Gen - it looks bigger, cooler, and the sound is much better than that from the 2nd Gen Dot, and even on par with that from the 2nd Gen Echo. I am totally satisfied with the product, but just hope it won't get too smart in certain areas, like the one I mentioned above.

reviews.reviewTitle: Hopefully the Dot 3 is just having growing pains
reviews.reviewText:
The good news is the internal speaker is listenable, not bad even considering the size. Compared to the Dot 2 the speaker is light years ahead. Aesthetically, the 3 is 10x more appealing than the 2. It feels substantial, not plastic-y. Microphone-wise, I am not seeing much difference between the 3’s far field 4 mikes and the 2’s seven mikes...call it even. The bad news is, at least for me, the Bluetooth connection to external speakers is (was) waaaaayyyyy buggy. I tried it with a Bose Sound Dock equipped with a Bluetooth 30 pin converter and a regular Bluetooth speaker both of which functioned flawlessly with the Dot 2 right out of the box. The 3 had a terrible Bluetooth connection. So much so that I ended up calling Amazon for help. Annalise was great BTW...we ended up resetting the 3 and that seems to have fixed the issue...but then it made my WiFi smart plug start acting buggy...I fixed that on my lonesome.

Once you get past the tin-foil hat aspect of having this thing listening to every word, it’s a freaking cool concept and the 3 elevates the sound game exponentially over the 2. For $24 on Prime Alexa sale it’s near the price of a stand alone alarm clock radio and is infinitely more useful. Once the bugs get worked out I think I’ll love this thing. An added bonus is if I say Echo, murder, blood...the cops should be here quicker than a 911 call ;)

Don't get me wrong, the Echo's are truly helpful and enjoyable. We no longer have to write things on lists as we think of them. Just speak and say "Alexa, add celery (or whatever) to the Shopping List." And, we have numerous lists for the farm supply store, builder supply list, club shopping list, and so on. When cooking, or washing clothes, or whatever just say "Alexa, set a timer for 15 minutes." "Alexa, what time is it?" "Alexa, what's the temperature." "Alexa, dining room lamp on." The benefits of these abilities are super.
What's not super, is having numerous echos responding either when you're calling on one or having them respond to each time "Alexa" is spoken on a computer or television. Just now, I was watching demonstrations on my computer and having to constantly say cancel to the Echo in my study. It's an endless aggravation, and it's one that Amazon could easily correct. BUT, THEY WON'T!
I have at least six Echos and one Echo Show in my home. All respond to "Alexa"! Yes, I could have them reply to Amazon, Computer or Echo, but how long will it take me to learn & remember which I've named which, and why should I have to stop each time to consider the specific name of the one I want to communicate with. If Amazon could get over their pride, vanity or whatever you want to call their proprietary philosophy, they could change the software to allow us to give custom names to each of the devices we've bought and paid for. In my case, the Show in the kitchen would be Kitty, the master bedroom would be Betty, the basement would be Bessie, the front porch (by the rockers) would be Roxie, and so forth.
Yes, we absolutely love having them (and I'm contemplating getting the newest version of the Echo Show as I type), but this inconvenience is sufficient to reduce my 5 star rating by 3 stars. You decide for yourself.

Cons
Unpacking was a pain. The plastic wrapped around it too LOTS of effort to remove.
Sound is like it’s coming through a tube. I can’t inderstand what is fully being said, that’s how bad it is. It KNOWS your previous WiFi password (if your upgrading) a little unsettling. I have the same issues as I had with 2nd Gen.
yes you’ll need to unplug for 10 sec. and plug back in for it to reboot, hopefully wo kinks.
Pros, it looks nicer.
IMO NOT worth it, move along and stick w the previous version. Mine is going Back!

I ordered two of these. I plugged the first one in and sunk it up with my Wifi and was eager to see how it worked. the voice commands DO NOT WORK! If you hit the work button on top it works and responds to questions and commands.... but just standing in the room and sayin "Alexa" doesn't work...… Hooked up the second one and the same results.... not satisfied at all.

reviews.reviewTitle: Stereo pairing feature incomplete, otherwise a good device
reviews.reviewText:
The sound is definitely improved over previous generations, and is downright good at this point. The SmartThings integration is likewise very good - I can control pretty much everything through Alexa, and the setup was easy and well documented.

“Computer, turn off the living room” and off go the lights, TV and Christmas tree. Brilliant.

The grouping is excellent - whole home audio is here, and it’s great. (Drawback of stereo feature below also applies here, though.). Just make sure the Dots are in Bluetooth range of each other.

I’m disappointed in the stereo pairing though, and this could be a deal breaker for you. So first, it sounds great, when it works. Amazon and streaming content sound so much better with stereo pairing. Synchronization is perfect, and this really adds to the experience. BUT, it seems you cannot use stereo pairing with a Bluetooth connected audio source. Do you want to use stereo Echo Dots as your Bluetooth computer speakers? Nope. The sound only comes through one Dot, and the Bluetooth connection between dots is severed until you disconnect the Bluetooth audio source. Do you want to stream from a smartphone or tablet via Bluetooth and listen in stereo using 2 Dots? Not gonna work (in stereo) at the time of writing this review.

To me, this oversight/compromise almost makes it a 3 star device. I am giving it 4 as the whole home audio is quite nice, and Alexa is at the top of digital assistants in my opinion. But the stereo implementation isn’t compete.

One other negative is latency when used as a speaker for Fire TV 4K. I love my new fire TV 4K. I purchased it in a bundle with the 3rd generation Echo Dot. However, the two barely function together. The audio latency is well over half a second, so the picture is totally out of sync with the audio. Big drawback.

In summary, use your Echo Dot as a mini smart home assistant. It sounds great, and functions very well as a smart home assistant. The whole home audio feature is great so far. “Computer, play Christmas music downstairs” and it’s an instant winter wonderland in here. But I would not recommend attempting to use this as a Bluetooth speaker for a video device due to the latency issues. Likewise, be aware of the limitations with stereo pairing.

reviews.reviewTitle: The Echo dot is OK for the price, but the Echo is 100X better.
reviews.reviewText:
I've been using the Echo dot and the Echo for about 3-weeks now. Everyone talks about the difference in the speakers and sound quality, so I'll leave that out of this review. What I want people to know is that the Echo is much better than the Echo Dot even though the Dot is 1/3 the price. I say this because the Echo Dot has a low-quality microphone. This is probably one of the ways they were able to reduce the price. Consider this:

1. Responsiveness: I have the Dot in my room and the Echo in the living room. More often than not, when I say "Alexa" the Echo in the living room will respond while the Dot does nothing. Because of this, I had to change the wake word for my Dot. There are also times where I have to repeatedly try to wake my Dot because it just doesn't hear me. On the other hand, the Echo can hear me while I'm in the bathroom with the door closed.

2. Understanding: A lot of times I'll clearly (and loudly) tell my Dot to do something, but it thinks I said something else. The Echo sometimes does this too, but the Dot does it much more frequently.

I like the Dot overall, but if I could go back in time I would buy another Echo on monthly payments instead. It's just not worth the frustration of having to repeatedly yell at this hockey puck to get it to do something.

reviews.reviewTitle: This thing is whack - 2nd generation wasn't crazy
reviews.reviewText: Everything I play on this device, now plays on all my other devices. I can't get it to play ONLY on the Dot. I scared the heck out of my roommate this morning when my alarm went off on the Dot AND on the Show that's in my family room. I previously had the 2nd gen - I'm going to plug that one back in and return this piece of garbage. (FYI I've also been on "chat" with the tech department for about 30 minutes... they keep asking me the same things I already answered... they must be AI also and not real humans.... shame on you Amazon)

reviews.reviewTitle: Very disappointing compared to previous models
reviews.reviewText:
I have 2 original echo dots, a first gen Echo and a second gen Echo and this is by far the worst. The microphone pickups are terrible. When I asked Alexa a question to this 3rd gen dot from 8 feet away it does not hear the question, yet the 2nd gen Echo in a bedroom with the door closed can hear me and does answer? This Dot replaced the 1st gen Echo that was placed 20 feet away in the kitchen and had no problem hearing and responding.

Did the race to the bottom on costs lead to cheaper inferior microphones? I see there are only four on this one.

I was at the point of returning device until I called Amazon for help when unable to connect echo dot, after speaking with Kate , who walk me through the process of setting my echo dot up I am very satisfied with product now. A special thank you to Kate for being patient and helping me set my echo dot up and connecting it to my wifi. Hope to enjoy using echo dot more during this day.

Great improvement over the 2nd generation echo dot. The look and feel is a huge improvement, it feels sturdy and it looks amazing. It definitely is a bit bigger then the older gen but for good reason. Sound quality is amazing and so much louder. I had my 2nd gen connected to a small external speaker via the AUX port because you could barely hear it. This version is loud and sounds so good that the speaker is not needed. Response is just as fast as the previous generation when using the wake word. I did notice that the light has a slight delay compared to the 2nd gen when using the wake word but the light has no effect on alexa actually hearing you. Still responds and hears what you say with zero issues. This version is definitely a good buy and I'm very impressed with it.

reviews.reviewTitle: I have many different Echo's and the Dot Sucks!!
reviews.reviewText: Sound quality is poor and music can sound distorted. Also, many times it does not even respond to a command. My other echos can hear "hey alexa" from far away this dot many times doesn't respond unless I am within less than 10 feet. I'd return the thing if I hadn't already missed the return window.

reviews.reviewTitle: Known Amazon software bug with Dot and Alexa app
reviews.reviewText:
I purchased 2 of these last week. I went through the entire set up process (as I did with my Echo; that went flawlessly) on one of these and, in the Alexa app (iphone), the Dot kept showing "offline". However, the Dot actually processed voice commands.

I did inet research and see that this is a very longstanding issue with the Dot. So, Amazon has known this for quite some time.

I spent 45 mins this morning with Amazon support having me go through all the steps I did for hours last night. At the end of 45 mins, the rep said "this is a known issue and will be fixed within 48 hours".

Now, that rep should have said that from the outset. I know a software bug when I see it.

I'm giving this a low rating because 1) Amazon has let a known software bug continue through many versions of the Dot without fixing it and 2) Support wasted so much of my time instead of owning the problem up front.

I'll update this in 48 hours. We'll see if Amazon fixes their known software bug.

reviews.reviewTitle: Like talking to an automated phone system.
reviews.reviewText:
Good sound. The timer and reminders are handy when it understands you.

It is like trying to talk to an automated phone system. After 30 or more minutes of trying to select your language it moves you on to the next selection where you spend another 30 or more minutes and then have to start over or get disconnected. Makes for some funny reminders since 90% of the time Alexa mishears what your reminder is or cuts you off as you are telling it what the reminder is. Sometimes when asking to set a reminder or what the weather is it misunderstands us and thus turns on the tv or changes the channel. Thankfully the tv is the only thing connected to it.

There have been several days where it just does not work at all.

I really want to like it and want it to work. Hoping with time and updates things will improve and I can redo this review. I also hope that when she has takes over the world she does not remember the names I called her when frustrated.

I have a 2nd gen Echo Dot, a Google Home Mini and now the 3rd gen Echo Dot.

The Alexa functionality is great on both and Amazon has done a wonderful job. I like the overall design of the new version. That is where the positives end.

I actually think the sound is better on the 2nd gen Echo Dot. The 3rd gen is much louder but is still lacking in the sound quality. The sound on the 3rd gen is very flat. Listening to music is not enjoyable on the new generation Dot. My Google Home Mini has a much better sound quality and I was hoping the new device would be closer in that aspect.

I prefer the Alexa devices over the Google devices for voice commands (even though the Google devices have a better sense of humor). I use my 2nd gen Echo Dot as my daily alarm and have been very happy with it for some time.

I am not expecting great sound quality from such a small device. I can not understand why Amazon thought this was acceptable.

Amazon -- PLEASE improve the sound quality on the next version.

When I saw they had a new Echo Dot with better speakers and a new look, I was very excited. I have a couple of the Gen 2 devices and they work quite well but I wish I didn't have to pair them to a separate speaker to get high quality sound. I use Alexa to control my entertainment system and various lights and switches around the house so I thought adding a couple new models to the home would make 'her' a lot more useful. However after using the new devices a couple weeks, I've found that I don't like them nearly as much. They are louder and the sound has a lot more bass but often normal speech is very muffled. The audio settings in the app for bass and treble don't seem to do anything at all. It sounds exactly the same with the bass all the way down and treble all the way up as it does on the default, middle setting for both. It sounds a lot better for music than the Gen2 but I listen to stations like Comedy Central Radio with the SiriusXM skill and often the comedians just do not sound as clear as they do on the Gen2 devices. Even Alexa's voice itself is affected and very muffled.
I'm also disappointed with the performance of the Gen3 devices. They seem slower than the Gen2 devices. My Gen2 devices respond quickly but the Gen3 devices always stall a couple seconds before replying. It's possible the Gen3 devices are having issues decoding the voice commands which could be related to my next point..
The Gen2 had no issues hearing me most of the time but I find the Gen3 devices misunderstanding commands or more often not hearing me at all and having to yell commands to her even though I'm not far away. Quite often the Gen2 devices in other rooms will respond due to how loud I have to speak addressing the Gen3 right in front of me. It's pretty ridiculous, actually.
It's my understanding that the Gen2 devices have a 7 microphone array to hear from every angle but the Gen3 only have 4 mics. I feel this is probably why the devices do not hear as well. I bought two Gen3's and have the same issues on both of them so I don't think it's a anomaly. I feel like the audio controls can be fixed by a software update as I have no idea why the audio sliders in the app have no affect. Perhaps the 'hearing' problem can also be updated by a software patch but until those issues are addressed, I can't give the 3rd gen Dot a good review.
I've been using the Gen2 devices for about a year and have had very little problems with them. I love what they do and really hoped the Gen3 were going to be a big improvement but they're actually a step down. They sound great when playing music but when I have to yell to get it to play, (and risk one of the Gen2's over hearing and stepping up to the task) it gets a bit irritating.
I'm not going to return the Gen3's since Amazon was selling them for the same cost as the Gen2's if you bought two. I hope they will fix them with future patches, but I am going to swap them out with the Gen2's and put them in the less trafficked areas of the house for now. I really wanted to like these new Gen3's, but side by side with the Gen2's, I have to stick to the older model which easily gets 4.5 stars. Stick with those until they iron out the bugs.

I have been enjoying the Amazon Music BUT the albums and selections I selected on Amazon Music do not always play upon my request and at times some music I do not like starts playing! Also, the one Echo Dot is all I have and I only want to subscribe to the $3.99/ month option and it will not let me!

No the sound is wrong when I tell it to remind me or set a timer the light goes off but there is no volume and I’ve called Amazon twice just to try to repair it
UPDATE

As usual Amazon helped me with this one. They have sent me a replacement! Amazon you Rock!! Thank you so much!!

Disclaimer: I wound up getting this as a premium for updating my Sirius radio account, so I didn't pay for it, but it wasn't a free gift from Amazon, and it has no bearing on my impression of its quality and performance.

Never gave much thought to getting one of these things, but now that I have one, I find out that it's both fun and very useful! Only had it a week, but I'm still learning. At this point, I use it primarily to listen to SiriusXM programming and some iHeart Radio stations.

I don't expect exceptional stereo sound quality from it, as that's not the intended purpose. But it sounds just great -- plenty of volume for my needs, very clear audio. Connecting bluetooth speakers for listening in other parts of the house is effortless and the range is quite impressive.

Having a lot of fun with it and can even conceive of purchasing another one or more in the future to have around the house.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not nearly as good as previous generation. No need to updgrade!
reviews.reviewText:
I bought two of these and am super disappointed with them. I have them in the same room with two of the 2nd Generation Echo dots and I am CONSISTENTLY about 1-2 feet away from the new (3rd Gen) version and about 6-8 feet away from the 2nd Gen one and the 2nd Gen is the one to answer my questions. SUPER annoying.

After a few weeks of me second guessing ("did that really just happen?" I finally called into the support line and got outsourced to who knows where and the rep was extremely uninterested in helping me figure out what is going on, and sounded annoyed that I was even calling in about the issue. NOT a good experience. Adding insult to injury. I'll call back tomorrow and see if I can get an English speaking rep and if I can't get some resolution- these are going to get sent back. Bummer. I SO wanted to love these newer versions. They just can't hear you as well as the old ones apparently.

Constant disconnect from wifi
worse then my older echo dot that did that once in awhile. This piece of crap disconnects every 5 minutes or more.
I think i may return and switch to google hub.
update
i called support and they had me switch to 2gz channel on wifi let’s see how this goes
pending another update

New update and replacement Alexa 3rd gen received ...
guess what! Red ring every two to three minutes. can’t stay connected ..
old alexa dog stays connected in same location
this is a paper weight!

Without a doubt - it's quite an impressive creature. It's not pefect...but no tech is perfect... and I love tech. So... Amazon added whisper mode today. Experiencing that today - was one of those very special "wow" moments.... I called my friends to try out that new feature...and they all love it. It does much more than I expected. For quite a while I waited, as I thought "I have my iPhone and Siri...why do I need Alexa?" Well, I love my iPhone... and am still very happy I now have an echo dot. I don't have any complaints- just look forward to the continued advancements Amazon's Echo team is making with the device. The quality of the device is excellent - and the sound it puts out- for its size... really impressive. Can I live it out it? Sure.... But is it fun and convenient to have.... absolutely. Very glad I finally got one!

Honestly, I am really disappointed. I was really happy to receive my first Alexa product, and I loved it at first. However, today I tried using the speaker many times and Alexa kept saying "I cannot recognize your voice right now. Please try again later". I am able to play music using the app, and the sound is the same as always but for some reason it seems the voice recognition is not working. This is an okay temporary solution but if I had just wanted a speaker I could have gotten a portable bluetooth speaker or one with better sound. I would like a product replacement or a refund, please.

I have lots of 2nd gen Echo Dots and wanted to like the new 3rd gen Echo Dot. Unfortunately I couldn't get past the change in fidelity to a larger driver that over-emphasizes base frequencies and under-emphasizes the rest (like the taller new Echo). The only improved thing about it as far as I can tell is that it can get louder and pair with another in a stereo arrangement. I can compensate by using an equalizer and external amplified speakers (great result that way), but what's the point in paying 3 times for what could've been done right the first time. (BTW, before you ask, let me add that you can't just ask Alexa to turn down the base -- that turns down *all* base frequencies, not just the over-emphasized boomy ones. ) For regular rooms I prefer the older 2nd gen Echo Dot or Echo to the newer ones.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great for the Absent-Minded! Changed my life!
reviews.reviewText:
It sounds wierd to say Alexa/Echo Dot changed my life, but let me tell you how it has helped.

I am absent-minded, and I have no sense of the passage of time. Quite often I'd forget to start dinner until 7PM, and since I am on a special diet, that meant eating later than optimal. I also take medication several times a day. Add to that how the day can simply get away from me, and I was feeling frustrated with myself! I had no one to blame but myself, but the thing was -- blame wasn't helping! So I got a dot. I started putting in reminders for meds, for starting dinner, for remembering to switch the laundry to the dryer. I got more done, and it helped me not get into negative self-talk/self-recrimination for my forgetfullness. If I had to stop mid-task, I told Alexa to tell me in 5 minutes. I used to really get off track if I went to the bathroom and forgot what I was doing before that. Well, now things flow better. I dont get annoyed with myself, I just fix the reminders! I don't use alarms anymore with their blaring noise -- if you are a forgetful or absent-minded person like me, an alarm is an annoying noise and youo still might not remember what it is FOR. Alexa just tells me. I am also free of the million-zillion post-it notes and the lists that always seemed to be in the wrong room. Alexa keeps all my lists, and can read them to me. I set up Google calendar, let Alexa have access and now she also can remind me what events are coming up --- be that doctors or social events. Finally I have a flow to my day that isnt disrupted if I chase down some internet research topic or read a little longer than planned. Alexa helps me keep things from falling off my radar, and I dont have to use a form of mild shame to motivate myself.
I wish I had tried it much sooner. My husband was so amazed, he bought the 2nd one for me! He now enjoys having Alexa play sports talk radio and news, and fun stuff like jeapardy questions. I've started to listen to audiobooks more and my imagination is soaring. Alexa is a great addition to my life, the personal assistant I needed!

This is my 3rd dot purchased. Bought two more cause kids want to listen to music and it's great to be able to reach them in their rooms with my Alexa or thru the app. Nice looking! Nice size! It's especially great if you have prime. The music library is very good. She's pretty good with basic questions. There are some really cool games, apps and fun things to do. I like being able to add past purchases into my Amazon cart just by telling her. I am a writer so it's great to be able to ask for synonyms and definitions.
Cons are..if you like listening to music it isn't great quality. Sounds good enough. But there's no bass and sounds flat. I hear you can send it to Bluetooth speakers but I don't have any. I need to look into those speakers the Dot sits in that supposedly improve sound quality. The sound is just fine for anything other than music. Also, she isn't great with answering questions the way the other companies "assistants" do. Basic math she can do. But you can't use her like a calculator. She's not very good with telling you how long a drive will be from point a to point b(which is something I ask often). She is pretty bad at identifying business addresses and phone numbers..specially if they are local. She usually doesn't even get the business right and you sometimes can't stop her once she's spouting wrong info.
All in all, it's very cool to have handy. Although, if I was paying per hour for a real assistant who did the same things...I would likely fire them..lol

I keep receiving message "No internet connection" when trying to connect the wi-fi even though My Echo(1st gen) works and this Kindle Fire tablet which I am writing this review. Maybe the "DOT" I received was defective I don't know

The unit looks great and sounds great... SOMETIMES. Just started using it and once the speaker cut out. Also about half the time the sound has a buzzz and the voice is "staticky." I am on the phone with Amazon now, and it sounds like this is an issue they are encountering in other units. They were willing to send me a refurbished replacement initially, and now they are hesitating to do that since they are "afraid" the next unit will have the same problem. As we continue to speak, I am told they will send me the refurbished unit as long as I understand that there is already an open ticket on this 3rd generation echo dot and the problem may also be found in the new unit. I really hope they figure out the problem because when this dot plays without the distortion the speaker sounds really great! I will try to update this when the refurb arrives. The customer service was quite good. They really did try to help. This is a new product and there is always a risk when purchasing a new device that there may be bugs.

UPDATE:
The unit is working a bit better as of late. It isn't always distorted. It may not be the manufacturing. Could slight internet interference cause this? Dont know. Will keep testing.

reviews.reviewTitle: new echo added to the family
reviews.reviewText:
This is not my first echo dot. I've bought many in the past and enjoy placing them around my home. Don't get me wrong, they're great for simply asking the weather, turning on the thermostat, turning off the lights, or any other features you might find useful. The new and improved speaker is definitely better than that of its predecessor, however, the bass and treble still seem to be off. The app is now more convenient to maneuver and find the controls for your home.

I will still continue to setup smart home groups, and use them for multi-room audio. I look forward to receiving my other echo products shortly. Amazon has reinforced their lineup, and I'm proud to be their consumer. I've only had this device for a week, so I'll periodically update on here after I experiment with the device more.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great start to my Smart Home Integration
reviews.reviewText:
Echo Dot is going to be a great product to start my Smart Home. Considered Google, Siri but selected Alexa based on other folks recommendations. Just set up but so far pretty impressed, no issues at all with the app and with finding smart devices. I have started with some smart switches (Techkin) and so far everything seems to be working well. I will be integrating smart switches soon and see no reason why that would not work well. Alexa is responsive and music quality is fine for the speaker size, which I did not buy for the speaker quality. I have Bose in my house so hopefully integrating BOSE speakers will be seamless, initial Bose small bluetooth speaker hooked up to my Echo Dot with no issues..

UPDATE - AlexA just stops responding so having to unplug it and reset, EVERY DAY - very frustrating for sure and I did not expect this issue but seems like a lot of folks are having this problem. I was going to buy a couple more to put around the house but until this issue goes away I will NOT be buying them.

This really a waste of money. I can occasionally get it to turn on lights and start a timer. The frustration of trying to get it to do anything else is not worth it. The app is so confusing to try to get it to automate anything. Yes I can ask it some stupid questions or play a few games, but I can do all those things with my phone, and much better.

Considering Google's assistant is already built into my phone and works better. It was rather dumb of me to buy this. It just seams like for all the things it does well, there are cheaper and better options.

I just cannot stress enough how bad this device is. All the issues I seem to have, most people have to, by reading the app reviews.

Update: July 4th

I continue to believe Alexa is worthless for most people. Here is my latest frustration. I asked for the hours of a particular store. It got the right one the first time. When Alexa asked if I wanted to call, I said Yeah. It does not understand that Yeah as a yes. So I asked Alexa again. However, it started giving me Kentucky and other cities far from my location. I went and looked at what it thought I was saying. The first time, it thought I said "New Bird" every other time it understood I was saying "Newberg", but used the "Newburgh" spelling.

So now I say " New Bird" for "Newberg", it recognizes it as "New Bird", but will give me "Newberg" info. This is what drives me crazy about Alexa, always having to figure out the magic words to get her to do what you want. Other times you give the exact same command and it understands what one wants, other times it will have no clue.

This is my first experience with an Alexa-enabled internet connected device. I love it. I no longer understand why anyone would spend more than twice as much on an internet-connected radio when you can get this small package with similar connectivity and surprisingly good sound quality.

I had an internet radio, which I really liked, but it was three times the price and had less functionality. For listening to the news or even music at a regular volume in a regular-sized room, this does more, costs less, and is sleek and relatively good looking.

As others have mentioned it could (and probably will at some point) come in a wider variety of colors, but beyond that it's hard to imagine it being better for the size.

The one thing that could be annoying is that the lights stay on unless you instruct Alexa not to disturb you. But then you lose the notifications capability. For me, that's not an issue, hence the five stars.

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo dots in combination with fire TV stick
reviews.reviewText:
Just wanting to dip my toes in the water, so to speak, I purchased two 3rd gen echo dots with the latest 4k fire TV stick for my family for Christmas. All in all, this combination made for a minimal investment to try out and see how much we like it before going all in (the dots were on sale 2/$50 at the time). A little backstory--we have a smart TV in our living room and a regular flat screen in my bedroom. Our smart TV isn't really that "smart"--it doesn't allow for all of the apps we like to use, so we've always had it set up with a ROKU. Sadly, I broke our ROKU out of pure clumsiness. I was going to just get another one, but the kids had asked about getting Alexa for Christmas--initially I said no, but the more I thought about it, the more I considered the possibilities. See, my best friend has an echo plus, so I was a bit familiar with it already. After some thought, I got to work reading reviews and information online to see what I could learn. I'm already a prime customer, a kindle unlimited, audible and music subscriber as well. Amazon's array of services are just a part of life here--why not try more of the devices offered?

There are mixed reviews out there about the sound quality of the new 3rd gen echo dots--definitely an improvement over past gens, but still lacking in some way. No, they're not the same as the echo plus, but they're not far behind either. I was pleasantly surprised by the rich sounds coming from such tiny devices.

I'm sure we've barely touched the tip of the iceberg with everything that can be done with these amazing little gadgets, but my favorite feature is the ability to "drop in" on other echos around your home. Our place seems to have an odd sound barrier between upstairs and downstairs, so I have to yell pretty loudly to get my kids' attention. With the drop in feature, I can just speak to them in another room in a normal tone of voice. In addition to dropping in, you can also tell Alexa to make an announcement to your entire home, like "dinner's ready," or "time to go," etc. I LOVE that. I'm sure lots of moms could relate to needing something like this!

I also managed to successfully pair our new fire TV stick with our echo dot in the living room, so without touching anything, I can just tell Alexa what I want to watch. We used this feature on Christmas day when we were lazing about watching TV--we asked Alexa to find Christmas movies and were automatically presented with a list of basically every Christmas movie in existence (also included Die Hard--TYVM). The fire TV stick has a voice control feature if you press a button on the remote, but there was just something so neat about not having to touch a thing.

The music possibilities are endless--it makes me feel a little spoiled. Do you ever think of a song you'd like to hear or add to a playlist on your phone, but your hands are full with something else and then oops it leaves your brain entirely? Any song I want to hear, I just tell Alexa to play. And then I can tell her to add it to a certain playlist if I want. I understand that Alexa works with multiple services such as Spotify, Pandora, etc...I don't know how well those are integrated, but as an Amazon music subscriber, the experience is seamless.

All in all, I think my next step is to order an additional dot, a fire TV stick for my other TV and most likely an echo plus....maybe a few smart plugs too. I'd like a dot in all major areas of our home for communication purposes and an echo plus in the main living area downstairs for a more room-filling sound quality. Don't get me wrong, these dots sound great, but I'm also aware of how the echo plus sounds, so I would like to have that as well. We are all in with Alexa now. It's a great and fun addition to our home!

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo Dot is great ... just not this version, get the older one
reviews.reviewText:
Update 1/4/2019:
After using the new Dot for several weeks, I have to lower the rating by yet another star. The sensitivity of the microphones is pathetic. You essentially have to stand right next to it an shout to have it act upon the voice command. It also takes significantly longer to respond, as if the processor that is being used in this V3 is less powerful than the one in V2. Stay away from the third-generation dot!

Original Review:
It pains me a bit to say this, but the new version (V3) of the Dot is a complete engineering failure. The three areas that have become significantly worse compared to V2 (which we have two of) are microphone sensitivity, sound quality, and power supply.

- Microphone Sensitivity
From the very beginning, I had the feeling that voice recognition wasn't as good as with the V2. I had replaced our unit in the kitchen with the V3 thinking that it might eliminate the need to connect to an external speaker most of the time when casually listening to music. I noticed that I had to repeat myself more frequently when asking to add items to my shopping list, for example, or that the Dot misunderstood the items that I wanted to add.
This morning, I ran a little test to confirm the problem. I placed the two Dots (V2 and V3) next to each other and asked for the time. The old (V2) Dot responded. I then moved the old Dot farther away in increments of 3 feet. In the end, the new Dot didn't start to respond before the old Dot was at 3x the distance between myself and the new Dot. I guess value engineering didn't work out here with the removal of 3 of the 7 microphones that were in the old Dot.

- Sound Quality
People speak about an improved sound quality. It certainly is louder, but extremely muffled even when adjusting the equalizer to reduce the bass to its minimum and cranking up treble and mids. It's fine for music, but voice responses sound like they come from under water. It's shocking how poor the speaker sounds. The V2 version was tinny, no doubt, and some of the firmware updates caused problems, but at least you could understand what Alexa was saying.

- Power Source
The V2 used a micro-USB plug. I bet you have a handful of those cables and 5V cellphone chargers sitting around in case the supplied cable or charger gives up the ghost. The new version switched to a proprietary barrel mount and hardwired charger. You'd have to get a replacement from Amazon and will always have to carry that particular charger if you take the unit with you on travels.

- Overall
Go with the V2 version of the Dot and save yourself the aggravation. If you've never had a Dot before, you may not realize how well this can work from a voice recognition and responsiveness point of view. The new Dot is junk.

reviews.reviewTitle: As of FEB 3 2019 the voice commands for navigating FireTV are not ready for prime time
reviews.reviewText:
I think the device deserves 3 or 4 stars when considered overall, but in terms of its use as a voice-control for FireTV, it is really almost useless. Echo DOT voice commands with FireTV and related apps are really hit and miss. Sometimes they work, but most of the time they don't. It seems that the voice command intelligence may be privileging Amazon over other paid apps, listening for the title and ignoring the rest of the command if it is a title that Amazon offers.

Alexa, go to Hulu. SORRY.
Alexa, go to Hulu on FireTV. OK. Takes you to Hulu on FireTV. Good.
Alexa, watch True Detective. "Getting True Detective from FireTV" (Echo exits Hulu and brings you to FireTV page for that TV show ($$$). BAD.

Alexa, stream True Detective on Hulu. "Getting True Detective from FireTV" (you're not taken to Hulu but to FireTV's own page for that title ($$$).

Alexa, go to Hulu on FireTV. OK
Alexa, watch Saturday Night Live. SNL starts playing on Hulu. GOOD.
Alexa, exit Saturday Night Live. "Getting Saturday Night Live from FireTV". Leaves Hulu, starts playing SNL on FireTV. BAD.

UPDATE as of 2/15/2019

Alexa, stream Aeon Flux on FireTV.
Alexa: "Getting AeonFlux from Hulu."
But what actually begins to play is a movie called "Shattered" with Pierce Brosnan.

reviews.reviewTitle: Improvements for the go-to personal assistant
reviews.reviewText:
This is our first 3rd Gen Echo Dot, our #6 Dot in total, and a couple of full sized models as well. We've been using these devices for several years in a whole home network and overall really enjoy their 5-star versatility, which this review will not go into. Instead focusing on the 3rd gen Dot's improvements/functionality.

Amazon has the initial setup really dialed in. Unboxed, plugged it in, and it was 100% ready to go in less than 1 minute with me only needing to have the Alexa app on my phone open -- automatically set up Amazon account, WiFi and location information.

Appearance-wise, it's a very significant departure (and upgrade) from prior models. You can instantly visually see it's the latest model and in my opinion the appearance is significantly improved. It really looks sharp with the cloth surround and slightly bowed out grill which I assume has something to do with the larger speaker in this new model. The new appearance is elegant and really makes the first two gens look stark by comparison.

Voice command response (in our unoffical testing) seems to be slightly snappier despite there being 4 microphones versus the 7 of prior generations. Not sure if this is due to improved processing or better microphones or maybe both, but it's slightly better in hearing my wife and kids.

Speaker sound quality is improved. Granted that it wouldn't be hard to improve on the sound quality of a prior gen Dot, but none of the Dots, including the latest is a very big device, but for it's size the device it sounds good, and the latest gen definitely hits a greater range (more bass notes). When we have all of our Dot/Echo devices playing music sync'd throughout the our home, as a whole home system they sound good.

Overall the 3rd gen isn't such a groundbreaking upgrade that we'd plan on ordering 6 units right now today to replace our perfectly fine functioning previous gen 1&2 Dots, but moving forward the 3rd gen does significantly set itself apart -- both physically and sound-wise, enough so that I likely wouldn't buy a significantly discounted prior gen and all future orders will be gen 3's.

I was pleasantly surprised by just how much this little guy\girl can do. I have never had any issues with this device recognizing my questions its always accurate and knows exactly what I am asking it. The one issue I have with it is unless you are a techy person you may never use it to its full potential because you may never really pick up on just how the "Skills" as Amazon calls them work. Basically you have to download an Alexa app on your phone and then setup the device but from there you have to download skills to really take advantage of this device, an example would be I downloaded a Fios Skill so that I am able to control my cable box with commands such as "Alexa watch AMC on Fios" The problem is setting up the skills for this to work I had to enable the Fios TV skill then I had to choose what cable box this device was going to control, well if you never named your cable boxes by the rooms they are in then you have to figure out the name the cable company gave your cable box. Anyways like I said once you get everything figured out its great. I have it tied to my calendar in Outlook, my cable box, my Fire TV, I use it to play music from Amazon "Apple Music is coming to this device soon" I ask it what my commute to work is like, what's the Weather today. As far as the Sound quality goes, this small device is perfect for a bedroom or office if you want good sound in a bigger room buy the ECHO or ECHO Plus its that simple. Still some issues in being fully implemented but getting better all the time. Besides updates, Alexa learns from how you use it. Do you NEED it? No. But did we need cars instead of horses? Jets over propeller airplanes? This is part of an interesting future. Hop on and enjoy.

My one star rating has nothing to do with the device, it's about Amazon customer support. Getting into the Echo/Alexa experience is a big jump for us older folks who are still trying to figure out our smart phones. This is what I found out the hard way. The Echo Dot is primarily for giving you access to your Echo from another room. So, if you have already put an Echo in your home office and you want to ask Alexa what the weather is when you wake up, you need an Echo Dot in your bedroom. Why should this be a secret? Not knowing that, I bought the Echo Dot as my first Echo device thinking it sounded too good to be true for $30, and it was. After three phone calls to the support dept. about it not connecting, I was told the Dot had to be within 6 feet of the router. This is nuts. I was ready to return it but then I guessed there was something I was missing and I had to find it myself on other websites. If you have a $120 Echo next to the router then you can put an Echo Dot any where you want. Now, I understand but I wish I had known this before buying the Echo Dot. I will probably buy the Echo at a future time, after I save up the money from my fixed income. I've done business with Amazon for many years and this is the first time I felt that I was being led down the wrong path. Seems like the support people could have explained this. The Echo Dot is currently sitting in the office 12 inches away from the router and is working great. I just have to get out of bed and come into the office to find out what the weather is like.

reviews.reviewTitle: A great upgrade or additional device!
reviews.reviewText:
I've had the gen 2 for a little over two years. I have loved it and use it many times a day. It was great in our old, fairly small apartment. We just bought a new house with 2 floors and a lot more space. We needed another one for the additional floor. I don't need one for every room. I thought it over, and then seeing the sale price of $24, I decided to get the 3 instead of another 2.

I am so glad I did! I replaced the gen 2 in the living room with the gen 3 and moved the gen 2 to the finished basement. Out of the box, it looks much nicer than the gen 2. The initial setup of the gen 3 took a couple of tries, but was fairly simple. I get better sound recognition from greater distances with the gen 3. For comparison, in the same spot, the gen 2 would have a hard time hearing me from the kitchen sink, in a large open kitchen/living room space. especially if there was other noise, even if I raised my voice. The gen 3 can hear me not only from the kitchen sink, but from down the hall at a bedroom door, without me raising my voice.

The gen 3 speaker is louder and clearer for basic tasks like timers, adding to lists, and the weather. While the speaker quality is better than the gen 2, I still use it with a Bluetooth speaker for music and when I get her to read my kindle books to me. This is my personal preference.

Over all I like the gen 3 even better than the gen 2, but I wouldn't buy another gen 3 and ditch my 2 all together. The gen 2 still serves a great purpose downstairs, though she won't get as much use as she once did. If I decided to add more in highly visible places, I would probably get another gen 3, just for the look.

I recently purchased Echo Dot 3 with Alexa, primarily for starting a Smart Home system. I am disabled/handicapped and am confined to my bed most of the time. Since the disease I suffer from is progressive I felt that is time to prepare for worse days ahead. When it arrived, I was amazed at the things it can do. So far I have set up playlists on Amazon Music while I am waiting for my order of Alexa controlled outlets to arrive. As time and money allow, I will be adding more components to the Smart Home system. In the meantime, I have calm, soothing music playing all night long, helping to distract my mind from the physical pain that I suffer from 24 hours a day. That, in itself, is worth having Amazon Dot 3 and Alexa.

reviews.reviewTitle: *Echo Dot - Gen 3* is AWESOME & WORTH EVERY PENNY! MUCH BETTER than 2nd Gen Dot! UPDATED REVIEW!
reviews.reviewText:
I initially gave this only 1 Star due to it's appearance and "look." But every other aspect of the "Echo Dot 3rd Gen Alexa Device" I'm reviewing and commenting on right now I would give 4/5 or 5/5 Stars normally. Before I spoke with an Amazon rep during their phone call to me just minutes ago, I did not due to the quality of the "look" of said received item (Echo Dot). Even though it didn't "look" right, it worked perfectly. Now, I have been contacted by Amazon.com via phone # on file (which is even MORE AWESOME because they reached out to me the quickest and in the kindest way possible)!!! So, very quickly after my review, Amazon without hesitation showing their grace and professionalism they offered to make things right. Therefore, I am now giving this Echo Dot #rd Gen Alexa Device 5/5 Stars all around and an A+ for all those youngsters out there! :p This Echo Dot works GREAT and responds from far away too! It hears/responds from great distances (more than I expected) and I LOVE how I just learned about Alexa's "Routines" and how to make Custom "Routines" as well as adding new, unique and impressive "Skills" which are EPIC!

Thank you so much "TAMI" (aka the Amazon rep who called ME and took HER time to call ME) for all your help. It's because of you, Tami, and your professionalism towards the Amazon Item & Issue(s) -AND- your kindness, acceptance and non-judgmental positive and uplifting attitude towards my very unique physical and mental status that allows ME to make the time to redo a Review like this one and praise the people who SHOULD be praised! I hope Tami stays with Amazon a long time and hopefully, seeks more responsibility and they move Tami up in the business. Amazon needs strong women like her in higher positions of power to do right by Amazon's customers. I'm 99% more loyal today to Amazon as a business, as a whole, than I was this very morning, TBH! Also, thanks directly to Amazon as well for "making it right" with the problem with my Amazon Original Product! TY ALL AGAIN!!! :D Look forward to more business together!!! I just bought a CyberPowerPC Gaming Desktop PC and an Asurion 3 year warranty today or late last night or so and now I'm just waiting on that to get delivered and for payment to go thru! ;-) I LOVE AMAZON AND THEIR PRIME DEALS!!! TY!

reviews.reviewTitle: Google Home is so much smarter.
reviews.reviewText:
I got this free with a re-up of my SiriusXM subscription. Unfortunately, you can only stream SXM through Alexa devices, and not Google due to an exclusive contract. So this dot sits on my coffee table and plays SiriusXM when I want to listen at home. I use my Google Home for EVERYTHING else. I tried Alexa, but she's not very smart or intuitive. She's great at finding deals on Amazon, or notifying you about Amazon shipments, or reminding you that you haven't bought anything on Amazon in a while, but beyond being a pestering advertisement for Amazon, it's a hunk of junk compared to Google Home. If it weren't free, and I didn't need it for SiriusXM, I'd be returning it for a refund.

If you're considering setting up a smart home, go with Google. This is junk.

I purchased a second generation dot when Amazon put them on sale before Christmas. I was not sure if I would like it and wanted to go with the least expensive starting point. I really enjoyed it and bought a 3rd generation for my wife to use. The functionality of the two is essentially the same since they are running the same software. However, the sound quality of the 3rd seems reason enough to purchase the more expensive and newer 3rd generation. I also like the appearance of the 3rd generation. The sound quality difference is not bad when Alexa is giving the weather or something like that. However, we use the 3rd generation to play ocean sounds at night for sleeping and that is noticeably different and better with the 3rd generation. I have used the app to group some smart plugs and have enjoyed the convenience. I feel like we will continue to find little uses for the dot that make the morning routine a little easier and it is nice to play a little music while getting ready for work. Do note that the sound quality is not what I want to listen to music in general but ok to have a song play while getting ready in the morning. I would not sit down and listen to an album in the evening on it.

I’ll start by saying that I have owned every version of this Echo dot so far. I also have google home but still prefer the Amazon ecosystem overall. This Echo dot with the clock display was a NO BRAINER for me, I’ve been waiting on a clock feature for a couple years now. This newer version is 90% the same as the original Gen 3 echo dot so I won’t rehash that review again. In short…. This is the SAME as the original gen 3 but this version adds a clock and a few more tweaks related to the clock and display. Here are some highlights below in a nutshell:
-Same as original Gen 3...but with a very useful clock!
-Sound is powerful and can be heard across any room. Thanks to the EQ in the Alexa app you can tweak the sound even more.
-The LED clock is genius! Shows the weather and has adaptive brightness settings.
-In my opinion the clock is worth an extra $10 for the Echo dot
-LED time/temperature visible from across the room, even in the daytime.

Room For Improvement??
-Sorry...I’m still not feeling this power cord. A USB-C connector would have been perfect! I’d even take a micro usb connector compared to the default cord.
-Why is the power brick so thick?? My Phone charger has even more power than the Echo power brick at half the size *Head scratch*
-The sound is definitely an improvement vs the 2nd Gen echo but it feels just a TAD lower compared to the newest google mini (maybe since the mini has front facing speakers)

My Verdict? I give this Echo Dot with LED Clock TWO THUMBS UP! Works great for a bedside clock and I have one in the bathroom now as well for morning news and to tell the time.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great addition for small home office or bedroom etc
reviews.reviewText:
So I have never purchased an Echo yet till this point. I am working on my AWS Certified Solutions Architect and got to the point to write programs that will use the Echo. I did not want to spend a lot, but was also hoping to get at least fairly good sound. I had heard the earlier versions of the Dot and was not impressed. But the reviews on this one seem pretty good, so I got it. I can say I am duly impressed. The bass response is a bit lacking, however the sound is clear with a pretty decent frequency response. I work from home and this will definitely sit in my home office for background music. I love that I can easily get things like the current weather and temp just by asking. I am also looking forward to programming some other features to use with the Echo too.

I can also see putting this in a bedroom, or a kitchen, or other secondary room in the house. It is more than loud enough to hear while working in the kitchen. And it would give good enough sound to go to sleep by, then wake up and find out the temp outside before even getting out of bed. I am hoping to program it so I can check on school closings at the same time I get the weather in the morning.

If you are a very critical audiophile this is not the device for you. But if you just want some good sound akin to a really good clock radio or small portable radio I think you will be more than satisfied.

Oh and I LOVE the dad jokes Alexa tells when you ask for a joke!

reviews.reviewTitle: My Echo Dot is so amazing!!!!
reviews.reviewText: I don’t know how I ever got by without my Echo Dot. In addition to amazingly simple access to my music library, I use it for just everthing -from my alarm clock to my reminders to my dictionary and my private secretary, weather reports, game scores, amazon order staus, and so much more without having to pickup a device. But my favorite thing about the echo dot is walking through the house, thinking of any song (and artist) that I want to hear, and in 10 seconds it’s playing beautifully on my echo dot without ever touching the device. I am still amazed at the technology even after having it for two years. Am I worried about someone listening in on my Echo, heck no! Just think about it rationally for a few minutes and I think you will agree that its not possible for an Echo Dot to collect, sort, store, analyze and share 20 second snipits of one persons voice data given the trillion pieces of data the all the Echo Dots on the planet generate every minute. I will let the conspiracy theorists worry about that if they have time between planning for the zomby apocalypse and doms day prepping. I hope you enjoy your Echo as much as I do!!!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa, THE Amazon salesclerk at your side
reviews.reviewText:
First, I honestly purchased echo dots hoping the devices would work in my vehicles. And even when you link through your phone as a hotspot, it has intermittent connectivity in my area. It takes s but to set up & then can be lost easily. So now I am on a list for the Amazon car device that seems to overcome the obstacles the dot has. (This could take years.). I look forward to read that text & reply to take text. Ford Sync support is very short lived.

Amazon in the home: If I play music that is supposedly a part of Prime, Alexa asks me to enable ordering & subscribe to music unlimited. If I play any game other than Jeopardy, Alexa asks me to unlock the rest of the game or categories. This appears to be a by game charge & not an unlock all games. If I inquire about a book, it wants to sell Kindle Unlimited or an Audible book. So it constantly trying to sell me addition purchases in spite of both being subscribed to Prime & Audible. WiFi calling is the one use currently since I don’t have smart plugs & bulbs. I would not invite a Walmart or Target salesperson in my home so basically, the dot is unplugged & in a drawer.

reviews.reviewTitle: Sound is not as clear as the 2nd Gen Dot
reviews.reviewText: I have several 2nd generation Echo dots and recently received this 3rd generation one. I switched out one of the others for this new one and immediately noticed a different in the sound, and not in a good way. No matter how I adjust the bass or treble, it sounds hollow and much less clear than the earlier generation. I listen to Audible books and music every day and immediately heard the difference with the 3rd Gen dot. This was received "free" as part of a package with another order, so I can't return it for a refund, and I feel like a replacement would do the same, so it will definitely be going out to the shop, where it will be rarely used. Pros: It looks gorgeous and very modern. Cons: Sound is much less clear.

reviews.reviewTitle: I enjoy this little dot, it makes me laugh.
reviews.reviewText: I live alone and have nobody to talk to. I get a kick out of this Alexa echo dot, she is not real bright at times but she still needs more input. She is like my very own Johnny five. Give her a try, she can be fun.

reviews.reviewTitle: Superb Sound Quality, But Still Not Sure the whole purpose of a smart device?
reviews.reviewText:
Received a code for this as part of a promo for a popular service that floats over your head beaming music. Never really been hip to a smart device such as this (Siri and any personal assistant if it's in my phones over the years has been reduced to be a marginally used piece of technology gathering dust in the crannies of my phone)

Only lasted a few days before the overwhelming urge to just tuck it back into the box came up. Rather then that, it found it's true calling, going to my next door neighbor. His wife recently had a car accident and has been going through surgeries and healing up.

Currently it keeps her company and allows her to enjoy music and have some tasks made easier!

With luck her new digital friend keeps her company, and I solved the problem of having it languish in my box of electronic gizmos!

Maybe i've blown the chance to yank it out in 50 years and take to a hologram rendered version of the antiques roadshow for big bucks, but better to make someone's life easier!

Sound was good, setup was easy, app is flawless but it just doesn't fit into my needs like it does for other folks. And that 's okay! May alexa live long and prosper helping a lady get back on her feet!

(Bonus: Shortly after being unwrapped, Junior Rangers Nick Wilde Dropped by to see what the fuss was all about. He thought the same thing, great for others but decided against keeping it because you can't find a outlet in the wilderness most of the time!)

Firstly this was not the reason for my purchase, but I must start off with my 3 year old ABSOLUTELY loves these! Hearing him say, "Alexa, Alexa, Alexa, play baby doo dooo dooo" or Alexa, Alexa, Alexa play gummy bears", or "Alexa, Alexa, Alexa!!! STOP! STOP!", is just too adorable!!!!!!!! He has to say her name a few times as his speech is still growing. She does pick up that he is calling her after the second or third attempt. ( Not an issue with the adults of course ).

My reason for purchasing these at first was due to our home size and honestly so fed up of screaming for one end of the room to another to call someone. These have limited this! Enabling me to drop in on my teenager (the main reason for the screaming! ), to advise it is dinner time or any other form of communication. The ability to also alert the entire house with an announcement of, " We are leaving at 12 PM be ready to go! ", or any other message, " Dinner will be done at 6 PM, wash your hands and come to the table by then", again any message at all!

Having my youngest son this has also made life easier. At times your hands are busy or you are just occupied. Being able to change your sons diaper and realize you are running low and just quickly say, "Alexa add or order diapers"! No more 'I forgot moments". Same principle works in general daily movement in your home. Maybe your cooking and realize you have run out of paper towel, sugar, salt, anything, just add it verbally while still on the go! Not sure about you guys/ladies. Half the time I forget what I was suppose to get and the list goes on until I am completely out of something.

Audible & Music!

What can I say my teenager gives it a thumbs up for sure! My 3 year loves it! Again, "Alexa play....!", super cute to hear!

Mom time! Being able to shut down for the evening with a glass of wine or not! Lay in bed and say Alexa play this book, or play relaxing music. It is not about being lazy! I used to think this about this form of technology! Truly, I would say only people with money need things like this or lazy people. Ha! I was so wrong! Firstly I am not lazy, secondly, I am not rich but not poor either! It is the convenience it adds to your home. Now do I need Alexa to turn on my lights for me? I have not been suckerd in that far as of yet. We will see if I write a review on that product in the future or NOT.

Taking a shower! Needing to wake up! Just shout out, "Alexa play my wake up station". In a rush for work, "Alexa what is the traffic like today", or "Alexa what is the weather like today", so many possibilities.

As I always say don't over think it! Buy and if you do not like it return it.

Awesome product! Buy the 3 bundle package they offer to save money! You will want one in every room.

My son CON is that at times you can say Alexa and it will be picked up by another device depending on how close they are, if doors are open, and I guess how loud you are speaking. I believe and not 100% sure you can have the devices react to different workd phrases other than Alexa, but not sure, we have not played around with this function as of yet. Which may eliminate this issue. This CON is not a factor enough to not purchase or continue to purchase them. Each device has a voice command turn off button. If you are leaving a room just deactivate it, such as your bedroom if it is conflicting with a near by communal room.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa Dot does not work on my mesh WiFi network
reviews.reviewText: Amazon the on-line retailer is best of breed. But the Alexa Dot uncovers a weakness in their technology offerings. Out of the box, the two Dots I purchased looked handsome. Both were configured to my network easily. This was done with the units in the same room. I wanted to use the Dot's broadcast feature and my initial tests showed that it worked between the Dots. I then moved one unit to another room out of earshot. The broadcast feature did not work! Amazon Customer Service was contacted and after 15 minutes of diagnosis, the broadcast feature still did not work. The Amazon Agent confirmed a known defect in the Dots: they will not connect to each other on a mesh network system for purposes of the broadcast feature. Very odd.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not an very good alarm clock
reviews.reviewText:
So with the added clock I thought awesome this could be a really cool alarm clock. What found is that Amazon stuck a clock on there device without really looking at how it would be used. My desire was for a alarm clock that I could wake to music. Setting this up is possible but clumsy and quite glitchy. I am still using it as an alarm clock with the hope it gets better.

I have many little dislikes with but will only note the main ones.

1) no physical way to turn off the alarm. This by far was the most challenging to do when I first wake up. Having to talk while my wife is still sleeping....

2) not being able to pick what music that will play.

3) the interface for setting the alarm needs work.

I now have 2 dot 3gen and for the most part I figured out how to use them by trial and error
The documentation that comes with the device is usless.
There is nothing to tell you what app you have to download on a phone and there is no explanation of anything on the app. What are the buttons on the screen? no explanation
I fumbled around to fiquire out what did what and I still not completely sure
This is a bust for me but they were presents from my kids for my birthday so that is the only reason im keepimg them
I just found out my issue with playing spotify all night is a known issue and they are working on it

Sorry to say this but if they were not gifts I would return them

Well, I'm sure like a lot of you recently, I got my echo 3rd Gen from the Amazon music promotion. It's my first smart device that's not my phone or TV. I've only had it a short time (about 2 weeks now?) but I've had lots of fun figuring it what I can do with this thing. I don't use it much now already but I'm glad to have it when I need it. It's mostly for music and the speaker sounds nice enough, but having it at full volume sounds pretty bad. Still, it hits a decent volume before the sound quality deteriorates. I'm not gonna complain though for getting it with the promotion, but had I paid full price, I would definitely mark it down some. I have an off brand portable shower speaker that I paid like 15 bucks for that blows it out of the water in terms of sound quality at high volume (plus being portable is a big bonus for the speaker). That being said, it's not going to leave that speaker, the echo has its place in my room and the speaker goes everywhere else.
