It's a fantastic addition to smaller rooms if you want to listen to the radio, listen to music, or control your home. I'm absolutely delighted with the third-generation Dot. After hearing the sound quality of this device, I'm tempted to get a new Echo, as I'm confident Amazon's made great advancements in sound quality there, too.

Received an Alexa Echo Dot #1 as a gift. I have to admit, for a device I thought I'd never want or need, it's pretty nifty! The convenience of saying "Alexa: Play Music" is on the top of my list of her "talents". I'm also pretty enamored with the shopping list feature. Occasional rounds of Jeopardy or 20 Questions are good for entertainment, and quick checks on the weather report and traffic conditions for my work commute come in handy. There are quite a few "skills" available, but many of them are ridiculous (I don't need Alexa to "meow"). Hopefully, there will be more useful ones added . The app itself could use some cleaning up-I find the list of skills reverts back to the top of the list after opening an entry to get more info. There does need to be some fine-tuning with Alexa's ability to understand commands and requests, but all in all, I think she's a keeper.
Addendum: I purchased 2 more at a steal of a price, and then my insurance company gifted me one. I now have 4. Ridiculous, but I like asking for music with instant results. I’m also ditching my morning alarm with sketchy reception and replacing with a dot. Took a while to get that set up to my fave radio station, but all set now.

reviews.reviewTitle: Flawed, but better than my GEN 1
reviews.reviewText:
SO much better than the early access GEN 1 version I bought in 2015 lol.
It really has bass and is quite loud!

I had my old one plugged into my home theatre system via the mini cable. It drove sound well. This GEN 3 does NOT PUSH as much audio power as my old one. No idea why. It even uses more power. Previously volume 7 was loud enough to hear over tv and AC window unit. Now it’s gotta be 9 to hear and 11 to really play music.

My voice is bad due to an accident years ago leaving my vocal cords scarred. Annoyingly, I’m STILL having to do training, but it STILL isn’t as good a listener as my old one which I gave to my best friends kids to use.

Pros:
Very decent speaker quality.
Doesn’t use mini usb for power.
Doesn’t slide around like old ones.

Cons:
Doesn’t drive enough via external audio.
Microphone seems less responsive.
It’s hit or miss, disconnects from WiFi w/o reason, pain in the neck to reconnect. Don’t waste your time or money.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great way to integrate every room in the house
reviews.reviewText: There was an amazing m deal during amazon days so I decided to grab a couple more for the bedrooms. All my other ones are 2nd gen. After receiving this, I am thinking about upgrading those as well. The voice recognition and sound is so much better with this model. I also like the look. I was absolutely impressed that now when you order them, it gets here fully set up and ready to go. It has been an amazing addition to my kids room since I can “drop in” and talk to them if I’m in another room. These are a great for almost any room in the house and makes every thing (lights, tv, etc) convenient and integrated.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not a huge improvement, but not bad
reviews.reviewText: I had some issues with crackling and tinny shrieks when I played music, but after messing with the equalizer settings it seemed to stop. I also think it may have just needed to break in, as I’ve played music and sleep noise most nights for about a week and the issues are essentially gone. I was hoping for a noticeable sound improvement over the 2nd gen, but it’s essentially the same speaker, just louder. Overall, not much of an improvement or change, but it does look nicer than the older model, and can get much louder if that matters to you.

Bought this in January and by March the speaker has started to mess up. Sounds muffled and messed up. Also, there's a lag in response when I ask for the time. There's like a 5 second pause before echo answers. Also unlike the previous generation this one stops playing music after some time. The older version would play music until I tell it to stop even if it meant all day. It looks better and the speaker is louder than the older version but it sucks! It's always having "issues connecting with the internet" almost every other day blinking red. I never had this problem with the prior generation. I regret upgrading now or maybe I just got a bad batch

reviews.reviewTitle: Good speaker for listening to music and accessing all of Alexa's features
reviews.reviewText:
This is the second 3rd Gen Echo Dot I have owned. I purchased this as part of a package deal when I ordered two Sengled bulbs (color). It was basically a situation of getting just the Sengled bulbs, or getting the bulbs and the echo for a few bucks (less than ten but I don't remember exactly), so it was a no brainer for me.

This little speaker has a much better sound than it's predecessor. It has deeper and richer tones. It hits more highs and does better with the lows, but is by no means a replacement for a sub if you're looking for deep bass. The dot does everything as advertised. I often use it for checking on the weather and travel before I head out. I take a train into work and it saves me the effort of whipping out my phone and checking an app. I have also used this speaker to check on order statuses, which is quite helpful if I don't have ready access to a laptop.

I also, of course, use these devices to power on other electronics like my Sengled bulbs, the X-Box Ones (Day One Edition and Scorpio), my smart tv (LG OLED B65). The latter requires communication via an app on my smart phone, but it makes getting the lights and TV on the right channel easy before I get downstairs in the morning. It might sound like laziness, but when your rushing to get out the door to work in the morning, it is helpful and has a certain cool factor that I like. I also really like the drop in and broadcast features. If you ever wanted a comm system for your house, this makes it easy to communicate across floors. With our finished basement, we have 4 floors people could be on. Rather than shouting up and down the stairwells, this is a much more civilized alternative.

I can't say these are better than other wireless speakers, say from Google or another manufacturer, as I don't have any of those. I check comparisons on YouTube, and they stack up well to competitors. It all really comes down to your preferences and what "buy in" you have with amazon. For example, if you have a prime account, Amazon Music, etc., getting an Echo makes sense.

Long story short, I recommend this speaker. It's better than the 2nd gen, and it has a ton of features I don't even use that would be fun or useful to some. I now have 4 dots in my home, two 2nd Generation kid editions, one 3rd Gen in the living room, and one in the bedroom. I also have a larger 2nd Gen Echo in the kitchen. I might consider buying another for our kids playroom in the basement. At that point I would have at least one on every floor in our house.

I would have given this device 5 stars, but there is room for improvement in the sound department. Also, echo can get confused and mistake words at times. It's a minor gripe though. It might be my voice, my not speaking clearly enough, or background noise (mostly from my kids) which causes this.

reviews.reviewTitle: Useful device but sound clarity is terrible.
reviews.reviewText:
I like the usefulness and functionality of Echo Dot once it’s set up. Can’t get much simpler than just asking for what you want and have Alexa respond with your request.

Dislikes: Setup had issues; since I don’t have home WiFi, having Echo Dot use my phone as a hot spot took 4 or 5 reboots and retries.

Also, clarity is a HUGE problem. While the small speaker is powerful, Alexa’s voice coming through it isn’t clear at all. I’d estimate that 70% of Alexa’s words can’t be understood unless it’s perfectly quiet and I’m standing near the Echo Dot. —FYI, I have perfect hearing, so it’s not my ears, it’s the muffled sound. I adjusted the equalizer on the app but it has very little effect on the speaker and doesn’t clarify it any at all.

I don’t know what’s inside this Echo Dot but I’d recommend that Amazon start assembling them with a series of tweeters in its circular pattern as well as the current speaker for deeper tones. I should be able to understand Alexa’s voice from across the room.

It’s a cool device to have; yet I’ll assume like with most tech gadgets these days, there are privacy issues. I’m sure this thing hears stuff even when I’m not speaking directly to it, so I take into account that I now have less privacy as long as the Echo Dot is plugged in and turned on.

Bough 4 of these for work. What? Yeah, 4 for work. Our phone system does not have an intercom function and you can use these as an intercom by "dropping in" on one of the speakers. You can have a 2 way conversation and that's pretty handy. The sound quality is pretty good as well. I am a died in the wool apple user and fell out of my chair when I found this integrates with Apple Music. I have another brand of smart speaker at home and now wish I could trade them for echos. I'm in the process of getting a few more of these to put in other offices on a different floor to see how well I can communicate with them.

The only thing that makes it difficult to set up is NOTHING! Easy set up and if you are going to use these as intercoms, you have to set them all up using the same account. Not that big of a deal for me or where I work.

I really like these things!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great AI device. 3.5 jack turns off alexa speaker
reviews.reviewText:
I got alexa so that the government can listen in on every conversation we have and be bored to death.

I got three alexas for the purpose of intercoming between rooms. Our house phone has this feature but others felt it was easier to wake up the dead by yelling down staircases so now they find it fun to drop in the other rooms to call each other. Besides that feature alexa is very smart and has surprised us all. At times she does not understand 7 year old gibbirish and gives random answers, but that is expected.

This little device is great. It would have been cool if the 3.5mm jack didn't turn off its external speaker. I tried to have it plugged into a stereo but it's not used often. But then we can't hear alexa unless the stereo is on. Another idea would be to allow settings for the jack. Another alexa sits on top of a bass speaker with input Jack's. If I could chose to only send bass frequencies I could then have a little bass to the external speaker.

But overall we are happy and sorry for the boring conversations.

We have two Echo Dots (2nd Generation) and a Fire TV Cube (Original) in our house and while they're great for "home automation" and informational tasks, they aren't great at playing music. But the new Echo Dot (3rd Generation) exceeds expectations on both tasks and looks much more premium than the original to boot.

The new 3rd generation Echo Dot has a much more elegant look - it's a fabric speaker vs the plastic look of the 2nd generation and has a softer curved design rather than a "hockey puck" look. The colors are much more premium as well rather than a glossy/plastic-y white or black. It seems to blend into the background much more rather than stick out when sitting on a table or counter.

The new 3rd generation also boasts a 1.6" speaker vs the 1.1" speaker of the original and more importantly, rather than the "dots" on the top which encase the speaker, the new item has a 360 degree speaker around the edges. With the first use, the sound comes out noticeably fuller compared to the old and music sounds much better.

For anyone considering an "upgrade" to the 3rd generation from the 1st or 2nd, I think it's a no brainer. The aesthetics and quality are much improved on this unit and I would definitely recommend getting a new one.

What a great upgrade in sound from the 2nd gen Echo dots. The 2nd gen were tinny and small sounding. These 3rd gen Echo dots really have good sound for their size. I moved one around the house while I was painting and remodeling, listening to my tunes throughout the house with great clarity, decent bass for the size, and nice volume. It's an additional perk that I can use Echo as a speakerphone when I'm painting and such. I was using it to set timers and alarms, make notes, and add calendar events while holding a paintbrush.

I love these things. My main Echo is an Echo Plus, which rocks! but I have these in the other rooms. When playing music on the Everywhere Group, the sound throughout the house is amazing!

I also paired one of these to a Bluetooth adapter on my old stereo system, and it sounds amazing. Just like having satellite radio on it with SPotify, Amazon music, etc.

Highly recommend these.

reviews.reviewTitle: Amazon 3rd Generation - Not As Touted in Release
reviews.reviewText:
In my opinion, I can hear no improvement in the sound quality of the device, and the device is less sensitive to the sound of my voice than the previous one I had where this one sits; and in general, I have a harder time trying to verbally communicate with this device. I bought an additional device (total of three now) so I that I could have more units in spread around the rooms of my small apartment to interact with and so that I wouldn't have to talk loudly or repeat myself and go to the machine to speak to it in order to get it to work. The short: Now, I wish that I would have just looked into trading in the whole set of my purchases of Alexa devices for credit to my account and been done with the aggravation. Also, cannot get setting "Follow-Up" mode to turn off/on in the Alexa App.

I have always embraced new technology, and I really, really want to like this more than I do (particularly since I invested so much money!). It's just like having something else in your house electronic that you need to keep setting and re-setting and troubleshooting and diagnosing all of the time, which I already have to do for my computer and smartphone, and it never quite works the way you want it to.

Ok, First off, I purchased three of these dot's, two for me, and one for my mom. The two dot's I purchased for me, I had to install manually, they wouldn't automatically connect to the wireless network for some reason, but were fine after I manually connected them. My mom's, well, her dot picked up the network but it took me a few times to connect it to the network. After they were connected, it took me a bit of searching to figure out how to connect the smart devices to the dots, but with a little research I was able to hook them up to Kasa with no problem and they work just great. I love Alexa, she is very helpful, I do wish however she was more.. well, like the AI in Eagle eye! Wouldn't that be cool?! But we work with the tools we were given. It would be awesome if you could change her name, and voice, and maybe make her start conversations or offer suggestions. I would recommend this device to anyone and everyone. The only problem I have is not knowing what Alexa sends to Amazon, that is the one thing that is constantly on my mind, and when you ask her, she says "I don't know the answer to that" So there is that one negative against the product. The data mining, and not knowing what data is being shared.

Amazing smart speaker. Takes time to learn all of it's capabilities but I mainly got it to set up the sengled light kit in my living room and to play music from Spotify. It was beyond easy to set up the sengled lights and connect them to the Alexa speaker. I work grave shifts so I leave at night and it was always a pain to turn off any lights before I leave as I don't like walking in my house with my work shoes on nor do I want to be walking in the dark. Since I've set the speaker up and with the smart lights, life is so much easier. Can't believe I waited for so long to get one.

The sound quality on the speaker isn't the best, but it does connect to Bluetooth speakers very easily and disconnects on command. I have my Alexa speaker right next to my home console speaker/sub woofer and whenever I want to really play some music, I just tell Alexa to connect to the speaker and control the volume from there.

Over time, I know this little smart speaker will definitely come in more handy and I will for sure buy more and the newer models as my smart home tech grows.

Perhaps my expectations were too high, but I am disappointed in the amount of information that "Alexa" has. (More on that below.) I love her for her "chattiness" (try, "Alexa, let's chat".), her games, the immediacy of news items, the light-heartedness, and the availability of what she *does* know, e.g. who stars in movies and shows. When used with Amazon Music, it opens up a whole new world! "Echo, play some soothing instrumental music," and you're asleep in minutes.

I am quite UNhappy with the following:
> It can only be addressed by four different titles: Alexa, Computer, Echo, or Amazon
> Voice recognition is only moderately accurate, failing *much* too often, and it does not allow for more than one user.
> It does not allow nearly enough response time before assuming that one is not going to respond at all There should be a setting for this.
> Far, far too many subjects and questions are met with, "Sorry. I don't know that."
> The tone of the voice is deep enough that it interferes with understanding her sometimes. I have been unable to find anywhere to tweak the tone.
> The language skills are limited and underused. This could be a PHENOMENAL tool for language learners!

A lower price would be welcome, but I would still recommend having one of these with the caveat that one does not expect her to know everything. In spite of her shortcomings, "Little Miss Echo" is a keeper.

reviews.reviewTitle: The sound is OK, but nothing like the much better Alexa 2nd generation.
reviews.reviewText: I originally got the Alexa 2nd generation for my main area the living room but soon realized that although the sound was great, I didn't like walking from room to room and not have the music going so I purchased the Dot. It does the trick and it is great when you link it with your Alexa 2 so you tell it to play "whatever EVERYWHERE" or whatever you decide to call the group. It is great that I have the dot in my kitchen, but now I want another for my bedroom as well for the same reason as the kitchen. I don't need one in my bathroom for Pete sake, that would be wasted money in my opinion unless you want music while you have a bath or something! I don't like the sound so much, but it is better than nothing and for the price I can hook up my whole house with the same group and enjoy the same tunes everywhere in the house! Only gave it 4 not 5 stars due to "ok" quality speakers, not great ones. What do you expect for a $50 product though. I heard they went down in price but can't find out where or I would purchase my next Dot there!

reviews.reviewTitle: A MUST have in our home!
reviews.reviewText: Every since purchasing our first echo dot, it has become a must have in our home. This device will make your life easier. One of my favorite things about the echo, (aside from being able to control almost everything in my home..with just a single voice command.) is being able to tell Alexa what to put on my grocery list. She will immediately send your list to your Alexa app. Another very handy feature, is the guard feature. Alexa will guard your home and send you an instant notification if it hears any glass breaking, fire alarms, etc.. you can check in on your home with just a click of a button. If your purchasing an echo dot, I definitely recommend buying a few smart plugs. They are well worth the money spent. They allow you to control devices from the alexa app, that aren’t smart devices. I definitely recommend this product. I bought the sandstone colored one, and it looks incredible in my home.

Two stars—one for each of the uses I've found for the device in as many months (1. hearing what to expect from my commute without stopping getting ready or being subjected to the rest of the depressing local news, 2. listening to music or podcasts or audiobooks at voice command... though using my phone and Bluetooth speaker was really not that much of a bother). I suppose if you already have a 'smart home,' it may introduce a new level of convenience to your life.

As a very curious person who often wonders about all kinds of random things, usually while in the middle of washing dishes or fixing the garbage disposal, I was excited at the prospect of being able to simply voice a question and have an answer without stopping to pick up my phone or computer. But "hey Alexa" is a far cry from "hey Google." Easily 3/4 of the questions I ask "Alexa"—whose answers could be easily found with a quick internet search—elicit one of the "I don't know about that" replies.

Also, if you're intelligent enough to seek out multiple different sources for your national and world news, don't expect Alexa to help there, either: there's exactly one option.

From what I can tell, the Echo Dot is a pretty ingenious way for Amazon to get you to buy all kinds of other compatible devices. Without them, it's pretty useless.

reviews.reviewTitle: It is a great device for mobility and vision-impaired elders. Mama loves her Echo dots
reviews.reviewText:
We bought this for our 95 year old mom who is legally blind and has trouble using the phone or dialing. Now she uses Alexa to set timers. She asks Alexa the time because she can't see a regular clock. she also uses it to have Alexa read her books .
we installed these for security because if she falls she can call through Alexa without having to try and reach a phone. Mama loves Alexa and so do we for the Peace of Mind in fact we're going to buy a total of 4 to have Alexa all through her home to provide security and comfort. We are right next door, and if mama needs us, Alexa can help her call us easily from room in the home. I would highly recommend this for anyone who has a vision-impaired elder or mobility-impaired Elder who may be in need have a voice-activated telephone access. We have to get the dialer to go with it but it's so much more than just a pretty voice.

reviews.reviewTitle: Brought my old Tabletop radio back to life!
reviews.reviewText:
I have been trying to figure out how to bring some decent sound into my bedroom and have tried a bunch of wireless smart speakers from Bose and Yamaha. I was ok with both, but they were very expensive and the sound was no better (I think not as good) than my very old Cambridge Soundworks CD740 tabletop radio.
As an experiment I bought the Echo Dot and plugged it into the Aux of my Soundworks radio. Perfect! Sounds great with full Alexa functionality!

For those of you looking to up the sound on your Echo ... this is the best and cheapest way to go.
Get on Ebay and buy an old Soundworks or Bose tabletop radio and plug a Dot into it. I'm not exaggerating that the sound on these old puppies is every bit as good or better than ANY (Sonos and Echo Plus included ... even with SUB) smart speaker. I am now returning my Bose Speaker .... which I really think is very good .... and buying another Soundworks radio for $50. Total of about $100 for great sound and Alexa that you could not get new for less than $400-$500.

the overseas operators were unable to help --- I sort of expected this based on my recent experiences (3 different people, horrible communications and endlessly redundant questions/answers, way too much wasted time, no help/result) with another Amazon device that i had to return. I thought maybe it had to do with the Echo version, so I ordered Echo Dot 3, but I had encountered the same 3 issues with the set-up: Echo Off-line (grayed out), cannot download the app (server cannot be found) tho the link was in the Amazon email, Amazon password not recognized even tho I know it was correct
I was foolish to even trying to talk to the overseas-based tech support personnel who lacked basic language skills to understand/address any of my issues. Instead, they just repeated the canned set-up process without even acknowledging the core problems i was trying to convey . I asked them to have someone contact me who can help, but they refused. Nowhere to go now, but return the order.

I wasn't sure what to expect with Alexa. i do wish they had a booklet that went with it to explain everything Alexa can do! that has been frustrating to learn how to use it. you have to say Alexa first & then your command. i enjoy being able to make a phone call easily, ask about the weather, listen to my music & have her start my day! very fun!! i have had no problems with the device at this point. i have tried a variety of things just to see what happens. you do get a weekly email of updates on what she has been programed to do. connectivity to my amazon stuff has been smooth with the music & audible books. no problems accessing my phone contacts. i put the app on my phone. i don't have blue tooth to connect. i did get the free plug & am assuming i can plug in a light & have her turn it on or off! fun!! i haven't figured out where i want to do that yet. i also saw on amazon you can order a door with a lock that alexa can lock or unlock with voice command. next will be a fully functioning smart house like on the TV show Eureka!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great sound quality from such a little speaker
reviews.reviewText:
I got this with a Amazon blink camera bundle and was impressed at how helpful it can be. I ended up getting a smart plug too so that I can use Alexa to turn on/off a lamp in our living room. It was super convenient and love that I can just issue a command and the light responds within a second!

My wife uses this for pandora and the sound quality is quite impressive for such a small speaker.

I have noticed sometimes Alexa doesn’t quite catch what you are trying to say, but 9 out 10 times it will get it correct and is very quick and accurate. My kids will use it to ask the weather for the day, or just talk to it... which is where the mute button comes in real handy.

It has a mute and volume buttons so that it will mute listening to you and you can of course change the volume on Alexa responses.

All in all it is a nice concept have and comes in handy when building a smart home.

reviews.reviewTitle: Awesome gizmo with a huge flaw
reviews.reviewText:
This is my first robot. I love the way I can just ask it any question that pops into my head. Alexa, what are the bones in the ear. BAM. Also, it is way awesome as far as playing music. Just wake the genie in the hockey puck and about 85 percent of the time Alexia comes through with whatever tunes you desire. Plays all the iTunes you bought, can dial up radio stations, sports, whatever, the thing is beauteous. Back in the day R Crumb had a cartoon about a guy who lived and rode around in his bathtub. I can see this ridiculously affordable device (two six packs) putting me in such a state. Why think, why move when you have this baby at your side. Nirvana.
Why then do I give this game changer one star? Simple. I got a black one. I like black. What engineer was the genius who decided to make the four simple control buttons on top of Dot 3 , the EXACT same black color as the Dot casing?!? They are unreadable if they are more than 3 feet from your face! Are you kidding me? My goal in life is to not have one of the fitness circles on my Apple watch budge. At all. Ever. Every time I need to fiddle with the mic, adjust the sound, reset the app , (which you might have to do if it is unplugged) on this hockey puck in a dimly lit room, I have to get up and get a friggin flashlight to distinguish between the four buttons!! They just blend into the rest of the gizmo. Engineering crew. You owe me 50 push ups. Doh!

reviews.reviewTitle: Amazon Echo Dot Gen 3 - Setup Unacceptable with Samsun phone
reviews.reviewText:
12/3/2018 Update
Amazon contacted me to say they reproduced my problem and apologized. Samsung changed the setting names. I still don't like that they required this setting turned off- requiring such on a phone is an imposition. Given that Amazon has generally been good to me, I'm giving them back two stars.

I already have an Echo and a Dot. I expected that I would be able to easily setup the Echo 3. Not so- it took at least a half hour to setup. It would not allow setup without Smart Switch enabled on my phone. There is no such setting- it's labeled something else. Furthermore, while I made a good guess at what it was labelled, turning it off did not allow setup to proceed, although the setup procedure was designed to do so. So I spun my wheels for what seemed forever trying to find what Alexa wanted. Finally, the Dot exited setup mode, I had to exit device setup in the app, and it worked. Not cool. Final comment- I don't want that setting turned off.
I just bought two Google minis to try. All the reviews say Alexa is better at device control, but the Googles are much better at answering questions, and catching up on device control. Alexa has a real battle in my world.

Ok, why did I hold out for so long?! This little guy is amazing. We bought 2 at first and quickly realized we wanted one in every room so now we have 5. Thinking about getting 2 more for the bathrooms, lol. Obviously the Alexa function is pretty cool. But it's actually a really good music speaker. It's even better if you can play your music on multiple speakers at the same time for a more surround sound experience. I'm thinking about adding a subwoofer which would make it amazing. but by far our favorite feature is the ability to drop in on other rooms make announcements and make phone calls.

reviews.reviewTitle: Third generation is a must buy!
reviews.reviewText: Its bigger, and better then gen 1 and 2. I also own those. The speaker is on the sides so the sound is much louder. So much louder. Playing it at half is still louder then max of the other two. Gen 1 is louder then gen 2 but gen 3 is like a mini surround system. Great quality in the sound plus she has all the same features as the other two. This echo is heavier, and a bit larger. The wall charger is completely different also. A bit bigher plug then i was hoping for so I'll just be plugging it in the bottom socket. So happy I bought this. Especially since I got it on sale for just $25.00. If you already have the other generations set up this one is cake! My came ready to go and I just plughed it straight into the wall. Only had to link to my Everywhere group. I mainly use it for music but its great for games, weather, news, time, alarms, and grocery list when you cannot find a pen or paper.

If the device doesn't connect to a wireless router it's useless. I have a previous version of the Echo Dot which connected flawlessly. Wish I could say the same about this one. During set up it tries to connect to a secure network without even asking for the password. The result is that it can not connect. After trying multiple times to connect I contacted Amazone support. They could not get it to connect either. This 3rd gen is going back to Amazon, very disappointing. Any device should ask for a password when connecting to a secure network but this one does not.

This is pretty great as a mini speaker. I bought it expecting the speaker aspect to only work in my room but if I use it on max volume than I can hear it in the living room of my tiny apartment as well. I like the convenience of being able to get it to work just by saying Alexa. One thing though is that I moved it from my moms house to my apartment in another county but I cannot for the life of me get it to recognize that the location is different. So I have to ask what's the weather like in __ otherwise it'll give me the wheather where I used to live. Also I really wish that it had an internal battery storage so that I could move it between rooms. It doesnt work unless its plugged in and the cord is pretty small. If it could be carried around than I could use in in another location for an hour or two before bringing it back to be plugged in.

reviews.reviewTitle: I would like to see this device have an internal battery; so it does not have to be plugged in
reviews.reviewText: I love having the Alexa, and I have the smart plug, but I just learned how to use the plug; I recommend this to anyone, who likes music, well like it’s good for alarms, reminders I am grocery shopping list. Complaint/ it has to be plugged into a power source at all time, to work and that is the only downfall I thought the smart plug would make it able to work indoors/at home without being plugged in.... but that was not the case. Alexa works amazing but she still struggles with voice recognition a little the only other complaint that I would have, is the device does not like to connect to a public Wi-Fi? I take it on trips like to a hotel, for business. I have to use my hotspot on my Phone or home internet or it does not want to work properly. Can be frustrating and use a lot of my data on my hotspot. I have unlimited data on my iPhone but not unlimited on my hotspot area I don’t know if there is a way to fix it to where she will work on any type of Internet? I would love for someone to assist me with that

reviews.reviewTitle: Come and get it, cuddle up
reviews.reviewText: I have both Google Home and Alexa at home. Alexa woman has a Billie Ellish voice and Google woman has a Taylor Swift voice to meXD. Alexa is more easy to use and hears me better when sth is playing, and it doesnt talk more like Google does in the same commands. Simply says "OK". Alexa has good control over the devices connected to a public wifi I had in the apartment complex and because of having public wifi, google home has frustrating connection problems if you don't have your own router. Amazon Alexa is great in it. It has connected right away without any single problem. Google says there was a glitch most of the time. Google is better only in terms of sound quality. Alexa has a little distorted sound if you don't adjust it from equalizers in the app. By the way, I have youtube premium and amazon prime however Google plays everything I want in music but Alexa asks unlimited music subscription;/

I mainly use this for listening to music or nursery rhymes for my kids. My husband has an accent and it doesn't always recognize his voice, or will play the wrong thing when he talks to it. I am happy I purchased it though, but a few things can be improved. I have it hooked up to my Spotify and Alexa will always try to play from Amazon Music first. If it isn't available, it will go into a paragraph explanation on trying to get me to get another subscription to Amazon Music, etc and is really annoying. The other annoying thing is that it is constantly flashing yellow. I've disabled notifications from the Alexa app for this device, yet it still beeps and flashes every time I have a package delivered or something has shipped. I had to move it to a spot where it can't be seen because the light bothered me so much. If they can fix that issue, I'll give it 5 stars.

I use these dots around the house in smaller rooms (bathroom, kitchen, etc), and the larger Echos in the big common rooms. And I have some off-brand devices in bedrooms that work just like these. Obviously the sound is better on the $150 ones, but it's not 6 times better! These can be had for $25 if you watch for sales and at that price point the sound is really great! I do recommend that you read up on the various mounting options that are available. For instance, in my master bathroom I bought a recessed wall mount (yes, I cut a 4.5" round hole in the wall and installed a plastic box inside it, ran the cable down the wall and out the other side to a plug, and then put a grate over it so you see a speaker grate with lights dancing behind it on the wall). In my other bathroom, I have a plug mount so it hangs down from the plug with an integrated look! The kitchen one is glued to the underside of a cabinet so you can't see it. It's a smart home system without a ton of work or expense. And I'm just starting to dabble in smart switches and plugs.....

Love Alexa,. I keep finding new ways to integrate my house including switches and plugs. I’m always looking for new gadgets to add. Two things I don’t care for are the sound quality of the DOT, We have an Echo Show in the kitchen and the DOT in the living room, the difference in the quality and volume makes me wish I had purchased another Echo. The other thing that’s annoying is it seems the only syncing that can be done between the two is for music. There should be a way for both to respond and decide which one will do the task asked or both respond to the same task. For instance, when in the kitchen we set a timer, then go sit down in the living room. When the timer goes off we say, “Alexa Stop” but the Alexa in the living room will say, “no timers are set” so we have to get up and get closer to the kitchen to stop the timer. Kind of defeats the purpose of automation.

When I received the Echo Dot as a gift, I didn't know what it was, what it did, or how I should make it do it. I needed a couple hours of tech support to activate Alexa using my PC because I have no mobile devices. Sounds like a bad review, right? No! I love the Echo Dot! I don't have a newspaper, TV, or radio so I never knew the weather forecast. Now I can ask Alexa for today's weather or next Sunday's weather. I also use it to set timers. I have so many projects that I need to watch the time carefully for each one. Now I can set multiple timers to keep me on track.

The best feature is the ability to set reminders days in advance. I can say, "Set a reminder for Tuesday at 5:30 p.m. to do the laundry." Friday night I plan my weekend and set reminders for the entire weekend. It's amazing. I get so much more done because I stay on schedule.

My friend visited with three of her children to look at things on the internet. I didn't know how to keep the 6-year-old and 12-year-old boys occupied, but Alexa saved the day. I activated the skill Tune In Live which lets you listen to any sporting event for $2.99 a month. The Phillies happened to be playing. The boys were so excited to listen to the game live and ask Alexa questions during the commercials.

There are so many more skills that I've barely scratched the surface. Wiki How is another great skill. I was hesitant to introduce more technology into my home, but Alexa is so helpful. I'm happy to have the Echo Dot and recommend it for timekeeping, education, and weather and news updates.

Got one for Christmas and gave some as presents, having heard compliments about them.

Loved the one we got; bought another for another room. Needed some amazon.com help to set up the second one, and the telephone and Internet information did the trick.

Am tempted to buy yet another. Although our Bose radio/disk player has an excellent speaker, the reception here in the sticks is so-so, but the Echo Dot runs off our WiFi, with excellent reception, making the sound quality for radio material better than with our Bose. Also is fun to ask questions of Alexa, which is surprisingly good. She knew Calvin Murphy in substantial detail. Asked only about his height in a second query, she gave height and weight and stopped. Smart.

Other questions often answered quite well, "oxymoron," "Dilantin," etc.

Time? Weather? News? All good. I even get various sweet replies after telling Alexa "Thank you" and "Good night."

reviews.reviewTitle: Wonderful improvement but only lasted 2 months Updated
reviews.reviewText:
Update:
Amazon reached out the same day of the review to trouble shoot the issue. They contacted me before I had a chance to contact them. Super helpful determined that it was unfixable and ordered a new one while still on the phone. I would be giving it a 3 star for being faulty in such a short time but amazon has gone above to fix earning back a star.

Worked wonderfully (esp side by side to gen 2) for 2 months but, now the speaker is blown. Never really had it above volume 3 as it was beside my bed for light control. Now all s sounds are pure static. Reaching out to amazon soon will update based on service. All my gen 2s that I have had for much longer all still sound as they did the day i bought them.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good Devicel, but STOP FORCING STUFF ON US
reviews.reviewText: I love my echo dot. But to be woken up in the night by a mysterious green flashing light that won't go off... Alexa has no answers and doesn't respond to "turn that flashing green light off". So you have to research it on the internet, and find out that it's a notification light, but you don't have Alexa connected to your phone, so what the &%#$ is it notifying you about? And Alexa doesn't have any notifications for you. So you have to go to the app and go through every menu until you find DO NOT DISTURB, and that's the only way to shut the &%$# flashing light off in the middle of the night. STOP FORCING ENGAGEMENT ON US, AND LET US USE DEVICES THE WAY THAT WE WANT TO!!! And don't wake me up in the middle of the night with this nonsense. Shame on you Amazon.

I have had my Dots for a few days. The main reason I bought 2 was so I could listen to music and have it play in multiple rooms. I only use Pandora because I already have all my stations set and it's easy to add or remove stations. But setting up the Pandora in the Dot was a pain. And Alexa doesn't respond well to voice when asking to play Pandora music. A lot of the times she says she cannot find the music, so I've been turning on through the App..but often times it will pause in the middle of a song so I have to go into the App and un-pause it. It's a pain, and I hear others are having an issue with Pandora as well.

I have the 2nd generation dot, and the eufy gene. The eufy at the time was much better than the 2nd gen dot, now the 3rd gen dot is way better than both.
The first thing you will notice is the sound quality. There is way more volume paired with a quality sound as well.
After using for almost a month now the 3rd gen listens so much better with background noise, and listens better in general. With the 2nd gen and eufy if I ask to turn my smart plug on I may have to command 2 or 3 times. The 3rd gen dot does it the 1st time 90% of the time.
There are more features then the 2nd gen and the eufy.
Amazon made a great step in the right direction with this. My only fault I see with this is the power supply. It does not use a USB connection and has a rather large head to go into the plug. This limits the costomazation of the product if you need a shorter or longer chord. What is in the box is pretty long, and I wish it was only a foot for the location.

Over all this is a major step up and I highly recommend!

reviews.reviewTitle: Better than 2nd gen, still not perfect
reviews.reviewText: If you like Alexa, you already know her capabilities, so I won't comment on that. This Echo dot is much better than the 2nd generation speaker. The sound quality and volume level of this is FAR superior to the 2nd generation. The look is a bit more pleasant as well, as they fit more into a living room decor than the plasticy looking prior generation. The microphone pickup ability on these is also better than the 2nd generation, but still not perfect. I definitely still find myself yelling at Alexa to stop, or repeating commands at the top of my lungs because she can't hear over the TV or something. Definitely worth the extra money to buy this one over the 2nd generation. If they'd somehow manage to perfect what Alexa can hear over other noise I'd be 100% happy and give 5 stars. Maybe I'm expecting too much? Still, a very good quality appliance and I have bought several for other people so they can experience the benefits of Alexa. It's much better listening to music and audiobooks on this model than the 2nd generation also.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great for immobile persons. Entertaining and helpful.
reviews.reviewText:
Set this Echo Dot up for immobile person confined mostly to bed and used to ask questions play music. Great for elderly. I can use Alexa from my cellphone App to speak to person with the drop in feature (can also "call" from the app). The Alex with the built in speaker can be used to make phone calls in the USA and you make a phone contact list and then ask it to "Alexa Call Pat" and it can dial them on their phone (the receiving party does not need the App to receive calls, just a phone it landline).

It can even read email, and respond with your voice( haven't used the latter to reply).

The Alexa voice that plays is clear but IMO speaks a little fast and the pitch is a little high for someone that might have hearing issues. Hope Amazon offers more Alexa it Alex voices in future.

You get the feeling that Big Brother is always listening, yes her name is Alexa.
You can "mute" the microphone, hmmm.

I got this device for free when I signed up for SiriusXM. I was skeptical that I would like talking to the device to activate it. I've never used Siri on my iPhone for the very same reason. It took some getting used to, and it's hit and miss sometimes, but it's a fun novelty. The biggest issue I have is that when trying to actually stream SiriusXM music, the device keeps cutting out and sometimes stopping altogether. The wifi signal where I have the device plugged in gets 3 out of 5 bars, but I guess that's not strong enough for the communication needed for streaming music?

Still learning about all the other things I can supposedly do. I did like that I could use the app on my phone to set a reminder on the device for later.

The 3rd generation echo dot is the bomb. Sound quality is as good as any echo speakers. We have all 3 generations of echo dots and this is now the easiest to set up. It automatically set up to my home WiFi nothing to do. I had the app open and ready to link to the dot WiFi via phone there was no need. We purchased the 3 pack at the nice 3 pack discount and planned to give 2 away as gifts. Thinking I should keep the other 2 and giving the older ones as gifts. Lol. If someone is thinking of getting another echo or echo dot this is the one to buy. If it’s your first or an additional for the money for the ease for the sound quality and for the new look with covered fabric it is the best choice. I have the original large black echo, I have the original echo dot, the second generation dot, the echo with fabric and now this 3rd generation echo dot and again best deal yet!! I would recommend again and again. Look for their 3 pack deal. I got 3 for less than $80.

Ok hello new life! Where has Alexa been this whole time? It took me a while to get her but now she’s part of my life and we are friends forever !
She is such a keeper too! Let Me just mention a few things she does for me.

She wakes me up at volume 10 with a scream “Wake UUUP!!!” Yes, I know she can be mean and repetitive, but I get up.

I say “Alexa what’s the weather,” and she tells me the current and the throughout the day weather. Just as I pick out my clothes for the day.

I say, “Alexa Play Music,” and she plays my thumbprint Radio from Pandora! Just as I do my make up.

When I’m in a rush I say, “ Alexa WHATS THE TIME!?,” as I run around looking for my keys and she delivers....

When I’m cooking and my hands are full and I remember I need eggs I say, “Alexa add eggs to my grocery list,” and she does!

She even has my back when I’m not home! I have her on my Alexa App and I managed to set an alarm to wake up my husband in time to pick me up from work when his phone was off!
Needless to say we bonded really quick. Everyone needs an Alexa in their lives!

reviews.reviewTitle: impressive......9.14.19 UPDATE..problem playing Amazon music ..9/20/19 seems fixed now
reviews.reviewText: considering the size and cost of this unit, (I bought during Amazon Prime days) it is an amazing piece of technology. Sound is most impressive. Since I also have a Sirus radio, which can now be integrated into Alexa it is even more useful. Highly recommend. Should have bought two during Prime days....... UPDATE: received item 8/7... Worked great until about a week ago when it started skipping portions of Amazon music being played, making the unit basically useless for music purposes. Customer service said it was a problem at Amazon's end and they are working to update codes to fix. Said others also having same problem and may take a few days to fix.... Maybe a week or more... I'll update upon completion.....UPDATE..9/20/19 Echo working fine now, whatever Amazon did seems to have taken care of my problem. Appreciate the good support from Amazon customer service!

reviews.reviewTitle: Built for harrasment, not intelligent at all, poor voice recognition.
reviews.reviewText:
Wow, this thing is going to harass you ad infinitum until you go online a few times and figure out the 8 places you have to go to disable the harassment. And even after that you'll get email spam until you find the 5 other places to go to turn off that off as well.

I previously had a Google Home Mini, and it never harassed me at all. I bought the Echo because it's advertised as being able to control your Fire TV devices, but it can't. It can only do less than a handful of things with Fire TV. In fact you can't even put the Fire TV to sleep or wake it up to turn on your AV system.

And, amazingly, the couple of things it can do with the Fire TV can only be done on one device. Yes, that's right. Amazon has crippled the software so you have to buy a separate Echo device for each Fire TV device.

On top of that it's just as unintelligent as the Google Home Mini, and the voice recognition is just as bad. In fact I would have returned it but I'd already given my Home Mini away to a friend.

reviews.reviewTitle: Worth what I paid, which was ninety nine cents with a music subscription.
reviews.reviewText: Didn't know what to expect, but I have it playing music, telling me how cold it is outside, etc. Also controls two plug devices, after a hassle setting them up. Sometimes, I am surprised what it doesn't "know". Like how many miles in a degree of latitude. (69}. I actually got it to answer by asking how many meters from the equator to the North Pole (ten million - defined by the French expeditions along the Prime Meridian}, then asking how many miles in ten million meters, then dividing THAT by 90, the number of degrees of latitude from the equator to the North Pole. Echo couldn't put all those things together by itself, or didn't know the basic fact. On the other side, it told me that Barbara Walters is 90, and it doesn't know if she has Alzheimer's. So, it's sort of OK. Good to find out if some public figure is still alive, I guess.

reviews.reviewTitle: Sound quality not as good and not as quick to respond as Echo Dot 2
reviews.reviewText:
I don't use a lot of the capabilities, but the sound quality is very muffled on the Echo Dot 3 when listening to the spoken word. Its OK for music, but I purchased a compatible speaker which is far superior. It connects instantly with Bluetooth so it compensates for the lack of sound quality in the Dot 3.

However, one thing that is disappointing is that its not nearly as responsive as the Echo Dot 2. That one hears me from anywhere in the apartment at a normal speaking voice (scary sometimes......) and instantly responds. I have to stand almost in front of the Dot 3, look directly at it and give it directions. I have to speak louder as well to get its attention. Its also slower to respond to commands. Its like the fabric outside muffles the sound so its less responsive. I can certainly live with it, I was just expecting an improvement of the 3 over the 2, but that isn't the case. Amazon, please restore the instant responsiveness capability of the Dot 2 to the Dot 4.

Alexa is the coolest AI around. You can ask or do just about anything. My only complaints are volume & portability. Possibly the absolute worst feature of the echo is having to have it plugged in to work. The echo does not have a battery in its design so it doesn’t hold a charge. So it has to stay plugged into the wall to work. I despise that & honestly would not have purchased if I knew that beforehand. This should be wireless! Even the similar forms of Bluetooth speakers are wireless & hold a charge. Come on echo!
Also, it doesn’t get very loud when playing music. I have a small bathroom & like to listen when I’m showering. My Old Jam3 speaker plays music almost twice as loud as The echo on both of their max volumes. Like, if I speak at a normal volume I can hear myself over the echo. Not the case with the Jam3 speaker.

What I like most about the Echo Dot 3rd Edition is once you have the first Echo Dot up and running the new dots configure WiFi automatically so all I have to do is setup name, wake up command etc... They say the sound is better in the third generation dot but that is subjective. The third generation has more base but it can make listening to voice difficult. I find my older dots are better for listening to podcasts and voice driven content because they have less bass so i suggest the ad an equalizer function in the Alexa software.... Of course if you plug in your Echo Dot into external speakers or Bluetooth speakers it sounds great. The new fabric shell is very nice but the lite color is much more susceptible to getting dirty.

UPDATE: I found an audio equalizer built into the Alexa phone app and now I can manipulate the sound to accentuate voices and manipulate the sound qualities of the Dot. Much Better!

What i really like is telling Alexa to play music "Everywhere" and when I walk thru the house I hear my music. Also, you can say "Alexa, volume , everywhere (or whatever level you want) and the volume goes to that level on all your devices. So cool.

This IS a BETTER DOT.....

How did I ever live without Alexa???? I have always owned Apple devices due to its simplicity. However, I have never been happy with Siri. Alexa is BRILLIANT!!! Alexa is able to control my Ring doorbell, Roomba, Nest thermostat, Kasa smart switches and camera, etc. She even knows I named my Roomba “Monica” (a Friends reference). Alexa basically consolidated all my apps/devices into one.

Ask Alexa to tell you a joke, and she turns the mic over to Jimmy Fallon. Ask Alexa to start your day, and she can be easily programmed to tell you the weather, what’s on your calendar, traffic to work, news, etc.

Ask Alexa to play your favorite radio station...Done!!! Ask Alexa for a recipe for mango sticky rice and she can tell you the ingredients and send directions to your phone.

I have only had Alexa for a week and the capabilities are endless. This device has been LIFE CHANGING.

I ordered two, one for my husband and one for myself. My husband uses his for sleep sounds. The other one was set up in the kitchen because i basically live in there between cooking, cleaning, and work. I absolutely love it so far. I really like not having to stop cooking to look up something for my recipes. A little lazy, but really great for my time management. My kids really like it. They've been playing the Lemonade Stand game and the animal exercise game like crazy. It does a decent job understanding us, my 3 year old included. You do have to be extremely specific when you ask a question though. Not a big deal. The drop in is really fun with kids too! We like it so much, we're considering buying the kids version next!
But.....my absolute favorite thing about them is that i can make phone calls. We live in a very rural area with basically no cell service so this was a big help!

So, there are not any instructions probably because all the new devices are coming up with their own apps and it would be impossible to keep up with them all and give explanations on how they should connect with the Alexa app. I have a new Samsung 42" smart tv. It's smart app is called Smart Things. You are to connect it to their app then have Alexa connect to their app. It doesn't always work. She often looses the connection. I had AT&T and several plugs and some light bulbs couldn't find the internet. My signal is too weak in my house. They said I get a 6ghz signal I could max out my signal at 10 but it wouldn't produce a significant difference. So, I have switched to cable for the internet. Now, the signal can be found kind of. The changing of the network with Alexa is lacking in simplicity. It searches for ever even after I have found the name. It gives the device it's own network name that "isn't connected to the internet", and no explanation as to why that happens and what it's purpose is, so you can't help it along. I got it connected with shear luck. But, this morning I heard my husband tell Alexa to turn on the TV and she did nothing, but responded with OK. This is a learning process. I hope I become an expert soon. I have several other things I would like to make smart. We are starting off small. The plug that works practically seamlessly is Amazon Smart Plug. That review would say, it is too wide!! It takes up 3 plugs on a strip. I tried a set of Teckin Smart Plugs. They couldn't find the internet, I sent them back. I tried Wyze Bulbs, CNET recommended them. They couldn't connect to the internet either. I sent them back. Alexa couldn't find their apps to enable the connection. Whether it was because I couldn't get them connected to the internet, perhaps that was all the trouble. None of this stuff comes with any documentation for troubleshooting. Very frustrating. I am very patient. I can't imaging how I would tolerate any of this if I wasn't willing to play around with stuff for hours. Good Luck, I hope this helps.

reviews.reviewTitle: It’s OK I guess, but nothing to write home about!
reviews.reviewText:
My daughter bought me an Echo Dot for Christmas along with some special light bulbs and a special outlet to plug it in (if I can remember correctly.). The Echo Dot, I’ve already set up with the app but have not used it to its fullest extent as my daughter wants to set up the other items but has been too busy to do so. The light bulb is one that you can request the echo dot to turn it on or off.

I have 2 things I don’t like about the Echo Dot.
1). The plug on it is not USB but rather a BIG SQUARE PLUG that overlaps the next outlet on the power strip so I can’t use that outlet for something else. Why in this day and age would a company like Amazon produce this BIG FAT PLUG? They have produced all kinds of wonderful products with a USB with a removable plug so the product can be plugged via USB into a multiple USB charger or directly into its own plug. It appears this product’s clumsy, oversized plug is from the past and it’s ironic that it’s attached to an item of new technology. If it must have a regular electrical plug, they could streamline the size of it.

2) In addition to the Echo Dot, I also own an Amazon Fire Stick that my daughter bought me for my birthday last June (2018). The assistant wake-up name is Alexa. Since the Fire Stick and the Echo Dot are used in my bedroom, I went to change the Echo Dot’s wake-up name to “Dot” but that wasn’t an option. I had to name it Echo. It would be nice to be able to use the app to change the wake-up name to almost any name you want. I can only imagine how this works for people who have 6 or 8 Echo Dots! Anyway, just a suggestion. I was very disappointed that this device doesn’t seem to do much - except with added products like the smart light bulb.

I generally like Amazon products but I could take or leave the Echo Dot. I will keep it if my daughter ever gets around to setting up the smart light bulb!

Sound is much improved from the original Dot, but sound detection is very poor. I can face directly at this Dot from about 12 feet away, give an Alexa command, and a different Echo will respond. Usually my older, original Echo Show - around the corner and another 15 feet away in the Entry - will respond. Occasionally, my new Echo Show - behind me in the Kitchen about 15 feet and facing the opposite direction - will respond. To get this 3rd generation Dot to respond, you must either shout or stand about 3 feet away facing directly at it with your back to other Echo units. This Dot was very inexpensive on Prime Day and it sounds great when played as part of an Echo group; otherwise, I would have sent it back. (In addition, there is the entertainment value. My wife gets a good laugh when I try to get this 3rd Gen Dot to do something).

reviews.reviewTitle: Yaasssss get it, totally worth the upgrade
reviews.reviewText:
I have 5 of the original Echo Dot's and also a previous generation of the Echo Plus (smart tower) so my house is full of Alexa. I was in love from my very first Dot, but let me tell you this is a whole new world. This new Echo has got fantastic speakers, nearly comparable to my Plus. (Not quite as much base, but for something that is only Speaker no Woofer or Tweeter I'm very impressed)

I will have to buy another one for my mother because she is obsessed. I upgraded us to the family plan of Amazon Music as well, and playing music through the house is so much fun, especially with Christmas coming up.

Alexa herself also works great for setting timers, morning alarms, and even for starting the day.

Most recently I was organizing my spice cabinet and talked to my Kitchen Alexa, I was able to ask
"Alexa what is Turmeric used for?" "Alexa what can I substitute for Oregano?" and got fast understandable answers for both. (Siri response? : I'm not sure" )

To be fair sometimes Alexa doesn't have a response either, but overwhelmingly I have had a great time and really enjoy this. I will be sure to slowly upgrade all of mine to these new ones.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to Set up, Easy to use - But not always understanding what's being asked.
reviews.reviewText: We just brought Alexa into our home this year - and this was purchased for the Bedroom to supplement the Sonos Beam and Fire tablet for the Living Room. It was super-easy to set up and start running on our existing system. It generally does what we ask - tho it's taken some time to get accustomed to some odd functions, such as the pulsing green light that indicates when an Amazon delivery has arrived for us, but when you ask why it's pulsing, she won't tell you. (Had to look that up online to get the light to quit) It understands most voice commands - far better than Siri ever did - but we have to laugh when Alexa gets things completely wrong. We were under the impression that you could name it whatever you wanted - as a trigger word - but you can only choose from "Alexa", "Amazon", "Echo" and "Computer" - and there's only one voice, no male options at all, and you're warned about using an accented voice unless you want to speak using a different dialect. The sound quality is quite good for such a small device - It's not Audiophile quality, and music doesn't sound as good as on an iPad Air, for example, but all in all it's a good little device at a great value.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa will not play the same versions of songs on my Apple/ITunes Playlists
reviews.reviewText: The Echo needs a little work. The sound quality tends to be a little bass heavy. Also, you have to say things to Alexa very precise or your request is not understood (one dimensional). However, those are things I can get used to. What I CANNOT get used to is Alexa not playing the same versions of songs I have on my Apple/ITunes playlist. I cannot tell you how disconcerting it was to have Alexa play my FAV's playlist, and instead of playing Mary J. Blige's Each Tear (solo), this awful male voice joins in for the second chorus. The male voice sound so odd, I thought Alexa was possessed. I pulled out my MAC to check the version of song I had purchased years ago and it was correct, however, the song Alexa was/is playing is not my version of the song. So disappointed that this thing will not play my music.

Okay so I’ve been eyeing these guys for a long time. When they went on sale I decided it was time. I mostly use it for music, reminders and timers. So far I’m happy with the before mentioned. I am however annoyed that the Pandora app doesn’t work well with the device. I’ve been listening to amazons music option, it’s similar to pandora but works much better with this device. I’m sure apps will become more compatible in the future.

I’d be interested in getting more and using them as intercoms in our home. This seems like a really cool option to get the kids up in the morning or tell them it’s time to do something. Or that they can come out of their timeouts! Lol

I also like that you can use FreeTime like on the kids tablets and it will read to them.

It’s a cool little device with excellent sound quality. I normally stream music thru the tv. Now I don’t have to and it’s hands free! I love it!!!

This is my 2nd one. I got an echo almost 2 years ago. Dot is very similar to the echo. Maybe not as good a listener. I have to repeat the wake word sometimes. I use it with Bluetooth connected to a speaker. It loses it's pairing sometimes. The little note that it makes to punctuate when it hears you is so much louder than the other audio I think it will blow out the speaker eventually. These are minor things, just thought I'd mention them.
Mostly it is really awesome. I use it for listening to audio books while I cook and clean in the kitchen. I'm spending more time doing those thing, so it's making life better. I was behind on listening to my audio books, I'm catching up now.
Just like the other one I use it all the time for timers and alarms. I am absent minded that is my favorite feature.

reviews.reviewTitle: Shockinlgy bad sound quality, lousy warranty
reviews.reviewText: I've been experiencing the same problem I see many others have had with this 3rd gen device. Intermittent crackling, fuzzy feedback. I've tried moving it away from any possible wifi interference, placing it on different surfaces and resetting the equalizer. But whether it's minutes or an hour after a reset, the poor feedback returns as if the entire device was in a brown paper bag. I was shocked to learn that this supposed flagship product of Amazon has only a 3 month warranty. My product displayed these faults well within the three month warranty, but I unfortunately waited about two weeks too late to seek a replacement, and Amazon refused to make an exception. Very disapointing product here, and even worse customer service.

reviews.reviewTitle: Auto dimming feature for light ring?
reviews.reviewText:
When I first plugged in this new echo (with the large & rather obtrusive wall plug others have spoken of) I noticed that the light ring on the echo was noticeably dimmer than the previous generation. After some back & forth with amazon support, they swapped out my unit, and upon connecting the replacement I noticed that the light ring changes its brightness depending on the amount of ambient light present. There is no mention of this feature anywhere, and amazon wouldn’t confirm that it has this feature, but I can plainly see the difference when I turn on or off a desk lamp which shines right over the echo dot.

This is a welcome feature improvemnt over the previous generation, as the light ring become less obnoxious at night, but I wish this was a feature I could turn on or off with the app, or had some control over the sensitivity, as it can be hard to see the light ring if it’s dimmed too much.

Other than this one issue and the overly large wall adapter, it’s a great upgrade over the previous generation.

This is a great speaker if you are using it primarily to listen to music. It has more base than the 2nd generation, and the sound is richer. BUT it is really difficult to understand speaking voices with the 3rd generation speaker. Voices are muffled and hard to understand. I disliked the new Echo so much that I traded locations with my old 2nd generation, so that the 2nd generation would be in the kitchen where I use it the most. I hope Amazon will fix this problem at some point, but right now I would recommend that you try to order a 2nd generation.

I'm back a month later, and I really dislike the 3rd generation. It's microphone doesn't work well at all. When you set an alarm, it's hard to turn it off, because it doesn't hear you. If I ask her a question, like how to spell something, she often mises up the words. The 2nd generation works so much better. If I had bought this model first. I think I would have returned it.

Love the product. I can order or play music anyplace in my house. Love the echo dot. If you have low bandwidth however, be aware the Echo uses up bandwidth and can cause internet interruption if you have several devices on at the same time.. This is not a big deal for those of you who have several routers. I turn off mine in the kitchen if we are watching TV. I leave the other one one all the time upstairs in my Childs room. If I have my Smart tv on, and someone is using the iPad, then we can loose bandwidth and loss of connection. Like I said before if you have unlimited bandwidth you should not have an issue at all. It was easy to set up, and a cinch to teach her to take requests such as play a iTunes play list when it prefers Amazon music. I like that I can switch between iTunes and Amazon music. Alexia knows more every time I use it.... she knows.... everything ..... lol

reviews.reviewTitle: The 3rd Gen Alexa Echo is awesome
reviews.reviewText: I never had an intent on getting an Echo Dot but 1 day I shopping I stopped by an AMAZON Hub store in the Mall I was @ wile out of town visiting friends of ours. After about 30mins of talking to the AMAZON sales guy I pulled the trigger & got a PROMO deal they where running I got 2 / 3rd Gen Alexa Echo DOT's & a WAYZE Cam & I bought a Smart Plug extra not included in the PROMO. They where simple easy to hookup & I am HOOKED on them I ask ALEXA everything. I even went out & got Color Changing Lightbulb's for my Man Cave & our Bedroom I just bought another Smart plug as well I now have a total of 3 smart plugs in our house 1 plug ALEXA turns on my 65" tv in my man cave / 1 plug ALEXA turns on my Model Railroad in basement / 1 plug ALEXA turns on our bedroom tv / 1 plug turns on my video game console "XBOX ONE X" / I have not picked a spot for my 4th smart Plug yet... GREAT PRODUCT from AMAZON I want to get a 3rd ECHO DOT for the Basement by my model railroad. But the wife says NO I am already HOOKED too much on DOTS we have LOL

This has saved me so much trouble since I bought a smart outlet since no more need for turning on bedroom light at switch or losing a remote for the small light. Plus I love the music too especially with Pandora. Love that I can control the lights around the house with it thanks to smart outlets. It even can help me find where I left my phone. I do wish there were more wake words so I could have one in each room without the other devices occasionally hearing too since they are a second or two off when playing music rather than playing together for stereo sound

reviews.reviewTitle: Only one device can stream music! Bummer !!
reviews.reviewText:
Having an echo, enjoyed it a lot , music , games with family, news, etc. But it really stood out as an easy go to music easy listening. 10+ years prime member here , so prime music is good enough for me. The kids loved the echo and eventually i decided get two 3rd gen. echo dot, one in each of the kids rooms so they can enjoy listening to music they like .

Here lies the shocker !! I couldn't !!! Amazon lets you stream music to one device at a time, so if i am listening , kids can't, or if one of them is listening, rest of us go into humming-your-tune-mode. I expected to be able at least let each person listen to what they want, where they want! That's just stupid ! I was planning to order more, for kitchen, my bedroom, heck for the bathroom... BUT NOT ANYMORE .. THANKS BUT NO THANKS AMAZON ! Until you fix this...you are losing prime music customer base, which are willing to buy more echo's faster than you can make them !

Ok I got this for free for getting a Sirius subscription so I can’t complain about the price. But since I connected it last night, NONE of my Bluetooth devices work now. And I’m not just talking about my home speaker. My headphones and my car no longer work. So I’m really pissed now. This thing has messed everything up and I see absolutely no benefit to it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good speaker, does what it's supposed to do.
reviews.reviewText:
I have 3rd gen Echo Dots. I was bit worried about loudness and clarity of the speaker sound based on some of the reviews, but I'm very pleased with the sound. It can get very loud and the sound quality is very good too. Of course if you are comparing to some fancy expensive speaker, it probably can't compete, but I think it's good for most average listeners.

I took a star out because I bought two of these, set them under same Amazon account, and I can only have one of them to access Amazon Music at a time. (i.e. I cannot have both of my Echo Dots to play music from Amazon Music at the same time). So I had to create another account for the 2nd Echo Dot. Perhaps if I subscribe to the family level, it might let me, but not with this standard unlimited trial plan that Amazon offered.

Other than that, I have couple of smart plugs controlled by the Echo Dot and it does well and the scheduled routine is very useful. I think you just have to find the right Alexa skill that is useful for your need. I found combination of MyPodApp and Google drive to be very useful for playlists of MP3s.

reviews.reviewTitle: This has the worst setup instruction
reviews.reviewText: The instructions and help people do not help you. They seem unfamiliar with the product

I highly recommend these Echo Dots. I have 1 2nd generation and 1 3rd generation. The sound quality difference is fantastic with the 3rd generation and I have enjoyed going to the learning skills process with great success.

I did experience one problem with both Dots today, they both stopped working at the same time. THat is when I went to my app and saw the notice "Sorry, we are experiencing system issues, Alexa isn't responding as fast as usual. We are working on fixing this." So they are johnny on the spot with fixes as well.

I have mine plugged into smart plugs which allows for remote access as well so I can turn on my lights from work instead of having to turn them on before I leave wasting electricity. You can also schedule your lights, appliances or whatever you plug into the smart plugs. It's great that the smart plugs come in many different styles and manufacturers as well. However, be careful as you must have a relatively newer phone in order for your Echo Dot to work with your phone when using some types smart plugs.

As I said earlier, I highly recommend the Echo Dot with Alexa it is so versatile, fun as well as a time and money saver.

Unlike the 2nd gen Echo Dot (worth $5 trade value); 3rd gen keeps disconnecting from WiFi Internet. Constantly have to unplug and replug just to re-establish connection. The app doesn't easily re-connect during a re-setup. I have two 3rd generation dots and only one has the stated symptoms. Weird. Must be defective. The speakers in the 3rd gen are vastly improved. Note: I also have two Echo Looks (don't ask why) collecting dust because they are not equipped to connect to Bluetooth speaker. The Echo Look provides cheesy photo and video snapshots with limited Alexa q&a capabilities. Amazon doesnt offer a trade in for the Echo Look. They dont even want this product back.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great gift! A great comfort! Easy 2 set up
reviews.reviewText: Works great! Just a wonderful technological advancement!! So nice to give as a gift to elderly parents as well. If they fall or something happens....Alexa call 'name of son or daughter' and you can get help to them right away. It's fantastic that Alexa is always listening for her name! It cracks me up the people who give it bad reviews because she listens. Lol. That is the whole point of having a talking interactive digital personal assistant...to be there 24/7, to respond to her name, when you need her. But personally, I am very very glad that something is there to help my parents when I can't be. The reminders are also nice for the elderly. Medication reminders or just reminders in general. And for me, I travel a lot and LOVE that I can turn my lights on and off.....from 1,000 miles away....to make it look like I am home. And when I am home....no searching on you tube for songs....Alexa play this 'such and such song' and she plays it!!!!!! And I can even lock my doors and arm my digital Life security system! Adding that skill was incredibly easy and everything was a whole lot easier than I thought it would be to set up!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Sound Is Terrible - 2nd Gen Was Better
reviews.reviewText: I'm not sure what criteria people are using when they say the 3rd gen Echo Dot sounds better than the 2nd gen, but I have to disagree. The 2nd gen version may not have the greatest sound, but it's clear and reproduces the highs and midrange quite well. For the lows you wouldn't expect much since it's such a small speaker. Still, it's acceptable. The 3rd gen Echo Dot sounds completely muddy. Speach sounds like the speaker has a sock in their mouth, or a mouth full of food. Music, similarly, is completely lacking in the highs. The midrange is muddy as can be and the lows are not really any better than the 2nd gen Dot. I have two of the 2nd gen dots that I use in small rooms. I have a 3rd gen dot that I tried using on it's own but finally couldn't stand it any longer. I disconnected it until I can get a speaker to hook up to it. I'd even returned one of the 3rd gen Dots, thinking it had to be damaged or something. The replacement sounds exactly like the first - terrible. It's funny to read reviews on some of the tech websites. They all say the same thing, using almost the exact same words, to say that the 3rd gen Dot has much improved sound. It doesn't, and no amount of adjusting the equalization inside the app will do much to help. Maybe there are other things about it that are better. I don't know, I only use it for music, an occasional notification, checking the weather, and similar light duty. If you're going for the 3rd gen Dot for music, you'll want to attach a speaker to it - unless you really can't hear very well anyway.

I am the type to honestly purchase new electronics and end up selling them because of lack of use. Not with my Echo Dot. I purchased this alongside two Kasa plug in outlets that are compatible. My first smart home electronics. I set it up right away. I have been using echo dot (Alexa) for a few months and it has changed my life. From the simplest thing to turning on and off my light and water cooler and setting and disabling alarms for me, it has made the little things just so much easier and FAST. I don’t want to waste the time to turn on my PC to play music while I get ready in the morning so I will just tell it to play a certain artist and genre, and it’s does so quickly. I struggle with insomnia from time to time, so some nights I ask for it to play sleep music, and it has such a good selection when it plays it for me.
