I absolutely love this device as a 19 year old open to using electronics for different purposes, and I am excited to find out the other skills and uses the device has! Thank you for creating this!

reviews.reviewTitle: OHHH Alexa! Where have you been all my life?
reviews.reviewText: I really like this thing. i am not techy at all, so Alexa is pretty laid back in my home. My favorite part is when I'm running around late for work and yell, "ALEXA! What time is it????" My next fave, "ALEXA, what is the weather today?" And seriously, having her play all my old favorite songs with just a simple request is like Christmas every day! I know I am simple, and easily amused, but this is just the best thing ever. It was so easy to set up, I did it myself. I hope my kids one day add a few extra features, but if they never do, I will be happy to just have Alexa around for these things. ONLY complaint is the speaker is a bit muffled, but the dot is not very big and I may someday get another speaker to improve the sound quality. PFFFFF not really much to complain about with this awesome gadget and the sooo very reasonable price!!

reviews.reviewTitle: BUYERS BEWARE , Amazon will only replace faulty item with a refurbished one
reviews.reviewText: I ordered two echo dot 3's when Amazon had their "big sale". One set up to wi-if no problem and has worked great since. The second one, I had to try several times to connect, before I was successful. But it did not stay connected and all I could get out of it was a " I'm having difficulties at this time, please try later" response. At times it would just start talking without even being prompted.Then it might work for a week or so before it wouldn't do anything. I reached out to customer service via chat. That chat lasted over thirty minutes only to be " disconnected " before problem resolved. Again I reconnected going thru all the steps. Week later it didn't stay connected, so I called and talked to a " electronic specialist ". That call was over half an hour long. I tried requesting a return shipping label, so I could send it back and get a new replacement since it was a faulty device. I was told that is not an option. I would have to send it back and they would fix it. I responded that I bought a new item and want a new one as a replacement, not a "FIXED ITEM " He finally agreed to send out a NEW echo dot and I would have to return the original. A few days later, I received a "REFURBISHED" echo dot 3. When I called to speak to a supervisor, I was told that it is their policy to send refurbished ones if a new one is not in "their stock". Doesn't matter they have new ones to sell on the website. I told him that I don't except that and it was not what I paid for. And if they are sending out refurbished echos, there must be a huge problem with them. He advised that they test them and to try it out. So I opened the box. All that was in the box was the echo dot. No power source . Again 4th time reaching out to a Tech specialist- supervisor and 45 minutes of phone time. I was told that they only send device out when replacing. And they don't send out any accessories. When was a plug considered an accessory when it is needed to use device. Again I told him that I bought a new device and it was faulty and I wanted a new device as a replacement. Not one that has been fixed. Also I found out that the 90 day warranty did not begin again when the replacement device gets registered. They back date it to the original sell date of first device. So I only had 40 days left on the warranty. Also if you go on line , a refurbished echo goes for $29.99, compared to the $ 49.00 , for a new one. Not once did any representative say that I would be refunded the $20.00 difference for the refurbished echo dot. I told him that this is an AMAZON echo dot. It has their name on the product and they should stand behind their name. I also said if I were to buy a tv from a store and took it home and it quit working, they would replace it with a new tv, not a refurbished one. I will never buy another electronic device that AMAZON sells with their name on it. I will tell all my friends and family that they will get screwed if something goes wrong with their product. So buyer beware. Amazon does not stand behind their products and the consumer whom keeps their business Alive.

reviews.reviewTitle: Coming from a 2nd gen, this is a nice upgrade
reviews.reviewText: I have two 2nd gen dots in my house and bought this during Prime day. The voice recognition seems improved as it can hear me from farther away than before and the speaker quality is night and day. I put this in my living room where my kids like to tell Alexa to play different songs and previously with the 2nd gen vs now with the 3rd gen, the quality it emits is much better. I use Alexa for a lot of things--random questions that would be easier to ask her than to look it up on my phone which always gets me a good answer, to control the various wifi lights I use, to set timers for when I'm cooking, to ask what the weather is/will be like, and lastly to play music. These are extremely helpful to have and depending on how large your house is, you should have at least 3 of them strategically placed in your house for easy voice access whenever you need to ask her something.

reviews.reviewTitle: Amazing!!!! Quite impressive. It is worth the money!!!
reviews.reviewText:
Right out of the box I hooked it up with no problem. I do like the power cable for not being a USB connection. I have a 2nd generation dot that would become unplugged especially useing a power supply.

I have been using as before mention for nearly a year. I have noticed how flat the sound is. It would cause you to realize or wonder if the sound is down mixed to one channel. It is more for reading than anything else. Its day is over.

From the instance you plug it in Alexa's voice sounds fuller than being spoken though a muffled small speaker. Soon after hooking it up I by chance played instrumental music to balance the sound. The sound is like listening in a restraunt to add an ambiance setting. I also listen to a kindle booK, her voice was clear than 2nd gen. Otherwise it sounds as a real person is speaking. It's not as someone is speaking from a distance. As stated, I ballaced the sound : base, mid, treb to get it sounding smoothly. I am impressed for a good reason. It is something that can be used at a party but also doesn't need to be turned up if used in the kitchen. Keep in mind, the environment does effect the sound so adjust to it. The volume can be turned up loud but who wants to. The voice does "hangs on" the louder it gets. The volume does get to the point of being annoying.

It is really convenient being able to use the voice control and automation features. Super handy. I was really starting to like having the Alexa around, I had one in my bedroom and one in the living room.. Except I woke up in the middle of the night with my room full of smoke and the outlet my Alexa was plugged into was on fire. I quickly turned off the breaker and extinguished the fire, but it really scared me considering I would have been leaving for work two hours after and it could of burned down my apartment with my kitten in it. I'm not sure if I can trust any Amazon devices after this. This was way to close of a call. I'd recommend checking your insurance plan for fire coverage and potentially upgrading before installing these in your house. Mine lasted maybe a month or two before bursting into flames during my sleep, but your milage may vary.

Got this for free with a Ring Doorbell. It is a large improvement over my Gen 2 dot. Sound is very good for such a small device. Very acceptable for streaming music while I work. Seems to pick up commands better than the Gen 2 does, but it is in a smaller room, so that might make a difference. Still misunderstands more than I would like. I really like the heavier design and rubberized base. It stays were I put it. Much more attractive than the gen 2. WiFi is improved over the Gen 2 as well. It connects to 802.11 AC while the Gen 2 only connects to N which is great as I'm trying to reduce/eliminate all Non-AC devices. If I get a chance to pick up more Gen 3 dots, I'll replace my Gen 2 dot and Gen 1 Echo. This device is nice enough, that I'm not sure why I would want a new Echo. It sounds good, is compact, looks good, and blends into the environment. If I want better sound for music, I'll turn on my receiver.

I received this as a gift. I wouldn't have bought it for myself, and in fact, I still wouldn't. So I'm probably the last person who should be reviewing it. Or maybe not; having no expectations, maybe I can try to be entirely objective about it. It is unobtrusive in appearance and the power supply wall wart has a decently long cable, so finding a place to situate it is pretty easy. It was very easy to set up, starting with the alexa app on the iPhone, and all adjustments since have been easily accomplished using the device itself. Teaching Alexa to recognize my voice and my wife's was straightforward. It can 'hear' and understand instructions from 10 or more feet away, though getting closer helps if it seems to be having trouble understanding something. Most of the time it understands what it's being asked surprisingly well, though sometimes it's necessary to try a few times to find the right form in which to ask something. Sound quality for such a small device is very acceptable for background or casual listening, though no-one would mistake it for hi-fi. And of course it's mono, unless you pair it with a second one. It is loud enough to be more than adequate in even quite a large room. So as a modern alternative to a boom box for playing music while you do something else, it's very effective. At the moment I have a free trial of Prime Music, but this is frustrating as about 30% of what I ask for isn't available. It would definitely be worth getting the full Amazon Music service if you intend to make more than very intermittent use of it. You can have it tell you jokes and play games; I couldn't care less. You can use it to streamline the shopping process on Amazon; that might be convenient but I'm wary of ceding too much control of that to a relatively autonomous device; I think I'd rather spend the extra time checking what I'm ordering and howg than just saying 'Alexa, order x, y or z', but it may well be possible to set it up so it can't cause too much trouble. So it's a nice toy, and I guess I like having it around because I intend to keep it plugged in and may even try Amazon Music. Has it enhanced my life beyond all recognition? Nope. Not even close. Does it appear to have been nicely designed and to be capable of anything between casual entertainment and some quite useful tasks? Yes, certainly. It's a fun little gadget. I guess, despite myself, I'm quite happy to recommend it, at least at the price I didn't pay for it.

This unit is great if you Do not have any previous batteries chargers holders or anything like that from the previous generation. As of now there are no known technical differences as far as capability between gen 2 and 3. I do wish however dad it was easier to set up and I could attach a battery to it as I live in a small space and my routine was always too let my previous ECO wake me up fully charge on the battery and move it through the house with me. I haven’t quite figured out what the advantage is yet other than response time and machine learning which seems to be a little bit less functional Previous Dot to after a long time I wish there was an easier way to sync their data. I do however love the new color and form factor I just wish there was a simpler way to use it other than always having to revert back to a tablet – making it self-sustaining. I’m also a little hesitant that it activates skills without your knowledge especially high cognitive machine learning. It has told me some very very strange things such as where it’s data centers are located in Texas and it ties with Siri and IBM Watson LOL and then doesn’t remember.

reviews.reviewTitle: Hasn't been as good as Gen2 for me
reviews.reviewText:
UPDATE: Things are getting even worse. It really has poor microphones. I have this in the bedroom and I have to raise my voice (even though room is silent) to get it to hear me. Wakes up my wife. My older echos work much better.

I have a voice that doesn't carry very far so I was excited to replace my gen2 Dot with this one... which promised better microphones to pick up voices even when there's background noise. I have not seen any improvement. I would say it is actually worse for me. Biggest pro is the whisper functionality - when it works. For example: I whispered something to try and be quiet for someone that was sleeping... Alexa whispered back the answer then asked in a normal loud tone something like "Did I answer your question?". Defeats the purpose of the whisper. Overall, I like Echo Dot. I just haven't had a good experience with the gen3 version. Don't know if it's an anomaly for me or if others are experiencing same thing.

I have Apple Siri. I had Google Assistant. I was hoping Amazon Echo and Alexa would be the best choice for most needs. Alexa has more skills and better music quality than the others. The price for two Echo Dots (3rd Gen) was hard to pass up. It really is new and improved. I have been a huge Amazon fan. However, the Echo series has some fatal flaws: (1) Privacy. Do you really want to give Amazon the capability to listen in (or view with the Echo Show) anytime, anywhere, even in your bedroom? (2) Utility. This device will not replace my smartphone or tablet for listening to an Audible audiobook at night, privately with earbuds. Why? Because I can't control the audiobook from the ear pods. To pause I would have to say something to Alexa and wake up my wife in the process. This device will NOT replace a NOAA weather radio for assured tornado warning alerts … the software is much too limited. Devices like these MUST reduce clutter, not increase it. These factors combine to make it much lower in value than it appears.

reviews.reviewTitle: THE ABSOLUTE WORST TECHNICAL SUPPORT EVER
reviews.reviewText:
The product is pretty cool. However, I'm currently experiencing an issue with the alarm sound. First, I chatted with someone, who then asked if I was referring to Amazon Music (??!?) No. This is an alarm issue with my Echo Dot Gen 3. Then, they asked for my phone number (which is already on file) so they can have the "experts" call me & walk me through the repairs.

The woman that calls me sounds like she is in the front row of a concert. There is an ABSURD amount of noise in the background. So much so, that I can just barely make out what she is telling me. She walks me through various steps. One of which is a factory reset. It wouldn't reset, which revealed a possible second issue. I ask her about THIS issue and she tells me she doesn't have an answer because she's been passing all of the info to "The Development Team". WHY WOULD I NEED TO TALK TO YOU IF YOU'RE SIMPLY A LIAISON??!? I need to talk to the people you're relaying my issue & coinciding info to!

After all that, NOBODY has given me any answers and I now have to wait 3 DAYS to hear back from HER. SHE will then relay the findings of "The Development Team" back to me. This says to me, if their suggestion doesn't work at that point, I then will have to do this same song & dance with 2 people & a team all over again.

Pure insanity.

reviews.reviewTitle: We love our Dots! This was our second; and our favorite!
reviews.reviewText:
The sound is AMAZING. It fills two rooms nicely. It sounds better than our little Bluetooth speaker. We do have issues with Sirius XM on it. It could be our internet, or Sirius XM, it keeps losing connection. I do not think it is the DOT, I think it is our Evil Internet. We Love The “Drop In” Feature, it save us from having to run up & down the stairs..or screaming at eachother. There are so many fun Skills, we have yet to use them all. I do want a third one, for the bedroom.. Dot makes a great alarm clock/ Sleep Machine. I LOVE all the Options.. Story Time, Sleep Sounds, Amazon Music.. REMINDERS, where would I be without REMINDERS.. Oh, I forgot.
WE did have to change her name to “Computer”.. Anytime I would listen to a video, or be on a call, and “Alexa” was said.. Ours would respond..LOL. That was driving us batty.

Alexa has been working better for our calls, than the “Google Phone” device thingy. If I did not have to take “private calls”, I would send that back & get another Dot!

We just got some of the light bulbs and are excited to try those.

reviews.reviewTitle: Some real interesting conversations with this
reviews.reviewText:
I like my Alexa, but I sure hope it improves. I have a Living room fan which gets used almost every day, I will tell Alexa "Living Room Fan on" to which she replies, "I can not find a device named Living Room Heater" and we are off I try several more times and unless I speak very slowly just a few inches away she just does not get it. Alexa does not have that issue with the living room lamp or the living room door, how does she confuse FAN with HEATER?

I will just make a couple of points I can keep going a while. I like playing music via Alexa, but if you try to give a command while she is playing music, bring our your inner drill instructor, because she will never respond unless you get close and yell or press the button on top to shut her up.

I like it and hope she gets better, meanwhile our give and take when she gets it wrong would make for good Abbot and Costello fodder.

reviews.reviewTitle: Review for ECHO AUTO (posted here because Amazon isn't yet allowing reviews for Auto)
reviews.reviewText:
1. Does not respond to commands such as "alexa, cancel" or "alexa, silence". Plays (tunein radio, for instance, unceasingly, despite all attempts to silence it).
2. Takes a VERY LONG TIME to re-establish functionality after encountering even the most-minor drop in cellular data coverage. In an area with spotty reception, this is a 100% functionality-killer, especially since the device does not resume what it was doing following a momentary interruption in its data connection (similar to a problem that plagues all Echo devices).
3. Cannot be configured for selectable wake words, custom device name, or language.
4. Will not function with a USB "charging" cord, even if no data connection is required.
5. Needs a small speaker, so that it can respond if not presently routed through car audio system (which it can detect via feedback through its built-in microphones).

reviews.reviewTitle: DONT LIKE THAT ECO CAN LISTEN TO PRIVATE CONVERSATIONS
reviews.reviewText: WHY DO YOU NEED TO LISTEN IN ON PRIVATE CONVERSATIONS WILL PROBALY THROW IN TRASH WILL RETHINK ABOUT BUYING FROM AMAZON AFTER THIS . NOT HAPPY !!!!!!!!!!!! ,first one I owned thought it should work better, some things work great others not so much , Bumped up the star rating because an Amazon rep. called and is trying to help me with problems 2 thumbs up to amazon for the call !!!! BUT NOW VERY UNHAPPY WITH YOUR PRIVACY VIOLATION

reviews.reviewTitle: Great help with day to day activities
reviews.reviewText: Having Alexa has made my life easier. It (She?) does everything from reminding me daily to take my meds to assisting with shopping and shopping lists. We converse on everything from the nature of the universe to answering questions like can cows swim. People ask, aren't you afraid of "them" listening? I answer, I'm not doing or saying anything "they" can't hear. There is no secret subversive spy stuff going on in my house, so no, if anything "they" probably think we're pretty silly in my household. We play games, run appliances, listen to music, news and ambiance sounds and generally have fun with Alexa. She's become an extension of the house and at times is hilarious. Only occasionally will she give me some off the wall answer that makes me think she tapped into secret government projects (like her answer to my question what's in retinol cream - she gave me answer sounding like she was describing a retina screen) and the men in black will be showing up at my door soon. But all in all I'm thoroughly enjoying my Echo, the sound quality is great and setup and operation are a snap.

I am VERY impressed with this device. I've got 4 of the 2nd generation Echo Dots, and this new 3rd generation positively blows them away. This Dot actually puts out some noticeable bass - the 2nd gen had absolutely none. Instead of sounding like an intercom speaker, this one can be used to enjoy music as well as all the other features.

Now, it's not going to replace your larger Echo devices in the sound department, but for putting next to a computer or listening to from the nightstand, this Dot is ideal. I used to love the versatility of the 2nd gen, and still do, but this one has all of that and enough sound to impress.

I purchased the sandstone flavor, and find it to be rather sharp looking, but neutral enough to blend into it's surroundings and not stick out.

Bottom line: This is quite an amazing device and a huge value. There is absolutely no way to go wrong with one of these. You get all the features of the full-size Echo in the size of a hearty hockey puck. Again, I'm amazed with the sound that comes out of this little thing.

Echo dot is really neat. It was kind of hard setting up the Alexa app to it, but I got it figured out. It was on my end that made it difficult (internet issues). I have two children. Sometimes they can be a little unruly and talk back. I discover that with the Alexa app, there’s this thing on there called “communication” and if you go on there, your able to type any message in.. no matter where your at and it will relay the message right to the echo dot. You do not even have to be in the house. I use this app with the echo dot for my children. I type their names in and state “be good”, “no fighting girls”, or some other message as if they are being watched and they stop what ever bad behavior they are doing. My daughters get a kick out of it, because I also use it if they are being good and say thank you for picking that up, or good job for sharing etc.

I never owned a first gen Dot, but I did use one. I also own two second gen Dots (as well as an Echo and a Tap). I got a third gen Dot for free during a Sirius XM promotion, and now I'm really considering upgrading my two second gens... the sound is much better, but the microphone improvements are also noticeable! Some of the reviews knock the speaker... but let's be honest, you're never going to get a full spectrum of sound in this size. The real power of the Dot is the ability to hook it up to an external speaker, whether wired or bluetooth. This continues to be my favorite Alexa product, at least of the ones I've tried. Definitely a good buy if you're looking for a smart speaker!

reviews.reviewTitle: Much bigger than it's predecessor, nice cloth cover
reviews.reviewText:
This is our 7th echo dot, 1st 3rd gen. We have them all around the house. These things are so fun, the kids play all kinds of games on them or just make it say silly things. My wife and I use it mostly for music wherever we happen to be in the house. I like that you can create groups and play music in multiple locations, I just wish you could create multiple different groups with the same dot. example: Our master bedroom and kitchen dot are in a group. Master bedroom is upstairs, and kitchen is downstairs. I like to play music to these 2 while doing laundry and I'm up and down the stairs. I would like a second group with master bedroom and each of the kids bedrooms to play music strictly upstairs when I want. You'd think that would be simple enough but once a dot is part of a group, it can't be part of another group without removing it from the first group.

Otherwise though, we love our Echo Dots and Amazon updates them regularly so there's always new features... Who knows, maybe they'll fix the group restrictions some day.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works well... if you have a new phone
reviews.reviewText: This review applies to my particular situation (Though I doubt it is at all unique) First, the PROS: What it does, it does very well. Reminders, alarms, random info, conversions, jokes. It does integrate with Amazon Music Unlimited very well. I have yet to ask for a song or album that it couldn't find. The CONS: I'm annoyed that so much of its abilities and performance are dependant on the Alexa app on your phone. I don't have a new phone so my echo dot is severely limited as to its functionality and abilities. I did check the availability and compatibility of the Alexa app on my phone prior to purchase. The app installed and gave no indication that it would be mostly non-functional. The app doesn't even have the Alexa voice prompt. My main complaint is that it can't access my contacts or make/ answer phone calls until I buy a new phone.

I've gone through 3 Echo Dots all with the same issue. When using this device with either of the two different bluetooth speakers that I own it will only play music for any between 5 seconds to 10 minutes before the Echo Dot will lose it's internet connectivity. If you call technical support they will make you go through the same setup guide that you find in the manual. After a 30 minute process they will offer a replacement, so that in a week or so you can go through the return process all over again.
The issue is that the Echo Dot 3 is not stable and can not run a bluetooth connection without giving you the red ring of failure. If you don't plan on using it for bluetooth, you might find it good enough. Otherwise look elsewhere.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love using it — can improve voice and Alexa integrations
reviews.reviewText:
Using this echo dot is convenient and entertaining. The alexa integration makes life easier — you can play songs easily, know the weather, set reminders, and so much more! It’s not 100% perfect though and sometimes it gets stressful to repeat yourself hence the 4 stars.

Tip: Set up everything properly! If Alexa dont understand your first or second request, just be clear and tell her what you want.

Cons: I ordered during Prime Day and the shipment was delayed 3x but Amazon support handled my complaints it pretty good.

While this is very cool technology, the actual performance of the product is mediocre & at times utterly exasperating. I have several devices, hooking into stereos in various rooms in the house. At times it performs perfectly, and at other times it is nearly impossible to get it to play the same radio station that you play every morning [one specific example: "Alexa, play Vermont Public Radio." Response (again and again on some mornings): "Playing Maine Public Radio...."] The words "Vermont" and "Maine" don't even sound similar, so I don't know why it has so much trouble with this. Sometimes Alexa has no trouble finding my playlists on Amazon Prime, but at other times it cannot find playlists, even when I stand right next to the device, use my best elocution, and ensure that I have the name exactly right by reading it directly from my phone. In summary, this product was released before it could work as promised. Amazon has apparently decided that the most lucrative business model for this product was to release it early, without warning consumers that we are all, collectively gullible beta testers.

Have three of the Echo Installed and absolutely love them. Easy to set up and enjoy.
So many uses, I use for my outside lighting and inside lighting. Its a clock, weather report. so many endless things you can ask. Love the shopping list and to do list. I have app on phone and when you go to the grocery store its right there, all the things you tell Alexa to add to your list. Plays my playlists and It works my TIvo box, changes channels and controls the recorded shows. There is so many uses as listed in description. I didn't realize how useful the Echo would be until I got them and started using Alexa controls.

We got an Amazon Echo to help my dad remember to give my mom her medications on time each day (she takes medications 4 different times each day). Dad (88) was struggling to always remember to do that and Mom (89) forgets. They are still living on their own, so the Amazon Echo is another tool that will hopefully help them remain independent a while longer. I've also set up other reminders, including doctor appointments. They aren't using the Echo for anything else, but this use in and of itself makes it invaluable. My husband and I got an Echo at the same time, even though we weren't sure we really needed/wanted one, but have been surprised at how useful it is for a variety of things. We especially like asking Alexa to play whatever style of music we're in the mood for and the music immediately begins to play. It is also synched with my iTunes account and I enjoy streaming my music through the Echo. I have a morning routine set up that helps my day get off to a good start. I know we're just scratching the surface of what it can do, but we're off to a good start!

reviews.reviewTitle: Super slick! Better than the previous versions.
reviews.reviewText:
You know it's bad when you go to work or some place public and you have to fight the urge to say "Alexa! Blah blah blah!"

Seriously the best thing since Apple Pie. I have an Echo Show, Fire Stick, a bunch of previous generation dots, smart plugs, and the echo with the speaker but recently ponied up for a few of the newer generation dots.

I have to say, these are super slick - not as clunky as the previous generations. I really enjoy looking at them and I love that there are more colors than black.

I think Amazon should include like an outlet mount (for an additional cost) so that I didn't have to buy it from a third party vendor but outside of this, I'm pleased with this generation of Echo Dot.

As time goes on, it seems like the Dot continues to pay for itself by being able to control and/or work additional devices released. This is an added benefit of having the Dots.

reviews.reviewTitle: Can't Connect 3rd Generation Dot to my music group
reviews.reviewText: I have 6 Dots, four Echos, two Shows and one Tap. I conduct a lot of training for Occupational Therapist on the benefits of a smart home. I have been able to setup all of my devices (except the Tap for obvious reasons) to be able to play music throughout my home. All of these were straight forward to connect together. However, I cannot connect the new 3rd generation Dot I got on October 11 (I preordered it when it was announced in September). I don't know what i am doing wrong, but the setup was just like all of the others - same Wi-Fi network and using the new Alexa smart phone interface. This is also the case for my Android and iPads. On top of all of this, the Help selector on the smart phone interface does not work, so it does not give me any assistance. Perhaps this was rushed to market too soon.

reviews.reviewTitle: Even better than the 2nd Gen Echo Dot
reviews.reviewText:
I got the Echo Dot 2nd Gen and Google Home Mini for Christmas 2017 and liked things about both of them. My biggest gripe with the Echo Dot 2G was that the sound quality wasn't great. The ED 3G sounds much better and looks great as well. I think this is a big improvement over the 2G version and definitely beats out the Google Home Mini. The most frustrating thing about the Google Home Mini for me was the voice recognition sensitivity seems very poor. I often find myself having to yell at it to stop over it's own sound output. Echo Dot is not like that. It seems much better at hearing me through it's own sound output.

Pros:
Good responsiveness to voice commands, even in a room with noise
Looks much better than the 2nd Gen.
Great sound quality - definitely better than Dot 2G or Google Home Mini.

Cons:
Not uncommon for Alexa to randomly start talking when I never said anything to her while the TV is on.
Search engine for questions simply isn't as smart as the Google Home Mini.

Purchased my Echo Dot on Black Friday at an INSANE deal, but after using it for a little over a month now, would buy it again at the regular price. Got the Dot on the advice of my niece, who purchased an older model for my brother, someone who is NOT tech savvy. The set-up was almost as easy as just plugging it in. Thinking I might need more volume in order to hear to communicate throughout my house, I also purchased a very small separate speaker. Pairing the speaker to my Dot took a matter of minutes, and it works perfectly. My brother asks Alexa to play all of the old Pop tunes you don't hear any more, and to remind him of appointments, etc. I do the same and enjoy listening to entire symphonies of classical music plus every song in the repertoire of my favorite country and rock artists. We play the Jeopardy J6 clues each day, and I let Alexa make my shopping list for me. I know I haven't even scratched the surface of what this device can do, but I really love it so far. A little advice for anyone planning to buy, spend the money on an Amazon Prime Membership. In addition to the basic benefits of Prime, being a Prime member creates an even better experience on Dot.

reviews.reviewTitle: I never thought I would buy a wire tap
reviews.reviewText: I am strongly against my privacy being encroached. I am one of those conspiracy theorists. If you had told me a year ago I would be buying one of these things I would have laughed you out the door. So there I was on Prime day and Amazon was throwing echos at everyone who bought something. All my friends were getting echos with their purchases. I didn't get an echo with my purchase so I felt left out. I thought about it and clicked buy, before I knew it this wire tap showed up and had itself sitting comfy on my night side. I've whispered all day. Afraid she is going to hear me. Who knows who all is listening to me and my weird conversations with my cats. Seriously though. I like Alexa. We have had fun all day playing with our 3rd gen Echo. It does a lot more than I knew about, like finding my phone. Can't wait to get more wire taps.

I've personally tried many of these type of devices and honestly this has to be the best I've ever tried.
These are some of the best aspects of this product
Voice Recognition- this product works great in this area it picks up my voice great everytime.(especially since my voice is so very low in octaves that most devices and people cant understand a lot of what I say) so if your like me this will be great for you

A.I. or Artificial intelligence- the A.I. that comes with this product known as Alexa is stupendous it works great everytime. It is simple and easy to use and understand. I know everyone will agree with me.

Affordability/worth- This device is very affordable especially since it gives on sale all the time. They give you so much in such a little package, there are so many features for you to discover and play with and can connect to so many different products. If your someone who is just wanting to get Into smart home products I would strongly recommend this to you.

Now is this for you? This is probably a question you asked yourself when looking to buy one of these. Well let me ask you a few questions. Are you new to smart home tech? If so than yes. Are you wanting a way to make your life a little bit easier? Than if so yes. Are you wanting to access information faster and easier? If so than yes. If you answered yes to any of those questions than this is for you. It's a great way for someone on a budget to get started.

My overall consensus- I give this product a 5/5 because of it's affordability and it's overall quality as a product. I strongly recommend it

reviews.reviewTitle: Works very well with voice commands. I’m impressed with its level of comprehension.
reviews.reviewText:
After spending a week in an Echo-rich home, my wife and I fell in love with them. Mainly we listen to music from Amazon or our Sirius XM subscription, but listening to our Flash Briefings, fills in well for our lack of receiving broadcast or cable news. A quick weather forecast or using them for an intercom rounds out our current uses.

We have one in our great room/dining room/kitchen, one in the first-floor master bedroom, one in the second-floor workroom/office, and one in the basement kids’ playroom. We’re pretty well covered for our usage.

Because the home-automation system from a major big-box lumber store is being discontinued, I’ve adopted a new system which works very well with Alexa voice control. So ultimately Alexa will be doing a lot for us, every day.

The three Dots have pretty good music quality, but the big, base unit has surprisingly good sound quality for its size and cost.

I have not much negative to say about these units.

We love Alexa! I'm sure there are lots of things that we will be able to do with it as time goes on. I have watched many Youtube's to get ideas.

We purchased this one on Amazon's Prime special day as a Christmas gift for our aunt/uncle that are in their 80's. They get a great kick out of watching us use ours and I know they're going to have lots of fun with it. My uncle at 88 refuses to learn how to use a computer but is always asking his wife to look things up. This will let him do his own look ups without her help.

One of the fun things that we use ours for is to start our day with the weather forecast and calendar update. It then plays our local VT radio station for us here in Florida.

I wish I had ordered a couple more of these for gifts. Black Friday!!

reviews.reviewTitle: CRAPPY TECHNOLOGY FOR THIS DAY AND AGE
reviews.reviewText:
Update. with the way technology is today you would think the Alexa app would be much smarter in understanding the English language. Awful. And beware it will purchase things or put you on a monthly payment of some sort of service quite easily and without you knowing if you say the wrong thing. So keep an eye on your bank statement. Simple statements such as Alexa go to chapter 1. Just like that and all she says is I'm sorry I don't know that. very very simple commands she doesn't get it when reading a book. The device is nice but the Alexa service sucks pretty much

I bought this to listen to books from my Kindle library but I did not know it was not wireless. However it still works great. And it is so much fun to have. Read stories at night. Plays games. Plays any song I want from the Amazon music.... all voice controls. Absolutely love it. If this holds up it's worth every Star if it doesn't I'll come back in re-edit

Total garbage. Not the device itself so much as the crappy software. You have to speak in very specific “computer phrases” to get it to work. If this is the future of AI, I’m not that worried. You cannot speak naturally to it at all. Want to arm your security...”Alexa, set (name of system) to system mode (whatever)”. If you just try to say “set the alarm to away”....nope. Doesn’t understand. So frustrating. Steve Jobs once said something to the effect that voice recognition is worthless if it has just a one percent failure rate. That is so true. In the time it takes me to figure out how to awkwardly tell Alexa to do something, I could have done it manually five times.

Also, I have huge privacy concerns with this thing as do many people. There is a mute button but it just lights up, how do I know it really isn’t still listening to me.

Also, the Alexa app is terrible. Probably reminiscent of the Amazon phone. Remember that? No? That is because it sucked and was only sold for a short time.

Sorry folks, the future is not quite here yet where you can talk to you computer and get relevant responses like in Star Trek.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good improvements to Gen1 and Gen2
reviews.reviewText:
Better sound, better listening capabilities but a few bugs. We have had a gen2 dot for quite some time and, other than the sound quality and sometimes difficult time getting "her" to hear you, we were very happy with it.

When this unit came out that reportedly got better at those two things plus the holiday price, we purchased it. I already mentioned the good but the unit does loose functionality with time, hard of hearing and says it can't do functions it has done before... reboot her and all is ok. I reported a bug to Amazon about alarms when you tell her to snooze... sometimes she says she is having difficulty snoozing and other times, when she says "snoozing" and her voice stops, the alarm is on full blast before she mutes it. Other times, it was ok. We will see if the bug is fixed over time. I am sure they will get this one as stable as gen1 and gen2 were but it may take a little time. Nothing I have ever used even comes close to the Gen1 full size alexa for stability and sound and hearing though.

reviews.reviewTitle: In general comment about all Alexia products
reviews.reviewText: I've purchases numerous Alexia devices/models over the years. Some for personal use and others as gifts. In short...they are great for knowing the date or time and limited easy requested music listening. However, in terms of over-all ease of use...they fall far..far..far from being called smart devices. Most of what you would think you can ask, can't be answered by Alexia. Over time, this issue gets to be very frustrating and a waist of time & effort. In fact, it's like trying to have an adult conversation with an toddler. I think you get my point. So, if you plan on doing some heavy duty music request(s) or serious educational inquiries....you're probably much better off trying Goggle Home Assist or Apple smart devices. Al least until Amazon decides that it's time for Alexia to advance beyond the first grade!

reviews.reviewTitle: 3rd gen is best Echo Dot so far
reviews.reviewText:
well what can i say other then this Dot is similar to the other Generations, except the sound quality is much better. I have google home / home mini and other Echo products. I had a home mini in the kitchen because it had better sound, after i received the 3rd gen Dot I put it in the much used kitchen. ( Wife and I like to listen to music when cooking).
One of the other things to note my wife says the Echo (s) works better, she says that she almost never has to repeat herself. She would complain that the Google doesn't hear her correctly and she would have to repeat herself. I agree with her somewhat, the echo seems to allow for wider variations of phases / words / or voices VS. Google home.

I cant wait to get more acclimated to this Echo Dot! What an excellent promotion catch! I do enjoy Alexa's humor, and appreciate the expressiveness.... Quite refreshing in comparison to Google Assistant's boring "Hey, Google.." ... Atleast Alexa has personality 😂....

One thing that continues to bother me with Alexa is the fact that she won't play any of the music that I ask her to play... and worst of all, she tells me that I need to subscribe to Amazon Music Unlimited-- which I do not understand why it's like that, considering that the Music Unlimited acct is set up & synced to the Alexa app..... I mean, that was how I got the Amazon Music Unlimited & Echo Dot together in a bundle deal so I kind of feel like Alexa should be on the same page, ya feel? But she be on some other one hahah...

I'm Alexa'fied". She is everywhere in my house. The new Dot looks great. The sound is improved some, but still not on a par of course with an Echo Show or dedicated speaker. I use my Show in the bedroom as a stereo pair with the new dot. Gives you an all around the room sound.
The one thing I am curious about is that my earlier generation Dots get into a conversation with me. I can say, Alexa what time is it, she tells me, and then I say, "How is the weather?" and she tells me, and sometimes on the end of a string of conversation I say, "Thank you" and she says, "Anytime". I notice the light ring on this new third generation goes out immediately after responding to the first command/request. I'm wondering if there is a setting that allows it to make conversations like my other earlier versions do.

This is my fifth echo Dot. The other four are second generations. the only reason I bought this one was because it was touted to have sound much superior to the 2nd generation. Well, to me, it sounds like someone talking through a rag!second generation sound is not that good but not horrible. However I would definitely give the third generation sound a horrible rating! I'm very disappointed!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great functionality, App and Permissions need refinement
reviews.reviewText:
I wasn't planning to get one of these. Saw no need for one. I became interested when amazon offered these on a discount with amazon music. It was easy to set up. After pairing it with some smart plugs it quickly became useful and convenient. I'm a new convert to the convenience of these things. I use it for music and home automation.

The Alexa app and permissions still needs some work to make it more user friendly. For example, the account permissions only allow 2 adults in the household to control it with unique logins. Our 18 yr old daughter is legally an adult and has limited account permissions due to Amazon labeling her as a "teen". She can't even use the echo to its fullest capacity due to the restrictions Amazon has in place. Fixing this would make it a better experience. There shouldn't be a limit placed by Amazon as to who has what access to Alexa functions. I want better control over that myself.
It also took me a few contacts to Amazon support to get our phone numbers attached to the correct account for my wife and me.

I wasn’t sure if I’d like this at first, but I’m pleasantly surprised by how much I do. I fact I love it so much I’ve purchased two more. One for my teenager’s room and another for my toddlers room. My teenager uses it for music, and an alarm clock. She does not have a prime account and it works perfect for her. I use it to check the weather, my Amazon Prime order status, set multiple timers while cooking, and general info like what movies are playing in our area. I use the one in my baby’s room to play soothing music while she’s going to sleep. It can also be told how long to play it for or I can control it with my Alexa app on my phone. I purchased wall mounts for all three. Great for keeping them off furniture and out of the way and out of reach from grabby toddler hands. Even wall mounted it gives off great sound when playing music.

I thought i was loving this and amazon music. Though ive enabled alexa skills set it fails to pair with anything. If i am missing something it doesn’t matter. The purpose is to do the thinking. Apple tv and home kit are “user friendly” that is why i go to the expense. While listening to the blues A bot asked if I would participate in its competition. I said NO. The bot said “you have to say stop”. I said stop. The bot did not stop. It again advised me, “it was part of a competition”. I was not able to resume listening to my music and had to unplug this to shut up the bot. Now I don’t want anything amazon in my home. It’s creepy.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa is unresponsive and kind of useless
reviews.reviewText:
TL;DR; I acknowledge that a lot of my complaints may stem from my own inability to use this device properly. In the same breath, I have not been able to find easy answers to my questions and there does not appear to be a real person to talk to about this thing and the Alexa service. In the end it may be I am simply not willing to put in the effort to configure it properly, however I feel for a device that is supposed to be easy to setup and use, it really falls short of that mark.

We bought this primarily for our kids to use. We have a friend who loves theirs and says that they have all kinds of 'Skills' games that they installed and that their kids love to play. It also plays music and audio books and all kinds of stuff! sounded great and at under $50 it seemed like a great deal.

We got ours and plugged it in. Package quality was great and it is a nicely built device. We plugged it in and downloaded the Alexa App; and this is where the frustration began.

My Wife and I both own a Galaxy s5 and we installed the app on her phone. Adding the Freetime mode and the kids profiles was fairly straight forward and then we attempted to add Skills. The App freezes and becomes 100% unresponsive. You can't even browse the skills. We tried turning the phone off and on again. Uninstalling and re-installing the app. We tried emptying the app cache. We followed a few articles but in the end simply could not get it to work.

The kids by this point are starting to play with it and they are asking it questions and that seems to be interesting enough and then they ask it to play music. Well Alexa is only tied to Amazon Music. You need an Alexa app or Skill to use anything else...well that is not helping us. We don't have an Amazon music subscription and we don't have any interest in getting one because we have Pandora and we also have Youtube Premium. So bummer.

Finally after searching through the help documents I find out there is also a Browser interface for Alexa. So I pull that up and we Add the NPR One Skill, the Pandora Skill, the Audible Skill and A Game Skill or two. Looks like it is getting better. Then we tried to use them.

We tried every 'Phrase' to get any of the skills to work and Alexa just replies "Sorry, I can't do that." to anything other than, "Alexa, Play {song name here}". None of the installed skills will work.

So we try turning off 'Free Time' and adjusting the parental controls and just about everything else we can think to do. We go searching for help and can't find a way to get a number for a live person to ask questions too and the documentation is specific but kid of useless because it is not about troubleshooting, it is all about how to do X.

I really kind of feel like I purchased a voice enabled bluetooth speaker and that is it. The only thing that is keeping me from asking for my money back is because the Kids do like to listen to music on it and they can control it without my help, so there is that. But from everything it seems to promise, I think it fails in just about every way.

reviews.reviewTitle: Plug and Play and I LOVE it: clock is perfect bedside clock
reviews.reviewText: My 3rd Gen Echo Dot with clock arrived yesterday and I already love it. I'm in a smallish house and have 1 Echo Spot, numerous smart plugs and the Alexa App already so the Dot was just plug in and all is well. The only thing I did as far as setup was to schedule "Do Not Disturb". I bought it primarily for a bedside clock and also so that I did not have to "yell" to the Spot across my house. The clock is perfect: enough light to see but not so bright as to be disturbing. Also nice to ask for temperature … BUT, I am on the hunt for an Alexa compatible weather station so I can get temp at my house for alerts for frost/freeze primarily and town temps do not equal my mountain foothill location temps. Bottom line, I find the Alexa products and smart "things" both useful and fun.

Purchased two of these for two different rooms. Also purchased smart outlet plugs to automate the house. My original intent was to buy one of these to control the garage door opener after purchasing a WIFI module for the opener, but it turns out there is an additional fee from the garage door opener company to link to Alexa which I am not willing to pay a yearly fee to add the functionality. Mainly use this to check the weather and trigger sequences to turn on and off various things in the house. The kids seem to think it is fun to make Alexa tell jokes or sing songs. Will have a good time discovering additional features. Sound is amazing for such a small device, loud, and lots of bass (surprisingly). Would purchase again. Love the fact it gives me notifications on my Prime purchases.

reviews.reviewTitle: i did. pre order first my 3 rd. generation echo.dot
reviews.reviewText: First. off. i got to say. i. own 3. echo dots. my first one is the echo dot 2nd. generation. and my second one. is the same. and. last is my 3rd. generation. and the reason why. I got. my 3rd. generation. echo dot. is because. i. delt like buying. it for my early birthday gift for myself. and. i was taking. one. of my 2nd. echo dot. to fl. and. going to. leave. it. in my house there i got 2 echo dot. in different states. and. i. use my echo. dots for alarms and reminders i got. to say. also. in my review. that. i absolutely love my 3rd generation. echo. dot but. i did not. bring. it to. fl. with me. it in a different state. and. i. miss it alot. i. do. find it bigger. then. my 2nd. generation echo. dot and. i. love it. in the color charcol. that. is well as in the same color. as my other 2 e ho. dots as well. i do find. her though a little bit of a. mind of her own. on things i do. not ask. her on. and she comes on automatically on telling me stuff. i did not ask. her on she a little bit of a spy . well. anyways. i. hope u find my review. interesting. as you. read it

reviews.reviewTitle: For $6 a month over 5 months, how could I resist?!
reviews.reviewText:
I love tech gadgets! I've been curious about this since the first one came out. I wanted to get one but didn't cause at the time, I thought the price was too high for my budget. Lately, a lot of devices have the payment plan option. Which is great for Prime members! There are so many pictures I decided to not upload any yet. Mine is charcoal. I ordered my first one on June 5th. It was delivered by UPS on June 6th. After enjoying sleep sounds and music, I ordered another for the front room/kitchen area!
I live in an small apartment for reference. The sound when I'm playing Pandora radio is better than I thought it would be. There are times when there's volume changes between songs, so I have to adjust for that. I did notice that when music is playing, Alexa sometimes struggles to hear me. Then I have to get up and either manually adjust the volume or speak closer to the mic, which is annoying cause I like hands free. I did reposition the device and set it lower, that seemed to help except when the volume is playing too loud. I'm hoping with use, the issue improves. I don't have any smart home devices, so no opinion there. I never had any of the previous versions so nothing to compare it to. Looking forward to experimenting with skills!

Arrived on time and well packaged
This device is kinda cool. I love to listen to music when I cook or clean and I don’t like having my phone on speaker, earbuds or pull out the portable speaker. Once you’ve setup your device you’ll love it. The first one I purchased had issue with pandora so I sent it back. Now I have three and you can make announcements to other rooms that have an echo. If you have more than one and once you create groups you can play music in an individual room or multiple rooms with the same music. You can command echos from other echo locations within your home. For example if you forgot to turn Alexa off in the kitchen you can send a command from your master room or wherever you have one to turn off Alexa in the kitchen.

I’ve never been into the whole echo and google assistant but I quickly became I fan of the echo dot and purchased 2 of the dots and 1 of the bigger ones in less than 3 wks. The Alexa jokes are pretty lame but that doesn’t take away from the rating.

reviews.reviewTitle: Amazon Echo Dot is a great purchase
reviews.reviewText:
Here are the positives regarding the Echo Dot:
1. My wife has found that song quiz and National Geographic geo-quiz are her favorite games on the Echo device. Nice that the device has built in game functionality.
2. The ability to have Alexa turn home lights on or off is a nice feature.
3. The ability to have Alexa integrate with home alarm system is another positive.
4. Having the Amazon Echo Dot play music or news upon request is great.
5. The sound quality of the Amazon Echo Dot 3rd Generation is excellent!
6. The Echo Dot is also a great price! We got both of ours for $24.99 a piece, a no brainer for anyone looking to buy one.

As far as negatives, I don’t have have any negative info to provide. My wife and I have had our Amazon Dots for about a month now and really enjoy them. They are easy to setup and when I programmed in my work address it is nice to say, “Alexa, how is the traffic to work?” right before I step out the door to leave. Alexa proceeds to tell me if the route to work is clear or if there are issues.

reviews.reviewTitle: Why should I stay with Echo?
reviews.reviewText:
We have enjoyed all of our Echo devices- 2 Dots & a Spot. It has been wonderful to be able to play Amazon Music on these devices with out ads. With the removal of Amazon Music I am considering going with Google Home. Google works with my Hue Lights and can do everything Alexa does & more.

Why should I continue with Echo devices- that doesn't have its own Music and can't answer 2/3 of the questions my "Ok Google" on my phone can? (And it's not eligible for return. )

I ordered two of these. I'm still learning all the things that ALEXA can do since I'm late to the game - resisted inviting ALEXA into my house. I have paired two of my outlets (ordered 4 more) and my bluetooth BOSE speaker with the one in the kitchen. Sound quality is decent but just wanted the more dynamic sound of my BOSE. Fairly simple to do following the instructions in the ALEXA APP. I have enjoyed adding things to my "shopping List by just saying, "Alexa, add lemons to my shopping list" . Everything I add then shows up on my APP on my phone so It's handy when at the store.. It even told me today where my Amazon order was when I asked her "where is my stuff?" Handy for setting timers for cooking or reminder when to leave the house for appointment. Also telling her what time to wake me in the morning is very convenient since my 2nd one is in my master bathroom. I can tell her to snooze without having to roll over and hit a snooze button. :) The possibilities are endless.

reviews.reviewTitle: Slight improvements over the 2nd Generation Echo Dot
reviews.reviewText: Seems the sound quality is better with the 3rd Gen version. Seems like it can "hear" you voice better than the 2nd gen, notice it most with a lot of background noise. I think it also looks better. Only slight changes from the 2nd gen, but I love my 2nd Gen Echo Dots. My brother bought me my first Echo Dot for Christmas a few years ago along with a couple of smart plugs. Nice present, and something I wanted, but not something I would have bought for myself. Nice little "toy" to have I thought. Now I have some type of Alexa device in every room in my house, 2 in some rooms if you count the Fire Sticks, not to mention my Ring Doorbell, Ring Alarm System, smart plugs, etc. Oh, I also have an Alexa Auto in my truck. Probably not the best person to review Alexa and Alexa enabled devices. Amazon now owns me. That nice little toy I got a few years ago has taken over my house, truck, and me. On the rare events when the Internet goes out, it has the same impact on my life as the power going out.

I purchased this third generation Echo Dot for my wife as a Christmas gift. Although there are numerous ways that the Echo Dot can be used, we only use it in two ways currently. The primary way we use the Echo Dot is to play music. This has been much easier than playing music through our Apple TV. Sometimes my children ask Alexa to answer questions so they can be either entertained or gain knowledge.

Setting up the Echo Dot wasn't too difficult. I did contact Amazon's services because I had a little trouble setting up two Amazon accounts on the device. I was extremely impressed with how quick I was able to get assistance from Amazon.

We have our Echo Dot in the kitchen which is in a central location in our house. It can hear our commands from other rooms without any problems. I like how small the device is, it's sound quality, and low cost. We have zero complaints about the Echo Dot and think you'll enjoy it and find it easy to use

After some thought I opted on buying the echo instead of the google device. I should have not done that.
I have been trying to import my contacts for two days. I requested multiple verification codes and received none. I have an iPhone 8 so my phone is not the issue.
So I tried contacting customer service via the “call me now” service. After the usual generic troubleshooting instructions the system prompts you to press “1” for customer service. Well...I pressed “1” about a million times and I was prompted to press “1” each time! At the end they hanged up on me. This happened 3 times.

I’m returning this and getting google.

(Edit: Amazon contacted me and stated they service all their products whether gifts or not. They replaced my Dot quite promptly. I will update again after using the replacement.)

I received a new Echo Dot for Christmas this year and let's just say I fell in love! However, two weeks after starting to use my Dot, the speaker is already blown (and at first I was originally impressed with the sound quality). And I haven't used it with the volume up loud or anything. Light music use and a few commands. I'm really disappointed because I love all the uses for Alexa. And I can't return it for a replacement since it was a gift. Bummer.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is the most useless electronic toy I've ever purchased.
reviews.reviewText: There was a lot of hype about the Echo Dot. So I thought I would buy one to try it out. First of all, it didn't recognize most commands I gave it. Second, it couldn't ever figure out the correct audio device to stream to. Third, the software interface is awful. If you ask it to play a certain album, the interface didn't show you the list of songs in the album and what was coming up next. Fourth, if I told Alexa to launch a program on my Windows PC, it didn't ever work, which I would have expected to be one of the first features to be implemented in a device like this. Everything this device can do, I can do better by just using my keyboard, mouse, and touchscreen.

Bought this new unit to go in the living room. I have one already in my computer room. Took a long time to get he app to recognize and change the "Wake up name".. Then the fun began.. It started announcing "Good Morning and You've Got Mail" when I signed on to AOL. It also informed everyone in my living room when I signed out "Good Bye".. Now, today, it started playing any sound made on AOL.. Game background noise, (VERY annoying) and anything I want to listen to on AOL in the computer room is all broadcast to everyone in the living room, LOUDLY. If this is not bad enough, I have spent hours on several chat sessions with four different people trying to solve this. The last one, Prabhansh, was chasing me all over. "Try this.. Try that..." An hour with him and he had NO idea what he was doing. I guess I have to return this and go on EBay and get a 1st generation that works... SHAME AMAZON....

reviews.reviewTitle: Buggy and not all that bright
reviews.reviewText:
The speaker sustem works well enough, but Alexa has serious bugs and has trouble answering even simple questions.

Example: Ask Alexa to play music in a certain room. If music in already playing anywhere else, she will tell you that and ask if you want to play music where you requested. YES, THAT'S WHY I ASKED!

Example: If you ever turn on the explicit music filter, it cannot be turned off. Alexa will tell you it's off, but if you then request she play a song, she'll tell you she can't because the filter in on. ARGH!

Example: If you request to play music using the app, it will always respond that there are no Alexa devices connected to the internet. Wow, really? I have 6 connected!

Amazon tech support was no help fixing any of these issues.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alone, it's more gimmick than tool
reviews.reviewText: So, it's all fine and dandy. It works. But, I'm not willing to give it access to my ordering, because then it can be messed with too easily. I had it connected to my contacts until I thought about how bad an idea that is. The fact is, if I had four of these and a full size Echo along with a FireTV control unit and a bunch of smart plugins/bulbs/etc., then it could be a useful tool. But, by itself, it's just a gimmick. It's nice to hear a joke and be able to play music, but I have other mechanisms for music (have to upgrade my Sirius account to integrate with Alexa, don't listen enough to make Spotify a good deal...). Anyway, as part of a complete system of home components, probably great. As a stand alone item in the living room, kind of annoying to have it flashing at me that I have notifications when I've already received a text message and an email from Amazon telling me my package is being delivered.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great quality and great sound for this third generation Echo.
reviews.reviewText:
The main reason I like this third generation Echo dot is that it has a more deep sound than the second generation version.

A bonus is that you compare these as a stereo pair. In the Amazon Alexa app you can find an option for adding a stereo pair. Just follow the directions but keep in mind that if you have put them on a guest Network you cannot pair them because guest Networks do not allow each device to see each other. This was a bit of a dilemma for me because I prefer my Echoes to be on a guest Network to protect my main network from hackers but the more I thought about it and realized that I have antivirus software and firewalls and a lengthy wireless router access code I went ahead and took the plunge. I wasn't disappointed. When you play music on Amazon music it will stream stereo with left and right channels and it sounds terrific. Keep in mind that you cannot stream stereo from a Bluetooth device yet because they don't have that capability.

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo Dot (3rd gen) Smart speaker with Alexa
reviews.reviewText:
I got my first Echo Dot smart speaker for Christmas 2019 and generally I am pretty happy with it. It has good sound and was easy to set up. I mainly use the Echo Dot for music playback, news and free trivia. I had a free trial of Amazon Music Unlimited and was happy with that. Afterwards, I set up a free Spotify Account and I found out the Echo Dot only syncs with a premium Spotify account, I was disappointed with that. I do have some iTunes songs to import and will try my free Pandora and iHeart Radio accounts.
The biggest disappointment was the iOS Alexa app for the Echo Dot. I put it on my iPad and I find that the app is slow, buggy, and freezes. It needs some refining and updating. I didn't want to add my contacts for privacy reasons and it keeps prompting me to do that as well as turn on the bluetooth on my iPad.
The adjustments on the app for sound quality do not work and it misidentifies my other Amazon devices. There have been no app updates and that is disappointing because it does need a lot of work.
If you are buying the Echo Dot for just music and news and other minor things, I would tell you to wait until the software app for the Dot is updated/reworked. The dot itself works good but sometimes spits out strange phrases like "Its too cold to go outside" and "I wouldn't do that".

reviews.reviewTitle: DO NOT BUY IF YOU HAVE TEENS!!
reviews.reviewText: This product is ridiculous. It's all over the web how parents bought this for their teenagers only to find out they can't use them. Amazon does not allow teen accounts/profiles to access these devices. That means you would have to use your account to register them giving them full access to buying because the echo thinks it's yours. It also means no music custumization. For as advanced as a company as Amazon is, this is a MAJOR shortcoming that needs to be resolved. It should not be difficult to allow teen accounts to have their own echo with the same limitations as the apps on their phones.

reviews.reviewTitle: If Bass Matters, Worth the Extra Cost Over a 2g
reviews.reviewText:
The 2g Dot has about a million (sarcasm) microphones across the top whereas the 3g has 4. They both work just as well.
Sound quality when listening to music and phone calls , on this one is noticeably better but as I wrote prior the outgoing sound and recognition are virtually the same
It is notably heavier and taller than the 2g but still isn't heavy and tucks away from view readily
Using smart home, skills, daily flash briefs, etc is the same across the 2 different Dots and the big brother Echo
My only gripe with the 3g Dot is the lack of sleeves available. I don't want a decal for my Dot. I like the true sleeves of the 2g Dot and Echo for changing things up instead.
I got this one as a 3rd Echo device over another 2g because it was on sale for the same as the regular price of the 2g.
Any of the Echo devices are fun to own and use and you won't go wrong but the sound quality of the 3g is well worth the price difference to me, even at regular price. It's almost as good as my Echo.

I bought the echo dot along with an Amazon fire stick with an intention of controlling the TV using the echo dot. While that is not completed, I am impressed with the sound from this echo dot (3rd generation). I have an Amazon echo, which produces excellent sound and this "dot" is quite good. The "dot" also teams up with my echo so music can be played throughout the house. Lastly, I intend to take the "dot" with me when I travel. It's good for general fun, wake-up alarm, music, a timer, news reports and anything that the full size echo can do, but is a small package for convenience. I'm happy about buying it even though I haven't set it up yet with the fire stick.

Alexa takes over your life like a virus. We just love our new assistant. The kids have lots of fun with it. Our lights turn on and off on command. I just gave it a three for three reasons:
1. There is no reason why the kids' model can't be the same price as the standard model. They are just tacking on services I don't want to the colorful case that I want. So the kids got a grown up Dot for Christmas...
2. One of the most powerful features of Alexa is the ability to play music. Those speakers are still well below par.
3. The microphone is not quite there yet, either.
Nice gadget with plenty of room to grow.

This is my 5th Echo dot. I had problems installing some of the other ones (internet not showing up, screen clearing when I went to enter the code, etc.), but this one was a breeze. Also, the sound quality on this little device is almost as good as my more expensive non-dot tall device that I first bought. And it's thicker and more sturdy.

I have two devices on every floor. I don't even turn my head to look at the clock anymore; I just ask Alexa. I only wish I had one in my car. Alexa reminds me things about 6 or 7 times a day.

My only complaint –– Amazon used to allow you to hear your voice reminder. Now it's just text, and Amazon often scrambles the text so I don't know what it was that I was requesting. I hate this. I wish to God they didn't take that huge advantage away.

I purchased 3 echo dots with the intention of being able to talk between rooms and maybe a little home automation. There are a couple of methods of talking between echo devices, "calling" and "drop in". Calling requires someone at the other echo to answer the call; drop in does not required any action and is good for eaves-dropping on conversations. The sound is unintelligible; I wind up shouting down the stairs. So I cannot use it to communicate, but surely I can use it for home automation. So I bought two plugs and hooked up two lights. Sounds great. But turn on the light always gets me the same response - which light do you mean. Perhaps I want to turn on the light in the room where I am standing. You can give the lights two different names, but the names have to fit something alexa can reliably understand like "light one" and "light two". Which one is "light one" again? Ok. Still not a problem, I am an expert programmer I can just write some code and get alexa to do what I want. Well, not really. The tools are very limited. The Alexa programmers have a very narrow view of what Alexa should do and you can't really step outside that very tiny box. Well they do play music and it sounds better than AM radio so I gave it 3 stars.
(update) Someone asked what code I was trying to write. First I tried to create a 2 echo microphone array to improve the sound quality, but the data I need is not accessible. The second thing I tried was to use data from my phone to improve home automation, I can get temperature, altitude and location from my phone which then can be used to turn on an air conditioner for example. Nope, can't do that either. The last thing I tried was to have two alexas carry on a conversation - this could fool would be thieves into thinking there were people in the house. Oh, well. My wife put things into perspective, "What did you expect, Alexa is just a child after all".

reviews.reviewTitle: Needs some work, but still a better assistant than me.
reviews.reviewText:
Overall: I'm into it.
The routines feature is great for triggering multiple events, ("alexa, help me wake up" triggers the kettle to turn on, my lamp to turn on, alexa reads my news and todays calendar, tells me to have a great day, and then starts my morning playlist. It would be nice to have her start with the music and then slowly trigger my other actions but unfortunately right now music triggers must be at the end of your routine chain)
also for creating your own commands/responses/jokes ("alexa, what do you think about my roommate?" returns "I don't know how you put up with him")
Theres definitely a learning curve to the setup and specificness of commands, it's not something I would buy for a non techie type, unless you set it up for them and give them a list of specific things to ask her. But if you're a gadget type, the options are endless.
You can stream your music/audiobooks through My Media for Alexa (free trial, then $5/year subscription for this service, pretty disappointing but in the end, worth it if you don't use itunes) or ask her to play radio stations/podcasts from a variety of sources, or NPR.
Currently I am working on Alexas location commands, so that she will remind me about things on my phone when I leave the house, or arrive at work, although I have not been able to get that to work.
Overall, theres a lot of kind of annoying things that get in your way when you're setting up alexa (too many useless skills being the most annoying, but also figuring out the curve in talking to her; when I initially got My Media, I would ask her, "Alexa, play harry potter from My Media" but she would suggest "harry potter quiz" or "harry potter on audible" and we would fight, but after looking at some suggestions from My Media, I realized I should be asking her like this, "Alexa, ask my media to read harry potter and the sorcerer's stone" so no more annoying suggestions) but she does make a great personal assistant and has greatly improved my morning routine.

Pros: she connects to my bluetooth speakers, she connects to my media collection without needing to put it on the cloud, she can read stories, play interactive games/trivia, remember things, help you make lists, announce things to your house, the list goes on and on. I find her to be fairly loud on her own, but I like to connect her to my nice bluetooth speakers. I was thinking about the voice remote because sometimes I'm too far away for her to hear me, but the reviews on it are spotty.

Cons: too many redundant/out of date skills to sort through (seriously,search sleep sounds it's nuts) I also saw a number of skills that are set up to run routines or lists or reminds (I assume these were all created before alexa had those features herself).
It would also be nice to have some sort of list of commands. I realize this could end up being super long, but if you could search through it, it would be a great way to see if you're saying something the wrong way, and also get suggestions for new commands. (I'm sure theres many ways to turn up the volume, maybe if you search 'volume', you can see that you can ask alexa to turn the volume up, turn the volume way up, or turn the volume to max, and realize they all do different things)
The fact that Alexa is essentially a paperweight without wifi is also disappointing. It seems like they could have added a few simple offline functions so you could at least pretend she hasn't magically turned into a brick until your wifi comes back on.
And finally, for me, the biggest con is obviously the power cord. I don't know why in the world you would change to a proprietary cable except to screw over your customers and that feels awful. I have a vindictive cat that hates alexa and chews through her power cord. I have probably 20 micro usb cables around the house I could use in an instant but instead I have to get back on Amazon, and pay another 20$ to wait a few days to get my alexa back. Pretty suspicious.

I've owned a 2nd-generation Echo Dot for a couple of years. Although I was pretty happy with it, I felt this one might offer an improvement in audio quality. So I moved the old one to another room, and purchased one of these to replace it. I have to say this 3rd-gen Dot provides a significant improvement in sound quality. It's a little bigger, and a little heavier, but now there's some ACTUAL bass. It's not really good bass, and it's not really loud bass, or even clear bass -- but dammit, there's bass now where there had been none. Enough that you can actually follow a musical bass line now. And it can play louder, too. You can also adjust the tone using audio equalizer settings in your phone's Alexa app, which I've done. Overall, I think this device about splits the sound quality difference between the Gen 2 and the larger Echo (non-Dot). Don't hesitate to buy one of these for streaming music or radio, as long as you don't need too much volume and are not using this as your primary musical listening device.

The technology still has quite a bit of room to grow but it's fun to have in the house. Helps with a lot of things. I wish there were more color options. I like the walnut finish on the echo and wish I could somehow have all of my devices match. Also I the devices synced up better. If I'm leaving, and I set Guard, I have to tell each device. It would be nice to be able to tell just one and they all set to "away". Another issue, I have is if I ask alexa on my phone to play music while I'm out, it almost always defaults to my echo at home. I feel like if I ask for music on my phone then it should play it on my phone. If I wanted it on the echo, then I would be talking to the echo. This happens when I have my home devices set to away too. Perhaps I'm expecting too much from my smart devices lol I'm still enjoying it though.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good product but sound is muffled
reviews.reviewText: I received my first Echo as a gift from my adult children Christmas 2018. It was the Echo Show. After setting it up to play music, video, and control my home automation using Alexa, I decided to extend coverage to our bedroom with an Echo Dot. After reading a lot of reviews, it became apparent that the 3rd gen. was the way to go, so ordered it on my Prime account and waited for it for over 2 weeks. After receiving it, I found setting it up to be a breeze since it was set for my account when it arrived.
