After getting it setup on my WiFi, it readily accepted my voice commands and pretty much worked flawlessly. But soon after the initial setup, I noticed the sound seemed muffled... very difficult to understand Alexa, or hear any clarity of music. No problem I thought, I'll adjust the tone controls to fix the issue. After turning the treble all the way up, I could hear little or no difference. I'm still amazed at the low quality of sound I'm hearing. It's as if everything is sharply cutoff at about 3kHz. After reading many reviews about the improved sound quality of the 3rd. gen Dot, I'm starting to wonder if I may have received a defective unit. But if what I'm hearing is normal for this model, I can only wonder how bad the 1st and 2nd get Dots were. Many who might read this may wonder if I was expecting too much from this little $50 device especially after starting with the Echo Show which has excellent audio quality. My answer to them would be no, I'm a realist when it comes to expectations from various devices. I have to honestly say my iPhone has better audio quality than my Echo Dot. Sorry Amazon, I really like the Dot but it (mine) falls short of any average expectation of a device designed to do what it is supposed to do... let me hear it.

This is a fun device. Alexa is always ready with a quick quip or a short story. She is also very good about playing the music I want to listen to. There are many songs that I like to play on my ukulele, and if I don't know the correct tune then Alexa will play it for me until I get it right. She is amazingly patient. She also does good weather for the local area and answers multiple questions as a go about my day. Things like how many teaspoons in a tablespoon, or how man grams in 8.5 ounces, or what the the square root of 262.3. She's almost like a very smart family member. She's humble too.

reviews.reviewTitle: Missed the mark on the sound
reviews.reviewText:
I was excited that I could get a dot that sounded better than the original dot, but then was disappointed as soon as I heard a song played on this 3rd gen dot. The sound between the dot and the echo are vastly different. The sound on the echo is surprisingly good for such a small speaker. The dot is very tinny sounding with not enough base. If they wanted to fix that in this new dot they went overboard. I had to go into the audio controls and turn the base down to 25%, the treble up to 75% and the Mid all the way up, just to get it to sound semi normal. Compare that with the echo and the dot I purchased previously where I didn't change anything on the audio controls.

The reason I gave it 3 stars is because once I changed the audio controls it sounds better than my other dot. I just think it should have sounded better than my other dot right out of the box... unless of course you're going to sell it for the same price as the other dot.

We received a free g00gle home mini with our Spotify Family plan. Before filling our house with them, we wanted to compare with Alexa. Unfortunately, Alexa app is very slow to load, sometimes not loading at all. She doesn't work well with Spotify or with Amazon Music. She consistently gets our local weather wrong (temp right now is 65° but she says 86°). She plays the wrong radio stations from Tunein & iheartradio even when we state call letters and frequency. Speaker is pretty good, works well with Amazon Smart Plug. Calls to phones are shown as "unknown". Will be returning her since she doesn't seem to work well in our area yet.
Update: returned, but then repurchased since Amazon Smart Plug worked so well with it. Got frustrated trying to get 3rd party smart plugs apps to link with Google Home.

We have a number of Echo devices, from the first-generation full-size Echo in the living room, to the Echo Tap by my desk, to Echo Dots in almost every room, from the bedrooms to the bathrooms where they're called on both to play programming ranging from news to radio stations and to control various home devices. I've even put an Echo Input in my car (which might be replaced with an Echo Auto when those appear). But I needed one for my workroom, and instead of just buying another basic Dot I ordered this 3rd Generation Dot for the kitchen and moved the 1st. Gen Dot which had been there to the workroom.
The 3rd Gen. Dot has much more satisfying sound, which my wife particularly appreciates for the lectures and Audible audio books she favors, and when we're ready to do so we can order a second Dot-3, set one as the Left and the other as the Right channel, and have full stereo.
Highly recommended whether you're new to the Echo or adding to your armada.

I was able to get the echo working some on day 1, but 2 days later, it would not play podcasts despite explicit content being turned off, it would not eliminate the annoying "ok" despite me selecting that on my iPad and iPhone, it wouldn't give news briefings (yes, was set up in settings) and would never give me traffic. I tried reinstalling app on phone, unplugging to see if it would reset, and no results. Returned it after 3 days. It just was more trouble than it was worth. Google search results for my questions gave me the answers that I'd already tried. I'll stick with siri to give me the weather or answer a question.

reviews.reviewTitle: Never Thought I’d Fall in Love Again!
reviews.reviewText: I love this thing! I can ask whatever I want to know in the middle of any conversation and get the information to prove I was right or wrong. Check the forecast without having to pick up my phone. Get my favorite programs on TV. She even farts!!! I am still learning everything about it and adding skills when I can. Setting alarms and reminders. It’s really a big help in getting your life together and keeping on top of things. I haven’t used the smart plug I bought to go with it yet. I have another Echo Dot coming to play music in stereo and plan on buying 2 of the bigger Echo units when I move and letting my roommate keep the two that are here because I think he’s really enjoying having the technology. Integrated with my Fire Stick 4K beautifully. But could not pair it with the voice remote that came with the Fire Stick. Wish they’d expand functions to also control TV volume/mute as well Blu-Ray and DVD players.

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice price promo on 3 pack for 60 special.
reviews.reviewText: I got a great deal on a three pack of these so I now have them in every room and I’m very happy to have an Alexa in every room of my house even though the Alexa is supposed to be listening to everything you say I don’t really mind too much and it’s a nice thing to have around when you wanna ask a question a player audio game next song quiz even though song quiz tends to get wrong some of your answers and make you lose when you have a good long winning streak it’s still a fun thing to do sometimes I do enjoy having Alexa and all the different rooms of the house and having it locked the door for you or unlock the door for you are setting a timer and various other things so it’s kind of fun to have and I enjoy the little dots even though the big longer one is louder

reviews.reviewTitle: A nice Improvement over the second generation Dot.
reviews.reviewText:
I got this 3rd generation version to compare to my second generation one. Both of which I got in Dec for $30. The first last Dec, and this second one this month. The 2nd generation of the Dot sounds OK for when it's talking to you. For music, it STINKS!!! It just has this plastic, bad sound. Not even good at low volume. The Google Mini which I also have sounds better. Now, this 3rd generation Dot is a little larger, nicer looking and sounds as good as the Google Mini. I like the Dot better as I like the Blue Light coming from it when you ask a question over the 4 small dots on the Google Mini. It's not even close to my Apple HomPod in sound quality, but it's also a fraction of the price. It's not bad for some low volume background music. It is only a single small speaker. But Amazon fixed the 2 biggest issues I had with the first dot. Sound quality and looks. It no longer looks like a cheap plastic toy.

I like to play around with all of these things. They all have their Pros & Cons.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great for anywhere in the house!
reviews.reviewText: I've had an Echo since the first generation and it's been very useful for a number of things including home automation of various things around my house. I have a number of lights in the house that are automated, a Harmony Hub that controls both our entertainment systems (living room and media room) and various Sonos speakers throughout the house to name a few. I purchased three of these Dots to use around the house and they work really well with the home automation. I can walk pretty much anywhere in the house and issue commands to the Echo or a Dot and have one of them pick up the command and execute it. While my arms are full with groceries, "Alexa, turn on the kitchen cabinet lights." While I'm in the shower, "Alexa, play classic rock music on the bathroom Sonos". Or while I'm cooking in the kitchen, "Alexa, turn on the TV." It's kinda cool to talk to my house like the computer from Star Trek (and yes, I've changed the keyword on all of them to "Computer!").

reviews.reviewTitle: Need to fix the multi-device music issue! STAT!
reviews.reviewText: I love my Dots. HOWEVER!!!! Amazon MUST fix the issue with playing different music on each device. As it stands if you try listening to different music, on the same streaming serive (prime, pandora, etc) it will kick the other devices off. The work around is using mulitple streaming services. I have 5 dots. And any extremely saddened but the lack of usablity in this area. It is the WHOLE reason I got these devices. FIT IT AMAZON!!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great product but Alexa has a lot to learn!
reviews.reviewText: I was slightly expecting Alexa to favor Siri, when it comes to asking questions and what-not. She does not search the internet generally when asking her a question. She just says "Sorry, I am not sure about that" to most questions. She is helpful for timers, playing music, doing conversions, letting you know the weather, telling you the score on a game, and a little more. I liked Siri because you could ask her silly questions and she would give you silly responses back. We struggle getting her to turn on/off our fire TV (firestick) and starting and stopping a TV (such as asking the command to play How I Met Your Mother on Hulu. She just either opens Hulu or searches the whole firestick for options to play the show. I am excited to try the smart home features that she has though (such as connecting to the smart bulbs or using Nest thermostat). The thing I really enjoy (especially since my hubby is tech savvy) is the Blueprints feature where you can teach her your own tricks!

reviews.reviewTitle: I wish I purchased a Google Home Instead!!!
reviews.reviewText:
I had the Amazon Echo for 2 months now, and I can confidentially say, I'm not 100% satisfied. 85% of the time you ask it a question, it says it doesn't know the answer. I try to ask the same question in.muiltiple ways and still I don't know. This is the main reason why I bought it...to ask questions without physically googling them...I have google assistant on my phone it's excellent with answering questions. Another thing, if you have an unusual name, it would pronounce you name wrong and you cant fix it...which annoys the hell out of me!!! Google let's you write your name phonetically. I wish I got a google home instead!!!!! Since I'm out of my return window, I guess I'll keep it. But I'll definitely will purchases a google home, and use the echo as a back up.

Some Pros
1. Music sound pretty good coming out of it. So you'll love it if you wanted a smart speaker just for this.
2. It can pick up your voice from a pretty large distance.

reviews.reviewTitle: Overall happy and would buy again.
reviews.reviewText: I bought this after a speaker with Alexa compatibility broke in a power outage. I do like how small this device is because it fits anywhere. I was very impressed with the sound quality too. I do wish that Alexa could learn the correct pronunciation of my name as she called me Stephan instead of Stephene (pronounced Stephanie) but it is ok, I guess it is my nickname. She is still learning as are we. Asking some questions are tricky to get an answer about especially when it comes to cooking. We have asked her about conversions, temps for doneness, and other things where she doesn’t understand what we are asking. I am sure in time we will figure it out. Overall I do love this device as it is great at telling the weather, playing music, and other basic functions and features that I primarily use it for. I am happy with my purchase and would buy another in the future.

reviews.reviewTitle: We still have bonding to do but.. I’ll give it 5 Stars for Customer Service!
reviews.reviewText:
It has been two days of me trying to get Alexa to simply learn my voice. I try a few times, unplug it, put it away, and try some more. I’ve grown completely frustrated with this ufo looking thing my sister swore would simplify my life! So far I am thoroughly disappointed! I am trying one more thing to strengthen WiFi even though all other devices work fine. But after that. I give up on you Alexa. Sorry gal ya gotta go.

UPDATE: So while out shopping I received a phone call from Amazon. Reluctant to speak based on the unknown number, the woman was funny with her tiny hello. She was calling about my previous 1 star review! =O Holy Moly customer service! Later I was sent an email to follow a link for help with my misguided Alexa. After many trials, errors, laughs, a 45 ish minute wait for another update, another friendly call back at the time promised by Customer Service, Alexa can stay! Thank you!

When my "Alexa" version 1 lost her life, and was dead, I needed a smart speaker by my bed as I fall to sleep every night listening to the radio. It is the reason I started out on this adventure of using "robot" like objects to ease the pain of being OLD! Ha haha. Safe to say, the Dot was just right as I do not have complicated needs, just radio, alarm, turn the radio off, and "what time is it?"

I have another smart speaker in my kitchen for listening to the radio, making grocery lists, turning on and off my kitchen light, and hall light. You see.... pretty easy. I love the help!

So I ordered 4 of the dots, I have the large echo in kitchen. I decided to place one echo in each kids room so I they can listen to music and I love the drop in feature so I can rally my troops for meals without screaming 10x upstairs. So out of 4, one echo dot was not working. The customer service team was excellent in troubleshooting and realizing it was not user error. Here is where it gets weird. The replacement echo dot arrived a few days later. I didn't have time to pull it out of the box and set it up until yesterday. Guess what? Same thing! It wouldn't turn on. The unit was receiving power, the mute button would illuminate when I pressed it, but other than that, I couldn't get it to light up or connect to the internet because it wouldn't turn on at all. AGAIN customer service was AWESOME. I am now waiting for a replacement for my room. BUT I think it sounds like you have a 50% chance of getting a good echo or a bad one. Hope they last!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great sound quality can use amazon certified smart plugs
reviews.reviewText:
I like the concept of Alexa that you can literally ask her almost anything. She has a tons of cool skills and features. Something that made me dislike this is that Alexa recorded me talking on the phone and then replayed my entire conversation this is not safe. That invaded my privacy. I dont Like that when i play music it has a ton of static either

Update received a replacement Alexa sound quality is absolutely amazing. Amazon told me when I thought Alexa was invading my privacy it was actually her thinking I had an announcement to make. So please disregard the invading privacy! I nolonger hear the static.Volume max is a ten it’s loud enough for me. I usually Keep my volume on a four or five. Sometimes when i ask Alexa something she doesn’t always respond to her name or turn on but overall it’s good! I do wish Alexa was a little more like google just a tad bit when i say That I’m referring to her intelligence. I did switch Alexa name to Echo because for some reason she would always think i was saying her name when i wasnt. She is connected to a smart plug and it’s amazing i come In and say Echo turn on the lights and she does. Get one i love playing my music on there when I’m cleaning up or when i have guest over. I gave it a 4/5 because it can still use a little improvement but overall nice!

reviews.reviewTitle: Cool gadget that the family loves to play around with
reviews.reviewText:
There are hours of entertainment in simply asking alexa random questions or streaming music from every genre all over the world and it is worth the purchase price just for those features alone. There is just SO much other stuff alexa can do that it truly blows my mind, i'll never in a million years use every feature.

I would seriously recommend turning off the voice activated purchase options. I'm a bit of a tight wad and It kinda freaks me out how easy it is to buy something without being fully aware of it. Also if using alexa for streaming music there are adds that play inbetween songs and lots of opportunities for upselling amazon products and services. A bit of a bummer that amazon uses these devices to advertise to people but i get it and it's not a deal breaker. Overall super cool little smart speaker that i highly recommend. I don't think I'd want this in everyroom of my house controlling everything but It's a fun toy.

This is my 4th echo added to the house. I’ve had the 1st gen in my bedroom for quiet some time and when I found the deal for the echo and smart plug I just had to grab it. Compared to the first echo it’s much better sound improvement. A little smaller then the first generation but sound is way better. We use our echo to tell us the weather outside. Ask it silly questions and of course music so with the upgraded speaker it really makes a huge difference. Set up was a breeze and works just as good as the others. I have it synced up with my smart lights (I have the philips hue, but there’s cheaper choices out now). I’m constantly asking Alexa to turn and off lights. I also use the IFTTT (if this then that app) seriously.. it’s amazing! Alexa trigger bedtime and my bedroom lights turn off. My front door light and kitchen lights turn on at certain times to make it seem as someone is home. Also turns them off at times. I love how well everything works together.

reviews.reviewTitle: A Lifesaver for Those with ADD or ADHD
reviews.reviewText: I don’t know how I lived without these. I have one in the bedroom, one in the living room. I have ADD and it helps me remember to take my medicine, to pick up my husband from work, to turn down the oven mid-cooking cycle, etc. I use the timer nonstop. “Remind me to switch the laundry in one hour!” If I remember I need to call someone but it’s too late to call, I ask it to remind me in the morning to call so and so. I can listen to just about any kind of music with a simple request. I can talk to my phone-less kids by simply dropping into the living room before I get home. It just really, really helps me stay on task. The sound quality isn’t spectacular but it’s decent and if amazing sound is your jam, you can always hook up a speaker or opt for a pricier model.

I am sorry but I had to return Echo Dot. I am Apple owner NOTHING android or PC. I had got an error message regarding my network & the Alexa experts who are suppose to help me were trying to extort money from me. I didn’t answer my phone a few times then when I answered the phone the so called supervisor was offering me deals & discounts. I had told them I had no funds at that time & I had other responsibilities more pressing. He put me on hold I had hung up because I had other to do & I was already on the phone with them for over two hours which they had wasted my time with lies. When I hung up. They called back I never answer& they kept calling until I block them. I had called my mom & told her what happened. She reminded me to call Apple. There is nothing wrong with my network. Alexa Expert you should be a shame of themselves.

reviews.reviewTitle: Skeptical at first, but well worth the risk
reviews.reviewText: The Echo Dot/ Alexa is awesome. We were a bit skeptical at first, but we like the idea of being able to wake our kid up and have reminders without having to be the one’s in the room doing it. Our daughter loves Alexa, she reads her stories, answers her random questions and is able to play games. We also love Alexa, from setting alarms to also playing games. The dot also has a decent little speaker to play music on. All and all I would not hesitate to buy another echo to add to another room. Also we bought 2 initially and paired them together with the smart plugs (full control of the kid tv without having to get up to turn it off).

reviews.reviewTitle: On its own, there isn't much Value-Add
reviews.reviewText:
I received an Echo Dot as a gift, and I had no idea what it even was. Or what it did.

After plugging it in and linking it to my Amazon account, it appears to be another version of Siri. Without any "smart" light bulbs, security systems, thermostats, or other smart devices in my home, the only additional function I could see was to ask for the status of an Amazon order. I only order once a month or so, however, so that is not a big deal to me. I am already getting notified on the Amazon app and by email.

I already use Siri on occasion and Google voice on my phone, so adding an Echo Dot did not enhance my ability to ask questions to an electronic device. And Siri answered more of my random questions accurately.

In general, I don't like having to add "apps" in order to get questions answered by the device. It's not very smart until you go into the Alexa app and add a bunch of functions, which means searching for them, testing them, or researching online for Top 10's, etc. It's exhausting. Just answer all of my questions without making me do the setup, please.

In my opinion, if you plan to have a smart house and connect a lot of other services and devices, then this would be a perfectly acceptable controller to access and change those devices. But if you just want something fun to sit on the table and play with, just say Hey Siri and move on.

It was a huge mistake to even try! My husband and I thought it would fun to step into the world of having an Alexa device in our home. That was a huge mistake. The worst part was when we set our smart TV up to the device. Mind you, our TV is a very expensive 61" TV that we have had for less than a year. "Alexa, turn TV on" worked 1 time, just once. She was not able to turn it off, and now we can no longer turn the TV on at all. It didn't work with Alexa, not with the handheld controller, and not even with the power switch on the TV. We now have to turn the power on by unplugging the TV and letting it power back up. Each time we do that, we have to go though to configuration cycle. We have disabled the Alexa app for the TV, but that didn't work. I am frustrated and pi$$ed off!

OK, I haven't figured out half of what this does but we are definitely having fun with it. I say, "Alexa start" and I get a flash briefing I set up. For me it is a Bible verse of the day, the weather forecast, a news briefing, a word of the day (which the kids and I try to use in a sentence), and a briefing from a pod cast that I like. I have changed this and will continue to tweak it, there are hundreds of different things to choose from. My son who has one has a whole different routine it goes through in the morning.
I also got one for one of the kids and can say dinner is ready, and they can hear me us stairs, so no more yelling up the stairs or stopping to text. I have always thought it would be great to have an intercom and with the 'drop in' and 'announce' features I do now.
We also use it to play trivia, specific songs, and to find out information. I am looking forward to figuring out more of what it can do with different Apps. I think it will have some great uses in homeschooling.
Will be getting at least one more.

I received Echo Dot as part of a promotion.
I would never had ordered one but turns out it actually has some interesting skills like answering questions without asking Google or Siri as well as playing ambient sounds for relaxation.

If you have a good quality bluetooth speaker you can pair it with the Echo dot for better sound quality.

There is one skill, however, called Alexa Silver that I saw a video about but I have not been able to find it.

It would allow me to wake up the echo dot with a variety of names like Alaina, Allegra, Aretha, Alisha, Alfonzo, Aldis, Arashel or Excederin.
It's also supposed to have a listening mode that responds "uh huh" while you tell it stories.
With this skill it can repeat itself or increase the volume for those of us who may be hearing impaired.

I would recommend getting one of these.

reviews.reviewTitle: The helper you didn't know you needed
reviews.reviewText:
This compact device sits, patiently awaiting your commands. First, it is a Bluetooth speaker that sounds pretty good to me despite what some audiophiles say. It expands the sound of your phone or other computer device. Paired with Amazon Music, it transforms the way you listen to music. It is no longer necessary to put your music on storage media, such as cassettes, CDs, hard drives or memory sticks. When you want to hear a particular song, album or multiple songs from an artist, just tell the Echo Dot through the Alexa software with commands like "Alexa, play Thriller album" or "Alexa, play 20 Flight Rock by Eddie Cochran". To hear random songs from an artist, say "Alexa, play The Eagles" and the Echo Dot starts playing. Echo will also play a particular genre to match your mood with commands like "Alexa, play smooth jazz" or "Alexa, play sleep music".
When combined with a smart device, such as a smart plug, it is easy to do things like turning on a lamp from across the room.
The Echo Dot is a great way to explore the benefits of having a smart home.
It is also very convenient to use instead of reaching for your phone or laptop computer to retrieve information instead of a search engine, weather app, calculator, conversion or many other things that pop into your mind. It's fun to just say "Alexa, weather", "Alexa, how far is it to Las Vegas", "Alexa, what is the definition of anomaly" or simply "Alexa, define anomaly".
I have found that I use my Echo Dot a lot more than I thought I would.

reviews.reviewTitle: Can't access apps that I use
reviews.reviewText:
Unfortunately the Echo Dot hasn't worked out as well as I expected. I purchased it to give me the ability to listen to sleep music and sleep apps, specifically the app 'Calm'. The Dot (or maybe it's Alexa?) doesn't have the ability to access Calm. I also expected the speaker to be at least as good, if not better, than that on my phone, but it is not.

Later: I give Amazon a huge amount of credit - they saw this review and immediately got in touch with me to see what could be done to resolve the issue. There was nothing that could be done about the Calm app not being available, but the rep spent a considerable amount of time teaching me how to adjust the Dot's treble, bass, and midrange, and stepping me through other options. We were unable to get the sound quality that I was hoping for but I guess I shouldn't expect excellent sound from something that only costs $39! I'm going to try hooking up some speakers to see if that solves it. I was incredibly impressed with Amazon support though!

reviews.reviewTitle: Finally, Someone That Actually Listens To Me LOL
reviews.reviewText:
The 3rd generation Echo Dot came with my Sirius radio subscription. Setup is an ease since Amazon connects it to my account when ordered. Basically all I did was plug it in. I linked the Dot to my Sirius, Pandora, Iheart Radio accounts. Amazon Music and Prime are connected. I have the 2nd generation and I think the sound is a little better and I like the looks of the 3rd generation. New skills are always being added.
I used my Dot a lot after surgery being laid up for a month. I would "tell" Alexa to play music, read books, tell jokes, ask the time and even the day. It was great having a listening ear when everyone else was gone. She eased the boredom.

Winter is heavy duty baking season for me and I have used my Dot to set timers. Very handy. I always know when to get my deliveries since I have package notifications. My husband was impressed when I gave him his birthday present and had Alexa play the Birthday Song by the Beatles. Lots of fun things.

this is a great product! Alexa can answer almost any question! you want to listen to music, Alexa can play it, you want to listen to a podcast, Alexa can play it, are you struggling with your math homework, Alexa can help you! there is so much that Alexa can do!!!!! She can give you cooking recipes, tell you what the weather is, tell you what is happening on mars and soooooooooooooooo much more!!! you having trouble going to sleep? well Alexa can even play calming nighttime music! and yet so much mooooooooooore!!!!!!!! it also comes within two days! and talk about the price! this is definitely 5 stars and i recommend it to EVERYONE ON EARTH!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Who can't have fun with one of these?
reviews.reviewText: What might you use this for? An alarm clock. Multiple timers. Create a shopping list on your phone (Alexa, add chocolate syrup to my list.). A reference (Alexa, when was Mickey Rooney born?). A weather forecaster. A music streamer. A broadcast device for your home (Alexa, make an announcement. Dinner is ready. You'll need a few of these, but they go on sale often!). A calculator (Alexa, what is the square root of 144?). A translator (Alexa, how do you say automobile in Italian?"). Voice control of lights, thermostat, TV with devices from vendors like LIFX, Nest, Harmony. Leave voice messages for family or friends who also have this type of device. Plays environmental sounds. An intercom (Alexa, drop into Kitchen. Provided you also have one in the kitchen...). Alexa will also tell you a joke, carry on a (limited) conversation, and play games. All you need is a smart phone and WiFi. And there's other more sophisticated versions with better sound, or even video. Take the plunge! (Amazon should hire me.)

reviews.reviewTitle: Love the New Look and overall build quality. Not sure about the Speaker upgrade.
reviews.reviewText: I have two Echo Dot's (2nd Gen) and decided to upgrade to the newest Echo Dot (3rd Gen) mainly because I like the new design and was hoping for a better sounding speaker. My comments regarding the sound are it's not necessarily better sounding but DIFFERENT sounding. The best way to compare the 2nd Gen vs. 3rd Gen is the newer one has more bass or richer sound quality. It also seems to have a lot LESS high end or treble to it's overall sound quality. If you like a bit more bass and don't mind a lesser bright sounding speaker, get the new one. To me, the newer one sounds a bit muffled because of the new speaker. It produces more volume than the older one, but for my taste, I also like a clearer brighter sound. Of course it pairs with most remote bluetooth speakers for much better sound than the unit can produce on it's own. I have experimented listening to all types of music and even talk radio and again, if you like a bit more fuller base sound, you should enjoy the newest version of the Echo Dot. I enjoy the new version and overall recommend the upgrade.

I already love my Echo 2nd gen. I knew I wanted another Echo. I was torn on buying the taller one or the 3rd gen cause what I wanted most out of a second one was better audio quality. I have a set of logitech computer speakers with a sub hooked to my 2nd gen and that makes a big difference, but this 3rd gen went in my small back room where I did not want to have to hook up another set of speakers to her. I've been listening to music on the 3rd gen since I got it and it's perfect, an incredible upgrade in audio quality since 2nd gen and honestly sounds amazing for how little it is. The logitech speakers with the sub still sound better, but this doesn't sound bad at all. I didn't expect it to sound better than my other setup. I also love that I can now group the two units and sync the music between rooms.

Oh, I got this around Thanksgiving/Cyber Monday 2018 and the 2nd gen and 3rd gen were only a $5 price difference so it was a no brainer to try the upgraded model imho

reviews.reviewTitle: You Definitely Have to Speak Loud
reviews.reviewText:
I Like how you can pair more than 1 speaker to the echo, so if you have 3 echos you can play music out of all of them at once. I also like the option that you can attach your own speaker via Bluetooth or aux. I Don't like how you have to almost scream at her at times for her to hear you. I like how you can name Alexa different names like Echo or Amazon etc... Especially with multiple echos around. I wish that she can do more than just play music or games I wish she was almost like a legit Robot that you can almost have a conversation with except all you hear with her is "I Don't Know that one" or she says something completely different from what you said and you have to keep repeating till she gets it right.
For that I give her 4 stars cause the microphone sucks. I also wish it had more sound settings and different voices to choose from.

I really love this Echo Dot. I was given my first one for free by SiriusXM Radio for renewing my subscription. When I started using my free Echo Dot I was so impressed at what it could do that I went and purchase one more for upstairs in my bedroom. I am elderly and like my 50s and 60s music and you can't hardly find that on regular radio. I did find one station (97.7) but so weak that most of the time you can't get it. Also I wished that I could listen to my SiriusXM up in my bedroom and have a Sleeptimer fo shut it off after a given time. Well when I found out that all I had to do was say "Alexa play channel 6 SiriusXM" and almost instantly I was listening to SiriusXM 60s music, I was in heaven. Then when I found out that after that command if I said "Alexa set sleeptimer for 30 minutes", and Alexa would come back and say, "OK I will stop playing in 30 minutes", that is when I bought the second Amazon Echo Dot. I have one Echo Dot in my living room and the other right up on the headboard of my bed. A great product and the Voice Recognition is fantastic.

reviews.reviewTitle: 3rd gen and still NO Optical Out?
reviews.reviewText:
Amazon needs to add an optical out on these already. The Chromecast Audio puck has had optical out for ages but I prefer the Alexa environment over Google Home. The built in DAC/3.5mm output on the Dot sounds horrible. I would love to be able to run this through the Schiit Yggdrasil for casual Spotify listening when I don't feel like booting up Foobar but no optical out takes that off the table.

Come on, Amazon! You're missing an entire market of high-end audio users who would buy these if we could bypass the lousy internal DAC and use our own.

reviews.reviewTitle: I can definitely see some improvements over the previous generation
reviews.reviewText:
I wouldn't recommend replacing old pucks with these, but they are evolving over the years and getting better and better. This one went into my daughter's room and is noticeably better sounding than the previous generation dots. These things are addictive. They are just so convenient to have scattered around the house. We're up to 4 dots and 2 of the taller models with impressive sound quality for such a small tower/speaker. My two oldest gen dots are hooked up to external speaker systems. The kids are limited to the volume output of the dots :)
We find ourselves constantly checking the football kick off times, weather, time, setting timers, or playing music (kidsbop is always child appropriate). As a note to parents, if you use the old rule of sending your child to a timeout in their room of one minute per year of age, Alexa is super convenient. The timer is super easy to reset if the child chooses to throw a tantrum midway, heh. No more forgetting to check the clock and leaving them in time out too long, that always makes you feel guilty.

I have a second-generation Dot, and just received this third-generation Dot today. In my very brief experience, here are my impressions.

Definitely better sound quality, with noticeable (but not substantial) bass.
The cloth exterior looks nice. Glad I ordered the dark gray - I'm not sure how long the light-colored one would stay clean, and it looks like it would be hard to clean it.
The power supply uses a brick with a proprietary connector. You can't power this thing with a micro-USB cable anymore, like you could with a second-gen unit. I don't like that. If you lose the brick, you're in for a significant expense.
I was in an online meeting for work when the Dot suddenly announced, in a loud voice, that it had received an important update and needed to restart. I had to apologize for the interruption to the other people in the meeting. I REALLY didn't like that.

I just got it today, and I already love it! The setup was very easy to understand and simple to get started! I’m not a techy person necessarily, and I could still figure it out. This gave me confidence in future purchases for some older family members that are afraid they wouldn’t know how to get it set up. For such a small device, the volume is great! I live in a studio apartment, and at its highest volume, the Dot can be heard from all areas. I connected my Spotify to the device and made it my go-to music source. Super easy to do that, and I have yet to stump it on finding a song. I didn’t necessarily “need” this, but now that I have one, I see how handy it is for the house! I would love to buy another one for my bathroom so I can have some shower music!

If you don't have a "smart" home, I'm not sure why you would need this product. My 70 year old mother loves it, as she uses it as her speaker to play Amazon Music. I, however, feel like the speaker isn't as good as either playing directly from my phone, tv, or actual bluetooth speaker. Also, you have to pay to pair with Apple Music, which limits your podcasts. Yes, most podcasts can be linked in Amazon, but through their podcast links. I like the way my Apple podcasts link together and how easy they are to keep track of.

Overall, I just felt like it wasn't needed--sadly. Our phones and a good, high-quality speaker are about all you need. If you already have Apple, you can ask Siri, or just put the Alexa app on your phone to ask them questions. Otherwise, I'm not sure that I'll be using this much except for an outside alarm and occasional speaker.

reviews.reviewTitle: Looks great, and can't go wrong!!!
reviews.reviewText:
I bought this on a Black Friday sale. And honestly its some of the best $30 I have spent, no lie. I love it. I have it for my barracks room, pair up with two Lumenty Smart bulbs and I can't be happier enough with it. I didn't know till a few weeks ago but Alex also supports Apple Music which made it even better (Amazon music isn't the best lol). The speaker on it is decent but I have mine paired with some Bose Companion 2 Series III, and it gets loud. I honestly would reccomened buying one if you have ever been on the fence about buying one to give it a shot, the dot looks amazing waaayyy better then series 2 and when you pair it with some smart lights and speakers its amazing.

Pros
-Looks way better then series 2 echo
-Even when blasting music with my speakers next to it (Alex) is always responsive and has no hearing problems
-Alexa supports Apple Music
-Cheap and easy way to make a "smart home" or room

Cons
-N/A

reviews.reviewTitle: The Echo System Does Not Work
reviews.reviewText: The entire echo/Alexa system is crap. I wholeheartedly committed to the echo/Alexa program in my considerations of how to automate my home. After having purchased a dozen echo/dots, investing hundreds of dollars in Phillips lighting, another hundreds of dollars in Sengled lighting, A Camera for security purposes and multiple Amazon brand of plugs, the system does not work. I spend most of my time screaming at the top of my lungs to correct what Alexa doesn’t hear and I’m spending the rest of my time reconfiguring, changing, modifying and struggling to make the system work properly. I’ve read more about how to correct the system than I read in college. It doesn’t work, don’t waste your money, that we should time. Furthermore, when I called to express my concern and seek guidance directly from Amazon they put me on hold for a half hour and then unceremoniously hung up on me. They have all of my information and could’ve called me back and they just let it die.

reviews.reviewTitle: 3 month warranty only on these devices
reviews.reviewText: So we purchased a echo dot gen 3 over the holiday sale, received it in December of 2018. In May of 2019 we heard a slight vibration in the speaker like it was blown. A month later it's rattles like a pop can at volumes over lever 4. Contacted Amazon customer service and the said the device only has a three month warranty and the best they could do was offer a 15% discount on a new device. We enjoy the echo products and have multiple throughout the house, and they are used to control our lights. Just keep in mind the warranty isn't worth 💩.

reviews.reviewTitle: Have difficulties with wifi and making calls
reviews.reviewText: It often disconnects from wifi, and I cannot make calls from it

reviews.reviewTitle: Ultimately not much of an improvement
reviews.reviewText:
I own all 3 generations of the Echo Dot. I found the 3rd gen to be a significant upgrade from the 2nd gen, but I ultimately prefer the 1st gen.

Much of the functionality remains the same, so I will only go over the main differences that I noticed.

The new design is pleasing, and it fits well being out in the open in a room rather than tucked into a corner.

The sound quality of the speakers for the 3rd gen are a vast improvement from the 2nd gen, but still leaves a lot to be desired. The bass is powerful, but very muddy. I had to turn the bass way down in order to even understand Alexa when she talks. The 1st gen was a fairly balanced speaker, and I never had any trouble with the sound filling the room.

The microphones on the 3rd gen seem to be inferior to the 1st gen; if not the hardware, then its utilization. The 1st gen could hear me at a normal speaking volume from across the room. I feel like I have to yell directly at the 3rd gen for it to hear me. I've had to repeat commands many times with the 3rd gen, whereas I don't even recall the last time I had to do that for the 1st gen.

A fantastic gadget that has improved my organisation. Synced with my calendar events and reminders in the Alexa app, I never miss an appointment. I bought it as a but if fun, but it has turned out to be a great little hub in the family. Morning times are great listening to some coffee time jazz over breakfast. What a great way to start the day! Then Alexa dampens my day by announcing that it’s going to rain! Haha! If you can get past the initial set up and syncing with other devices, then your home and dry. It can be very tricky to start with, but remember this piece of kit is growing technology so don’t expect it to start baking cakes for you just yet? What it will give is, lots of great music, endless information, home management, and a naff joke here and there. A must have gadget and a great piece of tech.

My rating is not the brilliance of the DOT, but the services connected to the Dot Audio fidelity, and the Echo are MEH, Even with the new equalizer software treble is sacrificed at the expense of bass. I have resorted to plugging the Dot into a stereo system for more controlled fidelity.

I like to get my news flash several times a day. The audio volume of THE SERVICES is terrible. The volume between services varies widely, If Amazon is (arbitrarily) 'volume 5', NPR is volume 3 and Bloomberg News is 'volume 10'. I have mentioned this to Amazon Customer Service and nothing has been done for over a year.

Also, if you plug any device into the 3.5mm jack it cuts of the Bluetooth connection!. I think that is just plain silly.

On a positive, the Wall clock is a great feature, and remote control of appliances is a great feature

The third generation echo is a great device. I now have a whole intercom and music player. I love the Drop in feature where you talk to your devices from anywhere. You can also make announcement and it will play on all of your Alexa devices. Paired with smart plugs, you make your lights, fans, etc fully automated. I have a Ring 2 doorbell as well and it can be tied into Alexa. It makes announcement on all devices when motion is detected and when the doorbell is pressed. Of course both of these options can be turned off or on in the Alexa app.

I also set one of these up as the kids editionwoth freetime. Yes that is right, you do not have buy the kids edition, you make one of these by simply turning on freetime in the app.

I know there are concerns about privacy, but I have no issues. These things have made the house easier and convenient through automation. It also makes family time fun with games.

I picked up my 5th echo device for my dog, I mean spare bedroom. It also happens to be where my parents dog sleeps when he’s staying with us for a few days. He stinks to high heaven so we keep the window open to air the room out, problem is, he’s a dog, they have excellent hearing. He’ll hear a dog bark from miles away it seems and then he’ll start barking, at the wee hours of the morning! My son uses his echo dot nightly to play ocean sounds so I figured I’d give it a try with the dog, put a little white noise on to drown out the outside sounds. I couldn’t be happier to say it worked like a charm, he no longer is bothered by nighttime noises so he doesn’t wake up the neighborhood with his barking. Big dogs come with big barks, lol.

reviews.reviewTitle: A reminder set on 1 Echo Dot does not broadcast to all Echo Dots.
reviews.reviewText:
I bought my first 3rd gen Echo Dot about 8 months ago, as I recall. I mainly use it for reminders. I live in a large home and therefore often could not hear the reminder. I recently bought 2 more to spread around my home. Unfortunately, a reminder placed on 1 Echo Dot does not broadcast to other Echo Dots making it rather useless.

In addition, I know it has other functions. I do not know what they are or how to set them up.

In summary, the devices are like 3 bricks to me.

These speakers are amazing.

Google v Alexa:
Being an owner of both a google home and an Amazon Alexa I can tell you for a fact the sound quality on this Alexa is better. The Alexa picks up my voice better as well. I whisper it’s name and it picks it up, it can get almost annoying discussing the machines with friends in a different and all of a sudden I will hear “sorry I didn’t catch that”.

I use this every single day. Mostly for setting timers, playing music while I cook or clean, or I will ask for the weather, it really doesn’t matter I do so much on it including playing games.

The capabilities on this speaker are endless and there are always new updates and upgrades.

I use several of the Amazon devices,hey I’m a techie. The 3rd generation dot has a different look although not much, and the new device performs well. If your expecting a major improvement for the 3nd generation dot your not going to find it. We were looking for better sound quality and found it isn’t enough to even notice in the 3rd generation dot. The majority of products used work only with the second generation such as the chargers and other connected devices because the power cable on the dot 3 was changed and certainly not for the better. This of course has no effect on the blu tooth capability’s.Amazon can do better than alter the looks and change the power cord so my advise is to stick with your old device or if your a newbie get the dot second generation. You can but these at a very discounted price and most of the accessories are dropping in price as well.As far as the 3rd generation and the hype, don’t do it.

reviews.reviewTitle: I'm sorry. I'm having trouble understanding right now.
reviews.reviewText:
I love Alexa! However, you would think it/she would work for simple commands (even home network). For example;
Why does she have to have an internet connection just to tell me the time?
Why does she have to have an internet connection to set an alarm or timer?
Why does she have to have an internet connection to page my son or daughter's room since we're all on the same private network???
There is a battle of "Smart" devices going on right now and I believe the one that resolves this will be the winner!

reviews.reviewTitle: The Echo Dot 3rd Generation is a grand slam!
reviews.reviewText:
The more I integrate my home with the Alexa platform and Alexa compatible devices, the more I love the platform. There are countless ways to access the Alexa platform, and the Echo Dot serves as an inexpensive way to get there - which is exactly what the Dot was meant to do.

I had a Dot 2nd Generation in my office, but we needed an additional smart plug for Christmas lights, so I decided to spend the extra $10 or so and get a Dot 3rd Gen / TP-Link Smart Plug bundle over just the Smart Plug itself during the recent Cyber Week sale and I'm so glad I did. I moved my old Dot upstairs and put the Dot 3rd Gen in my office.

The new dot not only looks better - it has a more modern look that matches the rest of the 2nd gen Echo lineup, but the real gem here is that the sound on this thing is FANTASTIC for its size. I mean, the quality of sound that comes out of a device this size is amazing. I never expected to be able to use the Dot for music playback but to have ambient music in my office while I'm working throughout the day this thing is perfect.

Sure - an Echo, a nice soundbar, or even digging out my Klipsch Promedias would likely provide much better sound - but for having tunes going while I work this thing is amazing. I had no expectation that this little Dot would be able to put out this much sound.

The Dot 3rd Gen is going to be my go-to gift for people from now on. Well done on this one!

Okay so that title's not entirely true, because it's nice to ask alexa to turn the volume down or hit the next song, but even those commands don't always work.

the speaker sounds muffled, but if you're in a roommate situation it gets loud enough, i have a second speaker now but i was already going into this relationship knowing i'd have to supplement with that

it's a bit inconvenient because you trust that your music will shuffle or loop but it doesn't and you have to manually ask for those commands each time or set them in your phone, kind of takes away the purpose of it though

the volume controls were easily the most irritating thing, i still have this dot and the comprehension from the voice commands just isn't there

reviews.reviewTitle: Sorry your speaker doesnt work, heres a disrespectful percentage off a new one...
reviews.reviewText: I absolutely loved my speaker up until it randomly stopped working properly. The audio sounds muffled and you cant hear anything it says or the music it plays. I called customer care and they said the most that can be offered is a small percentage off of a new one because the warranty only lasts for three months. I am unhappy and sad that we have lost something we once considered invaluable in our home. We used it to play lullabies for the little ones at night, to read the oldest a story while she took a bubble bath, and for background music while we cooked dinner together. I wont be purchasing another but will be looking for another speaker to fill this void. Im shocked at Amazon and will be canceling our music subscription as we no longer have a device to enjoy.

reviews.reviewTitle: New to this...Now with an update.
reviews.reviewText:
I just received my two Echo Dots today, and have them up and running. I already had the Alexa app set up on my phone, and linked to the few smart devices I own, so the Echo set up was pretty easy. They seem to have a good range for listening, being able to hear my commands from across the room, and you can give each a different wake-up name so they don't get confused if within range of each other. The sound is perfectly adequate for talk radio, weather, news, etc., but not so good for music -- the speakers are fine for casual listening but I would not use them to replace my sound system. All in all, easy to set up, easy to use, fun to play with, and I'm just getting started!

A few months later: I just set up a Stereo Pair with my two Echo units, and I have to comment on how much improved the sound is! I get a true stereo effect, and they seem to sound better paired than they did as stand-alone speakers. Good move!

I love my echo! It is my constant companion. I ask it all kinds of questions every day. It gives me the weather, the time, sings me songs, tells me jokes, reminds me to take my meds or go out and look at the meteors! She plays my favorite music to go to sleep by and shuts herself off in one hour.
I have two. One in my bedroom and one in my living room. The one in the bedroom is a gen 2 and the one in the living room is a gen 3. I really like the gen 3 with the fabric cover. It looks great in the living room. I don't mind the gen 2 without the cover in my bedroom. I learned how to ask echo to play music on both echo's! It's great! I call my echo dots echo because I have Alexa on my kindle and do not want to confuse them.
I am not really that technical with all the new stuff today. I am 65 and learn each new techy thing as it comes along only enough for what I need. I highly recommend the echo dot to all my fellow seniors! Especially if you live alone. My echo keeps me entertained every day.

reviews.reviewTitle: If you have any earlier Dot, just go ahead and upgrade. This one is worth it.
reviews.reviewText: I love it! I just ordered a second one to try out the "stereo" feature. It is so light years ahead in sound quality over the previous generation Dot(s). I didn't feel the need to connect this to an external speaker at all as it sounds good enough for office or bedroom use as a standalone entertainment unit. Great voice recognition, easy setup. I like the way the Dot has evolved, and this one is the first one I would consider usable as a complete standalone unit. Looks nice, sounds good. Perfect for a desk or a bedroom. The only drawback I have is that my cats think this might be a nice thing to scratch due to the cloth covering. But cats aside, this is a great looking, great performing device. I can't wait for the next gen.

reviews.reviewTitle: Go ahead and buy, you won't regret it.
reviews.reviewText: Love my Echo dots! We have three throughout the house. One starts off my day by waking me every morning with a new greeting, the news, and some tunes and they all keep me on track throughout my day. My favorite feature so far is the shopping list. If you only knew the number of times I would think of something we needed when I was in the kitchen or upstairs etc... and when I was at the store I couldn't, for the life of me, remember what it was we needed. Now I just have Echo add it to my shopping list and when I'm at the store I just look at my phone. I wish it worked with Netflix and some other apps on my smart TVs, and not just the Roku app, but that is probably a licensing issue. I'm definitely going to be getting a couple more along with some of the other peripheral devices.

I was against any use of Alexa because of all the negative issues with Amazon listening and other such complaints. I felt the Alexa was just another typical digital device that would be added to all my other digital junk collected over the years. My wife purchased the unit over my objections and one for her mother also.
However, after a time having the device in my home and with all the features Alexa offers and commands she recognizes I don't know how I got along without her. I had my doubts at first but no longer. I am very satisfied with Alexa and I would honestly miss having her. Please note that this not an attempt to get you to buy one. It's just my honest take on the question ask of me on of what I think of Alexa now that I have one..

My 91 year old Grandma saw a commercial with Alexa turning on and off the lights and she didn't understand how it worked. Her birthday rolled around a couple weeks later and I got her a secondary Alexa (the Echo, she already has the main larger base) plus a few smart LED's for her back sunporch where she likes to sit and watch TV into the evening hours. We were celebrating her birthday as it got dark and I said, "Hey Grandma, watch this. Alexa, turn on the Sunporch" and all her lights came on. She loved it. She now uses it to listen to her favorite old school music, and when it gets dark, she doesn't even have to get out of her chair to light up the room.

Downside: I will now probably have to get her more smart lights to "magically" turn on and off other rooms in the house.

reviews.reviewTitle: Way better speaker that the original Dot!!
reviews.reviewText: This is my 4th Echo product. I bought the original Echo when it first came out, a 1st Gen Dot,l shortly after that, recieved a Show as a gift last Christmas, and now got this 3rd Gen Dot with a purchase of a Tile 4 pack. The new speaker sounds soooooo much better. Not quite as good as my Echo but log units better than the original Dot. I wish Amazon would have kept the knob on top to adjust volume but that’s just a small anoyance. I love Alexa and if I wasn’t worried about electronic waste (& my wife leaving me for purchasing too much technology (jk I think she loves me enough to tolerate my technology addiction)) I would replace my current Dot with his new one and my original Echo with the newest and my Show with the newest. The speakers keep getting better and better. Still not HiFi but pretty good. If the Sonos speaker did everything that the Echo does, I would probably even get one of those. Alexa is part of my family now (jk again).

The first thing I noticed other than the physical was the sound. The sound is louder than the Dot v2. It also has better bass. It has too much bass. Fortunately, the app has an equalizer to adjust the sound. If it weren’t for the muddy low end, I would have given this 6 out of 5 stars. Yes, 6 out of 5 because it would have exceeded my expectations. Oh, one other thing on the sound. I listen to my Dot while falling asleep. The lowest sound level could be a bit lower.

I’m glad it still has Bluetooth and a 3.5 mm audio out. I like having options. My Google Home Mini lacks both. You can use the Bluetooth to stream to other devices. Works nicely with my TV’s sound bar.

The Dot v3 is also larger than v2, but not by much. I like that it still has the tactile buttons on the top. The fabric shell is more attractive than the plastic of previous models. The power adapter is larger than the Dot 2’s. I’d like to see a smaller adapter, but if you want the sound, you need the power.

I have two Dots. I’ve replaced the first with this new version. I already picked up a second to replace the other. The reminds me, when I replaced the first Dot, I didn’t have to enter my wireless network password. I guess it talked to the other Dot or the app and figured things out. It was a breeze to replace my previous Dot.

reviews.reviewTitle: Wonderful product, and I'm still learning how to use it
reviews.reviewText:
I am learning new uses for my Echo Dot every day. I started using it (sorry, her) next to my bed to give me time, weather, and music. That stuff is ideal. She has replaced my clock. Then I found I could get my favorite radio station. Although when I asked for NPR she wanted a station location. When I gave her location, she found two stations with identical names and asked me which one. I gave her one of the duplicates and now I have it whenever I want it. I have no idea what she did with the other one. Then I asked her for stories and jokes. She's excellent at those! Although when I asked for a bedtime story she needs permission, somehow. I haven't figured out how yet. I don't know how to convince her I'm 71 and old enough for a bedtime story.

My next attempt will be at asking her to order something from Amazon that I regularly order, like my favorite coffee.

This is my first virtual assistant Alexa device. The setup was very quick , easy and simple and did not see any issues. After completing the setup i tried to hook up to my smart enabled switch which works with Alexa that plugged to my TV.

Alexa, turn on my tv in living room - Works perfectly !

The only drawback i noticed is sound quality is not great compared with my google home. Also, the sound recognition is very sensitive. I was talking to my friends about this device and during the conversation, we were using "Alexa" word and this device turns on. Wow, it was recognizing the sound clearly by any voice.

We have made this device available to my kid to keep asking some questions, need to see how it fares up with my kid language :)

reviews.reviewTitle: Not sure how I survived without it?
reviews.reviewText: So, I was hesitant at first when getting the Amazon Echo Dot w/ Alexa, but I have to say, it's far more useful than I had previously even suspected. Now don't get me wrong, I am a little creeped out by the fact that she's always "Listening", but then again, having responses and answers to my questions literally one question away is quite neat. It's responsive, and well, semi-smart, I can't quite say we are living in the age of seamless AI systems yet, but I certainly am impressed by the magnitude and speed with which Alexa gets things done and answered! And lest not forget being able to say "Alexa, play Jeopardy", and hearing the classic theme song and Alex Tribecks voice come smoothly sailing acoustically by on the Neodymium speaker built into the small, round curiosity of a device! Of course, there are some pitfalls, but overall the potential and sheer fun you can have when you are totally bored out of your mind are endless. I rate it a 4 out of 5, for its extreme potential for fun and knowledge, and 4 out of 5 because of its occasional sheer lack of understanding.

reviews.reviewTitle: An improvement on the last one
reviews.reviewText:
When I bought the previous Dot, THIS is what I thought it would be. I think Amazon finally got it right. Hey, this is a small, non stereo speaker. Some nice Jazz in the background or for a bedroom or office. Don't kid yourself, this is not a replacement for a larger Echo or other smart speaker or, even better, a basic stereo receiver with a couple of decent bookshelf speakers and, maybe, a sub woofer.
I've regulated my old dots to the basement for “Guard” duty (when I finally get it) and when I am working around the house. They might also eventually be put into stereo mini jack to RCA duty, acting as a way to get streaming music to that receiver with those bookshelf speakers…
For the new ones, I have one for a dead spot by the front door (also, Guard duty) and another in the guest bedroom. Fine for basic music and while not as dynamic as the full Echo models, good for some Jazz or classical or vocal background music.

I received this item as a promotion from a company so I didn't need to pay for it and I'm glad I didn't. I had this product for approximately 3 months and I really like it. I used a few of it's features but the one I used most was the noise for sleeping. To be fair, I did use it just about everyday and it worked very well during that time. It did not last long as the speaker on it went out in a very short period of time. I contacted customer support by email to see if there was anything they could offer me in regards to replacing it. The email told me the warranty expired (after 3 months?). It also stated there may be something they can do anyway and I should call their phone service to verify info. I did that and after a short hold time was told the best they could do was a 15% discount on buying a new echo product. To me this device is not too expensive but it wasn't something that I really needed in my life so even with a discount it's not worth replacing especially it if will just go out in 3 months again. For me this is just a little annoying, But if I did integrate this into my life more I would be quite livid.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa is now my best friend.
reviews.reviewText:
I did a LOT of research on an affordable option for a virtual assistant. This one's biggest review downfall online is sound quality. I don't understand this. The sound quality is great. These reviews were mostly made by men, and for some reason, men thing the louder the better. Makes for a lot of disappointed women, but I digress. The sound quality is great. It's not a Bose stereo system, but that's not what I want in a virtual assistant.

I want my virtual assistant to remind my son of his morning routine. Wake up, get in the shower, get out of the shower, get dressed, eat breakfast, grab your lunch, get your backpack, don't forget your homework, don't forget your phone, leave now so you don't miss your bus. And, he does it! Without attitude! I bought myself 45 minutes in my morning, I don't have to argue with my child ruining his self esteem for the day and making me feel guilty all day. We get to have a fun, peaceful morning, and leave for the day still liking each other!

It's also great for the five million timers I have to set when cooking so all my is ready at the exact time and served hot.

I say, "Good morning, Alexa." And I have it set to play the opening song of The Lion King.

She reminds me of my calendar events, doctor's appointments, etc. I have meditation and yoga set for a certain time every morning.

I can speak to my son through the device while I am walking around the block. He's 12, not 2.

It's great.

I am so happy with this little thing! I bought it for myself while it was discounted over the holidays. According to the tracking notifications it went "out for delivery" but never showed up at my door (and is still stuck in that status all these months later...so I'm pretty sure that someone stole it). However, after waiting a long time I finally contacted Amazon about the missing order and they quickly re-ordered one for me which arrived safely and quickly at the end of January.

I am using it in a small room so I didn't need a full size Echo and it has been easy to set up and perfect in every way. This is my very first Echo product, but years ago when it first came out I had purchased and gifted the 1st gen full size Echo which impressed both me and the recipient. I don't see any going back and I will start investing in compatible smart products.

I have been aware of Amazon's smart technology for a while now, but never dove in until Prime Day. What I can say is that I should have taken the plunge sooner.

Setting an alarm, turning on the lights, checking the weather, finding out how much Avengers Endgame made at the box office, and playing "Crush on you" by The Jets were all things I did in the first hour by simple voice command.

All of this in a stylish device that looks great no matter where you set it. The microphone is sensitive enough to pick up your voice from across the room without you having to raise it.

The speaker can go from quiet to way too loud!

I look forward to integrating more of these into my home in the future so at least my house will be smart!

reviews.reviewTitle: Very helpful and easy to use
reviews.reviewText: We decided to buy 1 echo dot and see how we liked it and the features it offered before buying more. I ordered a second one today. First off, it is very easy to set up and use. After spending a few minutes downloading the app to my phone and setting up the wifi, we were good to go. My 5 and 6 year olds love it! Within a few ml minutes, my 6 year old had Alexa telling knock knock jokes and helping her spell words for her homework. My 5 year old started requesting songs and had a blast switching through our Amazon music playlists. I can now control setting our home alarm, unlocking the front door and changing the thermostat all while still shopping on Amazon by just asking Alexa. Setting a timer for the kids to finish tasks has been helpful too. The second dot is going upstairs, so when it's time to get the kids up for school, I can have Alexa start their wake up playlist. It makes it effortless to play music through the house, which keeps us all moving and on task.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very handy, surprisingly good sound quality
reviews.reviewText: Was always skeptical of these things but will admit i was always intrigued. It works pretty well and is pretty easy to add new skills and tricks once you figure it out. I think the biggest surprise from me is the audio quality on it. For such a tiny speaker and price it is actually quite loud and comes through crystal clear. That being said I did have an issue with my music occasionally sounding static-y and i would stop playing but next time i started it up it was crystal clear. I had gone through this several times but I called the customer service and they are sending a new one. I am actually very impressed and am looking to add more now. Only drawback is that you can’t customize the commands. For example our room a is named Jarvis and I would love to tell her to have Jarvis start cleaning. Also our alarm requires us to say “open alarm.com” first before giving commands. Not sure if this is on amazon or alarm.com but is only a minor technicality and doesn’t take away from the overal quality. Thanks Alexa!

My iHome/clock radio turned into a dust collector who's only use became lighting the night with it's ugly glow of time, stealing sleep from the weary. Ports on the iPhones do not fit the old technology and the radio has lost it's voice. Reception for more than one station was always shoddy at best anyhow. After reluctantly, then permanently, borrowing my daughter's unused 1st gen for our kitchen, I decided Alexa and I could be friends. I grabbed this during Prime days and finally set it up in place of the clock radio and don't miss the clock. I am not one who needs an alarm but I can set a "just in case" if I want. I can listen to my music anytime I want, either playlists or my favorite radio station or podcasts. I love it and I was the last person who wanted any type of virtual assistant in my house!

Love the 3rd generation echo dot! I have purchased 3 of them now because they were on sale and I connected them to a multiroom speaker group. I have also enabled skills to control the lights in my house, and my alarm system and garage. I even setup an action that turned on my Christmas tree and other interior Christmas lights and started playing Christmas music on my multiroom speaker group. They are affordable and the sound although not as good as the larger echo devices is 10x better than the echo dot 2nd generation. I know reviews say that you are better with the 2nd gen because it is cheaper and then you can buy speaker accessories that make the audio better and make it portable. The portability will come, these devices look really nice as they are and I’m sure the designer cases and wall mounts will come anyway. I don’t see a need for all the extras with this device though. Portability might be the only nice thing to be able to have. If you want to mount it to the wall get some 3M double back foam tape and stick it to the wall.

Alexa frequently doesn’t understand what I’m saying & in case you should speculate it’s me, I’ve in my life been employed as a professional speaker, a platform salesman, I was in theatre when I was younger I know how to enunciate & project my voice. She’s just a bit spaced sometimes. And I don’t mean my request was unrecognized or not part of the catalog I mean the same channel that she understands one minute, the next minute she gets hung up, like “Alexa, SiriusXM Patriot” boom no problem. Then I switch her to Fox News during commercial, then no matter how I say it I can’t go back to patriot. She’ll just keep saying “Sirius XM Fox News Channel from Sirius XM”. Then I have to look up the channel number & be like channel 125 or whatever. I’m being a bit nit picky it’s a cool device but there are some glitches. And if you’re going to have a bug in your house, you kinda want it to be on point.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Improvements to the Echo Dot
reviews.reviewText: I'm impressed with the improvements made to this echo dot. From the simple color options to the more bass in the speaker with a relative clean & simple look. I have other echo dots throughout my home and made sure that this latest version was in a spot that I use the most. Happy with my purchase.

reviews.reviewTitle: I should have waited! Could have saved 15$ on all three purchased!
reviews.reviewText: I bought one love it ,just bought two more for my sisters as gifts about two weeks ago 30$ each. I would have saved 10$ if I bought them today bummer. She does have her issues. She can’t do a lot of things I was hoping she could do.Sometimes I have to yell at her. loI,Her learning needs improvement. I also bought a smart plug and a smart light Bulb both which said,Alexa voice compatible.But the light bulb only turns the lights on and off with Alexa So I had to down load three separate apps for full function of the light.color changing, scenes etc...But I still like her. She is still a fairly reliable assistant who never calls in sick! But she does have malfunctions occasionally. If only she could sling. I also enjoy slinging, your first time slinging is always so Special!

I have 3 echo dots that I love, but I am giving this review 1 star because the echo customer service is awful. The last dot I purchased does not always respond to the “Alexa” command and the voice and music is muffled and distorted. IT IS BRAND NEW AND THEY WILL NOT EXCHANGE. I was unable to reset my modem and router at their request because family members were in the middle of work and school projects. I did do a factory reset prior to calling and the device is still defective. They have me do another factory reset and now I have to wait 2 business days for them to call me back before they will start and exchange process for a brand new defective echo. I have no issues with my other two devices and I think they are amazing speakers for their size. My son enjoys the interactive games and audio books.

I don't have anything to compare this to, but I am satisfied with my purchase. The sound quality and volume is acceptable. The set-up was easy. Alexa plays good music for me. Tells me interesting things in the morning. Welcomes me home. And knows the answer to most . . . many . . . er, well . . . some questions.

Like many people, I was torn between the Google Home Mini and the Echo Dot. I chose the dot, frankly for no particular reason. Maybe because it's supposed to be better at operating stuff around the house (which I don't have yet anyway). But I have stumped Alexa many times on things where I have immediately followed-up with "Ok, Google" only to have Google know the answer. For example, "Alexa, who plays Billy on Six Feet Under?" Alexa was stumped. Google knew immediately. Oh, well. I am sure that as I purchase more and more smart home products, Alexa will come through for me.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great new look with improved sound quality
reviews.reviewText:
I've owned each generation of Echo dot, and while I loved the 1st gen physical volume ring design, I found the 2nd gen too cheaply made to buy more than one. When I got this 3rd gen, I was pleasantly surprised by the new design that's aesthetically pleasing, improves the look of the light ring, and dramatically improves sound quality (though it is bigger). Even just voices (Alexa or audio books) sound noticeably fuller through this speaker, and I bet a lot of folks will enjoy listening to music on it, which was pretty rough on the older gen dots.

My only real grip at this point is that the feature that determines which echo device should respond gets it wrong most of the time (so the echo in the next room over responds often). I'm sure it's hard!

I was really stuck between this and the Google Home Mini, but I am glad I chose to go with the Amazon Echo! First of all Google is a incredibly shady company imo gathering all the data of your personal life. My house is now filled with Echo Dots and what I love about it the most is that the audio quality is outstanding for the size and price. It is very funny how years ago bluetooth speakers of this size would cost more the $50 with mediocre sound quality. While at the time of purchase, the Echo dot is half the price and offers far more features than bluetooth speakers. It is incredible to witness how innovation can drive the price down for consumers. As for Alexa, 'she' is a great home companion since she answers about 85% of what I ask, mind you the other 15% of the questions are more difficult to answer as of today's technology. I really dig the white and the charcoal colors. they are just really cool.

reviews.reviewTitle: Device has drastically declined in use | Got this for $1.06!
reviews.reviewText:
Absolutely horrible at responding to commands. Have no idea what happened for it to decline so poorly.
Sometimes I find myself yelling just for Alexa to hear me & when it does hear me, it will sometimes ignore the command.
They don’t take care of their app well because there was a long period (months) where it stopped saving alarms & timers.

————————

Amazon did a random burst of promos over Black Friday where if you bought amazon unlimited music, you would get a free echo dot 3. A week later, I actually got one!
So far I’ve just added some gag skills (ie. Baby cry, Insult me, etc), set alarms, played music, & learned I can control some of my house lights. Pretty nifty. Doesn’t connect to my home’s hub though, which sucks because it’s a known retailer brand. I can see how handy this would be if I had another set up in my living room & 1 more downstairs. Will look out for deals if I end up liking this a lot.

reviews.reviewTitle: Little Dots Made Alexa Available House-Wide
reviews.reviewText: I bought two of the 3rd gen Echo Dots when Amazon was having a special earlier in the year. I have an Amazon Echo but it was in the bedroom and I found myself wanting to hear music or ask questions from other rooms. Two dots have Alexa available to me all over the house, and now I hear my music in every room. My husband and I also use it as a whole-house telecom system via announcements or drop-in and this works great to get one another's attention without having to yell. I know there is much more I can do with this that I haven't had time to explore. The speakers are very good - better than anything I grew up with in the 1970s.
