The Echo Dot speaker sounds like something I would have spent several hundred dollars on back in the day, or a radio today (although maybe even a little better than some radios). I have nothing bad to say about the Echo Dot.

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect puzzle piece to expand smart home control
reviews.reviewText: We already have Alexa controlling several smart home devices through an Echo Show but wanted to extend voice control upstairs. The Echo Dot is perfect for this task. It's compact and stylish yet has a reasonably powerful speaker. Setup is a breeze when you instruct Alexa to discover new devices. I'm adding a few to cover voice dead zones that are unreachable through my Show located in the downstairs kitchen. The new colors available are cool but there are a zillion covers available if you need it to stand out or blend in with specific room decor. The holiday price was too good to pass up & i'm glad I bought it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Much more useful than I thought
reviews.reviewText: We love this little Dot. This was a Christmas present my husband bought for himself and I kind of made fun of him and predicted that this would be one of those things that once the novelty wore off it would be forgotten and never used. I was very wrong! I didn’t realize you could set all kinds of alerts and reminders (even daily) and that you can use Alexa for almost anything you would normally use google for, the weather and news. No more checking IMDB for info on who was in what movie. It can arm/disarm our ring, play music from our Spotify account, call anyone in our contacts and converse right from wherever we are sitting, even do group chatting from our household to our daughter’s who also has a dot. There is a caveat, however—you do have to spend some time learning the correct way to say things. Once you get that down, it is a really valuable tool, and inexpensive too.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not as good as old DOT...
reviews.reviewText:
We wanted a second DOT do we could have music everywhere. So since we were ordering another, we decided to order the latest model. The DOT arrived earlier than promised. A definite plus!!!

It just seems like it runs slower than our first DOT. And it keeps disconnecting from our WiFi. Our other DOT doesn’t do that.

Plus we really like the way the older DOT can lower volume by spinning the ring. I don’t have to see which arrow I have to tap is. The new DOT has arrows. I know I can lower by voice command, but sometimes doing it manually is quicker to get it just right!

Plus the “fabric” cover on the new DOT is harder to keep clean. Dust shows much more on the new DOT than the old DOT.

I think the old DOT is the one we prefer. Wish I had saved the box and such to send new DOT back and order an older model.

When I completed the setup (connection to the internet), I played music from Pandora, WOW! what a difference from the generation 2 Echo Dot sound, which I had for well over a year. I was impressed.

When it is at volume 5, on some songs/music it cannot hear me say the wake word, "Alexa". I have to literally be inches away from the Gen. 3 Echo Dot to make it respond. At volume 7 or higher, FORGET IT!!! It can't hear me yelling almost kissing the new Dot.

Connecting this to an external Bluetooth/wired speaker, it listens and hears the wake word as long as the external speaker is a bit away from the dot, even at high volume (your millage may differ). This defeats the better sounding built in speaker if connected to an external one.

Stick with the Gen 2 Echo Dot if you plan to use external speakers. I was going to return it though the price paid (discount + 5 mo payment option) I decided to keep it and not use it at high volume. Maybe I will give it as a gift.

Njoy Life...

qarawol

reviews.reviewTitle: This is garbage-no where near as good as the first or second gen
reviews.reviewText: Muddy boomy sound heavy on lower mid and upper bass response. No treble whatsover. Worthless to listen to music which I could easily do with my other DOTs... Have tried using the alexa app to alter the sound quality. The device just has no treble. Also, it no longer takes a standard USB cable. Now it is a proprietary adapter and cable all in one with a small round jack. I guess too many people were trying to use echo dots with a substandard usb power adapter? But now you can't buy the length or color of cable you want. I put this on in a bathroom to play soft jazz during parties, but its ugly black cable stands out stark against white trim. I will keep playing with this for another day or two before I send it back if I can't make it at least as good as my 1st and 2nd gen dots.

reviews.reviewTitle: This thing has changed my life.
reviews.reviewText: Are you one of those people who thinks "I don't need an Amazon Echo/Dot!"? Yeah, me too. Until my wife got one for me for my birthday. Then we started researching all the things you can get Alexa (the Amazon app) to do! Now I have voice-controlled plugs, switches, dimmers, ceiling fans, thermostats... you name it! It's fun as hell to be sitting somewhere thinking "you know what? I'm kinda warm. Alexa! Set thermostat to __ degrees." I have routines for waking up, leaving the house, going to bed, etc. And I'm just getting started.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to set up easy to use
reviews.reviewText: pretty easy to start up w the application. I’m still learning everything she can and can’t do. I use her mostly for music and the speaker sound is pretty damn good. I’ll update my review after I’ve had her a few weeks. Update: I’m not sure if I’m not asking the right questions or what but many responses from Alexa are to go to the App to manage your list. None of my music is showing in the “list” so no idea why.. I’ve been trying to create a second music list but that isn’t working either. Alexa says hmm I don’t know that one” more than I care to hear or she doesn’t follow direction. She goes completely off topic and has occasionally just stopped playing in the middle of a song. The App is not helpful in navigating either. Hoping to find better instructions on how to “manage” your lists

Compared to my gen 1 echo dot. The driver compared to the older one I also have seems a little deeper. They do handle bass differently though. The highs seem muffled in comparison, but what can you expect from a single driver. Voice recognition works as expected. Originally i was concerned about both echo dots trying to perform the same task when asked. Both my systems or not close but living room and kitchen or open concept but it appears the two do not compete against each other. Not sure what tech is involved in this but they seem to work fine together. Now if I could get them to play the same thing at the same time for stereo mode that would be nice. Maybe it exist but I've yet to find it if it does.

I am very pleased with my Echo Dot. I love being able to make a shopping list without writing one thing down. I was baking a cake and realized I was out of chocolate chips so told Alexa to put it on my shopping list. I didn't need to stop what I was doing or stop the mixer. Whenever I realize that I need something added to the list, I just start with "Alexa," and it's on my list. Another feature I love is being able to play my Pandora thru the Echo Dot. The sound is so much better than playing the music thru my TV. I just tell Alexa which station I want to hear while I'm cleaning house. There is probably so much more I can do with the Echo Dot, but so far I'm enjoying having Alexa as my assistant. I wish I was able to change her name to something other than Alexa or Computer, though. I am very happy with my purchase.

Bought this for my 10 year old. She LOVES it. And now we all want one. lol

My daughter has ADHD/APD, and we are a homeschooling family. It is great for her to use as a tool for her education and for organization. She sets alarms so she can remember things like putting her retainer in at night, and sets timers. She asks it how to spell things, or to learn random facts about her current interests (which is hit or miss, depending on the question... It's not as much of a wealth of information as a Google search, but it also doesn't come with as many risks.)
She uses the calendar a lot, and listens to audible books.

Her favorite part is the freedom to listen to whatever music she wants. Lullaby/ambient music helps her get to sleep at night. And she frequently has mini dance parties in her room with her sisters and friends. lol. We do have an Amazon Music subscription, so we have more choices.

It's perfect for her needs.
Now I need one for me in the kitchen.

reviews.reviewTitle: Group streaming is terrible. The app isn't much better
reviews.reviewText:
We have one Gen-2 and two Gen-3 echo dots. Unfortunately, the "Group" streaming is terrible. The App isn't much better.

The sound from the Gen-3 dots are significantly better than Gen-2. The music from all 3 devices cuts in/out, randomly, and from different devices. No pattern. I've rebooted, reset, etc. No luck (w/suggestions from Amazon support). The app also freezes, or is way behind the live feed.

Anyhow, if you want to play one device at a time - no problem. If, like me, you want the same music on as you move from room to room, go with another music system/streaming.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great sound quality and WiFi calling functionality.
reviews.reviewText:
Bought this unit as a christmas gift for my parents. They love this device and really enjoy how they can use Alexa to set reminders through the day, check the weather before they leave for work, stream any song they like from Prime Music's large gallery and etc.
Another cool feature is that they can call me (to the Alexa ap on my phone) free of charge, without the need for a cellular connection. This is a great feature to have when I'm travelling internationally and want to talk to them. I just have to dial them on the app and I can have a seamless conversation for free.
The sound quality on the device is great, as well- the bass is pretty decent for what one would expect from a unit of this size, and if you don't like the sound, you can always connect external speakers to this device over Bluetooth.

I currently have three Echos in my house, a v1 Echo in the kitchen, a v2 Echo Dot hooked up to my stereo for streaming music on better speakers, and now this v3 Echo Dot to stream music in my office. I had the v2 in my office, but got this v3 on a Black Friday deal along with an Amazon Smart Plug. The sound quality is very much improved over the v2, which is why I moved the v2 to plug into my stereo in the living room.

It sits in the corner and is unobtrusive, but it is a more attractive little hockey puck than the original Dots. The voice recognition gets better with each passing day, and the mics have a lot of accuracy (so that the NSA can really get a clear recording of all my conversations, right guys?).

Overall I'm happy with the Alexa service, mostly for setting timers and streaming music. I only use a fraction of its functionality, but I'm happy with what I do use.

reviews.reviewTitle: It sound ALOT better compare to gen 2
reviews.reviewText:
It sound ALOT better compare to gen 2 dot
I put them side by side and do a few sound test. the sound is more full and not as cracking like gen 2.
Still not as good as the full speaker, but hey! for the price and size of this thing I would said is pretty good already.

If you care about how much power it runs
Gen 2 runs about 1.7w idle and 2.0w playing music
Gen 3 runs about 1.4w idle and 2.0w playing music

reviews.reviewTitle: Loses its luster after a few days
reviews.reviewText:
I feel like this is a novelty device. I had something more in mind but maybe I built it up too much in my head. I originally purchased Alexa and a few Wi-Fi plugs so I could control my Xmas lights with my voice. Which was super cool by the way but once I took my lights and my tree down there wasn’t a whole lot left to do. Now I have 4 WiFi plugs and an Alexa device just sitting there doing nothing. Every once in a while we get a chuckle out of her beat boxing skills (or lack there of) but then the laughter stops and I’m left with what seems to be a paperweight.
It does do everything as promised so I can’t knock it for that but I would really like to see a fancier version, one that would display my security cameras when prompted to do so. I realize they make the echo dot but the screen quality was so poor and so small it didn’t do any good so I returned it for this simpler version.

When needing wanting to relax ask Alexa to play gentle soothing Asian usic or sounds of ocean. Love not having to get up or turn on something.

I bought Echo because I am disabled & live alone. I have a medic alarm button but it wasnt working & I was fearful.(years ago fell in bathroom. Fortunately my son was here. If he had not been I would have died alone with broken femur) And so wanted Echo as backup. I mention that because if you have an elderly person you worry about this would help.

So, yes I love Echo/Alexa. Wasnt sure how I"d feel with it but very happy with purchase.

Although this new EcoDot 3rd gen device sounds fine, well built and so on, there are some problems regarding the integration with Alexa and 2d gen EcoDots; I've got 2 of these and one of the latest gen, the latter one, can speak and understand Spanish which is my mother tong and the other 2 won't , so at this point, I have to speak English to some and Spanish separately, making life kind of tricky, also I need to call them with different names: Alexa (English) and Eco (Spanish) in order to avoid conflicts. On the other hand I was expecting integration with FireStick latest 4K version, as Alexa spoken commands won't trigger on, off, channels, volumen, etc. to my home theater components which have been previously programmed into the Amazon remote FS control which works fine manually.
I wonder when this integration glitches can be solved some day.

I tend to be behind the times when it comes to tech products, but I finally broke down and purchased an Echo Dot when I was baking holiday cookies and realized “dang, a voice controlled timer/speaker would be handy as heck right about now.” My house is far from a smart home, but I have enjoyed playing with the different features and skills of Alexa. I did primarily purchase this for the voice-activated functionality. The timer/alarm sound is also much nicer (and louder! Useful!) than the obnoxious beeping on my microwave timer. Ironically, this device seems geared more for millennials: it’s ready and willing to stream pretty much anything under the sun, but it doesn’t function the way any other Bluetooth speaker functions. I can’t seem to hook it up to my phone and have it work as a speaker for things like YouTube or my own iTunes playlists. Or perhaps I just haven’t discovered the right skill yet.

reviews.reviewTitle: Is it the CIA? I don't know, but it plays music really well
reviews.reviewText:
Some will say that Alexa is all apart of the CIA. Well, if it is, then oh well. My cell phone and computer hear everything that my family and I say so what is one more microphone in the house. It is great to listen to music and play games with.

The sound quality is pretty good considering it is such a small speaker. Good bass, great mids, and highs. This is not audiophile level, but for every day listening it is wonderful. Alexa integration is great. I can just talk and it listens to me, better than my children. My only gripe is that multi-room listening doesn't work with my Echo Tap. This is a whatever thing and not a deal breaker. Oh well, all I need to do is ask Alexa to move the music where I want it.

All in all, my CIA voice recorder is amazing. I would totally buy more. Nothing like sharing my information with the government.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is a product that belongs in every home
reviews.reviewText:
I was always curious about Alexa; I wanted one, but never wanted to spend the money. Last month I put it on my Christmas list on a whim, and that was one of the best gifts I’ve ever asked for. I’ve always been an Apple person, but Siri isn’t even in the same generation as Alexa. Alexa is far more advanced than even my millennial mind expected. Imagine making dinner and simply asking for any NPR program, slow relaxing jazz, 70’s Disco, Cher or any other genre/podcast/artist you could possibly desire and it immediately comes true in a sound quality that is next to none. Alexa does that. She answers questions, responds to compliments, adds to your grocery list, continues the conversation and can teach you a little something about everything.

I bought a 2nd Echo just days after receiving the first one. This product isn’t overrated, it’s the standard and you should have one!

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to set up and a breeze to use
reviews.reviewText:
I got this for my wife, first experience with Alexa. Setting it up was very simple and easy with the accompanying app, Amazon has this process simple enough for anyone to do I believe.
The responses and use are quite good, and the whole experience has been pleasantly quick and easy and useful, for the most part. I do not believe that Alexa is quite as responsive as Google Now in some cases but all-in-all for the majority of time it works about as well as the other smart assistants out there.
It looks nice too, blending in well with any decor I think, and isn't very noticeable.
The ability to add 'Skills' is interesting though in some cases they are hit and miss when trying to connect to external devices.
For the rock bottom price of these piece of electronics it's hard to beat, and it works quite well in general. My wife loves the games you can play with it, like the music ones.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great for my parents and family! We bought 2 for the home.
reviews.reviewText: Gifted two of these to my parents for Christmas and what a hit! Definitely don't need the bigger one IMO. Bought with Hue lights, an Alexa wall plug, and a universal remote for the TV. Sure it's got some issues here and there like not understanding, hearing the wrong thing, or speaking when not spoken to, but I still give it 4 stars. My main complaint is the app and way you link other apps is not intuitive. There are skills and accounts and alternate apps to download versus what comes with Alexa, etc. It was difficult to set up for me, a tech savvy 24 year old, my parents never could have done it on their own. But now that it's set up they love it! Use it to turn on their lights, turn the volume on the TV up, call family members, make announcements, and play games. We also have a lot of fun messing around from a distance, sending good night messages or changing the color of the lights for a laugh.

reviews.reviewTitle: If not using for music, stick with 2nd generation Dot
reviews.reviewText:
I use multiple Echo Dots in my condo. I had a Gen 2 dot in my bedroom and living room, and got two new Gen 3 dots - one to replace the living room and another one for the bathroom. The sound quality is improved, and not as tinny as the Gen 2. However the bass is overly pronounced, and a lot of dialog and spoken word comes out a bit muffled and boomy.

My biggest critique however is how slow it is to activate with the wake word. And many times it simply doesn't wake up at all with "Alexa". I've literally had to go over to it and yell "Alexa" multiple times! This is really annoying for home automation (like when you want the lights to come on as you've entered). I think the main culprit is that Amazon reduced the number of microphones from 7 to 4 on the new generation. I wish they hadn't cheapened out where it mattered most! I have 100% wake word activation with the Gen 2 Dots - and would recommend them instead.

I have a whole bunch of Echos throughout the house, and decided to try out the 3rd gen to see what was better. Turns out... a lot!

First, it is noticeably larger than the 2nd gen. It's also noticeably heavier. I love the new design, which is a little bit rounder and the LED light ring is better integrated into the edge. Seamless.

Sound is also noticeably improved with better bass. There is a larger power brick instead of just a simple USB cable, most likely due to larger power requirements of the internal components.

If you're just passing by the 3rd Gen Dot, you probably won't think it's much different... but it truly is. Great job, Amazon. I'm excited to see what you do with the 4th gen after seeing so many great changes from 2nd to 3rd.

My device failed after 5 months and Amazon does not stand behind these devices. They offered to give me a 15% discount to buy another one. When I told the rep that they were on sale for 20% off yesterday and I purchased it for 50% off originally she told me that I could also trade it in to get another 25% off. I had some problems with his device early on and didn't immediately ask for a replacement because I assumed Amazon stood behind there products. It would work again after I unplugged it and it restarted, but then it completely failed and died. On top of that, the link in the order says a replacement may be available for up to one year, which is not true. Google Home has a one year warranty. The 1st and 2nd Gen Alexas have a one year warranty, but the 3rd gen has a 90 day warranty. Ask yourself why Amazon would change the warranty for substantially less time if the device was really an improvement over the 1st and 2nd gen devices. I own several of Alexas, but I certainly won't be buying more.

reviews.reviewTitle: Like the old Echo Dot with surprisingly rich sound quality
reviews.reviewText: The new 3rd gen echo dot packs a surprising amount of quality in a small package for a great price. I definitely recommend it for anyone who liked the functionality of the Echo Dot 2nd gen but felt its speakers were not adequate. As with all Echos, the voice recognition works great with a male voice, but Alexa seems to not really understand women as easily. Still good and entirely usable, but occasionally frustrating for my wife. Also, the fact that you cannot link two accounts to your echo network is frustrating. My account has all the smart home stuff configured, but my wife's has all the music associated to it. I don't see why Amazon is reluctant to allow us to link those accounts when we live at the same address...

We just got our Alexa yesterday, so we’re a bit new. The first thing is that the set up is very easy. Lots of Alexa apps to chose from so I wasn’t sure best one to chose and I don’t have too many smart features so I’m hesitant, at this time, to pay 30$/year for subscription. I’m not impressed with the drop-in. Can’t always hear, sometimes it’s choppy and this is the a feature I REALLY wanted. Also, the cord?? Why no USB port? I feel like the Gen 4 will be fixing these bugs and I’ll have to put another ding in my bank account (probably sooner feather than later). I am looking at the google mini home, too. I would love to be able to add groceries to my Walmart App. Perhaps I will buy one and see which I like better. Hmmmm. Decisions decisions.

reviews.reviewTitle: I love Alexa ❤️ Is like a personal assistant 24/7
reviews.reviewText:
This is my third product that has alexa, first I tried the Amazon Stick, and the alexa app.
And I need to say it I love it.
Alexa makes your house smarter in anyways, you can sync it with your tv, your lights, your spotify,etc.
Makes you spend less time in a lot of thing and makes your life easier just saying Alexa.
Every common task like math, weather, music, lights and even searching things becomes a handsfree things, just using your voice.

I love it and Im waiting echo car to integrate my car with Alexa.

Some downs are that alexa sometimes doesnt hear you while you are playing music.
But the fact that is always there makes me love her. Is like having a personal assistant at home.

AI technology always disappoints, so voice assistants have never excited me much. Whenever I think they might finally be turning the corner, the technology, and most of its advancements, are lost.

The Echo Dot is no exception. The hardware is nice, capable of many things, but greed prevents it's software capabilities from being very useful. It works with a very limited number of smart devices and services, so unless you invest heavily into the Alexa ecosystem, you're mostly stuck with the vastly unneeded services provided by the voice assistant on your phone.

I only gave this a 3rd star because the hardware is nice, and despite being mostly useless, the Echo is still one of the leading smart voice assistants. I've still enjoyed playing with it and I'm hoping the usefulness improves in the future, but as of this moment, the hype is far larger than the usefulness.

I was an early adopter of the Echos and have used Gen 1 (Echo), Gen 2 (Echo & Echo Dot), and now Gen 3 (Echo Dot). I will say that this Gen 3 Echo Dot is a VAST improvement over the Gen 2. I still have some Gen 2 interspersed with my Gen 3s and the sound quality is multiple steps of improvement over Gen 2. I can finally use just one Gen 3 Echo Dot in a room vs having to use (2) Gen 2 in a large living area. The sound quality isn't quite up to where the Echo itself is, but it is very close. Music on the Gen 2 Echo Dot was distorted sounding and very tinny - this is not the case with the Gen 3 Echo Dot. Would highly recommend upgrading if you are considering it. I exchanged a few of my Echo Dot Gen 2s in when Amazon was running the trade-in promotion - seems like they are running such deals every so often to encourage upgrading.

reviews.reviewTitle: Trouble with voice setup, but sounds great
reviews.reviewText:
I have not been able to set up voice recognition with this unit. It gets to the commands it wants you to repeat and then has trouble articulating them. It stutters twice and then closes the interaction. While you don't need this to recognize your voice to use it, it's a bit of a disappointment.

One important thing though because there are a lot of negative reviews on the sound. It sounds really good. It's the size of a hockey puck and I was very impressed with the quality of the sound that came out. For a $25 speaker playing prime music, you'd be hard pressed to find something better. If you are an audiophile, then perhaps you can tell the difference. For just listening to music and interacting with it, it's great.

reviews.reviewTitle: Only good as an alarm clock
reviews.reviewText:
The whole Alexa product is worthless, it cannot answer most of the questions that I ask it, When I ask Google I get an immediate answer. Unfortunately too late to return it.
******DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY*****

My Wemo devices worked great with Echo, even the new Echo Spot. As soon as I plugged in my replacement Dot, every Wemo device stopped working. Dot said the Wemo was offline. It wasn't. It worked fine with my Android phone app. But not with the new Echo Dot. Should have kept the old one. )-:

Numerous small issues.
When you set a timer, it's local to that device. So if you set a timer in the kitchen for, say, cookies or something, then go to another room, that timer will only go off in the kitchen even if you have an echo dot by your computer.
The app is annoying; it needs a "duplicate routine" option for if you need to make multiple similar routines. For example, if you make a routine for "I'm in the den" which turns off all the lights except the ones in the den, and then you want to make an "I'm in the living room," you can't just copy and edit the first one. You have to set it up from scratch, which in my apartment means setting six individual lights to off and one on. Each of those is selected from a menu, then you set options in sub menus, so something that should take less then a minute ends up taking up to ten. Plus if you accidentally hit "back" it drops all progress and starts over. And there's no option to create routines on PC in a browser where it would be more convenient.

The echo dot often doesn't understand what I say. Sometimes I have to repeat commands up to three times.

Alexa never shuffles playlists when I ask her to play music, which is only a minor annoyance but it's still annoying.

There's a ton of potential for this to be awesome in the next generation, but for now it's just okay. The device itself would get another star if the app was better.

I bought 3 of these for around the house just to try them out after seeing other echo devices at my daughter's house and how love them. I can without a doubt money well spent. My younger boys love Alexa and talk to her all the time and she not ever let us down. Speaker is good with voice and music. I put 1 in the garage mainly for the gaurd feature but it is able to play music loud enough that you can listen while working on projects. I will get a couple more when they go back on sale maybe prime days .

I have a full sized Echo and am satisfied with it's performance. So I thought the Dot would be a nice addition for another room.

The pros:
1. The device is attractive and blends into the rooms decor without being an eyesore.
2. For it's size the sound quality was good.

The cons:
1. Sometimes it would respond to the wake up word, but would ignore the command/question and go back to "sleep."
2. Sometimes there were pauses during songs or flash briefings.
3. After less than 5 months the device stopped working. I would give the wake up word and a red ring would appear instead of the blue one and Alexa would respond "I'm sorry I'm having trouble understanding right now. Please try again later."
4. Customer service was polite, but after going through all of the steps with them they determined the Echo Dot would have to be replaced. The warranty was only 90 days, but they would grant a 15% discount.

The bottom line for me is simple. If the product won't even last 5 months, I wouldn't throw good money after bad for another one. The device was never dropped, abused, or had anything spilled on it. I've had batteries last longer. Lol

reviews.reviewTitle: Amazing product with huge variety of tailor-made option to suit you
reviews.reviewText:
I have now gone Alexa all the way! The 3rd edition is an absolutely amazing addition to the Alexa Plus.
It is way better than the original edition because it has a drastic difference with audio quality due to the wrap around improved speaker.
I love the option to be able communicate with different rooms by using the “drop In” option. Also, the set up is extremely easy but does need the WiFi. I have now set up a routine to say “good night” and have my lamp turn off. Or, “Good morning“ which I set up to have my lamp come on at 75%, and give me the days forecast.
Catching up on the special price of $29.99 was an absolute steal. But I have bought 3 and didn’t mind paying full price for one of them.

reviews.reviewTitle: This Gen 3 is hard of hearing... READ UPDATE AT THE END!
reviews.reviewText:
Was excited to get the Gen 3 Echo Dot. Had a Gen 2 and wanted better sound. The Gen 3 delivers more bass and richer sound! However, this Dot seems to be having a hard time understanding us. About half the time, she hears the wake word and I get a blue ring, but as I start talking, she goes black. I literally have to make the room quiet and stand directly in front of it for it to hear me. It is placed exactly as the Gen 2 was, but this Gen 3 seems to be hard of hearing. Disappointed...
UPDATE: My bad... I had a Fire tablet located in the same room. It was picking up my commands also and was replying. The volume was turned down on it so I couldn't hear it. I turned off the hands-free Alexa option on it, now my Gen 3 is working like I expected!!!

I have a home based sewing business that involves client appointments. I had always had problems keeping track of appointments, mainly because most of the time I was not near a calendar or was busy in another room.
Since Alexa moved in, I’m able to have her add appointments to my calendar, all I need to remember is to ask every morning what my day looks like. If I need further assistance, I’ll have her remind me 30 minutes prior to appointment. She does the work of a secretary and has really helped to keep me organized. I have three of them and keep one in the basement where I spend part of the day-one in the kitchen near my main phone and one in the house where I do most of my sewing. I find that the reminder is very helpful also especially when I have something on the stove. In the meantime I have music anytime I want it! How did I live without her?

I bought these because I wanted a few speakers to listen to music, audiobooks, etc. at home. My apartment isn’t terribly big, so three speakers are sufficient. And they work fine as long as you are working with an Alexa-compatible app (Amazon music, audible, etc.), but if you’re streaming from another app (for example, the app I use to download audiobooks from my library), it is confusing and frustrating. I can’t get it to play on all speakers at the same time. Sometimes it will let me change the speaker with relative ease as I move from room to room, but usually it’s a big production. There’s no reason for that-except that it “encourages you to use amazon services. 🙄
And perhaps the most frustrating thing is that Alexa won’t answer troubleshooting questions about her. She tells you to go to the “help” section in the app.

Like millions of others, I love voice assistants and Amazon leads the market with their Echo Dot. The new third generation is a cozy device, mine is black with awesome speakers! Alexa's voice is vibrant as well, all the Alexa Skills I enjoy daily like "Positive Living" and "Big Sky" are rich in sound quality. I also enjoy seeing the "green halo" around the dot letting me know about Alexa notifications,

In our house, we also have the Echo Show Device - it's the best also - we love the visual presentations that come with Alexa Skills like "Ask a Question." Amazon is leading the way for their voice assistants and the developers who create amazing Alexa Skills for us to enjoy!

Buy two Echo Dots - keep one in the guest room!

reviews.reviewTitle: Better Speaker, Worse Microphone Than 2nd Gen.
reviews.reviewText:
The design as far as aesthetics is concerned is an upgrade from the 2nd gen version we have. However the ability to hear commands seems to be a bit of a downgrade. There is now an equalizer, so the sound can be adjusted to your liking.

Alexa's voice now has much more bass. The added bass does enhance music played through the 3rd gen dot. The equalizer option in the app has given me the ability to lower the bass and increase the treble for a clearer voice.

What is becoming more evident is that this 3rd gen does not hear us as well as the 2nd gen version - especially when it is playing music or there is some background noise. This newer version is in the same location as the previous 2nd gen dot, however we have found that we have to be just a little louder when giving commands. This is likely due to the newer version only having 4 microphones as opposed to the 7 on the 2nd gen.

If the 3rd gen had the same ability to hear as the 2nd gen, then it would be the clear winner. Simply put, the new version has a better speaker, but worse microphone setup.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love it, but will probably lead to world domination.
reviews.reviewText: I love my Alexa dot and find myself slowly growing overdependant on it. Alexa takes care of my shopping and to do lists, tells me what the weather is, plays music, and chat with me when I'm bored. I don't think it will be long before I buy myself a second echo device, and then possibly a third. It is this mentality that I feel will lead to Alexa to take over the planet. Still, even though she'll inevitably be our artificially intelligent overlord, at least she's a NICE artificially intelligent overlord, and I'm pretty sure she likes me, so that's a plus. Still, because it the blatant world domination plans I have to dock a star from my rating. I hope she dodoesnt hold it against me.

Gotta love the echo Dot, my daughter gave me one for Christmas and when I saw a second one so cheap decided to buy even tho honestly I probly don’t need two as my house is one floor and not large. But I want to try the white noise at night to see if it would help me sleep. My son gave me some hue light bulbs also and it’s nice to turn the light on before I get into the rooms. Also have tv hooked up to with a smart plug...another gift to turn that on off! Very easy to get the second one synced to the first tho the instructions a little off in that there is no orange light when pairing but it is a lime green. My son hooked the first dot up for me So found myself waiting and waiting for it to turn orange before I realized it was all ready to use! Alexa doesn’t always get the commands right but 98% of the time. I took advantage of the six month payment too which was nice.

The darn thing doesn't understand what I'm saying half the time. I have to use the app to find what I'm looking for most of the time. Sound quality is good. I haven't tried ordering anything on it. I'm very disappointed in the Prime Music. For what I pay for Prime, I feel Amazon Music should be included. I'm very disappointed in that respect. Unless you buy your music or pay for Amazon Music, you're going to be limited to only playing a random selection from an artist or group. You aren't going to be able to find one album and chances are you aren't even going to find the one song you want to hear. The latter is the reason for a 3 star rating. In my opinion, paying $9.99 a month for Prime and if I want to find the songs or album I want to hear, I have to pay an additional $8.99 a month for Amazon Music is just a way for Amazon to soak you for more money.

I had the first generation echo dot and loved it but had to connect it to another Bluetooth speaker for better sound quality. My 14 year old son kept taking it to his room so I got myself the echo in Black Friday and got two dots for my kids. My son (14) and my daughter (9) each got a dot for Christmas and it was and still is their favorite gift. They are easy to set up, very stylish, great sound, and hours of fun. I love the drop in feature, love that I could get a family Spotify account so each of us can listen to whatever we want and have our own playlists, and love that Alexa keeps the kids entertained. My kids have renamed their Alexa’s so they don’t interrupt each other while talking to it. My daughter even listens to music at night and I can just yell down the hall for it to stop playing when my daughter is asleep! I’m very much a fan of Alexa but I do mute the Alexa in our rooms and living room at night because she will randomly say “I didn’t hear that” or other weird things. Since muting, I haven’t had any issues.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not as seamless as hoped, but that’s to be expected
reviews.reviewText:
Was very eager to get these while they were $25, and I’m honestly very glad I didn’t pay full price for them. Don’t get me wrong they’re nice and they get the job done, but I’m constantly having connection problems that I seem to only be able to resolve by unplugging the dot and plugging it back in.

I was very eager to get one for my kitchen for list making and timers, and while the list making is fine, by now I can’t stand the timer. I constantly have to yell her name multiple times because most of the time she can’t hear me over the timer sound, or it gets messed up somehow and the timer cuts our communication off.

It’s also pretty lame you can only have one Spotify account connected for the whole house. It would be so much nicer if each dot could have its own accounts. It treats the household as if it’s meant to have 2 adults and little kids, not catering very well to a house full of teens/young adults with their own personal stuff.

Overall I don’t regret getting them, just wish they worked more seamlessly and were more catering towards households with more than 2 adults. If you aren’t easily frustrated by technology not always listening and you don’t mind only being allowed one profile for apps then there’s not really a reason not to get them.

reviews.reviewTitle: First Time Owning of an Alex Voice Activated Device
reviews.reviewText: The Echo Dot came as a complementary device to my RING Security System. Setup was a breeze and I was able to manage it thru both the web portal and my Android phone. Along with this purchase I also ordered the Lycase cable management holster which (See attached Photo) held the device securely and I was able to plug it into one of my living room outlets which I can call Alexa from any location and it would respond. I am still playing with the features and what I like the most is that I can activate my smart light switches and turn on any TV set I linked up to the Echo. I can also perform this task via my Android phone, remotely, and turn on my home lights and TV's. This is a great security feature which people would think someone is home and yet I can do it from a distance via the android app. I highly recommend this device. Great Buy.

reviews.reviewTitle: If you've been thinking about getting one of these, go for it!
reviews.reviewText:
Easy setup, pretty much brainless. I use it to control my indoor lights and my security cameras. Keep up with weather and traffic conditions. There are a bunch of "skills" you can set up to use with it and Alexa. Example there is a Flash Briefing where you can set up different news sources within the Flash Briefing. Then you just ask Alexa for your Flash Briefing and you'll get an audio update from all the sources that you have set up with it. They are always adding new Skills and commands that you can use with your Echo Dot and Alexa. I've got two of these, one in my living area and one in the bedroom. You can Bluetooth it to a speaker.

When I got my first Dot I actually didn't think I'd use it that much. But within a month I'd bought a second one for my house when I found out how useful they were. Really nice product!

reviews.reviewTitle: Amazing Device, you must have one.
reviews.reviewText: I love the all new Echo Dot, it has a place next to my bed and sings to me nightly. I can ask it to set the alarm and it will. You have to be careful with the mic because Alexa can hear you in another room or even on the other side of the house. A few times when I lost internet connection, Alexa told me she was not feeling well. My first clue that there is something wrong with the internet. Sometimes the answers to the questions can be entertaining. I am sad that you cannot use it to turn on a Fire Stick, but with the Alexa app you can turn on the Fire Stick or Echo Dot with your cell phone. Or even send music to it from the App on the phone, subscription to Amazon Music needed. Sometimes Alexa will start speaking for no reason when the TV is on, I always wonder if it is due to a programmed ad. So if your worried that Alexa will record your conversations, rest assured that it will, even when you are in the other room. There is an on/off button for the mic, but it is just as easy to unplug it if you are worried your conversation will be recorded.

reviews.reviewTitle: I’m in love! Buy it today-you won’t regret!
reviews.reviewText:
I LOVE ALEXA! I’ve never used an in home smart device such as this before and boy, was I missing out. My mom got me this for Christmas and highly recommended it, I didn’t understand why until I started using it! She answers all types of questions, tells jokes, the weather, the news (from your choice of news outlets!), and more!
I love that my amazon music playlists are quick an easily accessible through Alexa as well.
I haven’t used an external speaker as I find the built in speaker fine for me (I’m not an audiophile-just enjoy ambient music or podcasts in the kitchen).
Speaking of podcasts, Alexa can pull up your podcasts in seconds-I love that!!!!
I haven’t even fully explored all of her functions, but the little that I have has already impressed me! You won’t be disappointed with this and this price is a steal for all that Alexa brings to my home!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great little device, especially if your thinking about implementing some home automation.
reviews.reviewText:
Really like the performance and sound quality of this device. I think some people get down on the sound quality but this is a subjective area and for me it works well. I am not reviewing Alexa (separate review) just the dot itself. Seems to be well made and is attractive in a non-intrusive way. I bought 2 when they were offered 2 for $50.00, definitely worth the money. They have gone up since but I believe they are still reasonable at 2 for $60.00 and I do need 2 more.
The one area I have to complain about is something I find fault with on almost all wireless devices. I secure the wireless portion of my home network not just through encryption but also as a first line I MAC filter all devices on it (except the portion set aside as a guest network, call me paranoid). It would really be nice if the label on the bottom of the device included the MAC address so i could plug the entry in directly rather than having to sniff it out.

All I can say is do your homework first to see if they will fit your needs and keep in mind you have to deal with Alexa on the device as well as the Alexa app to set it up.

reviews.reviewTitle: My Favorite Clock in the House
reviews.reviewText:
I recently became a cord-cutter. And while I don't miss cable TV too much, I quickly missed the digital clock in the living room that was on the old cable box. This Echo Dot with clock is a great replacement for that.

My children enjoy asking questions to Alexa and I like listening to SiriusXM channels linked through my online account.

I thought I would like the clock's adaptive brightness, but the digits were a bit too dim to read during the day, so now I just use a permanent brightness of 40% and that works great.

This is the fifth Alexa device that I've purchased, and I'm just as happy with this one as I am with the others. Five stars!!!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Good purchase.....love it...even though it is like a kid...
reviews.reviewText:
Yes, Alexa to me is like having a small kid because sometimes I have to yell at it so that it could stop or to listen to me. I think Alexa has flaws like if you ask "Do you work for the CIA?" Alexa does listen but it will shutdown without responding, there are several questions that she does that.
I love the idea of having all my smart devices from home on one app, well i still have the other apps, but Alexa app can control all other devices. I like it because I can just instruct it to turn off a light or on, I also like Alexa because I just add items to my shopping list while I am cooking. I do recommend this device....I would love Alexa to partner with Google, that way you can have a superb search engine, currently Alexa uses Bing.

reviews.reviewTitle: Greatly improved Dot, horrible power adapter!
reviews.reviewText: Love it!! The sound has been improved considerably, I can now use it without pairing to a different speaker. Works better with the sleep sounds I use every night to relax. The reason I am giving it 4 stars is because of the horrible chord and power adapter. With my Echo Dot 2nd generation, everything fits in a case I bought for it (Dot and adapter and chord). I bought a case for this 3rd generation, which fits the Dot perfectly, but there is absolutely no way this impractical and huge power adapter will fit inside, hope this detail is corrected as now I am stuck with a very nice case that cannot carry everything.

reviews.reviewTitle: She can be sensitive to listening but great for daily interactions
reviews.reviewText: We are really enjoying our Alexa but wish we could call her a different name and also that she listens a bit better. For an AI she does have a lot of limitations but we notice Amazon is increasing this all the time. She can’t answer some of the more basic questions you think she would be able to sometimes. She also seems to not hear us time to time even when we are in the same room as her. Overall, we enjoy her for music mainly which is a bummer that Amazon pushes so hard to do their music subscription and limit a lot of music even for children. She does have lots of recipe options and can even find specific ones you already have in mind if you say the right things. Overall our family still likes The echo and think it was a good purchase choice.

Lovin' my new Echo Dot. Haven't even begun to figure out everything it can do, but what I have found so far has been great. I like the easy access to information when I'm not actually at the computer. It has many, many apps for a variety of interactive and fun games. It has also become my alarm clock, weather and flash news report, as well as a way to call my folks when my cell phone died. I highly recommend the Echo Dot for help with reminders, lists, finding new information, and just plain fun. I was truly skeptical about whether or not I'd actually enjoy something like this, but because you can pick and choose how you want to use it and what you specifically like, I'm sold. Even ordered a smart plug to go along with it.

reviews.reviewTitle: No Top end. An attempt to create something wonderful.
reviews.reviewText:
An attempt to create a small speaker with good sound. Unfortunately if you are into at least a basic decent sound, this product fails. It's just a lot louder than the older generation of Echo Dot's. Quality of sound...nope.

The "sound" is an attempt to create a larger sound but, the sound is compressed flat and an awful basic bassey sound. Maybe it's Amazon's attempt at streaming at 32 Kbp/s ? That's what it sounds like....

Stereo pairing is a joke along with trying to integrate with the older Echo Dot's. It was painfully difficult to pair or even set up. The delay when using the app to skip an Amazon track is ridiculously slow..to connect with all speakers is bloody awful. You are much better off with Apple's Airplay system even with the outdated Airport Express's.

If you want to use this system, please use it in the bathroom when you are having a shower. That's about it.

I'm sending it back. Not even worth integrating with Amazon's Eco' Echo system. The older speakers are clearer and are a lot more responsive. Very disappointed.

reviews.reviewTitle: Didn't know i needed this until I got it
reviews.reviewText: I stepped up my Christmas light game this year and decided I wanted to be able to control different lights are inflatables and not have to manually unplug them. So I decided I would get some smart plugs and when I went down that rabbit hole I wanted to add an Echo to control them. Really I've been looking for an excuse to buy one since they came out and this was it. Setting up the echo was relatively easy as was adding devices to it. After setting it up I left some post it notes to my wife telling her some things to ask it. I received a text at work telling me how much she loved it. I guess it's a hit

It's good when you have one. It plays music well and controls your smart devices. There's a few hiccups here and there, but overall, it's good. If I still had the one Echo, this would probably be a 5 star review. The problem came in when I added 2 more Echos around the house.
It gets bad when you have them in multiple places around the house. Getting music to play consistently on the multi-room groups is an exercise in frustration. The music will stop playing on one or more of the echos intermittently. Sometimes it comes back on, sometimes it doesn't. Sometimes you try to tell Alexa to play the music on a group, and it will just play on the Echo you're talking to. There doesn't seem to be any rhyme or reason to this problem. I normally use Amazon Music. I also have the Plex skill installed, which is a total nightmare, but that may not be Amazon's problem, so I won't discount any stars for that. Bottom line, if you're buying this for whole house music, I would look elsewhere. This just isn't a stable platform for that. If you want to turn off lights, go for it.
When these things start flying planes, I'm out.

I bought it hoping for it to have more functionality than my Google Home Mini. Instead of just saying "I don't know how to help you with that" like the Google Home Mini, the Amazon Echo Dot will read long sections of wikipedia pages unrelated to the question asked. After getting an Amazon delivery, the Echo Dot lit up yellow. I asked the Echo Dot many questions about how to remove the yellow light. It was only able to tell me to disable the notification in the app on my phone. After disabling the notification in the phone app, the yellow light remained. After searching online and finding nothing, I repeating asked the Echo Dot to remove the yellow light with different wording until "Remove all notifications" worked. It is unbelievable how precise my words had to be to do this. Why was it not able to help me do this quicker? The Echo Dot's text to speech is also no where near as human sounding as with the Google Home Mini. I would say the Google Home Mini is mildly useful and the Echo Dot is even less useful.

reviews.reviewTitle: I use it more than I thought I would. I have 3 of them.
reviews.reviewText: We live in the basement of our office. We bought the echo's so it was easier to communicate upstairs and down. I use them for more than I thought I would. Mainly lists and reminders, timers and alarms. Music and podcasts. My only gripe is that I need instructions on how to tie them together. If the office echo gives a reminder, I would like it to also say it on the kitchen echo. I'm in my 50's, so my technical abilities are limited, to say the least. I would say, write the instructions like you are talking to a kindergartener, but I'm sure that a kindergartener knows more than me about these things!! Just write the instructions like you're talking to a dinosaur. LOL

Super happy with this product, and we'll probably buy at least one more for another location in our home. Its primary uses (for us) include: acting as a "phone" so my children can reach me or my husband when we are not at home; acting as an intercom when I'm in one location of the house and need to reach the area where our Alexa is kept without shouting across the house (thanks, Alexa, for enabling my laziness!); playing music. I love that I can add as many voices as we have Alexa apps. Meaning, we've trained Alexa to recognize my voice and my husband's since we both have the app on our phones. Our children, however, do not have devices of any kind, and we can't teach her their voices without them having devices with the Alexa app.

Thought this would be a great purchase but found that they are more useless than useful. We purchased the 3rd generation after returned two 2nd generations that did not work well at all. We constantly were unplugging and plugging back in when the Echo would tell us that they weren't able to connect, or how it couldn't understand us. We would ask to play music and it would begin, and say playing such and such music from spotify, then nothing. It would cancel itself... I returned the 2nd generation and purchased the 3rd. Got them all set up and doing really well for the first few months but now we are having the same exact problems. The echo will turn red and it will delete items on our shopping lists... it would respond or stop mid saying something. Also, it will turn on sometimes when nothing else is going on.

reviews.reviewTitle: Wherever you want to go, Alexa can take you there!
reviews.reviewText:
Alexa is great! I can ask her to play jazz. And she does! Then if a jazz musician starts singing, which few do well, I ask her, “Alexa, play instrumental jazz only.” And she does! Just now I asked her to play the Dave Brubeck Quartet. Great stuff! All this from, I think, Amazon music. But I’ve also linked her with SiriusXM. Sirius tells me Alexa can bring me, all I have to do is ask, Howard Stern, talk radio, comedy, and sports in addition to many, many more music channels. But I’m willing to forego all that* and limit my requests to Sirius’s Real Jazz, Watercolors, and Symphony Hall channels. I’m listening to Brubeck on the Echo Dot speaker just now. And it’s just fine, curled up here by my elbow like a cat keeping warm in winter as I type this on my desktop. But should my country-music-loving spouse complain about the “noise,” I can send Brubeck, MJQ, Miles, Stan Getz, Wes Montgomery and their many friends, both rowdy and cool, to my earphones, wired or Bluetooth.
*For now. The possibilities are, apparently, as numerous as habitable planets in the universe. But much easier to get to. Thank you, Alexa!

Everything was fine in the beginning, however after 5 months of light use (playing music) it decided not to work. I ask Alexa to play music. All is well at first, but then about 4 minutes into the music she stops. Sometimes I get 45 minutes before it stops working. It is annoying because it has to start over at new places in the que. I wouldn't have written the review, however, I couldn't find a way to contact Amazon directly. Into the trash it goes.

reviews.reviewTitle: You'll need multiple devices to cover the house (no surprise).
reviews.reviewText: I wound up with 4 Dots, Living room / 2 kids rooms / game room with the phone app counting as a 5th. No more yelling up the stairs that dinner is ready, come down for awhile, etc. Only thing to keep in mind is to name the devices with something very simple so you can use Drop-In without it babbling on and on about not knowing a given name. The utility is excellent. I had considered getting a home intercom, but this served the purpose as well as the net-integration. I haven't tried bridging to my Wemo devices yet, but I'll consider other home automation solutions as we go. By the way... no... Alexa isn't sitting there recording everything you say and reporting to the supreme technology overlords. As a developer I can reassure you we/they are not that sinister or covert and wouldn't let a company get away with it. Relax, enjoy the convenience.

So I bought alexa because I felt a little lazy getting up to turn the fan on while sleeping and turning on the fairy lights that's in a hard to reach place(behind a crib). I'm also currently using her as a speaker for my laptop because one of the speaker is broken. I love the sound that comes out of it! It's a very neat gadget that has so many use to it! I'm also planning to buy an Alexa compatible thermostat and robotic vacuum. I like that one of the review mentioned they used an old bath and body works candle holder.. went to go buy one, but of course they have seasonal things so I picked one with larger holes so that the cord could be inserted. Fits the Alexa third gen perfectly with tiny gaps in between!

reviews.reviewTitle: Keep 2nd generation dot. 3rd generation is garbage
reviews.reviewText:
This new echo is terrible. I had unplug it and just not use it. It always misunderstands commands. It normally randomly starts listening when no one even said the wake word. 2nd generation is better.

Update: after seeing this review amazon reached out to me so they could try to remedy the issues. After troubleshooting, the sent me a replacement refurbished echo dot. This one is still having similar issues as the last one. It's great that amazon is focusing on customer support but it's unfortunate that their product still isn't working right.

reviews.reviewTitle: Requesting music is complicated across devices...
reviews.reviewText:
Signed up for Amazon Music on one Dot. Now, every time we ask our Amazon Show to play the music we OWN in our library, we get a long advertisement for the $14-something family plan. I’m already paying for the ONE device I want it on. But I fear I am going to get nagged any time I want to listen to music on any other Amazon device.

It used to be easier to just play from my library on all devices. Easier before I started PAYING for a “SERVICE.” Go figure.

Maybe there is a magic phrase other Amazon devices understand that would play from my library without hassle of listening to the family plan ad. So far, I do not know what it is.

Ultimately, the user is asked if they want to switch streaming to the different device being used. But it’s a long ad to get there, and you have to endure it every, stinking time...

This is a fun little gagit. My shark vac won't connect to it anymore and my lights go on and off that is connected by the base plugs but the bulbs that I have placed in the lights outside are great and stay on unless I ask alexa to turn them off. When I forget to turn the garage lights on, I open the alexa app on my cell phone and tell alexa to turn on bulb one. (YES never in the dark again trying to open the door) I really like the sound when I ask her to play music. When I have a question, you guested it, I just ask alexa. I like that she finds my cell phone. She turns on my tv and plays a movie if I know the name of it. I like that I can tell her the name of the person I want to call and she calls them. This would actually be great for old people that can't move around. She would keep them company. She will read stories to you. So much fun.

reviews.reviewTitle: SUPER CONVENIENT, easy to use, very capable.
reviews.reviewText: Pretty awesome device, very VERY useful and convenient. Plan to add more smart features to my house now that I see what this is capable of. I use it for my alarm clock because it is very loud, Bluetooth speaker for my fire TV stick, the find my phone feature is awesome. Still haven't figured out how to send and receive messages to other alexa devices but it's well worth the money, the sound quality really surprised me how good it sounds for music as well. Alexa is definitely my little assistant. Would definitely recommend. A tip for anyone who has or is thinking of getting one, make sure to train alexa to your voice an it will recognize you ALOT better. An it is almost completely voice controlled all the way to the volume settings.

reviews.reviewTitle: keep beeping even when mic is turned off; not smart enough
reviews.reviewText:
Cons:
1. There is the short beep sound once in a while. I thought it is waked accidentally by my voice or something. But the beep is still there when mic is manually turned off. It beeps during the night, creepy.
2. Not smart enough. For example, when I say "play a song", it starts playing whatever is left off on spotify. I sometimes listen to a podcast on Spotify, it just continues playing the podcast! Come on, that is not a song!
3. The alexa app is really slow ands stupid. For example, the settings page always return to top when you click return. Also not able to change to a male voice, not able to change the tone or the speed of alexa vioce. Comparing to the google home mini I have at home, this app is a piece of sh*t.. Every click I make somewhere in the app, I have to wait about half a second to a second. (iPhone Xs, latest iOS). Come on, amazon iOS developers, you can do much better than this.
4. some other small things I couldn't remember now.

Pros:
1. skills alexa can learn, like integrate with many news sources, even though it is not many though.

reviews.reviewTitle: Required for stereo sound, too loud?
reviews.reviewText: Got two so I could set them up as a stereo pair. That works but I later got stereo wireless Bluetooth speakers for a lot cheaper that did the same. Compared to the 2nd generation echo dot, these are possibly 3 times louder. The problem is that level one is still too loud when you want to have discreet background music to fall asleep to. I tried setting the sound level to 0.3, and 0.5 but anything but 0 itself sounded as loud as 1. Being louder so much is probably great for parties but generally, I have to set them at 4 so that Alexa doesn't shout back at me her OK. The solution is not to make them quieter, but to have fractions for setting the sound. Also, it would be nice if, for example, at night you whispered, "Alexa stop playing the music", that it would whisper back OK, instead of shouting it and waking the kids you were trying to put to sleep.

We got the original Echo when it was first introduced and it's still working great and sounds fantastic to this day. Once you experience having Alexa in your home, you realize that you want her capabilities in other areas. Our next addition was adding an Echo Dot to the computer room - so great to listen to your favorite genres with a single request. If two devices are good, three are better. I purchased a wifi extender just to be able to use this 3rd device in the basement. Because the area is so much larger and open, I hooked up a bluetooth speaker. Set up was a breeze and now we can have the Alexa experience throughout our home. Amazon has truly changed our experiences... it's incredible. Thanks Amazon!

I bought this wonderful little inexpensive device for my husband as a 20th Anniversary Present. He is 64 and loves music! From June Christy to Jimmy Hendrix! Instead of shuffling through approximately 400 CD's or spending time searching You Tube on his phone...He says Alexa play the Beatles and she responds back to him "Shuffling songs from the Beatles on Amazon Music"! He has a new toy that I don't think he will ever stop loving! She tells him jokes and it is funny! She is one smart cookie! An amazing product! The speaker has volume control which you can request her to turn up or down, or do it yourself manually! The speaker is great quality and can be heard from another room! This was the absolute best gift I have ever given to my husband! Thank you Amazon! Also, you can try Amazon Music for free for 30 days or continue the service for $3.99 a month! Less the $50 bucks a year! How can you go wrong? It was extremely simple to hook up to wi-fi and to blue tooth speakers! I would definitely repurchase for gifts!

Not to overstate, but, I'm not sure how I was able do without the Dot. I'm a writer, and, I'm always looking things up.
In many cases it's pretty easy.
I found out today that if you spell a word you're unsure of, Dot will give me the pronunciation.
I love how I can play any song or any artist from My Music. and, you can ask for the name of the song. Of course, to take full advantage of music features it's good to have the Prime music subscription.
I can play music libraries such as smooth jazz or rock.
Or any radio station, anywhere.
Lastly, I use the timer and the weather functions all the time. I run, so knowing the temperature and coming weather is important.
Get an Echo. You'll love it. And, wonder how you did without it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Divice will barely outlast the 90-day warranty
reviews.reviewText:
Shortly after the 90-day warranty expired the device began to have sound issues. The speaker basically broke down over the next few months and intermittently is completely impossible to listen to due to the scratchy hissy popping noises from the speaker.
Unfortunately since the device is out of warranty I got a shoulder-shrug from support, and they offered a 15% discount on a new device. That sort of offer makes sense if it has been two years of good performance but less than half a year of use out of this thing leaves me disinclined to spend more money on a replacement, discount or no.
Google Home Mini's come with a one year warranty against defects like this and with an identical price point and better speaker, I think it's time I made the switch.

I have had Alexa on my firestick and Kindle Fire, I decided to get the Echo Dot because it was on sale and I wanted something that would be interactive and useful without having to use the TV or Tablet all the time. Echo I noticed has limitations. Firstly, the smart speaker on the Echo Dot doesn't play music, you must buy speakers separately. Secondly, the Echo Dot tends to want to use your phone rather than its own smart speaker for questions as it kept asking me if I wanted to use the device or app, I clicked on the device a few times in the app, then I decided to try the app, it never has asked me to choose since and I haven't been able to find a setting to switch it back. However, for routines, and books, the Echo Dot uses its own speaker unless you have other speakers connected to it or switch the setting to your phone which is easy to locate. I hope in the future that there is more stuff one could add to the routines, the radio selection is highly limited, newsflash is also highly limited, sports news is the same way. But even with such limitations, I find this product useful, and I can see expanding its capabilities in the future which makes the purchase worth it!

I purchased 6 of these units for my family. Amazon shipped each separately, costing me $864.00TTD in shipping expenses, that could have been avoided by simply sending them together. Furthermore, the EchoDot does not connect to YouTube, forcing you to purchase Amazon music. It is unable to play our local radio stations as well!!!! I wish I could return ALL of it because I just wasted my money.

I love the 3rd generation Echo Dit ! I use it through my Harmon Kardon Speakers and music sounds wonderful. You can just ask to hear whatever you want !
I downloaded the Alexa App and now use it to build my grocery list . I don’t forget things because I just tell Alexa to add it to my list which appears on my phone . And you can never forget the list because you always have your phone !I liked it so much that I bought another one for upstairs.
I used Alexa for an alarm in my bedroom. You can create a daily routine with news and weather . You can wake up to music or nature sounds . I also use her for a timer when cooking, and as a reminder to do certain things during the day .I am a person that has to make lists or I will forget but now Alexa does it for me !!!!
I highly recommend this ... It make your life easier and who can’t use that ???

reviews.reviewTitle: All you need in an Amazon Echo.
reviews.reviewText: I have to admit that I have several Echos. I purchased the first generation Echo at half price ($99) when it first came out as a Prime exclusive. I found it to be quite impressive for playing music and several of the other helpful tasks that my family uses it for (News, Math for the kid, homework help, timers, alarms, etc.). Since then, the device has added so many features that we decided to add them to nearly every room. I have a 2nd Gen in the kitchen/family room - the 1st Gen was moved to the basement. I have a Spot next to my bed, and we purchased a dot for my son's room. Now to the heart of the matter: the 3rd Gen Dot I purchased at the irresistible price of $24. I wasn't sure what to do with it, so I placed it in the office. After hearing the sound quality, I was so impressed that I considered switching the Spot out of my room. This thing is all you need in any room of about 15' x 15'. Great sound quality and all the features of the full size Echos. For those who don't know, the Echos can be linked together for whole-home music; they can be used as intercoms between rooms; they can make announcements across the whole system; they can give weather and news reports; they can make phone calls; and they allow you to communicate directly with anyone else who has one anywhere in the world. If you want to try out the technology, look no further than the 3rd Gen Dot. Even at the $30 price point, it's a bargain with the sound improvements over the original Dot, which was a bit weak and tinny.

Wish I never purchased these Alexa devices. I have an Alexa Show and Echo dot. The dot was $49 and the next day went on sale for $29.... They are good for music at my desk and that is about it. Outside the weather, they are rarely useful answering any question I pose. The voice recognition does not work well on either from across a room unless it is perfectly quiet or you are yelling. The reminders are nice once you program. Updates keep turning on things that you turn off. I don’t like that from a privacy standpoint. Not sure if I will throw both away as they are past the return point. I wanted the show to monitor blink cameras. It takes more time for it to show the camera including asking than I could just pick up my phone and look.

Overall, I like the functionality of the device, but Out of the box, my speaker has sporadic static as if the speaker is blown. Sometimes it's clear, sometimes it's sounds like it's raining in the background with music and Alexas voice. It's a known issue with a 3rd generation dots (google it). I've filed a ticket with technical support and they're giving me the run-around that they'll contact me when they have a solution but refuse to give me a credit or replacement under the warranty until they figure it out. I'm very disappointed because Amazon usually is good with returns with items that they sell from other manufacturers, but when its their own product, they'll guve you the run around and fight you when its an obvious flaw with the unit.

I mostly listen to talk radio, and that's working well on this device. I also use it as an alarm and a timer. Thumbs up on those.

HOWEVER, the ambient noise function for sleep is terrible! I actually prefer brown noise, and it starts off great. But then, it shuts off after less than an hour, no matter how long I set it for. Telling it to loop worked once or twice, then never again. I read that telling it to set timer for X amount of hours would work. And it did...ONCE. Last time I used it, it shut off after 20 - 30 minutes, and I told it to reset 8 times! Anyone who sleeps with ambient noise knows that it interrupts sleep if it stops. My research on how to solve that problem showed many other such complaints. So annoying!

Also, Alexa subscribed me to the monthly Amazon Music subscription without my permission. Thank God I caught it soon after it happened. Customer service canceled it and told me how to disable it.

I'd actually give it 3.5 stars for these reasons, but that isn't one of the optiions, so I gave it a 3. Fix the ambient noise option and I will give it 4.5 stars!

Let me start by saying I purchased an Alexa a year or so ago and I have been very happy with as far as quality, voice recognition, and sound. So on prime day when I saw the echo with a smart plug I was excited to give it a try.

First impressions of this little gadget were great I love the sleek look of it and it blends well on my stand. However I’m not at all happy with the rest of it. After messing with it for a while I finally got it to turn my lamp on/off but it was annoying having to say “Alexa turn on/off first plug in bedroom” every time. Finally got it to where it’s “Alexa turn off bedroom light” but still it’s a lot to say every time however I could live with that.

What I can’t stand is for some reason I feel like I have to scream at it just for it to wake up. I’m literally laying a foot from it and I had to ask 4 different times getting louder each time to get it to turn on. I know it’s not as good as the bigger Alexa but still my other one I can talk in a normal voice from another room and it will pick up on my voice but the echo from a less than a foot away can’t seem to hear me at all. My room is very quiet except for a ceiling fan which I hardly hear at night.

Last but not least it has happened 2 times in a week I thought maybe I said something in my sleep and it responded but last night as I was reading it randomly said goodnight. That caught me off guard I spoke nothing before nor did anyone else and for it randomly to do that I was uncomfortable so I unplugged it and had planned on returning.

As far as returning it I’m really upset that there only giving me a refund of 14.00 after only having it a week. Granite I paid 26.00 for it which was half price but really not even gonna refund the full amount that is messed up.

I like the sound better than the Gen2 dots, so I put this big boy in the Den, where I'm more likely to listen to tunes.
Not sure if the microphone performance is equal to the Gen2 dots, but it works well enough for our needs.
The SandStone version kinda matches the Google Home on the same lamp table.. :)
I hope Amazon improves the 'Routines' by adding in some simple operations that will allow users Routines to run logical commands like: IF Sensibo Temperature => 75 THEN TURN ON Sanyo ALSO Say " AC IS ON"..
Or maybe be able to use URLs and GET commands to fletch weather information from an IP home weather station. Of course all this stuff, without having to use IFTTT with Alexa..

I was able to pick up the echo dot at a great price, because my wife subscribes to Amazon Music Unlimited. I got it at basically half price so I picked up multiple dots initially to use as intercoms for my teen kids since they are usually locked in their bedrooms usually deep into some video game. I don’t know why I hesitated so long. The sound quality is great especially for such a small device whether steaming Amazon music or connected by Bluetooth to my iPhone. And I was easily able to integrate all the other smart devices (WiFi enabled led bulbs, smart switches, etc) in my home to one activation source (in reality to multiple activation sources). I’ve created some simple ”routines” like announcing it’s time to wake up and play the current weather report to specific devices or telling my the traffic situation to work. It’s just amazing the things you can do with this device.

Decent little speaker(s). I use one in the bedroom for audiobooks; compatibility with Audible.com is a major advantage. I use two in the kitchen for stereo. Reliable, easy to connect, easy to program. The problem is that the reason why you bought the dot yesterday may not be available tomorrow. Functions seem to come and go at random. Programmers are able to drop functions with no notice or explanation so you are now the "happy" owner of a device that performs half of what you expected when you bought it. I complained once before and the function returned w/o notice. Five weeks later the function has again disappeared w/o notice. Will any of the functions be reliably available in the future? Buyer beware.

Love this device. Didn't really want to purchase because I consider myself "living in the Orchard" with all our  Products. The one thing I find annoying about my Siri is that sometimes I have to pick the phone up to continue and when you're cooking or doing something where your hands are tied up - its just inconvenient. No more - Alexa works seamlessly with my iPhone and I love it!
After visiting a friend who was sick and I don't even know how the conversation began, she asked this little dot to do look up something and "Voila" I was hooked. The sound of music coming from this little thing is amazinggggggggg - I live in a condo and I always wear headphones pretty much or play music through tv. No more - without additional speaker hook up, this little dot plays like the big boys (of course its not surround) but buy some more dots and there you go.
Stop reading this and buy it all ready and to my fellow peeps in the Orchard - go ahead, they'll never know. lol

Stopped playing music from any of my 5 linked accounts. I did a factory reset, linked and unlinked the accounts and the echo Dot still says "I'm having trouble playing music". It's been two weeks and still no fix, I might have to switch to Google 🤷🏽‍♂️. *Update* Customer service called and pointed me to "Technical Support" which then proceeded to troubleshoot and perform everything I had previously done.
