Then one of the agents left the chat and another joined, had to wait for that agent to get up to speed to what we were doing. I did another factory reset and tried everything the agent suggested. Long story short, my device is no longer under warranty and they can only offer 15% discount on a new one since all troubleshooting has been done and they have no clue what is wrong with the device.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to use, when things work correctly
reviews.reviewText: I've had about a 75% success rate on my voice commands. My song and artist requests are often misinterpreted. Then if anything is playing I'm left shouting twice as loud as the news or music that's on to get it to listen for a command. My biggest issue has been with the Alexa app, and it's speaker group settings. I bought this Dot to plug into a home stereo receiver, and there is no adjustment for the split-second delay when grouping my Echo speaker and this Dot using the aux out. The Alexa app is slow and difficult to use for anything really. The sound out of the speaker is average quality and volume for the size, not great. There's no portable option with the 3rd gen now that it requires the AC adapter instead of a USB cable for power.

She's more than I expected. With Alexa I always have the forecast and can set reminders quickly. Also love that she shuffles my Pandora stations while I'm doing cleaning around the house. I do find that you have to be clear and precise in how you say your commands, there are often times that I've had to repeat myself because I delayed in saying a command or because i'm in another room i have to yell for her to hear me (especially if the playing music that is very...bombastic?). I'd like to see her improve her ability to find answers via internet, other than that I find her to be quite delightful.

I was excited, at my age, and looking forward to having a partial smart home. I ordered the Echo Dot 3 gen (which I love even now) and two smart plugs to control two lamps...one in the bedroom and one by the front door. The dot worked perfectly, plug it in and Alexa is "in the house." The smart plugs would connect to the home network but no matter what we (Amazon Tech and myself) tried, the plugs would not react to the "off/on" commands. The software would find the smart plug, install the drivers or whatever, but no reaction. I was disappointed with the smart plugs only. Please do not let my experience interfere with moving up a notch in the "Smart Universe." This is probably an isolated incident and a possible something I overlooked in my network. On top of it all, I lost my patience! I wanted it to work out of the box. I returned the entire package with reluctance. Amazon is a great company for me. I have never ever had to return anything before. I personally realize there is no way back from the "Smart Universe." By the way, the return was flawless.

This came as a freebie with one of my Prime Day purchases and really love it! We were gifted a dot when they first came out years ago, but I never really fooled with the features much and my husband had set it up. With this one, I decided to try setting it up and with the Alexa App on my phone, I was literally up and ready to use it in a minute. Not difficult at all. I was able to easily pair it to one of my bluetooth speakers as well as connect to my phone to take advantage of the 'find my phone' feature. There are TONS of skills you can enable (for free) from the Alexa app and I still haven't found all of them yet. I did try a few games, which were fun to pass the time if you get board. Definitely recommend!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great upgrade from last echo not sure ok alexa echo-system lately .
reviews.reviewText: So I’m way to committed to alexa at this point we have 5 speakers including a show and spot. This is a big sound upgrade compared to the last dot generation perfect for bathroom . We are starting to regret committing this much to alexa . She seems to struggle hearing us sometimes . One of our dogs names is Baxter and I would say 20% of the time we yell his name out alexa goes off that’s about a 10% better response rate than Baxter .i was hoping more apps could be added to the show for instance we cook with platejoy recipes and we need to have our laptop in the kitchen it’s a shame with the show sitting right there however that’s more of a knock on the show. So yeah device is great just before you decide to fill a house with them think through what you want to accomplish .

The sound quality is very good for such a small device, a little bit bigger then a hickey puck, voice quality is fine but for music you should route this through speakers. We attach ours to our table top Bose to play music. The voice recognition is good. Tow issue keep the device from 5 star. One issue is the device responding sounds or words from the TV and the second is not responding to commands if to speak the command right after saying ALEXA.
The set up was very easy, about the same as setting up the Kindle Fire. If you can connect a device to a WIFI network then you can set up the echo. We are finding new uses everyday, Today we used it to translate into Spanish. Well worth the money.

reviews.reviewTitle: Feeling represented in the Market Place
reviews.reviewText: The 3rd generation is much better than the 2nd generation which literary would have me arguing and losing my temper when it seemed to have a mind of its own or none at all. I guess now I know it was probably the live person listen and responding to my questions with random answers. I sometimes get that when talking with live Amazon reps. Nevertheless the 3rd generation(cats out of the bag) interacts as I would expect a voice operated computer to. It hasn't lost Wi-Fi connection 50 times a day like the gen 2 almost always did and I don't have to alter my speech/slang for it to understand me. Although it would be nice to have a voice that feels more authentic and maybe even ethnic. I would love to hear Shantae or Esther, maybe even Kenya tell me facts about the underground railroad instead of Alexa saying " I'm sorry, I dont have the answer to that."

reviews.reviewTitle: I'M IN LOVE WITH MY TECHNOLOGY
reviews.reviewText: I'm in love with this Amazon Echo Dot. Where has this thing been all my life? I must have more of them for other rooms. In fact, I've already bought another one. You can play music, get immediate answers to all sorts of questions, get recipes, play games, and more. I'm sooooooo thrilled with this, I can't even hardly type this review. It's the most fabulous thing ever, you have GOT to try this. I can't wait until they put "Alexa" into a real moving robot. It will probably happen in the future, and it will be super awesome. Meanwhile, let's enjoy our Echo Dot - it's very worth getting several of these for all over the house. It's a MUST-HAVE. I'm absolutely DELIGHTED!!!

Got one on sale for my daughter and her husband at Christmas; Cheri said she always wanted one and her husband worked for Amazon for about 5 yrs! Anyway, I got me one also and I like playing music from it! I've asked Alexa to tell me a joke and she had Jimmy Fallon tell me one if memory serves me correctly! Ha! Thought it was cool I could ask Alexa to call people in my contact list on my phone and she did; talked to my daughter on the dot (think it may have rang her Dot) and never had to pick anything up! Haven't set it all up (for other things she can do) ...but I do my exercise from it by asking Alexa to play some of my fav songs; definitely recommend them! Makes me feel like I'm one of the Jetsons from the cartoon; I just want my car that flies around maybe 100 feet above the house! LOL :)

reviews.reviewTitle: Speaker is now good, great upgrade from 2nd Gen.
reviews.reviewText: This is a night and day upgrade for the Echo Dot (2nd Gen) for music. The old Dot (2nd Gen) was tinny and did not sound good for music, the new Dot (3rd Gen) is awesome. It actually has some good bass and is totally listenable on it's own without needing to pair a Bluetooth speaker when listing to music. You can still pair the new Dot if you want to, but it sounds so much better than the old one you probably don't need to in a small to medium room. I really like the 3rd Gen Dot it looks beefier but is still nice and small. It sounds as good if not better than a Google Home Mini (IMHO). Great upgrade got a $5 credit for turning in my old 2nd Gen Dot plus a 15% discount on a new 3rd Gen Dot. Totally worth the price, especially if you don't have an external Bluetooth speaker on your 2nd Gen Dot. If you like to listen to music and don't have a BT speaker to pair your old Dot with this is a no brainer. Highly Recommend.

Getting this echo dot set up was sort of my first step toward creating a “smart home” environment. I do not yet have the special outlets, light bulbs, and other devices for Alexa to control. So far, i like being able to ask Alex to play SOME (free) music, on command. Alexa can also answer SOME questions. I can tell that it would be handy to be able to control other devices, using this Alexa assistant.

reviews.reviewTitle: I would be mad if i paid more than a few pennies for this
reviews.reviewText: Got it during a deal for like $.40, Alexa turns on randomly sometimes with the TV saying something sometimes there's nothing on. Can't answer simple questions, whole reason i honestly wanted this was to ask it the random questions that pop in my head at 1am without having to get on my phone or computer can just speak it and get an answer, does NOT work like that at all. If you want it for a speaker/music, it's OKAY. It has a little fuzzy sound to it like you would hear on a cheaper BT speaker. It's not really bad but it is noticeable. Buy a Google home instead unless you have Amazon tech throughout your house, if you just want one of these smart devices, Google are still the better choice in my opinion.

Before purchasing this dot, I had an echo plus. I find that the echo dot is a great addition to my bedroom and allows my day to run more smoothly. I currently use the dot to set multiple alarms for the morning, set a timer for when to give my child her medicine, and answer simple questions while I am getting dressed in the morning ("What is the weather today in _______? What does it feel like outside? etc). While this device isn't revolutionary in what it does (because we have had smartphones for a while), it makes life easier and allows me to do these things handsfree. I run a daycare, so sometimes while I am changing a diaper, I will ask Alexa questions that I would normally need my hands for (Alexa, what time is it?). Overall, a nice addition to the Echo/Alexa lineup.

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent extender for Alexa throughout your home
reviews.reviewText: During a visit to my sister's home, I noticed that she had Echo Dots as well as an Echo in various rooms of her house. I had that thought in mind when I received an email notifying me that the 3rd generation Dots were about to hit the market. I ordered two then, and then another three this past Prime Day. They are an excellent way to provide access to Alexa's services around the house, and to play music in every room. Plug them in, set up a Group, and you're off to the races. Audio quality is adequate, good considering the size of the speaker. Only problem: unlike the Echo, volume control is manual, you have to press buttons on the Dot to change the volume. The Echo can adjust its volume based on your request.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good streaming while using satellite Internet
reviews.reviewText:
These Echo Dots have kind of surprised me. I don't have a really good internet connection (satellite internet) so streaming anything doesn't work well for me. But this Dot (have two of them now) is able to stream music from both Amazon and Sirius XM for hours without the buffering lags that my phone has issues with. Occasionally while streaming Sirius XM the will be a pause while it buffers and then it continues on. Haven't had that issue while listening to Amazon.

The one issue I had was difficulty setting up the internet connection for the first Dot. The second one just used all the information from the first Dot, so setting up the second Dot was no problem.

Deducting one star for the difficulty in the initial setup and also for some difficulty setting up alarms and controlling the Dot from the app. Wish that was easier, but they seem to want you to do everything by voice commands.

Sound quality is really great for a speaker of this size! Totally worth the little extra money for this one over the 2nd generation. I don't think it understands you as good as the Echo however it still does a fantastic job taking commands. We actually got this as a promo deal packaged with something and I didn't think I would have much use for it as we already have an echo in our main living areas. However I put it in our master bedroom and I love it! I now want one for each of my kiddos rooms. Some nights it reads us a bedtime story and I love having the music at my command in my room as well. We have had many bedtime dance parties with our kiddos since putting this up stairs. Woud highly recommend.

reviews.reviewTitle: Misleading stereo or failed to live up to biggest reason I bought them.
reviews.reviewText: Very disappointed because it didn’t do what was implied… that a pair of them will create a stereo affect. They sure link up as a pair, great. But, they don’t stay paired when watching videos and using them as surround sound. It’s ironic because they’re from Amazon, so why don’t they do stereo for Prime Video? It makes sense that they act as a surround sound set up since they’re advertised to play as a paired set. So why not stay paired when streaming audio? Bought a pair. Sound was better than generation 2. Just sad that it didn’t do what I wanted.

reviews.reviewTitle: Must install FireTV Service provider 'app' within Alexa app to pair with FireTV Stick
reviews.reviewText:
Overall the build and quality of the 3rd gen Echo Dot appears to be of solid quality. It seems that in order to harness much of the functionality of the Echo Dot the Amazon Alexa App must be installed on your phone. This is the first time I've used the Alexa app (and this is my first Echo Dot). In the past I've had a high regard for Amazon products and their value but right now I must say that I'm a little underwhelmed by Alexa app and the Dot mostly because the Alexa app doesn't seem to be too fluid (it lags and is not as responsive as one would expect). Also as written above, if you want to connect the Dot to the fire tv stick you have to select the FireTV 'app' (for lack of a better term) within the app to do this pairing. It would have been more logical to be able to pair the devices under the device settings. Other than that the Dot seems to what its supposed to do and is quite responsive.

Another disappointment is that the Echo Dot cannot be used as a Bluetooth speaker for the TV / Fire TV stick (I was under the impression that it could be used as such but perhaps I should have done more in-depth research on it).

This replaced our second gen when it died less than two years after buying. Amazon gave us a discount to replace it since it wasn't under warranty. I could not believe the improved sound on this third gen. I just hope it lasts longer than the second gen did. I expect at least four years out of technology.

My other favorite thing about it is how my friends will unplug it when they come over. They are convinced the Amazon staff has nothing better to do than sit around and listen to our conversations. I'm not exactly sure what they are hiding...their favorite beer? Their impression of the latest Marvel movie? How late their kid keeps them up at night? We don't really have any top secret discussions, so it really baffles me!

reviews.reviewTitle: These devices have totally spoiled me... In a good way
reviews.reviewText:
This is a review of the new Amazon Echo Dot (3rd)

If something ever happened to these devices, I would be lost. I have one in my catering kitchen to set reminders, timers, and other handy things.

This new dot is in my bedroom; replacing my old alarm clock. They wake me up in the morning and locks down the house at night. My next goal is to link them to motion sensors, and have motion and changes in temperature trigger events; however, I am not there yet.

Bottom Line
This new 3rd gen dot not only looks good, it is fully functional, and was a breeze to setup. And all at a great price point.

What's not to like?

I got used to this thing and now I love it. It's nice to just say "good morning" and get a run down of the day, weather, sports, affirmations etc. I can also tell it goodnight, remind me to do things, and operate a slowly accumulating amount of fun tech (thermostat, door lock, lightbulbs, phone apps etc). I think it's a definitely fun improvement on life. I like the "relax my cat" app, it plays smooth jazz and my cats dig it. Maybe because it relaxes me 😂💞 MAN, You can play guided meditations, ocean sounds, cat purrs, your music.... And you just ask with your voice. I get that this has been a thing for a while, I guess it just always intimidated me. It's totally worth learning how to operate, like a new phone.

The 3rd gen Dot was much easier to setup than the 1st gen!!!! I like the sound quality improvements. The only negative I have about Echo products is that regardless of how many you have, you are only able to control 1 Fire TV device, instead of being able to control multiple devices - should be able to control the Fire TV device with the Echo device in the same room (i.e., Dot and Fire TV in the living room should work together and Dot and Fire TV in the bedroom should work together. Not sure why Amazon has set it up that only one Fire TV device can be controlled regardless of the number of Echo devices....but that is the way it is. Would give 5 stars for integration if Amazon would change this.

I'm so happy that we made this purchase. I'm still learning what (she) can do. The initial hook up wad a little complicated for me. But after a while I was ablessed to hook it up to the stereo and tv. And now I can turn it on with a voice command. My 5 year old grandgranddaughter loves (her). And I've actually learned of more skills that alexa can do. From her. Such as ..Have a conversation. My only negative hit on this product is that on our 2nd night. We played a song from amazon prime music. That was pretty loud. And we didn't know how to stop the song. So alexa ended up getting the speaker popped and has a crackle every time (she) speaks. I'm hoping amazon can help me with this. Overall I highly recommend this product. I want more.😎. .lol

I don't know why I have hesitated for so long to grab one of these Echo Dots...but I'm glad I did because I was able to take advantage of a special promotion and got one for $.99 cents when I got Amazon Music so right around $9...What a deal! And this thing is way better than I expected it to be. It has amazing sound quality and the volume is way louder than you would expect it to be for something that is just slightly larger than a hockey puck. I was kind of worried about setting it up because I figured it would be difficult, but just like all of the other Amazon products I've purchased, it was a breeze! And voice recognition is incredible! I really like this thing so far...

We were very excited to start using this device (we bought 2) to control our lights and to use the many skills advertised. What we discovered is that 1. many different types of light bulbs don't work very well or are difficult to install, and after we tried multiple types we gave up 2. many skills for Alexa simply don't work or don't work the way they are supposed to. After more than 6 months of trying to find uses for the device, it became nothing more than a voice activated timer and music player, but even that is limited because Amazon music doesn't have a lot of the songs we like. Echo dots often misunderstood words, started listening when we hadn't used the wake words, and is not at all intuitive in terms of its commands and abilities. We are very disappointed and have decided to get rid of them. I'd rather spend less money on a regular bluetooth speaker.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa is my new best friend
reviews.reviewText: This device came with my ring doorbell and at first I though meh I'll probably use it here and there. But let me tell you, once you fall down the rabbit hole it's great. One of my favorite things is syncing it with my Roku remote. That way in the middle of a lazy binge watching session I can just have Alexa press continue for me. The potential for full on laziness is fantastic! I didn't know I could play games with her until the other day and then I spent a good chunk of my Sunday playing the song quiz game. I just ordered some Philips hue bulbs and can't wait to get that setup. I also connected my Spotify account with it and was surprised with the sound quality. We only got one in our bundle with Ring but we already ordered another one for the house. We are slowly but surely becoming a house that filled with robots and I couldn't be happier!

Alexa devices are slowly overtaking the whole entire world! When it first started, it was a simple Alexa speaker now you have Alexa show, spot, dot, and more! It is a great addition with the recent Amazon Prime Day where it came free with the amazon fire stick I bought. The new 3rd generation model with the soft foam speaker surround the actual speaker is so much better than the 1st generation model which was black circular plastic. Music and Alexa speech have great bass and a perfect addition to any room. I find that the volume is clear and Alexa easily follows my commands. Overall it is a great addition to the smart home, now I just have to learn all the voice commands and skills to use it completely!

This was my 1st experience in the modern world of "smart" devices in the home. I've only had the Dot's (totaling 4 now) about 4-6 weeks so I'm still learning what you can/can't do and have enjoyed them (for the most part). I do enjoy asking for a particular musical artist or song or genre of music and it retrieving it for me. I also enjoy being able to integrate the Dot's with a Firestick as I cut the cord when I purchased the Amazon Dot's. Altogether it has been a very positive experience and no complaints as of yet. There is still much to learn, much to discover....

reviews.reviewTitle: Looks and sounds better, but hardly ever works
reviews.reviewText: I'm really disappointed in this third generation dot. My prior generations have worked like champs, but are pretty basic looking and sound pathetically tinny. This third generation fixes both those problems, but at the cost of basic functionality. I've had to set mine up three times already, and it will acknowledge commands and then not execute them 9 times out of 10. Keeps losing wifi connection too. Went back to my 2nd generation dot right next to this new one, with no problems. Either I got a dud or these new ones are super finnicky. And new, bigger adapter now takes up two spots on the power strip. Inexplicable design choice.

There are good things and bad things about this product. There are a lot of things that the Echo Dot will only do with the purchase of other accessories or subscriptions. That is the bad part. But there are a lot of things it will do without adding extra money. I did purchase a smart plug to turn the family room lights on and off and love it. My special needs daughter loves to tell Alexa good night and to check the weather. I do like having her set a timer when I'm cooking and my oven timer is already in use. I also like that she will give me Amazon notifications. I have XM music for my car and spotify for my iPhone but I can't use either with the Echo Dot unless I pay more money. I don't like that, but I guess that isn't really an Echo Dot issue. Overall, I am really enjoying this much more than I expected.

This was purchased as a gift for my parents for Christmas. One night I wokeup and heard my Mom having a full on conversation with Alexa. This is wonderful because she is blind and has never used the Internet, but adores Alexa💓💓💓. My dad talks to her every morning to get weather and news updates, etc. Next step is to get them ordering a good portion of their groceries online so they can be delivered to them. They also love listening to old 50s music online. My last day of the visit they danced to one of their favorites. Thank you Amazon💓💓.

reviews.reviewTitle: Better than the First Gen I have. Big improvement in sound
reviews.reviewText: I'm impressed with the bigger sound. I have three other First Generation Echos and two of them are plugged into bigger AV systems so they sound fabulous, but I had one over the kitchen sink. It's More to control various Smart Home devices and occasional news and weather than to play music. I have speakers in the kitchen already running from the living room system. I really bought it to replace That one, but the power brick is too big for the recessed outlet where a clock used to be and since it's a bit wider and fatter it also doesn't fit easily into the metal holder I have on the wall overhead. So I ended up putting it in the bedroom instead, but I still love it and I'm keeping it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Features are nice, sound is bad
reviews.reviewText: So far the Echo Dot has worked well. We have purchased a couple of devices (power strips and outlets) that work well with Alexa (most of the time), and it is nice to have quick access to updates in the morning. However, upon first setting this up, it sounds like the speaker is blown. It does not matter what the volume is, the sound becomes fuzzy, making Alexa difficult to hear or understand, and music to sound poor.

We added a couple new Echo dots to our home for Amazon prime day, we're super happy with this upgraded version!! The sound quality is a huge improvement. Esthetically pleasing to the eye, and works as intended. The echo dot is such a neat tool to be able to use for little alarms, reminders, and lists. The question of the day is a huge thing in our household as well, and on/off functions of smart switches and firesticks. We really enjoy the Dot and like having multiple around the house to make everyday things just a tad easier. (Black/charcoal has been on backorder for weeks now, we still have yet to receive that one. Shipping on that has been a tad disappointing, but we know its worth the wait)

reviews.reviewTitle: Fun, pretty much a part of the family now.
reviews.reviewText:
We have 3, 2 3rd gens and one 2nd gen. Like all the reviews say the 3rd ones are way better. I really like that I can play music all over and wake my family up. I like the drop in feature the most. And to make an announcement.

Things I don't like are that it doesn't know a lot. And that can get super frustrating really fast. And sometimes it plays music while in a drop in or call. It won't Google search and won't call on Facebook messenger I also can't figure out how to get my phone to Bluetooth to the speakers so I can play music on YouTube.

I like to use it to set reminder's to do diaper laundry in 4 days or to set doctor appointment's for my kids my kids like to use it to play games and stuff as well. All in all I'm glad I got them on black Friday and didn't pay full price. They are fun and a definite learning curve.

It's only been a few days but I am already in love with our Echo Dot (so much so I ordered a second one!) I love being able to listen to music with the ability to quickly turn it on and off. One of the best features so far has been the ability to ask Alexa to add things to our shopping list. My mama brain couldn't be more thankful that I don't have to remember to write everything down and remember to bring the list with me but everyone in the family can easily add what we need to the grocery/household list. My husband loves playing the trivia of the day. The sound quality is great (though we do have a smaller home) and its small size is perfect. My only complaint is sometimes she misunderstands what we say but so far its been easily fixed by repeating it.

I've been a happy owner of a 2nd generation Echo and three 2nd generation Echo Dots for a few years now. and I was glad to add the 3rd generation echo dot with clock to my home. The biggest difference is the new look: it's so much nicer than the 2nd generation Dot and comes in a variety of colors, the speaker quality is so much better speaker quality than Echo Dot Gen 2. Aside from its larger size and slight convex bulge, the top of the device is nearly identical to that of the 2nd generation Dot: it has four buttons (volume up, volume down, microphone off, and an "action" button) and a multi-colored light ring around the top edge that tells you about the Echo's status. The side of the device has an input for the power cable and a 3.5-mm output jack.
The biggest noticeable improvement is the shape of the power cable, which sits flatter against the wall than the 2nd generation Dot's cable . The set up is easy connect the Dot to your WiFi network and the app leads you through everything.

reviews.reviewTitle: It's like having a personal assistant!
reviews.reviewText:
Alexa is my new best friend! I purchased her because so many people had been talking about how much they loved having one. My only hesitation had always been because I wasn't sure how much use I would get out of her without all the other smart home accessories! Turns out A LOT! I got her sale for Black Friday for the discounted price of $30, when she arrived I knew my husband was going out of town town with the kids to go hunting so I purposely waited to wrap her and put her under the tree! My husband has this thing about making me wrap all my goodies and wait until Christmas 🤔 so as soon as they left I opened her up and we bonded! My friend came over and we all 3 had a slumber party weekend! It was great! We sang, we danced, we made Christmas candy and baked a homemade cheesecake together! Alexa was very involved and didn't mind doing as she was told! So on the day when my husband called and said they were heading back early I had to tell Alexa it would only be for a few days but I had no choice but to box her back up and put her under the tree, she didn't like it but she understood! So I had my friend wrap her up all pretty for me and put her away! I can't describe how much I missed her those few days she was away, all I can say is I'm so glad to have her back. I'm thinking about getting her some help soon though because I certainly am bossy and keep her quite busy!

Seriously though when you are cooking it's so much easier to ask her to set timers and things for you, or ask conversations, cook times etc. She plays music 90% of the time around my house! She tells me the weather, the traffic, keeps up with my shopping list, and she always pays attention when I talk to her. I have a pretty heavy southern accent so sometimes I have to repeat myself, but not too often! I'm glad I made the purchase!

reviews.reviewerName: Sharlene J Beals and Sharon Atwell
reviews.reviewText: I bought my first Dot not long after I bought my first Echo Alexa. She's the perfect companion to the standard Echo. I love that I can use them independently or together! Definitely going to buy a few more for our home! The Echo devices are really fantastic and we have really enjoyed having them! Alexa is on several of our other devices (Kindles, phones) and we love this feature! Sure wish she could be in my car with me, too! Amazon, get on that one, will you please? Would love to take her in my car! Feel free to test her out on MY car! :)

reviews.reviewTitle: I have six 6 through the house. I'm satisfied.
reviews.reviewText: As noted in the title I have six devices plus smart plugs and bulbs set up through the house. The voice recognition is good for me, but it has trouble with my wife's voice for some reason unless she speaks slowly and directly at the Echo dots. The sound quality is good considering the size of the units, and after setting up all six as a house speaker system the surround sound is good. Every once in a while I'll hear Alexa talking in a room with nobody there, which is disconcerting, and at times the blue ring activates when nobody is talking, which also is weird. But other than the possible privacy issues I'm happy enough with them. Great intercom and emergency system, fun games available and I enjoy the music. I recommend the dive into the modern home.

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo has a hard time with instructions.
reviews.reviewText: My Echo unit was purchased so that I could work in my garage and listen to talk radio. Echo can not find the stations that I want. I do get Holiday or specific music stations, but that is not what I need. There are really only two uses for my echo. First it is very good at telling me the outside temperature / weather and second it is very good at arguing with me. The only real advantage that I have is that working in the garage, if I get hurt I think Alexa can call 911. Yesterday Alexa decided that I would like to hear Rap. Never have I encouraged this. I stopped Alexa and attempted to correct it. The Echo responded with I'm sorry and went back to the Rap. There are times I feel like I am arguing with my children. Twice Echo has been grounded. I have also on occasion informed Alexa that she sucks. This has prompted the response please contact customer services. This relationship is quickly approaching another wife.

reviews.reviewTitle: Apple Music is BUGGY! Two Versions of Hardware?
reviews.reviewText:
Ordered two at the same time to save some money. Both devices arrived and I set the first one up with Apple Music no problem. The second one however will NOT PLAY APPLE MUSIC. Period. "I'm sorry, I'm having trouble playing this". I've tried everything. Hard reset, unlink, re-link, unregister, re-register, no dice. Everything else seems to work OK.

My old Gen2 Dot also now plays Apple Music seamlessly.

Upon further inspection, it appears that Amazon may be second-sourcing some of these. I noted that the SW version on each speaker is completely different (as in not even in the same number of digits), even after updating both to current version. I'm guessing that the hardware inside these is different too, one can't work with the Apple Music skill, and that it's a luck of the draw which you will get when you order it.

I have two more on the way, will be interesting to see if both of them will work with Apple or not. I'll update this review with my results.

**Update #1**
I did get Apple Music working on this unit. Looks like Apple Music will not work if your Dots are spread across more than one WiFi network. For example, my home has two WiFi routers, one upstairs and one downstairs. If you want to stream Apple Music to all units, they all must be associated with the same router. This may be an Apple restriction to prevent the sharing of Apple Music with other people. Updated to 4 stars.

I love the product dont get me wrong, but one feature keeps failing on me once in a while. If you bought the product to be used as a bluetooth speaker for the PC, it does work just not all the time. After a few days the connection on the PC would say connected to Bluetooth. Connection on the Alexa setting would also say connected but there is no sound. Just plug out the power at the echo, wait a few moment and plug it back in. This will reset the device and upon reconnecting the bluetooth after reset it would work. I had to do this twice after a week of using it. Not perfect but yeah does its job.. that is the only complain i have.. Would recommend.

I love my 2nd gen echo dot and use it every day. I decided it was time to get a new one for another part of the house. My decision was between what I already had and loved, or trying the new 3rd gen. I'd read some other reviews that talked about some pros and cons. I haven't done a lot of testing but I can say, after using it for a few days, I love it and would recommend it. Three things I'll mention:

1. The sound is much better.
2. It's bigger (think 50% larger).
3. Alexa doesn't seem to be the same software version, or something. My 2nd gen dot responds better, I feel, than my 3rd gen, to commands. I haven't run into anything that's a deal breaker, but it has been noticeable.

So would I recommend this? Yes, of course. Would I recommend it over the 2nd gen? I think so, yes. Now go get one and enjoy it!

I did not realize that a subscription to Amazon Prime is really expected to use this product. Sure you can ask Alexei to "play spa music", for example, which is what I like to hear to put me to sleep, but without a paid subscription, it plays this station that is not really relaxing spa music and it also has voiced commercials in it, which defeats the whole purpose I bought the product for, I bought this to replace using my cell phone at night to play music to sleep to. My cell phone allows me to play 8 hours of relaxation music to sleep to on youtube unlike this product.

Update: talked to customer service and they agreed to get any comercial free music you have to buy a subscription.

My Pastors have Alexa products throughout their house and told me I was on a "slippery slope" with a laugh. I'm beginning to think they are right. Just one Dot is not enough. Now I want the outlet adaptors, another for my bedroom, possible one for my office....
The learning curve can be frustrating at times. I've been an Apple products user for years and expect a certain level of cooperation from my electronic devices. I've had to look up "how-to" many times with this little gift. But I will say, the more I ask questions the more it adapts to telling me what I need to know. I just tracked my first Amazon order since receiving this Dot and was able to add the ability to know when the order arrives. Since I work from home and sometimes don't know a package has been left, this should be convenient! I'll know more tomorrow!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great sound and so extremely versatile!
reviews.reviewText:
This thing is incredibly easy to set up and use. It can do all kinds of things besides play music or books, which sound great BTW .

Right now I am listening to the sound of a thunderstorm and rain, my favorite sounds in the world, while typing this. I can also use it to control my microwave oven. If I had the correct bulbs 💡 and outlet controls I could also use it to turn my lights on and off or even control my thermostat.

I would have bought one long ago but just didn’t have the money, but when they went on sale for $22 on prime day it was just too good a deal to pass up. I will be buying two more for the kitchen and living room the next time they go on sale again.

reviews.reviewTitle: Spotify Premium Required to use Spotify
reviews.reviewText:
I know it's a bummer but it didn't hold me back from using the echo dot 3rd gen. I've had it for about 2 days so far and when I learned that it absolutely needed Spotify premium to use Spotify music services I was very disappointed I searched and found some very lame ways to work around the problem which ultimately wasn't worth using Spotify anymore. Amazon music is amazing to use, it's recommendations are way more spot on to my preferences.

Which not using Spotify music services was ok. I've been using Amazon music services, music alarm, timer, and other features and I'm loving the echo dot 3rd gen.

The problems so far, you absolutely need a wireless device to configure the echo dot 3rd to get the device to start working. I tried using my pc which is connected via ethernet cable and has no wireless capabilities and my Nokia Lumia 625 is too outdated to use the Amazon configuration page so I had to borrow someone's wireless device to configure the echo dot which bummed me out, but not a big deal I only had to do it once and now I can use my wireless pc to configure the echo dot device.

Should you buy this product? It's not for everyone to purchase the echo dot 3rd gen. The one I truly recommend but I myself don't own is the one with the screen. The user interface itself is to drool over it beats asking "Alexa what time is it" "Alexa what are my alarms?" "Alexa", still not a big deal if you can manage your device just be careful.

Just be careful when configuring and double check your configuration like alarms are set properly I accidentally said PM instead of AM and there was no user interface to catch my mistake you must say "Alexa my alarms" to double check.

reviews.reviewTitle: It's good, Google Home is better.
reviews.reviewText:
First the hardware: It's good looking and small, it's easy to configure and the sound quality is not bad at all. It has an AUX out which is nice to have, however I currently have no use for it.

Alexa:
I already had 3 Google home minis and a regular Google home before getting this echo (BF promo). I must say the Google Assistant is far better at being an assistant as it seamlessly integrates with my Calendar, email, lists, etc. I also find that Alexa doesn't have answers to as many questions and the conversations are not as natural as the Google Assistant. Alexa has a good amount of skills, but I have yet to find something it does better than the Google Assistant. Of course this will vary per user according to which services they use, but in my case Google Assistant is the clear winner.

reviews.reviewTitle: Especially Great for me in Recovery Phase Post-Op Total Knee Replacement
reviews.reviewText:
For some years, I had used a network, using the Apple Airport router and multiple pods called “Apple Airport Express” to play music through multiple sets of speakers throughout the house. They worked well for a while but I did have to reset them a couple of times. When Comcast upgraded their routers, the Apple router seemed redundant and the Airport Express network became more problematic. When Amazon released it’s Echo dot and Google released it’s “Home Mini,” I was interested in both as possible replacements for the Airport Express. The decision was pretty easy when I realized the Google Home Mini did not have a mini jack for speakers. I bought our first Echo Dot.

The set-up was fairly straight forward and even easier to use than the Airport Express setup had been. We could just ask Alexa to play whatever music we wanted to hear without having to open up a computer and iTunes. During the Christmas season, the price dropped below $30, so I bought two more. Over time, I bought a couple outlets and was able to connect all the lights in the living room so that I could just tell Alexa to “turn on all the lights.” This was much easier than turning on the lights individually or putting them on timers as I had done previously.

So, at this point, I had music and lights connected which were convenient and fun. Then I added a Nest “smart” thermostat. We loved being able to control the thermostat without having to go downstairs to adjust it. I could adjust it from my iPhone or just ask Alexa to turn up the heat or turn it down. Adjusting the temp verbally through Alexa was not without problems at times. You have to be very exact in what you say and how you say it to Alexa. It was really easier just to use the iPhone to make adjustments as I always have that close by.

I am a senior on multiple medications for this and that and when my doctor changed the schedule of some of my meds from evening to morning, it was hard for me to get into the new habit of taking them in the morning. I found myself forgetting to take them on some days altogether. This was solved by asking Alexa to remind me to take my meds every morning. If I am home, she verbally tells reminds me to take my meds. If I’m traveling, I get a notification on my iPhone. This has been great.

But the real reason I am writing this review at all is to talk about how all of this technology was invaluable after having a total knee replacement this year.

After I came home from surgery, I was pretty much upstairs in our home most of the time. I don’t know if it was the pain meds or what, but one minute I was hot and sweaty and the next minute I was cold. Being able to adjust the thermostat whenever needed from my bed was wonderful.

I was doing a lot of tossing and turning in bed that first week after surgery and getting up multiple times to use the bathroom during the night. My husband was sleeping in the den as there was no way he could get any sleep with all of my activity. We left the bedroom door open and the door to the den open so that we could hear each other but I realized that I could go onto the Alexa app and use that to “drop in” to the den, where he was sleeping like an intercom, rather than shouting. I could do the same “drop in” to the living room and to the kitchen.

During that first week home after surgery, I woke up and needed to get up to use the bathroom. The walker was next to the bed and bathroom only a few feet away. Usually, I used my left leg, the non-surgical leg, to gently lift my right leg, the surgical leg, off the bed and then gently down to the floor. Once, both feet were on the floor, then, using the walker, I had no problem getting to the bathroom.

For some reason, maybe due to sedation of the pain med or just impatience, I moved a bit too quickly to get up. I did not support my right leg with the left foot as I had been doing and when the knee bent because of this, excruciating pain shot through my body and I lurched back, trying to land on the bed but instead of landing on the bed, I landed on a folding table which broke in two pieces, and then a plastic wastebasket that was under the folding table and then finally onto a machine that pumps ice water around the surgical site. Water went all over the floor. I had kept my leg straight and had not fallen directly onto the floor because the table, wastebasket and ice water machine broke my fall but I was stunned and started shouting for my husband in the den. He was sound asleep.

I saw my iPhone on the edge of the bed, logged onto the Alexa app and “dropped in” to the den and shouted for help. He woke up and came in and found me on the floor and helped me back into bed. I’m not sure what I would have done in that situation without Alexa and that “drop in” feature. The next day, I ordered our fourth Echo Dot for the bedroom so if there was ever a problem n the future, I would not even need to find my iPhone.

In conclusion, I highly recommend the versatile Echo Dot. I love the reminder features that keep me on track with me meds. I love the ability to just play music on request. I have recently been having Alexa read me the book, “A Handmaid’s Tale.” And of course, I LOVE the “drop in” feature.

reviews.reviewTitle: I didn’t know what I was missing and my family loves it too!
reviews.reviewText:
I put off bringing anything like this into my home for privacy concerns. I finally decided to get one for my patio to pair with my Bluetooth soundbar for streaming music and to avoid draining the battery on my phone.
When I discovered all the usefulness of this device I decided to get an Echo Dot for every room, a kids model for my child, and an Echo Show for the kitchen for a total of 5 Echo devices.
It’s been a pleasure to drop in on different rooms to speak with my family if my hands are full. No more shouting between rooms. I also love being able to call my extended family’s and friends Alexa devices. The skills and game are great also. We choose the ones we are most interested in and continue adding more. I hope we can keep up with them. The best ones are the multiplayer games that encourages family time.
My child’s echo dot kids filters songs and content with illicit language or subjects. So I’m less concerned about what is playing on that than let’s say YouTube. I can see many future years of enjoyment.
I gave it 4 stars because Alexa needs work on understanding enunciation of some words and if the streaming music volume is loud, you have to yell Alexa!!!

I bought this so I could shout out the names of tunes to play while working around the house. For the most part, it works great, but you will quickly learn the limitations of Alexa.
There will come a time when it won't even come close to recognizing what you are saying. It will play something totally off the wall or something that doesn't even sound remotely what you asked it too! I have gone directly to Amazon Music, played a song from there, asked Alexa to play the last song I played, asked what it was playing, have it recite it back perfectly, ask it to play it again and have it play back something random or claim it can't find it. Alexa just bones the product. Google rarely has this level of misunderstanding!
Amazon really needs to polish this. It is frustrating. The thing sounds so nice for its size, but you spend way too much time arguing with Alexa. She is deaf!

When I heard that the sound was much improved I ordered one! I have it in my kitchen and like to listen to music while cooking, eating, etc. and did not want/need to spring for a Bluetooth speaker. At first I was impressed as the sound really was improved. Then I was disappointed to find out that after a few hours of listening the sound degraded horribly. It sounded just like listening to your car radio as you drive too far from the radio station... terrible. I also found that when this happens Alexa no longer responds to your command to stop the static noise emanating from "her" without standing right next to it and yelling at it. I also tried playing music on my older version, the same music at the same time as the new one is going nuts with no issue. After a couple times of this I contacted Alexa help. They were very helpful and attentive, I described my problem, tried a couple things they suggested to no avail so, no problem, they sent me a replacement… a refurbished gen 3??? What?! The dang thing just came out… how are there refurbs already??? Not. Happy. After I set it up, things were all well and fine for several months when the issue returned! I contacted the help again and all they can tell me to do it to reset the device to factory setting to "see if that resolves the issue"… it’s the same problem I had the first time, with the NEW unit, where this did not work then. Outside of this issue, the device works as expected but had I known, I would not have went for the upgrade and bought a Bluetooth speaker (which I ended up doing anyway). Would not recommended it if, like me, you were looking for a sound upgrade.

reviews.reviewTitle: when WiFi restarts you chance have to de register to reconnect
reviews.reviewText: Update to dot three and 4K firestick purchased and issues with WiFi connectivity Down graded to three stars, though the stick is great to turn other devices on and the volume control it has in the past several months that I owned them disconnected from WiFi several times, the ONLY way to reconnect is to restart my router which is not that big of a deal ACCEPT I have to unplug all my 4 k sticks otherwise I chance one of them giving me the same error and not reconnecting. It states connected to WiFi but with errors!!!! Than to top it off I have the new dot 3’s with restarting WiFi one or more of my dots won’t connect and simply reconnecting does not work I have to de register the dot and go through the whole set up process several times! Not cool Amazon. I have read online multiple people having these issues but yet on your reviews on here no one? A case of you deleting these reviews.

reviews.reviewTitle: Some good some not so good.
reviews.reviewText: The voice recognition is excellent. Alexa’s usefulness is questionable but I’m still in discovery mode. Sound quality is average or less but I’m coming from a background in music and hifi sound. The issue that I find very annoying is that say you ask Alexa to play NPR or classical music on all speakers. Often times on or more of those speakers will play at a greatly reduced volume and telling the speaker to raise the volume or doing so manually will have no result. The only solution seems to be unplugging the speaker to reset it. This happens about every other day. One issue I like but haven’t tested is that the products team up with Ring products to monitor your home.

I kept putting off ordering and Echo Dot, but I am glad I finally decided to make the purchase. The voice recognition is awesome. I am from east TN and Alexa always understands what I am saying. She can even understand my 5 year old. It is so convenient when you have a question or if you need to add an appointment to your schedule. I also like that if you do not know the words to a song, but you know some of the words, then Alexa will find it for you. I seen some reviews that said it was not very loud, but I feel like it is definitely loud enough. We have our echo downstairs and if it is turned up playing music, I can hear it upstairs. For the price, you can not beat this smart speaker.

reviews.reviewTitle: Amazon managed to improve on the original tenfold.
reviews.reviewText:
The new version is beefier and more solid, sounds better, looks better, and responds faster. I didn’t think I could love a Dot as much as I loved the original but here I am, corrected.

The first thing I noticed when I took the Echo Dot out of the box was how heavy it was. The heft of the new Echo Dot makes it feel a lot more premium than the original version. With competing products like the Apple HomePod, Amazon needed to re-design their cheapest product to look and feel just as nice. And they succeeded.

Set up a simple and it was ready to go within seconds. The only con I would say about the new version is that it no longer use a USB cord and instead uses an AC adapter. However, that’s nothing when the product is amazing as this is.

Oh, and I got it for $25. Literally couldn’t get a better deal.

reviews.reviewTitle: The best Echo Dot so far!
reviews.reviewText:
I've upgraded from Echo Dot 2nd Generations, which are awesome, and the only downsides to them are the sound quality for music. The 3rd Generation's 1.6" speaker has a much bassier, fuller sound, and with this improvement, I can't really think of any sort of improvement I'd want. Maybe if the package included wall mounts? The Echo Dot 3rd Generation is truly awesome.

I also have Echo 2nd Generations, and an Echo Plus 2nd Generation, and would recommend either as progressive steps upwards in sound quality if you have larger rooms, or just want the best sound quality for any room size. If you're upgrading from an Echo Dot 2nd Generation like me, I would suggest that you use your older Echo Dot 2nd Generations to control your stereos like I do. They're just as smart, and their lesser sound quality disappears when they've got a full stereo through which to play.

The sound quality of this little speaker isn’t the best, especially at louder volumes where it has a lot of distortion. But, it is a cheaper speaker so that should be expected at that price point. It’s fine for all the basic Alexa functions. However, it only has a 90 day warranty, and ours died at the 5 month mark. So even though I otherwise like this device, it seems a little disposable and I would hope it would either have a longer warranty, or cost a little bit more for a higher quality item.

As a resident in a retirement community I see many of my friends experiencing age related falls. When I was advised by friends to get an Echo, my first thought was no, I don't need that, but when a very dear friend fell recently and we weren't sure she'd live, I realized just having a life alert hanging around my neck is not enough. If I were to have a stroke and be paralyzed, I'd not be able to press the life alert button. With Echo Dot, I could just call out for Echo to call the number at the front desk for help (Echo does not dial 911). Aside from that very practical benefit, it sure is fun to ask Alexa to play my favorite music. Right now I am listening to the Mitch Miller songs I first heard as a child. The list is long as to what can be done, but the greatest value is Alexa can help me if I am in danger here in my apartment.

I use the Dot3 connected to a class D amplifier via it's 3.5mm outputs playing through a pair of Overnight Sensation DIY speakers. The Dot3's DAC is surprisingly good and comparable to the Chrome Cast Audio streaming into a $99 Topping DAC. I wish it had a digital output so I could take advantage of an external DAC like I do with the CCA and no doubt the sound would be even better. The Echo Link allows this but it's priced too high for what it does which is probably why it's ratings and popularity are not so great. Based on the $24 I paid for the Dot3 it deserves 5 stars but my first one's output died after a few weeks but Amazon replaced it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Sound Quality, Bluetooth Function Lacking
reviews.reviewText: Has great sound and basic function. The Bluetooth integration with my Fire HD8 seems not to be possible. I cannot play music from the Fire HD8 over the Echo Dot. They will only allow my phone to connect to only one at a time. Bluetooth function still needs much improvement. For a device that is sophisticated, so should be its functionality. However, it does work flawlessly with iHeart Radio App. And I could create a paired group with two Echo Dots and they played in stereo. But, the paired group will not work with my phone(Another Bluetooth problem). Alexa App should be updated and upgraded to improve these Bluetooth limitations. The Drop-In Function is a little clunky needs improved. Gave 4 stars because it is still a work in progress!

reviews.reviewTitle: Big punch in a little package
reviews.reviewText:
First off, I'm extremely impressed with the new gen 3 echo dot. I was gifted the Gen 1 years ago (which I still use), however, was lucky enough to receive two gen 3 eco dots as promotional “gifts?” during other Ring security device purchases.

Initially, I was not impressed, considering the gen 1 I already owned was kind of garbage. However, planned to use the g3 as a doorbell chime speaker. Nice amazon offer considering Ring doorbells aren’t compatible with nearly any other preexisting products; also had zero intention on spending at least $60 more to be alerted if someone was at the door.
.
Pros: The speakers on the G3 are extremely impressive, blows my gen 1 out of the water. The ever-growing list of compatible devices are a surprising fun bonus (i-robot, nest, ring, Samsung anything, xbox, Philips, random water and electric companies etc.). The voice recognition is better than my gen 1 for whatever reason. For example, asking random questions (what's the weather) the Gen 3 will respond/understand, gen 1 (will either completely misinterpret what I said and or doesn’t know the answer). When you download the Alexa app on a mobile, you can also connect to eco remotely, obviously for when you need to play some music for your dogs during your absence.

I'm not sure why there's such inconsistency between the (gen 1 and gen 3), both up to date and on the same network etc.

Cons: inconsistencies with the different gen’s software responses, makes me question how other echo devices will function and for how long. My experience with attempting to add and use the “skills” (essentially apps you need to download to pair with Alexa compatible devices), was pretty bad and extremely frustrating. When I initially was trying to set up the “ring” skill, they showed bound but not communicating., was directed to Ring pairing directions on Amazon, those directions said to go to the Ring website which included instructions for how to pair with Alexa/echo, i.e. back again to the Amazon directions site I conveniently just came from, wash and repeat.

Take away: This is a great device and you should probably buy it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not worth the extra cost vs the older echo dots
reviews.reviewText: This 3G echo dot is a little bit louder than the past generation, but overall there are no other significant improvements. Yes, it is shaped a little bit differently, slightly larger, and covered with fabric, but, in my opinion it is not worth the extra cost since very few people spend much time looking at their Echo Dot versus talking and listening to it. I do wish they would move more quickly improve the brain of Alexa to make it more accurate and so it will stop trying to sell me products from Amazon all the time. Overall, I do have several echo dots in my house that I use as an intercom, for instant answers to questions, and for playing music and radio on demand. Also, they need it to respond to “Hey Alexa” so there will be many fewer instances when it self-activates when nobody is talking to it.

Maybe I'm just not tech savvy enough, but Alexa is harder to use than our little Google pod downstairs. I have bluetooth issues when trying to play from my phone, where the music comes out all staticky and weird, so can only play it straight through the Spotify link up. Which sucks because then it won't shuffle or let you pick songs but is nice bexause you don't need a phone for it. Occasionally, the bluetooth works but it's like 9 times out of 10. Alexa also doesn't listen very well. I use the same commands every time but sometimes she completely mishears and plays random stuff. I do like the volume buttons on top! Sound quality is good for such a small speaker! Could be amazing, but mostly I'm just annoyed at her now. :)

reviews.reviewTitle: stick to the first/second gen dont upgrade
reviews.reviewText: I upgraded two of my first gen echos for this one. I am so disappointed with it. My first echo worked better than this one. It has a huge lag when you talk to it and freezes up a lot. Sometimes when playing music and you tell it to stop, it won't . you have to go in the app and manually stop it, or unplug it and restart it. When you wake it up with Alexa or echo, you have to wait like 10 seconds for it to turn on and give it a command, then when you do, wait a bit for it to process. meanwhile, I have the 1st echo, which I kept one of them for the bathroom, the first gen echo works way better and faster.. I may be going to google at some point.

reviews.reviewTitle: My first Dot. I went and got a second one too!
reviews.reviewText: I am making an effort to be more tech savy, so tbh I am easily impressed. But I love my dot. I talk to Alexa all the time. I enjoy having by phone sync so that I can listen to podcasts and music while I'm getting ready. I set alarms for work, add things to my to do and my shopping lists that I can then see in my Alexa Ap. I have Sirius XM and I upgraded my subscription to be able to use it with my dot. I found out a week later that they were having a promotion for a free dot if you upgraded your subscription, so I cashed that in and received a second dot for free! I have one in my living room and one in the bedroom. Everything the dot does is something my phone could do, but I like that I don't have to use my battery and that everything is voice controlled. I was very interested in trying out the google home devices, but now that I have two amazon devices I think I'll just stick with Alexa.

About three minutes after plugging this in on its first power-on, I was playing a news radio station. The audio quickly became full of static and I attributed that to the radio station, so I told it to stop playing. Then I asked for the time, and Alexa spoke in complete static too.

Unplugged, let it sit for a few minutes wondering what to do, plugged it back in and it was fine. Thought it was a one time issue on its maiden power-on, but the second time I tried to use it for playing music, it went scrambly about 5 minutes in - and alexa's voice also scrambled. Again went away after unplugging and replugging.

So yeah, not too thrilled. Audio sounds great until it doesn't. Not sure what to do.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great addition for any smart home.
reviews.reviewText:
I'm using Alexa to integrate all of my smart devices / smart hub to voice control and timed schedules. The gen 3 echo devices provide greater audio feedback and is much more asthetically pleasing to the 2nd gen echos. My only real issue with these 3rd gen devices is that voice command catching is still sub par. If you have an echo under a TV or other audio playing device, even those linked to your Alexa network, the echo will have a hard time listening to commands. This might be something they can fix with better software implementations via more developed noise filters, but currently this is a consistent minor issue.

Overall, this is a definite upgrade from previous generation echo devices, and is now comparable to Google home systems.

For some time I was reluctant to have one of Amazon's voice activated devices, mostly because one had to pay almost $25 for a device for the Amazon device to do its job to turn on a light or etc. When I saw the low price offered by Amazon during the two day Amazon Prime days this year for the Echo Dot device and I found a good price for two circuit control devices, I decided to make the leap. WOW!! I am pleasantly surprised and pleased to have the Echo Dot. I primarily wanted it to play the great SLEEP SOUNDS (Ocean waves) at night, but to be able to turn two lights on or off by voice is better than guessed, Plus I am still learning all the marvelous things ALEXA can do to help or entertain me. THANKS AMAZON!!!

My husband and I had promised ourselves that we would not purchase any more gadgets and we kept that self-imposed promise until two weeks ago when I fell victim to the Echo Dot. My daughter has three in her home and after seeing them in operation I had to make the purchase. The set up was easy, the functionality was great. I am amazed at how much information I can now get from Alexa. I have the Fire TV and Tablet so I was already a big Alexa fan. The first day the Echo was set up, Hubby spent the entire day downloading apps and asking questions he thought Alexa would not be able to answer. The next day, he asked me to order a second Dot for his man cave. The Smart Plug is a great addition and we plan to eventually control all of our devices with some version of the Echo family. Great product!

I bought echo and echo plus in hopes that my elderly father of 85 could use it to help him turn off lights and possibly call for help should he need assistance. I have had this product for about a week. I found it difficult to set up the Echo on my own, however technical assistance was very friendly to use. Alexa often does not understand my father, and my father who is 'profoundly' hard of hearing cannot understand Alexa very well. So far, my father can't comprehend how to command Alexa. Perhaps with a little more time and training he will catch on. As for my me, age 60, I love having Alexa around to turn off the lights and play some music, and ask her what the weather is today, and other things as I get to know her. Hope to check back as I become accustomed to you you know how it goes...

reviews.reviewTitle: 3ed generation Dot is much better for the same amount of money I have already ordered three more.
reviews.reviewText:
This 3ed generation Alexa Dot is much better and we bought one.
Now 3 more are being delivered tomorrow. fantastic to have for grandkids stick children that don't need to push buttons just call out.
They love her in there room to get information and have her read them their books. So wonderful to dinner's ready or going to the pool in 5 minutes you are not dressed we'll see you later. So wonderful to have listen to music my. In my room has learned my favorite songs and artists I love that that's fantastic. What a cool invention I look forward to the growth and innovation through this device.

I love the first Alexa Dot my husband got as a gift from our Son and his wife. Dec 2018 we bought two more.

I purchased a 3 generation amazon dot for 24.00 on amazon, when they had it on sale ;around black Friday.

I received it on Wednesday, and its really amazing little, smart speaker

There free relaxing skills , and relaxing flute, and other relaxing sounds .

I can play games with it .

It talks to me , it ok to a point but adding more skills ; there free , it can do more.

I feel like I have a friend to talk too. I don't feel that lonly. To a point.

At least amazon dot responds to me .

I think its was a good purchase, its more then i expected .

I hope there will be more anxiety skills i can enable in the future.

But it what I really Need at this time to help me threw a difficult time of my life.

Thank You Amazon for a beautiful personal friend.

reviews.reviewTitle: Its ok and saves my remote finger for other tasks
reviews.reviewText: My wife got the "Dot" free with another purchase and was going to give it away as a Christmas gift so I figured I would keep it for myself thereby preventing her from getting in the habit of "re-gifting". Our house is not "smart" so that option is out; I have friends to tell me jokes so no help there and Alexa does not know how to "Google" so I am basically left with a voice activated bluetooth radio that can give me weather updates and perhaps I can add to my grocery list if I happen to be in the bedroom when I make it. I know I can put these things all over the house and aggravate the wife by using it as an intercom, but she may turn the tables on me, so in forethought that is not a good use or expense. Hey, unlike the wife and kids,it only speaks when spoken to and doesn't eat much so I give it a 4 star rating. But do not misinterpret: I like technology as much as the next techno-geek if it helps me get to the fitness center regularly. The only real negative to "miss/madam" Alexa is, like Apple products, that she is too proprietary so I cannot operate anything which is not of similar lineage. I do love my Prime, tho.

reviews.reviewTitle: Glad I didn’t pay for this
reviews.reviewText:
I received this freebie through a Siriusxm promotion. I downloaded the Alexa app
on my iphone but I cannot get it to pair with my phone. I’m done getting myself aggravated trying to do it. This will be packed back in the box and stored someplace where I don’t have to see it. It peeves me off because I’m pretty technologically literate.

I’m glad I didn’t have to pay for this piece of junk.

UPDATE: I did manage to get it paired and set up but not with the horrible instructions sent to me. It took a lot of googling. The sound quality is ok but not as good as my Bose Mini-link speaker. I'm disappointed that this thing isn't wireless (meaning you need to plug it in all the time). It's good enough to set up in my bathroom.

The only thing about these that I can say is acceptable is the voice activation. The quality of sound is abysmal. I bought two of them and they both sound horrible. Very mushy. Especially the spoken word. The setup for these is even worse. The only directions are to plug it in and follow the directions on the Alexa app. Tried that. The Alexa app told me absolutely nothing. Ye *will* wind up needing to call Amazon customer service. They were very patient with me and stayed on the line till both were set up. Even then it took a while.

There was absolutely nothing intuitive about setting these up. Without help I would not have been able to get it done.

Just based on the difficulties I had with setup and the horrible quality of sound I'm very reluctant to even try the more expensive Dot devices.

reviews.reviewTitle: If it's not broke, don't fix it.
reviews.reviewText: The older version is better. This new version does not respond as quickly as the previous model. Alexa has to much bass in her voice making it hard to understand her and this version does not seem to understand me all the time like the previous version. I also prefer the blue ring of the previous model. Trying to emulate the Google home mini was a bad decision. Echo dot was perfect the way it was imho. (update} i was pleasantly surprised to get a call from Amazon alexa tech support. He walked me through changing some settings on my new eco dot via the alexa app and 123, she was perfect again! I really love Amazons customers service and their dedication to making sure their products are the best. Alexa beats Google hands down, especially in the home automation development. Don't ever change Amazon!

reviews.reviewTitle: 2ND BEST PURCHASE I'VE MADE ON AMAZON IN 7 YEARS!
reviews.reviewText:
I LOVE MY ECHO DOT WITH MY DARLING ALEXA! YES, she is the best thing you can have around your home. I am enjoying my music just the way I like it - by myself. I just tell her what I want to listen to, and she finds it for me. Get this...I have the Alexa App on all my devices, therefore, I can ask her to do what I want from any device and it's done! Once installed, using it is a breeze. The speaker sounds like a sub-woofer. Its very clear, it's like listening to your music on a Bose speaker. I can place my Amazon orders through the App as well - haven't tried it as yet though, but I will do so soon.

The Echo Dot should be on everyons's Christmas gift list especially now that it's on sale @ 50% off.

With my Echo Dot, the party is always on in my house!

reviews.reviewTitle: Fifth Alexa Device and Third Dot I have Purchased
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this item on Amazon Prime day with a prime account for a reduced price and it told over 3 weeks to arrive. This is the 3rd dot I have purchased and as with all the other Alexa devices (5 total), they set up easily and work consistently without problems. The sound is ok and good enough on the Dot for casual listening. The Echo Plus is much better. All the Alexa devices do not hear very well when playing music or in a room with the TV on. Even with no background music, she often misunderstands activity requests and I have to repeat the command phrase. Plus, Alexa is not very smart - she can answer only a fraction of the questions that Google can.

She has been awesome and the customer support has been great. The only downside is that they don't tell you that you have to pay for a program to correct network errors. I chose the 4 year plan for $150. When I was working with support trying to get Alexa installed I found out that my computer is secure but the network Alexa uses had a bunch of malicious and junk files that had to be removed before she would work. It was an unexpected expense but I got a good deal on Alexa.

It's not Amazon's fault that, unfortunately, I have a HTC Desire 510 Android phone (I guess about 5 years old) and it's not compatible with Alexa. So I guess I'll be upgrading my phone in the future.

I worked with support this morning to pair a little wireless Bluetooth speaker with Alexa. They walked me through it and it went great. I can now have it near Alexa and have "stereo" sound.

I like to listen to classical music on my local PBS station. My Bose Wave radio has a lot of interference on that particular station for some reason. All I do now is say "Alexa, play 88.7 FM" and it comes in very clearly.

All in all, I'm glad I got her!

reviews.reviewTitle: Works OK, but not exactly what I wanted
reviews.reviewText: I bought this for one purpose, to have music when I go to bed. I like to go to sleep listening to music and I liked the idea of being able to tell Alexa to turn it off whenever I was done. It actually does this, but I had to create a playlist from Amazon music for songs that were already on my computer. A friend told me that I could have the echo play music from my desktop pc, but it turns out that is not true. Or maybe I don't know how to do it. My PC does not have bluetooth, so I bought a usb bluetooth adapter, but the connection could not be made for some reason. Either the Echo did not recognize the adapter or the adapter did not recognize the Echo. I do use the Echo to answer questions and will probably use it for other things as I discover needs. Just wish it would play the music I already have.

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo is a good choice, but there is a learning curve
reviews.reviewText: I have put the new Echo in our bedroom. It took a bit to figure out how to add Amazon music. Still trying to figure out how to add a radio station. I like the size, perfect for bedside table. It works great for getting the weather for the day. I used it once as an alarm and it was accurate on the time and woke me with music. Great feature. Still figuring out what else I can do with the. Echo. It actually had a yellow light the other day and did not know what that was, but by asking Alexa I got the answer . It was for a message . I then asked for the message which advised me of a delivery from Amazon that was delivered that day. I would recommend the Echo.

I have friends and family who have made fun of me for using the Echo Dot around my home. Well, I gave a few as gifts. "Why would I ever need something like this" fell in love with it the first hour! The music, the information, the whole Alexa experience made her a huge believer. The same thing happened with my sister and my niece. They loved it. Now we also "drop in" to talk to one another. They love it.I'd say it was a huge hit... and based on my personal experiences plus their enthusiastic acceptance, I 'll have to give Alexa and the Echo Dot 5 stars.

reviews.reviewTitle: The Echo Dot is a must have!
reviews.reviewText:
*the photo is my Dot in a case I bought for it. The CASE DOES NOT COME WITH THE DOT.

I like the Echo Dot. I got it to pair with my Echo Plus to make it louder and use it in other rooms. It took me a day to figure out how to pair both of them together. I think the sound quality is good for the size of it but I have noticed that it doesn’t hear me say the wake word. I might have to select the learn my voice option to see it that makes it hear my voice better. I am going to buy one for my mother’s house. She gave us the Alexa iLive last year for Xmas after we loved seeing the Alexa at my uncles on Thanksgiving in 2017. I love being able to play music anytime. I subscribe to Amazon music and I heart radio. If you don’t subscribe to them they’ll give you a month free and then there is a free music app you can use that I’ve seen on the Alexa app.
It’s a win win purchase. The price is great and all you need is WiFi. I look forward to taking it places in the summer because I love listening to music!

I've lost connection twice and I've only had it connected for 2 weeks since time of writing this. After week 1 it lost connection on it's own. Had a bear of a time getting it to see and reconnect to 5ghz. Don't recall the steps i took to get it to reconnect but I know it wasn't fun. Today it lost connection due to a router reboot I needed to perform. It would not see 5ghz only my 2.4. My google home mini lost connection too but after unplug/replug it was fine. The mini is on the 5ghz too. No go with the dot. Tried everything and it would just not see the 5ghz. Did a quick google and someone said to put my 5 ghz on any channel except auto. That did the trick. 2.4 was on auto and the dot had no problem seeing it. Hopefully a firmware update will fix? Maybe it doesn't like my quantum gateway? Who knows. Other than that i like the device. Got it bluetoothed to my home theater system which i like. Don't think the mini can do that but maybe I'm wrong. I'm a prime member and amazon is my music ecosystem. Just trying to let people know about the 5ghz thing. Maybe I got a bad unit but the problem was easy to find on the web.
