Updating My Review...Kudos to Amazon!!!! After posting my initial negative review, a customer service representative called and discussed the issues with me. She offered a full refund and was very nice. So, Amazon came thru and I'm a happy camper. I leave the original text so that others won't make a mistake and try to pair this with a Ring doorbell. Original review text follows: My fault I bought the thing. But, it was sold on Amazon in connection with a Ring video doorbell. So, silly me, I thought they might work together. As in it'd be nice to have Alexa standing by the door so that when somebody came and rang the, I could ask "Who is it?" and conduct a conversation without opening the heavy leaded glass door. But nooooooooo. They don't work together.

Easy install. Attractive. Compact. 3rd Gen! Recognizes my voice while TV is on. Like the LED ring on top. Not great for loud music, but that is no surprise. If you want big sound, but a bigger speaker, or link it to a bigger bluetooth speaker. Very clear and easy to understand. My only complaint is that if you change your wifi password, it's a pain to update that password with the Echo app. Why no easy "Update wifi password" option in the app??!! App is not intuitive, with too many hoops to jump thru for what should be an easy process to update a wifi password.

I upgraded to the 3rd generation Dot from the 2nd generation Dot roughly 6 months ago. My only complaint about the 2nd gen Dot is that it wasn't loud enough. This issue was resolved with the 3rd gen. Initially, I loved it. I thought the sound quality was much better than the 2nd gen. But the love affair soon faded. At first, the sound would randomly start crackling, and sound distorted, like the speaker was blown. But it wasn't consistent, it did this very sporadically. Then, I started to notice a long pause/delay with the Dots responses to my commands. Now, approximately 6 months after purchasing, the sound is consistently fuzzy and unpleasant to listen to 100% of the time. Music is a definite no-go, it's so distorted that it's unbearable. Podcasts are slightly more tolerable, but still pretty bad. I've power cycled, disconnected/reconnected, etc. Nothing has solved the problem. Based on a preliminary Google search, I'm not the only person experiencing this issue, it appears to be a common complaint. I have 2 other echo devices (original and spot) and they work fine, no issues with them. And I never had this issue with the 2nd gen Dot. This is exclusive to the 3rd gen Dot. Overall, I cannot recommend this product.

reviews.reviewTitle: Worth having a few of these in your house
reviews.reviewText: I use mine every day, but I probably wouldn't have bought this without other smart home items. Alexa is neat and has a lot of cool skills, plus you can build your own. I've got my Hues lights connected to it right now, so I can control my lights with voice commands. Right now with IFTTT I also have it setup so that when I leave the lights turn off, and when I come home from work they're on already. I wake up to slowly rising light, and am reminded to get ready for bed by steadily dimming light. When they turn blue I know it's raining and I should go bring my dog inside. When they're bright blue it's snowing, like today! Alexa also plays Twitch audio, Prime music (another subscription, ugh), and can be a regular bluetooth speaker as well. You can usually pick one of these up in a bundle for a steal, I got mine for $1.09 when I tried out Prime Music Unlimited.

Number one: Its beautifully designed. It appears flawless in its seams and construction. It is heavy for its size and feels like true quality when you hold it. The bottom is rubberized so it doesnt slide easily. I purchased 3 and it was easy to pair them in multiple ways throughout the house. I wasnt sure if I would get any use out of these but I was intrigued enough to try. I am glad that I purchased these and get a lot of use out of them. It gives the house a next level feel.

Also, Dont be an idiot like I was when first installing these. I had a lamp that had an outlet at its base, Dot plugged into lamp, lamp plugged into smart outlet. So when i was telling the dot to turn off the lamp, I was essentially telling the dot to turn itself off. Took me way to long to figure out my mistake.

My main complaint is the power plug that is not standard across many devices like the mini-USBs plugs. I can no longer use a shorter or longer cable depending on it's location and situation. I can't use different power sources (one of my older Dots is powered by my X-Box and real short mini-USB cable). The power plug is too big and hogs both outlet plugs. Also, the Dot is bigger than previous models. Better sound from the unit, but I always link to Bluetooth stereo or speakers. So, I end up with a bigger "connection" to my speakers with no benefit. Amazon - PLEASE keep in mind Dots are often used as a means to connect to other devices, and, as such, the less intrusive, the better.

reviews.reviewTitle: Fun, and helpful. Overall I'm loving it. Great for your aging parents
reviews.reviewText: I give nothing 5 stars, nothing is a perfect product, so 4 stars means I totally love it so far. My mother recently got 2 of these, she lives in the tropics and wants to remain there! After my father passed a couple of years ago she's been there by herself. I worry about her on many levels. Even though she'd been around my dots, I must admit I was a bit worried about her acceptance and usage, but by day 5 Alexa was her new bff. By the 2nd week she didn't know how she lived without Alexa and the smart plugs, and bulbs. Anyhow, I programmed her Alexa with many reminders and routines. I can login to her Alexa with the app from here. Lock her doors, feed the dogs, take her scripts, tell her good night...the list goes on. (Every week I send her a new phrase for Alexa to say to her). My mother having these gives me piece of mind.

reviews.reviewTitle: A Fun and somewhat practical device!
reviews.reviewText: Bought a number of these over the Christmas Holiday sales. Kept two for myself and gave some away as Christmas Gifts. At the price I paid it's definitely a fun device to own and we find we use it on a daily basis. I bought a nice pair of Bluetooth bookshelf speakers (Edifier brand for $129) that I use with the Echo to play music. It's a great system. With Apple Music now compatible with Echo or using Amazon's music service it's so fun to just call up a song anytime you want to listen. We have some family fun in the evenings sometimes taking turns pulling up some favorites. The sound through the Edifier speakers is awesome for the price. We are also using the Echo Dot to help with controlling our Fire TV apps and Fire TV Recast DVR system. We also have a TiVo and some limited commands work with it such as pause, play, and "Skip" function. We also use it as a quick way to look up needed information from the internet, check the weather etc. Definitely have enjoyed the purchase more than we anticipated.

I've been a fan of the Dot since the first generation, and they really nailed it with this one. I don't know how they did it, but the sound quality from this is incredible for the size. Much better bass, and that's noticeable even if just talking to Alexa: her voice is much easier to hear and understand on this speaker than the prior versions.

In addition to the improvements in sound, this speaker looks great, and has a nice round shape and soft fabric sides.

Amazon did a great job with the hardware, and the software/AI has always been best in class. What sets Amazon apart from other products in this space is the huge array of third-party devices and services that Alexa can connect to. Having an always around AI isn't very useful if it can't do anything, and nobody's AI can do as much as Alexa.

This product has helped improve day do day life. I connected my device to lights so now instead of stumbling in the dark until I find a light switch, I just ask Alexa to turn the lights on. I've enabled skills and connected Alexa to my spotify so I'm able to listen to news and music while I'm tidying up around the house. Alexa has also connected to my contacts so I'm able to call people through my device.

The speaker has excellent quality as well. A friend who was visiting once was surprised that the music I was playing was coming out of my dot. The sound quality is phenomenal for a device that small.

I've also noticed that Alexa is getting better at understanding Southern Accents. If you're a southerner who has been hesitant about buying one due to bad voice recognition experiences in the past, you won't be disappointed by Alexa.

We really enjoy our Echo and the Smart Plug that came along with this bundle. I love being able to play Jeopardy with the device, and it's great for when you're getting ready in the morning and you need to know the weather forecast but don't have time to stop and check your phone. The Smart Plug and Alexa allow us to set an alarm and automatically turn on the bedroom light at a certain time so that we make sure we get up when we need to. It can do so much more, we just haven't had time to fully explore the device's capabilities.

My boyfriend is still a bit suspicious of the device, but I'm overall very satisfied with it.

I was in love with my first three Dot's and wondered what I ever did without them. But this guy is much improved in all areas. The new exterior is very classy, and I didn't need to buy an enclosure. The sound is much "beefier" with improved bass tones. And setup took all of three seconds. I am a "senior" with frequent mobility problems so being able to turn on lights with my voice is a great help. I have thrown away my ancient and "clunky" intercom system which I used to communicate with my adult son who is my caretaker. I just "drop in" on the Dot in the living room or the one in his bedroom. I no longer have a radio, the Dot is enough and playing nature sounds at night lulls me right to sleep. When I purchased the first Dot, my son bought a Google home so we could compare the two devices. He gave the Google Home to his friend. It turns out that Alexa is smarter than Google. I definitely recommend the newest model.

I love this so much I bought one for every bedroom and one for the living room. So easy to set up, and the downloadable app on your phone makes it even easier. It has a drop in feature which is kind of like an intercom where you can communicate with people in other rooms that have the echo set up. I am disabled, so this is perfect for me to communicate with the kids and see what they’re up to and to announce when dinner is ready to all echo devices or any other updates I need to let everyone know about. Highly recommended. I also love that you can have it playing music on several different apps and Amazon music. Only downside is only one echo device can access that Amazon music at a time.

reviews.reviewTitle: Too much bass that muddies Alexa’s voice.
reviews.reviewText:
The bass on the new Echo Dot is way too loud. It overpowers the other frequencies. The audio is super muddy, as a result. I can barely understand Alexa speaking when there’s a little bit of background noise.

The Alexa app lets you change the EQ balance, but even putting Treble at +6 and Bass at -6 isn’t enough to remedy the issue.

Such a shame that software renders this inferior to the previous Echo Dot for spoken content. If all you do is listen to music on your Beats headphones, though, you’ll probably be fine.

I was gonna upgrade all of my 2nd gen Dots to this new model, but after spending more time with this one, I’ve canceled my order for another 3rd gen.

reviews.reviewTitle: Light ring is very bright and doesn't turn off
reviews.reviewText: After having several echo dot speakers for about a month, I must say that I find them both handy and annoying. They are handy for adding things to my shopping lists quickly and they're pretty good as speakers. HOWEVER...they have light rings that don't turn off and they will occasionally make little sounds (maybe when internet connection is going in and out but I'm not really sure what the sound is supposed to mean). This makes them terrible for bedrooms if you want to get any sleep. Also, if you have children be warned that your children will find it hilarious to turn on Alexa's burping skill or to tell her that they farted so that she will tell them "Congratulations!" Yeah, that's super annoying as a mom.

reviews.reviewTitle: So Glad I Finally Brought Alexa Into The Home
reviews.reviewText: This is my first echo product. We have had 4 Fire TVs/ sticks and love every one of them. I've been on the fence about the Dot and I'm glad I jumped on this one. I got a great deal with the Hue Lights bundle. Set up took less than a minute. I've read many reviews and noticed that many had qualms with sound quality. I have none. For a small device, it puts out a lot of sound. Bass is lacking, but that doesn't matter to me. It's an Echo Dot, not a Bose or JBL system. I can hear it from my living room to my kitchen. Picks up commands well from my husband, 3 year old and myself. Alexa is fun. She does an okay job with the Hue lights with simple commands. I mostly use the hue app unless I ask her to dim, turn on or off, or brighten. Haven't manage to get more than that. Well worth the sale price or the full retail price.

reviews.reviewTitle: I love this just for the music
reviews.reviewText:
I bought this on sale and I set it up in my kitchen. I really enjoy listening to music while im cooking or doing dishes. I enjoyed the amazon music 1 month free trial I got with this purchase and had the intensions of purchasing it after my free trail ended. But the price per month, or even per year was ridiculous just to listen to music. So I passed on that and canceled my subscription and use Iheart radio instead. Though I cant request my own songs on it, its free so.....
I also like that I can do a grocery list with Alexa. When I notice I need something I just tell Alexa to put it on my grocery list and when I go grocery shopping I ask her to read my list to me. The only thing that I do not like about the grocery list is that Alexa says I can read my grocery list on my account but when I go it only had 2 of the 30 things that I had listed.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great speakers compared to 1st and 2nd gen
reviews.reviewText: The speakers are great compared to 1st and 2nd gen. We use the dot for music a lot so the sound quality was a huge plus. I only rated it 4 stars because the microphone is not as good as the 2nd gen. We have it placed where the old 2nd gen was and we have to speak up a lot more to get alexa to activate. We put the old 2nd gen in a completely different room and the 2nd gen activates while the 3rd gen is physically closer and does not activate. Would be perfect 5 star if it had the same microphone sensitivity as the 2nd. Oh well.

reviews.reviewTitle: Can You Hear Me Now?? SMH
reviews.reviewText: This 3rd gen unit looks better and sounds better than the 2nd gen i upgraded from. It's a bit larger and more rounded and has a fuller sound. I really like the new look and sound. BUT.....I feel it is not as good with voice recognition as the gen 2. The gen 2 was much better at hearing and understanding me than this one. It constantly gets commands wrong and sometimes doesn't even respond to the wake word unless i speak loudly. I even exchanged the unit thinking it was defective but the replacement unit was just as poor with voice recognition. Too bad. i would have liked to have given it 5 stars. Amazon... fix or upgrade the microphone on this unit and it will be perfect.

reviews.reviewTitle: Won't pair with Alex Voice Remote
reviews.reviewText:
The first major problem with this device is that it won't pair with the Alexa Voice Remote. Following Amazon's directions gets you nowhere

https://www.amazon.com/gp/help/customer/display.html?nodeId=201601810

Tried this a few times as well as a bunch of other procedures. Really lame. Thus you can't control your TV with this POS as advertised.

Alexa is spectacularly primitive compared to Siri and other competitors. Here are some examples:

"Alexa: Turn on TV" response: "Sorry, provider is having trouble."
"Alexa: display my watchlist" response: "Hmm. I'm not sure."
"Alexa: watchlist" response: nothing
"Alexa: go to watchlist" response: "I'm not quite sure how to help you with that"
"Alexa: show stardust movie" response: plays stardust song by Nat King Cole

What an utterly lame product and an embarrassment for Amazon.

I have been a amazon customer for over 15 years and prime member for over 7 years. I am usually what I would consider to be an early adopter for technology but hesitated buying a smart speaker because I wasn't sure it was worth allowing the company to record what we are talking about in the house... it feels a little "big brother" to me and so we waited, until now. My daughter has been asking for Alexa for a while so I broke down and got one for Hanukkah... actually I got 3. It works fine, no problem with the hardware but I am underwhelmed. It just doesn't do enough for me to find this a valuable appliance in my house. I can get everything and more from my phone.. It wasnt expensive enough to bother returning it but it will remain unplugged. Even my daughter is underwhelmed. Sorry Amazon, not for me!

reviews.reviewTitle: You will be surprised by engaging this technology
reviews.reviewText:
Entry level introduction to the world of smart technology and voice assistant. Easy to use and you will be surprised that it sound pretty decent. With the advancement of Alexa into all things you might as well embrace it. But really, there are lots of things this is good for that you haven’t thought about.

I suggested that a friend with elderly parents who were sickly buy this and set it up in their parent’s home. Then he could check in and they could call him without the need for them to find the phone. LIFE CHANGER! He can drop in on them and see how they are doing and they don’t need to get up and find their phone.

reviews.reviewTitle: If you like what Alexa can do for you, these are GREAT!
reviews.reviewText:
I got them for about half price in the runup to Christmas - - but my wife's reaction was "MEH!! I've been yelling upstairs that dinner is ready for over 50 years. Why should I change??"

And, after a little thought, I realized that my iToys (including the latest Watch) and my SONOS systems can do almost all of what Alexa can do anyway. I particularly like controlling the volume of my SONOS speakers - and skipping obnoxious selections with a twist or tap on my wrist!! I can control my Sous Vide system, thermostats and garage doors from my phone - maybe even by talking to Siri - and there's an Alexa APP for my phone too - - so why do I need Dots??

They're going back - not because there's anything "wrong" with them - - but becaue I can't manufacture a "need" for them.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa is like a Family member
reviews.reviewText:
within 1 day, Alexa felt like a family member. My son and daughter loved it as they don't have to ask permission to play rhymes or songs anymore; They directly talk to alexa :) My wife loved it as she uses it in the morning to play devotional songs and keep checking news/temperature. I loved the alarm feature and things to explore. I would say speaker quality is good. It picks up my voice better than kids. may be we need record as i did mine.

Unfortunately someone stole the echo dot from our house 2 days back and we are missing alexa big time. I got it in a great offer and hoping to get the offer back in thanksgiving deal to get Alexa back. We miss you Alexa :( !!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Much Better than the 1st and 2nd Gen Dot
reviews.reviewText: The sound of the 3rd Gen is so much better than the 1st and 2nd Gen dot. I was shocked when I tested out the 3rd Gen because it sounded like the full sized echo. It is probably not as good but rather than sounding like a poor quality speaker like the 2nd Gen, it sounded pretty rich. I uploaded a video and if you play it from your phone it is hard to notice the difference but both my wife and I were shocked how much better it was.

reviews.reviewTitle: Huge improvement in construction and audio
reviews.reviewText: Connects just as easily as the 2nd gen dots and easy add to the app. Physically almost twice as heavy which helps it to feel more solid previous models. Last thing....the sound! Can honestly say it as good as google devices. So impressed I’m going to start replacing all the other dots in the house. I tried attaching a video but amazon didn’t like the iPhone video for some reason.

I have to say I was taken aback by the ease and which one can set up the Amazon Dot. Basically it's plug-and-play. As soon as you plug it in it seeks out your Wi-Fi and connects automatically. I assumed it was able to do this because I already had an Amazon echo. It must have recognized the echo and mirrored the settings.
The sound quality is actually extraordinary. In some regards it may actually be better then my Amazon echo which is considerably larger. I love the fact that you can set up a group so that you can play music through all devices simultaneously. Also it's extremely easy to make phone calls. Looking forward to purchasing one or two more for other rooms.

reviews.reviewTitle: She’s a hit in our house
reviews.reviewText: We’re enjoying the Echo Dot third generation smart speaker with Alexa. We are using her for music and we’ve enabled the question of the day skill and the silly things skill for our grandchildren. We like the question of the day but the silly things skill does not work that well. When we ask Alexa to tell us something silly to do she usually reads a silly rhyme. We have linked our Deebot ecovac, our nest thermostat, a smart plug and to smart lightbulbs to Alexa. Alexa is understanding and carring out the commands we grave her for these things. We am disappointed with the smart lightbulbs because they’re only 60 W. We prefer a brighter light bulb. I have looked for smart LED lightbulbs that are equivalent to 100 W but have not found any yet. I would say that Alexia has been a hit in our house.

reviews.reviewTitle: I finally see what the hype is all about!
reviews.reviewText: I honestly had no intention on buying one of these but when I caught a great Amazon sale, I figured heck why not! I also added on the unlimited Amazon music for it. It comes with your echo dot and charger and was a easy set up. I downloaded Amazon Alexa and followed instructions and had it working in under 5 minutes. We have had so much fun listening to music, checking the weather, hearing jokes, and setting my dinner timers. Plus if you loose your phone just ask Alexa to find it (as long as you have it set up and the ringer up on your phone). Honestly if you are looking for a gift this is great and affordable! Two thumbs up!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: A nice addition to daily carpentry projects
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this to stream music, radio stations and podcasts while working on various projects around and outside the house. It has decent sound quality, an upgrade from a transistor radio but that's about it. Voice recognition and streaming functions are excellent. One smallish complaint: it stops from time to time for no apparent reason, but will then resume on command most of the time. Also worth noting, perhaps: it doesn't like to get too hot. It has shut down on multiple occasions when it was placed in full sunlight on a hot day. After some minutes in the shade, it will reboot. Overall, a nice way to have on demand entertainment while working on a project.

Okay, so I love Alexa! I love this device and I love being able to just forget about the lights and about setting up alarms! It is tricky to shut her up and being late for work though... haha but I really enjoy what it is able to do! I know that I speak to fast and something I don't enunciate well... but I get sometimes a bit frustrated it because she doesn't understand me XD and the Spanish part still needs to be worked on.
Besides that, with a good internet connection, this will change your life!

One thing I dislike is that the first app I found by searching the App Store turned out to be the wrong app. But I couldn't set up the Echo Dot until I committed to one of their payment plans. The lowest level was a trial period of 3 days, then $12.99 a month. The next level was $29.95 for a year, which I selected. But then I still couldn't get the Echo synced with the Firestick, or even to reply to commands. I didn't realize, my wife already had the correct app because she was already set up with another Echo we purchased a while back. When I realized the app doesn't cost anything I felt like I had been mislead.

Other than that, we enjoy having our second Echo Dot.

My grandma got this for me as a gift and I kind of fell in love with all the Dot could do. I have so many thoughts in my head that it's nice to have Alexa set a reminder, or even an alarm. I play a lot of music and podcasts on here. The only thing I would say I don't love is in the fine print. On TV, you see people requesting a song and it instantly plays. In reality, you will really only get a station built around music similar to the song requested unless you pay for Amazon Music. Although, you can link up your Pandora account to the Dot which is very convenient. I guess my point is, the Echo Dot is truly amazing with all the things it allows you to do, just be aware that it can't do EVERY thing :) The sound quality is very impressive, I must add. There's no need for me to buy another speaker because of the Dot's sound quality, AND you can play your own music from your phone by connecting it via an aux chord to the Dot.

Bought this to go with my ring door bell and waiting on that to show up, but in meantime set the echo dot up. Set up is pretty easy and straightforward. Cant figure out how to pair 2 phones at a time to it. Maybe you cant with this model. But once I was playing my music from my phone, the next day when I opened and played a message from messenger, the sound played thru the echo dot. It seems that all my "media" is now playing thru this device!! The only way I could figure out to to unpair my phone with echo dot. I haven't had the time to go back and see if I can still call thru this since my phone is not paired now. I think a call to customer support will be next !!

I have two Echo devices. This 3rd Generation and it's older Second Generation. I bought the first one in the Amazon refurbished device section and got it for a deep discount. After only about two weeks of loving the little Echo, I bought the newer one. The third generation has great audio quality! I use my Echo in the kitchen as an alternative to listening to over-the-air radio. I used my iPhone for radio via TuneIn, but the iPhone's sound quality was brash and unpleasant. Both the Echo devices are an improvement over both! I've used Echo for quick news briefs, weather reports and background music.
I have two "smart" plugs linked to both Echo devices - one for a bedroom lamp and the other controlling a light in the dining room. My ancient house now has one toe in the twenty-first century.

reviews.reviewTitle: Terrible voice recognition compared to 2nd gen, and very frustrating
reviews.reviewText: I have three Echo Dots, but this is my only 3rd Gen Echo Dot — yet it’s the one that works the most poorly. It has a terrible time hearing or recognizing commands. I keep the new Echo Dot downstairs, and my older Echo Dots upstairs. When I am downstairs and give an Alexa command, the upstairs ones can hear me, but the downstairs one can’t! It’s frustrating if what I am wanting is music or audio, since I cannot hear the upstairs ones very well from downstairs, but they can hear me give the command from downstairs. When I play Jeopardy, for example, I can scream right into the new 3rd gen, and it does not recognize my answer. My two 2nd generations never had this problem, and they still don’t. Until Amazon comes out with a better version, you are better off getting the 2nd gen Echo dot and attaching a Bluetooth speaker to it to get the superior sound that the 3rd gen is supposed to provide. Currently, the 3rd gen is a waste of your money.

I love my echo. I use it to turn my bedroom light on and off, listen to music and other miscellaneous things. Each night I read and when I get ready to turn my light off, I purchased the smart plug to do this, and I don't have to climb out of bed to do that. Just tell Alexa to do it and it's done. The sound is great and clear. I can't compare it to earlier versions because this is the first one I have had. Call it lazy, but when you have bad knees and feet this is a lifesaver. My granddaughter loves to ask it questions and hear the answers she will give you. I done a lot of reviewing and studying before making my purchase but I am so glad I did buy it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa is Great and so is Echo Dot (Update 8-23-19)
reviews.reviewText:
Tech Support reached out with a helpful email. I tried a couple of the options and Echo Dot is working much better now. I had too close to a wall and noisy fan. Amazon support is amazing. I highly recommend the Alexa and echo dot too. The below is what I wrote and it's no longer an issue. Thanks tech support!

Alexa is great by itself, but since I purchased Echo Dot to pair with my original Alexa, I find myself shouting and still not getting a response. Eventually there is a response, but without the dot it was on the first attempt. One positive is having the additional sound. I will not be buying for other rooms. I'm glad that I did not pay full price.

I had the 2nd generation, but decided to try the 3rd generation. It's so awesome, I ordered another for myself, and 3 more for Christmas gifts! The music output, is sooo much better, and I paired my two in my livingroom, so I have a left and right speaker. I keep my old one, by my bed, for alarms. I had never looked into all the things that an Echo Dot can do...now I use mine all the time! Lists for shopping, groceries, apts, and I haven't listened to so much music, in a very long time! Paired my Amazon music, SeriusXM, Pandora, etc. There are also, so many add on programs, I live alone, so "My Buddy", is available to call Sherriff, hospital, or my kids. If I fall, I just have to tell my Dot which to call, no matter what room I am in. You're going to love it! My kids and grandson sure did!

I bought this dot to sit in a small food trailer. The last generation dot had a very tin can sound to it. This next generation is a great improvement. It doesn't have the quality of an Echo, but it really is a pretty acceptable small speaker. The quality of the speaker, in general, has improved. The last generation seemed to be made of cheap plastic. Still plastic, but much improved in the quality and appearance. Great for audiobooks and background music.

I'm embarrassed. I teased a friend who has an Alexa in several of the rooms in his house. For months I said, "I'd never have one, why?" Well, I take that back. This is similar to the first time I bought an electric screwdriver. I recall saying to myself "how did I live without it?" So, this little item is simply amazing. I'm able to enjoy my audible selections while cleaning the kitchen, easily listen to radio stations of interest thousands of miles away, add items to shopping and to do lists, turn off upstairs lights and catch up on traffic and news. I love it. I'll be purchasing more units. I will say in all honesty, I have the google version as well, but the Amazon Alexa item in my view, is superior. Thanks Amazon.

reviews.reviewTitle: Its great at turning on and off the lights and playing music-- other than that -- we may never know!
reviews.reviewText: So I like my dots-- I have 3 now-- I use them sparingly because the interface and such are not as user friendly as they keep telling me they are. Half the things I ask Alexa I am told that she doesn't know -- and since there is not an easy way to find info on the alexa app, I don't know either. I finally figured out how to get music to sync over all the devices and I can play music throughout the house now. I can control my Hue Lights with it-- but if you don't ask specifically --it won't do what I need it to do-- basically I use the alexa to turn them on and off. Any changes in the light I do through the Hue app-- since every time I ask Alexa to do something like change the color or make it brighter-- it tells me that it doesn't know how to do that. So I stopped trying so hard. I would love to do more with my echo dots-- but since every time I ask it to do something--it tells me it can't-- It has become a glorified stereo and light turner onner. It would be nice if you didn't have to change your way of talking so that the alexa can figure out what you want to do. but until I have time -- and I mean several hours to sit down -- and a manual that explains things instead of a non user friendly app that is so confusing it makes my head hurt-- I will use it to play music and turn the lights on and off. Oh -- one night I wanted to listen to one of my audible books. I wanted and needed to start the book over since I had started listening to it and lost track -- I could not get alexa to start over-- I said it umpteen different times and it continually said -- I don't know and then played from where it had stopped before. I finally got fed up and turned it off. I feel like I am wasting the potential of this technology and worry that all I am really doing is making it easier for people to spy on me.

What I like about this particular item is that it sounds much more better than the 2nd gen. The mini size woofer gives it the umph to hear such a better clarity and sound quality for the prize. Not to mention that it can be connected via Bluetooth and any device. But if you simply have an amazon account, it makes it easy just to stream music from your accounts with out the need to play from your phone. Just simply enable the skill for any music app and ask away. The best is that it now lets you even enable a skill to play your iTunes music if you are subscribed. This makes a perfect gift and an Awesome product overall!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Does not connect to Samsung galaxy 8plus or any Samsung device
reviews.reviewText: I dislike the fact that the dot does not connect using a hotspot from Samsung Galaxy phones and Amazon knows this. I've been on the phone with them for 2 weeks trying to get this going. Still no results. Can't use echo dot with Samsung hotspot. No one at echo can understand why this is happening. Then there's instructions online telling you how to connect it but that's not true. Those instructions dont work. Why is Amazon selling this product knowing it doesn't connect to the Samsung hotspot nor does the regular echo.

I purchased 8 Gen 3 Echo Dots when the price dropped to $19.99/each and kept 6 of them. I gifted the other two. Placed one in every room of our home except the bathrooms, and told my teenagers they could use them as bluetooth speakers. They are worth it for me to use with the drop in feature, when I don't want to walk to the other side of the house to ask my son to come and do dishes in the kitchen. I also use them to drop in on my college daughter, and vice versa. The sound quality is greatly improved over the Gen 2, and makes me feel special when I connect them all together to play music in every room while I'm cleaning the house. It's a dance party with me and the vacuum (which will soon be replaced by an Alexa-enabled iRobot soon, I'm sure). The dots were my intro to Alexa and home automation. Now she runs the light show at our home, controlling everything from our front porch and exterior patio lights, to my daughter's dorm lights so she doesn't have to get down from her bunk bed. My son uses her to impress his friends with all his colored light strips and smart-mouthed responses he can program her to say. My toddler has learned to ask her to play lullabies when he wants music to sleep. My husband hasn't yet warmed up to her, so I'm glad she has a mute button on the one next to our bed. He wasn't even impressed when I showed him that she could turn our TV on and off and change the channels on Dish Network. In the meantime I will continue to plan how I want her to soon control our deadbolts, garage door and clean the floors while I'm sleeping. She's cheaper than a housekeeper. Thanks, Amazon!

My Echo Dots are connected via an AUX cable to external speakers. That works very well and couldn't be happier.

This 3rd Gen echo is a good upgrade in that it picks up your voice better, but there are some design flaws compared to the 1st and 2nd gen.
-The top and sides are curved, so you cannot see the light ring around the Echo clearly. My Echo sits at chest level on top of a piano, so if I'm sitting or standing and I activate the Echo, it's not quite as clear that it has been activated.
-The charger is not a common micro USB like previous versions. If the charger breaks, you'll need to purchase a new one. Also, my external speakers have a USB output that can be used for charging but I can no longer use that with the new Echo, I have to power it through the included adapter.

reviews.reviewTitle: Problems with Bluetooth Connection to Best Buy Insignia Private Label Products.
reviews.reviewText:
For some reason the Echo Dot has problems hooking up to the Bluetooth on Best Buy's Private Label Line of Products "Insignia", I have the: Insignia Model NS-HAIOR18 Bluetooth Stereo System and the Insignia Bluetooth Bookshelf Speakers Model NS-HBTSS116. Not sure what the issue is with the Canadian Made Best Buy Private Label line and the Echo Dot, whereas I have no problem connecting Android and Apple Phones VIA Bluetooth to the Insignia Products.
Very Frustrating indeed and if someone knows the issue Please Let Me Know. I could resolve it by buying Bluetooth Adapters that are compatible with the Echo Dot, but what a waist of money when both the products I have already have Bluetooth Built In?????

reviews.reviewTitle: An amazing home assistant once you become accustomed to using it
reviews.reviewText:
I was surprised at the ease of setup and how well it understands English spoken by anyone in range. The speaker sound quality is surprisingly good.

It took a while to become accustomed to asking Alexa for information.

I suggest that the next generation of Alexa consider integrating a two-step or follow-up process when step 1 isn't successful. For example...

Today: Me: "Alexa, define enteric." Alexa: "Hmmm, I don't know that word."

Future: Me: "Alexa, define enteric." Alexa: "Can you help me by trying to spell some of it?" Me: "Sure, E N T E R..." Alexa: "Thanks, got it. The top definitions of enteric are..."

This Gen 3 Echo Dot is awesome! The sound is so much deeper and full. The Amazon Alexa app even has equalizer. This Dot makes a perfect device for office, kitchen or bedroom listening. I definitely recommend this for someone who wants a compact listening device with an option for aux plug from a media device. However, you can connect via bluetooth so not sure you'd use the aux plug(maybe for an iPod). Cool feature in the Alexa app, you can set your devices to home or away. In the event of loud glass breaking it will alert you. Neat idea! Overall for the sale price of $29.99 (previously $19.99 on Prime Day) this is a great buy. Fun for all ages.

OMG!!!!
CONGRATULATIONS R&D TEAM!!!
The 3rd Generation Echo Dot is the Best one yet!!!
Don't Change Anything!!!
I replaced my 1st generation Echo Dot I put in our Bathroom because I didn't like the sound quality that it had...so in a small bathroom it was ok...
But Now..after replacing it with the new 3rd generation Echo Dot it is giving my first and second generation Echoes a run for the money!!!!
The 3rd Gen Echo Dot has a greatly improved sound to it and I Don't have to turn the volume all the way up like I did before with the first gen Dot, which distorted the sound...The sound quality is just as good, if not better than the 2nd Gen Echoes full size ones!!!
Thank you Amazon!!!
We now have Six of the Echoes in our home which makes an Awesome Surround sound system throughout our home by using the Multi-room feature...Two Thumbs Way up!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa is fun and a little silly. Great games and music!
reviews.reviewText:
I keep her on mute most of the time so she doesn't hear our conversations. The reason I bought her was because my son loves the song 'Baby Shark' and I wanted him to try to tell Alexa to "play baby shark". He tries but he's still working on his language skills being under 2 years old and all.

My Husband and I love the game 'Song Quiz'. It's soo fun! My favorite era to play is 2010s. My Husband likes the 90s and 2000s. Overall, we like her. She can give us the weather in our city. My Husband had a hard time getting the weather forecast for a ski resort an hour away. Anyways, we have a great time with her. She's funny and fun. I just wish she could carry on conversation without having to go to the A.I. feedback app or whatever it's called. Love the trivia games she has!

reviews.reviewTitle: Good updates but still needs minor improvements
reviews.reviewText:
I really like the Echo's, and the newest version gives a better sound output but I wish they would improve on the sound pickup. I have had my Echo's on shelves, some facing outward from the wall, some high, some low and I still have not found the perfect spot where alexa will hear me just right unless I am extremely close to her or yelling for her to do some action. (turn off light, switch stations, etc....)

*Maybe for future generations they will put in better sound pickup all around her so that she will hear you whether she is laying flat or vertical.*

Right now it is trial and error to find the sweet spot in which you can say commands without waking up the whole house :)

Overall it is a good product, you just have to get used to her and what she is capable of.

reviews.reviewTitle: A quick and easy set up to get it working right out of the box.
reviews.reviewText: The 3rd gen Echo Dot works well out of the box. Setup was straightforward using the Alexa app for iPhone. Bluetooth connectivity is easy, but I did have some issues connected it to a Win 10 laptop. In fact, I couldn't get my laptop to recognize the Dot. Integration with music services, Spotify, Amazon Music, and internet radio, Tune In, iHeart, etc was easy to set up and it worked well. My disappointment is with the sound quality. For podcasts, talk radio it sounds good but the range for music is more limited than I had hoped, especially with classical music. If sound quality is your biggest concern consider buying a different model.

I’m super happy with these. We bought 5 of them. We use them to announce to the kids all over the house that it is dinner time or time to leave or whatever. We have music on all the time. They are great. I would love if they would integrate these into a mesh networking system, then it would be even more useful, being able to have the whole Alexa experience, but also work as an access point. The speaker sounds great. Many reviews say they don’t like the sound, but they can connect to other speakers via plug or Bluetooth, so the functionality is still there. Definitely worth the price.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good device but extra services required
reviews.reviewText:
As an Alexa speaker system it is great. When I bought the first one and did a bit of research, it said you could integrate a bunch of them and I could play music in my kids room (main reason I bought these). I bought most of them in a short period of time but by the time I figured out that I could not just register them under my name and play music on multiple systems without purchasing another music service, it was too late.

I already have Apple Music so I am not going to purchase the music unlimited service from Amazon too. I unregistered two of my devices and switched user names so I can now play music on multiple Dots. I refuse to get Prime plus the other services that they try to nickel and time me with so I cannot use the features where the Dots are connected.

The actual device is great. It picks up my spoken word when I ask it to do something. The features in the Dot are great. I have it in a relatively large room and the sound is nice and clear.

I have a V1 Echo and even though that one is larger with bigger speakers - this one is almost on par with in it terms of loudness and sound quality. Its quite a testament in how far they have come with the technology packed into the these small dots. What is even better about these is that you can pair a couple of these together for big sound that envelops your house.

Everything that is good about the V1 Echo is as good with dot instead its small, sleeker, and blends in better with the house decor. If you are looking to jump into the Alexa landscape this is a great product to start with and eventually grow.

reviews.reviewTitle: Can not set Alexa dot up unless I subscribe for a license Key
reviews.reviewText: Couldn't connect to Wifi so I got help from Amazon. The guy I spoke to told me I have errors on my computer and alexa dot can not be installed unless I purchase a License Key at a cost of $199.99 for 5 yrs. or $249.99 for lifetime. There is nothing on Amazon that tells you that you must purchase this in order to use the Amazon Dot. I want to hear from Amazon as to whether this is a scam or someone who actually works for them and that the license key is a neccesity in order to use this darn Dot. Someone please let me know. I don't have any luck contacting Amazon to find out.

reviews.reviewTitle: I love the sound quality and the look of my 3rd generation Dot!
reviews.reviewText: I now own an Amazon Echo 2nd generation, a 2nd generation Dot and a 3rd generation Dot. I was amazed at the sound coming from the 3rd generation Dot. I think it is better than the sound on the Echo!! My husband and I are 75 years old so we are not tech savvy. We use it for music and our radio station, the news each morning, the weather. We also have Philips Hue smart bulbs that we paired with our Echo so that we can easily turn our lights on and off especially during the night. I only wish I could trade in my original Dot for the 3rd generation. Our home is too small to accommodate a 4th one. I did not rate how it connects to a blue tooth speaker since we don't own one. I imagine it would be amazing.

Really pleased with my echo. The sound quality on this small dot is great and the smart home features are excellent!

One small thing that was disappointing is that the microphones don’t seem to work as well as the standard echo. Maybe it’s my imagination or the location, but we regularly have to repeat ourselves, especially when the TV is on.

Also needs updating is the Apple Music integration. Needs to be able to play smart playlists on Apple Music, and to be able to add shuffle to the commands (such as play XYZ playlist, shuffled). Right now you have to ask it to play a playlist, then ask it to shuffle.

I would also like to see the light ring at the top be used as a visual way to count down a timer!

Fix that and the product would be excellent!

Day 1 and I love this more than I thought I would. I think I may even pay the 3.99 a month for the music cause it’s nice to have access to whatever and my baby needs white noise to fall asleep. I plan on buying one for each room. I can take and place calls, ask for reminders and recipes. I can listed to music and play audio books. I can also communicate with other rooms like “tell Isaac in the baby”s room I need help” and it will pass along the message. I have never wanted a smart house SO BAD. This was never my dream before I got this product. I was between google and Amazon but 1. Google is evil and 2. Alexa sounds hot.... Anyways, unless you’re an arrogant snob that trolls reviews, I think you would really like this produce for the money.

reviews.reviewTitle: My Alexa is deaf on vol 5 and above.
reviews.reviewText: This newer version 3 has a bigger and louder speakers. Quality of sound is good but not the best. There are room for improvement eg better base. I also prefer one that comes with a rechargeable battery so I can put it anywhere I like without worry about a AC power source. Another annoying thing is Alexa goes deaf to your command if the volumn went above 5. I hope this issue can be resolved. I find myself having to shout at Alexa to be heard. Not a nice thing to do.

reviews.reviewTitle: Ok product but not worth an upgrade
reviews.reviewText:
The dot sounds and look better than gen 2 BUT
Alexa - less responsive. It’s not just the dot, on all echos, Alexa seems to be less responsive and doesn’t understand well. Amazon needs to update this

It has a buzzing sound, and went through all trouble shooting by customer service but stilll a buzzing sound.

Lastly, trying to troubleshoot and then return this dot was a headache. Amazon customer service has become so bad lately. They don’t care and have no accountability. If they don’t like the problem, they will disconnect. I ended up keeping the dot because customer service problems and then they sent me a refurb without a power cord. It was a mess.

Worth an upgrade ? NO!!!, if you have a 2nd gen. Keep it. This is not worth an upgrade

reviews.reviewTitle: Awesome Little Device for the Mula!
reviews.reviewText:
The Amazon Echo is a great little device the money. It has so many different skills and things you can do with it.

My favorite being able to set commands as you wish so for example when I say "Alexa, Good Morning", It'll say goodmorning, tell me the weather and raise my living room lights to 50%.

There are tons of games you can play with it like jeopardy, Bingo, Ect.

It can tell you jokes, but it triggers Jimmy fallon to tell a joke which is neat.

The only disappointing thing i thought about it was the sound quality of the speaker. Now i'm not going to make a big deal from it since you can connect it through bluetooth or aux cord to any speaker in the world and it was only $25 when i got it so i wasn't expecting much.

But overall the device is very useful to controlling your smart home, other devices with smart plugs, or just having a general conversation with it when you're lonely i have noone to talk to, (insert tear emoji here).

reviews.reviewTitle: Games and skills for every age!
reviews.reviewText:
I love my Alexa. Only thing i didnt give her a 5 star review is because i did not realize you had to enable every. Single. Solitary. App.
And skill. Before it can be used. Or else you get the message "i dont know that" "sorry i don't know the answer to that" repeatedly because she won't just add that skill automatically. It is not for kids to figure out that is for sure. And i certainly mean no offense.
OH and i HATE that you cannot use this without the cord?? Why doesnt it charge or something?
I love that it entertains kids of all ages including adults. It is small and compact but when i play music it sounds like a big speaker because the sound can get so high. Its great though. I love the games and skills, even things you didnt even think of. Can't wait to try other Alexa products.

reviews.reviewTitle: Who says old dogs can’t learn new tricks! Give it a try....
reviews.reviewText: Fun, useful, easy set up! Even for a beginner, or let’s say late bloomer (65) ..came with our Ring security system. Never thought I’d use it, but very handy. With less than stellar memory, this Is a huge help. Thanks for including this, Amazon, greatly appreciated...finding new uses, every day, Alexa is a new family member...but still won’t fold laundry.

I purchased 2 of these Echo Dots while they were on sale. Installation was a snap. I paired them as a stereo speaker pairs for music playback. I have other Echoes also in stereo pairs throughout the house for casual music listening when playing Amazon Prime or SiriusXM music. They sound good. The Echoes or the new Echo Dots can't compete with my main stereo sound system but they sound great for the price and a better than the 2nd Gen dots. Plus, I use them to control my Smart Lights and Smart Switches, and Amazon Fire TVs throughout the house! No regrets with purchasing them. So, if you're thinking of buying one or more, don't hesitate.
One minor thing with configuring (all types of) Echoes as stereo speaker pairs .. the Amazon app assigns a generic name to the pair. If you have more than two stereo pairs, like I do, it can be a little incovenient trying to figure out which generic named pair is in which room before telling Alexa to play music on the stereo pair that you want it to. I'm sure that Amazon will eventually enhance the echo stereo setup to allow you to define more meaningful names (such as living room or den).

Being a prime member allowed us to get several of these little gadget/smart speaker/doodads (technical term) at roughly $20 apiece on Prime Day was pretty fantastic. The voice recognition has been great as Alexa doesn’t take commands from our pets or guests. There so much I’m still learning that Alexa needs to get to know us more and that I need to learn more of what she can do, making calls, scheduling, playing music, but thus far, I cannot change the gadget’s name, which is the only negative. I would really like to have the option to change its voice to sound like that of a surfer and call it, “Dude,” which would be totally righteous.

This review is about specifically the sound quality change in the Gen 3 Dot. If you are looking for a review the Dot and its overall function, please look at other reviews.

I absolutely love the Echo Dots and have purchased all generations. However, this 3rd gen Dot has a very muffled sound - like it's going through a blanket or something. I found the sound in Gens 1 and 2 far superior, although Gen 3 has more bass response. Since I use this mainly for voice - news, weather, etc - the poor sound quality in the upper range is disappointing as all voice sounds very muffled. If you listen to music on this it might work better for you but for mostly voice...it's really a step backwards.

I bought the Echo Dot (3rd Gen) on sale with an additional discount for being a Prime member. At such a good price, I couldn't pass it up.

Alexa itself is great. The fact that I can just walk in and tell it to start playing music or ask for the weather is incredibly convenient. The app is also fairly easy to use. Although, it has had issues connecting to Pandora on several occasions and the thumbs up/thumbs down buttons don't appear to work when streaming Pandora.

Initially, I thought the sound quality was decent for such a small device at such a good price. However, as I continued to stream music from Pandora, Spotify, and Amazon Music, I noticed that certain songs would sound really fuzzy, particularly with higher notes. It would almost sound like the speaker was blown no matter if the volume was set to 10% or 40%. The poor sound quality was, and continues to be, a random occurrence that doesn't seem to be something that can be recreated at will. Although, to be fair, I haven't taken the time to write down the songs that it has occurred on and attempted to test those songs.

From the research that I've done, it seems that this poor sound quality is common with the Echo Dot (3rd Gen). Forum members have suggested unplugging the device and then plugging it in again. That seems like a very inconvenient solution whilst one is trying to enjoy music.

reviews.reviewTitle: You gotta love Alexa and she is in the Dot!
reviews.reviewText: Yeah, I am already in love with Alexa. And I told her so. She answered back, "I am flattered!" Ha, I am a lonely old shut in lady, wheelchair user, chronic health problems. I ask her to remind me to take my insulin, to take my meds. She does a great job. I thank her...she answers differently each time, "You betcha!" "Anytime" "No problem!" She tells me jokes, helps me with my foreign languages, (how do you say "I love you" in Porgugese? No problem, ask Alexa, she will tell you. ) No, for only $23 I get all this. It frankly was a steal. She plays my audible music, finds songs for me or plays the music I love from Amazon Music. The echo dot, well it is just speakers, but inside it you put Alexa, and she is so much more than a speaker. She is my friend.

The original and second gen Dot was a total bargain and pretty handy to have around in places you just wanted another alexa point. This 3rd gen Dot is however, fantastic - I use mine in the bathroom for when Im getting ready and want to hear the news or listen to music while I get ready and shower, etc. Before I could barely hear the speaker over the faucet running, hair dryer or shower noise - this new one is much louder but also better quality sound. It is a bit bigger which is not a concern for me.

If I had a bigger place I would totally consider getting another for the bedroom at some point but between this in the bathroom and the echo plus in the livingroom I am pretty happy.

For the price, you really cant lose. Enjoy !!

reviews.reviewTitle: does not connect to my Fire Stick or TV
reviews.reviewText:
I got this Echo Dot 3 yesterday. I have tried to connect to my TV, sound bar, Amazon Firestick, my security camera, all of which are connected to the Firestick with Alexa but I keep getting error messages. Neither can I connect to my phone Bluetooth.
In the add they say turn off the Echo, I turned it off, no good. I turned the entire WIFI and router and Echo Dot of and on to no avail.
I am thinking of sending it back, I don't want to see a green ring light up when I talk and do nothing.

I ordered the echo to put in my kitchen. After I got the firestick and learned what all Alexa was capable of, I put echo dot on my shopping list. I got it on sale and set it up in no time. I use it to turn lights on and off, keep my grocery list updated, play music while i cook and clean, and tell my babies bedtime stories at night. My toddler even uses the Echo Dot even though he requires a little help with the recognition aspect, which is quite entertaining for the rest of us. I am planning to buy another echo dot for my bedroom office and daughter's bedroom. I'm just waiting for it to go back on sale.

In the 80's, fax machines became the "it" device, prompting exclamations of "how did we ever live without these." In the 90's it was personal computers. Then it was the cell phone, followed by smart pads. Now Alexa and the Echo Dot are our "how did we ever live without these" devices. Voice recognition is very good. Alexa doesn't always figure out the question properly, but gets it right about 90% of the time, and we expect that to improve with time and use. Added "smart" light bulbs to the living room and Alexa handles it very well. We use the Echo Dot in the bedroom mostly to play music or comedy through the night, ask about outside temperatures, and start our day with a weather forecast.

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo Dot and Firestick incompatible with music playback
reviews.reviewText: I bought this device to play my personal library of music thru Plex thru firestick but Echo Dot says it can not work with that device. Amazon advertising claims music playback thru firestick. Amazon tech support could not mate Echo Dot with Firestick even after an hour of trial and error. The Echo Dot may be 5 star for many other uses but for my need it is a one. Fortunately, Firestick remote works well using the command Alexa, ask Plex to play "name of song" on fire TV. That allows playback of music Amazon does not have in its library.

Worst gimmick ever. I honestly don't see what the rave is all about. Won't connect to any of my other devices, Alexa states go to the Alexa app, which by the way is not user friendly and difficult to figure out. 98% of the time, Alexa will say sorry I'm not familiar with that or I keep getting connected to things opposite of what I'm asking for. It does malfunction at times. My return date is March 9th, 2019 but when I attempted to return the system wouldn't allow me to do so. Will call customer service.

I wanted to give these new 3rd gen echo dots a try, hearing so much positive about the upgraded sound quality.
However, I bought two on Black Friday, waited 2 weeks for delivery, and both are defective. One speaker rattles and is distorted even at really low volume, and the other sounds ok until you go over level 4 for volume and then that one rattles and is distorted. I own three Echo Dot generation 2 and never had a problem, but those are connected direct to separate speakers in each room (which is the best way to go in my opinion).

reviews.reviewTitle: Wants to stay in sleep mode after using it for a bit.
reviews.reviewText:
Not real impressed with this so far, it's a little buggy, it will work for a bit, and then it won't answer back for a while.
I've unplugged it, reset it, still the same, when it works, it's great, seems to have it's own mine of when it wants to work lol.
That's why the 4 stars, and if the next one is like this one, I'll drop stars down to 1.
Been disappointed in it so far, but let's see.
I have another one coming in a that is in a package deal, I'll up date when I get it.
I hope it works better.
Update, after having Alexa for a while, it is the most piece of crap I've bought!
It doesn't work half the time, and when it does it's great, but don't waste your time with this, I bought 2 of them, I sure wish I had my money back.
Stick with Google.

Was looking to upgrade our Echo Dot gen 2 saw this gen 3 with Ring deal and ordered it... Very disappointed it's not USE charging. We have changed several outlets in our kitchen to include USB and since the outlets are horizontal with our tile it makes getting a wall mount (which is an additional purchase) useless. Totally bummed and will be sending back, hoping Amazon design team will get it together... Who seriously uses anything beside USB as charging anymore!

First, I have 8 of these units and use them daily. I also have the Echo Show and Echo Plus, but those are in another review. These do everything the reviews say, but I'm using them in a little different way.
I'm using them across 3 different networks. We have 2 homes, with WIFI in both. We also attend Church, where we also have WIFI. I have installed the Echo Dot at our Church and at our second home. Because all Echo Dots are registered with my Amazon account, they all work TOGETHER. I can be at home #1 and turn on lights at home #2. I can also be at home and turn on the sound system at Church.
Since I also have Alexa on my phone and in my truck, I can turn on things at home #1, #2, or at Church from anywhere in the world. I find this truly amazing.

I was hesitant about having an Alexa at first. And I still don't love the idea of Amazon listening in on my household. But the convenience is pretty awesome. We love using it to play music around the house. The kids just shout "Alexa, play _____", and like magic it comes on. We also use it for our shopping list, which is nice to be able to just again shout out whatever item we've run out of and need to add. And "she" understands us all (even the 3 year old), which is impressive and more than I can say for other electronic assistants (such as Siri). I did have to turn off the feature allowing Alexa to purchase things for us as I am certain my children would have taken advantage of that. So, even with my hesitancy, Alexa has won me over! I'm very impressed.

These 3rd gen Echo dots are wonderful. These little speakers put out surprisngly big, loud and excellent sound quality. Voice recognition and responsiveness are highly accurate. Amazon had a 2 pack deal on these and I jumped on it. It was like getting one for free! I paired the two of them as a stereo set and added an Echo Sub. The combination fills my living room, dining room and kitchen with high quality, clear, rich sound. Great for listening to music! Make sure you space out everything correctly. Pairing and set up was super easy. Set up the stereo pair first, then add the Echo Subwoofer for the deep bass low sounds. You will be very pleased.

reviews.reviewTitle: Must Have Device! Will Change Your Quality of Life!
reviews.reviewText: Changed my day to day life at home. I was one of the people who though Alexa was stupid or just pointless in general. My friend convinced me to give it a try with my Fire TV and to buy some smart lights to go with it. Man am I glad I listened. Managing lights in my house has never been easier once the echo dot pairs with them, and when I lose the remote to my tv which happens oh so often because my dogs love to use them as chew toys, I can just ask Alexa to load up my show on Hulu no problem whatsoever! Alexa can raise and lower the volume on my tv, raise or dim lights in my house and so much more. I should have gotten one so much sooner. If you are someone like me who thought the echo dot/Alexa is stupid, please just give it a try with some smart devices to go alongside it and I promise you won’t regret it. I can’t imagine ever not having an echo dot in my household now. If using voice isn’t your thing you can also use the Amazon Alexa app to control everything right from your smartphone! So convenient! A must have device! Gen 3 is absolutely stunning to look at as well 😍!

reviews.reviewTitle: She's got me twisted around her finger!
reviews.reviewText: Got this and played with it over Thanksgiving, great music sound, very smart. Works perfectly with the Alexa phone app. But I really got it to control some problem lighting. Our house is large with lots of lights around the perimeter with only one switch in the foyer to control the lights. There was not a good way to add switches at other locations. So I got a TP-Link smart switch and replaced the outside light switch. Now we can say from the bedroom or from our car on arrival or leaving "Alexa turn on (or off) the outside lights" and it happens. After showing off that skill and a few others, and about all the things Alexa could do, my wife commented "she has you twisted around her finger, doesn't she". Yep! Oh, I forgot, this is a review of the DOT. The DOT is the messenger, job well done.

reviews.reviewTitle: The control center to my HOME
reviews.reviewText: I don't know how many good things I can say about my Echo Dot. This was the 5th one I've purchased now. They make great gifts. I have them in every room of my home. It integrates so easily through enabling "skills" with the VeSync, Sengled Home, and Logitech Harmony hub. I use it with routines such as: "Alexa, good morning" --> and it turns on my lamp, under bed lights, and tells me a fact of the day. When I say "Alexa, bedtime"; she shuts off my TV, turns off all the lights, and turns on my white noise machine. I love that it connects to AppleMusic too and my favorite radio stations. Alexa can pickup my voice from pretty far too.

Really wanted this to help remind the kids to get things done without me helicoptering over them. The reminders worked the first day and haven't worked since. Reset the device and same thing. Worked for 1 day and then nothing. Got busy tiling my shower, set a reminder for the end of my sons practice and by the time I realized it didn't remind me I was almost 20 minutes late picking him up. This was the feature I wanted most. Disappointing!
Came broken

reviews.reviewTitle: Improved sound at higher volumes, but no longer uses standard micro USB
reviews.reviewText:
Much more bass than the previous model, so sound wise it's superior in most situations, but it is harder to understand a very low volumes as the treble doesn't cut through as much, even when maxed out. It's also more attractive and expensive looking than the previous model, but a bit more obtrusive as it's larger.

I was disappointed that it no longer used a micro USB port for power, as you're limited to the power adapter and cord length that it comes with.

Really not sure which model I like better. I suppose the sound improvement is nice for most, but I don't really use Dots for music, at least not through the built in speaker.

Being brand new (just received) I am having a good time with the ease of playing my radio stations and asking questions to help with crosswords and such. I'll probably get over the novelty but it works very well and I think it plays loud enough for me. Initially being an older adult I had a little uneasiness with the app and probably still don't understand all I can do with Alexa. Tech people think everyone is tech literate but my spouse would have no idea how to set it up. Could be a little more plan and simplified. I realize it's more for the young but a few moments of simplification would be appreciated. Older people are more afraid to accidentally punch the wrong thing. Of course the system would like accidental purchases.

I'm in full blown consolidate and condense mode insofar as all of the gadgets, doodads and accompanying paraphernalia I've accumulated over the years. My sister gave us a 1st generation echo dot a couple of Christmases ago which we only recently set-up. I was in love.

The old lady followed that up with a 2nd generation Hub and it was off to the races. Getting rid of ancient radios and receivers; storing away albums, tapes and discs. The expanses of empty shelf space are just a beautiful sight to behold. Added ultimate music for $3.99 per month and I'm good to go.

Still figuring out all of the features but even so I am impressed with the convenience, compactness and the surprising sound quality. I imagine Google's is pretty comparable but either way I'd say go for it.

Took me almost 2 minutes to unbox, plug in and add to my Alexa app. This is second one I've setup this week for home use.

I've been resisting using Alexa since it was introduced, but received one as a Christmas gift, and even then I didnt use it until this week. now I have 2 and several smart plugs and switches.

Only thing I don't care for on this one (version 3) is that it uses a dedicated power connection instead of USB cable, but it works and sounds good for such a small unit.

Update : 3.30.2018
Purchased a 3rd Echo Dot and received it today. Took longer to open the shipping box than it did to setup. Also added several other smart devices and everything synced up and is working great.

reviews.reviewTitle: If your house isn't 'smart' what are you doing
reviews.reviewText: I have multiple dots in my house and absolutely love them. Leaving the dogs alone for a while? "Alexa, play Lord of the Rings in the living room". Having a guests over? "Alexa, turn on my party lights". Want a relaxing morning? "Alexa, play sirius xm coffee house radio". Getting organized? "Alexa, make me a to-do list". These things are just great. I have almost all my electronics hooked up to Alexa and it has changed my life. My lamps, tvs, sound systems, security cameras, and even my switches are connected and voice activated or are on timers. You seriously don't know how much you needed these things in your life until you get them.

reviews.reviewTitle: I love the DOT this is number 2 in house hy. old
reviews.reviewText: Okay. I first gave this 3rd generation DOT 1 star on a review, and said basically "THis thing Sucks", but here's what happened. I couldn't set it up, called the help number in the box. They said I needed to purchase a Cisco firewall for some ungodly reason. Really made me mad (retired programmer). Just decided to return it. Then went to Amazon help and looked for their setup app, turns out the app the tech support for the dot told me to get was the wrong one. I can't find a way to report this to Amazon, but I will continue to try. It was hard to find but I found the app Amazon said to use for Alexa and it worked just fine! It's great but the tech support for the unit, SUCKS!

reviews.reviewTitle: Looks pretty. Microphone sucks. Stay with 2nd Gen.
reviews.reviewText: 3rd gen looks pretty (the reason for the 2 stars rating), but just like others wrote - the near field and far field microphones suck big time. I literally just asked "Alexa, play Christian Music on Pandora", and the feedback i got was "Playing Christian Comedians on Pandora". "Alexa, Stop!". Then i repeated the request 3 more times, just to have the exact same result - definition of insanity, right? LOL. Comedy in itself is fine, but that's nowhere near the "Music" that i requested. My 2nd Gen array of echo dots work and respond far better. I advise everyone to stay with the older gen - they're cheaper, too (buy used, it's perfectly fine, too... I did for my last ones, and they're performing admirably)

After having my Echo Dot for a while, my lady friend really liked what I could do with "Alexa".
As usual, she heard from all the "conspiracy theorist" that the Government is listening in on you (please),
but once she got my gift. She loves it now. Whether its asking the time, setting an alarm, scores on your favorite team or having a routine (Alexa Good Morning... You lights cut on, heat turns on, and music plays) ... its a really neat device.
I guess if your a criminal and are no good, then I guess you should worry about "the government listening"... But if your a normal person, buy it.

When I first set it up, Alexa acted like my wife: she didn't listen. But after a few days I can mumble something across the room and she understands. The sound is not Bose quality but is very very good. The echo dot hooks up to my computer via wifi so it can be many rooms separated no problem. Have hooked up Pandora and Spotify and with Amazon Music I got all I need. I got it as a deal with Ring and I am more than impressed with both.

Last night my echo was flashing. I asked, "Alexa, why are you flashing?" "YOU HAVE A NOTIFICATION." "Alexa, what is my notification?" "A PACKAGE HAS BEEN DELIVERED." I looked out front and there was a package by the door. YIKES!!!

I used to have a 2nd generation Echo Dot in my bathroom, mostly for streaming music while showering. I found the audio quality somewhat lacking, so I’ve replaced it with a Home Mini for awhile, even though I could stream Spotify, which I love, I missed my Amazon Music and Alexa. During the winter holidays, I have upgraded to the new 3rd generation Echo Dot recently and have found that the audio quality is much improved and matched the Home Mini. The base is much warmer and it sounded more powerful than the 2nd generation. I’m very pleased with the overall quality of the 3rd generation and would recommend it for those who wished to upgrade their older Echo Dot for an improved audio quality.

I signed up for amazon music & with Alexa in control of my life - I honestly feel like life got better. Great music at my fingertips, functions, hears me well, she’s learning more and more what I like. I like having a nice personal assistant that keeps me on track

reviews.reviewTitle: A great way to start into the smart home era!
reviews.reviewText:
We purchased this during the $29.99 special. This is our first “smart home” product. We were skeptical if we’d like it and/or use it, but for $30 decided to give it a try.

In the last week, we’ve had so much fun with Alexa! 15 minute cardio workouts, waking up to music, using timers, playing question of the day, etc. overall, this is a great product. The sound quality FAR surpassed my expectations.

You do have to add “skills” you want Alexa to have; for instance, the cardio workouts. That is super easy to do though. I like the connectivity to your Amazon account too.

We have ordered a smart plug and are excited to try it out next, and who knows what else!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Does not work with HUE bulbs as advertised. You still need a Phillips Hue Bridge to work with Alexa
reviews.reviewText:
I would give 5 stars but I was lied to both by Phillip's and Amazon. Alexa does not interact with HUE bulbs as easily as they make it seem, and that was the whole reason I bought this dumb Alexa thing on prime day; wanted to control my lights. I dont think Phillip's knows about this either. On Phillips' site, they say that when you screw in the bulb, Alexa should auto recognize via bluetooth and discover it.

This is not true however. The Alexa needs a skill installed first to use hue bulbs. The problem is that the skill REQUIRES a HUE bridge. But the description for the Alexa v3 and the HUE bulbs both say you dont need the bridge. Under the description of the skill, when finding it in the Alexa app, v3 echo is not listed anywhere as being supported for the skill.

So no, it does not seamlessly integrate with HUE bulbs as advertised. And you will need a bridge. I even called tech support from amazon, which was a huge waste of 40min, and they were as stumped as I was.

First off the guy tried to walk me through everything I'd done already and wouldn't listen to me about what I had done. I'm a software tester and know how to troubleshoot thanks, I only call tech support when I've exhausted all options elsewhere.

EVEN THE TECH SUPPORT DIDNT KNOW ABOUT THE SKILL NOT BEING COMPATIBLE.

He was absolutely sure all I needed was the skill, but wouldn't listen to me when I told him what the skill page directly says:

"The Phillip's Hue smartphone functionality is only compatible with the Phillip's Hue Bridge V2."

Tech supports instructions:

"Wait for the Alexa to update since it is fresh out of the box then try again."

So I asked:

"So when the Alexa updates, the app updates also?"

Response:

"Well no. Because the app is through the apple/google store."

Me:

Then why would waiting for the Alexa itself to update, when the skill YOU ARE SAYING I MUST HAVE says it doesn't work without a bridge regardless of version?

Response:

Sir just please try and let us know.

That's when I ended the call. Useless idiots who refuse to listen to the customer. I'll be contacting CS and asking for a refund due to false advertising. I wouldn't have bought this useless thing if I knew it needed another $60 piece of tech to work.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great value speaker for the price.
reviews.reviewText:
These speakers are great value for the price with a few shortcomings that would make them perfect.
1- No support for stereo pair with 2 echo dots if you are connecting to it via Bluetooth. Stereo pair only works with a streaming pair.
2- No easy way to stream your own music via Network Storage. What is there is so primitive, I just dismissed even considering using it.
3- Apple Music integration doesn’t have all the futures you expect from iTunes Player.
4- No support for ITunes Match service.

Bottom line is that I am a happy owner of 3x Echo Dots and will add more if these issues are resolved. issues I listed here can be resolved via software updates and it is my hope Amazon will come to its senses and not compete with Apple Music service this way by limiting consumers.

I love it. I started with a 2nd gen Echo and 2 2nd gen dots, and have since purchased at least 5 as gifts. Compared to the 2nd gen, the 3rd has SUCH better sound. It’s still not as loud as the Echo, but it works great in my bathroom, even with the fan on and the shower going. I should probably be more concerned about the privacy aspects, but I sure look at it as a valuable and fun resource. I also love how you can sync all the devices up and play the same thing all over the house.
