I also gave one to my parents (actually an Echo and a Dot), and it’s great for them too, since my mom has mobility issues and listens to NPR for 12 hours a day. It’s really fun for them to be able to listen to anything they want anytime they want (for me too!).

reviews.reviewTitle: We are in absolute LOVE with the Echo Dot!!
reviews.reviewText: I got the 3rd generations in every room now. All because of the sound quality. I love these little echos! I use mine alot for music and the alarm clock. The kids use their for jokes, music, to find out questions about things for school work or just things they are curious about. I love having it because Inised to play music off of my phone so if I got a call or a text of course my music would get interrupted or if my phone died i’d have to put it on the charger in another room. So this is very helpful in that arena. Also we use the drop in feature when we tell the kids to do something, or when we leave the house we drop in on the dog so he can hear our voice and we can hear if he is barking like crazy at random people outside. Its really fancy to us.

reviews.reviewTitle: I love the alexa...but w/ my dot I am have issues with voice recognition with this particular one
reviews.reviewText: I loved my first generation Alexa ...I love how small this one is and how it sounds but The voice recognition doesn’t seem to live up to my experience with my previous Alexa ....more than 50% of the time I have to repeat myself over and over again to get a response even when I’m close to the unit I’m not sure if there something wrong with it or this dot version just does not work as well as the original. if the song is playing and I Ask Alexa to turn it down or turn it up ...Alexa rarely responds until I repeat myself three or four times but overall I love the products I think is amazing and I’m hoping that the issue is limited to the particular one that I have

At first my echo works really well, but after awhile the sound started getting fuzzy. If I turned it off and then back on it would fix that issue. Then one day I came home from work and the red microphone light on top was lit up. I couldn't get it to turn on at all or reset. I called customer service and tried everything, to be told it's not fixable and that they would give me 15% off a new one (since my 90 day warranty expired last month). Not very long to have it for it to break already.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great quality speaker, easy to use, love listening to music!
reviews.reviewText: I love this! Now if you’re like me and mainly using it for music you have to also pay for the amazon music unlimited monthly which was $3.99. It does have to be hooked up to WiFi and download an app on my smart phone. It took me maybe 5 minutes to set up, voice recognition and all. It has a definitively great quality speaker and the volume adjust well. Highly recommend, purchasing another for gifting. My 7 year old daughter enjoys it too. Alexa recognizes all the Disney songs and plays them when asked!

I love the new design.. setup is very easy it connects itself .. works great and it is really smooth on my nightstand perfect match next to my echo show 2 .. when i play music it fills up the room .. and sometimes when the show 2's screen is off i don't even know where the music coming from .. from the dot ? Or from the echo show 2 ? ..
The new echo dot is well made great design ,and looks good in my bedroom .. you won't have trouble to place it .. it looks good in the kitchen in the bathroom ,bedroom ,or livingroom ..

reviews.reviewTitle: Not as smart as they make it out to be...
reviews.reviewText: I have Alexa units in my house and, although it was the shiny new object for awhile, I've grown annoyed and disappointed in what it can - and can't - do. One, Alexa is not "home smart". She may be able to recite facts accurately ("Alexa, what is today's weather forecast" works well) but ask he to turn off the light and she will stumble because you have to tell her exactly WHICH light to turn off. Alexa isn't smart enough to recognize you are in a specific room and want the light in that room turned off - you must name each "device" attached to Alexa and use that "name" in your commands (ie., "Alexa, turn off the master bedroom lamp" - even when I'm standing in the master bedroom. This becomes annoying and means ever person in house has to adapt to the machine, instead of the machine adapting to the humans. Amazon's developers have it all wrong and need to rethink their approach to home automation...

This is my second Alexa Dot, desiring to extend my network throughout the home, I elected to purchase a second device. Still a great product, unlimited possibilities, and an ever growing "Skills" list allow connections and communications with third party applications. The only thought I will express is the change in speaker tone; the 3rd generation has more bass tone effect in the speaker thus with my hearing defect it is difficult to understand the unit. My 2nd generation Alexa Dot has a more pleasant speaker tone which is easier to hear and understand. Perhaps with time this issue will become more pleasant or perhaps a firmware update in the future may serve to improve the sound quality.

This device is small in size and doesn’t take up too much space. It’s light and easy to move, and it takes minutes to set up. You’ll get easy to follow instructions, in the box, along with emails and notifications right on your dot. For me, I’ve only had the device for a couple of weeks, but I’ve already learned a bunch of great things to ask Alexa for help with; playing music, turning down lights, turning down volume, weather reports, math, setting timers, and even jokes. She’s got tons of Easter eggs, as I found out New Years morning, when I told her “good morning”. She basically “woke up” and said, “what year is it” while yawning, lol I totally recommend this for anyone who lives a busy lifestyle, has kids, and can even be used for conference calls.

reviews.reviewTitle: pairing two as stereo only works for requests made over device over like music unlimited.
reviews.reviewText:
much better sound then previous version. very full sound.

however pairing to get stereo is a pain. amazons wanting to box you into buying from amazon music rather then play your own music in stereo kills this device. would prob be 5 star if it wasnt for silly things like this. not paying 7.99 a month to actually use these. if you try to play anything other then streaming services in stereo it will only play in one speaker only. there is no reason for this other then artificially limiting your device. so sadly these will go back.. well at least one.

I recently received an Echo Dot as a gift. I knew of them but wasn't looking to own one but I didn't return it. Eventually I set it up (which took me a while, I'm an old lady :-) I started out asking Alexa simple questions; music, weather etc. Then I synced it with my Sirius account to listen in my home. Then I got the Alexa App and started making lists; shopping, To Do, books to read....I love this feature as it all goes to my phone. I'm definitely enjoying this and who knows what I'll do with it next week!!

I like music sometimes& I like quiet so I find Alexa very handy for switching songs on and off. when people are over it is nice to have background music works and the dot works well with the prime music station. Sound quality is ok, after all it was a $25 purchase. I had no trouble setting it up although I did download Arek for the set up then promptly trashed it. However just a couple days after I purchased the dot I read that these are manufactured in China which I knew, but predominately by 16 and 18-year-old student working 10 hour shifts and earning $1.67 an hour. I truly urge Amazon to improve their ethics sooner rather than later

reviews.reviewTitle: We Love Echo - It Works Great as a Monitor!!!!
reviews.reviewText: We have four Echo Dots (3rd generation). We're using one of them like a baby monitor. My wife's mother lives with us, and we have one Echo Dot in her room. We've named that Dot "Mom" and another Dot in our bedroom "bedroom." All we do is, at Mom's Dot, say "Alexa, drop in on bedroom." Once Alexa connects, we press the mute button ON OUR BEDROOM Dot; the mute button has a circle with a line through it. That way, we can hear Mom, but she can't hear us, unless we un-mute. If you want to use two Dots as a "monitor", it's very important you mute the dot you are using to "monitor" the other room. Remember, you're muting the microphone, not the speaker!

reviews.reviewTitle: Speaker is not as good as the Echo, but good for smaller room
reviews.reviewText: I have an Amazon Echo and love it. I got the Echo Dot for the bedroom. I have tried to connect them for multi room use, but the instructions are hard for me to follow. Someone more tech-savvy would probably easily understand. I may have to ask my Grand children for help! Anyway I was a little disappointed with the sound after the larger Echo, but I had a Bose CD/Radio that I had had for years. The speakers on it are still excellent, so I connected the Echo Dot to the Bose (with the help of my son) and the sound is awesome. I love this little dot and may get some help to connect so that I can play the same music in multiple rooms! However, for now it sounds great! If you want bigger sound, go for the Echo.

Not like a high fidelity stereo system but sounds pleasant for most any room. Enough bass to not be a wimp. I found the 0 settings on equalizer to be best otherwise highs get harsh. Bought couple at $50 pair then couple more at that price a deal. Fills house with nice sound at about volume 4 for each - great bluetooth range. Also linked to upstairs and down stairs audio receiver systems if I get in mood for high fidelity sound. With Amazon music or even better Spotify this is great. Not as smart for information questions as Google Home.

Knocked off a star given privacy concerns given web articles about Germany cross user securit gaff although given all the crazy articles about that wonder if some of those are from Russia or other fake news....

I bought a second generation for myself for Christmas for my room so I could listen to music at night. I got a good deal and wasn't sure if I would like it or not. Well bought this one on a package deal (came with a plug) for my birthday lol. My favorite thing is the "list" option. When I think I need something I use to go look for an index card, make a list, and forget it on the counter when I went to the store. Now I just say "Alexa, add q-tips to the shopping list". My favorite thing, and now I go to the store, open up my list, check things off and if I don't get it, it stays on the list! Yes I love I can listen to music, ask questions, and laugh at my grandkids trying to remember the name Alexa, but mostly I love my shopping list!

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa's fine, we've sold our souls
reviews.reviewText: Fought and fought not getting this, then finally gave up. Now I love it. Set up was easy. My favorite trick is getting her to "announce" a message when I'm upstairs, baby's sleeping so can't yell, and I know my wife's downstairs and her volume on her cellphone is off. So I'll have Alexa speak a message to her. It'll be a fun trick to use around Halloween. My complaint about Alexa is her choice in music. Sometimes she's in my mood, and other times, she takes a wild left turn and starts playing annoying stuff, no matter how many times I tell her to play something different, the genre doesn't change. Maybe next generation can start offering choices? I don't know.

I'm returning this for one reason, the continued interruptions of my conversations. Alexa is nosy and gives her opinions when Im on the phone. She is only supposed to speak when spoken to and only when asking her by name. What Irks me is Amazon has known about this flaw but they won't fix it which leads me to believe they want to eavesdrop on us. Effective today Alexa, I'm taking the L out of Lover and its over, sending you back where you came from and buying a Soundbar for good sound quality and no talk back.
C ya!

We have several Echo devices in our home. We decided to try the Echo Dot 3rd Generation. I must say that as I was preparing for the usual unpleasant task of going through the set up process, the dot just kind of set itself up after we plugged it in. I was so impressed by that! I didn't have to do anything with my phone app. It just started working! We did change the wake word to Computer because of the somewhat close proximity to the one in our kitchen. Now when we watch old Star Trek episodes on TV Alexa answers. Oh well... The sound is much better than the 2nd generation. I would recommend this dot.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa! Where have you been all this time?
reviews.reviewText:
Alexa has helped me with many questions especially with how to spell certain words. I've heard of weird things other people have experienced with this item and last night during the Super Bowl I had a funny thing happen to me during the Beta Testing. As the commercial played my Alexa answered the questions/commands that were playing on the t.v.. It was amusing at first but quickly became annoying so I muted it.
I use this mostly to play music as I fall asleep. Brahms is my choice. This composer wrote very soothing music, better than any raining, loon bird noise relaxing sounds that are being sold currently.
The alarm strings work fine but I wish Alexa could provide a different tone. All in all it was a good purchase.

Hi. Went from 2nd generation to 3rd. Thought I would have to reset everything. It all fell into place right away. No password needed etc. It saw all my routines with no hassles. I did have to re-find my Bluetooth speakers. But that was a breeze.
It weighs more than 2nd gen.
Listens BETTER. Hence, no yelling at her, repeatedly.
I got white but suggest you don't. Fyi. Just a matter of preference! The speaker in it is an improvement. Less tinny.
Hence the weight. The power cord is longer and the power supply is rated at 15 watts.
I got the deal of the century.
A 3rd generation and Amazon smart plug for 49 bucks. VERY happy and recommend it . I think it's worth considering. CRAIG ☮️

I bought Echo dot just for fun, but found myself enjoying so much many things that are useful, line the shopping list and drop in to send messages, the call with voice meanwhile I am cooking for example, and playing music all around the house (bought three echo dots).
This can be extremely useful for senior adults to communicate with their siblings and being able to live independent and being checked, fir other disabilities it comes to my mind so many ways it can be useful.
What is kind of difficult is to configure... but with a little help it is worth the trouble and to learn the “hows” by those who don’t know much about apps, or settings.

Got one as a gift for my mother. While waiting for it to arrive, I went and bought one for myself at a local retailer.
Best.Decision.Ever. Nothing like asking Alexa to play your music while your hands are in dish water or having her call Mama while you are making dinner. Hands free is the way to go. Weather report, traffic, news, music and even compliments at a whisper.We love her so much that we bought another for the house and I even got one for my desk at work. She plays all of my music and radio channels that won't pick-up in my building. When the phone rings, I simply say "Alexa mute" and she stops. "Alexa Resume" and we are back in business. Lots of easter eggs and fun. She can answer almost any question and can even fart or bark on command. Life is complete.

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo Dot 3rd gen or Google Home Mini? I went with Google Home Mini after playing around for a week.
reviews.reviewText:
I know this is a sensitive topic and I bet some will disagree with me and some will agree. Anyways, don't get me wrong, I think they are both great personal assistant products and have areas where one performs better than the other and it was a very tough decision. It is hard to give either Google Home Mini or Echo Dot a five star as I think many would agree that they need much more improvements. If you already have a smart home setup and deep into the Amazon ecosystem and happy with it, then Echo Dot is most likely your pick. However, if you are new to Smart Home world like myself and is not tied into either ecosystem yet, then I would probably go with Google Home Mini.

One of the main features I love about Echo Dot that Google does not have is the 2 way Intercom feature, Google home had similar feature but it is not as convenient as Echo Dot where you can "drop in" to a specific speaker and start a 2 way conversation. Google broadcast to all speakers and to reply, you have to actually say reply. Echo Dot also seem to pick up the wake up word a tiny bit better than Google, just need to speak a bit louder. Both not too big of deal for me personally for not having, and I bet Google will have an answer to that in near future.

Many reviews compares how much Echo Dot 3 sound is better than Google Home Mini and how you can pair it up as stereo speakers... in my opinion, better sound may be true but only for listening to music because the bass is heavier, however, when it comes to conversation/requests, it feels a bit muffled because of this (some other reviews mentioned something similar) and Google felt more crisp in that sense. In addition, since I'm not a music enthusiast, I find Google Home Mini is sufficient for me; Echo Dot only sounds a bit better to my amateur ears and not enough to count against the mini; if I'm a music enthusiast, then I probably won't be counting neither to be my music speaker anyways :)... on that same note, I won't be using Dot as my stereo speakers. I did install multiple Home Mini in my house and I would just be playing same music throughout the house (different floors and rooms) and actually don't want it to be paired in stereo mode. In addition, since my main purpose of having the speaker is to act as a smart home/personal assistant, which I think Google Home Mini sound is more clear and comfortable to the ear when having a "conversation".

I also like the idea of Echo Dot's Whisper mode (Google Home Mini only has Night mode based on manually set time period) but it still needs some improvements... in order for it to whisper back to you, you really need to Whisper to it (speaking softly is not the same as whisper), so not really useful for me at the moment... :(

Last but not least, many tests/reports indicates how Google Assistant is head of Amazon, Apple, and MS when it comes to accuracy/smartness (which is definitely my main factor to consider for such a product) which I have played around myself with both Echo Dot and Home Mini and I tend to agree.

Above are things that had been pulling me apart when trying to deciding which side to go with so hope you find them useful when making your decision.

reviews.reviewTitle: Sounds better than gen 2 and fits our decor better
reviews.reviewText: It's an Alexa Dot that does just what the last Dot did, so there's not a lot to say other than the sound has a bit more bass and is "fuller" and nicer sounding than the o4 gen 2 Dots we have around our home. The more tactile feel of the fabric covering, and the shape of the new gen 3 feels more refined and less "techy" than the last Gen 2 device, though I was able to 3D print wall hangers for a couple of our Gen 2s that allow us to get them off the furniture. That won't be as practical with the new shape, but then again the new shape looks nicer on our furniture. At the end of the day, we are in deep on home automation. In fact I know carry a Google Home mini with me on monthly business trips to Ireland and the UK - I need an AI to talk to!

I picked one of these up for my girlfriend and was pleasantly surprised with it. I is noticeably smaller than previous Dots and quite heavy for its size (just for its size, it isn't really that heavy). I expected to have the same issues I have with previous echo products with getting it connected to the network. I plugged it in and suddenly got a notification on my phone asking if I wanted to connect it to the network. I said yes and it has work fine. Very nice update. I was a bit disappointed that it is no longer a USB power plug but a small round adapter hardwired into the wall plug. Nothing that takes a star off my rating but something to note.

Overall, I like this update from the older one that I have and the speaker sounds really good on its own.

I do not know how I made it up to now without the dot and Alexa. It has made me so lazy. Now, sometime I have to admit I would like to kill Alexa. I can give command and it just does its own thing. Most likely I just speak well enough on those moments but it can get a little frustrating to keep repeating but finally we do get on same page. Some reviews comment on sound quality. I think it is just fine. I do listen to some music but I am blind so I use the dot /Alexa to read book to me from kindle. I can have dot in one room and turn up volume and hear fine in other room. Soon I am going get another dot and link so that will even better.

reviews.reviewTitle: It is great except for sleep sounds
reviews.reviewText: I have 2 other Alexa devices and love them. I wanted to try one for sleep sounds but ended up removing it. I could not get it to play anything continuously. The "loop" would pause, then restart at randon times, waking me each time, which was bad enough, but on 3 occasions, it stopped entirely, requiring me to speak to it again to restart, which then woke my wife. It also kept offering me songs from Amazon Music instead of sleep sounds. Nothing I could find on the Alexa app or online seemed to address this issue. I really wanted to use the Echo this way and it seemed so simple to accomplish but for this purpose, the Echo is a fail.

I received the Echo Dot 3rd Gen. along with an Echo Plus and Amazon Subwoofer a short time ago. Of course you know I was excited to get started. You can see my reviews on the other 2 items when you look them up. They are more attractive then before. The set up is quite easy by going to the Alexa App on PC. The one in the picture is between the kitchen & living room and I also have one in my bedroom. The thing I noticed the most was the sound quality was really improved. Also the new design looks so much better. Not only can I turn my light off when I go to bed, I can listen to music to sleep by. If you're thing of getting started just do it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Don't buy if you don't have your own Private Wifi
reviews.reviewText: Not sure if I just didn't read all the details and information, or if it was just never disclosed. But I recently purchased the Echo Dot and was excited to use it. I live on campus in student housing. While attempting to set up my Dot I was informed by tech support (after an hour on the phone redoing everything I had already done alone) that my school's internet was not private enough to protect my information. I'm glad keeping my information private is a concern for Amazon, it's just unfortunate I had purchased this and was so excited to use it just to be told I can't unless I buy my own private internet. Which as a poor college student I don't want to dish out more money on something that's not quite necessary. Again, I'm glad my info and privacy is a top concern, just wishing for future customers for them to know that if they don't have a personal wifi it won't work.

reviews.reviewTitle: Better speaker sound but worse microphone
reviews.reviewText:
I have the V2 and V3 (this one). I set this one to "Echo" as the wake word instead of Alexa because the microphones on the V2s pick up my voice from clear across the house!

These microphones don't pick up very well at all. You need to be right next to it. However, they sound really good for music for such a small footprint.

I have 3 of these for playing music in various areas of my house. Placed strategically for Multi-room music (which is easy to set up and sounds great).

We have an Echo Plus in our living room, so we bought this in order to listen to music in our bedroom. It has very good sound. Since I already had the Alexa app, when the Dot arrived to my home, it was already listed so I just had to do the simple activation process. I did not have to add skills to it as they carried over from having the Plus.

A downside is the voice recognition could be better from both the Plus and Dot. If the items (software) were new, I could understand the problems but the operational part of these is not a new concept. At times when asking for a radio station, I have to repeat multiple times, or Alexa runs the wrong station.

I replaced an old Dot with this unit. It has had the sound drop out a couple of times. All of a sudden the light looks like it wants to reply, but it is silent. At least a previously set alarm one off. (I think?)
Looking around for solutions there seems to be two fixes.
1) power on and off
2) reset the unit and reconnect it to the app.
Option 1 is annoying. Option 2 is unacceptable if I ever had to do it more than once.
As this seems to have been a known problem for over a year, why is there no fix?
I have no bluetooth devices connected. My wi-fi works fine on a dozen other items.

I have a second generation. I'm giving my daughter I had it hooked to an external speaker which work good for that one this one really doesn't need an external speaker it's got great sound I have 2/3 Generations now one of my bedroom one of my office and I have the big echo in my living room echoing all over the place haha the great item I love it going to get one for the car too

I was looking for a full apartment speaker system and these very affordably filled that role. Amazon's prime music doesn't have everything but it does have enough that I managed to build a 16 hour playlist without anything beyond my prime subscription. The ability to sync them together and play the same music throughout my home was the big selling point and I will be adding an additional one or two more before too long.

The only reason it did not get the full 5 stars if that the volume control is flaky. Some songs are too loud and others too quiet. The voice commands to change the volume are not granular enough so it goes from one extreme too the other most of the time.

*Edited after months of use*

There is something to be said for brand new electronics that are only backed by a 30 day warranty and it isn't good. They need to be rebooted frequently or else they will run too slow to be useful at all and 1/3 has already had a power supply fail which of course happened outside of the 30 day joke if a warranty. I'll need to read the fine print better next time certainly won't be buying anything more complicated than cables with Amazon's name on it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Quantum Leap in sound over 2nd Generation Dot
reviews.reviewText: Got the new 3rd generation Dot over the weekend to see how it compared with the 2nd generation Dots I already have. I was not disappointed! The sound quality is MUCH improved, sounding closer to an Echo (but without the bass) than its predecessor. I placed it in the kitchen and was pleased with how well I can hear it announce timers and reminders when I’m in the living room. It seamlessly integrated with the other 18 Alexa units we have (2 Shows 6 Echos 3 Spots and 7 Dots) and collaborates in two music groups without any issues. Before, the Dot was a good entry level for just using Alexa, but now with improved sound quality, it contributes to music groups with greater fidelity.

I was really excited about getting this. Both my daughter have one and they love it. So I bought one for myself and absolutely loved it... problem being... at just after the 90 day warranty it started only working here and there. Ask it to play music and after about 2 to 3 songs it stops RIGHT in the middle of a song. Then you give it a new command and you get nothing. Plug it back in and repeat. I was told it’s out of warranty and they would give me a $15 dollar off my next one if I choose to purchase another. Disappointed in mine to say the least. My daughters are both working well... just bad luck for mine? 🤷🏻‍♀️ 3 stars because my daughter have had good luck with theirs.

Alexa technology is great as well all know who have seen one. You can play music in the nursery by saying " Alexa play ambient music". You can set a reminder, you can use it as an alarm clock, you can leave love messages for your partner when you aren't home, and you can ask her questions rather than logging in to ask google or siri a question HOWEVER you should be weary of this technology... she's always listening recording conversations in your home and uploading it to a cloud database. She is a machine with too much power over your life. Locking your doors, turning on lights, computers, and other electronics in your home. I don't know about your concerns about government intrusions but do your research before buying one and bringing one of these into your home. If you already have one unplug her when not in use.

I got 2 dots for the kids rooms, and have Alexa built into my Bose soundbar. the intent was that we all would be able to listen to different music at the same time if we wanted. Found out that we cannot do that unless we get the most expensive music unlimited package. So i would need to pay for prime and also pay 130ish per year for unlimited music. This product is not intended for families, if your single than your fine.
very disappointed with the money making scheme amazon has deployed.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love it - great option for people who live alone to reach emergency services.
reviews.reviewText: I bought this and other Echo devices after I fell following a hip replacement, couldn't get up because of excruciating pain and had to use one leg to push myself a little at the time to another room to get to my cell phone to call 911. My son was insistent I get some kind of "I fell down and can't get up" device. This is much cheaper than service you have to pay for every month. Just keep in mind you need as many as is necessary to be able to call out to it and that it doesn't work when there is a power failure. There is a battery pack available. I hoped it would be on sale for Christmas but doesn't look like that's going to happen. I actually hate to use it because this one is cute. Of course, I am enjoying more than just the security feature but others will talk about that.

reviews.reviewTitle: Shouldn't have to download ad-ons or enable things in app for Alexa
reviews.reviewText: I love Alexa and the assitance. Truth be told, I have one in my office, one in my garage, one in my kitchen, one in each bathroom (2) one in the living room and another unopened, because It's only a matter of time before I want another one somewhere else haha. All of that being said, this review is meant for the app/enabling features. I think if it's internet based it should be able to do everything that it advertises automatically. No going to your phone and downloading add-ons or enabling features. It's very much annoying. The world is too far advanced and this product is too far advanced not to already be doing this. --- Wrap up: Love the product -- annoyed with the software

reviews.reviewTitle: Very loud alarm for my almost deaf ears!
reviews.reviewText: I have trouble hearing, but I turned up the volume and asked her to speak slower and she did! I still cannot hear everything she says, but my alarm clock did not wake me up anymore, so Alexa has a very loud alarm that I can hear. The speaker on this thing is great! My sister bought 2 of them. I tried to get calming music for my dog, and it seemed to work, even if I can't hear it.

Very impressed. I got an echo dot gen 1 two years ago and love it. This year I thought I’d ask for an echo plus for the better sound quality and the hub would be cool but not necessary, a plus if you will. Well my gf got me this gen 3 dot based on price and from the second Alexa greeted me while booting up I’ve been blown away with the sound. I have a small home and the gen 1 did well giving me enough sound all throughout the house; this one is leaps and bounds better sound quality. The bass and mid tones are great with a bit of eq fiddling. I think the look is a nice improvement but I do like the hard corners of the older model. I am not at all mad I got the echo dot 3 instead of the echo plus I asked for (and it was $85 cheaper).

reviews.reviewTitle: I think the Echo Dot is a great little product!!!!
reviews.reviewText:
This summer we purchased the product Ring.com and with our purchase we received the Google Home device. I have spent way to much time trying to connect this device to my iPad Air and my I phone with no success. Once again shopping on Amazon, and saw the Echo Dot on sale for $39.99, and thought well why not. Received it not even 2 hours ago, and I’m all hooked up to my IPad Air and IPhone. Echo has played the songs
I’ve requested, watched a show on my iPad, and asked her the temperature outside. Unbelievable how easy the setup and use. I personally think this little speaker works great for my needs.

Our daughter's room is very close to the rest of our home, so we like to play some white noise to cancel out any of the TV noise while she sleeps. After doing some research, we couldn't find a noise machine for kids that we liked at a reasonable cost, so we bought the Echo Dot. This thing is great - it plays white noise, lullaby sounds, whatever works for your kid. I can talk to my Echo in the living room and turn it off/on without having to go into my daughter's room, adjust volume on my phone, etc. The speaker on it isn't anything special but it serves its purpose.

The only thing I don't like is how it sometimes cuts out in the middle of the night. I assume this has to do with a loss in Internet connection but I am not sure. A lot of noise machines work on timers, so having something that could play all night was big for us.

What I like the most about using the Echo Dot as a noise machine is that, when my daughter gets older, I can still use it, instead of storing it away with the other baby stuff. For >$50 bucks (goes on sale quite often), you can't go wrong.

My echo dot is for personal use only, and Alexa has been very helpful.
Some of the new things are "Alexa turn down the bass and turn up the treble and mid range" "Alexa whats the temp outside?" "Alexa text someone and send an emoji smiley face" Alexa play the soundtrack for the movie "Atomic Blonde etc."" Alexa how are you?"

The echo dot has been a fun and interesting addition to my existence and I plan to add a connection to my stereo soon.
I like that you can be working on something like a project and you can ask Alexa for detailed instructions on how to perform this task. A computer without a GUI to view but a speaker to hear is an interesting concept. If your in to technology and electronics I recommend buying and Echo product.

reviews.reviewTitle: 3rd Generation DOES NOT PLAY Apple Music.
reviews.reviewText: After about four months of phone calls to Amazon’s technical team, my two 3rd generation Echo Dots still do not play Apple Music. I’m told it’s a software glitch, since my two Echo dots (2nd generation) play Apple Music just fine. I am beyond incredulous that a company the size of Amazon can’t update their software for this device after four months. A far cry from Apple or Google, that’s for sure...and a great advertisement for Amazon’s competitors.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great way to dip my toe into voice activated devices
reviews.reviewText: We've finally decided to take a jump into home automation and decided to start small with the Echo Dot as part of a Prime Day special. So far, so good! It was fairly easy to get it to connect to my Ring door cam, integrate with my Sirius XM subscription, and to just ask it for some quick and simple questions. We are prepping for attending a showing of Hamilton, and my wife wanted to try to learn the music beforehand. She brought it up again this morning, so I quickly asked Alexa to play music from Hamilton. It was immediate and seamless - made her very happy! Looking forward to exploiting it's abilities further as we get used to it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent Device, A few tweaks could make it great though.
reviews.reviewText:
I love these smart home devices. They make listening to music so easy and fun compared to the days of using CD's.
I have a number of devices in my home from lights to cameras that I love to control with Alexa as well. I spent a couple of years using google home because at the time the google home mini had a much better speaker. I connect to stereos in some rooms, but others, like a bathroom it is nice to listen in the shower without having a larger expensive device taking up space. I have now had Alexa for a while and am happy I made the switch from google, but there are some things that may keep techie people from making that switch. I quickly realized (since I use these devices for more than the most basic stuff) that there are a lot of areas that seem to get ignored or maybe it just takes a couple years to figure out...

Pros:

- Allowing devices to trigger routines is in the works and is awesome! Need more device support for switches and motion sensors!

-Alexa is so easy to say! I would much rather be able to name my assistant, but this was well thought out compared to "okay google" (saying that command got old fast)

-The Alexa app is pretty good, it is easy enough to figure out.

-I can control my smart lights well.

-I found a great 3rd party app for integrating my shopping lists and notes (anylist). The shopping list feature was terrible on google.

-I love listening to music by voice and making playlists.

-Echo Devices connect perfectly to stereo equipment with AV to Aux cords making a huge sound upgrade.

-The price is great for all it can do.

-Routines are so useful, unfortunately this feature is mostly a Con for me.

-The speaker sounds pretty good, not quite as good as google mini (maybe debatable) but not far enough behind to be a deal breaker.

Cons:

-Routines need a ton of improvement. Google home had the ability to type custom commands into your routines. This allowed the user to string multiple commands together using one phrase. With Echo there are no custom command abilities, you cannot control most of your skills through routines. When you start playing around with it you realize it is very limited compared with google home. I don't know why they let them have the edge here! This one is tough to not be frustrated about despite the technology being so great. I could have so much more function in my smart home than what they are limiting us to.

-I do have weird server issues , mostly streaming amazon music. I seem to have to reset my echos occasionally to fix this (about every two weeks). I have a mesh wifi network (orbi) with great signal strength so I can't imagine improving on that.

-The devices have a delay in the response most of the time, I remember google being right there. I still rather say Alexa though. Okay google is an awkward mouthful.

-Alexa's voice volume really needs to be separated from the music volume. If you turn down the music you can no longer hear your assistant!

-I cannot continue music in another room once starting somewhere else.

All in all I think they have created an amazing piece of technology, and they are the leader here. I hope they start listening more to customers who use the advanced features. I do thank Amazon though because these things are a lot of fun!

Hate it. She just randomly stops playing ALL my music, then tells me she doesn't know what is wrong...I should "check the app" and give feedback🤨 She cannot understand half of what I say, I have to yell (I am a quiet voice talker) so I am flinging spit droplets when I try to have her do anything because I am YELLING. She plays games with me and tells me my answers are wrong...then repeats what I said back, as the correct answer. I don't have an overly strong accent, I do not slur my words, I do not speak ghetto or whale...so I do not know what is wrong with it!
I ask her to play "Hits One on Serious XM" she says "shuffling songs by Frank Sinatra on Amazon Music"... 😶 but.. I really didn't know how good Frank Sinatra is, so thanks Alexa!

Vice recognition is very good. Even when other noise is around, once you say "Alexa!" your next command is recognized. I find the sound quality is more than acceptable for me. So far integration of other devices is good although I have only added a couple of smart plugs and integrated Spotify with Alexa. I am contemplating purchase of another Echo for upstairs or in the garage.

There are a couple things that I have noticed about this new version. First, you will not be able to use it with some accessories, like certain wall plug holders or any device that depends on the diameter to be like version 2. The diameter is larger and the periphery has the speaker grille which cannot be covered up obviously. Secondly, the audio level, compared to gen 2 is lower. If you have routines that set the audio level or if you use voice commands to set the level, you will need to adjust upward to achieve the same audio level. My routine that sets the level to 2 needed to be increased to level 4 for the same loudness. I believe this applies to the Bluetooth level as well, which the Dot remembers separately. Not a big deal, just different.

I got 3 of these on Amazon prime day due to the discount, as I was not sure I'd really use it to be paying full price. However, it has been really useful. We have one in each of 3 rooms, and my husband and I both use them. The ability to turn on and off lights (with the smart plug) is useful, and the ability to play music. We've used the timers, reminders, drop ins, and asked random questions that we would have usually had to go to the PC to look up. We've also had fun asking Alexa the random things that some of the emails suggested. All in all, a great buy. I will probably be purchasing one more in the future.

reviews.reviewTitle: My first Echo ...won't be the last.
reviews.reviewText: This is my first Echo and first experience with the Alexa technology in my home. I bought it to pair with a LIFX smart bulb and it works great. I've learned to create reminders and routine. I like making lists that are available on my Galaxy smart phone also. I have created routines and still learning new things. I plan to buy another Echo--the larger Gen 2 with a better speaker to play music but will still use this Echo Dot for many tasks. Echo Dot does not have excellent sound -- and that's why 4 stars and not 5 -- but I am 100% satisfied with it's functionality and that it is an inexpensive introduction to the Alexa wifi virtual assistant technology that I intend to expand in my home.

As a long-time iPhone and Siri user, I’m super impressed with Alexa’s fast reaction and accuracy. It really puts Siri to shame. Alexa correctly understands my commands over 99% of the time and immediately performs them. I use it to tune into SiriusXM channels and my local NPR station, play music through Apple Music, listen to news headlines, get the weather, and connect to my phone for a Bluetooth speaker when I want better audio than my phone’s speakers. I also use it to turn off my tv (it’s sadly too old to turn on with Alexa, but off will do). Alexa’s technology and “skills” (aka apps) really seem to work seamlessly. It makes me want to upgrade my existing home gadgets, which mostly lack smart home features, sooner so I can fully avail myself of Alexa’s smart home capabilities. My usage is still fairly basic. I don’t use Alexa to make calls, or read or send messages/emails because I think some of those functions are limited to contacts who have Alexa devices, and others just seem like major security/privacy breaches waiting to happen. I also don’t use Alexa to do Amazon orders because I want to be able to price shop and know exactly what I’m getting before the order goes through. But overall, I’m impressed with its technology and capabilities. Shocking that Amazon beat Apple here so roundly.

reviews.reviewTitle: Better than previous version — Not the BEST
reviews.reviewText:
Hi, I will go with my comparison to google home mini.

Positive Side: Sound quality got better and voice recognition got better than the previous versions.
Volume level is higher than google home mini and also attractive with those lights around the speaker.

Negative side: First thing i noticed was the charging pin was changed from previous versions and no longer supports your android phone chargers. Not sure whats the benefit of changing the charging pin to old style.
Second Negative thing is when i connect it to my desktop it slows down the video and audio sync, i don’t see this issue with my google home mini.
Third Negative over google home mini is the voice recognition and search results, google home mini out stands in this category.

I never ever thought I would venture into home automation, much less talk to a "dot" but this thing is pretty cool. I'm not using this to its full capacity but what I've used it for so far is great.

I start it in the morning playing music for my dog when I leave for the day.
I can check the weather.
I have yet to use it for traffic
it will tell me the news if I ask but you have to set that up
it will tell me if I have a package coming, or if it has been delivered.
I can ask it to start my deebot and that is very cool.

So far it's been a good experience and the sound quality for the size of speaker - it's amazing.

The sound quality is mostly good, but it’s surprisingly hard to control the volume. If I change it on my phone via the app, sometimes it just randomly changes back to whatever it wants. If I change it by pushing the button on the echo dot it tends to stay there, but then it’s just kind of a pain to have to walk back to change it again. There’s a HUGE discrepancy between song volume and commercial volume on some of the amazon free music stations, and with some of the skills (notably some of the quiz/family game type skills). Alexa understands me 95% of the time, and the other 5% of the time seems like she’s having a small stroke and comes up with bizarre responses or skills. Regardless, I still really want another to add upstairs, and also an echo plus...

reviews.reviewTitle: Great upgrade from the Echo Dot 1st Generation
reviews.reviewText: Really happy with my new Echo Dot third generation. I’ve added my daily routine‘s and smart plugs to my home. Now I’m able to turn on my TV both upstairs and downstairs with an Alexa voice command. My TVs are not smart TV so I have them plugged into the surge protectors which is powered on by the smart plug. Love the new look in the sound is a lot better than the first generation. Would highly recommend to upgrade. I purchased this on cyber Monday for $29.99 with a free smart plug which is worth $24.99. Great buy.

reviews.reviewTitle: this new Dot is a joke
reviews.reviewText:
I have an earlier version Dot that works just fine, but this one is a real piece... voice recognition is good, but EVERY time I pair it with my phone, it says “searching”, but doesn’t connect the first time. when I try again, it connects. then it works fine for about 10 minutes or so before the audio cuts out. hitting play (Spotify app) then plays through my iPhone speaker. if I try to re-pair it, it says I’m already connected, and when I hit play again, it plays through the Dot like it’s supposed to.

never had these issues with the older Dot. unless it gets some kind of firmware/software fix, this thing is garbage.

fun fact: telling Alexa to shut up is pretty effective, which I now know thanks to how frustrating this device is. at least they got that right.

reviews.reviewTitle: These are awesome devices, everyone will soon own these.
reviews.reviewText: The device provides entertainment (ask it trivia, it tells jokes, plays music, reads E books, etc), provides useful information such as weather, travel information, news and it is also a tool when controlling items such as lights, providing instructions on how to do common tasks, recipes, etc. Think of it as a hands free verbal internet search device that can also interface with your physical world through controlling plugs and lights. You can set timers for devices such as turning on/off lights or small electronic items once, daily, weekly, etc. We now have three and an echo. They can play music independently in separate rooms or play the same audio through your entire home through multiple devices and the sound quality is very good.

Ok one I got this free with Sirrus XM. I am not a fan of this device. It’s annoying always answering when no one is speaking to it. It also does not get much right when you do. A little while ago I was speaking and could not get a response because Alexa keeps interrupting me when I’m trying to get a whole command out to use with my sirrus subscription and then when I try again Alexa said calm down. That pissed me off only good for a hockey puck keep this spy garbage out of your home. Phone call from Amazon seconds seconds seconds after writing this review “if you ever want to give our r&d people full access to the voice log they can help you with your issues” possibly helpful but invasive. Ah maybe the NHL can help the dot get further. It does look like a puck. The phone call left me wondering if I should just let go of prime music video shopping etc. I’m feeling more Apple in my diet.

reviews.reviewTitle: Eh?? Could have left well enough alone
reviews.reviewText: It's a Dot!! It functions just like the previous one with added weight, less flexibility for the plug which is not a delight. The handy holder I had for my Dot 2 will not work with this and that's an added expense for a new one. What I did not get is any noticeable sound improvement. Sorry Amazon, it sounds the same to me as the Dot 2. For me, it was an unneeded trade up. It functions without a hitch just like my other ones which I did not replace. The old and the new both do everything the Dot is told to do. After two days, I simply paired it once again to a better speaker the same as I had been doing with the prior version.

This was a Christmas gift. I never really wanted one. It sat in the box for a week. When I finally plugged it in, it kept trying to connect to my secure wifi without asking for my password. It finally asked for my password after trying to make many attempts. It won't play music unless I paid $$ monthly to play music. My daughters were really disappointed with that. Big $$ scam. They asked it questions it didn't have answers for . Sometimes the Echo wouldn't understand my daughters. We've had it plugged in now for 2 weeks and we haven't played with it since the first day we plugged in. We will probably unplug it soon. It's just not that fun or useful.

reviews.reviewTitle: There were problems from the beginning
reviews.reviewText: So when it arrived, I had problems trying to install the app so I called Amazon tech support. The technician asked if he could get on my computer so I let him. Then scared me too death! He started going into my system files telling me I had a virus (not true). I have McAfee and Malwarebytes and nothing gets past them. I was so scared because all I wanted was him to help me install the app but after the way he was going deep inside my system files I demanded he remove himself from my computer. I ended up purchasing Google Home and I couldn't be happier. Google Home is the best device I have ever purchased and I recommend it to everyone.

reviews.reviewTitle: Lots of fun and helpful too!
reviews.reviewText:
Fun little toy! Most of the time the echo is great until my youngest son learned to say Alexa. Then it was “Alexia fart” ever 5 min for the longest time. I know that you can change the name and I have cycled through all of them so many times he can say them all.
Just a bit of advice a 1-3 year old will learn anything that can annoy you at an accelerated rate. So think long and hard before you show them how to play a song that you like because they will play that song 9 million times a day! My son has almost ruined “Cary on wayward son” by Kansas for me and it has always been one of my favorite songs!!

Early morning, I usually get up to prepare the day and Alexa has my back. Reading me the weather, events, inspirational quote, and the playlist I love.

While cooking, I ask to her to set timers. No greasy or gross residue. During homework we play “classical music for study”. Kids have 5 min time out timers. I ask relative questions throughout the day.

And then of course at night. We may play a little jeopardy on Alexa.

People get worried about Alexa “spying on them” which I can’t say for. But don’t iPhone listen to everything we say to as well? Not sure if you’re going to think one why not the other?

Music - speaker on this model is AMAZING. Better than most Bluetooth speakers I’ve owned. If you have Amazon Prime Music. They haven’t missed a song I’ve asked Alexa to play yet!

We were given this echo dot as a gift. We weren’t sure how often we’d use it actually. But now we ask Alexa things multiple times a day. We ask for weather forecasts, when our favorite sports teams play next, what we should eat for dinner along with recipe ideas etc. The speaker is great on this device so we frequently listen to music. Set up is fairly quick. You download an app and plug the device in. My family also plays trivia games with the device which we love. There’s so much to do and the price is so reasonable. We appreciate the emails that we receive from Amazon telling us all about the amazing things Alexa can do for us. This device is fun and informative. We recommend it highly. Best gift we ever got that the whole family enjoys.

This is our second echo dot. My husband wanted one in his man cave so he could listen to Amazon Prime music while working out in our basement. The speaker on this new 3rd generation is improved over our 2nd generation dot which is in the kitchen. One great feature is Drop In. Drop In works as an intercom system between our 2 dots. If I am in the kitchen and my husband is in the basement I can call to him using Drop In.

reviews.reviewTitle: Software is difficult to use- Sonos support is difficult
reviews.reviewText: I have a Sonos system in my house driven by a Sonos Player and my own speakers throughout my house. I recently added a stand alone Sonos paired speakers in my bedroom to the overall system. Those speakers use the Amazon Alexa commands.The bedroom speakers worked so well with the Sonos and Amazon Alexa voice commands that I though I would try voice in the living room where I listen to music much of the time so I added the echo dot. It took a long time to set up a grouping of my rooms to use the echo dot and I am quite technology oriented. The software and the documentation is not helpful. I finally got it to work the way I wanted to by creating speaker groups that the dot now recognizes. Software was not easy to use but it now works well

This was my 1st step into this sort of device. While I'm still learning all there is to know about it, I've got some thoughts. 1. This is a fun device for starting your home automation journey. It seems to work pretty well and has been good at figuring out what we say to it. Seldom does it falter on a command. The one issue I have is the sound quality is marginal. It's pretty much all mid-range with no highs or lows. And no obvious way to adjust the tone. I tried to use it as a desk speaker but it just won't cut it. Also, I don't know where it gets it's weather forecast from, but it's frequently at odds with the local forecast as well as Wunderground.

reviews.reviewTitle: so far, mostly just for fun
reviews.reviewText: i started w/ some "fun things to try w/ alexa' (a story from one of my tech pages). when i started to try other things i thought i would find useful, i got many 'i dont know that' answers. ie; alexa, what temp to cook skinless chicken? (obviously worded better than i type) i tried some 'fun' stuff of my own; 'alexa, what time is love?' ( a KLF reference). many other neat things like when i say 'thank you' ( i dont know why i do this other than my upbringing) i get 'you bet' or something similar, pretty fun. but until i get a door cam or sonos or lighting controls, still just a play thing. tried connecting to cortana, not much use there other than using my desktop calendar, which connects to my windows phones. wont connect to my music on my system, or i simply havent figured that out yet, only pandora and amazon, et al so far. trying some of the 'skills', not finding much use there either, but i've only had it for about 2 weeks. we'll see...

Echo dot device came with charger and schema explaining buttons.
Apparently it does not have batteries and works only when plugged in.
But it works very well.

Installation, using smartphone Alexa app is a snap. The biggest part of it was typing my WiFi password.

Quality of sound is great and top volume level is very high - I would say it is too loud for me when my kids play their music ;)

Responsiveness to commands / microphone sensitivity is very good and Alexa, as a software, is very impressive.

I like the presence of "microphone off" button to assure privacy and I like the overall cool design of the new Echo Dot.

It is primarily used by my children and It is their new BFF.

I got my Echo Dot just a few days ago so I'm still exploring all its possibilities, but so far I like what I see. I stream Pandora Free, use it as an alarm clock and with sleep sounds (my favorite is Hard Rain), listen to weather and NPR news, and I've got a smart plug on order so I can be really lazy and tell Alexa to turn on the light over the coffee pot in the morning. I travel a lot for work and it looks like this would be ideal to take with me since everywhere I stay has wi-fi and I never trust the alarm clocks in motels (I've been using my phone). I don't consider this an "essential" item because I have other smart devices like the phone and a computer but it's fun to use and gives a lot of bang for the buck.

This thing is super awesome. Just what the doctor ordered. Except the directions are not very clear. A lot has to be figured out on my own. And the alexa app is very buggy. Like the yellow flashing is for notifications and messages. But how to stop the flashing. Had to read both notifications and messages. But app has no notifications section. Only messages. And alarm volume is separate in app from regular volume. And groups do not work. I had a echo dot in a group. Then removed it and now when I re add it the group is empty. It is checked marked but the group still shows empty. I even deleted that and added a new gruop. No luck. Still shows e!my in app. I even bought a second dot 3 and set it up. But still not showing in a group.

I’m now hooked on this thing. I use it all the time. She’s my cooking timer, music, lighting controller, back up to my burglar alarm, random information and alarm clock. Also regarding the alarm clock.... yelling Alexa shut the f—-up!!! Actually works at 5am to turn off the alarm clock LOL.... you can also say Alexa call (name) and she will make a phone call for you. Handy when your in the middle of cooking or doing dishes. I got another one for my 76 year old mother. Got her life alert and she refused it. Got her Alexa and she’s using it. If my mom falls or gets stuck she can now just yell Alexa call 911 and help will arrive.... got my mom three more echos so she’s covered in the entire house.

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent Device with minor Flaws of limited Info
reviews.reviewText: I use this product to listen to music, find information omline and have even attempted to find research information online. It works well for music as I am not that interested in loud music but rather, I am interested in music that plays clearly and can be heard as I go from room to room. For this purpose, it works well. As I am a Caribbean Islander, and though I have done the voice recognition feature with Alexa, Alexa still has some issues returning my selections or commands. Also, for research question on definitions of theories, Alexa can’t seem to return any valid answers. Otherwise, I find Alexa to be amazing. I haven’t yet tried Alexa with recipes and nifty information on life-hack sort of questions but I would love to at some point.

I ordered this on Friday afternoon and received it on sat before noon!!!! I absolutely LOVE it! This is the first Alexa I have had so have nothing to compare it to but the sound is great for a small device! Very clear. did fiddle with the bass a little but not hard to work at all. I had it setup in less than 10 minutes. I love it! The shopping list is soooo easy, just tell her what to put on it and open the list on your phone in the store and check things off. The timer is great too as you can hear it in other rooms. The music sounds wonderful too. Still have to check out the book and podcast reading. Love Alexa! Considering buying another for the bedroom so I can listen to the wonderful sleep sounds like rainforest and beach sounds. Also considering buying several for Christmas gifts.

My family love the echo dot 3rd gen. Ita very handy with homeschool needs and general things like music & weather etc. Set up isn't as easily done as one might think of you have a 2g and 5g connection you can hook up to. 2g is best but wouldn't work so we had to use 5g. Took a little while even with technician to figure it out. The only other thing I have against it is due to amazon prime alone. You pay for prime but cannot get music unlimited without it being extra so she won't play a lot of songs without it. Also audible is extra as well which stinks cuz that's a handy & fun tool alone for my kids so we use free sites for all the above but overall alexa is a nice addition to our familys needs. The sound for this little thing is amazing.

Yes, I'm aware that it's recording everything I say and that I have to tell it daily to delete my voice in the event I say anything worth deleting. But I just replaced my ancient, beat-up clock radio in the kitchen with this sweet little device that plays my local NPR station, or all the hits of 1991, or the weather. It even tells me bad jokes. Plus I finally have someone in the house that I can boss around. Seriously, the sound on this little inexpensive thing is much better than the pricier radio it replaced. I couldn't be happier. I haven't tried integrating it with anything. That's a little above my pay grade.

This is second one i Baught. At first, I was reluctant to talk to a hockey puck. Okay so I am old fashioned. I use smart sockets in some areas in my home. I have them connected to my phone. But I found out you could program the Echo Dot to them. I have gotten used to talking to it. I now command it to turn on and turn off certain things around my home. You can command it to guard your home. You can ask where your orders are. If you say good morning it will give you information as to what happened on that date years ago. You can joke with it too. The things you can do with it are endless.

reviews.reviewTitle: Much better sound and look than previous gen.
reviews.reviewText:
I'm very happy with upgrading to the 3rd gen Dot. I could tell when I opened the package the speaker had been improved by just the weight of the Dot.

Improvements -
-Sound - Definitely the sound quality has been improved. I really enjoy using my Dot to play music. The improved speaker has won me over.
-Appearance - I personally feel the new look is much more attractive. The softer curve and the fabric shell make it fit better with a variety of different décor. The other benefit of the curve is that the notification light can easily be seen now. Previous gens had the light on the top and you couldn't see it if it was placed high.

Overall I give this 5 stars and a big improvement over the previous gen Dots.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great sound, more depth than gen 2, and more reactive.
reviews.reviewText:
I had the gen 2, and upgraded to gen 3 after hearing it play music at a friend’s house.
I am very pleased with this device, the sound in a multi-room set up is great, and complements well an Echo Or Echo Show.
It is more reactive than the previous version, and the sound has so much more depth than the gen 2, the improvement is very impressing.
I also like the new design, it feels more modern, and sits very nicely on our console.

We use it every day to control lights, music, ask for weather, news, etc and has not failed once. I find the microphone more accurate than my Echo Show gen 1 sometime.

If you are looking for a screenless amazon device, I would definitely go with the Dot. It is cheap and does all the things the Echo does, with a sound close enough to the Echo. If you are looking for a much better sounding device and have the money, I would recommend the Sonos One.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is prefect for my garage
reviews.reviewText: I have the echo show, four 2nd gen dots and bought this thinking I would put this in my bedroom on the nightstand next to the bed. I must say I like the sound and bass of the 2nd gen better for my bedroom. This third gen does have better sound and more bass, but that is the problem. It has too much bass and I found that the thumbing next to the bed made it harder to go to sleep. So I put my 2nd gen back by the bed and use this 3rd gen in the garage. It sounds fantastic there and the added bass and larger volume makes it sound great there, as where the 2nd gen sounded to small and tinny in the garage. This is prefect for my garage.

reviews.reviewTitle: Sound Quality Sucks Compared to Earlier Versions of Echo Dot
reviews.reviewText: I received my new Echo Dot (ordered on Prime Day 2019). It was delayed in delivery due to the high volume of purchasers on Prime Day. However, this Echo Dot has the worst sound quality of any of my dots I've purchased. (I have 5 of them throughout my house and garage. I don't know if they rush ordered these from China and bypassed the quality control or if they made them cheaply to offer at the 1/2 price discount for Prime Day...but I'm totally disappointed. I'd return it, except then I'd have to pay full price (and I already turned in my better performing 2nd Gen Echo Dot for the trade-in discount). Buyers beware - you get what you pay for! :(

Yet another device that has to be set up using a smartphone. Be careful downloading the app from the AppStore. I downloaded two wrong apps before I found the actual Echo Setup app. Other apps that are designed to make you think they're what you need pop up at the top of the list. I finally had to delete them from my phone and start over again in order to get the Echo to work. I still can't figure out how to link it to other Bluetooth speakers - using it is not as intuitive as the ads would have you think. Still, once I got the basic stuff down, it's fun to use and convenient if you like to listen to lots of different types of music.

We love our echo dots! We bought one the very first night of Amazon Prime Days. We got it the next day and fell in love, so ordered 2 more. We have one in our kitchen, one in our room, and one in our kids room. We love asking Alexa questions, what the weather will be, adding stuff to our shopping list, playing music. I bet there’s so much we have to learn!

One of the reasons we originally got the echo dot, was because i read a review that people use it as a white noise machine for their kids. Which we decided to try out instead of using an app on our phones. The sound is amazing from the echo, and our kids fall asleep faster with the noise coming from the echo.

I’m really so glad we bought these! I was really worried i wasn’t going to enjoy them being in our house. Can’t wait until next amazon prime days to see what other Alexa toys we will score!

reviews.reviewTitle: I prefer it's predecessor hands down. It looks nice but it doesn't sound nice.
reviews.reviewText: Only had it a couple days. Music sounds better than it's predecessor but the Alexa voice is too bassey. Bought it in conjunction with the smart switch for a better price but I think that was a mistake. I say that because whenever I bought this it was $24 plus $5 for a Wi-Fi plug. When I go to return it it says that you cannot return something about a package deal. The other thing is if it's a package deal why don't they ship them together, I got the plug one day and they thought two days later. I would have no problem sending back the plug but when I look at my billing it's supposed to be $24 and $5 and for some reason it turned out to be $19 for the dot and $10 for the plug so I'm going to get raked over the coals when I return it - at least I think so.

reviews.reviewTitle: This Echo dot is one of 3that I purchased for me and all work wonderfully!
reviews.reviewText: I cannot find fault with anything ... A nice small size that tucks away nicely yet it picks up my voice constantly from about up to 25 feet away, the sound is clear and amazingly robust for such a small item. And once you research/Google what else this Echo dot/Alexia can do, you will find it is not only fun, but really handy to find the estimated time to your office or returning home that wok day, top news items from any of my favorite sources, add to my shopping or to-do lists,\ ... kind of wonder how I did without it. My kids bought my wife one for her Bd to try and we liked it so much we got these 3 more dots o put in other rooms of our house for convenience. Love this item!

reviews.reviewTitle: Dont buy amazon products till you read this
reviews.reviewText:
Purchased 2 echos and phillips hue lights worked grwat about (2 years or so still loved the products and bought a 3rd echo. In feb, amazon updated alexa s/w and it keeps adding multiple lights and in order to use it, I have to open alexa app, delete all the duplicates and then it works fine. Amazon tells me they wont fix it unless I pay a technician to debug their update! Really, How about this idea, everyone I speak to will hear this B.S.and how the google product works fine for half the price. SORRY BEZOS, you clearly think your customers are idiots that you can rip off and get away with it. Poor business model to break a customers product you sold them and then plan on charging them to fix it.I'm sure this is illegal. At least 100 purchases per year lost plus everyone I tell this to who chooses not to give their money to crooks.
Wake up Amazon, you are not too big to fail...

reviews.reviewTitle: Better Sound, Better look, but plug is now specific to the Dot, no longer micro usb.
reviews.reviewText: So far so good. Setup is much faster than the older gens, not that they were difficult, now it’s Bluetooth. The look has been cleaned up, curvy and a little bigger than the old models. Better color choices, I got sandstone. Although as many other reviewers have said it does pretty much the same things as the old ones but has Noticeably better sound and ability to hear you correctly if at all. Downside, they changed the plug...it’s now just straight AC with a bulky wall plug as opposed to the basically universal micro usb. I don’t know why amazon would do this. If they are saying it’s better, inside, faster etc. then if they wanted to change the plug, which WHY?! then they should have went tic USB-c since it’s backwards compatible, high speed data transfers and charging, plus people have them, now if it breaks you have to buy their one of plug... Will update any changes.

reviews.reviewTitle: Extremely disappointing Like the previous version better
reviews.reviewText: I purchased two of the new generation dots and replaced 2 of my previous generation. They have been nothing but trouble. If our internet goes out, they go out and don't come back on until you put them back in set up mode and go through all of that. My old dot would wake me up even if the internet was out. This one does but you can't turn it off without unplugging. The final straw was when I reset it up last night after having unplugged our modem to change the plugs around. I got her all set up and then tried to re-input my alarms and she said she wasn't set up for that. Basically she was pretty dumb about everything but the time and weather. I'm extremely dissapointed.

I’m finding it very hard to use this for many of the “skills” this is touted for. It’s not responding to commands. I thought it was that I wasn’t using the right words, but after fighting with the thing I finally called tech support. They told me I have to set up my voice and every voice in the house. Plus, I have to either create a different account for each person in the house, or I can put them under my account but if I do it that way, they can purchase anything off Amazon they want!! Then, I have a 3 year old granddaughter who is shy & wont speak up - not something that’s normally an issue but if I try to help her or tell her what to say, Alexa thinks I am saying it so it defeats the purpose.

So I have had Fire TV devices for years and this Prime day I decided it was time to automate the home. I got smart plugs and the Echo and some Echo dots and started to study how it all integrates and works together. The Echo can do more than I will ever need and it works perfectly as long as I don't mumble my words. Now that it controls all my lights,TV,thermostat, wakes me up, keeps my various lists and on and on and seems to know all the answers to my questions I am one happy camper. With the Alexa App I can add or subtract skills and customize my privacy. The sound quality is very good a big surprise for the size

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent for Use with Seniors Interactive Conversation and Updated with Reminders
reviews.reviewText:
We purchased this as a gift for a family member to ask about weather updates. One of our senior loved ones has slight dementia and forgets the time of day or time. We use these features with our loved one with the following
1. Simply ask the time of day
2. Weather Updates
3. Tell as a simple joke
4. Play Jeopardy or other Games
5. Play Amazon music for relaxing
6. You can set a reminder to take your pills or medication as a gentle reminder

We also discovered the drop in feature which allows us to drop in on another family member and have a conversation without a phone call. This device is a great way to encourage interactivity with conversation and memory skills for a senior.

I highly recommend the Echo Dot 3rd generation to anyone looking to delve into Alexa products or looking to update their current wares. We currently have 5 total in our house -- two 2nd generations + three 3rd generations -- and the sound quality of the 3rd generation is far superior. While the unit itself may be little, these provide perfect (and booming, if you want!) ambience for parties, endless entertainment for kids (try, "Alexa, tell me bedtime story!"), and a great & accessible hub for controlling smart house functions.

For the not-quite-perfect aspects, we've had a bit of trouble with the voice recognition at times. Not only does Alexa refuse to pronounce my name even remotely right, she often misunderstands (I'd say once out of every 5 commands) and sometimes has trouble connecting to the internet, even with a strong signal.

That being said, the pros definitely outweigh the cons (really, quite negligible for the benefits), and for the affordable price of the dot, this is a must have!

reviews.reviewTitle: Wow, significantly better speaker than 2nd gen
reviews.reviewText: I replaced the 2nd gen echo dot in my daughter's room with this 3rd gen, then took her 2nd gen for my office. I like the new design, the fabric looks very classy. I was blown away how much nicer, richer, and louder the sound is from the new one. When she puts on an audiobook at night, we ask her to turn the volume down to 2 so we can't hear it all the way down the hall!

I'm revising my review slightly upward. After a few hours (!!) of trying we got the dot hooked up. The problem really is the app - among the worst I've ever worked with. The first issue was that there were no instructions for setting it up from a computer, so I went to my phone and the app store. WARNING: there are several apps with similar names to the set-up app that are bogus - even one of Amazon's that just kept trying to upgrade me to subscriptions for Alexa.

We got the right app installed, but it kept glitching. After 3 times thru the process with no success, my wife tried to set it up with her phone. Same issues. Mostly it kept telling us "the device is not registered," then directing us to click on something which took us right back to where we started. She gave up and I tried again. The app finally directed me how to "register" the device, but that step had not come up before.

Amazon did reach out to me after my initial negative review and offer to help, but by then we were done. I appreciate the contact, but better instructions sent with the echo dot or available online or a much better app is really the answer.

I like the new look. I will fit in room decor easier. The sound quality is much better than the earlier model, which is the only reason I will keep this one.
The power supply (wall charger), has a larger "foot print" and tends to hog the plug outlet, especially the location of the exit point of the cord, not allowing anything else to be plugged in next to it. Also, the cord is permanently attached to the power supply, not allowing the same flexibility of using the traditional USB plug, for routing the wire. I'm assuming that is because the new model has more power needs than the previous models, and they want to be sure we use only the original power cord.
So, I will keep this 3rd generation Dot, but I won't be replacing my 2nd generation dots any time soon.

reviews.reviewTitle: So much better then the other generations, used as speaker for pc
reviews.reviewText:
I have had Alexa products since they first came out, and with my new pc (no speakers set up) I decided to get one of the 3rd gen in order to use it as a bluetooth speaker for my gaming pc.
Works great. BUT... If you are planning on playing a game like rocket league that is fast paced then it wont work very well for you as it still has a hard time keeping up, not by alot but noticeable for me. Is that a deal breaker? first off I use it for most other games and it works awesome, when i play competitive high paced games I just use my headphones.
Sound is much improved and responsiveness is better then my gen 1 large tubular Alexa. Overall for the price you cant go wrong.

reviews.reviewTitle: Just right for our needs and more.
reviews.reviewText:
The sound for music throughout our house is really good. I purchased three, one for each
level of house. The sound is so much better than previous versions I’m so glad I choose not to save $3 per device and go with the old ones. Use mostly for music and life loves it. Started using lists for shopping and try new things all the time. Upstairs one is between kids bedrooms and starting to try as sleep sounds. Also use the drop in feature and use as baby monitor when watching movies in the basement late. Using announcements too when time for dinner or time to leave, beats the heck out of yelling across the house. I’m sure I’ll get a few more or may try the Echo Plus for even better sound and move some Echo dots around.
