reviews.reviewTitle: My life will forever be changed.
reviews.reviewText:
I’m in love with echo speakers, I bought 3 of them +the fire cube and the functionality is incredible. I’ve managed to connect all of the speakers, and cube- and had envisioned being in my kitchen, watching something on my iPad and being able to ask Alexa to turn on my sound at and connect to the two from the other room (so I can play music). Boom guys. My dream actually came true. Not only that but I can be in my kitchen and say “Alexa, send a message to (name of a friend who also has an echo)”. YES. CANT MAKE THIS UP. Here I am, constantly finding ways to terrorize my friends (I’ve been labeled a FaceTime terrorist) and YET THIS CHARM has provided me another way! “Alexa, send a message to Hope ********” and BOOM. Hope’s Alexa gets the message and she gets to hear my wonderful recording. Some of my favorites are “Alexa- make an announcement” and BOOM- use this baby to project messages to all the other Alexa babies throughout your home! “Alexa, wake me up to amigos @ 7am” - BOOM. “Alexa connect to my iPad” BOOM. “Alexa disconnect from my iPad- Alexa connect to my iPhone” BOOM.

MY LIFE HAS BEEN REVOLUTIONIZED. THANK YOU AMAZON— I LOVE THIS COMPANY!!!!!

I have not found a fix for the sound issue with the Dot 3.
It's terrible the sound is so Muffled you can barely make out what is said music not clear. I'm not the only one with this issue. All the fixes on the internet apply to the DOT 2 not the 3. There is no firmware update to fix the sound. I'm so disappointed! You may want to see if there is a fix for this BEFORE you order this model!

First off, when my kids asked if I was concerned that people at Amazon were listening, I told them I had no plans to break the law anytime soon, so, no. I replaced my thermostat and wanted to get one that worked with the Echo. I also suddenly had an excuse to add a couple of Smart Plugs to let Alexa turn lamps off in the family and bedrooms. Those lamps required you to awkwardly reach up under the shade to switch them off. Now we just ask our buddy, Alexa, to turn them on/off for us. I have been enjoying the Amazon Music Unlimited too. I love paying $3 to hear whatever music I am feeling at the moment, vs using my tv and wearing it out. Echo Dot 3 has a sound as full as or better than my Blue-tooth LE-Bose Surround speaker.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great buy! Reccomended to friends, not reccomended to privacy paranoid people.
reviews.reviewText: One of the best Bluetooth speakers I've ever owned as well as the ability to request any song through Amazon music. Don't say your trigger word or it will turn on, most of the time it would shut off when it realized you were not talking to it. Sensitive but changeable trigger words. Teachable to recognize voices, unable to teach it to not answer to kids so they can mess with it. Turn off purchasing via voice to not rack up a bill with kids. Decently able to change settings to my liking but a few settings need to be added and changed to completely personalize it. Alexa is cool, the speaker is awesome, and I would buy another for sure at this price even though it's with the Amazon music purchase it was worth it!

I bought this Echo 3rd generation Dot, and I've hit to say it's pretty cool. I can tell Alexa what to do and she does it. It's the perfect quasi-wife" for hopelessly single guys who are a little old fashioned and really enjoys having a woman around the house. She's always there. To this point, While servicing my needs for 2+ months now, she's been primarily limited to playing individual songs, playlists and radio stations around the world on iHeart, TuneIn, Amazon Music (non-paid version) and Sirius XM. I enjoy listening to audio books from Audible and Amazon, and that's as easy as 1, 2, 3. There's lots of built-in games, latest. News, sports scores and more

. You can even order pizza or an Uber through this little darlin. Well, sort of, you have to enable her "skills," (then just tell the newest lady of the house what. To do or what you want her to do for you. I got a great deal before the 2018 holidays, but that's gone gone gone. Should've ordered 4.imstead.of 2, but hey I wasnt planning on marrying her, I was just taking her for a test drive. But, I truly fell in love. I'm gonna try this next, "Alexa, sweetie, I love you, bring Papa a beer!!!!!!" Will foow-up soonish on how that worked out.

reviews.reviewTitle: Don't Buy this Device, Buy the Google product
reviews.reviewText: I have several of these devices and they are not reliable. I just spent close to 40 minutes on the phone trying to get one of them to work again. That was after reading about hundreds of cases where consumers were experiencing the exact same problem. Amazon support is in the Philippines. Amazon is paying workers in the US so little that many are on Public assistance. Imaging how low they must pay workers outside the US. I will be avoiding Amazon in the future. Bezos is starting to scare me. No resolution to my problem. Didn't offer a replacement. Offered me half of what I paid toward a new device. Avoid Amazon and particularly their own products.

Wow! I wanted an alarm device for the kids rooms like their iPads (nice music, easy program etc) but didn’t want their iPads in their rooms. I had ordered, and returned, $20 beeping alarm clocks and saw that this was only $10 more so I ordered two and it’s exactly what I was looking for ... and more! Not only can they wake to nice music, it also plays them stories and/or bedtime meditation or nature sounds. This also works as a sound machine on loop all night... sets reminders for homework and will play games with them like “freeze dance” and “kids trivia”. Honestly, best purchase I’ve made in a while. I think I may order one for each room lol.

reviews.reviewTitle: Sounded great at first! After the first month...
reviews.reviewText: After the first month... the speaker almost sounds blown? I haven't been listening to very loud music on it either. It almost sounds as if, I'm listening to a radio station that isn't quite tuned in. Static or blown... IDK... I've tried unplugging it, reconnecting it to the wifi and completely resetting it. I need to contact Amazon and see if they will send me a new one. Sound quality is better than the other generation dots, I've seen. It just sounds blown now.

We currently have 4 alexa speakers in the house (Living room, kitchen, loft, bedroom). I will be adding one to our bathroom soon. I basically use these for 2 purposes. The main purpose is to control our wemo outlets (echo lights on). Recently we have started using the music group functions and it has been amazing. If I am do chores or getting ready to go somewhere I can say "Echo play 80s music everywhere" and the same song will start playing throughout the whole house. We have the gen1 dot in our master bedroom and the sound quality of these newer speakers blows that one out of the water. I will be replacing that older dot with one of these newer models. These are pretty amazing considering the negligible cost.

I love everything about this Echo. We are having fun with the "Announce" feature at bedtime. If you announce "good night" it plays a cute little tune. You can ask things to specific devices like "Ask Bea's Echo to bring me tea" or ask Livingroom Alexa to turn off the flood lights. Mostly I ask for music or details on an actor/actress that I'm currently watching on TV. The Echo is separate and I don't want to bother Alexa (but, sometimes I do.) I set Echo alarms, and tell all of the kids "announce" dinner is ready. This is an underpriced gizmo -- making life a little easier and fun!

I love my new Echo dot. I enjoy all the skills and the fact I can control lights and my box fan I run through the night with this device. The drop in feature is neat to talk to another room as well. I will say while playing music, the speaker has messed up a couple times to where the music sounds like a scratched up CD and even her voice is the same. If the issue persists, I will exchange for a new device. It happens randomly while playing music on occasion and giving her a break seems to fix the issue or changing the volume after giving her a break helps. She has also already spoken without being "called upon" one time. It was creepy, but I shrugged it off. Alexa is part of the family now and she has so many skills on the app store to utilize!

reviews.reviewTitle: Cool but Could be SOOO much better!
reviews.reviewText: It was an incredible pain in the butt to set up. It wants to communicate through my wife's Kindle rathert than it's own speaker. She has to turn off her Kindle. It also refuses to recognize other bluetooth devices such as my speaker system which I can access from all my bluetooth computers, iPhones, iPads etc. We could be listening to high end music but have to listen to the echo which isn't that great. I attempted to find help which in many cases amounts to a chat session, but Amazon isn't doing this, so it's a matter of searching and searching and searching. I'm still trying to figure out how I can get Echo to play through my speaker system. All my devices show my speaker bluetooth receiver except Alexa.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works as well and sounds as great as the Alexa.
reviews.reviewText:
Let me start off by saying I am not very tech savvy. I had no idea what the difference was between the Alexa or the Echo dot. I ordered the Dot. The set up was quite simple. There are step by step instructions on how to download the app and get it set up on your network. I had it programmed and up and running in no time.
I am so glad I went on and purchased this. I was worried that I wouldn't use it very much and it would not be as good as the Alexa. But that was not the case. My 4 y.o. and I love doing many things with Echo. Setting reminders, alarms , listening to music/ podcasts are just a few of the things we use it for everyday. My favorite is being able to listen to music while I am in the kitchen cooking. I can skip songs, pause the music and even turn the volume down all without having to stop what I am doing. I would definitely recommend buying the Echo dot. We now have 4 of them in our house!

If you're like me, you never think to turn on music until *after* you're elbow deep in dirty dish water. Alexa has my back. If you're like my husband, you want to hear your news while making coffee. Alexa starts our day. When we have friends over and want to question the validity of any factoid in the universe, Alexa is right there, putting strain on our friendships with her hit-or-miss knowledge. She tells our robot vacuum when to harass the cats, she keeps the delivery guy in check with our completely unimportant parcels, and she effortlessly redirects me to the app for half the things I ask her to do. She's just like any other member of the family. And we love her.

I got the product nov with google home mini to validate what is better ... 95thday my echo dot went dead... I contacted the amazon support... they simply said it’s more than 90 and they can offer a promotional credit of 15%.... and they even closed my report saying it solved .... bad customer service and cheap product.... google home mini is better ... it goes good

reviews.reviewTitle: Can’t receive calls. SUCKS. Besides this, it’s good.
reviews.reviewText: There are many things to like about it, but it FAILS to do the most basic thing I expected, which is to receive inbound calls from landlines and mobile phones like a speakerphone. This functionality is something even my $10 portable Bluetooth speaker can do.

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo Dot (3rd Gen) - Smart speaker with Alexa - Charcoal
reviews.reviewText: I received my Echo Dot quickly. The speaker quality is very good. It took me a minute to figure out how to sync to Alexa app to Sirius XM so I did not have to log into my Sirius XM account every time to do it. It is up and running now. Not a frustrating process at all just something new that I am not used to. I am still getting used to just telling Alexa what to do. I am a boomer and I think this thing is cool. I keep it up in my office. I have just learned how to sync my smart TV to my Echo Dot and it works fine. So I am happy with my little round speaker. I look forward to more wireless options in the future. Thanks

reviews.reviewTitle: Few things can be improved but overall a great device for its price
reviews.reviewText: I honestly been having a bit of an issue with the voice recondition. I would call Alex while in the kitchen but she would not turn on and I have my device in my living room which is right next to my kitchen. I also feel like the sound should be improved it’s not that loud at all. I wish it can go a bit louder. But honestly overall I am still satisfied because I use it a lot in my room which I have no issues with the device when in my room being that my room is small. It works great in small areas of the home. I love that alexa can do a lot of different things such as set your alarm. Make you a check list tell you the weather and ext.

reviews.reviewTitle: Would not work/no help with communication to return
reviews.reviewText: I have tried contacting for help, need to return this item. Drove to the UPS places by me, they said I would have to drive over an hour away to take this item to the place for UPS to scan the QR code. I could have easily printed the label myself but cannot since I don’t have the scanner required. I spoke to the UPS driver that comes to my house, he had no idea about the QR code to print the label. I tried repeatedly to get help and got none. Tomorrow is the deadline, and I am stuck with 2 items I cannot use. I wanted this to work for me and it does not work. Very disappointed and upset.

Really warmed up to the idea of having one of these things. It's kind of like having a smartphone in that you don't realize how handy it is to have around until you do. Voice commands work really well. It's amazing how you can think up so many different questions or commands and it automatically understands. Love streaming music through the house. Setting timers verbally while I'm in the kitchen and my hands have food on them. Great for reminders. Parents can also montior the sound in the house from a remote location through the smart phones app. Great if you have kids. Also helps my kids with their homework when I'm not around. It's the side of a hockey puck.

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice, but I like the 2nd generation version better
reviews.reviewText:
The 3rd generation Echo certainly has better sound than the 2nd, but it's too bassy for me and the audio controls (tone adjustments) don't seem to have any effect. But worse, it doesn't have as many, or as good, microphones. I can be in the same room with it and ask a question, and the 2nd generation echo in the next room will answer instead of the one beside me! It obviously hears me because the ring lights up, but apparently the one in the other room hears me better.
Amazon seems to have done the same thing that every other manufacturer does - they took something that was awesome and broke it by trying to improve it.
But I still love my Alexa!

reviews.reviewTitle: Wishing everything used artificial intelligence now, lol
reviews.reviewText:
I bought 3 Dots to use in the kitchen and my 2 daughters’ rooms. They have become our music speakers, alarm clocks, PA conference system, personal assistant, nagging reminder person(lol), dinner bell, scheduler, personal secretary and I am sure there are more things I have yet to think to ask Alexa to do. I love the “announcement” and “drop in” features- this makes living in a multi level home so much easier. No more screaming loud enough for my neighbors to hear, just trying to communicate with someone downstairs.
I also like being able to use these features from the app on my phone while I am away from home. My girls are constantly on their phones, so even if the phone dies, or it takes a little while to see my text, I have another option for communicating with them. I also love being able to announce that I am almost home and need help with the groceries ;)
after I’ve done all the shopping, they can do a little heavy lifting too...

These Dots can be very addictive;) Shortly after using my Dots, I almost told Alexa to vacuum the floor, but I realized she couldn’t do that... maybe Amazon will create Rosie the Robot soon :)

And... Amazon——please find a way to replace Siri— Alexa is a much better assistant!!!

I have had sooooooo many issues with this device. I have to unplug it almost everyday because the alarm continues to go off as some sort of defect. I have returned it and got a new replacement and it does the same thing. It also does not effectively work with looping. I use rain sounds to go to sleep and this device will not loop causing me to wake up in the middle of the night super annoying so I had to just create a rain sounds playlist on my apple music to go to sleep to. I just am consistently having an issue with this device. It'll play music when not prompted causing issues with my music on my phone. I have to give commands several times sometimes. I'm just more annoyed than pleased overall.

I own several of these dots in my home. I love the intercom ability and the streaming music. This one is the BOMB! I had an ugly clock for 40 years that would just never die. I needed to replace it, but never found one that was bright enough or looked pretty. This little gem lights up the time brightly -- and I have bad eyes. It doesn't leave a big footprint either. It's perfect on my nightstand.
As for the other capabilities, I haven't jumped into all Alexa can do. I must say she tells the best jokes.
But KUDOS for the clock. I wish all of my other ones had it now.

reviews.reviewTitle: You may integrate it in your life in areas you never dreamed!
reviews.reviewText:
I love owning this! There is no way I'm using it to it's fullest potential, though I've picked several things that I want it to do and it does them almost flawlessly.

I have personalized it, too. I went on vacation for a week. When I got home I asked Alexa if she missed me (jokingly). She responded that it's great to have me back lol

CON: I told her that I was depressed. She responded by giving me several numbers I could call. Knowing that if I were a teenager that wouldn't help me, I told her I just wanted to talk to her. She sent me to an AI who basically tried to force me to talk about movies. I tried again but adding that I wanted to hurt myself. She sent me to a different AI. It's not good at helping someone who may be suicidal.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa is FAR ahead of Siri
reviews.reviewText:
We are still learning all that this device can do but already, we are blown away at how far superior Alexa is to Siri on every level!! We are pretty hard-core Apple device people but Siri doesn't come close to what Alexa can do.
This Echo Dot is amazing in it's ability to understand questions, statements, commands, and it's capability to complete fairly complex tasks. We are going to set up a second one in another part of our house which will allow us to communicate with each other from different rooms and set up chores lists for the kids (Yay!). Don't know that Alexa will be able to make them complete their chores, but at least they can't say they didn't know what they were supposed to do each day!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Speaker not that great - But still love the Echo
reviews.reviewText:
This is my 3rd echo and I'm a bit disappointed with the speaker on it. If you put it on full volume or even on 75% volume levels, all sounds have a gravel/scratchy noise to it or like a bad radio connection. I have to speak louder with the 3rd Gen, as Alexa doesn't always hear me like the 2nd Gen with the same ambient noise levels or no noise at all.

This is not to say, I don't like Echo's, I love them all and am now finding it inconvenient when they are not available to me (when my internet goes out) or that others don't have them in their homes/apartments. I've gone so far as to purchase multiple echo's for my Parents and my Sister so that when I visit them, I can ask Alexa to do things for me.

reviews.reviewTitle: Do Not Miss This Great Kitchen product
reviews.reviewText: I was kind of fearful in spending $90 on anything that I was not 100% totally in to.. I read some not so good reviews and found most of them were from folks that did not read instructions. Such an important thing to do. I also read lots of good reviews. So I got the 3 qt pot on sale and soooo glad that I did and it is the most useful pot that I own. I tossed out several pots and pans and an old fashioned pressure cooker...never go back to that one. the only thing that I wish they added was the clear lid. That should have been a no brainer..was adding a vege steamer.. oh well one more way they can get your money. lol but at least you are getting a good product for it. It is irreplaceable.....

Love that the sound is so much better than the last Echo Dot. Looks nicer too. Same old Alexa, of course.

VERY disappointed that the plug has been changed from USB to proprietary. Not only does this mean that any problems with the cable will require a special buy, but the new plug is too big to fit nicely on a power strip. Since I have several USB ports on my power strip this was especially disappointing because instead of using one of my convenient USB ports I've had to switch to an oversize plug.

I got an Amazon Echo for Christmas, and love everything it does. Speaker, for the size and cost, sounds great. Even if the TV is on or other people are talking loudly, it still hears it's name and responds flawlessly. So I got this Dot to go in my office with the intention of piping the same music around the house - with the intention of getting more. What I find is that I don't really want them to be playing the same thing. If I'm working, I can have something playing and my wife can use the Echo for what she wants. Multiple assistants! Again, for the price ($30!) it sounds great and works flawlessly. (I give it 5 stars in sound quality only because it is so cheap. If this cost $100, I'd probably only say 3 1/2 stars.) Couldn't be more happy with these Amazon products.

reviews.reviewTitle: 3.5mm jack output volume is disturbingly LOW
reviews.reviewText:
I would give this five stars. The sound quality through the internal speaker is vastly superior to the old Dot, and almost comparable with a full Echo. Definitely good enough to listen to music through the internal speaker.

However, the volume output on the 3.5mm jack is about 50% of the volume that was delivered by previous gen of the Echo Dot. What's up with that? I formerly used an older Dot on powered speakers (PreSonus Eris E3.5) and I used to be able to set the volume at 50%. With this new 3rd gen Dot, I have to set the volume to 100% to get the same volume.

So, all other things being equal, it would seem this new Dot robs your system (if using 3.5mm) of half its power. That's quite a crime.

We have several Echo Dots all over our home (one in each bedroom, as well as our study, and garage. Our big Echo is in the living room and the only one we use to play music.

I like the convenience of having a Dot in other rooms because we use it to control our Phillips Hue light system and can turn on lights from any room in the house. It also makes it easy to add something to my shopping list if I think of something in a room separate from where I would keep my list.

I have the solid black, solid white, and this charcoal grey. I like that you can get different colors to match the decor in each room. As for the sound it really isn't bad, but just not as robust as the larger Echo device.

reviews.reviewTitle: Speaker blew out after a couple months of minimal, non-max-volume use.
reviews.reviewText:
I loved having music I could control by voice, and played music through this Dot about 2 hours per week total, in 30-minute chunks, with volume between 3 and 6 (out of 10 max). Today I noticed a singer's "S" sounds were fuzzy and blown out on a familiar song; I tried other songs, and sure enough, the speaker was blown out. This seems unreasonable, as I never even played at the max volume, not for extended periods of time, etc.

The item is beyond its return window. I would appreciate if Amazon contacted me about alternatives. I have two other Dots (same model) and am worried the same thing will happen.

I bought this because the radio in the kitchen was getting difficult to reach due to back problems. Now, simple voice commands get me the radio station or information I want. I had problems setting it up using my phone and my tablet, but the laptop worked well. It does not always give you what you want, however. I asked it to play "Who's on first?" and it started playing some odd music and then offered me an Audible subscription. After I said "no," it played one of the intros to my request, but stopped after three seconds. I'll try again.

Other than that, I consider it a good investment.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not Portable-stuck to needing an A/C plugin. Everything else is amazing!
reviews.reviewText:
If we had only met sooner!!! Love Alexa and the ease she has brought to our lives. She answers pretty much any question we ask. She tells jokes. The Echo Dot speaker sound quality is great for its small size. Any recipe I ask for Alexa gives it to me, same with calculated measurements and changing liters to quarts, etc.
Only downfall that it has, and is why it didn’t get 5 Stars, is this convenient little pod of information is NOT portable and I cannot even attach it to a battery pack because there isn’t one for the 3rd Gen Echo Dot!! This is frustrating when the greater part of my time at home is spent OUTSIDE the house and around the yard. So AMAZON ......get this 3rd Gen a portable battery!! Please :-)

reviews.reviewTitle: Bluetooth setup, can use 5g, sound is a bit muffled
reviews.reviewText:
This is MUCH larger than the 1st and 2nd gen. Sound is a little more muted than the previous iterations. So it was a 4 star for me. However, two MAJOR differences make this a 5 star.
1. You can use Bluetooth to set up. Using Wifi to previously setup was sometimes a real PITA. Much, MUCH easier now.
2. Works with 5GHz as well as 2.2GHz. Nowadays, there's so many things that use the 2.4 band (including your microwave!) that the bandwidth gets used up and everything slows down. A definite improvement.
The sound quality at normal volumes is less sharp than the previous gen dots. Slightly more bass- but nothing like the Echo's bass, and fewer highs. Sounds like it's under a pillow most of the time.

Surprised me how good voice recognition is. I asked "her": "Alexa, what is non-Euclidean Geometry". She immediately gave a brief, but satisfactory answer. Sound quality is excellent for her size, but... well, there's only so much you can do with a "dot". You can add speakers, either blue tooth, or direct, so if it matters, no problem. Only real problem so far: my wife is paranoid that "she" is listening all the time.... so she unplugs Alexa when she's not using it. Not that anyone could ever possibly care what we talk about! We've only had her for a couple days, but several times I would have liked to ask her stuff when she was unplugged. amazing price, amazing product.

I thought when buying the Dot(3rd Gen) it would be easy to connect and start using immediately. However, one big problem, that seems to happen all the time, is that the modem needs to be set at 5ghz to 129. I found this info in the internet after trying to set my Dot up but it will not hold the WiFi form more than a few minutes. Since my modem is set to 5.0 ghz, through Spectrum Cable, I cannot acquire the necessary ghz to operate my Dot.
If you have any knowledge to help please advise.
David Bornhorst

reviews.reviewTitle: How did I live without Alexa?
reviews.reviewText: I have this Echo Dot in my kitchen and I love Alexa! When I make my morning coffee, I listen to my flash briefing. Before I leave for work, Alexa tells me the weather for the day. When I’m cooking, Alexa can set a timer for me when my hands are dirty. Alexa reminds me every Saturday morning to water my plants. I can create grocery lists with Alexa and the list will be on my phone when I’m at the grocery store. Alexa can play my music from Spotify or play numerous playlists from amazon music. I personally like the cooking with classic soul I think it’s called. You can play games/quizzes with Alexa and she can tell you nerdy or corny jokes, which are funny to me.

This is my 2nd dot. I had the 2nd generation version which lasted 367 days. It stoped working and I had to replace it. Unfortunately it was off the 1 year warranty. Amazon was kind enough to give me a 50% discount on the replacement. The jury is out on this unit and hopefully it will not have the issues the other one had. Hence 3 stares. I have 5 Alexa devices in the home a enjoy the convenience they offer.

reviews.reviewTitle: Potentially good. Needs heavy involvement to be useful.
reviews.reviewText:
The setup was simple though we had a couple hiccups connecting to our WiFi at first. Whether we blame Amazon or our provider, I don't know. The premise to call upon Alexa to answer our questions and perform tasks for us is very neat but "she" basically answers from Wikipedia. A good portion of the time, she simply "has no opinion" or "cannot find info related to that".

To get the best out of Alexa, it appears you would need to purchase subscriptions that she can contact for you, like music or other entertainment. With time, money, and knowledge, one can probably make Alexa into a virtual assistant to be fawned over. For us regular folk, I feel it is too extravagant a venture.

I love my Dots! I first bought an Amazon Echo and loved it so much that I purchased 2 Dots, a black form my bedroom and a white one for my bathroom. If I’m not asking Alexa to play music, I’m asking her to tell me a joke or the meaning of a word or countless other tasks. One morning driving to work, my routine after a certain stretch of road, I pray to God, giving thanks, asking to get me to work safely and on time, what’s on my mind, etc. This morning as I reached my “prayer zone” I started by saying, “Alexia”. I immediately caught myself and burst out laughing! I always start with “God, thank you for my life ...” Since God has a great sense of humor, I bet there was a little more laughter in heaven that morning.

reviews.reviewTitle: Loved it so much I bought more!
reviews.reviewText: My electric company gave me one as a promo. I loved it so much are order more for the rest of the house.. and since they have lowered the price it was easy! I listen to Amazon music and the speaker quality is excellent for such a small speaker. It doesn't take up much room but the sound is good. The reminders and alarms that are voice activated are so helpful. Alexa remind me in 10 minutes to take dinner out of the oven. Alexa wake me up at 6 in the morning..so easy and so helpful. really where are you going to find a quality speaker to listen to radio or music for that price... And have Alexa too.

first of all when I tried to order them they were out of stock and I'm back order however I did receive it in the time specified. I would also like to add is that the new 3rd Generation Echo Dot has a heavier bass sound to it but unlike the first and second generation the 3rd Generation has audio settings on the Alexa app which is outstanding. It is of course a bit larger than the old generation dots and it seems to pick up voice commands much easier over music that is playing from it because that was a problem that I had with the old generation dots. I would recommend that their Generations over the first or second easily and I did it using the trade-in program provided by Amazon.

A Notch up from the last Generation. Great concept,Great product. Dose have its pro's and con's. Let's start with the Pro's : The sound quality greatly improved,although it dose have bluetooth that enables you to connect to near by bluetooth speakers, output jack port for direct plug in also. Very handy for general information, asking date and time, setting alarms and reminders from both the unit itself or your cell phone. Businesses time of operations,location and phone number, weather,general technical or historical information: spelling,mathematic ,measurement and weight conversions, geographical statistics as some examples. Plays music on demand from play lists ,unit to unit calling or even calls to your contacts or even your phone if lost/missplaced. Smart home integration with some devices and appliances,sometimes with aid of a specialized seperate device.
Cons : My biggest issue is the inconsistentency of its listening ability.
My opinion: Over all great product and concept . I just hope that software updates continue and hardware updates with newer technology continue as newer models are released.

reviews.reviewTitle: No Sirius to Alexa device streaming >2 months now
reviews.reviewText:
The device itself works fine with whole house integration - lights, alarms, connectivity all fine. The ding 1-star rating is due to the continued false advertising by Amazon and Sirius on streaming ability. Since early March, Amazon Alexa devices haven't been able to stream from Sirus. Amazon is aware (have the emails from customer service), Sirius is aware (no email/ticket, but a nice promotional offer to 'offset' the disconnect.

What really bugs me is the lack of public acknowledgement from either company. Just a couple of weeks ago, got a postcard advertising the ease of streaming Sirius to Alexa devices - while in truth it hasnt worked in over 2 months! And there's no date proposed for when it will work again (from Sirius Account Specialist), yet both companies continue to advertise sirius streaming as a feature.

For pete's sake, at least have the decency to inform your customers of known issues.

reviews.reviewTitle: It’s like having an invisible personal assistant in the room with you!!
reviews.reviewText: I got the echo dot 3 with a smart plug and plugged my Xmas tree into the plug and I use Alexa to program when my Xmas tree lights turn on and off and I can also just ask Alexa to turn on or off my smart plug. That alone is worth it! Using My echo dot 3 for so many other things. It’s like having an invisible personal assistant in the room with you. Don’t have to teach for pen and paper or my phone and open my notes app anymore!! I just ask Alexa to add to my shopping list or remove an item and it’s done! My husband can even play rock paper scissor with Alexa! And we both love the sleep sounds every night our favorite is city rain! My husband was joking around and asked Alexa “what do I do about my stomach ache today” alexa rattled off a list of things! We looked at each other” like wow pretty cool! I’m going to order another smart plug maybe 2 and also get my husband his own echo dot 3 to put in his home office so he’ll leave my personal assistant (Alexa) alone. Lol then we’ll have one on each end of our house :) definitely definitely would recommend!

I needed to extend my Echo 2nd generations range since we have recently added a new room to our home, quite a distance from where I keep Echo. I got a kick out of telling Alexa to "Order me a dot", during the last big Amazon sale. It was so fast to do, and fun to actually have her do it for me!
My new dot is wonderful. It takes up a minimum of space and is perfect for our office addition. I use both mostly for background music, and my new Dot sounds so similar to my larger Echo, that I forget the music is coming from the newer, smaller model. I am more than pleased with the Dot.

surprisingly good voice recognition; our grandson demo'd the "are you smarter than a fifth grader" feature of the "dot", which worked very nicely and was fun. Haven't used it to integrate Alexa controlled devices like lightbulbs for instance, so cannot comment on that feature. Sound is very warm, almost too bassy, but is overall pretty easily understood. Volume of sound is surpisingly strong from such a small device. It has some "heft" to it, being much heavier than one would suspect from just looking at it. Overall, we like it and it was priced nicely on the Amazon shopping day recently offered.

reviews.reviewTitle: Super stellar Sonic hearing ability never fails to amaze
reviews.reviewText: This product is clearly ingenious. It's basically the computer you don't have to type into did that responds instantly and is native in the fact that it will adapt to your style of interaction. It's not without its quirks, but I feel that once I learned better how to use the Alexa app everything will be groovy. The ability for voice recognition above my blasting of whatever music and background noise and the like is probably the most interesting thing to me, although there are so many thousands of things that you can do with this item I'm sure you'll find something less dorky. I also purchased a second generation Echo and the sound quality is only slightly marginally better, I wouldn't say it's louder, just more Bass. Additionally, despite it having more microphones for voice recognition it fails to pick up like the 3rd generation Echo dot does. I'm still trying to learn what all the light rings in flashing mean but I find it entertaining to look at. I'm 100% not concerned about the fact that there's a microphone in my house listening to me all the time, I do not believe that there is malice intent nor even really ability to utilize something such as this in a negative fashion against somebody. Plus the worst thing it could hear is me talking on the phone with my sisters. Hope I helped.

reviews.reviewTitle: I love the new Alexa Dot
reviews.reviewText: I had the first generation Alexa dot, and I liked it very much. I gave it to my granddaughter and she figured out she could call me on it. She doesn't have a phone. She's only 9. But, this new one, I LOVE! I really appreciate the sound quality. I have played all genres of music on it, and the sound is great. Of course, if you are a purest, I'm sure you could find problems with it. But, for me, and just working around the house, I love the way it sounds. I got the Echo Dot and an Amazon Fire stick in a bundle at Target for around $60 with the discounts. I'm really happy with my purchase!

This 3rd generation device replaced a second gen in our master bedroom. We found the audio quality to be much better than its older sibling, however, it really doesn't compare to the full size Echo devices. To save on night stand real estate we decided to purchase a wall mounting device. Surprisingly, mounting the DOT on a wall outlet resulted in a significant deterioration of sound quality. Adjusting the equalization via the Alexa app didn't help. It's unclear whether the resulting boominess of the audio is due to the mounting device or the wall placement. Since we only use the bedroom DOT for command and news purposes the sound quality issue isn't a big deal for us. Functionally it works very well.

I was very excited for this new version but I find it more often than not frustrating. I could give the version 2 commends walking past it, this one I have to stand in front of it and speak loud and slowly.
I have three echo devices and I have to talk so loud to this one while I am downstairs where it is that the two upstairs hear me and respond more regularly that this one does.

But it looks better and I got a deal on it at Christmas so I left it.

I don't know if mine is defective or Amazon focused so much on the speakers that something got left out of the microphones.

It does look much better though, but looks aren't everything.

Game changer for my Dad who has Parkinson’s. It’s very “Harry Potter-esque” to have a beautiful little device with lovely descriptive colors do your bidding from playing music, to answering questions, to simply being able to verbally place a phone call and literally talk - and then hang up without lifting a finger! I will be adding more throughout the house. Plus, I can do things like turn the music off with the app remotely from my phone without having to run around, and I can imagine all the other jobs it will streamline as well. Just wonderful!!! And thanks for adding a feature for jokes and fun things like guided meditations and sweet phrases in response to “small talk”. Functional, beautiful and fun!

reviews.reviewTitle: Some great improvements but not with the microphones.
reviews.reviewText: This is definitely a great improvement over the Echo Dot 2nd Gen in all aspects except the microphones. I use to work for Amazon doing phone tech support for Echos and Kindles so I am disappointed with this. The older Echo Dot had 7 microphones and the new Echo Dot only has 4. They said it should be better but most of the time, my Echo Dot has issues hearing me. I had to by a 3rd party stand just to adjust the angle and have the device work face out toward the room. I never had an issue with my Echo 1st Gen or the Echo Dot 2nd Gen when they were in the same location.

I figured I would try a dot since my phone is listing to me all the time anyway. I cannot say I am very impressed. The dot has already stopped doing things like “this day in history” and does not have access to many answers.

I tried to use it with Rosetta Stone and that didn’t go over very well. On top of this my smart light bulbs with with google home not Alexa (bummer).

After owning this for several month now I use this as a glorified timer. The interface is just not reliable or precise. Also, on many occasions it turns on and listens which no activation word said.

The tech will be great someday but at the moment it is spotty.

Improved sound over the 2nd Gen Dot - won't replace a 1st Gen Echo, but definitely better for a small listening environment where Alexa connectivity is more important than fidelity. I must report that I was very disappointed in the new "custom" power supply (hence, only 4 stars). Previous 2nd Gen Dots all utilized a charger with a USB/USB Micro cable. This was convenient in that one could use readily-available USB cables of various lengths (and colors) for placement of the 2nd Gen Dots. These also worked with 3rd party powered speakers for 2nd Gen Dots. The 3rd Gen Dot now uses a "hard wired" power supply which limits placement unless one purchases a distinct power supply with a longer cable.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very Nice Addition to Our Home
reviews.reviewText: Bought these for the kids' rooms. Easy to open, a snap to set up. I like that I was able to rename the dots to the kid's names/rooms in the app. Instead of 'drop in on Echo dot 2', I can say 'drop in on xxx's room'. Kids love them. Broke down and got the Amazon Music Unlimited Family plan too so they can stream different music simultaneously. Also cool that, although Alexa is in several rooms and the experience is seamless, each device retains its own identity. So if I set a weekday alarm for 6:10am in one room, it only goes off in the one room, not on all devices. Anyway, we are all very, very happy with the purchase. Thinking to add just a couple more now.... :-)

Most responses are 'hmm, I don't know that one." The chat customer service is also poorly run. I asked echo if it has bluetooth and it said it didn't support bluetooth yet. But it does. How does it not know it has bluetooth? Echo is mostly a weather station and trivia resource. Beyond that, she lacks any real useful skills. Very frustrating. It seems to work hard to keep Spotify from working properly, just to make Amazon Music seem like a good alternative. Just be honest and let echo say "I don't want you using spotify". That would be understandable. I have a FireCube and it is the same way. These are mostly party tricks, not much more.

reviews.reviewTitle: Is Alexa and Dot a tool or a toy? They are useful so I say a tool.
reviews.reviewText: I purchased a three pack of the Alexa dots. One is destined for my shop. I have a Wi-Fi range extender there so it gives me Alexa communication there. One was a gift to my girlfriend’s grand-daughter and the third will be a gift to another friend. The dot seems to communicate as well as the regular Alexa and makes for easy hands free calling between my house and my girlfriend or her daughter’s. They stream music. Tell jokes. Give me weather reports, timer, alarms, trivia, just a fun verbal internet toy or tool? Gee. That may be a question I need to ask Alexa. I bought her as a toy but she definitely has proven to be a useful tool.

We loved our first two Dots so much, we ordered two more. We now have the Echo (2nd gen) plus four Gen 3 Dots. This gives us an Alexa connection in all the most used areas of the house. The Dots have very good sound considering their size. The intercom feature is nice, and the grouping feature works great. It's nice to walk from room to room and hear the same music in perfect synch in each room. I will look into hooking up to our Bose radios in the future to get even better sound. The only problem with that is that doing so will disable the internal speaker, so I will either have to disconnect the Bose, or leave it on ($$ + energy). Since I ordered 2 Dots at a time, I had one setup problem. As I went through the setup, it did not complete, and when restarted thought I was doing the second Dot, not the one I was working on. It may be because I tried to rename it during the setup process. The problem was easily diagnosed when I said "Alexa, say device name" and the response was not the correct name. A little editing, and all was fine.

Where has the DOT Been on my life? I HAVE OWNED A FULL-SIZE ALEXA for a couple of years. But I decided to buy an echo dot when they were on sale at Amazon. I bought it for my bedroom. I love having it and I don't know why I didn't do it sooner! When I go to bed at night I tell Alexa what I want music I want her to play. I also tell her how long I want her to play it! That's wonderful. also, if I'm sleeping and don't want to wake up to look at my clock I just ask Alexa what time it is! I really enjoy having this ECHO DOT in my bedroom! I can also use it as an alarm clock although... I'm retired and don't really need an alarm clock!

reviews.reviewTitle: It would be a cool device if it didn't sound like crap
reviews.reviewText: I bought the Dot and the Spot in a bundle with an early Black Friday deal. I'm slowly adding smart home features and I thought it would be nice to try both - especially the newest Dot. Set-up was fairly easy. I have the Dot in my bedroom on a bedside table. I set up a morning routine without any trouble. Sound is pretty good - when I start my morning routine I get a breakdown of the weather, traffic, and then I have Alexa stream music from Spotify. The music WAS clear and loud enough for me to hear in the shower. Unfortunetly, as I was going through my routine this morning, the music started to have static sounds in it. When I asked Alexa for the time, her voice was popping and had static in it as well. I'm pretty bummed because I've had bluetooth speakers for years and they never started to sound like this. It would be a cool device if it didn't sound like crap.

I have never been much for gizmos, but my wife likes them. She wanted one of these after hearing about them, so I eventually gave in and bought one. Set it up with her phone and that was pretty easy. Now she yabbers with it like its her best friend. Truth be told it is actually kind of handy at times. Asking for the latest weather forecast seems to be it;s primary function at the moment, but I have also found it to be useful for settling disputes over this or that. I am surprised how quickly Alexa responds with an answer as well. Decent price and useful ? Win-win.

reviews.reviewTitle: Sounds great... while it works. I have two, both are the same.
reviews.reviewText: Initially, speakers sound great and they work great... after a few months, now speakers going out, and I keep at vol five of ten max. Also, connectivity and understanding commands is really getting bad. Gen one speakers were not stereo sound quality, but still working well. These, not so much. Bad investment. Not just one, but same problems for two of two I purchased at about the same time. My money in the trash, literally.

I recently purchased a Roku TV (which I luv BTW) and felt it was a perfect addition. Being on a budget after buying the TV and based on reviews these were perfect. Arrived quickly (thanks Amazon) and hit a little snag. Enter my word of caution. I went to the website and as so many companies provide, I used the chat help. Long story short.... he did not help me at all... what he did was try to confuse me and get me to buy his services for $200. Don’t fall for this ploy. And then he got nasty and hung up on me. So I went on yo fix the issue myself in 5 minutes. Be warned...
And I really really enjoy the speakers. Good sound and being so used to Siri I am having a blast with Alexa. And you certainly can’t beat the price

reviews.reviewTitle: Something wasn't programmed correctly for music playback as the previous, same device.
reviews.reviewText:
This one works fine but one big programming issue I've yet to find a resolve. Lightning took out the previous one. This one will not play songs it does recognize (find), only samples. My spotify will not work with it but it didnt in the other one anyway. BUT the former one, one version older, did play any song in complete. I've tried all the suggestions. I'm hoping there is a customer service with a person I will be able to find and fix the issue.
It's for a blind man and is his only technology that's very helpful for the caretaker for reminders but he always admired and adored his previous one.
I pray this issue will have a solution. There arent many technologies for the non technical blind. Especially cell phones. You have to SEE where to touch to simply answer one.
I can't give a 4 star review until this is resolved. Makes no sense if the prior one worked fine.

If you want to know how much I love this item then let me inform you my house has four of them. I'm disabled and the drop in and call function that lets me use an Echo Dot to call for help is the most useful thing I've found in ages. Frequently when I move from room to room I'm not capable of carrying things like a cell phone with me so when I get stuck all I need to do now is call out Alexa call my husband and poof I'm connected to someone who can come help me. Also I'm now never without entertainment when I get stuck in a room. Alexa can play my music and read my books and play podcasts. This is a perfect for a disabled person and fun for the able bodied people. The Echo Dot can also run your smart home functions so it's useful for that too.

I currently have some Echo Dots (2nd Gen) and wanted to upgrade to this new Echo Dot (3rd Gen) and was I glad I did! This latest Echo Dot is much heavier and solid than my Echo Dot (2nd Gen). Upon plugging it, it installed right away. Played music via Amazon music and it sounded so much better. Bass was good but not boomy, mids and highs were tight and clear. It picked up my voice commands from about 10 ft away. I am happy that I upgraded but not sure what to do with the 2nd Gens now that I have the 3rd Gens. Trade in value only $5 via Amazon. Prime day coming up so maybe you'll get deals on this one.

I have an echo dot and it works fine. I gave a gift of one and tried to set it up. Impossible! The instructions were bewildering and impossible to follow so we called a chat person who could barely speak English and she informed us we needed something for a firewall? which she could install for $385.00. After an hour of confusing and nonsensical instructions, we gave up. We were convinced we had been preempted by scam people in Canada. We still cannot get it to connect and will now have to take her computer to an apple store to see what information they obtained from it in our conversation with these people.

I DEFINITELY like using only one word activation, "Alexa", in lieu of Google's "Ok Google" or "Hey Google"...... VERY ANNOYING !!!
So therefore, I find myself using Alexa more for that very reason.
BUTT........ she is for some reason, not NEARLY as smart when asking a question, and answering, as my Google is..... VERY ANNOYING !!!
And seven microphones or not, I do not understand why she is NOT hearing me at times, with no other noise going on, AND at the same volume as I would JUST have asked something else.
No matter what I do, I also cannot connect stereo sound, though they are both paired together, to listen in stereo to certain music streaming, or music on my phone...... VERY ANNOYING !!!
I have yet to start really using skills, so I cannot speak much on them.
I do however want to "Drop In", and yet it always tells me I have to give it permission, or activate, yet doing everything it says do, I can NOT find the option where it says to look for it....... VERY ANNOYING !!!
So as it stands, I for now, must use BOTH, when I prefer to have just one type of A.I. smart system.

reviews.reviewTitle: Best and easiest way to listen to music and radio
reviews.reviewText: The Echo dot is the best way to listen to your own Prime music or your favorite radio stations. I can ask it to play any of my favorite songs by any artist and it never disappoints me. Listening to music and radio has never been easier! No CD's put put in and take out and no turning on my radio. I just ask Alexa to play my favorite stations, my own prime music or any thing I want to hear. It works best if you choose a music plan though. I chose the unlimited music plan and added my husband so he can also listen to his music too. The cost of the unlimited music plan is so very affordable. That is one of the best things about it having an Echo. I can listen to any type of music I want and there is really no need to buy a physical CD anymore unless I just want to. I am in my 60's and for me, it's so much easier just to ask Alexa to play my music. That is my main purpose for using it. I am thinking of getting another dot for my kitchen so I can listen while I cook. The sound is very good and can be adjusted if needed. I have a hearing loss but can hear it very well. If you want the sound to fill a large room, I suggest you the the regular Echo. It has a broader range of sound and a better speaker than the dot. But for my own personal use, the dot suits me well. I am so very happy with my Echo dot and would recommend it to anyone!

I'm well aware that the machines are taking over but if they're gonna listen in anyway, I prefer they do it through my Echo. I'm an Apple guy. Like old-school Apple guy. I was buying those ugly eMacs back in the 90's. Alexa makes Siri seem like a Speak-N-Spell. She responds instantly. You don't have to wait to talk to Alexa like you have to with Siri. I love it. For $25, it's a steal. We have a total of four in the house now so the government can listen to all of our conversations. Still worth it. I really like that I can use the drop-in feature to yell at my kids without having to get up. Really helps with my old age kickin' in. I can also change my thermostat when my fat body starts sweating in the middle of the night. Overall a great wiretap.

Alexa is my new best friend. She has so many amazing features. Some of my favorites are:

1) Communication. Many of my family members have their own Echo devices so it is a BLAST to send and receive messages or calls from them. Even when I am out, I can use the Alexa app to call someone's device and talk to them.
2) Order Updates. I love that Alexa can tell me when an Amazon package will be coming in AND she sends me a notification when it is dropped off at my door. You can also enable the UPS skill and log into your UPS account and she can track your UPS packages for you (genius).
3) Routines. I say, "Alexa, Start My Day" and she plays the news for me, tells me the weather, tells me an interesting fact about the current day, etc. etc. I also have a few "Smart Plugs" connected and I created a routine where I say "Alexa, Goodnight" and she turns off my bedroom lights and turns my box fan on. And it can all be changed to my liking in the Alexa App.
4) Skills. There are thousands of games and skills that are being added, so when they say Alexa is always getting smarter, they mean it.

To sum it all up, buy an Echo device. You will never be lonely again.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great for use with a powered speaker
reviews.reviewText: We have these Alexa/Echo devices throughout the house (probably could use 2-3 more) and so far we have really enjoyed them. I always wanted a whole house speaker system and dreaded having to run wires everywhere or spend thousands of dollars on a wireless speaker system. I had an older powered computer speaker system with powered sub-woofer sitting in a corner and figured I could use that with this small Dot system and it works really great. Yes, there are some significant improvements needed in the Alexa/Echo voice response system, however for basic stuff, it works well. Highly recommend.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa should never try to sell to us
reviews.reviewText: I love the devices; I have them in most rooms in my house. But, I would never have gotten one if I knew how often the devices would waste my time trying to upsell my music subscription. It is constantly, and wrongly, thinking that music is already streaming on a new device. Can I trivially have it cancel that other music (which isn't actually streaming)? Nope. I have to listen to the same advertisement for 'the family plan'. There is zero possibility that Amazon doesn't know how annoying this is. It's such a good device, with great sound quality, but the experience is ruined by Amazon trying to get us a few more $ from me per month. I wish I never got one of these, despite the overall quality, as it introduces purposefully annoying advertising into my home. It's entirely unacceptable.

Purchased Echo Dot to use at work in my office. Wanted primarily for music but also to be like an assistant with questions answered easily. For the most part it works perfectly. Sound quality is good and no longer have to hassle with radio station static. One complaint is if I don't ask a question every 3 hours or so it goes off. When I ask why the response is was shut off due to inactivity in several hours. I was listening to the music! Oh well I adapted. Another complaint is since live streaming music it goes off if get interrupted WIFI (which happens for me at least once if not more times per day). Again I adapted.

So yes I do recommend the Echo Dot.

I bought two to connect my house with my alarm clock and security system. Everything integrates ridiculously easy (As soon as I plugged these babies in, they got picked up by my network (Phone) right away. Just clicked the pop up on my phone and they set up within SECONDS - Understand, I had already set up my main hub (Alarmclock) so the network was put together (That took like 10 min tops) already. Either way, it is fast to add a new device. They are really well made and look very nice. They do flash a light when they sense you are in the room, so if you dont want that just tell Alexa, Stop blinking and she will no longer flash the colored ring light. I would buy more if I had more rooms.

P.s. They give discounts if you buy more than one at a time (Saved 20$ when I bought two).

First. I am not a big fan of these machines. This one came with a subcription to satellite radio. It took a short time to get an "app" and set it up to use my wifi. I use it to access the satellite programming via internet "streaming". It does that job well and I am satisfied with that. Any of it's other functions I don't use and expect not use. My wife has one of these and uses it for streaming music and she gets the local news and weather through it too.

It arrived in good order and well protected as usual. I would recommend one to customers who are interested in such things but cannot speak to the other functions like controlling a "smart house".

Bill

reviews.reviewTitle: Here are some audio enhancement tricks...
reviews.reviewText:
Love love love Alexa, and she’s bundled up in this nice small puck-sized unit. What could be better?

I won’t go through all the reasons to buy an echo, there are plenty of other reviews for that. I’ll just say that the setup experience is flawlessly easy, the unit looks good, and the sound is impressive.

In order to get improved sound from the echo, you’ll need to elevate it off the hard surface that it sits on to increase the bass effectiveness. There are a ton of 3D printable holders to make, some you can simply order, or if you’re lazy, just set it in the box it came in (empty it for best results). You may be impressed as well.

Microphones are not as good as 2nd Gen. Echo has a much harder time of hearing our commands with this device vs. the older 2nd Gen device. Also, seems to be slower at answering. You can say "Alexa" and it will 2 seconds before the blue ring even lights up, then another couple seconds before she follows through with the command or request. We have our lights controlled by Alexa and the older device could get the lights on and off in less then 2 seconds of making the request. This one really has to think about it before Alexa will do it. Not very happy with the purchase at all. May return and just get another older 2nd Gen one since it seems to work better. It has 6 mics vs. the 4 in the newest model.

reviews.reviewTitle: Dot with Clock Is Worth The Extra $
reviews.reviewText: We wanted to add a Dot to the bedroom (voice-controlled heat/AC is the best!) and I bought this to replace my alarm clock. Integrated into my Alexa app quickly and easily, and looks nice in the new "sandstone" color. As a bonus, the clock auto-dims according to room light and my wife really like our new, darker room. Alarms and sleep timers can be set by voice which is way easier than scrolling through the time on a clock. Sound is not as good as my Echo but I wouldn't expect that given how small it is. It recognizes voices from across the room and is very responsive. I also added the Alexa smart plug for five dollars extra which made it a great deal.

reviews.reviewTitle: Smart house is no longer dumb........ we love it!
reviews.reviewText: we have a mix of Echo Shows and Echo Dots throughout our house... with over 50 plus devices now integrated into our routine, we couldn't be happier with the relatively low cost foundation that is Alexa. We use her for setting alarms, controlling lights, TV's, security systems, doorbells, sprinklers, doors, thermostat, etc.... we love it! In comparison to 2nd generation Dot's this 3rd generation is a wonderfully designed upgrade. The expanded speaker is perfect for listening to music or whatever request you have for Alexa.. the lower cost of this device makes it a no question purchase for upgrading or expanding coverage.

REALLY disappointed in so many ways with this. 1st off, I've setup 2 Echos in my home & it was easy & done automatically for the most part. Tried to set this Dot up using the Alexa app on a brand new Android phone & it forced me to setup in MANUAL mode & on top of that wouldn't complete the process. Tried multiple times doing different things following their steps & it wouldn't work. Finally had to use my laptop & it's Alexa app to set the wifi connection up manually. Should be working correctly out of the box...not create a headache.
2nd, the audio is no where near as loud as either Echo device at max volume. Very disappointed on so many fronts. I'm giving the Dot as a gift & hope it doesn't come back to haunt me.

reviews.reviewTitle: ANNOYING AS TIME GOES On... WHY!??
reviews.reviewText:
I don’t understand why this product is so cool at first but then when you try to “get to know it” as you use it more in time; the freaking thing becomes dumber and dumber and it is not fair!! I really was looking forward to it actually working, but as usual buying with my luck I’ve experienced in purchasing through Amazon (which I don’t know why I keep trying; but I’ve been VERY HOPEFUL and the fact that I currently don’t have transportation to get to stores due to unforeseen issues... For the price you cannot beat the Echo Dot (make sure it's the 3rd Generation!). Without a doubt you will discover new things it can do on an almost daily basis, and there appears to be no limit as to what it is capable of. Ask it for a joke, ask it to sing a song, ask Alexa if she loves you (awesome response for that), and so much more. Plus, it is TRULY useful in terms of weather, alamrs, white noise, traffic, the list goes on and on. The most surprising thing about this would be the sound quality. It's beyond what I thought it was going to be and the built in speaker is deep and rich and louder than you will think. Amazon should be proud of this product, and it's worth every penny.

You get this Echo Dot, as opposed to the standard one, because you want to see a clock. Yet, the way the clock is built into the side of this Dot makes it very difficult to see unless you are on the same plane as the clock. If you are above or below it, the clock can be difficult tor read. A classic case of form over function.

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo Dot, Where Have You Been All My Life?
reviews.reviewText: I received an Echo Spot as a gift, then 2 smart plugs, and then purchased the Dot. What a system! After the initial setup of the Spot, the rest basically set themselves up. At my age, I thought it would be hard to get the components to work together, but the technology is very user friendly, even for seniors like myself. Bedroom lamps turn off with a couple of words. Coffee comes on in the AM when I tell it to. The Dot is a cute, little item that sits on the counter, answers questions, adjusts its own volume, turn things on and off, plays music, and basically makes life easier. I definitely plan on adding additional Echo Dots!! Very Senior friendly.

Good small unit for a bedroom. The annoying part is you cant turn off the notification or light ring. So if you dont clear the notification you get a nice glow all night. So not very good for a kids room or if your too lazy to ask a second alexa what are my notifications. I mean how many times can you ask her per device? Or at least give me a menu option to turn it off in the app. I do wish there was a grey or black version of this. Only other thing is alexa itself doesnt seem to be as sensitive as a alexa show when trying to activate or talk to her. Otherwise sounds great for a small unit and works like other alexa devices.

I love it! I use it to wake me up in the morning. I set the alarm in ascending mode. I wake up refreshed not feeling being attacked by the alarm.
It’s the best alarm clock: Now I don’t have to grope for my phone and squint at it while trying to find the snooze/stop icon (God forbid you press stop when you meant to press snooze!). Just for this feature alone, I got my money’s worth.
It’s a great reminder too. In addition to listening to Alexa’s very soothing voice announcing the reminder, you get a notification on your phone too.
Plus all the other great features: listen to prime music, news, traffic, weather, track your orders, etc.

The 3rd Generation Echo Dot is a vast improvement over the previous Echo Dot models. You can feel the quality and weight of it when you remove it from the box. It is slightly larger in height and diameter than previous versions and it now has a speaker that rivals that of the Echo.

Setup and functionality are the same as and Echo device.

reviews.reviewTitle: My home is getting pretty smart by the day.
reviews.reviewText: I am becoming more and more amazed how my home is shaping out to be a Super Smart home. With the Echo Dot (3rd generation), I've been able to start transforming my house into a "Smart Home" by managing my lights, ceiling fans, audio system, security alarm, etc. into a "smart home". Aside from some of the most common capabilities Alexa has, I can now make calls from the Echo Dot 3rd.Gen. Alexa can tell me what's on my calendar, give me reminders, and basically answer any questions that may cross my mind (similar to Siri or Cortana). There are jillions of "skills" available to program Alexa. In the end, sky is the limit with Alexa. I just got it a week ago, and I have been able to implement so many skills for my "smart home". It is impressive!!

Alexa is an incredibly stupid AI to the point where it's frustrating. She has trouble hearing programmed routines or will answer your question with the wrong answer. The worst and most frequent answer though is "I don't know how to answer that".

The final straw was when I set an alarm and it went off so I said "Alexa, snooze for 20 minutes". The alarm then started going off every 6 seconds and I couldn't stop it. It would beep once, pause for 6 seconds, beep again and repeat. I was yelling "Alexa stop" and she would just give me answers like "Which alarm do you want to stop?BEEP". I eventually got fed up and pressed the button to try and set her up again, had the yellow ring and everything but the alarm was STILL going off. Just going to unplug her for now

My Google home works way better than this thing

reviews.reviewTitle: Didn't quite do what I thought it did.
reviews.reviewText:
I purchased this device specifically because I was looking to integrate some smart lights in my house (it'd be nice to turn them on from my phone in the driveway when winter hits), and from the description where it came in a bundle with the two lights it sounded like the Hue lights integrated without -another- device (the Hub). This is apparently not the case.

The only real benefits now are the ability to play music through my place by having the echo in my bedroom, and the dot in the kitchen/living room area and adding stuff to my shopping list without having to yell across the place. Sound quality isn't nearly as good as the Echo itself, but decent enough for chores around the house.

reviews.reviewTitle: extremely useful assistant, good quality speaker
reviews.reviewText: We use our echo dots with Alexa for music, party games (trivia, naming songs, etc.,) shopping, weather, reminders, timers, news, lists, alarms, travel, controlling smart plugs (lights, iron, Christmas lights, etc.,) checking calendar, checking email, checking flights, audio books, ambient sounds (rain, fountain, ocean, etc.,) kitchen measurement conversions, foreign language translations, spelling, word definitions, and anything else we can think of. The speaker has amazing weight, volume, and clarity for such a small size. Very pleased with it, and bought several for convenient spots throughout the house.

I got a few dots and while I had problems with delivery and Amazons ever worsening customer service for this order I finally got my items in and set up. In less than 24 hours one dot stopped working, I picked it up and it was HOT to touch like gonna melt itself hot. I love the concept but if you have a issue be prepared to talk to at least two different departments and they don't talk to each other or know what your issue is even when you take the necessary steps online to specify what your problems are, it just makes for a headache.

Product is good when it works but with one device failing so quickly my confidence is shaky in it and customer service is becoming a ever increasing joke over at Amazon

reviews.reviewTitle: Slaying Dragons while cleaning the house , Alexa can do that !
reviews.reviewText: Surprisingly good sound , this is my second dot , this looks better too. Alexa is pretty good at understanding my thick accent lol . Alexa provides entertainment , games, news, audiable, weather, just ask her Alexa what are your RPG skills and you be slaying dragons in no time in interactive stories such as Runescape and the magic door and tons of others. Or if you have kids , Alexa provides you with a story for bedtime and reads it too. Make up a morning or bed routine, like when you say Alexa good night she turns off your tv ( cheap Alexa enabled plugs) and turns on your 20 minutes guided meditation or just ocean or white noise. Ya, I like Alexa! And so far everything was free of charge!

Bought this on Prime Day for only $22 and should have gotten at least two! I love that I can choose any genre of music and the dot plays it. The sound quality is quite good. I love the San Francisco Giants baseball team and Alexa can tell me what time the game is on and play the radio broadcast. This is huge because I live in the central valley and our radio reception for the game broadcasts is often staticky or weak. My grandchildren enjoy hearing Alexa's jokes and asking "her" questions. I don't have any smart lights or other devices yet so I haven't tried that aspect of it. So far, it is one of my favorite purchases.

Love this with the alexa app I have bought multiple of these and currently have six working to cover different rooms in my house long gone are the days where you had to wire your entire house to have music in every room even better is that I can hook these to real stereos or for the kiddos rooms let the sound come through them so my wife doesnt have to yell when the music is to loud also another great perk is that with the drop in app we can listen to the kids or use it to talk to them and ask them to bring laundry or get ready for dinner. To do this they all must be on the same wifi network.

reviews.reviewTitle: Sounds good, dirt cheap (on Prime Day anyway)
reviews.reviewText:
Very surprised with the sound quality on this version. I wouldn't rank it as high-quality, however in a small space at low volume it sounds just fine for music. Alexa as a product is available through this device which is obviously it's main selling point and things like white noise and various notifications and access to simple queries have all been very welcomed and enjoyable.
If you want to listen to music in a large room or at high volumes I would encourage looking towards the larger Echo products. They would be worth the investment for the sound quality and volume upgrade in my opinion.

reviews.reviewTitle: New to Alexa but immediately addicted
reviews.reviewText: This thing is sick. Synced right up with my philips hue and has an even nicer user interface than the philips app itself. I also renamed my free included smart plug to “heater” and I just calmly say “Alexa turn on the heater” and it works pretty much every time without having to really raise your voice (and I keep the device about 15ft away from me). The only creepy part is just that, that this thing is listening all day and appears to catch low volume conversation quite well. In one instance, it played country music because we said the word “alexa” and “country” in the same sentence. I love being able to start my small plug in heater remotely as I get home to come home to a nice toasty room, but after the cold goes away I’m not sure what I’ll be running on the plug.

reviews.reviewTitle: The hardware is good, but the software needs a bit of improvement.
reviews.reviewText:
This was purchased as an upgrade for the first generation Alexa. Overall, much better for the same cost.

The sound quality and volume increased significantly, but it has trouble when communicating with Bluetooth speakers. It can send them from quiet to loud skipping the mid range of comfort. Yes, the Bluetooth speaker works just fine with other devices.

Also, it has trouble responding when you choose it’s name to be Echo, but not with the other (pre-programmed) names. I think it is because “Echo” is two syllables and the others are three. I would really like it if I could choose its name, so that my conversations with I would be more fluid.

The 3rd generation Dot has some improvements.
1) The sound quality is better than my 2nd generation Dot. I still won't listen to music on it (without an external speaker) but the sound is improved in both frequency response and volume.
2) The appearance is more pleasing to me than the stark black puck that is the 2nd generation Dot.

The disappointment is that the new Dot requires the provided power supply...I can't just plug in into a USB port for power. So, yet another "dongle" is added to the mass of wires/plugs/dongles that seem to go with electronics today.

I recommend getting the new Dot rather than the old for the advantages above. And living with the dongle.

Why 4 stars then...

Well, cause as great as the sound is, as cool as it is to turn lights and control TV...

Some of it it's quirks are hard to get used to.

Set a timer in one room, you can't shut it off from another room without unplugging the one near you, or changing the 'wake word' to 'computer, echo, amazon, or alexa'. Those 4 names are all bad, it's STRANGELY limited, since you CAN change the name of any light or device any time you like.

It would be AWESOME if you could control one with the other, and I'm sure they will add that some day... why can't I say, "echo, tell computer to pause netflix", etc.

This is such a wonderful system!!! We have a big Alexa for the open floor plan of our home. Then we have an echo dot in each kids bedroom and one in ours. each person can stream their own music while others are streaming theirs. It also works as an intercom so if I need one kiddo I can “drop” into his echo I’m his room from any other one instead of yelling to him from upstairs. Also, for example when dinner is ready I can send a message to all units in the house and it does a dinner bell and it’s my voice announcing “dinner’s ready!” It is a wonderful tool. Everyone can to the grocery list if we run out of something. The kids can even play games or tell jokes.

I bought a 2nd gen Dot the last time they were on sale for $25. I like it a lot, other than the mediocre speakers, so I leave that one constantly plugged in to an audio input on my sound system.

This newer one, though, has WAY better audio. It's good enough to justify itself just as a portable speaker, not even considering the Alexa functionality.

As a bonus, I placed this in my garage, far enough away from my wireless router where my phone just barely hangs onto a signal, and the Echo works fine, just a tiny bit delayed on voice commands.

TL;DR it's just like the 2nd gen echo, except a little larger, a little better looking, and with good enough speakers to stand on its own.

reviews.reviewTitle: A must have in the Smart Home era.
reviews.reviewText: Quick and easy set up. It’s a Must have in the smart home era. I recommend getting a case for it the smart home era. I recommend getting a case for it and attaching it directly to the outlet so it’s out of the way. A virtual home assistant to help with everything from basic inquiries to smart home applications. I live in a 2 story 2500 sq. ft. home and I have 2. However, properly placed, you could get by with just one. The more you invest in its application, the more you get out of it. Alexa sets my daily and weekly schedules and handles mundane tasks with no complaints. I waited until they were on sale for 25$ before buying them. I suggest you do the same and use the saved money to invest in smart plugs and bulbs. A good investment for the home.

reviews.reviewTitle: What a great smart home device to have.
reviews.reviewText:
This is my third Echo dot so far and I love this thing. Its entertaining, it plays music, controls my Firesticks, lights and plays music. There are many other things that make this great, but it would take time to write it all down.
