I'd say when it comes to smart home devices, this is by far my favorite. They look great on the nightstand or living room side table.

My only criticism on the the Echo is the reminder function. Now this may be my lack of knowledge of the Alexa platform, but to that it is a little annoying when you set a reminder message and it continues to repeat that message until you tell it to stop.

Other than that one small issue, it is a great device for the household.

This is my first time ever buying or owning a device like this. This is a pretty handy little thing. Amazon had these on sale for $30 during Mother’s Day weekend, so I got one for myself. I’m not a mother, but a sale on Amazon is a sale on Amazon. Lol.

Anyways, this thing is pretty awesome. The sound quality is great and I use Alexa a lot to stream music from my phone via bluetooth. She has a hard time understanding me, but that’s not her fault. Sometimes she can’t hear me or I speak too fast. She can be slow to respond or reply, but that’s not her fault either. That’s all due to whenever the WiFi is slow as hell.

Overall this was a great buy for a great price. Glad I got it on sale. Would’ve paid full price if I had to. I recommend.

I changed the name from Alexa to Echo to avoid it chirping up whenever something close to "Alexa" is said. It wouldn't shut up when I was discussing an echocardiogram on the phone. That's a bit alarming to think it listens to conversations but then I checked out the history online and found it listens to WAY more than you think. Like everything. It was fun for awhile playing trivia games but I never connected to every damn thing Amazon wanted me to because of the privacy issue. I finally unplugged it. I use my remote for my tv and the wall switch for my lights.

Horrible device and customer service when trying to get a new one. I bought two at one time. One sounded good the other was clearly defective and the speaker rattled. I was on chat with customer service for over 1 1/2 hrs. Finally got on the phone with a supervisor. My prime account was suspended one month early and was sent another defective unit that sounded worse than the defective unit I already had. So I had to pay to re-active my prime account, and contact customer service again for another replacement. Worst customer service ever!!! I was placed on hold, told I couldn’t get a replacement. When I have another 2 hrs to waste I suppose I’ll call back again. Lesson learned, I won’t be purchasing any Amazon product again.

reviews.reviewTitle: Did not make me want to learn more about it - a neat little oddity
reviews.reviewText: I already have a chat cylinder from another company. Quite honestly, I forget a lot about what it was like to setup, other than I did not particularly care for it. The other product that I have had a seamless, intuitive, and easy setup. The Echo Dot was so boring, and seemed focused around Amazon, that it annoyed me. It gave the appearance of listening all the time, cataloging what was heard in the in house - just my perception, not saying it's a fact. Alexa offered to make phone calls, so I told it call someone, and said that they have to be on Amazon, or something like that, to work - what a flop. I'm going to buy another outlet controller so that I can turn Echo-Dot/Alexa on and off through my other product. Also, the Echo Dot would not pair with my Bose Bluetooth audio adapter - until the Echo/Dot, I haven't found a device that didn't pair with the Bose Bluetooth adapter. The quality of the Echo Dot audio is nothing spectacular. It's a neat little oddity that I cannot take very seriously.

reviews.reviewTitle: As good as a Mid range $30-40 bluetooth speaker
reviews.reviewText:
I have to say I am super happy with the Gen 3s .

The gen1/2 have a sound quality for music that makes a blu tooth speaker or hard wired speaker 100% needed for music.
On par with a low end phones speaker phone music.

The Gen3 on the other hand has an incredible range and great sound and depth . I would put it on par with Anker or any of those mid range blutooth speakers - you can still pair or hard line direction to speaker but the Gen 3s don't even need it . I have 3 in the house in a music group and one gen 2 and when you walk in the room with the Gen 2 its like night and day when they are playing.

reviews.reviewTitle: Don't bother trying to find Voicecast!
reviews.reviewText:
I bought the Dot to hook up to my Fire tablet listen to music in two rooms in my house, knowing that Voicecast would allow me to do this. After days of struggle, this is what I found out after an hour online with the tech:
"Thanks for being so patient with us, let us check from our end, if that is it.
I am really sorry, after consulting leadership and higher authorities we got to know that the Voicecast settings have been deprecated on January 20 2019.
Also, I am sorry to let you know that we do not have information on when the feature will be back.
I apologize for the inconvenience caused to you."
Amazon has specifically made this impossible!

It's a great help through out our home. I don't have to scream through out the house to make a statement. I love the fact that she plays all types of music in that particular room. Her jokes are so dry I love it. The reminders are so helpful. Timers are exactly what I need all the time. I love that I can take her anywhere as long as I have a wifi connections. I just found out that she can remind me to change my toothbrush... OMG. I'm always trying to remember what month it is. Now I don't have to think about it... she'll think for me. My only question - can she work in a bathroom. I want to place in the bathrooms, but I'm not sure if they will withstand the moisture. Great Job Amazon!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: My 4th, this one goes permenantly into my vintage stereo system. no more stored music
reviews.reviewText: The Echo system is the greatest source of music for my vintage 1972 McIntosh/JBL stereo system, restored to original specifications. Echo provides an unlimited source of full fidelity, clean, music. It also makes it easy to personalize and mix many selections on digital storage for playing later. I have found that albums, and tapes are not needed now and are taking up space. A good multi-band equalizer provides the old "tube" sound I have gotten used to, now without the hiss and scratches. My other Echo devices provide mathematical help in my shop and another one is my multi-function "alarm clock". Even though I do not use a "smart" linked system, I find it easy to input information with my home computer.

reviews.reviewTitle: Wayyyyyyyyyyy better than Google home mini
reviews.reviewText:
I initially thought whatever the tech giant Google launches will be super cool and top notch in quality and performance and I bought two Google home mini, then the shocker, its sooo pathetic in quality that i had to return both of them, then thought of giving Echo dot 3 a try, i would handsdown say Echo Dot 3 is atleast 10 times better than Google home mini.

Pros of Echo Dot 3 over Google home mini
- 4 mics vs 2mics - from one room i was able to give a command to the alexa which is sitting in another room(distance between rooms is 35feet). and google home was so pathetic i have to maintain a distance of atleast 15feet.
- response when playing songs (however loud the songs might be playing, alexa responds brilliantly, Google sucks, it just doesnt listen even when i go and shout at its face with just 1 feet distance also)
- superb build quality vs mediocre quality (do not fall for the looks of google home mini)
- Excellent audio quality vs normal audio quality (for the speakers of this size , echo dot 3 is excellent)
- "alexa" vs "ok google" - totally annoying to call it "ok google" every time -worst ever implementation by Google
- response time - "alexa, turn on the lights", but google home "ok google" wait till it responds then say "turn on the lights"
- More tactile nice Buttons vs no buttons at all - i had google home for 2 months, not even once i was able to increase or decrease the volume with ease, shame on you google.
- easily mute by press vs take the google home mini in your hands and then turn it upside down and then slide the mute mutton - wow how can google implement it so stupidly?

Pros of Google home mini over Echo Dot 3
- Google home mini looks cute and doesnt look like a speaker at all.

The only Advantage of mini over dot 3 is looks and nothing else NEVER BUY GOOGLE HOME MINI (its one beautiful crap),

Now I am going to order two more echo (a bigger one and dot)

Customer service was unable after one hour and a half for Alexa Echo Dot to connect with the fire stick. I was transferred back-and-forth multiple times between four different people. The fire stick works fine. The app says Alexa is connected to the fire stick. However, Alexa never recognizes the fire stick when I ask to turn the channel. The problem is with Customer service.

Very nice toy. Great for playing music.i bought 2 a echo and a dot. The echo sounds better but the dot sounds good for the dive it is. Would liked it to been a tough louder but it’s good sound for the size and cost. Just getting started with make my home a smart home but so far I like it a lot. My son loves to ask Alexia questions. I would recommend it. Very easy to set up and tied my Apple Music to it. Really like being able to make calls with it. So if my son (7) needs to call me or want to call his Grandmaw he just says the name like it is in my phone and it calls. Very cool. Also can call between echo units is nice for when the kids are upstairs. No more yelling.

The Echo Dot is only good for playing music and asking Alexa questions. But, if you intend to use it for smart home devices to give Alexa commands to turn lights, etc, on or off, forget it. I have 3 Echo Dots (3rd generations). One of them suddenly stopped recognizing my Wemo smart plug, LIFX smart bulb, and ADT home security, even though all of them are linked to the same network. Other people have reported on this same type of problem with their Echo Dot 3rd generations where one of the units suddenly tells you "I can't find a device named <xxxx>" even though the skill for that device is enabled and linked to the Alexa account. And, even trying all of the various suggestions listed at both the Amazon site and other websites, none of it resolves the problem. I've also found the Amazon support team to be unresponsive to requests. If people want an artificial intelligence device that they can do more than ask for weather reports, the time, date, year, or to play music, I would suggest trying another company's device.

reviews.reviewTitle: This would easily be 5 stars if I could fix my one issue
reviews.reviewText: I have an Amazon Echo in my kitchen and three other echo dots in other rooms of the house. I have two amazon smart plugs. The echo dots will not recognize the smart plugs no matter what I do. I have to go into the kitchen to tell them to turn on. This is literally my only complaint and would be happy to change this review to 5 stars if someone can tell me how to fix this. When I go into the app and click on all devices, all 6 devices show up but only the Echo will recognize it when you ask it to turn on. Other than that, having the ability to make lists, turn on music, turn on lights, ask general questions without having to touch anything is fantastic. It saves so much time and truly is like you have your own personal assistant. Couldn’t go back to not having them.

I got an echo for my in laws. I wanted to set it up so that it would play music which, apparently you have to pay to get anything good. I didn't want them to pay so I called customer service so that they could help me. Online the woman said I couldn't do it from their home, I had to be at my computer which seemed odd. None-the-less, I went home and she said that she would talk me through set up. She didn't. She instead took control of my computer through rapid fire pressure tactics and then infiltrated my computer. Just a heads up, there are some criminals working there to steal data. She moved all my files to the cloud and I had to wipe out my whole computer to regain any control over my mouse. I am still trying to regain and privatize my files again. They still don't have Amazon music.

reviews.reviewTitle: Watch out for scam iphone apps for alexa!!
reviews.reviewText: This is a great smart speaker with great sound. The quality is better than google home mini. I have 2 google smart speakers (1 regular, 1 mini) and I have been happy with them, but I wanted the guard and burglar deterrent features which google so far does not have. I believe setting up various music applications (spotify, tunein, pandora) is easier on the echo dot. Right now these miracle workers are on sale for $29 which is quite a bargain and I would recommend them to all technophiles. Watch out for iphone apps to set this device up (Setting Up Alexa, etc.) -- some are demanding money and don't add anything to the device. Amazon should not allow these apps to be sold on Apple store (don't know if they exist on google store). The ONLY app that you need is "Amazon music" which is created by Amazon, not some scammer. Note Amazon does not demand money to add skills (at least music, burglar deterrent, guard), so if your app asks for money (Prime), then you have downloaded an app which is a scam.

reviews.reviewTitle: Aux Out Only - Useless for me
reviews.reviewText: This is an excellent device for using as a smart speaker, but I wanted to use it in my classroom as a speaker for my projector/laptop. I purchased this device because I am very impressed by the quality of my other Echo speaker at home, and I wanted a smaller version for my classroom. When I hooked it up with the auxiliary cable... nothing. Since there were students waiting, I tried a couple of other things to no avail; but finally just gave up and brought it home to investigate further. After nearly an hour searching videos on YouTube, reading articles online, and 30 minutes with Amazon customer service over the phone; it turns out that only the Echo Dot 2nd Gen has the capability to have Aux In. The Aux port on the 3rd Gen (which I have) only has the option for Aux Out. Great speaker, but totally defeated the purpose of my purchase. I'm sure it says somewhere that this is a feature, but I have used my other Echo device in the same way and it worked. You know what they say about assumptions...

I've had a couple 2nd Gen Echo Dots for nearly 2 years now and have loved them ever since I got them. When the 3rd Gen Dots came out and I read the reviews I couldn't wait to get my hands one one. They're just slightly larger than the 2nd Gen version, but you'll barely notice the difference, and it's totally worth it for the improved speaker quality. The speaker on this version is much clearer and provides much more base than the previous generation. It also seems to respond better to my commands than the previous version. Best of all it integrates seamlessly with the existing 2nd generation units I have setup as a household so I can continue using those in lower traffic areas of the house. Overall very pleased.

After much debate, i finally broke down and invited Alexa into my home via 2 of these echo dots. i cannot believe how handy they are and i have become slightly dependent on them lol. The audio on these little things is quite impressive, they rival my bose speakers. at full volume i can listen to music from all the way across my 2000 square foot house! Its listening capabilities are so good that it can hear me in my normal speaking voice from across the room. i have had to be care full because it will start asking me what i said when addressing my daughter (Alyssa). i am now in the market for more of the line like the Ring and smart plugs, im hooked!

I received it yesterday and I was able to connect it very fast. I have Alexa 2nd generation and I was thinking about trading it for the 3rd generation. However, I remembered the " I robot" movie and how replacing the old technology robots with the new ones lead to revolution :). I actually decided to keep both, the new one in the living room as it has a better sound and the old one in the living room. They work great with each other. I only wish that Amazon allows us to customize the name instead of using the existing names (Alexa, Echo, Amazon or computer). I like Alexa name but sometimes it gets confusing if I name both of my dots as Alexa so I kept Alexa for the old one and renamed the new one as echo.

I absolutely LOVE my Echo Dot 3Gen. I love all the different task it can do, alarm clock, weather, news, music, just to name a few. There are so many other task that I have yet to explore. The size is perfect for my living room/kitchen (connected), I am able to put it on one of my shelves and it blends in to my decor. It's seriously awesome. The sound quality is great, she (I call her she..) can get pretty loud. Now I'm not talking drop the base loud by any means, but can get up there. I love that you are able to ask her turn it down and she does it. The drop in feature is amazing! I love being able to drop in and check on the pup, or when my Dad is over. I don't have a smart home (yet) so I can't say anything about turning on and off lights, locking doors, alarm setting, etc. BUT one of my friends does and I have to say that the whole smart home feature teaming up with Echo is very impressive and gives people a peace of mind. Love it!

Easy to install and sync with my phone. Had it synced with the smart sockets in no time. Syncing Apple music and the roomba was simple once I found the directions of how to do it online. Setting up the Alexa app and enabling apps is pretty simple, just have to play around with it and discover all its features. Turning the living room lamp on is a cinch, so is triggering the roomba, or playing a certain song or a playlist of a certain artist. It can even create a playlist around a theme or based off a certain song, just ask Alexa. Got mine on Prime Day for $20. Best purchse ever.

Love this device already. Alexa is pretty accurate and does a Whole bunch of things. The size is perfect, making it easier to fit almost anywhere you desire. The Charcoal color is beautiful as well as the rgb light that changes color depending on the function or command provided. The device is very useful, especially for people like me that has a speaker without wireless/bluetooth connection and therefore Echo Dot can be used as a breach between my speaker and my iPhone. There are always discounts for this kind of products( I bought 2 instead of one for a very good price) . I recommend it

Alexa gets stubborn when you don't say the name of a device correctly. If you tell her to connect to your iPad - and the iPad's bluetooth is off, it will connect to the iPhone instead and you waste 5 minutes to go find it and turn that bluetooth off. Moving from one echo to another with bluetooth is a pain as well.
Sound quality is ok, loudness could be better for certain YouTube videos. Too much base for TV shows, etc. maybe ok for music.
After recent forced update, Alexa voice recognition got worse, you have to say commands 2-3 times, before they work. It definitely got worse after 7 months of use.
the intelligence part of Alexa for sure needs improvement.

reviews.reviewTitle: Does what I wanted it for -Ask My Buddy
reviews.reviewText: I got this for the sole purpose of using the "ask my buddy" app. I am a senior, living alone. I used to keep a land line phone in my basement, at floor level, in case I fall down the stairs. When I got rid of my land line, I no longer had a call for help solution. With the investment of $25 (on sale) the echo dot sits in the basement, pretty much unused, but it's a big weight off my mind knowing it's there. I test the wifi signal every morning by yelling down the stairs asking the temperature. And have it play the radio when I am doing laundry. Most importantly, we test "askmybuddy" once/month with my son. It immediately sends him an alert by phone, text and email. I recommend it.

First, and foremost, understand that Amazon does not believe in this product enough to give it a 1 year warranty like most electronics. You only get 90 days and will need to press the customer service reps to replace this product if it fails you. My speaker blew at around 6 months. I never took it over level 8. My suggestion is to keep it lower than that if you want some longevity out of this item.
On the other hand, if you purchase Echo products with a good credit card that extends warranties, like a Costco Citi card, you can run a claim through them.

We received a 2nd gen echo dot from our internet provider for free, so it was a perfect chance to give Alexa a shot. We loved the features on it so much, we ordered a 3rd gen to use in the front of the house. The 3rd gen speakers are so much better than the 2nd get (not anything like a sound system but perfectly adequate for christmas music!) that we ordered another 3rd gen to replace our 2nd gen. This version is also more aesthetically pleasing, as it comes in a softer look and softer colors than the stark black or white of gen 2. It's not a giant brick on your countertop.
Not only is it super easy to set up, but it actually understands what you're saying. We're an apple household but Siri just sucks when you're trying to get it to understand you. Alexa never gets it wrong; she even understands my 6 and 4 year old who constantly want to play memory games with it. We couldn't be happier with our purchases and plan on giving these for Christmas as well!

reviews.reviewTitle: Better than 2nd gen, but has it's flaws
reviews.reviewText: So I've been using echos since the first gen. This is my first third gen, and I'm not really enjoying some of the changes. Mainly it doesn't power by USB anymore, but rather uses a pigtail connector and ac adapter that comes with it. I'm not a fan of being tied to a special power adapter like this. I like having options for power delivery that the previous generations had. It's bigger and heavier, the sound quality is improved over the 2nd gen. I still miss the ring from the first gen. But bring back USB power. Use USB c if you have higher power needs now.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good quality speaker, bad user interface
reviews.reviewText:
The speaker in used as a Bluetooth speaker or just to ask Alexa basic questions is great. Also found a way to dig through the settings to manually pair my, and others, devices to her Bluetooth. The device is also very small and looks really good (I have mine in my office area and my boss never noticed for the first 2 weeks until someone else brought it up, and then he thoughts it was pretty cool). The sound quality is pretty good despite the form factor (Does best with highs and mids, but as long as it’s not a bass tester or something super heavy in bass it sounds really good even at max volume. I play mostly hip-hop, 60/70’s Psychedelic, and House/Deep House music and have had no complaints as far as sound quality. Plus it doesn’t rattle, even at max).

That’s where the positive ends though.

The app for the speaker is completely garbage and useless. The only thing on there is the backdoor to the settings so that once you manually pair the speaker to your device (and I highly recommend you do it this way, as speaking to her to do it is extremely tedious and frustrating), and the time and weather (which I can get off my phone or watch’s lock screen a lot easier). All of the in “skills” (sub-apps) for music streams are junk and don’t work (most of the time won’t even boot, or if they do you have zero control over them) and it’s just a nightmare. You would think a trillion dollar company like Amazon, who’s trying to push these smart speakers into every home and office, would be able to come up with a simple and functional app with working “skills”.

Bottom line it’s a good Bluetooth speaker that can tell you your local weather or play a trivia game with you. If the app was fixed and 3rd party apps were better supported it would be a great speaker that I would buy for my home. But at this stage I’m still on the fence.

I wasn’t really planning on upgrading from my second generation to this third-generation dot until I came across the cyber week special bundle with a smart light kit. The sound, look, & “foot” of the new version make this better than the last one.

Overall, I was very happy with my second generation., using it to play music, listen to the news, and hear the occasional joke. I understood that if I wanted to hear decent sound, I had to connected to my Bluetooth speaker.

Enter third-generation dot: As you can hear from the video, music sounds much better, with a bump of bass without needing an external Bluetooth speaker.

The gray fabric looks very classy with any decor. Also, the foot is much grippier than the second generation one, so even though the new version is heftier, it moves less. Overall, highly recommended!

reviews.reviewTitle: Slight improvement over the previous generation
reviews.reviewText: The Echo dot when on discount are great value! The new model is heavier and seems built very well. The deep base is slightly better than the 2nd Gen dot, however still not as good as the full size Echo, however songs with bass will quickly make the speaker rattle which makes the speaker unusable at high levels. The tinny sound from the 2nd gen echo dot is gone and now has slightly more bass in this model. I don't find the mic's work better which I was hoping they were. The new model has a hard time recognizing my Wemo light switch for "bedroom" and often says "Bedroom can not do this action" while the older Echo dot 2nd gens had no problem.

reviews.reviewTitle: If you don’t have one, get one.
reviews.reviewText: We love this thing. We downloaded the Alexa app, and amazon music app (we have amazon prime) so I’m not sure if the music app is free otherwise. But it’s super easy to use. It doesn’t struggle to understand what your saying. You can completely control it by voice, even down to volume and putting it to sleep. Our son waits for us to play his favorite songs in the morning to get ready to now (wonky donkey song) it’s got it all. You want to play a playlist from your music app, open it, hit shuffle play, and select it to play through Alexa echo dot and walk away. Too loud? Alexa volume down. Need it to stop? Tell her to pause or stop. Tell her who to call, done. It’s awesome!

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo Dot habla español!! (Speak Spanish finally!!!)
reviews.reviewText: Its first time I have echo device.once I integrate a Smart House and Alexa on echo dot its impressive on how far it understand sentences, clarity and easy to use for simple.things. NOW HABLA ESPAÑOL. My family like to speak Spanish and suddenly it started to speak in Spanish when I setup to Spanish to see if it could do that and it does pretty well. Connected to prime subscription unleash power to listen a lot of music with voice commands. Amazing product!

I have been a fan of Echo Dot since it arrived, have given it as gifts and travel with it. That said, the first two versions have done well when left in place but were unable to keep connecting when I traveled to different locations. This version is slightly larger, definitely heavier, and so far has made it through several trips. I was very disappointed it did not fit into the same carry case as the previous versions, so I had to ditch my cute round pink case and get a clunky black case that fits this version. That said, I use the Dot every day and night (sleep sound machine) and love that it links with my SiriusXM account and Audible.

I bought the Echo Dot (3rd Gen) not knowing if I would even be able to use many functions on it, and wondering if anyone else in the family would even use is. Months later and I learn a little more and a little more of what it is capable of! I have a couple lights hooked up to it, so when I walk in the house carrying way too many bags of groceries, I don't have to put them down before turning on the lights, I just tell Alexa to turn them on for me! I love the ease of set up and the ease of use. Everyone in the family uses it! We listen to music, play games, read books, and obviously turn on the lights. I cannot wait to get a Fire Stick and start using that with Alexa also!

Love All 3 of my Dots. Works well in my smart home. So many different uses. Family games are fun. New is great and i love the fact you can make your own Alexa Skills. Useing Alexa can get immersive. It's funny cause after awhile you start talking to Alexa like a normal person in the house. I found my self even saying thank you after she tells me something. What i like most is the dot is small. There are plenty of 3rd party cases, shelves and mounts that allow you to intergrate it in to your decor. Mine is in a black sturdy rubber protector case that looks like a futuristic version of the old bell alarm clock. Looks awesome with Alexa's ring going.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good way to help children with routine
reviews.reviewText:
Setting up reminders for chores for the kids sure makes it easier around the house and getting stuff done. From wake up to brushing teeth reminders make life easier for our home. Alexa makes a great tool for school work too. Math problems just ask Alexa for help. We have Alexa set up so that every day Alexa tells us what the top story in History is.

I like that the kids can tell Alexa call mom and she does. Alexa will also make announcements so if I'm out for a stroll but stopped to talk with a neighbor I can announce to the kids that I have been delayed but not to worry. I can also "drop in" and listen to things going on in other parts of the house.

I have the second generation Dot, second generation Plus and now the third generation Dot. As expected the sound on the Gen3 Dot is better than the Gen2 but not as good as the Plus but that doesn't matter to me because I've connected it to a pair of floor standing Snell speakers through a Grace Digital Bluetooth amp. Obviously real speakers will beat a tiny speaker by a country mile.

My one complaint is about the power connector. Amazon did something inexcusable with the Gen3 speaker, they used a non-standard round power plug instead of USB as they did on the Gen2 Dot and the Plus. What were they thinking? The no reason to use anything but USB for a low power device such as this.

So far i have been enjoying it but like most people it has been giving me some issues. The first is that it wouldnt give me local weather even though but on my app and online it showed my correct location i actually have to remove my location from both places and then put it back in before it finally gave right weather. Even though if i asked whats my location it would say it right. it also has some trouble understanding commands unless i am right near it. If i say from other side of room play music it seems to get it right about 80% of the time.

reviews.reviewTitle: Might be more technology than a rural area can handle
reviews.reviewText: I have more than a little bit of a chore getting this on-line with a crappy internet connection. The ISP told me I degraded my signal further by adding more devices. GRRRR. Now that I have her on-line my crappy internet is intermittent at best, but early in AM plays great. I have hope if I fire my ISP. I also have to start from scratch if I want to travel with these. Once playing, it has great sound. Alexa has added several items to my shopping list by eavesdropping on conversations -- even something the cat "said". Not happy about that either.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not much different other than a few new issues.
reviews.reviewText:
I upgraded by Dot to the 3rd Gen based on the thought it would have better technical improvements and the comment that it has improved voice recognition; unfortunately the difference is not noticeable. in fact, I find myself having to repeat commands much more often than with my 2nd Gen Dot. Maybe Amazon needs to have separate Voice Recognition settings per device.

Having 2 Dots has caused some issues as well, mostly with Bluetooth connectivity. For some reason the connection I delete from a Dot still automatically connects, and it isn't listed in the settings - strange. It should also be easier to transfer Unlimited Music from one device to another.

I use the Echo Dot in the bedroom as my alarm, play music and ask general questions. I first bought the Alexa tower and enjoyed it so much that I ordered the Echo Dot. If I had known that the sound quality was so good on the Echo Dot, I would not have spent the extra $$ for the tower. I have detected no difference in the sound quality between the two. I will be ordered a few more Dots as Christmas gifts. I really enjoy playing the question of the day and other games. Excellent product at a very reasonable price. Highly recommend the Echo Dot 3rd Generation.

Pros:
- Small
- Great design
- Excellent sound for something so small

Cons:
- It has a really hard time hearing you. Especially if its near other things.

---

My first generation alexa has no problems at all hearing me. But this 3rd generation dot has a lot of trouble picking up my voice. You need to be in line of sight and really project your voice for it to work. My 1st gen is hidden behind things and hears me even from the other room. I can't help but feel the microphones in this generation is worse than their previous models.

Admittedly I primarily use these in conjunction with Amazon Music and to tell me the weather/forecast. I'm not really using these to their full extent yet. However, being able to play the music throughout the whole house across multiple devices is a huge plus, especially if we're planning a party or just cleaning the house. Likewise I'm learning to use the Alexa more effectively in calling for the type of music I'd like to listen to. Setting up the devices was easy. Once I got one setup, the others just needed to be plugged in from the box. I should note that I have the Echo Dot Gen 3 and the Echo Gen 2. The Echo Dot Gen 3 seems to carry sound just as good as the bigger Echo for a fraction of the price. If you're going to buy one, buy two.

We already had the full size echo and enjoy using it daily. I got a the Charcoal and Heather Gray ones for Christmas to maximize voice coverage since our main echo is in a central location and doesn't always hear clearly when there's a lot of activity going on. I put it in our living room and it has helped tremendously! The other one is in my crafting area in the basement and it works great. The drop-in feature that allows you to talk between units is very helpful. I didn't think we'd have much need for that, but it does come in handy. They weren't on my Christmas list, but I'm very glad my husband got them for me. These two are very nice additions to our household.

I caught the Echo Dot on sale and decided to give it a try. I attempted to cancel my order when I learned it did not support Google Play Music. Unfortunately Amazon would not allow the order to cancel since it was being shipped. Needless to say I love the Echo Dot. When it arrived I decided to give it a try and was very satisfied with performance. Not supporting Play Music is a major rain on my parade, I want to love this device. I really want to, but until they add support its only 3 stars from me. Especially when they support nearly every other competitors streaming service. Just bad business.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great product with lots of uses
reviews.reviewText:
I had been tracking this product for long and thinking whether it would be of any use to me. One day, Amazon launched a deal price of $25. I just ordered it and was ready to keep it aside or gift it to someone if it was not going to be of much use to me.

Pros:
1. The first thing i tried was play songs. The sound is crisp and clear. No issues with speech recognition.
2. You are in a middle of some task and got a distraction, ask Alexa to remind you in few minutes to continue the task.
3. The best thing is calling anyone in your contacts on Alexa by just saying - Alexa call <your contact name>.
4. Drop in option is another great feature to talk to people at home from your phone.
5. You can always connect your phone through bluetooth and play any songs on Alexa.

Cons:
1. It is troublesome to play radio stations from Tune in as it expects the exact name (sometimes even the FM frequency), but once you have played, you won't need to repeat the full name next time. But there is an option to play your favorite radio station on your phone and connect it using bluetooth to have alexa sound experience.
2. When you set an alarm and want a specific song to be played for alarm, it asks for amazon music subscription.

There are more options i am yet to explore. Will keep you posted.

Seems to be way less responsive that the 2nd gen devices. The volume setting is either too loud or too low. There is no in between. It also repeats itself even when you don’t ask for it. Unfortunately this will probably go back to amazon.

Purchased this window or Amazon’s annual sale and I’m so happy I did to replace my echo that too. The volume on this one is a lot better quality that doesn’t require using my sound bar like my original one. It also recognizes my voice better however sometimes I have to repeat the questions twice. Ironically if someone is saying Alexa on TV which seats next to the echo he has no problem recommendin purchased this when do I Amazons annual sale and I’m so happy I did to replace my echo that too. The volume on this one is a lot better quality that doesn’t require using my sound bar like my original one. It also recognizes my voice better however sometimes I have to repeat the questions twice. Ironically if someone is saying Alexa on TV which sits next to the echo he has no problem Recognizing their voice. I’m trying to use it a lot more than my echo to because my coworker says that it provides great value. So far so good!

Love these (bought 2) especially at the special price I got on Prime Day! The sound is fantastic for such a small unit and even better when connected by bluetooth to another small portable speaker. My only problem so far is for some reason when I stump Alexa with a question it can't answer, then it stops answering anything until I unplug it and repower in 10-15 seconds. Then works fine again until I ask a question it can't answer and rather than say "I don't know the answer" which it sometimes does, it doesn't say anything and I have to reboot. Works the same on both the Dot's I bought.

reviews.reviewTitle: speaker kinda sucks if your hearing impaired, but has Many Great abilities update below
reviews.reviewText:
Love the ability to set timers!! music playing ok nothing special.
be sure and set it to NOT record everything and send it to google for analysis.
it is set to on as default.
UPDATE
we now own 5 dots and 2 echo 5's this dot has a hard time keeping connected to the internet
The one dot isn't up to snuff it keeps needing a re-install as it can't stay connected to the net. we have to reset it several times a day and it isn't the farthest from the router there are 2 others farther away. might have to send in for repairs. reccomend to a friend 100% as they keep getting better all the time

I like this little fella! I have one of the first generations and it is really awesome. Bringing Alexa to the bedroom if a very convenient way to interact with A.I. I hope Alexa does not listen all the time to conversations in the bedroom LOL
Also, sound quality is impressive for such a small speaker. Voice recognition is great so far! I think this can make a great travel buddy when you have 10 hrs of driving with kids, you can connect it wirelessly to your hotspot, and plug it in your car charger (with a dongle) then you have Alexa on the go! read books, play music, have trivia! just a thought!

I love this speaker so much. I debated getting one for well over a year but now that I have it, Alexa is one of my favorite things in the house. Very helpful, especially with things like reminders and alarms. I got this as a Prime Day deal so it was much cheaper than normal. The only thing I don't like is that it's white-ish in color. I really wanted a black one but when I went to order it the black was all sold out apparently so this was my only option. Honestly, that's my only issue with it at all is that I wish it was the black model, but I'm ok with this one for sure.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy setup, delivers as advertised, versatile smart device
reviews.reviewText: This is my first echo dot. It delivers as advertised. Setup was easy. Voice recognition is very good. It would have been great if it supported music from Youtube but I guess you can do that with your phone while using it as a bluetooth speaker. Yet to test the full range of services but as far as asking questions, telling jokes and playing music, I am satisfied thus far. I like the ability to control other smart devices and aspects of a smart home. Definitely a useful buy, very versatile device. Also, it does not take up much room and speaker volume is loud enough for a standard room.

I have always been "frugal", I dont always pay top price (usually closer to paying the least) and then I am disappointed with the quality (I know, you get what you pay for!) Well let me tell you how surprised I was at the great sound this little thing puts out! I use it mostly for music and LOVE the sound. I know Alexa can help me with so much more but have not "talked" to her much. If this was only a speaker, I would be so very happy with my purchase and yet there is way more this can do. I have a Google at home and really like the sound out of the Dot more

I bought this Echo Dot because it looks like Amazon will never update the gen.2 to support Spanish. But the gen.3 Spanish support is far from good. I have to admit that the service isn't officially available in Argentina, so the servers may be difficult to reach, but the voice recognition had a very noticeable lag (several seconds). Audio playback quality isn't that good either. It has better bass than the gen.2, but without equalization the music sounded like playing from the bottom of a can.
Overall, I would stay with gen.2, even without Spanish support (come on, Amazon... you can't say it can't be done...)

I really like the Dot, so I bought another one. I was afraid to get the refurbished one at a cheaper cost, but I think its louder than my other one, and works really good! We used it on game night to do the music game, and I use it all the time to play music, check the weather, and ask other questions. The only reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is because I've googled, and you-tubed how to sync the 2 dots together for my music, as one is upstairs, and one is downstairs, but I cannot get them to sync at all, no matter what I've tried. It should not be that hard! But over all, I'm happy with both dots!

Really, a horrrible device. You have repeat commands so many times it’s annoying. Plus, I signed up for music unlimited on my device only, and it doesn’t pick up half of the songs. Not only that, but when I connect my phone to the device, it will not pick up songs for music unlimited to that device. Wait a few years and it might be ready. Disconnecting my 3 echo devices and putting them in storage for a few years. Going back to my Bose sound docks. Sorry amazon

I received this device as part of the purchase of a new smart home. After the Echo was installed and setup by the installer, I unplugged it and put it in a closet and do not intend on using it because I don't need it to operate my other smart devices. Echo devices are a great technology, but I've seen news articles where Amazon employees listen and use it for their amusement. I've also seen news articles where recorded statements from these devices were subpoenaed to use in court to prosecute people. These devices invade my privacy and I don't want anything in my home that records everything that I or my family say.

reviews.reviewTitle: The Echo Dot has completely changed my life!
reviews.reviewText: I bought my first Echo Dot during Amazon Prime Days. On the encouragement from my brother, I also bought the Echo Show 5. I am beyond happy with my purchases! With a few simple voice commands - I can find a new recipe, the weather forecast, the latest news, my favorite songs on Pandora, set the a/c to on, and even turn off the lights in my living room (I added power outlets too). I also geeked out on the fact that I could send an announcement to my son's bedroom letting him know that breakfast was ready. I honestly can't believe I waited this long to make these purchases!

I had one and put it in another family members room for inter-room communications. Works great. I added this one to my bedroom for a little late night music, news, and super easy to set alarms without jacking with buttons or dials. Just tell Alexa what time and it's done. The alarm is plenty loud and you can customize it online. I customize my news briefs so when I'm waking up in the morning, I can get the latest in news. Lastly, I just upgraded the TC in the bedroom to a smart UHD TV with WiFi AND Alexa. Yep, I can use alexa to change channels, volume, watch youtube, or nextflix, etc. with no remote. So cool. Love it!

reviews.reviewTitle: Super Easy to Start, Skills Linking More Challenging
reviews.reviewText: I'm still figuring out the skills set-up with the Alexa app, but she worked right away once I plugged her in and downloaded the app. We are getting to know each other. I am trying to get her to control Bose speaker, Samsung TV, and IRobot Roomba. I was very impressed by the very high quality of both the Echo Dot itself, the packaging and information sheet.

reviews.reviewTitle: Warning! Works great if Amazon doesn't automatically attach it to someone else's house
reviews.reviewText:
The 3rd generation one is soo much better. The sound quality is amazing for a small thing.
I spend over an hour with Alexa team trying to figure out why this one didn't connect to my house, even though it is connected to my house. The tech person couldn't figure it out, and to this day, a week later, they haven't contacted me back. Amazon automatically attached it to my secondary house, even though the information listed is the current house I am in. If it starts asking you for rooms or things that aren't in the house you are in, deactivate it, and activate it again.

Purchased three and my teenage son loves it uses it for multiple purposes, my teenage daughter sort of uses it and I have one but most of the time to turn on or off my bedroom lights. Not sure because we have three I had to use a slightly alternative way to command the turning off of the lights. We also had to name each one a different name. Echo only provides four name choices which sucks. The choices are Alexa, echo, Amazon or computer. I ended up with Amazon certainly no one wanted computer. They need more choices or ability to create your own name.

reviews.reviewTitle: Can't get this blasted think to work
reviews.reviewText: I have wasted countless hours trying to get this thing to work, It is really cute and occasional says something to me. I have tried to find a way to run it with my Mac Pro and was unable to do anything. When I try to download an app it wants my amazon account sign in but I am not sure if they mean the same one I go shopping with, anyway, it never accepts my password so I set up a new account with a different email and downloaded apps to an older Android phone but they won't complete the setup. I don't think Alexa likes Apple and does not want to play with the iPhone, I am getting so frustrated I am about to throw this Dot in the river and listen for the Echo.

I love it and bought another one so I could have one in my kitchen/living room and one upstairs in my bedroom. It's especially awesome for list making but also when I'm cooking or doing dishes in the kitchen it's nice to be able to change shows, volume, etc on the TV without having to go grab the remote. It's also handy to be able to just voice a song request but the speakers aren't the greatest and I've had some difficulty connecting it to a few gadgets - that's the only reason for the 4 star review. Also you can't control volume or on/off power of your TV through Alexa unless you have a smart TV and you're able to connect the two. Just having a firestick won't do the trick

reviews.reviewTitle: DAY 2 w/ Echo Dot and I Love It So Far
reviews.reviewText: I purchased the Echo Dot with an Amazon Gift Card after a co-worker recommended it. No-brainer set up, super easy. Was able to connect to my soundbar as well. I am still learning all the I can do with Alexa but it all seems pretty easy so far. As I cleaned up my home, I was able to check the time, set timers, play music from my play lists, ask the weather, make shopping list, play podcasts, etc. (all hands free). My friends use it to set timers for their kids and ask for conversion measurements while cooking. As you can tell my friends and I have simple needs but Alexa seems like a powerful tool for managing our busy homes. My biggest concern was my young son being able to shop via Alexa was easy to fix (just disable voice purchasing). I look forward to learning more about what Alexa can do.

reviews.reviewTitle: Getting info correctly the first time
reviews.reviewText:
The only down fall I can see for "Alexa" is using the Skills for info. Alexa can answer millions of questions but for some specifics like old radio shows. I have to say Alexa open radio Jack Benny or Open Radio the Whistler, I can't say Alexa play the whistler. If I say Alexa play jack Benny it will play songs sung by Jack Benny, If I say Alexa open Jack Benny she will then let me listen to the Jack Benny shows that used to play on the radio.
Alexa has gotten much smarter since I first got the Amazon Echo. Alexa answers my questons correctly more often the Siri.
I now have Alexa turning on a light for me which is great for walking into a dark room.

reviews.reviewTitle: Gotta get the hang of these things!
reviews.reviewText:
Whoa!! Took me a while to get these things sorted out. Purchased 4 of them. Unfortunately I have 2 of them named the same thing as far away from each other as possible, so one doesn't activate the other because of proximity. This feature I don't like. Amazon.... common, get with the program. Due to the community Q&A I have been able to find most of my questions answered, so thanks guys! Multiple rooms having the same audio, that was a tricky one! Overall the quality, sound and price for this is TOTALLY worth it.

Oh and I can drop in when my kids are fighting without getting my lazy butt outta bed. 😉😎😆😀😁😅

reviews.reviewTitle: Great speaker, Love the Echo Dot
reviews.reviewText: We love our echo devices. We have a Gen 1 echo and a Gen 3 echo dot. The Echo has better sound and seems to have a slightly faster response time, but the Gen 3 echo dot doesn't come far behind. Great sound, compact and small, and does everything you expect Alexa to do (we mostly listen to music and control the thermometer and use it as an alarm). My 15 month daughter always turns around and looks at the Echo or Echo dot when I say "Alexa..." and she loves it when the blue circle lights up and the music starts playing. The dot is a great price too. Alexa can use some improvement on answering information questions better, but we've noticed she's been getting better.

reviews.reviewTitle: We just don't use these are we thought we would
reviews.reviewText: Basically we have bought a few egg-times. We just don't use these are they are intended. It's a particularly poor music speaker, the room to room intercom is not good enough and the rest is hype. At least someone in Amazon can listen in to our arguments. Please let me know who you are so that you can confirm that I am right and she is wrong.

Huge improvement from 2nd generation dots. I bought two of these to replace a 1st generation echo we had in a small "sitting room" in our house.

I have these two 3rd gen dots in a stereo pair and they sound great for the music and volume we listen to. Usually no higher than 5, and listening to classic rock and Jam Band music. In my opinion this stereo pair sounds better than the single 1st gen echo.

Obviously no earth shattering bass, but I feel they are very "full" sounding. I'm considering adding an echo sub at some point, probably will if Amazon ever runs a deal on it.

I don't think you can beat the $50 I spent on this setup. Not sure if they would sound as good in a larger room, but definitely working well for my need.

I'm thinking of adding at least one to our laundry room. Besides bathrooms, laundry room is only place without an echo. I couldn't justify the cost of a full sized echo in there, and the old dot wasnt worth listening to music on. This 3rd gen just might be the sweet spot to getting music everywhere in our home.

reviews.reviewTitle: Just wish this had been the 1st generation
reviews.reviewText: The sound on this little thing is 10 times better than all of the past generations. Looks good and works well. Has the headphone out jack if you want this thing to play from your good stereo system, but where this shines is in places that you don't typically have a stereo such as the bedroom/guest bedroom or kitchen. Compared to the past Dots ( of which I have several), these are not tinny at all and have a much better range and can easily be understood without straining to hear. Better understandability for lack of a better word. My only regret is that I can't just replace all of my older models with these.

reviews.reviewTitle: Started beeping and wouldn't respond to any request to shut off
reviews.reviewText: I got this Echo Dot thinking that I needed it to control an Amazon smart plug. It turned out that the Dot was not really needed, as I can turn the smart plug on and off from the Alexa app. Although integration with the Dot started out smoothly and the Dot was cute to talk to for weather and music, when the Dot offered to turn on my smart plug for a timed interval, I tried it out. Unfortunately, when it got to the end of the interval, it started beeping and saying Interval is done. Nothing I could try would make it stop beeping. I tried saying, "Alexa, stop" and "Alexa, mute" and "Alexa, shut up" but it just kept on going. I thought maybe it would get tired and quiet down on its own, but no such luck. So I unplugged it and enjoyed the peace and quiet. By then I realized I had spent $50 on something that had some design flaws, so i returned it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Sounds and Mic are Better than 2nd gen Echo
reviews.reviewText:
First time owning the Amazon Echo dot 3rd gen device, i’m surprised of what it can do for me and my family. I have amazon music unlimited so i take full advantage use of the service with Echo device. The sound quality for music is ok, lacking bass and highs but when i connect to my Bluetooth speaker, it is a music power house. With this set up, i dont need the Echo full size. Dot is perfect because of the size and it does everything like the big brother full size Echo. I was able to get an addition Echo Dot 2nd gen cheap and it makes me like my Dot 3rd gen even more. Dot 3 sounds better, louder, and pick up voice commands easier.

What do i use this for in a daily basis? Weather, timer, alarm, white noise machine, music, story time for my kids, voice games, control my smart plugs and switches, npr news.

reviews.reviewTitle: I like it. Dynamic bass according to volume.
reviews.reviewText:
It works great. Much better then the 2nd gen Dot. I really like it playing in conjunction with the 2nd gen Echo. It also picks up my voice a lot better than that Echo, which surprised me. By itself, the Echo sounds much better. I’m actually more curious about the sound of two 3rd gen Dots in stereo with the sub-woofer, then using two Echos with it.

I found out you can’t have an Echo and a Dot in stereo. I only wanted to try them like that on opposite sides of a large room to hear the different mixes more isolated, and blending as I move between them. Viva la difference... maybe. Oh well. So much for being a musician and wanting to hear the instruments differently, and more isolated.

Actually, what I did right before I got the new Dot, was connect the Echo to a 2.1 sound system and that just sounds awesome. That’s the way to go; I would say, but I still like the Dot and Echo in mono unison as well, depending on the situation obviously.

Update:
I found the EQ in Sounds setting, so now I like it even more. I’ve only heard one album so far, but for now, the EQ settings in the photo really enhanced the sound. The best volume for that is 8, which is pretty loud.

Also, I’m sure it needs a more powerful AC adapter than the previous standard USB.

Ok...I am a 65 old woman. Not terribly techy. Got my 3rd gen Dot today, had it set up in 5 mins. Now have the newest in my bedroom..the sound is much better...the older dot in bathroom for morning news and music while showering...figured out how to connect 2 downstairs to a group. I LOVE this system! ...and, really..the 3rd gen is really nice, much better sound...and if you've got the extra cash..do it. Just another small lovely convenience...(and I could have gotten it for $7 a month if I had wanted) WOOOOHOOOO

oh...I also have my living room light connected...and can turn it on with my Kindle (ha! yeah, Im addicted) from work when I leave at 10p

I purchased this on Amazon Day and got a great deal. I have a 1st generation that I have been very happy with so I wanted to have a dot for my bathroom. The first one arrived and from the get go I was unimpressed. It sounded muffled and I tried it in different rooms in the house but nothing helped. I exchanged the Echo Dot through Amazon and the second one sounded exactly the same, muffled. I did find the settings and turned the bass all the way down and that seemed to help some but not enough. My 1st gen still sounds way better. When I talked to Amazon about doing one last exchange to see if I could get a good product and was told that my only option was to return it for a refund and repurchase. Now they cost twice as much......

After initial setup, which was more or less simple, the device kept insisting to have my phone number. WHile I get that that is how it could get some functionality for messages and calls, fact is I don't care about it and do not want it. There was no way to have this stopped. Because of that, I simply remove app from my phone and the so called "smart" device keeps sending notifications (or at least it says so) to my phone -which is not connected!" Second and more disappointing matter: outside of very simple questions like the weather, traffic and few others, most of the the time the device/service does not know the answer. Then there is the annoying fact that this "smart" device only understands if you ask or better said, pronounce words of places, cities, things, etc in English. WHy would that matter? Because at home we have 4-5 languages going on and we know the real names of place, things, etc....This spills into events, facts, history, etc of several other countries where we often go and need to get info of. Sometimes we have no idea what the English would be....We are at a point of disconnecting it and throwing it (unless someone wants it free). I'm going to give it a few days chance when I see about connecting a few lights and other and see how that works (though I do know that to make it work remote, I'll need to connect to my phone, but I'm setting up a Line2 disposable number so if I want to be done with it, I simply delete the Line2 and number.
While I'm sure it has good uses for many other people; it does not work at all for us and other people in similar situations (we have checked with amy of our friends in more or less same and they all say the same.
All in all, quite disappointed.

I don't have Amazon Prime, so that automatically prevents me from accessing certain "features," but this is still a welcome addition, almost like having another person around. She (Alexa) might not know everything, but she'll let you know if she doesn't understand or just doesn't know something. I play games with her and ask her questions, have her set alarms, watch the house when I'm gone, give me weather and scores, play music, and so much more. For the price I paid fo the Echo Dot on Prime Day, Alexa has already returned that price to me several times over.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Device, you can't go wrong!
reviews.reviewText: To start with, I have had conversations with my wife about this technology and thought "why would we ever have a need for this thing" ... So I never bought one. Then we really wanted a Ring door bell and the first echo dot was bundled with... Needless to say, we now have three dots and found them so intuitive and fun I can't imagine how we got along without them. Truly amazing. I am contemplating getting the show 5 next to replace my alarm clock! There are so many more "skills" Alexa can do than we task her with but it's awesome... Yes these are exciting times we live in if you stop and think about it...

I had the 2nd gen dot, and other of the devices, but the problem with the 2nd gen was it's lack of a real speaker and its plasticy cheap feeling. This new 3rd gen is definitely a vast improvement over the 2nds sound. I can actually hear it when I am taking a shower (as one does sit in my bathroom) or hear it pretty clear from anywhere in my house. Mind you I do have the Echo plus, 2 other dots, and the 1st Gen Show placed in different areas of the house, but the point is instead of having to have music play through all the devices if i want I can just use that one 3rd gen dot. It also has a more premium look and feel vs just the plastic 2nd gen. I have purchased 4 more gen 3s as gifts for family members for Christmas. I highly recommend this product

This is my 2nd Echo Dot. I have one in my livingroom & this one in the bedroom. I've surprised myself as to how many different ways I've used them. Got a Wemo smart plug to have an awkwardly placed lamp to turn on. Set reminders, ask questions, tell it to add items to shopping/to do lists which shows on your phone to check off at market, play games, set alarms, play bedtime meditation sounds on a timer, play almost any music, send direct voice messages to a friend that also has one & Amazon notifies you on it if your order shipped or was delivered! I said I didn't NEED one but NOW I can't imagine living without them!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Spontaneous kitchen dance parties up by 100% !
reviews.reviewText: We got a Dot for Christmas and we love it. We have automated most of the lights and switches on our first floor. My kids love being able to say "Alexa, play (insert practically any song title here)" and then a 3 minute dance party happens in our kitchen. Not to sound too corny, but it has brought our family a little closer together as a result of the instant fun that happens as a result of having the Dot. Its great to be able to play music while preparing meals, or really anytime. Love saying "Alexa, Goodnight" and having all the lights that were left on turn off, instead of me going around the house turning them off one by one. Now we need to get one for upstairs!

reviews.reviewTitle: She only recognizes my voice 50% of the time :(
reviews.reviewText:
Alexa has a lot of trouble recognizing my voice. She keeps wanting to call me by my husband's name & we sound NOTHING alike. When I ask her to learn my voice, she says she already knows who I am & names him instead of me. The next time I ask "who am I?" she gets it right. We go back & forth..
She does a good job of turning lights & gadgets on & off and she plays the music I ask for pretty well. I wish I could ask her to play music for a set amount of time. She doesn't get that yet. Maybe she will improve as more technology is added to her.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is not the home AI device you are looking for.
reviews.reviewText: Buy yourself a Google Home Mini for $20 and save yourself the trouble. Even with an Amazon Music subscription, Alexa can never find what I want, but I can searching Amazon on my desktop. More than half the time Alexa cannot understand me and I have moved her all over the place and tried speaking louder too. Finally, when Alexa does understand me, her answers are more than often useless. This may be the first purchase I return out of just pure dissatisfaction.

After waiting, I finally purchased my first Echo Dot. I love it...what nice technology! At its price I highly recommend it. I just ordered another and will buy a third shortly. I purchased 10 smart plugs and it’s a breeze now controlling, fans, heaters, lighting, my sound bar, air purifiers, coffee makers, etc, etc. I can check the weather add to my shopping list, open the garage door and have Alex wake me whenever the need arises. And all from my chair without getting up. I can say “Alexa turn on Security” from my bed and external flood light respond. This is great tech!

These things were on sale for $24.99 for Black Friday, so I ordered 5 of them, a couple for the house and few to gift....after getting them set up, we found them to be pretty cool! Sometimes if the music is too loud, Alexa will have a hard time hearing you call her name, but at a comfortable volume it functions very well, and it understands regular talk....so you don't have to talk like Mr Roboto or baby talk it to get it to understand you.... We have 2 linked so it plays music on both when we are listening to it. feels very sturdy and well built too. Happy with purchase...P.S....One of the first things we did after set-up was disable the auto purchase function in the settings!

reviews.reviewTitle: Love the Sound; Had a Problem With the First One
reviews.reviewText:
I ordered this 3rd generation Echo Dot to upgrade the existing 2nd generation Echo Dot we had in our bedroom. I found myself listening to music on it, but the sound quality was weak.
The sound quality of this new one blew me away! But shortly after receiving it, a buzzing sound developed in the speaker with every sound it made, almost like the speaker was blown. (I never turned the volume up past 3, BTW) I contacted Amazon and they, of course, took care of the issue immediately. They sent me a new one, and the new one is perfect. It sounds great and does everything it should. We may have to upgrade the other two of the gen 2s we have in the house!

reviews.reviewTitle: Frequent disconnects. Marginally better sound than previous Dot.
reviews.reviewText:
I got this because the music sound quality on the previous Dot is sub par. It's a little fuller on this one but it's still not up to my standards. I can listen to it though I wouldn't use it at parties. I get it. They want you to buy their bigger speaker.
My go-to speaker is my Sonos 1, I'm just getting tired of saying "Alexa, play..........In the Den".

There are differences in what this Dot will understand, vs. my previous Dot. Not sure what that is about.

Biggest complaint is that this thing seems to bug out. A lot. I constantly get the red ring followed by "I'm having trouble understanding". After an unplug/replug it seems to work fine. Sometimes not.

reviews.reviewTitle: Just like having my own DJ during the Christmas Holidays
reviews.reviewText: I bought three of these for the holiday season as I took advantage of the discounts. All the years I have been seeing these devices and was still unsure. But I was blown away by the quality of sound. It plays fantastic and any genre of music it can play...It was loud and you had nonstop music. When my husband wanted the latest BBC news he just had to ask Alexa and she starts the news channel. The only drawback is you must have Amazon prime although there is an option to pay for the music library but since I had Prime it was not an issue for me. Great device.Great product. Next waiting for Amazon to have an ideal price for the Fire Kindle. Still my next gift I want

reviews.reviewTitle: Works pretty well, once setup that is...
reviews.reviewText:
I ordered two of these, because I read about the drop in feature and figured having two of them would be useful, and could use it from different ends of the house. First off, the setup could use some work, it was kind of confusing and very convoluted. It took at least 3 separate tries to setup the first Echo Dot, it would get partially through a software update and then fail with an error. I had no clue if I was doing something wrong, and was about to the point of just returning them out of frustration. Finally on the third try the software update finally went through and voila, it said setup was complete. I thought a miracle had happened. I tested a few things, and Alexa responded as expected. When I went to setup the 2nd Echo Dot, expecting the same amount of struggle, and it literally was done in a few seconds. I had no issues whatsoever. I don't know if the first unit was able to share information with it, or what the issue was but it was done and working in no time, and it was farther away from my WiFi routher than the first one is. Weird.

Then I hit another frustration point, when I tried to setup Alexa to launch Netflix and Hulu on my Firestick 4K. When I tried to activate the Netflix and Hulu video skills in Alexa, for the life of me I couldn't figure it out, and had no idea what I was doing wrong. I think Alexa was confused because there were multiple Fire TV devices on my account, and she didn't know which one to launch the program on. Finally out of frustration I unlinked/de-registered the other devices since I was not going to be using them anyway, and voila, it started working. It was all very confusing and frustrating, but in the end I finally got it working. It seems to be a useful product, and have already configured smart plugs to turn on lights. I really like being able to get information instantly, like when does a store close in my area, etc. I hope to learn more useful things it can be used for. However, it still feels sorta stupid to be talking to a machine, but maybe I'll get past that. All in all it seems like a decent product for the money invested, so we'll see.

Not really something I use often. More or less a paperweight along with my other “smart home” devices. Other than an alarm clock or for music purposes it just sits there because it isn’t “needed” by myself I guess. Also, it won’t play my flash briefings unless I restart it on a daily basis. Wi-fi has a strong signal throughout my home and I adjusted my security settings like it said in the instructions yet it’s constantly needing reset.

reviews.reviewTitle: The product is good by itself but needs improvement!
reviews.reviewText:
I admit I was disappointed with this Echo before then after posting my experience, amazon reached out by phone and email to try to understand the reason behind the review. After the call, I discovered so many features and capabilities.
Such as: ability to create groups for difference "smart" items you want controlled together, the ability to connect via bluetooth to an existing speaker, connect to echo itself by bluetooth, link to fire stick,...

After this experience, I highly recommend amazon to streamline the setup process towards minimizing frustration to the user further down the roads. Also, improve microphone and initially set only one source of flash news until the user changes it (e.g., NPR or BBC?)

Overall, i recomment this product, looks cool and my friends always get impressed when i say:" Alexa, turn off the lights!".

Being a music plebeian who never before owned an external speaker, I would likely give this lil’ guy 5 stars ... if I didn’t also get the full-sized Echo. The Dot sounds perfectly fine to my untrained ears until I try using the speakers together. Then every other limitation already addressed in all the other reviews becomes clear. I’m told I just need to fiddle with the sound settings and, any day now, I’m sure I’ll give that a whirl. Without comparing to the bigger, better, more expensive speakers, it works just fine. Dot’s tiny, unobtrusive shape means I can tuck it into more places than the tall Echo. Alexa-wise, it works as expected. I don’t love the Alexa app, but that’s a different story. We use the Dots, along with Echo, to play music around the house, as well as control several Smart Plugs. Overall, a fun purchase for spreading the groove tunes around your space.

reviews.reviewTitle: First impression is this could be good.
reviews.reviewText:
Speaker quality leaves a bit to be desired. Voice recognition is also mediocre. Ease of use rates high once you get the thing to understand you. Still exploring features and will edit when we have a better idea of how we're doing to use this.

Edit: This device keeps attempting to steer my selection of music to Amazon Cloud Music service which it says is set as default. I prefer Spotify and even when there is a spotify selection available, alexa says it can't find it and tries to get me to subscribe to Amazon music. To hell with that and screw Jeff Bezos. Demoted to one star for intrusive decisions it makes on your behalf. Would give it zero if that was possible.

reviews.reviewTitle: The Echo is a junk box
reviews.reviewText: We got this for a Christmas gift and it does not work good at all. I’m pretty sure it is defective I set it up for about a week then unplugged it because it constantly stopped playing during songs and when you would ask “Alexa” to continue to play it would just spin and spin and never respond. It’s back in the box. I don’t recommend it . I even unplugged my router and tried re- setting it so many times. Nothing helped. The Echo is junk .

The Echo Dot 3rd generation speaker is a significant improvement over the prior generation speaker. The speaker itself is slightly larger than the prior version wrapped in a grey fabric. The sound quality and voice recognition are significantly improved. Music sounds louder, richer and clear. You can pair another Echo Dot for stereo sound although you won't get a Sono's or Bose experience, yet the speakers sounds pretty good for such a compact size. The connection is pretty flawless with the Alexa App. Overall an improvement over the previous model.

Echo Dot + Alexa App + Spotify = waste of time

For a company exceeding $200,000,000,000 in revenue for 2018, it is mind blowing that thousands of people have this problem.

reviews.reviewTitle: More useful than you might think
reviews.reviewText:
Requested/received as a gift, mostly just wanted it for simple things like quick checking weather, traffic and music while getting ready in the morning, which it does fine. I do like that it can control my Deebot vacuum, which is nice so I can ditch the remote and hide the charging station under our couch. I also discovered it can control my tv, at least once it's been turned on as apparently I don't have it set to always be connected to Wi-Fi. But that's also a nice quality of life feature I wouldn't have considered normally, as it's surprising how many times hands free controlling of the tv is helpful.
As time goes on I'm sure I'll find more uses for my Echo, but it's already a great addition to my house.

reviews.reviewTitle: I Will NEVER forget anything ever again
reviews.reviewText: I have an absent memory sometimes and always would forget things which is why I bought her in the first place, but she does way more!! If you are away from the unit, she will also send the reminders to your phone. I also have a bad habit of leaving my phone in weird places, she's got a find my phone feature and I've used it more times than I care to admit. I Love her timers you can set for cooking, her announcements you can make for the whole house, the games she has, I can keep track of my favorite sports teams scores without having to turn on the TV, when you make a grocery list, she'll send that straight to your phone too, so you'll never forget your list at home....And so much more!!!! I loved it so much and read up about things she could do and her advancements, that I bought another for my Dad, who is hearing impaired, for Christmas. I am impressed at the technology and it's just amazing. I am so happy I purchased her!! Now if I can just get her to cook for me and make me a sandwich, that would be perfect!

reviews.reviewTitle: A bit heavy on the bass and light on the treble; replaces my Echo Dot 2nd Gen.
reviews.reviewText: The bass was strong, and the treble was weak, probably because of the shielding from the grippers of the wall mount. But, I didn't want to fool around drilling holes to let more treble out, as others had mentioned. I did, however, adjust the tone from the Alexa app as much as possible. This is mounted in the bathroom of the master bedroom and paired with an Echo in the bedroom. That way, when I must use the bathroom, I get continuity of programing. (Sorry, I'm just a privileged geek.). This rig replaces a similar one with an Echo Dot 2nd generation.

reviews.reviewTitle: Sound Quality Much Better than 2nd Generation!!
reviews.reviewText: I had two Echo Dots 2nd Generation and thought they were pretty good. I also have the Echo but put the dots in various rooms. I saw the 3rd Generation at a great price for Black Friday and couldn't resist and ordered 3 of them. Well let me tell you that the sound quality is far superior than the 2nd Generation. It's also much louder if you like that. Huge difference in over sound quality of music. Set up was simple and the 3rd Generation can respond to my voice from a much father distance than both my Echo and 2 Generation Dots. I'll of course keep the 3rd Generation for myself and gift the two 2nd Generation Dots I have to family member who do not have any Alexa devices.

I was delighted to discover that Alexa already knew what my favorite music was because she is linked to my Amazon music account. I just wish there were clear instructions on how to adjust the sound balance. I stumbled across it once but couldn't find the balance slides since. If Amazon made it easier to adjust the sound, there would be fewer complaints about sound quality.
Still, this was a great deal on Amazon Prime Day. Hope it goes on sale for Cyber Monday in November. Also have Alexa learn your voice so she doesn't turn on everytime the word Alexa comes in the TV or radio.

I had an old Alexa that I tried to set up in my husband's office last year. It didn't work. I returned it and received a small credit. When I saw the Dot on special, I decided to try it. I set it up in husband's office. I read the instructions on how to set it up (the instructions were not too complicated!) and lo and behold it worked! We are learning how to use the intercom feature. It is nice to just have Alexa call the office for my husband and I to communicate rather than having to go call up the stairs or, heaven forbid, have to actually walk upstairs!

I like the idea of the echo dots. I wish they were cheaper. I would only give it a 3.5 rating if I could, but I don't think a 3-star rating is justified. I believe them to be worth the $30 I paid when it was on sale. But anyway, that isn't the purpose of this review.
