Watch the video, it's cute. It is my almost 3 year old. He loves to push the microphone button and ask Alexa what time it is. The fact that Alexa can actually understand him is pretty cool if you ask me. I know many adults who don't understand him when asking this question. Good algorithm. :-)

Big boost in Bluetooth performance and sound quality. Buy 3rd Gen instead of the 2nd Gen. The improvement far outweighs the small cost difference.

If you're like me (bought the original Dot at $89 and was bruised when 6-weeks later the price was slashed in half) it's OK to shake off lingering resentment and buy an "all new" 3rd Gen Dot. You immediately enjoy the new experience.

The Alexa platform is getting smarter. The mobile app interface is cluttered, but Amazon is constantly improving. My grandparents (and everyone I know) gets hooked on Alexa in a flash. Besides a better price point, Alexa beats both Apple and Google hands-down (IMHO) .
Arrived today--have been trying to get it to connect to WiFi ever since. Have spent the last hour trying to contact some sort of customer service. Waste of time and money. Boo.

reviews.reviewTitle: Convenient assistant, BUT no Shuffle for Apple Music
reviews.reviewText: Alexa works great as an assistant (weather, shopping lists, calendar, dictionary, etc.) but I purchased it to play music, specifically to easily access the many extensive Playlists I've created in Apple Music. It only took a day to realize that while it responds affirmatively when you request it to Shuffle the songs in a Playlist, it actually only Shuffles the first song and then plays the following songs in alphabetical order by artist. This means in a Playlist with 1,000+ songs I have to listen to dozens of consecutive songs by a single artist. That's hours worth of Radiohead before I get to hear a Wilco song. Also, when you hear a song in Apple Music you want to download to your Library, it is unable to do so. It seems the consensus is these will not be fixed anytime soon since Amazon and Apple have competing streaming music services and of course, Amazon wants you to use theirs. If this wasn't the case I would have provided a 5 Star rating . . .

Instructions for getting these dot's to pair with Wi Fi are horrible. You go in circles for hours. I got one out of three finally to pair and I'm sending the others back. Frustration level is not worth having these things. Support was very patient with trying to help me but nothing they said made sense to me since I didn't see what they said I should be seeing on my cell screen. I have two friends with a similar experience with these devices.

This may sound kind of silly, but I bought this for the bathroom so I could listen to music while showering. It's compact, and I got the sandstone to blend in nicely with my white quartz countertops. The sound quality surpassed my expectations, considering the size and price. I did turn up the treble a few notches and the bass one notch, and it's great. Volume can get surprisingly loud if you want it too. I tend to listen around half volume and it's plenty. The microphones work very well, too. Even with the shower running and music playing, I can say "Alexa, turn it up" or "Alexa, next song" and she hears me right away. I got it on sale, making it an even better value!

I received 2 of the 3rd gen's after purchasing some Ring products, I already had 3 of the 2nd gen's so I replaced them. This sounds so much better and the voice recognition is definitely better. Amazon is heading in the right direction with this and it makes my home automation so much better. I have Hue, Ring, and Nest products, as well as some smart switches so having Alexa do the work when I am too lazy to pull out my phone is great. Setting this generation up is a breeze compared to the last 2, it's not like they were difficult by any means but this is just so much more efficient.

reviews.reviewTitle: New and Improved, but less universal...
reviews.reviewText: So the new Echo Dot has improved sound quality over the 2nd generation dot. The bass is a bit richer, and overall sound is better. The unit is slightly larger, and has a new design. That being said, I'm not at all a fan of the fabric outside; the only thing that accomplishes is making it look more like the Google Home. Now, the real and true killer of this device, and the reason it's only getting 2 stars, is the lack of USB power. I understand the slightly larger speaker may require power above 5v, though I'm not sure that's the reason.. However, I now need some proprietary cable to power the unit.. I may be returning it, and getting another 2nd generation dot instead.

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo is for us, Google mini wasn't
reviews.reviewText: We love our echo dot. Great sound and responds to voice commands really well. We use ours in our kitchen and I love using the timer feature. It's easy to set a timer on my stove, but Alexa makes it even more hands-free. Some times my hands and fingers are dirty, so I feel it is a nice bonus to have that ability via a simple voice command. It's our first one so I can't compare it to the 2nd gen ones that I've read about, but I love this one. We bought my Dad a Google mini, because he has used his girlfriends in the past and he's not too tech savvy so I didn't want to throw him off, but I like my Alexa much better. I don't know why, but I just think Alexa responds to my voice much easier and knows exactly what I need. BONUS is the added Amazon prime music. We are prime members and it is much easier to find the music we want to listen to on the echo vs. the Google mini. Google mini only seemed to give "related" music stations to what you are searching for. For instance, Johnny cash. Google only gave us a station that played his music occasionally or more often, songs that they considered similar; while Alexa just gave us Johnny Cash (which is what we wanted). If I want 90's alternative, it gave me 90's alternative. This is our first time using the prime music feature with out prime membership and I don't know why we've waited this long. Now we didn't purchase anything extra with the Google mini, music-wise, so that might make a difference. But with the Alexa we would never have to (along with our prime membership which we already had). I'm not tech savvy in anyway, so if you want to get in detailed specs and such, I can't offer that review! we will be purchasing more!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Good but much much less functional than expected. Real problems with Australian amazon accounts.
reviews.reviewText:
I bought this product to explore the Alexa/Amazon universe for the first time. I intended to use it with my two Amazon Fire TVs that I had just acquired. The echo dot is *good-ish*, but there were a lot of problems, rather than everything working "straight out of the box".

1. Initially, all of the TV control functions would not work, and on investigation the entire menu section in the Alexa App for TV controls was missing. It took weeks to figure out what was going on: Amazon had decided the device was being used in Australia, and although they don't tell you this at all, Amazon chooses not to let Australian users control their TV through Echo Dot. I don't know why. Although I bought the Echo Dot in USA, bought the TV in USA, downloaded the Alexa App from the USA iTunes store and am using it in the USA, I once used to live in Australia. This was frustrating as all of the "Help" sites said "navigate to the TV settings in your Alexa app" and this whole section was missing. I eventually solved this after several weeks, but it involved having to fundamentally change settings across my entire Amazon account.

2. After I solved this, I discovered that, unlike my trusty Google Home devices which can control multiple fire TVs, the Echo Dot can only be paired with one Amazon Fire TV. Really annoying, as this also limits me using the other TV as a speaker.

3. Since then, I have battled to get Alexa to actually control the TV it is paired with. It can definitely turn it on and off, but after that... well if there's a solution, I haven't cracked it. I've stopped using the Alexa and have gone back to using my Google Home as my primary "media control" device.

4. Echo Dot and Alexa refuse to acknowledge my Audible account. Well, no, that's not quite true. They won't acknowledge my Audible.com.au account, which I log into using my Amazon.com username and password. Australian Audible is not OK. The only way I can listen to an audiobook using the Echo Dot is to start a new Audible.com (not Audible.com.au) account, and re-buy the books I want to listen to. As you can imagine, I am underwhelmed.

5. I use Alexa/Echo Dot to control my wifi lights at home, and it generally works well... adding new lights was not difficult once I understood the process, and grouping them into rooms has worked well.

6. I use simple routines with the Echo Dot/Alexa such as good morning and good night, which play me morning news, tell me the weather and turn the lights on/off as needed. Not bad, but REALLY limited as to what information I can have played in my morning feed compared to Google Home.

7. She doesn't love my Australian accent. Sigh. Nothing I can do about that. Oh well.

So.... for me, the Echo Dot has not lived up to the hype. The advertising implies it can do many things, but in actual practice, it turns out it's mostly just a voice-activated speaker, and Amazon has chosen to be really difficult about country codes. I'm not a google fan per se, but in comparison, the Google environment works much much better.

I love my Echo Dot! I had the larger one before (Amazon Alexa, I believe it's called), but I found that one too be too large for my needs, so I replaced it with this adorable little Echo Dot. I love that it's white--it's so sleek, and really blends in with the decor in the room I have it in. I often play my Spotify music through it, and it's SO LOUD. I didn't expect it to be so loud, but wow! It's really a great tool to have at home to get information from, keep track of things like grocery lists, and to just simply play music. Love it!

reviews.reviewTitle: Eats Gen 2 Echo for brunch, it's no full-sized Echo (and that's ok)
reviews.reviewText:
Is this as good as the full sized Echo? No. The full sized Echo has a significantly deeper sound and notable bass. It's not bad, and a great value for the money (I got the Gen 2 Echo Dot when it was $50), but if you want to blast music and feel it, this is not for you.

However, if you're not sure what to get and don't want to outlay $70-100, get this guy. You will not regret it.

The previous Echo Dot was very tinny and could not fill a larger room with sound. It would probably work for a small room like a bedroom, but obviously, the idea that Jeff B. is listening in makes that less palatable for many people. The new Echo Dot is probably ideal for a kitchen, office or smaller living room - anything larger needs the full-size Echo to act as a small stereo.

We now have 4 Echo devices throughout our house and a group so music can play throughout (also can do announcements for the kids to ignore "Dinner's Ready").

Final thoughts: Don't get the Gen 2. It's worth the extra $5-10 to get the better Dot

reviews.reviewTitle: How is this product out in the real world for 3 years now? SO MANY BUGS!
reviews.reviewText:
I have found over 10 bugs in the first 2 days. I am still going to keep it because it's so inexpensive, but it really has so many flaws. I want the alexa for 3 things: Alexa, REMEBER XZY... ALEXA add to list XYZ, and ALEXA remind me at time XZY to do ABC.....

all of these features work terribly.

"Alexa - remember that Roger owes Brian $20"

Alexa --> Did you say, "Roger O'Brian $20"?

"Alexa, add a reminder for 12pm"

Alexa --> What would you like me to remind you about?

"To do my physical Therapy"

Alexa --> Here is a list of Physical Therapists in your area.

etc. etc.

Customer Support is AWESOME....and they will call you in less than 2 minutes you are talking to a PERSON! that's amazing!

but you still cannot do stupidly simple things like, "Alexa, print my grocery list"

and you cannot delete a reminder...even if Alexa got it wrong. you used to be able to do this, but now they took the feature away. you can only mark it completed....or UNPAIR/UNREGISTER and re-REGISTER the device...

Support says the "completed reminders will clear themselves eventually" but how long is that?" no idea, they didn't say.

This device is still in BETA. Keep that in mind.

I bought this on the 2018 Black Friday sale for $25 and enjoyed the first one so much I ordered two more. Can do multi room music which saved me a ton of money over buying more expensive speakers like Sonos. The speaker quality is what you would expect for the price, Bass is okay but high tones crackle. The Alexa app has an equalizer built in so you can adjust each Dot’s mid and bass levels. The mic does okay at picking up your voice but if the music is too loud you have to yell “ALEXA, ALEXAAA, DAMMMIIIITTTTT ALEXA” and eventually she will respond. Alexa is not as smart as the google version. Hopefully more updates and she will do better. Overall for the price I paid I’m satisfied.

reviews.reviewTitle: DON NOT WASTE YOUR TIME AND MONEY
reviews.reviewText: Worst purchase I’ve ever made. Have a 1 out of 5 stars cuz she works MAYBE 1 out of 5 times. Set my whole house up with Alexa (lights, tv, outlets, etc..) and she hardly ever works. I have GREAT wifi connection and have spent a lot of money to make sure of it because Alexa always tells me my devices are not responding and to check connection. After spending hundreds of dollars on modems and the highest quality WiFi package she continues to do the same. I go to my apps to control from my phone and it works fine but Alexa doesn’t not, proving the problem is with Alexa. Also, if she does not hear you clearly, expect a 5 minute explanation of some movie or book named “lights” at full volume at when you are trying to get up for work. Worst part is when she gets started she will not stop, even yelling “Alexa” at the top of your lungs will not stop her. You just have to wait it out while she wakes up the whole house. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good for the price, needs some work on a couple aspects though
reviews.reviewText:
I bought this unit to compare the functionality of Alexa versus Google, of which I already have several devices. So far I've seen that it definitely has better long range hearing, as in it can actually hear you from across the room, and given the LED strip around the edge, it seems to actually be able to figure out a pretty accurate direction on where you're talking to it from. It also understands commands better than Google, though granted it can't do everything. Right now I have it mounted to the wall next to my stereo, and I used to have it hooked up to the stereo by 3.5mm aux port, but due to some issues with that it's just linked to the stereo by Bluetooth now. When connected by 3.5mm, songs will suddenly stop playing through the stereo, but the Alexa app says they're still going, and it seems like the only fix is to skip or restart the song. Bluetooth does not have this problem, however if I had some suggestions for software updates in the future, they'd be this: when the Echo is linked to a stereo either by Bluetooth or aux port, ALL the audio comes through the aux device, even Alexa just answering questions. I'd suggest putting in an option for the Echo to have regular Alexa voice come through its own speakers and music go through the aux device, at least giving the user a choice to choose from. I'd also suggest if that option became available, that the Echo lets Bluetooth linked devices and stereos sleep when inactive, and when given the command to play media, gives the wake command to the device before playing.

All in all though, it's been pretty nice, definitely worth the price, and is definitely my choice for playing music.

Let’s face it. I love both of my Echo Dots. I ask about the weather, set a timer, add to grocery list, call ME when I can’t find my cellphone, tell me a joke, and give me information on just about everything. I can yell from the kitchen “Echo! Play Connie Francis ‘Where The Boys Are’” and it starts. It felt not as cold as it should have been in my refrigerator, so I asked Echo what the temperature should be. She replied that the temperature should be 37. So now I have ordered a new fridge. (It was 56 and getting hotter!) My granddaughter keeps Echo busy also. We had to use Echo because the news stations and commercials kept saying Alexa!!

Wonderful! We love our Alexa’s! I bought two with the Christmas special. You can do so much with her. I have had her read audio books off Hoopla for me, play music, games, tell jokes, read the Bible and it is also fun to just ask her random questions! The only thing I cannot figure out is speaker pairing... I paired both Alexa’s but was considering unpairing and can’t find it. I did discover that she only plays music on both, but games, audio books, alarms, etc seem to go through the one you start it on. So maybe the pairing is not so bad. I was just afraid of it bothering someone else if I wanted to do my own thing in the other room or is a random alarm went off.

So I did get this and two Phillips Hue bulbs for a very low price on Prime Day, so i thought i would give it a shot. I currently have the Dot and both of the bulbs in my bedroom. I will admit it gets some getting used to. I keep turning on my lamps with the switch instead of with the Dot. But with the app i dont have to get up to turn anything on or off. As for Alexa, i dont think i have explored all of the options yet, but i mainly use it to control the lights and to listen to music while folding cloths, it is also handy for the weather for the day. Overall i think it was worth it and i cant wait to see what else it is capable of.

3/29/2019--it took some time with Amazon support, but they did get it worked out.

Worked for about a month, now just two days beyond return, buttons are unresponsive, light ring goes round and round. Reset, reset, works for a few hours, then nothing. 3/1/2019 got an email from Amazon; rep offered assistance and to contact him. Replied to that rep only to be referred to another rep; that was a waste of time amazon echo support-not good. This evening, said Alexa to this "3rd gen" and nothing. Restart, nothing. Can't return. And support said, "reply so I can help you." Replied, "please call someone else." Utter garbage amazon.

I saw this Echo Dot as a promotion and I purchased it right away since I owned some items that can use Alexa to voice control. Very easy to set up. You can ask Alexa almost everything and the one thing I don't like is that sometimes it can't fully understand your question or statement and you have to repeat yourself in a way so she can understand and help find an answer. I also like the hands free feature. When I am busy, I can ask Alexa to pick up or call someone at that moment when I'm doing something important. It is an awesome product to have at your home as an assistant.

reviews.reviewTitle: Is there an Echo in here?
reviews.reviewText: I purchased one for MBR and one for LR. New to these type of products. I would like to find one resource that has everything about the Echo's capabilities, rather than get random emails. Also, I'm not so well versed in this type of equipment so I really need it spelled out for me. Easy to install. Still learning how to use it. It is satisfactory for my use so far, but I would like to know what capabilities this has so I can use it even more. Getting tired of responses that Alexa can't answer for simple questions. Don't know if it's a setting...

reviews.reviewTitle: The speaker in this generation is a substantial upgrade! The only Alexa device needed!
reviews.reviewText:
I really like this little big upgrade from the previous dot. The speaker is much louder and for this I am grateful. I like how this can read me my kindle books. I find it 100% more useful than the google device that doesn't even have bluetooth and the speaker is so poor I haven't even plugged it back in. (I got it free with my nest thermostat I couldn't find a use for it compared to Alexa.)

So I guess for me my take away from this is that Alexa is the only smart home device cordinator I need. Plus my kids can use it to make VoIP calls. Also free time was fun to play Disney music.

I also use it to turn on and off light switches, set timers, alarms and tell me the weather.

I received my Alexa Echo Dot (3rd Generation) a week ago or so. It is about the size and weight of a hockey puck and relatively easy to use. Plug it in, download the corresponding app to your smartphone and you're off and running. The app is used to set preferences and settings since the Dot top controls are very limited (there are just 4: volume up/down, mic on/off and attention).

I use the Android app so comments below may or may not apply if you are an iPhone Nazi.

The interpretation of voice commands work pretty well. It accepts my voice without problems and that of my 7-year
old granddaughter and foreign-born daughter (who has a fairly strong Romanian accent). It does not handle compound instructions very well though. Keep your request to a single command and it works much better. I am told it accepts both English and German although my high school German is way too old to test.

I do not live in a 'smart' house so I did not test any of the remote device management capabilities (turn on/off lamps, unlock/lock doors etc.) nor did I use it for things like creating shopping lists. Although Alexa can provide local traffic reports my 'Droid app from a local TV station is much faster.

I suspect the most common use will be playing music (a trial period of Amazon Music comes with (I don't intend to renew at $3.99/month) but I have found that full of shortcomings:

1. Requesting a specific song might get you the original or it might get you a re-recording of the original.
2. A request for an album or genre will probably result in unwanted repeats of a single song (also happened with
NPR News summary as well).
3. Amazon claims to have 50 million songs out there but there are a ton of common titles that I have never heard
of and there are many popular personal favorites missing.
4. Requesting something like "play Hawaiian Instrumentals" results in vocal recordings and a request to play harp
music was not understood. Not sure what's up with that. I'm amazed at how good its vocal interpretation is but it
is still a long way from perfect.
5. And the WORST shortcoming - the audio level is very inconsistent between songs. Playing the Echo Dot on your
bedside while trying to go to sleep results in songs barely heard to the next one blasting you off your pillow.
Very irritating! And, the volume buttons on top of the puck are not lighted and hard to find if the room is dark.

On the plus side it does a reasonable job of finding a specific song or album (played in shuffle mode) and you can
build your own personal playlist(s) if you wish.

My granddaughter is going to be pleased with it because she loves to give it math problems. Saves her a bunch of
time doing homework. It is also useful as a clock radio (wake to music of your choice) but its rumored ability to
record everything around it might not be what you want in the bedroom (especially if your girlfriend's name is
'Alexa'). You can shut the microphone off but I'm unsure if that actually does what you would think.

I did notice that with unit not used for several days, even with the mic and notifications turned off, it starts
blinking - irritating.

It does have a mini stereo jack connection so earbuds do work and you do get full stereo out of the earbuds. The
internal speaker sounds mono but it isn't bad at low audio levels. It will reportedly connect via Bluetooth to an
external speaker although I did not try that. You can also set 2 Dot's up to create a stereo speaker although I
understand there may be issues getting that to work correctly.

I usually watch the local TV news while eating breakfast but if you don't do that this gadget will give you the
news from several optional sources while you eat. I did notice it repeats stories from time to time and appears to
be caught in a loop. I never found it very useful because not very many news sources are available.

My summary: it is a moderately useful gadget but not worth the money it costs (somewhere between $40-$100 on the
open market).

reviews.reviewTitle: A great entry level smart device!
reviews.reviewText: This thing has been really cool (I have 2 of them). My only complaints are that 1.) the audio quality is different between the two units, with one being slightly more muffled as you add bass, and 2.) it seems like the longer it stays plugged in, the slower it responds when you call it, kind of like a memory leak. I got my second unit at a drastic discount when I bought the first, so I'd say they're still an excellent deal. I use Alexa daily for my alarm, sleep sounds, and weather, and a lot of music when I'm around the house. It's cool that my kids can use the Dots to call me on my cell phone when I'm away.

reviews.reviewTitle: Better way to listen to Dot
reviews.reviewText: We have an original Echo device as well as several Dot's. I have a Dot in my garage and like to listen to music when I am working on a project in the garage. I am a big fan of the old Big Band sound including Glenn Miller and Benny Goodman. I was in the garage a few days ago and was listening to Glenn Miller when the dot fell off my work bench and into an empty 5 gallon plastic bucket. All of a sudden this robust sound I had never heard from a Dot came roaring out. My garage Dot now hangs from a hook inside a bucket. It has a much better sound than the Echo which is pretty impressive on it's own. Go drop your Dot in a bucket and enjoy a new and improved sound. Enjoy!

This is super convenient. Walk into a room and ask Alexa to play whatever you're feeling like at the moment, and there it is. The sound is a little bass heavy, surprising from such a tiny speaker, but that is easily correctable. For background music, the speaker is fine. For serious listening, I'd want a better speaker. Installation was easy. I have an Amazon prime account and mostly listen to Amazon Music, without commercials and no additional cost. I also listen to Pandora, which has a few commercials when using the free account.

reviews.reviewTitle: Surprisingly not as good as the previous generation echo dot
reviews.reviewText: I don't know what's different about this echo dot but I expected superior voice recognition and function. Instead, I have to speak more loudly and be closer to the unit for it to perceive what I'm saying unlike my previous echo dots (main reason for the four stars instead of five). The sound quality isn't quite as good, but again, not sure how the cloth-like exterior affects the dot. I don't hate it, but it's not better than the previous generation (at least not the one I received)… I got it for a good price and it was shipped promptly.

I love the way this product looks, feels, and functions.

Compared to the 2nd generation, the speaker quality clearly outshines it. The volume "10" is sooooo much louder compared to the 2nd generation, and also maintains a clarity of sound that leaves you enjoying it.

I bought one of these for each of my family members to make it easier for us to keep in touch and stay organized -- if you are thinking about buying one, then I say go for it!

reviews.reviewTitle: I'm not remotely using this to it's full potential
reviews.reviewText: I have these in multiple rooms in the house, and the most they get used for generally is to turn lamps on and off. My mother had back surgery and still has trouble getting around, so this and some smart plugs lets her turn the lights in her room on and off without having to actually get to the lamps, which is difficult for her still. I use the one in the kitchen to listen to the radio when I'm cooking, and occasionally to set a timer. I'm sure eventually I'll do more with them, but so far I'm really not using them to their full potential, and they're still well worth it.

reviews.reviewTitle: These are great smart speakers for my bedroom
reviews.reviewText: Initially I was skeptic about buying these but when I saw a '2 for $60' deal I went ahead and bought these. These are awesome little speakers. I fitted one in both my bedrooms and believe me they look small but have a great premium sound for little speakers and also gets the work done working as satellite smart speakers for my echo plus. I created a group for all the echo speakers and can play music from anywhere I want and it is great to hear all the speakers playing in sync. Gives a great surround sound feeling if setup correctly. Would have liked it more if it was possible for them to play in sync when connected with Bluetooth. As of now we can only connect them in sync if we are using some streaming service to play music. If used with bluetooth, only one speaker will play music that you have your bluetooth device connected to. I would recommend this to everyone who use echo plus to control their smarthome to have this in each of the rooms that don't have any echo device.

From the appearance to the quality of the speaker this Dot is a step up from previous generations. Alexa is Alexa, and will be even with Samuel L. Jackson's voice, and she can get pretty confused sometimes. I like the new finishes for the DOTs, the different fabrics allow you to chose the one that fits the room better than just a shiny black circle. The speaker is a better quality, music sounds a lot better. It helps that I only paid $30.00 or so, and I'll probably pick up another one when the price drops again.

Recommended.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not what I expected, but great potential
reviews.reviewText: I went into the Amazon Echo experience expecting a lot from this device, rightfully so, I heard a plethora amount of news and reviews about the little guy. I am impressed with the abilities, but also feel that it lacks some very key, yet small, details. Details like simply understanding my voice and not completely butchering what I say at times. I was expecting to be able to simply have a conversation with the Echo Dot and it would have a conversation back with me, but it seems it's not the case exactly. You have to say specific sentence structures in order to do what you want it to do. Although I understand its technology, I had a different idea going in to my experience so I hope you understand where I'm coming from. HOWEVER, just as my title states, there is so much potential with this device, I know in time the Amazon team will make it an exceptional device so I will be holding on to my device until then. =)

reviews.reviewTitle: Overall it's a very good item and worth the money.
reviews.reviewText: Sometimes when it's loud the Alexa command does not register so I have to repeat myself, but overall it's really good. Mainly I use it to get the weather. When I get power blip after a storm I ask it the time so set my microwave clock. The countdown timer is good too. My favorite thing is listening to news channels via Tune it, but sometimes when you first connect to tune in you get 3 ads in a row so that's annoying. I pair it with my wireless speaker too. I did buy a smart bulb that was offered with it but that was hard to set up and lost the connection after a few weeks so I took it out.

reviews.reviewTitle: Looks nice, might not hear me as well as our older version?
reviews.reviewText: I like the look of this newer generation. I am just not sure this one "hears" our commands as well as the old one. It went in the same place as our old one, but this one seems to have just a tiny bit tougher time hearing us on first try and we kind of have to raise our voice. I think the actual speaker quality might be nicer than the older one...well, maybe not even nicer, but it definitely has a different sound. I had them both plugged in in the same place and there's a different sound to the newer version (3rd gen) than the older one (I think we also have a 2nd gen). I don't know if there's anything significantly different and if you have an older version, it should be just fine, so I wouldn't say an upgrade is needed unless you like the way this one looks better than the older one.

Definitely an upgrade and so glad I purchased! I have the first gen Dot and the echo second generation and have loved both. I was also rather disappointed in the sound out of the first gen dot, but always had it hooked to other speakers. I was looking around at buying this one, but the reviews were mixed. Some said this wasn't even an upgrade and that the sound quality wasn't even noticeable. Ummmm...YES IT IS!! Much clearer and louder than the original with added depth and bass. Those that complain the speakers are still lacking...well this is the the speaker you put in a grand hall and expect to throw a dance party. No, get one of the bigger echos for something like that. But for clear, bedroom/kitchen filling audio -- you'll want one of these. I loved this one so much after seeing the difference that I'm tossing the old one and just bought a second third gen Dot.

reviews.reviewTitle: Bit difficult to connect things but good quality for the price
reviews.reviewText: For the price is great especially I got the Great deal on it. however setting it up is bit pain especially if you don't want to take time reading the instruction.. also I think this was made for native English speaker so if you have an accent or something you might have to repeat yourself couple times. I'm getting used to it though so I might try in different language setting if there is one, but for basic purposes like listening to radio or music was okay. quality of listening is pretty good just setting it up was bit of a pain that's all.

I loved the speaker at first, but I have only owned it for less than a month, and the speaker has a lot of static noise. It is not constant, but comes and goes. The sound quality to not great. I have an Oontz Angle 3 Solo that has much better sound quality than the echo. As far as the Alexa features I love it. I just wished the speaker had better quality.

I bought this because it was a Prime Day deal. So far it has worked flawlessly with my Philips Hue lights. I have come to terms with the knowledge that we're all being spied on by Zuckerberg, the gov't and the Russians. The other day I was THINKING about something I was interested in and then of course I see an ad for it on Facebook. So I figured what the hell, they're in our brains already. Might as well make their jobs a little easier and just give them access to my house. Now I'm just waiting for Alexa to start ordering me groceries without me telling her to.

reviews.reviewTitle: Pleasantly surprise on the many uses
reviews.reviewText:
Pleasantly surprised on the many uses for it. Purchased to be my son’s room speaker as he is becoming a teenager and has a phone but not allowed to use at home. We wanted a speaker that he would be able to listen to his music without the phone. This device did the trick and much more. Now he sets up his own alarms, tells Alexa to play his favorite music, search for stuff for him (even his phone), and we are finding more every day. So if you want a device that will facilitate your life, get it.
P.S.
It even finds clean music, a need for all of us parents.

This is the second Echo Dot that I will have to return for sound distortion. Our first lasted about two months before the sound all of a sudden was distorted and staticky. We never have the sound above 50% so I know it's not because of having it up too loud. I was disappointed that they replaced my first echo dot with a refurbished one. Now that one (which is less than two months old) is having the same issue. Not worth the price.

I didn't use it. I didn't open it. Reading about privacy issues with the Echo made me lose interest. Sure, call me a technophobe. Luddite. Whatever. I'll take the extra step to order things with my hands and have sex in private. Because privacy is real luxury. Soon it might even be trending.

Yes, I know. I have no real privacy on my phone or on Amazon. Except that I won't have a device in my home just waiting until it hears a phrase it a phrase close enough to a phrase or something else happens that isn't supposed to. Call it a lack of trust in companies that haven't earned trust.

reviews.reviewTitle: It’s an Alexa - what do you really want to know? Lol
reviews.reviewText: My voice is getting sore from yelling at her- if music is loud she can’t hear you talking to her. Still issues with connectivity from another room . Once again- yelling to turn off my smart lights and outlets . Sound quality still isn’t great when playing music- not near as loud as I would like but hey it’s a speaker that fits in the palm of my hand- lol...great for alarms, reminders, news, weather, really about anything you want- just like any other search engine . She’s still getting use to my voice commands as I seem to be yelling a lot..ughhh...doesn’t understand me or does wrong command. Ho hum... Technology

I am so addicted to Alexa that I take her with me when I travel... I have a few dots and the original echo. I'm currently traveling and on a project for 3 months... I contemplating bringing one of the dots with me but I did not and I regret it .. so I've just ordered another one for my hotel room. (I have compared both and Google mini honestly has better sound but if you subscribe to Amazon prime and listen to music the Amazon dot is the smarter buy. The Google mini is now at $29 for a mother's day special and so is the echo.) I honestly can't remember what it was like before Alexa...;-)

didn't understand simple commands. I got a lot of I didn't understand and a lot of MMMMM it did mange to set an alarm but when i asked her to play beach sounds she stopped talking. The worst part was I asked her for the weather she gave me a report on a town and state i haven't lived in for years! Creepy. I returned it.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is definitely the best value echo
reviews.reviewText:
Were I in product development at Amazon I could see myself actually recommending against releasing this product as it sounds very, very good and will for most buyers make the more expensive Echo irrelevant. For 49.00 - if you want an echo in your home this is the only one you need.
It made sense before as a cheaper option but now it's good enough to be your sole device. You don't see companies do this very often, offering something inexpensive which could eat shares of their other offerings but thank you Amazon, the dot is now very good and worth owning. For the record, the Echo sounds much better (like, way better) but for a lot of buyers, the difference would be negligible.

reviews.reviewTitle: The Sound has Improved a LOT!
reviews.reviewText:
I had an earlier version that I disliked and returned. I knew it wasn't going to sound great, but thought it would still be okay for other uses and maybe for listening to news, podcasts or audiobooks. It was just annoying.

This new 3rd Generation Dot, however, is a BIG improvement. Although I got it free as a promotion from another company I deal with, it is worth the $49 current price. It's not quite as full sounding as other Echo models, but by boosting the bass a little (using the Alexa app) it's not at all bad for casual listening in the kitchen or garage, for example.

Received my first dot for Mother's Day and bought a second one during Prime Day. I also bought the wall outlets that go with it and use Alexa to turn the lamps on and off. Not rocket science, but good to know I can do this do this using the Dot or using Alexa app on my cell phone when I'm not home. I also like listening to music or my latest audiobook while I do other things. It's great for making a shopping list. As I use things during the week I just tell Alexa to add it to my shopping list. I print the list when I'm ready to go to the store. Has made shopping much easier and I'm not forgetting to pick up ??? I also like making/receiving phone calls on it. Great range for voice pick-up and hearing others. My grandchildren have fun listening to jokes, asking funny questions and listening to their music. I find it's easy to use and the sound is good for it's price range

After 3 months of use of the speaker started to be staticky and distort the music . It plays well for about an hour now before the static starts. My older generation echo products still work great so I’m very disappointed with this 3 rd generation echo dot.

Got it for free because i got the amazon credit card. This thing is creepy. I let it die and threw it in a drawer and plan on selling it to my worst enemy. It’s also kind of useless since you can’t use it as a speaker for music just amazon music which... let’s be honest, we all want spotify. Anywayssss ya one star for this bad girl.

The 3rd gen dot is a huge improvement and a fantastic product. I have a gen 1 dot which I bought when it came out to keep hooked into my speaker system to make it voice activated. The speakers on it are impractical for listening to music. However on the 3rd gen the speakers are impressive considering the size and price point. No need to plug this one into another speaker, great little device to add music or voice commands to any room of the house. You just have to be okay with possibly giving intimate details about your life to Jeff Bezos. But whatever, worth the convenience and they're gonna get us somehow anyways. Highly recommend.

reviews.reviewTitle: Cannot be unplugged from outlet, NOT RECHARGEABLE
reviews.reviewText: Hello all - This little machine CANNOT be unplugged from the outlet and MUST STAY PLUGGED in order to keep working. I let it "charge" overnight and unplugged it in the morning to move it around the house with me and IT IS NOT COMPLETELY WIRELESS. To me, this is absolutely worthless, but my children love being its boss and telling it what to do and what songs to play without lifting a finger, so I'm keeping it for them - but if it wasn't for my kids, I would return this thing. For something originally worth $50 = and even something that I paid $30 for - you're better off buying a Jawbone or JBL speaker. This is only worth if it you're really in need of cheap access to Alexa.

I ordered this because I thought it would be similar to google. It does not stay hooked up to the WIFI and I have to keep reinstalling. It works for a while then it does not. I have to go to my fire tablet to get it to do anything. I am thinking about returning it unless I can find an easy fix. I love my 10" fire tablet, but not my Echo.
I wonder if anyone else has had this issue and found a solution. Would be interested in hearing if you have.

Great smart device to add to home. Easy set up and fun to play with. It easily integrates with other smart devices and the Alexa app makes things a breeze. The only qualm is the parental control is not as extensive as I’d like. For example it does have explicit language blocking for songs, but I can’t cherry pick other songs that may not have bad words but still has inappropriate themes dependent on age. Other than that I love it and may get another to add elsewhere in the house (announcements and drop ins are awesome too)

This is our third Dot and our best. This was purchased for bedside replacing an alarm clock. The light is not so bright that it keeps us awake like the alarm did. Setup was was almost immediate. The sound is superior to our older Dots. Just tell Alexa what time to wake us and it’s done. Highly recommended for this purpose.

i love the Echo Dots! I have 3rd Gen. The main Echo unit is in our downstairs dining room. I purchased 3 Dots, one for our master bedroom upstairs, and the other two for the mater bedroom and living room of our second home. They are great to use to communicate back and forth with others in the house, for turning appliances on/off through voice control, and to listen to music. (There are lots of things you can do with Alexa, but you can read all that in the description.)

I just ordered 3 more Dots yesterday so I can put one in each master bathroom, and one in our laundry room.

I like the design of this new Echo Dot. It has a better quality speaker than the last one for sure, but not quite good enough. I will have to compare it with my Google Home Mini. It doesn't quite seem to pick up my voice if I say it in normal conversation or conversation type volume, which could be a negative or positive. Maybe you were always talking about it and tired of it responding when you weren't specifically asking it a question, then it would be a positive. It could be possible that it is because of the environment that it is in.

reviews.reviewTitle: I love my echo devices, but..............
reviews.reviewText: We have four echo devices in the home and office. They have become an indispensable aspect of our lives. The quality of her feedback has greatly improved over time. Can't wait to see where we are in another decade. My only complaint, and it is a major annoyance, is the volume on the echo dot. At night (in bed as I fall asleep) and in the office I want to listen to very quiet music. Volume 1 is too loud for sleep or the office. She doesn't go lower than volume one. I have to switch to youtube on my laptop to get appropriate volume control. We love the new whisper commands.

Glad I waited for Black Friday sales. I was tempted to purchase one of these 3rd Gen Dots and had to wait and see if a better deal was on the way, and it was. Two for the price of one! The sound is amazing and ALMOST EQUAL to the new echo I purchased last year (almost, but no bass on this one). I would not kid you, the sound is so noticeable fuller and of a higher quality I do not know how they kept the price the same. The look is so much more “high end” I do not think anyone will feel the need to cover it up with cases, skins, or anything. Just let this beautiful dot hang out naked on your bedroom night stand and do her thing. You will be glad you did.

Everything is setup thru a smart phone. There is no cable connection to make to a desktop, you MUST go wireless. The Alexa app is hard to navigate. You need different app's to do different things with Alexa. So far the ones I want to use I have to keep watching the YouTube video and even then they are not always clear.
I thought that Echo Dot was a stand alone type product. I expected a power cord and then an option of wireless or a cable to connect to get to the internet. The Echo Dot has to connections the power cable and a headphone jack. Again, you are forced to go thru a smart phone to do anything with it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Only minor complaints, more capable than Google Assistant
reviews.reviewText: Excellent microphone, it picks me up from across the room. Speaker nice quality, even works well as a Bluetooth speaker. I do have trouble distinguishing been fifty and sixty when hearing the weather report. When Alexa misunderstands she is often too eager to play music instead of answer a question. When she answers a question it's usually the right you, if not the correct answer. For example it take several tries to get from her what direction the wind is blowing, but every answer send to also include the days high and low temperature.

This my third echo device. I bought myself a second generation Dot and fell in love with Alexa. The sound is an improvement over the second gen Dot but it still doesn't rival an Echo. I have slowly been smarting my house and all the Alexa products are a breeze to setup for that purpose. I can seamlessly walk through my house and yell for Alexa to turn on or off lights, remind me to check the laundry or play my favorite song. My only complaint is the same one I had with previous generations. PUT A NAIL HOLE ON THE BOTTOM SO IT CAN BE WALL MOUNTED without buy additional equipment.

reviews.reviewTitle: (Edit: IT WAS ) SO MUCH BETTER than previous gen's!
reviews.reviewText:
EDIT: 6 months in and the microphone completely blows... I have to literally yell ALEXA, TWO TIMES just for it to recognize it!
SO, it went from a 5 to a 2 star...

Slightly bigger, seems like 10x louder, picks up several times farther, looks amazing and doesn't need to face upright like the previous gen's, because the speakers are all around it! This is all you need to know...
I was starting to go with Google mini so I can carry on conversations and not have to say "Alexa" every single time, hopefully they will add that in the near future!!

Please mark helpful, it will help me greatly!
Very close to my goal!

reviews.reviewTitle: So many uses and improving all the time.
reviews.reviewText: We have an echo plus with built-in hub in the living room and added the dot 3rd gen in our bedroom. The sound from the dot is surprisingly acceptable when playing music which was important as we often go to sleep to some of our playlists. Also, having access to all of our attached devices is convenient if I want to turn a light on in another room when waking up in the dark. I might get another one for our cellar. I recommended these to a friend who just built a new house and likes to listen to music in different rooms. He bought two and loves them. They also entertain their grandchildren with the games that are available.

reviews.reviewTitle: very nice except when playing mostly unable to hear your voice
reviews.reviewText:
We all love Alexa, we use it mostly to control external devices and for that it works very well.
Sometimes my kid and wife use it to stream music and we found out that even with not very loud music playing Alexa has some problems hearing your voice when you first call it to interact, most of the times you need to go really close to make it hear your voice before it turns the music down in response of your call.

I don't know if there is a technical way to overcome the issue, if not maybe having speaker and voice recognition in the same device might not be a great idea.

Dessapointed on everything: 1) looks used eventhough came in "original ' plastic and box seems very used even not look beautiful at all like fading the color.
2) Still can't work like bluetooth speaker with my music in the phone without internet.
3) I am not impress at all with the sound, my other speaker is so powerful if I compare and cost me only $19.
4) Need to have Amazon music and pay for if I want to play songs that I really like at least play only from Pandora any music.

My wife and I got 2 for now, and absolutely love it! One is in my daughter's room where it plays soft music for her to fall asleep to, and the other is in the living room for our use. We ask for weather updates, and create shopping lists, and even look up information from time to time. We are still learning how to use it, the verbal commands, the limitations, but we are really enjoying it and are looking into probably getting one more for our room. One interesting capability is being able to tap into one of the Dots at the house and being able to speak through the Dot to chat with my wife. You can do this through the app on your phone.

reviews.reviewTitle: better sound compared to the 2nd gen
reviews.reviewText: i have the 2nd generation and comparing it to this one, i would say the big difference is the sound quality.. the 2nd gen, i have always connected to a speaker to play music on, while i don’t need to with this 3rd gen since it’s speaker already has a really good sound quality like it was connected to a speaker. other than that, most features are practically the same, though i need to mention that this 3rd gen is more aesthetically pleasing for having a tiny house, it just fit in with the interiors without it looking off. overall, i am very satisfied. i love my alexas 👍

reviews.reviewTitle: Much better sound, much slower response
reviews.reviewText: The new Dot sounds great, but it's consistently the slowest of my devices in earshot to acknowledge my "Alexa" call, even when I'm standing right next to it. Most times, the old Dot and my Sonos One—both in other rooms—acknowledge the trigger first. The reduced mic array doesn't seem to be as good as the past models.

I can't use the product. It was a birthday present for my husband from our daughter. She has one for every tv in her house and has older (up to 10 years old) tv's and the product works fine with them. Our tv is a 4K smart tv that's only 3 months old and it won't work with it. We called customer service to see if they could help and they told her that I needed to buy a more expensive tv. So, she deleted the app off of my iphone.

I bought the Echo just for a "toy." Friends I visited in California have one, and it was fun calling out questions. I don't know why so many people fussed about set-up -- mine practically did everything itself; of course, I have an Apple iPhone. Maybe non-AppleOS users experienced difficulties. I only have one "smart plug," but think I'd like to get one or two more for the convenience. I might consider syncing another Echo in the bedroom too. Oh -- good sound for such small speakers. I don't use it to listen to music, but the voice sounds more realistic.

reviews.reviewTitle: Does exactly what it’s made to do
reviews.reviewText:
Does exactly what it’s supposed to phenomenally. I bought two of them to run my smart apartment and they haven’t let me down.

Audio quality is pretty decent. Although I have a home theater setup and an Orbi Voice for my music needs, this does a good job when I’m putting something together in the living room and don’t feel like turning on my home theater.

Phone calls are a little disappointing. I can barely hear the other person even with it turned all the way up and the person on the other end says it sounds very muffled.

Anyways, for the things I need it to do (routines, turning stuff on and off, random questions) it does just great so I’m happy.

My roommate got a Google Home since his family got 2 (or something like that) and a week later my echo arrived. Alexa knew more random facts and was able to keep things up faster than Google and honestly she was more entertaining, but functionally she was disappointing. The emails should you need for each and every little action gets tiring. Want to download a song on your streaming service, download the skill. Want to connect to other smart devices or equipment, download a skill. And the worst part is, the skills are buggy as all get out. The save songs skill worked for a day and then Alexa would say, "you need to download a skill for that". I tried connecting her to my 4 Phillips Hue lights and she created 8 lights and then wouldn't turn them off if called by their nickname. She was unable to turn off my Samsung TV for a while until I changed it's name to "TV". She can't turn off my Vizio or do anything with my Fire Stick. Unfortunately the list goes on. It doesn't have as loud a speaker system as Google Home either so I don't know why I even got it. I thought the voice assistant would be useful but Google is way ahead in that department too. I decided to stick it out for over a month and now unfortunately I can't return it, so don't make the same mistake I did.

Never used an Echo or a Dot before. After receiving it, I bought a Echo to use in another room. Really simple to set up. Added several skills including control of my ADT alarm system, all of my Z-wave switches' lights, and various subscription music services I use. Just added my ceiling fans to the skill set. If you didn't use it for anything else, for $25 its a great clock (just ask Alexa what time it is) in the middle of the night. Another product that I didn't need and now I don't want to be without it. I'm sure I have just scratched the surface on the capabilities of this unit.

BTW-the first unit was lost in transit and Amazon was right on it--even though by then it was backordered, it arrived only a couple of days late----but stuff happens at this time of year.

reviews.reviewTitle: I'm far more comfortable with my Google smart speaker.
reviews.reviewText: I have given both Google and Amazon smart speakers tests for over a year now. I take comfort in the fact that my Google speaker recognizes my voice, and for the most part only my voice. It's very disconcerting that Alexa will activate with anything that even remotely sounds like the name... At least 20, 30 or even 40 times per day it activates (and starts listening) simply because of a phrase on TV. Admittedly, there are lots of Alexa commercials, but it SHOULD be smart enough to know the difference! I DO NOT LIKE KNOWING THAT A DEVICE IN MY HOME CAN BE TRICKED INTO LISTENING TO, AND RECORDING, CONVERSATIONS IN MY HOUSEHOLD WHEN NOT INSTRUCTED TO.

This is my 2nd Alexa device. What I like about it is the ease of getting it set up. Being a prime member the device comes to me registered with amazon straight out of the box. The only thing i had to do was connect it to my wifi and have it sync up with my Original Alexa 1st generation speaker( which still works great after 4 years). The 3rd generation Dot is perfect for my bedroom. It sits on my dresser taking up next to no space at all. I use it as an alarm, weather center, music, and story teller. Could i live without this device? Yes i sure could, but why would I when this device makes my personal life easier. What i mean is. I dont have to turn on the T.V to get the news push buttons to set a alarm clock turn on a radio to listen to music that i probably dont like even flip on a light switch or turn on the tv and change the channel. I can even re-order toilet paper or ramen noodles if i want or need to.
I bought this for my office on Prime Day at a discounted rate. I got the smart plug too and I love it! Great little gadget. A wonderful addition to my at-home office!

I already own the 2nd Gen. Dot. This was on sale so I moved my kitchen Dot to another room and replaced it with this 3rd Gen. Dot. Of course immediately you notice the powerful sound quality. Everything is just as good as the previous version. I was actually hoping for other noticeable improvements. I was hoping for a faster response. It responds just as fast as my original Dot. I don't like the pause you have to make after saying Alexa and then you can ask your question. I am sure they will fix this small irritation, I just hope you do not have to buy a new Dot to be able to have the capability to say Alexa and immediately state your command.

I am a huge fan of echo and this was my 3rd, however this kind in particular is horrible. It took me days of trying to finally get it to set up and connect. Kept saying I needed to update my app then when I checked there were no updates. My other 20 attempts the app would crash the second I opened it.. Now that is finally hooked up it won’t ever play music, always says “sorry, I’m unable to play music right now” I got it to play ONE time, once... then after one song, it stopped. It isn’t my internet either because all my other ones work just fine.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great update over 2nd generation echo Dot!
reviews.reviewText:
I have two 2nd generation echo Dots that I love and use daily. I decided to buy the 3rd generation as I got it for a great price on Black Friday on Kohls.com

I'm not disappointed!! Love the new speaker. So much better than the second generation.

Easy set up with the app just like the 2nd generation. This is slightly bigger in size than the 2nd generation and uses a different power cord.

I wish I had this version in all my rooms!

reviews.reviewTitle: Brand new defective 3rd Gen echo dot replaced with a refurbished one
reviews.reviewText: I purchased three of these new 3rd Gen echo dots and one of them had no audio right out of the box. I was able to set it up without the sound and it played fine thru a Bluetooth speaker, just not thru its own. The other two worked fine. I tried to make a product exchange online which would always loop me back to the same form which I filled out multiple times, always failing. I then tried online chat support and was required to troubleshoot the "problem" for over an hour even though it was obvious that the other two worked fine and this one did not. They finally agreed to replace the unit and they sent me a refurbished one. I paid for a new one, spent an hour trying to get a replacement, and recieved a used refurbished unit. This is not the Amazon Customer Service I am accustomed to. Especially on their own product. Other than that, the sound is only slightly better than the Gen2 model and it has a better look. The upgrade was certainly not worth the hassle I had to go through.

reviews.reviewTitle: Better sound - be aware that you can adjust the tone.
reviews.reviewText: Intrigued by the promise of better sound quality, I snagged one of these during a deal-of-the-day special. Although better and louder, it sounded like it's being broadcast from the bottom of a well. I then decided to do some checking, and found that they introduced 3-band equalization (bass, mid, & treble). By default, the settings are all 0,0,0, which explained the sound being flat. This is adjustable -/+6db via voice command or the app. Be sure to update the mobile device app if you have not already. The tone is adjustable from the app or by voice.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great sounds, discreet and complimentary look to it.
reviews.reviewText: We received this as a promotional offer through Satellite Radio Promo. We were not interested in a new speaker in any way but it was free so we got it. I LOVE THIS THING! We have it set up in the corner of our kitchen and absolutely love that I can turn it on and off by just speaking to it as well as adjust the volume. Also it's barely noticeable and the speaker sound quality is better than I expected for such a small device. It's not the same quality of sound that our Bose speaker has but the additional functionality is quite great none the less. Definitely thinking about getting more in the future for additional rooms of our home.

Works great, with my voice or my husbands and even the kids. Tons of functions, from reminders and timers to playing our amazon music to keeping the kids entertained with jokes and games. Looks nice on the counter, good sound quality and makes for some fun kitchen dance parties. Love that it can integrate with other units and speakers in the house.

This was free through Sirius. I like how it feels, sturdy and eell made. Just not a fan of the idea of this. I don't prefer the microphone due to privacy concerns so will not be using this for anything other than a bluetooth speaker. It really needs to not talk to me everytime I turn it on saying its not wifi connected since it never will be.
As a speaker it is very lackluster, very little bass and volume. The good thing is that on the right surface it vibrates through and feels louder. Maybe I'll sell it or give it away.

reviews.reviewTitle: Is there an echo in here
reviews.reviewText: Never thought I would actually get one of these considering the big brother aspect of it , but I really like it. I love getting up in the morning asking what the weather is going to be , put on one of the podcasts I like in the morning, reading audible . Haven't got the lights hooked up yet as they haven't been delivered but that's what I actually got this for . I would've given it five stars if it wasn't for set up . Here's my hint for set up if you're trying to put it on your tablet and you're having problems. If you have a laptop or a computer go set it up through your computer or laptop at the Alexa.Amazon.com site, it'll finally work and you'll be online .

I had a little trouble hooking it up but I was able to get someone on the phone to assist me and everything worked out fine. What I HATE is that it isn’t cordless. I thought it was chargeable. But as soon as u unplug it, it shuts off and when u plug it back in, u have to wait a few moments. Now it is 2019. Why isn’t this thing chargeable? I would’ve enjoyed this more knowing I can take it room to room throughout my house. That is a major set back.

reviews.reviewTitle: I used to like it more.
reviews.reviewText: Not going to lie, Alexa is convenient. But some things are frustrating. My biggest pet peeve with Alexa right now is the Skype update. You used to be able to call from the device and now it goes through skype. You have to connect your skype and purchase a plan for minutes. Plus 90% of the time there is an error and Alexa isn't even to make the call. In addition to that crappy update the are still not providing solutions to personalize responses. For example, when you tell Alexa you like a song she will give a long response about continuing to tell her so she can choose better music. After a year of that I am tired of hearing her 30 second response, and this is with short response on! I feel like the upgrade and stuff they are adding are more for bringing customers in and not satisfying the current customers.

This is my first smart speaker product, and I’m only leaving a bad review due to the glitch with pandora. I purchased this solely for music in my spa on my pandora subscription, however it skips and then changes the song mid way through EVERY SONG. Super distracting and annoying and almost rendering it unusable for me. Apparently this is a common issue.

We use this every day. Sound is great and voice recognition works as expected. If you have 2 devices nearby you can rename the echo dot to "Echo" or "Computer" rather than "Alexa" to wake it up. Nice feature. Integrates fairly well with our Sonos One although the devices get confused when streaming Amazon music. i.e. I tell Alexa on my Sonos to "play songs by..." and it will play a song then stop. I have to go to the app, tell it to stream on a particular device/room then it does it's thing. I also haven't figure out yet how to add my Sonos and Echo Dot to play the same station (i.e. can't assign them to a room). Great product overall but doesn't play well with others :)

reviews.reviewTitle: Great sound but doesn’t like corners
reviews.reviewText: This little device sounds great. Two recommendations for improving functionality. The mic isn’t as receptive when device is in a corner. I wish there was a way to adjust input sensitivity to address this. So, you may be yelling to get it’s attention if you’re around the corner from it. Related to this, unlike the Fire TV Cube, there are no audio tones from the device to let you know that it recognized your commands. So, unless you’re looking at it’s LED light effects for a confirmation that it can hear you, you’ll have to assume this.

I have three dots and an Echo. I can stand next to this dot and the older model (2nd gen) that's in the other room will hear, understand and answer but this one won't. It lights up like it hears me but it doesn't seem to be able to recognize what I'm seeing, especially in noisy situations. And it cuts in and out mid-routine. Pretty much the only time I can count on this one working properly is middle of the night when there's no other noise. Of all the Alexa items I have, the original 2nd gen dot works the best: better than the Echo and better than the 3rd gen dot. It's like they're getting prettier but less dependable...

reviews.reviewTitle: ll and works like my tall
reviews.reviewText: My echo DOT is great because I have it in my bedroom where I can listen to Christian music to go to sleep by, and I can use it to contact my wife in the living room on our big Alexa. We can communicate using these, to talk to each other without shouting. :-) It has come in to good use in many other practical ways. I would like to get a couple more as soon as finances permit. :-) And it does not take a lot of room on my dresser but has great sound. I did have to use the direction to get it to integrate. :-) LOL I'm not a big fan of reading directions…

I love everything on my echo dot 3 smart speaker it’s perfect around my home. The speaker sound is clear and quality is perfect. Love the size of the echo dot 3 you can place it anywhere and not be noticeable. Plus I love how Alexa gets frequently updated I have quickly adapted to having her around and assist with echo Calling, music, entertainment, and so much more.

I have a 3rd gen Echo Dot. There are no clear instructions that come with the device. The only instructions that come with it are is to download the Alexia app. The only problem with that is, there is multiple appls to choose from. I downloaded four appls and deleted them until if found one that was easy to use, I thought. I followed the instructions and have hooked up my Echo to my WIFI network, hooked up two of my external speakers that I have and hooked up my thermostat. Now asking Alexi to turn on the light or raise the thermostat, or even asking what time it is. I get no response. I've missed a step some where, but do not know where. Hopefully, I will figure this out. Side Note: the instructions that are on line are for either 1st or 2nd gen. Is there a difference between 1st,2nd and 3rd gen????

I like being able to ask Alexa for various answers from the comfort of my recliner. She times my walking and lets me know when to stop. I encountered one problem. She was flashing green. I asked her why and she responded that she did not know. I asked her what it meant if she was flashing green. She did not know. I asked her stop and she did not stop. Someone told me that it meant that there is a notification. I asked her to read it to me and then she stopped flashing. It would be nice to have a booklet to refer to to find out what different colors or flashes mean.

It sounds much better than second generation echo dot. Since I don't own any bigger echo device I cannot compare.

I have noticed some delay between Alexa word and the LEDs turning on to recognize the commands. The LEDs also turn off for a moment and then on again to tell the response to the command. Something annoying if you are used to previous version where the LEDs keep on all the time until the command is completed and the response received.

I tested placing my echo dot 3rd generation into a medium size metallic bowl and got a much better sound. Something like an acoustic box. I recommend testing it.

I had a TAP - that the wifi antennas where not picking up signals - would lose signal - So I called Amazon and the recommended this - I was afraid of the lack of sound for a small speaker and how it would sound ( It sounds better than the Tap ) was surprised but pleased !!!!!! have another one on the way for Alarm clock
would recommend for a apt I live i 600 square foot apt and i can here all over/ UP DATE - THE ALEXA APLICATION IS NOT WORKING RIGHT AND AMAZON HAS NO IDEA WHEN ITS GOING TO WORK SO IF YOUR LOOKING TO DO ADVANCE SETTING - DONT DO IT SORRY I DID AS OF 02/18/2019

reviews.reviewTitle: Stops responding - Doesn't Work With Pandora
reviews.reviewText: The Echo Dot intermittently stops responding to commands. It also stops playing Pandora in the middle of songs on a regular basis (1-3 times every 5 minutes). Customer service tells me that their technical support people have been working on the Pandora problem for a long time and have not been able to fix the problem. For me, the Echo has turned out to be a waste of money.

I have 4 2nd gen dots and love them, so I tried the 3rd gen. sound is superior to the 2nd gen. but I have to reset way too often. looses wifi connection approx. every other day. I never lose connection with the 2nd gen. also I like how I plug the 2nd gen into a cordless usb charger and use outside. can't due this with the 3rd gen as it uses a different charging system. but sound is great. I use this one now in the main room and the 2nd gen has been moved to other various rooms in the home. based on sound quality only. sound is about double the volume and rich sounding base. again this is no Bose, but decent sound for the price.

I bought this version on January 1st 2019. I also have the older Echo Dot and the newer Echo. Before I purchased this new Dot, I was 100% satisfied with my Amazon Echo devices. I'm not sure if I got a defective product or if this newer model is poorly made, but the sound quality is pretty bad and now, 3 months after I received it, it is starting to make a static sound at 45% volume. I'm definitely not happy.

I got this to use in the shop, mainly to play music while we worked.

Of course, this does what Alexa does. The main difference vs. generation 2 is the sound quality. (I have both.)

Our shop is L-shaped and 1500 sq ft. This Echo Dot is located at one end of the ell, yet I have no trouble hearing it at the far end with no machinery running. If I crank up the volume, it is as I like it at the far end (though too loud near it). So, though I don’t need an auxiliary speaker, one would help in that the volume would be more uniform.

I own a total of (3) 2nd Gen Dots and now (2) of the 3rd Gen and I personally cannot stand the sound quality! I've made so many adjustments trying to make it sound less boomy and muffled to no avail. I think they tried too hard for such a limited size device. I can't believe I'm actually saying it, but I prefer the 2nd Gen sound. I can barely understanding what Alexa is saying 1/2 the time and I find myself asking to repeat and continually adjusting volume and EQ settings. Music is definitely better, but asking questions or having conversation? Meh.

Sound quality decent for music but it is extremely hard sometimes to understand what Alexa is saying. Also it took several tries to find a good location so that the sound did not reflect off walls and other surfaces — thus making Alexa even harder to understand. As far as doing what I ask and answering questions — excellent ... when I can understand her. Playing Jeopardy, for example, is 50-50: I just cannot clearly hear some of the questions. Weather report, on the other hand, is usually easier to hear. Maybe because weather phrases are expected word usage combinations.

I am able to listen to Prime Music with an additional monthly charge. I am a regular Prime member. The speaker quality is very good and better than Home Mini, so I don't need to connect it to another speaker system. I turned off all notifications because on the second day it pinged and then showed a green light. Alexa said I did not have any notifications, but the light stayed green. I tried to unplug it and re-plug it, but the light was still green. I felt someone was listening in on me even though Alexa said there were no drop-ins or phone calls. The notification function will just have to stay off, which gives me peace of mind.

I bought the Echo dot to go with an earlier gen Echo dot and Echo that I bought on Prime Day. I set them up in my parents house as a Christmas present. My parents are not easy to shop for. If they really want something, they buy it themselves. So, every year I have to figure out what they want, but they just don’t know they want it yet. The best gifts are usually things that will make their lives easier. We’re starting out slow. They’re using it to find out what the temperature is in various cities, the score of the game, when the next game is on, setting a timer, and the answer to various questions throughout the day. Then I taught them to make shopping lists with Alexa, and to talk to each other from opposite ends of the house. Next, I might pair them with some Philips Hue bulbs. So far so good!

this is my 3rd dot the other two are 2nd generation this one has a MUCH better sound quality i have the other two on external speakers one on my computer and the other on an external wired speaker this 3rd generation doesnt need one the only thing is as easy as it was to pair my Alexa Fire remote with the 2nd generation one in my office ... this new one is not pairing with my alexa fire remote in my bedroom i am gonna look around for a stand for it and probably get a decal skin so many nice ones to pick from

I have a 1st gen Dot and got this new 3rd gen bundled with a refurbed Show on Prime Day, and I was pleased with how much better the sound is in the new one. It certainly isn't the Echo or Show, but it isn't nearly as tinny as the 1st gen Dot. This one in in my bedroom and I use it mainly for an alarm and to play some kind of audio as I fall asleep and this Dot more than fills the bill. I love my Alexas, they are in just about every room in the house (if they listen in, they are really in need of lives), most connected to nice speakers so my music plays all through the house on my Everywhere network. Wait for a sale and buy multiples, you'll wonder how you got along without them.

Been deciding which company to go with for future smart home integration. After looking at Google, Apple, and Amazon, decided to go with Amazon Alexa based system. We already have Ring doorbell and also Ecobee smart thermometer so this seems to be a natural move to go with Echo. Setup is very straight forward and quick, and everything is very intuitive to use so far.

Of course, the deal to get a unit for 1 dollar with 1 month subscription to Amazon Music makes this deal that much sweeter.

Loving it!!

Best $30 I've spent on a gadget in years! Liked it so much I bought a second one for my bedroom and a third for my parents as a Christmas gift.

I've recently started to slowly add smart devices to my home. So far I have 4 smart plugs controlling my lamps, a Dyson hot/cool air purifier and a Mysa thermostat for my bedroom. Next I'm thinking about adding a security camera or two. These devices can all be controlled by the app(s) remotely or by voice when you're at home. It may sound silly but I especially like the fact that you can change the wake-up name from "Alexa" to "Computer" in the app settings - makes me feel like I'm on the Enterprise!

reviews.reviewTitle: Simple but one of the most impressive tech I own
reviews.reviewText: I love this thing. In fact I love it so much I purchased 4 of them all at one. It’s a cool experience talking to Alexa and getting things like the weather, news briefs, shopping lists, and so much more. I have linked it to my nest thermostats and I can tell it to change the temperature and works flawlessly. It also works with my ring cameras. My only regret is not getting one sooner. BUT, I got them at their new lower price of 29.99 and they had a sale for Black Friday where if you purchased 2 they would come to $25 each. So I guess it was worth the wait. My next purchase will be the echo show so we can have it in the kitchen.

The decision to change the power cord from an easily replaceable usb interface to an exclusive cord sold by amazon has really turned me off of these devices. The upgrades (sound quality + aesthetics) are nowhere near enough to make up for the fact that I have to pay $20 when one of their very fragile cords fails. My cat took one nibble on the cord, bam, dead echo.

On previous versions of the echo dot, I could replace the existing usb cord with any usb cord of my choice, allowing me to get a superior product at an affordable price. This allowed me to customize the cord to something that was a color of my choice, length of my choice, and most importantly in my particular case - made of cat-deterring materials.

I'm not blaming Amazon for not making their cords cat-proof, that's not their responsibility.
