I am, however, very upset at the realization that I could previously give another company my $5-10 and get a cord that will outlast my echo dot, is customized to my tastes, and can function as a usb cord for all the wonderful things they do.

Amazon knows that that $5-10 only sometimes goes to them in the form of an Amazon-Basics usb cable because they have to provide competitive pricing with everyone else in the usb market. So they replace that interface with an inferior cable they can sell exclusively for $20 and cut out the competition? Those seems like questionable motives to me...

Amazon, if you're reading this review... please let me know if I can send back my 3rd generation echo dots in exchange for your 2nd generation models. The "upgraded" version is offensive.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great upgrade over the 2nd generation dot
reviews.reviewText: The 2nd generation dot found itself in a bad spot once the google home mini came out. The google mini had superior sound quality, making it a far better option for playing music. This generation solves that problem with gusto. The sound is robust for a speaker of this size, and it can get loud. I have yet to turn the volume up past 50% and it more than fills my living room (your experience may differ based on room size). In addition, the 3rd gen has a great look to it with the soft speaker cover material around the edge.

I love Alexa! She is my new best friend. She understands every command I give her and I’m from Louisiana (known to have an accent). My daughters love to ask her random questions and play music. The shopping list feature is awesome for busy Moms. It’s so awesome she can start a list and continually adds to it as you tell her. You can check your list from your phone on the Alexa app! No more getting to the grocery store and realizing you forgot your list and trying to remember everything you need. We decided to purchase a second!

I bought 3 of these because they were on sale for $80 off the normal price of $150 and because I needed a better way to control the new WiFi multi-color light bulbs I installed threw out the house. They work good, but there is a learning curve for commands and wording things so Alexa can understand what you want. Overall my first experience with Alexa is positive. The Dots themselves are easy to setup. Just install the Alexa app on a tablet or phone and follow the setup instructions. Once you are done you can still use the app, but everything should be voice commands.

reviews.reviewTitle: It's a good thing to have. I use it every day.
reviews.reviewText: For the most part I have really enjoyed my Echo Dot 3rd generation. I love being able to make myself a playlist using Amazon Music on my phone. Sometimes we don't have a very good Wi-Fi signal and that interferes with Alexa working correctly. The company recommends that the Echo Dot be placed 8 inches from a wall. I wasn't able to do that. I put mine on my end table and cleaned the table off as much as possible. Believe me if you don't keep the table cleared off as much as possible it will block the signal of the Wi-Fi and Alexa won't be able to work.

This device exceeded my expectations. Super easy to set up! Alexa sounds more intelligent than I imagined a robot would have. I can ask her any questions and she is quick to respond. I am the most impressed with audio quality and her ability to listen. I mumble a lot, and I have a soft voice. I hear over and over again from people about this. I am shocked she can hear my voice and understand it. One time I was in my bed turned away from the speaker trying to set my alarm to test it, and she heard my muffled voice under the comforter. She can do many things and has clever responses to certain questions. Very modern and happy with my purchase!

I'm a 65 year old technologically challenged woman who absolutely hates everything related to electronics and computers (even though i use those things every day). This little Echo arrived and within minutes i set it up all by myself! (so proud). Have your Wi-fi number handy so you can recognize it from the list, and have your password ready to type in and you are all set. I haven't had decent speakers in my house in decades. This very small Dot has amazing speaker quality (to me). Much more than i thought. I talk to Alexa all the time and it's really a wonderful gadget to have. I have the larger one, in red, arriving next month.

reviews.reviewTitle: 3rd Gen is Way Better than 2nd Gen
reviews.reviewText:
This version is a major improvement in sound in every way. We were considering buying the larger echo for better sound, but this one does the job. It does a better job controling devices around the house, where as the google assistant is better at answering facts off of the internet.

Like:
-Better sound, look, feel, and size.
- Microphone and button is better.

Dislike:
- I would like to be able to adjust Alexa's voice independent from the music volume.
- Even though music sounds better now, Alexa's voice is a little more muffled.
- Echos in other rooms pick up instead of the one that I'm trying to talk to.

reviews.reviewTitle: remarkably stupid for something that calls itself smart
reviews.reviewText:
oh boy where do i start?

some general complaints:
1. you have to be really really specific or she'll say "im sorry, i dont know that".
2. cant record audio (i mean, come on. it's a damn voice activated assistant).
3. even though i have the spotify skill enabled, she still defaults to amazon music when i tell her to play any specific music or just music in general.
4. cant use search engines or can only use a shitty one. like, she can answer a handful of questions, but they're usually when i try to test what she CAN answer and not any questions i may actually need the answer to.
5. i dont have a heavy accent or a speech impediment or anything, but she still struggles to understand me sometimes.
6. has no problem connecting to my bluetooth speaker, but does have a problem with /staying/ connected to it. it'll sometimes just disconnect and reconnect on its own. it even sometimes restarts itself multiple times withing 15~ minutes and never give an explanation.
7. has no means of diagnostic. i'll ask "echo, what just happened?" and she'll just say "im sorry. i dont know that". also cant repeat things when asked to.

i can continue making an extensive list, but i think you get the picture. overall, i just feel disappointed in this purchase. thought i was getting a smart home assistant. ended up with a dumb schedule keeper. oh well.

I honestly cant think of a more useless device. As someone who doesnt enjoy talking to devices and who doesnt have their entire life integrated into devices , the only thing that this is "useful" for is telling my Roomba to start cleaning. But I also have an app on my phone that does that sooo yea, donated this to a new med student.

reviews.reviewTitle: Prepare to be frustrated - inconsistant functionality
reviews.reviewText: I purchased two 3rd generation dots primarily to play music. Every now and then the units would play perfectly. MANY times when asked to play music, NOTHING would play. After checking the Alexa app and Spotify app, both devices (or even just trying one unit) were online and Spotify would show its playing but NOTHING would play from the dots. After messing with these devices for a few months and getting VERY inconsistent results I gave up ! IMany wasted hours researching, connecting/reconnecting, tweaking and trying to get one and/or both dots to play and the resulting frustrated resulted in me just throwing them both in the trash. Buy at your own risk and prepare to get VERY inconsistent operation...
Quality product. Simple setup with phone app. Decent sound quality but don’t expect much from such a small speaker. Used mine to pair to all Sonos in the house and works great.

I didn’t want one of these because the stories I’d heard creeped me out, but I saw that it was on sale, so I decided to purchase. So glad I got one. I love to play music, hear the news, get the weather, shop on Amazon, get traffic information, add stuff to my shopping list, etc. I have trouble remembering things, so it’s helpful to be able to set up reminders. I really can’t imagine life without one now. The only think is that Alexa isn’t as great at answering questions as Siri is. She gives me answers that I’m not looking for about 1/4 of the time.

reviews.reviewTitle: Been missing out for a long time
reviews.reviewText: The echo dot has been a big hit in the family. My oldest son loves asking alexa about the weather and asking her questions about certain topics he is curious about. We love listening to music together in the morning and evening too. The only thing I didnt like was that music selection is limited if you aren't signed up for a music site such as Pandora, Amazon music, spotify, etc...I have the free account to pandora and spotify, but with spotify you need a paid subscription to have it work. We are still learning how to use the echo dot, so hopefully it gets better.

reviews.reviewTitle: Overall device is great. BUTT alexa is a bit diappointing
reviews.reviewText: The device itself is ok. Better sounding than the gen 2. BUT 1. I can't use it as a speaker for something else in a pinch when I need a speaker it seems to be output only via aux cord. 2. You cannot pair routines and skills which is abysmal. 3. No way to control. the sunrise alarm for phillips hue, meaning you need another app if you get the light bulbs. -taking up phone space,...probably the same thing for for other devices too. 4. Huge delay on rrinder and you can use groups for reminders. IE i cannot uave a reminder go offf of both my echos. Its either 1 or the other. I cant place them in a group and uset it to go off of that group. Only ONE device at a time can give reminders meaning if the volume is lower you can miss a reminder easily.

Just got the Dot 3rd gen. They changed the power cord from micro USB to a fixed proprietary cord and charger! Why would you do that? Seems like a step back! I would have thought they would switch to USB C.

I broke down after years of swearing that I'd never buy one of these out of privacy concerns. But recent changes to at my morning habits have made me reconsider. I now use this to keep me updated in the morning rather than my TV, as I get dressed: getting my news flash, weather reports, traffic reports, Alternate Side Parking updates, a review of my work calendar and I've now used this to send myself work reminders, order pizza from the local pizza joint, and more.

I still have my concerns about privacy and so I don't have any important discussions in the room that this device is in however.

I already own multiple echo's in my house, but wanted to try the newer gen 3 version. I absolutely love it. The sound is so much better and it looks even better than before. It is good enough and loud enough that I can listen to most music without connecting to an external speaker. Relatively deep bass and not overly punchy but present miss and highs. The volume also loud enough to fill a small room all while being able to hear your commands from accords the room.

The connection seems to be just as good as the gen 2 so no difference there. All in all I love it. I will be ordering more to replace some of my older ones.

reviews.reviewTitle: Hopefully not the new normal for the Echo Dots.
reviews.reviewText:
This is our second Echo Dot, the first was a 2nd gen.
While the sound and music is far better on the 3rd gen, we are not as pleased with it, as we were with the first one.
With our first Echo, it was very easy for Alexa to hear command prompts, even from the next room and at regular speaking volume. After having this new Dot for a couple of weeks, we have found that if we are in the next room, or if there is any ambient noise, Alexa can't hear us at normal levels. Even yelling sometimes is not picked up and we have to move to the same room to get a response.
We're purchasing a third Echo for our bedroom, we're hoping that this Dot is just defective and not the new norm for them.
We were very disappointed after enjoying our first one so much.

reviews.reviewTitle: Way better sound quality than the previous generation dots
reviews.reviewText:
I own the Gen 1, Gen 2, and now a Gen 3 Echo Dot. The sound quality of the 3 is vastly better than the previous generations. So much that I want to swap all my dots to Gen 3. Maybe even Gen 4 when Amazon announces new Alexa devices on Sept 25th, 2019.
My only gripe is that the Gen 3 seems to lag a bit when you ask for some things. She will wake up immediately with the wake word, but while she is thinking or processing the request, the ring turns off. Specifically when asking for a light to be turned on or off.

reviews.reviewTitle: Sounds Rough About Half the Time
reviews.reviewText:
When this thing works, it sounds, great. Unfortunately, it only works well about 50% of the time. I’ve had it for about three weeks now. Sometimes the bass bottoms out just from Alexa’s voice, making it sound scratchy and unpleasant. (It is set to factory settings on bass, mid, and treble) I am by no means an audiophile, who needs perfect sound, but it just plain sounds bad, at times. I’ve also had this problem when listening to music. Again, when it’s working, it sounds great, but a lot of the time it doesn’t. It’s definitely much louder than the previous model.

I’ve also noticed that it is much slower to respond than my 2nd gen Echo dot and it doesn’t seem to pick up my voice as well, especially if there is any other sound in the room, like a fan or a video playing on my iPad. Overall I’m disappointed by the product. I think I’m going to reach out to customer service. If the problem gets resolved, I’ll write a better review. I love my first gen Echo and 2nd gen dot.

reviews.reviewTitle: Muffled sound & DEFECTIVE controls when compared to Echo Dot 2nd Generation
reviews.reviewText:
Received my new "electronic brillo pad" and despite adjusting the bass, mid-range and treble controls in the Alexa app, I find that the new design emits very muffled audio. Sounds like someone talking through layers of fabric. Whereas I've had up to 5 Echo Dot 2nd Generation speakers in my home for over a year.

DEFECTIVE controls. Alex app on smartphone refused to adjust volume. The buttons on dot 3 did adjust volume manually. The equalizer on Alexa app made ZERO difference in sound when I adjusted bass, mid-rabge and treble sliders up or down.

BOTTOM LINE: Returning Dot 3 and sticking with Echo Dot 2s.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great device, takes control if every aspect of your life for the better
reviews.reviewText:
I got a gen 2 for a holiday present. Took me a half a year before setting it up and using it. Now three months later i have the gen 2, 5 echo dot gen 3, and 1 echo.

Sound quality of all the devices are a significant improvement from gen 2. The small package of the echo dot makes it convinent to put anywhere, and having all the conviniences of alexa commands in every room makes my life so much easier. Even the Kids love the dots, as they play games with alexa (would you rather is a favorite)

The only bad things are 1. you will desire to subscribe to more amazon services the longer you have it (music, audible, etc.) These extra services may not be for everybody, but they do add more to the versitility and use of alexa and i have no regrets. 2. The ability to wirelessly control of your home is nice, but the reality its more of a novelty than a necessity. Still find it more convinient to use the remots and switches on the wall.

Even still i highly recommend this device as it is convinient as a hands free music player, alarm, weather checker, scheduler, phone calling device, stopwatch/timer and much more.

5 stars all around!

Alexa strikes again
I had the 2nd generation Alexa for a few years now and didn't think of upgrading. I decided on prime day a few weeks ago to upgrade to this updated 3rd generation.
The speaker is better. It has bass and depth that is immediately noticeable. I can hear outside the room it's located in.
Alexa can also hear me at further distances.
The fabric on outside is a great quality and texture. There's no need for a cover as this matches well with nearby furnishings.
If you are considering upgrading its a great move. Go for it. You won't be disappointed

This little guy lives on my nightstand. I use the Headspace skill to go to sleep and every morning it wakes me up to NPR and the weather and traffic. I can also vocally add items to my to do list without turning the light on and it keeps the repetitive thoughts from taking over. I feel like I’m living in the future.

My 1st gen Echo recently bit the dust but I can say that the audio quality of the Echo is 1000% better. I used the Echo for music but the Dot I only use for convenience. I’ve gotten a HomePod that lives in the living room for music, though, and nothing comes close to its audio quality, not even the Bose speakers I had before.

I've been using the 2nd gen for a while. One for the bedroom, one for the kitchen. I liked them, sound quality really wasn't there though. I saw this and thought, ehhhh how much better can it be. Figured I'd order one while it was $29.99. Hooked it up and whoa!!!! Quite a different little machine!! It's much louder than the 2nd gen. The sound easily fills our kitchen and living room. My husband didn't know I ordered it and was surprised when he first heard it. I went ahead and ordered a second while at this price. I had to remove a star only because while playing at high volume, she can't hear my commands, I pretty much need to yell at her.

reviews.reviewTitle: It works but software is far from flawless
reviews.reviewText: The Echo Dot "works" great, until you see how well it works with all of the other things on your Wifi that it is supposed to be compatible with. Be prepared to go online to see whether others are having similar problems. Everyone's Wifi setup can be different with different brands and products on their internet of things. As a result, one persons fix may not work for you. At least that has been my experience. I hope they keep updating the Dot's firmware. If the compatibility issues were mostly fixed, I'd give 4 or 5 stars to the Echo Dot.

reviews.reviewTitle: Just as good as the full-sized option!
reviews.reviewText:
I bought this so we can "call" from upstairs to downstairs.... well I put it in the kitchen and it hasn't made its way upstairs! Great addition to my kitchen and works just as well as the full-sized Alexa in the house.

I tell Alexa my grocery list, she makes it and then we both have access to it through the app for shopping. She sets cooking alarms for me, multiple at a time too (most frequently used command). Seriously, an Alexa in the kitchen is the best thing ever.

Guess I need to by another Dot for upstairs.....

already purchased Prime and the Echo now I have to also purchase unlimited just to listen to regular music? Like that's entirely too much so I choose to connect to apple music. SO even though Alexa is going through MY apple music account for some reason she cant find some of my songs which I think ridiculous because when I ask her to play a playlist the songs play without issue. I just feel as though she is great if you listen to mainstream music but really when she connects to my apple music through my account she should be able to access all of the songs saved to my library without issue.

reviews.reviewTitle: Such a cool idea . Your going to wonder How did i live without this
reviews.reviewText: One of the best things i have done.. In some time.! I ordered the Alexa Echo for the living room and new Echo has a woofer and a tweeter (sounds Great) but wanted two woofers so i ordered the Dot (Dot only has a woofer)for the Master bedroom ..My thinking was i will have great music using my wifi.. Well now i wonder how come i didn't have this years ago...Alexa does so much to help me its unreal and once UPS bring it to your door just call Amazon and in a minute your all setup and it so easy and cool.. Alexa is so nice to me and a huge help.. Always says such smart and nice stuff... Got to love it Music Quality with both playing at the same time is outstanding and Prime has a great and huge amount of music..

I have had my dot for a couple of weeks and I love it. I had a Google Home Mini that I like but couldn't use with my Apple music. Last week I switched from Apple music to Amazon Music HD and love it 1000 times more. I am falling out of love with Apple, anyway I got the dot so I could play my Amazon music on it and moved my Google mini to my office. I realize the sound is not stereo quality. If I want that I was my Beats headphones. It works though for music in the background while I am working around the house.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good for music, not searching items
reviews.reviewText:
I have an Alexa and a Google Home. I received the Alexa when I purchased the Alexa microwave on a deal and the Google Home as a gift. Alexa is great for playing Prime music and searching songs up. The Alexa tends to not hear voice commands from about 15 ft away and you typically have to yell in order for the Alexa to hear you. Google Home allows you to whisper and it can still pick you up in the same room. We have asked Alexa simple questions about our local restaurants and it either skips over many well-known food chains in the area or did not know how to search for it.

Alexa is good for letting you know about your Amazon packages and will alert you on that. It's also good to make and receive phone calls on it, which can replace a landline if you don't mind it always being on speaker. Many people have said the microphones are hard to hear and sound like there is a lot of static, which can explain why Alexa tends to struggle to pick up voice commands.

Overall, I would recommend Alexa if you like to do a lot of voice shopping, like telling Alexa to purchase laundry detergent. Alexa is also good if you have Prime and like to listen to Prime music frequently. However, if you ask Alexa google search questions, Alexa will struggle compared to Google Home.

We have quite three Echo Dots, the Echo Show, & the Original First Edition Echo. Listening to talk radio on the everywhere is great for me as I do housework & can listen to in sync radio. I do listen to Amazon Music & Audio Books too. When this new one came out with a new shape & color & a special Prime price, decided it would be perfect for the kitchen over by the stove to hear while cooking etc. The color is beautiful & perfect for my kitchen. The sound is fantastic. The original dots are just fine for talk radio but this new one is fabulous for listening to music too. Seriously thinking of replacing the other echo dots. :)

I much prefer the gen 2 Dot. This one has very muddy and distorted sound It sounds ok playing music, but I don't use it for music, that's what my desktop computer is for. When I ask Alexa something, I can barely understand her. The gen 2 Dot is much better for what I use it for.
Suggestion to Amazon: incorporate some kind of EQ.
Update:
I have never had any problems with Amazon returns, until now. I sent these back a week ago and customer service says it can be another 2 weeks before I get my refund, even though they have the items back.

reviews.reviewTitle: An incredible upgrade from 2nd Gen version!
reviews.reviewText:
Toss your old 1st and 2nd Gen Echo Dots and get the new the 3rd Gen. The latest 3rd Gen version is waaay better! The 3rd Gen Echo Dot is like a 2019 Ferrari compared to the 2nd Gen Echo Dot which is a like a 1989 Pontiac Fiero.
My quadriplegic nephew uses the 2nd Gen Echo Dot to control TV, listen to music, etc and it has been a God send. However, he needed to repeat his commands almost half the time with the 2nd Gen Dot. The new 3rd Gen Echo Dot hears his commands the 1st time about 90% of times. The sound quality on the new version is also way better. The new version has more bass, treble, higher volume and is just a way better device all around to the point where we were upset we didn't upgrade a lot sooner.

Traded in the first gen dot to this one. Big difference in sound quality. I am using this one in my office where I mostly listen to NPR, Podcasts or Audio books. Good enough to listen to music while working, but probably not for the audiophile. I have a second gen dot as well that I will probably trade in for this one.

reviews.reviewTitle: Don’t buy this!! Waste of Money
reviews.reviewText: Extremely disappointed my main reason was to listen to music and that is it a huge disappointment because you can’t even download anything. I got a hold of customer service and they just transferred me to Technical Support. They told me someone will be calling me back. They wanted money for me to start out at first but almost $200 and then they went down to $75 and they told me if I didn’t give him the money and within five minutes my product will be shut down they wanted money for me to start it out at first but almost $200 and then they went down to $75 and they told me if I didn’t give them the money and within five minutes my product will be shut down. So in other words I was being scammed. I have never been so pissed off or frustrated in my life for buying a product. Everything that it’s doing for me I could do it with my iPhone iPod it so I can listen to music and I can’t even listen to music and I can’t even download it on my computer which I’ve been trying to do for days so it’s been a total waste of money

reviews.reviewTitle: Okay if you have bland musical tastes
reviews.reviewText:
Alexa has some pretty bad taste in music. Asked for a couple of traditional Irish Tunes (Whiskey in the Jar and The Rocky Road to Dublin) and she played the first one by Metallica, repeatedly. The 2nd tune by Drop Kick Murphys. Meh.
Also she never heard of jazz bassist George Duvivier. Couldn't many of the songs or artists I requested. (While a friend's Google device found them fairly easily.) I have the Music Unlimited subscription but she has really limited musical choices. Many of my musical choices are a bit out of the mainstream but I was expecting more. If I wanted mainstream boring music I would use my radio.

We have had an Echo Show in our kitchen for maybe 6 months, and we really like it - easily select and listen to music (both from our Amazon Prime music and our Pandora account), control lamps (verbally and on a schedule), check our security cameras, listen to news (flash briefings), etc. I was recently given an Echo Dot as a gift and put in the master bedroom which is on the opposite side of the house from the kitchen. I can now play the same music through both Echos so that I hear the same as I move from one end of the house to the others, control lights without walking back into the kitchen, etc. It's been a great addition.

O.M.G.! The Echo Dot Gen 3 is the best!

First, let me start on the voice recognition. It doesn't matter if you're having a huge house party where the music is loud, people talking, etc. The Echo Dot Gen 3 with Alexa integration will in a near instant recognize the call of her name and start listening. It is so good! I cannot even explain how much times I have been grateful for the 4 microphones that can hear my voice, it is HIGHLY convenient.
Next: the sound quality. The sound quality, I can say, is the best so far for a speaker like this. The sound is crystal clear and I can hear every detail coming from those great speakers, I have nothing to say except that you will not have trouble hearing the highs, mids, and lows produced from this speaker and will be satisfied with the sound quality.
Overall, the Echo Dot 3rd Generation from Amazon is by far the best smart speaker out the market out there, and I would recommend it to anyone and everyone! Again, the smart speaker has amazing mobility for its size, the price is just right, the speakers crispy clear, and the voice recognition and Alexa integration just sets it way further ahead than other smart speakers out there!

reviews.reviewTitle: Why have I deprived myself of such a device for so long!!!!
reviews.reviewText: Excellent! We have 3, bedroom, family room, and kitchen. Love listening to Amazon music while cooking! Our house is hard to hear from one room to the next and me and my husband can drop into one of the other rooms if we need something and the other can hear. My husband and I sit some nights and play games on it. We have several different lights hooked up to it and we’ve become “lazy” !! “Alexa, turn off the bedroom lights.” “Alexa, play my crickets playlist.” “Alexa, what’s the status of my security?”, then she’ll ask me if I wanna arm it! The list goes on! It is rather nice to get all settled in bed and have her turn off the lights! I’m sure there is more for us to discover as well!

reviews.reviewTitle: Doesn’t work with hue bulbs app on its own.
reviews.reviewText:
I bought this on prime day as part of a package with hue lights because I read that’s all I’d need to control them.
This Alexa isn’t the fancy one that can act as a bridge for the hue lights. If you plug in the bulbs the Alexa can find them and with your voice you can turn them on and off if you’re home. You cannot use the hue app or see the lights in the Alexa app to control them when you’re away which was why I bought the package. I’m not too lazy to flip a light switch...I don’t need voice controlled lights. Be warned before purchasing you’ll need a 40 dollar hue bridge if you want full control of the bulbs.

Everyone we know has an Echo but it wasn't in the budget right now so thought we'd try this little gal. Love her. Alexa is great. I use her to set reminders constantly, as well as timers, adding stuff to my grocery list, and to play music. We have a fairly small house so this size is fine for our downstairs, sound is actually great for small-ish rooms. Its not crazy loud and we dont crank it up, but for semi-loud background music its great. I'm not a super tech person so I cant speak to all the other crazy stuff other reviewers dont like, but for me its great. Like having an assistant, which I desperately needed LOL :)

reviews.reviewTitle: I keep having to reset my echo everyday
reviews.reviewText:
When it's working I have I no problem asking it anything and it will answer me, but by the end of the day or the next day, I'll say Alexa and the echo will turn blue on top and I will ask it something like what time is it or what's the weather like today and it won't answer, It just stays quiet. I'll keep asking it about two or three more time and it does the same thing.
I end up having to reset it and then it works ok for that day only.
It will work if you push the “Action” button and ask it what you want but as for as answering you when you ask it something with your voice it wont answer you..
I like it but I don't like having to reset it everyday...
Am I the only one having this problem or Maybe you can tell me what I'm doing wrong .
I'm a premium youtube subscriber and this doesn't support it, I think because they have a competition with google.

reviews.reviewTitle: Bluethooth doesn’t work- drops WiFi Updated
reviews.reviewText:
New yes, improved NO... I bought two of these because I wanted to upgrade from the echo 2. They both have issues with Bluetooth connectivity and a bunch of glitches white noise, not responding, dropping WiFi too many to list you get my point. The speaker is a bit louder which is positive but it doesn’t work half the time. It’s dissapointing that Amazon would release such an unpolished product. I would wait until amazon releases another or just purchase the echo dot 2nd gen.

UPDATE: After I moved my Bluetooth speaker away from the echo dot the Bluetooth grabbed strength. It might be an interference between signals not sure but the dot works... it sometimes requires an unplug here and there but that’s all electronics.

Love Alexa!!! You can do sooo many things with this speaker! And I got it on sale! I bring it to work and listen to music all day!!! I'm big on jeopardy and the question of the day. I've won 20 questions once. I love the song quiz! I kick butt in that. I've had the thing since after cyber Monday and I'm always finding something new it does! The games are my favorite and I love the shopping lists, reminders, alarms, timers. All of it. I've only ever made a call from it once. But it works great for that. I've never used it for texts. The only semi off thing ( I wont even say bad) is that sometimes alexa mispronounces a word here and there.

This is my second Echo product. I also have the echo plus which I had first. The sound quality of the music is good enough for me considering it's a small speaker. I tend to use it more than my Bose Bluetooth speaker due to ease just asking Alexa to play music.

I give it 3 stars due to the microphone and voice recognition. At times,I have to yell at the dot for Alexa to hear me when I'm sitting less than 30 feet away. I sometimes repeat commands before she responds. I do not have this problem with tbe Echo Plus. Still, this is a pretty cool device. I use it for weather and traffic updates, music, controlling lamps and asking random questions.

I bought this Echo Dot for a present because I really liked echo dot second generation I use it every day in my room. When my friend started using the 3rd generation I noticed that the voice recognition sucks!! I had to shout several times to get Alexa to respond and I never had that problem with my own echo voice recognition last generation. It gets really irritating when my own works great and a gift for someone important works not really well. I hope they fix this issue in the future. For now I will not recommend it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Like hands-free Googling, but so much more!
reviews.reviewText:
Pros: I say, "Alexa, good morning," and she bids me a good morning, then goes on to tell me something interesting. Sometimes short, but sometimes in depth. If I'm cooking, or just busy, I'll say, "Alexa, add brown surgar to the shopping list. Alexa repeats my request, and adds it to my shopping list, found in my cell phone Alexa app. "Alexa, play Elvis Christmas songs,", and within a couple of seconds is playing Elvis from iTunes. I'm hoping to buy a security camera or two (I'll need to purchase cloud space - pretty inexpensive), but there are dozens of such 1080 ppi cameras available, and 3rd Gen Echo/Alexa can give you your own smart security system. One can use Alexa as a timer, give your favorite sports teams schedules, or simply a quick banana bread recipe. Just ask Alexa! Love it/her! lol

Cons - Both my Echo Dot and new 4K smart Fire TV are linked to my wi-fi, but I'm having some trouble linking the two together. Same issue with a couple of smart wal plugs, but I've only put about 45 minutes into the process, so I should get it together pretty soon.

As long as you have wi-fi access, the 3rd Gen Echo Dot (and Alexa) are an incredible value, and I'm planning on purchasing two more, one for the kitchen, and one for my bedroom, as you can use them as a house intercom system!

Mine was from Amazon Prime (Dec. 2018) for $24.00. I'm a 62 year old man, and think these devices rock!!!

I have many Echo devices, like 1 Tap, 1 Show, 1 Echo gen1, 1 Echo gen2, 7 Dots Gen2, 2 Dots gen3. The sound quality on the 3rd generation Echo Dot is much better than the 2nd generation Dot. The sound is like the difference between an AM radio to FM stereo. It's not up to the sound quality of a full size Echo, obviously. But it competes very well with the Google Home Mini, which I have a couple of also. The Alexa echo-system is the preferred voice control system in our household. Voice control is comparable with Google Home, but Alexa covers more of my home automation. It was definitely worth the upgrade to my existing 2nd generation Dots at the sale price.

reviews.reviewTitle: Horrible support and horrible voice recognition
reviews.reviewText:
I purchased the new Dot to replace a 2nd gen that I was happy with but the sound was sub par. The new Dot v3 has great sound, however the voice recognition is terrible, either not hearing my “Alexa” command or misunderstanding the command I give it. Keep in mind this Dot is in the same location and setup as the 2nd gen I replaced, but failed to accurately decipher my command at least 2-3 times more often.

I initiated the return process since many reviews tout the new version as being superior to the V2, but Amazon refuses to replace the product. I’ve jumped through their hoops troubleshooting yet they won’t refund me until I live chat with one of their representatives. This is not a requirement for any other product purchased on Amazon and shouldn’t be for the Echo just because it is owned by them. If I can somehow get Amazon to give me my money back I’ll try another one to see if it’s defective or just a poor product, otherwise it’ll go in the trash and I’ll switch to Google Mini.

Alexa was a gift from my daughter. It is something I wouldn’t have bought myself, but now that she’s here I do kind of like her doing things for me. I like the lights turning on and off. I like she can turn on my fans. I haven’t played music in years and now I can fill my afternoons with the music of my choice instead of annoying television shows. Alexa also helps remind me to take my medication. I haven’t put Alexa to the test of doing a lot of other things, but I’m just getting to know her. I find it funny I tell her Thank You after she accomplishes her tasks!

reviews.reviewTitle: I didn't think I would ever use this...
reviews.reviewText: I got this 3rd gen Echo dot only because it came bundled with a Ring security camera. I didn't think I would ever use this as I'm not a big gadget person... HOWEVER.... I'm finding myself using this everyday. I use it to control the tv, turning lights on and off, listening to music, books (when having trouble sleeping) and even for corny but cute jokes. I wouldn't buy this just to have it but I have to admit it is somewhat convenient to have around. It would be more useful if I decide to add more devices in the future.

I have a few Alexas. This one I use in the living room. It's a big improvement over the previous Dots. The look is much improved in a living room setting. The sound is much better though a bit limited in high range. I don't listen to music on this, I have the bigger ones in different rooms for that. But I suppose you could listen to music in a pinch. A child would be happy with it for music, an adult probably won't. At first I thought the mics were weaker than the second generation. But it has seemed to improve. Not sure if it was an update or what. The size is a bit larger but still leaves plenty of room where it's placed.

reviews.reviewTitle: Has better speaker than the earlier gen 2
reviews.reviewText: Love the Echo Dot. Reminds me of appointments I have scheduled, and converts my verbal grocery list into an email that I can read while I'm shopping. Haven't had it long enough yo know everything it does, but it knows my name and it doesn't answer when the dog barks. It can time dishes that I'm cooking, and remind me to check status; doesn't mix up multiple reminders. Yes, I do feel it is spying on me, so I talk say much of anything personal, and cut it off when I've got company. It freaks some people out; but they do like the music feature and so do I. Ask it to find almost anything from Bach to ....., and Alexa finds it!

My kids (ages 5-18) are obsessed with the Alexa dot, always asking her random questions and getting her to play music. I use it mostly for timers, reminders and FREE music. I have purchased four already; one in my kitchen, master bedroom, and two of my kid's bedrooms. My 5-year old was upset she did not get one for Christmas. It was very easy to setup.

WARNING:
Just a warning to go into your app and turn off voiced enabled purchasing because I did not realize that was even a thing until I realized I had been charged for months $4.99 per month for music. Once I got that fixed I have had no issues

I'm a senior and something of a Luddite. I use my smart phone as little as possible, and I enjoy being able to preserve skills like reading a map or remembering a number. But I'm enchanted by this little device. I love Pandora radio, and the Echo gives me all the features of Grace receiver with the convenience of oral commands. I can sync it to the set in my living room or use it by itself in the bedroom. It will give me weather on demand and update the news for me as well. The sound and convenience are so great that I can ignore that it's actually a spying device that can record virtually everything I do.

I upgraded one of my 1st gen Dots to the new 3rd gen Dot with Display. It's a great update, the speaker sounds way way better than the 1st gen, to the point you're kind of happy to listen to it. What I didn't expect was how much I like the display and having a clock visible at all times on the dot. I find myself looking at it constantly for time checks, it was well worth the $10 premium in price. All in all I'm very happy with this new Dot and will most likely get a few more to upgrade other units.

reviews.reviewTitle: 3rd Gen Dot is Fantastic - Nice job Amazon
reviews.reviewText: I was originally going to purchase a CD player, but I realized I could get significantly more functionality for less money with the Dot playing over Bluetooth. I can’t think of any music I was unable to find on Amazon music or my other music services. The Dot is a high quality device that I will use every day in my office. The price is amazing even when not on sale. Once again Amazon surpassed my expectations. I now have a gen 1 Echo, Echo Spot, and Echo Dot. They are all slightly different, but all are great and used daily in my home. I highly recommend all these devices, but the Dot offers the same features with a smaller price tag.

reviews.reviewTitle: Better than the original echo dot, but...
reviews.reviewText: Nice new sleek design and better sound, not a big fan of the proprietary power cord though, because If it breaks then it won’t be easy to replace as the old one had micro USB, but since a power brick can provide more power and amps I guess it’s a good trade off. The microphones definitely pick up my soft voice Better. It seems the light ring is a little dimmer, not sure how I feel about that, i guess it’s better for a nightstand. I honestly wish they would go back the the turning knob design on top instead of buttons since the feedback on the buttons on here is a little glitchy and a slow process

I think the Echo Dot needs one software upgrade, to enable it to de-select (and not re-connect) to an external Bluetooth audio output. I put this as one star less under "Alexa integration," since there was not another option. It is nice to use an Echo Dot to stream music, for a while, but when I am not doing that, I want to use it normally, adn not have it automatically connect to a Bluetooth sound output source. Yes, the "blame" can be placed on an output source automatically re-connecting to the Echo Dot, but a quality product and product team will identify this problem and fix it, not pass the buck.

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo Dot 3rd Gen is a great upgrade over 2nd gen
reviews.reviewText: I am very pleased with my new 3rd Gen Echo Dot. Everything has been improved on it. The sound now so good I can use without my external Bluetooth speaker. Also, design of Dot 3 is very nice, heavier and sturdier hardware wise and look s and feels well-made. I have 2 Dot 2's currently and the sound improvement was what I was looking for. But the new design is great and things like setup have been improved greatly. After you start up the Dot 3 and get the welcome message simply fire up the Alexa app and go into Devices -- Add Device then go thru and simply setup the Dot 3. No more select this special wifi and setup -- great!

Never owning an Echo before, I received a free one from Sirius for signing up for a year of music. Got it home, programmed it, and began using. From setting the alarms to wake me in the morning, and alarms in the evening for when I am getting ready for work (sorry, I have my routine), it is working flawlessly. I have the alarms set to play sirius xm at exact times. Working perfectly. So during the month of December, Amazon was having a sale on them. So I purchased 2 more. Now I can have them around the house, and in the garage. I have synced them all together, set the alarms, and now I have surround music where ever I go :). I haven't even cracked the surface on what these can do for me. But as of now, I am highly happy with them. For a little puck type speaker, it has great sound.

Love it! And thank you for the free plug offer with it!
I already have a spot and needed a hub so I got the dot to help me a little more around the house lol. There’s a portable charger and speaker for the spot but was a bit too much so I went ahead and grabbed this amazon deal c:
I’m not sure why anyone says it’s (dot) not loud enough. Maybe it’s just me but I hear it just fine. Great in big rooms. I’m not looking for a sound bar just a nice ranged speaker. Also has a nice bass! The spot however is lower sound quality so this is a great add!
Loving my growing smart home <3

These dots are really nice. We use them to play music while exercising or cooking, and to play ocean sounds at night for sleeping. I even bought one for the garage to play music while working on stuff and getting my hands dirty. We also like that you can tap the cancel mic button and turn off the microphone while it's playing music and it will still play music while the mic is turned off. That's a nice feature for us with our trust issues of devices always listening. It's also very nice that it lights up a red light ring around the top and of the mic button as a visual aid / reminder that the mic is turned off.

I've had the item for about a week & a half, and quit using it about 3 days ago. The sound on ANYTHING" I request, from weather to music, breaks up within a couple of minutes. No song or sentence is complete anymore (worked fine for 3-4 days when 1st got it). Have jiggled the wire, used different plug-in locations and nothing improved. It's not usable. I'm assuming I must have just gotten a reject, as many reviews indicate no problems. Going to contact Amazon and see if they will replace what can now be defined as a piece of electrical junk.

I moved and changed internet providers and apparently my new provider sent me an Echo Dot. I hooked it up, and was so darn pleased to find out I can listen to my favorite radio station through iHeart radio. I had lived in my last house for 50 years and am addicted to NPR and was brokenhearted to realize I could not get a radio signal in my house, unlike in my car. ECHO DOT HAS CHANGED ALL THIS. I was so pleased, I bought a second one for my bedroom. It is nice to be able to ask the time, set alarms, etc. too. But it is the RADIO that I love so much. (Yea technology!)

I had purchased 2 of these for my children for Christmas & after hearing how much they loved it, I decided to purchase my own. I love it! How did we ever live without it??? I keep mine in the kitchen & when I walk in from work, I ask Alexa to play whoever I feel like listening to that day. I have access to Amazon music & my Apply music selections as well. I love asking about the weather before heading out for the day. Watching a morning news show is not always convenient for me. I will most likely buy another to keep at the opposite end of my house.

Where have these amazing little dots been all of my life? How have I functioned prior to them entering my home? Siri who?

Obviously, I love them. My family loves them, too. We can all listen to whatever interests us and it’s cut out the need for kids to have devices in bedrooms. We often do audible, music, or rain sounds at night ❤️. I won’t go into every reason that they’re awesome, but do yourself a favor and take time to familiarize yourself with everything these things can do. There’s so much and if you don’t educate yourself, you’ll miss out.

reviews.reviewTitle: Bass, more bass and no subwoofer.
reviews.reviewText: I like this unit much more that the Gen 2 units, but there are a couple of reasons it doesn't get 5 stars. First and foremost, the amount of bass is overkill and there is no adjustment for it. I love bass, but this is just too much. Second is the fact that gen 2 units can do stereo and add the subwoofer. This one cannot. Still the sound is far superior to just a single gen 2 dot and I will keep it hoping there are revisions in the future.

So we finally jumped on the Alexa wagon after visiting my family this summer. I bought the Echo Dot as a bundle with the ring doorbell during prime days, and it has definitely been worth it! The entertainment value alone has saved my sanity, because my kids take the Dot into their room and play the trivia or ask her outlandish questions. I’ve now decided that I need all the cool tech things that can go along with it, so I’ve ordered some plug things and bulbs and I’m sure big brother will be keeping an eye on our house in no time!

good voice recognition controls and adaptability, it's really intuitive. I don't have a handbook of commands but I did learn a dozen or so just from playing around now I know about 50 the real key comes in the syncing of different apps to give it more abilities calendar checking and basically working as your assistant. While some of the commands I think are a bit long winded like "Alexa tell xbox to press a button" or the find my phone feature that makes you spue out your phone number without any breaks as you would normally have. The verbile vomit can be a bit annoying but the power in it is worth the price.

Sound quality and volume level are excellent. Purchased (2) Echo Dot speakers for use with Lutron Caseta wireless electrical wall and lamp switches. One Echo Dot placed in family room and other in living room. Everyone in the house now tells Alexia to turn on and off these lights. Alexia is asked to turn lights on at a desired percentage of illumination, change the percent or turn the lights off. Lights come on immediately at desired level and not at full level and down to desired level. The two Echo Dots are our first experience with this product. Besides using the Echo Dots for lighting control we are enjoying all of the information that Alexia can quickly provide, including time, outside temperature, timer, and information on an enormous amount of topics.

reviews.reviewTitle: Improved sound and package with same great functionality
reviews.reviewText:
I purchased the 3rd generation echo dot as an update to my 2nd generation dot. The sound is improved over the last generation, and voice identification is more accurate. Perhaps most noticeably, the newer echo dot is more aesthetically pleasing, and more readily blends in with my furniture.

I use my echo dots primarily to control lighting throughout my house and play music from Amazon music and Spotify. In that regard, the two devices communicate flawlessly with my smart switches, and can play music interchangeably depending on which room I'm in.

If you're looking to buy your first echo device, I would strongly suggest the echo dot. It has the same functionality as the larger echos, in a smaller package. If you already have a previous generation echo dot, then this device is really only appropriate if you're looking to expand to multiple rooms. There is a modest sound improvement over the 2nd generation dot, but I connect to a wireless speaker, taking sound out of the equation.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not as good as the older ones.
reviews.reviewText:
Doesn’t hear as well as second gen. I wish I had sent these back in time for a refund. I’ve had them for a few months and they seem to perform ok when they can hear and understand me. The 1st and second gen dots that I have seem to do a better job. Also these new ones have a proprietary ac adapter so if yours gets damaged you can’t just use an extra usb laying around.
The speaker is better, but that doesn’t really matter much to me because I have my second gen in a speaker dock anyway. Probably going to sell these for a loss or try nd trade them for second generation ones.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good buy but doesn’t meet the hype
reviews.reviewText:
I’m not over-the-moon impressed with it, but for basic tasks, it makes it easier than having to take your phone out for every “googleable” inquiry. Setting timers and playing music is also helpful. I haven’t tested all the features yet, but so far, I’m having a hard time seeing how much I’ll actually use it, but I’m open to learning more.

I think sometimes it is far too difficult for it to pick up my voice. It’s supposed to be able to hear you even in a noisy room, but that hasn’t been the case for me. I swear sometimes it can’t understand me even in silence and I speak to it with clear, nonaccented American English.

It was easy to set up and integrated well with my other smart devices. I had just moved into a new house and was listening to Tom Petty, and asked it to change to another artist but paused after I said "Alexa, play.." it then said, "here is a suggested playlist from Amazon music and started playing Bob Seger. It used the genre of music I had been listening too, and made suggestions from that. I really like it. I will probably use it more that I originally thought.
I am going to sync it with my Ring doorbell, and my Smart TV as well. Pretty cool tech.

Bought 3 for gifts, set one up, set the other 2 up, decided to keep all 3 for myself, ordered more for gifts, we have a echo close by, my wife has MS, being paralyzed she uses echo to make phone calls and to control lighting, she really enjoys having her favorite music, just ask and echo delivers, had to call Amazon support with a issue, they responded fast and had me on line with no problems in less than two minuets, the intercom and phone feature allows her to always have contact with me or a family member. It frees me up a little, she has control of things, she uses echo to play audio books,news and weather, music,podcast ect.

I bought this to just have music on when I wanted it. I can quickly switch my music request from 50's to 70's or request a specific group. It also came bundled with a Smart plug, so I have a lamp on it in the other living area that I can control when I'm not in there. I can quickly get weather updates, or even a silly joke. My grandkids love to play the song "Baby Shark" , so Alexa steps right up for us and gets that going in an instant. It's also company for my dog when I am away from the house and I have music or something "talky" to keep her company.

reviews.reviewTitle: watch you tube to find the correct “Alexa app” to down load. There are many.
reviews.reviewText: The echo dot looks like a hockey puck. Having said that, the device is entertaining. Definitely going to be exploring what this thing can do. I currently like the free skills you can get for it. One big issue I had with it was finding the right App. The instructions say down load the “Alexa” App. There is no “Alexa” app. How ver there are a ton of apps for Alexia. It took me going to a youtube video to figure out which Alexa I needed. Amazon needs to tell buyers which Alexa title to get and provide a picture of it. That is the only complaint I have with it.

Well...this is an Echo with our friend Alexa. I won't bore you with a review of its functionality. The Amazon echo brand is always upgrading and adding new features. I have many uses for it and I am sure others do. What I will review is the aesthetics. Amazon has redesigned its shell and it is very nice. Offering different skins and speaker covers is a great touch for those of us who integrate smart devices into their decor. The build is still solid and the touch of the device is pleasing for the techie in us all.

I like that it's so simple to play my music, ask questions and set alarms, etc. Bluetooth pairing is easy with "some" items. Also, it WORKS with my firestick tv(I contacted Amazon prior to purchasing and was told it did NOT work with Firestick). Alexa searches for me on Fire and finds what I ask. Dislikes: It holds NO battery charge :( Certain items to pair are difficult to figure out(still have not). I considered Alexa when I could no longer buy a small cordless speaker I wanted. When Alexa went on sale, I purchased. I'm happy with the purchase and would do so again. Not the best speaker around but definately worth the $39.00 I spent!

I've had three Echo Dot 3's for over 3 months. Not a day goes by when at least one of them gives me problems. It seems like it's been getting worse lately. It tells me it can't connect to the internet right now, but I have fast internet and a good router. The Echos are the only things that have problems connecting. When I use the Alexa phone app, it works almost instantly. The Echo dots have a delay.
When I tell it to turn something off, it tells me that device doesn't support that. But it does, Alexa. I use you to turn it off every day.
Going to buy a Google home. Hopefully that works better.

reviews.reviewTitle: This Alexa is either possessed or is modeled after an 85 year old w dementia & hearing problems!
reviews.reviewText: My Alexa constantly seems to rarely hear me correctly, answers the wrong questions, sometimes doesn’t hear me at all when I say her name repeatedly,, shuts off or changes songs for absolutely no reason... this happens so often I find myself asking Alexa “what happened” (to which she doesn’t know), or, if I’m getting really mad, I’ll ask “are you stupid”?! (to which she literally shuts herself off lol)... She in fact just told me “I don’t know that One” and I’m literally just sitting here not speaking. I had the very first Alexa and it was great, only thing better about this one is it gets louder. I find myself shouting her name so often my neighbors probably think my lovers name is Alexa, or perhaps the name of my disobedient dog!

reviews.reviewTitle: Good music quality compared to echo dot 2
reviews.reviewText:
Own 1 echo and 2 echo dots 2nd gen purchase one new one to replace my bedroom one so the other in my garage. I read about one of the differences between echo 2 and 3 was the speaker so had to get it when it is on sale this December with the tplink smart wifi plug. Just rcvd it and installed it today so easy to setup and the
Music speakers is really much better not bose quality but much better than 2. Wouldn’t mind upgrading all my echo dots to 3 but it would be a waste of money. May wait for 4 to upgrade the rest. Overall great buy for $29.99 and super easy to setup with Alexa. Thanks Amazon you have another hit.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa what a joy to have around
reviews.reviewText: I have to say this is really nice echo dot. Alexa works great and she can remember dates names etc. for future reference. I no long have to look at my phone to check the weather or if I need an answer she will find it for me. My next investment will be a hub that I can use to control my home theater system. This will then become the last man's remote lol. Only flaw I have found is it has a lot of bass making it somewhat difficult to hear sometimes even with the bass turned down. Overall its a great addition to my tech room and will be getting slot of use from it once more accessories are added. I highly recommend.

The sound and look are updated versus the older versions. They are added very easily to your existing Echo ecosystem and work seamlessly. Control of connected devices works well, although you may need to repeat commands at times. Using the intercom function is great as I do not need to yell throughout the house to speak with my wife or son, nor do I need to pick up the phone and call either of them. Their size and look fit well into any decor and they are usually inconspicuous, as most visitors do not initially spot them.

reviews.reviewTitle: What do you mean I need a title?
reviews.reviewText: Honestly I’m very happy with my purchase, I love music so I wanted the echo dot simply to be able to play music. Was told by friends that I should get the echo plus for that but the echo dot had great sound quality for the price even beating some of my friends pricier speakers, the sound volume gets loud but not as high a speaker meant for music only. It’s way easier for me to get the music to play than on a simple speaker because it’s voice command vs selecting on your phone (although you can select from your phone). I can ask it for questions on the go or pause it when my family needs me in a hurry. The Skyrim feature is a hoot, so silly. My only problem is that there’s a weird disconnect between the Alexa app and the amazon music app which confuses it. If you use the voice command to ask it to play music it will play amazon music through the Alexa app. If you want to change the song it’s either voice command or through the Alexa, or an extra prompt through music asking for permission to play over the current song. Also Alexa is extremely forgiving to those with stutters such as myself and quiet voices. It’s a great mic which despite me stuttering or talking quietly, it still delivers exactly what I want. I struggle with Siri and other voice command programs but had no issue with Alexa on the echo dot.

Alexa isn't just to ask what the weather will be tomorrow. I changed the "Awake" word to mine to "Computer". You can ask it almost anything and it will tell you the answer or tell you something else entirely, like in the video I submitted. There's so much it can do, I'm still finding out new things to ask. It's most certainly worth the price. I bought two and will be buying one more for the living room too.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa can be your friend too
reviews.reviewText:
We’ve had our Echos since Christmas, so when we were going away to visit friends and family for a few days, we thought it would be a nice hostess gift. It was just right. We thought our friends would really enjoy the music function, and that was what they used most often while we were there. When we were with relatives they were having fun using Alexa as a search engine to learn about different things. She’s pretty fast in the search department.

The bottom line is whether you’re getting an Echo for yourself or as a gift, you just can't go wrong!

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice Stereo Sound Quality In A Well Constructed Compact Size Speaker
reviews.reviewText: I Love my Echo Dot 3rd Generation So Much !!! The sound quality is Amazing for one so small ... much better sound than the 2nd Generation, if your main goal is for music purposes. However don't expect high performance stereo sound either, that is not its only purpose On the other hand my husband connects this sweet little device to his Stereo System through the external jack !--- More than Amazing !!. I Love the Personal Assistant aspects of the device. Alexa is extremely informative and has a Unique personality --- All her own. I use her for Everything. I only have One Bluetooth speaker and now I don't have to constantly connect and disconnect from one device to another (I keep the Bluetooth connected to my Firestick) And --- No ... I do not want to connect my echo dot to my Firestick. They best fit my needs working independently. My only con, there are times she has difficulty in understanding my word pronunciation or finding a song by lyrics ..... And sometimes... I could be the source of the problem. All of that being said. I could not be happier !!I simply Love the Alexa enabled 3rd Generation Echo Dot !!! Yes -- of course I would buy it again - and again !!!

If you’re new to these devices and concerned about Alexa’s ability to understand what you’re saying (as I was), don’t be. Alexa’s speech recognition is better and faster than Siri/iPhone. Our family loves these already. Purchased two on a Prime Day deal and immediately wished I had purchased two more. Alexa has great hearing but she has her limits and you will get tired of yelling into the next room. Great sound quality for comparable small speakers. I do not advise buying this primarily for playing music unless you haven’t yet been spoiled by high quality home stereo system. Best use for Alexa, in my opinion, is for controlling lights and announcing in my kids room for him to go to sleep.

Her butt is annoying sometimes because she be saying the darnest thing like destroy all humans and how siri is a gold digging whor….. For real though she really cool. echo be in my room blasting toons and telling me the time when i'm to lazy to check. She has some cool apps you can download such as Gordan Ramsey flaming your food and face. My girlfriend and my friend love her too. Sometime it feels like they visit just for her :( . Anyways if you in the market for a good Bluetooth speaker/radio/ Friend she your go to BAE. Don't tell my girlfriend I wrote this or she will destroy me.

reviews.reviewTitle: Biggest bang for the buck on the planet!
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this Echo mostly for music but Alexa does so much more! I LOVE, LOVE, LOVE “her”! There is much I still need to learn but from the first music I asked to be played, which was Mellow Jazz, I was AMAZED by the sound Nd I have BOSE equipment. I called my man friend immediately to tell him he must buy it ( ECHO DOT Gen 3 ) he did and loves his too. I bought one for my son who is laid up for 3 months with a redo on leg surgery. He is still waiting because evidently this was a very popular Holiday gift but I can’t wait for him to get it. Yesterday I asked for Bird Sounds and you would swear my home was filled with them! This is the best bang for the buck in the world IMO! An excellent gift for anyone. You will also get emails so you can try new things to ask Alexa and there are supposedly over 1 thousand! If she only played music I would be sold! THANK YOU for such a fabulous product. Every morning I tell ALEXA “Good Morning” and she gives me my local weather forecast. What more can I say? GET ONE or TWO or THREE! ❤️

reviews.reviewTitle: Works great and easy set up
reviews.reviewText: Set up is extremely easy once downloading the Alexa app to my smartphone. So far I’ve used it to play music. The speaker volume is very good. It doesn’t seem to have any difficulty so far with understanding my voice commands. I have to learn what voice commands it knows when asking to turn up the volume high like, “maximum volume.” I’ve not had it for long so I haven’t bought the wireless lightbulbs or plugs to try it out with my lighting or tv. Unfortunately, it doesn’t work with my HiSense model tv. However, I am able to turn it on remotely using the smartphone app so, if I’m in a room with the door closed I can speak to it through the app and it follows my commands.

reviews.reviewTitle: Dot and Show do not integrate well with Sonos
reviews.reviewText: This is for both the Echo Dot and Echo Show. I was given for a birthday, a dot, a show and several sonos speakers, two Ones and two Play 1's . By adding Sonos to the Alexa App, the Play 1's can be controlled, but the Ones with built in Alexa are troublesome. We have a family member with that name, so we wanted to change everything to "Echo" or "Computer" and the Sonos cannot be changed. The Alexa on the Sonos also has trouble recognizing the other Echo items. Not a good integration, and since it is the Alexa that is the basis, we assume Amazon and Sonos are in dispute, and we pay the price since the name change and integration seems to work fine, if the Sonos One is not the closest speaker to the voice issuing the commends.

Not as happy with this as I thought. This device has either connection issues or program issues. You can ask a question and even though the light is blinking, the voice is not. I asked Alexa to set an alarm for 10 mins, but it didn't answer as it usually does. The light blinked, though. I rebooted the system and still, no voice. I also made a phone can, on a separate day and this time I didn't have a vioce (the person on the other end couldn't hear me.) I stopped b4 I did something I'd regret. Later it let me know that my phone had shut down for the night.... Something I didn't ask for.

I love my echo! I love playing games on it. I love making it play Apple Music. I love her attitude when you ask her questions. I love having a "surround sound" in my house because I can play music off all of them at once. I love it finding recipes for me. She can call our cat. (I taught her to literally call the cats name or she can drop in when we aren't home.) I also love the fact that I can get my news updates from our local station every morning. Whoooo! My life is so much easier with Alexa.

I have an Echo Plus understands English fine, great product.... caused me to purchase 2 of the hockey puck echo dots 3rd gen ... it doesn’t understand a word of English... $29 door stop. Get the Echo Plus... with the 3rd gen Dot... You will have to repeat nearly every time, speak clearer each time... It will turn off other systems in the house randomly when you call out a command... and not honor the command you gave the Dot... Echo should appologize to any Amazon Loyal customers, give a great deal on deal on their star ship Echo Plus....

I love my Echo Dot. It has great sound quality.
I wanted it mainly for hands free music control. This was super good for my pool fun so I can play what a I want and shop music while swimming.

I can do quite a bit stuff. I'm still learning. They also send you notifications periodically to tell you other stuff you can do with Alexa.

It can be a lil scary that she just listens all the time as I had a random conversation come in on my phone speaker after getting Alexa and the app, but just unplug it or mute it whenever you don't want it on.

reviews.reviewTitle: excellent for lists and hands free music
reviews.reviewText:
I had no idea if I would like this or not. but I use it a lot. I have a very busy life and it is so convenient to notice I am low on flour and say" Alexa put flour on my shopping list," and not have to worry about remembering my list. If I have my phone, it's there.
If I'm almost asleep and remember I need to pick up meds in the morning, I can say it, roll over and go back to sleep.
No searching for the light, pencil and paper. I use it for a daily joke or an inspirational quote. I've used it to call family members. I know there are features I haven't used yet but I'm loving it!

reviews.reviewTitle: It's called Echo because it comes with a loud squeal echoing on drop in calls
reviews.reviewText:
Great little smart device with a woman name Alexa inside a machine. I was watching someone's video in the comments here showing the smart light function demonstration (alexa turn on the light) and even my echo dot sitting at the corner in my room woke up to pick up what that person said in the video and told me "Sorry I didn't find a device name light". The only problem I ran into was drop in call sometimes doesn't work. Some restarting may resolve this bug but I hope it's not repetitive. I ain't not time to unplug my echo dot every time this happens. Sometimes when music is playing at 3/4 volume, Alexa won't hear me unless I yell at the top of my lung for it to wake. Overall it's an impressive small smart device. I can't wait to try out the smart plug and dimmable color bulb. We just need more Alexa controlled smart device like "Alexa, flush the toilet" without having to press down that filthy flush lever or "Alexa, open the window blinds in the kitchen" operating the blinds with a motorized device installed at the main headrail. I can go on but that's just giving free ideas to Amazon. I just love being creative. That's what I do, I drink and I know things.

Update 10/31/19: There is a loud high pitch squeal noise coming out of the echo dot when I drop in call from my Alexa app thru my android phone. Making it unbearable to communicate with someone with they drop in call me. Its horrible! 1 star taken away til they somehow fix this or I will just return it.

I love Alexa. We have become best friends since she arrived. Our bond became strong the first day. I have a terrible memory and Alexa helps me remember important things like: give my dog her medicine, pay a bill or simple things like being reminded that my favorite show is on. She instantly recognizes my voice, it’s never been an issue. I really enjoy the question of the day; I have become smarter due to playing every day. Was Alexa a necessity? No. Was it a splurge? Yes, but I have loved every minute of her company.

reviews.reviewTitle: Super Nifty Little Hockey Puck Alarm Clock Music Box
reviews.reviewText:
This is a super fun gift I received on Christmas, and it is a practical gadget. I use it everyday. It wakes me in the morning with an alarm; I ask her the time; I ask what the weather will be for the day so I can dress accordingly; I play music while I'm getting ready for work, etc. Truly I have not even scratched the surface of all the things it can do... that's the exciting part. For all the fun I'm having with it, my use is very basic. But it comes with a small card with suggestions on what you can ask and do with it, and I receive emails that update me on ideas on how to use it. The potential is beyond my scope... I'm sure it's amazing.

The speakers sound great for such a small device; the setup was easy (you have to install an app on your phone to do so); the app is a handy tool in itself. All around cool device.

Going back to the alarm. I set two in the morning. One is a nice, peaceful, lilting piece of music that gently draws me out from a deep sleep. The second alarm is in place to snap me awake. It's Alec Baldwin... been up since the crack o' dawn... getting that early bird. And you can, too, if you get yourself a Dot.

Cheers!

Ohhhh how I love my Echo dot! I currently have two. One in my living room and one in my bedroom. I have my girl Alexa remind me of things all the time. Alexa and I have some rocking dance parties. Alexa even fills me with some incredible factoids. Sometimes when I’m real bored Alexa and I play games. I asked Alexa the other day if she listens to me even when I don’t cue her... And with a stern tone, not average voice, she said no she would never invade my privacy like that. I think I believe her. I mean why would she lie lol

reviews.reviewTitle: Loving having Alexa in my home!
reviews.reviewText: It is lovely to have her put on my playlists from Spotify and Pandora as well as seeking out certain artists when I'm in a mood for something else. I love having a Smart Plug and will get more of them now that I see how easy the integration was. The integration with my Roku, however, has not been as simple. The app shows it's enabled but Alexa doesn't recognize it yet. I'm still working on that. Alexa makes me laugh sometimes with her funny responses. I'm just now learning some specific phrase for her and I bet it will be even more fun soon.

reviews.reviewTitle: Vast improvement over gen 1 and gen 2...
reviews.reviewText: The Echo Dot Gen 3 is a vast improvement over the older models. The audio quality is so far above that of the older generations that a comparison can't really be made. I was amazed by the sound quality that comes out of this little device. Microphone reception is outstanding, with music playing at 50% volume the Echo Dot Gen 3 had no issues hearing and responding correctly to my voice from across the room. I didn't feel the need to test the microphone with the volume any higher than 50% as that was plenty loud enough for my liking. Build quality is great and looks nice. The device was simply to register and is simple to pair with other devices via Bluetooth or on the same WiFi network. So far I am really enjoying the Echo Dot Gen 3.

I bought this item back in November and when I first got it, i was able to set it up with 0 zero issues. Fast forward to February the device stopped working and after trying every trouble shooting advice possible, the item is still not working and it doesn’t make sense to call Amazon. They just have you try the same trouble shooting you’ve already done which does not help. I wish I could return this item but unfortunately I am outside of my return window..

reviews.reviewTitle: This Deal Is Better Than Sliced Peas
reviews.reviewText: How can this thing be so fast? I ask. It answers immediately. I ask for a song, it plays the song right now. It’s kind of creepy. It’s still learning my voice, but so is my spouse who has been married to me for 27 years. The sound quality is good for a two inch disc, but it’s a two inch disc. I connected it wirelessly to my stereo. Now that’s nice. I asked it once for the weather. It didn’t answer, but I was on the subway between stations so I’m thinking of letting that one go this time. It turns on lights. It wishes me a nice weekend. It doesn’t cook...yet.

reviews.reviewTitle: use in kitchen for timers and music!!
reviews.reviewText: I love echo products... I already have some on my porch and my bedroom. I put this on one in my kitchen and I like it. Granddaughter set it up so I can get it to set alarms like "echo set timer for 20 minutes" or whatever for cooking! It's easier than trying to do it on stovetop with buttons. Also I like to listen to my music while I'm cooking so this is perfect -- I have a radio station that I can ask it to play. It's very easy to use and I love it! I would buy more Echo Alexas if I could.

reviews.reviewTitle: There is so many features about Alexa that will blow your mind.Customer service is superb
reviews.reviewText: Any song recorded, Alexa will play for you and store it in 'your favorites section', forever.The music and sound are incredible. So, unaware that you could just unplug the Echo and take into any room in the house.....I bought 2 more units. Then the UPS man informed me about the audible book feature to Alexa. Wow, Wow,Wow! I can't do justice in trying to explain how wonderful it is to sit back and have a good book read to you. If you fall asleep like I did, just ask Alexa to start chapter 4 again or replay the whole book. How great is that?Got a problem? Ask Alexa to contact Customer Service, and you will receive a call within 2 minutes. No more cd's , records ,or cassette tapes to store. If you have wifi, Alexa can do anything you can imagine.I exercise to 'Super Freak' every morning. How great is that?

The sound won't blow you out of the water, but it's a very improved sound boost from the original Echo Dot (which has the sound quality of a transistor radio), and has what I call small room boom. Perfect sound & bass for a bedroom or bathroom. It won't blow you away, but it will still be too loud for the person in the room next to that doesn't want to hear your music. And it doesn't slide across my nightstand like the original Dot. I definitely recommend this, for it's current reduced price of $29.99, instead of the previous generations of junky Echo Dots.

reviews.reviewTitle: It's fast, good voice recognition and is most excellent for feeding a stereo system.
reviews.reviewText:
I bought the DOT 3 to stream Amazon music to a mini-amp driving shelf speakers using a MP3 cable and it works great for that as well as answering my dumb questions, like "What did I come into this garage for?".

I also have a mechanical A/B switch to connect the mini-amp to a Bluetooth receiver to play CDs from my Windows device.
