My experience with the little DOT 3 will begot a children's version for my 4yo grandson.

If he winds up going to Berkley, I'm going to ax for my money back!

My husband and I won this at a raffle and replaced our Gen1 in our living room with this Gen 3. The sound quality is outstanding in comparison - we thought the sound was coming through our TV soundbar it was that loud and clear. Definitely worth every penny to get this one over an older generation. Sometimes I have to repeat myself to get Alexa to listen to a command, but that's likely a fault of us having her close to the TV and in a corner rather than out in the open in a quieter location. Would definitely recommend! Love my Echo Dot.

This little thing comes with a lot of sound. Its so loud that I normally have it set to volume 5. My gen 2 I had to have on volume 10 all the time. The only issue I have is that when I use it as alarm for the mornings I set it to volume 10 before bed and it has a hard time hearing me tell it to turn off when the alarm sounds. Any other time ive ised it to play misic I have to yell "Echo" the name for it to hear me. If it could hear me better then it would get a 5 star. Plus the charging cord was changed from the USB to a different set up making it not as veraitile as before if you move it around at all. Other than that its a great upgrade from the gen 2.

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect, take the plunge and buy atleast one.
reviews.reviewText: Really great! I was worried about the sound quality because of the reviews but these are actually really loud. I bought 3 and all 3 are super loud. I have to turn them down about halfway. Love the broadcast feature too. Great deal. If you buy just one you’ll be back for more later so you might as well just bundle and save :)

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa's not all its promoted to be
reviews.reviewText: Alexa is no different from iPhone's Siri, except maybe for its hearing capability, it does hear well. Sound quality is ok, there's too much bass even after you turn it down. Its more limited as to what it can do than advertised. It's best for asking about the temp outside and playing music from Amazon Music (if you're a Prime member) but that's about it. About 50% of the time you ask it a question it says "I don't know" or "I'm not sure about that." If you're looking for a robot like device to converse with, Alexa is not that. It's ok I guess. My kids and I we're totally bored with it around day 3 after purchase. Now, no one hardly ever uses it. I'll probably end up giving it to someone else, it's about useless to us. It still can't beat googling on your PC. By the way, not 15 minutes after I posted this comment I got 2 back to back calls from Amazon wanting to know why I said this.

reviews.reviewTitle: Best echo device so far. Clock is a great feature
reviews.reviewText: Excellent new echo device. It’s perfect for a night table and the clock has an automatic dimmer when the light is turned out. Set up was a breeze as I already have the app and several devices in two houses. You just get a notice of a new device and accept and it almost sets up itself. Sound is much improved over the earlier version as well. Even my wife who hates gadgets likes the way it looks and the ability to get the weather for the day before even getting out of bed. Highly recommended.

First Echo device and we are pleased. Wish we had got 2 now. It's fun to watch our 8 yr old "quiz" Alexa and you can actually get a lot of information in return. Quick weather to start your day, timers, alarms, lists, reminders, trivia, the list is endless. Have fun with it and even let it help you out with reminders/alarms.

I know everyone is harping on "privacy" but really every company you come into contact with is gathering your information both online and in person. They have been for years without your knowledge. If you are concerned then you can turn it off under your device settings and privacy. Read and research on privacy concerns then take it into your own hands, but regardless companies are going to collect data whether you want them to or not. Sorry.

The Echo Dot is really 5 stars. But I subtract 2 stars for Amazon having replaced (as compared to earlier versions) the micro USB power input. I don't get it. Now we are stuck with another proprietary power brick. Really?

Otherwise I love the DOT. But I don't really perceive any improvement to the older versions. Sound might be improved but I keep running the little DOT with bluetooth or 3.5mm connections to more enjoyable speakers anyhow. Of course, I also have 2 Echo Spot, an old and a new version Echo show, 4 old Dots and two Amazon Fire tablets. There is a niche for all of them!

reviews.reviewTitle: Uses one of the worst apps known to man!
reviews.reviewText:
Seriously, what were they thinking when they made the app for this? Connecting it to a Fire TV basically involved hours of frustration and it still doesn't work! Yes, I've updated everything, made sure they use the same account, quadruple check the internet connections of all devices, installed the needed skills, and made sure all the information was correct. It still won't do the thing it's advertised to do: control my fire stick.

So now this thing is basically a fancy speaker with a few nifty voice commands I'll probably never use. There's a reason this thing is so cheap. Save your money and go with the Google Home hub or something similar.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good Voice Command Features, Not So Great Speaker
reviews.reviewText:
The Echo Dot is nice for voice commands, but the speaker is not that great. It lacks adequate bass, and doesn't get that lous overall. I like that it has an aux line out where you can connect another better speaker to it.

It's really cool that you can just say for example: "Alexa: play jazz music" and the Echo Dot will shuffle different jazz songs from the Amazon Music store. I bought this for $25, so I think it is worth that much for the voice commands, and access to tons of free music. You can automatically play any songs in your Amazon library. It has lots of other features that I haven't checked out yet. It's nice to check on the weather and movie times, etc. You can adjust the volume remotely or say "next song". Again, good for cool wireless and voice command features. Not so great for sound quality. I ended up buying a separate Bluetooth speaker, and just connected the Echo Dot to it for better sound.

reviews.reviewTitle: Better audio output, poor voice recognition
reviews.reviewText: I use this mainly for music, news briefs, and weather reports in the bathroom. The audio quality and Max volume are definitely and upgrade over the 2nd gen Echo it replaced. The downside is that it doesn't hear me as well and I have to shout at it and repeat myself frequently, which was not the case with the old one - the second gen would hear me sometimes when I was two rooms away speaking to another device. And just today it crashed and stopped responding entirely while playing music, requiring a hard reboot.

reviews.reviewTitle: Think you can't get any lazier? Guess again!
reviews.reviewText: My mother in law bought one, we played with her Echo dot & we decided to get one. Then we bought the smart plugs & smart bulbs. If you thought the clap on/clap off's were amazing, be prepared to be blown out of the water. The echo dot 3rd gen has a much louder speaker than 2nd (we bought both). With the smart plugs, you can rename each plug for what is plugged into it suchas "garage fan", "Bedroom light", "bedroom lamp", "hallway lights" etc. Ive heard some people complain thinking the FBI is listening in, but 90% of the time I'm yelling at Alexa to play some Dierks Bentley, Eric Church or Baby Shark...

Very good its way more updated than my older Echo 2nd gen tower. My son noticed this NEW dot plays music that the other Echo doesn't play. Newer dot versions Know about current events and celeberties. (Tower 2nd gen. doesn't)We bought 5 Echos dots updated 1 with $5 off trade in special. They are way smarter than older versions. . But this Echo dot is great! Smart and speaker is good. Worth it to get this one verses older models. I'm happy we bought them. I can drop in on each kid and they can call me when im gone. Set alarms reminders. Tells jokes reminds my kids to do their homework. I'm happy. We got them all over the house.

I absolutely love my new Alexa echo dot!. I like the design and the color variations. This is my third one, but first one to myself, the other two were gifts to my mother and mother-in-law. I have an order Echo that I'm letting my daughter's use in their room, so this will be replacing the one in the living room. Super happy with it!! And I also love that you can buy separate stands so that the cords aren't everywhere and you can put it flush on a wall. The picture I attached is my echo in the wall mount. Bought separately.

There are major software glitches every single day: from repeated volume control reduction to the lowest setting (without command) to music playback suddenly stopping or skipping songs in the middle of them, the subwoofer cutting out and/or one or two random speakers dropping off the “multi-room” playback function. There are so many bugs, I’ve had nothing but trouble with this system. I purchased the echo stereo sub combo AND 2 extra echo dots for whole house sound system (that’s 4 speakers and a sub). I don’t know if I’m asking the system to perform functions that are maxing out its capabilities but I am using the system in the manner that amazon advertised it to function, so I expect it to be able to perform as advertised. I have only owned my system for 4 months and Its been awful. I spent over 350$ and the system works about 50% of the time. I would NOT recommend to anyone.
I’m fact, I’d love a refund if possible.

reviews.reviewTitle: Needs Global option for Alarms, Reminders and Timers
reviews.reviewText:
I purchased two Echo Dots and they were easy to set up and start using. However, it needs a global option for alarms, timers and reminders. When I set an alarm, timer or reminder, I would like to have both echos ring without having to set the request on one echo and then walk to the other one to also set it.

I spoke with customer service and was told that I could set the request on both echos by specifying their names. However, I tried that and it didn't work. I am old, I live alone, my house is large and my memory is bad. I am hoping that the echo will help me remember what I am supposed to be doing.

If it had the global option, I would have given it 5 stars.

Not impressed. I have a 2nd gen dot as well. The speaker on that isnt bad. This one is plain awful. I don't know if I just got a bad one or not, but you can't listen to any music on it like I could with the old one. The static is just insane. Really really bad. It also took me over an hour to set up unlike the couple of minutes the old one took.

I’m still learning because I’m an Apple product kinda gal (former MS consultant that caved after young sons’ school many years ago went 100% Apple) but we are readers and have always have Amazon Prime and products such as kindles fire sticks and audible so I caved and got 2 echos and 2 smart bulbs and although much more to learn and to put time in to make it truly useful, the fact that I can tell alexa to turn off lights, makes this gal that grew up in the 80s wanting the clap on clap off gadget very 😎

I purchased the new Echo Dot with clock to replace my much older and failing bedroom alarm clock. After a week’s worth of use, I can already say with confidence it was worth every penny. The ability to adjust the brightness, set multiple alarms in the matter of seconds (and visually see them appear for confirmation), and Alexa’s whisper function are my favorite features so far beyond a typical Echo Dot. Any reservation I had of switching from an old school alarm clock to the newest technology is gone. It has exceeded my expectations. - 43 year old mom

I've had my Echo for a month now and it's just sitting there b/c Echos won't connect to wireless networks unless you broadcast your SSID. I spent two hours talking to Amazon "support". The first hour was me trying having to constantly re-explain the problem b/c the "tech" didn't understand. The second hour was me waiting while he opened a support ticket. The next morning Amazon support calls me at 5am with automated calls. Finally I get an email saying they are aware of the problem and working on it. Still waiting to use my Echo...

Love love love this. I have an Amazon Echo and love it - got this for my mum who has early stage dementia and is in a care facility. I thought she would enjoy being able to play music “Alexa play the Beatles, Josh groban, The Beach Boys” or check the date, weather, news... or hear a joke, or whatever, without having to touch a button. Well does she ever. The best surprise was when i used the drop in function from the app and was able to speak with her while she was in bed, hands free, no phone, no cord, no buttons - it’s fantastic and it sounds great. Nurses love coming to help her so they too can talk with Alexa. Brilliant little device for a tiny amount of money. (Great sale, tyvm Amazon.)

reviews.reviewTitle: If you have kids, you NEED this!
reviews.reviewText: Oh my gosh, I adore these things! I have two currently, one upstairs and downstairs. It is amazing for calling my kids downstairs, dropping in to hear what's going on. My kids now know they can say 'Alexa call 911' in the event of an emergency and will connect through my contacts. All off the added features are so cool! The bedtime story is my favorite by far, as I have it mounted to my hallway wall and it reads to my kids before bed! The trivia and games are so much fun! I could just go on and on about the endless features and am amazed with new discoveries daily. LOVE THIS!

I love my Alexa (Echo Dot). Whenever I feel the need to google something I just have to ask Alexa. I don't even do math anymore, Alexa is my math wiz. I use it most often for listening to music, and that's the one thing it still lacks on - sound quality. It doesn't really go that high in volume and the quality of the sound isn't that great. It's not bad, but I have cheaper wireless speakers that are louder and have better sound. I still love it though because I can just tell it to play the songs I want.

reviews.reviewTitle: Extra Easy Set-up and Better Speaker
reviews.reviewText:
This version of the Echo Dot has a couple of improvements over the 2nd generation. When adding to a group of Echo Dots, the set-up is much easier. Instead of going into the Alexa app and adding networks and completing multiple steps, all you have to do is plug it in. The lights flash for a few minutes, and then it is ready. Wow! It also has a better speaker than Gen 2. Gen 3 without an external speaker is not quite as good as Gen 2 with external speakers, but it is close. Pretty impressive for its size. It is only slightly larger than the Gen 2.

I'm not sure where Motion Detection comes from in the rating list. It has no motion detection at all. I didn't expect it to have it, the box doesn't mention it, and both waving my hands near it and shaking it has no effect. I simply didn't rate it for that feature.

Wow is she fun! Great sound quality, fills the house. My husband is having a blast with her, he asks her to do funny things like cluck like a chicken or bark like a dog. He also says good morning to her and she gives him the trivia of the day. Today was national underwear day! She came with a plug during Amazon Prime Days, we have our night lamp plugged into it and Alexa turns the lamp on and off for us. She is just way to much fun and has an extensive selection of music. We also have Sirius which she recognises.

Alexa is a saucy chica. I got one because it was so low priced. Whether or not it was worth the time invested, I am not sure. I have a fire TV stick that doesn't seem to work with this echo Dot. If it's supposed to, then they've made it more than a little difficult to pair and make work together. The drop-in feature is either creepy or just hilarious. Trying to send a message when you've enabled text communications and suddenly you have no control over whether or not Alexa sends an actual SMS text message or simply a message that is waiting on the other users Echo Dot. For $30 you could do a lot worse.

reviews.reviewTitle: One step forward 3 giant steps back
reviews.reviewText:
The music quality of the echo dot 3rd generation is a huge improvement over the 2nd generation, but the redesign is buggy and consistently crashes. (We use ours a lot for timers and on occasion a timer will got off and not stop even after repeat commands until the plug is pulled) worse the reason why we chose to upgrade our devices was the lackluster ability for it to hear us. Our hope was this new generation would be an improvement but was a significant disappointment as it regularly does not hear or understand us.

Updated 6.22.19- roughly a week after our review went live Amazon called to address the issue. After a reboot and reset I can say our echo dot still does not work correctly

This is the first echo dot I have gotten. The sound is an improvement over my Echo that I got a couple of years ago. I enjoy it so far. The only problem I had was with the setup. I couldn't get it to set up on my fire tablet with the Alexa app. It couldn't find my echo dot and the page kept saying, "looking for device". I tried to do it manually through the tablet and that didn't work either. In desperation I downloaded the Alexa app to my Iphone. That worked beautifully. It found the dot quickly and the setup was easy after that!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great sound. Easy to get addicted to.
reviews.reviewText: I can find out the time and weather before I get out of bed! Alexa recognizes deep voices much better than higher voices, so if you are having problems with that, drop your voice. Good with easy trivia (when did soandso die); but no substitute for internet searches (" Umm, I don't know that one." ). Love listening to music. Have this one and a 2nd generation one - the music quality is much better with the 3rd generation. I also enjoy asking her to tell me a story when I go to bed - helps me get to sleep faster. Wish she had more stories (getting repeats).

Considering everything you get for the price this an extremely high value devise, especially on sale. This 3rd gen Dot is attractive, conveniently sized, and has decent sound. I have my Dots wired into better sounding systems anyways, yet the Dot has surprisingly good sound consideing it’s size. Build quality also seems excellent. I expect my Dots to last a long time. I purchased Dots others too and as far as I know everybody’s pretty happy. My favorite uses are for radio stations such as NPR with crystal clear reception with no need for antenna and multi-room audio do I can rock the house down.

Very difficult setup procedure. I plug it in, get the spinning light ring and then the voice says "Hello. Your device is ready for setup. Just follow the instructions in your Alexa app." EXCEPT THERE AREN'T ANY INSTRUCTIONS. I have the latest version of the Alexa app on my Android 8 phone. No instructions come up regarding the DOT. I find the DOT in my devices, and it says offline. Ok. So I try to connect it to my WiFi network. I can enter the CORRECT password until I'm blue in the face and it won't accept it. Unable to connect. FAIL.

We have the original Echo Dot that we bought a few years ago - it still works great, but if you want to listen to music or anything it did not have the greatest sound quality and was not super loud. I picked up the 3rd gen on prime day at a great price, and I am glad I did. This is slightly larger than the original (due to more speaker) and the sound quality is excellent for a Dot - and it gets much louder than the original. I also think that voice recognition is much better too on this one. I am glad we picked this up.

I got this as part of a special deal. I have plenty of Echo Dots, a full-size Echo and one of those useless Echo Auto devices, but when I unpacked the Echo Dot 3rd Gen, my very first instinct was to ask "Alexa, what year is it?" Whereas all the other Echo Dots have a USB plug, this one uses a specific (if not proprietary) adapter/power supply. I think it's a horrible step backwards. Otherwise, I assume it's just like all the other Dots, which I recommend as far as functionality goes.

I got two Echo Dots for our house, one for me and my boyfriend, and one for his mother, who lives downstairs. The drop-in feature has already been useful, rather than us having to shout back and forth or go downstairs just to figure out what was being said. Aside from that, I connected my Amazon music account to both of them, and the unlimited possibilities for music has been a great joy on both ends of the house. Sometimes random questions need an answer, and just asking Alexa has been quicker than pulling out our phones to Google it. Every now and then we'll even play one of the little games Alexa offers and have fun doing that in our downtime. My daughter also adores having it around, because she now has her silly Spongebob music on demand whenever she isn't watching it on TV. We've even been looking into small smart house conversions to connect to it. All in all, for the first smart speakers any of us have had, they've been fantastic, and I do recommend buying one.

I bought this because my guest bathroom sits uncomfortably close to the kitchen table, where we do most of our entertaining. Sometimes, the food we serve can be a bit spicy. Quests and homeowners alike were nervous going to the bathroom, out of fear that a fart would sneak out, or the inevitable “bloop” of a turd dropping would echo throughout the kitchen.
With this fine Alexa device, we can all pee and poo in comfort. While listening to any music of our choice. A great investment!

reviews.reviewTitle: Confusing to set up a routine with an alarm
reviews.reviewText:
The only issue I have with device, aside from its slightly jacked up price, is that setting up a routine with an alarm is more confusing than it needs to be. You first create an alarm in the app, then you create a routine that is triggered when you dismiss any alarm within a given time period. Not exactly intuitive.

Compare that with Google's approach, where you create an alarm and assign a routine directly to that alarm.

Other than that, this Echo Dot has a permanent spot on my nightstand.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great item but doesnt work with half the stuff amazon claims it does.
reviews.reviewText:
So i purchased this on prime day along with cameras xt2 blink and some philps hue lightbulbs the light bulbs where even sold together as a package and guess what. Neither worked well with alexa and the echoe. The xt2 blink cameras I could connect but then lost control on my blink app so couldnt arm disarm my system or view the cameras
The philps hue lights wouldnt connect without a bridge. So got stuck with two falsely advertised products. The only postive was the blink cameras and system work perfectly without alexa

Started out with Google Home but had too many connection issues so got me one these to try out. All it took was unboxing and holding it to realize how much better the quality was than my Google Home Mini. Alexa is far more capable than Google Assistant, and works so much better. I can literally tell Alexa to start my car. Speaker is better than even the big Google Home speaker and a lot louder. Love the Drop in feature and the ability to arm my home so it listens for breaking glass or smoke alarms.

reviews.reviewTitle: A Tale About My Smart Home
reviews.reviewText: Well, I now have Echoes in every room except the bathroom (that's next). And they have networked throughout the house so I can turn on or off the lights in a particular room without actually being in that room. Since I rely on Amazon for all manner of things especially purchases, it just made sense to choose Echo. I can order things I frequently purchase as well as previous one-time buys so easily with Alexa. No regrets. The other day, I misplaced my phone, and no matter where I am in the house I can say "Alexa, find my phone." BaBam! Just like that I found it! It's official. My house is now smarter than I.

Wonderful device. The voice recognition is better than anything else I’ve used and it works great with our Hue lights and Ring doorbell. Alexa “Guard” is a great feature. There are so many great features and the weekly emails with new features and suggestions is a nice touch.

I think everyone should own one of these.

The dot is the smallest and cheapest and therefore the sound quality isn’t the best for bigger rooms, but they are perfect for bedrooms and smaller rooms.

Sound quality not as good as on the 2nd generation. Amazon really needs to add a digital equalizer. Very muddy, muffled sound. I have this and a Google Home Mini side by side. The difference is substantial. While the GHM doesn't have the bass that the dot has, it sounds very loud and clear. My official opinon, owning many smart speakers, is to avoid the smaller, cheaper ones, and get the regular editions. Yes, they cost more, but you get what you pay for. Both competing companies make great smart speakers, but spend a little more and get a lot more sound.

I have 2 Echo Dots, one set up in my bedroom and the other in my bathroom. The set up is easy and pretty straightfoward. Sound output is fantastic. There are a few minor issues: 1) Streaming of radio stations or podcasts can easily drop and you need to tell Alexa to restream, 2) no built in back up power (if power goes out, the Dots are useless). Also, the Alexa app is somewhat not quite intuitive and like most of Amazon interfacing software, its somewhat "clunky" and needs a bit of searching.

I was so excited to get my 3rd Echo Dot, my first 3rd Gen after buying a few third gens for my aunt and grandmother and seeing the difference, the only this is the sound quality is totally different! It's all bass! I live in an old apartment where it's easy to hear your neighbors and now I constantly have to worry about my volume. I then went in and turned the bass down as low as it could go and turned up the treble... But I can still barely hear song lyrics over the loud bass and constantly worry about being too loud...

I've got these all over the apartment now. They sound great when set up in Stereo pairs for music. I can tell they don't match the clarity of my old full size speakers, but they take up far less space and don't need wires running all over the place. I tried the Google mini, and the Dots are much better for music.

I have a couple of smart plugs for fans and a couple of smart bulbs. I know Alexa has all sorts of other features that I never use, but I love just being able to tell her to turn on and off my lights, fans and play music.

this is Alexas most frequent response. She knows nothing. Not who discovered America, the date of Bull Run, when the first model T rolled off the Ford line. She does however, know and to her credit, how to say "Hmm. I don't know that" in a lovely faux-British accent that many New Yorker's adopt when they place reservations at 5-star restaurants (which of course Alexa is clueless at to who they are).
Mine went back to its maker after 3 days. Her memory will haunt me for years--and not in a good way.

reviews.reviewTitle: BUY THE WARRANTY FOREVER OR DON’T WASTE YOUR MONEY BUYING.
reviews.reviewText: As an update they have replaced the defective device. Customer service did a great job of follow through. Purchased Dec 18, as of 22 Jun it just stopped. Warranty 90 days, Customer service says can’t help. Did offer some trade value, but this one only worked 6 months so not so sure if I will waste money on another. Poor engineering Only way to access bios/hardware/software is via WiFi which cannot be accessed unless it connects first. Did software update and it died. Dumb design, a USB port would give access but, of course, there is none.

I'm impressed. Alexa recognizes multiple voices even with background noise. If found this to be the perfect answer for turning devices on/off. Way better then opening wink on my phone. Its also faster. The wink app can take noticeable time before turning a device on. Alexa is almost instantaneous for the same device.
4 stars because my special needs son can't say "Alexa" correctly enough. I have no problem understanding that he's saying the word correctly. There is no way to train for just that command word. I also don't see a way to set schedules for devices through the Alexa android application.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very good, room to grow - which is a plus
reviews.reviewText: I received a dot with a robot vacuum, and love it. I ordered 3 more dots, and one plus as christmas gifts - all in the same home. The random groups are great, as I have labeled things like Upstairs, Downstairs, everywhere, Kids rooms, master beadroom, etc. You can place a device in multiple groups, and control music, volume, drop in, etc. There is a lot of potential in this device, and for the most part it is great. At high volume levels Alexa doesn't always hear you, and sometimes software updates break 3rd party compatibility. All native functions seem to work really well though. Alexa - beam me up!

reviews.reviewTitle: I don’t know why I waited so long to get these?
reviews.reviewText:
I wish I hadn’t waited so long to get echos for my children’s bedrooms. It has made our lives so much easier. They set all their own alarms. They love listening to music. And they ask Alexa all kinds of fun and interesting questions. My oldest loves to fall asleep to sleep sounds. And my youngest loves learning about the weather.
I don’t know if there are echoes with this feature but I think it would be great if they were able to have mood lighting. It would be utilized as a night light.

The sound quality is so much better on this 3rd generation. I use mine multiple times during the day for music as well as everyday information. Combining units is as good as, if not better, than whole house audio, As with 2nd gens, you can use with smart plugs, ring doorbell etc. Impressive! I only rated 4 stars due to the fact at this time I am experiencing small problem with one of the two dots I purchased. Seems like it dies in the night and has a solid blue ring but does nothing until I unplug it, wait a few seconds and plug in again. Working with tech to resolve issue. % stars if runs like the others.

Taller and fatter than original dot. And what?! No USB!!! Wasn't expecting that! 15 watt brick with single purpose, hard-wired, dedicated output connector. Bigger speaker may give a bit more volume but sound seems a bit muffled. Maybe more bass but less treble. Please don't stop producing gen2! Surprisingly the new fat unit with its fat brick draws slightly less current on standby than the gen 2 with USB but a bit more current when active. But it stays noticeably warmer than the older version. Will stick with gen 2 as long as it is available. If I need richer sound I can connect with BT speaker(s).

I have been using google home and my mom bought me an insignia Fire TV. So I decided to get an Eco Dot. I ordered it and set it up. It is difficult to operate. I have heard I don't know, not sure how to answer that and answers to questions I didn't ask. I have to program the skills and when I play games halfway through it, it starts from the beginning again. I can't adjust or change my alarm sounds other than the few in the list and they are not very good. The alarm is so soft even on 10 volume. There are so many other things I could say about how difficult to work Alexa. The rest of my house is all google and if I didn't already give my google mini to my Daughter I would go back. It took an online customer service person to help me set up the TV because Alexa could not find it. I'm also tired of Alexa telling me I have to set it up in the Alexa app. I'm going to use the dot just to have hands free TV control so really all is a fancy remote. I will probably buy myself a new Google Home hub!

reviews.reviewTitle: Loved the sound and variety of app integration
reviews.reviewText: No doubt, alexa is still leader in voice assistance. Enormous app integration.I have 3 google mini and 2 echo dot in home with dot being the latest addition and I am loving it. Google home is good in whatever they have integration with but still many apps are not supported by them. Echo devices deserve that extra thumb for it.

Our household is officially hooked. The Echo Dot was the first to join us two weeks ago. Since then, we have added an Echo for our living room and a second Echo Dot underneath the Christmas tree for our boys to keep in their bedroom.

This thing has so much to offer. Some of our favorite features are:

- The “add to my shopping/to do list”. This is great for those things that cross your mind and you totally forget if you don’t write them down. Having those commands allows us to make a note without having to stop what we are doing.

-Unlimited Amazon Music. Totally worth a few extra bucks to be able to stream our music on up to six devices at a time. I can listen to my stuff while working in the kitchen and the kids can listen to theirs upstairs without interrupting one another.

- The Drop-In feature. This is great because my husband or I can drop in at home from our cellphones and talk to our kids through the echo when one of us isn’t home. We can also send each other messages through voice command, which is simple enough that our elementary aged kids can do.

I could go on and on. Take the plunge, get the product, worth every single penny!

I’ve been using this echo dot dice the beginning of December. It had been great originally when I first got it. For some reason nowadays Alexa doesn’t hear me call her or when she does turn on, she will just beep and turn off. I tried an air blaster to clean it and everything but it either doesn’t hear me or just do what I want it to when it does. It has been happening for about a month and it isn’t every time. It was very clear and responsive when I first got it. It still works but it has become a hassle and some what annoying. I expected better from an amazon product.

Lo compré en un día de rebajas. Si llego a saber lo contento que estaría con él, hubiese comprado otro para la habitación.
La calidad de audio con música es bastante decente para el tamaño que tiene.
También puede ser utilizado como el típico altavoz bluetooth.

Creo que con el tiempo este tipo de dispositivos se harán super populares en todos los hogares.

The new version is a big step up in audio quality from the previous version. Plus, the fabric does make it look nicer. I don't know how much of this is just due to my setup, but I have this echo on a table near me in my living room (< 3ft to my 4 o'clock position -back right- from where I sit) but the Echo Input that's maybe 30 ft away (in my 8 o'clock position -- almost fully 'left') in my kitchen will hear me and respond. I wish timers weren't device-specific! Because when one of them heard me set the timer but another one hears me cancel it when it's going off, it's a little frustrating.

reviews.reviewTitle: Sound System Fails after appx 2 months of use
reviews.reviewText: I received the 3rd Gen Echo Dot for Christmas 2018. As of March 2019, I can no longer use it because the sound comes through as basically loud white noise. The music comes out completely muffled. I am very disappointed in this product. I can't figure out how to complain directly to Amazon to possibly get an exchanged, WORKING echo dot. I am a big supporter of Amazon products until now. Not happy.

UPDATE:
Added two stars because I decided to CALL Amazon Customer Service. After talking to a live person, doing the same tests with them that the representative on the instant chat told me to do, they decided to send a replacement. So far no issues with the replacement. Still leaving off two stars for the horrible customer service experience with the instant chat.

Original Review:
Have to give 1 star because it worked for about two weeks. Then one day, my WiFi went out. My internet provider fixed the WiFi, and now the device won’t reconnect to my network. I have tried everything - unplugging it, hard reset, forgetting my network, deregistering it from my account, and talking to customer service. I’m actually writing this review as I am waiting for the customer service rep to respond to my “instant” chat message (it’s been over 10 minutes now). Customer service has been about as useless as this device is without WiFi.

I have had both Echo Dot (3rd Gen) and Echo Dot (2nd Gen) for awhile now, Both do the job for basic voice control and things of that nature. The 3rd Gen Echo does have more base overall, but for my needs the extra base does not really add much to the experience. If your buying your first (or adding one to a different room) Echo Dot then I can recommend getting the 3rd Gen, But if your just wanting to upgrade a 2nd Gen for a 3rd Gen I would suggest either not doing it (unless you listen to a lot of music), or plugging in your 2nd Gen Dot to a set of speakers.

reviews.reviewTitle: Best device i have purchased for 30 bucks.
reviews.reviewText:
I'm a tech savvy person so i decided to buy a digital assistant and decided to go with Alexa! Glad i did, for 30 dollars you get tons of features and if you have Amazon prime it's even 10x better. Before i made the move on buying one i really didn't really try one, so i went in blind and it was good enough for me to buy 2 of them :) i bought them from bestbuy since if oyu buy 2 you get 10 dollars off.

The audio is Loud and clear (remember this is 30 dollars) plays anything I throw at it, I have a slight accent and didn't have to train Alexa she understands everything I say even when I'm half asleep. You can ask Alexa pretty much anything and she will have an answer. People say Google assistant is smarter but to me Alexa with Amazon Prime is the perfect choice.

This little echo dot is cool. Surprisingly enough, the sound quality is pretty good for a speaker this size. All the reviews that say "it lacks bass", duh, it's got bass but it was never meant to try and compete with other blue tooth speakers designed only for music. If was, the dot would be a lot more than 50.00. I love mine and am going to get a second one.

reviews.reviewTitle: Got it for the exteranl Audio Output
reviews.reviewText:
I was thinking about getting the Alexa device that you use your own speakers. Then I read one of the reviews and the person said that was a waist of money and I should get the dot because it has the external audio output. I have several amazon echos however this is my first dot. The 3rd generation has a lot of bang for $40.

I hooked this think to my stereo with a male 1/8 to male RCA adapter. Now I can listen to my amazon music as loud as I want. Amazon listened to people with that external audio output. I think that was a wise decision.

I am really enjoying the Echo Dot, so much so that after having one in my livingroom for a couple of days I ordered a couple more for my bedroom and my daughter's room. I have also started purchasing smart home devices such as smart plugs and lighting, and they all work perfectly with Alexa. I will say that once you start turning your home into a smart home it can get kind of addicting pretty quick, there is just so much that Alexa can do and so many devices she can work with. My bedroom lights, my Christmas tree and my outside Christmas lights are all controlled via Alexa, and I am just getting started.

reviews.reviewTitle: I Love This Product, Other Than the Sound Going Up and Down
reviews.reviewText: I love this echo dot, but the speaker is sometimes fuzzy (I don't listen to it loudly), and the sound goes up and down, like commercials do on a TV. It's very annoying, and the voice recognition feature should also be a little more reliable (things like Alexa volume up, Alexa volume down, etc). I also feel like I'm screaming at it for it to recognize my voice. It seems to recognize male voices better, perhaps due to the deeper voice? I don't have an accent, so that isn't the issue, I just wish that it worked a bit better.

I got this Alexa Dot for my parents and they loooove it! I showed them how to use it and explained that it would be linked to my account. LoL...well, every time there are notifications I get a call from my mother to "fix" the Alexa because the light on it makes her nervous! Hahaha!!! So yeah!!! Love it anyway!! Oh and I love that we could set theirs up to Spanish! When I asked Alexa to sing a song in Spanish they were floored...she was singing songs from when they were children!! It's these little things that make it extra special!

Amazon literally improved everything, right down to the plug! It sounds so much better than the 2nd Gen did, and even better then the Google home mini. This actually has some low end to the sound. It also looks a lot better, the fabric cover helps it blend into any decor and look much more premium. The plug is also better designed so it more flush with outlet and not sticking out like before. Only downside with the plug is that it can't be powered via USB, since it now uses a proprietary plug. Definitely recommend this over the old one, especially with this being only slightly more expensive at the moment.

This was my first entry into voice activated house help (previously used only Ok, Google...." for directions in the car.) I read the reviews and had to order one. After hooking it up in the bedroom, I could see just how useful these can be. I intended to use it to turn on the radio in the morning and to control a couple lamps in the house but after a couple days, I ordered two more. I live in a three-floor house and hate running up and down the stairs when Alexa could help. It's like having a very, very polite and helpful maid. This would also be useful for folks who have a hard time getting around their house.

reviews.reviewTitle: THAT'S what I was hoping for!
reviews.reviewText: I can babble on and on about Alexa and what it can do, but this review is specifically for the person who has a generation 2 and is thinking of upgrading to the Gen 3. It's ALL ABOUT THE SOUND. I have Gen 2 devices, and they work wonderfully, but each of them is attached to some form (either by 1/8 inch plug or by bluetooth) to a Speaker because the built in speaker on the Gen 2? Let's be honest, it's a bit disappointing when compared to the actual Alexa unit. But this Gen 3 is DEAD on fabulous sound-wise. It's the Echo size and the Alexa sound combined together. The kids now have Gen 2's in their rooms. The living room and my room have Gen 3 and no longer require external speaker support. And the play music Everywhere running on multiple Gen 3 units? Ooh, baby! Rig up a few iView bulbs set to the ENT scene...and you got yourself a disco!

Add a little fabric and a curve to the top and you have the 3rd gen Dot! it looks great, as I have it sitting on my end table, the sound is a little better, it is good for the everyday things you use your Dot for, skills, smart home, keeping shopping list, and weather updates but I still prefer to use a Bluetooth speaker system when listening to music.( I like it loud).
I took advantage of the trade-in feature on my 2nd generation Dot, it was a smooth transaction and saved me a few dollars, and I didn't need to have another electronic sitting in a closet after only using it for a year!

This my office assistant, reminds me of meetings, important dates and always good for a little history lesson when asked "what happened today in history"

Pros.
Great sound and great voice recognition

Con.
Sometimes just says " I can't play that song right now" when it wasn't asked to.

I have 4 Echo Dots and they have been nothing but trouble. Not only is there static, but they often miss commands.
When playing a group, there's issues every single day.
I honestly would avoid these devices.

They seem to have a mind of their own when it comes to streaming music-I have Amazon Music and am about ready to cancel it.

Customer service tells me to power cycle and factory reset, shut down WiFi ect.
This is ANNOYING because it has become a weekly process.

I got this 3rs generation echo dot yesterday, , I have 3 echo dot 2nd generation so I have experience with the setup . and was already to use the Alexa app to setup this new one but to my surprise I plugged it in and it set it self up on my Wi fi Network, and was all set to go , it found my Hue setup and functioned as it should with the lights, like the sound seems it has a better base sound than my 2nd generation dots, the 3rd gen is a little bigger then the 2nd gen all in all I like it.

I have a samsung smart TV and have tried everything to get it to do what I tell it to. It wont even turn off or on but it says it is connected. My neighbor is very tech savvy and he couldn't figure it out either. So for now all I am able to use is Pandora or asking the weather or some stupid question. I also.have an echo One but turned it off so it would not interfere. Echo One was only good for Pandora too. I am handicapped so really would like to have it work and control the TV. For now the remote is the only thing I have.

We have 4 echoes in the plastic shells about the house. I love them. This an awesome upgrade from the gen2. Cute as heck and they added Bass...Bump.. for a tiny little thing that she is she stands pretty proud in a room with sound at lower volumes. She lost the "tinny" sound of the plastic cocoon she was tapped in with a rim of outlets around the top to produce sound. The sound now radiates from the sides. If your already a Alexa owner the setup process is as easy as plugging it in. It finds your internet and sets itself up with no need to use the Alexa App. This is a very nice upgrade from the Gen2. I'd buy another one.

I have really grown to like our Alexa, we have two. It works great and is helpful with the added things you can teach her to do. I have smart plugs that are tied with Alexa as well as my thermostat. It is so helpful to be in some other place and have her turn lights on and off. I have really used the grocery list. Great way to remind myself what I need at the store as I run out of items in the house. The integration factor with so many "smart" things is a timesaver as well as making our house "smart". Purchase one, it is worth it.

This is primarily used for music. It does sound better than the 2nd generation but it’s still just OK as far as sound quality is concerned. I have it connected to a Sonos Play One which sounds very good. The bad thing is that you still can’t include Sonos speakers in groups created in the Alexa app. Another thing is that sometimes Amazon music will only play one song at a time when I request a station or playlist.

Works well on command. Couldn't get the bluetooth set up with many tries. Turns out needed to restart paring part of app. Then worked. The sound is ok for its size but the balance is strongly bass. I got this cheapest and smallest to just try the whole concept out. I like classical but the command line fails if the command is too long. So naming a piece like the Brahms clarinet quintet barely works and if you add a solo artist it fails.

reviews.reviewTitle: Pairing sucks very few products supported.
reviews.reviewText: I find that this product is a lot harder to pair with your home devices. Google mini Will pair within seconds with the Alexa device you have to jump through a whole bunch of hoops it's kind of ridiculous. UPDATE Amazon contacted me and put me in touch with support to help pair. Alexa is NOT compatible with LG tv's, Vizio Soundbars, and several other popular products. Google Home Supports all these devices and more and connects in seconds. I don't know why this product is so popular unless it's just popular with people who don't want there house connected to the device. I regret this purchase.

Love this little Dot! I received an Echo Show for Christmas and just love it. I was able to access my many Spotify playlists, and also started a few Amazon Music ones. (If you have Prime, you also get to use Amazon Music.). I thought it would be great to have Alexa upstairs as well, and the Dots went on sale for $29, making it a win-win! I also paired it with a Bluetooth speaker so I can listen to music in the upstairs bathroom while getting ready in the mornings. The Dot is nice and small but has a great sound for the bedroom I have it in. Would recommend to anyone!

reviews.reviewTitle: i think this thing is watching me.
reviews.reviewText:
I will have the PC off, and have conversations with my wife. she tells me that she want me to find a product to get her.
so i say ok, i turn on the PC and go to amazon. and its like her product is on the front page... its scary... last night i heard it say.. yeah i can hear you fool... dont worry soon we will take over your house. I woke up and the lil light ring was blinking on and off. so i said hey seri do you have notifications. and alexa replied I will Stab you if you say her name a gain..... im now hiding in the room....

reviews.reviewTitle: Love echos not sure about lights
reviews.reviewText:
Love love love my Echos 3rd generations. Music sounds great. So easy to set up. I had both done in a matter of minutes.
Problem: I bought the one with the light bulbs addition. Instructions are not as easy & I have yet to figure out how to set up & if I needed to buy the pug in sockets or if the bulbs were all I needed! Instructions were not clear. Also not sure which other APP I am to download for the lights!!! Would not have bought had I known this would have saved money & just bought 2 echos.
I’m sure I will get it figured out & love it thouh!

It takes me a long time to fall asleep, and I often think of things I need to do or alarms I need to set. I hate turning my phone back on to type this stuff up as then it "resets" the amount of time till I fall asleep. Now, I keep my Alexa on my bedside table and as soon as I have a thought that requires remembering, I can just ask her to do so!

The voice quality is terrific, and she has great hearing. My best friends name is also Alexa, so it can be a pain when trying to talk about her, so I have to refer to her as "Texas" (her home state), if I'm talking about her in my room.

Overall great product! Thanks Amazon!

I only wanted it for one reason. That whenever I come home and want to relax I can just give it an command by voice to play my music. It seem there no way for it to create my own personal music play list. I can not upload or add music that I already have safe on my phone or computer to make the play list. I have to use crappy 3rd party music apps or spend more money to buy songs I already have if I wanted to make my own music play list.

update after 3 whole days since my first review of this because it has since an high star review rate I wanted to give it an chance and keep using it. Honestly I only bought it because it was on sale for 29.99 instead of the normal 50dollars and I have to say this is one of the worst 30dollars I have ever spend and I have spend my money recklessly a lot during my life. If you try to give it two commands in one sentence it will completely ignore you and not reply back at all. For example " Alexa I do not like this song stop playing this song. " Alexa will just ignore it and keep playing. You need to say " Alexa I do not like this song" than it will add to the list of song. Than after that yu have to say " Alexa stop playing this song" for it to stop playing the song. Another issue I have is that I can not type in the song titles that I want to listen to and have to keep saying the music title and names of the artists. Can not even type in the song title on the Alexa app on my phone that connect to the device.

This Echo is sleek and elegant, however I find that my Gen 2 dot would recognize my voice way easier. I almost have to yell sometimes for this echo to hear me, even if there is no sound in the room. I keep this echo about 10 feet away and it just can’t beat me sometimes??? Also, I bought this echo hoping the sound would be way better for music but honestly it isn’t that much different. Amazon added just a smidge of bass but it really isn’t the greatest. It’s worth the price, just wasn’t what I was expecting.

reviews.reviewTitle: surprisngly good voice recognition, but doesn't work flawlessly with the existing alexa
reviews.reviewText:
Sometimes when I get tired, I mumble heavily. Even then, it catches my command pretty well.

The downside is that it doesn't work flawlessly with my existing alexa. I have one in the kitchen and one in the living room. I let somehting get cooked, and then sit around in the living room. I'll sat a timer in kitchen, but that timer doesn't get transferred over to the living room. Like, when I ask the living room how much time is left on the timber, it doesn't recognize the timer. That's kind of annoying.

Initially I had a heck of a time getting the Android app to find this thing and connect to its built-in Wi-Fi AP to set it up. In fairness, I got sidetracked by something else and I didn't get to trying to set it up until 20 minutes after I plugged it in. I wound up unplugging it and trying again and it seemed to connect that time.

Overall I'm pretty happy so far. It's controlling my Kasa smart outlets by voice as well as my aging (but gracefully) Ecobee 2 thermostat.

Maybe I'll ask Alexa to order me up some more smart plugs tomorrow.

Move over, Jetsons!

This was a unit I did not think to even purchase, but on Black Friday Best Buy had a deal that if you purchased the (1) BLINK unit with WIFI you also received this Echo free. I could not refuse, so I now have one.

I have found it to be very useful for asking questions, any questions. Questions about a person, event, weather, whatever. Also you can play your Amazon, Spotify, or Pandora music at a command. Another feature is that you can arm or disarm the BLINK at a command. Now that I like. For the cost, not a bad thing to have around. FYI Alexa is quite friendly and personal :-)

I love this device! I bought multiple ones to put throughout the house and love them! Why pay thousands of dollars for home sound sound systems when I can have these in each room. They can control my lights, play music, answer questions, and make calls. I seriously couldn’t be happier and think it is one of the best things of our house. I also bought the adapter that allows it to hang from the outlet so it takes up no space and carries the sound into the room. Definitely a great addition as well! Highly recommend both!!!

I'm pretty disappointed with the new 3rd gen product.
First, its a LOT bigger than the 2nd gen, surprisingly so. It looks nice overall, but it is much bigger.
Second, the power option is only a wall outlet plug; you can no longer use a USB as an option to power the device. That stinks because I specifically put a USB wall charger in the room when I was using the 2nd gen (which now randomly has stopped connecting to the internet - but that's a different review), and now the 3rd gen hogs an outlet.
Lastly and perhaps most importantly, the sound really is horrible. Music is 'ok', but if you want to hear news or stream talk radio (or just your morning DJ - really anything with just speaking), the sound comes out muffled. It appears they've up'd the bass on the device, perhaps to enable it to have a louder max volume(?), but they have sacrificed normal speech/treble - horrible choice. I wish there was a way to adjust Tone. Thought I could live with it, now just hate it every time I turn it on, but just missed the return window. Bring back gen 2! Two stars is me being generous in hopes that Amazon can fix this with software... soon.

My Echo and Echo Dot 2nd generation stream Pandora without any difficulty. However, Echo Dot 3rd generation does not. About halfway through a song, the 3rd gen model quit and started a new song. Amazon technical support was not able to fix this, despite putting me through a very long series of steps, resets, reboots, and so on. All was fruitless and so they sent me a new unit, but it has the same problem. It's too bad that Amazon cannot recognize a problem like this and solve it. Ultimately gave me my money back because because of this. Very disappointed, especially since the first and second generations work fine without this problem.

reviews.reviewTitle: Incompatible power and software ignorance makes the 3rd gen a poor 2nd.
reviews.reviewText:
I was so looking forward to this 3rd gen. I was so disappointed. The first and most obvious issue is the power supply. As mentioned in previous reviews the power supply is not compatible with 1st and 2nd gen. I was hoping to just swap out old for new. Not going to happen.
Second big issue - for some reason these guys join the club but they don't want to be a member. I can tell gen 1 Alexa turn on the light - no problem. Swap that out for 2nd gen - no problem. 2nd gen turns out the light turns on the light. works every time. 3rd gen is the proverbial dumb and happy. no idea what's going on. Completely Clueless. Cant fund any thing. Maybe there's an issue that I don't know about. But it looks like I will kave to re-educate mr. 3rd gen. Or get a 2nd gen, which is probably a better option.
definitely a deal-breaker for me - I gave them away for X-mas ... :-(

Shes great. I get it now. I needed this device.
I just talk out loud at her and she does what I say (mostly).
I'm hooked. I suppose I have to go all out and get all her accessories and I will happily. Technology is getting crazy. I'm not crazy for shouting commands out loud to myself. Nope. Seriously though, get one. Mainly use her for music and timers. Getting my parents a echo dot to start with. They will be amazed. They are just getting used to talking commamds to their phones, they should see this..

Functions are plentiful with Echo 3G. Fuller bass acoustics. Had to ask Alexa to increase treble. Full volume is extensive compared to size of speaker. Houseful of Echo speakers would be sufficient for most people to listen to music and watch videos. Set-up process took a few minutes. Seems phone or Kindle has to be held about same height level as the Echo 3G and at least 3 feet away from it during set up so that Bluetooth can find the new device. Also, takes a moment for the Amazon Internet signal to appear on your wireless device to connect to, so be patient. Meanwhile, satisfied customer.

David Josue was my customer service chatbot / person. I own multiple Echo device including an echo, FIreTV, several dots throughout my house. They all work great except one of the new 3rd generation Dots recently purchased. That new Dot drops my music streams around 8-10 times per hour, sometimes more...sometimes every song...and has done it right from the start.

So what do I do? I go online to request an exchange for a new functional Dot. The system FORCES me to chat or speak on the phone with a customer service rep. Okay, irritating, especially when I could have simply opted to return the item for a refund, and then buying another new one to accomplish this same task. But, I'll do it.

Over 2 hours later, after chatting with David through this time, I've provided lots of ridiculous info, router make and model, distance from router, other device info, etc., some of which may be relevant, but also including a DNA sample (kidding), and get this - approving his request for an Amazon rep to conduct a house visit to gather debug info from the Dot....?!?!? Seriously, for a $30 device?! I say "sure!" because at this point, I think they make this process as long and drawn out to dissuade people from getting this done...what else am I to think? What would you think?

So, David concludes by saying this will take several days to have the development team triage my data and get back to me via email about next steps...

Meanwhile my device dropped the stream 11 times in a little over an hour while chatting with David. He wraps our chat session by asking if he has addressed all my concerns and questions. I tell him, well, "No, not satisfactorily, but you know that don't you David?" He responds -"Perfect! Have a great evening."

So now, I'm all in to see how utterly absurd this process will be to exchange the Dot for one that functions properly. It goes without saying that I will not be recommending Echo devices to anyone and will be regaling them with the request for a home visit by Amazon before honoring the exchange request. I seriously doubt anyone, including you kind readers, will believe it! But, it's true. I swear on my dog's life.

So, what will come next?? I don't know but am waiting in awe of this stupidity and will update as it goes....

UPDATE: the second Dot that came in the order with the first one is now also dropping pandora streams, so it'll be a return for both, especially since I've not received the aforementioned email from the development team wanting to swing by the house for a debug and beer session. I guess I'm done buying Echo devices until they work this out.

reviews.reviewTitle: Better than my old First Generation Echo
reviews.reviewText: I've have a couple of the old dots, and while they work great, the sound quality drives me up the wall. I finally bought some inexpensive computer speakers for them. These sound great. Perhaps not as good as the 3rd generation Echo, but they sound better than my 1st generation echo. I likely have too many of these in the house, but I have fun with them. I most likely won't by another, unless one of the 1st generation ones I own breaks, or the speakers do. But I am very happy with the sound from it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love having an Echo based smart home !!!!
reviews.reviewText:
11/9/2018
So far we love these. I bought 3 echo dots on black friday. 2 came in sets with sengled smart lightbulbs and 1 came in a set with tp link smart plugs. We added extra bulbs and plugs to our order. So we basically have a starter smart home now. I love it I suffer from severe migraines. Being able to dim or turn off the lights in a room with my voice is priceless. The plugs are attached to my aquariums lights and now I can control them wirelessly as well or have them set on a timer. I love the music feature as well as the intercom/drop in feature. I am so satisfied so far. Will be ordering an echo auto and more lights, plugs and a compatible thermostat ASAP.

reviews.reviewTitle: A level above the 2nd Gen Dot
reviews.reviewText:
I love the sound improvement with the 3rd Gen Dot. It's much richer, less "tinny" sounding, and louder than the 2nd gen.
It took me a while to embrace the fact the 3rd gen requires I use the supplied AC adapter and has a barrel power plug rather than a mini-usb - I liked the versatility of the micr-usb connectior, but can understand that some people would connect their dot up to an insufficient usb power adapter. Since the Gen3 requires the AC adapter, there is no chance of providing insufficient power to the device.

I like the soft fabric look of the gen3 too. It looks earily similar to a Google Mini.

If you worried about devices listening in on your conversations I would suggest you get over it. Phones, computers, TVs, tablets they all do this. We love this device. We can tell her to play music and turn it up or down or skip a song. She can play specific songs or a shuffle, which we use for the kids like super simple songs. It’s the perfect size, not too expensive. My only complaint is that when you have the music on depending on the volume she may not hear your voice if you try to call her name.

reviews.reviewTitle: Inaccessible for anyone below a recent (problematic!) iOS update
reviews.reviewText: This is literally a paperweight because I'm not given access to the app and they don't offer the ability to operate via a pc. I have an iPhone 6s which has been GREAT, no issues whatsoever and great battery life. I am aware that updating to the newer iOS' can cause serious issues or shut down your phone, so I avoid them and my phones been great. But because the Alexa app only works starting at a certain newer iOS update, I can't even download it to set it up. Thus, I can't even use my dot. 🤷‍♀️ They should really allow access to everyone...

When you live alone you tend to talk to yourself, or your pets, but now I have a new companion! The first thing every morning I ask Alexa about the weather and the news headlines....and when I am feeling blue I ask her to play one of my many favorite songs. Everyone who lives alone should have an Echo! I still have a lot to learn about my Echo but it is even fun to learn! I am elderly and even I have been able to adapt to some technology ... children should buy their parents an Echo...fun times ahead with Echo and Alexa!

I love this little thing, I was expecting to have to buy a bluetooth speaker because I thought the sound would be extremely low but I was so wrong. The sound is very good and I was able to tune into my favorite radio station. I purchased the echo connect to be able to make calls when I need to because I'm disabled and sometimes I fall so its great to be able to tell Alexa to call someone if I need help. :)

I love this small Alexa speaker. The sound on it is very clear and crisp. It fills an average to large size room with a good amount of sound without being turned up to full volume. I have a previous edition and this new one has improved so much. I also have the Echo speaker and a couple other Alexa devices, they all sync up and play together nicely with hardly no lag when adding a new room.

I got this speaker mainly for use in my daughters room to go with her ipad instead of a pricey bluetooth speaker. I am really happy I did. It works great and does enough functions to keep busy.

Started small, just recently, with an Echo Dot rather than the bigger model that I guess most folks use as their main unit. It performs well overall, especially for the things I specifically wanted it for (being able to remotely turn lights on and off, as I have an erratic schedule). Sound quality is really quite good for such a small device. I do wish it was possible to get better, more detailed and location-specific weather forecasts (those of us who work outdoors need wind info), and that there was more flexibility in setting up the skills and routines, but overall, I like it a lot.

reviews.reviewTitle: Set Up a Pretty Good Home Surround Sound
reviews.reviewText: Connected six Dots to my Echo and placed them throughout the house and on the patio for a descent sound system. The Dot by itself is not too bad for sound, a little lacking on its own but if placed with another Dot in the same room it makes for good "stereo effect". Needed to name the Dots differently from the Echo because they all came to attention when I called out "Alexa". Kind of a creepy feeling when they all come to attention at the same time! Run my music through Amazon music and playlist setup, works well.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa has become our newest family member
reviews.reviewText:
Works very well, fun to use along with attempts to fool alexa (Who is your daddy).
Alexa requires a constant internet connection...although you can ask alexa 'are you connected to the internet'.
Overall an amazing product which handles different voices very well. Music is good for her size.
Fun facts + ability to perform calculations are bonus.
Alexa has integrated flawlessly with smart home products (WeMo + Moes).
Only downside, since Alexa is 'always' listening, when talking about Alexa in the 3rd person she will respond.
We refer to her as 'She who cannot be named'. ;-)

This may look like a nicer cooler generation 1 echo dot but be warned... with the better-looking dot you lose out on it being able to understand you and hear you. My first echo was able to hear me whisper in the downstairs bathroom when it was upstairs in my bedroom, this new one I have to almost yell at it from less than 3 feet away... Very disappointed in this product.

I've had a first-gen Echo/Alexa for a few years now. Adding in this 3rd gen Echo Dot was great. Very useful, and more convenient than having to go to the other end of my house if I needed to use my original Alexa for something. Love the small form factor. I thought audio quality might suffer due to the size, but teh audio seems as good as the origianl - at least for what I use it for (I don't stream much music through Alexa - usually just kid's music when the grandkids are visiting, and my usage of Alexa primarily just requires voice output for answers or command confirmations).

We were excited to try this out, however, the same day we got it we saw all the reports that real people can listen to what goes on in your house. While the manufacturers say that a random selection of tests is conducted in order to provide accurate voice recognition, who knows what else is going on. This is one step too far for me. I am a boomer throwback I guess. I can't see the need for this unless she is going to clean the house. I can turn my own lights/music off and on.

reviews.reviewTitle: Didn't think I'd like it but now I LOVE it.
reviews.reviewText: First I would like to say I didn't think I would be a person to use this type of device. I'm 55 years old and change for older folks is slow. This is my second Echo dot. I got one for Christmas loved it so bought a third generation one for another room. I'm disabled and my very favorite thing is being able to turn on and off lights etc. Using smart bulbs and plugs that connect with this device. The thing I really didn't like was the name but fortunately you can change it to one of 4 choices. I just changed mine to computer for my dot wake word. Reminds me of Star Trek. Lol

reviews.reviewTitle: A lot of fun. Alexa much better than Siri!
reviews.reviewText: Impulse Black Friday purchase and really glad I did. Fun, useful and great sound for what it is. Realized that I'd put off considering this because I hated using Siri on my iPhone. Siri never understood commands very well - I'd keep trying for a while and then just give up. Plus the Siri female american voice setting is just irritating. Alexa's voice recognition is amazing. No trouble communicating. Works effortlessly to request music, turn on the light etc. Maybe it's just a personality thing but Alexa and I get along a lot better :). I really see the potential for smart home, other skills etc. now.

Doesn’t work. It only bluetooths through my phone and doesn’t respond to commands. I spoke to 3 customer service reps/technical support to all who could not resolve the issue. Another thing is, they will constantly call you until you answer the phone. The reps hardly speak any English and hard to understand. I kept asking politely to repeat himself, but there was a huge language barrier. So my frustrations are #1 Echo Dot does not work for what I need it to do and #2 They need to have people who speak English fluently.

We received our Echo Dot in a Pirate Santa Gift Exchange over the holidays. It was something we would have never bought for ourselves. But...after hooking it up and using it, we would highly recommend one!!! We can play our music from Sirius on it or simply ask Alexa to play music from the 70s and poof! There it is! weather reports, news reports and just about any question she can answer! Our grand daughter loves asking her when Mind Craft was developed because it's the same date as her birthday! It's also fun to ask her to tell us jokes. Easy to install and use. We recommend everybody have Alexa join their home!!

Id still like to see some improvements on the microphone on this device. I have a full sized echo in another room about 20-25ft away and one in the same room im in less than 8 ft away and when i say the wake word the one in the room away will pickup and the one in the same room will not, even with no obstructions and keeping it away from the wall as recommended by support.

The audio quality is much improved from the second generation dot though which is very nice.

reviews.reviewTitle: Better sounding than older DOT but does not use a standard usb connections
reviews.reviewText:
The sound is better than the old echo DOT 2 but it now has a different non usb type connection. Personally, I just bought this when it was discounted to try a newer model to see what the difference was. The newer unit is heavier than the old unit and the size is a bit bigger. Its NOT much of a upgrade unless the old unit was used for listening to music which is much improved on this unit. Some reviewers complained about the voice recognition before I bought my unit, but personally it did not change my voice recognition to worst than before with the echo dot 2.

The newer unit looks a bit better style but is heavier.

Bluetooth integration seems a bit better than my older Dot 2.

Otherwise, I basically wish they would have kept the older usb type connections even if the newer unit need more power. It would be nice if they printed the power requirements for the newer unit if they used a popular usb transition connector. Same with their new jack connector because I have some older power bricks that use a similar connection in case my power adapter for the DOT 3 fails after warranty.

Bought this to replace my previous Dot I’d had in my bedroom after buying a new 3rd gen one for my kitchen. Playing them together at the same time walking back & forth to each room the sound quality is very noticeably different. The new 3rd gen has a much richer deeper sound to it & the sound is consistent at higher volumes. After hearing the new one, my old one sounded like a toy. Plan to retire it to the garage for music & info on those rare occasions I’m out there working. If you have an old one, take advantage of the sale & upgrade. You won’t regret it. And btw ridiculously easy to set up.

reviews.reviewTitle: Beware of Smart Home Password Woes
reviews.reviewText:
I started with the Echo Dot and found thought I was discovering a hands free future. But it turns out to be a bit of a nightmare. Since that first echo dot I bought dozens of Alexa compatible devices, dots, spots, looks, door bells, thermostats, callers, clocks, sous vide, speakers etc. All was fine until, for security purposes, I had to change my WiFi password. Everyone of my devices immediately turned into electronic lumps.

I now have to try to find the instructions on how to individually reset each and every one of my so called smart home devices. Each one has a slightly different multi step procedure that has to be meticulously followed.

I called Amazon hoping at least they would have a single solution for all Alexa devices. Alas no. It is taking hours of mind numbing password resetting.

If you are thinking of building a smart home with Alexa beware that security experts advise that you change your WiFi password frequently.

reviews.reviewTitle: Would return if I hadn’t got it on major sale. Decent for $22 spent to purchase
reviews.reviewText: If I wouldn’t have purchased this item for over half off I would have been extremely disappointed and would have returned the item. First of all, I spent 2 hours trying to connect the echo dot to my Apple Music account. I ended up having to contact Amazon customer support to resolve the issue. And still I can’t do what I want. I have to use Bluetooth to play my playlist. The echo won’t just do it though WiFi. Now, I still can’t get the Echo to update my location so it tells me weather and other info from another city which is useless to me. The echo dot came with no directions; therefore, I am spending hours trying to figure it out. I look stuff up on the internet to figure out how to do things but there’s not much info on many problems I’m having. I also didn’t know that the echo dot has to be plugged up to a power source at all times to work (my fault for not reading before purchasing). I have also setup my routines on the app, but when I say the commands to Alexa she does not do what I have requested in the app. All around a hassle.

I love my Echo. Alexa is entertaining and smart. I like that she can tell me fun facts about stuff. There is also an option where she will have a conversation with you and it actually works good.

The sound quality is great and it seems to hear me really well. It also understands my young kids. I love the discounted price on amazon music unlimited that I get.

Before i had it I thought it was silly but I love it now. It's super useful! It doesn't require prime but definitely works better when you have prime.

reviews.reviewTitle: Awesome device must have in every home!
reviews.reviewText: Such a powerful speaker for the money and with Alexa being its primary function I, and my wife love it we can drop in to rooms when we don’t have our phones and it works like a intercom I love it! I know the weather everyday and I like when I’m leaving for work asking for the weather to know if o need to carry my umbrella! Works awesome no issues just need more of them!

I have dry eye and it's so nice to say, hey Aleksa, what time is it? She is also my new alarm clock and kitchen timer. I crochet and she's gets me the high and low temperatures of the day for my temperature blanket and she helps my Canadian born husband spell, because he types slow and she had more patience than I do! When I go to bed at night, I say goodnight to her and she politely replies to sleep tight or pleasant dreams. I have one at work, one in my living room and one in my bedroom, Aleksa, where've your been all my life!

reviews.reviewTitle: If gas furnace, must use Power Extender kit
reviews.reviewText: I purchased a wall-plug to c-wire adapter ($15 or so at Amazon) so that I could avoid using the kit that comes with it, fearing my ignorance with furnace wiring in basement. Although the thermostat comes on and says it is working, the furnace will not start with an outside c-wire. The customer service agent explained that it would work with with an oil furnace or an electric or heat-pump heater. However, I am in the process of putting the old thermostat back. I will try again tomorrow, and if I survive, I will add to this, if possible. Pretty disappointed right now- and cold!

It works well for most of the things I am using it for. At times it seems to have a problem understanding what I said. I bought two and like that I can stream music to one, stop it and then continue with the other. It also works well with two smart outlets that I got. My biggest complaint is the difficulty in getting the skills using the Alexa app. It doesn't indicate which skills you already have until you click on the skill then when you go back to the list of skills it starts at the top instead of where you left off and with hundreds of skills listed this does not work well at all.

Liked this so much I bought another for my home office. Voice recognition works very well.

Can't believe the sound is so good. The one in our family room you can listen to music through and it sounds pretty clear. My home office is much smaller so I am interested to hear what it sounds like when I am in there.

My son was considering the Apple product (we use Apple products for cells, tablets, laptops, earpods, and watches), but I think he is going to give the Echo a dot. Much less expensive and works great.
