I love the Echo Dot. It's not just an Echo Dot it is a friend! LOL. Seriously it helps me out when I have to check the weather before my doctor appointments in the morning. It comes in handy when finding out the weather in other countries as well, great for when travel. Especially if I wanted to go to Venice, Italy right now with all the flooding!. Sometimes when I ask it to play my albums from amazon music I have to repeat the name of the album sometimes, but that's OK I have to work on my diction anyway, really, I do. I haven't had time to play music from my Pandora account yet but once I get the chance, I'll let you guys know. Overall it gets a 5 star from me! Thanks Amazon for the Echo Dot!

I ordered my Echo Dot on July 27th 2019 as my mother and her significant other had owned one downstairs. I realized overtime how helpful it was so I ordered it as part of my early birthday money.

I use my Echo Dot for alarms, weather updates, timers, google questions, sleep sounds. She has been so perfect for me and you have the option to change her wake from Alexa, Echo, Computer. I also use my Echo Dot for my lighting in my room that changes color and I can adjust them by saying the name of the light and the color I want along with dimming percentage.

She helps with math questions and just everything you can think of as I listed. It's great for being lazy too, haha. Just the best purchase I've ever made off Amazon hands down. Go get yourself one!

reviews.reviewTitle: on my 2nd one - both bad sound
reviews.reviewText: I have returned the 1st one because the sound was muffled and scratchy at times. I now have the 2nd one and the sound goes through the same ups and downs. I finally turned on only the bass and it removed the scratchy sounds but of course I'm hearing all bass now. Not sure this is the way speakers should be. I'm very disappointed in this item but I love my other 4 devices and they are older versions.

reviews.reviewTitle: Stopped Working After Only a Few Months!!
reviews.reviewText: The echo was a nice addition to our Alexa devices in our home. We currently have 3 fire tv cubes with Alexa, and one Echo 3rd generation. We bought this one to pair with our Alexa Clock. It worked for a few months and now is a DUD. Tried resetting it and re-syncing it. It has sound after some resets and then none after others. When it does have volume it is extremely muffled and incoherent. Going to try to return... I do not recommend buying the dot. We have not experienced issues with the other Alexa devices.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very useful and easy to use
reviews.reviewText: I love my Alexa. I love the ease of setup and how simple it is to use. I have Multiple Sclerosis and I don’t see well and days I cannot get up and so this device is so helpful to me in many ways. I use it from everything from playing music, to checking the daily forecast, to turning on and off lights. It’s not just a cool thing to have, it’s very useful for people like me who need a bit of help. I’m still new to using it and have not yet discovered it to its fullest potential so hopefully I can give more information as I discover it.

So when I originally got Alexa, I got her all set up, but when I had her learn my voice, she glitched out. She wouldn't understand a lot of actions I had said to her that were pretty basic.
I had called tech support and we reset my Alexa back to factory settings TWICE and she still did the same glitch, so I received a replacement Alexa.
Once I got my replacement I thought for sure the issue would be resolved, but it wasn't. The same thing was happening. I thought maybe it was a system malfunction and maybe it was happening to everyone and people just knew to wait for it to be fixed.
But today I had switched my internet provider from Windstream to Spectrum. And suddenly SHE WORKED CORRECTLY! I'm so happy because all the functions I bought her for weren't really working correctly until today.
So, If you have internet speeds that are under 30mps you may not get the full alexa experience you were hoping for. I know I will defiantly be getting a second alexa now that I know why she wasn't working originally.
She's really helpful for someone with memory problems, especially since she's connected to your phone as well. She also helps with keeping up with our calendar because my fiance refuses to check his phone for his schedule.
Overall Alexa has been a great addition. I just wish I would have known what speed of internet is required to make her work.

This is the only generation I have ever owned so I’m not able to compre it to past generations but this makes such a wonderful little stereo. I use to it listen to my audiable books and music when I’m studying or working. I still have yet to fully figure out how to permanently connect it to two phone devices without it always disconnecting. The skills are also difficult to connect as well. My pandora skill is already activated through the phone app but it still won’t play when I ask Alexa to play pandora. Other than that, it meets all of my expectations.

reviews.reviewTitle: Amazing sound quality and so useful! Buying more asap!
reviews.reviewText: I was blown away by the sound quality of such a small device! It's amazing for what it is! There are so many skills and Alexa is so useful. I paired it with an Echo Sub and wow I'm blown away. I know there are audiophiles out there that will put this echo down compared to Bose systems and sonos, but I stand by that for the amount of money you save this is my #1 pick!!!! You truly don't need to spend a ton on other name brand products just to say you're "cool" for having it, this is more than sufficient and Alexa makes it perfect. She even controls my Xbox and my kids are in love with their echo kids edition!

reviews.reviewTitle: Amazon echo is perfect for my house
reviews.reviewText:
This one was a 2nd echo for my house and I am pretty satisfied with its design and performance. I am highly impressed with its new design and its microphone is much better than previous version.

I will highly recommend to others to purchase it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Routines & productivity features limited; speakers buzz from Alexa's own voice at medium volume
reviews.reviewText: Voice recognition is pretty good and Alexa can do a lot of random and interesting things, but after the initial phase of playing around, it's day-to-day usefulness is somewhat limited for real life activities. The Echo Dot (3rd Gen) speaker also has distortion issues even at medium level playing its own voice. Also would be great if I could use Alexa as a bluetooth interface for my phone to call or text people just like I can do in my car. It can apparently only message or call other Alexa devices. Alexa Routines lack the capability to set timers or reminders as part of a pre-defined routine. This would be very useful for taking medications or any type of repetitious, timed activities that I'd like to trigger using Alexa. This limitation is really an Alexa app issue rather than the Echo alone.

reviews.reviewTitle: A big sound upgrade from 2nd gen dot
reviews.reviewText: What stands out the most is the improved audio. The appearance is also upgraded with the cloth surround instead of the plastic. It definitely seems to be a higher quality build. In addition the 3rd gen can be used with the amazon echo sub for added bass and you can pair these and use two together. Even though there are only minor differences (other then sound quality) between the 2nd gen and the 3rd the audio quality has improved so much that it is worth the upgrade. I enjoy using the echo dot and to recommend this 3rd gen over the previous model.

reviews.reviewTitle: Multitude of problems - Zigbee hub does not work over Bluetooth
reviews.reviewText:
This is my first ever Echo device and I only had it for a week now. I've always been a google home assistant person but gave this a try for Prime day, with the Philips Hue Bluetooth Color Bulbs combo. The voice recognition works well just as you'd expect from an Echo device.
First of all, I had a really bad experience with the on-time delivery of this device. They cancelled my order without my consent and then tried denying me a new device. I had to call them 4 times because every time I got assertive, my call got disconnected magically. Worst customer service experience for me in probably a decade and I cannot believe how low Amazon’s customer service standards have fallen.
And then the actual device’s problems. The whole - works with Philips bulbs over Bluetooth- thing, is either a scam or they just released it without testing it properly because of course, prime day sales. The device does not recognize the bulbs. Cannot connect to them. This problem persists with most people who bought the combo that amazon disabled reviews for the bulbs. I have spent north of 4 hours, tinkering with it myself and talking to customer service trying to figure out why. Both customer reps I talked to tried blaming it on my phone, that there is somehow something wrong with my Pixel 2, or the bulbs which is really low for Amazon. Only when I asked them to send that in writing in an email, they backed down from trying to blame it on my end. This is all incredibly shady.
They finally figured out that my firmware is not up to date but the device cannot update its firmware. It just does not update it and yes I have tried the whole mute overnight thing and it still will not update. Apparently there is no real way to force it to update. I cannot remember the last time a device gave me so many problems.
My advice, to those who are able to read this before this review mysteriously disappears from Amazon, is do not buy it until the general consensus that they fixed most problems. I hate that over the years I became so dependent on Amazon that I cannot really do anything about any of this, but write a bad review. I miss the company that put customer service on top of Jeff Bezos’ wallet.

reviews.reviewTitle: Top notch smart speaker for the money. Way better than the 2nd gen Dot.
reviews.reviewText: Freaking fantastic and it's a bargain at the holiday price. If you got it for the black Friday price, it's a steal. It took a bit of time getting it set up on AT&T Uverse, but once I looked it up, it was pretty easy. The sound quality over the second gen dot isn't even comparable. Way better sound over the 2nd gen Dot. Mic is also way better at recognizing your voice. After giving a demo to my dad, they'll definitely be getting one for Christmas. He was very impressed. I haven't tried any other smart speakers, but I'd have a tough time imagining the competitors in this price range could be any better.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa is the best part of my smart home
reviews.reviewText:
I can get in bed with the light on and get settled in, and tell Alexa to turn off the lights. I can stumble into the kitchen in the morning and tell Alexa to turn on some lights and set them to 25% brightness. I can tell Alexa to clean whichever room I want vacuumed. I also have multiple things on Alexa controlled plug ins, like scentsy burners, programmed to come on an hour before my spouse gets home and go off three hours later.
Alexa does it all with very little error. WAAAAAY Better than even a year ago.

I like my Echo dots - I bought the three pack when I found them on sale. I already had one of the first generations Echo. I have spread them around the house and we use them as intercoms as well as asking everyday questions. They are always good for a laugh or playing tunes through Pandora Radio. One of the things I like best is if you ask a question Alexa gives you the answer verbally. I also use Apples Siri but Siri says here is what I found on the web - meaning you have to stop what you are doing and read the answer - frustrating.

reviews.reviewTitle: significant improvement over gen2, and a deal with recent pricing under $30
reviews.reviewText: I've had a gen1 echo dot for about a year and a half now and it has always worked well, but it would also have difficulty understanding commands with background noise and the speaker worked well enough for voice, but was horrible for music. The v3 echo dot sounds significantly better when playing music. It still sounds thin and lacks bass response, but that is to be expected for a small speaker. It seems to provide better microphones even though specs show fewer internal microphones. It also looks better. In addition to the dots, I have a gen2 echo and fire tv cube with several smart home devices.

The things this can do is really amazing. The price is great. I bought the outlet control after receiving the Dot and it works flawlessly. It's like the voice command in Star Trek, really cool. For it's size it has pretty decent sound (and I am a picky former sound engineer). Great for a kitchen! I had a little trouble setting it up to my wifi but that was user error. Don't get frustrated if this happens. You can listen to the radio, make calls, hear news, local weather, voice games, I am only beginning to unlock it's full potential. With multiple units they are also able to be used as a household intercom. Neat product. It is linked to your account so in the app I made sure voice purchasing was set to off. YOU WILL NEED WIFI AND FREE ALEXA APP.
For the price and capability I highly recommend this or any other of their new "smart speakers".

reviews.reviewTitle: A good little speaker and Alex for 50 bucks.
reviews.reviewText:
The echo dot has a good speaker on it for 5o bucks. Alexa is fast and understands me perfectly and she fits nicely in with my small bedroom set-up. While Alexa with the Alexa skills app is much smarter than other voice assistants like Siri I dislike how you have to train her. For example: with my Philips hue color lights if I do not use the skills app I must say "turn on Philips hue down light 1". Whereas with Siri I just say "turn on lights and bam!". Not to mention the clunky pairing process of having to jump back and forth between apps. Again with apple and home kit I had to scan ONE qr code and it automatically found all 4 of my lights in less than a minute. Finally, I understand amazon wants you to use their prime music but I do not like the fact that I cannot use Apple Music considering many apple users like myself use this service.

All in all a good sounding speaker for 50 bucks, decent intelligence but the clunky set up with the Alexa app and the necessity of the skills app to really make Alexa smart is not very user friendly.

I have purchased five of these. I gave one of them to a friend as a gift. She was delighted. I have two on opposite ends of my open concept kitchen/eating area. I put them in stereo mode. I think when in stereo mode, the sound quality is amazing. I had the volume set fairly high. I did not hear any distortion. If you are not using stereo mode while playing music, I think the sound quality is just okay. I enjoy getting the news in the morning. They work well with my Ring home security system. I would definitely recommend them.

I’m am super excited that I purchased this Alexa! I couldn’t have made a better decision. Me and my family are obsessed with this Alexa. The device is perfect size, we purchased the black with gray charcoal coloring. The Alexa was super super easy to set up took maybe a couple of minutes tops. The speaker is super loud too which is amazing. It’s easy to use of course, you can play music which is good in our household and the best part it tells stories for the kids which I think is super fun for the whole family! All in all this was a perfect purchase!! The shipping was 2 day and fast as well!

For the price, not too bad, but I get better usability on a day to day basis from other devices of it's kind. This constantly jams up on me when playing music; it will often only play a single song from my playlists or simply not understand what I am asking. It's a bit of a dumb, smart device and I wish I had gone with something else.

The speaker is pretty good though and it is feature rich once you get it dialed down. I use it primarily for music and it rarely understands my commands, or doesn't hear me at all and when it does, it just stops randomly for no reason that I can discern.

reviews.reviewTitle: I got an used device, w/o power cable, not in the official package
reviews.reviewText:
I received this item as a replacement from another purchase that arrived defective. Thank you for that. The device seems to be working properly so far.

However, I have two complains. First, the product arrived without the power cable. Secondly, it was an used item (refurbished) and I paid for a new one.

With respect to the first complain, I will understand that when returning the old Echo Dot, I should do it without the cable. That is what I did, otherwise I would had an incomplete product.

About the second, it is very disappointing and ultimately, lack of respect for your customers. How can I know if the device has all its functionalities working correctly? Can you assure me that the item will have the same expected life as a new one? I'm worried about these issues, besides the fact that I paid for a NEW device, not an used one.

reviews.reviewTitle: Does not auto find my wireless network
reviews.reviewText: In a time where just about every device I have had thats wireless can find your network this device which should be cutting edge can't do it ? This is a terrible product

reviews.reviewTitle: Total failure two weeks out of warranty after one hour of total useage
reviews.reviewText:
I purchased this Echo Dot Gen 3 for my wife as a Christmas gift. We registered it, and then packed it away before getting any use out of it because we were in the process of moving out of state. I was really impressed with the sound quality. It was unpacked an connected when we moved into our new house worked really great for an hour before the unit died, exactly two weeks after the expiration of the 90 day warranty. Amazon replaced the power supply free of charge, however that did not solve the problem. The unit simply no longer powers up.

I'm certain that Amazon knows exactly how long this unit was powered up (since they're listening.) I'm just disappointed that the best they could do was offer me a 15% discount on the purchase of a new unit. We took a pass on replacing it. Amazon knows too much about us already :)

We have three of these - one on each level of the house. The voice recognition is great, the sound quality is excellent. The "intercom" function is hands-free, and the sound is so good that it seems like the other person is in the room with you. I'm not paranoid about the "Alexa is always listening conspiracy issues", but it IS listening - that's how it works. It's not spying on you. It's merely ready to give you a weather report, play some jazz, or add ketchup to your shopping list. Excellent technology, as long as it's used properly.

I wanted another Echo I could put in a guest bathroom. If someone fell in a tub or needed help, they could just have Alexa call me. Of course that is also possible to do that in other parts of the house (we have 5 Echo Alexa products so far and 2 more will complete the process).

I also purchased the gizmo that fits this 3rd generation Echo Dot that plugs into the wall socket in the bathroom and it works great. This newer Echo has a more superior quality sound.

Purchased on sale, a bargain, practical "toy" that you just have to get. The sound on the 3rd generation Echo Dot is a significant improvement over the 2nd generation. Have a 2nd generation unit that was connected via Bluetooth to a large speaker. It helped the 2nd generation unit significantly. I found the 3rd generation unit performs just as well on its own without the Bluetooth speaker (freeing up my Bluetooth speaker for other use.) All other functionality is basically the same on any Echo device that does not have its own screen.

reviews.reviewTitle: Fantastic Sound, But Stereo Pair Can Get Buggy
reviews.reviewText:
3rd gen Dot is worlds ahead of its predecessors. This one has good enough sound quality that it doesn't need to be connected to an external (better) speaker.

Only con is that I have two 3rd Gen Dots stereo connected, and after a few months they don't work quite right as a pair. Unplugging them and reconnecting them as a pair in the Alexa app fixes it. It's a 5 minute nuisance for months of being able to fall asleep to surround sound ocean noises, so I'm not mad at it.

I have the 2nd and now 2rd gen echo dot. I really didn’t think I’d care too much to upgrade but seeing it in person, and getting it set up made me fall in love with the newer model!

I like the way it’s easy to install through your Alexa app. We enjoy having Alexa play music, answer silly questions and help us find deals, specially on prime day!

We got this as a bundle with the ring doorbell and can’t wait to use it!

If you’re thinking of upgrading your echo dot 2, I say go for it!

reviews.reviewTitle: Like HAL 3000 if he smoked weed
reviews.reviewText: Will acknowledge my requests and not fulfill them or do the wrong thing, yet will do them first time when I'm sick or my friends ask. Also, when i ask the temp, a number is good. Blabbers way too much. I don't need the full report. Idk why I replaced the second gen. Guess I just liked the voice controlled lights and TV. Setting up apps / skills is amazingly annoying and integrating smart tech is so convoluted. Once you do it it's done but it's not fun. If you have more than one also they will compete with each other when you talk.

reviews.reviewTitle: Be careful if you have pets and they tend to get sick or have accidents.
reviews.reviewText: I have three cats in between cat hair and kitty litter that is tracked around the house I needed to do something. I decided to try to ruoomba. This is brushless so the hair shouldn’t get tangled in the brush like it will in the less expensive models. I have used it twice,I have 1500 ft.², it’s all tile except one room has a rug under the bed and it has done a fantastic job it actually cleaned better than one of my uprights did. I wish it was a little quieter but it is not bad. I have to run it during the day because if one of the cats gets sick (as they often do) I don’t want the iRobot to track it throughout the house.

reviews.reviewTitle: A little too rough around the edges
reviews.reviewText:
So my daughter ordered me an Alexa for Fathers day. So far, I'm finding it frustrating trying to add it to my daily life. Commands are hit or miss. Sometimes it will do what I say and others times that feature isn't available yet BS even though it just did it. Its also constantly trying to sell me upgrades or products. I honestly feel like I have an Amazon salesman in my bedroom. **Hey Amazon I already pay you yearly and order regular, so GTFO my pocket.*** Honestly it isn't my assistant. It's an Amazon AI salesman. I'm going to give it a few more days but I'm pretty sure I'll be returning it to order a google home. My other daughter has a google home and well it's actually fun to use.

All in all, too slow, too many mistakes, and it's constantly trying to sell me something.

reviews.reviewTitle: Our household gives these 5 stars! We love them.
reviews.reviewText: I think we have 6 of these. 3 bedrooms, Kitchen, Dining Room and gym. My son says he loves he can walk anywhere in the house and use Alexa. We also subscribed to the Family Music Plan so we use that quite often. I can walk into my gym and tell alexa to play my work out music play list and that right there sold me! I used to have to keep an Ipod down there and now don't have to fool with that. I also paired to a big speaker and that makes it very loud...I just wish it would pair to my surround sound in the gym..that would make it even better.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good thing we got this for free
reviews.reviewText: The Echo Dot is basically useless. It doesn’t work with basically any device like it is shown on commericals. It’s just not compatible with anything. You have to pay for Amazon music monthly to get it to play any good music. It doesn’t turn our tv or play any shows. Even the apps and games in the echo dot are awful. We tried to play an “escape game” with Alexa and it was horrible.

reviews.reviewTitle: Siri might be jealous but Alexa has won our hearts.
reviews.reviewText: Oh my! We are in love with Alexa! We bought one for the kitchen, one for my daughters room and one for my sons room. I have a morning routine setup with weather, NPR news and Beautiful Day by U2. I also set up Alexa to respond to me when I say things like “I need to walk.” She is my own personal motivation trainer. I can announce to the kids to hurry up without yelling up the stairs. I can listen to radio stations in Norway or London... we just adore her. Did I mention she keeps track of my shopping list and can order my almond milk as well? I always wanted a personal assistant.

At least the two Echo Dots I bought recognize my wifi. They were easy to set up, and I am loving Alexa's list making. What a help! And I don't have to bother looking up and reading any notifications. She reminds me by her green light and reads them to me. Part of that includes letting me know about the Amazon shipments I am getting that day, and again when it has arrived. Great product ! Now if I can just get the Ring 2 doorbell to work with Alexa....guess I will try again tomorrow.

I now have 3 Echo Dots (2 are 3rd gen) and an Echo Show 5. I also have a competing system that starts with a G. In almost every way, the other system comes up short. I love the drop in feature. I can drop in on my garage and listen, plus it makes a great intercom, something the other system lacks completely right now. Amazon, you came up with a real winner and I'm a total convert! And yes, I did start with the other system and still will use parts of it for now, but like this one better.

So sick of having to try to get apps from Microsoft Store. My win 10 enterprise does not have store and the app CANNOT be installed to get the Alexa app. How about you make the software available more easily. Have searched over and over to get the 'app' for pc but to no avail. Really discourages me from making any purchase where I have to go to Microsoft Store. Yes, I know I can do it on my phone, BUT I DONT want to. Not everyone in the world is GLUED to their phones

reviews.reviewTitle: Great sound and features out of this little puck - great upgrade to the original Dot
reviews.reviewText:
So I have the original Echo as well as an Echo dot. Love them both and get a lot of use out of them. The Dot is in my bathroom and I get the news in the morning as well as listen to music while I shower.

This new Dot blows the old dot out of the water. The sound quality is night and day - this is much louder and has way more bass. And you can hook it up to other Bluetooth speakers as well, pretty neat.

In any case, if you are looking to buy you can pick these up on sale for relatively cheap. Great little thing to have and the sound quality of this small one is really good now.

I’ve had an 2nd generation echo dot for a while, and I’ve loved the features and smart home capabilities it brought! I decided to get a 3rd generation dot for my living room, as it would be nice to have a newer model and better speakers in a room that would get a lot of use. Unfortunately, it has not been as solid of a model as I’d hoped for, and I’ve found that it’s worse than the 2nd generation model in many regards.

First off, the package came dented, which wasn’t a huge deal, though I wonder if that caused some of the problems. The setup process had a solid amount of errors due to already having on echo dot on my account, where it just flat out didn’t work the first day and continued to say it was not fully set up even after finishing it within the app multiple times. Once it was up, I was pretty happy with the speaker, and it can sound pretty good for such a small device.

The true problem is the microphone system. It almost never hears anyone, and you have to yell at it to get it to pick you up! Even then, it often mishears us and does something totally different than what we wanted. While it was funny the first time I was screaming “ALEXA STOP!” over it playing some music, it’s gotten a bit old now (but still kind of funny). We’ve tried putting it in different places, but no luck.

It’s a shame, because I really like the 2nd gen dot that I have, but this one just can’t compete because it can hardly hear anything. I’m hoping they improve the microphone in the future, but right now, it takes a major toll on the product.

I ask Alexa to do quite a few things and this speaker is very helpful. However It would be a major plus if it could be charged and you do not have to leave it plugged in to use it. Also the colors should be differentiated a little further because the rings that show up when something needs attention can be mistaken for another notification. (Lime green and yellow) but instead maybe it should be Yellow and Orange maybe. Other than that I recommend this device for those that don't mind leaving it plugged in to use.

reviews.reviewTitle: Can connect another speaker to it
reviews.reviewText: I actually really like the sound quality, I think it's beautiful and very interactive. Great for listening to audible. I can connect it to another speaker through audio cable if I choose to, however I'm only using it for my room so I don't need a loud speaker. But for those that want really strong sound quality for music, you can just get a separate speaker and you can plug an audio cable through it. I enjoy listening to music from the echo dot even without any additional speakers so no problem for me here!

Took advantage of Prime Day and got my new best friend here for $22 bucks! Just having something around I can get the time, weather, sports, and games made it well worth the money. The gag is I bought it because my bathroom speakers died the day before. I was simply replacing them and now I'm about to purchase the full Echo for the bedroom! I'm hooked.

This has made Alexa literally
My 7-year-olds best friend. She tells her she loves her and plays guessing games for minutes at a time (she’s 7 so that’s all the attention she’s got lol). She adores having her own bedtime routine “Alexa, Goodnight” and the ability to play “Baby Shark” on demand. I use Alexa to bring the kids down for dinner or relay other reminders even from work: “Mom is leaving in ten minutes-are your rooms clean?” It’s absolutely work every penny. I almost bought one for every room in the house (not kidding)

reviews.reviewTitle: Product failures are proof life but lousy support is not.
reviews.reviewText: Started getting static after a few songs which got worse the next day, could not understand Alexa at this point. Support said they had a problem with the Echo 3rd gen and would be fixed soon. The next day it was still unusable. This time support said they had not knowledge of a system trouble and to send it back. We got the link for return postage but no reason why the first support woman lied. They said they were not allowed to do an exchange so we sent it back. We then realized to reorder would cost us about 6$ more than the Black Friday price. Chatted with support for about 20 minutes to get them to finally send one at the price we paid for the bad one. Over a week later and nothing in the mail and no link to use to complain since the return is complete. Bad, frustrating, service after a failed product and this is my 3rd try to complain since the last two “crashed” just before I tried to send it.
Already half off and collecting dust.

Sorry... I was attempting to be funny however that is what both myself and my niece said as we turned her on and played our first song. This little speaker has AMAZING sound quality - a definite upgrade from the first generation Alexa which my sister owns. We picked this up for my niece for her room and set up was a breeze, all the regular bells and whistles are there but the sound quality was not expected for such a little device. I was thinking something similar to the JBL Clip's quality but this NEW Alexa sounds real good. For that you have a great purchase. I have been thinking about picking one up for my room if I can figure out how to sync it to my iPad via bluetooth - if Alexa can do that than count me in as a second buyer!

reviews.reviewTitle: Poor attempt to boost bass ruins overall quality of sound.
reviews.reviewText: I feel this device was engineered in attempt to make it sound bass-heavy, but instead it sounds like you're listening to music being played underwater. The treble is decreased in attempt to boost the bass. Even adjusting the audio quality to decrease bass and increase treble in the Alexa settings does nothing to improve sound quality. If listening to music with someone singing, the actual words are barely understandable. You have to blast the volume just to make out anything a person is singing or saying.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very helpful gadget. I love mine.
reviews.reviewText: Bought it for my sister. She really likes it. She isn't too tech savvy and is learning to use it more and more. As I am mine. It does a lot more than I use it for, but am continually using more of its functions. The emails from Amazon about its uses are helpful. I am going to give one to a friend who is going blind and teach her how to use it. She shops on Amazon a lot so it will be helpful for her to reorder. Listen to books. As well as know the time, play music, set alarms, timers and reminders. I use it for all those.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa is listening, and its a good thing.
reviews.reviewText:
I cant get my kids to listen but Alexa answers me back every time. good to play music on or ask a general question. Whats the weather today? Cant be alone with Alexa around.

Update: I have three of these and even got one for my elderly mother (she lives in a house in the back) and she can call me anytime she wants if she were to fall. Its way better than the help Ive fallen unit. She feels safer and I can drop in and chat with her anytime from anywhere.

reviews.reviewTitle: Much nice and better quality Echo (than the original)
reviews.reviewText: I bought a few more echos on Prime Day as they had a great day (only $22). I already had one echo which I ended up giving to my parents in law. I liked the original echo so I figured I would try the new version and I am not at all disappointed. These echos are better than the original in terms of both voice recognition and speaker quality, not to mention they look way better too. When I talk to these echos, they understand my voice much better and I usually don't need to repeat myself.

Real nice little echo that is convenient in my living room to control my tv and lights. The sound quality is not as full and loud as my full size echos, but that’s okay because I use my sound system in the living room. A great less expensive than a full size echo option for rooms where you have a sound system already in place. But, don’t be fooled, you can still play quality music from this if you had to, it’s just for a stand alone speaker, the full echo is better...obviously because the dot is like a quarter of the height and speaker size...but quality is great for its size. For voice controls though, and in terms of hearing and understanding Alexa, this is still great...makes an excellent, less expensive extension to my echo ecosystem. Probably will get another dot soon for the kitchen.

reviews.reviewTitle: Does not respond well after two months and the CSR is sucks!!
reviews.reviewText: After two month use, there was one time it did not respond me while playing music as my mouth only inches away, and another time when I called "Alexa" it does not respond at all but my second one placed farther responded. Contacted CSR for a replacement, the CSR asked to go through their troubleshooting process and told it was because the volume was low. That's interesting to hear that in my life the device volume is about if the device can hear me not the sound the device plays. And the CSR asked me to send back the product but they may send the same one back if they think there's no problem. I'd very like to know they would explain the closer one did not respond but the farther one did. Very disappointed

reviews.reviewTitle: I love it, Wish I purchased earlier!
reviews.reviewText:
My first Echo, so I can't really comment on if better than previous ones.
I've been putting off buying one as I figured it would just sit unused. I was so wrong! We found some amazing add-ons, my daughter (14) actually uses it to help her study! I'm sold!!!

However, I purchased 2 (my bedroom & Daughters bedroom) our bedrooms are not far away so as she would talk to hers "Alexa.....turn on my music" it would also respond in my room lol
Quick fix on the app I downloaded to my cell and changed mine to "Echo" and hers "Alexa"
No more issues of both dots responding lol

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Sound and Looks but not the Wizard of Oz
reviews.reviewText: Good product. Setup is not as easy as 1-2-3 though. What comes with the package is not really useful at all in the actual setup. Make sure you download the right Alexa app and from there it’s not to hard (I’m not a techie at all). The Echo Dot is one of those toys you don’t need but it does offer convenience when you want to know the weather, word definitions, synonyms, etc. It has misunderstood me multiple times and said “I don’t know” on numerous other questions, so it is not the infallible god of answers. Listening to songs is definitely a plus and the sound is amazing for its size.

Having used Google home for a few months, I knew what I was getting myself into. Long story short, I find amazon echo way more user friendly than Google.

Pro :
- I can setup different customized routines.
- amazon prime music is already included with my prime. (Can't access amazon prime music on Google, obviously)
- soft sides makes it look more fancy than Google's plastic sides. Personal preference.

Cons :
- Google's touch control for volume way more fun than echo.
- have to setup individual accounts (I.e. calendar, email, text, etc.) Google was all integrated.

The Echo Dot is pretty cool. I got the white one which looks pretty chic! Alexa responds well. Once in a while she doesn't understand what I am asking, but I do have a bit of a Latina accent...lol....
Looking online, there are many questions I can ask her. She keeps my shopping list, adds items and deletes as I ask, she sets a timer, has recipes, sang me happy birthday, and welcomes me home. It's really pretty, I just wish they wouldn't have run out because I need about three of them. I also bought the wall mount and currently waiting for it.
It arrived super quick!

I bought an echo dot and google home. I wanted to love the dot but side by side the echo dot wouldn’t play pandora when the google mini did easily. It couldn’t answer any of the questions that the google mini could answer. The only thing going for this is that the speakers are better than the google mini and personally I like the way it looks better. The way it lights up is pretty cool. Don’t even bother though and go straight for the google home mini !

reviews.reviewTitle: Cost Effective Entry Point to the Growing Alexa Ecosystem
reviews.reviewText: If you’re on the fence about jumping into the growing Alexa ecosystem the Echo Dot is a great way to give it a whirl for a very small entry fee. This third generation version definitely sounds better than earlier versions, with a bit more bass for playing music. However, the extra bass muddies the Alexa voice quality a bit, in my humble opinion. Two recently added Echo features significantly improved their versatility for me: compatibility with Apple Music and the Alexa Guard feature. What’s not to like about a device that delivers so much for so little.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works well but hard to set up
reviews.reviewText:
The difficult setup resulted in my lower star rating otherwise I might have been inclined to give one or two more.

Maybe it's just that I'm an old guy who doesn't follow directions well or maybe the directions are not clear but I spent many hours trying to get the installation program to connect to my network. I also purchased a Smart Plug and eventually two more Echo Dot so that I could order Alexa around from several locations. Again the installation was difficult with each of these units but I finally got through it. We are an Apple/Mac/iPhone/iPad/iPod home so I don't know if a PC/Android system is simpler.

I have two of the other products and the quantity went to poo after a week. I was hesitant about the echo based on the other home /nest products but so happy with my decision to take a chance and go with. Works seamlessly with my nest thermostat, ring doorbell, smarthome smart plug, and ADT. OMG, I love this thing. Sound quality is great. Understands my statements and questions throughout the room. Wish I had one in every room and I want to pick up Alexa products to replace the other substandard products. My wifi isn't awesome but holds up and the echo doesnt complain. Love it

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa. ALEXA! Im sorry I dont know that one.
reviews.reviewText: For me, Alexa is mostly helpful as a speaker and an alarm. I usually just ask her to play music and have her wake me up to a playlist every morning. I know she has alot more capabilities but I dont need a whole smart house (have you seen the Disney movie smart house? No. Thank. You.). But overall I'm am super happy with my Alexa. I have one in my main area and one in the bathroom. The sound quality is amazing. She usually hears me when i call her, but sometimes I'm home alone yelling at my Alexa.

reviews.reviewTitle: Can’t get enough of my Alexia!
reviews.reviewText: This is my second Alexia and is a 3rd generation. I have a second generation in my upstairs and the newer one on the main level level of my home. I think the newer one has better sound, but both are excellent! So easy to just talk to Alexia to get any music I want, set alarms, find answers to questions, leave messages for myself, and ask her to turn off the music after a set time when I figure I’ll be asleep. The very first set-up was a bit slow, but when I added on, it took me about 3 minutes and I am no tech whiz by any sense of the word. If my father were alive, he’d have one in every room. He loved technology, but never lived to see all the wonders we have today. If you’re wondering if it’s worth your money to buy one, stop wondering and get out and buy one! Emails come often that provide you with suggestions on new ways to increase your use! Why are you still reading this? Go buy one now!!!!

Already have the Echo Plus. Bought this for upstairs. Could not believe how good music sounds on both devices. AND I synchronize the music upstairs and dow. It was super easy to install. The only thing I haven't been able to do is to control the turning on and off of the Hue light bulb. It wouldn't respond, but I've been too busy to go back thru the steps needed. Also one must have one's smartphone to do it. I keep forgetting to take it with me. I also don't order anything from Amazon using either Echo. The process is either too confusing or else I'm just too dim to do it successfully.

I previously had a 2nd generation echo dot that I traded in for this 3rd generation. Set up was easy and picked up all of my settings that I already established with ease. The only issue I have is that the 3rd generation struggles at identifying my voice all the time. Minor glitches here and there but I still like the product and use it daily to run my smart devices.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great First foray into smart home
reviews.reviewText:
Received this for Father’s Day. I love technology but I have had to sacrifice a lot of toys in the past decade. I was stoked! Totally unexpected gift.
Looked good and almost too simple... then it got pretty great. Plugged it in and download Alexa app on my iPhone 6 Plus (seriously, I’m on a major budget)
After entering my parents WiFi password I to the app and giving the dot a couple minutes... Alexa became a part of my life.
So did the fun.
My personal favorite is when I say “Alexa wake me up at (time) and the tone wakes me the next morning. My automatic response is “Alexa, good morning”. She says “good morning” and gives me a brief update of news/weather Then I follow up with “Alexa play top Christian music” - she plays from Amazon free music.
The sound is terrific in the upper apt of my parents house. I’ll be moving into a home in about a month with my wife and son - once my new salary kicks in, I plan on getting a couple more to sync with it around the house. - aaand sell some bulky sound equipment I use for tunes.

I always wanted an Alexa to help me with waking up, playing music, and keeping me on schedule. And she does do that however, there aren't many things you can do without being a prime member. To listen to music you need either apple music or amazon music. I thought maybe it would allow me to link my music that I download from the iTunes store but I can only use the apple music (which I don't have). I'm not a prime member and I don't have any special subscription. I was just a bit disappointed with the lack of things you can do without paying for subscriptions that's all.

reviews.reviewTitle: I like the Echo 3rd Gen all around...
reviews.reviewText:
I like the Echo all around. I’m pleased with the sound. I mostly use it for the music (with Amazon Music). I like how I don’t have to go pull out my little radios. I can just listen to the radio, my playlists, a specific song just by voice. Helps when I’m multitasking. I enjoy the “Reminders” this feature has helped a lot with some of my forgetfulness—sends a reminder to my phone👍

Good bundle deal(s) on the Echo too, got a handful of echos because family members liked the Echo when they saw me using it.

This little guy is my first Echo device, and I love it.

Pros
The sound from the speakers is amazing. My music can fill my room easily. On 10% volume, I can hear my music quite well and little to no sound can be heard from outside my door.
It is placed about a foot from my bed. This device can hear me quite well, even when I whisper to it at night or in the early morning.
It's very portable, however, I don't recommend bringing it everywhere I go, simply because it is not meant to be taken everywhere. If you do want to take it places, for some reason, go ahead?
Brought it to my work before. Even with the loud environment, it still heard me and my coworkers well (most of the time.)
Has plenty of fun stuff (like Easter eggs and games) and useful tools (like checking weather and alarms).
The commands are always quick, unless it has trouble hearing you (which only happened in loud environments.)

Cons
Requires the "Alexa App" to work. The connection is quite easy, but it's the app itself is the problem. It can be ridiculously slow at times, or even buggy. However, the app is needed to add routines and lists via phone.

This little electronic is pretty neat. We have 7 children, so needless to say it makes setting "time-out" timers super easy. Depending on the bedtime those can happen. It's a great little tool to have for grocery list, a little music, dropping in on kids while on a date, as well as asking time/temperature throughout the day.

Like mentioned in other reviews, we dont like how it cuts off songs before their ending, we aren't sure why or how to fix it?

Would buy again at $30.

So I own a Google home and I own an Alexa first generation I still love my Google home and I still use it in my living room but this third generation Alexa is amazing, the sound is way better than the first generation in the sleek look of it matches my room!! I have a complete smart home with smart door locks, smart plugs, and smart thermostat &cameras. Alexa does a great job intergrating all of them!! And I got it for $25 I'm super happy

This thing works surprisingly well, and is a convenient way of controlling my smart outlets, getting the weather, setting timers, etc. Unfortunately Amazon has a terrible track record with privacy issues related to Alexa, which is why I'd rather have an Apple device for this purpose. Equally unfortunately, Apple is pricing their speaker out of reach (I got my echo on sale for $25), so here we are.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not as good as the Dot 2
reviews.reviewText:
I have a couple of the Dot 2's and recently got a Dot3. While the sound quality seems to be better that is largely due to the emphasized low end not necessarily an increased performance across the range.

My primary reason for 2 stars is that I find myself having to repeat commands much more frequently when addressing the 3 over the 2, it is just not as responsive and doesn't seem to respond to the wake word or commands as reliably as my older Dot 2's. If I need more Dots I will continue to look for the 2's and just tie them to a bluetooth or corded speaker for audio output.

My biggest complaint about the Dot 2 (my first)) straight out of the box was the sound quality. I was hugely disappointed to find out that unless you hooked up external speakers you could barely hear it across the room. This newest Dot has no problem being heard across the house. It also combine some of the features from the kids dot and The previous models allowing you to only have one type of unit throughout the house. We now have several of these with the Amazon music service which the kids love and I am very impressed with not only the quality but the price point as well. Nice job Amazon!

reviews.reviewTitle: Does everything as advertised - and more.
reviews.reviewText: I like this because it is easy to use, once you get the correct app from the App Store. You need the Amazon app for it to work easily. Other apps that pop up made me think that was the correct app and they weren’t. There should be a quick link to download the app.. other than that. I love it. Alexa is connected to my Bose sound touch speaker and it sounds great.. using Alexa for shopping list, alarms, appointment reminders, to track packages, play music, etc...i am still investigating all the other things i can use it for.

Knowing how poorly the Echo Dot line had always sounded, I didn’t have much expectations for the new Dot. Amazon, amazingly, has completely blown me away with this generation. There’s some bass with the Dot now and sound 10x better and louder. I’ve had the 1st gen Echo from day one and these definitely beat it by a long shot. After hearing how well it sounded, I decided to get another one for stereo pairing and let me tell you, it’s definitely worth it! Especially since Apple Music is now available on Alexa! Highly recommend for anyone wanting to use their Echo speakers for music.

reviews.reviewTitle: I’m impressed! I’m not in 4th grade!
reviews.reviewText:
I learn more and more things to do with this dot on the daily. Perfect if only used just as a wireless speaker, but why settle for just that?

Note: I didn’t write a 600,000 word thesis to receive my Masters Degree in all things Amazon like some reviewers (ahem, you know who you are) Care to know why? Because I’m living my life and not having a melt down over a $30 product that some people think should be as state of the art as studio grade speakers. It’s a DOT.

If you want better sound, buy a Tom Jones concert ticket. “Woah, woah, pussy cat.....”

This is a piece of crap! 80% of the time it can not find the music I am asking it to play. I just spent 20 frequent minutes of my morning asking it to play yoga and meditation music while it was trying to drive me out of my mind playing some horrific frequency music. I would break it if I didn’t have to earn my money so hard. This device is a waste of money and time! If this is the glorious artificial intelligence, we are all in for a huge trouble and mess.
UPDATE: I upstared my review because the problem was not with Alexa but with Spotify where it either played the wrong music or simply stopped playing in the middle of the playlist. I cancelled Spotify and switched to Amazon music. So far so good. Alexa still can not understand me so I have to control music through the app on the phone, but at least it plays without interruptions.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good so far for my first voice device.
reviews.reviewText: Good, girst experice with a home assistance device. I mainly use it as a speaker to play music from amazon music and spotify. I was happy tonfind out that it also reads books from my kindle collection! Haven't tried many yet, so don't knownif I just got lucky with the one I chose. Wish there was a voice command to mute the mic. Could be combined with a special phrase or word to unmute, so as to only listen to a special frecuency or pattern to unmute the dot. The only option now is to press the mute button, which limits the places where this device can be placed if you want/need to use this feature frequently.

If you are on the fence about buying one, do it now! I bought one for each of my kids rooms - love it. I can talk to them straight to their room from any location - no longer having to wait for them to pick up their phone! I can play music in their room to annoy them if they don't wake up in the morning. They love it too! They use it to play, tell jokes, play music (which when they play an annoying song over and over, you have the ability to change the music). Love the dot.

reviews.reviewTitle: East setup and really a useful addition to our home
reviews.reviewText: I bought the Echo Dot for my husband. We set it up in a few minutes, and used it all weekend. We were impressed with how well the voice recognition worked, and how well Alexa dealt with all the demands we made. We have used a lot of the apps and found this to be really useful. The small size works great just about anywhere in our house or yard. We were able to plug into our larger speakers for great sound, but this was perfect for background music on the porch. We were totally surprised at how much we liked it. Looking forward to trying more features.

reviews.reviewTitle: Massive improvement over previous dot. A+
reviews.reviewText:
Bought this for my son's bedroom. Opened it, synced it to my echo system and it sounds amazing for the size and price. The Echo 2 sounds better but it's more than twice the price. If you're on a budget for an Echo device, this is for you.

Compared to the Echo Dot 2, this new version blows those out of the water. Good bass response, louder, better mids. Doesn't sound like a rotary phone speaker!

Amazon has knocked it out of the park with the new Echo. Don't hesitate to buy one. As always, easy to sync and connect to my other Amazon devices and Philips hue system.

reviews.reviewTitle: The perfect supplement to my Echo 2nd generation!
reviews.reviewText: I hesitated before buying the Echo Dot (3rd Generation). I was very concerned that the sound quality would be too too “tinny”. Even though the sound is not as as rich as my taller Echo 2nd Generation, it is absolutely fine for what I was looking for. It’s nice to have the extra speaker in another room of the house. I call it by another name rather than Alexa. Honestly, the sound is not bad at all; I was actually impressed with it, coming from such a small size! I am very glad I purchased this item!

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to use and great features!
reviews.reviewText: Honestly this is pretty damn awesome! I love how it looks and the performance is amazing. I have a Google mini but I prefer to use this one. Setting up and linking my apps and devices was a piece of cake, anyone can do it. I personally prefer Alexa to be on high volume but you can change it however you want. My daughter loves it, she listens to music on it all the time. This makes life a little easier for us and we love it.

The echo dot has made a big difference! I am ready quicker in the mornings now that I can just ask her for weather, news, music, and my schedule instead of wasting time on myour phone trying to find it all. She's fun to have around during family get-togethers because she can play music loudly and they also have fun asking her questions. Even when I have nothing to do when I get home, I can just ask her to play games or play podcasts or play music. Although she's glitched 3 times already, it's usually easy to just restart it or let it do its thing and wait it out. It's very cool and useful to have around too.

I received a 2nd generation Echo device as a gift and decided to get an updated one. This one has better sound quality than the previous one and is ideal for listening to music. I have this one in the living room and use It throughout the day for reminders, timers, music, games, and more. I put the other one n my bedroom and use it to listen to sleep sounds and for the alarm, mostly. I’ve been trying to get multi room music to work for me but it is frustrating. Overall, I love the Echo device and am glad I bought it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Amazon did an amazing job on the audio
reviews.reviewText: I have the second generation Echo Dot, the second generation Echo, and now this 3rd generation Echo Dot. I can safely tell you that this little 3rd gen. echo dot is a huge leap over the 2nd gen. one in terms of audio and build quality. It gets very loud for a little speaker and would be perfect for a large bedroom or even a kitchen. I use this to set alarms, turn off xmas decorations and lights around the house etc. Love the product do not hesitate especially if you can get it on sale! (i purchased this with a smart plug for 30 bucks on amazon because they were running a deal on it)

The Amazon Echo Dot is a good item if all you want to do is play music or use it with home automation. I tried to listen to podcasts I'm subscribed to and most of the ones I ask Alexa to play she gets wrong or can't find. If I would have known Alexa didn't play podcasts such as iMore, No Agenda, Mac Geek Gab or Vector with Rene Ritchie, I would have opted for another brand of smart speaker.

Ok I bought one to give it a try... I'm old school an not completely up on this new technology. But I love it! I love just asking Alexa to put things on my shopping list and it goes right to the app on my phone. I like being able to just say Alexa remind me... an she adds it to my calendar. I took it last night to my dads and we had a great time playing games, and he liked being able to listen to old country songs. So I now have purchased 3 more for other rooms and for a gift. I cant wait to figure out what else she can do.

after contacting amazon about their "wonderful alexa" I've deceided to contact better business bureau and consumer protection,,,,,,amazon so badly wants you to buy their product however they LACK in customer service. Alex will NOW NOT play from my pandora account,,,,,,really dont care for amazon music, or prime music not a fan........PLEASE by the google speaker, you'll be happier

We use all 3 of our dots for music, nothing crazy, thats what my Klipsch subs are for. Anyway, all 3 have developed a tingy sound with the mid and high notes, a clear sign of a blown voice coil. Normal use at 50% or less volume, Im sure Amazon can verify that with how much detail is stored within the dot. Anyway, we bought small computer speakers to plug in so the dots speakers are no longer used.

Alexa itself is pretty solid for basic and mid level instruction, like adding things to a shopping list or setting a timer.

It’s both helpful and fun. I have reminders set at different times of the day for the kids. My son’s service dog even has a reminder for dinner. And she knows when it goes off what time it is and she runs for the dining room. It’s helpful for the kids when they want to know the weather before getting ready. The also use for other things including playing music or to meditate when needed.

For under $30 you can't go wrong with this. It's small and so cool looking (3rd gen especially). How can something this small sound so good. Perhaps some sort of black magic that Amazon employs to make this quality product, I'm unsure. Of course it's much more than a speaker to listen to your favorite music on. Alexa will keep you company all day if you want. Sometimes I set her beside me and just pretend that she's sitting with me, binge watching something on Amazon Prime Movies. She gets me, she really does. Now I think I have gone to far, have I? I never know. :)

Received as a gift from mt daughter. I have been very impressed with the little device so far. It has very good at detecting and accurately interpreting voice interactions. The responses have been helpful and relevant to queries. Sound quality has been very good, especially considering its small size. Music playback is nice and rich, just don't expect to be thumping gas-rich tunes at loud volumes without some distortion. And of course, if you are a big Amazon user, the Amazon integration is superior.

reviews.reviewTitle: They can be very helpful with tasks around the house.
reviews.reviewText: I have these all over the house. I love the ability to play music everywhere. It also tells me when there is motion detected at the front door. I use it to turn lights on and off also. When someone leaves the house or television on and I am in bed I can just ask the Echo to turn everything off. This will come in handy this winter. I haven’t yet used it to re-order products we use often but, I am sure I will soon. The speaker quality is really nice. Much improved over the earlier models.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love it but I’m sad about the new power supply
reviews.reviewText:
For all previous echo dots, the power supply was an AC to USB adapter, and a female USB to male mini USB cable. This was a nice feature because even when the Echo Dot is obsolete, the adapter and cable will still be useful. Unfortunately on this new model, the AC to DC adapter and cable are one unit and the cable is a round connector rather than USB. Thus, it is unlikely it can be reused. This is a loss because they will produce millions of these, and the world already has too much e-waste.

Otherwise a nice little thing, but I disagree with this new design.

POS, can't get it to work properly with my original echo.....if we have them both on, it floods our network so bad, the WLAN light on our router stays on steady.

update 8-8-2019
My husband has had 3 calls from customer service shortly after I posted this. My husband is VERY technically expert especially with networking stuff (as a matter of fact, the first 2 calls he got were from people who did not know ANYWHERE near as much about troubleshooting this problem and he did). The 3rd call he at least spoke with someone that was technically competent. They worked together for a couple of hours or so and could not come up with a cause or solution. The person he talked to said they would research it some more and get back to him in 2 weeks but that's now been about 5-6 weeks ago. Obviously, they have no clue.

There are two things I love about the new echo dot, music quality and the ability to set a routine.

For such a small and affordable device, you would be amazed at how high quality the speakers are. I am blown away at the deep bass and high treble you can hear. Honestly, if I had known the sound is this good on the Dot, I would have probably upgraded to the Echo or Echo plus.

Routines are my favorite part about the Dot. I wake up every morning to my favorite Spotify playlist, the morning news, and my daily commute. Would recommend and buy again for my other rooms.

Three times it has had issues playing music. It does not happen every time, but sometimes the music has a very loud sound like the tweeter is blown. It has somewhat better sound quality than the generation 2 Dot, but only on music. When Alexa speaks there is way too much base. Other than that it is OK and seems to work. After chatting with Amazon they suggested I reboot the device. I did so and played the same song and the issue seemed to be fixed. So it leaves me wondering if it is a hardware or a software issue. In any case it does not work as well as my older dot.

reviews.reviewTitle: I love access to everything without using phone/computer
reviews.reviewText: I mainly use to play games with daughter and listen to music although the bass sounds boomy and full something about it is not right. Her voice sounds great with the standard settings but I find certain songs clip even at low volumes (for example Metallica's ...And Justice for All-notorious for not even having bass) although most anything sounds pretty good through it anyway. There are EQ settings too. Im not going to complain about a $30 device that does tons of stuff. Favorite feature so far is having Alexa play rain noise so I can fall asleep. I sleep like a baby.

Pretty good device for the money. At just over $20 when we purchased it’s a bargain in my opinion. The only issue I have had is the speaker quality. I don’t have a problem with it because of the price but don’t expect to be blown away with the sound quality. Sometimes Alexa doesn’t pick your voice up but I expect that to be a learning curve along with our noisy house. We have confused the heck out of her because of all the talking but she has yet to crash. Overall not bad. I do like the Bluetooth connection.

reviews.reviewTitle: Only real complaint is Voice Recognition
reviews.reviewText: As a whole I love the Alexa product line. Before buying any Echo Dots, which at the time the 2nd generation was the most recent version, I had read reviews about how great the voice recognition was and how the dot would pick up the users commands even with the TV on etc. This has not been my experience, both with the 2nd gen and 3rd gen. I was hoping the 3rd gen would be better. I mainly only use Alexa for security and smart home functionality with the Ring skill and the voice recognition is my only real complaint with the product. My living room, dining room and kitchen area is a mostly open floor plan and approx. 1200 sq. ft. and I've tried all kinds of configurations with the goal being me being able to speak at my normal voice level or even slightly louder with the TV on and no matter where I am at and Alexa picking me up the first time and I have not been able to achieve this or really even close to it. Sometimes I have to almost yell. I have the dots plugged directly into outlets using 3rd party holders as I'm a minimalist and like to keep the clutter to a minimum. I have 4, all 3rd gen, and they are spaced pretty evenly apart. I don't have the TV off very much when I'm at home but I believe voice recognition is not an issue when its turned off even if i dropped it down to only 1 or 2 dots.

reviews.reviewTitle: Setting this up to pair with your Echo is a freaking nightmare. I hate your app Help!
reviews.reviewText: I ordered an Echo so I could have the same music played in another part of the house. After days of trying to set this up, I am ready to return both of Alexa to you. I have asked others about setting this up they have had the same issue. Now I only have music playing out of the Dot in the bedroom, No music will play on my Echo. This insane that you do not make the pairing of these simple. I may mail back both of your devices. This is a nightmare of something that should be made simple. And your App on the phone to set this up stinks! A useless amont of money to spend on this product.

reviews.reviewTitle: 2 out of 3 Echo Dots quite playing music
reviews.reviewText: I've worked with customer support on the problem with my 2nd Echo Dot(3rd generation). The problem is when playing music it will stop mid song after a couple of minutes, wait 30 seconds and then start playing a totally new song. I've done everything customer support told me and nothing changed. My 1st Echo Dot does not have this problem Finally decided to replace the 2nd Echo Dot with a new one. The new one came and had the same exact problem. Tried everything I did with customer service and still no resolution. These Echo Dots were my initial test for deciding what platform to use for smart home devices in my new house. While the first Echo Dot works great, the fact that these latest two do not work and customer support has no resolution leaves me thinking that Amazon may not be in my future new house.

reviews.reviewTitle: Needs better app connections & skills communication
reviews.reviewText:
So I always have trouble getting Alexa to connect to Spotify, that's one thing; I have to open it on my phone in order to get it to play, and if I ask Alexa to just play something she won't pull from recent playlists on Spotify, she will search other music libraries, which makes it harder to play stuff I actually want to hear.
For the skills, the commands to start skills are not sensible, and even if I ask Alexa to find a skill to provide a particular service, there isn't much luck. I have to search the app myself.
Also, it is inconvenient that I can't ask Alexa specific questions, such as what the temperature is right at that moment, that could easily be searched online but instead Alexa just provides the default answer of that entire days outlook.

Excellent, I received the desired product (Echo Dot).
It is a very advanced technological product, it is easy to program and it is implemented to provide support in the different academic processes of the University, which is excellent. Amazon, are the best, a very committed supplier, I recommend that purchases be 100% reliable. The items are new and in good condition. I recommend it to all those interested and friends meet their expectations. Thank you. It has features that allow you to perform numerous tasks facilitating work managed by smart devices.

I have the 2nd generation Echo that we use in the living room to turn the living room and family room lights on and off. When Amazon has the 3rd generation on sale if we buy 2, I purchase the white Echo. One for our daughter's bedroom and one for the Master bedroom. My daughter uses it to listen to Amazon music and set the ocean wave sound at night to help her sleep. I use it to listen to local news and for weather or if I need information and don't necessarily want to grab my phone or power on the computer. The sound quality is very good for a device not much larger than a hockey puck.

This little guy works great. I bought a fire TV cube a month or so earlier and I love the Alexa on that. I saw this at 50% off for prime day and I knew I couldn't pass the deal up. I have it in the same room as my cube currently. But it doesn't seem to cause much of a problem. Itll just got through which ever I'm closer to. Once I move out it should be much more useful in separate rooms. The color is great, very sleek and good for blending in. Speakers are pretty good. Not the best, but they definitely do the job.
Overall very happy.

With Amazon Echo the connection is almost endless you could do so much with it.. I'm already turning my apartment into a smart apartment.. definitely I need to buy another one so I can have one in the kitchen..since all my light bulb in my whole entire apartment is Philip hue, both of my air conditioners a smart AC,and a few smart plugs.. so pretty much everything in the house is digital so I can voice control almost everything here .. except the TV I will soon will be getting the fire TV cube

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa is the friend in the room
reviews.reviewText: I bought one form for myself and then one for my 52 year old brother who resides in a nursing home due to various medical conditions. Nursing homes are not considered extremely social environments and this makes Lon's stay monotonous. Having Alexa at his side allows him to actually have another voice in his room and connects him with various outlets that are otherwise not available in that kind of housing. He listens to his favorite music at will, checks on the news etc. I am very happy to help make his circumstances just a bit better and his life just a bit fuller.

I have (1) Echo & (2) Echo dots. Of course they are second to none for entertainment, but I need them for a more practical purpose. I am a full time caregiver, I use the Echo's for turning on and off lights, for entertainment of my patient but most important I use the "drop in" communication to monitor my patient while sleeping and communicate with her when she is awake. I am not through, I am going to add to the system as soon as I can afford it in order to enhance safety of my patient.

I did not think I needed a voice assistant/music player until I received an Echo Dot (3rd Gen) as a gift. I bought the unlimited music monthly subscription from Amazon, and it's awesome even though you have to buy a subscription for each device. Now, I use Alexa to regularly play music, set timers/alarms, and get weather reports, and there are a lot of other features which I am still learning about. I love the Echo Dot (3rd Gen) so much that I bought six of these to give as gifts, and they were really well received.

the device is Wonderfull, it does understand my broken English, sound is nice for a kitchen radio, it finds the a radio station of my liking right away, "Alexa play 80s", I have music in my kitchen right away......... so you are in the US go and buy one, for it is a very good deal.... If you are outside US it is hassle to setup because you have to change stores to download the app and after all that struggle I find out that I can not connect my Apple Music in my region!! so watchout all the users outside US....you may still use it but without your streaming

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Upgrade, Sound Quality is Amazing
reviews.reviewText: Bought this on a Prime Day deal and have been very happy with the purchase. We have a 2nd Generation Echo and a first Generation Dot (as well as the newest Google Mini) - and the sound quality on this product seems superior to all of them. Very simple to set up and we love how it integrates with the rest of our Amazon Smart Speakers. The "Announce" feature, for example, can be a fun and useful tool when you have them scattered throughout a large home. There are so many uses for this product but one of my favorites is scheduling reminders. You will get voice alerts at the given day/time, as well as a phone notification from the Alexa App. The streaming music via Amazon Prime provides a nice selection without needing to upgrade to a music subscription. Also, great for white noise while going to sleep. The new generation (we have Heather Gray) is very sleek looking as well You won't be disappointed with this purchase.

reviews.reviewTitle: Somewhat better than 2nd generation Echo Dot
reviews.reviewText: I have 3 of the 2nd generation Echo Dots and I am very pleased with them. I couldn't pass up the Black Friday deal price on this 3rd generation and bought 2 of these. They are a little bit larger (in height) than the 2nd gen and the volume is a bit louder with more bass than the 2nd gen. The third 2nd gen is in the baby's room and I use it for white noise and other soothing sounds so it is not a priority to replace it. All the Echo Dots work well with voice command and I have it connected to my Nest Thermostat, smart plugs, and Wyse Security Cameras. The 3rd gen are a keeper

I let it just sit there and wondered what the heck good was it? Really did not do anything spectacular and Alexa was already in my Fire Stick........ Moved it to the bedroom at it immediately replaced the alarm clock, can just tell it when I want an alarm set, wake up and ask it what the weather is right now and what it will be later. Fixing to install Ring security and will see how well it interfaces with that. Just for clock , temp/weather it was worth it and I’ll just have to discover what else it’s good for. Hope they have the listening in under control...

reviews.reviewTitle: Beware of refurbish echo dot 3rd gen
reviews.reviewText:
I finally got an echo dot 3rd gen that is working great. The 2 previous dot gens stopped working in lest that 2 weeks. I ordered the echo show 2nd gen and echo dot 3rd gen in July during the sale days. The first one broke down after 2 weeks. I got a replacement in a timely manner, next day. After one day the second one broke wouldn't work, wouldn't respond to commands and the light would randomly change colors.

I had some suspicions about the dots. I spoke to a supervisor and asked if the dots were refurbished, I was told yes. The supervisor said another one would be sent out next day. I asked if it would be a refurbish one, supervisor said it could be and there was no way to know if I would get a new one.
The supervisor suggested I buy a new one to ensure I would not get a refurbish one. I had to buy it, but would be reimbursed.
There must be some quality control problems on so-called certified refurnish products.
Be sure to asked if you ever have to return a new purchase, will it be a new one or refurbish.

reviews.reviewTitle: More of an Alex than an Alexa
reviews.reviewText: Though generally a very good experience, Alexa has selective stubbornness, like a husband. So she's also known as Alex now and then. Every once in awhile, we have to cut the power for 20 seconds and reboot the Echo so that she'll start responding to commands again. It would also be nice if we could have more integration between units in different rooms. Instead, it goes off on long dissertations on things not explained in any literature on how to go into protracted processes to get the two to work together.

Called Amazon 4 times within last month for this echo dot and other issues with the 12 devices I've purchased within the last year and roughly 1 month and still have gotten no where! The dot that just keeps spinning is the replacement Amazon sent me for the defective one I sent back. Now I've spent hours unplugging, uninstalling, re-installing, deleting groups, re-adding groups etc and still can not get help or devices to do what they were advertised to do!

reviews.reviewTitle: Terrible sound quality. It's called a speaker, but it's more like a muffled mess.
reviews.reviewText: I have something like 5 different Alexa devices and this is my least favorite. Why? The sound quality is terrible. It's supposed to be a speaker so I assumed that the sound would be at least as good as a regular Dot. Nope. It sounds muffled and there is no volume level that sounds good. It sounds like it's speaking through a blanket or heavy winter scarf. I do like the look of this one, but the sound "quality" makes it my very least favorite Echo -- by far.

reviews.reviewTitle: Amazon Alexa Echo Dot is the Best!!!
reviews.reviewText:
This small device is Awesome.

High Build Quality. Decent Sound Quality. Durable, Wifi-connection is great.

Voice reception and response is very fast. It can also understand your voice even in noisy conditions.

It can do lot of things: listen to music, ask weather report, general knowledge questions, bed time stories. There is no limit for this small intelligent device.

Great device and great invention from Amazon.

I’m an Apple guy. I used to work for Apple Retail and have used the HomePod and Apple Music extensively. I got the Echo Dot for free with the purchase of a Ring Doorbell.

Alexa is doing great! She picks up what I’m saying quickly and responds aptly. I haven’t even called her bad names yet, as Siri has taken a tongue lashing from me.
