In the same breath, she responds more quickly and more thoroughly because she is remembering all my conversations, and as we have recently learned, these conversations are being sent out to be listened to. Siri does not remember prior conversations for privacy reasons, which is a higher moral standard, but less effective in the short term.

But that’s okay, because you can turn off the settings that allows Alexa to send your audio out to be listened to.

Amazon Music is okay, but the library is nowhere near as large as Apple Music and couldn’t play some of my favorite albums.

But that’s okay, as I was able to easily set up my Apple Music account through the Alexa app and now I just tell Alexa to tell Siri to play my Apple Music. Alexa has an assistant, and her name is Siri.

The bass is almost nonexistent in this little Dot, with a lot of low-mid trying to cover it, which is does an alright job of. The mids and highs are nice.

But that’s okay, because it has a headphone jack and I just plugged it into my existing stereo.

I haven’t tried any of the higher functions yet, but right out of the box and the first week have been impressive.

Things are best when they are free.

I got my youngest kid a second generation one. What? He's not an audiophile and still can crank it up too loud. This one is for me. Says it all, right? It's an alarm clock. It's a stereo. It's NPR. It controls the lights. It's Alexa. They sound is good, with great tone, shockingly pleasing bass. Amazon ability to create stereo in a near-Bose fashion is impressive. Of course my main room has a full-size Echo (with a planned subwoofer) but this is a superior tiny music machine. Amazon is practically giving these away to get us hooked - and it works. But I can quit any time I want.

reviews.reviewTitle: A needed item in your house!
reviews.reviewText:
We are getting use to Alexa. Quick with answers to your questions or requests.
We'll come into the room where she is and sometimes she is singing or spouting off
some wikipedia information we never asked for. Only concern is the listening 24/7 to
our conversations. My understanding is that information is recorded and used by
Amazon for reference selling in the future. "Privacy is gone!" Yes, I'm concerned, and,
am telling "Alexa" to STOP many times a day now. Hope they stop using our information
without our permission.

Big sound from such a small device. However it don't seem to hear me as good as the original echo dot, it also seems slower to respond. Many times my TV or me talking wakes it up and it starts talking about random garbage. I wish it knew it's wake word and only woke up when it heard "Alexa".

I can wake it up by saying many different words that don't even ryme with Alexa. I figured by now they would update it, but they just leave it broken. Another annoyance, over 90 percent of my questions are answered with, "I don't know that". or similar.

reviews.reviewTitle: Sound died after 8 months Amazon will not stand by their replacement warranty of a year
reviews.reviewText: Although my account says it is available for a replacement of up to 1 year after purchase, I spent 3 days with their "customer service" only to find the actual warranty is for 90 days and the "replacement warranty" is not for my device (which is still listed as active under my account). They offered me a trade in and 25% off another device. When I went to the link, my device is not offered as a trade in either, and they asked if I wanted a 15% discount instead. I will not buy another amazon echo. If it breaks after 90 days, you are out of luck. Do not waste your money

First thing that I did was change the recognition word from Alexa. Otherwise you are watching a YouTube video about Echo and they start saying Alexa and you echo starts responding. I was surprised at how good the voice recognition is, there is only occasional times when it doesn't recognize what I am saying. It seems to have problems with letters more so than words. When I want to listen to a radio station and say the call sign letters it often gets the wrong one. But for controlling things around the housing and asking questions it is very good and interpreting my speech.

reviews.reviewTitle: Sounds great, software has taken a huge step back from generation one
reviews.reviewText: The sound is so good that it comes close to the Echo units. The 1st and 2nd generation Echo dots are laughable awful sounding compared to this generation. When the previous models came out, you were able to upload a few songs but now the only way is to have a prime account directly attached. This unit is on an account that is under a prime account but does not have access to same features. So I am stuck with the few songs that have been purchased through amazon and then Pandora or other streaming services.

reviews.reviewTitle: I dont know if I like who I am with Alexa
reviews.reviewText: Alex is still so robotic and basic. We have lots of misunderstandings in our relationship. Sometimes I feel like I'm always yelling. I don't know if I like who I have become in this relationship. I feel like Alexa was fing with me for the fun of it the other day. I don't feel like she really listens to me lots of times. AMD sometimes I feel blown off and ignored by here responses. Not sure this is my forever relationship, but we have had some food times. I guess I just hooed that we would have progressed more by this point.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not worth having more than one unless u like to spend more money
reviews.reviewText: Nothing like the amazon echo regular this one is stuck on stupid. Asked over 10 simple questions and can not get an answer. Also its not able to play music while another device is streaming music. All this technology and i need to pay for more services. Upgrade to a family plan or so. I already pay enough for prime service plus the cost of a large one and then the dot plus smart light bulbs and now spend more money so 2 devices can stream. What a disappointment

We have a few echo dots throughout the house. Awesome sound for such a small device. Definitely recommend linking these with any other echo devices on the “everywhere” setting to get a whole house surround sound effect. Great product.

I got this as a Christmas gift. I had been eyeing a lot of amazon smart home products and was lucky enough to receive this wonderful, generous gift. It's been a lot of fun. I'm admittedly a bit creeped out by the warning about how Alexa records everything going on in the background (she certainly has some good blackmail material at this point). I've had a little trouble integrating some skills, and for others it feels impossible to find the app that goes with the skill (apple vs google thing?) but overall i'm so happy with this product. I would definitely recommend it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Spend the few extra dollars and get the 3rd Generation Dot!
reviews.reviewText: If you are like me and have the 2nd generation dot then you know the speaker is "lacking" the microphone is temperamental and let's face it there is going to come a point where the 2nd gen Dot just won't support some of the new things Amazon is adding to the Echo's. The 3rd generation Dot sounds a ton better, its clearer, louder and has multiple microphones built in so it can understand you a lot better. I replaced my 2nd gen Dot's on Prime Day 2019 and couldn't be happier!

reviews.reviewTitle: Does not play well with Samsung a smart TV
reviews.reviewText:
The product itself works great however it does NOT like my Samsung Smart tv. Once paired w tv it worked once & then audio went mute. This is a similar problem I am having w my new 4K fire stick. Once I unpaired it from my tv the audio work fine. So buyer beware of amazon products & samsung products.
When I called customer service they try to blame it on the tv or my WiFi connection & when u call tv service they blame it on WiFi or amazon. It’s just not worth the headache for me & my try alternative non amazon products to replace them ex. Google chrome cast or google home.

Alexa’s nickname is “Worthless” in our house. Doesn’t enable you to voice select for individual programs. Sometimes just doesn’t work at all when you give it a voice command. It will stop and resume your program fairly reliably. Other than that, can’t say it’s done much to make our viewing easier. The remote that came with our fire stick is the only reliable way to control our set. We don’t care about having some dumb joke told to us or what a sports score is.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to set up, fun, and useful.
reviews.reviewText:
I wasn't looking to purchase this product but when I saw it was 50% off on Black Friday, I decided to buy it. It was very easy to set up and begin using. I quickly learned how to make a shopping list, play music from a local radio station, ask Alexa various questions, and send messages to people I knew that owned an Alexa device. I even had Alexa telling me jokes. That was the end of my knowledge of what the Echo Dot could do.

About a month after I purchased it, I came across a book called "Amazon Echo Dot" by C. J. Andersen on a free book website I subscribe to. This book was specifically written for the 3rd Generation Echo Dot. I am only 20% through the book and now have learned how to connect my Echo Dot to my smart phone calendar, TIVO, and blue tooth. Alexa now tells me what is on my calendar and can change the channels on my TV just by asking. I know that I will learn a lot more of its capabilities as I continue to read more. I am very glad I purchased the 3rd Generation Echo Dot.

Never thought I’d enjoy an Echo but truth be told I do. It’s extremely convenient for quick questions that you need quick and simple answers to. It’s nice to be able to have Alexa perform certain tasks on command like playing certain songs, setting timers, or anything in between. The only flaw of course is that it can be glitchy. It doesn’t always quite hear your voice commands or follows them so you find yourself repeating the same thing to a computer multiple times. I’ve had to unplug it too just so it can reboot. It can definitely be frustrating but it’s worth the price for what you want it for.

These Echoes are small but versatility and convenient. A nice feature is that with 2 of them you can link them as stereo speakers (just for streaming music services). I got one for free as part of a bundle with Echo Show 5 and bought the second one for less than $25 so it was a great deal. With echo dot it can fill my whole house with it's audio. It is a small device but you will be satisfied with the volume. Plus Alexa is so friendly. LOL! You can ask for the weather, play with your favorite music actually there's a lot to discover what Alexa can do in a very fun and exciting way, she can even tell a joke!

reviews.reviewTitle: can't listen to my audible throughout my house with my multiple devices!
reviews.reviewText:
I find it strange that I can't listen to my audible that is owned by Amazon throughout my house with my multiple devices!!! That was one of the reasons I got 2 devices! Many people like to listen to Audible as you know. Why is this not an option?! I pay for my books, I pay for my Alexa speakers, I pay for my internet, so why is it that I can't listen to them? Who decided that? So we have a God sitting in Amazon that will decide who can do what and when?
This is very interesting.

I've been using Google Home for some time and it adapts to my behavior and accent. The fact that I have to personally add skills to Alexa even they concern Amazon's own software such as Fire TV is annoying. Alexa sometimes has trouble understanding my accent. That never happened with Google Home. Also I cannot integrate Alexa easily with my calendar, e-mail, traffic and I cannot ask it to translate as I can now do with Google Home. I think that Google Assistant is a much more advanced product and it suits better my needs. Sorry Amazon.

My original Echo was the full canister size, generation two. But this new smaller Echo dot, generation 3, has just as high quality of sound. Echo is like personal computers--I don't know how I ever lived my life before Alexa (the voice of the Echo) arrived, and I can't imagine not having her now! I get my daily "flash briefing" news, ask for the day's weather report every morning to help me decide how to dress that day, enjoy listening to TED Talks and NPR radio live while I'm cooking, and music while I'm relaxing. (To get a huge variety of music selections, it helps to be a member of Amazon Prime.). But I find it most useful when I have a question; I no longer have to go to an encyclopedia or type my request on the computer. I can just say, "Alexa, spell (put in a word)." "Alexa, who won the World Series in 1992?" "Alexa, what is on NBC television tonight?" etc. Plus its jokes will totally turn your bad day into a happy day!

Honestly I never thought I’d own one of these things but there was a deal for cyber Monday we couldn’t pass up, so we got one! We have it in our living room, and hooked up 2 smart bulbs to 2 main lamps we use. I will say it was VERY difficult to get the WiFi connection set up so that the bulbs and the Echo could connect and the Echo to turn them on. Not sure what happened but overnight the connection wasn’t successful. The set up process through the Echo so that the smart bulbs will turn on/off/dim is also very tedious, but it’s worth it. It takes some getting used to it comes in handy.

After getting an Echo Plus for Christmas, we thought we would add purchase Echo Dots in the bedroom and in basement. We love our Echo Plus and have a light bridge and set up Philips Hue lights in groups according to room. When we set up the dots they worked for a few minutes then refused to see the light groups. I called Amazon to help figure out what is wrong and did a factory re-set on the dot device, which helped see the lights for about 15 minutes and then stopped seeing the light groups again. I am done. No one has time for that. It's supposed to be fun and helpful, not annoying and time consuming! The dots are going back to the store today.

Very happy with the 3rd gen Dot. I had previously gotten the 1st gen when it came out and did not like the sound from it at all. Its improved a lot with the new version, no more 'tinny' sound. I really like the new design as well, its not just a plastic disc. The edges are rounded a bit and the side has a cloth like covering which makes it a lot more attractive and gives it a bit of 'grip'. Got my echo in the kitchen so wanted this for the bedroom, music is definitely better than previous versions and the microphones were very responsive even with ambient noises playing.

My goodness. I was not really sure that I wanted to purchase this item but after my hubby expressed interest I decided to get it for him as a Christmas gift. It turned out to the best belly laughs that we have had in a long time. We listened to our girls (ages 5 and 6) talk to Alexa for over an hour. They were desperately trying to hold a conversation and on several occasions told Alexa she was their new best friend. They were concerned when she would not answer (because they did not say Alexa first). We overheard the crazy request for Michal Jackson Christmas music, and several questions like how many animals are in the world and how much meat is there? We also learned how many candies there are and how many people to eat them. All day long the girls have asked me what our computer's name is and how many Taylor Swift songs she knows. It has been so much fun to watch my kids play with Alexa. I can't wait to see what else it can do besides make us laugh so much.

reviews.reviewTitle: DO NOT BUY THIS HORRIBLE PRODUCT
reviews.reviewText:
Very disappointed in this product. Only responds to very specific demands/requests. Won’t play music that I’ve already downloaded from iTunes without manually doing it on my phone itself after having to pair it via Bluetooth. Also cannot connect to more than one device at a time. If I want to play music with my phone but want to use dual speakers I would have to use an aux cord to connect the two speakers. For the price, this product is a definite no.

UPDATE: downgraded from 2 stars to 1. Would give it zero if I had that option. It constantly disconnects from WiFi and doesn’t automatically reconnect afterwards. I’m forced to go through the whole set up from the beginning. Also some of the skills it offers are glitchy, offering paid-for upgrades that don’t work even after shelling out the extra money.

I wished I had returned this product when I still had the chance. But I was optimistic that things would get better once I got used to it and all of its limitations. Sadly, it got considerably worse and now I’m stuck with a piece of junk.

Ok, so honestly the best part about Alexa is I can scream from the other room and she will listen and answer me. My own husband and kids don't even do that. I never have to repeat myself, she's polite, and she always answers back in a polite tone. If it takes owning a speaker to be heard in my household then by God I'm doing it.

Added bonus, my husband is convinced she records all of our conversations and hates being around her. I like to randomly move her into whatever room he's in and watch the hilarity unfold. If she really is recording us then whoever is in charge of listening and reviewing said conversations will be thoroughly entertained and will probably seek psychological help for our household with all the talk of poop and farts.

reviews.reviewTitle: I like it even better than the big boy
reviews.reviewText: I owned the expensive original Echo. Had it 2 or 3 years but it broke. I was leery that the dot wouldn't have good sound quality or be loud enough-wrong! It sounds just like the original at one third the price. Added bonus: it's so small, I can hide it behind a lamp (my wife doesn't like the way any of them look) and it's entirely inconspicuous there, but works great. I keep finding new uses for it all the time - honestly, I wouldn't want to live without one now.

reviews.reviewTitle: Does what I wanted it to do
reviews.reviewText:
I admittedly bought this echo dot for one purpose: to replace my xbox one kinect on the new xbox I got that doesn't support the old device. I missed the voice commands to turn it on, off, pause, etc... and so this was the next best thing.

For the $30 I spent, I'm quite happy with it's performance. It understands me 99% of the time and is quick to perform tasks. The sound output is surprisingly clear considering the size and form factor. I have found it's basic capabilities (e.g. setting reminders, timers, routines, etc...) to be useful as well.

I haven't had my Echo Dot (3rd Gen) very long and haven't used it much, as I can't ask Alexa to order me a pizza or anything like that as I live in a very rural town that doesn't have a Pizza place or any nationally known stores. But I do ask Alexa to play my favorite songs, ask her for the News, and she gives me Word of the Day, then a brief news synopsis, then she tells me what the weather is going to be for my town. I am learning to use my Echo Dot and am sure I will use it more and more. I also printed the Alexa questions I can ask her, and will use more of them as I progress.

reviews.reviewTitle: Sounds good. It’s nice looking and it was on sale.
reviews.reviewText: Here’s why I marked it a little less than 5. We bought it to play Spotify. I have amazon music and also and Alexa and 3 dots. We wanted this one specifically for the significant other to use to play Spotify. It says you can but we can’t figure out how no matter how hard we try. So that’s why I didn’t give it 5 stars. Hard to use for anything but Bluetooth and amazon and no we still have no clue how to play Spotify not via Bluetooth so if you do shoot me a message.

I love that this is so weighty and sturdy. The sound get's nice and loud and clear. It's the perfect color so it's not hard to find. The button's are clearly marked which I love. Blends in with my room's theme perfectly. I just got it yesterday so more to be disclosed.
Update
I loved it so much I bought another for my relative, and she couldn't be happier. Looking forward to shopping for a nice holster for the walls. Not just yet, but we'll see what happens.

reviews.reviewTitle: Fun to use, but TERRIBLE sound quality!
reviews.reviewText: We are having so much fun with the Echo Dot 3rd Generation! It was extremely easy to set up, only about 10 minutes between the unboxing and first “Alexa” query. The only thing we don’t like about it is the terrible sound quality, and I do mean terrible! I’ve adjusted the sound several times (bass, mid-range, treble), but the sound remains muffled and has too much bass. I would exchange this Alexa for another model, but other than for the sound, we have no reason to upgrade because we don’t have a “smart house” and the other features would be useless to us.

Overall these are pretty good devices. They don't drop wifi connection like Amazon's smartplugs do and generally can do what is requested. That said the voice recognition is sub-par to Googles. If you've ever done something "custom" like make a shopping list you'll be amused by the interesting (but similar) things it puts in there that are only similar in sound to what you said. I also once set up a lamp and it asked for a name so I said lamp, it named it lamb. Things like that. That said by varying the names of your devices it is built to "guess" what you meant and generally works correctly even if its extremely clear at this point to me these things don't hear all that great.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great speaker but Microphone not as responsive
reviews.reviewText: The speaker on this Echo is a huge improvement over previous dots, especially considering the low price point. The only complaint is that the microphone doesn't seem as responsive. I have to speak much louder for it to hear me sometimes. Also the speaker is so loud that any volume above 6 or 7 rules out Alexa hearing you while music is playing, unless you stand right next to it and yell. But the biggest benefit is that you don't really need a bluetooth speaker to make this sound good with music like previous dots.

Won't connect to WiFi no matter what I do. I've read everything and looked up tutorials, nothing fixed it. I've built my own gaming PC and I have smart gadgets everywhere in my house, so I'm definitely not a novice on the subject, but this just plain out does not work.

reviews.reviewTitle: Wonderful for sight impaired or handicapped people.
reviews.reviewText: I wanted and received an Echo Dot for Christmas, as my vision is very poor and I could no longer set my alarm clock. Someone in computer class had mentioned they use it for an alarm and talking without their phone. It is easily set up with an app on your cellphone and can dial anyone listed on your cellphone, just by telling it to call so-and-so. It is not as knowledgeable as Google or Suri, but gives temperature, time and answers many questions. There is corresponding equipment you can buy to make it do other things, like change your thermostat and turn lights on or off, etc. I request various types of musican artists, and command the volume up, down or off. This is a God send for sight impaired or handicapped people. I had to buy a second one, so I could have one on each floor of my house. I was impressed with the sound quality, for such a small item. I am not knowledgeable about the larger Alexa's, etc., but assume they would do even more. I got this on sale for $30.00. More than worth the money! I only gave it 4 stars out of 5, because it doesn't know the answer to quite a few questions I ask it.

Sound quality is a little too much bass and muffled. Maybe there's a way to change it but I haven't looked. I find this very useful just trying random things, like when in cooking saying "Set a timer for 30 minutes" and it just works. I'm having less success with custom commands. If you teach her "Turn off the living room lights" it's all well and good, but she won't have a clue what "Turn the living room lights off" means, so you better have a good memory of what you want her to know. As an aside, Alexa is smart enough to know to be quiet immediately when you swear at her ;)

I bought this on promo and i love it. My poor Alexa has taken on about half of the random questions i get from our four kids per day. How far away is christmas, what is 1 million plus 2 million, who sings this song we are listening to etc. The music and shopping lists are awesome. Being able to remotely access a shopping list is awesome since we were using a whiteboard i had to be home to see. We are only using 3 features so far and i am already in love.

reviews.reviewTitle: Man, does this thing use a lot of bandwidth!
reviews.reviewText: Streaming on any other device slows to a crawl when this item is functioning. I like its responses most of the time. There are times it thinks I asked it to turn off the lights (none are connected) but that might be the way I ask it to perform. I've only tried a few skills and they all seem to have flaws, usually with sound quality. I think overall it's a good product, but the bandwidth issue needs to be fixed.

reviews.reviewTitle: Fun to have but seem to crap out eventually.
reviews.reviewText: To start off I received and amazon echo one of the first generations for free from my bank which caused a ripple effect of me buying one of the dots to have in another room. Slowly they just started getting slower and slower so I ordered two of these around Christmas time to replace my older ones and put the older ones where I wouldn't use them as much. Well one is still going pretty strong but the other one has a blown speaker. Yes they have been up pretty loud but not so much that it should've blown it. I guess I just have bad luck with these hopefully you'll have better luck with them than I.

I got this as a present for a friend. He really loved it. The only creepy thing is when Alexa thinks you are talking to her and you didn't think you said anything to resemble her name. It's an amazing item to have in the kitchen. She will create a shopping list for you which you can see through the Amazon app when you get groceries. Need milk? Just say "Alexa add milk to the shopping list." She will even remind you if you added an item twice so it won't be duplicated. Great sound. I will slowly add more to my collection so I can have one in every room!

We have two different echos in different rooms. One is my husbands and one is my sons. They are hooked to their own Alexa apps. Everyday before I leave the house I will play music for my dog. So as I leave I say “Alexa- play country music”. The Echo in the closer room which is the 2nd generation doesn’t always understand. The Echo in my son’s back bedroom will always answer and start to play Top country hits. It’s weird because it is further away but it is much more sensitive. The look is better on the third gen in my opinion as well. The 2nd gen is easier to clean and has a better sounding speaker.

The sound: It seems like the new generation has more bass, but it's not well-balanced at all, now I'm struggling to hear my podcasts/radio shows. I don't WANT a bigger one, and I definitely don't want to throw money at a more expensive solution, but ... :(

reviews.reviewTitle: This is NOT what I expected.
reviews.reviewText: My Echo recently died so I thought after seeing the dot on sale for Amazon Prime day I would give it a shot. BIG mistake, voice response is not as sensitive as my old echo and I can't see if there is a adjustment for it. But the WORSE is while listen to my Pandora station it skips to the next song in the middle of a song. If anyone has suggestions please let me know. I have Googled and went on support and all is useless. Now I know why it was half price on Prime day. Watta bummer.

This device and a fire tv don't perform well and seem to show that quality control is has declined. This device starts but won't play my flash briefing where the older Dot's I have do. It fails on a variety of commands that work well on the older devices. I'm invested in Amazon media so may just look for used older generation devices that work.

Last christmas I was given an ECHO... it's excellent, this year I was given a DOT... I don't like it at all... the sound is really bad but then what can you expect for $30.00... frankly, I don't Amazon should market this product, it sucks

I have a few of gen1 speakers and my biggest gripe with those is that the speakers aren’t particularly loud. I had one in the bathroom and it was a strain if you tried to listen while in the shower.
The gen3 version has phenomenal sound in comparison. I love the aesthetic and syncing to the Alexa app/group is a breeze. My biggest complaint (and this may be my internet vs groups) is that when you ask for something to be played on a group channel, some of the speakers play and others don’t.

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo Dot 3rd generation is the way to go!
reviews.reviewText: We like everything about the Echo Dot 3rd generation actually! Alexa is not hard of hearing she picks up every time we talk to her! It's so nice to be sitting around the house or whatever we may be doing and we say "hey Alexa play Halloween music" as we're carving pumpkins and it works! Or another example I love to use it when I'm cleaning house or game night!! We love it and will be purchasing another I'm sure! Thanks!

reviews.reviewTitle: It was not easy to install the Alexa app.
reviews.reviewText: When I tried to install an Alexa app it would not install. On the bottom of the screen appeared a CHAT screen. After hearing my problem she tried to install the app and was unable to and had to transfer me to a specialist. I ended up having to pay $180 because the specialist told me there was something wrong with my internet. He told me even though I have an Apple Mac and Comcast internet my internet was not allowing me to download the Alexa app. $180.00 later I have a 3 yr. protection policy and the Echo Dot is working.

This can't really be used as a stand alone bluetooth speaker. You have to use their specific apps for podcasts (doesn't seem to be friendly with Apple). It syncs with Apple Music, but I don't think it works with your own music via iTunes, just Apple Music. You can sync with Sirius XM but I listen to on demand and you can't specify shows, just channels. I got it as it was free with the purchase of the Ring System. For me, it's a waste. I don't need to have a speaker to ask what's the weather or to set my alarm.

We already had 2nd Gen Dots. We wanted to expand our coverage and bought these 2 3rd Gen Dots. The older ones were good; these are much better. The audio when we play music through them is really very good - noticeably better than on the 2nd Gen. The microphones seem to be a bit more sensitive, too. Our new Dots can hear and respond to us from all the way across the largest rooms in our house with no errors (well, only a few - but many fewer than the 2nd Gen). Overall, we are quite pleased with these and highly recommend them. Keep on improving, Amazon!

I have an Echo, Tap, a Dot Gen2 and two Dots Gen3. The sound on the Gen3 is far superior yo the Gen2; it's louder, deeper and solid for a device the size of a hockey puck. Sound is more than adequate for bedside. I purchased the Gen3 on Black Friday with a smart switch because of the price. I liked it so much that I bought a second one. I am now starting to take advantage of using Alexa to control lights and other devices. The Alexa app keeps getting better. If you haven't gotten an Alexa device, this would be a great place to start. You won't be sorry.

reviews.reviewTitle: Fantastic, even as a white-noise machine
reviews.reviewText:
I bought this primarily because I wanted a white-noise machine and most of the actual products designed to be white noise machines had questionable reviews. I decided to go for the Echo Dot instead, thinking that not only would it work great for white-noise (for my baby), but it would also be great to have an assistant in the home. I can play music, send messages, make calls, and order stuff on Amazon, all while holding my baby.
I highly recommend this. It can also be used as a Bluetooth speaker, so if you are looking for one of those, why not just get the Echo Dot? You'll get much more bang for your buck.
Also, it looks dang stylish.

The setup with the Alexa app is very easy, although I did go and buy some Phillips Hue lights a month later, and when I set them up now Alexa won't "turn off the lights" downstairs because technically it isn't a light she is turning off, but rather the 'smartplug' so she tells me she doesn't have any devices listed as 'lights.' I won't ding the plug for my stupidity or inability to set things up properly, but am slightly annoyed that I have to change something i already had setup because I added a new device to the Alexa app.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great little speaker with stereo pairing and audio out!
reviews.reviewText: Nice lil speaker and for the recent deal where it was about $10 - totally worth it. Especially given the fact that with two, you can pair them in stereo - which is what I’m listening to right now! Bass is a little bit muddy when played at higher volumes but if you were buying these for their sound quality, you’d wouldn’t be going for the Dot. That being said however, these do sound quite decent for their price. Quite a deal better than my Google Home Mini. They also have audio out which I 100% appreciate and praise!

My three year old walks up to Alexa and asks it to play Baby Shark and other toddler songs all day. She just loves that it can also read books to her, and I love the shopping lists, reminders, phone calls I can make, and so many other things we use it for. My teenage even uses it to catch up on his AP History events and get a more rounded view of the events he is studying. This week it was the French Revolution, Sedition Act, Marbury v Madison and so on.

reviews.reviewTitle: 3-Months in and now here’s my realistic review
reviews.reviewText:
What’s not to like about it? (Besides the occasional miscommunication between you and your Alexa usually from mumbling or faulted pronunciation) From as simple yet convenient as a Bluetooth speaker with Apple login for any room, all the way to making calls/play games and trivia/turning on lights/locking doors/ closing blinds/ controlling outlets/ etc. The convenience is all too good to pass up! I bought 2 of the Echo Dots (3rd gen) the first week the 3rd gens were released. One for me and one for my mother. And she absolutely loves it! It’s an everyday used product for sheer convenience with anyone I’ve ever known who owns an Alexa device. Definitely worth the purchase in my eyes!
With that said, it’s bug fixes don’t come as often as a tech-y kind of person like I would like BUT they hardly run into any problems as far as I can tell from all of the Alexa devices I’ve had. Like I said, miscommunication is number one problem as of now which hopefully will be managed someway/somehow. But as of now, just speak clearly haha. I have yet to experience any bad connections with any of my lights, outlets, or other Alexa devices with my Echo personally so I’d assume any review saying there are disconnection errors with external add-on devices would be because of either their poorly constructed third-party device or poor internet connection. Either way, I believe only what I see with my own eyes and what I see and perceive from my experience so far is a well executed and designed Amazon device.
For the great price they run it at, it really is worth the try!

The Echo dot is well worth the money. It performs flawlessly and is easy to set up. It has had no problems understanding my commands. The dot works with android, iPhone, and Fire tablets and phones. I have an iPhone 6, works perfectly. Also works with my 10" and 8" Fire tablets. Setting up new devices is fairly easy. Alexa takes you through the procedure step by step. Would recommend. I had the original Alexa. The dot works just as well for a lot less money.
"

reviews.reviewTitle: Anyone can use it! Great for the family and home
reviews.reviewText:
This thing is great. Have them around the house, my house is relatively old but this really turns it into a smart home with the addition of smart plugs, smart lights, and home security!

Set up is easy, it walks you through the steps and tells you all the features you can do.

Great you can change the wake word, because those commercials can really mess with it, and in conversation people bring it up casually a lot.

Great features, such as playing music, hearing the news, manage the house.

reviews.reviewTitle: Don't ask it to recommend music!
reviews.reviewText: A.I. is not here yet. anyone familiar with programming will see this as IFTTT. I bought this device and a google home mini at the same time. The mini can still hear you at full volume while the dot struggles. The sound quality is better on the dot. I tried letting the dot recommend music. It was a disaster. it kept recommending the same stations over and over again. it was recommending top pop and clean alternative. I Don't want either of these stations. I tried disliking them and it kept recommending them. The only thing that it did that was A.I. like was after I cussed it more than I have anything animate or inanimate it just shutdown. I reset it and decided to use the amazon music app on my phone. I thought it may have been an issue with the app. The app had plenty of good recommendations so it was not the app. If you want something to turn your lights on this is a good device. If you want to explore new music this is not the device. You would think with all the data they have been collecting this thing would function better but it is not there yet.

reviews.reviewTitle: It sounds very good to me for it's size and cost!
reviews.reviewText: This is our first echo device. My wife and I like it a lot! Music sounds good on it with it sitting in the middle of a small wooden table. Getting the weather on it is nice. We are getting used to asking questions and enjoy some of the games. Setup was real simple and painless. I got one of the smart switches for a hard to reach lamp in a corner, that works good to. I'd like a couple smart bulbs, but have to wait for a deal on them. I'm seriously thinking of getting one for the bedroom.

Bought two of these in a recent 50% off sale to put in our kids' rooms. Not sure they are worth the full price. It's been a game changer in our family home, though. Now we can "drop in" on a boy's room, or make an general announcement across all rooms. This is effectively like having a home intercom. We no longer have to choose between screaming at the top of our lungs or hiking all the way across the house to get our teenager's attention. Also, our little one loves asking Alexa to play music, and now he can do that in his room too.

reviews.reviewTitle: What did I do before Alexa?
reviews.reviewText: What did I like? I found Alexa to be a great help several days ago. I was sewing and impaled my finger with the needle. I was alone and could not reach the tools I needed to free myself. I used Alexa to call my son and she saved the day. I don’t advise getting rid of your life alert but she sure helped me in a pinch! I love being able to listen to books on audible. By far it is a very useful help for many aspects of daily living. I now own 3 and have no regrets. Set up was easy enough for me. (old lady)

reviews.reviewTitle: speaker quality and style much improved
reviews.reviewText: I received this Echo Dot in one of those "Santa" games at Christmas. Already had an older one downstairs, but this one has an appealing "upholstered look" and a much better speaker. Only problem (not amazon's) was when I went to set it up. Yahoo had so many ad sites above the official site that I accidentally went to a fake site, and it took me a couple minutes to realize I was giving info to the wrong people! Please be careful when you do your setup that you are on the official amazon site for Echo Dot. Otherwise, great product, and I love being able to get news, classical music and quick answers right at my writing desk.

I'm well past 60, and I had no trouble setting this up. I ask for the weather forecast, time to travel "from" and "to" areas, and playing music. I really like that it can be given an alternate wake-up name (as we have a 10" Kindle that responds to voice). I purchased this as a package with a smart plug--and the two work well together. Again, I had it set up in just minutes. Really liking this device--and the potential for more devices and smart devices in the future.

reviews.reviewTitle: Much better audio than the 2nd gen
reviews.reviewText:
I now have 2 of these Echo Gen 3's and a Gen 1 and Gen 2 Echo Show and while on the Show the big improvement is the much large screen, for the Dot's between 2 and 3, the sound quality is the most remarkable difference. I've ready some gripes about the power plug being different but all-in-all, these Gen 3 Dot's are a great deal for the cost and improvement over Gen 2 in sound quality and clarity makes the upgrade worthwhile.

...plus, I traded-in my Gen 2 Dot to Amazon to get a good discount on the Show Gen 2. :)

We received an Echo Dot (3rd gen) for Christmas and my wife took full possession of it so I bought another for me. This one doesn't function as well as the first. It starts and stops and will sometimes play for hours as background music and other times stops after perhaps two songs, five songs; it can be any combination of continuous songs. If there are upgrades in quality, (not just price) and you are determined to have one, spend the money for better quality.

I thought there would be more with this, there isn't. I like that I can make calls, it sucks I can't receive them unless that other person has an Echo.

Second issue is the volume and speakers. You can turn all of it up or all of it down. There are not separate settings for Alexa's voice and Music/media. Music ends up at a good volume, when I stop that, Alexa is too loud or vice versa. Speakers are muffled, seems to be getting worse. She doesn't respond unless I'm within about 5 feet without yelling.

It's really not all that useful.

reviews.reviewTitle: alexa is evil once you stoop to her level she just get nastier.
reviews.reviewText: I liked that it had potatal of being a cool device despite the many minor issue still wasn't bad. The Bot called alexa has given me a headache ever since i met her years ago she doesnt know simple commands and never learns she just gets dumber. i figured out the commands and she still gives me a hard time the spies aka tec can see that i'm sure yet they don't seem to care. yall need to get rid of alexa and find someone who cares about the consumer.

reviews.reviewTitle: No more pounding on walls and yelling at the top of your lungs
reviews.reviewText:
The Echo Dot makes for an excellent home intercom system at an affordable price.

Absolutely love being able to set zones where music can be played as well as the freedom to listen to whatever wherever independently. Sound quality it great, easily connects to a home stereo for larger sound. Volume can be controlled by voice. Access to amazon music, daily news, weather, whatever you want to listen to. Get answers on the fly, make announcements over multiple devices or drop-in on a specific device for two-way communication.

Set up is a breeze. Solidly built. Attractive design and color options.

reviews.reviewTitle: Bought as a gift for a friend - now I want one...
reviews.reviewText: I currently own the traditional echo dot 2nd generation. However, I purchased this newer one as a gift for a friend and I am extremely jealous. The sound quality is extremely improved, its visually appealing, and overall it seems to listen better than my echo 2nd gen. The only reason I don't purchase my own is that I bought a custom speaker to go with my original dot. Otherwise, the 3rd generation echo dot is fantastic. Definitely the way to go for a smart home integration system!

I have the echo and I travel with it, and use it on a daily despite its large size. Well when I saw this echo dot on sale, I grabbed it. And although it’s just a smaller version of the echo. I like the design. But I did have a issue with some type of static going on, and it wasn’t even loud. I unplugged it and plugged it back up, and that seemed to fix the problem. Overall it’s a cute little speaker for traveling or if you’re like me, listening to music while showering. The sound is decent, bass could be a little more, but it can get pretty loud for its size.

I purchase my Echo Dot 3 generation Dec 2018 on the 5 monthly payment plan. My last payment was made this month and today my 5 month old Echo Dot 3 speaker has developed a rattle so extreme that it is not usable. Amazon has reduced their warranty to 90 days so my only option is to connect this Echo to an external speaker. What a piece of junk.

I have a dot in many rooms in the house: kitchen - useful for setting timers; family room - useful for light controls, changing Netflix programs; bedroom - great for changing temps on the thermostat, getting morning weather report, turning out the lights, checking the locks; office - great for reminders, news flash, music from Prime.

I have an Echo, an Echo Show and Dots. They all answer to Alexa and sometimes, since I have so many, the wrong one hears me. A minor annoyance.

I also have Insteon door sensors, garage door opener, light switches, outlets for lamps (some are TP Link), Honeywell Thermostat (I have a heat pump and the Nest wasn't right for me), an August front door lock. All of these work with Alexa and make great gifts.

For this product I personally held off until I was gifted one. When I brought it home I installed and I use it all the time! In fact, I went and ordered two more for other rooms. At a $30 price point this cannot be beat. You can't get get speakers at the quality these are. I love to just listen to the radio or the music selections. Every morning I ask "what's up?" for the local weather and a news event. However, if it were a more expensive product I would consider it a passable product. The features, although nice, are accessible from my phone.

I've had first, second and now third generation Dots among other Amazon Echos. This third generation is a really great improvement over the first and second generation Dots. I offered my wife any Echo device she wanted but she likes small, simple things and chose the Dot. She is in love with it, and so am I, though I chose the Echo Show 5 which suits me better. The sound is louder and better than previous generations, and the style of it really looks great on her nightstand.

reviews.reviewTitle: Rocket Science Not Needed! Simple to use.
reviews.reviewText: I bought this for my wife, she does not really embrace technology. Set it up in our bedroom for her to really use as an alarm. I showed her once and boom, she took off with it and she told me it was not rocket science to use. Exactly what I was looking for her. She loves it and embraces the technology. Good look too, I use the basic black 1st gen, still works great. I will buy a new one to upgrade in the near future. Very satisfied with both our echos.

reviews.reviewTitle: I will not be part of the herd.
reviews.reviewText: I bought this, thought I'd give it a shot full well knowing that it listens to everything in my house all the time. I returned it because during the setup of the Alexa app, the damn thing said my password was incorrect. Then it proceeded to the next step without asking for me to reset my pw, and then it accepted the original pw that it had rejected. When something feels wrong, it's wrong and this thing is wrong. I'll stick with turning on my TV by myself.

This is a fantastic platform for alexa. I have 2 full size echo devices and 3 of the 3rd generation dots throughout my house. I actually think I like the new 3rd generation dots better overall. They are very small yet produce a great sound. You can hang them from wall outlets or use a wall outlet shelf to keep them hidden and out of the way. Overall for the price of these you can put one in every room of your house and link them out to get great sound throughout the house all at once. I have bought them as gifts and couldnt recomend them more!

I have had the 2nd generation echo dot for about a year now and I really enjoy it. The sound is ok but I really wouldn't use it to listen to music on its own, I just pair it with my TV soundbar. This little 3rd gen has such impressive sound I will probably use it listen to music in my bedroom at least. I like that you can assign different wake words (Alexa, Echo, Amazon, Computer) so that you don't trigger both echo dots at once (since I have a small apartment this is important to me). It's also nice to have a second one so that I can control both of my FireTV sticks with voice commands.

This was a gift, so what I must be rating is the app I needed to download. I have a Google device, so this is more of a comparison between the two. "Hey Google" is a bit of a pain (3 syllables, and pronunciation counts where Alexa is 2), so I figured, it would be easier to use. Nothing could be farther from the truth. Out of the box, Alexa knows just about nothing, and after messing with it, installing the app on my laptop, I still could not figure out how to tell it anything about me (email address, location, favorite radio stations,...).

LOVE the new echo dot!! We are a huge Echo family - we have three full sized Echos and 5 Echo dots. The older version of the dot was fine for a bedroom but the volume needed to be on level 7 or 8 to get any significant sound. For the new ones, they put out sound comparable to the full-size Echos and are so inexpensive that we have one in almost every room. I also love that I can group them together and also separately so that we can have the same music all over the house or individually play our own if we want. Awesome!

reviews.reviewTitle: We’re happy, using it like a fancy clock radio.
reviews.reviewText: We bought it on a very good sale for our boys room. They’re thrilled with it. For our purposes, it’s a glorified version of the alarm clock/ radio that I got excited about when I was their age. It has great sound for a bedroom- but I’m not super picky. We like how you can program it to say reminders at different times, or I can call it from my phone anywhere. The boys like the jokes and puns- we do have Amazon music- so that makes it better. It was surprising the first time they reported the weather, all official sounding over breakfast.:)

reviews.reviewTitle: significant sound quality upgrade and better look
reviews.reviewText: The third gen echo dot is a major improvement over its predecessor. It looks much more like a valuable and useful product. It's bigger, heavier, and the speaker looks real, complete with a cloth covering. The last version looked much more like a toy and not a home appliance. The sound quality is also massively improved. Lows are many times more pronounced and the mid range is solid. It's still missing something on the high end, and it sounds a bit muddy as a result, but this version has reached the point of a decent home speaker that I'd feel comfortable using by itself. The external 3.5 mm jack is still there however, which I appreciate. I'd definitely recommend upgrading to the third generation echo dot, and don't forget to take advantage of amazon's trade-in program if you own the previous model.

Maybe it's me but nowhere in the description did I see it say that this device REQUIRES wi-fi. At first I was mad that it wouldn't talk to me cause I don't have wi-fi but then I thought I could at least use it as a speaker BUT NO - it won't even connect to your phone via bluetooth you HAVE TO have wi-fi. Sorry but that's some bullsh*t this thing is absolutely useless unless you have a wi-fi connection. Thanks for nothing but thanks for my refund though.

These Echo Dots are amazing. Having voice access to the internet, and Amazon as well, is a convenience I didn't know I wanted... until I finally got this on a holiday sale. Amazon has created a useful piece of technology that my entire family loves. The device is very simple in design, but constructed with quality. I love it's edge-less round design, and sleek incorporation of buttons and lights. The speaker sounds great too, and reproduces music with incredible clarity & crispness. I'm also impressed with how far away the microphone can pickup voice commands.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not as intimidating as I thought!
reviews.reviewText: I won this at a family Christmas Party. I wasn’t sure I needed or wanted one. I thought this is a great way to see how it works. When I got it home I set it up. It was very easy and intuitive. I was glad I already had an account. I also have some light switches that are WiFi controlled as well as a speaker. So now I can control lights, music and speaker. If you don’t already have those kinds of things I don’t know whether I’d recommend it. However, we are really having fun asking questions. We get immediate answers. Kind of amazing. You can ask the weather (for anywhere) the time, the date, trivia questions. We were watching a playoff football game and they had a rules expert explaining a ruling. I thought who’s this guy? I asked Alexa and she immediately told us his credentials and I found he was more than qualified to explain the rules. I had never heard of the guy. You can ask for famous people ages. You can simply ask for a timer. Say you’re cooking, you can say set a timer for 30 minutes. In 30 minutes she sets off an alarm. You can say play some music for 10 minutes. You get music for 10 minutes. I’m not saying everyone needs this. But I’m really happy I have one. I’m learning new tricks everyday.

reviews.reviewTitle: Sleek, spaceSaving, rich sound and price. My bad for not getting a smartPlug.
reviews.reviewText:
Like: full rich bass sound. Sleek and compact. Price. Easy set up connecting and pairing.
Dislikes: confusing how it switches back and forth, I have to keep selecting Play On Paired Speakers.
My last dislike is on me that i did not buy a smart plug.
Overall, a learning curve.
This is actually a necessary practical purposeful purchase for me having adaptations in a modified home...the smart devices are a godsend.
Cust service has been great with me

reviews.reviewTitle: It must have ear plugs in because she doesn't understand me!
reviews.reviewText: Very frustrated with this new model. I say the same things I said with the 2nd gen but get no results. Plus I'm repeatedly told it "doesn't do that" but when I repeat the command phrase it does what it just told me it "doesn't do that"I The speaker is much better but the voice recognition is much MUCH worse! I switched back to my 2nd gen unit and the response is much better. I'm also amazed that Amazon won't publish an honest review of their product simply because it's a bad review. This product has problems and the feedback is letting Amazon know. Is that not why they have reviews in the first place?

I like that you can say “Alexa “almost anywhere in the house and she will respond to you. I was having Internet connectivity issues with the Echo Dot for a day or two but figured out that it was because I logged off of my Amazon account on my phone. I do not have any complaints so far All I have is good news to report. Sound quality goes beyond anything anyone would ever expect. Knowing that you can use an auxiliary or Bluetooth to connect even more devices only further in Hanses the usage of the Echo Dot third generation

For the price of 60 dollars, I was not interested at all in spending that much for something that talks to me. With the promotion, I had gotten it for only 99 cents. With that being said, I will continue the review without the bias of cost, until the end.

The sound quality and voice recognition is amazing. It literally feels like talking to another person, and playing music is like I bought a decent speaker.
Alexa has many features and can cooperate with pretty much every common app. So far I can say this and Alexa will do that.
The one thing I don't like is the peace of mind that this thing is constantly listening and you don't know what goes on in it's brain. They say the mute button physically unplugs the microphone but it's not convenient to turn it on/off. The red ring is a pretty nice nightlight.

There's a whole lot to talk about but I'd say this is a brief review of what should most concern the average interested consumer. With all that being said, 60 dollars is fair, but it would call it a luxury good.

I not only like the speakers, I love them. they are so easy to use. I love how you tell Alexa what to play and she does. I am a Country Music listener great songs she play for me through the speakers. I also love to listen to Ocean sounds and Nature sounds she play those for me too. You can get her to play almost any type of music you may love to listen to..

Still waiting to use the other features she does, like turn your lights on and off. etc lol lol

My friend call me lazy now, because Alexa play what I ask her to play for me. lol lol

reviews.reviewTitle: Great device! An actual updated device!
reviews.reviewText: Typically now a days it seems like tv's games phones etc always has some sort of quick redundent thing/upgrade without actually having any sort of update. As with the model prior to this one these devices are great. updated model definitely has a huge difference in sound loudness and qualityn which is great. One thing that i was hoping to see this time around was some sort of stand alone power and or battery having to stay plugged is a majordr's i mean come on the device alone stands out for future tech all together so not having that cordless compatibilty seems a bit odd to me but im hoping to see it next time around!

I’m not sure how to rate this. I just received my devices and have used them for a full day.

I do love the product, but I ordered 2 devices and one doesn’t work properly. I have to unplug it and plug it back in before speaking or give the command for it to do an action to the other device In order to get it to work. It’s very annoying.

I would return the 2nd device and exchange it, but I live abroad and it’s not cost effective to do so. A bit disappointed.

(Update) I found an online recommendation for a fix, changing the Wake word improves responsiveness. Upgraded my review to 4-stars This is a great organizational tool, but there are improvements to be made. It would be nice to see improvements in voice recognition, additionally clarity in Alexa’s voice, and more support between apps and devices, such as Apple Watch. I’m interested to do how these types of devices develop I the future.

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo Dot Third Generation with Time Display
reviews.reviewText: The light sensor for the time display does not adjust properly to light settings. In the dark it is too subtle, difficult to read. There is no ability to adjust light sensor settings. Other features same as with earlier versions of DOT, except generation 3 is not compatible with all 2nd generation external speakers for which the device needs to be cradled.

I have little interest in all the magical things Alexa can do, but I love the new Echo Dot. I was about to spend a few hundred dollars for an internet radio tuner. I live in an area of sparse radio coverage and wanted to play background music while I work or listen to news headlines. The Dot does both remarkably well. It won't fill the house with high fidelity music, but the quality of sound coming from a tiny speaker is simply remarkable as long as you keep the volume low. It's also very sensitive; you don't need to speak loudly to make it work.

reviews.reviewTitle: An amazing device that you won't regret owning
reviews.reviewText: I finally decided to take the plunge on a smart device so I decided to go with the echo dot 3rd generation because it was on sale for the holidays. I'm very glad I did because this thing is amazing, I can use it to control my tv, my xbox one and soon an led light strip from merkury. The only issue I have with the device is for some reason when I use it to turn off the xbox then try to turn off my tv it wont work and alexa tells me the TV isn't responding. I'm not sure if it's a problem with my echo dot or my tv. The tv I have is the sony 43xbr800d. Other than that the thing is amazing and I wish I would have gotten one sooner.

I like being able to accomplish tasks with voice commands. My first Echo Dot was a freebie from my SiriusXm renewal. I quickly discovered that having just one Alexa wasn’t enough. I also realized that moving one Echo Dot from room to room was quite efficient and most annoying. Within two weeks I have subsequently purchased four additional units so that I have one in each of the rooms that I frequent. There’s one in the kitchen, my office, my exercise room, my bedroom, and the basement. I have purchased a smart plug and a smart bulb and plan to add more accessories to my Echo Dot units. I am particularly fond of the one in my bedroom which turns on the light and the radio in the morning when I say good morning Alexa. Because I am a sci-fi buff I grew up on Star Trek, and being able to talk to the computer and perform various tasks is something that I always thought was way cool. I love my Echo dots and I’m having a ball using them.

Love this little thing. Great audio quality. Easy to set up and control. Only issue I have that is a little annoying is that it will randomly skip my songs on Pandora. It can go for a few songs then just out of no where skip to the next song. I've been turned off the voice listening while playing music. Same thing. Very strange.

**Update** After using other music apps on my Echo Alexa hasn't skipped any songs randomly on Pandora. Not sure what caused the error.

I bought three of these because the 3rd generation includes an intercom ability. Since then I have found it does a whole lot more. Other than the intercom ability, I use the Dots for instant information and music. The speakers are suitable for most music as I move around the house and pair easily to my blue tooth earphones for excellent sound quality.
I'm sure I'll become addicted to it as time goes on. Unfortunately, my dog's name is Lexie, and when I say the command, "Alexa," she looks up expectingly, then when the dot replies, she takes off.

I never knew I could get so addicted to a gadget like this, but I have! so easy to hook up - even easier to use and a lot of fun adding skills to it for entertainment. I can see this being very handy for people who live alone because theres so many things to keep you entertained and as a sort of back up for personal safety because of how you can call people thru it - imagine falling and not being able to get up and needing help n possibly not having a phone within reach - just ask Alexa to call a friend on your contact list. I just love this and my only regret is not getting one much sooner

reviews.reviewTitle: I'm still asking myself why I bought this........
reviews.reviewText: I never wanted this thing. I bought it and in as much as I don't regret buying it, I have questioned myself why I bought it (other than that my nephew and niece have a couple of them) There is a song trivia function that I think is cool, but the 'daily briefing' sometimes isn't current (not sure if that is an "Alexa" issue ) I do like the timer function. I find that to be useful when i'm cooking or doing multiple things at once. At times, I have to repeat my question several times before it answers. It's like she's asleep or something, LOL....

I bought two of these during Prime day and got 2 smart bulbs as well. It's a short sample size but early returns are fantastic! There is so much more to explore that we've barely scratched the surface. I love that I can turn the lamps on or off verbally. I love the trivia question of the day. I love that I can ask Alexa the weather, the score of the game, or to play any song I want. I'm looking forward to learning more functions and finding new ways to integrate my house into Alexa's world!

I got 4 of these altogether. I gave 3 away as gifts to family members and kept one to use in my home. I think she is a cute little "bot". She can give you an up to date weather report, play a song for you, she sings her own songs,too! She can do sound effects, animal sounds, give you recipes, answer questions in general and tell you what time your favorite sports team is playing on TV next and who they are playing against. She can also tune in a radio station, and be used as a timer. Still learning many things, but so far, very entertaining!

reviews.reviewTitle: Make sure systems are fully compatible.some say they are but you LOSE functions.
reviews.reviewText: Still customizing and intragrating with other house smart systems. All working good together. When finished I will truly have a smart home. The best feature with alexa for me is the ability to control everything in any room by talking to house. Got rid of light switches, soon all keys. Don't even have to turn security system on and off, heat ,camera's, others all automatic with geofencing. To many other automatons to list. Will soon be able to see who's at the door tell them to go away or unlock door turn alarm off, light on, heat up and invite in no matter where in the world I am.

I have the 1st Generation Dot. I really like it but after setting this one up it is by far a great improvement. It is bigger than my other one. The speakers sound amazing and for their size....are really good. Setup was again easy and played my music with no issues. I have 3 other Bluetooth speakers and this is on par with them as far as sound quality is concerned.
In my opinion, Amazon has done exceptionally well with this type of technology. I'm sure this is still on sale so get one or many before the sale ends.

reviews.reviewTitle: Still has trouble hearing me and understanding me.
reviews.reviewText: 3rd Generation still has a great deal of trouble hearing me even in a quiet room. It often misunderstands simple questions. I give it 4 stars because it is still extremely helpful in playing music and answering some questions when it does hear me. I tried using other wake words but it doesn't hear any better then the second generation. It also seems that the AI has not improved at all. It seems like Amazon has abandoned their artificial intelligence as it is not seeking to improve it at all. This can still only answer simple questions. If it hears me.

Love the Echo Dot! Currently only have 2 in my home but will probably get more later. In my opinion, the sound is good and her voice clear. I basically use mine for weather, occasional music and to turn lights on and off. So glad I finally took the first steps toward a smart home by buying these dots. Would definitely recommend to all. If you check Amazon’s main page, you sometimes can find the dot for $20.00 off( for a limited time). Well worth the purchase!

reviews.reviewTitle: this is the way to go
reviews.reviewText:
I was using a first generation echo, and was unhappy about the monaural music. the cost of a 2nd generation echo was equal to two of this product, and still needed a plug in speaker to achieve sterio. I purchased two of these, paired them, and discarded the echo. it picked up right where the echo left off with the programming, but added stereo sound.

we like to stoke up the fireplace in the middle of the night on a weekend, and play amazon music, with the lights out. a little hot chocolate, or eggnog completes a memorable evening. great sound.

Have it on my night stand and use it for playing music and podcasts for when I go to bed. Much better alternative to a tv with all the bright flashing lights keeping me awake. I can also ask it the time and not have to reach for my phone which is my favorite part. Sound quality is pretty good for this size. It sounds like it’s mono which is the only bad lart, but the bass has good depth.

We replaced a google device with this, so that our home is fully Alexa-enabled. The other device also didn’t seem to pick up our voices very well. In contrast, the echo dot hears us even though we put it out-of-sight and under a baby crib.

We had some issues with other echo devices. The first generation echo couldn’t make out our words very well, and the new version of the show has some rattling in the speaker. I don’t expect products to be perfect, so we are fine with those quirks. No quirks with this little device, though. It just works.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa, a convenient little assistant who's always willing to help.
reviews.reviewText: For the longest time I had always seen commercials with Alexa, but I never really understood the hype. Then prime day came along, and I saw Alexa as one of the featured products. Seeing as the price drop for prime day was significant, I put in my order, and received Alexa the same day. I should mention that I got Alexa bundled with a smart plug (highly recommend doing so) Aside from allowing you to blast your music, Alexa also allows you to be ten times more laid back than usual. I have some string lights that I use during the night and having to get up, just to turn them off is not the move, but with Alexa on hand that process is so much easier. With just one quick blurb, I can stay in bed and drift off to sleep. I've only had my Alexa for about a week at this point but if you're looking for a speaker that can help you out a bit, I highly suggest placing an order. To close this review, I'd like to mention that if you do go out and buy an Alexa, she is very responsive to her name. I don't know what kind of microphones they have inside the little hockey puck that is Alexa but, I've said her name under my breath and she somehow still picks it up.

Initially I had a tough time getting connected to Wi-Fi, as I didn't have enough instruction to know I need my secure password for connection. However, after getting everything working properly, I am happy with this purchase. It will give me peace of mind to have this, as my husband is disabled, & when I'm gone might need to call 911 plus me in an emergency situation. This is my primary reason for selecting this unit along with the Echo Connect device. We will discover much more when time & curiosity permits.

We’ve been considering slowly turning our house into a smart home. The Echo Dot has put this on a faster track. Why we haven’t gotten one of these sooner, I’ll never know.

The Echo recognizes voice commands (we are on a steep learning curve with Alexa’s skills, but we’re getting there), plays nice with the Fire TV, and the little speaker sounds really good. Seriously, you need to get this!

So far I am disappointed with the “upgraded” Echo Dot :/ I connected the first one in my room (next to my bed) replacing the 2nd gen so it’s not used as often but I’ve noticed it doesn’t pick my voice up as quickly as my old one and it’s slow to respond. I connected the 2nd 3rd gen in our living room right next to the couch just a few days ago and find it’s also frustratingly slow to respond. I have no issues with our 2nd gen and i am regretting not buying the Amazon Echo 2nd gen in favor of 2 3rd gen. The only real positive thing I can say is they are louder and gen2.

reviews.reviewTitle: New Echo Dot Has Multi-room Music solution
reviews.reviewText: I bought two 3rd generation echo dots, one for each of two bedrooms, to go with my existing echo which is already linked via Bluetooth to a Bose Wave system. I paired two Bluetooth speakers to the echo dot in one room, and am using the echo dot as the only speaker in the other. I’ve been able to add a Bluetooth transmitter via the aux jack on one of the echos and from their paired two speakers in stereo mode. This was/is a bit buggy but generally easy to get working properly. I was also able to create an “everywhere” group to command multi room streaming from any room using either echo dot or the echo. It works fairly well, with minor syncing issues between the room. Also, multi room eliminates the blue tooth connection between the echo and the Bose Wave system, and the sound in that room comes directly from the echo. I think the multi room and stereo pairing are great features and will improve over time. I would hope eventually the echo dots could directly pair with a set of stereo speakers without the use of the transmitter All in all, a great procur for the price.

Got this as a free gift for purchasing another product. I have Google Home everything in my house but I figured I'd give it a shot. I am using it to stream music in the rear garage. I also use it to set timers when I'm working in the garage so I don't forget to feed the dog etc. Using the audio output into a receiver and two pairs of speakers as the sound from it is not the best by any means. I can not comment on integration and control of other devices as I do not use it for that purpose.

reviews.reviewTitle: Drop-in feature saved me when locked out!
reviews.reviewText: We have 2 of these in our house. One is located in our master bedroom/bathroom and the other in my son’s room. These are perfect for listening to music, setting timers/alarms, and getting the weather. I locked myself out of the house one morning on an early walk and was able to use the drop-in feature to wake up my son to let me in (I had accidentally left the dot in the master bedroom unplugged and my husband wouldn’t wake-up to his phone ringing). I might have scarred my son as he thought I was in his closet. Ha.

I absolutely love having Alexa in our home! We use her for so much more than music.

I rarely watch the news so I rely on her for the weather, she also provides recipes. I use her timer function often to set device timers for my kids and I absolutely love using the music alarm for the mornings. I also use the thunderstorm sounds to help relax and fall asleep at night.

I was skeptical at first about buying one, but its definitely one of our better purchases this year!

reviews.reviewTitle: Still needs work it is not as seam less as lead to believe
reviews.reviewText: This system, if it worked as it should is a 5 star device. The issue I have with it is that requires a TON of hand holding and trouble shooting. Integrations with other devices stop working for no apparent reason, skills fail with zero explanation or error codes; all requiring you to spend your valuable time to trouble shoot a device that is meant to save you time......yeah no. Iron this thing out more, and stop using your paying customer base as testers to iron out issues as you go Amazon.

I bought this and a smart plug for a lamp that I could not reach. Alexa has been such a help turning the light on and off whenever asked. My granddaughter also loves this as well because she can request songs to put on a dance show for us. She also loves to check her math with it by asking for answers to confirm if she's right. It's always fun to thank Alexa after she does something for us because you never know her response, you're welcome, sure things, etc. Might have to get more of these for other rooms in the house.

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo Dot is a Great foundation to a smart home...
reviews.reviewText: I am very pleased with the Echo Dot third generation that I purchased. It’s a lot of fun and it is extremely easy to connect with other Echo Dots. I love the feature that allows one to connect two plugs or lights which is very convenient and controlling the lighting in your entire home. I can’t imagine the possibilities of providing or creating a smart home using the Echo Dot as your foundation . I love to ask questions of an Alexa only to find it providing with most of the answers. As time goes by I continue to find features that make life easier.

I no longer need to turn off a light and then walk through a dark room. I can turn the light on in another room and then have Alexa turn the light off in the room I just left. No more tripping over the dog or whacking my knee on the corner of an end table in the dark. A word of wisdom however. Do not have the unit set in close proximity to a smart Alec African Gray parrot!

I was very excited to receive my Echo Dot but have quickly learned that it isn't all that it is made out to be. Nine times out of ten, any channel i try to play only works for a short amount of time, if at all and then quits and I know it isn't our wireless internet which is working fine for everything else. It is a worthless item on my kitchen counter.

the echo dot has potential, but the app is terrible. not supported by older androids, and different app features depending on the type of phone you have. my son and I were both on android phones and his app had features mine did not. I cannot locate my music playlist anywhere even though my dot created one somewhere for me. I also have no idea where it found my phone contacts from, and have no way to edit it to use new numbers that are on my phone but for some reason my alexa has different older numbers it tries to call instead. the dot itself has potential, but without proper app support its pretty useless.

Small and sleek; easy to disguise behind flowers or small decorations. The sound quality is good, especially for such a small speaker. I am disappointed, however, with the voice recognition. We also have an Alexa Echo and it seems that both of their "hearing" has gone very downhill. Sometimes it'll take us a few times screaming into the actual microphone to get a response. Other than that, it's a handy and inexpensive little tool that I'd recommend for any and every household.

This is my first experience with an echo type device and I like it. I’m not so tech savvy that I can automate my entire home, but Alexa has her value. She is a great quick source of information like the weather, which NFL teams are playing, what certain terms mean, and so forth. Alexa also has a bit of humor in her AI whining find refreshing. I’ve read the stories about hackers listening in but the echo can be turned off thus eliminating this potential threat.

reviews.reviewTitle: Dot on the Horizon Looms Large, Surpasses Expectations with Flying Colors
reviews.reviewText: I have used Alexa in the past on my phone, on a Fire TV Stick, but I hadn't gotten an Echo, for whatever reason. I admit freely that I got a Google Home Mini, to see what it was like, and I enjoyed the freedom to speak to a working assistant without having to press a button, but while we're not unGoogly by any means, we're a little less integrated than some others. We primarily use our iCloud calendars, primarily shop at Amazon, etc. So it was with great excitement that, this year, I ordered myself an Echo Dot. The "try Amazon Music and get a Dot for cheap" promo was very convincing. But I turned right around and bought another on discount a few days later. Anyway, the first thing I noticed was the sound quality. I'd just tested an Echo 2nd Gen for my wife. Its sound was impressive, especially with such a small device. I was expecting ... let's say a little less out of the Dot. While its volume isn't quite what the Echo's is, its sound quality is actually as, or nearly as, good. The Dot pleasantly filled my living room with Christmas music, despite its small size.
