And by comparison, the Google Home Mini I'd bought previously sounded just as good at low volumes, but the Dot kept its sound quality even at maximum volume. Granted, Christmas music rarely clips or distorts anyway, because Christmas metal isn't tremendously popular on the radio stations I chose. Also, Alexa works nearly flalessly, even when the music is playing pretty loudly, unlike the Home Mini. I grant you that a more realistic comparison would be a Home Mini to a 2nd Gen Dot, but I bought the 3rd Gen, so I can only tell about what I have. Alexa has always been fun, but using her hands free is truly awesome. If I have one complaint, it's that Alexa is great, but I miss the variety of voices available from Google. And Amazon is the kind of company with the kind of design forethought to create different assistants with different personality and even different looks to sell to a variety of crowds. Alexa is a single, well-recognized actor in the Personal Digital Assistant space, but Amazon can do more. But that's a hypothetical gripe and has been brought up before. As it stands, the Echo Dot surpassed my expectations, transporting me simultaneously back to the first time I heard "Computer" in Star Trek and forward to the time that this tech becomes truly ubiquitous. Congrats, Amazon.

Update June 15 2016:
Still working great. Bought a second one. Sound is significantly better than the previous generation.

Original Review
Just like my other dots, but better! The sound quality is much better. Louder, too. Looks nice. Otherwise it is the same great Alexa experience. Set up was simple, and we have had no issues with it. We bought several gen2 models for $17. We got the 3gen for $29. Its worth the difference! But between a $17 gen2 and a $50 gen3, I'd go with the gen2. Functionally it is identical.

I know it wasn't expensive but GEEZ! Initially purchased in January 2019. Worked great until April then would not connect to network. I was sent a replacement. That too worked great until Mid may when it too stopped working on the internet. I got the first replacement for free but they back date the warranty on it to the original purchase so I was screwed for another replacement.
The Amazon rep did what he could. Gave me 20% off and I purchased the Plus instead. I have already 1 Plus since March. We see how long they last.

We have an Alexa show 2 and that is the gold standard as far as we are concerned. After we bought that, we wanted more Alexa devices for other rooms but did not want the expense of additional Shows. So we bought a few Dots to try in other rooms. We are very satisfied with the voice recognition, sound quality and responsiveness. The Show, of course, has even better speakers plus video, but the dot is still great for playing music, etc in a smaller space. Very happy with this purchase.

reviews.reviewTitle: We're only using 30% of this device's potential.
reviews.reviewText: The new gen for is great as a piece of hardware. Where it falls short, and risks becoming a glorified hockey puck, is in the manufacturer's inability to provide clear and intuitive guidance on how best to integrate the device's functional value, not only into a household or office, but into a larger network of Alexa devices. No amount of UGC YouTube tutorials could do as well as well conceived Amazon guides to the Alex's brand proposition... And that's currently lacking.

I have several Alexa devices throughout my house. This one was for my sister who came to visit for a surgery. She hated it the day she was there, but once she was recovering she fell in love. It made it easy for her to intercom me if I was in a different part of the house. I have other features hooked in so she didnt need to get up to turn on the lights. It would play her music and she could get information while remaining comfortable. Now, this is a gift for her. The first of many I am sure.

If I want better music I would get the full size one. This is a terrible update. Less crisp and really kill the clarity of the speech audio. I wouldn’t buy a dot for music and you really made the audio crappier where I have to make it overly loud to listen to the news briefings and such to get pass the voices now sounding like they are all muffled instead of being crisp and even tinny by those overly critical and wanting everything in a full size echo to be in a dot.

This device works well, but I think it's very gimmicky. It was fun to play twenty questions when you first open it, but now it has lost the fun. To use the search function is fine, but sometimes alexa misunderstands me no matter how clearly I speak. I don't have the smart lightbulbs/outlets so those features aren't able to be used. I hooked the device up to my TV, and she has some difficulty doing what I would like for her to do. Some features I can't access at all, such as fastforwarding my DVR. This is a cool toy but I don't see me using it frequently.

I bought this to replace an old Alexa Echo. My old one never had a problem hearing me. This one requires me to be right next to it when the music is playing and I want to interrupt. My old one kept better track of the songs I "liked." I have "liked" a song and had it added to my list and then during the same listening session I have "liked" the song again and it does not always tell me that similar feedback has already been saved. And there seems to be only one response when I say I like a song. The old one would say, "Got it", or "That will help me play more of the good stuff." It did not cut off songs before the end of the song was finished playing, bit this one frequently does. And it stops playing altogether sometimes even though I didn't ask it to. And I do not remember hearing, "Hmm, I'm not sure" as much as I do now. I have enjoyed asking for certain kinds of music or particular songs, but I am disappointed at how specific I must be. I asked to play Kasey Musgraves Christmas music and I kept getting holiday classics. When I finally looked up the name of Kasey's Christmas album and asked to hear it, THEN I could hear those songs.

reviews.reviewTitle: Useless hockey puck, won’t connect to WiFi, error 6:1:101:8:2
reviews.reviewText: Echo Dot 3rd Generation error 6:1:101:8:2. Suddenly stopped being able to connect to WiFi after months with no issues, no matter how many times I’ve tried to reset with action button, and unplugging. Had worked in the past with the TLink Deco M5 mesh network. No hidden networks involved. No support found anywhere online. Put through a runaround when searching for help. Can’t even find a help section that would allow me to contact assistance for this device. Basically have a big hockey puck now.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa cannot substitute the Internet, but she is great for controlling devices
reviews.reviewText: I think its great to use for controlling my devices, playing music, and even playing games. I also try to use it as a homework tool sometimes, but the Alexa cannot comprehend some questions. I assumed this would be similar to using a search engine online, but I guess not. Alexa has more limitations than I expected. My son likes to learn about sports, but if he asks something like "what previous team did Kevin Durant play for" she can't answer. We even tried rewording the question multiple times. My first time using Alexa (came free with Ring). Not sure how it compares to previous versions.

I'm in the Apple ecosystem and it was my first time with Alexa and I was really impressed. First off, I'm using it in the UAE and do not have full Alexa support. I had to use 3rd party software to set it up and it was quite a tedious procedure. And without the Alexa app I cannot access all of the functionalities. But despite those inconveniences, I'm impressed with how Alexa understands and responds to commands, as well as the variety of skills including games and quizzes which my family loves. The speaker quality is also surprisingly good for the price - almost as good as my UE wonderboom. All that for less than 50USD. I'm almost tempted to get another one.

We cannot get our Echo to connect to the Internet so the device is useless. When we were unable to get it to work, we had our son-in-law investigate the situation (he is EVER computer savvy and he said that the problem is with the APP - after one hours attempting to connect, no luck). If Alexa doesn't connect soon, we will be returning her....she serves zero purpose in her present state.

I purchased the first Gen of these and have loved her, so getting another one was twice the awesome. I keep the newer one in my office and I play music. I would love to purchase one for each room of my house and I will probably will. Totally recommend it. If you didn't know, you can use them in a pair to communicate with others in the room where it is, like a two way walkie talkie. You can even listen in on your phone and talk to others through your phone or through the device. I tried buying some of those wall plugs, they are expensive, to work with Alexa, I couldn't seem to get them to work, took them back to the store, but maybe with the newer one, it might work, Ill see, maybe when the price comes down some more.

reviews.reviewTitle: Makes me feel like a kid on Christmas morning!
reviews.reviewText:
The 3rd gen dot is the best value product I have ever purchased. Period. I am 64 and the custodial/biological father of two teenage girls. They got a kick out of seeing how excited I was with this product. They felt I was entering the techno age!
Amazon prime, coupled with the echo dot, is phenomenal. Amazon unlimited music, Alexa....the list goes on and on.
The dot is easy to set up. Sound volume is greater than I expected. Microphone sensitivity excellent.
And, the speaker output supports headphones....in Stereo! Buy it NOW!

So far, this product far exceeds my expectations. Alexa is smarter than Siri and it’s fun to play daily trivia questions and having her turn off lights and answer so many questions. I like that she can control my LG TV - however, she cannot turn it on because it needs the Wi-Fi connection to make it work. So, don’t blame Alexa or the TV - it’s logic - no Wi-Fi connection - she can’t turn the TV on - once it is on - she does everything the remote can do - excellent purchase and so far very happy with it!

reviews.reviewTitle: Don't buy if you want them to work independantly
reviews.reviewText: I bought two of these things for my kids for Christmas so that they can hear different nature sounds at night while they sleep. These things keep trying to sync with each other, and when they do one child hears the other one's request, and the one that request certain sounds get nothing. Trying to unsync them is a big pain, and is difficult to find any information from Amazon. When they don't sync, they work great, but when they sync they are a piece of junk.

I own two of these products and see them as it best adequate. They are very annoying in that they require you to repeat commands that you have used many times before over and over as they misjudge what you have said. The best feature is the ability 2 control lights and air conditioning by voice command. I subscribe to podcast and streaming Music Services and the speakers are excellent. However I cannot use the demand features of these services only live streams. The integration by Bluetooth with my phone is especially wonky. it often requires me to reboot my phone in order to connect. There is no easy way to understand the features of these devices so it is a hit-or-miss process setting things to work with them and requires ridiculous amounts of time and effort. Overall if you do not have a pressing need for these devices as I do you may want to wait another generation or two until they are ready for primetime.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great, but Drop In barely works
reviews.reviewText: I honestly really like this little thing. I got it in white and it looks very nice. Sometimes (and I mean really not too often at all) she'll mishear something and I'm not too frustrated as I know it happens to others as well. I dont have any complaints about the audio quality but I also didn't purchase this to fill my whole entire house with music. It does fill up an entire room though and that's enough for me when I'm relaxing at home. I do have one complaint and it's the only reason I am giving 3 stars. I'm not sure if I received a faulty product but whenever I "drop in" with my boyfriend he'll be trying to talk to me and when I answer, he says he can barely hear me. This is so strange to me because I can hear him just fine and Alexa responds to me even when I'm across the room, but for me to be directly over the Alexa Dot and for him to tell me that with his volume all the way up he can still barely hear me tells me that maybe something's wrong with mine? I'm not sure exactly and it's really strange to me. Also slightly disappointed about that. Other than that, I really like this dot.

This thing is ALWAYS listening, I don't like it. I keep it unplugged until I want to listen to music then I plug it in. When products you talk about in your home privately starts appearing on your home computer as suggestion then it's time to unplug. If you don't mind that then I guess it's not a bad device.

reviews.reviewTitle: Got a Disability? Alexa has your back!
reviews.reviewText:
I LOVE MY ALEXA DOT 3rd gen! As a person with disabilities in a wheelchair this is one of the most helpful, handy & incredible devices!
A true Must Have if you don’t have enough hands or even on out of reach places! Am purchasing 3 more to connect the entire house with sound & easier living assistance.

I got the echo dot as a birthday present and so far, ti's pretty good. The only problem is when I'm asking it to play music, half the time it says it's doesn't understand, but I can use the app to play the song I want, so it's an easy issue to get around.

What I don't like is when it suddenly activates itself and suddenly just says, "hmmm, I don't know that.". Scares the hell out of me!

Overall, since I'm still playing with it and getting used to it, I'll give it a four. There are still some problems, but I don't find them to be a deal breaker.

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo Dot 3rd Generation will not play any streaming music
reviews.reviewText: I recently got this for father's day. Spent a few hours trying to get it to stream music from ANY source including Pandora and iTunes. It would seem like it was going to work but then it would say "Sorry, I can't play the music". I then contacted support who verified there is an issue with the device (after almost another hour of trouble shooting) and showing them that all my other Echo's can play the music. I even tried it with another account on a neighbors wifi. Still doesn't work. Amazon says this is a known issue but they don't know when it will be resolved (per Amazon - could be one week, could be three weeks, just keep trying and EVENTUALLY it will work). It has already been over 3 weeks so not very hopeful it's going to work EVER. Amazon also had me contact my service provider originally as they thought it was my wifi. After hours of working with them and even getting a new router delivered it still didn't work. Then Amazon realized it was the speaker. I also purchased an Echo Link that has the same issue. I've given them plenty of time to resolve so posting this so that other potential buyers are aware before making this purchase. I'm going out now to buy a Google Home Mini.

I mostly use all of my echos to play music, or ask the time/weather etc.

I recently upgraded all my 1st and 2nd gen to this 3rd gen.
Sound quality is AWESOME compared to the previous generation.

My only issue is when “dropping in” my kids can’t hear me and sometimes when I ask Alexa something I literally have to scream at her. (Lol)
But other than that I think sound is 100% better and quality is better too.

it is nice and I enjoyed it but there are many control and feature can be easy to add but they did not .
for example
-there is a drop in feature is there but no intercom feature why?
-could have more control over the individual device how independently work. if we share house hold privilege someone, as I understand that someone can dropin or even possible to change feature of echo dot? -- I have not tested. it. I was told that they have full access.? it got great speaker for the price. it is always nice to know the weather etc..

reviews.reviewTitle: NO STARS AND THE TRADE IN PROGRAM IS A SCAM
reviews.reviewText: I decided to upgrade my gen 2 as part of a trade-in promotion, I shipped it on time, they mis-processed my trade and sent it back to me, charged me and now they've dropped the price to lower than the promotional offer without requiring a trade in

I like the Echo, this is my second one. The first is a 2nd generation and has very clear sound quality. The 3rd gen is very muffled despite having turned treble way up and bass way down. The look is good... the features the same as always but I wish I could get the clarity of the 2nd gen on this one. I didn't return it because others have said they've tried and gotten no where. So I'm keeping it, but it's relegated to an area of the house where we probably won't use it as much.

I already have an Alexia Gen 2, which I love. I use her for everything but she's at the other end of the house, so I put this "oatmeal" colored Gen 3 Alexia. This one feels like heavy cotton, feels much heavier and sturdier than the Gen 2. The speaker is bigger so I think the music is louder. I love both of them. Would buy this Alexia again. Very well put together and craftsmanship is really great!!! Love the color too, instead of just hockey puck black.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy for an older person to set up
reviews.reviewText: I admit that I was intimidated at the thought of setting up the Echo Dot (3rd Gen) - Smart speaker with Alexa by myself. I normally have one of my children come set up things for me. I followed the directions and had the Echo dot set up in no time at all. I love being able to set reminders and being able to ask Alexa questions or to find a recipe. I'm sure as time goes on I will learn more about Alexa's capabilities and begin to use other features.

reviews.reviewTitle: Finally got a smart speaker, and it's pretty cool actually
reviews.reviewText: Held off for as long as we could, but had a Prime Day special on these so got one... Pretty nice to be able to request music anytime, and generally ask the thing questions. Decent built-in speaker, but have plugged in to external for better quality. For the privacy concerned, we do regularly mute it unless we know we're going to be requesting things, but reality is -- we've got no privacy these days, unless you go completely analog and off the grid...

reviews.reviewTitle: Packaging a Joke! Was this a prank!!! Amazon is so inconsistent!
reviews.reviewText: I haven't set up this Echo Dot yet. I have others and like them but they aren't accurate a lot. My opinion is it/they need more work. Simple things Alexa doesn't pick up on and other times she picks up on harder things. Very confusing but fun for sure. My issue is with the way they shipped it. It was on back order (white) so when I received it yesterday I was shocked to see a mangled mess of what once a box that was shaped into a Charcoal Briquette Chimney Starter for no reason at all! On top of that it was a mess and no tape on either end. Anyone could have just pulled it out, plus it was dirty and just stupid... Get it together Amazon... PLEASE!

This is my third echo dot third generation and now that I have them I couldn’t do without them! They make my life so much easier. I love the feature that allows the echo to guard your home that way if any strange noises like breaking glass or fire alarms go off it Notifies you immediately and from there you can check in and listen in your home! I can’t wait to see what new features they come out with. I definitely recommend this device!

reviews.reviewTitle: Pleasantly surprised by how useful it has been.
reviews.reviewText: I bought this as an addon gift for my wife / family for Christmas. I thought it was cheap enough to throw into the pile and see what it was capable of doing for the family. My wife has set it up with her audible account, our spotify account, etc. etc. My 7 and 3 year old yell out commands to Alexa to play Kids bop Kids to start their mornings dancing. My 1 year old imitates them, its an oddity that I never thought of being in the household. There are so many small things that Alexa does that helps the family out that for the price.. it is an excellent addition to the household. I didn't give 5 stars as there are the ever present hangups with incorrect answers, Alexa responding to us when nobody asked it anything. etc.

True the speaker is a bit nicer than the 1st and 2nd gen dot, but the mic sensitivity is much worse compared to their 2nd gen echo dot. I tried saying the same thing at the same volume, and the 2nd get recognized and execute my command properly while the 3rd gen don't even recognize I'm talking to it.

Their ambient noise filter is also worse than that of the 2nd gen.
I am so disappointed with this gen of echo dot. got it at a discount, but still, I also got my other echo dots at a discount as well.

reviews.reviewTitle: Ready to pull my hair out
reviews.reviewText: I was excited to link my echo with my bigger more expensive Alexa, once I got Echo it did NOT sync with my other device...and I also have to manually go into Spotify to play music and also manually change my songs. Supper disappointed in this device, not user friendly and it also seems they have some things to work out. I spent maybe two hours trying to get my echo to voice recognize “Alexa play Spotify”...nope will not do it. I have to go into my phone click on the echo device before it’ll play. Never had this problem with my other device. Ugh.

reviews.reviewTitle: I found it pretty easy to set up.
reviews.reviewText:
I just received my Dots a couple of days ago and finally set them up today. I did have to use my desktop to find the correct app because the App Store on my phone almost had me signed up with some company out of Vietnam for $50 for life time service.
It'd be nice to be able teach Alexa how to pronounce my name. I had to spell it phonetically in my contacts. However, it still mispronounces it when talking about the account.
More later after I've used it for a while.

I love this thing. I have it in my room and I play music and stuff all the time. Im so used to it that sometimes I'll be somewhere else and start to ask alexa to do something and realize I can't because there's just an old radio. The only thing is my sister has a friend named echo and I've got a friend named alexa. Conversations where they come up (right now it's back to alexa) either end up with a confused echo dot or a response to a question we didn't ask, which is always hilarious.

Alexa has changed my life, a little. But a good change. I bought the plugs and and a WiFi light bulb that changes color in an old antique globe lamp that was losing it's paint from wear now it can be red without paint chips, or green, or pink. I also bought the firesticks to enable to pause and playback on my television with Alexa. Okay I know it sounds a bit lazy, but when your hands are full like say eating while watching TV, it is great. I can control most of my home with my voice. Maybe lazy, but I say efficient. You can also turn your lights on from anywhere else while on vacation to make the appearance that your home for security. There is also an app that plays iheart radio while I'm gone and keeps background noise for my dog. If I had to pick something to complain about, I wish you could pick your own wake word or she knew you were talking about her as opposed to her. Tiffany Hadish made her play Janet Jackson on Nobody's Fool, which was kinda funny the first time, but I could see it getting old hat. You'll also notice your eyes will glance across the room seeing if she lights up to unwantingly take part in your conversation, when you say her name casually like you accidently said the name of the person your gossiping about and they might be in earshot and heard you. But she's fun to have around the house. Timers are a lifesaver as well as even asking her the time. Games like SongQuiz are awesome that's has all generations of my family playing along, family game night is back and you don't have to clean up thimbles and fake money when it's over. She even tells me when my packages are at the mail box so I know my mail came. I use the lists for many of things, things I need for different projects at my house or for a trip the grocery store. I love Alexa she's awesome! Also an interactive kids tv show with an animated Alexa might be cool.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good quality, sound. Understands commands much better than Alexa.
reviews.reviewText:
If only our 1st generation Echo could understand our commands as well and sound 1/4 as good as this unit. Great sound, seems to understand commands much better than our 1st generation Echo.

PLEASE NOTE: If you appreciated this review please give it a “thumbs up/like” your helping me to continue to give honest/unbiased insight into products I’ve used and you may have questions about. Interested in a product but don't know enough about it and would like it reviewed? Please let me know and I'll see what I can do... Thank you 🙏

As a user of the 2nd Gen. Echo Dot, I can tell you that Gen. 3 is the one you want if you don't use an external speaker system. The sound is much sharper and cleaner than previous versions and even music sounds better on it. What I like about the Echo Dot is that you can pair it with another Dot to play music in stereo without the use of Bluetooth or directly connected speakers. A worthy upgrade.

reviews.reviewTitle: I didn't want to like it
reviews.reviewText: I had been looking for a good quality, small speaker and had some past products I wasn't happy with. We decided to try the Echo Dot, even though I was hesitant to have Alexa listening to everything. But honestly we love it! It is so handy and I love that she'll play any music I ask for. I know that I'm not tapping into all the features that this speaker offers, but I'm thrilled with what we're getting out of it. I will probably buy another one in the next year for another room.

I love having these echo dots on each of my rooms. They have so many functions for our family. We use them primarily for music, alarms, timers, lists & intercom. A few things we often ask it about the weather, what time it is, how to spell things, etc. The voice recognition has definitely become better too as the speaker for listening to music. I would definitely recommend. There are a ton more things you can do with this but these are the features we use on a daily basis.

I can't even begin to explain how much I love Alexa. So easy and convenient compared to her competition. I love the additional accessories that can be connected to Alexa. She speaks like an actual person instead of like a robot. I can control Alexa from my app from other locations and turn on lights or play music for my dogs while I'm gone. I can add things to my calendar, shopping list, and she gives me a wealth of information. I loved it so much I bought a second one and they are synced.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not always there to assist but confuse
reviews.reviewText: The device itself is well-made sounds great and looks good but the functionality is not there after setting it up it turns off the wrong lights tells me some lights don’t exist then tells me that there are multiple lights with the same name none of these things are true so therefore as good as the device is I couldn’t recommend it for anything beyond asking a basic questions or to play music or tell the weather. We own the second generation bought the third gen on another account set them both up I wish I would’ve just bought an apple home pod.

I treated myself to 2 of these for Christmas (one on each floor) and never even had a clue how much I would come to LOVE them. I have them play all kinds of music, remind me to move the laundry, answer trivial questions, make a shopping list, tell me about the weather, the news, read me an audiobook, call my friends, -- and I know I've barely scratched the surface.
If you're on the fence about whether to buy one of these little gadgets -- do it!!! You will only wish you had done so sooner!
I'm in love with Alexa!! You will be, too!

reviews.reviewTitle: Works just like the full size echo
reviews.reviewText:
I use this in a bedroom as a secondary to my main Echo. Both work exactly the same way. Sound quality is good. I adjust bass/treble to suit my preference. There are endless skills to learn, so you can do as much or little as you want. They need to improve the Alexa learning so she can answer more questions. I ask for the current outside "dew point" and get a definition of dew point. Not what I wanted. She does understand humidity, so I get that reading. I don't have any switches or outlet connected yet, so can't speak to that.
I do like the feature that Alexa can listen for smoke and CO alarms while I'm out, and message my phone about it.

Before this recent holiday, i've seen alexas on TV, seen them on advertisements, never really thought about how much they can really do. I am very impressed to say the least. In our house we have a few Phillips Hue Bulbs scattered around to make things "more efficient". Alexa connected to them FLAWLESSLY! It connected to the bulbs without having to link any accounts or anything which is a big plus. I have "routines" setup with Alexa to turn on our lights, or turn them off when we go to sleep. It can check your calendar, or the weather for you. It it truly a powerful little device! A great buy as a gift or yourself. I just got a second one within a day of receiving the first!

I love love love these echo dots. I got 2 of them for $24 each on the Thanks Giving deals. $24 for what I have? It’s amazing. For me the sound is good enough. And Alexa is so smart. I asked Alexa to do math (can’t believe), convern units, play music, tell weather, news and so on. I can easily add skills and control the lights and plugs. Really want to recommend my friends and family to get them.

Such a great product very helpful with any questions I have it’s like having the knowledge of the whole internet with just a couple words (hey Alexa). Love the fact that I can say play my playlist and I’m able to cook and listen to music on the crisp sounding speaker. The first generation wasn’t very loud and died after a year but the third generation is incredibly loud and works perfectly. Highly recommend to anyone this product fits great for just about any situation!

reviews.reviewTitle: Much improved sound over the gen 2 dot
reviews.reviewText: This is my second echo dot. I have another gen 2 dot I bought a couple of years ago. I still use the older but I have moved it to the bedroom and use the newer one in the living room as my main one. The improvements in sound quality is like night and day. Having the new one, the old one sounds grainy and low quality. Functionality is more or less the same and I don't notice a difference. The only real differences is the sound quality and the improved appearance.

reviews.reviewTitle: iPhone XR hates these. So does my iPad...
reviews.reviewText: Neither speaker, I ordered 2, would have anything to do with my iPad, my iPhone XR, or my husband’s iPhone 8. I bought it for my iTunes library...and it doesn’t wanna play. Have no clue if it’s an iOS/compatibility problem, but neither worked with any apple product. I’m not stupid and followed the directions to a T...but Alexa just flat out b*tch slapped Siri. Siri and I kicked Alexa to the curb. Returned both speakers. Replaced with Bose, and a flawless integration was had by all...

Just got my Amazon Exho Dot 3rd gen. And it work well, like my 2nd gen EXCEPT Alexa sounds like she's speaking to me through a pillow! It's very annoying and yes , I used the Alexa app. to try to adjust the sound and it DIDNT work. My 2nd gen. sounds so much better. I'm going to try to exchange it and see if that helps. Unfortunately the sale was buy 1 get 1 free and I sent the other to my friend as a birthday present. I'm not sure Amazon will exchange just 1 because of the sale and I'm sure my friend will be disappointed. This will be his first experience with the Echo Dot and I think hell probably send it back to me. That's embarrassing and it sucks. My 1st gen works like a charm. I'm a very disappointed Echo dot user and now would hesitate to purchase any more Echo products. :-(

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to use and setup, amazing price, superb sound, I can’t rave enough
reviews.reviewText: This is possibly one of my favorite and best purchases. This device replaces the need for an alarm clock, radio, MP3 player, calendar, sleep sound device and much more!! I never anticipated loving this product so much. The uses are endless from weather to daily reminders, jokes and recipes. The price is outstanding for the endless usefulness. It’s quick and easy to set up, and easy to use. The speaker has a wonderful rich tone while the design is beautiful.

I won’t an echo at my work Christmas party. Best thing ever! Got sick of my son stealing it so I ordered him a DOT and it’s great. I can run to the store and open the app and connect directly to either device. I can make announcements via Alexa’s voice if needed. I can control the volume. And also! Activate freetime which makes it so he is unable to access inappropriate material. The stereo sound is outstanding and it’s so underpriced. I suggest buying the Echo and Echo Dot 💯. So worth it!!

I can ask for a weather report, a news update or a specific song and Alexa will provide it instantly. Also, I an using it to turn lights on and off. Ask for a joke and you'll get one . If you don't think it 's funny , say so and you will a better one.
Hooked up to your internet, this can replace your clock, radio, stereo, and many other items such as a dictionary,

The echo sometimes doesn’t recognize we are calling it. And sometimes decides not to listen. We use it as a baby monitor (sound only) mostly, for a couple of reasons. 1. We have an Alexa that’s way better. 2. The echo responsiveness or lack of is very frustrating. 3. It doesn’t execute commands correctly. You can ask it to play a song from an artist and it’ll play something entirely different. We’re looking at upgrading to a show but for now this will do.

The audio is pretty distorted for the voice so it's difficult to understand.
Alexa also keeps taking over on the tablet, even if I say specifically where to play music.
This is gen 3 and it still feels like a beta.

I wouldn't buy it again, and I wouldn't recommend you buy it either. Maybe try Google. I'll get one free Soon from Spotify and I'll update my review.

We love Alexa!! she is amazing! everyone in my family ages 10+ enjoys using alexa. Great for an intercom system, music player, perfect for getting ready in the mornings, awesome kitchen assistant, and great when you're just curios and have a question. So smart! i have had 2nd and 3rd generation, they are both basically the same, but maybe the 2nd could pick up my voice better or maybe its because I have her in a much larger area than the previous version., not a big difference. The sound is also really great for such a small device!

I like my gen 2. 4yr old daughter uses my gen 2 echo dot to control the fire stick in the living room. I use it often for timers, date and time. Due to sound quality I use fire stick and not echo dot gen 2.
The reviews I have seen are correct! This new echo dot has great sound. Blows the old one away on quality and volume. Fewer mics isn't a problem, it does even better hearing us. Plus I'm going from 1 to 3, multi-room is nice feature. I don't like my older one now, this one makes that seem like junk.

Works the same, but big hardware upgrade, even weighs more.
Night and day between new and old gen 2 echo dot!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Integrates easily and beautifully w other Amazon Echo devices -- inexpensively
reviews.reviewText: There is absolutely nothing to dislike and most everything to like about the new Echo Dot. Of course the speaker is limited, but look at the price. For simply answering questions, weather, sports, even reading an audible book, the Dot is excellent. For quality music, the speaker is limited. Bottomline: It took 2 minutes to set up and the Echo Dot plays well with my family of Amazon full size Echo devices, at a superb price point.

reviews.reviewTitle: Why not a five star review - Amazon add control for the lights!
reviews.reviewText: It would be a five star review and I believe it is still the best offering in this category. I have 3 echo devices and 2 of them are the dots. Why only 4? I use these for home automation and if used in my bedroom unless you like night lights which I do not there seems to be now way to turn off the lights. Amazon please add a feature to control when the lights are active and even one better what notifications are allowed at night to trigger the lights. With out this I have to use black tape around the edges to be able to sleep at night.

reviews.reviewTitle: Everyone says she’s cool but not really impressive
reviews.reviewText: She’s cool. She tells me the weather. But my brand new Vizio Smart TV? Nah...skill is enabled but she “can not connect bc the skill isn’t enabled”. Same applies for about 3 other devices that say they are enabled under my app, but she has no enabled skill when I ask her to do certain things. For being so “smart”, she’s pretty much just Siri. Nothing special. What’s the point of having so many “skills” if they don’t work properly? With everyone telling me how awesome she was and how little is needed to be done to set her up, she’s a great big disappointment.

reviews.reviewTitle: We love it, but we're going for a Spot.
reviews.reviewText: This is a great review for a product that I am returning. Why? Because we also have a "regular" Echo and recently got a Spot. We thought this would be a cheaper alternative for our third unit - and it would - but we love our Spot so much, we're going to trade up. I haven't actually returned it yet, so I might cancel, get another spot and put this guy in a location where I can use just the audio - my bathroom for example. This is so "first world" I almost feel guilty, but it makes life just a bit more fun and it is not expensive.

This 3rd generation Echo Dot has so much bass that it distorts the sound and makes it unpleasant to listen to. You can adjust the bass/treble (just tell it to lower bass/increase treble, over and over, until Alexa tells you the bass is at its lowest or treble is at its highest), but it's not enough to make it nice to listen to. I much prefer the 2nd generation. And this 3rd generation is bigger and much heavier. I have no idea why this may be an upgrade from 2nd gen. I'll wait for another sale on the 2nd gen. I wouldn't buy another 3rd gen.

I received this as a promo on a Ring Doorbell 2 I purchased from a local big box retailer. Have spent 30 minutes trying to use this as a Bluetooth speaker, and nothing. I've got 4 other devices in the house that connect to my phone with zero problems, and this piece of shit won't connect. If I had known this, I would have used it as a stocking stuffer or something but now I'm stuck with it. Thanks Amazon.

This is my first Alexa device in an all Apple/Siri household. We love it. We use it to turn on our GE oven. Set the Honeywell thermostat. Make grocery lists with ease.
The sound quality is better than expected for everyday use, particularly at only $50. We like the ease of playing music from Amazon prime. The downside is a poorly designed power plug which makes me wonder what Amazon engineers were thinking. This should be redesigned quickly. It’s way too big. I’d also like it to work with my IOS Fantastical calendar but that’s a developer issue. We recommend this product if you don’t mind the oversized plug.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good things come in small packages
reviews.reviewText:
Good things come in small packages. Amazon echo has been a staple in every household, and should be. The amazon echo is easy to setup and fun to use.

Pro's:

Small
Stylish
good sound
lots of features

Con's : None

Overall impression of the third gen amazon echo is that its a good device for listening to music, playing games and many other different things.

Get one.

reviews.reviewTitle: To put it simply: It lives in my junk drawer
reviews.reviewText: I finally jumped on this Echo Dot bandwagon thanks to Amazon Prime Day. Well, this purchase disappointed. If Alexa even understands your instructions, you might get something going. But the connection is horrible and it's definitely not our network. And like I said, most of the time Alexa can't even decipher what someone is saying. I tried returning this but guess what?...Missed the cutoff. It's been sitting in the junk drawer since.

My husband got me the amazon echo dot so that I could use it to listen to music. We’ve had it for a bit over a week and I love it. Initially, we had it set up on our wooden desk, but found that the wood dampened the sound quite a bit. Once we put it on top of our printer, we’ve had no problems. My son loves listening to his paw patrol theme song and I use it multiple times daily to listen to music while I clean and play with my boys.

I do not see what the excitement is about regarding these. Mine only works about half the time, the speaker started distorting after a couple of months. All the cool things you see in the commercials, it says it cannot do, and you have to look up instructions online. Some things never work, like calling people phones or calling echos on a different room.

In our house, we are Apple product people. When it comes to any tech item there are pros and cons and Apple has a few that can be frustrating and Siri is just that! I believe Siri is there to annoy it’s user at times. I guarantee at least 2 times out of 5, Siri can’t assist me when I ask for aid! Then for Christmas my girls received an Echo dot and they loved it and then I got myself one and Alexa rocks! She doesn’t cause the issues Siri has and that is what I love! Definitely a pro in my book! I definitely recommend this item.

reviews.reviewTitle: It’s not as simple as you see on tv commercials.
reviews.reviewText:
My biggest issue is Alexa doesn’t understand what I’m asking when I’ve enabled the apps for it. I use the sleep app for rain sound every night and it still gets confused most of the time or will play the same one, even tho I’ve added most of them for rain. I also don’t like how the app pages default back to the top of the list after I enable something within the list of choices. I gave a 2 rating because so far I see nothing special about it, mainly because she answers with “idk” to most questions. Nor do I like how I have to remember the exact way to ask for what I’ve enabled. It seems to resort to playing a song from your music playlist based on one word it understands. Yet it doesn’t give a reassurance question, it just blast the song on. Ugh
What I like a lot is how the smart plug enables turning on lights. That’s pretty cool 😎. Problem is, you’ll find yourself walking right pass the light just to ask Alexa to do it. 😂🙃🤫
The Alexa site is confusing and boring. It doesn’t flow like other programs. It simply drops everything in one place in each category, and you just figure it out. It listed some books I’ve purchased in the past, and although Alexa can read them, her voice is very much monotone robot so the “umph” from your story is missed. Overall, I’m excited to see new upgrades as Alexa is tweaked. To me, it seems like it’s incomplete or was released too early or something. I’m not giving up on it because I’ve come this far and I wanna grow with my little buddy. 😬

I've always been against having stuff like this in the house listening in on your every move - but after buying a Ring Doorbell and this came with it we've had a lot of great laughs with it. The play music feature is pretty cool, and the sound isn't bad. It's great for kids so they can ask questions to their heart's content without having unsupervised access to the internet. I've enjoyed mine so much I bought another for my mom - she'll get a kick out of it I'm sure.

A great product that could use some work. I'm not a fan of the drop in feature. Even after contacting Amazon and getting help we still have random people dropping in. When connected to our fire stick tv the sound and the people are off which drives me insane and it's annoying listening through the speaker. I hope as we learn how to use it better I will love it more. I do like that I can play music without having to turn the TV on tho.

reviews.reviewTitle: Should of read a full review
reviews.reviewText:
I personally like the echo dot, but it doesn’t work for what I need. It would be the perfect accessory for secondary rooms. I should of purchased the echo dot plus first.

My kids Love Alexa and playing music.

I gave Alexa integration 1 star because I don’t have anything for Alexa to control and I haven’t setup What I have to see how it works.

I also gave sound quality 1 star because this speaker is perfect for a small room, and not to be used a main Bluetooth speaker.

Overall, this is a good helper that’s worth $50. I can give a better review once I add more speakers.

Side note: I’m an Apple person all the way, but I like Alexa at the moment way better than Siri just based on responsiveness.

reviews.reviewTitle: Sound quality much better, Voice recognition worse
reviews.reviewText:
I use my echo dots alot. I have all kind of routines set up, and they help me everyday. Lights, Scentsy warmers, Christmas lights, Lamps..etc. The new Echo Dot...the sound is a little tinny, but still alot louder over all and I really am happy with that. I have notice it doesn't hear me unless I speak very loudly. I was right next to it , and my other upstairs in my room and when standing at the bottom of the stairs, my upstairs 2nd Gen dot heard me and responded, but the new one didn't even blink on.
So overall..if you don't mind having to speak louder and clearer..go for it

reviews.reviewTitle: Great intro to the Echo product line
reviews.reviewText: So far, I'm very happy w/my Echo Dot. The voice recognition is Excellent! The main reason I got it was for music - linked to my Sirius account & I love it. The sound quality is good; voice recognition spot on & enjoying the options. I can see how easy it is to get hooked on using it. In fact, planning to upgrade my thermostat soon. I can also see upgrading to add the Echo (better speakers) for the great room & using Dot in other parts of my house. So far, all Good!

I have one (1) Echo, one (1) Echo Dot 2nd Gen and two (2) Echo Dot 3rd gen. Comparing Echo Dot 2nd and 3rd gen, the sound on the 3rd gen is so much better! This product regularly goes on sale, and for the price, it is an absolute great product. We are happy with the product.

For half of a century I've been using timers. Timers in the kitchen,bathroom, kids room long ago. I only need one Alexa. I don't have to remember a million (slight exaggeration) things that need to be done at a certain time. Who needs to be called, reminded of doing something I've forgotten, no more notes all around the house....JUST ALEXA, AND SHE NEVER FORGETS! My husband and I both love her..mainly because we're not telling one another to remind the other to do something! We should have gotten her long ago!

I ordered two of these around Black Friday/Christmas this past year. One of these was a gift and the other I use at least once a week. It works well sometimes and has great voice recognition and sound quality. Other times, it doesn’t recognize half the speech and has a static sound when it’s playing music.

Side note: quite a bit of music isn’t available on Alexa so that’s also disappointing. Do some research before purchasing. I did but might have made a different decision had I known the limited music library (unless purchases occur through prime) and how Alexa records your conversations while it stays plugged in.

reviews.reviewTitle: You need Alexa in your life
reviews.reviewText: The dots seem to hear me better than my echo show. The sound quality isn’t the best if you want to play your music loud but for usual everyday conversation with her it’s perfect. I have one in every bedroom of my house and in the living room. Definitely a helpful gadget to have and all the different apps and stuff available now are a lot of fun. Amazon even sends me periodic emails about new stuff Alexa can do so there’s always something new to try.

This did what we hoped- integrated well with our other Echo and smart home devices- better than echo input. Didn't like echo input and if you are looking at echo input, I'd pay the extra couple bucks and just get the dot version 3. Input has problems disconnecting from the music groups as well as needing to be re-paired to the speakers that it's HARD WIRED TO every time you turn off the speakers that input is connected to. No problem with EchoDot in the exact same speaker configuration

reviews.reviewTitle: The easy use of it. I take it with me when 8 travel.
reviews.reviewText: For traveling use. It’s compact and easy. I have it so I can play my car XM satellite radio through it. Love it. I have the Echo Show and 2 Echoes in my home. I use the music on the every group. It’s so cool. I will be happy when you can use different music on each one. That’s the only draw back with Amazon music. My children listen to different music based on their age. I love Country they love other music. So Mom wins at this point. Please Amazon allow different Echos in your home to play different music at the same time.

reviews.reviewTitle: Problems right out of the box
reviews.reviewText: I recently purchased a new WiFi smart thermostat and received an echo dot 3rd gen for free. It did not take long to realize why they were giving them away. The set up was seemingly simple how ever the function of the unit pails in comparison to my two Google home minis. When playing music the audio cuts out constantly. Sometimes it will pickup were it left off and other times it will skip to the next song. After doing a quick search online it became quite apparent that this is a largely know problem. Sorry Amazon but you have some work to do. Let me know if you want it back.... After speaking with someone who instructed how to perform and update on the device as it is several versions old it did not work. I spoke to another rep this morning who insists that it is my WiFi and completely ignored the software level even after being told several times. The product is in a business with top of the line WiFi which supports 5 vehicle scan tool devices with no problems. Finally she instructed me to ask ALEXA to update software which i cant do because that function is not available with the current software level. So frustrated and not even worth it since it was free. This thing is going in the trash and I will be returning my daughters Fire tablet given the poor customer service.

reviews.reviewTitle: Much more accurate & intuitive than anticipated!
reviews.reviewText: Having been used to Google's Mini, it's taken us a bit to adjust to Alexa/Echo Dot, but not long, and we've been incredibly impressed. You can practically have an interactive conversation with it, vs. Google's always felt more 1-off in the commands/interaction. Rated sound at a 4, which is still GOOD for such a small all-inclusive-device, but of course it would be impossible to be a 5, unless I were to simply do so given the circumstances.

reviews.reviewTitle: Better sound quality than older models
reviews.reviewText:
Have five older models in two houses. Bought two new ones and integrate well with older models. Sound quality is richer. Also use two [Upgraded] Anker Soundcore 2 Portable Bluetooth Speakers with 12W Stereo Sound, Bluetooth 5, Bassup, IPX7 Waterproof, 24-Hour Playtime, Wireless Stereo. Was easy to set them up for use and even set to stereo to have split left-right sound.

Nice improvements - when I ask time at night (whisper) the dot responds in a quieter voice.

reviews.reviewTitle: INCREDIBLE LIFE SAVER FOR AGING PEOPLE
reviews.reviewText: This is AWESOME for my 93 yr old mother. She has very low vision (macular degeneration for 10 years) and a little dementia. Although she first resisted this “robot” in her apartment, she has embraced it a short 2 weeks or so later. Alexa now responds to mom’s “thank you, Alexa” with appropriate comments, such as: you’re welcome, or glad to help, etc. Alexa LEARNED to do this!! There has been a learning curve, and Alexa speaks way too fast (as noted in many comments) which has been changed (8/6 or 7/2019, thanks for listening, amazon). Especially too fast for older ears. It appears you MAY have to tell her to speed up or slow down for each time she talks. Also , it APPEARS I cannot do this on the app as a “setting.” THIS NEEDS TO BE AN ACROSS THE BOARD adjustment (not time to time) AND it Must be Adjustable from the APP. MY reason for 4 stars on sound quality is due to these comments. The actual quality of the sound seems fine. Not 100%, but fine. Bottom line: Alexa has SAVED MY LIFE and GREATLY ENHANCED my mom’s quality of life. I’ve just bought Echo Connect. Hoping Connect will allow her to use her tv without having the ability to SEE the buttons.

THANK YOU AMAZON! my teenage daughter has cerebral palsy and has to be assisted with almost every facet of her life. I bought her an echo for Christmas and she LOVES it. She loves music and jokes, so she talks to it all day, making it tell her different jokes and playing Blake Shelton or Dolly Parton on Amazon Music. She can also control her Fire TV stick by voice now, she couldn't press the alexa button on the remote, so she doesn't have to wait on us to change it. I am thrilled to see her so happy that she can do something on her own without help. Thank you for bringing some joy to a young girl's life! A++ product

not as easy a set up as expected. My daughter has one which is tied to my Amazon account & now trying to set mine up (will not connect to wifi) Best Buy is making me take both to the store. No one can just answer a simple question they want you to pay $199.00 a year for tech support. Soooo I'm not completing my set up until I go to Best Buy and see what the problem is. Wish I hadn't bought them. A real pain

Love this product. We have three of them all in different rooms. Plays music of so many things. Even from our Sirius XM. I can just say Alexa add whatever to my shopping list. Have her turn on lights or not. She”ll tell you a joke, let you know a reminder if you asks her too. Tell her to wake you up at a certain time and a alarm sound goes on. If your listening to music, just stay stop when you want and she will. I can ask her to call someone from my phone list and easily talk to anyone. You just have to add her app to your phone. It’s so much and have so much to learn but well worth the purchase. Love it completely.

So I bought this for my bedroom. I already have two Alex is in my house. So between the other two. Three we’re just too much. So I gave this one to my nephew. And I only does he love it the whole entire family loves it. I’m a huge fan of Alexa. I got one years and years ago when she first came out. Alexa does so many amazing things and she makes life so much easier. From timer to alarm to music shopping list and that’s just the tip of the iceberg

reviews.reviewTitle: i like it, but it's bit deaf
reviews.reviewText: she's kinda hard of hearing i have to shout in monotone while annunciating every word crystal clear or she cant understand which is annoying but she's good at finding playlists the games are fun i like asking her questions, i don't have her set up to turn lights off or anything like that it's not the best speaker but supposedly you can hook her up to better speakers, thinking of getting firestick but will she understand the show i want to watch? i like the grey with the black and the blue light it's cute i like using the timer when my hands are full

I instantly knew this is a better, higher quality device than last generation as soon as I unboxed it. It has a better wieght to it, which means a bigger magnet, which means a better, louder speaker. I love my 2nd gen dot, but I'm so happy with the 3rd. The sound quality is a vast improvement. It also seems to recognize my voice more easily. My 2nd gen had trouble hearing me when the alarm was playing. That's no longer an issue.

I bought one because they are on sale, not expecting much. After a day of using my new dot, I ordered 3 more.

I am pretty tech challenged...so it is taking me longer to get to know everything Alexa can do, but so far...so good! Great alarm clock, plays my Christian music, lets me know the scores on my Gonzaga basketball games, updates the weather for me, and she totally freaks out my cats (which I LOVE)...I also got a wall mount so Alexa is out of the way, adn on the wall, the cats don'm mess with it! ...really, I'm just getting started, and I have heard from others that the more I use Alexa the more she will learn! So enjoy the journey as I am!

I bought this because I already have a 2nd generation and it works great, however, this 3rd generation says it can call contacts from your phone but mine doesn’t want to contact to my contacts from my iPhone . So it says that you can ask to call mom mine doesn’t because it won’t connect to my contacts, so needless to say I’m not to thrill with it. It also says that the sound is better then the 2nd generation and that’s not true. So if you decided to buy one I would suggest to get the 2nd generation which is cheaper and works just as well.

reviews.reviewTitle: Like the upgraded look, wish it was still a USB power cable.
reviews.reviewText: I have the 2nd generation and I definitely like the look of this 3rd generation better. So far it's worked pretty well. Glad that it still works essentially the same as 2nd gen. just with some updated looks and buttons. Am a little disappointed that the 3rd gen doesn't go to USB to power adapter like the others, this has its own cable. Since one of the 2nd generation ones that I have, I have plugged into a USB outlet. But realistically it's no big deal. I still really like it.

I had to get help to connect to wifi as I'm not familiar with how to do things like that but once I had Alexa up and going I've loved it. My purpose was to see if there were sounds like rain or storms that would help me to sleep but after I was connected to the music, I fell in love with it. I'm a traditional country fan and was happy with what I was able to listen to. My young Granddaughter loves more modern songs so we will play games, first she chooses a song, then I do. I know there's still more to learn with my Echo Dot 3 and I can't wait.

I was immediately able to play the music I liked and control my lights and ask about my calendar, as I had those things already synced to my Alexa app. It is super duper tiny. It fits in the palm of my hand. It's so cute and discreet! There were some abstract questions I asked Alexa: queries like good ideas to do on a cold day spent indoors. Alexa doesn't know that one, but she is learning. However, I am thrilled to have her help in my home. I even had a friend over and was able to play Trivial Pursuit with them through Alexa. It was a fantastic experience. I can't wait for Alexa to learn more. ^_~

reviews.reviewTitle: the third generation is mind blowing thank you Amazon now you. Really Rock LOL !!!!
reviews.reviewText: If don't have one yet you are missing out this third generation all new Echo Dot is unbelievable who would've thought you can't even compare The two from the Power plug to the base in the speakers to the quality of sound the overall good looks n design I would have to give it a 10 hands-down one of the nicest changes from Amazon to the consumers still for a unbelievable low price what a deal.

reviews.reviewTitle: Pretty Good if you are an avid Amazon user
reviews.reviewText:
We wanted to test out Alexa vs Google. We have both an Alexa and Google Home. I definitely like Alexa for ordering things on Amazon or for Prime use. I dont ask it many questions because it cant answer them like how Google can. Alexa has a ton of features when using the Alexa App. Ive used Alexa to turn on my Xbox and to talk to Pikachu. I suggest the generation 3 since the speakers are around the product rather than on top. The sound comes out more easily.

If you use Amazon Music or any of its products on the daily, then I would recommend an Alexa.

If your looking for more answers to your search then get Google.

Or if you're just a little bored and have some extra money to spend, then get both. Lol

reviews.reviewTitle: It's worth the upgrade and outlet mounts are awesome!!
reviews.reviewText: Prime Day deal!! I traded in an old Echo Dot and upgraded to this 3rd generation model. Wow, what a difference! The music playing on this sounds amazing and speaker volume gets super loud. Voice recognition is way better too. I have two 3rd generation echos and got the 2 pack of Proudbird outlet mounts which is perfect for both devices!! They hide all of the cords and keep the echoes securely in the outlets. Highly recommend if you haven't upgraded your dots yet!

I loved the one I bought so much, that I bought 2 more! I have them set up so I can play music around the house, or just have the one in my childs room start playing something. The sound quality is amazing for the size. I don't have a Smart TV yet, but I look forward to having these linked to TVs around the house so I can put things on for my child in her room while Im in my room or the living room. Very good product for someone new to the 'smart house' concept.

I don't have any real 'smart products' to speak of, but this is still fun to play with. I ask her all kinds of questions and she answers me. She will meow at my cat for me, which my cat seems disturbed by. She hasn't failed me at playing descent music.

I'll get a few more to extend the range of which I can talk to her, but she does seem to hear me fairly well when I am a couple rooms away (even if I can't hear her reply, I can see her light up though).

reviews.reviewTitle: The sound quality is terrible compared to the previous model.
reviews.reviewText:
I upgraded because the old one had trouble hearing my wife’s commands, as she is very soft spoken.

Not only did we not see much of an improvement in it’s listening, but the sound it omits is muffed. It sounds just awful composed compared to the older model. There’s almost no treble. It’s all low range, which from such a tiny speaker is pathetic unto itself.

This is a downgrade from the prestigious generation in my option.

I love the Echo Dot. The functionality is quite good, it works most of the time, it's small and unobtrusive and, for the price, it's a great purchase. As I add more devices to my home that can be controlled by the Dot, its value will only grow. My only complaint is that the Sonos Skill (which was the main reason I originally bought the Dot) is lousy and plain doesn't work. I also have some minor privacy concerns, but that's not a big issue for me. Overall, I'm very happy with the Dot.

I bought this just as an alarm clock. We're not talking about Gigabits of computing power here.....Alexa failed miserably at this simple task. Why? Maybe because if your internet suffers one microsecond of interruption while you are sleeping ...guess what? No wake up. ....No on board clock or battery backup of any kind apparently. Got an important wakeup for a job interview at 8 am and the internet blipped overnight? .....too bad. Really need to rely on Alexa for something important? Look somewhere else.
Best and brightest at Amazon? Really?

I've had the echo dot for about two weeks thanks to the amazon music + echo dot promotion. It is really an amazing device with very useful features. The reason I don't give it a 5 star rating is because, and I don't know if this is normal or just my device, I had some difficulty connecting with my laptop and wi-fi. Additionally, sometimes the device will become unresponsive at random times. I can't yet identify what it is that triggers this unresponsiveness. When it happens either it auto-restarts and takes a good 10 minutes to start working again or I will manually unplug and plug back again. Other than that I really like the echo dot. Very fun.

Great sound for such a small speaker, I received mine as a gift. Alexa works well, I wish there was an easier way to learn how to use this device other than emails. I enjoy using it as a wireless speaker at home, it works especially well as a sound machine, I keep mine by my bed and use it to help sleep. The reason I give two stars and not five is because there's no battery, and this device MUST be plugged in in order to operate, the included cable is incredibly short, and I haven't figured out if there's a voice command to tell Alexa not to listen to you (as if you were to press the mute button and the red ring appears). Also, a side note, wouldn't it be cool if this device doubled as a wireless charger? This in my opinion would have offset the fact that it does not have a battery. Or at least a couple USB type A power out ports. Some sort of charging capabilities would be very nice, considering you cant take this device anywhere outside the home. It would also be great if there was a button command you could press on the speaker to enter Bluetooth pairing mode, instead you have to use the app/website which in my opinion is cumbersome. Overall this is a "good" product, I'm glad I received it as a gift because however "good" it is, I would not spend my own money on it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa is My New Friend and Confidant
reviews.reviewText: My insurance company Travelers decided it would be a good thing for their policy holders to have the device so they made a deal with Amazon to provide them. I live in a smart home and have been having more fun communicating with our friendly Echo Dot. Alexa is the call sign that begins a conversation with the high tech device. While I don't know many features at this point it is my understanding that there are over 50,000 commands. Thanks to Travelers for the introduction. Special note: If you ask for something that might cost an additional fee Alexa asks if you want to learn more about the requested feature.

I've added an Echo Dot to every room on my quest to have a smart house- I love how easy Alexa makes things, from turning on lights to arming my security system to playing music. My older dot is slowly starting to become harder and harder to communicate with but the new gen works wonderfully. I also bought holders from Mount Genie (their website directly because Amazon was sold out) and the mounts are a perfect home for my dots as they hide cords and position Alexa on the wall above where she's plugged in.

(It worked great for a few months, now it won't connect to the internet??? Moved it around to where I have other things connected but it still won't connect. I can't seem to find any info that tells me what the problem might be.)
I RECEIVED A CALL VERY SOON AFTER WRITING THE ABOVE REVIEW AND NOW I HAVE TO SAY THAT THE SUPPORT TEAM WAS EXTREMELY HELPFUL. THE PRODUCT WAS FINE...POSSIBLY OPERATOR PATIENCE ISSUE..... THEY HAD ME IN BUSINESS IN A MATTER OF MINUTES.

reviews.reviewTitle: It is an Echo Dot, it works as advertised.
reviews.reviewText: I bought a couple of these. The sound quality is good, however I did attach some plug to speakers that really rounded out the music experience. I an very happy with my Echo Dots. I use them a lot. I had issues at first with losing wifi connection, however once I went to a secure (not open) WIFI connection; I have not had an issue since. I will purchase more in the future (to have in every room of the house. I am just anxiously waiting to get my invite for the Echo Auto...

I love this... I bought two. Still learning about her but it’s great. I bought three smart plugs. My hands can be full and just ask her to turn the lights on. It’s great. No fumbling. I getnin bed and get comfortable and don’t have to move. Just ask her to turn the lights off. I ask her to set timers and reminders. I’m trrrible about being busy then I remember something I need to do. No need to stop. Just ask Alexa. I can’t imagine not liking this. Makes my life easier and saves me time. Still learning about her.

reviews.reviewTitle: Hard to set up initially but very easy to use
reviews.reviewText:
I did not like the instructions that came with the device. I definitely needed to contact support and work with them. If I had had the correct password for my WiFi, it would still have taken an hour or more. (One can get their working WiFi password on Windows 10 by click through a series of dialogs, but it is quite obscure and convoluted. Not Amazon's fault.

One I had it set up, this device is delightful. So far I have been able to control it with brief, natural-language commands. Perhaps I should say 'her' rather than "it."

We currently have our echo dot in our 7 week old’s nursery (which is basically our bedroom right now until we decide to move her crib to her room). It’s so convenient to ask Alexa to play “rain sounds” and dim our lights when it’s our daughter’s bedtime, lock our doors, tune into NPR while changing a diaper, and/or set reminders for myself. I’m giving it four stars because today the volume was being wonky and you could barely hear it even when turned all the way up. (If this happens to your echo dot, unplug it and then plug it in again—it should work after that!)

I bought two of these to have in the bedrooms to use as a sound machine for my twins. It works perfectly! The ambient sounds loop throughout the night and I am able to use other functions such as the highlight to make it more versatile. Additionally, my daughter loves to use the hide and seek component and thinks it’s hilarious! I’m tempted to get another for the main living space. The only small issue is that it picks up my voice in the living room (small house) and will change things.

reviews.reviewTitle: works right out of the box
reviews.reviewText:
Whats not to love with an Alexa dot?
It works exactly as expected, and set up in minutes.
I've been using Alexa for a while now, and it senselessly added to my network of devices.
We'd been having trouble with a third party speaker, and were really hoping this would resolve that.
We were happy to find that it did. It also allows me to announce from my phone, and set up routines that include speaking.
Very nice

I love this little Amazon Echo. It's a big sound upgrade from the last version.

The one thing I HATE about it is that it only has a female voice option. Why is it that in the USA (it's different in the UK), anything with an electronic masculine voice is always authoritative and everything with a female voice is helpful? It's incredibly annoying. I wish that they just gave us the option to choose like the Google home product (which I got for another room but returned because I like the Echo better overall).

reviews.reviewTitle: Every old person needs an Echo Dot
reviews.reviewText: Amazing product. I love my Echo Dot. Finally I can set alarms and timers easily. Now I am going to try to use her with a smart plug to see what happens. I am 66 years old and the Echo Dot is a great help in keeping me aware of cooking times, medication doses and appointments. I could use other types of timers and alarms but if I did that I would no longer have “Alexa” to talk too. Plus she will play almost every piece of music I ask her for. She will even turn her volume up and down if asked. She has a decent price and is always around for me, day or night. Plus her sloths jokes are pretty funny.

reviews.reviewTitle: Pretty easy use and set up
reviews.reviewText:
My first time buying an echo and I have to say it's pretty awesome and easy to set up. I bought the smart bulb and outlets and it was super easy to install and is awesome to have. Alexa is pretty good at answering you quickly and quite innovative.
Downsides, music quality is decent, but bass sucks. Also she can't hear you call her when music is on. You have to literally shout to get her attention. Also her languages need work. She has trouble with her English/Spanish, Spanish/English modes.
But other than that she's really great and helpful to have around the house.

My family is new to the world of Alexa but so far we are loving this echo!!! I love to just voice command a genre of music and have it play a station while I am in the middle of cooking, if I don't like a song while stiring a pan on the stove top, I just tell Alexa to skip to the next song . I had ordered a smart plug with it so I can control my Christmas tree lights, I just tell Alexa to turn them off and on, no more plugging and unplugging. My daughter loves that if I run to the grocery store she can call me using the Echo Dot, this feature alone is worth the cost for kids to connect with family without tying up their parents phone, for my children the call quality is much better than them fidgeting with a cell phone using speaker phone. Between festive music while cooking or kids having dance parties, we all are enjoying the convenience of Alexa with this Echo Dot. I highly recommend having one in your kitchen or any frequently used room. Next I want to get one for the bathroom, how nice it will be to voice command songs to play or check the weather while in the shower.

My daughter asked Santa for one of these for
Christmas. We really liked the one she got so we bought 2 more for ourselves. Siri can’t understand a word my daughter says. Alexa understands everything. She can start my car, turn lights off and on, play games, tell us the weather, tell us the time, and so much more. I really like how it’s given our house an intercom too with the drop in feature. I will be buying more when I see a good sale again.

reviews.reviewTitle: This Little Dot does more than expected!!!!
reviews.reviewText: I really didn't know how much the echo. can do until I got it downloaded the app and read what it could do. I am blown away by this little technology device. I love how I can just say Alexa turn off 1st plug, ask about the weather, play a game song quiz true or false and a can give me my own breathing of what I need to know before I leave the house in the morning. This little thing Has blown me away Especially because I am a technology gal! Definitely worth the money and I might get another one as well as more things that hook up to this echo dot.

reviews.reviewTitle: A crippled girl's dream come true!!
reviews.reviewText: This device is life changing for me! I am confined to a wheelchair with limited physical mobility, and to have a device as my helping hands has been AWESOME!! So far I've gotten the HUE lights and attached my tv, music, and a few other devices to my echo dot and boy has it made this little cripple's life easier!!! Can't wait to add more household devices over time!!!

Like my first alexa, it did not take long for it to not understand commands that had been issued regularly without issue previously. As I alluded to, I have two Alexas - upstairs and downstairs. Often the units will play on the other one repeatedly despite commands otherwise. SOOOOOOOO frustrating. Add to that the fact that employees listen to your alexa recordings. Just as easy to use my phone for music and podcasts and my kitchen timer - instead of the glorified timer that alexa is. I have used the tech dept for issues before and they were useless - they suggested I restart the unit - wow never thought of that.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa not ready for prime time
reviews.reviewText: Alexa is not very smart and can’t find any good music unless you pay for it. If any song is a little obscure you won’t find it. Asking Alexa questions is like talking to a dumb blonde. (Sorry Blondes. Blondes are smarter than Alexa). I mean blondes like Kelly Bundy. Sound quality is only okay if you plug it into another decent sound system. You can do that with an iPhone. I don’t see how this device becomes anything necessary since the smart tools can be controlled in better ways with a phone. Alexa is a little annoying Bitch!

I'd like to customize the wake word beyond the few you have built in. There are, ironically, two Dots in one room (they're on different accounts), so we had to change one of their wake words so that both don't answer to the same wake word. I would like to change mine to something like "Finley," but Dot won't accept custom wake words. Can you work on that?

Otherwise, it's a fun device. LOVE the "Vortex" thing. Surprising, and yet, very entertaining.

Own a few Google Home Speakers and I feel that Echo 3rd generation speakers sound better than home mini. The home mini was better than the 2nd generation echo though. Ok now the bad part. Echo is not as smart as Home mini when it comes to responding to basic questions like singing some nursery rhymes for my baby. One thing that I don’t like is it doesn’t have a physical stop button like the google mini has; you can just tap on it and it will stop. This one doesn’t have that so if I have to stop it without shouting alexa stop I am out of luck.

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo Dot Alexa Could be Better
reviews.reviewText: I really do like my Echo Dot Alexa but it needs some improvement. Mostly I just play music and sometimes the sound is not good and has an echoing or scratchy sound. I have Amazon Music Unlimited (and it sounds so much better in my car than on the Echo Dot) and when I request a song like Michael Buble's new White Christmas version she always plays his old one with Shania Twain and I want the new one so Alexa is not up to date.

We have an Echo in our kitchen that serves as our primary hub. I had tried the first iteration of Echo Dot and was very displeased with the tinny sound of the speaker. Well let me tell you, this new generation of Dot is incredible. I got two -- one for each of my teenage daughters' rooms -- and the sound in a bedroom is almost as good as the sound produced by the Echo. Way way better than the music coming out of their laptop speakers (which is how they listened to music before). Nice job, Amazon. We are huge fans of the Echo product.

reviews.reviewTitle: This little dude is a good sounding Dot!
reviews.reviewText: I have numerous Echos, and have given some as gifts and was waiting for a chance to get one of these new dots. I had read the sound is much better than previous Dot models and I am impressed. This one little dude sounds as good as the full sized original Echo Cylinder... I don't now how they did it, but it actually "hears" better than the second generation Dots as well. Nice little piece to add to my large collection of Echo products and other smart home items.
I’ve had this item for 8 days and the speaker already sound awful. It has a crackly quality like the speaker is already busted.

We received our first unit as a gift from my daughter, and it has become a part of our lives. From controlling lights to maintaining shopping list to answering questions on the fly and giving daily and weekly reminders. We just ordered two more units.
