Here is a suggestion Amazon if you ever review these, add an application to teach language. A person could converse with the echo and it could give you words and phrases to say and check your pronunciation.

reviews.reviewTitle: Huge downgrade from the previous version.
reviews.reviewText: Worse speaker, worse microphone, huge delay after saying "Alexa". Bring back the old version!!!

Wasn't sure how much we would use it or how useful it would be, but I thought we would try it out. My children love it for playing music and I have found it useful for reminders, weather, general curiosity questions and also as a sort of intercom as well as the music and other features. It was a little difficult to set up the WiFi but that is likely because I was going off of an extender to connect. I had to install the app on my phone for set up and use the manual connect using my phone's WiFi connection. It also took a while to figure out how to connect to an older Bluetooth speaker that was not listed, but once it was set up there have been no issues and we use it more than I thought we would.

Love this as long as I'm connecting at home but if you travel for work like I do its basically worthless. Most times it won't connect in hotels and if it does the connection isn't stable. It won't even connect in a corporate apartment.
It's fine when I'm home but since I'm rarely there it's going to be gifted to someone else.
There should be a warning about connection issues. They also said I could possibly hotspot it for a connection but since I'm not in the country I'd probably get roaming charges. If I had known I wouldn't have purchased this or the music upgrade. Waste of money!

reviews.reviewTitle: Sound quality much improved. But still a little too mush bass for speech
reviews.reviewText: I listen to the news on this device. This replaced my 1st generation Echo in which the speaker "died". Sound quality improved BUT, in my opinion too much bass. Also on daily briefing, too much difference in volume between BBS News (volume drops considerably) and Associated Press...Wayyyyy to loud. This volume difference issue is not device dependent, I've notice for a few years on all of my devices ( have 3 Echo devices).

At all time, I do not know what to do with a digital assistant at home. This time Amazon offers 8 dollars, then why not. I bought it, brought it to home, set it up, and wowwww... Now I do not need to walk around or use my apple watch to turn on all the lights, but just call "Alexa, lights on" or "Alexa, play classical"... Wowwww
I recommend you guys to try it out even if you do not know what to do with it. You gonna find your life is so much better!

Clock is a great addition, and obvious improvement. The only thing things is... If you use it for an alarm clock you still have to talk to Alexa to turn off the alarm. You can snooze with the action button, but actually turn it off. And while the alarm is obviously designed to wake you up, your voice talking to Alexa can be more of a wake up for your bed partner. An off button option would be an improvement one step more.

This thing has been great! Very loud which apparently was an issue in the old generations. One frustrating thing is that it seems to recognize my children's voice more than my own... And as you can imagine, listening to the clean up song or the gummy bear song 8000 times a day is pretty miserable. So. When i have to yell at all my children AND Alexa. It can be pretty frustrating lol. But all and all very good. Lots of cool features. And super handy!

Its a good thing .. this lazy maker.. telling to turn on lights , music, coffee, maker. etc.. but it works great and thinking of getting another one for the downstairs area..that way I don't have to yell it to do something. but it hears great.. the only reason I don't give it a full 5 stars is because of sound quality.. to muffled..when ALEXA responds, it sounds like she has the "phone on her cheek" even the music sounds a bit muffled.. finally al attachments are pretty expensive.. plugs etc..that are sold separately.. other than that..I like it..so far

Addition to our family echo dot lineup. We love the ability to make announcements across our house. Really cut down on the yelling to get our voice heard from one level to the next. Nighttime music and sleep timer is used every night. Never wanted these devices but now that we have a few we love them. Really spend some time playing with the skills and reading some articles to get the most out of your device. Wish I did that a lot sooner.

I have two of the first version and the new one is much better. The speaker quality and volume is hugely improved and I like the new style (less utilitarian looking). Was easy to setup (of course) and recognizes my voice even if I'm not speaking loudly. It's a Echo....what more do you need to know. Of course, I have a Google device as well cause neither do everything I want. Maybe they should mate and produce a Google Little Dot. :)

Easy to set up if you have experience with pairing devices and using your cell phone e.g Amazon Alexa and Smart Life. Fun for the whole family! I was shocked at the amount of cool features the echo dot with Alexa has! The trivia games are great fun to bring everyone together and I would have to say my favorite feature, being in a large home, is the ability to broadcast messages to any echo dot that is connected to your home network. The echo dot with Alexa is a great feature to our home and it is kid friendly. My daughter asks Alexa to play, "Jesus loves me" every morning. I will definitely be buying a few more echo dots to fill other rooms in the home. Nice sounding speaker even at max volume, Good voice recognition, and a great number of different options and ability this little device has to offer. Good buy!

Nothing but problems with shipping on three of them so I finally get two of them neither one of them work I finally get one to work after a few hours and playing with it and it doesn't even play anything for me from Amazon it keeps going other places very silly I'm going to Google, should have did that right from the very beginning

I had no idea how handy and used this would become when I bought it! So much fun to play any music, any white noise, podcast, whatever, all voice activated. My favorite ridiculously simple feature is the lists... whenever I think of something, can verbalize, and it’s added to the lists on my phone in the app... love, love, love!!! Play song quiz all the time with my 10 year old, among other things. Great for quick questions, handy and fun for a million things.

This is our third Alexa-enabled device, having started with a 2nd gen dot then picking up a 2nd gen Echo. We really liked both of those, primarily for music and setting up a daily Flash Briefing, but have also added some basic smart-home accessories. The full size Echo has much better sound quality than the 2nd gen dot, but this 3rd gen dot has noticeably closed the gap! The sound is fuller overall, especially on the low end, and voice recognition seems just as good. In addition, the new design looks much better, despite being slightly larger.

reviews.reviewTitle: It's cool except it won't do the thing I wanted it for.
reviews.reviewText: I wanted to use it to play music, and was a little disappointed to find out that I cant play my own playlists through the Alexia app for the I-phone. If there is a way to do it it's too confusing for me to figure out. I can understand a little because Amazon wants you to subscribe to a monthly fee so that they will make more money. I can play some free services like I heart radio which does have playlists, but they don't always play the music I like. Actually it would be much easier for me to play my I phone through some blue-tooth speakers and be done with it.

reviews.reviewTitle: We have four dots now - and an old echo in the garage
reviews.reviewText:
Although we are not Alexa power users these have been nice. I have them all over the house and they mostly get used to turn certain lights on and off and to play music "everywhere", kind of a wireless intercom system. My wife listens to her favorite radio station on Echo.

We have played around a bit with using Alexa in the kitchen step through recipes and it makes a great timer. I use it in the garage to verbally add fractions when I am woodworking and to convert fractions to millimeters or back.

I purchased this echo dot as my second unit of echo after having my first Amazon echo for almost 1 year. I like the responsiveness of "Alexa" to command and it was able to fulfill requests correctly, most of the time. Mostly, I use the echo to hear music, the quality of the sound is very good, clear on the high frequency and deep enough bass providing richness of what you expect from a music or songs. I am slowly adding additional Alexa compatible devices, such as the smart switch and I was able to command Alexa to turn on or off the light in my room. Although like many other people, I have my share of concern to what other thing that the Echo is listening all the time.

Bought this to upgrade my Echo Dot (1st Gen) smart speaker. Compared to the 1st generation - this one is amazing! The sound is very nice for how small it is, and I like how responsive this new one feels. I also feel, like this one has a harder time hearing my voice across the room or right in front of it. Maybe a software update can fix this, all in all it's a nice upgrade from the 1st generation echo dot.

Also, I like the dedicated power plug included in with the speaker - compared to the usb wall wart and micro usb connection.

Borrowed one from a friend as I never thought I'd want one. This thing is not only great fun and informational but has multiple practical applications. One of the simple uses that I love is the shopping list, whenever my wife and I think of something all we have to do tell Elexa and its there on my phone, no getting up write it down, and once at the store you just check each item off. Its amazing how quickly she can get answers on almost any subject you ask. Every home should have one.

I got this product because I changed cable/internet providers and lost my access to SIRIUS XM radio. The ads for ECHO Dot indicate I could get that service and "Listen to all my favorite music". What they don't tell you is that you need a subscription to SIRIUS XM Radio, which is approx. $20 a month. No where is any of the literature does it say that. I was annoyed and disappointed. I returned it the very next day. Also, in order for ALEXA to perform functions,you have to keep adding "TASKS" or apps for her to do what she is supposed to do. Not pleased with the information on this product. I didn't own the product long enough to determine how good the product actually is.

Yes it’s always listening... but how else would it be able to respond to you?! Also, who cares what you say in your house? I have 4 Alexas in my house and my spouse has one in her office at work. We use it all the time. I wish it could replace Siri on my iPhone and I could use Alexa everywhere. One issue I see is that the multiple Alexas don’t work well together so you basically have an independent Alexa in the area where it’s located. If you don’t have an Alexa, you should 😎👍

Works a lot like the first Echo I bought way back when it first came out--with a price tag of about $200 but on sale for $100. Got this one on sale for about $20. Does a lot more than the first one (which is still in service) but in a much more compact version. Love being able to call people with it. Love getting the news and weather. And love the blinking yellow ring that tells me she has news from Amazon for me! Alexa, what's the notification? You have a shipment from Amazon shopping coming today!!

reviews.reviewTitle: The Dot is mostly on spot
reviews.reviewText: I love it! It's a great for alarms, reminders, shopping lists and just general questions about almost anything that Alexa can answer usually on the fly. Not to mention a song you want to hear that pops into your head or a playlist that Alexa can pull from my Spotify account. I connected my Dot by cable to my Bose computer speakers. As far as controlling devices, it works flawlessly on my plugs and switches. It has a little trouble responding to my Sony Bravia TV when I ask it to turn it on. Works maybe 75% of the time. That may be a problem with the Alexa App provided by Sony. It just came out on my last Sony Android update and may have a few bugs yet. It does work flawlessly on other TV functions such as volume control, muting, changing input and shutting off. I'm still learning everything this amazing product can do and I suspect in time there will be new functions available.

I love using the Echo dot and giving Alexa command to play songs and start my smart LG tv and playing my fav shows on Netflix. I also comment Alexa to turn on the heat or AC via the Nest thermostat, I tell her to turn on the smart LED bulbs and the ambiance lighting behind my tv and below my bed.
I also tried the new feature where you can have a conversation with Alexa and get to know the news and many more things. I love the sound quality for music.

reviews.reviewTitle: Life is easier with the echo
reviews.reviewText: I just love my echo I'm still learning everyday new things from alexa and new ways top use the echo which is thrilling in itself. But life is easier my husband and children also are able to enjoy it. The timer and the adding things to my calendar are my favorite and the drop in on my kids when I'm at work to check on all of them . I love that my husband is reminded of appointments when I'm not around to remind him and everyone can ask what's on the schedule for the day so they know what needs attention in the house internally and externally.

Love this cool little dot! Easy setup and easier to use.

I call on Alexa most often for music, so will probably end up ordering a larger speaker or two, but it is so handy to think of a song and tell Alexa to play and it starts. I love the reminders and get a kick out of the super fun interactive games and animal sounds.

Still trying to figure out how to control my Fire TV stick with the Echo dot vs the stick remote.

reviews.reviewTitle: The BEST OF BOTH ALEXA WORLDS!
reviews.reviewText:
This is the best speaker PERIOD, I have ever owned! By far the best Alexa I have ever owned, besides my new Fire Cube! They are both the best devices that you have made in past years and REALLY IMPVED UPON!

THANK YOU, and CONGRATULATIONS or making two wonderful devices that will go a long ways and increase your profit line. By far two pieces of electronics I am very happy to have HOME and OWN!

Please, keep up the great work Amazon. From a VERY SATISFIED PRIME CUSTOMER! YOU RETURNED MY FAITH in PRIME MEMBERSHIP!

reviews.reviewTitle: After several months of low volume usage, speaker is horrible
reviews.reviewText: After using this for several months (volume typically around a 5-6), the speaker sounds horrrrrible. The Alexa voice recognition is mediocre, but I like it being connected to my Amazon stuff, so that's fine. The fact that the audio is so horrible it makes me question whether or not I should go all-in on the Echos :/ I only have one of these echos, so I'm not sure if it's the model or just the one I have. Super disappointed.

This was my 4th one. Now we have Alexas in multiple rooms and I can get her to help me any time. This new design, with the fancy cover is cool. But I would take Alexa in any format. We use her all the time. She gives us weather, movie/show trivia, spells for us, does addition/subtraction/multiplication when I need it, does conversions. And she plays music as needed. She does so much more. I just need to take time to figure it all out.

I did get the echo dot with the purchase of SiriusXM radio. It really stinks though that it started to break down just a month after my 90 day warranty expired... static and Buzzing whenever you play anything on it. Called and they said the best they can do is offer me $15 off of a new Echo Dot yeah no thanks probably won’t buy it again. I’ll stick apple...

Just like anything extra, you don't need this at all. However, it is a REALLY nice thing to have for any occasion! Specifically for music! It won't let me play specific songs because I don't have a premium account, but even without a premium account it's incredible! I was cooking with my grandma one time and asked her to play "cooking music." My grandma laughed and asked "What's 'cooking music?'" I replied honestly: "I have no idea." I just was curious. now I know that cooking music really is a thing! Hahaha. The music was a lot more fitting for the situation than I thought it would be! it was perfect! And it's perfect for giving you reminders. You can just say to remind you of something instead of getting out those sticky notes and a pen or pencil to write it down. She even can tell you what time a place closes and on which days it's open. She makes things a lot easier and faster! (Granted, this IS how the lazy people will take over. lol.) My favorite feature is more specific to me. When my alarm for the morning is dismissed, I set her to tell me a joke for the start of the day. It puts me in a great mood! :)

I love my Echo and Dots but when I signed onto Unlimited Music and found out that I could not play a song on multiple devices at the same time in my home with the unlimited music the service. I was told that you can only play unlimited music on one device at a time. If you have 5 devices on the family plan you can only play different songs on each device if it is from Unlimited Music. This is crazy since I have Amazon Prime I can play the same song on multiple devices but with a family plan or single unlimited you can only play a song on one device at a time. I was on the phone for 90 minutes with Alexa helpline and they all insisted that you cannot play one song on multiple devices in your home with an unlimited music account. I am a big Amazon fan but if this is true it is a completely asinine way of restricting folks that have paid an additional fee for more music choices but are getting much much less. Crazy????

reviews.reviewTitle: Better than 1st Gen by far, but still far from great.
reviews.reviewText: Head and shoulders above 1st Gen unit, but still far from where it needs to be. Still getting ridiculous answers to questions, and home control is far from great. Usable, but not optimal. Ask her to turn on a specific light and she'll tell you it doesn't exist. 30 seconds later ask her to do the same, and she complies with no rhyme or reason. Still much better than Google Home which is having a plethora of problems lately.

reviews.reviewTitle: 3rd Gen Alexa - Even Better but fix Boxcar Willie's songs, very poor quality
reviews.reviewText:
Sound is somewhat better than 2nd generation. Amazing that they can get such good sound from such a small speaker.

Selection of songs is quite good, they say 10,000,000. Would be great if she would tell you which artists she has for a particular song, I look it up on YouTube then specify the artist I want. Volume not consistent from song to song.

Still having problems with Boxcar Willie songs, I've asked them to fix it but it has been months . . .

reviews.reviewTitle: Sound quality is well worth the price.
reviews.reviewText: I upgrade an echo dot 1st gen and added to a few more rooms. Honestly, if they just said.. "Echo Dot is a wonderful speaker and you can just tell it to play whatever music you want" it would be worth the price. But this is so much more... Homework buddy for my son, he uses it to check almost all his answers. I have one on my desk as my "secretary" making calls for me, setting reminders and alarms. And the 3rd generation echo's are in a group, and the group music sounds wonderful throughout the house, really nice when doing housework.

reviews.reviewTitle: Account Service is Right on Point
reviews.reviewText: I'm an owner of both Alexa and Google Home. What I can say about both is that I love Alexa for use and tied to my existing Prime and Amazon services. Voice recognition is clear and provides quality results for my service requests. Where the two services truly differ, and where Alexa still leaves something to be desired, is in the information search capabilities. Google's capability to query search questions across its entire catalog and provide good, insightful responses back is nothing short of impressive. Too many times for Alexa I get a response that it is not able to answer even basic questions that Google can find. Clean up this issue and Alexa will be the product of choice. As it stands now, Alexa stands out as a personal assistant that ties well to Prime and Amazon services. Google still reigns for search and information queries.

The dot is somewhat useful for reminders when I don't have the quick moment to write down a note or reminder. The alarm sound selection is small and is kind of redundant when you can make a routine for the same purpose.

The Alexa app is a total mess, not user-friendly or organized very well. No way to search in-app for what you are looking for, and there is no way to make a routine for select days; only weekends/every day/weekdays.

Alexa is also not that "smart." She is not intuitive and I find little point in the speaker. I use it more for a music speaker than anything else.

Communication is also broad and not specific to a speaker. If a user calls my account it rings on all family dots instead of a specific dot like I want.

We use this in our kitchen. We play Spotify on it and ask her to set timers, alarms and reminders. She's a very useful assistant. We don't have a landline so I use the drop in feature to call and check on my kids when we aren't home. She doesn't take up a lot of space yet has a decent speaker. I keep adding them to other rooms in the house. I was skeptical of the privacy aspect of an Echo but found the app easy to use and the content easy to control so far.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great satellite for the Alexa system
reviews.reviewText: I purchased Echo Dot to add to my existing Alexa-based smart home system. The integration was simple and easy. Because of the proximity of the main Alexa unit, I had to change the default wakeup name from Alexa to Echo. Using the Alexa app, that was not a problem. The smaller speaker doesn't quite have the same music fidelity as its larger sibling, but it's not bad. And it's nice to have an extension to the smart home commands. I plan to purchase additional Echo Dots to provide coverage throughout the house.

I've never been a smart house kind of person untol my husband convinced me to snag an echo dot on black Friday.
It's super easy to set up and i use it daily!!
I play music while I'm cooking and cleaning. The sound is actually excellent. I also use it to update my calander and set reminders. So handy because as a busy mom i can be forgetful. The reminders also go to my phone if I'm not home.
T
My only complaint is that when we tried using it to make a phone call my dad couldn't hear us but that could be call receiver error ;)

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa is Great for adding Music to the Room
reviews.reviewText: I mainly got this to play music in my room as we just got one of these as a gift that we have in the front room. I enjoyed listening to the music and randomly saying Alexa play....and the music would come on-so wanted one for my bedroom. I'm enjoying it the only drawback is you keep trying to sell me another subscription for $4.99 a month when i already am paying for Amazon Prime and you kept advertising free music catalog but now it keeps wanting to charge me for more. So that is the main draw back. Haven't really used it for other stuff yet, although husband asks it questions and it answers.Very helpful.

This is our first echo dot and w love it! It gets what we ask on the first try, and unlike Siri, the echo dot understands our questions or commands from cross the room. It’s great to ask it o play music I like, set a timer, play hide and seek with my kids, question of the day, or even play the specific episode of my current podcast. Sometimes I notice it lights up when I walk past it, maybe listening for a command. So I guess that might be why people say it’s always listening? Anyway, we are pleased with it and now we got second one for upstairs.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa provides good sound quality once you get to know her.
reviews.reviewText: The major drawback with Alexa is a lack of documentation with the Dot. Repeated directions to "go to your APP" are worthless when you do not have the APP yet and are trying to get the thing to work. Once installed and working, depending upon your provider's service quality, Alexa offers simple and effective access to music and information with very good quality sound, whether I place it on the arm of my recliner or on a hard wood surface. It is certainly worth the discounted Amazon price.

This was our first Alexa product and I have to say I love it! It makes the day to day easier and smoother. My whole family can easily add to our shopping list, we can get the weather and traffic updates automatically when we dismiss our alarm in the morning, she has a lot of entertaining things to can do. I've even found a skill to help with learning languages. We'll definitely be buying more in the future. She does occasionally have issues understanding what we're saying, but repeating a bit more clearly usually does the trick. Now we just need to save up to make the whole house smart!

[My friend gave me a used gen 2 echo dot, and it definitely takes longer to get anything from it and it has a harder time recognizing what we're saying, so it's safe to say the gen 3 has improved from previous ones]

I originally won one in a raffle at my jobs Christmas party so I got a smart bulb for it. After tinkering with it and using it for a while I liked it enough that I now have two of them. They work great for smart home integration. You can listen to music on them but honestly the sound quality is absolute garbage after about 40% volume. The speakers just distorts so much that you can’t enjoy the music. But as a smart home hub as well as personal assistant it works extremely well.

reviews.reviewTitle: DO NOT BUY, even Spotify does not work
reviews.reviewText:
What it can do for me: Spotify, Alexa skills. No Spotify not really work in stereo mode. Nothing works.
What it cannot: read Apple News, read Books, Podcast, or play anything I bought from iTunes.
And of course you cannot use smart speaker to have the same experience as browsing fb, Ins, and watch movies.
Plus the sound is even worse than Sony SRS-XB10 Portable Speaker. I mean I already lowered my expectation.
Really disappointed. Done

It's cool for the first couple of days. But the lack of a good search engine it really isn't super useful. It's a nice speaker but the services it let's you use for music are either something I don't use or are not willing to pay for. Stuff like Deezer and Spotify... Or Amazon music... The build quality it good. And I like that you can use an external speaker.

If the Google dot had the same or similar hardware, proper buttons and the ability to use an external speaker I would get one of those.... Cause Google

Don't waste your F&$#ing money on these pieces of $hi$. They never respond and the software is a comical sideshow. Amazon claims they are the future and they are not. They can't pickup your voice an inch away or a mile away. Stop being lazy and take back control of your home. Because when you need them to work they won't. They get progressively worse and are a complete waste of money. Don't do it! I literally just threw mine in the trash. All three of them.

reviews.reviewTitle: Fun new device for the living room
reviews.reviewText: The Echo Dot is a valuable addition to our living room and we're already thinking of where we can use more of them. I recently upgraded our SiriusXM subscription to "All Access" during a promotional. The upgrade included a voucher for the full purchase price of the Echo Dot. As soon as I installed the Dot, it was immediately useful. We ask it to play SirusXM and iHeart Radio stations. We set countdown timers. We get weather reports. We ask it questions of general information. It's amazing how well the voice recognition system works. I highly recommend the Echo Dot for the types of usage I've mentioned.

Bought three of them for additional rooms and love them! I had stayed away from them in the past thinking the sound would be bad, but I was so wrong. Full sound from the little critters. Hooked one up to my house stereo too... that way I can listen to what ever music I want just by talking to Alexa (need Amazon Music or Apple Music). But it is making me seriously re-think my large album and cd collection (yes, I guess I'm dating myself here ;). At the $30 price, there is so much convenience in them you should consider them in all rooms you spend a good amount of time.

To be honest I wasn’t quite sure about having one but I decided to try and now I am so glad I did. Matter of fact I’m going to get two more for kitchen and living room. I love the way she can interact plus I love being able to ask her to give me a Bible verse and even pray with me. I think this is awesome to start your day. I would highly recommend she can turn your TV on turn the lights on play music. She’s just like talking to anyone else she takes care of your needs.

reviews.reviewTitle: Beats the Heck Out of My Shower Radio
reviews.reviewText: I like to listen to sports radio and / or music when I am showering in the morning and the reception in my bathroom was horrible yielding only two or three stations full of static. I put the Echo Dot in the bathroom and now stream my favorite sports radio station in crisp, crystal clear sound. Also great for listening to music and or asking Alexa to add toothpaste, shaving cream, shampoo etc. to my shopping list when I am running low on supplies. The speaker has great sound quality, the Dot looks nice and it takes up very little room on our bathroom vanity. A great purchase!

I really like the 3rd Gen Dot a lot. It’s sound quality is much improved over our 2s. It’s also much more attractive looking. If you have an Echo second Gen it will match it well in the looks department.

Since we are fully entrained in the Alexa echo system, I continue to find ways to make us of the products. The ability to create groups is a fantastic thing. Especially when we want to stream music throughout different regions of the house.

Bang for the buck it’s much improved over the second gen model.

reviews.reviewTitle: Was Skeptical at first...but love my Alexa
reviews.reviewText: I was skeptical and wasn't sure I really needed an Alexa, but have enjoyed her. I love that as I am cooking, and run out of an ingredient or realize that I'm low, I can just say "Alexa, add ____ to my shopping list." Then, when I am in the store I can pull up the list and remember what I was running low on. I was terrible about forgetting my hand written list at home. I've used her for a timer or for reminders. I also love that I can announce that I'm on my way home if needed.

reviews.reviewTitle: Work great as a stereo pair with an Echo Sub.
reviews.reviewText:
I ordered two of these thanks to a SiriusXM promotion and set them up as a stereo pair with my Echo Sub. The sound this pair makes is better than the original Echo (beta testing version) I had set up before. The 3rd gen dot has much better sound quality for music than the 1st and 2nd generation dots also.

They were very easy to setup using the Alexa app on iPhone. Something that might help you in the future; push and hold the action button until the ring turns orange to put an echo in setup mode.

reviews.reviewTitle: An amazing device - You'll want more than one.
reviews.reviewText: I am absolutely delighted with the Amazon Echo Dot 3rd generation. After using the first one for a while I bought two more to put in other rooms. I bought the first one to control lamps, using the $10 Mini Smart Plug for each lamp and it is perfect for this. The Dot easily replaced my much more expensive and less reliable internet clock radio. It is adequate for casual playing of music. I use an OontZ Angle 3 PLUS when I want better sound. I use the Dot to find out the time at night without having to open my eyes. It will call numbers on my contact list, give me the latest news and it even read a Wikipedia article to me when I asked about Marco Polo.

reviews.reviewTitle: Nagging delay in responding to Alexa...
reviews.reviewText: I have five other older Dots and each responds quite quickly to the "Alexa" prompt. This one takes much longer leading me to wonder if it heard me at all. This is extremely annoying. Humans are "wired" for interaction and response. There are established usability rules about how long a system should take to respond to an action and this thing clearly does not follow that rule. Over one second. Look up Jacob Neislen's page on "Response Times: The 3 Important Limits"

reviews.reviewTitle: Great for communication with chair or bed bound elderly
reviews.reviewText: I am using the echo dot in the room of an elderly relative I care for in my home. He can use it to call me on the phone. I can "drop in" to make sure all is OK when I am traveling and he is being attended by home health aides. He is a bit confused, and with this device there is less chance he'll use it in the wrong way. When he had a medical alert pendant, he pushed it a few times for non-emergencies, bringing an ambulance to the house uneccessarily. With Alexa, he knows to call me, and if there truly was an emergency he'd know to call 911 (or if he called me, I could do it.) He can use it to turn a light on and off. This echo dot is working really well for an elderly invalid.

I upgraded from an original Dot to this 3rd Generation Dot and couldn't be more pleased. I wanted better sound quality because I listen to a lot of music on it. The sound is considerably louder and also richer. And there was another plus for me. On the original Dot I had to turn straight to it for it to hear me. I can have my back turned to the new one and am still clearly heard. I got the gray one and think it looks very nice.

reviews.reviewTitle: Have 5, 1full size & 1echo speaker doesn't work correctly. I'd love a replacement, I'm past my time.
reviews.reviewText: I've bought 4 of these. One of these was a larger model. I received this one, and it has been used very little. However, I did buy several (3) at Christmas, and one of them is defective. My son has it almost all the way up, and he can hear me great at first, but then my voice fades all the way out. I am upset about that one. This o e I purchased for work. I plug it in a lot and unuf because I work for an attorney office, and confidentially is our number one concern.

reviews.reviewTitle: Sometimes Alexa is home; other times, not so much.
reviews.reviewText:
Alexa Client v1.24.205530.0; Android App v2.2.271281.0

Alexa needs her hearing checked. About 40% of the time we give Alexa a command, she either doesn't hear it or doesn't carry it out correctly. We have gone through the 'Learn My Voice'. Alexa knows us by name but that has little impact on her responsiveness.

+ Alexa integration (when it works in a timely manner).
+ Amazon Music Unlimited subscription availability.
0 Sound quality (average). Echo Series 1 was a better experience all around.
- Responsiveness to voice commands (slow more often than should be) Once the devices are power cycled, the responsiveness improves but it doesn't last long.
- The ability of the devices to maintain the requested streams or services. (More times than not, the stream or service stops playing at some point after it begins. That or the dreaded, "I am having trouble playing the music" message.
This was not an issue with our Echo Series 1 device. We thought the Echo Dot 3 version would be better and allow us to have more coverage in the home. Unfortunately, it has been more frustrations than a good experience.

Amazon blames SiriusXM. SiriusXM blames Amazon and we're without access to a rather expensive paid service on either of the Echo Dot 3's. Pandora is a little better but both services stop repeatedly. Wireless availability isn't the issue as smartphones, tablets, and computers remain connected when the Amazon Dots don't.

Amazon has a long way to go with these devices. I have 2 2nd generations and 1 3rd. One of my biggest complaints is keeping it awake and listening. Even though I have set it in the app to stay awake longer, I have to keep calling it's name to wake it up again because I wasn't finished with it. Amazon needs to change the programming to give it an option to stay awake until the user tells it to go to sleep

Some have spoke of sub quality audio. As with any speaker system if you overdrive them the sound will become distorted.

I have several of these devices and find them to be of high quality. I often listen to Amazon and Pandora music and find the audio to be of excellent quality for the size of the speakers. However if you attempt to turn up the volume to hear them in other rooms in your house you are overdriving them and the audio is degraded.

Using Alexa with them for controlling smart plugs and things is of great benefit.

reviews.reviewTitle: 6 months using it speaker is dying
reviews.reviewText:
It's been 6 months of using it and the speaker is already dying. The sound comes with that white noise of a speaker dying, I believe that it being an amazon product which is so greatly advertised it should have been of greater quality. Not so.
Voice recognition is terrible if you dont have an american accent it will NOT recognize what you're requesting. It should also be made wireless, cables, really? in 2019? come on.
I would like a refund or a replacement.

Amazon must find a way to streamline the setup process. As it is, having to download skilled apps, linking the same to one's account is repetitive cumbersome and a downright nuisance. All the buyers info is already on your servers. Upon purchase, all the relevant software apps required to make it work, must be available out of the box; without recourse to optional licenses. This is a damper on the utility of the product, and is absolutely annoying.

reviews.reviewTitle: Was Sceptical If I Would Even Use IT
reviews.reviewText: As I stated above didn't even think I would use them but I can tell you I use them on a daily basis as does my whole family. We use for everything from a house intercom to a voice remote for the TV and cable boxes to checking the weather. One interesting thing we were able to use it for that we didn't realize was to be able to be out of the house and drop in with the app on my phone and talk to our kids in the house even if they don't answer there phone.

reviews.reviewTitle: Work fine if I am within ear-shot of either Alexa and without my smart phone.
reviews.reviewText: Alexa understands my voice and what I am saying, than I do hers. I guess that is because I have been busy and therefore neglected to adjust her treble and base, volume only. Music reproduction is fine. Some of my problem may be the fact that I have my own huge personal library of music and sound equipment and mentally compare it to her sound. Thing is, I can't up and take that equipment from room to room where I can the two Alexa's. She's a winner.

I can't understand it, because this Gen must be based on the previous gen but I the 3rd gen dots seem to be lacking compared to the previous gen. I have 2 of the 3rd gen and they share the same two problems: they frequently lose their internet connection and their voice recognition has problems. This may be due to the fact they are set up in a different house than my others. At one location, I have a mesh router but here I don't. I am also running a femtocell near my router which I do not do at my other location. Whatever the cause, I am not happy with the performance of either of these

The new Dot is a little more pleasing to the eye and sounds a heck of a lot better as a music speaker, which is all I use it for. It's not the best speaker in the world but as a little desktop speaker, it's great. Love the improved bass and overall sound.

This is a minor upgrade from the 2nd Gen. The speakers are louder with a more pronounced bass. Well enough for use on the loft office for downtime movies. I moved my 2nd gen to the guest room. My gripe is the plug, it’s massive. There would be cases that you can’t plug two devices side to side if using an extension power cord. Also the plug doesn’t have that optional USB detach cable anymore. I plug my 2nd Gen via USB on a 5 port. But the power needs directly to an outlet. Design is certainly better leaving the Amazon logo out.

I bought a 3rd generation echo dot 6 months ago. I woke up this morning to the alarm and the speaker was blown out. The volume has never been higher than 7/10 using the actual speakers on the device. Amazon has a 3 month warranty on the echo dot, so they would not offer me a replacement or fix. The customer service representative offered me a 15% discount on a new echo dot. I would be happy to give the product another chance for without paying more than I already have, but I’m not interested in buying a second echo dot in the hope that one of them will work longer than 6 months. Consider carefully before buying any Amazon branded electronics, Amazon doesn’t appear to trust its devices to work longer than 3 months, why should we?!

Alexa and I have not been getting along. She seems dumb and was much harder to setup than my other smart speaker. We're constantly fighting because she forgets my smart devices and doesn't understand me. My other smart speaker is much better in every way, easy to setup, less robotic sounding, and understands what I want. I'm kind of sad this is not a better product, I am a huge fan of Amazon but this speaker is not nearly as good as the competition.

reviews.reviewTitle: Worth it for the upgrade in sound quality and volume.
reviews.reviewText: I bought this to replace my Gen 1 Dot. Now it isn't the snazzy new one with the time on the front, but it doesn't matter since I have it hidden behind some things anyway. The sound is so much better than Gen 1! And really that is all I wanted. I wish it was white or sandstone as they call it now. Maybe it was my mistake ordering it or maybe the bundle I got was only for charcoal. Either way, just aesthetics. It works great.

reviews.reviewTitle: Just don’t waste your time with a hassle
reviews.reviewText: At first it was a good device worked as it should it had problems at first with connecting to Apple Music and would keep saying ask Alexa if she needs a software update then we would ask and she would say shes up to date after that we just quit using Apple Music.. later on we went on vacation and had Alexa unplugged the whole time when we got back the dot was completely a brick. I tried everything to get it to connect to our WiFi and nothing works I’ve factory reset it reset all routers modems tried different phones/tablets/computer and nothing worked along with that we have two WiFi setting from our router a5ghz one and a 2.4ghz one and neither source can pick up the WiFi. Disappointed and upset I have a $50 dot that needs to be scrapped

reviews.reviewTitle: Set up is a pain in the ass, but once set up they are a lot of fun to use.
reviews.reviewText:
This was a complete pain in the ass to set up! Just telling the end user to "go to the alexa app and follow the directions is a really bad joke! I spent over two hours trying to set this thing up and I was unable to do it following the app directions. I had to have a friend, who has set up six of these units for his family, set mine up. Even he had some problems making it connect. Now that it is set up, I really enjoy using it.
I have since, helped set up two units for my sister and a friend. Before I did, I reviewed online videos on how to set them up and thought I knew what I was doing, but still they were a "pain in the ass" to get set up and connected. I finally called the Amazon Echo Support phone number and a service guy walked us through the set up and we got the job done. My advice to someone setting one of these units; down load the alexa app, plug in the Echo device then call the support line at 888-283-1678 and have the service person walk you through the set up process. This can save you hours of frustration because Amazon techs don't know how to write instruction sheets that human beings can read and use.
Besides the set up head aches, the units them selves are a lot of fun to have and easy to use.
Amazon needs to put a written instruction sheet in the box that tells the end user: The account names and passwords you need to have ready, the need to have a credit card on file with Amazon, then a step by step direction on how to set these things up. I have other friends who are interested in purchasing one of these units, but they have heard how hard they are to set up and are intimidated and are afraid to buy one.
Amazon: Fix the set up problems with proper instructions!!!

The fire sale (pun intended) Amazon had on its Echos and Echo Dots made it almond impossible not to pick a couple out to try for myself.

Once one is installed and hooked up, the others are just plug and play. The Amazon Echo and the Google counterpart pretty much do the exact same things, at the exact same speed. The only difference is the Amazon integration.

So find out which one is cheaper and give it a shot. I promise you you'll like having the help once you start using the features Home Ai offers.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa thinks she know it all..
reviews.reviewText: I love Alexa..she can answer any questions you can play different games with her and the whole family can join in to n play..you can ask her to play any music example "Alexa play the #1 song in Noway" you can even ask her to play movies read out your favorite book but the only thing is most book,music,movie won't play because you have to be a subscriber for Amazon music Amazon ebooks Amazon movie witch you can get all of it plus free delivery from anything you buy from Amazon and Amazon grocery for only $99 not for a month or three months but for a full year subscriptions... Alexa can Order any food grocery book a ride to places..just download Alexa app she can even controls your light example "Alexa sleep" light will shut off..controls any Bluetooth I'm not Lazy it that at the end of a hard day it feel good to just grab a drink sit down and let alexa do the easy but hard things for me..we argue laugh cry..lol it worth the price .

reviews.reviewTitle: Oh Alexa, why do you torment me?!
reviews.reviewText: Setting up the dot was super easy. Getting it to link to an amazon smart plug super easy. Getting Alexa to respond to the commands to control the smart plug was face-slappingly frustrating. Turns out that speaking to my Alexa in my house was controlling the smart plug in my sister's apartment 150 miles away.....that's got to be an accomplishment. Still haven't been able to figure out how to get her to pause or stop or do anything other than play shows and movies on my Amazon Fire TV stick. I'm sure I'll figure it out eventually, but, for now, she doesn't seem very receptive to commands.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love the ambient light clock and easy operation.
reviews.reviewText: I already bought an Echo dot some months back and decided to get another one for the upper level of my house. I especially like the integrated clock and how it changes to show the current temperature when asked. It was easy to sync both of the Dots to play my music at the same time so I have music pretty much throughout the house. Convenient little devices.

I already have the other colors offered for this generation echo dot but always avoided the white one because it just didn’t seem like a good idea because it would get dirty too quick. I decided to buy one in white and I really like how it looks, very clean and I have it in my room so it doesn’t get dirty. I probably wouldn’t buy this color for a kitchen or somewhere near kids because the white color would get dirty so much faster than the charcoal or grey colored dots.

She’s pretty cool. We got the dot for free when we purchased the Ring Doorbell 2. She’s in the living room. My kids like asking her things (they are 5 and 7) but sometimes I have to tell them to leave her alone. I typically just listen to the local radio station all day when I’m home by myself (I work from home). I don’t think we’ve tapped all her capabilities yet but I especially love that I can connect her to my OurGroceries app and can just ask her to add to it. Best thing ever. She can answer the Ring doorbell too. If it comes for free with whatever your buying, it’s worth it. Heck she’s probably worth the money too. Enjoy!

reviews.reviewTitle: Don't bother to use for music
reviews.reviewText: You would think that Amazon would have perfected the speaker in the DOT by the 3rd generation! I use my full size Echos for music and the DOT strictly to control my Echo clock (very cool product btw) and soon my Amazon combo microwave/air fryer (hopefully) in the kitchen but forget about any type of quality sound. Muffled, bassy and just plain junk for a speaker. Hey Amazon, get together with BOSE and learn a lesson!

reviews.reviewTitle: Unexpectedly much better than Echo dot 2nd generation
reviews.reviewText: I added it to a little "chain" composed of 1 Echo and 2 Echo dots 2nd generation; moved the old echo dot from my bedroom to another room and replaced it with the new one. What a difference! A cuter design, immediately connected to the network, very responsive to the voice even with background noise (such as radio on), and especially better sound: richer, clearer, more bass. Almost (but not quite...) like an Echo. Maybe I should have bought more....

I have all 3 Dot generations, the Spot, and of course the original echo. This (as it should be) is the best sounding Dot yet. It doesn't quite match the rich sound of the echo, but it has very good sound given its size. It is perfect for its design and I can imagine when paired up with a 2nd and sub it would sound like the original Lifestyle Bose system. Great job.

The Echo Dot has made my home truly tech friendly, from turning on/off light, controlling the thermostat, easy integration into my stereo system to play my favorite music. It's amazing that life existed before technology however, it has made our lives easier - sometimes not in a good way, just my two cents. I have mine sitting behind a picture on a side table so it's barely noticeable. If you wary about setup, it's super simple and you don't need to be a techo geek to do it.

reviews.reviewTitle: RESPONDS ON COMMAND TO ANY QUESTION
reviews.reviewText: I absolutely love this device ! Alexa is 10 times more accurate than Siri, when you ask a question she’ll give you a direct answer or response, she’ll play almost 98% of the songs you tell her to and uses a variety of music resources from pandora to Apple Music to Spotify. Unlike Siri she instantly plays any song on command. My most favorite thing is the smart home voice commands! Turning on lights and appliances through voice command is incredible and I have recommended and bought almost all my family members echos and smart home devices from lights to plugs. I guarantee you will love everything this device will have to offer and it just keeps getting better

This is a great smart speaker. I use it mostly for listening to music and the news but there are also a ton of other features that are possible too, many of which im still figuring out. The only downside is that if you want to listen to a lot of specific songs you’ll have to subcribe to amazon music which can run you around 7.99/month.
Got this echo dot on discount on black friday for $25 and it’s currently going for $30 right now for their holiday sale. Its a great time to buy if you’re thinking of trying it out.

reviews.reviewTitle: It knows it's name... that's about all...
reviews.reviewText: I should have bought the Google mini Chalk, like my girlfriend has. Google's device is much more intuitive and has better AI which allows it to figure out what you're asking it to do... plus the Google Chalk has personality. The DOT has ZERO personality, and is just plain stupid. I am able to ask the Chalk about 3 times the questions and it retrieves information for me. I bought three, but haven't even taken the other two out... VERY disappointed...

Uh hate, doesn’t sink at all wth hot spot, does not pair with iPhone at all via Bluetooth. Can not search internet. Honestly I don’t get the point of this thing. It’s decent speaker for laptop that’s about it. Would definitely go for google home or something instead. I only got this because it was free with serious xm radio subscription. Would Not get again.

reviews.reviewTitle: DON'T TURN UP TO EVEN HALF WAY! 6 MONTHS IN, MOSTLY STATIC!
reviews.reviewText: I have had this echo since Christmas 2018, 6 months almost... and all I hear is static playing. The songs still play but its "crumbly" and difficult to understand. We do not play the echo loud at all, at most, maybe half way up! I've noticed the volume has remained close to the same and slowly, the songs get more and more static. I believe the speaker is "blown". That's what it sounds like at least! I hope to get an exchange as this is still so new to us. :(

reviews.reviewTitle: Was great until it just stopped working!!
reviews.reviewText: I am so disappointed in Amazon's customer service. (WOW- those are words that I never thought I would say!) but, here I am. I have amazon prime, have purchased 4 echo dots, an echo spot, 2 smart plugs & even had a monthly amazon music membership as well until recently. With all of that being said, one of my dots just shows a red light and totally stopped working randomly. No damage to it whatsoever. I Called customer service to trouble shoot which they did and when they told me that they couldn't find an issue with the product, I asked what my options were. she informed me that there was nothing that they could offer because it was outside of their 90 warranty period. BUT she told me she would make me a special offer of 15% off of a new echo product if I wanted to buy another one. NO THANKS! Its a shame that a loyal customer was lost over this. What a disappointment. Why would I continue to put money into a company that doesn't value their loyal customers?

We were never to "into" this idea. However the sound quality of the Echo devices is really great and since it's nice to summon music anytime! So we took the plunge!
Also being able to easily set reminders (great for older folks), alarms and multiple timers and ask for solutions to math problems is truly appreciated. These devices work very well and they provide a great informational interactive opportunity. Highly recommend!!

I like the Alexa, but when I first got it, I tried to install it using my HP computer. It had very little written instructions in the box. I went to the website on the small amount of info given. Some how I got connected to what I thought was a customer service rep. It was really a scam who charged me $99.99 to install my Alexa. He said it would not download due to some internet problem, so he had to clean my internet. Thinking I was on line with Amazon, whom I have always trusted, I let it go too long and had to pay the money.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy setup, Fabric shell material is a nice modern decor over 1st gen models...
reviews.reviewText: Bought to add to my bedroom so I can control devices from there without having to go downstairs. Works well & setup was a breeze. I was confused at first and went thru setup twice to make sure I wasn't going crazy - because it practically configured itself. Once it connected to my Wifi connection & Amazon account. Guess it knew when I added the device to my existing network & acct, it pretty much auto configured itself. Also the fabric outer covering makes for a nice modern decor that looks good in most any home.

reviews.reviewTitle: My first Echo device and I love it
reviews.reviewText: This is my first echo purchase and I think I’m hooked. Just moved back from Europe and as I was unpacking it was a pain to stop and change a Sirius station on my phone. Echo dot to the rescue! I had a problem at first setting it up but once I did it’s been amazing. I can switch from listening to Howard on Sirius to asking Alexa to play classical and than to 80’s music. Every morning she tells me a joke and than we start unpacking. I was also very impressed with the sound and how loud she actually plays. Very impressive for such a small speaker

What can I say? Alexa Echo Dot is the most enjoyable gadget you can get. The sound quality is super.
You can finally enjoy music the way you always wanted. You can get the news, weather, sport scores, recipes, etc. It is a nice addition to the house. Supposedly you can make it synchronize with your house appliances but I haven't tried that yet. And you can move it around from one room to another. There is a lot of potential in this gadget.

This thing played techno music in the middle of the night (we don't listen to techno), I unplugged her and put her in time out. Also randomly plays stuff, the other day I was on a meeting call and she starts playing something. While watching TV, she'll do something based on what someone said on the show but it wasn't Alexa! Other than this i really like it, but needs some serious upgrades. The speaker is really good on the latest one, not so much for the originals.

This is the second Dot to glitch out on me. The sound crackles, and the device is lit up red and the microphones will not work. I have reset the device to factory settings with no luck. Voice Recognition used to work wonderfully , however recently all of my Dots have trouble understanding basic commands. I will tell it to play my playlist Spring and she will play my Christmas playlist.

On top of that frustration, I return here for a replacement, however even though my order details shows it may be eligible for replacement, there is no option to start that process.

reviews.reviewTitle: The best gift I never knew I wanted!
reviews.reviewText: I received this as a Chrisymas present and so glad I did! I never thought I would want one, seemed kind of hokey tbh. But I love playing music on it, getting the weather, etc. I can yell out items from the kitchen to add to my grocery shopping list and my 10 year old son can add things to his wish list so I know what he needs/wants when I'm out. I even picked up some smart plugs and can have Alexa turn the light on or off when my hands are full. It's a huge help when I am coming home from work after dark and I'm juggling my work bag, my laptop, my son's backpack, and the mail. And the to do lists and reminders help me make sure I never miss an important deadline again. Alexa is my new best friend, I'm not sure how I ever managed without her!

Was expecting better sound. It is louder but voices at volume 7 thru 10 over-drive the speaker and it is hard to understand what is said. The volume under that is fine. It does "hear" commands better than the first 2 versions even at higher volumes. I usually change the "wake" word because TV folks use the Alexa word in all their ads which starts the blue light flashing and sometimes it does what the TV ad talks about. Amazon needs to allow the user to create their own wake work. I would use Shumerlovestrump. LoL

My gen one works well. This gen three doesn’t read NPR news briefs and doesn’t play Pandora. Keeps saying it has trouble playing. My Tap and gen one Dot continue to work well in that regard. All set settings are the same. Everything else work on it (litecontrols, etc.)

I love the Echo Dot (Gen 3)! I've never had anything like this, wasn't sure I'd be able to get used to it, but I downloaded the app to my phone, plug in the Echo, told Alexa to play my fav radio station and WHAM, there it was! Sound quality is GREAT! At 50% volume I could hear it loud and clear throughout my apartment. Super easy to set up, only took me about 3 minutes. Been playing with it all night and I love it! Highly recommend it.

I have several Echo 2's, which I now use to provide input to my sound systems. They work fine in this capacity. I had originally purchased an Echo 2 for the bedroom but was not happy with the quality of the sound and replaced it with the Echo 3. The third generation's sound quality is superior and well worth the $10 difference in price if you want to play music from it. All my granddaughters got Echo 3's for Xmas this year and are quite happy with them. I have no problem communicating with Alexa on it. Works great!

reviews.reviewTitle: Looks and sounds much better than 2nd Generation Dots
reviews.reviewText: Bought 3 of these 3rd Gens' to upgrade from my 2nd Gens'. 3rd Generation looks and sounds much better with deeper base and expanded high end point. The tin sound is gone, but sometimes it can feel like the voice response from Alexa is coming from inside a container of some sort. General sounds and music sound great though. Set up was super easy if you already have the Alexa app. Make sure you open that app before you plug in your device and it will likely find it for you and ask if you want to add it to your devices. Very happy and glad I upgraded. (No changes to functionality that I have found, just better looking and sounding)

I own both a second generation and a third generation Echo Dot and I think the third generation is much better when it comes to reproducing sound. The bass is surprisingly good for such a small speaker.

I also find it very convenient having two Dots. My wife had surgery and must sleep in a different room while she heals. It's so convenient her being able to drop in on me if she needs anything during the night.

Had to return all 3 of these that were purchased as a Christmas gift. None could be connected successfully after spending hours upon hours of reading and following Youtube instructions. Other friends have had the same connectivity issues. The older versions are better if you want this type of product.

reviews.reviewTitle: For the price - it’s a good deal and helpful
reviews.reviewText: The addition of Apple Music is awesome. The routines feature is a great way to for Alexa to perform multiple tasks in a row with one command. The start my day routine is great. Oddly these routines don’t work with the last list. Prioritizing tasks isn’t possible. Alexa doesn’t connect to Apple’s reminders. Skills - like accessing a news source or your bank account - are good but not great. There are many skills but overall the skills feel underwhelming and version 1.0. Voice response is fast and accurate when I used it. The speaker for music isn’t Dolby surround sound but it’s decent. You can’t beat the price which makes the echo a good deal.

reviews.reviewTitle: The sound is so deep I can't understand it, I'm not sure why , but miss 2nd gen
reviews.reviewText: I have already 3 2nd generation dots . I got my phone opened the app thinking I would have to do something , plugged in the 3 rd generation and it did everything, I changed it's name and hit devices checked it in my group and it was playing music in all 4 rooms. UPDATE I HAVE USED IT LONG ENOUGH TO TELL THAT I MISS 2ND GENERATION, THE SOUND HAS WAY WAY TO MUCH BASS EVEN TURNED OFF , I LITERALLY CANT UNDERSTAND WHAT THE DEVICE IS SAYING. ALMOST TO POINT OF USELESS.

I wasn't really interested about any of the Alexa products but on Prime Day when this puppy got slashed from 50 bucks to 25 bucks, I decided to give it a go. I got it thinking it might be the start of something new but like many others was instantly annoyed when I couldn't connect and couldn't find any help online. It took me all night but after going through every single setting on my phone (Android S8), I think I finally cracked the code and boy is it stupid easyyyyyy. I never write reviewes but the pain of not connecting the damn thing is real so I thought I'd share. SO, if you have an Android and can't connect -
1. GO TO SETTINGS
2. GO TO CONNECTIONS
3. GO TO DATA USAGE
4. GO TO RESTRICT NETWORKS
5. Here you will find that the wifi that is associated with the Echo, for me it's Amazon-TV5, is turned off AKA your phone's default settings doesn't let you connect to the Echo. Turn the sidebar off.
6. Proceed with the regular instructions and you should be good to go!

I hope this works for you!

Aside from this, I'm very much enjoying my new toy! 😊

I had the 2nd gen dot before and wanted to get another one for my master bedroom. However, after much thought my wife and I decided to put the 3rd Gen dot in the kitchen instead after hearing the much improved sound quality that came out of the build it speaker. The installation of the device was very simple, I originally thought that I would have to charge up my dead tablet where my Alexa app was installed in order to setup the wifi configuration on the device. To my surprise, the device automatically picked up my wifi where I can only assumed it is due to my account setting is already present in my other amazon or profile where I didn't have to set anything up in order for it to connect to my secured home connection. I would recommend this to anyone that is looking for a low cost voice command unit to add to their existing home automation or about to start one.

Spend more to get the echo, or just get the competitor, it's significantly more advanced. There are so many problems With this device, the frustration isn't worth $30. voice problems, connectivity problems, volume is easier to turn down manually that repeatedly asking, it has linked to my cart to buy things because it is so easily confused. It is convinced that I wanna hear barry manilow whenever I turn on the shower and ask for tunes. Got unlimited music for your echo 10 feet away? Get used to it trying to sell you what you already have. It won't link to my echo, but it will try to connect to the dot in the bathroom 2 floors up. Horrifying.

reviews.reviewTitle: Terribly bad compared to my other one
reviews.reviewText: The orinal tiny Echo is so far better than this one but has the one problem this one does not which is speaker quality. This product does not listen right. You have to tell for it to answer you even with no noise in the room. It does not understand speech as well either. It sounds well but they is about it. I am sorry I purchased it. My original Echo gen 1 picks up from the room far away when this does not even tries to listen and I'm right next to it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo is working and integrating with our home.
reviews.reviewText: We bought two of these and started with a home security system that also gave us one. Most of the time it works well with integration to our systems. It has difficulty with one smart plug, but none of the other items we own. Works great with our security system. Part of our difficulty is with smart devices that only work with the lower Wi-Fi frequency. The Echo dot does great with 2 or 5 frequency channels of our Wi-Fi.

I purchased 3 units with intent on using one in my home office, one in the family room and one in the mother-in-law house next door. First let me say, I watched all the videos and read all the instruction for installing the three units. Note not all answers are available.
While the units will give you most information you ask for, it is the "Drop In" feature that I really was interested in. Unfortunately the drop in gets confused. When asked to drop in on the office from the family room, the MIL unit activates, same thing happens when asked to drop in on the MIL from the office, the family room gets activated.
The Amazon Dot would have been a very good solution to the elderly. This type of wireless assistant to a senior citizen who does not know how to use or possess smart phone technology, could prove very beneficial. But much improvement in voice recognition for elderly speakers is needed. My 89 yo MIL doesn't / can't speak loud enough to activate Alexa.
Amazon really has missed the boat, when it comes to use of the Echo for senior's.

I am getting older and my hearing is not as good as it once was. The Echo three was a replacement for the Echo two and my hearing and first impression say this is a nice overall improvement estheticly but the bass jumped out at me. It was boomy and at first I did not care for the sound . After I found out I could adjust treble, bass and midrange through Alexa the sound is a little more tailored. Not great but much better. Still the bass throws me off but the overall sound is much improved. I suspect a younger set of ears will really appreciate what Amazon has done and the kicking bass of the speaker. I for one want more high end and midrange with a little less boom.

reviews.reviewTitle: Inability to physically shut off alarm...only snooze.
reviews.reviewText:
I got this particular echo dot because of the display. I figured that it would completely replace my nightstand alarm clock. While you can tap the top of the unit to snooze the alarm, you can't tap or touch anything on the dot to "shut off" the alarm. I realize I can say "Alexa, shut off the alarm", but I would rather NOT have to do that at 5:30AM while my wife is peacefully sleeping.

So, every stinking morning I have to go into the app on my phone to switch the slider to the off position. Now the other problem that this causes is that I have to restart my alarm every night. Not happy about this.

reviews.reviewTitle: Never Thought I'd Like Echo and Alexa So Much!
reviews.reviewText: Setting up the Echo Dot was much easier than expected and I never thought I'd like having Alexa as much as I do. Discovering Alexa skills has been great with having children in the house. There are so many skills that the kids love from educational trivia quizzes to music they enjoy. The ability to control our thermostats from anywhere is wonderful and we are growing out smart home little by little. Thanks, Alexa!

There are so many good things I can review about our Echo dot. We enjoy listening to the music we request, if we are stuck on trying to figure a question that is asked of us, Alexa knows. If we need to know what the weather will be we just ask Alexa. The most important feature is the reminder. My husband is a diabetic and has to have 2 shots a day. He always remembers the morning shot but forgets the evening. With peace of mind Alexa reminds us every day at five that it’s my husbands time for his shot.

I'd like to see a setting with which I could increase the sensitivity of her wake command. If the fan in the room is going she doesn't hear too good. But when she does she performs well. Not too good a trivia questions like "Alexa, who was Neil Armstrong" she often responds to those requests "I'm not sure" I find myself responding to her to "look it up" I sound like my mother.

Overall, good tech. controls my alexa enabled home very well.

So I've had Alexa in my home for several months now. While these are great little speakers, I don't think that the Alexa smart controls are ready for public release yet. The voice control and command recognition just simply does not work well enough. I am going to keep these little speakers because they are good little speakers for playing music in the whole house. But I am afraid that I am going to have to switch to a system that has a better long and proven track record when it comes to voice recognition, control, and personal assistant. Sorry Amazon. I really hoped that it would have worked better. I just don't think it's ready. Not for me.

It's almost as awesome as an Echo... but smaller and cuter. lol. Less overall volume, and less overall footprint. Ties into your system very well if you have other Alexas. You already know how stuff works. If you're looking for a cheaper way to add a 2nd room, this is a great option. Then go into your Alexa app and create a group. Nothing beats having some Alexa devices around the house, tied to a group, and saying telling Alexa to play music to that group. All speakers fire up at once, perfect. We largely use it as an intercom system too, nothing beats remotely yelling at the kids! haha

reviews.reviewTitle: Great deal on Amazon Echo Dot
reviews.reviewText: This is a great little gadget, it plays music from my iTunes Library, as well as Apple Music and Amazon Music. It was a real pain to set up though. It took two long, involved conversations with Amazon to get this puppy working, though. Very happy now it is up and working but still cannot access all the music on iTunes, have no idea why. All in all, a great price for a delivery that was just 2 days from the date of ordering of an exceptional product that works great.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works great! Sounds fantastic for such a compact device!
reviews.reviewText:
I’ve been an Apple Device user for the past several years. So I purchased this thing and WOW!

I’m super impressed by the technology!

Alexa is far more fluent in Human interaction than Apple’s Siri!

Plus having all of the Star Trek Easter eggs built into the system has practically turned my man cave into a Starship computer system! Lol

I purchased two of them and an Echo Sub and now have an AMAZING theatrical sound system and a very low cost!

reviews.reviewTitle: A must have for older people. With an Echo Connect you can call 911 just by saying, Alexa call 911
reviews.reviewText: I like the fact that these things practically set themselves up. I think a lot of the skills are about worthless. But, there are some that are great. It would also be great if there was a skill that would close your garage door without having to call another skill like NexxHome. If it can be done with your front door, why not the garage door? These are great for older people’s safety. You can have it ask everyday, “Have you taken your medications today?” Endless opportunities to better one life.

reviews.reviewTitle: Buyer Beware - $1 Echo Dot sale is too good to be true.
reviews.reviewText: So, get this! I ordered this Echo Dot on sale for $1 with a subscription to Amazon Music Unlimited. Good deal, right? Wrong! Amazon delivered the wrong item to my house. This isn't normally a problem because they typically make it right with no problems. Not this time! Because it was bought with a subscription, my only option was to purchase a new Echo Dot for full price ($49.99). They did give me my $1.00 back though. The pic of what I received is NOT an Echo Dot! LOL!

Was very happy with one of the units that I hooked up at home. The second unit was to be a gift for a friend. When I deregistered the unit to set up to somebody else it would not work. This person is a prime customer also. When I called the helpline I was told I would have to pay for reregistering and for a limited time of 1,3, or 5 years. So the way I understand this I cannot buy certain items under my account if it is going to be a gift. This sounds ridiculous to me. Am I missing something.

reviews.reviewTitle: Impressive Value, Well Worth the Money
reviews.reviewText: I have two full-sized, second generation Echos which have always impressed me and wanted a third Echo in the bedroom. As this area is rarely used to play music, I figured the Echo Dot might be a good choice as its less expensive than the full-sized Echo and sound quality is not a big concern. I was shocked to find out that the Dot has incredible sound for such a tiny device. Loud with amazing fidelity. The latest generation Dot performs nearly as well as my older full-sized Echos in every way. Well done Amazon!

I will addore as i use it...just got it..but i am in review mode so here ya go..lol..loving it this far..tho set up took a minute since i already had fire stix..now i have the 4k stx to go with this echo3gen..but they dont want to pair or link...so after i call help...i will have better review.

I was given a 3rd generation Echo Dot as a gift. I have a 2nd generation Echo Dot which I own for a couple of years. To be perfectly honest I like the sound of my old 2nd generation Dot better than the new one. The new Dot is much prettier looking but the sound is more muffled than the old Dot. I use them both in different rooms but I prefer the sound of the old Dot. I gave the 3rd generation Dot 4 stars because of the very nice look of it.

Love it I put it in my bathroom was thinking of replacing it with my google home mini In my bedroom but can’t because Alexa isn’t as superior as google The features aren’t there for me Alexa can’t turn on my tv unless it has a fire stick supposedly but google can turn on my tv even without a Chromecast.... even though Alexa hears perfectly unlike google.... don’t get me wrong they are both great products and use them both..... would love if Alexa could cast Netflix without 3rd party app

reviews.reviewTitle: I was surprised how much I like it!
reviews.reviewText: I did not want to get an echo, but after the Amazon special deal, I decided to buy one. I love it! Every morning, I ask what the weather is, followed by the news as I make my breakfast. I love listening to my audible books while I work in the kitchen. I also use it to play music. I find the amazon music that is free with Prime covers my tastes. I also love playing Jeopardy and feel I am only starting to see what different things Alexa can do!

My son had already gotten us an Echo Dot and last year and I love it. We have it in the bedroom and I use it for reminders, alarms, playing songs etc. When Amazon started selling it for pre-Black Friday at a reduced price, I was tempted to get another one. After waiting a little while, I couldn't resist and bought it. This one is in the living room and that way, I use it to also check the weather, find out things and even set alarms when I put food to cook so I'd remember to turn off the stove or oven.

TO ALL OF THE PROGRAMERS AT AMAZON/GOOGLE/ etc, this posting is directed- The device works well, but I find the main issue is on the knowledge base access side. I can access information that is easily available on the internet by doing google searches, etc., BUT, When I ask Alexa the same thing, the device often replies "I don't know" I would encourage all of the folks behind the scenes to expand it's database for reference. Having t be able to access open copyright works to be read aloud would be helpful for vision impaired. Having it go through speakers is phenomenal.

I have the echo dot in My kitchen under my counters. I love it! I especially love the wall mount accessory. I make grocery lists, to-do lists, set cooking timers, play games like jeopardy, plays music genres, announce reminders. I love it. I can pull up the info from my echo dot on my phone in my Alexa app (free). I can access the app and share my list. Example: go to the grocery store I can either pull it up on my phone through the app. Or I can text the list to someone who is going to the store for me.

reviews.reviewTitle: Bad Unit Do Not Buy One
reviews.reviewText:
I purchased this Echo Dot last Black Friday. It worked at first, but did not work when I changed addresses. I tried over and over again to get the Amazon wireless link on the install process to work-----but the option does not show up.
I am pretty computer savvy and know this unit is dead. Never dropped it, never abused it, just does not work anymore.
I would not recommend buying the White Echo Dot.
