It understands me perfectly when other devices in the past could not, or ever! Had it like a month now and finally found that it does have mistakes, no answers, or un comprehensive. I asked it to play Inuyasha season 3, it took me to some Ocean videos lol but still, it is getting smarter! And tho i never wanted to spend so much money on a little box that just sat there! But now doing so, i now understand the quality put into it for its beautiful speaker and sound! And is a more active Alexa than b4! Idk about the full price of it, but bought mine on sale and i must say, it was in fact worth my pay!

reviews.reviewTitle: Gen 3 Dot works and sounds great - setup was a step backwards.
reviews.reviewText: The new size, look and most importantly, sound is fantastic for the Gen 3 Dot. My only real complaint was the activation process – in the Alexa App, theirs a special option for Gen 3 but after using that, I was never able to select my home network properly and was left with timeout after timeout. Tried to reset the Dot twice to no avail. I finally tried the old Gen 1/2 setup procedure which always worked on my other Dots and fortunately, that worked flawlessly for my new Gen 3. I’m sure Amazon will get the bugs worked out.

I finally decided to get an Echo Dot with its compact size, improved sound quality, and the reduced price during the Black Friday sales. I am still learning about its capabilities and uses but have been using it listen to iHeart radio, and to control my Wemo light switches. So far, it has worked with no problems and sits quietly on my desk most of the time. The voice recognition surprised me when it reacted to a YouTube video that said the word "Alexa." There are many skills that can be added to Alexa through the App.

reviews.reviewTitle: Fun, convenient and easy to use!
reviews.reviewText: We love our dots around this house. We have the original as well as a 2 and 3. These are such fun little devices. The capabilities really are endless. My kids use them daily to get the weather before getting dressed for the day. The speaker and overall appearance has definitely improved with the newer models. If you haven't used one yet, I would absolutely recommend you give it a try. I can't imagine you wouldn't find at least one feature you love.

I got the Dot while preparing for my surgery/recovery. I am so glad I did! Alexa is amazing, she was my helper my entertainment and she kept me on track. Her skills are exceptional and very helpful for someone who couldn't get up and walk after surgery. I also got the plug-in wall casing for the Dot - the sound is great and the unit looks good and clean on my wall. I would definitely recommend Alexa Dot and I am going to purchase again to place in other rooms. Very pleased with my purchase.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Device, I wish it worked seamlessly in Spanish as well
reviews.reviewText:
Great device! I had basic home automatization devices such as my lightning system which works perfectly with the Echo Dot. Although due to the people that interacts on my home I'd wish that it worked same as in English for the Skills, because their functionality is not equal in languages different than english. So it works perfect for my, but not so great for other people visiting our home.

Also audio quality is amazing for such small device. Even my dogs now are enjoying music when I leave the house.

The Echo Dot joins the Echo and the Echo Cube in my house. I specifically bought it so when I am working in my office downstairs I can simply "drop in " on my wife upstairs without yelling to get her attention. Yes, I also use it to get the news reports and to listen to my music on my XM account.

I was surprised that it took nearly a week to receive it when I order other items from Amazon and they arrive within two days.

Overall, I am pleased with it's performance and sound.

I wanted to hook up to a hotspot, not my phone. What crap, it would not do it after working on it for 40 minutes. Someone owes me $100 for my time. I'm so sick of doing IT's work for them and going back to the 1990s of frustration. Make this intuitive. Yes, I threw it away, I don't even want to look at it as a paperweight.

I was ready to send the darn things back, I followed directions, but couldn't get the little suckers to work. I wasn't told, that apparently, the dots have a pecking order, #1 and #2. Who knew? I had left #1 dormant while I wasted time on #2. I gave one more try and started with the dormant one, and BINGO! Both of my dots hooked themselves up! Wonderful! The sound is great and Alexa and I are BFFs. She finds just the right music and helps me in the kitchen. I'm going to buy 2 more dots.

reviews.reviewTitle: A little disappointed but I would still recommend it as it’s fairly inexpensive
reviews.reviewText: I like that I can command Alexa to turn on Sirius radio and play certain games that aren’t available on my google I home mini. The Trivia games are pretty enjoyable. However, I am somewhat disappointed. Even after going through the steps to eliminate it, alexa seems to struggle to understand me sometimes. I will command Alexa to turn on a music channel and when she can’t seem to figure it out i just give up and have the google home mini play it instead. The mini understands the same command that the dot does not. I would bet that the echo dot can get louder than my google mini but i don’t know because the volume never needs to be loud. Especially living in a townhome with a shared wall. the quality of the sound is poor at the low level we use it on. I feel like the bass needs to be turned down and the treble needs to be up at that low level because it’s not clear. For that reason I struggle to understand it as well. All in all it’s a decent little piece of equipment and should provide entertainment well worthy the cost.

I purchased this unit for my job because...it was on sale. I really liked this 3rd gen because they upgraded the speaker and my music was clear and had depth. I could put this unit on 2 without disrupting anyone around me. Unfortunately, while I've been traveling for work someone has been using it because I came back today and the speaker is blown. Anything with bass is distorted and tinny sounding. If I find out who blew my speaker I'm going to make them buy me a new one!!!

Had the Google home, wanted to try the Alexa since my work uses it and I liked it. We had so many issues with basic things, like setting up multiroom music. Something as simple as playing a song on the two Alexa's should not have been so so so complicated. Whisper mode only worked occasionally and it couldn't even tell us the definition of a word. Google does everything Alexa does and it does it better, so we returned Alexa and kept Google.

reviews.reviewTitle: Worth the price when on sale!
reviews.reviewText: I got this on sale when it was two for $50 dollars and I gave the other one to my best friend. She loves it... I think it is good but my only complaint would be the voice recognition. Sometimes I have to say things to Alexa multiple times before it gets the request correct.

I got this When there was amazon prime day for mainly white nose for my kids since it does the job and much more. I LOVE it!!! And my older son also loves to play with alexa lol (hes only 2.5yrs) every morning he will literally call alexa to play his favorite songs even though alexa doesnt really understands what he says. Only down thing is you have to have music unlimited for most of newer songs which sucks but other than that, i love it

reviews.reviewTitle: Worth the price of admission to upgrade
reviews.reviewText: We own several of the 2nd Generation Echo Dots and love them. After plugging in this 3rd Gen, I can honestly say I love it even more! It has a much richer sound and seems to have a better ability of picking up my voice. My 2 year old son is even able to get her to respond to him, which doesn’t happen on the older generation devices we own. Definitely worth the price and would even consider upgrading the older devices so the whole house audio skill I have set up will sound even better than it currently does.

reviews.reviewTitle: Can't wait to see what else this can do!
reviews.reviewText: This thing is amazing. Like so much technology, I'm not sure how we got along without it before. It makes adding things to lists while you are otherwise occupied a cinch (like when you fixing something or washing dishes) since you don't have to stop what you're doing to write it down before you forget. Also, my wife and I are able to communicate with one another (as well as our kids) when we are not in the same room or even in the house. Out seven-year-old was able to contact us on our phones just using voice commands. The music on demand is also a great feature and the sound quality of the speaker is absolutely amazing. It was well worth the cost.

We have a few Echos and an Echo show that are performing well. This one we've only used for a few months after returning from vacation before the speaker "blew". The sound is horribly garbled as if the speaker is defective. Worked with Amazon customer service hoping to get a replacement but after going through the rickets of deleting and re-adding it to our Alexa app was denied a replacement but was offered a discount on a new Echo.

I love my Echo dot. I put it in the kitchen and am learning all the skills. It reminds me of my chores, my shopping list, etc. It plays my music, has news, jokes and can do so very much more. I now have three Alexa products and this is one is my favorite. Every day you can ask Alexa to delete everything you said that day. I love that. When I get her trained, I expect she can whip up a pretty good dinner. When she's mastered dinner, laundry will follow.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good Bass — Inconsistent & Poor Alexa Experience
reviews.reviewText:
Pro:
What I really love about this is the base. The bass in this is better than the Google Home Mini (previous-generation), woohoo.

Con:
When I tell Alexa to cut off a light, the air conditioner, or a fan, etc., Alexa cuts off multiple items instead of one single item. I don't have this problem through the Alexa app on my phone or on my tablet.

reviews.reviewTitle: iffy mic results. Also direct plug in version of EchoDot3 would be more practical.
reviews.reviewText: I find that if I set the volume low, Alexa doesn't respond to commands as well. Amazon always claims that audio volume and mic listening ability are not related - BUT, I agree with some other folk who have reported the same results. I so wish they would offer a direct plug in Echo dot. (Not the tiny new echo plug in they just started to sell) It would be nice to get rid of the messy wires and make echo less conspicuous.

Easiest hookup ever! As a semi-computer literate retiree, I had both of my Christmas gift Echos unwrapped and hooked up in less than an hour. No problems with initial set up because the online menu walked me right through it.

My only disappointment is not with the Echo at all, but with my older 2012 Sony Bravia Smart TV which is actually “dumb” because it doesn’t have an operating system (android or otherwise). I’m sure there is some sort of work-around for this.

I’ve had a lot of fun playing with Alexa, and when the day comes to start replacing older appliances, I’ll make sure they are smart too.

I have the 2nd gen and 3rd gen echo dots. I had read MANY reviews that the newer 3rd gen didn't sound any better than the previous 2nd gen. But then I saw one at Kohls and decided I would check it out in person. I'm sure glad I did because the sound difference has definitely improved over the 2nd gen dot! I was very impressed with the sound quality and would have no problem using one in a bedroom application. Bottom line... if you're on the fence about it... go to Kohls and hear it for yourself before making a decision.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works like the earlier version, just prettier looking and the low sound is stronger.
reviews.reviewText: I tried to get it to control the smart wall outlet but couldn't get it to work. Still use this and an earlier version for news, weather, and as an alarm clock. Sometimes I ask a question when I don't want to turn on my computer or tablet. I use it to turn on Pandora radio sometimes. Whatever I do with it I have to watch how I give the order. There are many ways to say the same thing but only a few that Alexa can understand. The electronics are amazing but the computer in the cloud is a work in progress.

I can't speak to the improvements over the generations as this is the first generation of dots we have bought. We weren't disappointed by our dot though. Decent audio and super helpful in everyday life. I used to burn a lot of food for example. To the irritation of me and my boyfriend lol. No more burnt food because I have Alexa who doesn't forget when my food is gonna be done. You can do so much with Alexa and the dot didn't disappoint

This product is amazing I love the voice recognition, even if I am really far from it, Integration of services with the Amazon it's really great I can always ask for my products or quotation on product In real time, Also I love how can work with my TV and power outlets to control my house with my voice.

Sound quality is not the best but the speaker is really small so it's understandable but the functionality it's amazing.

reviews.reviewTitle: There are endless things Alexa can do!
reviews.reviewText: Echo Dot has become an integral part of my life. every time i think of something i need from the grocery i tell Alexa to add to my shopping list. when ever i think of something i need to do, i tell Alexa to remind me at some point prior. i than get a vocal reminder if i am home or get a notification reminder on my phone. i use Geo-fence with Alexa to control my heat/air conditioning and all my lights in my place are voice controlled through Alexa.AND MUCH MORE. those are just some examples. definitely required to have to help make your life easier and is very inexpensive.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great imporovement in speaker quality since 2nd gen.
reviews.reviewText: This generation REALLY improved the speaker quality, now I would definitely recommend it to anyone thinking about getting one. For the price there is really no reason to hesitate. The only real problem I have with these smart devices are the concerns of privacy and security. It is just another point of entry for hackers and a great device for hackers when compromised with it's microphone and generally close proximity to the home owner. Maybe turn the mic off when you aren't using it, which is a great feature.

reviews.reviewTitle: Improved sound output & having fun with intercom and drop-in
reviews.reviewText:
I already own a second generation Echo Dot, so when the third generation came out, I was not at all interested to buy it. Until I found out that having two echoes (or more for that matter) would enable me to broadcast messages and use them as intercom across my house. I live in a two-storey house, and its nice for me and my family members to communicate with each other from different floors without shouting and disturbing our neighbors. Plus its fun.

The third generation has much improved sound quality compared to the second generation. I would not use it solely for music listening though. However, when I ask it to play something (I listened to an entire Thievery Corporation album) it does not sound bad, and I actually enjoy it. I would never have asked Alexa to play music on the second generation, unless it was a purely vocal track, and even then I would not have liked the tinniness of the second generation.

I bought the third gen while it was on discounted price, otherwise I think I would have been satisfied with one Echo Dot. But I am glad there was a discount.

Have wanted an Echo for awhile; when I saw that price, I had to get it. Alexa tells me the weather, the correct time, tells me jokes, plays my favorite music, plays Jeopardy with me, even reminds me to do things! She's even polite. If I invest in some extras, I'll even have her turning on my lights. My future self may need something that's voice-activated (I'm 61); hoping it will help with my Fire TV. But it's not only useful - it's fun! Haven't had any problems, except remembering all of Alexa's skills. So cool.

Okay so here's the deal. This is the fourth Amazon Echo I have purchased for my household and business. I thought it would be great everyone can listen when they want to. There is a fee you pay each month, on top of the purchase price.
BUT
But they Don't tell you is if you want to listen to more than one device at a time- even if I'm at work and someone is at home, you have to pay an extra $240 a year.
You Get that?
Two.
Hundred.
Forty
Dollars.

Overall the product works fine, with the following exceptions. 1) which bulbs can I add? You would think that this would be easy to answer but it isn't. Sengled makes a number of bulbs that do NOT work with the hub. It is difficult to determine which bulbs can be added to the system. 2) I can turn on/off lights at sunset/sunrise. I think that this is mostly an Alexa problem, but really. Of course I want to be able to turn on lights 15 minutes after sunset or off at 20 minutes before sunrise. But I cannot. Amazon doesn't care what I want, but if Sengled told Amazon to fix the problem I suspect that they would listen. 3rd problem. you are better off getting a smart switch that a smart light bulb. If someone turns of the light switch your smart bulb doesn't work

Much better speakers than the previous generation. I don’t use the Bluetooth speaker in the baby’s room anymore. However, seems like Alexa doesn’t hear me as well as the older version. Not a deal breaker. You won’t need to buy an additional cover anymore and honestly, it was ridiculous they charged $10 for those. If you can afford it no problem then upgrade. If you cannot, don’t worry, you’re not missing out—especially if you already have nice Bluetooth speakers hooked up.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works as expected but just a tiring toy after about a week.
reviews.reviewText: We bought this since it seemed to be new technology that we should learn about - we connected a couple of lights to it, and occasionally ask it to play music or answer a question. Its kind of neat, but after a while found it more work/effort to use than just turn on/off the lights are self. Since we have Siri (iPhone) there really isn't anything the DOT does better or different. I'm glad I bought it but like most things it just sits silently barely used now.

reviews.reviewTitle: Pretty good logic, but not quite there
reviews.reviewText: We got this on Prime day to see if they're worth the hype. I also wanted a way for my toddler to be able to call someone if there is an emergency. Mostly we use Alexa to play music. Occasionally I ask about weather or traffic. We've tried to ask when certain stores or restaurants are open but she can't always locate them. I'm giving 4 stars because I can't talk to her like I talk to Google and get results. Overall it's a nice little speaker to talk to, with some helpful information.
Can’t get Apple Music to play and when I ask Alexa, she says I need an update to my software. When I try to update - nothing.

reviews.reviewTitle: What did I do before Echo Show?
reviews.reviewText:
This is my first 3rd Gen Dot! A thing of beauty. The sound is .... Excellent! Now, since I have an ECHO in the Living Room, Master Bedroom, Kitchen, Upstairs Studio, Downstairs Studio and one at my son's home in Minnesota I'm thinking I might need just one more ....... in the Bathroom.
So, if you haven't gotten your first Echo, be aware, they WILL multiply through your home!
PS AMAZON ECHO CREATORS... I am eagerly awaiting the Car Echo.... actually desperately awaiting the CAR ECHO.

reviews.reviewTitle: Must have for tech savvy family!
reviews.reviewText: Overall great! The sound quality is amazing for such a small speaker. It can hear me say Alexa when I can’t even hear myself. The blue light when it hears you is very noticeable so you can tell if she hears you. I made a few of my own skills and I love how personalizable it is. I where when my husband comes home it tells him what I need help with for the day such as chores. I also made a skill of flash cards and quizzes so I can study for my exams for class. I absolutely love it! We bought a second one for upstairs for our smart lights that came with the bundle.

i ended up buying the echo dot 3d gen out of impulse but oh my god this thing is fun to play with! i tell her to play anything and she will. also it has replaced my alarm since its louder and more soothing i love that it has an option to do daily briefing and you can add whatever you want to hear from it through your app on your phone. i also really love this feature that allows you to send a voice message to your echo through the app as well on your phone all you have to say is alexa announce " " and she will send your voice recording to the echo dot. i use it to freak out whoever is at home when im bored and im out and about lol. anyways this device is really helpful you can ask it almost anything and she will have a response for you and theyre frequently adding new commands on top of that. 10/10 would recommend

reviews.reviewTitle: Getting Echo Dot Connected and Working
reviews.reviewText: Our second Echo Dot arrived today. I spent an hour trying to get it connected and working. I failed. I then asked Amazon for help and a very kind Amazon helper spent another hour trying to get it connected and working. That also ended in failure. So, two hours of effort and the new Echo Dot was not connected and not working. When my wife came home from work she took out her iPhone and she had our new Echo Dot connected and working within 12 minutes. Whew! So happy to have a smart Life Partner.

This is a steep improvement in sound from the last model design. We use it often in the kitchen and it feels like a closer cousin to more expensive surround sound speakers like Bose.

The cloth options were also welcome on the speaker as they blend well now into a room.

We plan to buy more for classical music and jazz as it is dynamic and full in presence. I wish I bought it sooner. Spend the extra money and ignore the prior model. This will far exceed your expectations and give you all those echo features you want.

reviews.reviewTitle: Compact alternative to the full size Echo
reviews.reviewText: We have had a full size Echo in our family room for more than a year, and wanted to have Alexa pipe music in our living room as well. The Echo Dot is a very nice, unobtrusive unit, and its audio output plug allows us to directly connect it (rather than depending upon a Bluetooth receiver) to our home entertainment unit and its 12" subwoofer, for much richer music than any built-in small speaker could hope to achieve.

Great Alexa. Does what every Alexa does. I gave 4 stars b/c the 3rd gen has a new plug and I don’t like that. Gen 2 you can pull out the Alexa cord and use the USB base for something else if needed which is really convenient for my house as I have children who own 100 different toys that charge with a USB charger now and guest come over and will use it to charge their phones etc since it’s in the kitchen. I put the new one in my bathroom instead of my kitchen like planned since the cord is different.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great product but Amazon needs to improve it!
reviews.reviewText:
Great product. The sound is improved. It understands better. and it's a fun toy.

HOWEVER, after several years on the market you would think the programmable part would have improved. Most everything I want it to do is a pain in the #$%!. I am sure Amazon gets tons of requests for improvements but they are not listening or have a microscopic programming group or maybe just myopic... Spend some of the millions you are earning to add some features! Google is going to pass you by if you don't!

I have bought a couple of 2nd Gen Echo Dots and really enjoyed them. It was therefore a no-brainer to buy the 3rd Gen given the insignificant price difference between the two.

The main difference between the two is the better speaker on the 3rd Gen Dot. I therefore use this new Dot in a bedroom where it can act as a speaker. My original Dot is synched to a Sonos speaker.

Once you start off on a smart home journey you begin to discover the myriad of ways that an Echo Dot can help with household tasks.

I bought it fot my mother who is forgetful thinking it would help stimulate her mind.
We speak Spanish so I was so happy we could cortar that language. However, the "Spain" Spanish is difficult to understand.
And we really have to speak loud and directly at it for the "Mexican" Spanish to hear us which makes it frustrating to use. Also, it doesn't seem to understand us either. So, basically it just sits there
No as smooth as my English version.

What did I ever to without my dot and Alexa???!!! I tell her goodnight and she turns on my fan, turns off my lamp, and plays my music from Pandora. Then when I wake up, I tell her good morning and she turns on my lamp. off the fan and music, tells me the weather and my schedule for the day. I also use her as my alarm clock and timer for cooking. So many great options! The speaker is small and sounds decent when playing music. It always needs to be plugged in, so it is not as mobile as I would like, but I still love it!

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa works fine. Speaker and sound is garbage.
reviews.reviewText: I bought two of the Echo Dot 3rd Gen and sent both back. I opened one and tried it out. The sound is horrible, even after adjusting through the Alexa app. They just sound like a muffled mess. And these aren’t rechargeable. You’ll need to carry the power cord no matter where you take it. I realize this is a small speaker but I have a few other Bluetooth speakers just as small as this and they have great sound range. Amazon needs to go back to the drawing table on this one, as far as decent sound is concerned.

I love how easy this is to set up, i was kind of nervous about the set up, as the instructions were not very extensive, but i soon found out they didnt need to be. I love that i can say Alexa from anywhere in the house, to change the music, set up a grocery list or set up an alarm. I had seen others use this product and thought it looked kewl, but i honestly had no idea how easy to convenient it was. I will definitely buy a few more for all over the house.

reviews.reviewTitle: Amazing sound quality from such a tiny speaker!
reviews.reviewText: This was the first time I have evr used one of these " smart speakers" and I am very impressed on the ability of the unit to recognize voice commands. I was blown away at the sound quality of this little thing. Like having a high dollar BOSE Speaker in something the size of half a beer can! we have one in the Kitchen and my daughter has one in her room. We use them all the time and have no complaints.

I have been hearing about "Alexa" and have been going back and forth with myself deciding whether or not to purchase it & am very glad I did! For some reason, I thought that it would be so hard to use, complicated, etc... but I couldn't have been more wrong! All I had to do was open my Echo Dot when it arrived yesterday, plug it in, download the Alexa app to my android phone, sign up and then I was up and running! My husband and I had a lot of fun with it last night and were actually amazed at home interactive Alexa actually is :) I would definitely recommend it, don't wait as long as we did, just do it! :)

reviews.reviewTitle: It’s something you didn’t know you needed
reviews.reviewText: I have only had this for a few weeks, and with the exception of one problem it has worked as expected. I have enjoyed listening to music more frequently and it’s convenient to turn lights off and on. I had one incident when Alexa stopped talking although she was following commands. I unplugged the unit and plugged it back in and it was fine after that. This was a gift and I don’t think I would have purchased it myself but I am finding it useful.

reviews.reviewTitle: It works okay but still have some ways to go...
reviews.reviewText: Well Alexa is responsive but not all the time. The wisper doesn’t work and if you ask her the time when the volume is high at 2 in the morning she’ll wake up the house. Even when follow up question mode is enabled it doesn’t work very well ...... everything else works fine. Installing the Echo Dot was a bit tricky but the Alexa app works better now. I forgot to mention that the light on the unit itself should have an on and off as it’s very disturbing at 3 in the morning if it’s updating and your trying to sleep.

reviews.reviewTitle: I'm not tech savvy, love it!
reviews.reviewText: I was in a wreck 5 years ago and have brain damage. Alexa with the dot is a life changer for me. I programmed my own "routines", which is the echo way of saying when I tell Alexa specific phrases she then responds with a series of things I have preset. This has been helpful with my mornings and getting kids up. Reminding me to start lunch, or complete chores/tasks. I love the music quality. And that with just my voice I can turn down or pause the music.

reviews.reviewTitle: Be careful not to use any Alexa app on Yahoo or other wbsite.
reviews.reviewText:
I downloaded the Alexa app for android on Yahoo. I was prompted that the Alexa Echo Dot will guide me thru. That man took over my mouse and my computer. He then pressured me to pay $299.00 for 2 yrs to remove the virus he put in my computer.
I sent both Echo Dots back for over a week. Still no refunds from Amazon Prime. I have been a Prime member for over 9 years hence I cancelled my Prime membership. This is not away to treat a loyal customer.

Whereas the 2nd gen Dot was easy to set up, 3rd gen was a royal pain. The online PC app is not worth anything to try to set up. The Fire HD tablet was useless. Amazon customer service did not help, even after forwarding to Tech Dept. It took several attempts with the Alexa app on cell phone to finally get it to work. There is supposed to be an audio improvement, but it is barely noticeable.

Seems to have somewhat better wifi sensitivity than the second-generation Dot, but that's where the superiority ends. Sound is bass heavy and muffled. It's also quite directional and speech can become downright unintelligible if the Dot is not properly oriented or close to your ear.
I also found that the switch from a USB power supply to a dedicated one is not a convenience, especially if you have earlier Dots around the house, or need to relocate this one occasionally.

reviews.reviewTitle: Hard to set up but we are FINALLY cool! 😂
reviews.reviewText:
Holy moly was this difficult to set up! I'm not sure if my husband's Bluetooth being turn on his phone while I was setting up that caused issues but it took me far too long to get it figured out. In the end, we got it right. She didn't give me my morning brief when I greeted her this morning but we're still getting to know each other.
True story, first thing Alexa did for us was meow like a cat. We'll get along just fine.

reviews.reviewTitle: Maximized audio playback with minimized space
reviews.reviewText:
The 3rd generation Echo Dot rivals the sound quality of significantly larger and many times more expensive speakers.
A true breakthrough in audio streaming quality, it reduces the space needed to the equivalent of a single wall outlet.
This enhancement virtually restricts the earlier generations of the Echo Dot and Spot to command only functions.
To be clear, you can still stream music on the older generations; you just won't want to after hearing the 3rd Gen Echo.

I got the Echo Dot about a week and a half ago and I absolutely love it. Not only do I love it but my entire family loves it. My husband uses it all the time for music. My son figured out that you can ask Alexa to fart and thinks that is the funniest thing!! It was also really awesome to have at Christmas. We were able to track our letters to Santa and then track Santa on Christmas eve! The speakers are nice and clear and loud. I was surprised at how well Alexa can hear and understand me over all of the kids. My favorite part is being able to control things like the lamp without getting up. I ended up buying one for my teenage daughter and my mom.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa and Amazon are getting a little too big for there britches!
reviews.reviewText: Alexa and the echo devices are becoming increasingly less cooperative every time I use them. Cannot get them to work the way they are supposed to like playing the same music on multiple echo devices through creating a home group. I made sure I am on the family plan so I keep upping my subscriptions and I keep experiencing more and more technical difficulties. How much does it cost before it just stops working and gives me the big middle finger? Seriously thinking about getting rid of all forms of Alexa, echo devices and Amazon all together. If I can't get what I want and am already paying the top price for all of amazon's music services there is nothing else I can do but stop giving them my money!

reviews.reviewTitle: Item is ok, customer service needs work
reviews.reviewText:
Sounds great for the price
Update- This broke after a month of moderate use. I was able to get a replacement. The replacement is a refurbished one that did not come with a power cord. Since I sent my power cord back with the device I now needed to order a new power cord that magically wont be here for 5 days with my 2 day prime. The device itself is ok, but the customer support is lacking a bit. My advice is not to send your power cord back if yours fails like mine did.

reviews.reviewTitle: What a difference from the older version
reviews.reviewText: We had picked up second generation as soon as they came out. We also have a Google mini and love going between the two to see which one's better. The primary complaint what's the quality of sound where the Google beat hands down. Finally decided to try this new 3rd generation and wow what a difference insound. Thank goodness because we no longer have to use an external Bluetooth speaker to play music through Alexa.

We bought the google mini for my bedroom and this echo dot for my kitchen. I bought both so I could compare them. I really liked this product better than the google mini, until the echo dot started rattling. Only been using the product for one month. (Btw, we never dropped it and never had the volume more than 50%.)
So I called Amazon and they quickly offered to ship me a free replacement, however they told me I did have to do the legwork of returning the defective item to a UPS hub. For me this will be a 30 mile trip. Wish they would have offered just to have it picked up at my home to save me the trip. Giving this 2 star for being defective and having to make the trip to return it. Would have given it 4 star if they would have just not asked me to return the defective one. The google mini is still working fine.. no rattling. I hope the replacement echo dot I get lasts longer because Alexa just seems more like a real person than google.

reviews.reviewTitle: No Amazon Unlimited Music for paired 3rd generation Echo Dots.
reviews.reviewText:
I bought two.
No Amazon Unlimited Music for paired 3rd generation Echo Dots.
It's not supported!
I will keep the second one I bought only because I got it on sale at about
half the usual price. I'll keep it in the kitchen for use as a timer and
weather reports.

It is an improvement over the 2nd generation Dot with dramatically
fuller sound. Doesn't look or feel cheap like its predecessor.

I does NOT do what I wanted: play Amazon Unlimited Music in paired (stereo) mode.

reviews.reviewTitle: A good upgrade from last gen!
reviews.reviewText: Better, louder sound quality than last gen. If up too load Alexa can’t always here you from a distance but that is rare situation. Miss usb connection though as now it takes up another outlet and the plug is big so not easy for certain wall plugs. Overall, I bought two for stereo and that does work fine but not as good as a Bluetooth connection to an amp. Might work good for a small office or room. Good buy so far as I caught them on sale for $30.

reviews.reviewTitle: Sounds Great and is Easy to Set Up
reviews.reviewText: I've has this for about a month now and am still wowed by the sound that comes out of it. I love my second gen dot, but this is a very nice upgrade. I only wish it was still powered by a mini USB rather than a propriotary plug and sometimes the trebel sounds like an AM station that is slightly tuned off its frequency when adjusting the equalizer, but overall it is a very nice addition to the Echo family at a very nice price. I just hope someone will come up with a battery base for it to make it portable.

Short and sweet review:

Everything about the Dot is great except the sound quality for music. Sound quality for music is really poor like it was an unimportant afterthought. The sound is muddy, unclear and uncrisp...as though the speaker diaphragm is made of brown paper bag material.

This poor sound quality certainly doesn't motivate me to invest in a more expensive version of the Echo.

We have a number of connected devices from Amazon, but I wanted a smaller device that could be mounted to the plugin (we purchased a mount separately). This device not only sounds good but looks good as well. At first I was disappointed that the first generation was no longer available as the mount options are much more plentiful. However the style of this device makes it look like it is supposed to be there and the rounded edges don’t hurt if you kid bumps into it.

Overall I have to say that this makes my life way easier. Generally it's very good at what it does. However if your getting one for the first time know that you will need to say things exactly as it's programed to interprite. This is especially true when using voice to activate routines. The software that runs this device hasn't quight grasped the idea that it should understand synonyms. Not a deal breaker, just something to know.

This speaker is great at hearing me even when the music is playing. I grabbed this speaker after utilizing alexa on a Sonos One speaker....so unfortunately, I was a bit sad to learn of the audio difference. But that was expected. My issue is with the 'skills' of Alexa. The skills on the marketplace are very specific or dont seem to have a feature that is very helpful. Perhaps if they were organized in a better way, so that I could find something most useful to me? I haven't found one that I need/use that alexa doesnt do. My other concern. Is her knowledge on some basic questions. I also have google assistant in my house, i use google assistant for knowledge based questions or something I would search online. For example I ask Google what else an actor played in, or the definition of a word and get a great informative answer, and Alexa's answer to 'what is a other word for communication' was communicate... I use Alexa more for communicating with smart things in my house or connecting via bluetooth to my phone, or using the drop in feature with family.

The AC Adapter is much to large and charging should be accomplished using a micro USB cable and AC adapter preferably the size of a small ubiquitous Apple Cube the Echo Dot charger is almost 3 times larger - there is no sound reason for this. The reason why having a large AC Adapter is an issue is because it takes up too much space at the electrical outlet (See image provided) Also, the device must be continually plugged in - thus eliminating the ability for portability - it should be a rechargeable - it's not. Also the design should allow for wall mounting, didn't anyone think of that ?

reviews.reviewTitle: Just Buy It - My Second Echo Product and I'm Likely Slightly Biased
reviews.reviewText: I have been delinquent in writing this review - I now have three echo products and I think they are excellent. I purchased this DOT for my bedroom and she (I guess it could be a he) interacts wells with the other echo's in the house. I was a bit hesitant that the sound quality would be sub-par but have been pleasantly surprised. Even the bass response is great, especially for such a small footprint. What can I say, just order it. If nothing else, they make EXCELLENT gifts!

reviews.reviewTitle: speaker is already blown after only a couple of weeks
reviews.reviewText: I got the amazon echo (full size) and fell in love with it immediately, so I bought the echo dot to add surround sound to my house, I have never listened to it above volume level 5 and only after 10-12 uses, I started noticing some static in the sound, I didn't realize that the speaker had blown until I walked into the other room and heard my full size echo, still sounding as clear as the day I got it. I still very much love the product, and my review would sing nothing but praise if not for the diminished sound through a defective speaker... only problem there is, the speaker is just about the most important factor of the product... hence the "one star" rating

I love my Alexa but it needs its updates especially for person that speaks quieter and slower than the machine is used to and it will not change even through the app so they got to fix it. The phone ringer doesn't like in the advertisements. It needs to have audible books play in every single room on Alexa. It needs to be connected to Comcast email cuz I do not get my email. It needs to know more information on the get-go without downloading skills. I can go on and on but I will not. There are a lot of good things about Alexa also.

As with other Alexa devices the integration with skills and smart home devices is half baked. Smart switches often don’t work or are unresponsive. If you have your lights and other items hooked to a smart switch for voice commands and the skill is constantly unresponsive, then what’s the point?

My siblings and I LOVE using the echo dot. We play it’s fun mini games and use it to play music (connected to Apple Music). We have fun asking Alexa numerous questions. I even use it while cooking for quick measurement conversions. I set reminders on it when I need something in the moment but will surely forget. The sound quality is amazing. The only thing that I would suggest would be to work on its voice recognition. I don’t have an accent and my voice isn’t deep. I don’t mumble or shout. Sometimes it doesn’t recognize words that I say and I end up repeating myself twice. But it doesn’t happen a lot, so I still enjoy this!

reviews.reviewTitle: I can call for help if I am alone on the floor!!
reviews.reviewText: I fell on the kitchen floor when my husband was in the hospital and I was alone. The phone was 20 feet away and my cell phone was in my purse in the bedroom!! Thank goodness I was not badly hurt, but it scared me. I am only 68 and I refuse to wear one of those "things" around my neck! I got 3 echo dots (3rd gen) , one for each part of the house. I can say " call jack" or "call mary" and speak from the floor to a friend who can come and help me or call 911. I don't feel so alone now!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Works as well as the larger model.
reviews.reviewText: The Echo Dot has surprisingly good sound, and works just as well as our larger Echo. We have had it for nearly a year and love having it for our favorite music channels. It comes with an App on your phone and you are able to rate the music you are hearing. If you don’t like a certain song, rate it thumbs down, and you won’t hear it again. After a while you are only hearing great songs on the station you are choosing.

I just recieved this today. Imholding out on the fifth star because I havent gotten to try everything out or use it much. But so far I can comment on the sound and the reaction time of alexa. First of all,this thing is loud at full volume. Which is great. I have no problem understanding the music that is playing or what alexa is saying. And as for alexa, the skills offered are awesome. Ive only tried a couple out but the two that I have tried worked great. My daughter played a guess the animal game and tried to trick alexa by choosing a human and alexa got it. It seems to understand what we say just fine as well. Before I can even finish saying alexa stop it stops. So predictive reaction is phoenominal for that.

I love the convenience the echo dot gives. I talk to her all day, and she's really smart! She helps me stay organized and I love the fact that I can be hands free with my lights and my speakers. Not that being tethered to my cell phone is that much of a hassle, but I still like this better. Of note, though: Alexa does not swear. She tells me to "Clean your BEEP house you BEEP". I think it's funny, most people won't. :)

Works great and does everything I need it to do and more!
I don't have a house phone so if I am the only one here and lay my phone down I can easily find it using the dog simply by asking Alexa to find my phone.
Turn lights on and off by voice command.
Get the news and weather. Set alarms and reminders and p!at music.

I love this device for what it can do, but sometimes I cannot get the command right to get it to do what I want to. Sometimes it works and sometimes it does not. Simple commands are ok, but I am still trying to figure out why it does not work sometimes. It does not work with Spectrum cable service which was a surprise and sometimes I have trouble with getting my tv to respond. I do however love listening to Amazon Music or Pandora through it and love being able to set the alarm with a command. Maybe if I had gotten a more expensive version it would do more.

I love this item! It is so helpful to ask Alexa questions without having to look anything up. The ability to choose music, make lists, play audible books and explore the unknown with Alexa is simply great. A friend encouraged me to buy this and Amazon happened to have it on sale. For the price your money is well spent. Amazon's assistance in setting this up properly was quite helpful although it turned out I could have set it up myself. Excellent purchase!

This version of the Dot is so much better than previous versions. It is hard to believe the audio difference in the 3rd ten Dot. We've replaced almost all of our previous Dots with the new version and those that we replaced in main rooms are being used as secondary and just voice control devices in other rooms. My family loves to have these around the house to easily get weather forecasts when getting ready in the morning to being able to have music whenever they want.

reviews.reviewTitle: Cloth muffles the sound of the speaker. The microphones are weaker than gen 2 dots.
reviews.reviewText: The grey cloth on these new echo dots LOOK good, but at the cost of sound quality. The speaker sound is really muffled compared to earlier plastic echo dots. Also, the microphones seem to be weaker, perhaps the cloth somehow breaks up the sound of my voice? I have to speak a LOT louder for this new echo dot to hear me. The earlier gen. plastic echo dots sound better and louder, and the older plastic echo dot microphones pick up my voice much better.

I bought a pair of these Echo 3s in January. One has worked well and I can move it from room to room as needed. The second has never worked properly. In trying to replace it , I find Alexa reporting that I have 90 days, the website reporting 60 days, and the sales slip reporting 30 days. Hmmm. I guess Amazon does not have confidence in this product. 30, 60, or 90 is a very short warranty period no matter how you look at it. I am not unhappy with the Echo that works but, since I can't return the defective one, I will check out the Google product and see how it compares.

Love it, my only two complaints are that Siri, generally, is a smarter and more capable personal assistant, and that you can’t set up a routine to automatically unlock your door with Alexa. Kind of stupid if you ask me. - 1 start for those alone. Minor complaints are that it sometimes doesn’t hear me unless I make a dramatic pause between Alexa and the subsequent command, meaning I have to speak unnaturally to get the thing to execute what I want it to do.

reviews.reviewTitle: Anything 3rd Gen is worth the upgrade.
reviews.reviewText: No doubt the speaker and the mic have been upgraded. I have at least 1 of every generation echo device. This 3rd gen is noticeably better. The music sounds great and she is much more responsive. They do need to add a couple more names to the list to get Alexa’s attention. Th reason being Alexa is available in more and more devices that you can end up with multiple devices in the same room or proximity. The better mics also are a reason to have more than 3 possible names which are Alexa, Computer and Echo.

reviews.reviewTitle: A Great Assistant for the blind
reviews.reviewText: This was a second dot for my home. The first I received as a gift. I loved it so much I bought a second one. Echo dots are great. You can place an order, look up information, get latest news & weather, set up reminders, listen to music, etc. It’s like having a computer you talk to. It makes a great gift. A legally blind friend is able to get anything we can get on a computer just by talking. What a great piece of technology!

reviews.reviewTitle: The very impressive 3rd gen Echo Dot
reviews.reviewText: I have had and enjoyed an Alexa Echo 2G5 which is stationed in my living room for over a year now, and have thoroughly enjoyed its features and functions. I love the fact that she is always learning and expanding her capabilities to enhance my experience. That is why I did not hesitate to purchase this 3rd gen Echo dot for my bedroom. I use it to control my lights, play music and even set a sleep timer to play nature sounds to help me fall asleep at night. It was very easy to install, being pretty much plug and play, and once connected to my WiFi router, all was up and running smoothly! This Echo dot I feel was a great deal for the surprisingly low cost considering its abilities and I highly recommend it to anyone considering upgrading their tech in their home to make life more entertaining and easier.

I have the Echo tower installed in my bedroom. It is good there but when I was in another part of the house I would have to go to the bedroom
I decided to add an Echo Dot in my living room and love it there as well. Alexa knows my voice and has learned spe ial phrases l used. Instead of using flash briefings I as Alexa "what's up" and I get all my flash briefings. Sometimes it is like I can almost have a conversation.

reviews.reviewTitle: An excellent improvement over the second generation echo dot.
reviews.reviewText:
Pros: The sound quality is greatly improved over the first and second generation dots. Amazon has also refined the microphone system. The new dot now picks up conversation and understands much better. I used to have problems with room echo with the generation 2. Great looks, great sound and better microphones make this unit a hit.

Cons: There really isn't any. If Amazon would have included the internal thermometer as they did with the next gen echo plus this unit would have it all.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very cool item, but it & you have a learning curve.
reviews.reviewText:
UPDATE:
I can't figure out how to make the DOT play music at the same time as using an external plugged in speaker...and or... I can't make it work on its own when its plugged into an external speaker.

Original review: I never wanted an item that is listening all the time, BUT... when my iphone & dock for my stereo was dying, this is about as cheap of a replacement as I found. Best part, you can link a bunch of them together and listen to music all over the house.
Challenges are its & your learning curve to make the thing do what you want.... I have only had it a couple of weeks and used it 5-6 times, but so far pretty darned cool.
I want a list of the correct phrases to say for things to happen, I will search on line to see if it exists.

Much better than the first version but there is a bug in the software which I have reported but has not been fixed yet. Ask for weather and Alexa gives it for a location 30 miles away and yes before you ask Alexa is set up correctly as verified by support who replicated the issue. It’s been 4 weeks since I reported this and nothing has been fixed. And if anyone is listening at Amazon I have a case Id.

We have 3 small dots throughout our house and everyone one of them is the 3rd generation style and we enjoy everyone of them. The devices hears your voice fairly well, often times when there is a TV going on in the back ground. The speaker function is great too! The sound fills the room well, so if you want to play some music while making dinner, you truly do it immersive sound in the space. I would recommend this product for anyone who doesn't want to spend a ton of money and has a reassembly small space!!!

I own 2 of the previous generation of the Echo Dot and one of this gen. This one seems to have a hard time hearing its wake-up word. Also, the old one had no problem hearing me over the alarm or music that was currently playing and this one can hear if the volume is above 6 and there isn't a pause is audio. I literally have to wait for pause in whatever is playing to catch its attention.

The only plus side is that the audio does sound a little better and it looks little more modern than the hockey pucks.

reviews.reviewTitle: A Great Little Helper and Information Announcer 3rd Gen Echo Dot
reviews.reviewText: I wanted to wait a few months before I wrote this review. I had purchased several of these Echo's for my house and I bought a couple of Echo Dots (3rd Gen) for my daughter's house as well for Christmas. The Echo's have worked very well. In fact they have exceeded many expectations. I'm able to use them as an intercom for the house. I can call from room to room. I can play music throughout the entire house or individual room. Finally, I get news and weather in any room. My daughter also uses them for entertainment and music for her family as well. All that with the ability to control lights from my smart phone to make my house more secure and safe. It truly is a great product. I plan on adding more Alexa's in the house.

I bought an echo about a week ago for the first time from bestbuy and I have been loving it. I bought another one from amazon because they had a deal at the time where for $35 I got the echo 3rd gen and a LIFX bulb. I'm still new to the smart home thing but so far I've got some plugs for lamps and the christmas tree and this one smart bulb. The kids also love Alexa, I will saying hearing "Alexa, play baby shark" 100 times a day does get old but I enjoy having it. I can also control my DirecTv with it so that's great.

It took a while to get my order but worth the wait. I ordered these during Amazon Prime Day and just took delivery. Seems they are more popular than the good people at amazon thought. I am amazed at the fidelity of something so small. This little device has a lot of features and functions I have yet to discover. The fidelity is heavy on the bass side and I have to ask for less bass all the time. Could be my 72 yr old ears.

reviews.reviewTitle: the default 'find my phone' app has a surcharge
reviews.reviewText:
also it doesn't integrate with google reminders, or any of the google ecosystem, which is basically the only contiguous global reminder system i can really consider using. two reminder systems is a no go for me, so until this device integrates into that, it will likely remain entirely a novelty ...

like just for fun, i talk shit about jeff bezos to it. honestly, if i were jeff, i'd make the thing be a feedback device for real time public opinion analysis. on at least myself, and probably all the other public figures, just to map a graph of who is *actually* important.

though, always gotta be careful with that dataset because once people catch on, they might manipulate you back.

and the devil, is *always* in the details that you're missing, however small, dawg. ;)

~ u/goderator200

I heard so much flack about the Echo Dot and having a horrible speaker but at $24 for the holiday sale, I couldn't pass up the opportunity. I bought it.... I was surprised at how good it sounded. Granted I had nothing to compare it to. I bought another one because I was impressed. A few days after having bought it, it still sounds fine and my opinion hasn't wavered.... much. I bought an echo plus and sadly the bass from that thing makes the echo dot sound not so good. Hahaha, so that opinion is a bit biased.

reviews.reviewTitle: Next to my cat, Alexa is my next favorite buddy.
reviews.reviewText: I tried Echo some years ago but decided to get the Dot and try again. I just got it today and set it up and Im so hooked am getting one for my bedroom. I live in a small two bedrokm apartment by myself so dont need much but love that I can listen to my audio books and music and ask anything Alexa a lot of interesting things. Its so cool. I also have 4 Kindles! A great friend to a senior citizen of 74 almost 75 years old. The geek in me loves all these devices!

I have an Echo in my bedroom and thought it would be nice to have music in the kitchen since I spend so much time there. However, I love my Echo but the Dot just does not have the same sound as the Echo. It does provide music and Alexa integration is okay, but I will be upgrading to another Echo for the kitchen in the near future - probably on Prime Day, and then I'll use the Dot in the Master bathroom for those long soaks in the tub.

reviews.reviewTitle: From Gen 2 to Gen 3 - WHAT AN IMPROVEMENT
reviews.reviewText: I loved my Gen 2 Dot. But, the sound was horrible. Spent hundreds of dollars for quality speakers for her to bluetooth to... wish I would have waited for the Gen 3. Speakers are awesome on their own. Gen 2 would make me cringe, but the Gen 3 is fine for me all by itself. Now, I still use my expensive speaker with Gen 3, but only for music and transporting it from room to room. Otherwise, the Gen 3 Alexa Dot is perfect for me to listen to my Audible Books (which is about 95% of what I use her for).

I am 73 and decided to get two of the Dots to use with Alexa. I was worried about how to hook it up and thought I would have to wait for one of my son in laws to help me but to my surprise it was easy, oh so easy. I found the sound very clear and love hearing the "rain on tin roof, babbling brook" nature sounds. We have only had it three days but we are enjoying it and believe we will purchase two more soon. We dim our inside and outside lights with them. Its amazing what all you can do. I just need time to figure out some of the other additional components to keep learning these incredible devices. I will say they are attractive, we got the charcoal and the size is not intrusive.

reviews.reviewTitle: The sound on these is damn near as good as the full-sized Echos!
reviews.reviewText: No lie, the sound on these new 3rd Gen Echo Dots is LEAGUES better than the 2nd Gen Dots. If you have to pick, buy these 3rd Gen Dots hands down over the previous models. In fact, it is so much better than the previous, that I find it to be fairly close to as good as the full sized Echo. You won't get the volume with it that you do on the full sized Echos but you will get the clarity for sure. All in all, it's a no brainer. I own one of these and will definitely be buying another in the future.

This past year experienced echo and echo dot for the first time. Now we have one echo and three echo dots in our home. We have only used them for very simple things like playing music, dropping in on each other and some other more simple apps. Can only imagine how awesome this will be once we start utilizing them for a hands free home. Very simple interface and simple to get started. Very reasonably priced for all the possible uses.

When the Alexa is working, it actually works well. I use it for news, music, weather, alarm, and timer.
I even order a second one during prime day. Yet, I am still waiting for my second one to be shipped to me.
After several weeks, I have found that at times it does recognize what I am asking, so it just doesn't do anything. It occurs off and on, not all the time. Probably, like one day in a week. Wondering if I should consider cancelling my second order. I presume it will take another month to receive my second Alexa echo dot. By that time, I will know more and perhaps decide to return or keep the second one. I gave it a 4 star because besides the above it is overall a good product for the price.

reviews.reviewTitle: Compact package and decent sound quality
reviews.reviewText:
Nice upgrade to the 2nd generation Echo Dot. The integrated speaker has good sound quality. The small size is nice when shelf space is limited. You also save one outlet and an external speaker, cable and so on. If I could only hang this from a hook/nail or just through-hole mount to a wall stud with one screw. Overall another winner from Amazon Echo line.
Their Thanksgiving/Cyber Monday deal made buying this a no-brainer. Oh, and it arrived in 2 days amidst the holiday rush...all around another wow!

A handy little gadget that provides responses to voice commands, such as specific types of music, alarms, weather, time and other information upon request. Basic setup needed to get started is easy, but other things are not nearly as intuitive. For example, if I request music by a specific artist it will search the Amazon music library (up to 2 million songs are free and an advanced library with up to 10 million songs are by subscription) is easy. However, I haven't figured out how to set up Pandora to play on it.

It also connects with Bluetooth devices easily. For example, I connect it to my Beats Pill (a wireless speaker) so that I can have music on my patio.

It has privacy settings that are supposed to maintain your privacy (so no one, including Amazon, can hack in and listen to what is going on in your house. The fact that it can be accessed by a third party in the first place makes me skeptical about any privacy settings. So if you've got nothing to hide, privacy shouldn't be too much of a concern.

A personal assistant for less than 30 bucks, what’s not to love? Was very easy to set up. Alexa understands me 99% of the time. I don’t have to raise my voice or try to annunciate. She usually understands my 3 year old as well. I use it with Amazon music quite often and it’s plenty loud enough to listen to in my living room and kitchen. I added several of the free kids Alexa features to it and they enjoy playing games like Simon says, freeze dance, etc. I’m planning on buying another for our basement.

This is a fun gadget, but there is still work to do. Sound quality was great the first day or two at a moderate volume, but after that the speaker sounds like it is blown when trying to listen to music. The voice recognition doesn’t seem as sophisticated as other devices and my husband often gets a “I’m sorry...” I didn’t get that type of response when trying to use the dot. I have enjoyed the drop in feature for an intercom while I am cooking.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works better than any other assistant I've used
reviews.reviewText: Alexa is amazing and the integration is so much deeper than any of the other smart assistants I have tried. You can ask Alexa to play games and control your thermostats and lighting etc, without a ton of extra crazy hoops to jump through. Notable difference: Alexa, I want to play Jeopardy leads to a trivia game with the speaker. Another smart speaker will instead play a random song titled Jeopardy...

reviews.reviewTitle: How did I ever get along without it?
reviews.reviewText: This is the fifth Echo dot that I have purchased. I bought one and loved it so I bought two more and send so added two more with total of 5. Because they're so versatile and so able to provide Integrated Controls and things such as lights, thermostat Etc. I have a multi-level house and we'll use them as intercoms to talk between rooms and levels. The sound quality is great for listening to music. They become an integral part in our quality of life.

Bought an Echo a while back. Enjoyed it a lot! Easy to use- listening to music or podcasts in the kitchen while cooking or whatever. Thought I might get an Echo for the front room. Uh... mistake. Now the original Echo can no longer pair with my iPhone for podcasts or non-Amazon music or anything non-Amazon related. Jumped through some hoops- Apple now says they need a "paid subscription". Now? So what changed? Spent an hour++ on the phone with a super patient Amazon dude who finally said "sucks to be you." So now Amazon will no longer pair with non Amazon devices, or no longer offer tech support to resolve the issue. Srsly, shoulda seen this coming. Unless you are fully drinking the Amazon phone and tablet Kool-Aid, don't waste your money on this garbage!

I brought this item for my Mom and I also bought one for myself and I simply enjoy it. Its' great to have this thing to ask questions and get answers to. That's why I call it the companion. I just wish it was a physical robot where I can ask her to go get me something at the fridge but I can imagine that will happen eventually. My Mom is in love with Alexa and the funny thing is that she argues with her...lol! Great product.

Despite poo pooing the concept, when the Echo Dot had a super low price on Prime Day, I got one. Didn't really know what I'd use it for, but I thought, what the heck?

It's replaced my radio, (i'd been looking for an additional Bose unit) because the sound is go great and I can find my channels. We now have Alexa turning on lights and fans, and particularly is helpful as she anwers my 94 year old mom's questions (over and over).

How did I ever live without this? I bought two more for other areas in the house.

reviews.reviewTitle: Why did I wait so long?
reviews.reviewText: I love this. Granted, I am only listening to music but it is so convenient. My favorite part is the Alexa integration. Being able to use voice commands to mute it or lower the volume helps so much if I get a call or am talking to someone. It was pretty easy to set up and since I have Amazon music I had built in playlists. If you have a Sirius/XM subscription you can link that too and tell Alexis which channel you want to listen to.

reviews.reviewTitle: The echo dot 2nd gen works better!
reviews.reviewText: Pretty on the outside, but compared to my other Echo devices (2nd gen, spot, show 2nd gen) voice recognition very poor, and sound quality is much louder, but when at lower levels muffled. For audible books voices not as crisp at any level. Spent sometime adjusting the equalizer to make it as good as possible, but still need to unplug/reboot frequently. They say they will replace, so we will see if replacement is better or more of same.

reviews.reviewTitle: Much better sound than the 2nd gen I had before
reviews.reviewText: The 3rd gen Echo Dot that I purchased has noticeably better sound both in terms of quality and volume. I was a little disappointed that the new Echo would not fit into the holder that I had for the older one but I suspect that the Gen 3 device being a bit larger is a result of the better microphone and better speaker arrangements and it is a price I am willing to pay. Now if I could just get the other older Dots I have to stop thinking they hear their wake word in all manner of words and conversations I'd be a totally happy camper.

We got a free Alexa as a promotion for our satellite radio. I thought it was going to be stupid... but for free I would take it. Actually, I am amazed at how fast it answers my questions!! When cooking, I yell out questions and get the answer right away. "Alexa, how many carbs in a strawberry?". " Alexa, how long do I pan fray a scallop?", "Alexa, how many carbs in an olive". Alexa has certainly simplified going KETO!

I have not had a lot of time yet to use my Echo Dot, but so far it is just what I wanted to use in my kitchen to listen to
my audio book on, I have several different "apps" I can do that with, but his is just so easy doesn't use up time on my phone, and it is right there where I am, I also found out that Alexia will read any book I already have loaded on my Kindle, for free, that is a great feature, and i am sure it will do lots more and I will have fun finding out what all she can do.

reviews.reviewTitle: This item is terrible! Customer service even worse! Will NOT play Pandora!
reviews.reviewText: Amazon could not fix the issue of this 3rd gen echo dot streaming with my Pandora Account. My older models work just fine ( 2nd gen ) but NOPE ~ Amazon has offered zero solutions to get this thing to play my Pandora music and I have spent over FORTY HOURS trying to fix it!! I would give a zero if I could.

Constantly finding new ways to use Alexa! Us over 50 crowd can really appreciate how exciting tools like Echo Dot are!
I'm taking it for granted that I can ask Alexa to play any music track - and it streams down upon me! 40 years ago that would have entailed - driving over to the record store - making the purchase bringing it home - putting it on the record player and an hour or so later listening to it. Thanks, Amazon!!
PS- I do miss not having record stores.

For a small speaker it sounds pretty good. The only complaint I have has to do with how the Echo and Dot can't seem to coordinate how to handle audio as a pair. When music played in both devices the system holds onto the last song's information BEFORE the group is aked to play no matter how many songs are played through a group. You can ask for a particular song and that song will play but if you then ask Alexa what song is playing the response will always be the song title last played on a single device.

I received a Amazon Show for Christmas and loved it. I rounded out that purchase with two other echo dots that have been a marvelous edition to my home. I am able to sync all three devices and have great multi room sound. I have named them all different wake up names so I can distinguish which unit to pick up the command. Excellent alarm clock and data retriever. Excellent addition to my Bedroom and Living Room.

Upgraded my second gen dot for this Heather grey third gen.
First thing I noticed was the weight, and althought I won't be holding it, I have a young child and 2 cats so the weight is nice to keep it grounded. In addition to the weight the bottom grips nicely.

The sound quality for Alexa's voice, as well as for music is incredible on this beefed up hockey puck. The second gen dot is decent, but now that I've heard this one, I'll likely order another third gen to replace my bedrooms echo.

The set up was easy, probably because it was linked to my account on Amazon, but if you gift one of these it shouldn't be a challenge for a newbie or someone elderly.

We bought this one on a deal for 29.99 USD, and at that price point it's hard to go wrong. Ours is the one without the built in clock (Don't pay extra for a visual clock... Just ask Alexa what time it is.)

reviews.reviewTitle: Great products with great interface regardless of the device you're using
reviews.reviewText: I love that we can use the voice activation to tell Alexa to find stuff for us I love that if she really doesn't know the answer or can't determine what I'm asking she tells me that I love that she can tell me jokes or have other people tell me jokes I love that she can choose from vast variety of music I love that my son my father-in-law and ask and I'll use it to this matter what age I love that we are all user-friendly with her I love the interfacing the ability to use it with all of our devices and rtb our phones Kindles everything else just a great overall product sometimes the Time saver when I visit you as something else I can ask you to hunt down things I need to know

reviews.reviewTitle: It's an Echo Dot, what's not to love?
reviews.reviewText:
This is my first time with a device like this in my motorhome! I LOVE Alexa! I do wish I could give her any name I want! I have Siri on my iPhone, and Alexa all around my motorhome - it's often confusing!

The Amazon Echo product advertisements on TV are causing my Alexa to get kinda noisy when they're on! At least 4-5 times the ads call out to Alexa, which is kinda distracting! Not a big problem, but, changing her name to whatever I want would be AWESOME to solve this!

reviews.reviewTitle: Appears to be working ok - However, green light stays on a lot ???
reviews.reviewText: This Alexa appears to be in working order. However, the green light keeps coming on and staying on for long periods of time for no reason and then shuts off after awhile. When asked what the green light means - it states "You are on a call, or a call is coming in or drop in" however, none of these is happening when the blinking green lite comes on and stays on??? The dot continues to work just fine with the light blinking however it is really annoying to see. Anyone have any suggestions???

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa now has issues hearing me compared to the old version.
reviews.reviewText: This new version is supposed to have more mics listening to you. There are 4 holes on top of the device for the mics while the old one only had one. I have two of these devices that replaced 2 of my old ones and I end up having to repeat myself and/or have to say any request louder compared to the older model. Sure the "upgraded" loudness of the sound is welcome but that's about it. if you already have the old version, don't bother getting these.

Purchased this as part of a mother's day present. Who couldn't for merely $24? I have an Echo Show, and the setup on this little guy was easy. Simply open your Alexa App, setup and login and you're done! Capable of doing many things too. I managed to change my moms lighting to RGBs, and it really freaked her out when I made her living room turn red. Overall, great! Mom seems to like it and talks to Alexa like it's her daughter in law or something.

We have the dots in 4 rooms in our home now. I am a "mature" woman who is, as we all are, at risk. I live in the downstairs part of the house so I have dots in 2 rooms and my family has one upstairs in the kitchen and one in their bedroom. If I should fall, or am ill, I can just summon Alexa and help is on the way!
But when you're talking, just as an aside, you have to either whisper or pantomime her name because she responds so easily.

I have Alexas all over the house. I like its ability to answer questions, give weather reports, and control lighting. The lighting control is kind of iffy sometimes. I have to reset the hub to make it work properly. I don't know if the problem lies with Alexa or the smart switches. Is Alexa a spy for the Powers That Be? I don't know but as long as she can give me information about almost anything, she's welcome in my house.

My Alexa use started with a fire cube. After finding how much I used Alexa I decided that I neede a few more devices in the house. I a, very pleased with the dots. The one drowned back is that you cannot share timers across devices. Many times I will set a timer in one room and don’t want to miss it because I have moved to a different room. More importantly I don’t want a timer to go off and have to run to another room in order to turn it off. I can play music across all my echos, it doesn’t seem out of the realm of possibilities to share timers

we decided to order the echo dot for our bedroom after being so happy with our larger echo in our great room. it is a great companion to our other echo. if I need something from the front part of our home I can "drop-in" on our great room and ask my husband to bring me whatever I need, the same for him lol. it will be very reassuring should one of us be ill and then we can contact the other for our needs. we are now considering a third echo dot for our den. a great product and a real value for everyone especially seniors.

I got my son and grandsons the dot last year and was kinda disappointed in the sound of them. I received MY 3rd generation the other day and I absolutely LOVE it. Hooked it right up...I have the TAP downstairs and love it because its got an 8 hr charge and can be taken outside or other rooms, but got the DOT for upstairs bedroom and love listneing to distant thunderstorms at nitetime and getting weather and news briefings when I wake up. Just not into radios as I like to listen to what I want to and am loving these Alexa's!! : This DOT is GREAT.. very happy with sound.

reviews.reviewTitle: Dot 3 does not work with a ring doorbell 2.
reviews.reviewText: I purchased the ring doorbell 2 and choose to receive a dot 3 with it. I assumed the dot would ring when the doorbell did but it does not. I'm not certain why but one would think it would. I ended up buying a ring chime which works but by the time it actually rings chances the person at the front door has already left. One would think that Alexa products work with each other. In addition if I would have bought the ring pro I read it works with the dot 3. There are too many issues to make this a good solution.

This has to be one of my best purchases! Only $50 and it has mostly all songs on it if you pay for amazon prime. I do not pay for music plus unlimited or whatever because I have apple music but you will get mostly all songs!! Just not like new new ones like despacitooooooo! But thats ok maybe apple music and alexa will play nice sometime. Hopefully.... hopefully...... anyway- o also use this to control my Xbox One either on n off or launching games. I must say its amazing! The speakers are loud its responsive and alexa i love you

reviews.reviewTitle: I'm not sold on Alexa - but it was free... so???
reviews.reviewText: I got this with my Ring Doorbell. I wasn't excited to get it -but it came as a package set. I have been using it to listen to music on my wifi, and it's kind of nice. I don't have to get up to tell it to stop or go. And, I'm able to listen to some of my favorite Christmas tunes by my favorite artists. I'm not a fan of Alexa listening for you...

reviews.reviewTitle: AI definitely needs significant improvement. Speaker is ok
reviews.reviewText: Amazon needs to do a lot of work on Alexa, let's get that right. It often doesnt understand what I'm saying (or anyone else in the house), does the wrong thing, answers a totally different question, turns on and off by itself, and does not hold a charge if you unplug it. However, they work decent enough for timers and controlling smart bulbs if you dont mind repeating yourself several times. The speaker is also decent enough for an indoor room.

reviews.reviewTitle: Looks great compared to previous generations!
reviews.reviewText: Quite the unique little dot. It's appearance has greatly improved over previous generations. It's more eye appealing and fits the room a little better. Doesn't look as much as a hockey puck like the past generation did. Nice smooth curves wrapped in a cloth exterior. The speaker quality has improved as well - although it's still nothing to brag about. But it does have an external aux output, so that can be solved with an external speaker setup. It's a pretty cool little device. Definitely worth the buy!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great addition to my living room
reviews.reviewText:
