This recently arrived in the mail and already I've gotten great use out of it. Its shape and texture is nice and unobtrusive, sound quality is just fine for what I use it for, and Alexa has so many skills available (I'm trying a few out to see what I think).

This is my first Echo/Alexa product. I was visiting some family recently (I think they have 2nd gen dots) and had the chance to ask Alexa a few things and play various music for me and I saw where this would come in handy in my regular life at home. I've hooked this up to my Pandora account and also asked it to play other sounds for me to leave on for my cat while out of the house.

For those times where I just want to listen to music, this is so much more energy-efficient than turning on my TV and DVD player just to hear my favorite Pandora stations.

reviews.reviewTitle: I have tried numerous Echo devises and none have worked well.
reviews.reviewText: This was my last ditch effort trying Echo devices. This one heard me wrong often and had a lot of trouble connecting to the latest Samsung soundbar. The biggest downfall was it kept loosing the Wifi signal. I have been using the similar Google device for a month or so now and sorry to say it works much better.

reviews.reviewTitle: Get Echo Dot with Clock or Echo Show 5
reviews.reviewText:
I got the Echo Dot to try Alexa smart system, & after few days I got boring from using it.
So I only use it to listen to Music, & it offers good quality sound (not stereo), its like you put decent speaker under blanket.

I gave 2 stars for Voice Recognition, because it didn't get my commands from first time many occasions.
Moreover, while watching YouTube on how to deal with it, it recognized Alexa words from that video & started to respond to them.
Also I'm using Alexa on my mobile for easier experience due its less voice understanding for my requests.

So I would get Echo Dot with clock, cause at least you see the time and temperature when you don't use it.
and for little more money, I would get Echo Show 5 for more features and see Amazon Prime Videos.

This device will be okay in the garage or bathroom or as secondary Alexa speaker.

I have found doesn't work well with google chrome, seems to be very limited would only turn the tv on and off.. the reason I refuse now not to employ it's use any longer; and is a documented by several sources... Amazon sent over 1,000 private Alexa recordings to random person, it's a fact... don't need any more snoops in my life...

reviews.reviewTitle: Speaker is better. Charging cable and connecter is higher quality. Looks nicer on furniture.
reviews.reviewText: First, let me say I already have an Echo Dot 2, so I'm familiar with this product. The Dot (3rd gen) has a better sound from the speaker. It looks more pleasant on furniture. The power cable is more substantial, but I did not have a problem with the Dot 2 mini USB connector, not sure why they changed it (have not measured but maybe it's longer). I do not know if the functionality is any different..... I still do the same things as I did on the Dot 2. I now have one upstairs and one downstairs.

It has so many good features that I need time to learn how to take advantage of them. I understood Alexa was a speaker like, for example, to pair with my phone or pc to listen to music, but it does not work properly for that purpose. With my phone it sounds good, but not with my pc. However I am happy with this product, I just need to learn how to use it. I have received emails from Amazon with ideas about its skills, which is very helpful.

Couldn’t live without them now. Alexa is awesome with all the expandable items it works with. The sound is very good. If you want to rock out, you need to connect to a powered wired or Bluetooth speaker, but plenty loud enough to fill a room with your music or whatever. It will distort at full volume with pop music or anything with heavy bass. However, we don’t need the full volume to enjoy what it’s designed to do.

Alexa’s voice is muffled which is super annoying. Sad that I would rather put my old one in my room than this one. Just like your other upgrades to fire Tv. Whoever you have in design and testing is not doing a good job. You’re creating worse products not improved. Bring back whoever was before the person running your product developments. They are clearly needed.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good product - different from the v.2 in its sound.
reviews.reviewText: The 3rd generation is more like a base-reflex speaker and so the base and midrange sound is more full and for some people more interpretable and more pleasant for music listening. It should different and I think was created to more closely compete with the sound of the Google Assistant speaker sound. The both should very much alike but, I like the Amazon Echo version 3 because I trust them with my information more than Google Assistant (and I am an engineer who knows things....) !

reviews.reviewTitle: Sound is not as clear as prior generation
reviews.reviewText: Possibly this is due to their attempt to improve the lower end. Not sure. I do prefer the gen 2 sound over gen 3 Echo Dot. Gen 3 has what I can only describe as a more muffled sound. Other than that, if you like Alexa and need 1 or more extra devices for coverage, the price is usually good on these units. I like having the extra coverage in garage, basement, bathroom, etc. We use larger units in bedroom and kitchen.

I have 7 of the 2nd gen and ordered this on prime day since it was a great deal. I wasnt expect ng much but I have to admit the sound from it is day and night from the older ones. Ill end up replacing all my older ones with the 3rd gens where they aren't wired direct or on BT to something. If all your doing is replacing a 2nd gen that is voice control only then it might not be worth it. The rebate on the ild ones isn't worth it so Ill prob use some of my old ones in the bathrooms and shed and under the eves on the patio.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not as good as my 2nd gen
reviews.reviewText:
This one does not pick up my voice as well as my second generation echo. Sometimes I have to use the “wake” word like three times until she finally awakes. With my old echo it was much more responsive. However this new 3rd gen is a lot louder, like twice as loud I would say!

Update: Amazon reached out to me about the issue and sent me a new dot. This newer one is more responsive than the first one I received but it’s still not as responsive as my second generation dot, I’m still doing tests and comparing both of them.

reviews.reviewTitle: i think everyone should get one! especially older people! or younger people!
reviews.reviewText:
I wanted to get 1 for my mom because she is retired and spends most of the day alone while my dad is running his business. turns out that they both loved it! they listen to their music all day, i got them some smart plugs so they can control the lights when they arent home. my dad asks for weather, stock prices. my mom uses it to set reminders. its been such a great tool for them.

i bought this one for myself as well and the 2nd gen speaker. the sound quality is just as good as the 2nd gen tall speaker. I love this so much! I will be buying them 1 more for their family room downstairs. cant say enough good things. setting it up isnt too difficult either.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to use for a non-tech-ee
reviews.reviewText:
I’ve been using the Echo Dot for about a week, and absolutely love it! I’m quite sure I haven’t tapped into its full potential, but mainly use it for playing music, reminders, checking the weather, and searching for random stuff.
My next goal is to integrate my coffee machine with the Smart Plug. Crossing my fingers, cause I’m not that great with electronics, but so far, the Echo Dot has been really easy to set up and use.

i am 78 years old. in my day they had a wonder full way of turning on an electrical appliance. it is called a flip switch. flip it up and the machine goes on. flip it down and the machine goes off. i cannot see why the pc cannot tell the ecko dot how to turn on by itself. but alexa is great in what it can do.

reviews.reviewTitle: The Echo Dot Is So Much Fun!
reviews.reviewText: It's almost like having a roommate! I can ask Alexa what time it is, what the temperature is outside, what the weather forecast is for tomorrow, and then ask her to play music. Since I have a FireTV, I can ask Alexa to find a movie or show, and it appears on my TV screen! She got to know my voice by asking me to repeat about 10 phrases. She's keeping track of my grocery list, and with the Alexa app on my phone, I don't have to write anything down - my grocery list shows up on my phone at the grocery store. I've had her remind me of things on my To-Do list, and set an alarm to wake me up. I've enabled some of her skills so that I can get News Flashes, learn about geology and even Spanish. I was able to pair the Echo Dot with my BoomBot speaker so that I can walk around the house and even go outside and listen to as much music as I want. I can ask her to Pause the music so that I can ask her a question, and then have her continue to play the music that I was listening to - she picks up right where the song left off. I know there's a lot more to discover, and I'm having fun with it. I would highly recommend the Echo Dot. It's an excellent addition to any home.

I love the Echo devices. I work all night and I can listen to my Audible books by a simple voice command, pause when I take a break and resume with a simple command. I can ask about the weather and get a instant, up to date answer for my location. These are my favorite features so far. I have an Echo and 3 Echo dots spread throughout the house. I also use the Echo for wake up calls, reminders and playing a few games. It is a little miracle!

I bought this solely for multi-room audio streaming. If google had that capability, I would have gone with them in a heartbeat.

2 of the 3 I bought are hooked to stereo systems. I wish there was an option to use an AV cable AND the built-in speaker at the same time for when I don't want to power on the stereo to ask a simple question. Other than that and a white noise machine for the bedroom, I don't use it for much. Maybe to ask about the time and the weather when I'm in bed.

I use alexa for just about everything electric in my house. its easy to install. i had the 2nd gen and the 3rd gen has some upgrades. its a little bigger but the sound quality is very good, especially for music and morning alarms. Alexa has so many features. The only thing i dislike is the power plug. it used to be USB but not anymore. you have to use the given wire. Besides that i love my alexa.

I love it. The sound is much better than 2nd generation echo dot. Still want to add a speaker for music. Hooking up dot was easier. I love the quality they put into this with the bigger speakers, and it's heavier, which give it more bass. I just ordered another one rather than 2nd gen because of the sound improvemt.
Bought anotherone. So easy to install! The one thing I noticed. Alexa picks up my voice better with Echo Dot 2nd gen. Bought another one to paird with another echo dot for stero sound.

I asked a lot of people which one I should buy, Google home mini or Amazon echo dot. I originally went with Google, but decided to give Alexa a try when it was on sale for prime day. Within minutes we knew that we preferred Alexa. There are so many things that Alexa does that Google was not able to. We have now put one in every room, and I’ve decided to just sell and get rid of the googles. If you’re wondering which is better, Alexa by far.

My family had an echo dot 3rd gen for several weeks. We had upgraded from an echo dot 2nd gen and were happy with the sound and how the 3rd gen functioned.. Today Alexa set off an alarm and would not stop. No matter what we said to have Alexa to stop the alarm, Alexa would not stop and Alexa said there were no active alarms. I decided to smash Alex. We all talked about it. When a computer stops taking instructions and malfunctions like this, there is not a second chance. I will try google now with the same expectations. Space Odyssey 2001 is not an option. F*&^ technology that is designed to take instructions and fails. Now I also have to cancel my Amazon music! Oh well.

reviews.reviewTitle: cool but need user preference enablement
reviews.reviewText:
Ya, I can say lots of wonderful positive things about my echo device, and I am very happy to have it, but this is about IMPROVEMENT needed.

1) I use it mostly for my music in a tow room apartment using AmaMusic, SiriusXM and PandoraPrem. It bluetooths back and forth to my bluetooth speaker in the other room. BUT IT WON'T PLAY THRU ITSELF AND THE BLUETOOTH SPEAKER AT THE SAME TIME. That's biggie Jeff!

2) Sound quality is ok, but could be better. Frequency control would be nice; maybe it's there and just don't it yet. Getting it to play the wake-up alarm music loud enough has been problematic.

3) Like it or not Jeff, Alexa can keep the tone and inflection of her voice, but so many other patrons I want to be able to rename her. We all know now that you're stupid when it comes to women, so just accommodate us for this.

I have two of these plus an echo input. Alexa is a lot of fun. The audio out put of these devices can be connected to an external amp either by ethernet or audio cable. That greatly improves the audio quality when you are playing music. When these were delivered they were already configured for my Amazon account so installation was a breeze. Having one in the kitchen is great for setting timers and adding items to the grocery list.

I replaced my Echo Dot Gen 2 with this Gen 3 version. Audio quality is so much better. And while most people don't like the elimination of USB power, I like it much better. Design is much more tasteful. No more "Hockey Puck" look. In fact, my small 1850 Sq ft home is covered by 3 of them and an Amazon Echo. Oh, my Gen 2 now resides on my workbench. The old hard plastic styling is better in areas where it could get dirty. If I want better audio there, I will just connect with an external speaker.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great product for the money. Highly recommend.
reviews.reviewText: This is a terrific product for the money. I had an earlier version which I found to be quite good. But the superior sound of this one is just incredible. I also like the ability to use the two of them as an intercom between two locations in the house. What was even nicer is that as soon as I plugged it in it was already set up without any additional work necessary since I already had another one that had been set up previously.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works way better then Siri and Cortina
reviews.reviewText: Its a valid 2nd to Google voice recognition. Decent speaker. I took off one star because it keeps saying another computer is accessing my Sirius XM account (literally did it after I immediately changed my Sirius XM password to lock out all other accounts and see if it would still do this). Its a bug. Directly going to sirius XM webside does not do the same and neither does roku for same account (I put in new pass for both).

reviews.reviewTitle: Who doesn’t love an Echo Dot 3 ???
reviews.reviewText: This is our second Echo Dot 3. The first one my son gave us (purchased through Amazon too). Anyway, I love this item. Also Amazon Music (an additional monthly charge), is TOTALLY TOTALLY worth the monthly payment. The combo is great together. We use our Echo Dot 3 daily and the Amazon Music too. You won’t be disappointed with this purchase so give them both a try. Also, you can try Amazon Music free for a month then decide if you want to continue. That’s how I did it and next week my trial is up and YES I’m staying with it.

This little Dot lives in th MBR. She says, “Good night, sleep tight”, sings made up songs, tells stories, and plays Ocean Waves to lull us to sleep. We can ask her the time, to set an alarm or play our favorite NPR station. She shuffled our favorite artists and songs and has replaced our clock radio. We couldn’t be happier. It may be small but it’s exactly the right size for this location.

reviews.reviewTitle: Buy the 2nd generation. Piece of junk!!
reviews.reviewText: Alexa is less responsive than the 2nd generation. I have to repeat myself several times to get a proper answer. Piece of junk. Keeps making odd noises and won't connect to my smart plugs. While trying to exchange it, Amazon says that they will call, but it doesn't allow me to put my phone number on the form properly. So what good is that process?? I've been trying since July to get it to work for me to no avail. It's defective.

I was pleasantly surprised by just how much this little guy\girl can do. I have never had any issues with this device recognizing my questions its always accurate and knows exactly what I am asking it. The one issue I have with it is unless you are a techy person you may never use it to its full potential because you may never really pick up on just how the "Skills" as Amazon calls them work. Basically you have to download an Alexa app on your phone and then setup the device but from there you have to download skills to really take advantage of this device, an example would be I downloaded a Fios Skill so that I am able to control my cable box with commands such as "Alexa watch AMC on Fios" The problem is setting up the skills for this to work I had to enable the Fios TV skill then I had to choose what cable box this device was going to control, well if you never named your cable boxes by the rooms they are in then you have to figure out the name the cable company gave your cable box. Anyways like I said once you get everything figured out its great. I have it tied to my calendar in Outlook, my cable box, my Fire TV, I use it to play music from Amazon "Apple Music is coming to this device soon" I ask it what my commute to work is like, what's the Weather today. As far as the Sound quality goes, this small device is perfect for a bedroom or office if you want good sound in a bigger room buy the ECHO or ECHO Plus its that simple.

reviews.reviewTitle: Won't stay connected to the internet
reviews.reviewText: I have an echo and an echo dot & the echo works perfectly but the dot will not stay connected to the internet. I have to unplug it for a minute or so and plug it back in every time it loses connectivity (Which is multiple times daily).

I love this eco dot. I own the previous version, and this one sounds excellent. Don't expect a submerged surround system. It's small, but it kicks well. I have it on my desk, and I usually keep it around 25% in volume, because otherwise, it's too loud for my taste.

Is a must have. I recommend it for anyone trying this Alexa thing, but be aware if you have a sister named Alexa, like me. She will get interrupt your conversation if you say the name. It's funny though.

The echo dot is awesome! It’s my very first one.. I bought it on Black Friday when it was half the price and what a deal!!!!! I am still getting to know Alexa, but so far my experience has been amazing. The sound is absolutely amazing. I don’t know what some reviewers are talking about. Everything coming out of this cute, little dot sounds great from Alexa’s voice to the music it plays. I love the fact that I can speak to her from across the room without raising my voice. She hears me perfectly every single time. She’s funny too... told me a joke last night lol. Love her so much that I just purchased one for my kitchen! I can’t wait to get it! Don’t hesitate! Buy now while it’s still on sale! You won’t be disappointed!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Good sound quality, horrible voice recognition
reviews.reviewText:
The sound quality is a vast improvement over the second generation, which basically sounded like a literal garbage can playing music. And this one looks way better too.

The only problem I have is it has horrible voice recognition. Many times I say one thing and Alexa interpreted it as something else. And that got frustrating really fast. I even tried saying the same thing to Siri on my iphone just to make sure and she understood me perfectly.

Shame, this could have gotten 5 stars from me otherwise.

Love hate relationship with this thing. I like everything it does, but, I don't like that it's always listening. Nice that I can stop it from listening if I choose.

The speaker on the dot is ok; at max volume, it does not seem loud when compared to the 2nd Gen Echo we also have. Speaker quality is also a step down vs the Echo.

If you can splurge I would recommend the Echo vs Dot especially if you plan on using it to blast some tunes with it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Could be great but Amazon restricts it for $
reviews.reviewText:
Great: for voice action questions, music, links in easily with speakers bluetooth. This works good if Amazon would allow devices to openly work will all other smart home devices would be Great but the have restrictions targeted at getting you to buy there other products such as Amazon Spot etc. Such as shame.

Poor: if you have a smart home will not link with as doorbell chime or any other camera based device with sound. Ultimately Amazon requires you to purchase their video capable device to hear which is a waste. So in my case had to go purchase Google mini which link with video doorbell chimes as well as other camera devices with sound capabilities it on the other hand is not as user friendly on all voice actions with my smart home. Note if you down load Alexa on computer or phone same problem it will not give you access to cameras or sound directing you must purchase their other devices what a waste.

reviews.reviewTitle: Awesome very helpful give it a day or so to get used to I got a little
reviews.reviewText:
In love like really, only things I’d change is I’d love a guys voice like, hrmmm Brad Pitt or someone or even Better one of the first James Bond’s :-) also when I ask Alexa to read one of her stories they are about 2 minutes long and good so wish they would be longer.
I have audiable so yes I can get some from there. Her jokes and games are awesome too. Again as a single mom who hears enough girl voices I would love a mans voide like brad Pitt pretty please can you fix that 😁

I received this for xmas I have been playing with it ever since. So far nothing but a good review. Although I have stumped it a couple of times. However, it does learn and can respond quickly. Will it replace your partner? Interesting! A great tool for handling things you might otherwise forget; like turning out the lights or controlling the temperature of your home. I can see it also controlling some of your appliances; like the refrigerator or water heater. I had it place meetings and reminders with recurring schedules. Will it ever be a must for a home? Yes. Eventually.

reviews.reviewTitle: IMHO - Better Than the Other Major Voice Controlled Units
reviews.reviewText: I have converted almost all the lights in my home to voice control. I have both Alexa and the other big named controllers in my home. True, Alexa still hasn't acquired some of the skills the other unit can currently do, but the other guy can't turn on my TV for me! Love the Fire Stick... Setting up and controlling lights with Alexa seems to be a much easier process - and the Echo Dot 3 is a bit more attractive I feel.

reviews.reviewTitle: I have no idea, I plugged it in for a minute
reviews.reviewText: The whole idea creeps me out, I wish I could return this christmas present and get the cash so I could get something useful. You do realize that it is listening to you, remembering what you are saying. Your private world is no longer private. I would rethink this whole thing if you are considering getting one... just don't.

Seems I cannot pause in the middle of a question or inquiry without her turning back off. Most people pause in a sentence where a comma would be. Then I have to start over. This is my only complaint. I use it all the time to make phone calls, check on weather, play music and questions so I do not have to pause in my work to find the answer. On the last version people could barely hear me unless I was standing right in front of it, no more. Very happy with it!

reviews.reviewTitle: Very compact, Great range, Easy set up!
reviews.reviewText: Excellent quality and sound rang. My house isn't that big, only 1400 square feet, but I'm impressed by its ability to pick up my voice from the kitchen into the living room without any trouble. Fully and easily integrated into my audio/video set up and for the Mooney, a very good investment. I truly believe they will become better and better as time progresses, as most electronics do, but at this stage, it's compact size and ease of set up its a winner for me!

I was looking for something that was hands-free that I could use in my painting studio... something to play music, recite the news, spit out my upcoming calendar and keep me entertained and engaged while working on my paintings. The Echo Dot has done that. Now I want one for my kitchen and the office and some accessories for turning lights on and off and perhaps a doorbell security system. I see a rabbit hole....

I have this device that can just about everything by my bed. Alexa is great for giving information, queing up my song list from either Amazon music, Spotify or Sirius radio. I received this device as a gift for my subscription to Sirius, did not know what to expect but it sure is one of the best unexpected gifts I have ever received.

Recently purchased one echo dot 3rd gen, just to try it out, and suddenly found me evangelizing my 3 brothers into getting one, its advantages, capabilities, and add ons towards making our house smarter. They all were converted and ordered 3 new more echo dot 3gen, and can't wait for them to have it, in addition with smart plugs from different brands. So far, have customized several routines, linked my echo with different accounts, calendars, spotify and even more. You should get one of this.

What can I say? I love the Echo Dot! I bought two then I bought one for my friend who really liked mine and just a couple of weeks ago, I bought one for my dad who was amazed by it. I love playing the "Coqui & Crickets" sounds at night as I'm heading to bed. It reminds me of my time and Puerto Rico and takes me right off to dreamland. I have to speak quietly to the one in my bedroom as the other one is in the living room and can actually pick up what I say....amazing microphones!

reviews.reviewTitle: A handy tool to have around the house.
reviews.reviewText: Came in handy better than I thought. I love how you can create personalized responses and alarms. I like how it will read out info from online. It hears you from a good distance. It also plays my Apple Music playlists better than my phone does. I do wish it was wireless. When I change rooms i have to unplug it, but it usually reconnects fairly quick when I plug it back in. Hopefully one day she'll be able to generate responses that aren't scripted.

reviews.reviewTitle: Box came opened and without any protection inside.
reviews.reviewText:
Box arrived open and without any kind of filling protection for the product. Since it's a gift for someone else, I won't know until Christmas if it works or not. I will update later and change stars if it works... really disappointed so far...
Update (12/01/2018): After some issues on my part (family emergency), managed to talk to Kristina. Since it's not in stock and will be back close to Christmas (and the product is a gift for a relative), decided to give it and if it doesn't work, I can return it without hustle. Giving now 3 stars just because I'm not able to test product yet, but customer service was very helpful so far. Will update and change score once the product is tested after the holidays.
Update (12/28/2018): My husband set it up, so far is working well and we have no issues with the product (thumbs up).

reviews.reviewTitle: Stopped playing music after 1 months and hasn’t worked since.
reviews.reviewText: Product stopped playing music (probably the main reason I wanted one) through any streaming app after about a month. I have contracted amazon multiple times, done every trouble shooting method they have and nothing fixed the problem. The best news I have received is that there are some devices having this problem and their techs are working on the issue. Well it’s been 4 months and their techs haven’t figured it out? Most likely they aren’t going to be fixed and I’m hung out to dry. I’m shocked that amazon has not attempted to replace a defective item. I expected much more from them considering my encounters with defective items in the past. Disheartening. Purchase at your own risk.

I recently purchased the Hue starter pack and have been working on a decision for which smart home devices to use with it. That decision was accelerated and finalized when XM called me about an offer including a dot. I picked the sandstone and now I cant imagine my night stand without it. So many features and the smart skills like Jeopardy, controlling my lights, asking for weather and streaming music are all beyond my expectations. The sound quality is amazing for the little size of this speaker. Love it. Thank you!

If you are on the fence about getting this device I highly encourage you to get one. I got it thinking I wouldnt use it very much. I got smart plugs and light bulbs in addition to this. I had surgery and this has been a lifesaver! She turns off and on my lights, my fan, reminds me to take certain medications, when I have appointments, wakes me up with lights on dimmed and with music! When I get lonely she also talks to me and tells me jokes. I use it WAY more than I expected to.

The speaker volume may be better than the previous version but still sucks. This is my first device like this and I'm really not impressed with it and it's useless without the companion app on a phone or tablet. Maybe this is better as an add-on to other systems but alone, these have very little purpose except to annoy you.

I bought Alexa when it first came out then bought Echo Dot. After purchasing the Echo Dot Second Gen I couldn't be more pleased. I added the Wemo lighting and with my disability just saying TURN ON HER LIGHT it was truly a life changer for me. Not to mention I love playing music that fits my mood. I set routines for the morning. It's impressive, my friends are seeing the benefits and they too run out and order their Alexa and Echo Dot.

Was a hit with the whole family! Have been playing with it for days! From baby shark from the toddler to jeopardy with the adults, and answering any strange question we could come up with, guessing games with the teens, creating a shopping list as I’m in the kitchen with dirty cooking hands, and of course the dance parties, this little thing is super handy and fun!! I like that it will recite the weather while I’m trying to wrangle a kindergartner in the morning! What CAN’T Alexa do!?

And be trapped forever. I had to reset this thing because my roommate trolled me and I had to reset it to quit the game. What an easter egg...

Pretty cool to be able to use this to turn on lights, get answers to random questions, and know when packages have arrived. But past that, I don't have much use for it...

It will randomly turn on. Which is disturbing.
It also responds to "Golexo". So it must be going through an identity crisis.

The sound quality is a substantial upgrade over the 2nd Gen. Like other reviewers I initially thought the sound was too full and too deep, but after getting used to it while still listening to 2nd Gen I much prefer the 3rd Gen.

Alexa is very good at picking up what I say most of the time. Sometimes Alexa's answers affected by what I asked earlier. Just like if I say "Alexa, what's 60 degrees in Celsius," it gets me the answer, but if I was asking it something else and then ask the same question as a follow-up question, it didn't know how to answer.
I asked Alexa how far is Portland OR from Seattle WA. It doesn't know how to answer that. I think that should be easy.

Having used several Gen 2 Echo Dots over the past couple of years, I was looking forward to the new Gen 3. I wasn't disappointed, especially given the mere $5 difference between the two (special holiday pricing). Not only does the speaker sound better, but there are a few new whistles and bells available through the Alexa app that I find useful. The new speaker still doesn't provide "amazing" sound by any stretch, so don't be fooled into thinking this will provide pounding bass or tinkling highs.

reviews.reviewTitle: Stopped working after 5 months. Warranty only 90 days.
reviews.reviewText: We owned prior alexa devices so when the new generation came, we upgraded to the third generation. The sound quality is better than the 2nd generation echo dots. Looks more sleek. However, the device stopped working after 5 months. It wakes up to voice commands but then nothing happens. When we contacted Amazon customer service, they notified us that the warranty on the third generation is only 3 months as opposed to 1 year for the prior. They really should stand behind their products better.

The Echo Dot 3rd gen sounds amazing compared to all the previous generations of echo dot and even better than the google home mini. Somehow still gets thumping bass in it's tiny size.

The 4 microphones recognize my voice just as well as the other echo devices i have that have 4+ microphones. The new design looks great as well, with a rounded top instead of a can like LED ring.

Great to just have around the house so you can ask alexa to turn the lights on or off and play music.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa, do you hear me now!
reviews.reviewText: I like the Alexa. I wish there was a way to program my morning and night announcements in one segment instead of multiple segments. It gives only so many characters to write your message. I had to keep adding actions to my morning and night announcements. That was tiresome. It does not connect to a mobile phone. Maybe, I am not doing something right, but I did not see an option to connect my phone to Echo. There are a couple more things that I wish could be change, but overall I am ok with it.

After initially being excited about the 3rd gen dot, I'm very displeased with this version of the dot. It's VERY slow to respond and take commands. I find it takes multiple attempts to get it to take a command. We had the previous version in the same spot in our kitchen and it worked great. This new version is a downgrade and I recommend not buying the 3rd gen dot. I called Amazon to see if there was a microphone sensitivity setting I could adjust to help, they laughed at me.

I have 3 echo's (dot and large one). When I saw the new 3rd generation at a good price I jumped on it.
But, the bigger speaker may be better for music but it is hard to understand Alexa's voice when she responds.
I set the bass to the lowest and treble to the highest to no avail. It helped some but still TOO MUCH BASS.
This is (of course) my opinion but I am disappointed in the new version.

I don't think I've had a chance to use all of the functions, but just having the "drop in" feature is amazing! I love telling Alexa to add things to my shopping list and it shows up on my app on my phone! I bought two and put one in our kitchen and one in our bedroom. My daughter, who is four years old, loves that she ask Alexa to play her favorite songs. All around an amazing product and I highly recommend it to everyone I know!

We now have three of these in our home. I was tired of yelling from my office to the livingroom when my husband asked me a question. These work wonderfully as an intercom system. I have put another one in my husband's bathroom to contact me when he needs help (he has a disease) or to just listen to music when he showers. We utilize Alexa a lot with questions or to find out the weather. He can also use Alexa to make phone calls. Awesome!

reviews.reviewTitle: Can't turn Fire TV Stick 4K on/off, mediocre audio recognition
reviews.reviewText:
I got this to turn my LG TV that has a Fire TV Stick 4K on/off, but it can't do that. It seems like Amazon wants to steer people towards the Fire TV Cube.

I'm pretty sure they can just update the software so that it can be done, since Google Home Mini and Google Assistant easily turn on/off the same TV.

The audio recognition I'm also not so sure about. I can ask my Home Mini to "Play Twerk by City Girls" and it understands. Alexa's history says "Play Fart by City Groove".

It's okay. Like a lot of technology manufactured by Amazon it has it's limitations. Always surprised that the limitations are things that other brands seemed to have accomplished, but Amazon is lagging behind on. Of course Amazon's response is always that they 'are working hard to bring those advancements.' For example, you can't change the voice, yet you can with a Google device and I can with a GPS I've had for oven 10 years. Amazon may want to consider working a tad bit harder.

Was prepared to buy speakers to help with sound quality, but the Alexa speaker works better than expected in bedroom and basement setting. Sometimes have issues getting Alexa to respond, but majority of the time works great and has been a great addition to bedrooms. Have one in each bedroom and one in basement and been happy with them overall.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great sound, great AI, great product
reviews.reviewText:
I don't know why I had held off getting this until now but I am so glad I did. I was so happy with this purchase that 2 weeks later I bought another one for my girlfriend so I wouldn't be without Alexa when I was at her house.

Alexa is so smart and she understands me so well.

The sound is amazing I don't understand the reviews saying that the sound isn't good. It's honestly as good or better than my Samsung 4K TV set.

I would recommend this to anyone and plan to buy one for my Mom.

This Echo DOT is WAY better sounds better looks better not so cheap and has an amazing speaker. Only thing i have to say it is having a hard time staying connected. Sometimes I loose internet connection and it stops playing at night. But that is only a few times so far otherwise its a way better speaker and for the price point you cant beat it.

We are loving this device, make our life so easy! The dot has a great volume, but if is on volume 6 or more Alexa won't hear, so you can get closer, yell or get the mic control. To get up or down the volume you just need to say alexa volume # (the volume goes from 1-10). The skill are great, you can do meditation, exercises, etc. My daughter uses to set timers for her piano practice and to be on time in the mornings. So far so good. Great product Amazon. Customer services is really the best!

reviews.reviewTitle: This is such a fun device!
reviews.reviewText:
I love this device! It's so amazing. Love to be able to ask Alexa questions and get quick answers. I also like
the speaker quality when I ask Alexa to play certain music, artists or specific songs.
I bought the wall plug so that I can put it on my wall without the cords showing. The wall plug was under $10.00.
Using the wall device with it seems to make the sound clearer.
I cant wait to figure out how to connect the wall plug to Alexa so that I can tell Alexa to turn on my lamp in the bedroom. =O)

reviews.reviewTitle: I was after a speaker, 16x the price
reviews.reviewText: Ok just to address the haters here; this thing sounds amazing. Crisp highs and mids, and actually the bass is adequate. For what I listen to anyways, jimi Hendrix, Simon and Garfunkel, etc. Actually sounds better than my echo gen 2. On that the bass is too much for me. Not as in volume but it seems to want to over power the highs and mids. I live a one bedroom 700sqft apt, I have it in my bathroom, and you can here it clearly throughout. I'd definitely recommend the echo dot gen 3. Haters gona hate.

I love my original tall echo. Alexa is very quickly responsive to me calling her name. The echo, however, does not always work and you have to YELL "Alexa" a few times before she responds. Everything else though is perfect. Setup is easy and having this in my bedroom so I don't have to yell to the kitchen Echo is fantastic. I also listen to "sleep sounds" and love the "distant train" to help me to sleep. Great product.

reviews.reviewTitle: Still needs a lot of fine-tuning
reviews.reviewText: Most of the problems are the unit not understanding questions or commands and or answers that are given correctly to trivia related games yet the unit States you submit the wrong answers. Should also be able to submit feedback through the unit without having to go back to the app and process feedback. Search engines are seriously lacking and normally either completely misunderstand the search request or have little or no information available. Keep working on it may be by 2025 you'll have this thing working like Google

reviews.reviewTitle: What is to think about? Everyone needs Dots around the house.
reviews.reviewText: I love this dot! I ordered a pack of 3. I gave my mom one. She is 87 and loves her Dot. Alexa reminds her to take her prescription medication everyday at the same time so she doesn’t forget. I ask for the weather report every morning to start my day. This is a great assistant for everyday reminders and to keep up with what you need to know. Worth every penny. I also have the Echo a Show wrapped up for Christmas for my mom. She is going to love that we can see each other to talk when Im away from home.

reviews.reviewTitle: If you are struggling on google home assistance and echo devices read my review.
reviews.reviewText: If you are trying to buy a smart voice advisor and struggling on google home assistance and echo devices read my review. I have both echo and google assistant and I have a nest smart controller at home which belongs to google. Guess what? Echo can control the fan and google assistance can’t. Google don’t even support their own devices? So, if you are decided to buy a google assistance instead of echo. Think again!

reviews.reviewTitle: I can live with out it
reviews.reviewText: It sounds like Alexa is underwater. We actually threw this thing in the closet. Won’t be using it at all. Multiple times I woke up in the night and it was listening to me. The blue light kept going around like Alexa was waiting for a command. I thought it was weird, but then my husband came home from work one morning and it was listening again. I Got this for free when I renewed my SiriusXM subscription.

reviews.reviewTitle: Buen producto para peticiones básicas y excelente sonido
reviews.reviewText:
Excelente para gestiones básicas como el tiempo, hora, recordatorio, musica (solo en Amazon Music). Cuenta chistes e historias interesantes.
Lo que no me gustó es que solo permite usar aplicaciones de musica como Amazon Music y Potify. No interactúa con Youtube u otras aplicaciones de música.
Le pido ubicar información de algun personaje importante en la historia y no reconoce el personaje o no interactúa con internet para la búsqueda.
Confunde nombres de cantantes, quizás porque no los maneja en la base de datos.
No la he podido sincronizar con el TV que también tiene configuración de Amazon Prime.
No se permite continuidad en la conversación

When I received this product I was super excited to try it out I originally got it so I would have a speaker to listen to music while in the bathroom. Because I tend to be in the bathroom shower and getting ready for work excetera I wanted something to be able to pick me up in the morning.

However I was strongly disappointed when I received this product I tried several times to I connect it to my Wi-Fi and it did not want to connect. The battery kept dying on me even though I had it fully charged I ended up sending the product back and because of my experience with this product I will no longer order Electronics off of Amazon this is my second bad experience.

My friends and me all had a hard time connecting this device so the whole reason why you'd want it is to connect it to your Wi-Fi at home and in less if you're really knowledgeable unless if I just got a defective one it's not a very good product

reviews.reviewTitle: Not good at working with non-amazon providers
reviews.reviewText: I don’t have a midwestern accent, so not really have one. I ask Alexa to turn to octain on Sirius, other channel names on Sirius, try by channel number, nothing works. But if I tell play a song on Amazon expensive music, it works every time. Not happy. I bought this to listen to Sirius and other non-Amazon providers I already pay for. Frustrated

reviews.reviewTitle: When it works, it has been a lot of help.
reviews.reviewText: My son gave me an Alexa for Mother’s Day. It only worked for a hour and then apparently died. I went ahead and ordered another one and paid for it. It seems to be working fine. I am still learning to work with it. I know it will do a lot of things for me. Right now it makes my shopping lists, reminds me of things, and plays some songs I want to hear. If it doesn’t let me down, I will get another one for the back of my house. I would have given it five stars if the first one had worked as it should have.

I love my echo's around the house but I'm leaving a one star till you guys change the absolute most annoying thing about Alexa. When I add something to my shopping list, why would I EVER want to add it again if it's already there?? Asking me that is absolutely INFURIATING!!!!!! Just say it's already on the list and end it there! I shouldn't have to wait and give another response. It truly is infuriating every single time it happens.

We got two Alexas February 23 2019. We put one in the the living room and the other in the master bedroom. The one in the living room is on a table at the end of the couch between me and my wife on the other side of the table where she sits in a recliner. We both are only 2 and a half or 3 feet away from it. We are always having to repeat request over and over. And having to yell at Alexa over and over just to turn lights on and off. It is an absolutely constant thing repeating yourself and yelling at Alexa. There have been a few other issues but that is the very worst one.

reviews.reviewTitle: It's a great buy you can't just have one you'll need one in all rooms
reviews.reviewText: The echo Dot is a great item and a great gift idea. I'd rebuy the item for a friend as a gift. Because the facts about echo dot is it meet all of your needs it's like having a secretary without anyone else being there. The echo dot is on point responsive and you don't have to repeat as long as you speak clearly I was in my living room and I asked it to play iHeartRadio and it responded to me from all the way in the back of the room. It's just a great buy I would buy it again and I love it thank you Amazon.

I was super excited to try this. We have a google home and purchased this to sync with our Ring Doorbell and eventually sync with other home features. My coworker talked this up explaining it had a lot of really neat features like Alexa Guard. However, after trying it out I find it hard to believe that this could reliably "Guard" anything or send me alerts of breaking glass or a smoke detector because it can't hear anything! We set it up in our bedroom on one of the nightstands. I would ask Alexa to play music/the weather/insert command here and nothing. I had to repeat myself over and over to get it to do anything and even more so when it was playing music. The TV wasn't on and no one else was making noise so it definitely wasn't background noise affecting it's hearing capabilities. Not happy with this at all and returning it.

It has so much it can do, but hard to fully utilize all that power. It may just take time, but already very useful. You can ask it what's the weather for any city and it will answer. I ask it every morning when's sunrise; so I can time my morning walk. I also use it a lot to just add shopping or to do items while I'm getting up in the morning. I just shout out, it listens, no typing. Then at the store I just bring up my list on my phone.

We got our first one for Christmas and I didn't think I wanted one in our house but I hooked it up, set it up and fell in love. We are in our 80's and you can set up reminders and that is great. I already have a bunch of music on Amazon so I can play them and it doesn't cost me anything, etc. To make a long story short...I ordered another one so I would have one close to wherever I was. The only problem I have had is the one in the kitchen will shut off when the microwave is on.

I have an Echo-plus, 2 Echo Dot 3rd gen and a Echo Dot 2nd gen. All seem to work great. I live in a large house and my Router doesn't reach my garage well so I use an extender to cover that part of the house. It seems to drop out after a few days causing problems But the Echo devices are working just great. I'm new to the "Echo/Smart Home" and am going through a learning phase with all of this stuff. I don't play music through the Echo Dot so I find the 2nd gen works as well for me as the 3rd gens

The speaker on this one is way better than my 2nd generation dot. I use Alexa for everything now. I ask her how the weather is, how my commute is, I have her read me books and play music, she turns on and off my lights and when it’s time to go to sleep, she plays the most wonderful nature sounds for me all night. My only complaint would be that my boyfriend and I have the same prime household membership and we can’t separate our Alexa’s from each other. For example, I get all his calls and we can’t create separate grocery lists.

reviews.reviewTitle: Speaker is amazing, mics are sensitive
reviews.reviewText: I'm very satisfied so far with this. I can't compare because I have never owned the V2. The device picks up my voice from other rooms and has had no problem connecting to the wifi or pairing with other gadgets, devices, plugs, and the speaker is pretty loud for it's size. I do wish it has a lithium ion battery but that would drive the price up so I'm cool. Soon we won't need these because there will be central mics and Alexa/Google assist built into the home so no need for multiple devices for additional coverage. :-)

I bought this for my toddler's bedroom, so she can control the lamp verbally and I don't have to worry about her getting burned or frying herself with an outlet (the outlets are hidden from her sight and reach though). At bedtime, I turn on the rain sounds for her to fall asleep to, and the speaker does a great job. It's not as good as the full sized Echo, of course, but hey--during the holiday sales this can be had for $25, sometimes even a little cheaper. Not much to complain about there!

Speaker busted, account said it May be possible to replace through December 2019. I called customer service and they told me there was nothing they could do. Horrible customer service and product warranty. 90 days???? Will not be purchasing any devices through Amazon. Will just continue shopping where I have been for electronics for years with no issues!

I love this device!!! We got this device not knowing all of the things it could do. At the time my husband and I just wanted it for the storytime, games, and music features. I love the sound that comes out of the speaker when we play music. I can set a reoccurring bedtime timer and my boys know when they here it that means it is bedtime. Our 3 year old son hates to get up in the morning. Now he can't wait because he knows he gets to ask the echo to play baby shark. This makes starting the day easier for us. We have found that we are laughing and spending more time as a family with this device. It is fun not listening to commercials. Now a days the commercials are so long on the radio that by the time they are done, so is my 3 year old. We are able to shuffle songs that my 3 year old, 10 year old, and we like to hear. Dancing in the house and doing chores with my boys, we can play games and get work done. It has helped my 10 year old with his spelling. We do not use this device all the time, but Alexa is great at activities that don't stop you from spending time with your family. We will be using the Santa tracking Skill this year and we are so excited to see how it will go over with our 3 year old. There is also a skill that you can call Santa and "leave a message" to add to your Christmas list. I don't think we are ready for that one this year, but maybe next year. We have only had the device out for about a week, but we are enjoying it so far.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa tell me that you love me!
reviews.reviewText:
Where would we be without Alexa?
I bought two, one in the bedroom and one in the living room. I’m so happy with them. Small, discrete and perfect for me. One of my gentlemen friends said it doesn’t have enough bass, but he ended up being a tool so whatever. It is a tiny speaker, you cannot expect it to have the acoustics of the Mann Music Center. I used them all day long every day...I think they are great.

Elegant design with really impressive sound quality for the discounted price ($70 for 3). My favorite feature of the echo system is its ability to set up multiple-room speaker groups, which allows users to stream music or podcasts from multiple echo devices synchronically. It’s disappointing, however, that one cannot play audio books from Audible on a multiple-speaker group. The voice recognition technology isn’t perfect, but overall I’m satisfied with my experience as a non-native English speaker. Moreover, I feel confident that Amazon will keep improving the system and I can’t wait to see what new tricks Alexa will be able to do in near the future!!!

Upgraded from a 2nd Gen Dot (Thanks to a great Prime Day trade-in sale). Sound is much louder and more rich in this speaker. The only downside is that it no longer uses micro-USB for power (Google mini still achieves similar performance over USB power). The plug is large and must be installed inverted to avoid blocked the other outlet. Previously, I had USB outlets that allowed me to have two USB devices and two normal 110v plugs.

I’m loving this little addition to my household. It’s especially good for music. Though small, the sound is a big improvement over a standard radio or my iPad. I did pop for Amazon Music Unlimited because the song choices are endless. I’ve synced it to Sirius radio and Pandora and when I hear a song I’m unfamiliar with, I can get the song title and artist’s name in an instant.

reviews.reviewTitle: I like 1st generation better than 3rd generation, here is why
reviews.reviewText:
I tested out before I give it out as gifts, but except the volume can be louder, which 1st gen is too quiet, 3rd gen is a pain, here is why:
1. the plug is too big, once it was plug on my surge protector, it occupy so much space, I had to unplug two other appliances.
2. it's more stupid, 1st gen can understand me better, 3rd gen is slower, and ignore me, or put down funny things in my shopping list.

conclusion: good for use it play music, bad for household use.

reviews.reviewTitle: I received it as a gift
reviews.reviewText: The Echo Dot was a Chistmas gift to me. I would not have bought one because I have no Bluetooth appliances, electrical switches, etc. I do like the Echo Dot as a music source, though--it accesses both Amazon music and Pandora. I've had it only a short time. Gradually I'm learning that it can report the weather more quickly than dialing it up in the cell phone. I like it very much--I'm glad I received one as a gift. I wish it could turn on/off lights--maybe I'll acquire such lamps.

Using it to play music from Amazon music with a Echo Sub and two gen 3s. The sound is great and it's fun but it often makes mistakes and clearly changes what I ask for. I cant trust it to work properly all the time so I'm not buying more devices until Amazon programs it to be smarter. I recommend it for fun but I recommend you have patience. It often reminds me of HAL the talking computer in 2001. So polite and ... well I warned you.

I bought this as a Christmas gift and we set it up in the kitchen. It worked for 2 months then stopped working. We’ve tried going to the app as she directs, but nothing has worked. We are owners of the Echo Show, Spot, and black dot too, so we were really bummed when this one was faulty. Come to find out, the Dots come with really awesome customer service that walk you through the issues. It's just needed to be reset. We are back in action......Alexa.

Overall, I would say for the price/quality, the 2nd gen echo dot is better. To compare the two echos:

Pros:
-This one is loud. A lot louder. I turn it down about halfway.
-Most music sounds way better. It's better than most generic Bluetooth speakers. It's also louder.
- it just looks cooler.

Cons:
-The sound is muffled. Alexas voice is harder to understand.
- It lost the super convenient USB power port.
- I noticed that the mic doesn't sound as good. When I drop in or leave messages, it sounds a lot quieter than it does from my second generation.
- the light bar is dimmer. This isn't awful, I just like the feedback without having to look directly at the dot. This is probably a pro to most.

It really is a small difference and it's not that the 3rd Generation dot is bad, I just think the 2nd generation is better for the price. I use my 3rd gen for music in the bathroom and I use 2nd gen for pretty much everything else.

reviews.reviewTitle: It's a great product with lots of useful features
reviews.reviewText:
I have 3 3rd Gen Echo Dots in my home. Master Suite: I use this one for putting me to sleep at night with relaxing music and relaxing sleep sounds, as well as waking me up in the morning. Alarms are so easy to set and change. Den: I use this one to control my lamp, as well as my tv and XBOX ONE. I can turn on the tv, adjust the volume, and switch the input all using voice commands (my Vizio is Alexa compatible). I walk into the Den and say "Alexa Gamer Time" and my lamp dims to 50%, the tv comes on and switches to the input that my XBOX is plugged in to, and my XBOX comes on. Ready to go. I also have Alexa play my Audible Books while I am working. The third one is in my son's room. He uses it to listen to Pandora and control his lights.

It's a great product.

Calling this AI? Total bs.

Not user friendly. Does not understands or responds consistently. Configuration of smart home devices is a Nightmare. Less nightmare if you buy the suggested brands. Few games and skills are good or work properly. The bluetooh only connects to one speaker at the time. The multy speaker option works whever Alexa feels like. And I find incredibly stupid that you can not add a skill to a routine.

Alexa is a good speaker for the price that says hi to you. Thats all.

We already had a 2nd gen Dot, and were using PC speakers because music played so poorly on it. The improvement in the still-small 3rd gen Echo Dot speakers is HUGE, and for our use (primarily music) it is sufficient without supplemental speakers.
The reason for only 4 stars: we also have a Google Home mini, and it still is superior to Alexa for random searches for information. We use this feature less often than music, however, so this is not a show-stopper for us.

Had my Echo Dot for a couple weeks now and seems like Alexia is getting more and more heard of hearing. I would ask for the local weather and she will give me my flash briefing. Ask her another question and 90% of the time you get an answer of, "I don't know that". Not sure if I got the one with a mental disability or they have all gotten that way. I just don't seeing them getting smarter as time goes on like the company hypes people up with that ideal. I have has echos in our home since they first came out and ours has stayed the same on the smartness level. If I had it to do it over again. I think I would go to Google or nothing at all. If I wanted to talk to something that knows nothing I wold talk to my teenagers.

Love this devise! I bought one for my son for xmas last year and have regreted not getting one for myself in the kitchen ever since. Soooo when they had a deal on it couple weeks ago i scooped one up! Its so handy from something as simple as tell me tje wheather to setting a timmer when baking! Also i easily added the device in my app and i could set my devise settings separatly from my sons

reviews.reviewTitle: 3rd Gen improvements are worth the purchase price
reviews.reviewText: I have a first and second generation dot. Each new generation is vastly improved over the previously released models. That being said, the sound quality on third generation is by far the most impressive part of the device. I am enjoying the solid feel to the Dot as well. I was always afraid of knocking my first gen Dot off the table. Not so with this one. Solid, dependable and clear. Best Prime Day purchase by far!

I love this little gadget ! I use it a lot and it's connected with our ring doorbell so it will tell you someone is at the front door. I like using it for news and weather information and playing my favorite songs. You can tell it to turn down or up on the volume or stop. It has 1000 uses I'm sure but I only use a few that I don't think I could live without. It will set a timer or a reminder for you. Just remember to say Alexa before the request.

I have several Echo and Alexa devices. I always bought an extra speaker for my dots - until now. This is an astounding little gizmo and I love it. I will be replacing all of them within the next week. Alexa keeps getting better and better. I am very glad I stuck to kindle, fire TV, echo, and Alexa smart stuff. It keeps things standardized and it seems to me that they are the best in the field of 3. I can't WAIT for the Alexa car device to be released!

reviews.reviewTitle: HORRIBLE PRODUCT FROM WORSE COMPANY EVER / WONT LET YOU RETURN CRAP ITEM
reviews.reviewText:
DO NOT BUT THIS PRODUCT. IT IS PRODUCED BY AMAZON. IT RUNS AS GOOD AS THEY DO, SO YOU CAN'T EXPECT VERY MUCH FROM IT. JUST ALOT OF FLASHY LIGHTS AND LIMITED ANSWERS. TRY THE GOOGLE HOME.

AMAZON PULLS DOWN REVIEWS THEY DON'T LIKE GETTING 1 STAR. THEY HAVE PULLED MY REVIEW TWICE. I WILL KEEP POSTING.

Alexa is now playing Abba and I didn't have to pay for a download! The Echo Dot is great. Caveat: identifying the correct app for setup was a supreme challenge. The correct app is subtitled "music" and that immediately told me keep looking for the setup app. In no way would I download a music app. NOT! The app labeled "music" IS the setup app. Setting up the Dot was anything but intuitive. This app needs reworking. Very few setup prompts along the way. It was 95% guesswork so plan on trying this or that link to find the next logical setup step. I finally had to call the HELP desk and she walked me through the whole process. Exceptional help from the HELP Desk. Thank you for that Amazon! I was close to putting it back in the mail today.

I don’t know how I lived with Alexa before. I use it constantly and it’s a huge help in managing my day from shopping, weather and entertainment such as music, jokes and games. It does much more. I chose Alexa over other brands because the products we chose integrate with the Samsung Hub and Alexa which was very important for us...Samsung refrigerator, Kwickset door lock, Cree light bulbs, etc.

I was getting really annoyed with not being able to do simple things like grab the remote or turn off then lights after having my baby and busy nursing. This echo dot with Alexa has saved me and makes my day way more efficient. I control the lights and electronics. I love the whisper mode and telling my kids to ask her how to spell things or ask her questions when I am busy with the newborn. I look forward to using it more in the future and integrating with other smart devices.

I've got an original Echo, an old dot and now this new 3rd generation dot with a Fire TV stick 4K on order. I'm really getting into the Echo products and this Gen 3 seems to have the sound quality of the original Echo in the size of a dot so, I'm loving it. I'm really pleased with the 3 generation dot and Alexa in general.

We love our Alexa's at my house. My 3 year old loves to make Alexa fart and play the Puppy Dog Pal theme song. My 10 year old loves the jokes that Alexa tells. Let's just say that there is never a dull moment in my house because of this. We currently have 3 and im sure we will be getting a couple more. It was super easy to set up and the app on my phone is super handy. I can hear when my kids talk to Alexa and what they say.

reviews.reviewTitle: The same and not the same.
reviews.reviewText: I bought this unit as a upgrade to my older one, a mistake , at least for me. This unit is separate in energy and sound from my last one. This one has its own power input and the sound is better for most but not for me, older and my hearing aids do not respond to better base which for the powers that be in music is the answer for everyones listening while to me it sounds like everyone and every instrument has muzzles over their output. My wife loves the one I gave her that was mine.

I purchased this for the simple reason that I could pair it with a Bluetooth speaker which you can't do with the larger Echo. I was hesitant to purchase just because I assumed the sound wouldn't be very good. Boy was I wrong. The sound is great considering the size of the Dot. It was so easy to install since I already have an Echo. So glad I made the purchase - price was great too as I purchased it during Prime Days.

I've had Alexa about a week now. I placed the unit in my kitchen and have found a variety of uses for her/it, mainly centred around cooking - on the fly I have Alexa convert measurement units, set multiple timers for different cooking times (last night I was baking some ingredients in the oven while others were frying on the stove), add items to my grocery list, and in the morning I have her play the news from my home country (from Canada, I live in the US) while I make coffee.
I don't regret buying the unit at a discounted price, and I'm strongly considering ordering another one when it goes back on sale. Note, I do *not* have any smart devices that she can interact with, other than my phone, and thus someone with more technology may get more use out of her than I do.
Alexa is NOT ready.... She's dumb and doesn't understand simple questions. She reads too much information back to easy questions or requests. The options for making lists are not great.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not bad! Not bad at all!
reviews.reviewText: My Alexa finally has someone to play with! Sound quality is really really good! I was actually very surprised. Only annoying "habit" is trying to connect to my BT streamer on the sound system. Finally had to disconnect. Also don't know how to turn on the acknowledgement sound on it, so don't know if it's listening to me when I call it's name. I probably need to read up on the instruction. The older Alexa had the "ack" beep on by default.

reviews.reviewTitle: How Will Alexa Fit Into Your Life
reviews.reviewText: I'm glad I bought these. They were easy to set up. I am better organized, entertained, and fascinated by the technology. It can be pricey when you consider your subscription services that can be connected to Alexa. I decided what I would use and the best rate for the service. For example, I stream my music through Amazon Unlimited instead of another popular service for savings. The dots do not take up much space and you can purchase dot hangers that connect to the wall.

We have a dot in our main living room but I decided to purchase the echo dot for my room to access features like audible, music and news just for me. I am so happy I did! I ask Alexa to start my day and it is the best. She is my alarm now, too. The sync process was super easy and wow the sound is amazing. For the area I use it for if you didn't see it you might think I had a bose playing!! Totally worth every penny and then some. My fav feature is just keeping my skills up with the Question of the Day!!

I love this little dot.. because she reads to me my audio books. Alexa is good for asking the weather or time... And She is Great when I ask her to call someone. BUT she is really dumb... "Ok Google" is must smarter than Alexa.. When I ask a more complicated question like!!!!!!! Alexa How long do I cook wings in my air fryer... She always says hmmmm I don't l know that one. But if I open my android and say ok google ... same question.. I get an immediate answer.

It is about a 50/50 % chance of it doing what I ask . it lights up blue reconizing I'm talking to it then does nothing at all it doesn't even say it can't help or any just nothing. other times it will do what I ask. When i play music it have the time will not stop the music and i will have to unplug it from the wall all together . the sound quility is great to bad it is slow and faulty

I don't know how I managed before this little smart device. I am hooked. I need more in my home. Anything I need, Alexa will assist me with. From reminders to recipes. Amazon, Alexa is a the gift that keeps giving. Thank you!❤❤❤ I want to write more about this precious gem. People this is honestly a must have. Do your self a favor and purchase an alexa devise you will have no regrets.

I am in love with Alexa ask to sing, play song and do so many stuff like call.Alexa itself could describe what are it capabilities which I got to know through amazon email. The best thing I like is to create shopping list and even we can categorize based on store.Handy and nice sound quality, good range and can pick up from long range. This is my first echo dot product and I wish I had tried much before. Overall nice product to be in home.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very Boomy Sound - Not Worth the Upgrade
reviews.reviewText: Amazon does some amazing things, but audio quality is not one of them. I cannot believe how poor the sound quality is on this device. My solution will be to buy the older generation as long as they are available, and for locations where I want to listen to music I'll offboard a JBL Flip 4. Sound quality is in another dimension.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love the upgrades from the older ones!!
reviews.reviewText:
I have an earlier generation dot that truly had me thinking I wouldn't buy another because of the low volume level and I often did not use it. Well I am super impressed with the difference between my older one and this one. A huge difference in the sound!
Of coarse everything that Alexa can do for you is still amazing. And I'm learning new features everytime I use her. One feature worth mentioning is the alarm. I was shocked at how well it works. And this is coming from someone that has a hard time waking up to very loud multiple alarms in the mornings.
I went from rarely using my older one to now wanting to buy more to put in other rooms.

While I have no complaints...other than the sound seems to amplify the lower frequencies and not a lot of mid-to-upper range frequencies...I can't give this a solid 5 star rating. It functions as expected, the price-to-value factor is satisfactory, and it has a lot of potential (allegedly), we have not found sufficient use for it yet. Not disappointed, but certainly not amazed either. I can get virtually the same from Siri on my Iphone.

reviews.reviewTitle: Surprisingly good sound - Now have 3 at my mom's house
reviews.reviewText:
I got 2 of these for my mom (she lives alone & loves her 1st generation Dot)
So I wanted to add one to her bedroom (as an alarm clock) & one for the family room so she could her her pill reminders & check the weather when she isn't in the kitchen (where her original Dot is).
The sound is really great for such a small speaker - way better than the original Dot (which was fine for news & weather) but these new ones sound good playing music - nice improvements Amazon!

The quality of these are much better versus the 1st generation, which is what I originally had. The only thing I don't like about this one, they don't have the same plugs as the originals and other android devices. I liked being able to use stuff I already had if something tore up, and now that's not an option. Sound is much better. Voice recognition is soooo much better. And there seems to be more options/settings for these in the Alexa app.

I was liking this Dot a lot until it starting flashing a green light for no reason! I had to unplug it to sleep so I couldn’t use it to play my sleeping music. I searched and discovered green meant a message or call coming in. Nope! There were none. After asking for messages a few times it finally stopped flashing and went dark. But, I don’t trust it now. If it wakes me up in the middle of the night I’m going to throw it out the window!

So i'm new to the whole alexa thing, and i consider myself pretty tech savvy. However, setting up things on the echo was a little confusing at first. I still need to earn the commands. I mainly got it so i can use it for my spotify playlists. It worked great the first night when i set it up, but the day after, I asked alexa to play my playlist and it kept giving me nursery rhymes from amazon music lol. It was quite frustrating. So i went into the settings and realized that somehow my main music was set as "amazon music"-(which i dont even have) instead of spotify. Once i switched spotify to my main music, it worked again. So hopefully it doesn't happen again. I will write an updated review once I learn more :)

reviews.reviewTitle: What I hate most about my Alexa!
reviews.reviewText: The thing I hate most about my Alexa is that when I asked her to change to a British accent she told me she couldn’t do it. And then I thought to myself this is ridiculous. Every piece of technology I own talks to me in an accident my GPS talks to me in an accent my Siri on my iPhone talks to me in an accent. Not because I have an accent not because I live in a different country but because I just love hearing other people talk to me in an accent it just makes me happy. So in the future with future updates Alexa should take this into consideration I would like her to talk to me in an accent for example British! Other than that I appreciate everything she does for me she reminds me of everything I need to do creates my to do list am I shopping list which is amazing. The other thing I hate about her is that she does not do monthly reminders so my credit card bill that is due monthly she does not remind me of which is kind of frustrating so you can remind me at the same time every single day to do something but God for bid you remind me at the same time every month to do something, how does that make sense? Once again Amazon please read this message and take this into Account on the next update!

Upgrade from Echo 2nd Generation. Easy setup. All I had to do was connect power, rename the device, and turn follow up on. I’m not sure what the complaints are I’ve read about the sound quality. It’s not Bose or your other high end quality audio brand, but for what it is and what you pay, the audio quality is great. Unless you’re an audiophile, you’re not going to know any different. Voice recognition improved as well.

I have had the Amazon Echo (2nd generation) for some time. I have it downstairs in my Family Room. When I ordered the Dot above, I put it upstairs in the Master Bedroom. I now am able to pipe music to both floors of the house by pairing the two Amazon devices. They work great and have excellent speaker quality. I am now able to use both devices much more frequently by having them on each floor of the house.

Can retrieve all music in Amazon library, though the library does lack some music. Sometimes you have to re-phrase request to get what you want. Must always speak a little loud and definitely clear. Sound for music is very good from such a small device. I think it would be a good teaching tool for youngster and easy to use for elderly, unless they forget to say "Alexa" as the first word in their request.

I resisted buying this as I just did not want yet another piece of tech in my home. Now I'm asking myself, 'what took me so long?'
I love, love, love this gadget! She hears me from way across the room speaking in a low voice~Yayyyy! I am not a loud person and we live in a quiet house, so that's important to me. I had a free trial of Amazon Music with it, sooo fun!
I'm going to order one for the upstairs rooms, too, and that speaks volumes.
What are you waiting for?

reviews.reviewTitle: better than version 2 with some caveats
reviews.reviewText:
I really like the sound and how much louder version 3 is compared to version 2. However, it is too bass-y out of the box. Go into the settings and adjust the treble all the way up and the lows down 2 and mids should be up 1. this in my opinion gives it much better sound and allows the vocals to come through more precise.
Version 2 is better if you want to hang from a wall or get a adapter to hang from the plug. new version is too big and too bulky for the adapters.

reviews.reviewTitle: I really want to love it!
reviews.reviewText:
I really want to love this but for some reason every 2-3 days it drops the wifi and wont reconnect without having to reboot from step 1 like it's new out of the box. I've had it for 10days and I'm on the 3rd need for a reboot which im tired of doing.

On the plus side, its amazing on the amount of things it can do. My 6yr old loves talking to Alexa and the voice recognition is on point. I seen complaints about the volume level but im impressed with it.

I really want to love it!

reviews.reviewTitle: this thing is great only one problem
reviews.reviewText: I love my echo but if you live in a location with no or pour hard line internet like me and are force to use wireless hotspots as a main source of internet then you will need some extra set up. the echo does no do peer to peer connections like Wi-Fi hotspots so if you need to connect it to one you have to buy a 3rd party Wi-Fi router to feed off the hot spot or establish a mesh system in your house, but once you do that it works great and doesn't drop off.

I love Alexa, sure she gets on my nerves at times because you have to word things a certain way for her to understand but she’s still great. I took a star away because I got this for my sister & I have the echo 2nd generation & for whatever reason the dot can barely hear us in the same room but mine hears us 20 ft away. She picks & chooses when she wants to hear us. I have to put mine on DND when she is using hers because it assumes she’s talking to it even though it’s 2 rooms over.

reviews.reviewTitle: Decent sound in a small package
reviews.reviewText:
Already have an Echo, so didn't really need the Echo Dot.
However, when Amazon had it on sale, figured what the heck.
Placed it in our bedroom.
Easy set-up.
Pretty decent sound for such a small piece. Not great, but better than I anticipated.
Sits far from my router, and lost the signal once.
Firestick in same room has never lost the signal, so will need to see if this
will be a recurring issue.
Otherwise, pretty happy with my purchase.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa makes so many little chores hands-free.
reviews.reviewText: I resisted getting Alexa for so long, but now I wish I hadn’t been so resistant. I love it! She plays my Audible selections for me, which is very nice. She sets reminders and if you purchase smart devices and smart plugs she can control your house for you.
