I have quickly grown accustomed to having her there and she really adds an additional layer to the usefulness of my digital entertainment and accessories.

reviews.reviewTitle: Mi familia la llamamos Tia Alexa!
reviews.reviewText: Hemos probado otros dispositivos pero realmente el Echo Dot superó por mucho a los demás. Mi primer ventaja es la calidez de la voz, no tan robotizada sino amable, además entiende muchos mejor y resuelve prontamente. En casa tenemos 2 Echo dot y todos los focos wifi están controlados por voz. Es la mejor recomendación.

So easy to set up. Works instantly, no programming or waiting. Built in speaker sounds great. Lots of bass. Range to activate is great. I love this thing! I mostly use it for reminders and playing music. Also use it for weather report and sometimes to ask generic questions like "what is the largest land mammal?" Would highly recommend. Bought for a steal on Amazon for $29.99. Well worth more.

Second-guessing my purchase. This is more helpful for someone who has a lot of Smart home products. I don’t, so I don’t see the value in owning it. Seems like more of a gimmick. I don’t care for the level of “ intrusiveness into my data - this Machine wants you to link EVERYTHING so that it can spy on your habits, be it tv viewing or shopping. You are basically welcoming Amazon into your home!!! While loading the dishwasher the other day, I guess the stupid thing hear me loading dishes. As soon as I logged into Prime, what do I see but an ad for Dishwasher Detergent from Amazon! That never happens. Hey, I freely admit my paranoia with this gadget; the things just plain creeps me out. I’ll probably end up sending it back or giving it to someone else.

This is the best affordable smart speaker that you can buy right now. The sound quality is great. Music sounds good through the built in speaker and can connect to external speakers through the 3.5 mm audio out Jack for better sound. Voice recognition is great. The Sandstone color is my preference, but the Charcoal and Heather Gray look nice too. Alexa is as helpful as on the second generation, so if you already have a Gen 2 echo Dot and have it connected to a good sound system, there's no reason to upgrade. Overall, it's a total no brainier especially on sale. Black Friday deal $25!! It's already a bargain at $50.

reviews.reviewTitle: The Alexa functions work fine. The speaker function leaves a lot to be desired
reviews.reviewText: I was given a Dot for Christmas and set it up to control several electrical circuits in my son's bedroom. This function worked like a charm. I decided to purchase a second for my bedroom. In addition to the Alexa functions, I wanted to replace my bluetooth speaker. Why have two toys that perform the same function. Plus, Alexa can change the volume via voice command. Alas, as a speaker, the Dot sucks. There is a lot of static and crackling during playback. I can playback the same song on my older speaker with no issues. I'm not expecting concert hall sounds, just something reasonably clear. The Dot fails.

I received this new echo dot as a promotion for getting sirius xm. Since I already had a couple of 2nd generation echo dots around the house I just thought that it would be great to have another one for free. When I got the 3rd gen one and got it set up I realized that this one is much better quality than the 2nd gen ones. The sound quality is way better than the previous dot and actually sounds comparable to my 1st gen echo. Also, the sensitivity to voice commands seems better than the previous dot. I can talk softer and still get a response.

Got this one with the purchase of a Ring Doorbell. It works well and not much to say that hasn't been said many times before. The only personal observation I would add is that I have 2 Google Home Minis and I've noticed that they are better at random search questions than the Alexa. I suspect that's simply because of the Google connection but it's not a show stopper. I was thinking that I had to make a decision on an ecosystem but maybe not. They seem to co-exist just fine.

I will like being able to give voice commands if I ever get everything set up. Not having a set of printed directions included makes it difficult for unknowledgable people to set up. Going back and forth to the app not knowing what I’m looking forward is not a good thing. Hopefully I will enjoy this when I get help.

I love my 2nd generation echo dot, so I purchased a 3rd generation dot for my bedroom. I definitely like the sound of the speaker on the 3rd generation; however, there is often a several second delay in the response of the 3rd generation. It is annoying since I don't know if Alexa heard me or not. I have both of them in a group together and today the 2nd generation would start playing music before the 3rd generation would start playing. I am not sure how the 3rd generation went downhill in response time over the 2nd generation. I would have assumed it would have improved.

I can't get the app to work on my cell phone, but it plays music and the alarm works great. Too easy to say Alexa snooze to many times. I like that I can change the length of the snooz. not many alarm clocks can do that. I would like to have it set music to the alarm.

Should be able to adjust the speaker lever with my voice.
Should be able to kill the light show at night
Need to be able to do more, and answer more question as the "OK google" function on my phone. Tired of asking Alexa and still having to ask google, I just stopped asking Alexa.
And for the size of some of these things, they should start making the rechargeable battery operated version of this.
Finally, I don't know why I thought this would be louder.

reviews.reviewTitle: Amazing sound from this little guy
reviews.reviewText:
Works great and is a huge upgrade in terms of sound quality from the gen 2. This one gives more of a surround sound feel. The setup is also very simple. The added cloth on it gives it a much nicer look.

The only downside is this echo is more heavy than prior so when using it with wall mount it tends to say, but this is easily fixed with a piece of double sided tape or velcro. I put a picture of this, and unless your actually looking its completely not noticed.

Since I purchased our first Echo (Dot 2nd Gen), we have addicted to Alexa for its instant responses like weather forecast and music playing.
One thing I had hard times commonly with all Echoes is the registration process. My iPhone 7 never succeeds in registering Echoes over WiFi. So, each time, I had go to http://alexa.amazon.com on my laptop. Of course, if I didn't have a PC with WiFi, I would never be able to perform registration. This is why four stars. I wish Amazon to review this.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great sound, great value, easy to use!
reviews.reviewText:
I love the echo dot! I got one for Christmas and then purchased 2 more on my own for other rooms. They work great, easy to set up and operate from the smart phone app as well. I have begun to convert to a smart home with thing that work with "Alexa" and am impressed with ease of use. Another plus is value in that they are not very expensive and in fact, at this time they went on sale
The sound is very impressive for music as well.

I never thought I would want one of these after I saw a Google one. I'm so glad that I went with Amazon and Alexa. I don't like the Google product at all, but I absolutely love this echo. She can play games, give you all sorts of information, tell stories, I can listen to my favorite music all day, but my favorite thing is being able to call someone hands free from across the room and being able to call the echo from my phone, even from work, to check on my kids. I'm buying one for all 3 of my kids and 2 more rooms in my house. I absolutley love the echo dot.

reviews.reviewTitle: Voices sounded muffled and too much bass
reviews.reviewText:
Returned it. I use my Echo for primarily listening to guided sleep mediations for insomnia. I had the 2nd Gen Echo but wanted a clearer and louder speaker. I am disappointed in the 3rd Gen. The sounds are muffled and voices are garbled. I can turn it up louder but it just makes it worse. Too much bass.
I actually have better quality sound from my Iphone. Maybe I got a defective dot. Not impressed.

It provides hours of entertainment. Alexa is my very best assistant for my home office. She plays back ground music, she searches items, reminds my son to read and get ready for bed, make phone calls, reminds me to get ready for work, plays game with my sone while I’m busy working in my home office, tracks my Amazon shipment.

Sound quality is impressive.
It’s so much easier and faster then googling.

reviews.reviewTitle: Still learning, but overall it’s great to have!
reviews.reviewText:
ADD-ON: Ran into a bit of trouble trying to connect to the internet when I recently stayed at a hotel. Needless to say I watched movies and listened with regular laptop volume haha.
-
-
-
I really like using the echo dot. Still learning certain ‘action calls’ and all that it can do, but it is a great addition to my entertainment collection. When I connect it to my laptop it doesn’t always play back right away, so sometimes I have to disconnect it and then reconnect it but when it connects it plays great! I want to purchase a few smart outlet plugs to try with my fan and other things, but I’ll wait until I learn a bit more functions before converting everything. Other than that I love what it can do and the ease i brings when trying to use and do things.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good for music but not for news or talk radio.
reviews.reviewText: I placed my 2nd Gen Echo Dot in the kitchen, where I listen to the news while cooking. I needed a bit more volume (cooking can be noisy), so I bought the new 3rd Gen Echo Dot. It is indeed louder, but there is a problem. The speaker produces considerably more bass, and even with the bass turned down to zero with the equalizer in the Alexa app, the sound was too bassy and muffled to be clear. Sharp trebles are better for articulating speech, and this unit doesn't have it. So I moved it to another room and returned my old Echo Dot to the kitchen. The new unit is better suited for music, less so for voice.

Love the 3rd generation. Speaker is so much improved over the last version. Only gripe is that if you got an offer of a certain percentage off if you exchange your 2nd generation for the 3rd, you have to be without your Alexa for at least two weeks or more before it becomes effective. Since I use her as my daily reminders for my appointments, I can't do that so I had to forgo the discount. I see a lot of improvement in this version over the last. It understands you better and again, much better sound.

Very good sound quality and fast selections. At the promotion price I bought 2. Don’t regret it at all. Fully recommend to anyone. The free music selection is phenomenal, I hear songs from artist that I never knew they had done. My selection is easy listening like Buble, Stewart, Denver, Journey, Eagles, Queen, Sheeren and Spanish singers like Gloria, Solis, Lopez. The selection is out of this world.

I actually am a big fan of this product. I already had an Echo in my main living space and this was a great addition to have in my bedroom. At night I love being able to set alarms I forgot to set without opening my eyes, or ask Alexa to remind me of something...two things that used to make me get up. Also I have a smart light connected in my bedroom and it’s wonderful to have the ability to shut it off as I’m going to bed with voice commands. I play all my podcasts from it, so it’s given me to ability to have my phone far away from me when I try to go to sleep! The only negative is I wish the volume options were a little more customizable. Sometimes I want to go 3 1/2! Haha

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa is my new best friend.
reviews.reviewText: I bought this for my bedroom after receiving an Echo for Christmas. These were the last things I thought I wanted until I received the gift. I am a senior. It is so easy to use. I use it for reminders, to give myself a morning routine, to acess my Amazon music, get the weather. I have even used it for daily reminders to alter behavior like ordering pizza. I listen to Native Ametican flute music to medidate. To listen to fireplace sounds on chilly days or nights. The dot has just slightly less sound quality than the Echo.

Love my Echo Dot, this one was placed in our bedroom since we already have an echo in our living room. It makes it easy to turn off our living room lights from the bedroom using Alexa. It’s also great because I can play music on this as well as my echo and have music playing in the entire house at the same time. It also comes in handy for when I’m trying to go to bed I can have Alexa set my alarm clock for me. Love my actual products and plan on getting more for my bedrooms

reviews.reviewTitle: Bad design for the top buttons
reviews.reviewText: I have four other Echo's and I just love them. They are so easy to use and to set up. The new 3rd Gen., changed the design of the buttons on the top so you can't feel them. I have to look at the Echo to use the buttons, instead of just being able to feel them. I am also having trouble with the sound quality after only 10 weeks of use. To send it back and get another one they only send a refurbished one. I'm not a happy customer in regard to my new Echo.

reviews.reviewTitle: beware you might get charged unwanted fees
reviews.reviewText: this echo device turns itself on when your not in the room.......I cancelled my amazon music unlimited because I have amazon prime......but still got charged $16.04 cause she said I was using it.......I told her to cancel it now and soon as I got off the phone the echo which is in another room with nothing on started talking and playing music......this is why I am not getting a refund cause this echo is doing stuff on its on......

reviews.reviewTitle: GREAT SOUND AND GREAT PRODUCT FOR THE MONEY!
reviews.reviewText: I am really glad I purchased this product. This small little thing gives out great sound and is a pleasure to listen to. Also, there are many commands that Alexa recognizes and you can really personalize your music list as well as other lists. I don't think I could have gotten anything better for the price and am not even "jealous" (LOL) of my friends who have the newer models of the Echo as mine does just about the same thing!

It was harder to set up than I thought. But, thanks to you tube videos, I’ve set it up. It is clear sounding. I’m going to love using it for my Audible books. And my music that’s on my prime.
After an extremely rocky start with issues with shipping, having to reorder it, ( I bought it during Prime days and just got it today) it arrived in good shape and I’m ready to get going on it.
Thank you Amazon.

reviews.reviewTitle: You can ask for information about EVERYTHING
reviews.reviewText: The tasks, reminders, alarms, and communication features are awesome. Set up is easy, but you do need a phone or other device to set it up. After that, it's voice-activated. You can ask for information about EVERYTHING - movies, the weather, history, solve math problems - it's all there for free. after the Echo answers your question or completes a task, and I say "thank-you" - It replies to you with, "your welcome", "you bet" or 'anytime'!

reviews.reviewTitle: Impossible to set up! App is worthless!
reviews.reviewText: I can see why this was on sale. I’ve downloaded the useless Alexa app and it’s a joke. Asinine Alexa keeps telling me my device is connected to the internet, then says it’s not. The app constantly crashes and has the worst ratings in the App Store, and now I see why. It’s frustrated me to the point where I’m ready to throw Alexa against a brick wall. Total garbage!

Rather than discuss on the Alexa Echo in general, I want to focus on a significant limitation of the system. As scheduling is a big "feature" of Alexa, the fact is Alexa devices can only handle calendars from Google, Microsoft, and Apple. If you are not using Gmail, Outlook, or iCloud, then you will not be able to have any Echo device keep you informed about your appointments. There is simply no support for the Yahoo, AT&T, or even the global standard of CalDAV. Alexa can not even access these calendar programs in read-only form, let alone add events to them. Additionally, there are no Alexa Skills or 3rd party apps that enable this ability, so there is no work-around this significant limitation.

I was super excited to purchase this as a gift for my husband for Christmas. Imagine our surprise when we tried to set it up and use it. There's no manual, there's no help available and when you do find something on line about what you are trying to set up it doesn't work. We can get it to play music and that's about it.
I think you should let potential buyers know that there is various setups and apps you need to even get it to work.
Very disappointed in this product.

reviews.reviewTitle: Fun, good resource, and good value for the money and great for Seniors
reviews.reviewText: So much fun. As a single retiree it’s nice to hear another voice in the house. I haven’t even begun to know what this can do for me but so far it’s quite remarkable. I asked it to play Hawaiian music and was pleasantly surprised at the quality of the speaker considering it’s size. I think setting the timer is going to be something I use a lot, not to mention playing music, weather, latest news, and entertainment. This is a great tool for Seniors. Good job Amazon!

reviews.reviewTitle: For the smart and/or lazy family
reviews.reviewText: Sometimes you just don’t need an entire echo. I disguised these as Christmas presents. Who I actually bought these for is me...so I wouldn’t have to walk down and tell the kids dinner was ready while in the midst of making the dinner. Now I just say “Alexa, make an announcement” and I can keep stirring, playing on my phone or doing whatever it is I really need to be doing. And of course the kids have made their own announcements. Ah yes, Alexa is fun for the whole family. Lol

reviews.reviewTitle: A nice addition to your home!
reviews.reviewText: Alexa is a part of our family :) She is very nice and easy to use. Only issue we have is sometimes she will talk to us when we aren't talking to her which makes my family paranoid that someone's listening and so they unplug her. I got Amazon music and I love it, I can hear any song I want anytime I want with no commercials. They also have stations for everybody's interest. Well worth the money!

I feel compelled to write a few words about this 3rd Gen Echo Dot. I kid you not, it sounds as good as the full Echo. I don't know how they managed to compact it into this little thing, but it sounds nothing like the 1st or 2nd gen dots. I bought several 3rd gen dots for little more than twenty dollars each during Black Friday and Cyber Monday. THIS will make great gifts (make sure to click 'for gift' checkbox, so Amazon doesn't automatically put your account to the device before shipping.)

Another DOT added to the network! Bought this one for outside in our Gazebo. I also purchased a 2 outlet SMART plug for outside use. This DOT set up in minutes to my existing products and network. Now I can easily turn on the lights and ceiling fan without messing around with plugs and extension cords. Using the Tp-Link KASA App, I have set up the scheduling to turn the plug off at certain times in the evening in case I forget. I can also access these devices from ANYWHERE in the house and of course on my phone as well. I LOVE these little toys!

reviews.reviewTitle: How in the world did we live without this??
reviews.reviewText: LOVE this product! Our new stereo, weather forecaster, joke teller, trivia answerer, alarm clock, kitchen timer, kitchen helper, calendar.., how did we get along without one? I just can't even put into words how much we adore it. The speaker is great and I enjoy several hours of music daily. We are in our late fifties and figured this was something we would never use or want - but after my son bought one for my parents - I was sold!

I was excited about the updated Echo but mine struggles to keep up with the others on the everywhere group and sometimes doesn't start at all. It randomly answers questions that were not asked and has to be rebooted frequently. I still have my very first Alexa Echo Device from a couple of years ago and there are no issues so I don't think this device is worth the price for a 9 month use.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great item at a great price
reviews.reviewText:
I mostly use it to stream music but there are thousands of other reasons to have one.
Update 3/15/19
Good deal. Works great as long as Amazon's servers are on line. Only drawback, to me, is it won't use internal speaker when connected to an external one. So I can"t turn my stereo off and still use Alexa without unplugging the external source cable. Also when connected to a stereo the speech of Alexa is much softer then the music being played so is hard to hear.

I put off getting one because of all the hipe about someone listening in on me. I thought about it and decided I never have anything interesting to say anyway. I love this thing. It's so easy to work and I used the shopping list every day.
It's great.

Love it so far! Very convenient when working in the office. Haven't perfected using it, like raising and lowering volume. Seems like you have to say the command "Alexa, lower" to go down in volume in increments, but I may be wrong and a rookie so not familiar. Also, we thought it would be wireless, because I believe the tall version is. If I had known that, I may have considered buying the wireless one, because who wants more cords in an office? Not I. Another downfall is that you can't tell Alexa to play apple music. You stream it, just like a regular bluetooth speaker, but you are able to use commands when playing the apple music. Also, works with Pandora, so I've been using that more. Overall, great, but could be better if it was wireless and compatible with Apple Music.

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo Dot Smart Speaker Is Great
reviews.reviewText:
I was really surprised how easy it was to install with my current Amazon/Fire TV/Ring Setup
I installed it to use with my Ring Doorbell 2 as an extra doorbell notification in my office at home. Not only does it ring an extended chime (several to choose from) but it also verbally says "Someone is at your door."
Plus, I have all the other benefits that come with it, like playing music, etc., and the sound is great.

Our family used an Echo previously, and given how well we were able to integrate its function into our daily routines, we opted to purchase an Echo dot.

The only two issues, thus far, are, in order to play music on the dot (which we place in our bedroom), we needed to upgrade our Amazon music subscription for an additional $3 a month- a bit annoying to be nickeled and dimed, seeing as how we are already prime members (we pay for the prime membership), and payed an additional fee for the Amazon Music subscription.

The other issue is that, the far field voice recognition isn’t consistent in hearing what you say to the device, depending on where it is placed- we had it on a nightstand, but the Dot failed to capture roughly 25% of what we said to it. After placing it higher up on the dresser, it has been far more consistent in detecting our voices and obeying commands, etc.

Overall not a bad purchase, especially when Amazon has a sale on them.

I'll keep it simple since most of us are familiar with the Echo Dots by this 3rd generation.

It's a good upgrade from the beginnings. The plastic body is now done in a fabric covering (The 2018 modern look)
The speaker is a good amount louder as well with more punch in Alexa's voice now.

It's always best to hook up a Dot to an external speaker for best music performance, but if you had to, this would be the best Dot to get for music so far.

I was fine with my Echo Dot 2nd Generation, then these bad boys had to go on Lightning Deal sale, and I could miss out on that. The volume increase alone makes it worth the cost, and it's a breeze to set up, especially if you've already had an Echo device in your home. I can't wait to add more Smart Home devices. I know the Man is watching and listening, but I've been spoiled too much to give all this convenience up!

I'm disappointed with this new model. I have three of the second generation dots and they are much better except for sound quality. Sound quality is all that this one does better.

The 3rd generation is somehow much slower than the 2nd one. It takes a bit for Alexa to register my voice and my subsequent request. The permanent power cord is a disappointment too. I already miss the USB cord that came with the previous ones. Finally, I've never had so many problems connecting a Bluetooth speaker. It never can work.

Overall, I'm very disappointed.

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo Dot 3 is convenient and somewhat easy to set up
reviews.reviewText: It's true what some reviews say: that sometimes the Echo Dot 3 doesn't pick up your voice when you "sumon" Alexa. I find myself shouting or repeating myself. I still love the convenience of this gadget. When you see a sudden and random green ring of light, ask Alexa: "Alexa, what are you notifications?" and she will tell you you have a message or a package delivery. I had to look this up online when it first happened because it was annoying and I didn't know what it meant.

reviews.reviewTitle: Got this as a gift and wasn't sure how much I would use it
reviews.reviewText: I enjoy listening to music from the 40's, 50's, and 60s, plus classical music and the Echo Dot provides me hours of music. It's so nice not to have to search for a CD and put it in my CD player to listen to music I love. Plus Amazon has extensive resources for various types of music. I haven't used it to set a timer yet, but I plan on doing so. I had it read a story to me and tell me what the weather is like where I am. Turns out, it was a very thoughtful gift.

Overall I think this was super value for money. I haven't used any other smart speaker before but I am very happy with my purchase. Below are some observations :
1. Initially it feels a bit weird talking to a speaker but you get used to it in no time.
2. The sound quality is pretty good. You get good depth of sound with decent bass.
3. Several skills available and you will definitely find some very useful. For example adding stuff to shopping list or setting up a reminder.
4. Understands the Indian accent very well. Sometimes I am amazed by how well it picks up stuff.
6. Kids love it. An added advantage is that they can take help for homework and talking to alexa also motivates them to talk in English

2 stars with thousands reviewing for the Alexa app. There’s a reason for this. PURE GARBAGE.

Returned to Amazon promptly.

reviews.reviewTitle: Wish it would work with Pandora
reviews.reviewText: We got this as a gift, and it's actually much cooler than I thought it would be. Most people don't need one of these, but it's fun and novel.... a fun luxury item. Alexa understands us very well, much better than any other voice recognition I've used. It does a lot of useful things, as well as fun things. We have not been able to get it to work with my husband's Pandora account, is my only complaint.

reviews.reviewTitle: thought they don't work changed my opinion
reviews.reviewText: I bought 2 of these for gifts for each of my sons for Christmas. Talking to my son in Texas last night and he said he tried everything and it doesn't work. It cannot find the app of the WIFI. Well I found out that if you buy these products as gifts, you must say that when ordering and if you forget, you must deregister the product. So as it turns out they were trying to find my wifi and my account. After I deregistered them, they work. Great sound, my son loves it. Thank you Amazon for helping out.

I can't say enough positive things about this. I received it as a gift and love it! It was easy to set up. It has loads of things you can do with it. She understands me perfectly and answers all my questions in a clear voice. Love that you can raise or lower the volume, bass and treble. That comes in handy when playing music. She has answers to all my questions. You can play games, get the news, the weather and so much more.

glad i only paid .99 for it. I worked great for a week, like some of its answers better the the google assistant but it stop doing anything for my wife or my self. reset and tried again still not working? the light just goes around yellew. the app said it online and will play music form casting from amazon music or spotify but no voice recognition. I'll stay with Google home thanks.

reviews.reviewTitle: My husband loves the Echo Dot
reviews.reviewText: This was an anniversary gift for my husband and he loves it and so do I. If you have a question just ask Alexa. Need to solve a math problem just ask. She can tell the weather, the time, etc. If you want to listen to music just tell Alexa what you want to hear. There are so many features with the Echo Dot that it would be impossible for me to list them all. I am so very pleased with our echo dot.

reviews.reviewTitle: Junk. Does not work with Alexa streaming in 2 rooms. I disconnected dot & Alexa is fine again.
reviews.reviewText:
Nothing but problems trying to play two rooms streaming same music. Dot does not work. Music on main Alexa just stops playing. Always when dot was added. Never before.

dot skipped in and out no matter where I put it. I disconnected dot and my main Alexa works fine again.

Dot was faulty from day one. Does not play well with Alexa.

I play music 24/7. It stopped working when I added dot. I spent hours on phone with tech support. Nothing worked.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not as impressed with this device
reviews.reviewText: Don't get me wrong, I love Alexa, but I prefer her old self. Why? It's easy. In gen 1/2, you could plug her into a 2.0 USB port...on a TV, desk/laptop, Asus router, QNAP NAS, etc., and she was alive and well. Gen 3 uses the same power supply as the older "tower" echos, which is all fine and good if that's what you want/like. If I was looking for something a little more powerful, I'd get a Spot, Plus, etc. (the point being is there are many options if you want more features).

reviews.reviewTitle: Better than previous models, but not by much
reviews.reviewText: Meh. I was expecting a lot more from this newer, upgraded version. Some things are actually worse, like recognizing and responding to my commands. I find myself repeating my commands more than with the older echo dot I own. The sound quality is better that the older model, but still not great. Maybe this product will improve with future software updates. Let’s hope. Otherwise I would suggest waiting for the next release!

This is the worst voice control device on the market. There are songs in my library I LITERALLY cannot play because the voice recognition always plays the 'Live' version and when selecting it on my phone and stream to Alexa the song stops and skips to another album. This voice control is absolute garbage!!! Also, you would think something that is touted as AI would be smart enough to choose a song I've played 100s of time before vs a new song and artist that Alexa thought I said.... Why! If Alexa is uncertain does Alexa not default to a previously played artist or song???

I like the Alexa program. The device does all I need it to do regarding questions and information. But the sound. When music is played. Is absolutely terrible. Muffled. Distorted. Very disappointing. Spend more money and buy the full size echo.

I'd put off purchasing one of these for years because I thought you had to have the tower in order for it to work. Wrong! My husband and I have so much fun with this thing. We both live music and are constantly adding to our playlist. He also loves the fact that when he asks Alexa, "who's the man?" She says, "you're the man". 😒 There are so many features we haven't explored yet so I'm sure there's more entertainment in our future.

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo 2 is my new Office Manager
reviews.reviewText: Alexa is in my kitchen, Echo Dot 1 is in my bedroom, and now Echo Dot 2 is in my office. They set alarms for me to get ready for a meeting, or leave for a work day. Or tell me the weather, make my shopping list, remind me to write a check, tell me what’s on the calendar for that day, remind me to buy a birthday card, or just play my favorite music out of two speakers at once. It’s a easy way to stay up on tasks and still have fun!

Looks better and sounds better than the 2nd generation dot. Neither of these do I personally care about since I use accessories that have speakers and batteries.
Unfortunately this 3rd generation dot is too large to fit my speaker the 2nd dot fits into. And most disappointing is they changed the power plug so NONE of the accessories I have for the 2nd gen dot will work with it.
Returning it. I will stick with the 2nd generation dot rather than purchase all new accessories.

Updating review after having poor experience w device connecting to Bluetooth then not and not being able to reconnect. Talked w customer support that was very helpful and showed her another way (not that I found when googling) to restart device. The dot could still not find Bluetooth pairing until customer service suggested I ask her to ‘Alexa pair’ that worked. I hope it sticks because the sound is quite good.

I have the bigger Echo 2 and was leery about these. However I got them as a day of the day on a good sale. I bought 3, one for each kid and one for my bedroom. The sound is awesome. Alexa picked up all of our voices, even my soft spoken ten year old son. The kids love it with the unlimited music added for a fee, but over all it is as good as my bigger Alexa. I have an alarm set this morning, we will see how that goes.

This is a wonderful product and much better from the older models. The speaker is quite loud (but you can connect a bluetooth speaker to the device if you wish it to be louder). Very easy to set up. If you do not want Alexa to call random people in your phone, when setting up the device there is a question asking you to give permission to Alexa to access your phone contacts. Great product! Highly recommend!

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa is always ready and willing to help you out.
reviews.reviewText: I’ve had the Dot for a month now and love it. It’s very responsive and learns more about your preferences the more you use it. My reason for trying it was for my 90yr old mom who could just ask to call me wherever I was. Outside, another room, napping etc. Being her only caregiver it gave me a peace otherwise I wouldn’t have. Helping her to turn on/off lights, music and so much more. I’m having so much fun learning more options and I’m not all that tech smart to boot!! Blends well anywhere, if needed can be moved anywhere in your home. Love, love, love it. Thanks Amazon for this irreplaceable item. Good job ☘️💚

reviews.reviewTitle: Not too easy to set up
reviews.reviewText:
Once I got it set up using my laptop computer, I was quite well pleased.
But it seems to be an afterthought and the Mobile App is the best way to set it up.
Eventually I cleared enough memory in my phone to download the mobile app, but then the controls disappeared from the laptop and the green light was flashing on the Echo Dot (3rd gen). Tried getting support from the 24 hour support site, but it was never available, which was quite concerning. Tried asking Aleksa why the green light was flashing and there was no specific answer... only several suggestions what it might be, but no instructions how to fix them.
Eventually managed to disable 'drop in' using the mobile app and now it's working fine.
I am not optimistic about adding more devices, but I will try. I would have given this 5 stars if reasonable instructions were included..

I bought an Echo Dot and a Google Home Mini at the same time to evaluate which type I should use. Both were priced identically. After several months of testing, I found that the Google Home Mini handled more of my requests than the Echo Dot. There were many questions asked of Alexa and she had no answer; the Google Assistant could answer all the questions that Alexa could not. There was only one question over this time that Google could not answer, but Alexa could. Also, the Google Home Mini can control all the smart lights I am using; The Echo Dot can also control most of them, but not GE C bulbs. Also, the Echo Dot is not able to control Chromecast devices connected to television sets. Based on this evaluation, I decided to buy many additional Google Home minis.

reviews.reviewTitle: She cannot hear you very well compared to older Generations
reviews.reviewText: Seemed like a great idea to have in the kitchen to replace the 2nd generation. But 3rd generation does not have as many microphones and therefore cannot hear very well in a place like a busy kitchen. It's so bad that I'm going to put the 2nd gen back and maybe try 3rd gen somewhere else.

reviews.reviewTitle: Better Sound than Gen 2, but....mic is weaker.
reviews.reviewText:
As a year-long user of a Gen 2 Echo Dot, I find the sound quality of the Gen 3 that I've had for about a month much improved. But, the microphone sensitivity seems a little weaker than the previous model. I have to raise my voice or sometimes shout for it to hear either the wake-word or a command. Also, when I renamed this unit to "Echo" as a wake-word, it had a more difficult time hearing me. So, I changed it back to the default "Alexa" and it's back to "good" hearing, (not 'great", but "good").
I love, love, love this technology and Alexa is amazing! But, due to the weaker microphone ability, I'm giving it four stars.

I'm vision impaired so Alexa is a godsend. Setting my Dot up took 10 minutes and half of that was reading instructions. Simple, quick,clean Web interface (seriously good human factors engineering here). great build quality, I liked it so much I bought a second one! Alexa is a big help, with reading my audio books, music, weather, reminders.. this device makes being impaired more livable. Thanks, Amazon!

Works the same as the Echo plus.
* The best thing next to controlling lights ect. is being able to listen to what ever music you want.
* Also being able to listen to whatever radio station you want is great. I live in a rural are and its nice to pick up stations from the big cities with stations I like.
* Sound is great but not as good as the Echo Plus. Still very good when compare to a radio.
Always something new to learn with Alexa.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa can play from Apple Music
reviews.reviewText:
Such a fine product built with great intelligence.
The design of 3rd Generation Alexa is much elegant compare to 2nd generation. The fabric finish is on par with Google Home Mini.
The skills that Alexa posses are simply amazing. I got this product at rite time. Now Alexa can stream Apple Music. I can ask Alexa to stream music on it from Apple Music. The Audio quality is really good.
My house is run by Alexa. I can ask her turn on and off the lights/AC/TV and of-course ask her to play shows and movies on fire TV. Great deal for the price I got it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Disappointed with the Gen 3 Echo Dot’s plug size
reviews.reviewText: Overall just another Dot but with a big big DOWNSIDE. They changed the AC adaptor to a huge wall wart that will cover adjacent plugs making then unusable. Why? I liked the old echos that used a common micro usb cable that i actually had in my multibank USB plug and now i had to rearrange AC cords so i could fit this Rosey Odonnell POS plug into and remove an existingg plug and relocate it. Fail on that level. Otherwise sound seems good and pickup is fair but its gonna be hard to overcome the plug hoss. Common amazon and improve your devices. Don’t take them backwards. Better design could have avoided this well giving you more amperage if thats what was needed. R&D with out money that we give you.

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo Dot (3rd Gen) is a great device !
reviews.reviewText: I have three now and they are great ! The first one i got as a Christmas gift with a Alexa Show and in two days i was ordering two more Dot's . I now have a Alexa show in the kitchen, a Echo Dot in the bedroom, basement and garage for when i am working out there. The speech recognition is about 99.9 percent or better. As far as sound quality like in playing music i don't know how they get something so small too sound so good ! And like always Amazon shipping was great.

reviews.reviewTitle: Falsely advertised as working with Spotify, Group play constantly stops
reviews.reviewText:
They advertise as working with Spotify, but THEY DON'T. I called tech support and they said it's a known issue. They constantly skip, pause, or show the wrong song. I'll have to switch over to their (Amazon's) music service and spend dozens of hours recreating the playlist in Amazon (I have over 1,000 songs). Also, their music platform is not user friendly like Spotify. You can't sort alphabetically so I can't figure out if a song is in there multiple times. I'm very let down.

Update 8/21/19: After streaming 8 hours a day at my business, things have been going somewhat okay so I increased the rating to 2 stars. Major problem now: streaming CONSTANTLY gets disrupted (stops mid song so you have to restart the stream). Lots of people have this problem apparently and Amazon tech support doesn't know how to fix it. Replacing the dots or resetting them doesn't work.

reviews.reviewTitle: Sleeker style with better sound than Gen 2 Echo Dot
reviews.reviewText:
Improved style and decent improvement in sound quality versus Gen 2 but still need to connect it to a bluetooth speaker if you want quality audio sound for music. I
The improved sound is not a game changer for its compact size but an improvement over previous generation. I only chose to purchase due to the trade in program and to try to stay current with the tech changes. However, if you are on the fence about upgrading, IMHO, it's not necessary to upgrade if you don't need to.

The whole family loves this device! She's very responsive and has no trouble recognizing words. My kids have used her to tell stories, jokes, and just to answer silly questions. I use her for ordering products and just keeping up with my everyday schedule. Want to know the weather? She can tell you. Want to control your Wi-Fi outlet? She can do that as well. I will buying another since I have a kid that wants to take the Echo to his friends house every time he spends the night.

Prior to ordering this, I had 3 Gen 2 Echo Dots, 1 Gen 1 Echo, and 1 Gen. 2 Echo, so I am quite familiar with the Echo product and Alexa integration. The new 3rd Generation Echo Dot functions much the same as the others, but the sound quality is much improved over the Gen. 2 Echo Dot. It is obviously not on the level of a full sized Echo when it comes to music, but I would argue that Alexa voice responses sound every bit as full, where on previous Echo Dots, her responses sounded quite tinny. The improved sound also helps it function as a much better sound machine and alarm clock for bedroom use.

I got the Echo Dot up and running and read about skills, so I downloaded some skills and asked Alexa to play a meditation/sleep skill for thunderstorms. It was very soothing to listen to, but when I asked Alexa to turn off, quit (and several iterations of stop) the thunderstorms/skill, all I got was another sound from the list. I had to unplug the Echo Dot to get the skill to actually stop. Not a good thing...

reviews.reviewTitle: speaker blew out after less than 3 months
reviews.reviewText: Have the original echo (which I purchased years ago) and it's still going strong. But the echo dot's speaker has already blown out. Not like I was throwing wild parties and challenging the speaker capacity. In reality, was simply using in a studio apartment and still, the speaker blew out today. Super disappointing.

Dose what they said it would . Had a friend set it up easy for him to do he used his smart phone .Very happy with it . Love i can get any kind of muice I want . She plays my local raido staions .comes in crystal clear.One of the reasons i bought Aleax was in the past i had bought 3 raidos they came in terriable as i live in a mobile home .Have played her just about every day .I also ask her the weather. Hope that can help .

reviews.reviewTitle: Great speaker, few things could be added though
reviews.reviewText: Very cute, practical and excellent response time. The information she gives when asked a question is short but good, it gets to the point of what you asked and cuts out all the extra stuff that isn’t of any importance to your question. Definitely better than Siri and most smart AI assistants, she can hear my voice over other sounds which makes talking to her in a crowded or loud house very useful and overall she meets all my expectations. The only thing I do wish is that you have more control of her over the app, for example instead of asking her to change the volume or going up to her why don’t we intergrate a control panel in the app that lets you adjust volumes to your liking, let’s you change the language she speaks or understands, changes the color of her circle light maybe from blue to pink or red or even cycle through a bunch of colors, have a mute botton on the app so that you don’t have to walk up to her and press the botton. There’s a lot of potential in the app that deserve to go with our smart buddy, it’s wonderful what we can do with our voices but if she had a control panel on the app it would make her better than any other smart speaker out there guaranteed.

reviews.reviewTitle: The sound wasn't great and I don't like having my privacy compromised.
reviews.reviewText:
I had the Echo Dot for around 10 days. Neither my wife nor I felt terribly comfortable knowing that Big Cousin was listening. I got another bluetooth speaker; one that's not voice activated. The sound on that one (Tribit) is far superior and it's equally compact and holds a charge a good long time.

I think until I am comfortable knowing that the tech is as protective of me that I want it to be (and it's not there yet), I'll pass on voice activation. I use it on my iPhone all the time, but in that case, to the best of my knowledge, Siri is listening only when I invite them to listen.

reviews.reviewTitle: Cute, compact, but not a know it all
reviews.reviewText: I like my Echo. It's cute, compact and fits and easy to set up once you sift through the fake and phony set up apps that come up when you type in "echo setup." a photo of what the actual app looks like, or some other information to assure the purchases gets the right app without pulling hair out would help. It's great for playing music, accessing info already on your phone, and getting basic information like weather, But its not Siri. Some information it can't help with.

It cannot link up with your iTunes. It’s a waste of money if you plan to use for music purposes. The speakers won’t even play what I am playing on my phone. It cannot be hooked up as Bluetooth speakers. If the music features are making you consider Alexa products you should not buy. Very faulty. Very limited and customer service has no answers besides we are working on it. I’m very upset about this feature and “skill”. Regular Bluetooth speakers would be a much better investment if you are looking to dabble in your music. I purchased this thinking I would be able to wake up to or work out to my playlists. But I can’t do any of that. Big let down and I highly recommend not purchasing for music lovers

reviews.reviewTitle: The sound is terrific and the size is small. A real winner all around.
reviews.reviewText:
I own one 2nd Dot, three 2nd gen Echoes, and have now added two 3rd gen Dots. The sound on these 3rd gen Dots is terrific. Much wider and natural sounding range, and better bass. Everything sounds so much more real and lifelike.

I never liked listening to music on of my 2nd gen Dot, but I love listening to it on these 3rd gen ones. I’m totally happy with this purchase... I bought 2. Now we have music and Alexa’s skills throughout our home, using these six Dots and Echoes.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love it. Much better than previous version
reviews.reviewText:
This 3rd gen is far superior in sound quality and accuracy of detecting words that the gen 2 device it replaced. The 2nd gen device is banished to the kitchen now!

Works flawlessly with all home automation and audio-visual devices in my bedroom and office. The Bluetooth sync to my TV's sound bar is perfect and flawless.

Only complaint is that the choice of songs/music that my amazon prime gives me is pretty lame. But that's not this device's fault!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy Setup and it seems to know everything!
reviews.reviewText:
I was hesitant to have this device for a number of reasons. However, I ordered one just the same, received it timely, setup the 3rd Generation Echo Dot and I am enjoying immensely. . so much I ordered another for myself and gifted a friend, enticed my non-technical older sister to have one and now we are all wiser and inclined to be inquisitive and learn its capabilities. There is not one thing that I dislike about it, although I do not use all if its features at this time.
Thank you!!!

Just amazing what the Echo Dot (Alexa) can do. The speaker although small in size has excellent sound quality. Playing music from iheart radio and amazon music is a snap. Connecting the Echo Dot to my Bose Soundtouch Soundbar system is so easy and switching from the Echo Dot speaker to my Bose speaker is simple. Just connect via Bluetooth and tell Alexa, Speaker. It just that simple. Love the Echo Dot. Looking forward to installing a few more throughout my home.

I want to love this product but I am sick of having to raise my damn voice just for it to work! And I live in a 400 square foot tiny home for crying-out-loud! I can be standing right next to it sometime and have to yell at it for it to register my voice.

That aside when it works I love functioning my house by all voice commands. 'WHEN' Alexia understands you! Lights ON and Lights OFF sometimes really confuses Alexia's old toaster parts! ;)

reviews.reviewTitle: Fun device to play around with
reviews.reviewText: I bought this to play music trivia with myself since I live alone. It's fun to do that and I have only begun to scratch the surface of its apps and capabilities. I like that it reminds me to do things and gives me the weather, Amazon notifications, and trivia for the day. Unfortunately, it is not compatible with my surround sound system that is throughout the house. I was hoping that the music could play through those speakers rather than it.

I had a first gen echo that was great and my son loved it. I thought I’d exchange it for this smaller version that looked nicer in his room. This doesn’t play ANYTHING she doesn’t recognize anything he says . It won’t play music . I have everything hooked up correctly on my amazon app. I also have an echo show that’s pretty flawless. So I think it’s a problem with the dots. I have 2 and neither get used because they are useless

Has all the functions of echo dot with the addition of a clock. alarm volume controlled bu up down volume buttons like with a plain echo dot. More than adequate speakers for music. Excellent value for the money.

My siblings and I decided to take advantage of the Amazon special and get the 6 months of Amazon Music with the Amazon Echo for my dad for Father's Day. He loved it and uses it all the time! We had no idea that the Alexa could do so much (this is our first smart speaker in our home) and it has been so entertaining. The rest of us in the household that do not have an Alexa are thinking of getting one for us!

When i say Alexa it wakes up then goes right back to sleep. Only way I can get it to do anything is by pushing the button and telling it and if I'm lucky it does the right thing. Google is so much better

reviews.reviewTitle: Smart little speaker with good sound
reviews.reviewText: Love it. Straight out of the box it blows the functionality of my apple HomePod out of the water. Why did I spend $350 on a HomePod when Alexa is so smart. Can make calls on my iPhone when HomePod couldn’t. Decent sound. Certainly the sound doesn’t compete with HomePod but I’m getting the other echo now for that. This I use in my office and it is perfectly good sound quality to fill a small room. Get this speaker. Only thing I wish is that it used a usb plug but the plug it has works fine.

I bought this to upgrade from a previous generation of Dot and I'mhappy I did. First, for $50 you get a great smart speaker. I use this in the kitchen because it's small and doesn't take up a lot of space.

Secondly, it sounds great. Amazon upgraded the speaker and it's much better than previous versions.

Third, great style. Rather than a plastic hockey puck this version has a better cover, feels more solid and has a better design. All in all, I love the Dot and what it can do.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great sound quality, excellent voice-recognition sensitivity
reviews.reviewText: Love the rich, deeper sound. No "tinny" speaker! Excellent range on voice-recognition tasks. Recognizes commands even while streaming music and talk radio. Good weight, stays put on surfaces. Excellent purchase!

There are a lot more reviews than there were the other day and I can see why. Amazon dot echo 3 is amazing, with room-filling sound and helpful skills that can help you with basic tasks for your everyday life. This is extremely affordable and portable. If you are looking for a great Alexa enabled device then you can't go wrong with this amazing device. Thank you Amazon for impressing us once again with your smart assistant enabled device. I can assure you that my review will not change. :)

reviews.reviewerName: Amelyn Randall ~ Double-Edged Words Book Blog
reviews.reviewText: I have a very poor memory, so the best thing about Alexa is when I remember to use her. The reminders, timers, etc. are priceless to me. My son gave it to me as a birthday gift and it’s the best gift I’ve ever gotten. So thoughtful. I use it every day for various things. I love the email tips and tricks that teach me new things I can have her do. I’m finding that she’s more important to me than my phone. Gasp!

I found it easy to set up. But, only after I sat down with my cell phone and did some reading. I now have 3 dots. I've replaced my radio in the bathroom with one. I have another in the living room. The third in the bedroom now has replaced my clock radio. I have alarms set with "Reville", "The National Anthem" and the "Marine Corps Hymn". That's enough to wake me and get me going. Sadly, I can't find one sound, a US Navy's ship with "This is a drill, this is a drill. General Quarters, General Quarters. (Then the klaxon alarm)" Experience from nearly 50 years ago would really wake me up. I ask for any type of music genre at night and it is restful. My only problem would be if I don't ask the question or command in the proper manner, it will come back with "I don't understand" or "I can't do that" or "Sorry, I'm not sure about that" or something like that. For instance, I just asked what time an English soccer game plays on Saturday. Alexa couldn't respond with an answer. I then asked the question a different way and I got the game location, game time and opponent. It can be frustrating, but maybe it's me.

Works great, somewhat better sound than my gen 2 dot. Setup was an absolute breeze. It cooperates nicely with the Echo Show in the very nearby kitchen, no voice conflicts, one always yields to the other based on things like which of them I’m closest to, or which has the necessary feature for carrying out the command. Slightly better looking than the older model. Consistently hears me clearly.

So we needed a new radio for our kitchen. Do you know it is hard to buy a radio now a-days? My husband and I decided to buy an Echo Dot for our replacement. We had help making our decision from a major electronic store worker. We loved the Echo Dot so much, that I have now purchased two more on Amazon. We listen to the radio on it, play games with it, select songs to play, and use the timer and reminder features regularly. My favorite part is adding things to my shopping list and then it is right there on my phone when I am in the store. We even bought a smart bulb, so we can use the Echo Dot to turn on the lamp and have it change colors. So fun! There are frequent sales, so I wouldn't pay full price.

reviews.reviewTitle: Bullet proof little hockey puck of joy
reviews.reviewText:
My Alexa went swimming in the toilet, into a bag of rice on the sunniest window sill to dry and back in business. good as new after a submersion.
And it isn't hard to change the preferences to shut down the buying stuff verbally function, so it will work with roommates or kids who can't be trusted not to buy too much. love it!
1 suggestion for improvement: a battery so i could take it out in the yard or carry it room to room without losing sound.

My husband and I have been having so much with this. Figuring out all the stuff it can do is an adventure. The sound quality isn't great, but we hooked it up to a speaker system and it works very well. The app leave a lot to be desired, I wish it was easier to navigate and had a little more guidance. Switching between user profiles was as easy as telling Alexa to "switch profiles/accounts," but it took us two days to figure that out.. I'm learning that sometimes the most obvious is the way to go.

reviews.reviewTitle: BIG sound, little package - same great Echo functionality
reviews.reviewText: Bought this little guy for our workout room. I wanted a discreet and most importantly - SMALL - smart speaker that had the exact same capability as the Echo in our kitchen. This little speaker delivers amazingly BIG SOUND for our 20ft x 15ft sized workout room. Same great flawlessly functioning software as the regular Echo too. Would definitely buy again. I just wish there was cordless version.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love it! Trying not to ask Alexa for help when I'm in places I can't bring Alexa. lol!
reviews.reviewText: Absolutely love it! My son loves to use it as well as my spouse. It works fine as a music player. I love how it can play incoming calls. It's like my mini assistant. I only wish it offered battery back up so I could move it to another room with me without turning off. Yes I realize I could buy more but it's still a nice feature. It's my favorite gift for Christmas! Thinking about buying more for other rooms and the kids room. Just depends on if they would actually use it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great little device for all ages.
reviews.reviewText: What can i say about this product other then i love it!! I love how she recognized my voice and can tell you who I am. The sound on this thinf is amazing!! Sounds like a bif stereo on certain song. My son likes how he can tell her to play his favorite song and she will listen. I did make sure i turned off voice purchasing on her. Dont want to accidentally have something ordered.

reviews.reviewTitle: Much better volume than previous model
reviews.reviewText:
Wow! I’m pleasantly surprised how much better the sound quality is with this compared to the previous model. So much louder.
It does have more sensitive “hearing” so sometimes it creeps me out when it goes off on its own. That’s why I gave it 4 stars instead of 5. Keep in mind if you have a TV or anything noisy nearby, it may activate the unit. Once it asked me if I was whispering. Creeepy!!

Getting Alexa to recognize my voice at first was very difficult. I had to reset the device to factory settings before it would work. Also, my Bluetooth Vava Voom speaker for half the price has better sound quality. It is useful to have to control other Bluetooth devices in the house with voice commands, such as lights and power outlets. I’m hoping I will find more uses for the device.. Devices seem to get confused with the Alexa integration, which is frustrating. I’m not really seeing all they hype yet.

I wanted to put another small round assistant in another room, so I decided to compare google to Alexa. I already have Google, and the ability to listen to Sirius on Alexa was the reason I wanted to try the Amazon version. Can’t say I can tell much different, but I think Google understands what I say better than Alexas. I would, however, say you can’t go wrong with either.

reviews.reviewTitle: The Echo Dot is Better Than Ever!
reviews.reviewText: After having the Echo Dot (2nd Gen) for a year and loving it I thought if take advantage of the Black Friday deal on the (3rd Gen.) Wow, what an extraordinary difference in performance. Way beyond anything I'd expected! She is much more responsive and the output is not too shabby. I have mine connected throughout the house on a speaker system. However, the speaker alone on the (3rd Gen) is astonishingly good all on its own which was quite a surprise. Upgrade if you haven't yet you won't be disappointed.

I received this from my son and his husband as a 70th birthday gift! I called to thank them and added that I hoped they were coming in to install it. But much to my surprise, the installation was a breeze (took about 3 minutes). I use it mainly for listening to music streams, and am finding I'm listening to more music and more new-to-me music than ever before. Have also used it for timers and weather reports. Still getting used to and learning all the features but loving this gift I'd never have gotten for myself.

We had about 5 of these including the full size ehco around the house. They seemed great but the more information you asked for, the less it seemed to know. It was hard to integrate with apps and we found it more or less useless. My favorite feature was Prime Music access. You can listen to just the artist as opposed to a station on Pandora. We sold the system and switched to Google which we find much easier. Both systems work well with Phillips Hue.

Whoever claims this new echo dot doesn’t sound too different than the original must not have actually compares the two. I ordered this new version because I can never hear my original playing NPR radio while I’m in my shower over the water running. The. Ew version gets easily twice as loud- so loud that at max volume, audio is uncomfortably loud. Besides volume, voices are much more lifelike and not ‘tinny’ like the original dot. The new dot is twice as loud and twice as clear.

reviews.reviewTitle: Setup is the devil, Alexa is an angel
reviews.reviewText: I'd honestly give this 5 stars, but the setup process was so infuriating I almost returned it. But after 20 unsuccessful attempts to connect my wifi to Alexa, and 5 unhelpful articles later, the wifi finally connected. I didn't do anything different, didn't change my position from the router. Nothing. It just decided to work that one time. But after all that she works really good. Very helpful with my sengled lights, and I love hearing the weather forecast while getting dressed.

I love my echo dot gen 3 so much I got my dad one. We all love it. Its super lightweight and goes with any room color. I got the slate gray for us both. The sound system is great. Its easy to setup and your phone can connect to it to play any playlist you may have through apple music or Spotify. The only downer is it is not a wireless speaker and has to be plugged in. It will turn off upon unplugging but it does remember it's setup and doesn't have to be reset.

reviews.reviewTitle: What a Big "punch" for such a small device.
reviews.reviewText: This is my first experience with an Amazon Alexa device and I read many reviews before purchasing. Many of the reviews have "things to say" regarding the sound quality. This is quite the small device and I don't think it is meant for a large space. I have it on a shelf in my bedroom and the sound is rich, bass is very good, and overall it's "clear as a bell" not "tinny" at all and I tend to be an audio snob. I have already made phone calls , which I like. I can't wait to try all the other features! I am quite impressed. Well worth the price.

I love this thing!! I signed up for the music unlimited as well and it's SO nice to have any song I'd like whenever I ask for it! The sound quality is amazing and the small thing can hear and answer from wherever I am in my medium sized apartment.
I've use it to ask cooking questions and I've even got Jimmy Fallon telling me jokes whenever I ask! There are fun apps "skills" that do anything from tell me ScoobyDoo stories to playing white noise.
There have been a few times I've asked something it couldn't answer and that was frustrating but not enough to take away from all the great things it does.

reviews.reviewTitle: Two out of three arrived broken!
reviews.reviewText: Two of the three Echo Dots I ordered for Christmas presents were broken when they arrived. Not at all happy, and customer service was totally less than satisfactory. Replacement for one was a REFURBISHED one, and didn’t include a charging cord. Then I was advised to return the other one for a refund. GRRRRRR.

I love the Echo Dot. This device can be so useful for setting reminders and alarms and reminding me to buy things etc. You can also have it play music and tell you things you want to know and the weather etc. It can literally do anything. They even have a microwave with Alexa built in if that tells you anything. You can just be like Alexa heat my food for 1 minute and BOOM! Done.

reviews.reviewTitle: If you’re looking for multi-room play the works consistently - move along
reviews.reviewText: If you’re buying this for multi room don’t bother. Constant frustration and aggravation. Music stops every other song. These started off working fine but after several software updates you’ll still find reams of forum posts with lost upset users with the same issues. Amazon seems to not even acknowledge the issue or publish a fix.

There are so many functions I like about my new Echo-Dot. First of all, I love music. Whenever a song comes to me and I start to sing, I'll say," Alexa, play We come to far to end it now, Smokey Robinson" and the song starts to play. Secondly, Alexa, play Jeopardy, and realized there's a lot that I don't know. But my favorite is Alexa, play relaxing sounds, Thunderstorm, Jungle night, etc. And when I ask her, the time, weather, recipe, exercise playlist, it's very handy. And I always say, "Alexa Thank you. I love Alexa.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa has made it to my house!
reviews.reviewText: After visiting with my daughter and 3 adult children, it seemed I would need one for my home in Oregon and they are on TN. My GD set hers to play a certain album at 9pm and go off at 10:30 pm. I thought that was really nice The boys had different , which were equally interesting. I need to reset Alexa since getting home from my vacation and get her on my WI FI. I think it will be great for finding recipes and turning off my office lights as I seem to forget them often,

reviews.reviewTitle: Not worth money - just by a better Bluetooth speaker and use your phone to control
reviews.reviewText:
It is actually kind of fun to set this device up, try different voices and give voice commands to tell you the outside temperature or play Amazon music. But I was able to do this with just my phone and a bluetooth speaker.

I find that the device frequently does not respond to voice commands. For example, if I command it to set a timer, it does set the timer and the timer does go off but I then cannot get it respond to shut the timer off!!! I literally have to unplug it and start over.

Some documentation says it can send SMS texts but it can't. It can only communicate with people who have other Alexa devices. This is a significant drawback.

Save your money - the technology doesn't appear to be ready yet. Lots of good Bluetooth speakers out there that sound much better than this. Alexa is kind of like a well-meaning but green intern in this device.

We have been using this for about 2 months and find it useful. I play music from it while cooking, use it for a cooking timer, ask the weather and other simple questions, love the smart outlet/ light compatibility feature and the drop in feature. I probably don’t use it to the extent you can but overall it has been proven to be useful. Only complaint is sometimes Alexia doesn’t respond and the complexity of naming/ assigning devices to the smart function.

Won't open any app on fire stick. Sometimes it'll search. But if you tell it to open Netflix, it only searches, and didn't even give Netflix in the search results. The boss baby is the first search result for Netflix. I literally got this JUST for the fire stick, and it's extremely pointless for that. If it does manage to give the correct result, it won't actually open it.

reviews.reviewTitle: If you love quiet don’t buy
reviews.reviewText:
I actually HATE Alexa and the Echo Dot but it’s not fair for me to rate it poorly based on my preferences and not on its ability to do what it’s made to do. The speaker aspect of it is actually really great for me. I use it to listen to npr shows’ podcasts. It’s crisp and clear. Sometimes I use it for music.

Why do I hate it so much that I don’t even leave it plugged in unless I’m using it as a speaker? I HATE having to talk to it. Can’t stand it actually. Which I realize now is the exactly reason most people buy it. To me it ruins my piece and well-being. Introverts should NOT buy it. I had no idea before it arrived just how irritated it would make me to have to keep speaking out loud to it. If I use it through the ap i like it more but still not a fan.

If you’re not weird like me, definitely buy.

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice device to enter the home automation era
reviews.reviewText: This was my first Echo device. After delving into the home automation scene I later purchased a Echo Plus and another Dot. My wife listens to music a lot on it and the Echo Plus went in the main family room. I moved the original Dot to my bedroom and the 3rd one when in the basement. I don't see the need in anymore at this time. I haven't had a problem getting any manufacture's devices to connect and work well that advertise compatibility with Alexa.

reviews.reviewTitle: Stay away if you use a Bluetooth speaker
reviews.reviewText: I replaced my generation 1 dot with this generation 3. They are both paired with a HK Onyx 2 speaker. The Gen 3 dot needs to me set at more than twice the volume as the Gen 1 or my Gen 2 dots. Glad Amazon is selling these cheap. The Gen 3 is by far the weakest sounding of the 3 and will likely end up in the junk drawer.

The new Echo Dot is kind of amazing for what it is - a full-featured voice assistant and Bluetooth speaker, all for $50 (often much less). The previous Dot was great, but the speaker was just barely functional - for music, it was better than nothing, but nearly anything else was better in turn. The new Dot is a massive improvement in sound quality - there's more extension on the high and low ends, and there's a warmth and depth that was completely lacking before. It's still limited by it's size, but it sounds much more like to the full-size Echo than it does the previous Dot. Despite losing a few microphones, it hears at least as well as the previous generation. With a soft fabric covering, the new Dot feels much more at home in, well, a home. It's a bit bigger than the old version and now requires a custom power adapter, but apart from that, it's an improvement in every way.
Mine doesn't do anything I ask it to do. Can't read half of my kindle books to me.

reviews.reviewTitle: Wow, sound is great improvement over last gen Dot!
reviews.reviewText: Super lucky to grab this deal for a buck during Thanksgiving specials (along with Amazon Unlimited music for 3 months, 99cents per month). I already have a 2nd gen Dot in the kitchen/living room area so this new one went in the bedroom. The speakers on this new Dot is amazing - stereo sound that a whole new level compared to the 2nd gen Dot. Amazing how Amazon has improved the sound quality. If you play music even somewhat often on your Dot, getting the 3rd Gen Dot is a must!

Did not work, was put in technical support & made to troubleshoot for 1 1/2 hrs to no avail then sent a refurbished one with no power cord! Amazon’s customer support has gone totally down in the past few years!!
So dissatisfied & won’t be signing back up with renewal. I’m tired of the lack of concern...

This takes some time getting use too and works with it. Some of the commands have to phrased in a certain way in order for Alexa to understand. It will come with time, I hope. Also there are certain apps or podcast I have trouble connecting to the Echo Dot. And if I have my bluetooth “ON” in my iPhone, it will disconnect any other Bluetooth device you may be using. This is annoying because it will keep doing it until you completely shut off the connection from the Echo. Other than that, in time I will get to know the commands and what Alexa understands. That is why I gave it 4 stars. I may come back to update my review once I get the hang of the Echo Dot.

reviews.reviewTitle: Blows previous generations away with sound, but amazon wants to make you sign up for unlimited...
reviews.reviewText: Sound is much better than previous. So glad I upgraded. However, amazon is ruining them. Unless you have amazon unlimited, prime songs are constantly being moved to unlimited and then unavailable to prime members. You may ask for a song and Alexa will play a “station associated”. Or she plays something completely different. Also, I have multiple echos, and the closest one is supposed to respond. That hasn’t been happening lately...the one in the other room may respond instead.

Enormously useful when it's not a jerk. A long way from human understanding, kind of like trying to get an eight year old playing with Legos to pick up his room. The functions of being able to manage home heating and make shopping lists as things occur however (the lists appear on your mobile device, so you always have them at the store).
I am working on communication, and I suppose so is Amazon. In the meantime it's not perfect but highly useful.

reviews.reviewTitle: Makes life better for elderly to call or get info..
reviews.reviewText: Bought this to add to existing base ... in elderly mother in laws bedroom.. we have them mainly so she can just say.. Alexa call........ and can contact friends or family.. she can’t see well enough to dial a phone and can’t remember numbers.. but gives her ability to call for pleasure or in emergency..we have base in living room and this one in bedroom ..so from anywhere they can hear her voice..

reviews.reviewTitle: love it - why did I wait so long?
reviews.reviewText: While I really, really, really wish there was a way I could play songs/playlists from my iTunes library, I do love how easy it is to request songs of Alexa or play playlists from Amazon Prime Music. Music is much more a part of my day now. I come in the door with my groceries and request a song while I'm putting them away. Washing dishes? Request songs. Also ask for alarms to be set. Still discovering what all Alexa can do. A fun toy, and what a deal at $24 on Cyber Friday.

I have many amazon devices but this was my first dot, I bought it to use in my bedroom and absolutely love it. Very easy to set up and integrate with my other devices from the Alexa app. The sound quality is great, I’m actually surprised how loud this little guy can get, it fills up my entire second floor when I play music. Exactly what I was looking for to add to my amazon family.

I have 5 Alexa devices in the house from a Spot, a couple dots and a thermostat! This is by far much better than the 2nd generation dot. The sound quality is great for what it is. Especially setting up whole home sound playback! It’s great to have one in the bathroom for music and news, the kitchen for recipes and timers, the bedroom for alarms and controlling home automation. The Alexa platform is extremely versatile and once you get the hang of it it’s hard to live without them!

I have used the dot for 2 months now. I have it in the dot wall mount(sold separately). Alexa is able to hear me and follow commands from the next room. The dot max volume is pretty loud. The sound quality in the dot is decent, however the wall mount does muffle some of the sounds. I can’t imagine life without my Alexa devices, and having the dot in our bathrooms is an easy way to announce to the house when you need toilet paper, or play music in the shower. Or ask Alexa the time so I’m not late to work. Highly feel everyone needs an echo dot.

reviews.reviewTitle: Had it for about a month
reviews.reviewText:
Overall its ok, I used it during the holidays for music, and also daily news casts.
Its just been over a month now, and honestly, I have not used it in the last week to 10 days....
It does take time to learn all the possible commands.
Would I recommend it, not sure really. Its enjoyable at first but to some degree, its another piece of technology in my life, and really, too much tech in ones life gets annoying.
The sound quality is good....

reviews.reviewTitle: Never worked and horrible customer service. Not what I expect from Amazon.
reviews.reviewText: This dot never worked. I trouble shot it several times with Amazon which is documented, it is still not working. Amazon have a generous trade in program. I want to trade it in for a show. They will not trade it because it does not work. The customer service agree if it worked I could trade it in. I am beyond frustrated. I have spent three hours at least trouble shooting this thing on the phone with them.

I got this echo for my dorm room and it is a must have in my opinion. It was really easy to set up, however had some issues connecting, but that was more of the school Wi-Fi rather than the Echo itself. The sound quality is great and I use it more than my Bluetooth speaker due to its convenience. My one concern is over how amazon handles privacy, but that is an institutional issue, not relevant to this product specifically.

reviews.reviewTitle: Initial Set up issue but service awesome to fix!
reviews.reviewText: Got as gift for childs room for music and alarm clock. She loves it but she uses it for basic items. It got her to sleep in her room more regularly at night. We have a few throughout house and had an issue getting this one set up which is why I only gave it 3 stars. Called tech support who was fantastic. I’d give the person that helped us more than 5 stars as she had to try a few things. And getting thru to a live person could not have been easier. But now works great.

reviews.reviewTitle: What exactly is it good for?
reviews.reviewText:
I didn’t buy this from Amazon. We got it free when my wife bought the Ring doorbell camera elsewhere. It works great, but for the life of me I can’t figure out what I need it for. Music sounds ok, reads me the news briefing, and tells me my Amazon order is on it’s way ( which I already know). I have other things that play music much better.
What the heck do I need this for?
Update, I have plugged it. Just one more thing taking up Wi-Fi bandwidth.
