reviews.reviewTitle: So far I'm really liking this little smart speaker
reviews.reviewText: Alexa doesn't know how to respond to every command you can think of yet but does a great job at what it knows. The speaker quality is great for the price and voice recognition is great, it almost always knows what I'm saying even when there is other background noise in the room. So far I've added a smart plug and I've bought a smartthings hub as well. I plan to add additional lights to my smart home in progress.

reviews.reviewTitle: It's Big, Heavy and Its Wood...
reviews.reviewText: They made it use a different power supply, because the 2nd generation was being used everywhere. I don't think its as good at voice recognition, but it sounds little better. Having stereo is nice, there's two 3rd gens in the room now. There's not a lot more to say, everyone has one of these things. Alexa gets better, sometimes it amazes but most of the time it annoys. Lower your expectations.

I love the Dot! Its small, stays out of the way, and is the handiest thing I've bought in years. She makes my shopping lists, my to-do lists, tells me the time, the weather, tells jokes.

I really can't see any difference between the Dot and the Echo, except for size and price. I'm told the difference is the speakers -- but really, I can't tell any difference in the sound quality.

I will eventually have a Dot in every room.

reviews.reviewTitle: My second favorite non-human!!! Only her big sister is better!!!
reviews.reviewText: OMG! It's like having a companion that only eats a little electric to keep her running. She knows so much and can learn so much more. As far as being concerned about being under surveillance!?!? Who cares??? I have nothing to hide, so spy away!!! As for the convince, well everything I want to know is right there and her response is so quick. She may not understand me some times, but then no one else does either! Superb sound for such a small unit. I love it!!!

Alexa responds to voice commands is good for asking simple questions weather time temperature does integrate easily with Kindle and fire stick however Alexa lacks a lot of skills that my Google Assistant can do very nicely unable to make phone calls access reminders etc I'm sure things will improve since I only paid $12 because if a prime special and a gift card I really can't complain I got my money's worth.

reviews.reviewTitle: The Echo Dot support team scammed me out of $450.00
reviews.reviewText: I called in for help when I couldn't get the set up done. Was directed to a Mr. Mike Harvey who proceeded to tell me my system had a major virus. He said he could correct that issue. He needed to access my computer and Amazon Account. He said because I was such a good customer I won a $100 gift card. He just needed me to complete the CC number to apply the card to. Instead he bought 3 - $50 cards and sent them to another email address. He then accessed my email and AMAZON account - deleted all transaction notification and removed them from Deleted and Archive history. I asked him why he did that and he said they were just taking up space. I told him to put them back, but did not. He was going to update my anti virus. I got 3 $100 Google Play cards that he said would be reimbursed 75% after the program was installed. Well no program and not reimbursement. And I still can't use my DOTS. I am very upset and discussed that AMAZON would have that sort of business going on. I have contacted my bank to file a dispute claim.

Great product that can also work without a transformer- 100 to 240 volts. The sound quality from this little device is amazing. I am hoping that before the end of the first half of 2019 that Amazon upgrades its geographic features to include the Eastern Caribbean Islands to get 5 starts from me.

Enjoy having multiples of these now cause you can do music in all my rooms as well as drop in on people and stuff is neat... Some family members have gotten some as well and that could be interesting since they're states away in still getting to know what it can do
I do wish there was a better way to see what fit my life than just exploring.. they need like a test thing to fill out that will then suggest use of done functions rather than just new things to try

Our first Echo Dots were second generation, and performed reliably and well. The sound quality, however, left much to be desired, so we use them these days as inputs to larger sound systems. They work OK for that purpose. The 3rd generation Dot, on the other hand, has significantly better audio: highs and lows are much extended, clarity is impressive. And they seems to easily hit twice the volume to boot. On top of it all, they look much nicer. Well worth upgrading.

My favorite aspect is the colored lights. I love that I’m notified when I’ve received a shipment. I enter through my garage, so I need a reason to go to my front door. Alexa helps make sure I get all my packages. I also absolutely love the fact that it’s handsfree. I always forget to put music before I start cooking, but the dot makes it SO easy. I love, love, love it! I already purchased a second one :)

This is an amazing piece equipment. You can do so much besides playing music with it. There is so much to learn you really need to buy instruction book to take full advantage of this amazing piece of equipment. We have our inside and outside lights turning off and on At certain times which is great. Good night time we have a sleep sounds that put us to sleep. Buy a couple you’ll use them

After 6 months of ownership my Dot started to malfunction. It was playing music randomly, often waking us up in the middle of the night. After spending 20 minutes with tech support I was told it needed to be replaced........... at my cost! My mistake for not reading the fine print, only a 90 day warranty! I was offered a 15% discount on a new one. Seriously? When they go on sale they are 50% 0ff! I will be selling all my Echo products and changing brands....

Sound quality is quite good. Plays lots of good music.
Pretty responsive to my voice requests, even from next room. Plays good guessing game with my grandkids. Good for news and weather. Cons: poor set up instructions. Tells you to download Alexa app, but not specifically which app. I downloaded wrong app and had to call for further instructions.
Also, there is no online list of free music available. Have to find out by trial and error to learn what is available without monthly fees.

reviews.reviewTitle: Buy echo and enjoy life at home
reviews.reviewText: Never thought this little magic can do everything just by saying what I want! I enjoy music and any thing that I need to know in seconds without search in phone just calling Alexa and enjoy it with relax , the sound close to the Bose mini Bluetooth speaker that I spend $199 on it.. really the speaker of the echo dot crispy and and the bass balanced and very good like most expensive speakers get one and don’t waste your money on something else unless you want to damage your ears and pocket..

I was very, very excited to see these units work as I purchased two of them on Prime Day, and to my surprised they are amazing. The sound out of these small unit is quite loud for being the size they are and the sound quality is very good, not perfect, but for the size they do themselves justice. I would recommend them, especially if you get the Amazon Music subscription that I got for one year with one of them. The Voice Recognition is very good. Every so often you need to repeat yourself, but overall is is very good.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa is part of our home now!
reviews.reviewText: Our family uses Alexa for everything! We had the Echo Dot 2nd Gen & just updated to the Echo Dot w/ Clock 3.5 Gen & what a noticeable upgrade with the sound & the visible display showing i.e. Clock, Temp, Timer, etc. We couldn’t be happier with this purchase! The Echo dot will be used for years to come! If you have a Gen 1, 2 or 3 I highly recommend upgrading to the 3.5!

reviews.reviewTitle: A GREAT gadget for your smart home
reviews.reviewText:
We recieved one of these when we purchased our Ring Security system. It was the Amazon July deal. I set it up in our bedroom and it works well iwth our Ring Security system as well as our Kasa plugs we have set up throughout the house. I ended up purchasing an additonal one for my home office!

PROS: Size, easy to install and set up, color
CONS: None noted

reviews.reviewTitle: not playing clear tones turning off when it wants to
reviews.reviewText:
I play music but the tone is not clear I don't know how to clear its a very low base tone why is that
Please answer as its hard to listen to not up to par
this dot is not working properly its shuts off when it wants to it doesn't play what I instruct and just is not right
I thought it was me but I just had a friend that knows the product and he says its not working properly
what can I do Can I have another Dot to replace this one Its very irritating I am annoyed as I am a one person office and want to listen to radio station also soft music and it continues to shut off or not play what I ask pat loffredo

I had a Google mini first... Then I got echo to see side by side which one was better.. Echo sounds way better... I don't have to repeat my self as much with alexa... Alexa actually does what I ask... The Google was always having to be reset and tried to do things I didn't ask...over all is have to say Alexa owns this... However it was nice to be able to change the voice on Google...and it was actually polite.... I said thank you to it one time and it complimented me on the nice way I asked... I tried it with alexa and she didn't notice

So far so good. I have multiples and enjoy the intercom feature. Only complaint is one of the 4 has an issue where the person on the other end hears an odd noise like feedback but only while they talk. Present from multiple devices contacting the one. Also get occasional devices dropped off the network and have to pull the plug and plug back in to get it to reconnect. I have purchased smart plugs to allow me to power them off and on remotely to remedy this.

I never thought I would use one of these Echo devices, but now have 4 in my home! They are so incredibly convenient with regards to getting weather info, listening to music, and a plethora of other things that can be automated. What really takes Alexa to the next level is when you start integrating smart lights or smart outlets in your home and gaining the ability to turn lights on and off with either your voice or through your phone! Great thing for people who hate getting out of bed to turn the lights of at night haha!

reviews.reviewTitle: Poor job at recognizing various things
reviews.reviewText: I will ask, "Alexa, play the song that goes..." and say a lyric from a song, and it never gets it right. Not even close. It also does a poor job of answering questions or will tell me irrelevant answers if it actually does come up with an answer. I can ask simple questions such as, "alexa, are CFL or LED bulbs brighter?" And I'm always met with a "hmm, I dont know that one". I wish I didn't spend all this money on putting one in almost each room.

reviews.reviewTitle: Device sound quality horrible after 3 months of use!
reviews.reviewText: The sound quality of my device totally crashed after just 3.5 months of use (right after the 3 month warranty expired)! Everything has static in the background and all voices (Alexa and voices on podcasts) sound like they have a horrible lisp! I contacted Amazon customer service and their only advice was to buy a new device with a 15% discount. If the quality of this device is so poor that it only lasts 3 months, then clearly it is not worth re-purchasing. I'm extremely disappointed in the quality of this Amazon device and cannot recommend it.

I purchased two of these for my sons at Christmas. We already had a Google Mini at home I received for free and they loved the concept.

Let me just say that there is no comparison in the microphones, responsiveness, and most importantly, the speaker sound. The microphones pick up from other levels of the house. The sound is double that of the Mini. The speed of the processors and response is about instant. I love the product and I am looking into other amazon speakers to replace the Mini.

reviews.reviewTitle: I love Alexa! Suck it siri!...
reviews.reviewText:
I don't know what I did with my life before Alexa. I use this echo in my bathroom, and it is everything I have ever wanted. I know I am probably not using Alexa to the fullest, but for what I use her for, she's excellent.

I just wish the unit listened to more than single commands and didn't require me to say "Alexa" before every command. But other than that, I love it!

reviews.reviewTitle: It's a good looking addition to my room
reviews.reviewText: Basically the same as the previous generations bu the fabric cover hides the microphones and make them less accurate than the models with the top mounted microphones. I actually think the 2nd genertion works better and actually sounds better. The physical size is a little larger but the older models produce better music & voice. I don't think anything is actually better than the sales price, for, $29 it's a bargain.

It has a slow response. Picks up background noise easily. I was setting up Alexa to recognize my voice and alexa picked up the noise from the fan
Not really enjoying it but I have to say "Alexa" for it to continue or I need to sy "Alexa" twice or three time.
Setting up alarms and what to play when the larm sets are easily done.
Overall, I have mix feelings about this device.

I needed this Echo Dot (3rd Gen) for the visible clock feature for both daytime and nighttime use. The auto brightness feature works great for the two lighting extremes. I also have grown to really like the fact the current outside temp displays when you query Alexa about the weather. We are now officially an 8 Echo household, including the original Echo and the Tap!

reviews.reviewTitle: This is #2 for me and I love to discover the ways to use Alexa
reviews.reviewText:
I had to put my first Alexa in the kitchen because I taught my husband to use it to put things on the grocery list.
I use the timer and weather feature and answer questions I don't know when I am watching "Who wants to be a millionaire". The 2nd one is in my work room. One thing for sure - Alexa helps with my calendar and she is great at spelling. Get one for your parents - they will love it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent audio quality for the price.
reviews.reviewText: I have been invested in the Google Home ecosystem for a while but after Amazon's purchase of Ring, I decided to give the Echo a try. Alexa is able to respond to some queries a lot quicker than Google, particularly with home-related things like turning off lights or changing the thermostat. What I was not expecting was the awesome audio quality this speaker puts out. It's not earth shattering, but for the price it's really deep and clear. I use it for audio almost every day. I will be purchasing more to start replacing the Google Home Minis in my house in the near future.

...…. update. I cut mine in half with my new dewalt bandsaw I bought from amazon. Made quick work of it.
Also found a battery of some sort in it. maybe just a capacitor. either way this thing has power for a bit even when you unplug it. This product needs to be outlawed. Googles bad enough. I don't need amazon listening into my household.
Thanks and stay vigilante for products that invade your privacy fellow amazon shoppers!!!!

I love my dot!!! It’s everything as advertised and more. I love being able to play games on the dot with myself and my family, but I also love that I can link it up with other dots to play music or communicate back and forth.

The only problem I have is this: every so often, it chooses to sound almost tinny. It’s only just slight enough that I notice it. It doesn’t last long but it does happen. I don’t think this is common to all Dots, probably just mine individually (so don’t think they all sound tinny- it actually has incredible sound when it’s working in full function!)

I have been recommending this to all my friends. Sounds amazing with all genres of music and very helpful with the alarms and reminders and news reports.

Overall its an somewhat of ok smart assistant. Issues: Integrating it with another amazon speaker is not easy/its pretty bad because it would either not play in sequence with another speaker or even worse is when you would ask for a song to be played on one speaker in kitchen for ex and it would play in a living room while kitchen one will be silent. Dont really know why it does that. Speaker vise its pretty weak but its tiny and packs fee features so expected. Another issue is phone connectivity. It would connect to the phone play music for like 4 mins and just silent itself. No matter what you do it wont play anything until you disconnect the phone 🤷🏼‍♂️ Rest of the features its ok. also when it does connect only one speaker will play off the phone which is annoying. Alexa needs to become a little smarter with answers too. Rest of the features its fine.
Had a tough time getting it hook up to my pixel 3, never did get it to work right. Directions are HORRIBLE cannot get it hooked up. What a waste of time will give it to somebody smarter then me.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexia hates me & we fight a lot!
reviews.reviewText:
I guess whe works fine I just think she doesn't like me. Maybe it's a woman thing.
It works great, just adapting to never having one so learning how to "talk" to a coded computer & learn what she understands versus what or how we are asking her to do things is tricky. She does seem rather obstinate & stubborn like the dreaded mother in law that doesn't listen when you tell her then kids need to go to bed kinda stuff.
Can't compare to a 2nd generation other than it looks cooler.

I purchased this, my third Echo device to replace a radio in my office that was going out and sounded terrible. The new Echo Dot was a great alternative. Since I am an Amazon Prime Member, I have free access to Prime Music and with the Echo Dot, I am able to get access to a huge amount of Amazon Music and even radio stations by using Echo Skills. The sound quality is outstanding and it is easy to control and change music without having to get up out of my chair and go across the room. I would highly recommend the purchase of an Echo product for many needs and even as I did, as a replacement to a radio for music.

It was a Christmas gift from our son and his wife. It was easy to set up and works well. I have noticed that various Sirius/XM channels play at very different volume levels and must be adjusted after starting to stream each station. Also, the sound is a bit inferior compared to some bluetooth speakers with which I am familiar. I find that my wife, who is not tech savvy or friendly to any large extent, uses it as much as I do. A good basic beginning.

We LOVE our alexa devices! We now have 4 of them throughout the house. After a "summer cold" I had to spend a week in the guest room to avoid contaminating the rest of the house and there is no TV or radio back there. I ordered the Alexa dot for the back room and can play all of my pandora favorites on it. It is a GREAT device and we appreciate amazon offering this product at a discount during their July sale!

Alexa me eschucha y me contesta siempre por cualquier pregunta o deceo,,, ATENCIÓN ALGO IMPORTANTE PARA TODOS LOS AMIGOS DEL SUR AMERICA. MIRA LA PRONUNCIA DE TU IDIOMA,MUCHOS SE MOLESTAS PORKE NO CONTESTA....ALEXA ENTIENDE ESPAÑOL Y SE TU LE HABLA CON PALABRAS DE TU PAIS ELLA NO TE PUEDE CONTESTAR..EN TODOS LOS PAIS LATINOS Y YO SOY DOMINICANA LO SE SE HABLA ES UN ESPAÑOL MIZCLADO... ALEXA ES UN ASISTENTE Y NO UN MAGO.

The new Echo Dot 3rd Gen is heavier in weight and is better looking and has a deeper and more resonate sound.
I believe it has more volume than my original Dot. The transformer is also larger, the Dot 3 feels warmer to the touch
than my Gen 1 Echo Dot. The new fabric exterior adds a touch class and gives the new dot that finished look.
In conclusion :Winner Winner Chicken Dinner !!!!

I love the convenience for playing my favorite music from Amazon music or Spotify. Love the ability to quickly learn the weather and latest news. Love the Alexa features. However the Alexa app can be a bit clunky compared to a typical Apple designed interface. I bought the dot as a trail to see if I like the concept for my home. Okay sound but nothing to get excited about. Will upgrade to the larger and better Alexa speakers in the future.

I bought this and a Google Mini over Christmas just to play with and compare. Long story short, the Google Mini understands me better and seems very much more natural and adaptive in its understanding and replies. I have not used my Echo Dot in a month even though it's sitting on my desk here at work plugged in - it's just too frustrating. (I love Amazon and own several Amazon tablets - I sure hope my review is not rejected.

ii bought the 2 because my mom is bed ridden. after her last fall, i thought these would be the best way for her to get a hold of me. FAST. well, 2 weeks ago she feel and the dumb thing dd not preform like i needed them to do. if, i was able to return, i would of. But, after 30 days i am stuck. i have not checked them after this. I cannot get stressed as i am also disabled.

reviews.reviewTitle: Fun as long as you understand the intrusions
reviews.reviewText: Very simple to link to my laptop, did recognize my small grandson trying to talk to it and wouldn't respond. It's probably true that "someone" can listen in so we simply unplug it should we decide to have a personal conversation within earshot. I also didn't link it to my phone. Very good at picking up music selections, answering questions and keeping alarms going as needed. Excellent deal for $30!

reviews.reviewTitle: Better Sound Quality Then 2nd Gen, Less Sensitive to Wake Command
reviews.reviewText: Have a 2nd Gen and this 3rd gen. Sound quality is DEFINITELY improved, but anything about volume 7 (which is pretty loud) only distorts sound and doesn't get much louder. I do have some complaints on the far field mics vs the 2nd gen. It doesn't seem to pick up "Alexa" command as easy. Could be my placement location, but I've had issues in 2 separate locations. The redesign does look nice and fits well with home decor. I use this in tandem with multiple Alexa devices and I'm overall pleased with it.

The Echo Dot replaces my aged alarm clock with a few more high tech features my clock radio was sorely lacking. Plus, it takes up less space than the clock radio and can be voice-controlled rather that stumbling around in the dark trying to find the right button and applying the correct pressure to shut the thing down. Less stress, especially in the morning, is certainly a major selling point for me!

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy addition to my Echo Dot family!
reviews.reviewText: I use the alexa.amazon.com application to chat with my Dots instead of a phone app. The setup routine easily recognized a new addition, helpfully labeled it as Dot 2, and I was pretty much up and running. The hardest part was to establish a group to play music with, so that whatever song I requested would play through both Dots. Here again the setup routine helpfully suggested "Everywhere", so now I just append that word to the end of my song request.

We very quickly have integrated this device into our daily lives. The kids quickly discovered it can play their favorite music on command - currently the Mamma Mia soundtrack. We immediately changed the name to "Computer" so we can feel like we're on the USS Enterprise monitoring the neutral zone. We love the daily trivia games and the routines you can set. The Dot tells our kids to go to bed at 8pm and the listen to it! My sister has one so we set up drop-in and then had to give the kids ground rules. We can't be connected all the time! We are very glad that you can restrict who can drop-in and what Dot can accept a drop-in if you have multiple. I can see us getting more and creating intercom system in the house.

When we get the smart light bulbs I am adding "Lumos Maxima" and "Nox" as commands to turn the lights on and off.

No issues with voice recognition even while playing loud music. Alexa integration is good however so far I've been unable to use it as an additional speaker for my surround sounds which I thought I could. Sound Quality is very good considering how small it is. I have not figured out how to do any of the following so far: let the dogs out, make dinner, clean the house, and when I asked Alexa to make me a sandwich she replied "okay, you are a sandwich" which I thought was very disrespectful.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not as great as I was told.
reviews.reviewText: The sound is not nearly as good as my I thought it might be. Also I get quite a few disconnects that makes using the thing a pain in the butt. It's be just sitting getting no use now due to it not working like it should. Everything thing else that's wifi works with no issues in my house. Yet the dot seems to have issues staying connected all the time. Looking into the Google options now. All my friends have recommended the echo line so I figured I'd give it a shot. Must have got a 🍋. Gonna go shop the Google offering and see if the grass is greener on the other side.

I have two of the 2nd generation dots. I upgraded because I read the audio was better. I won’t lie. The 2nd gen was awful Audio. I got a regular echo for music and connected one of them via aux to a speaker. I figured for the holiday price, it wouldn’t hurt to see what the audio improvement really was.

I have to say. I wouldn’t say it’s the best audio ever, but it’s got more bass and a better sound. I am impressed. And I’ll probably get a second one to pair stereo sound.

Def impressed.

Good product but no convenient wall mount system. Not everyone has room on a table. Can the engineering geniuses at Amazon develop a “Plug in a wall outlet” Dot with the Power Adapter built in such that it leaves a plugin free? The attached photo shows a mount for the Gen 2 and was as good as it gets several years ago. Not only does the current mount stick out further but it covers both outlets. COME ON ENGINERS. You can do better. Make us an all in one.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy and fun to use. Over 40 and thrilled I bought it.
reviews.reviewText: I am not technologically savvy at all and I no problem hooking this up. I bought one on Prime day and then bought an additional two for my home and some smart plugs. I have Alexa in three rooms and set up now to be able to utilize my smart plug so I can turn the lights off and on as I come in or out of the house or up or down the stairs. I get my morning briefing on whatever topics I choose like how many days till the next holiday. I had no smart items in my home and my cell phone is 3 generations behind and I found this easy-to-use and actually a lot of fun. I did sign up for Prime this year so I got the Prime music and all I have to do is tell Alexa what song I want to hear and it plays. My kid meowed at it and Alexa interacts and meows back. It's really just a lot of fun if you're over 40 like me and afraid of this, don't be, it was extremely inexpensive and I have a Galaxy S6 and that's what I use to set it up and I'm really glad I did this.

I had to have assistance to setup my WIFI with Alexa but we got it quickly. The sound aspects with my new Dot are beautiful! Really resounding and selections of Alexa's abilities are vast. Easily setup Alarm, listen to my Music list, ask daily the weather, upcoming forecast. I had wondered if I'd really use an Amazon Device but this Alexa or Amazon Dot is a very pleasant addition to my household. Even my Cat loves listening to Alexa's voice...and the animal sounds!!

Adorable little Dot has been way more fun than expected! Bought as a gift, my daughter claims she has a new best friend😂. Music sounds great, ease of use is awesome, only downside is as a gift for teen on my Prime account, I still had to help w setup due to some restrictions which was a little frustrating. My only complaint would be for Amazon to work out that kink, but overall we are more than pleased with the quality and affordability! Absolutely recommend

reviews.reviewTitle: At least try this! It's as simple as just an Internet connection 🎄
reviews.reviewText: The only reason I'm sharing the next part is so it's understandable just the ease of use this product is! I've have a small amount of brain damage due to an accident. This is not only easy to use but WONDERFUL! I stopped listening to music because I had trouble with setting things up but this puts off a perfect sound. I live in an apartment so surround sound wouldn't work. I compared this dot 3rd generation to a small Bose I used to have. But don't get me wrong I love Bose and naturally gravitate to that product line. I love it and might get 1 for my sister! She never treats herself and this is not expensive 🎶

reviews.reviewTitle: Ask question first and if you use these systems off your cell phone , have them set it up .
reviews.reviewText: Well received the echo as a gift and thought it was awesome , until I tried to set it up and that's when I realized after 4 hours and not being able to set it up easily , I put it back in the box and went back to using the radio .. I love things simple , like put in the mod,e you have into Amazon Alexa , down load a app , plug in your echo dot connect and set up and your on your way , it turned into a nightmare .... I had to drive a half hour to gave me this echo and ask them to set it up and still no luck another 4 hours wasted , it sure would be nice to have simple set ups right off your cell phone to these Alexa systems , I gave it away to a friend and told him good luck ... don't need complicated systems in my life ..

reviews.reviewTitle: I want to love it but I’m just frustrated!!
reviews.reviewText: I’m becoming so frustrated with this thing!!! I bought the Black Friday bundle with this and the new 4K fire stick. It seems to be flipping impossible to connect the two together so I can control the fire stuck with voice commands through the echo dot- which is the main reason I purchased the dot along with the fire stuck. I wanted to love the dot as much as I love the fire stick but I’ve been tempted the chuck the thing out the window!! Hopefully that won’t be necessary... but ii

reviews.reviewTitle: Works great with Hue light bulbs
reviews.reviewText: I bought an Echo Dot after seeing my sister's during a visit. It looked like fun. In reality, it has been very useful. I have a couple of hanging lamps with cords but no inline switches, and using the Echo Dot with the Hue light bulbs, it's easy for me to turn the lights on and off or dim them at any level. I also use it as an alarm clock and timer. I'm sure I've barely skimmed the surface of what it can do.

Alexa is really a blast. I love the things this thing can do. My gripe is that there is not enough info provided relative to using the applications. I found it almost impossible to set up a calendar. I went on line and selected the top site offering help. It turned out to really be one of the computer scams for buying new protection that does nothing and has no relation to Alexa. I could not find a manual to download.

This echo is much louder than the second generation. I bought this as a back up to my second generation echo. I got curious about the volume level after reading a review. I have to it better than my second gen. I retired my second gen echo to the garage and put this one in the bathroom. Its louder and clearer, and can be heard in the shower with the shower going. And I got it for $22. During Amazon week!! Win... Win

I've been using this gadget for the summer time while the kids are home. I set routines on the Echo to remind the kiddos when to complete certain tasks, or to remind them to eat their lunch, while I'm away at work. I also use it to drop in from work to check on my younger son who doesn't have a cellphone yet. Its been useful! The kids really enjoy playing music on it and asking it random questions.

Got one in a special pack with a Ring Doorbell Pro and got hooked. I bought 3 more during Prime Day and have them in various locations. The one for my husband is used in his shed just as a speaker when he plays music or talk shows off his cell phone -- all we had to do was pair it. Got all of them hooked up to Alexa in very little time. The sound quality is more than sufficient for our needs!

reviews.reviewTitle: Highly recommend! Does look and work fantastic!
reviews.reviewText: Works great! After getting an Echo Plus for my living room...I really wanted one for my bedroom but didn't feel another Plus was needed. This definitely fit the bill very well. I feel it actually hears me better than my Plus does! Does look fantastic and sound, while not as good as the Plus (obviously) and it's not a $180 Bluetooth high end speaker, but it does it's job and sounds pretty damn good.

reviews.reviewTitle: Dots work great even without an Amazon Echo
reviews.reviewText:
You do not need to have an original Alexa to make these dots work! I had misunderstood that and that's what kept me from getting one sooner. I ended up purchasing 2 of these Echo dots and we have been using them since Valentine's Day. I have five children that have had a lot of fun having Alexa tell stories and jokes.
One thing that I really like is the ability for me to drop in on the downstairs Echo dot using the upstairs Echo dot to relay messages to the kids that "can't hear me".
Since I have Prime and lots of Prime music for free, I use it for music often.
Another feature that I had no idea about but use everyday is the ability to stream any radio stations using TuneIn.
I can stream those all day long, to my location in Utah from their location in Pennsylvania, and the sound quality is great!

reviews.reviewTitle: This is our first echo, and we have been very happy!
reviews.reviewText: We're always thinking of something while we are dressing or in the bathroom! It has been so good to add something before we forget it! At night we listen to ambient ocean waves that shuts itself off in an hour. We are really enjoying it, and when I miss the reminder it shows up on my phone, YAY! Our son's family is able to help us while we learn. There are videos on youtube also! We got the package with the smart plug and used it on the Christmas tree!

At first I was really enjoying my dot. Our whole fa liked asking it questions and listening to music. I have it in our bathroom because our 3 year old daughter likes listening to nursing rhymes and sin in the bathroom tub. We have the volume about halfway up and the speaker sounds like it's blown out?! We only had it about 4 months. At first I was thinking about getting one for each level of the house. But now that it sounds so crappy....I think I'll stick with my Bose speaker.

reviews.reviewTitle: Useful but technology not all the way there yet
reviews.reviewText: I love this smart little thing! But I honestly always forget I have Alexa until she reminds me to take my medicine or wakes me up in the morning with the gentle alarms I schedule. She's only struggled once to connect to the internet. The Alexa app could use some work since it's hard to find what you want and doesn't have everything available in the routines app. Like when I say "Alexa, good morning" I have her respond with traffic conditions to work and the weather for the day. But I can't add the reminder to take my medicine so I have to make that separate at the same time everyday which sucks since I don't say good morning Alexa at the same time every day. I also work at two different locations so I'm unable to get the traffic and weather for one of the two locations since there is no option for a second workplace address in the app and what days to set it at. She also could be more friendly to comments about mental health issues from users.

After deciding to buy an Alexa, I researched the different models before selecting this one the current generation. It is easy to set up and use although it does take a little while to remember what to say when using it. For example, Alexa turn on the 1st plug and NOT turn on plug 1. We also have been listening to Amazon music with it.

Just the size and quality of the sound overwhelms me. My friends have a lot of fun with it. If ever one who tells me that they're going to buy an Alexa, after seeing mine, should lead to new business. Alexa is the way to the future. Enjoy the technology now and the future devices will be easier to adjust to. I like Alexa for accepting other applications plus Amazon. I am totally impressed with the amount of music offered by Amazon. I didn't this until I got my Alexa.

reviews.reviewTitle: Third generation dot offers so many improvements!!
reviews.reviewText: We bought this dot for my daughter’s room. She mainly uses it to check the weather each day for school. She also turns on and off her light because we paired it with a Smart Plug. She also sets an alarm on it for each morning. The third generation sounds so much better too! I have a first generation dot that I use for talk radio because music sounds terrible out of it. The third generation speaker is leaps and bounds better!!

My amazon echo dot is not working properly. You need to speak real loud and repeat your requests multiple times.. Dot
Alexa didn't responded when ask for simple command, I will say Alexa .... the light will come on for a second and no respond. very frustrating. and embarrassing when you have guests. Nothing what I expected. Also it force you to purchase a premium monthly package which is ridiculous when you are already paying for amazon prime..

reviews.reviewTitle: Not worth the stress repeating yourself.
reviews.reviewText: Turns off randomly, doesn’t respond. Says it’s working but clearly no music comes out. It does what it wants and I’m dissatisfied with buying two. I’m throwing all three away since amazon does not want to help me resolve these issues. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY ON FRUSTRATING SPEAKERS

reviews.reviewTitle: Have 2 in stereo, working great, even for music
reviews.reviewText: As I mentioned, I've got 2 of these paired together, I've got them in my bedroom and primarily use them to play music while I try to get to sleep or clean and they've been working pretty well for that. Don't usually play them loud but I did see what they sounded like at max volume and I was actually impressed. Not perfect but I was definitely expecting worse. It's also nice that they will light up when a package arrives at my door. Plus combined with the Fire Cube it's nice just be able to ask Alexa to turn off the TV and to play music for an hour while I try to sleep from the comfort of my bed.

The echo dot is okay, but setting up the wireless on the app is hard. You really have to search to get to where you can enter your wifi password so it will take. When setting it up it would say you are connected when you actually are not. The sound quality is not good. It will not connect to peripherals except another echo. I would not have kept it but it was a free promotion from a sirrusxm subscription.

reviews.reviewTitle: The Echo Dot (3rd generation) is AWESOME!
reviews.reviewText: Well we got the echo dot for Christmas and absolutely love it. It is so helpful with schedules, listening to music, turning on/off lights with our smart plug, and so much more.. My favorite is the "flash briefing" which I've set mine up to hear a verse of the day, a positivity statement, and of course, my news and weather for the day. We've used meditations, white noise, and so much more. Love to discover new ways Alexa can assist us where needed or, or learn new things it can do just for fun!

reviews.reviewTitle: still unsure about the Echo Dot
reviews.reviewText:
First it took 9 days to arrive even though it is a prime item. Did an online chat regarding this and she said it was out of stock at the local amazon warehouse. With that being said after it was shipped it still took 5 days and everything about this order said 2 day shipping. I was also suppose to get a $15 credit and that never happened.
On to the product itself, it was relatively easy to set up, however I did have an issue initially. I got it set up and I love it, after about a month the speaker started to have static in the sound. I turned it off because it didn't go away then turned it back on the next day and it played fine for the hour I was listening to it. I hope it was a fre. ak thing and continues to play well. Still disapointed with Amazon customer service.

reviews.reviewTitle: Never knew we needed Alexa until now!
reviews.reviewText: After my family used an Echo Plus for a few days, it quickly became apparent we needed more of these in our house. I waited until the Black Friday sale ($24/Echo Dot) and picked up four of these for our house (and two more for gifts for Christmas). If you buy on the same Amazon account and have saved your Wi-Fi password during the initial Echo Device setup, then these will pair auto-magically and it only takes about 15-30 seconds after plugging them in to get Alexa up and running.

The overall sound and performance of the new generation echo dots appears to be better and excel over previous versions. Sometimes it's just an image in your mind but in this case, the changes are apparent and real. Are they vast and profound enough to warrant replacing all your previous generation echo dots with new ones? NO! But the changes are sufficient to warrant paying a little more for the newer generation if you have a choice when you make a purchase.

I bought this for my birthday. I love Alexa! She is helpful, remembers things and is lots of fun! When we have friends over we play some of the game skills and always end up laughing and having a blast!

My echo did randomly disconnect from the internet (I have two, this generation and the second generation) when the other one was fine.. I had to reset and restart it up to get it to work.

That's been my only thing so far, otherwise I love it!

I absolutely love using my echo dot. The setup was very trying at first. I couldn't get it set up and I tried over and over again but it wouldn't accept my password. Finally after looking for similar situations online I read to move the dot closer to your wifi box for setup. Although the wifi box is only in the next room, literally about 15 feet away, moving the dot closer did the trick! It set up very easily after that and now works like a charm.

reviews.reviewTitle: Would have returned, missed window by one day...
reviews.reviewText:
Very nice build, great sound for small speaker! Three stars only cause I don't really have any use for it and a few small blocks...

First, in the month I've had mine, I've asked what the weather is maybe 10 times and when it decides to work, would turn my Xbox One on/off.

Also, cant play my own music through speaker... Huge downside, you can only use things like Amazon music or Spotify or something. I actually like owning my music and don't want to pay for a music service to stream music while also taking internet bandwidth from other things in the house. I don't need to call out specific artist/bands either, just being able to call out play/pause/shuffle would be great for my own music playing.

I would have returned mine, but apparently it only has a one month return window and it is literally the day after... Nice if you can find uses I guess.

reviews.reviewTitle: Hardest gadget to connect; use alexa.amazon.com instead!
reviews.reviewText:
Connecting this gadget should not need to be so hard! That is why i'm cutting 2 stars. The app didn't work on my phone (Google Pixel 1); it would hang on the screen "Manually connect to Echo Dot" after connecting to the Amazon-XXX SSID (even with my phone's Mobile data turned off). I finally had to connect using a Chromebook to alexa.amazon.com before I could configure the Echo's wifi! Come on, Amazon! It took me an hour of googling to get this connected. (Thanks to reddit for the solution!)

Everything else about it works perfectly once the setup issue is resolved.

About a week after I purchased this it is now making weird noises. Like static noises and Apple Music integration is terrible. Overall not at all satisfied and will try to return it because I got it recently enough and haven’t moved it from the counter or anything so there is absolutely no reason this should be happening and do not understand why a week after setting it up to the best of my ability (because Apple Music has not worked) and it shouldn’t

reviews.reviewTitle: Stopped working after a few months, spinning blue circle and unresponsive.
reviews.reviewText: I purchased my Echo Dot in Jan 2019. It worked fairly well (I was disappointed that it would not play my Apple iPhone podcasts) until all of the sudden at 6 months it just stopped - only a continue blue spinning circle but no response. The instructions said to hold down a button on top until the orange light reappeared. Nothing. And no other options. So a waste. I loved the voice activation but 6 months of being operational? So I was out of warranty by the time I got around to calling tech support but to their credit they did try to help with over over an hour of trying everyone had already tried to reset the darn thing. They sent out a new plug to see if that might help. Still just an endlessly spinning blue circle. So overall I would have to say it was a wasted $50. For very limited use.

We purchased first one and then three more of the Echo Dot 3 units. We enjoyed them at first but the novelty did wear off. We use them primarily for intercoms and shopping lists, both of which works well. My main gripe is that they are not programmed to tell you how to use them, what steps are needed to perform common tasks, i.e. how to interconnect with each other, what can you control. Any question is that regards usually gets the same comment from Alexa, "Hmmmm I do know that." There is only so often you can can and wait in a cue for answers. Alexa is a dumbed down Siri as far a facts are concerned.

Upgraded from the previous model and impressed with the 2 major changes:
1. speaker sounds amazingly good by itself.
2. IF, and when I want to listen via my bluetooth speaker I only had to sync the initial time, to listen through my bluetooth speaker all I do is turn my speaker on and it automatically starts playing through the speaker. Previously had to sync speaker each time I wanted to use it. Small upgrades but worth the price.

reviews.reviewTitle: GREAT SOUND FOR SUCH A SMALL SPEAKER
reviews.reviewText:
I love this little thing! We have the Echo 2nd gen and I like it too.
This one is heavier, so it's not as easily pulled around on a desk or tabletop. It still has the rubber on the bottom to keep it from sliding, but even with that, the small amount of extra weight just gives it more stability, I think.
The sound is a lot better than the 2nd gen. It's clearer, and being able to change the equalizer is a nice touch, too.
I think the sandstone is cute and practical.

1. disappointed by the automatic setup. I still don't know how to name a pod, i.e. TV ROOM
2. There seems to.be some incompatability between mod 1 &2 and the mod 3. Durring installation, the older pods started doing tasks without command.
3. There should be a volume control for the mic. Mod 3 has trouble hearing the wakeup command.

One very bright star for the sound output. The tone quality is excellent.

reviews.reviewTitle: Buy one! You won't regret it!
reviews.reviewText:
Wasn't as impressed as I thought I would be when we first got it. Now she is used a lot and have a couple plus the show.
I love getting the weather, setting timers (great for my 3 y.o timeouts) and best of all My shopping list!!!! I'm the type of person that needs a list of my lists!
This is just great to tell her as I go, as I run low on something in the kitchen, I'm telling her to add it to my shopping list!

reviews.reviewTitle: kids love this. Sound is excellent in my opinion after accounting for size
reviews.reviewText:
It took me under 5 minutes to get this online though I still need to tinker extensively with integrating it I don't forsee this being an issue. I would give it 5 stars but I have only had it for 24 and want more time first. My first impressions :
- it is solidly built as it is heavier in the hand than expected.
- It's sound is very good for its size.
- I have a 6 yr old 4 yr old and 2 yr old. They were transfixed by the joke function which has been pretty hilarious to watch.
- It does a surprisingly good job finding songs if you know the artist and song name though performance I find so far is significantly worse for song title alone.
- I actually was trying to talk to it within 10 minutes of setting up. It is very good at encouraging a conversational approach. I do a lot of dictation and I struggle with dragon not understanding me as wel as I would like but alexa does well for single commands
- a Con is the initial fun of conversation grinds to a halt after about the 2nd step of the conversation. Alexa for me thus far really just does 1-2 step interactions and nothing more complex.
- Overall very happy with purchase. Very interesting gadget. I think I will find legitimately useful applications in the next month or so for it even with a mostly "dumb" house currently

reviews.reviewTitle: Cant sync more than 2 speakers together and have to be the same speaker....
reviews.reviewText: I would give it a 5, its loud and sounds great. BUT, you cant connect it/pair it with the bigger Amazon echo? Seriously amazon come on. Your amazon speakers have so much potential and were basically revolutionary 6 years back when you released them and now they're already obsolete because you dont want people to be able to connect them wirelessly... if you have the money go with SONOS, better quality than bose and has built in alexa features and you can sync them all together

I bought this on a whim on prime day along with the Firestick. Little did I know how much I would actually love both of them! Alexa is so handy in the mornings when I need to start my routine, letting me know the weather and the latest news. I was extra excited when I realized I could connect my Spotify and play from the playlists that I already have instead of making them on Amazon music too.

reviews.reviewTitle: Mostly OK, but could be much better.
reviews.reviewText: Purchased primarily for music in living room and kitchen. Good sound quality, but performance is sketchy and capabilities are limited. Paired stereo (two echo dots in living room) works, but frequently one speaker or the other “ignores” the first 5-10 seconds of a song then starts mid-phrase and plays properly until the next song whereupon the same symptoms repeat. Only fix seems to be unplugging both dots and restarting them. We’re also very disappointed that there is no way to play music from our own library.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Option for Music Throughout the House
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this device to create a network in my home. This is an upgrade from the second generation dot I have owned for a while. There is a definite difference in sound quality between the second and third generation dots. I used the second generation dot in conjunction with a Bose speaker. The additional speaker is not needed with the third generation. Setup was easy.

reviews.reviewTitle: Disappointing. Bluetooth and multi device play back extremely limited.
reviews.reviewText: Disappointing. I am a big podcast listener and had hoped that multiple series 3 would give me Bluetooth audio on all designated devices so that I could move freely through the house listening. Unfortunately, ain’t going to happen. Stereo pairing only works with two series 3 devices on streaming music services. Or hear the end of the egg timer in the bedroom instead of just the kitchen. What is Amazon thinking? This is not a heavy lift.

3rd Gen: slightly larger but not so much as to create a space issue if you are replacing 1st or 2nd Gen. Also, it has "cloth" which may not be as easy to wipe clean but I personally don't touch my unit much... so no accidental cheetoes finger prints left behind. The upgrade to this unit is most definitely in sound quality and volume. I recommend the 3rd generation.

I purchased as an impulse on Amazon Prime Day, mainly to use as a music speaker, UNTIL a friend told me about all the great things Alexa can do. Our whole family enjoys all her amazing features. I also feel like I am finally catching up on some of our ever-changing technology options, while it gives me some serious piece of mind in regards to her communication features and security system syncing.

reviews.reviewTitle: If you work from home and have conference calls this is a necessity
reviews.reviewText: I cannot believe it, but this is also an IP Phone, and I used it to dial into work conference calls. This was an amazing surprise because it relieves my cell phone and land line from being used for the conference call. So on top of telling Alexa to wake me up with classical music or hip-hop, and getting the news, and playing music, and controlling whatever else is connected, I can make phone calls to anywhere, and still use my phones for other calls (I multi-task).

reviews.reviewTitle: Why would I not give this a 5 star?
reviews.reviewText: Probably so some home user does not switch power supplies to a standard mini USB supply, the power connection on the 3rd generation Dot was switched to a one piece power supply that can not be interchanged with any other supply, because of the redesign to a non USB connection. the size of the adapter ends up taking more space on the outlet and makes the second outlet mostly unusable. It is more of a square cube in shape instead of long and skinny like the 2nd generation.

reviews.reviewTitle: The sound compared to the 2nd gen echo is tremendously better!
reviews.reviewText: I had 2 second gen echos which worked ok, but when i hooked one of the third gen’s up and played a song the sound quality is in another world. Its like going from mono to stereo. Since you can now adjust the bass, mids and highs just wow. I ended up getting 3 more to basically setup an all home speaker system which sounds pretty darn good for the money. I have thee of them on outlet holders which makes rhe sound even better and keeps them off tables. Also the look is much better compared to the 2nd gens.

This speaker is perfect for anyone that wants alexa but wont be playing alot of music through the speaker and still wants it to look good. The sound quality is still good to play music but the full size alexa will perform better in that aspect. Get everything alexa has to offer in a smaller package with the stylish fabric on the newer models. Overall great alexa device!

I purchased 6 of these to use in our large two-story home as intercoms/alarms/radios. The system was absolutely seamless to set up via the Alexa App. These little machines are brilliant! No more shouting up and down the stairs! The kids love listening to the radio and the sound quality is MUCH better than expected. The microphone can pick up commands from more than 10 feet away!

We are a google home and got this alexa as a gift. It's pretty cool, kids love it because she's more responsive than google...meaning she responds sooner, has an actual answer instead of the usual "I don't understand" blah blah blah comment google responds with. Kids have stopped using our living google and just use alexa for all their commands and music instead. I still love my google though for things alexa can't do regarding non amazon related stuff.

I purchased this echo dot after I used echo plus for a few days. We put echo dot beside our night stand so that we do really need to yell in order to get the echo plus that is in our living room to respond. Echo dot pretty much does almost everything that the plus can do from my stand point of view. We really enjoy what the echo dot can do for us. The only weakness that I would like to point out compared to echo plus is its sound quality. If you really would like to use the speaker for music, I would suggest an echo plus or even higher end echo products.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good device but a bit confusing
reviews.reviewText: While the Echo Dot does a good job at most things, I'm not clear on how to connect devices to it. I have gone into devices on the app and I thought I had done what needs done but it isn't completely clear on how to make this thing work with Fire TV, etc. Sound is reasonable for a small speaker. I have noticed that while listening to music it will sometimes stop playing for no apparent reason.

I've had the Echo Dot for a little over three months. It comes in handy every day, and can be useful however if you want to use this on a regular basis for a music speaker invest in something else. I only had the dot turned half way up listening to music during daily chores around the house and the speaker blew. Now even the voice of Alexa is super crackly and distorted and really annoying. I was really excited for this product and now I am just rather disappointed.

I've purchased this item at the end of the year 2018.
Got a faulty unit which has bad speaker quality, during the setup process and 90% of the time the speaker was working (playing music, responding to my request, etc..) - the sound comes out of it was like the speaker is damaged.
I've contacted Amazon support (which were great!!!!), 3months afterward, and they sent me another item - the 2nd one suffer from the same issue - but less, its happen only 20% of the time - still annoyin'.
Both units connected in different areas and on the same network.
I've got 1x Echo 2nd generation, 1x Echo Plus 1st generation & 1x Echo Plus 2nd generation which are all working great!!!! (they all located at the same home, using same WiFi).
Would buy only the "higher level" of Alexa speakers next time.

reviews.reviewTitle: Sound quality is suprisingly poor for an Amazon product
reviews.reviewText:
I like the access to information and the integration with our RIng doorbell. But, compared to our Google Home Mini, which sits next to the Echo Dot, the Dot is a Dolt.
Very disappointed that Amazon didn't do a better job on the sound quality and controls (which I've maxed out to try to "sharpen" the sound) for a product that's supposed to be "leading edge".
Not anywhere near it!

I received this a gift last Christmas but didn't get around to setting it up until this May so I am still figuring things out. I like the daily briefing of weather and news, the Question of the Day and playing the extra Jeopardy clues. I also set reminders and make lists. Sound quality is not fantastic but okay for what I use it for. Alexa, for the most part, understands what I am asking/saying and responds appropriately. Still playing around with this gadget but I am enjoying it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love the sound level and clarity on Echo Dot generation three
reviews.reviewText: Really enjoying this 3rd generation echo dot! Sounds so much louder than 2nd generation echo... speakers on this new one are awesome! We love it! I would recommend that you place it out in the open, as we put it under our cabinets in our kitchen at first and it sounded muffled, or echoed off the speakers I just know it didn’t sound good, however, once we moved it out from that area a little bit it sounds great! Very loud And clarity is awesome

We have a variety of Echo devices. We keep the Dots in rooms where we have a smart device like a lightbulb or smart outlet. Example is having on in a nursery with a smart light. You can simply tell Alexa to turn on/off the light without having to get up and disturb holding your child. From a music standpoint the sound is great and the biggest benefit is having all Echo devices connected in a group so you can play the same music throughout the house.

We got these for morning alarms with the Phillips hue lights, for the teens, so we can take there phones and I pass away at night. But we are having a difficult time with the programming. The music is Spotify family account that have saved library’s on them (so we don’t want to switch five users to amazon music). Only one Spotify account user will program at a time and if we want to play the same music on two or three we can not do that. You have to move the music from unit to unit verbally if you want it in the room your in. If the registered user leaves the house, then the music goes to bluetooth in the car and leaves the ones at home unusable for music. So perfect for prime users that like amazon music. Speakers quality is good. The lights have to take up a Ethernet port on the router. That would be fine if all the teens didn’t think they needed to be hard wired in for faster gaming speeds. So the lights never work when the teens are home (they unplug them to use the port). Trying to an additional router to resolve and having issues getting the Phillips light bridge to reconize the new router. Hope this was helpful to other families that are thinking about using them with kids.

reviews.reviewTitle: She's quite handy to have around
reviews.reviewText: I was kind of nervous about having an electronic device 'listening' to our every word, but honestly, when I think about it, my phone does exactly that with Google. I wouldn't have bought this, but I got the Echo Dot for 99c because I ordered a year of Audible. Now I'll probably buy another one. I use the shopping list, playing music, timers and asking about the weather the most so far.

Firstly, I wish Alexa could do web searches. And not like a Google home but at least basic things. Anyways it has good bass but I wish the volume could be louder. You can't hear it from another room. But you can talk to Alexa from another room. There's alot to do with Alexa it's just finding it. The Alexa app is a problem though. Alot of the times I have to keep reconnecting Alexa. Only thing I say you probably need the app for is the skills. Other than that the app is useless.

And I don't know if it's the Alexa itself or the Amazon music app but I can't play music from the music app to my Alexa. I used to be able to but now it won't connect.

this was a rlly great product and i loved it.. my family now has one in all of the main room (kitchen, parents room, my room, and my sisters room) we can all talk with them saying things like breakfast is ready or calling.. you can also [play music, set alarms/reminders, and more... theres a few tweaks that could be made but idk how to describe them and thats why its four stars.. it was pretty easy to install mine but some of the others in our house were kinda confusing.. also, mine and my sisters got mistaken and the names changed so we had to rename them.. rlly minor things tho.. i love it and i think its rlly great overall :)

reviews.reviewTitle: It's Part Of The Family Now
reviews.reviewText: Didn't realize how nicely this little thing would become as part of our daily lives. Got Christmas music playing while making coffee in the morning, I use it to see what time it is so my son doesn't miss the bus as we get ready in the morning, constantly use it for reminders (so I dont burn cookies anymore now, yay!). Also did things like I didn't even know theres a Spongebob game u can "activate" in the skills section that tells u orders and then u gotta listen then pick one of 2 options to tell spongebob what to mak, etc and my 6 yr old loves it. Also got ambitent noise skills and such (birds, rain, fan, etc) which helps me goto sleep. Also bedtime stories to tell my kids at night which is cool cause I've read most of all the books I have already. It does much more to be sure but these are the main things I use em for, best $25 bucks I ever spent! (was on sale at the time). PS Alot of ppl said the dot doesnt have great sound but I say for the size it is, it has a decent speaker in it. I got a 1400sqft ranch home and i can hear it any room of the house with it only being like 50-75% volume.

reviews.reviewTitle: Big improvement in sound from Generation Two
reviews.reviewText:
I have two gen 2 Dots, and use them frequently. But never for music. The sound quality was just too lousy for that (I'm spoiled - we have Sonos in our home). This Gen 3 has much much better sound quality. In a pinch, I do use it for music. Looks nicer, too.

I do wish Amazon would have an alternative voice. Those who have hearing loss can usually hear lower tones more easily - we need a MALE Alexa voice, PLEASE!

Alexa is the main reason I got an echo dot which works way better than Siri on my HomePod. She actually recognizes my transcriptions. After I adjusted my privacy settings I felt more secure about the transcription reviews. Don’t expect the echo to completely blow out of the water sound wise however it has a good sound for the size of the speaker. You can also connect it to other echo speakers as well which would provide a more powerful sound. I have bought a second to run some of my smart stuff in the house and I find it super convenient and the price wasn’t bad either.

Nice sound, easy to install, love the new design, and the price point makes it super accessible. I was reluctant to buy it initially. I thought I’d poo-pooh it, but I ended up getting it for the kids’ room after all because they love listening and dancing to music. I have come around and have to admit it’s an awesome little gadget that has exceeded all expectations. The few people complaining about the new Echo Dot need to seriously check themselves. It’s great!

I have been using the Google home device and had no intentions of switching. I had some privacy concerns about Alexa after reading things online that gave me pause.

I got a free echo dot as part of a deal I got on prime day. I really didn’t even want it. Thought about selling or giving as a gift. However, my 7 year-old saw it and insisted on opening it. Admittedly curious, I did set it up. We started adding things to my grocery list and asking questions. I was blown away with how much better the voice recognition is (even for my younger son). Alexa understands it. I love the music and the convenience. It’s now the google device that I’m going to give away. Alexa is such a good product and I’m already addicted in spite of myself.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not only Alexa device, can be used as Bluetooth speaker, too!
reviews.reviewText: The echo dot is a great addition to the Amazon Alexa line up. Amazingly, for such a small speaker, it has great sound! Alexa hasn’t had any issues detecting our voices and I really enjoy the “drop-in” (intercom) feature. This speaker can also be used as a Bluetooth speaker if you don’t wish to connect the device to your internet. Just have her search Bluetooth connections to sync with your phone.

I traded in my Echo version 1 for this. The Dot's speakers are better than the original Echo by about a billion percent. It's also ridiculously fast compared to the old Echo. For $30, you really can't go wrong. Now I've got lightning fast commands to just about everything in my house (TVs, Stereo Receiver, Nest, Blink, Hue lights, EVERYTHING). The best thing (and sort of creepy) was that I did no setup. I plugged it in and (I guess) since I already had the Alexa app on my phone, it just set itself up. Plugged it in and it was working. That's how smart home equipment should work.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa Does Not Understand Many Requests
reviews.reviewText:
Pros:
Great for getting the weather and time
Good for playing Spotify with voice-commands

Cons:
Snooze function on alarms is unreliable. Sometimes they do not play. I have been late to work because of this. Also, you cannot set multiple alarms at once. If you have trouble getting out of bed like me, I would not recommend this as an alarm.

The speaker quality is just decent. If you have seen the Despacito ad, you will be disappointed that you cannot ask Alexa to play the non-remixed version. There have been many times when Alexa has played the wrong song.

The biggest con is the lack of information available. Trying to Google stuff with a voice command is pretty useless. 90% of the time, Alexa does not give me the correct information. This is a big deal breaker. Fortunately, I got this as a gift. I feel bad that the person paid $40 to get me a weather machine, timer, and mediocre speaker.

Overall:
They should have trial periods for Echo devices. People will understand how disappointing these things are.

reviews.reviewTitle: Does a lot for a little Dot
reviews.reviewText: This is my second Echo Dot. Extremely easy to set up. I like the looks of the 3rd gen. My other dot is 2nd gen. I went on line to see what it can do and there are numerous "skills" that you can chose . Which leads me to my only complaint. There may be an answer and I don't know. So what frustrates me is in "my skill" I have to scroll through to find them. I would like an easier and faster format. Like alphabetical that I can click on or similar to my phone list. It has a lot of cool things it can do, but if it takes too long to find them or I forget what I have then I won't use them and Dot does very little but answers an occasional question.

This Echo Dot is probably the best thing I've ever bought from Amazon! I absolutely LOVE it! Alexa can do so many things, you will be so pleased. Every day she wakes me up with a positive message and also with history facts of things that happened in History on that day. How cool is that?? I have synchronized all my playlist from "everywhere" and am able to play any song from the whole Amazon Library. It's awesome, and I will probably buy another one for the bedroom soon. Alexa teaches me something new every day. Buy one, you will not regret it!

After the super easy set up, the Echo Dot performs exactly as you expect. The voice recognition is fast, and the sound quality is acceptable. It's much better than a phone speaker so its bluetooth connection is very helpful. The fabric on the outside is fantastic and the overall weight of the Dot is very nice.

I would like more customization like a custom wake up word, nickname when talking to me, more alarm sound options, and ability to play youtube audio.

Overall this is a great little home device.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great sound quality, and fun device!
reviews.reviewText: I must admit, I was rather skeptical about getting a device with Alexa, but this Echo Dot is awesome! Not only does it look nice and have great sound quality, but it also is a lot of fun. My children enjoy asking it for knock-knock jokes, and other silly questions, and we all enjoy playing the word games Alexa has (especially the escape room game). On top of that, it looks nice too! My wife even uses it to check the weather forecast, and for recipes.

reviews.reviewTitle: “It’s always listening” for the wake word
reviews.reviewText: Appearance-wise, it’s beautiful. The power cord is not the same as the 2nd gen so if in case the cable is lost or needs replacement, if there’s still warranty that’s good, if not then that’s another purchase. The setup is easy enough. I find that the green ring is always running waiting for the wake word to be spoken so it’s always listening. I haven’t been able to load the history to delete recordings so I’m giving it a 4-star

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo is great but the Alexa app is buggy!
reviews.reviewText:
The item came on time. As usual, flawless transaction from Amazon.
I'm enjoying the Echo Dot but irritated that the app is glitchy. The Echo itself works fine but the skills catalog wont load completely so I can only enable skills that randomly pop up on the home page in the app.
I have searched online for information and read reviews of the app in play store.. seems like there was an update last week that is causing issues for all users.
Allrecipes skill isn't helpful at all. Despite finally figuring out how to enable the skill and installing the app, Alexa can't find any of my saved recipes in my favorites.
Pandora works great, as do random questions. Over all, I'm pretty pleased but anxious for bugs in the app to be fixed.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa Makes ME PULL MY HAIR
reviews.reviewText:
I never write a review and rarely read reviews cause i think there rigged
but today im writing one. To say that google out shines alexa. Alexa blabbers on when you ask it something. It gets me angry...it makes my blood pressure go up. Its hard of hearing and when it hears, it hears something opposite of what i tell it. Nothing compared to my google home. Im returning my 3 echo 3s and going on to try the home pod and to see if that works better. Also it didnt work with my LG OlEd tv nor My samsung Soundbar N950. It kept saying the bar wasnt found even though it was connected in alexas device list. So yea buy it and find out the hard way

This Echo Dot is a beefed up version of the first Dot by Amazon. The speaker is noticeably stronger, which is really the only reason to get it, as it is identical in function to the first generation. It does pair with other speakers for a stereo sound, but I have not found this to be useful since we virtually have one in every room and when you play to the group the whole house becomes a speaker! The stronger speaker is DEFINITELY worth the extra $10.00.

reviews.reviewTitle: Fun but not as impressed as some
reviews.reviewText: We don't hate it. I wasn't as happy with getting these as my husband was. We use them for verious things around the house. Several voice commands the manual says to use seem to confuse Alexa. We have quite a few bugs to work out. Supposed to connect to our Roku TV doesnt. We are supper upset but a little annoyed because again it should. I wouldn't ever want to pay full price for these

I am very pleased with the Echo Dot 3rd Generation. I said that this was a great toy because other than making it simple to look up information on a phone or tablet. So far it has allowed us to be true couch potatoes since we can ask Alexa to turn on and off lights. My wallet prevents me from getting some of the products that work with Echo Dot/Alexa, but again the value isn't there for me.

reviews.reviewTitle: Best personal electronic assistant out there.
reviews.reviewText: I cant imagine life without my Echo Dot. It really has helped get my life into order. When I wake up in the morning "Alexa, start my day" She gives my the current weather forecast. She keep me up to date on the current news, daily facts as well as traffic information. ..what my commute to works looks like. Truly my best buy of 2019! I have yet to fully utilize all that Alexa is capable of, but I know that when I do, i will not be disappointed.

Does a lot. Sound is FANTASTIC! When it works. It tells me "Sorry. I cannot find the music" several times a day on Pandora and Amazon Music. Or just does not play at all. And I bought it specifically for that. Support does not have an answer, though they keep saying they do, and I tried everything they said PLUS went on the Forums. Not impressed with Gen 3 and/or whatever is causing the problem. Didn't happen on my Gen 2.

I finally decided to get this device a try . I recieved the Echo dot in the mail and after 3 hours of attempting to set this thing up, emailing and speaking to customer service on the phone and trying every suggestion they had to offer, I have come to the conclusion that this product is not worth the time or effort. Customer service suggested that it may be my Internet connection. But since every device in my home connects it is not my Internet connection. It is the Echo dot. I am sending this back. Thanks for nothing Amazon.

reviews.reviewTitle: don’t keep her boxed in! she won’t hear you.
reviews.reviewText:
pros:
- pretty decent sound quality!
- alexa is nice and can help you with a lot of daily tasks
- fast! a lot of different reactions to the same questions.
- whisper mode is an amazing feature! great for when I don’t want to wake my pet.

cons:
- if you keep her in a sorta boxed in area (shelf, for example) her ability to hear you from afar is cut in half.
- the noise it makes when you have a notification scares me every time
- my family hates having one in the house because they think she listens to us

overall, i invested in one for speaker usage for music. over time, i became more comfortable using alexa for daily tasks, asking about weather, news briefings, etc. very helpful for a college student!

The dot I received was defective. After 20 minutes on the phone with Amazon's rep, the unit will not connect to the wifi. Then they expected me to drive to the UPS store and ship it back to get my 99 cents back. Ridiculous, this thing is going in the trash. I'm VERY disappointed with Amazon's poor product and even worse customer service.

I really like this Eco Dot. Love it’s sleek, unobtrusive design. For a relatively small machine it packs an incredible, high quality sound when playing music. I was able to easily link my Apple & Pandora subscriptions in addition to Amazon Prime Music options. Use as a timer, alarm, cooking sous-chef (converts measurements...), shopping lists... Got it for $22 on Prime Day which didn’t suck! Definitely recommend!
It seems to have only for mics rather than 6, but seems to work fine with that. I'd estimate that It's about 20% larger and wroth it because of the noticeable improvement in sound quality. I like it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Poor sound quality versus previous generation.
reviews.reviewText: Produces a very poor sound quality. Although the speaker is louder than the first generation the sound quality is not good. Listening to a podcast or talk radio, voices give off a rattling, tinny, and distorted sound. This even happens just using Alexa. I would not recommend. I have four of these second generation speakers that replaced the first generation. I wished I would’ve kept all of the older versions. These Gen 2 echo dots are just placed in areas of convenience but are very annoying to listen to.

I receive an Echo Dot for my birthday from my son and daughter-in-law. My husband loved being able to choose songs (as did my grandchildren who are here every afternoon.) When they kept choosing songs unavailable, my husband signed us up for Amazon Music. That lead to the idea of surround sound by putting one in our living room to sync with our family room. And then one in our master bedroom upstairs was even better. So now we have surround sound and intercom capabilities without cutting into our walls or ceilings. Very happy!

I just received my 3rd generation to add to my collection. It was very easy to setup and works fine. The reason I prefer the second generation is because of the power plug. It does not use a USB adapter. The power cord is all one piece. I prefer the other for portability and the use of wall mount. It’s also larger than the 2nd gen. It’s supposed to be better looking. In my opinion it’s only a slight improvement. Although, I did not mind the look of the 2nd.

reviews.reviewTitle: Didn't listen while playing music on decent volume
reviews.reviewText:
When the song is playing on a volume greater than 6 it does not listen it's name "Alexa". Finally has to use hardware volume buttons. Setting up my voice profile was a big trouble it keeps getting stuck 😡 in between. Cannot play songs on YouTube.
