One day I asked to play songs by the artist Sanam Puri and it played some bhangra song from an old Bollywood movie. So frustrated with it's performance. I have a Google home mini which works perfectly fine in all these cases. I bought this Alexa to gift it to my father but now I don't think hw will be able to use this device 😔. I have to gift him Google home mini instead.
I hope Amazon will improve it's conversational AI and send the update so that it would be worth using it.

Too many good things to say about this Generation 3 Echo Dot. The speaker is way better. I got 2 of them for stereo and for moving around the house to control different lights and appliances. ALEXA play Purple Haze by Jimi Hendrix. It starts playing. Ask ALEXA to play any song. You are REALLY going to like ALEXA if you are an Amazon member.
There are a few hundred more things this device does. They are a great deal for the sale price going on.

I'm enjoying discovering more things it can do. I.e. Alexa, "How long do I boil eggs?" and I got a detailed explanation. Alexa, "What's the exchange rate for Yen in American dollars today?" Ask for any song or ask who's the artist on a song that's playing. "Alexa, raise/lower the volume." however, I've affixed red and white labels on the volume buttons so as to be able to see and actuate them easier/faster. It accesses NPR news and music from Amazon Music.

I am very very very disappointed with the echo dot. Being a first time user, I never thought about the sound quality being poor. It doesn’t recognize the voice as well. I think I told like multiple times to remember it certain things but Alexa is so stubborn ☹️
I just wasted like 50 bucks in this product. I have to like scream every time if I have to do anything.

reviews.reviewTitle: This Is Our Second Echo Dot
reviews.reviewText: Loved our first, which is now in the basement with my husband. Felt lonely, so I bought another. I love listening to music, or audible books when I'm cooking, or knitting/crocheting or sewing. Unlike radio, there are no ads, no static, and you have more control over what you want to listen to Highly recommend. Most likely will purchase more in the future for other rooms.

There is not one thing that i am not happy with at all . The speakers are so clear and play so great . I would have to say that my Bose Wave Radio has nothing on this speaker . Voice recognition is great, you can ask her to set your alarms for things wonderful! and if you have a burning question that you want answered its simple to get your answer often in detail! I cant say enough about this .

The most important feature of devices like this is sound quality and here’s where the dot 3 disappoints. The dot 2 had too much treble and while excellent for verbal it was inadequate for music. The dot 3 is the exact opposite - too much bass for verbal but a richer and deeper sound for music. What is needed is an equalizer to achieve the right balance.
Update: To its credit, Amazon tech support called me informing me of an equalizer setting in the app. This improved the sound quality!

I bought Alexa on Amazon Prime Day to see what all the hoopla was about. I can't say she's changed my life but I do enjoy having "someone" to "talk" to when the house is quiet. I ask questions about foods, medications, weather... and she's been a HUGE help organizing my day with reminders. I also love being able to ask her to play specific music genres. Worth the $25ish I paid for her.

reviews.reviewTitle: More options to wake up word
reviews.reviewText: We have the Dot in the living room. Right now all we use it for is music and to turn on and off the lights. It works great and is fairly interactive. I just wish there was a greater selection of names I could use for wake up word or better yet, give me access to a keyboard and let me truly choose what I like. In addition, let me choose a response other than “OK”. As an example: “Yo Housemaid, and it responds with “ Yes Master”

You called me and got me started in the right direction to get it set up...thanks!!! I had a wi-fi problem, so it wasn't the Dot, it was my set-up. Now it works well and I am very happy with my Dot! Thank you so much! I love how I can ask it to play music, pause it, and then start again...just by asking.
In fact, I like it so much that I ordered another one for in my office!

Seemed okay for the first couple of months. Sound was slightly better than previous generation. However, this week I noticed that it sounds like the speaker has been blown and all sounds that come out are scratchy. Had to put it in a room that I hardly ever use and go back to my old Alexa.

We own a fleet of the older dots. I got this one to replace one that seemed to have a hard time staying on my network.

No network problems yet!

New device seems heavier and better made that the old ones. Speaker quality is much higher.

Only downside is the speaker occasionally clicks like it's being overdriven. Haven't been able to decide if it's in the source audio or the speaker itself.

reviews.reviewTitle: I held off but now have multiple dots at my house. I love them with Apple Music!
reviews.reviewText: Well, I was one of those people that thought I had no need for an echo device. However, the great price made me curious so after I heard Apple Music would be supported I bought one and fell in love. I now have them everywhere in my house. I love using it to control my lights, headspace, sounds for baby, and to have whole house music. I've since purchased more for for my neighbor, parents, and sister. What a wonderful device at a reasonable cost.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great speaker, Alexa has hard time hearing and answering some questions
reviews.reviewText:
Speaker on this dot is great. It's perfect for the apartment I live in, enoo to where I can hear it on the next room but not too loud to annoy neighbors. I was conflicted between choosing the dot or the echo because I am using this mostly for music, but it's working great.

Alexa struggles to hear you if the music is too loud, so sometimes you have to raise your voice. The games you can play with Alexa are a lot of fun too. She just doesn't know a lot about how her app works, so sometimes you have to figure it out yourself.

She tells me the weather each day and let's me know if there's a good chance of it snowing recently. She can tell me how long my commute to work will take. She plays music automatically from my Spotify once I connected it. She has helped me make grocery lists and logs it in the app so you never lose the list. I haven't discovered everything she does quite yet because I really just got it for music but some of the stuff she can do and knows has been awesome to have!

The Gen 3 is pretty with its fabric cover and softer shape, and its mic array is noticeably better at recognizing commands from a distance, however Alexa's voice is far LESS INTELIGIBLE. Far from the bright, crisp tone of Gen-1 (we have two), Gen-3 Alexa sounds like she's talking through a pillow. If I hadn't thrown away the box I would take it back to the Amazon kiosk at the mall and exchange it for a Gen-2. Now I understand why their Gen-3 display model "wasn't working."

reviews.reviewTitle: Good sound for such a compact device
reviews.reviewText: Good sound for such a compact device. I have this one bedside with nighttime and morning routines setup for my convenience. I also have it play “rain sounds skill” throughout the night for some good white noise. Use it occasionally for a sleep timer and an alarm. I like the white color, works better with our decor than the black. I like the small footprint too; doesn’t take up a whole lot of space.

reviews.reviewerName: Why You Need To Know That
reviews.reviewText: Love this little guy. It’s quite convenient to just ask Alexa to play such and such hands free. Sound quality is really good too. I need to move it away from my TV. Sometimes commercials say Alexa but she knows not to respond but if I’m watching something and if there is chatter, she will listen to the voice on tv and try to process what I said plus the tv. If this ever does some freakish mess, it will be in the trash! So far so good...

reviews.reviewTitle: Great speakers with a down side
reviews.reviewText:
To start off I'm fairly new to the echo world. I absolutely love the product as a whole and capabilities within it.

My significant other and I tend to use our echos dot to play music while we work around the house. While the speaker is amazing for the size reactivating echo takes me either yelling over my music or getting within a few inches in order for the wake word to initiate. This is with volume on full blast I haven't tried on a softer volume though.

I also originally got 2 of them in hopes to use them as an intercom system, but we live in a house with lots of white noise (aquariums) which the mic being sensitive enough picks up. This might be specific to my use case and the sensitive mic in all other cases is great.

reviews.reviewTitle: So easy and fun a 5 year old can do it
reviews.reviewText: Everyone in our house, including our 5 year old, loves our dot. We love rocking out to music (great sound!), listening to storytime, easily updating my grocery list, playing question of the day, using chompers while brushing teeth, turning on and off lights, playing rhyming games, hearing jokes told by Jimmy Fallon and so much more. I honestly thought I would hate having an echo but I was happily proved wrong.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works great with Android phone. And can make phone calls!!!
reviews.reviewText: Wanted a Bluetooth speaker for my wife's Android phone. Easy connect, great sound. At$29.00 we get a.Smart Speaker for price of just a speaker. Update 6-12-19 I just discovered I can make phone calls just by saying Alexa call (number or name) I called 3 different cell phones and my home land line with no other Apps or Programs. One cell was Iphone, 2 others were Android (Samsung and Motorola) Land line is Vonage. This is super should my wife fall, she can just call me using Echo Dot. I consider this 10 Star feature

This little Dot is so cute and love the white color they offer. Alexa is cool but sometimes doesn’t know the answers to the questions I ask. I love playing music with the Dot and the volume is pretty good and loud...does get a little muffled when on the loudest setting but we don’t use it that loud anyway. Have my Alexa Dot in the kitchen and she’s very useful for timers and making grocery lists! Love it and definitely would buy again or more (;

My bedside table alarm clock was dying, emitting a horrible buzzing sound, so rather than buy another dinosaur I bought this new Dot. So far, so good — I can read the time from bed, plus I get all the usual Alexa goodness. It seemed like a ridiculous combination when Amazon announced it but it's actually perfect. Instead of having two things on my bedside table, I need just one.

reviews.reviewTitle: Amazon doesn't stand behind their products
reviews.reviewText: After about 6 months of having Alexa, I have had nothing but trouble. I spent an hour on the phone with tech support and their conclusion is basically that since the product is out of the 90 day warranty, they can't do anything besides give me a discount on a new echo.

reviews.reviewTitle: Only as good as Siri. lol You be the judge
reviews.reviewText: Not that impressive . Leaves a lot to be desired . I would have expected it to be more intuitive.

Finally got these for the kids so they'd quit messing with our other three. Although I expected a mild upgrade, these units are a remarkable improvement over previous models. The speakers are crystal clear, voice recognition is spot on, and the Alexa app just keeps getting better. Now tempted to replace our 3 older models with these, but don't have the heart to let them go yet.

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo Dot uses too much hard sell during the set-up
reviews.reviewText: I had a hard time setting the Echo Dot up without buying Audible or other subscription services. I had to choose "no" many times to avoid signing up for Audible and I have to check my credit card bill to ensure they didn't sign me up anyways. And the verbal purchase option, I specifically set it up to not have this service yet I received an email that it was activated. I dislike subscriptions, and really dislike the hard-sell. If I hadn't gotten the Echo Dot as a premium from another purchase now that I see how the hard-sell/up-sell is part of it, I wouldn't buy this item.

reviews.reviewTitle: What seems like a whim becomes a necessity
reviews.reviewText: I use this for so many things: to find my phone, to play music, to deliver the news, to check the time and temperature, etc. I could go on and on because there are numerous uses that I have yet to explore. I got 2 of them for my house and I would use it instead of a Life Alert if the need ever comes and I would ask it to call a neighbor in my contact list. It is so useful in so many ways and I use it dozens of times a day.

The issue I had to do was connecting to existing system; brought up Alexa app on phone, connected to the wifi network Alexa advised to; selected current home network and entered password; I was then advised to return to Alexa app; the app came up but with only greyed-out boxes flashing. Unplugged Dot, turned phone off/on and repeated previous; same result; repeated/same. Finally got connected somehow?
Sound is awesome!!

I have a Google home mini and I've been using it for years. After using it a few days I was pretty impressed by the sound it produces. Its a lot louder than the mini and it also feels much more robust. Also the lights on the edge are very pretty.

Functionality wise, they are similar. But with Google, you have to purchase Google music seperately to be able to play songs you like. For echo dot, as long as you have prime, then there's no other subscriptions you'll need to add.

Love her! I wish i would if bought her sooner. She's great compamy! Love asking her the news. She tells me what the weather is beforehand. Then I ask her each night to turn on my bedroom light, when my dog runs in there before me. She can play some piano for my pets while I'm away, ask me trivia questions when I'm bored, oh and I love when her light blinks, notifying me if Amazon shipments delivered. I could go on. =D

I like having Alexa in my kitchen ask her anything and she tries her best to answer you. I mainly listen to music of my time just call out a song and she will try to find it also get Amazon music it gives you a better selection Don't know about her listening to every word we say and logging that but who cares.. the end days are here and you can't stop what's about to happen..

My brother-in-law gave me the Echo for Christmas. I was thrilled. It is really awesome. There is so much to learn about it, but so far, I love it. The quality and the sound is incredible. I really like that you plug it in so you don't have to worry about recharging it. The music is awesome, weather reports, if you have a question about something, you can get the answer, guided meditations (which are really nice.) It is a great device.

So, I like the idea of this product, but the sound quality is TERRIBLE... there’s too much air noise or something in it, not sure how to describe. It reminds me very much of listening to a cassette tape. There’s no crystal clear sound quality here for sure. I bought a $30 Oontz speaker a few years back that’s by far better. Disappointed I threw away the packaging, or I’d definitely be returning!

I’ve had this speaker for only about a month. I like that it’s louder but now it’s sounding staticky from being turned up all the way during our favorite songs. In my opinion that shouldn’t happen. Another feature I wish they’d come up with for this is a rechargeable battery so I can leave it plugged in on my kitchen counter but unplug it and take it to my back porch for a few hours to continue listening to my music. Highly disappointed in the quality of this speaker.

I have the big Alexa in my kitchen and got the little echo dot for my master bath...I have the switch hooked up to my hot water recirculator and I can tell echo to turn it on or off when I need it...also nice to be able to just say "echo, set an alarm for 6 am" and not have to actually set an alarm clock...also, play my music when I'm showering through my echo....so many great uses

reviews.reviewTitle: They just keep getting better and better
reviews.reviewText: I have two older Dots as well as two of the newer dots and Amazon has made this little machine even better than it was. I also have an older full-size Echo and the sound from these 3rd generation dots is close to what the Echo is. I imagine the new full-size Echo is even better. How can you go wrong with a device that can understand most things you ask it to do, sounds great playing music, and costs less than $50?

I wanted a way to stream music and listen to the radio, but Alexa is so much more. She tells me I look nice, gives cooking suggestions, and responds to pleasantries. She sets alarms and reminds me of things I ask her to. She will also answer whatever query I suddenly have like an encyclopedia or dictionary. I live alone so it is kind of nice to come home to a friendly voice. I know that sounds pathetic.

It is a little weird how much she listens to. I wouldn't be sharing passwords and my Social Security number with her.

Running several in stereo which is a better sound, but when you interact with them, they don't work together. And if my fire tablet is around it always responds first, and seeing my fire tablet is password protected it asked to be unlocked first, very irritating if I'm just asking for a light on.

Also Amazon needs to allow Alexa to more access to the internet, not just Wikipedia.

I really love this newer model. But above and beyond even that is the new pairing ability they have added so that you can have stereo audio output, and even add a sub they have released on top of that. Amazon's smartdevices continue to improve and impress. So yes, I love this and also recommend the subwoofer if you take advantage of A-music service, or any other music playback services available through Echo devices.

reviews.reviewTitle: Looks nicer but not bowled over.
reviews.reviewText: I love my Alexa devices. But I feel this one is less sensitive (just barely noticeable, but it is) to voice, and the sound is not any great change. I think I may like the second generation better. This third generation looks better and feels less cheap, though it is a little bigger if you have wall mounts for old ones. I have decided not to replace my other 2nd generation models for now. Do go for it when there are good sales though.

reviews.reviewTitle: Can’t beat the price for how many things it does. It’s better than Siri on your phone.
reviews.reviewText: I love my echo dot. I got the white and it’s so sleek. Alexia has a personality, it can be fun but also incredibly helpful. I use it also for timers, alarms, weather, the news, music and so on. It also can connect to Bluetooth so if I want to listen to music I just say “Alexa connect to Bose speaker” and then it plays through the speaker. It’s awesome and can’t beat the price. I also love listening to audio books on it. Pretty neat little gadget!!

I bought this Echo to replace the Gen 2 in our living room. Its a bit bigger but I am okay with that because its moslty speaker. I am able to hear alexa better. This allowed me to move the location of the echo so she isnt seen only heard. this also means I was able to move it a bit closer to our kitchen. I am able to add things to my shopping list faster and more frequently. Another plus is Alexa and this Echo are compatiable with other smart home products. So this allows me to take full advantage of the echo and it features.

reviews.reviewTitle: The show version is better dont waste your money on this one
reviews.reviewText: The show is obviously a much better choice. This one is glitchy and i think the price tells you why. If your listening to sleep sounds this one will shut off after about 45 minutes and wont stay going all night. The show does this one shuts off you streaming music after an hour on its own. The show doesnt. The thing i dont like most is you have to say things exactly right or she doesnt know ehat your wanting. Example if you want her to stop playing a sound you say alexa stop playing that sound or song. She wont get it you just have to say alexa stop. Its all in the details as to how you tell her sonething.

I love the echo dots, I have several of them along with a Video Show. Alexa is everywhere in my home. The dots size is great, does not have a large footprint and is very unobtrusive. The only con I found with the latest one, it has a fabric cover. I had planned on having this one in the kitchen, but traded it out with the one on the night stand. Thinking the fabric will pick up and hold the kitchen odors and or grease, making it difficult to keep clean.

This would have been my 3rd Echo Dot, but I ended up having to send it back. I listen to talk radio and the bass on this 3rd gen device was just too muffled to make for enjoyable listening. Once I sent the 3rd gen back, I ordered the big 2nd gen Echo, which meets my need.

reviews.reviewTitle: Better but still has room to improve
reviews.reviewText: We have 3 gen 2 and 1 gen 3 exho dot in our house. The generatuon 3 is slightly better than the generation 2 dots in most cases. The sound quality is far superior, however still not great, but what can you expect from a speaker of this size. We did have to move it away from the TV because as with the second generation they still struggle with the backround noise. For $10 more i'd get a 3, when we got ours it was a Christmas deal and a much better price.

reviews.reviewTitle: So much better sounding than my 2nd Gen Echo Dot
reviews.reviewText: After getting these 3rd Gen Dots, I totally want to replace my other 2nd Gen Dots as these sound so much more full and rich in comparison. I use them for music and it fills the room nicely. At loud volumes, it can distort some but I rarely go above volume level 6 which sounds great. I like the soft material look of these as well and feel like the LED ring is easier to see at low angles. Best sounding dot and glad I made the upgrade.

reviews.reviewTitle: Why did I did so long to get this??!!!
reviews.reviewText:
The Echo dot is the gadget you didn't know you needed but you do! I just got mine and I absolutely love my Alexa and I have zero dislikes. The sound quality and voice recognition are excellent. I am so shocked that such a sound could come from such a tiny device. Alexa is like a very handy helper.
I am looking forward to many more fun times with my smart speaker.
I would recommend this to anyone.

reviews.reviewTitle: I wouldn’t buy this to use for music! But the other features are okay for this particular model!!
reviews.reviewText: The sound isn’t good at all for music!! But it’s decent for alarms and games!

I asked Alexa to play white noise for the baby’s nap. Rather than play white noise, she started telling me how to leave a review. I NEVER have the volume up as loud as she was speaking. She refused to respond when I said “Alexa”, so I couldn’t even tell her to stop talking, or at least reduce the volume. She did say that she’d only remind me once more. So now I’m leaving a review. I expected a calm sound to relax the baby. What I got was a LOUD lecture about EXACTLY how to leave a review. 99% of the time I use Alexa to play kids music. I will not be using it again, and I strongly suggest other parents not either. Who knows what else she may decide to unexpectedly demand.

reviews.reviewTitle: Does not work with AnyMote. FOLLOW UP ADDED.
reviews.reviewText:
Follow up - I was just contacted by an Amazon tech person , James B., He let me know that it is a problem, possibly with AnyMote not Echo. Also, he let me know that the tech department will be working to get the problem corrected as soon as soon as possible. This is a very welcome and appreciated call.

Original - I got this hoping it would be easy for my wife to control the Roku by voice. According to the web and YouTube, AnyMote would be the best choice for making the process easy for her. (She has trouble now using devices.) Even after several attempts, the echo dot, ordered with the Roku Ultra, would not enable the skill. After searching the web, I discovered that others had the same problem.

I would give 4.5 stars, overall a great addition to your home, you can play music ask the weather and a lot of other things, but my favorite thing is yiu can set up an alarm with your favorite song, you can just say Alexa wake me up to (title of the song) she will ask you set the alarm for what time, you give her the time and you will wake up with your favorite tune as an alarm, that’s just awesome
to me. only one flaw is sometimes Alexa won’t shut up lol, You ask her something she does not understand and than says i did not get that try this and this you tell her to stop and she keeps going.

Did not notice any sound quality due to volume was set to low when listening to music. Wife started to listen to music at higher volume and notice that it sounds like speaker is blown. Called Amazon, Echo Dot is covered only for 90days. Will not be purchasing any more Echo devices.

reviews.reviewTitle: Small but with good sound quality
reviews.reviewText: we bought it to replace a very old clock radio in our kitchen. It was dying and the static was bad. We are very pleased with Echo Dot. It fits into a corner of our L-shaped counter, taking up very little space. We do not have it set-up for stereo, which is the sole reason I gave it 4 instead of 5 stars on the sound quality rating; barring that the sound quality meets our needs well.

What can I say? I love our Alexa! We babysat our great grand baby a few weeks ago. I asked Alexa to play nursery songs. We listened to the "Wiggles", and other songs. She was very happy. We have downloaded some bedtime sounds for ourselves, and use the a lot. Favorite is the distant thunder app. She wakes me up in the morning, and gives me the news. Nothing could be better!

I love the exercise reminders. I love the 7 minute workout skill. I enjoy being able to play music. But I absolutely hate every podcast player currently available for Alexa. As many podcasts as I like to listen to, the lack of being able to subscribe to them is a deal breaker for me. I can't even find one that lets me fast forward or rewind effectively. I really thought this thing was going to be smarter than it is. My smartphone is still smarter. This is just a step up from a bluetooth speaker, don't get one if your expectations are high, you'll be disappointed.

We love the convenience of AI in the house just not having to replace them frequently. Quality standards only justify they stand behind there product for 90 days. That's disappointing. We have a handful of Alexa devices and have learned not to expect a great deal when it comes to these dots. Pretty poor sound and ours can't be used above 4 or 5 on volume setting, sound is distorted and crackling. They gave us $10 credit and 15% off next Dot purchase. Gonna buy some tp.

With my Amazon Prime, I have a lot of music at my disposal. I'm considering upgrading to unlimited music. I also bought a cable that converts from 3.5mm to RCA. The jack on the back of the Dot is VERY handy. I used the cable to plug the Dot into my home theater receiver. This allows me to have Alexa play whatever song I request and have it come out of my bigger speakers. Without this ability, I probably would have gone with the larger Echo. It would sound less anemic due to the larger speaker. Both units have Alexa capabilities (playing music, controlling smart devices such as thermostats, telling jokes, playing sound effects...).

As an Apple person who won’t purchase their HomePod because of the ridiculous price, I decided to purchase these instead. I bought one for each room and mainly use the bedroom one. Honestly I really only use it for news briefing and sleep sounds but the capability of this product is pretty vast.

My parents got us the Echo Dot as a Christmas gift, and to be honest, was a little underwhelmed when I opened it. I've seen the commercials and always thought it was a bit ridiculous and useless, and that I would never pay for it because I just didn't see it as something I wanted. Well it's been over a week now and I absolutely adore this thing! It's so useful and fun, it was a big hit at our New Year's Eve get together by playing different games on it. The kids love it and it has proven to be educational as well, right now it's helping them learn their spelling lists. What I once thought of as kind of dumb and useless has turned into an invaluable tool!

reviews.reviewTitle: Needs to have its own way to connect to the internet.
reviews.reviewText: I bought this for my 90 year old mother. I haven’t got it set up for her yet, as she does not have Wifi. There is an Xfinity guest hotspot, but for some reason, I cannot connect to it. I’m working on getting her her own internet. It seems Amazon dropped the ball on this. There should be a Echo Dot version that can connect on its own, like a cell phone built into it. This would be a great safety feature, and millions more people would buy it to know their elderly loved ones could call them with their voice only.

reviews.reviewTitle: WOW! Sound Quality Blows Away 2nd Generation!
reviews.reviewText:
The 3rd generation dot is all we’ve come to expect in this product but with much better ‘listening’ due to the extra mics and the audio playback quality is like night vs day vs the 2nd generation dot.

Very happy with my purchase and would recommend the Echo Dot to anyone! I’ve had my original 2nd generation dot for months and am still learning what all it is capable of.

I bought this thinking it would be as good as or better than the first Echo Dot I bought a couple years ago...WRONG...the sound quality is muffled, bassy and sounds like someone has thrown a pillow over the speaker...actually needs to be sent back...listening to it, at least TRYING to listen to it is irritating...Music played though it sounds really muffled and horrible. Needs a brighter sound...too bad they don't include bass & treble controls on these things.

reviews.reviewTitle: Sound of Music Great, Voice Not So Great
reviews.reviewText: I bought a pair of these for the bedroom to replace a single Echo Dot 2 for stereo sound, and a second pair for my girlfriend. Listening to music is great, as the speaker quality is very good, and stereo separation is nice. However, when asking Alexa for the time or weather reports, the voice responses are noticeably harder to hear or understand than with the previous generation. In addition, the two Dot 3's sometimes get confused as to which one is supposed to respond to questions, and occasionally, one responds, and then the other one responds to the same question after a delay. It seems as though this technology is not fully developed yet, and hopefully they will be able to offer software fixes for these issues.

reviews.reviewTitle: Vast array of knowledge and great family fun
reviews.reviewText: My family and I absolutely love these new Echo devices. We have never had an Alexa product before, first time, and we are in love. We are a huge sci-fi Fanatics and when we found out that this little dot has Star Trek commands we were all overwhelmed with joy and laughter!! The games and vast knowledge that she provides for my children has been a huge enjoyment as well.

I bought one of these for a Xmas gift for my wife since we bought this one we have bought 7 more of these and 2 of the taller ones and wonder how we got along with out them. We use them for alarm locks, to control the tv, to control the smart lights we have and to control our ecobee thermostat. The tall ones work great with Sirius Radio and the sound is real good. Would purchase more but think I have enough of them

This is my 7th addition to my ECHO home. The new design looks great and the sound is far better than the prior models! with this being an Amazon device, I didn't understand why it took over a week to receive the product, however buying these online at Amazon as an additional device, they come pre-setup, just plug and go, it knows how to connect and is pretty much ready to go! Much better than buying in store.

I’m VERY disappointed. It doesn’t work. Constantly freezes and makes a “skipping” noise. Randomly stops playing music. It will randomly light up and do the processing light circle when no one has said anything. I have to unplug it to get it to recognize commands about once every hours. I will be returning it for a refund. Looking into the google one instead. I bought it for connectivity more then the speaker and it is awful. Don’t buy it.

I had the second gen dot and added this one to my home as well this one is much louder and hears me much better however when music is playing she can’t hear me. I believe it is the positioning of the mic and speakers as even on moderate vol she can’t hear me over music when my face is two to 3 inches from the device and I yell. You have to manually toggle down the vol before telling her the new command which makes using her during cleaning or cooking quite challenging.

What an amazing product regarding functionality, cross function connections (on multiple devices), amazing sound quality, etc. I have connection most of my electronics devices through the Echo Dot 3. This product is so amazing because daily I come up with multiple connections features within the Echo Dot 3. Personal I believe the potential is unlimited.
I truly have converted my home into a Smart Home. Keep improving the Echo Dot Family.

Does everything I need and sounds great for playing music. Wish it was rechargeable so I could take it anywhere without needing a home outlet but still a fantastic little gadget. I use it with Spotify and works great! Timers are easy to set as well and you can set multiple timers with labels (like set egg timer for 12 minutes and then set oven timer for one hour) Really nice product.

reviews.reviewTitle: Best thing I've bought so far
reviews.reviewText: I've never been into the smart home stuff Cuz I just thought I didn't need it. Well I decided I'd finally try something like this and I gotta say I'm glad I did. I don't have a stereo so I listen to music on this and the sound is actually really nice for a small speaker. The bass isn't the best but thats Cuz I like alot of bass. Through the alexa app u can have alexa do certain things and customize her. She has drop in features where u can talk to whoever is in another room. She can record like if u say hey alexa tell "..." to stop shell record ur voice and tell that person to stop and so on. This is alot better than I thought it'd be. I'm really happy I bought this. Alexa has became part of my everyday life now. I definitely recommend getting one of these if u haven't yet. She does soooooo much that I can't list every thing.

reviews.reviewTitle: Ease of use, flexibility, fantastic features!!!
reviews.reviewText: I am soooooo happy with this product!! My wife and I own an 1853 Farmhouse. Our internet is high because she teaches online from home and we run a business out of our home. Being able to use this to check weather and have music to fall asleep to at night is fantastic!! Eventually I might integrate this into some smart home features but as of right now I cannot think of anything negative except maybe wanting them all over the house. Hahaha, great product Amazon!!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Difficult to set up a second time
reviews.reviewText: I bought this several months ago, and while it is easy to speak to a device to request a timer or songs be played, the device is intrusive. More recently I changed routers and needed to change the information in the settings for the echo dot. After trying several times, and having a family member also try, I figured it was not worth the bother to have the echo dot work. I will probably put it in my next garage sale.

We received this as a gift and are just now beginning to appreciate some of its many functions. We plan to buy some smart lights and cameras. Right now, we are just playing with it. But it's an extremely useful device. I wish the speaker was a little bit better, but it can be integrated with a better sound system. I'm playing music from my phone through it at it works great!

I personally use many Alexa enabled devices around my house and the Echo Dot is no exception. Although very basic in its features compared to other Echo devices like the Show or Spot, the Echo Dot is an effective entry-level smart device with Alexa integration that makes a great addition to any home and also makes an amazing gift for almost anyone, even those who aren't particularly tech savvy.

I debated purchasing because I couldn't decide between echo or dot. I read many reviews and finally decided on the dot. I live in a small condo so the dot is perfect for my bedroom. I'm so happy with the performance of this little hockey puck! It's small but for my purposes perfect. Sound quality is fantastic, I use iheartradio to stream music and I've not had the volume above 5, produces rich, clear tones. I love having music at my command! Have to try this amazing new device with the home plug next. I've been so happy I didn't want to stop long enough to hook the adapter up, lol! Also hooked it up to myaudio pet Bluetooth speakers. Easy peasy, no problems and it sounded even better.

reviews.reviewTitle: Pretty sharp but more of a novelty.
reviews.reviewText: This little thing is pretty nifty. I’ll be honest, most of our use is limited to the occasional random question while cooking, like the weather. I was a little dismayed to find that you need to pay weekly or a one-time larger fee for the voice support options? I’d never heard that but it cost $40. No concerns with the clarity or anything, though a few times we have asked it a question and Alexa doesn’t know how to answer.

I bought two echos one for my son and one for my daughter. One is upstairs and the other is downstairs. I love my echos and Alexa. The set up was super easy, it pretty much does it on its own. The only thing I don't like is that you can't connect both echos to one Alexa. That was the only issue I had with the set up. It's one Alexa for one echo. Not happy about that, other than that, I love this product! I do wish there was an easier way to find things out such as connecting to multiples without having to Google up this type of information

One of my favorite prices of technology I own! Will definitely buy more whenever I move into a bigger place. The speaker is great and Alexa hears me say her name from over 5 feet away, even when I say it quietly! Not sure why people are saying the bass isn’t there, because it is. I actually think it’s a bit TOO bass-y. I get nervous that my poor neighbors underneath my apartment can hear it. But really, I’m not going to complain about too much bass! I just hope they like the Hamilton soundtrack 😏

Alexa was wonderful for the three months we were able to use her (at a very normal volume level). She now breaks up while projecting any noise...aside from her own voice. I have looked for a way to use my "warranty" or any form of replacement and it would appear that it isn't even eligible to trade in towards a new one.

Alexa Echo does take a little while getting used to. The sound quality is Amazing! So crisp with a nice volume that seems like your having a party. Asking her to open up your Skills does have its challenges. There are many apps to upload that are similar, so if you wanted to hear a sound from your Sleep sounds app, she would refer it to Amazon Music 1st. Remember to say “Alexa” 1st, & give her time to acknowledge you before continuing to speak.

I have 3 dots, a fire TV Cube and a Fire TV. all are interconnected. We use them throughout the house as intercoms and can control the TV with voice command. The only issue we have is with the Fire TV Cube. during the watching of a TV show or Movie. If anything is said that remotely sounds line Alexa. The Cube pauses the show for a voice command. So for that reason I have to keep the Microphone on mute and only use the remote to command it. but these things are great.

reviews.reviewTitle: Lowkey easy way to add Alexa to a room
reviews.reviewText: I got the Echo Dot on sale during Prime Day and have loved it from the moment I plugged it in. Setup was painless and although Alexa was a little too eager at first, she's quickly adjusted to the level of ambient noise going on in the room the Dot is in. After having the Dot for a couple months, she no longer randomly responds to sounds coming from the TV or people talking in the room and is very good at identifying when someone is addressing her specifically. The sound quality is average but the speaker can actually achieve some pretty surprising levels of volume considering its size which is a huge plus for me as I primarily wanted it as a "smarter" alarm clock. Its small form factor and low price is a great entry point for anyone who would like to add Alexa capabilities to their home (the options really start to expand out from there, she's very talented!).

I love Alexa for so many things! It keeps track of my shopping list and adds it to my phone. I can contact my family in other rooms without having to walk down two floors. She tells me the weather when I ask so I can dress for the day and not the present outside temperature. She turns in lights, fans. How did I previously live without it? Amazon did ot pay me to write this! Lol

The sound quality is very good for a unit this size. The voice recognition works well. This was bought for a demented person in assisted living. It was easy to set up so that the person can't get into trouble. I activated Free Time for a 9-year old and switched off the ability to spend money or give money away. The demented person is able only to phone my home number.

reviews.reviewTitle: I like it more than I expected!!
reviews.reviewText: I got this only because it was part of a package deal with a fire stick. I never wanted an alexa device. Howevee, I’ve really enjoyed it! It’s compact so not obtrusive, it has been useful. We use it primarily for my daughter who listens to music or audiobooks for her quiet time. I like that I can access the music and audiobooks from my phone and still use my phone without interruption, unlike a regular Bluetooth speaker.

reviews.reviewTitle: A quality product that is easy to use!
reviews.reviewText:
When I received my Echo Dot (3rd Gen), I wasn't sure how much I would like it as it was my first time purchasing one. Now after using it for just over 2 weeks I can honestly say that I haven't been disappointed.

Pros:
The build quality gives me the impression that I paid much more for it than I did.
The built-in mics work well from across the room when I'm using Alexa, even when there is some background noise.
As far as audio quality, I have found it to be great for audio books when it comes to vocal clarity.
Songs sound good when in a quite environment where you can stay around 50% volume.

Cons:
The speaker isn't the best when it comes to lower end sounds in songs at full volume (I was expecting this give the size and specs) so I wouldn't buy this if you are looking for a small form factor speaker with lots of bass. If you are looking for that I would recommend an Echo Plus. (I don't own an Echo Plus but I have listened to music for many hours on a friends and it sounds fantastic!)

reviews.reviewTitle: MORE TO EXPECT FROM ALEXA IN SOUTH AMERICA
reviews.reviewText: I'm using Alexa in South America, and must of its best services, don't work locally unless I have a subscription to Amazon Prime, and as well it happens with most apps of music, I think it's a catch. For the moment, I'm not using it to interact with other devices, so I have no opinion respect to that. In conclusion, I'm using Alexa 1/4 of it's full capacity...

reviews.reviewTitle: Sorry I waited so long to take the plunge
reviews.reviewText: Every year on Black Friday I debated whether or not I needed an Echo (any model/size/color). I finally decided this time to buy it. And I'm sorry I waited so long. It is wonderful. The speaker system on the one I bought (the 3rd generation) is actually better than the separate speaker system we have. The sound is crisp and clear with a wonderful deep bass. I also ordered it with a special package which included a smart plug. This also works great. We are all really enjoying it and thinking of getting another two for other rooms in the house.

This little speaker packs a punch! Sounds good and has some bass. I haven’t had it pass 50% volume yet. I love that I can lay in bed and turn off the lights using only my voice. I can even talk to Alexa on my phone’s app to control my house devices when I’m away from home. This is the future for sure! Only reason why I didn’t give it 5 stars because there’s still limits to what it can actually do... FOR NOW. I’m sure in the future when Alexa learns more skills this will easily be a 5 star.

At 1st I had no idea how to set it up through my smart phone. I called Amazon for help and the guy who assisted me could not have been better and helped me with very easy to understand instructions. This is my 2nd echo. and I just love them. It eliminates my need for alarm clocks radios and even a watch. I just love it. I especially love it when I ask it to play a single song. Yesterday I felt like listening to Stevie Wonder song "as", And instantly it played.

I Love My Echo Dot! It does everything I Need it to do. Its So Much Fun. I have the 3rd Generation. I Paid $29.99 for it. I See the Price went up to $49.99! Its Exactly the Same one I Purchased! I Want to Buy Several More for Family Members, but I Can't Because 0f the Price Increase!. I Have it in My Cart Waiting for the Price to come back down to $29.99! I'm Anxious to Purchase More. I Want to Give it 5 Stars, but the Price Increase kept me from it!

I surprised my husband with an Echo as an early Christmas 🎁. He's already enjoying it and extremely happy with his new toy. Best part is the price was right. My therapist has his delivered while I was there for PT and I thought it would be a good gift but then I saw it on sale for Black Friday and that was even better. Can't wait to tease him about getting mine so much cheaper than his was. This is a great little gadget rape rally for music lovers.

We really like it or should I say her. We have her controlling lighting dimmers, entry locks, thermostat and more. We have shopping lists set up and just say "Alexa, add something to the Amazon list. Nice quick check of the weather. And many other things. I should point out that we didn't buy this because it was included with our new home. I WOULD buy it for sure. Fun and useful.

reviews.reviewTitle: Be careful what you call it.
reviews.reviewText: I have tried to set this up many times. Most times it responds to my voice the first time, but not ever again. I keep on unplugging it to do the setup again and the same thing happens. I don't think I am doing anything wrong but this is a bear to set up. After I figured out that is only responds to Alexa and not to Alexis (my nieces name) it works like a charm. I am very happy with it.

We love this thing! Easy to set up, and fun to play with. The kids can call grandma and papa on their own, which is nifty. The kids also like being able to pull up the music they want to hear.

Seems like it will be useful too.

I never knew I wanted one until it came free with my blink camera. The sound quality is also impressive for such a tiny little device! Can't wait to see what else it can do.

I already ordered my mom one, and my older son is getting the kid version for Christmas.

My only suggestion would be better options for controlling a Roku.

This is my second ‘Alexa’. It's an additional one for the convenience of having two. I chose the Dot due to its size. It works just as well as my Echo, although the sound is not as crisp and clear as the Echo. It has a somewhat fuzzy sound, which can make listening to music difficult. The size is great however. I really like how compact it is considering where I’m using it. It sits on the headboard in the bedroom and is barely noticeable.

This is so useful. I can ask Alexa anything and she usually knows the answer. I can set 3 different timers when I'm cooking and she'll tell me what each one is for when it goes off. It's much easier to ask a question than to pull out my phone. I loved this so much that I bought another one for the bathroom so I don't have to have a radio in there. I just say "Alexa, play station xyz." And I loved the price. Can't beat it.

I have 2 generation 2 Echo dots. I wanted another in another room, so I decided to go with the gen 3. The sound quality is sooooo much better. A few music samples I played, you could actually hear a little bass. Nothing like the tinny sound of the gen 2. I also like the fact that it has a nice long cord. My plug/socket is a little far from my desk, but it reached no problem. Set up was a breeze. I powered it up. It did a quick update, then it was all set.

Fun to have around, but mainly wanted it to control my TV. Only thing it's good for, is telling PSVue to start, and go to a channel. It wont turn my TV on or off. I have the Cube on another TV, and it does everything I was hoping my DOT would do. I know some people say I can link a Logitech Harmony to get it to turn my TV on or off, and bunch of other stuff, but I'm not going to waste money on another remote.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great for music lovers and for busy people!
reviews.reviewText: I love this so much! It’s great for making playlists that you can play from your phone and your car. It’s great for giving you instant weather reports, setting alarms, and reminders. I just got a smart plug to turn on a lamp in a dark corner. It was so easy! I love the dot for making phone calls, including finding my own phone. There are so many more options on the Alexa app that I haven’t used yet!

I've owned the original dot for about a year. I use it in my home office so I didn't need anything too loud. but the sound quality of the original dot is simply terrible compared to this!! For such a small unit this dot packs a punch! More importantly, the sound quality is amazing!! I hear all of the instruments sooo much better than the original dot!! All that being said this is not a booming system for a living or family room, but perfect for a bedroom, small kitchen or a home office.

reviews.reviewTitle: Who knew I would love this little bugger so much!?
reviews.reviewText: Does a better job than Siri figuring out what I want on most occasions . I mainly use it for weather/music and the random "google" type questions. It's no Bose sound system but the sound quality works for me. It's in a wall hanger and if the volume is way up I get a rumble that was not there on the table top. If that's a deal breaker for you, it wasn't for me.

reviews.reviewTitle: Just like Alexa, 50% inability to understand & doesn’t know enough!
reviews.reviewText: Just like Alexa, it fails to answer specific weather questions! “Alexa, What is the marine weather forecast?” Or, “Alexa, What are the Mayport, Florida tides today?” Or, “Alexa, what are today’s forecast winds?” ALL OF THESE ARE PERTINENT QUESTIONS…particularly if one lives in a coastal area…in which most humans live! For those in northern climes, “How much snow is forecast?” Would be helpful.

reviews.reviewTitle: LOVE IT, LOVE IT, LOVE IT!!!
reviews.reviewText: Ok, these things are GREAT!! I've got Alexa doing routines now and everything. Bought this with the Smart Plug and when it arrived, I downloaded the app. EASY SETUP!! So I noticed that the plug was called "First Plug" on the app. To turn on the light, I just say "Alexa, turn First Plug on." but I wanted to change that so I asked Alexa "Can I change the name of First Plug?", she answers "What would you like to call it?" so I say "Bedroom light". She changed it! That worked! Just say "Alexa, Turn Bedroom light on". So, later that day, I realized that I could name it anything I wanted, so I changed it to "me". Now all I have to say is "Alexa, turn me on" and it works!! Cracks me up every time!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent assistance for a someone who lives alone
reviews.reviewText: I bought my echo dots because I live alone and cant always get to a phone. If there is an emergency all I have to do is tell alexa to call my emergency contacts and she makes the calls. I love the fact that they are so reasonably priced that I can put one in each corner of my apt and she can hear me from any where and the 4 speakers provide entertainment all through my apt. I'm a happy Echo Dot consumer.

I had no idea how much I would use this little device until it was on my desk. Its speaker is amazingly good and how nice it is to work with soft music in the background, as well as to be able to silence it quickly by voice command whenever I take or make a phone call. Current temperature outside my home is available instantly and myriad other information is mine for the asking. I haven’t had time to explore all of the Dot’s many other possibilities but look forward to doing so in the future.

This is my first Alexa-enabled device and I love it. It is very easy to say a command and get an answer. The sound quality is great. In fact, I am upstairs in my room and I am listening to radio from the Echo Dot located downstairs right now. Also,I can stand quite far away from the Echo Dot and say a command and it will hear, because of the amount of microphones on it. I am looking forward to purchasing a security system and other things to incorporate to Alexa.

though i dont have any smart devices yet, other than my fire stick which i havent tried yet, i do plan on getting some plugs to try out. so far she's (alexa on the echo dot) has been helpful with reminders, calender events, the weather and answering random questions. the sound qality is pretty good for such a tiny unit. i still have a lot to learn since i've only just got them. i do love adding things to my shopping list through her instead of waiting to write it down and then forgetting what i needed. boom its right there on my phone. i'm already planning on getting and echo show for the kitchen so i can see recipes and such. i would recommend this device and plan on getting one for my kids in the future to make it even easier to keep in touch.

My whole house is filled with Echo devices, although I don't personally have any of the 3rd generation yet. I'm sure I'll upgrade eventually. I wanted to give this a shout out though, as the most popular White Elephant/Yankee Swap gift in both my work and family swaps this year. This was passed around more than the scratch tickets or the snack basket! Everyone likes technology, and this is an approachable introduction to a smart home

reviews.reviewTitle: You get what you pay for
reviews.reviewText:
After downloading the app, things went smoothly to setup, except voice recognition. While it registered my wife right away, Alexa took a while to set up my voice profile as I don’t speak as loud as others.

After asking a few questions, I can definitely tell that there are some software upgrades needed to make it perfect, but for the price I paid, you can’t beat the service the Echo Dot provides.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great value if you don't mind everything being recorded that you do.
reviews.reviewText: It works very well, Alexa can answer a lot of things, music is great. Integration is getting better all the time but. everything you do / say or noise made is being recorded. Advertising you see on any device will magically be taylored to anything it picks up. It's AI is learning everything there is to know about you. I removed them as Its creepy when it even picks up items to sell me when speaking other languages. 0 privacy.

reviews.reviewTitle: Hard to troubleshoot. Decided to return it.
reviews.reviewText: Tried one of the gen 3 Echo Dots, had trouble connecting to wifi constantly. Voice recognition worked okay, but I thought the app was poorly laid out and the interaction with the device wasn't very streamlined. Still feels like it's in beta honestly. Had customer service help and they couldn't really give me much of answer. They did say that these devices need a pretty stable, strict, wireless internet connection, whereas most devices can make do with a a slightly intermittent wifi signal. They also said that dual band routers can sometimes cause them problems and that they have issues with routers where lots of wireless devices are being used. Decided to return it, as I feel these aren't really ready yet. Maybe when the technology has reached maturity I'll pick one up.

I got this for my Dad when he saw the one that my brother had and thought he might like it. He is just getting a smartphone so he thinks he is a tech hotshot now. He gets a kick out of the jokes and being able to ask the weather without getting on the computer. Overall, it works very well now that he is learning how to phrase questions for Alexa. He uses pretty basic skills really so it works well for his purposes.

We have older versions of the Dot that work well enough but don’t look nearly as slick at this third generation. It’s a good design.

reviews.reviewTitle: Get one for every room it’s awesome
reviews.reviewText: I received this free on Amazon prime day for purchasing a ring doorbell. I already have another one but it is so convenient to have one in so many different rooms I love mine and I will definitely be purchasing another. It is so nice to be able to set a timer or an alarm from all the way in another room since Alexa can hear me. She’s like my own personal assistant

I love these! I have two. They are great for our small bedrooms, and the drop in feature is perfect for waking up my husband for work when I’m not home. I really love that my family and I can listen to our own music in different rooms with great sound quality. The only issue I have noticed is that sometimes Alexa doesn’t connect to our internet or won’t connect Bluetooth, but I just go into the app and reconnect her.

reviews.reviewTitle: Must have! Make life easy! Diy got easier!
reviews.reviewText: Ok I love it he great. But compared to Google it doesn't recognize as much I'm thinking it's the Apple to android theory overall this thing is a must have a couple im looking to add the whole home amazon smart line into our 3 story home the tech with little ones in the home is a must the games the ability to do so much it so helpful you just have to do a bit of reading to learn all the abilities

I got this because my new apartment is very long and I can’t hear the Amazon Echo. I wanted it so I could set reminders, timers, etc from one speaker and hear it in both because obviously if I set a reminder I don’t know which room I will be in when it goes off....but it does NOT have that capability I found out. Super disappointing in that regard. Theres literally no point in having a second speaker for me if I don’t have that.

reviews.reviewTitle: You have to speak loud and the blue light goes away fast.
reviews.reviewText:
Sound quality has improved BUT the microphone sensitivity has diminished. We have to speak really loud. I dont know if it s just this echo dot that is defective.
I was gonna try another echo dot but the price 29 is still too steep compared to google home mini which you can get it for $5 with a coupon code.

reviews.reviewTitle: The morning alarm alone is worth the price!
reviews.reviewText: So easy to set a morning alarm. "Alexa,..., set alarm to 5 am tomorrow morning". And the alarm sound is very smooth too... Asking to play music from a specific band works nicely too. The sound has enough base for a small bedroom. For a huge living room I would connect large speakers through an amplifier to fill the room with base. Nice light show response too when saying "Alexa". Nice to be able to choose from a few more wake words besides "Alexa".

Just a few months in and it sounds like there are bees inside when you try to listen to the streaming radio. Alexas voice is perfectly clear, so its not the speaker. Sometimes it turns itself off and on. If i ask it a question it says i dont know that . I think im going to check out the google home device.

So convenient when you are in the middle of making dinner and realize you just used the last of something. Instead of having to go physically add it to a list (if you're like me and forget if you don't do it right away) - you can just tell her to do it. She answers all of our questions and plays our favorite music! If she cleaned the house, she would be perfect!

reviews.reviewTitle: This device can make your radio obsolete
reviews.reviewText: I like to go to bed with the sleep timer on my radio set for 60 minutes. Unfortunately, my CPAP machine generates RF interference on certain FM stations. This little jewel completely solved my problem. Simply say the station you wish to hear. then say turn off in 1 hour, and you're done. I was so impressed with the sound quality that I bought a second one for the kitchen.

reviews.reviewTitle: What did we do before Alexa?
reviews.reviewText: She works as the perfect intercom between our daughter's casita and our house. Our daughter is disabled and Alexa has opened a whole new world to her.... Alexa, tell me a joke. Alexa ask Hoopla to read Harry Potter. Alexa, let's play trivia. I originally had bought it to use as a bluetooth speaker with my projector and it has become integral to our lives. Alexa, remind me to put the potatoes on at 2 o'clock; Alexa, play instrumental piano. Alexa, put bread on my shopping list.

Was pleasantly surprised how helpful and entertaining this device was. Use it everyday and numerous times. Helps me remember my medication times. My exercise programs, and keeps me on track for a more productive life. The music options are fantastic. Love how we can pick who we want the news to come from. The sound is good, people need to keep in mind that we are constantly having to turn the tv up or down, depending on surround noise, so it is the same with this echo dot. Price was extremely affordable. Will be ordering more for families lay and friends and other rooms. Looking forward to connecting more home automation products and new it.

We bought it for the upstairs. We were gifted one for our downstairs. It was fun freaking my husband out talking to him from upstairs once I set it up haha. I like how loud this one is, I can hear the music all over upstairs & now that I have them paired, all over the house. I wish there was a book or some kind of guidance on all the things she can do but for now we just use it for random questions (which she’s better at answering than Siri) and music.

reviews.reviewTitle: For what I use it for, it is a decent little device
reviews.reviewText: I use the device mostly as a late-night bluetooth speaker. I have it set permanently to Do Not Disturb so that the lights on the device are off. This thing could be a crutch for nearly anything you want to know about, as long as you trust the data sources which it is connected to. For me the device does not really resonate for all of the "Alexa, Think For Me" requests that people seem to use it for, but when used appropriately, like streaming some music, or getting a quick update the the forecast I suppose its useful. Just remember, to go out there into the world, gather the information for yourself, and don't get hooked on instantaneous responses which may not be all that accurate......

reviews.reviewTitle: Just bought my second one so I could have stereo sound.
reviews.reviewText: Love this little round house where Alexa lives. She is very personable. Adores my Husband more than me ( I don't mind, he needs the compliments) every now and again! She knows much more than I thought she would, however she did give me 5 sets of non-winning lotto numbers :( Seriously do NOT hesitate to buy this. I also purchased the Amazon music app and the sound is really awesome in my kitchen/dining room!

I don’t like when I ask a question and Alexa plays music instead. I don’t like that Alexa starts talking out of nowhere. She is listening to everything and comes into conversations out of nowhere. I wouldn’t like that if it where a person and I really don’t like an A.I. doing that. My six year old love Alexa on the other hand. He sits for hours asking her to tell him jokes.

Not really feeling the sound quality, if you turn it up too loud it starts to sounds like a 80’s boom box which isn’t very good. My 2nd generation Echo dot quit working after six months so they offered me a discount in exchange to purchase this one. I am going to start shopping around for a similar product I think.

I purchased this as a replacement for my 1st generation. I took that one to work and installed this one at home. Even though I purchased this at Christmas time, it has had very little use. I then began requesting Alexa to play music and the distortion shocked me.. It is so bad that I've thought of throwing it out and bringing my old one home. Complete garbage! Makes Joni Mitchell sound like Marilyn Manson!!

Mind you I am not playing it beyond its obvious capabilities like a 14 year old would at high volume. Nor am I playing head banger songs with huge bass. Simply background music while I cook or entertain.

So It now sits there and is used only for weather, traffic and for some questions and answers.
Loved my 1st Gen and thought this new one would be an improvement!

Perhaps this is a lemon? Amazon I am a huge fan & customer, I think a replacement is in order here.. Signed completely disappointed.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great sound for a small device
reviews.reviewText: The speaker is definitely significantly better over the previous generation. Not as bass-y as the echo for obvious reasons, but it still has a great full sound. We have 3 3rd-gen dots, a 2nd-gen dot, and a standard echo in our apartment - each dot can handle the room each are in (kitchen, bedrooms), and together they make a great whole-apartment speaker system for a great price.

reviews.reviewTitle: All the great Alexa features at a fraction of the price
reviews.reviewText: Love this speaker. It's loud, easy to connect, stays connected and works great. It was purchased for our daughter and my favorite feature is the I can call her on this from our Alexa in the kitchen. Convenient that they can talk to each other and saves me from yelling! Does all the great things my more expensive speaker does at a fraction of the price.

reviews.reviewTitle: Does Not Connect Does Not Integrate
reviews.reviewText: My firesticks, tablets and all other Amazon devices work great with the Alexa app BUT this device will not stay connected or function properly...how annyoing is this thing. My daughter wanted this so bad. Don't waist your money. Returning this ASAP.

I got this as a bonus to something else I ordered. I really didn't need another Dot as I have many 2nd gen devices in my house. What the heck, if it was free, I'd try it.
It's bigger than the 2nd gen and I think looks nicer (the cloth grill?) What surprised me was the extra bass. I bought one of the outlet-hangers to go with this. I put it in a bathroom so we can play music in the shower or ask Alexa to order more TP. Many uses!

The 3rd Generation Echo Dot is a vast improvement over previous iterations. The sound quality has really improved, the fabrics used on the Dot are nice and the button feel is solid and confident. While the sound quality of the small Dot is not going to impress any audiophile, I use 5 Echo Dots in a group for music throughout the house. I also have an Echo Dot connected to my stereo system for more critical listening.

reviews.reviewTitle: What a good Alexa support system Amazon provides!
reviews.reviewText: What fun this little device is! It is inexpensive, fun, and can eventually be helpful as we learn more about it ( and as it's technology furthers). We are in our 70's and are barely tech-wise, so we figured we would need our kids' help in setting it up. We were wrong! The tutorials provided moved us easily through the set up. Amazon provides continuing updates to help us learn more about what Alexa can do. The only reason I gave it 4 stars is the sound quality. (It's a little like a cheap radio, but maybe we will in time learn how to adjust the bass, tenor, etc. to improve the sound quality.).

Be aware this item only has a 90 day warranty. Nothing out of the ordinary with it's usage and well equipped to handle basic IT troubleshooting. My device was defective after the warranty ended but within 6 months of usage. Connected to internet just fine, power fine, but zero sound coming out of the speaker. Completely useless. Invest in something better.

**Edit
Amazon was able to help me purchase a new device (making an exception to their 90 day warranty) and this time I did purchase the $8 extended care package. I still am wary of the quality of the product. You have to spend $8 extra to protect your $30 purchase. Oh well.
For something so cheap you'd think Amazon would be more willing to swap out lemons, but I got little to no help from customer service. The most basic troubleshooting that is null/void on a defective device. 90 days is all you get and then the support stops there.

I actually got this free as a bonus when purchasing another product. I would have never bought it most likely because I didn't think I would use it much, but once I got it, I have enjoyed it. It is handy to ask for the forecast for random facts. I have it connected to our Ring Doorbell, so it alerts us when someone is at the door. I really find it helpful

reviews.reviewTitle: Great device for Alexa, not the best to listen to music
reviews.reviewText:
I had two Amazon Echo in France and was very satisfied. I just arrived in the USA and found an interesting discount on the Echo Dot so I did buy two of them!

The design of this new Dot is awesome! Alexa works as great as on the Echo (very well!), even when there is some noise.

However the sound from the Dot is not as good as the Echo, and that's why I'll probably have to buy an Echo for the living room, or even the new Echo Studio because listening to music is one of my main usage of Alexa.

I'll keep the Dot for the garage & the kitchen, to run timers or for home automation!

I have two Echos at the moment. The first one I purchased was refurbished and it works perfectly. I purchased this Echo brand new and am a little disappointed. The refurbished one I have has superior performance. This one is disappointing because there is a very slow response time. I have made a command and have waiting up to 10 seconds for a response. Also, this echo has also stopped playing my music randomly without a command. Sometimes I have to repeat the wake word 2 times before I get a response. I don't know if I received a defective one, but this has been my experience.

Bought this for elderly parent who has low vision and lives alone In order to make hands free voice calls to loved ones and emergency contacts. Placed three of them around her house in case of a fall that prevents her from getting to the phone. She also loves to use them for spelling and to add and subtract numbers when doing paperwork related to her business. Sound quality is really good for such a small device and she loves playing her favorite music on them!

I got started with Alexa, when I bought a smart thermostat with an embedded Alexa. Added the Echo dot because the thermostat is fixed in place. The Dot was very easy to install, and works in conjunction with the smart thermostat. I have added smart bulbs, and smart plugs from different manufacturers and all are very easy to connect to both of my Alexa devices. Now I can warm up the house and start the coffee before getting out of bed. Very convenient!

Ugh I’m so sad writing this review. I wanted to love this plug soooo badly because I’ve heard such rave reviews from friends but after the (at least) tenth time of successfully setting up the plug then a half an hour later, the plug saying “device unresponsive” I’ve offiically given up. It continuously disconnects itself and then I have to set it up all over again, just to have it disconnect again. I definitely consider myself a techie and know that both technology, and setting it up, comes very naturally to me, so I’m really sad about this one...because I know this one doesn’t fall on me :(

reviews.reviewTitle: Just another revenue stream for Amazon
reviews.reviewText: We purchased multiple echos (4) and are just as quickly returning all of them. We primarily wanted them for music, not to have Alexa mind our business. In order to play different music on different Echoes you have to purchase the family plan for another $150.00+ per year or deal with their generic music. We might have been open the individual music family plan but more than that NO WAY! Time to say NO to Amazon and being ripped off!!!

This is my 8th echo. I moved a gen 1 dot to a bathroom. When you start adding to a bathroom that's when you know you have enough. Same easy setup as other devices but it does now use a proprietary plug (no micro usb now) which is a downside to me, but the sound is better and the look integrates it better into the category of "home/office decor". Watch for sales as you can save $10 or more from time to time.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great sound for such a small speaker
reviews.reviewText: I previously had a first or second generation echo dot. I liked it a lot for music on Pandora, or news on TuneIn. But I connected it with a larger bluetooth speaker for better sound. That meant always remembering to find the remote and turn on the speaker when I wanted to listen to music. This newer generation has surprisingly good sound -- good enough that I don't bother to use the bluetooth speaker.

The sound of the Dot is surprisingly good, sounding rich and full in my living room. It performs the same functions as my Echo and hears me easily from the kitchen. It matches up effortlessly to both of my iPhones and both of my Kindle Fire tablets and to my computer. What I especially like is that I could create an Everywhere entity so music and books play through the Echo and the Dot simultaneously, so I can walk around without missing anything.

I got this free when I purchased and signed up for Sirius. We had an dot gen 2 with a speaker in our master bathroom, but the speaker would cut out at high volumes. I put the Gen 3 in place of it and it has more sound than the Gen 2 with an external speaker. It's also handy to connect our shower Bluetooth speaker to so we can enjoy tunes while taking a shower.

I own an Echo Dot (2nd gen) and a Sonos One speaker which have been working together well. I bought an Echo Dot (3rd gen) without realizing all Dots have to be same generation to work together! Now my Sonos speaker doesn't work with Alexa ("I'm sorry, I can't understand at this time; try again later"). Disappointing. Wish the description of 3rd generation Dot would have advised about this before I bought.

reviews.reviewTitle: NO BATTERY so it is NOT portable
reviews.reviewText: I assumed (my bad) that this would be a portable speaker, but there is NO BATTERY. Really Amazon? You couldn't make this a little bit better so we can move it from room to room???? I am extremely disappointed. My own fault for not really researching but nowadays, portability is the norm and the standard. I didn't even think to check. So, it's a glorified stationery speaker. VERY VERY DISAPPOINTED.

Really cool thing to have and I absolutely love to check briefing in the morning when I wake up similar device from Google cannot even compare, Alexa much better!! The only thing I don't like about it, it does not have internal battery so you can move around and then plug back in. And I was expecting for better bass.. It's loud but the quality of the sound is not that great. But I'm not planning to use it as a speaker to play music anyway..

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo dot and Alexa are a waste of money in my opinion
reviews.reviewText: I purchased the echo dot to mainly work with my Sirius XM radio subscription but she does not want to use it. She keeps telling me she doesn’t understand. I have it added to the echo, but she wants to use Amazon music. I also cannot get her to play ocean sounds at bedtime nor give a weather forecast. She says she only knows current conditions. It seems like a waste of money to me.

I love the wonderful potential this dot has to everyday life. Since I got it on Feb. 20th, it has enhanced my day, helped with shopping, cooking, music and news of the day, plus lots more. 2 issues, does not wake up in a.m. I have to go into app to get it started. Next, it is a learning curve to talk to Alexa. She doesn't understand me or/and I do not understand her. Words can be difficult to pick up. Such as REIGN(movie) vs. rain.

We have 2 of these in the house and they work great. I am getting used to having a digital assistant who really assists. Sometimes, the integration between the 2 devices isn't great, but I honestly haven't spent much time learning the nuances of Alexa and her devices. However, these take up no space (we use the wall hangers) and work fine, so no complaints here!

This is a great improvement over previous generation.

It is more aestically pleasing with its larger size and improvement in sound. Unlike the original echo, the dot was made to hook up external speakers to it. You can use it without external speakers but but you won’t get the bass you are looking for. I have mine hooked up to a pair of Edifier speakers.

This is definitely the cheapest way to introduce Alexa into your home.

Good Smart speaker, i feel better than google home mini of the same size.
most importantly i like the Custom QA Skill. you can add your own Questions and answers. I added some funny questions. this really good. You connect to external speaker through 3.5 mm jack.
Downside, charge port is an old pin style instead of the micro USB.

its really good

Right now I am not super impressed by the Echo Dot but it serves it’s purpose for what I need the Bluetooth functionality does not work for me and I am a speaker guy so that’s very important however the voice interface seems OK I hope in the future I have a better experience with this Echo Dot...UPDATE: Customer service work with me and Bluetooth problem has been resolved now I don’t want to live without Alexa because it functions How it was advertised!

I like that its very easy to set up. It has descent sound quality considering the size. Echo has a lot of great features and can help do things to make life easier, e.g. control lights, locks, play music, and control your TV, etc. One thing I didn't like and was a bit disappointed is that you cannot rename Echo to a custom name. You can only rename it to 4 different default wake words...what a shame. I will continue to use Echo dot for now, but once another company can offer a system that you can rename and call it whatever you want that's the system I will buy.

reviews.reviewTitle: LOVE THE SIZE WEIGHT AND FEEL
