reviews.reviewText: I LIKE THIS UNIT FOR IT SIZE AND WEIGHT, GOOD LOOKS MANUEL OVERIDE FOR COMMANDS IN LOUD ENVIROMENTS, LIKE THE AUDIO OUT FEATURE HAVE IT HOOKED UP TO MY TANGENT TABLE TOP RADIO AND SOUNDS GOOD WHEN IT PLAYS MUSIC, BUT NO AS RESPONSIVE AS GOOGLE HOME MINI SLOWER TO WAKE UP AND HAS A HARD TIME UNDERSTANG COMMANDS LIKE, TURN THE HEAT OFF JUST NOT AS SENSITIVE AS GOOGLE MINI TO LANGUAGE BUT IT WORKS AND LIKE THE LOOKS AND RESPONSIVE LIGHTS

reviews.reviewTitle: Amazon Echo 3rd generation adds so much to my life
reviews.reviewText: The Amazon Echo is amazingly clear, understands my commands and is quick to respond. I love having the ability to shop, listen to music, check the weather do a trivia quiz, make calls and use as a intercom between my two devices. I even control my lights with the Amazon Echo Dot 3rd generation by using Smart bulbs that are Alexa enabled. I can control a downstairs light through my upstairs device or on my Iphone using the Alexa app. I don’t know how I ever lived without the Amazon Echo Dot.

Alexa is an idiot. I asked "How many seasons Fraiser was on for?" she replied "4". Any show I gave her she said 4. I would ask her who sang a song she would respond to a particular song I had her play earlier. Her answer would be completely the wrong subject. Sound quality is still not up to google mini. I think Alexa needs a small speaker added to the top, I think it would help. But I got frustrated with her not being able to answer me about 75% of the time.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not as good as my 2nd generation echo dot
reviews.reviewText: I don't know if I have things set up wrong or what. The echo dot doesn't hear every time I say Alexa even when it is dead quiet. I will also give it commands to turn lights off or AC on and it will fail. I've noticed the sound is also muffled. In general it has trouble hearing me sometimes. I can say Alexa really loud and my echo dot 2nd generation picks up the sound.

We bought this in November after being very satisfied with our previous gen echo and echo dot. It's been an absolute headache from day one. The voice recognition is horrible and works when it feels like it. The speakers plays well for a while and then starts crackling (no matter how many times I have reset it). It has also made trying to use the "everywhere" network a nightmare. The music will que in other areas and play for several seconds (sometime a whole verse) and then start playing. This also causes unexplained pauses during playback.

I could go on but this was supposed to be a luxury purchase and I feel like I've done way too much work to this point.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works very well, easy to use, great product.
reviews.reviewText: It seems to have a little trouble connecting at first, both to wifi and then to my phone. Once it connected it's worked well and it seems easy to use. I also have the Google version and I like this one a little better. It seems a little more user friendly, my wife prefers the Google so it really is a matter of personal opinion. The only thing I prefer about the google is the sound, for the same size device the Google has better sound but only by a little bit.

reviews.reviewTitle: How can you NOT like these?
reviews.reviewText: Seriously.. what is there to not enjoy about these devices? They're so fun to have around. Setting timers, setting alarms, controlling your smart devices, stories, jokes, music, calendar, traffic reports, news.. on and on and on.. I gotta tell ya, I was pretty surprised at the depth and quality of the sound of this little guy. I am planning on purchasing at least 3 more of these and one of the big echo plus units. Super excited.

reviews.reviewTitle: Always disconnecting from the internet (not an internet issues)!
reviews.reviewText: We got this for a white nose machine for it child. It is really got and did exactly what we what except for the 3 or 4 times a month it cannot connect to the internet and totally stupid working for the next few days... Now before anyone makes comments about this being an internet issues we have Google fiber gigabit internet speeds and a small home. Using any device right beside the echo Dot while it is having internet issues you can stream 4k video without a moment of hesitation. So it is definitely not an internet issues, it is totally an extra door issue. That being said if it stops working several times a month (often waking up our child in the process) we now are going to get a Google home mini to do the job that this obviously cannot do. Other than that it is a great speaker

Having bought an Echo Dot 2nd generation and being not so impressed with it allowed me to notice the upgrade and big difference that the Echo Dot 3d generation: much much better quality and louder sound that enhances the experience using multi-room speaker. Oh! and Alexa now speaks Spanish which to me is an added benefit that it didn't have before. It will be very helpful when my mom, who does not speak English, comes to visit. I can set the Echo in her room only to Spanish.

Heard these third generation smart speakers were a huge improvement in sound. Wanted one for the bathroom that had a small footprint and sounded reasonably good. They are not as god as much larger speakers, but for the size and the room it was being used in, it was great. Can hear it clearly even while showering. Does not distort when cranking up the volume. And with the cloth surround, much more appealing visually. Not suggested as your main Echo Smart speaker, but if space and cost are of prime concern, this fits the bill very well.

I started off buying one echo, and one 2nd gen dot. Then bought 2 3rd gen dots. I love everything about Alexa, though my Dutch wife sometimes has a few troubles. The 3rd gen is incredible with really good sound. So, I ended up buying 8 more. They were on special for $24 before Christmas. 3 for my Dutch daughters' house, and now we have 7 in our house. Everyone here likes them and uses them daily. And announcements come in very handy. The announcement goes to all devices, so no more hunting everyone down for dinner, etc.

The Gen 3 Dot is my latest addition to the Echo echo system in my house. I have a couple of Gen 2 dots and a full size echo that I love. I added inexpensive bluetooth speakers (they are attached via aux cables) to the Gen 2 dots for better sound quality.

The Gen 3 is a lot better sounding. The mic array seems to be more responsive, but that could be just me. My most recent dot came as a bundle with a Ring Pro doorbell so I didn't even pay directly for it, but would gladly pay up to $35 for one. I do not think $50 is a good price especially since they offer discounts fairly often through Amazon.

I have one in the kitchen that I use for cooking questions, controlling my Amazon Microwave, and weather questions, etc. I have one in the bedroom to play sleep sounds, tell me the time, tell my smartplug to turn on the CPAP machine, etc. and one in the computer room to answer whatever questions pop up and to tell Alexa I'm leaving so she can go on guard duty. Very handy.

Sometimes its hard to understand Alexa, but we like the ease of using this for music and calling. Kids have fun asking questions too. Hopefully they'll be on sale again during the holidays. Got this one for $15 during the Anniversary sale. I had to use my computer to set it up because it wouldn't complete set up on my phone, other than that we've had no issues.

We received the Echo Dot with the purchase of a years subscription to Sirius XM radio. So with that being said, it would’ve had to have been a dud for me not to like it. It has proven itself, however, to be quite indispensable around the house. My young daughters like being able to listen to stories, and they are empowered by the ability to search and listen to the music that they like. Sometimes we listen to nature sounds at night to soothe the girls for bedtime. Quite pleased with Echo Dot, all around.

reviews.reviewTitle: It's the best Alexa information center!
reviews.reviewText: My friend that lives 5 hours away from me had gotten one for Christmas, so when this came on sale she called me an told me what a great price it was. I immediately ordered me one, it came in two days free shipping with Prime, I love it very much. Was easy to set up to my internet and my voice. Alexa entertained my 7 & 4 year old grandson's. I was so impressed with the Echo Box I reordered two more as gifts. My 17 yr old granddaughter loves hers. I have the other one I'll save for a gift.

very nice recommenable at the start i thought it didnt bring spanish and it only showed 3 launguages and i spoke to custumer service and they sent me a email explaining me how to do it and thats how i got in the launguages and i found spanish its not that hard to find when you set it up and you put it in a bedroom or living room you press that room and there the launguages will pop up and there is spanish i hope this helped someone thanks

reviews.reviewTitle: This worksd great for me the echo dot.
reviews.reviewText: I like it because I don't have to get out of bed and turn off light at night. I read at night and I would have to get up and turn off light then I wasn't sleepy, so now I just tell it to turn of light and go right to sleep. When getting ready to go to the gym I tell it to turn on my radio station I can listen to music while I get ready. It all so lets me no of any message I have. It is great.

It hates me. It is very hard to get it to do what I want. On the other hand when my African aid comes to help out it picks up her voice even though she’s not using it and performs what it thinks she wants. It has some great sound though. I like listening to music through it but I haven’t figured out how to get it to play my iTunes. Also I don’t trust it to stay on all the time. Everyone is in the business of filling in the blanks about the personalities, buying habits, etc. etc. of their consumers. None of your business. So I use it every once in a while and then just unplug it when I’m done. Thanks for the great price on it, Which I think was just shipping. But you’re getting what you want in return, I knew so I guess we both get what we want.

Device has nice weight..Music is a little distorted... muffled and sounds like there is gravel in the speaker...playing at 64 percent.
May sound alot better at lower volume with simpler music. I play soca music and alternative.
I have the echo first gen...and Logitech and sony smart speakers...my rating for sound quality is 6 out of 10.
It does play loud...but not balanced and clear.

reviews.reviewTitle: I think Alexa is spying on me - AMAZING sound over ver 2
reviews.reviewText: Amazing sound over version 2 almost like a bose speaker. However I think Alexa is spying on me, I ask her to play music and it appears. I ask her to change the TV station and it happens. I asked her what 348293048 divided by 7 and she knew, well I think she did since I don't I had to take her word for it. I asked her who was getting custody of her in the divorce and she didn't know. I feel sorry for her now coming from a broken home and all.

I initially bought her to replace my lifeline--as a safety measure. Her range of hearing is better than I thought it could be, so I can ask her to call someone when I am in bed and it works. Her voice is so pleasant and I enjoy our little conversations. I ask for current weather; she gives that plus the daily forecast. Great for playing music that you want. Sports information, etc.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works OK but way to invasive
reviews.reviewText:
I received the Echo Dot as a gift. I would probably never have purchased one for myself. It was set up by the person who gave it to me so I didn't get to choose any of the options. I used it for maybe one hour - then it went back in the box where it will probably stay until I can sell or otherwise get rid of it without offending the gift giver.

Shortly after setting it up, I started receiving Alexa and smart device email offers which I didn't ask for or want. It records every command or request it receives and deleting those is not any easy process. There are probably those who don't mind sacrificing their privacy for convenience but to me, it is mostly a privacy invading novelty item.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love it but the speaker has issues
reviews.reviewText:
UPDATE:
Ever since I restarted the unit about a month or two ago I have not had the same problem. I’d totally recommend this over Google Home.

I loved the alarms you can set and also how you can link SiriusXM to it. However, my speaker gets very static which is weird since this is streaming and not antenna. It happens on and off and completely ruins my mood when a great song comes on.

The speaker blew within the first 3 months of use. Used very lightly, and never mistreated. I did some research and MANY customers have had this same problem. Pretty disapointed because I expected high quality from Amazon.

Sometimes the speakers are so bad that if there's an S involved in anything being played musically or in speaking it just comes up as pure static. Also intermittently just disconnects in the middle of playing Pandora or something, even though my echo less than 40 feet away is continuing to play and it's still connected to the internet. It just decides to stop playing. Also doesn't pick up the sound of my voice very well even though I'm near it. Find myself yelling to be heard. I'll probably never buy one of these again

My kitchen radio broke and instead of getting a new radio ( could not find an option that looked nice); I decided to get the Echo Dot. I can listen to the local radio show I like in the morning and the rest of the day I listen to my favorite commercial free music. I have Apple Music and Amazon Music so my options are pretty great.

I have not used it for too much else, I don’t have smart gadgets connected. I have asked for a few traffic reports and reminders.

I like it has a mute button so it shouldn’t be listening then.

It is small and looks great on my counter.

Set up was pretty easy, I actually bought two and had a little bit of trouble setting up the second one. I have them working independently, but I think you can have them connected as well. So far, enjoying it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Better Sound; Not as good at picking up voice commands
reviews.reviewText:
The difference in sound between the dot 3 and dot 2 is amazing. If you’re considering getting this to upgrade a dot 2 but unsure, take the plunge and get it.

That said, the microphones in the new dot are not as good. Often an echo from another room will answer me when I address this dot. Oddly, it does pick up my wife’s voice better than the generation 1 echo and generation 2 dots.

reviews.reviewTitle: Significant sound upgrade from the 2nd-gen Dot!
reviews.reviewText:
What a huge upgrade from the 2nd-gen Dot this is! The sound quality is leagues better and it actually fills the room. I would expect that, given that the power adapter is almost twice the wattage (15W for the 3G Dot vs 9W on the old 2G Dot). Replaced a few of my 2nd-gen Dots with some of the 3rd-gens and haven't been let down.

The downside is, there aren't any good speaker cases/shells for it, so be sure to get the color you want upfront, there's no customizing it just yet.

I have family members that have the first generation dot and let’s just say this little speaker has come a LONG way since then. These little speakers sound so clear and go a long way for how tiny they are. When the song plays it’s doesnt sound like the vibration is overpowering the song. The only problem I have is that I can’t link both of my echo dots to play the same station at the same time. But as far as clarity and style these little guys go a long way!

No more USB is kind of a downer, now you need an actual plug. So if you were running an Echo Dot off of another device you are out of luck. Sound is a bit louder and a bit richer then second generation. New look might be slightly better but holds dust and is a pain to clean. I paid $18.02 for mine, PrimeDay plus $5 coupon so I'm not upset. Overall my preference is the second generation Echo Dot.

reviews.reviewTitle: Why doesn't she understand when linked?
reviews.reviewText: I bought this to listen to music AND to be able to control my smart plugs for my lamps. I linked my smart plugs to Alexia and I can open the app and turn them on and off, but she can't do it by voice, which was what I wanted. She says there is more than one device with that name which one do I want. WHAT?? There is not more than one device with the same name.. frustrating ...

reviews.reviewTitle: Great for quick inquires; the dog thinks her name is "Alexa" now
reviews.reviewText: I bought this during cyber week in a package deal with smart bulbs. While I haven't tried out the smart bulbs, I've asked Alexa a variety of questions about weather, current events, movies, astrophysics and theory. I can tell she pulls most of her information from either Google or Wikipedia. While on Christmas vacation, I'm trying to stay away from sitting at a desk so she's great for quick inquiries. The other day I heard my boyfriend answering political questions that Alexa was asking HIM in the form of some quiz with multiple rounds. I believe the dog thinks we're changing her name to "Alexa" as she trots over when we call for the Echo across the room. It has a great range as I can ask for her while I'm in the kitchen and the Echo Gen 3 is way on the other side of the house in the living room. Overall I'm happy with this purchase! I didn't think I would take to it so quickly, and I'm eager to install the bulbs to control lighting. Over the coming months I'm hoping to purchase a Ring doorbell and a smart thermostat.

reviews.reviewTitle: It almost does what it needs to
reviews.reviewText: The microphone on my second generation echo dot is much better than the 3rd generation echo dot. My apartment is 600 sq. ft. and my second generation (in the bedroom) picks up my voice better than the third generation 5 feet from my entry door.

I have the echo, echo dot gen 2, and not echo dot gen 3. Gen 3 is by far the worse when it comes to connection and requires constant restart. I originslly placed in in the room next to the router but it constantly had issues. The other device dont. I switched rooms and moved the dot 2farther away and dot3 a few inches from the router and next morning. Im having trouble connecting, other one is fine. Its not the signal strength nor is my apt built with thick walls. My echo 1st gen is furthest away and never disconnects. I recommend going gor older models. You arent missing much upgrading.

reviews.reviewTitle: LATINOS DO NOT PURCHASE ANYTHING THAT WORKS WITH ALEXA.
reviews.reviewText: LATINOS DO NOT PURCHASE ANYTHING THAT WORKS WITH ALEXA, CUSTOMER SERVICE IN THE USA DOES NOT WORK IN SPANISH, AND WHEN THEY PASS FOR MEXICO, THE MEXICANS DO NOT WANT TO ATTEND BECAUSE YOU LIVE IN THE USA. THEY BURY AND DISCRIMINATE BOTH THE MEXICO AND THE USA.

reviews.reviewTitle: What is that high cracking tone?
reviews.reviewText: I guess I need to call CS but sound quality in one of the 2 I purchased is not good. One has a high pitch and will even crack when it gives me my morning flash briefing. I really can't use it as it sounds so bad I have to turn it off. So one star for now and off to customer service I go.

reviews.reviewTitle: Speaker is decent if you're not too picky on sound quality
reviews.reviewText: I didn't need or want this thing in my house but I received it as a gift and I can't just refuse a gift, so I only use it for music. Now, I know this isn't made for music but I just liked the idea of being able to skip tracks, turn on music from other rooms of the house (my house is fairly small), turn up the volume, so on and so on. Other than music, I have zero use for it. I've had it roughly two weeks now and with a constant listening volume of 5 the speaker has blown and is very distorted. Back to the sound bar and blu-tooth.

This was a gift and is easy to set up with your internet connection. I use this echo dot with Alexa for many things, I can track my orders, receive notifications, play my music from the cloud, and there are still things I'm learning.

I have even thought about purchasing a couple more for my household, it comes in a few colors and blends in well. If you are interested in the Echo's than this is a good generation to start with.

I have two 1st Gen echo dots that I like so much better than the 3rd Gen!! The sound from the 3rd Gen is quite muffled. I think they were probably trying to make it better quality (maybe a little less harsh) than 1st Gen but it is really just softer. The 3rd Gen also cuts out frequently. I can be listening to music or a radio program and all of a sudden it’s gone. Sometimes it comes back by itself and other times I have to restart verbally.

Sound quality is so awesome. I got this as a gift for my son. He’s seven and it’s able to understand him completely when he asks for songs. It’s so easy to use. There is no limit to what this little speaker can do. Call friends, play music, tell the weather, add things to a grocery list. It’s really great. Makes life easier. I’ve already bought another since getting the one for my son.

Difficult to set up. I have been in the Technical computer support business for over 20 yrs. I will update this review if I change my mind. PROMISE!

Got an immediate response from Customer Support. She helped me quite a bit. I'm going to raise my review to 4 stars. The wife LOVES it. She can lay on the couch and hear any song that pops into her head with a simple command. I still think that it should be easier to set up.

So I have had the Echo Dot for about 2 weeks so far and I love it. It was very easy for me to set up, it took about 15 mins, and I had no problem connecting to my home WIFI .

The only issue that I ghave was that I was unable to connect the bluetooth speaker I already had to my ALexa network, it would not find it, no matter what I tried. I did not try and call Amazon, but I may do that at a later date to see if they have some troubleshooting ideas.

The Echo dot is fine. However I purchased this with the Phillips Hue Bulbs. Two weeks ago the bulbs simply stopped connecting via blue tooth to my echo dots. The lights work but there is no way to adjust any of the settings. So now its a wasted purchase. Purchased on July 16th as a set.

I cant review the bulbs some how reviewing them is blocked and that seems shady...

reviews.reviewTitle: Failed at what I needed it for. But great for everything else it is meant to do.
reviews.reviewText: I use this device Specifically as an alarm clock. I have college Monday Wednesday Friday. Set my alarm for 5am on those days an I'm not sure how or why but there are times it let's me down an does not go off. I found that if the Alexa app doesnt say that itll go off at 5am on say April 29th but instead says set to Mondays at 5am then it wont go off. The alarm should have the dates is basically what I'm trying to say. Having it just say mondays does not work

reviews.reviewTitle: App may not work with your device so be prepared
reviews.reviewText: Alexa App worked for approximately two days before it completely failed. Uninstalled/Installed three times and it was DOA at step one each time. When it did work it was satisfactory. Wouldn't use it as a stand alone speaker for music as it's small with limitations. Fortunately it was free so I'm only out my time but I wouldn't recommend buying it.

After weeks of trying to get this and constantly being notified that it was on back order and would be sent on such and such date... I was finally refunded so I could purchase a different color. The amount I was refunded didn't cover the entire cost of a different one because the original one was on sale and this was not. Otherwise I like it very much.

I started out buying one echo dot and one of the Google equivalents. I can tell you this, after the initial novelty wore off, the Google device just seemed to be a search engine for Wikipedia. The Echo just seemed to become an important part of the house.

Since my initial purchase, I’ve added 5 more echo devices throughout the house. The Google unit is hardly ever used. I think that says it all.

I’m still learning how to work Alexa but she’s fun. I do like the “start my morning” option. I also really like that she stays connected to your phone via Bluetooth which makes it easy if want to listen to music/podcasts from your phone. The sound quality is also good for music. If you want to drive your cats crazy, have her meow at them. I will give an update when needed.

reviews.reviewTitle: Multi language feature does not work
reviews.reviewText:
The device does pretty much what Siri does, except she has a harder time understanding or doing the right thing.

I’m particularly frustrated right now because the multilingual function that just came out does not actually work. After speaking with 2 different Amazon reps 4 times, and doing the same diagnostics over and over again, no one knows how to make the multi language function work. If the function is not ready for launch, it should not be launched. And if amazon wants to launch something, make sure your techs know about it rather than making me forward the communication to them so they can research and learn about this new feature.

I feel embarrassed for amazon.

I was about to buy two more but during use i realise that the.voice recognition is not that great you tell her one thing it does the other , and if you set the volume to higher than 8. Then it is unable to hear you so you’ll have to either shout or press the botton for it to hear you.
Sound is great mainly i use it as an alarm and some ambient music that’s it otherwise not that great

I have purchased this twice as gifts and recently purchased one for my bedroom. I have have also purchased two other more expensive echos, one of which stopped working to my dismay after not having been used hardly at all. My gift recipients have been very happy with their gifts and I have enjoyed having the dot by my bedside if I am in mood for music or in need of a wake up call. For the price, you can't go wrong.

2nd 3rd generation echo. Obsessed. You can link all your Alexa’s to play music around the house. You can teach your Echo lots of skills via the app, and you can even customize and make your own skills. Before I owned the Echo I didn’t even really know what it was or if I would use or like it, after 2 months I now have an alexa in all major spots in my house. My son uses it to control his Bluetooth lights as well as turn on and off his tv. Obsessed.

reviews.reviewTitle: Way better voice recognition. Love the clock!
reviews.reviewText: I like having a clock near my tv. I got this dot, bought some Phillips color changing light bulbs and moved my 2nd gen. dot upstairs to my bedroom. Now I can say "Alexa, TV lights" and the lights dim, some change to blue, and my Hisense Roku TV turns on all automatically. The voice recognition is noticeably different... I mean wow. Even sitting right under my tv she does a great job. I am so pleased.

I'm currently a college student in a dorm room and this is a great way to play music in my room! The sound quality is pretty great and it's fairly easy to use, I just connect the Echo to my phone's hotspot. I do wish that the Alexa app was a little easier to use though, and I wish that my Echo would atuomatically connect to my phone's hotspot when I turn it on, because I have to re-pair it with my phone each time I use it, which takes about three minutes each time. Not a huge deal, but I would like it if I didn't have to do that haha. Overall great device.

reviews.reviewTitle: An upgrade from the previous generation.
reviews.reviewText: This version of the Amazon Echo Dot is definitely an upgrade in comparison to the previous model. It sounds better, the design is refreshed and it doesn’t look like a cheap toy, the charging port is easier to plug and it’s also longer. You can create routines to integrate the Echo Dot to your Ring doorbell and make it announce that people are in your front door or if it detects motion, what I found really nice. Overall, a good product.

I think it is an improvement over the google counterpart... slightly. It would be nice to be able to talk immediately after a question is answered by alexa without having to say alexa a 2nd time. Maybe alexa could keep its mic open until a thank you is heard or until X number of seconds went by of quiet. This could be an option called "conversation mode". The user could end the conversation by saying "alexa rest"

reviews.reviewTitle: I thought they would be better
reviews.reviewText:
So I bought 2 echos because I wanted to get a speaker to listen to music and maybe have an alarm as well. I got them when they were on sale and I was happy with the price... Now it’s been a while and I’ve used them quite a bit and I have to say that the echos are just okay
They sound just okay, I have them as my stereo speakers but the sound get’s all distorted if I turn the volume up
They almost never recognize me when I use the wake word and I have to say it multiple times and it’s really frustrating
And they just disconnect from wifi all the time
I’ve tried resetting them and troubleshooting all sorts of things and nothing
I like the concept of having smart speakers but the execution of them is not that good

My JBL speaker broke so I purchased this one. I really tried to give it a chance but it kept disconnecting from my phone everytime I tried to play music on it. It's not even that loud. I really don't think it's worth $50.

I love Alexa. It has been so helpful to have a shopping list, before, I would write things down, and then forget the list, or forget to write it down. I love being able to ask about the weather or a cheerful corny joke. The crazy thing is she sounds so nice that it is hard to remember she is not a living person. She deserves to be.
This was easy to set up. Husband and I are computer savvy though. Love it so much I bought a second one for my sewing room.

reviews.reviewTitle: great buy, great price, and great sound output. the only thing is the mic...
reviews.reviewText: I love the output of sound for the price, as well as the price. I think it is appropriate priced in reference to the Echo, which I also own. My only grievance is with the voice mics... it seems to have trouble picking up clear statements when you speak from the side. Only when you are standing directly over the mics will it pick up clear statement. This is a somewhat large flaw... but I think the stand you can buy on Amazon might be a suitable answer for this. Since it seems to work when speaking directly into the mics with no issue, the stand should help reorient the mics so they are facing toward you. After that I can't foresee any issue. It functions just like any other echo, and is room link-able like any other Echo. A+.

reviews.reviewTitle: Spanish & English set up perfectly working
reviews.reviewText: Quick set up, I was able to have the one In the living room set up in Spanish for my parents and it works perfect, I haven’t had any issues as of yet, it sounds great. Does have issues when other sounds around but for the most part everything works perfect both in English & spanish, thought the Spanish version would lack but it works just perfectly as the one I have in my room with the English set up

My only issue isn't with the Dot, but with the Alexa service itself. Maybe it's my internet connection, but the Dot keeps losing connectivity and shutting itself down. This has happened twice in the last week, and it was down for both of those days. I received this as part of another company's promotion, so I didn't pay anything for this one, but I'll be ordering at least three more for my new house. Now, I'm not so sure about the whole thing.

This unit is much nicer and better than the 1st generation I had ages ago. Easy to set up and the sound is very good considering small speaker. When I plugged a set of Desktop speakers with a subwoofer it really came alive. I received another one just like it for Father's Day and I have them set up in my office space and Living room. The intercom feature comes in handy when my wife wants to call me to watch a show or have dinner. Highly recommended.

reviews.reviewTitle: Cool to use, shipping is horrible
reviews.reviewText: Overall - the echo dot 3rd gen is a cute little speaker.. doesn’t have perfect sound quality like a beats pill or a Bose soundlink but if you have another speaker you can connect it to if you’re using this primarily to stream music - you’re golden. If you’re looking to get this as a quick gift .. turn away & go find another speaker !! This takes FOREVER to ship out whether you pay extra/have prime or not. Not worth the wait in my opinion as well.

We have an existing Echo. This one was purchased to put upstairs in our daughters room. She can listen to music in her room or we can sync both the Echo and the new Echo dot to have music playing throughout the house. For such a small device this Echo Dot puts out great sound for a small room. We are very satisfied with this purchase. I would recommend this product to a friend/family member and I would buy again. In fact I am sure we will buy one for our bedroom!!

Great for a single, full-range, down-firing speaker. Their circuitry has it bass-heavy, so in settings, increase the miss up 2 & highs up 4 or max. I bought 3 more, to have 4 in total, and I placed them in a room for excellent sound and clarity. Even outside, the 4 dot group sound is pretty good. Put them a few inches from a wall for better, and louder, sound.

Alexa gave me an inappropriate, and OFFENSIVE answer to a question I asked.

Apparently ANY Amazon customer has the opportunity to go into the Alexa app and answer questions that confused Alexa. That means when you ask your Echo Dot a question, you could get an answer from ANYONE, including a person making a rude joke about overweight people?!

Let's get straight to the cons:

- Hard time to pick the signal from the noise. In NYC where sirens go off every 10 mins, Alexa does not seem to respond to requests (might just need a better mic or maybe the algorithm needs more optimization).
- Very often the speech rec. does not understand my requests and I have to shout and speak very slowly in order for Alexa to understand.
- Wired.

reviews.reviewTitle: Don’t let Amazon’s price point fool you, these have a higher price sound
reviews.reviewText:
I’ve got several of these dots in different places. And find them to be a nice addition to the whole house music system. They can play different things in each room at the same time. Or they’ll play the same thing everywhere.
They have a great sound for their size, that’s full and rich. Don’t let Amazon’s price point fool you, these have a higher price sound.

I’m totally happy with this speaker. I use this one in my bathroom, because it’s louder than my other three older version Alexa echos. I have them all through my house for full home surround sound. Only had the issue of them all not syncing like two times. Alexa is pretty cool, especially since I have almost every lamp and other things in my house, even my bearded dragons’ light timer set to it. My Wyze cameras also work with these, Christmas lights etc.

reviews.reviewTitle: Try it.... Good for the price but nothing is 100
reviews.reviewText:
Notice this has a higher quality base tone and volume pitch than the original one's.
It's wrap a material fabric and speakers are awesome.... Great price. Not water proof or fire proof. Will recommend for sure but a flaw when you put the ear buds to listen to music it's loose doesn't grasp well.have to wrap cord on the bottom to tighten the grip...🙄🙄😩but it's okay. Ear quality I guess it depends on the brand of headphones....

reviews.reviewTitle: Gen 3 sound much better than previous generations
reviews.reviewText: We have Echoes or Dots in most of the rooms in our home and use Alexa to control lights, sprinklers, plugs and keep us entertained with music. We have a Gen 1 and Gen 2 Dot, but I’m surprised how much better this Gen 3 sounds than the other two. It’s also nicer looking with the charcoal fabric that covers it. It was easy to set it up and add it to a couple of my room groups.

We have two echo dots - a 2nd gen and this one. Both seem to have the same issue of stopping unprompted or answering unprompted. This version initially had a static sound when we plugged it in but it would disappear and reappear on occasion. Now the static is gone but she often decides to stop playing music in the middle of my horrible rendition of a song. This leads to a lot of embarassing moments at parties. Otherwise, she's cool.

my kids got these for xmas so each one has one in their room. we have an Echo in the kitchen. great option is that we can call any given dot from the Echo in the kitchen so acts as an intercom system to talk to our kid. beats yelling from downstairs. great for calling them to dinner. all the same functionality as the Echo just a bit smaller unit and not as loud, but plenty of sound for room music listening.

Sorry, this video is unsupported on this browser.
 Amazon has horrible customer service. If you have any problems with your account amazon disconnects all of your Alexa’s and if you have your refrigerator, lights, ring, garage door hooked up to Alexa like I do then nothing works and amazon solution is for you as the customer fix it yourself even though they are the ones that deleted everything from my account. In my case they did this twice to me and sent me emails in French about why they did it. I’m an American and only speak English!!! The amazon employees on the phone are no help either. First thing out of the team leaders mouth was I can’t do anything but send a email. I’ve been a prime member since 2004 and this is how they treat their customers!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Surprised by sound quality, don't know why I waited so long to buy one!
reviews.reviewText: I had been so hesitant to buy an Echo. I set it up today, and have been using it ALL afternoon! I love the trivia games on it, I've set up some cool skills, and I love how it's able to remind me of daily needs, and things I add as needed. I'm buying a second one to put in my bedroom with the clock on it! Can't wait to test the routines feature. Setting up a playlist for my dog for when I leave as I review this!

I wanted to bring Alexa upstairs and the Echo Dot is perfect. For such a small unit, the sound quality is excellent, very responsive to voice commands and easy to connect to my downstairs Echo when I want music throughout the whole house. I love having the Dot on my nightstand to listen to podcasts/music/ambient sounds when I go to bed.

I bought the Echo without a specific purpose in mind just because good speech understanding for $25 is so impressive.
We use it most often to listen to NPR in the morning because the audio quality is better than our radio, which suffers from occasional static.
Occasionally we ask it random questions for information or fun.
The most annoying problem is its inability to hear "Alexa" when it's playing loud. We often have to repeat ourselves a few times to turn it down or off. Consequently we've quickly developed a rather stern tone when addressing it: "Alexa!"
Very occasionally it hallucinates its name when we're merely conversing. Its resulting response is a bit creepy but amusing.
It's interesting how we relate to it. I can say things to Alexa that would be rude to say to my wife, e.g. "Shut up!"

Perfect Amazon Alexa gadget for our bedroom. We use it to wake us up with the latest news, turn on our bedside table lamps, and for the weather. I personally love Dropping In on my husband when he’s upstairs playing video games. Beats yelling at him to come down or having to call him on his phone, which he never hears. Might buy one for our daughter’s room just to drop in and tell her to wake up when she sleeps past noon. 😈

reviews.reviewTitle: The Echo Dot is a Must have!
reviews.reviewText: I was hesitant to get a smart speaker but I’m really glad I did. I’m really really enjoying having this speaker. I’ve got one in my living room and bedroom. The sound quality of the speaker is awesome. I’m going to purchase the subwoofer to make the sound quality that much better. It’s not necessary to have it but I have music playing all the time so adding the subwoofer is just a bonus.

This is my first Gen 3 Echo. The sound is no longer even close to normal. Way to much bass. Appears no way to fix it. They need to go back to the quality as in the previous Echo Gens. Voice quality is almost not intelligible. It is so bad I am returning it as a defective product. Appreciate the talk with the Amazon tech guy. However he did not have a solution.

It's alexa in small form! I am just getting to know this little lady, but she sure has a lot of information! I have yet to unleash its full power...I guess my only problem with the Dot is that the bass is not that great..If you have it up too high, you'll get distortion, too low, and it's just not enough bass...I have this paired with my full sized echo and I love being able to listen to music throughout the house..

This is absolutely AMAZING!! I tried not to jump on the Echo bandwagon But i took a chance because of the procing during the Prime days! My angels and i are in LOVE. I ordered anothernefore the price point expires! The sound is soooooo good to us. We do live in an apt so i don't know if that has anything to do with it. I recommend this little thjng to everyone....ALEXA HAS A SENSE OF HUMOR lol. FYI we only had her for a coupke of hours but so far so good.

reviews.reviewTitle: Power Supply Change is Net Negative
reviews.reviewText: The change from a USB type power supply to a proprietary type is the reason I am not likely to buy anymore 3rd generation Echo Dots. The 2nd generation aftermarket holders that effectively hold the device on the electrical outlet keep everything neat and tidy. With the new power supply, I have 2 feet of unwanted wire to deal with.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa is my first, my last, my everything!
reviews.reviewText: I love my Alexa so much that I don't want to live without her. She fulfills a lot of my daily needs. She's there to tell me the weather, to tell me who won a football game or who's playing which teams. She's there every time I have a question. She is irreplaceable. She's my everything. I love her dearly. She tells me jokes. She tells me math problems. She gives me driving advice. She lets me play games. She reminds me to do important tasks. She converts cooking measurements and times. She knows every recipe. She speaks every language. She is a wealth of knowledge. She's an Enstine and even knows my voice, and my favorite music. She's better than any human and "SHE"S MINE".... I'm so blessed!!!!!

Better sound than the 2nd gen eco dot. This 3rd gen provides lower base frequencies so Alexa's voice sounds more natural. No longer runs on USB power. This one has a proprietary Amazon power brick instead :( It still has the 3.5mm phone jack aux and Bluetooth pairing like the 2nd gen which is good. But if you are fine with the speaker on the 2nd Gen, the 3rd gen doesn't offer additional features. I like it though.

The Echo Dot is great for rooms where you need something small that can communicate with Alexa and play music decently well. We have several dots in use in our home office and other rooms in the house. It pics up commands well and has good sound quality for a small speaker. The microphone on it is able to pick up commands even with ambient noise in the background which is nice. The build quality on it is also quite good and it feels sturdy and well made. I've been happy with it thus far.

I'm not quite too sure how this is an improvement over the Gen 2. It does seem like it has better name detection; I don't feel like I have to walk up to it and literally stand 2 feet away and shout "Alexa" at it 10 times to get a response.

The sound on it is AWFUL; sounds completely muffled. Something as simple as "Alexa...What time is it?" sounds like "muffle muffle muffle PM." when responding...

So far the only thing I dislike is the speed at which Alexa speaks. I am from the South and speak more slowly than the voice from Alexa. I use it daily to get a quick news report when I am brewing my coffee, defining an unusual word in some book I am reading, determine time of day or current date when issuing checks, tell a joke from time to time, there are lots of other uses but for now I consider it as a useful and amusing toy.

This Echo Dot is everything I wanted to handle my to-do list without having to be tied to a pad and pen. I never seem to remember my shopping list when I leave home so now my list is on my phone after Alexa handling the list. I have not had it long enough to report on more things but can add to the review after using it more. So far, I am very happy with the purchase.

I'm still learning the features of Alexa. I have uploaded my music to the Amazon Music Libary. The Echo dot has decent sound. I discovered it can Bluetooth pair with my speakers so I don't need an AUX sound cable. This is an awesome feature. Alexa understands most of what I ask. Sometimes, I need to manually control the Dot using the cell phone app, like when I paired it with my Bluetooth speaker.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good new or as an upgrade. Exudes quality.
reviews.reviewText: Upgraded from 2nd gen echo puck, much, much better sound quality. Unit is a touch larger but with the fabric cover but much more elegant. Definitely worth the upgrade. I believe the microphones are much better at picking up commands. The biggest upgrade is the sound quality it's not tinny, it's got body and it's much more enjoyable to listen to especially talk radio.

reviews.reviewTitle: I love my Echo Dot, however...
reviews.reviewText: My Echo Dot was a gift from my daughter. I love it. However. I've had a couple of issues. On the back, the second outlet is misaligned so it can't be used. But one side is fine so I can plug the adapter into the wall. Next, I was listening to my favorite radio station through the Echo Dot and it began playing the same music over and over. After checking the station on another device, I realized it was my Echo Dot. That could be a one time problem. I still love my Echo Dot. As I said it was a present from my daughter.

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice addition to my Alexa enabled devices
reviews.reviewText:
Last year we got two echoes and have loved them. This year I wanted an additional device for our computer/media/work room but since it is a smaller room did not think I needed another echo. I saw good reviews on the 3rd Gen of the Echo Dot and ordered this one.
I love it. Enough sound to fill this small room and allows me to listen to Daily Music and News briefings at my work desk.
Highly recommend for smaller rooms.

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo Dots are great smart speakers
reviews.reviewText: This is our first time having any smart speakers and so far Echo Dot has been great so great that we now have two of them also we have even got some bulbs and switch’s that can be controlled by the Echo Dots everything has worked great together the ability to control the lights have came in very handy also the Echo Dots apility to play music from our Apple Music subscription has been a really nice feature to have and they are many more features that can be very handy in every day life I strongly recommend the Echo Dots to anyone that is wanting to get a small smart speaker to help control your smart home!

reviews.reviewTitle: Much better sounding than my gen 2 Echo Dot
reviews.reviewText:
It has inherently better sounding speaker than its predecessor.
I'm getting even better sound by placing it on an inverted, cleaned, empty 42 oz., cottage cheese container with the lid left on.
Then I cut one hole, about a 2" diameter, in the container's side. It acts as a resonance cavity thus enriching the sound further.
No possible way to improve the sound at no additional cost. I spray painted the "stand" to improve its esthetics.

My grandson comes over just to ask Alexa questions. He loves to learn about different things and he is amazed that she knows the answers. How many miles to the moon? That is his favorite. We like it to find out the weather and time. We are just now learning other things about it and how to integrate it with the TV.
So glad I bought this and I plan to get one for my little grandson so he won't ask his daddy so many questions.

It needs a volume control to increase the sound of the feedback after hearing the wake word. Not disabled-person friendly at all. Also, it doesn't seem to hear your voice as well as the 2nd generation Dot did. It like the look better, but overall it doesn't function as well as the last version.

reviews.reviewTitle: Small but packs a powerful punch!
reviews.reviewText: Before ordering I was told by a few people the sound wasn't that good, but I was pleasantly surprised at how good it really sounds for such a small device. It certainly exceeded my expectations and it's a lot of fun to have around. Obviously it's very handy to have around because I use a lot of reminders and timers throughout the day. Amazon music sounds really good on it. Probably not ideal for a large space but definitely awesome for my office!

reviews.reviewTitle: Much more sensitive to picking up Wi-Fi
reviews.reviewText: I have a two-story 3000 square foot house. I also have three Echo devices. The large device I have in the family room, the second in the living room, and the third upstairs in the bedroom. The bedroom is away from the Wi-Fi by the length of the house and upstairs. The version 2 of the Dot won't connect with a Wi-Fi at that distance but version 3 does. Darn good reason to spend just a little more money to get the better device.

I bought this as a gift and it was well packed. I gave it to my parents who are in their 60's. While they do not use it to its fullest extent I hope they take the time to learn more about it . I have one of these myself so I can say it is a well built product with some really great features and functions. There are so many add in and add on products we very well may be seeing the beginning of the largest automation company in history.

reviews.reviewTitle: Amazed with what the echo can do.
reviews.reviewText: Actually won the echo in a raffle at work. Many co workers wanted to buy it off me and now I know why. Very simple to install and setup. I purchased the music package after the free trial because the speaker sounds pretty good. Echo lights up when there is an update on my amazon purchases, can estimate drive time to places, tells dumb jokes and is just plain useful for any random question that may arise.

Says “I don’t know too frequently”. Initially I asked to schedule the “? Of the day”. I have trouble understanding Alexa due to an unusual type of hearing loss. So I told Alexa many times in different ways to cancel the daily question. I’m still getting it every day. It’s good for setting a timer... Handy when I’m cooking. Would be okay for a daily reminder to take meds. Otherwise, I’m not impressed. I can do that with Siri.

I was hoping for more from a latest Echo dot, but was only mildly impressed. I have the 2nd gen echo dot and purchased a portable speaker case that sounds pretty good. The benefit is that I can take it outside wirelessly. This newer Gen 3 Echo does not have any option for a portable case. The sound quality is good, but no better than the sound on my portable case for the older echo.

Great item. I enjoyed being able to use the voice commands to play music or initiate a call. Many times I will ask question and it makes me feel as if I’m married to Alexa because she refuses to answer. It has its moments where it’s not so easy to have her search for information in order to assist you an answer and a question. Sometimes her processes go from one point to the other, example one day I asked what happened in today’s history and got a full lecture of history event which was what I want The next day when I went to show off with Alexa it would not work. Again you can count it as part of a relationship or maybe as a child because it’s not always listening.

reviews.reviewTitle: Speaker started sounding bad a few days out of the box
reviews.reviewText: I bought this Echo Dot for my master bedroom. I use an Echo in my living/dinning rooms. Just a few days out of the box and the speaker on the Echo Dot sounds defective - like a speaker that's been played at extreme high levels over a long period of time. I only ever played this Echo Dot around 30% of the volume because I play it at night before I go to bed and I don't want to disturb others. I'm thinking of returning it for a new one or just getting a regular Echo.

While most things in our life( I mean tech) usually get better with time, Echo dot does not.
It is such a poor device with no recognition of any more than basic commands, that I am wondering what Amazon developers are thinking. It is not even close to Google assistant - as it was a year ago...
Gonna to get Google again.
Seriously, this echo dots are the most annoying and unintelligent things ever...

Gone are the days that I write something down then lose the piece of paper therefore never doing what I needed to do. With this Echo Dot and the Alexa app, I always have my list. It reminds me to take my medication and make appointments. Let's me know when a shipment has arrived. Even reads me a book. Now if it could just remind me not to reach for the sticky notes.

I love having Alexa at my beck & call. Replaced an old echo dot 2nd gen for this one (3rd gen) and picked up one more. Now every room in the house has an Alexa device. The sound quality of the new 3rd gen Echo Dot has been greatly improved. It is a little bit bigger and heavier that the previous model. The only complaint is that it no longer uses a USB to charge. It now has a bulky transformer plug that takes up 2 spots on my power strip.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa, how do you sound on the echo dot 3 rd generation?
reviews.reviewText:
Well the answer is that the sound is so much better than the previous one. Tones are richer containing more base. The 3rd generation is a bigger and heavier unit. Being bigger means it take up more space, but not enough to be a problem in my case. Being heavier is a plus as it is harder to knock it off a table or where ever it is resting.

Overall I am pleased with this generation of the echo dot.

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice looking, small and sounds good
reviews.reviewText: However, it seems very hard to install on our Vizio smart tv. We have done the factory reset twice, follow the instructions and we still haven't been able to get it to operate. We are going to have to talk to the tech support. If they are able to help us, I will do another review. Let's hope! I rarely get anything from Amazon that I'm unhappy. Probably us!

I put my Echo Dot upstairs, in my bedroom, and was concerned about the setup process and whether it would communicate with my Echo that is in my front room, downstairs. It was very easy to set up and I've had absolutely no issues with them communicating with each other. I listen to guided meditations at night and love having my Echo Dot for this and can listen to music while upstairs.

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent product, no more review needed
reviews.reviewText: Sound quality is excellent. Bluetooth connectivity is great but both echo and Bluetooth devices don’t play same time. I need help with grouping my smart home devices because I found group is not perfectly effective. But I didn’t find anyway to contact Amazon Alexa expertises. Online search didn’t help. Is there way to contact Amazon Alexa technical support? I created group and put devices under the group but still hearing Alexa asking “A few things share this name.....”

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Speaker, Terrible APP and hard to play podcasts.
reviews.reviewText: Not a bad product at all, the speaker itself is a nice speaker eith good sound quality. The dot itself listens really well maybe even listens to much(you can activate it accidentally). The APP on the other hand is TRASH! It has constant crashes and doesn't allow you to look up anything through it so if you can't get Alexa to find the song through voice communications. I tried to play a Link Flloyd song and it refused to play the correct version and would CONSTANTLY SWITCH TO AMAZON MUISIC. I DON'T USE AMAZON MUSIC, IT'S CRAP! Last complaint is that you have to connect to it bluetooth and find the one you are looking for. Alexa will never find the podcast you are looking for and since the APP is pretty much worthless it's a pain. If you are buying this for music and just to ask it simple things it's great but if you expect it to do anything else and expect the app to help you are purely out of luck.

Very high quality sound and voice recognition. Excellent connectivity and ease of use. I was only disappointed with lack of compatible devices that Alexa could control, it is very limited to either Google brand or maybe 1 model of latest product of a fee other brands. 99% of other consumer electronic products with wifi or Bluetooth are not compatible. However, the echo dot is sti pretty impressive with the functions it can perform.

So we have had this for 6 months and it gets used about once every 2 weeks to play music and out of nowhere the speaker started to crack and sounds pretty bad when playing music. Its to the point where we don't even use it any more. I wish I could exchange it because it pretty useless now that the music sounds terrible. It also wont let me pare my Galaxy S8+. where our older dots have no problem.

Love the product it’s like having a personal assistant can do so many thing also got 2 light bulbs that I can control with it works great super convenient low rating on sound quality because if the sound is to loud or you turn the bass up in the settings it starts to sound like the speaker is crackling or would definitely take damage if listened to for to long in a higher volume

Works well, sound isn't too bad, not as good as the Echo Plus, but that makes sense, these are much smaller, can;t sound like a surround system being it is a puck. Works good for what it is. Listen to music in the bathroom getting ready every morning, and does that job fine. Love the ability to use nay of my dots to add something to a shopping list.

They are good to have for convenience in giving commands pretty much in each room in the house. However, they seem to be much slower on the "up take" to wake up and listen properly; the main amazon alexa larger system is better in response. Also, I don't like when you tell on of them to wake you up, the others don't seem to know about; pretty weak. So, you have to go back to the one you set the alarm to turn it off.

I wish I had purchased this sooner! The Echo Dot w/Alexa is awesome! It is so much fun exploring all that Alexa can do, and it's so easy to do so many things now. Need to make a list for grocery shopping? Just ask Alexa. Need a reminder to call the vet? Just ask Alexa. Need to listen to some upbeat music? Just ask Alexa. Fun, fun, fun!

We really are enjoying our echo dot. She is all ready controlling our lights and a few other electronics. We have started playing the trivia games in the evening after the news. It's become a lot fun. Setting it up was fairly easy. Every now and again she will just randomly shut down in the middle of a game or say you are wrong when in fact you gave a correct answer. Which can be frustrating. But over all the echo dot is perfect for us.

I purchased the original Echo Dot a while back and have enjoyed it. There have been issues with it from time to time. It would restart itself from time to time or freeze, but overall my family has enjoyed it and have benefited from using it. I bought 2 3rd gen Dots and have noticed a great enhancements. Better sound quality and a better connection when i "drop in" to talk with my family. It seems a bit faster in its response time too. Great product.

I love my echo. Has really helped me out on my everyday chores. Keeping up with reminders appointments alarms Etc. Love that I can take it anywhere in or Outdoors sounds great when music is playing can't wait to get the rest of my Alexa products so I can join them together and have a smart home highly recommend this product to anyone who's busy

reviews.reviewTitle: Great for controlling smart devices and calls
reviews.reviewText: The sound may be better in this than the previous generation but I would still never buy this for listening to music, at least not loud as it very quickly meets its limits. What I really love about it is the ability to make calls directly from my phone (Alexa, call ....) and use it as a speakerphone and I also love that I can control all my smart devices, such as lights, thermostats vacuum cleaner, etc. and drop in on other rooms. For that purpose it is absolutely superb, hence the 5 stars.

Awesome smart speaker. This is the Amazon Echo Dot 3rd Gen. It looks so much better than last year's echo, and it sounds even better, too. The design is similar to the Google Home Mini, it's covered in cloth and it's a little chunkier than the previous echo dots. I bought a speaker system to go with it, and it works really well. Alexa is still inferior to Google Assistant, but she is still super helpful.

This is my second Echo dot. I was hesitant to order the sand color, but it was all that was available. It's a very neutral color and works fine with my decor. Since I already have an echo dot this was immediate set up as it synced with my other one. Echo Dots are easy to set up regardless. My second one will be upstairs and I'm having Alexa turn on my bedroom lights with the special plugs ordered. I love the Echo Dot ;Alexa is always there to answer a question, play music, keeps me company lol. I got an excellent deal on this during Amazon Prime days. I couldn't be happier with purchase.

I received this as a gift from my son and recently purchased another Echo for my kitchen. I keep this one in my bedroom and added a Smart Plug to turn on/off the lamp next to my bed. I also use it for ambient sounds (numerous selections such as distant thunderstorm, rain forest, ocean waves, etc.) at night for falling asleep. I have set up a 'routine' (very easy to do) and when I say "Alexa, good morning" the response is the weather forecast for the day. It's fun to have for silly moments such as asking it to bark like a dog (my cat's reaction was hilarious!) or playing music. Since I live alone, I feel secure knowing if there was an emergency I could easily ask Alexa to dial 911 hands free (I have not needed this, thankfully). I plan to add devices such as my thermostat in the near future. I highly recommend this product!

Love it looks good in the room and with all the Alexa updates keeps getting better
Only down side it several times I have to repeat and she still gets it wrong. Tried voice recognition more than once so when she messes up
She does more right than wrong so I just give her a piece of my mind and she doesn’t give it back like others would
I would definitely buy again

I love alexa I have the original in my living room. So when my alarm clock stopped going off. It was old it had dual alarms that I would set every night. I also would have to reset the time when we had a power outage. Which is frequent. I decided to get a echo dot for my bedside. I love it. I can chose to wake up to music or an alarm. The best.

reviews.reviewTitle: Best Voice Assistance in the market
reviews.reviewText:
Really best Voice Assistance in market. way better than Google or Siri.. Love the Alexa understand my accent and easily reply answers. We play some games and play music podcast. Only Problem is the sometime local NPR channel sound get cracked up.. speaker react like its magnet or the net is about to break. However overall a great voice assistance with cost effective price.
Last most impotent thins is we can make calls from Alexa

I bought this for $22 when they were having a sale on Amazon. It was an impulse buy. I love it! I can be walking through the house and have it play my favorite music, add to my grocery list or tell me the weather. The sound is good when I am listening to music. I am very happy with this product and will probably buy a few for my nieces and nephews for Christmas.

I really, REALLY like this echo dot. I have gotten smart plugs, and lights, and its kind of fun using it to play jokes on my nephew. Not to mention other things it does.

I do admit, when I first got it, I had problems connecting it to the internet, but after talking with customer service, they helped me get it connect really quickly. And THIS is why I continue to shop Amazon.

Device working great, but App does not support many things.
Hopefully, update the app can do just like device.
Most importantly, The Amazon, please check more than three times before shipping the device reason, The device I received has been used by someone because when I check the history on the device and I found many of commands has been used and called.
I order a new device and pay for a new device not used the device.

I have to start by saying I am not a "techie" person, so when my husband said he was ordering these I thought "OK". Once he set them up and ask Alexa to play some of our favorite music I was hooked! The sound is wonderful! I am retired so my husband partly ordered these so I could listen to music throughout the day, rather than having the stupid tv on for company. This is an amazing product!

reviews.reviewTitle: Watch for fake start up apps.
reviews.reviewText: Went to download the app from amazon web link and it sent me to a app that I downloaded and it kept saying somethings wrong someone from tech support will call you. They did in minutes and said there was a start up fee. Don't fall for that. They only got my email and phone number. Wish there was some way to stop ppl from stealing a good thing. Other then that dot works great.

reviews.reviewTitle: Best Value In A Smart Speaker
reviews.reviewText: The ability to have all of what Alexa does is the primary benefit. Its ability to display time, temperature and other features makes it worth the additional money. It also recognizes voice better than my old Alexa speakers. It does not sound better than my old first generation speaker, but it does a remarkable job for such a small speaker.

it took me a little while to decide to get one of this as siri does not always understand my accent... Alexa does though! so i just wanted to share this with other people who may be concerned about that... also, it has "apps" that you can integrate and essentially can play music and radio from your country for free! i love that! the apps are a still a little clunky and as the sentence becomes longer the likelihood of recognition is less...

Loved it! Much louder and better quality sound than my 2nd Gen. I like the new look, little more bubble-y and textured. I have it in my room and Alexa does everything I could ever need her to! We read books, listen to music, set alarms, wake up in the morning together, she really helps me get my day started. The only thing I do not like about this modle is that it has a different plug, not the same Android charger that I was used to from the last gen. But since it comes with the cord it wasn't a very big deal :)

When my wife and I discussed getting an Echo Dot, she said “what do we need that for?” I told her I thought it would be fun and a helpful device. Well, we are not disappointed at all. It’s fun and we are using it for shopping lists, playing music on demand, answering questions and telling us jokes and puns, etc. There are many things we have to learn, but it’s easy to use and I am sure we will find more and more things to use it for.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa is a learning program but it is fun to discover new things she can do!!
reviews.reviewText: We are still learning from Alexa with 2 devices. I bought the light bulbs that Alexa can control. It’s great to just tell her to turn on whichever light each with a different name, and she can dim them by telling her a percentage. Her volume can be controlled by telling her to set it at 1-10. And our favorite new bedtime ritual that my husband really enjoys is to play question of the day!

We got our first gen 3 and are not pleased with it. Amazon claims these listen/hear better than gen 2, but we are not seeing it. We have to yell at this one a lot. Sometimes I end up unplugging it to get it to stop. I personally don't like that it doesn't use a standard usb plug for power anymore. I think I am going to hide this one in the basement and bring a gen 2 back up as our primary.

reviews.reviewTitle: All-In-One, much better than Apple or Google
reviews.reviewText: This, for $22-30 is a STEAL. $50 is still reasonable, when not on sale. I have 3... one for the kitchen/living room area to listen to tunes while cooking and eating with the fam... one in my bedroom for alarms, night sounds, and TV/music integration... One in my KIDs' room so they can listen to my bedtime playlist I created for their bedtime and also for trivia and audio books.

I have eight different eight different Echo devices currently in use. This new generation of dot is by far the best. I received two of them today and they were both, as usual, easy to set up (we won’t mention echo for the auto....). Anyway, nice improvement on an already simple and very useful device. The visible clock feature is great.

This was a great purchase for my bedroom. Alexa is so helpful. She plays rainstorm sounds to help me fall asleep at night and wakes me up with the weather, how long my commute will take, news and she turns my tv on so I can watch shows while I get ready for work. She reads me my notifications on my cell phone and has my routine down. She rocks! She is super helpful and I am so glad I got on the Alexa train!

We ordered multiple units and though it is not too complex to network them all, its more complex to get them working with two different iPhone users in the house. Follow the directions and all is well. Love the sound from the speakers. The only challenge I am finding is making it possible for two separate iPhone Users to play their own Spotify playlists from our Family Account.

When you go to Alexa web and plug in something for her to do it does not happen, she gives other suggestions. We plugged in for weight watchers wellow and activated it and she cannot find it or suggests other things to look for. ???plugged in amazon music and cannot find it but suggest other sites to go to?? I think giving a 3 star is too high but will see as time go on as today it day 4 - 5 since we got the unit and will see what happens.

Searching through the "skills" has shown us that we were missing out on so much functionality! When we started adding more and more skills, we knew that having these in most rooms of the house would be helpful, so we ordered a few of the dots to have in places where we wouldn't need superb sound quality, or wanted a lower profile device. These fit the bill perfectly!

We bought this for my parents and they love it. The are constantly using it to play music or ask fun questions to Alexa. It has good sound quality and works well with their larger Alexa. Specifically, they are trying to end up with one in each bedroom. We have our grandma in the Home with us and she uses hers to call for assistance whenever she needs it. It helps her stay more connected and supported when life gets busy.

Great for music but I need to learn how to ask Alexa to do things. I sometimes say the exact same thing and Alexa will play music from my online list and other times Alexa will play something completely different.

But the speaker is very loud for a room and of high quality. I wish Amazon would allow me to play music in another one downstairs while I use it upstairs. I have to always choose one.

This wasn't really on my list of things to buy, but I seen it on sale with Amazon music for 9 bucks so I figured I would give it a try, so far I have used it to make calls, listen to music, ask about the weather, ask what time it is, and use it as a bluetooth speaker, it has some weight to it and feels well made I'm happy with my purchase

reviews.reviewTitle: What's better than an Alexa? Two Alexas!
reviews.reviewText: I integrated my new Echo Dot (3rd Gen) to my Echo Dot (2nd Gen) without any problems. I created a Speaker Groups Multi-Room Music named 'My Room' to play songs in stereo. Was easy to do using the Alexa app on my Android and sounds much better than expected with the improved speaker on the 3rd Gen. No response problems as the nearest Alexa answers my requests. Was also easy to setup the 3rd Gen to respond to my voice playing the requested channel and program on my Roku. Who needs two Alexa? I need two Alexa! Um maybe three.

It was hard to connect and still can’t figure out how to use the smart plug i got with it. The app I had to download for the plug wouldn’t let me connect. Why was there so many apps to connect echo and different prices?

I use it along with the smart plug so I can have my lamp turn on before I get up. The light makes it harder to fall back asleep after my alarm goes off. I also enjoy using voice control for my Spotify, playing trivia games, and generally messing around with the AI Easter eggs. Just try not to picture Jeff Bezos in a musty, dimly lit room with headphones on, listening to your every sound — conversation, bodily function, or otherwise😉

I love these things. They are so good at understanding me. I have one in each room. In my bedroom I have a paired set that gives me a stereo effect. I find the sound quality is great. (But I am no audiophile and I do not blast music often.) I would say they are huge improvement on the Echo 2 that I own, in terms in terms of sensitivity. The sound quality is as good or better too - as far as I am able to judge.

Speaker is starting to sounds crackly and make a rattling sound-Almost like there is wrinkly plastic. I am extremely disappointed, as I am outside the return window and I bought this after being told I can't play Multi Room on Tap and my other Echo combined.

reviews.reviewTitle: Has only a 90-day warranty. Ours lasted about twice that long.
reviews.reviewText: Worked ok as our second Alexa device (driving external speakers, so I can't comment on the audio quality), but then got bricked when we tried to reset it when the hotspot it connected to changed. Our slightly older Alexa Tap took this in stride, but the 3rd-gen Dot died as a result. Not even factory-reset works (guided by Amazon support). A bit of reading suggests others have had the same problem.

I ended up signing up for Amazon Unlimited Music and got this Echo Dot for .99 cents. I gotta say I really enjoy owning it. I integrated it with my entertainment center and works perfectly. My 3 year old son love talking to Alexa. He even tells her he loves her so I have to deal with that lol. My wife loves it for adding and removing things on our shopping lists. Overall its pretty neat and works great!

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice size & Great sound for a Bedroom Or Apt.!
reviews.reviewText:
This is our 1st Echo & so far, we are loving Alexa!! We got it on sale & with the mthly payments, made it a easy decision to FINALLY buy!! I am SUPER HAPPY w/ it.
We live in an Apt. So put it in our Bedroom which is perfect for its size & it fills our room with sound nicely! I will for sure update in a few months or if anything changes.-
Hey holidays are coming, so with easy pay-.
Makes a Great gift- have a teen or kid in a college Dorm? Maybe even a parent who enjoys music...in fact...who doesn't need music in thier life?? ( I like music & I deff. Love gifts. Lol) Maybe even treat yourself ....Oh go ahead, ya know ya what too!!

I got this during a great deal, around blackfriday so it was a no brainer. I love the design, the fabric makes it look far more premium. Alexa is just as useful as before, but I noticed they added more microphones and a better speaker which fixed my main complaints about the first gen. Now obviously this isn't as loud as a full size amazon echo, but the third gen really narrows the gap and is very handy!
Definitely would buy again.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great gift idea and be sure to order one for yourself.
reviews.reviewText: I tell Alexa to play Chopin and she does. I tell her to play alternative rock and she does. I ask for Dion and the Belmonts and they play. I ask her for cooking measurement conversions and get it. I ask for the weather and she tells me what is going to happen in my area. She alerts me when the cake is done or when to take the roast out. These are just a few of my favorite things.

As someone who enjoys IFTTT devices, this Echo Dot is perfect for me. I already have a few voice home assistants, however due to the small form factor of this one, it is perfect for my kitchen. Utilizing both Google and Alexa home assistants, I would say that the integration of Alexa with IoT devices is greater and is greatly leveraged by my Amazon Prime Account.

I loved it so much I bought one for every room. The speaker is actually pretty good. Not as loud as the largest one but overall it’s pretty good. We use it to contact each other in our rooms. Better then yelling for each other. When you’re cooking its nice to be able to call your kids to get more product when your hands are too messy or full when cooking.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works the same as a generation 2 but with better sound
reviews.reviewText:
There is a noticeable difference in sound quality between the 2nd gen and this 3rd gen. Sounds Great.
I mostly use the things for controlling lights, reminders, alarms and weather reports. Lot of fun to play with too. There are bunches of skills and routines available for just about anything. Prime Music really sounds pretty
good. Bought this one on amazons Black Friday deals at a great price. Sets up easily. Definitely 5 star.

reviews.reviewTitle: What did I do before Alexa?
reviews.reviewText: Was on the fence about the whole Alexa device craze, but I gotta say, this thing is super nifty. I got this when it was on ca crazy sale around black friday for my boyfriend and I and I love it. I have smart lights now and it makes everything a lot more convenient. I've had some connectivity issues and have a difficult time getting it to connect to my spotify, but otherwise, I love my echo.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easily access Alexa through the house.
reviews.reviewText: We use Alexa in our living room. We purchased 2 dots to expand our coverage. We placed one in the basement entertainment room and the 2nd dot is in the kitchen, but we also bring it out to the patio. We found the dots eady to setup and easy to integrate with our main Alexa unit. It is nice to stream music in multiple rooms without it being too loud in any one room.

Started cutting out all the time... No other internet connection problems with my other devices. I tried rebooting, re registering it, moving it, turing off all other devices so they wouldn't hog my internet.. nothing. Called customer service 2x and no help from them .. complete junk

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo Dot 3rd Gen - Alexa is dumb
reviews.reviewText:
