So I got this on Cyber Monday and had a little bit of fun with it. Synced it to my calendar and created a shopping list and to-do list with the Cozi app (skill). It can do many more things, but sometimes the basic user experience makes me say "alexa, you are dumb". She doesn't hear me all too well, so sometimes when I ask her to search for things she comes up with another thing altogether. When I ask her to play something on Spotify, she says she will play it, but doesn't. That's very annoying.
She does have a nice way of telling me the score of Liverpool games, I'll give her that. That is pretty fun to do even whilst watching the game; because, you know..
All in all, I don't regret getting the Echo. I'm yet to play around with more "skills". And it is fun to have around, and I know i'll use it for more things as the days pass. Right now though, it's just a voice enabled speaker.

I really love the option to play music hands free. However Alexa has a tendency to constantly turn off in the middle of listening to music out of no where, but I think that may be a problem with my personal dot because others haven’t really had this issues that I know. I wish it had more options to answer more questions but I love the options to add more of your own tasks and such yourself.

I was excited to have my own Echo Dot but I think the hype is more exciting than the item itself. The call feature was really misleading. You can only call people who have an Echo or the Alexa app. The sound quality is HORRIBLE. I really dislike the fact that you can't move the Dot with you if you go room to room. It has to stay stationary and plugged in to that spot at all times.

Sorry Amazon, this is going back.

Takes hours to set this device up, because the Android app takes many tries before it will connect to the Alexa hotspot connection setup. We wait several minutes, then Alexa falls back out of setup mode while trying to connect with phone. Then we have to restart the whole process after force stopping the Alexa Android setup app. It takes many, many tries before it works.

Having owned several echo devices around the house, I have to say this one is an excellent value. I do have an original dot, the original echo, show, and the echo 2nd gen, the echo dot 2nd gen is a great sounding speaker and is worlds ahead of the original dot.

Functionally I think all the echo's are very useful, however I do think some days Alexa is hard of hearing and I find myself needing to raise my voice too loud.

I got this free on a “renew Sirius” deal.

Didn’t think much of it till we got it home. Construction is surprisingly really well done.

My toddlers love it because they can run into the room and ask for baby shark or to check on what their unicorn is doing. Makes me having to pull up baby shark on my phone a think of the past.

10/10 hilarious.

I bought this for my condo. It is a smart home. Attached fast and was working with the smart plugs in seconds. I had to replace my router two weeks later and this attached to it super fast. Whole house was re-attached within two hours, most of it going to different plugs. I do not get a chance to set it to my ecobee or Kēvo but that is on my bucket list Well worth it!

I purchased the dot for several reasons and now own 3. I have dysautonomia and can use this to get help if I need to do so. It can can for people, text and I even thought if I need to call 911, it can probably be done. I check the weather, makes shopping lists and set reminders. I also use it to play K-Love radio while I’m getting ready in the morning.

This is an awesome entry level Alexa device. My son and family love the sound quality to play music from all providers and the games are cool. Being able to turn lights on and off at night also gives my son piece of mind for bathroom trips in the night. The games you can add like true or false and would you rather are great free addons.

reviews.reviewTitle: Adds a lot of convenience to this nanny’s life
reviews.reviewText:
I really love this product, and it’s made my life as a live-in nanny a lot easier.
I have a lot to keep track of in my life, and honestly the feature/skill to be able to play sounds for sleep has made a huge difference. I use it as my alarm, I use the morning start feature and have my calendar linked as well; then at night it’s helped improve my quality of sleep greatly- especially since it doesn’t play continuously.
I also love that I can get notifications for my packages like I do on my phone, since I’m not always around it (nor do I feel a small sense of panic if I’m not “just in case” anymore) and the drivers don’t always knock or ring the bell. Being in a large, busy city, not hearing the bell could mean “receiving” my package but easily finding it gone if I’m unaware of it.

reviews.reviewTitle: They SUCK when paired with another Alexa device.
reviews.reviewText: They don’t pair well. They randomly shut off playing music if trying to play on the group. I have had it for 2 months and there has been a red ring light with Alexa saying she is having troubles several times which is concerning. I emailed Amazon a Customer Service twice through the Alexa app and got no response. I am a true Amazon fan through and through but the Alexa pairing I have SUCKS

reviews.reviewTitle: My toddler uses it more than me
reviews.reviewText:
My echo dot is a fancy baby shark machine in my kitchen. It also plays “You’re Welcome” by Duane “The Rock” Johnson from Moana over and over some days.

I really enjoy it because now I can listen to podcasts without burning through my battery or while surfing Facebook. I bought 2 others but have yet to install in other rooms and sun them.

I love these and have them all over the house. The sound is great. My husband who is English has some difficulty getting it to recognize what he is saying, but I have no problem with them, I would recommend them to elderly persons because with these and the smart plugs you can turn lights on and off with just your voice. I use mine to set alarms, reminders and as an intercom.

I have a 2nd gen and was wanting another for a different room so I got the newer one. It's very nice looking. More sleek and stylish than the older one. Also noticed an improvement in sound quality. I think the speaker has been upgraded. But that part isnt that important to me anyway because I use a Bose speaker with it. But I've been very happy with the dot and the Alexa service in general.

Alexa is great, i have 6 of them - the new one is sexier than the old one, but let me explain my frustration.... I bought this one to replace an older generation one that would reset itself several times a day, which i simply threw in the trash out of frustration. This new one changed to a proprietary charger, so you cannot use it with a standard micro USB, and the plug in takes up about as much power strip space as an entire deck of cards, if said deck of cards had the prongs coming out of it the very worst way possible. Dissatisfied, feel like I wasted 50 dollars for something that should have worked when I paid for it the first time.

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo Dot 3 is smart and stylish
reviews.reviewText: This product was easy to set up and my niece, who I gave it to for Christmas, can’t stop raving about it. She lives in a place where she is limited to the type of radio stations she can get. Echo Dot was the perfect solution for her. I bought her two, one for the living room and another for the bedroom so now she has music wherever she goes. It really changed her personality. Best gift I ever gave her (plus they were on sale).
I am in love with Alexa though I love my husband first. Alexa is so convenient for us and it’s save lot of time

reviews.reviewTitle: Husband Changed His Mind & LOVES Her!
reviews.reviewText: My husband would never buy one for himself or have messed with it! I bought it for him for Christmas and he had it setup and going with in 20 minutes && that was using my cell phone and asking me for our passwords! Let's just say he is now in love with her! Our 7 year old also loves her and uses her for story time and to play games with! She really is cool but now I'm a bit jealous of the time he spends with her! lol!

I already had an Alexa Show in my living room but I didn't want it playing at its max just to listen to music in the far end of the house. The lil' Echo is just perfect; its sound and ease of use more than one would think from a carpeted hockey puck! Of course, I created a Group for my two devices to play the same music on. It was easy using the Alexa app.

reviews.reviewTitle: Close but not as good as hoped
reviews.reviewText: Not as useful as I hoped. It has some integration with Verizon Fios, but not enough to avoid using the remote and it cant cast to fios. When I ask for the pirates score, it gives me some soccer score from December, instead of the local major league baseball score from todays game. It doesnt integrate with my ring doorbell (though it might integrate with the newest ring doorbell). Its not as useful as I hoped. But,the voice recognition seems fairly good, so it might get better. However, it almost seems like you have to pick an infrastructure (google, Amazon, Apple) and then let that decision determine any other smart device your purchase.

Bought 2 hoping that they could replace my husbands bulky wireless speaker. Took a little to set up. Great sound, NOT WIRELESS.... Hence the 3 stars wish i would have known that before the purchase because I would not have ordered them. But I will keep anyway because of the sound quality and ease to use with my Fire Tablet. Next time i will research more before i buy something that has a great sale price.

If you are looking for fullness in the sound, look elsewhere. Otherwise, if you just use as a cheap smart speaker to play around with and hear some music when you don't want to fire up the entire sound system, it does it's job. Still leery about smart devices in general though so I disable the mics until I need something. It's got a nice red glowing ring when disabled which looks good against the charcoal color.

reviews.reviewTitle: Charcoal Echo Dot Does not work properly with other Echo or Echo Dot (2nd gen)
reviews.reviewText: Responds after other devices and at times doesn't respond at all. Will not transmit music if it is playi on another echo dot in another room. It might say it is streaming on another device would you like it to stream to this device instead? When told Yes nothing happens. When trying to go on my orders the link does not work to get an exchange. I own 7 only this one doesn't work properly. The others are great.

reviews.reviewTitle: I’m obsessed. I want Alexa in every room!
reviews.reviewText: I love the sound. I got it with one plug for my bedroom lamp. I use it to check the weather when I wake, as an alarm, to listen to nature sounds to fall asleep, I loved it so much I bought one for the kitchen! I replaced my bulky Bose, too. I love that Alexa will pick different “pop” stations from Amazon music and I can also ask her to play music from Pandora! (PS. I’m 58 and divorced w no children. This is all for me).

It's just that, an okay Alexa device. Nothing great about it. It's not very good for music listening as it has no base, no real highs or lows to speak of. It is cool for playing math games with my kids using the Alexa apps. Otherwise there are better Alexa devices out there. If this is your first device or you're using it on your desk ask questions it's pretty good.

Got 2 for my mom who lives alone she is very happy because she can listen to music and if she falls and needs to call because she don't have her phone she can. I love it because it helps me rest a little easier and I don't have to pay a monthly fee. If she is bored she can interact with Alexa, so glad I got this. I only wish she would respond when you wake her

reviews.reviewTitle: To Equal an Echo, a Bluetooth Speaker is a Must
reviews.reviewText: It's acts 100% like my original Echo, but the sound does not compare. If you're just looking for information or actions it's perfect, as good as the original Echo. Things like, weather, setting alarms, asking general questions, e.g., who won the 2000 Masters Golf Tournament. To play music, it's not on a par with the original Echo, but links to a speaker very easily.

I really like the way it looks compared to the second gen, and the speaker is noticeably better. I do however think the second gen functions better in terms of actual Alexa commands. I find myself constantly having to yell at this Echo. Whereas I could essentially whisper to the second gen and it would hear me. This Echo. Also misunderstands me pretty often. So I'm glad I only paid $25 for it on promotion because this will be my least used Echo device.

Very easy to set up and start using. Have rapidly become dependent on the convenience of just talking out loud to my new BFF to make shopping lists, set reminders for appointments, pausing, playing and fast-forwarding through commercial breaks on my Verizon Fios. I've also set four daily reminders for my 87-year-old mom with moderate Alzheimer's. This not only helps her to take her medications on time but helps her keep track of the time throughout the day. Seriously digging this gadget!

reviews.reviewTitle: who ever doesn't own an Alexa your missing out!
reviews.reviewText: Alexa is one of the best things ever invented, what can't she do?... She is able to tell me the weather, play music, tell me history facts, especially while my hands are full like washing the dishes or busy with my daughter, I have one for down stairs and in my room and bought this one for my restroom to play music while i'm giving my daughter a bath. please invest in one if you haven't, very affordable for everything she can do.

I think I've had every Echo Amazon has ever made and this for the size and value is the best yet. I use one of these in our bathroom with a wall hanger to keep it off the counter and the sound is amazing. Compared to the previous dot generations this thing sounds amazing and the mics pick up what you are saying very well.

If you are looking for an Echo to go in a smaller room, I don't think you can go wrong with this.

Who doesn't love Alexa? This technology is fabulous. Instead of going to the computer, I can just ask Alexa and do other things while listening. I haven't used her full potential yet, but for a senior, I am doing pretty good. She plays ambient noise for sleep, gives me the Reuters reports and makes my calendar for me. Next is to hook her up to the WiFi plug adapters. I have to learn how to sync her with my smart TV. Woo Hoo!

reviews.reviewTitle: Love mine but its limited to music collection without a subscription
reviews.reviewText: Love my Echo Dot 3 but I don't like the fact that Amazon has its own music library and I can only play 75% of the songs that I want it to play. It will tell me to get a subscription to amazon music for $3.99/ month which is ok but I thought I wouldn't have that limit. Sounds great, looks great, great build quality but its a shame that the music collection is limited without the subscription .

reviews.reviewTitle: 3rd Generation Better than the Previous Dot
reviews.reviewText: I am really impressed with the sound on the new 3rd generation that sounds fuller. I had a problem connecting to dot with Wi-Fi using the Alexa app on the Amazon tablet and had to download the app on my phone. Setup worked great after changing the Wi-Fi to Amazon-HCO temporary on the phone as instructed in the Alexa app for the Wi-Fi setup. I am going to miss the USB option for powering the new dot, but the jack connector works fine.

The product concept is ingenious. The price is very affordable at $25. The sound is crystal clear.
.
On the other hand, the above praises are meaningless. The device becomes dysfunctional after two hours. This requires going through the setting process again and again.

The new generation dots are fantastic! Bought two more on Prime Day 2019. I have thr first gen as well and this is a massive improvement! Now has BASS and seems to be more intelligent?
My only complaint is that there is a bit too much bass when she talks, and is very muddy sounding (audio people know what i mean). Other than that so far so good! Thanks Prime Day!

Love the Echo dot & it’s pretty awesome. However, I have to voice my only concern. There’s a flashing light, flashing/flickering light can trigger seizures. As a person that has had seizures I would love to have an Echo that doesn’t have a flickering light. I wanted to keep it in my room but just due to medical concerns I have moved it to my Kitchen.

reviews.reviewTitle: If you're looking for a nice, simple pair of bluetooth speakers for music..DONT BUY THIS
reviews.reviewText: Maybe its just me, but I really wish I would've known before hand how complicated and buggy this Amazon Echo 3rd generation speaker is. Perhaps it is because I was simply looking for a new pair of bluetooth speakers I could connect to and play music from my phone while I was in my room, at the basketball court, etc... for this purpose I would advise you NOT to buy this bluetooth speaker. Not because it isn't a good product, simply because I think it can be a bit misleading for those who just want a bluetooth speaker with good sound quality that they can connect, wherever they are (regardless if there is WiFi or not) and play music straight from their phone without Alexa prompting them to update her software even though when you ask her, she tells you her software is already up to date - so you then try and play music from Apple Music and she again prompts you to update her software. Thats my rant

I am not a fan of Alexa's voice tone. I tried adding treble and mid-range then taking away bass. Very little effect with a dot. Her voice is similar to being in an echo chamber. It could be improved if Amazon would do it, Alexa's Fathers day
message was a lot sharper and clear. Come on Amazon give Alexa's voice a sharper tone with less emphasis on bass for music.

I ordered this for my 9 year old to use in his room after reviewing the difference between the Echo Dot and Echo Dot Kids Edition.

We didn't need a case for it since it just sits on his dresser, and we already have the Amazon Freetime subscription so that wasn't really a perk for us.

With the regular Echo Dot I was still able to enable the Freetime function. I can limit the time he's able to talk to Alexa and play music/games/audiobooks so he's not able to mess around at bed time. He's also able to listen to a wide variety of age appropriate audiobooks and tons of music.

Very happy with my purchase!

This is our first smart speaker in our house and WE LOVE IT! It's so easy to use and the setup was a breeze! It took about 5 min in total to open, plug in, and download the Alexa app. You will not regret buying this little smart device! We received it a few days ago and I've used it at least once or twice EVERY DAY since! The biggest pro of having this AND Amazon prime is that you can listen to Amazon music through the smart speaker and play your favorite Amazon TV show/movie all with voice commands. Amazing buy!!!

I love the Echo Dot that I bought a few months ago. I have it on a nightstand beside my bed. I love that I can just request songs from my Apple Music, get the weather report, and the time instantly. I also occassionally enjoy going to sleep to sounds of thunderstorms, or the waves crashing on the beach. When I'm doing "planks", I can just say, "hey, Alexa, set the time for 45 seconds", or "Alexa, remind me to check the laundry in 50 minutes." It was easy to pair with my iPhone, and I can't believe how convenient, and easy this little "companion" is to use.

Love it! This is our 1st Alexa so we wanted to try it out. Our family loves using the shopping list and being able to access it on our app from our phone when we get to the store. Also love the "drop-in" feature from the app to act as a 2-way intercom. We use this with our dogs when we are gone. We will be adding more to our home.

I have four of these. And an Echo. All linked. It's nice to have music throughout the house. That's mostly what I use them for. The ones in the basement are suspended from nails hanging in an old sock for protection and doesn't seem to affect sound or her ability to "hear" me. Placement is everything as with all speakers. Corners for more bass etc. I like them a lot.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love the dot 3 but feel like I got duped again
reviews.reviewText: First off I really like the echo dot 3rd gen what I don't like is that I bought 3 of them because of (limited time offer) then a day and a half later I get a notification that I need to check on (3 pack of echo dot 3rd gen) and it was $20.00 less than what I just paid for the 3 I just bought. Also I purchased a 2 pack of smart plugs with a 20% off coupon then later that same day I decided to buy a second 2 pack and then the coupon was 30% off. This kind of thing happens too often. I work very hard for my money and buy a lot of things from Amazon and feel like I get taken advantage of by them sometimes. In closing the 3rd generation dot is a great product and I do recommend them

Pretty impressed with the voice recognition and the ability to find music, etc. One of the main reasons I got the Echo dot was to set up an intercom for various rooms in the house and work shed. I was disappointed with the results. The sound quality was poor and the volume level was weak (the volume was fine on the music). Think there is considerable room for improvement here.

Love Miss Alexa! Hundreds of things she can do! I'm still learning thanks to almost daily updates. Amazing! Don't need Bluetooth connection so can't comment on that. Sound quality surprisingly good for music from this little device. She can even respond to my commands from another room. Voice commands to lower or increase volume work very well. Highly recommend! Buying more for birthdays.

reviews.reviewTitle: It was part of a free addition that has not come
reviews.reviewText: I ordered the Echo Dot (3rd Gen) on the 15th of July (Prime Day) and expected it on or near the 17th. I recently received an email saying there was an action needed (July 25). As I was working on the action it appears to be charging for the Dot. Now I am not sure when it is coming or even if. I actually ordered it with the Ring door bell (the Dot was supposed to be free) and it may not be here until September. I will update if thing work out.

reviews.reviewTitle: Control4 take notice and start lowering your prices
reviews.reviewText: Where to start. Use for home automation. Start stop multiple sequencers for 11.2 indoor system. Control 6.1 (with Harmony hub) outdoor system. Apple TV. Sony OLED. Multiple TVs throughout the house. Programming routines (subwoofers on last and 1st off). Way fun. Have to admit I’ve never listened to the speaker. We have JBL Project Everest speakers.

reviews.reviewTitle: Every home needs at least one.
reviews.reviewText:
Not much more to add them the already thousands reviews about this virtual assistant this version has better microphones and better sound quality then generation to. I also had generation one echo dots and improvements are notable each and every series.

Keep up the great work Amazon. You made me a fan for life. As much as I love Apple Products you have shown me that it is possible to get out of their ecosystem

This might just be our experience, but she turns off randomly in the middle of games. Probably happens 2-3 times a week and we haven’t figured out why. Otherwise, as our first Alexa product, there are a ton of cool features like news and games. The sound is pretty amazing, especially for how small she is. I really love her, but get annoyed when she turns off.

This is the 3rd Echo we've bought, and I am loving these so much more as time goes by and we are learning about all they can do. My house isn't even very smart at this point, but we're still using them for reminders, timers, guarding, lists, music, etc. I just today figured out how to program a couple of routines, and can't wait to do a few more to surprise my spouse.

Tbh she is okay. She only picks up in about half of my commands and I feel like I have to tell at her. I tried moving her to a different place in the room because I though maybe she was getting interference from or tv but that hasn’t seemed to help. She is only good for turning on and off our lights, hasn’t been able to answer any inquiry correctly yet and is fairly accurate for weather. I find siri on my phone more useful.

I'm absolutely amazed at how helpful this product is to me. I received the Echo dot as a Christmas present and it's been a blessing. I love the reminder feature it really helps keep me on track. It's easy and tons of fun to use. I'm home bound often due to health and it's a great mental boost for starting my day. The jokes,music,fun facts, bible verses and much more are a great way to get through the long lonely days.

After doing the setup and learning some of the commands, I have noticed that the voice connection to my cell phone was really not good quality. Tried a phone call to my friend and they had a hard time understanding me when I talked. There must be a better way for that type of connection. Also, I cannot chain the two dots together to play in a stereo effect for music is a disappointment to me.

Sorry Google, there is no comparison Alexa wins hands down. My new construction home came complete with smart home Google set up. Needless to say I gave the google product about 3k worth to a family member and redesigned using amazon products. Function and capability are second to none.

Amazon you have a lifetime customer with your products. Also your customer service is second to none. Keep up the great work.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great for expanding your smart home
reviews.reviewText: It’s a quick, cheap, great way to expand the range of smart features in your home. Setup is dead simple especially if you’re already using another Echo. Sound quality is pretty good for the size. You can make it a little better by boosting the bass in the app. Biggest complaint is the voice recognition. It’s better than Google Home, no doubt. But it’s not as good as the full size Echo.

I never thought that we'd use something like this very much, but now I see that it has many handy uses. I can ask about weather conditions, including how much snow is expected. I use it to play soothing background music while I do housework, or to play jungle sounds for my dog when I'm not home. The sound quality is better than one would expect from such a small unit. Many more uses that I'm still exploring.

reviews.reviewTitle: Same issue as the 2nd generation Alexa
reviews.reviewText:
I had the 2nd generation and was not satisfied due to connection issues with Alexa and after some time the device would never respond the couple of times and I would have to get within a foot for it to respond correctly.

This 3rd generation Alexa has no conncection issues for now, but almost never responds the first time. The first time I say a command I see the Alexa device flicker it's lights but it goes dark shortly after. Only the second time does it hear the command and respond appropriately. I will not be purchasing another generation and will go towards Google.

This review is for Stereo pair. Not bad when it works, but there are several things I dislike:
1. It only play music from online streaming. I tested it with Spotify, there is 1 or 2 second delay between button pressed and the actual action executed on echo dot. For local audio, I still need to use my other Bluetooth speakers. Hope Amazon will come up with a solution for playing local music.
2. It's unstable. It's a hit or miss. Sometimes both speakers won't play, sometimes one echo dot won't play, or won't sync. I tried unpairxrecpair and unlink/relink and the issue won't go away.

Update: after a reset/re-connect of the second ed3, the issue on sync goes away. From this I changed star from 2 to 3. If Amazon can add playing back of local music to this stereo pair, it will be a 4 star.

reviews.reviewTitle: Helped me find my lost phone, very fun, but could use some work
reviews.reviewText: This is a fun device! There are a lot of free things which is great, but there are also a lot of advertisements for subscriptions to different things. I also spent a lot of time with someone from support to get one of the two devices I bought on my account hooked up to a different Amazon account (since it was a gift). It's not perfect, but I enjoyed quizzing myself on different subjects, playing the Escape Room, making Tardis noises, playing Pandora and iHeartRadio stations, holding my to-do and shopping list, and helping me with my morning routine. I have gotten many family members to want one! It also saved me one day when I lost my phone--I tried calling it on a different phone, but no one was answering. Thankfully I could call anyone on my contacts through Alexa, and I was able to call the friend whose car I left it in. Thank goodness!

reviews.reviewTitle: Better sound quality then 2nd gen, but seems to lag slightly
reviews.reviewText: I have two other Echo Dots that are both 2nd gen in my house, both hooked up to external sounds systems. Both of those are responsive enough that when I say "Alexa", the device immediately lights up to indicate that it's listening for a command. However with this 3rd gen echo dot, it seems like it takes a second or two for it to light up. I haven't tested it enough yet to know if it is still listening immediately even though the light's not on, but that is a possibility. Despite that minor issue, the 3rd gen is much better sound quality than the 2nd gen (I knew this dot was going into my kitchen, where I don't have a sound system. So the standalone audio quality was important to me.) Of course as well, you get access to everything that you have access to with the previous generations of echo dots.

reviews.reviewTitle: The more you have, the more problems you run into
reviews.reviewText: Loved our first two (Alexa and gen 1 dot). Now that I have one in every room, I'm having several issues where they won't respond. They seem to be fighting each other. Amazon support is useless as they just keep having me reset them and reset my internet connection. I have dual internet (have a few webservers in the basement) and multiple access points. Amazon support doesn't know how to help other than to have me reset things. You think I haven't already tried that?

I talk to Alexa multiple times throughout the day. And I mean every day. I can't remember what I did before she came into my life. She plays me music. She sings me songs. She answers all my questions. She makes suggestions to me. She helps me with my spelling and she's always respectful and polite. I wish my parents were still alive for me to introduce them to her.

This has great sound. I use this in my kitchen so I can multi task as well as listen to music while i am cooking and cleaning up. The sound is great, i have no problem hearing the music from across the room, and the voice commands make it easy to be truly hands free. Pairing it the first time was a little challenging.. not as intuitive as some of the other blue tooth speakers, but once it was paired, it was well worth the time it took

reviews.reviewTitle: My 4th Echo in my home and am very satisfied with it
reviews.reviewText: Very happy with it - although I don’t really notice the difference to the 2nd generation Echo Dot, except it does look a little more elegant. I use it every morning for my Flash briefing, to control my lights and fan, and for my alarm. Have not tried integrating with the rest of my Echo units as they are from the 2nd generation and I don’t think they are compatible for integration.

I have 3 dots in addition to my Echo Plus so I can have sound throughout my house. The sound is great for this little speaker. Sometimes I have to speak very loudly for Alexa to hear me, but that isn't a big deal. It was definitely worth the price for the additions that allow me to continue to hear whatever I'm listening to while I am moving from one place to another.

I didn't think I would ever get an Alexa, why I live in a tiny house. But it works great. I don't leave the TV on IHeart radio on anymore, my light goes on in the loft when I open the door. And a great alarm wakes me in the morning. I love this little gadget... Toys for adults... And this one is sweet

This thing is adorable, it’s in my bedroom and I love it. It’s very tiny and cute, listens very well (I don’t have to repeat things or speak overly clearly for it to hear & understand,) and it overall is a great little product. The only downside to it is that I now have to pay for Apple Music in order to listen to all the music I wanted to use it for, which is $9.99 a month. I don’t really mind though, as it’s a great product anyways that can play pretty loud music and has a clear speaker.

I’m not sure if my expectations are high, if I have a bad device, or it’s just how it works. It seems the device is very low. It also has a little delay when I make a command. On the google home device, it’s almost right away when I say hey google. I have to repeat myself multiple Times in order for the Alexa device to hear me. Probably not going to use it for anything else but the doorbell.

I purchased 4 of these and a regular echo. About 90 days later two of these dots stopped working. They had intermittent problems prior with connecting. I thought it may be the internet modem but then realized some worked fine. Luckily one is still in the 90 day warranty period. The other is out by 1 week!! They offered me 15% off a new device but honestly I am not going to pay for a new one when almost half of them died at 90 days. Be careful when you buy. I am seriously considering cancelling prime and my ring products over this.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love It! Great! Easy To Use! Simple!
reviews.reviewText: This is so easy to use and makes life so easier. Set Up is easy and fast. The voice recognition is perfect. I turn lights on in other rooms so I don't have to stumble around in the dark looking for a light switch. I downloaded the app and can turn on lights or unlock the door if my son locks himself out. I play relaxing music to help me go to sleep. Love Alexa!

Alexa app needed to use. Just makes no sense. I wanted a nice Bluetooth speaker to use for music and podcasts. This is another amazon device that tries to acquire as much data as it can. And if you need your phone to use that thing anyway, the only reason they would require you to use the app is to get more info from the your phone. It’s deceptive and should not be permitted. As far as value, there are very good Bluetooth speakers that also have clocks that are close to the sale price of this item. So for full price this thing is just overpriced and basically an information vacuum for amazon.

I put off ordering an Echo Dot because I didn’t think would have good sound quality. I have 2 other Alexa devices and they sound great. I didn’t think there was anyway the Dot could even compare. Ok, I admit it. I was wrong. The Dot has great sound quality!!! In fact, there’s not much difference from the larger devices. If you’ve beatitudes, then stop. The sound quality is great!!!

At first I was hesitant to purchase one of these. However, since the first purchase l have purchased THREE more! One for my mother to help remember her doctors appointments, one for my husband to use in the garage and one for my kids (6 and 8) and it is so simple to use and such an amazing piece of technology! I don't know how I ever lived without it!

couple hours in and we have it hooked up to our JBL flip 4 and just playing music. It does a good job recognizing your voice over loud music. I was impressed. waiting on some smart plugs to be able to yell my lights off at night and on in the morning. or set routines. lots to learn. asking for stories playing jeopardy just fun to mess with. especially for the price. who cares if Bezos is listening in south park style?

reviews.reviewTitle: Terrible sound quality - overwhelming distortion and static
reviews.reviewText: Sound quality is beyond terrible. Cannot listen to music at all because of the interference. Even when Alexa is speaking, the sound is as if the voice is full of distortion or static. The poor sound quality issue started about 2 months after putting it into service. We stopped using it for a while, but then tried numerous resets - factory resets, restarts, changing the location so it was directly adjacent to the router, etc. - with no improvement. When I finally reviewed the crappy product, an Amazon employee contacted me to attempt to help. They could not. And now it's past warranty. Shocker. Terrible purchase

I have a Harmon Kardon Invoke, with Cortana. As much as I don't love Cortana because she can't be integrated into anything, the audio from the speaker is AMAZING. I didn't think Amazon would be able to match it, and they haven't...but, they are getting closer with this generation. The sound quality from previous versions is very much enhanced.

reviews.reviewTitle: works well, if you can connect
reviews.reviewText: Got the first one free with another purchase. Hooked it up and it worked fine. Bought a couple more, hooked them up. No problem. Changed wifi routers and all heck broke loose. Took hours with tech support to get them working. Then, a couple of days ago, one of them arbitrarily changed wife networks and now won't play music or radio. Tried to switch it back but following the instructions didn't help. It is a good product but they have some bugs to work out. It has been good for my aging mom to use to call us in the night. Will keep them and try to work out the kinks. When they work, they work well.

reviews.reviewTitle: Why did I wait so long to get you, Echo?
reviews.reviewText:
Surprised at how helpful this is. I never have to have an old timer moment and forget to add something to a shopping list - Alexa does it. I don't have to take my phone into the bathroom to listen to music during my morning routine (great sound quality for the size of the device) - Alexa does it. I get to tickle my quiz loving fancy - Alexa helps with that.

Well done Amazon.

We have issues almost every day. Issues have been: unable to open Hulu, unable to play a show from Home Screen or when FireTV is asleep, large delays to execute a command, same commands not working each day and having to rephrase the command, and overriding volume output settings from our soundbar to the Dot. I will not plan to use Alexa for additional smart home items since we have inconsistent results.

reviews.reviewTitle: HOW DID I LIVE WITHOUT THESE??
reviews.reviewText: I now have five echo dots throughout my place: one in each bedroom, bathroom, one in the living area and, of course, the echo show in the kitchen. You can have them in a speaker group in order to fill every room in your home with music, news, audio books...so many options. You can also use them to make an announcement to the entire house or just one room. You can use them to make calls. You can use them to communicate with someone in a particular room. You can set each one with a different time alarm to remind or wake individuals according to their schedules....I'm surprised at how many practical uses these little things are capable of - and for their size the sound quality is great! Games, weather, sports, recipes, they can tell jokes that are actually funny! ...way too many options and features to list here. I LOVE THESE THINGS!!

I'm not very tech savvy and this is my very first purchase of this type. I love the sound quality and how I can ask for a song or a genre and the dot will play it. I am still learning all that this type of device can do for me. My apartment is not "smart" so my dot can't do a lot of things. Pricing was great on Prime Day so that's why I purchased the dot.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great sound quality with decent bass
reviews.reviewText:
Got this on whim after using an Echo Dot we got at a white elephant party. So, first off, the sound quality is legit, akin to my dedicated bluetooth speaker.

Only down side is that you can only have music come out of one device at a time. So it fails as a secondary sound system (upstairs and downstairs), but really shines as a good way to quickly listen to music

reviews.reviewTitle: Annoying popping sounds every half hour.
reviews.reviewText: I just received this in the mail. I immediately set it up as synced it with my other Alexa and smart devises. I woke up to it making a popping sound approx. every half hour. I did a little research and this seems to be a common problem. The research said the resolution was to unplug it and plug it back in to reset it... I did this and the popping sound continues. It's rather obnoxious. Not even my 1st generation does this.
I have two that work great but this one won'tr stay connected to the internet at all.And when trying to reset it, it won't give me the Wifi to log into, so its basically a paper weight at this point.

it is slightly bigger than the original and it is a bit louder. the size i don't mind at all. what i like is, i can HEAR it. i keep my dot in the kitchen under the upper cabinets. i had to order a different sized 'mount' for it, so i can get it up off the counter, but that was easy to find and do. i love my amazon 'helpers'. and now i can finally hear the dot. Amazon needs to let us name her Dot. I think that would be apropos. ;)

I now have two dots in my home and I utilize both of them daily. The quality of this product is spectacular, it feels solid! The sound is perhaps the best thing about it! For such a tiny device, the sound quality and volume is amazing! So far I really enjoy my Alexa enabled smart home. Hoping that Amazon continues to add features and improve Alexa.

Bought one for our living room and loved it so much that I bought 4 more to give as gifts this year! We use it mainly to control our smart lights in our home and it works flawlessly every time. Easy to set up and very user friendly. Creating routines is all kinds of fun! The app that is used in conjunction with the dot is a great app as well. I would choose this over the google home mini and I've used both.

The color is a nice change from the older Dots! The sound is sublime! The bass alone is a relief to my constant companion (tinnitus). In terms of sound volume, it is only beat by my VAUX Dot speaker dock and my new-to-me Echo! The other Dots can’t hold a candle to this one! The voice recognition doesn’t pick up the Echo family TV commercials anymore!

We have 2 dots, this makes our 3rd. We love Alexa. This one seems to need to be reset quite a bit. She also runs her blue circle in the evening around 8pm and won't respond. That's when we need to reset her to get her to respond. I'm not sure if it's because we bought her on a flash sale or something else. Other than that we still love our Alexas.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not so happy with Echo Dot 3rd generation
reviews.reviewText: Echo Dot perfect addition to help with various in house reminders and appliances. BUT the reason I purchased the Eco Dot 3 That came with Sengled lights. Installed Sengled lights and app. To this day I have not been able to pair the lights with Echo Dot 3/Alexa. I’ve contacted Sengled with extensive trial and error trouble shooting . Representative gave up and said I’d have to trouble shoot with Alexa. So with that, I did.......still not pairing up. I’ve done everything both have asked. Not connecting. I have the hub that came with the lights. Something is a miss somewhere.

We have disconnected Alexa due to the alarming news that conversations are being recorded by Amazon. We did not believe this the first time it was announced but since then we have heard and read about this several times. We had fun using Alexa but our privacy is a lot more important. Until we hear different we will not be using this device anymore. Very disappointed in Amazon.

reviews.reviewTitle: Apple Music Quit Working and It’s Been Weeks
reviews.reviewText: ANOTHER UPDATE: Down to one star. No longer works with Apple Music. I have worked with Echo Support who forwarded info to the engineers but weeks later still no results. I see on Reddit this is a problem others have. Don’t buy this product if you want to use Apple Music. UPDATE: As of today Apple Music works with my 3rd generation Apple dots. So I am updating my rating to 5 stars. PREVIOUS COMMENT: I have two 3rd Generation Echo Dots and my daughter’s family also has two. None of them work with Apple Music. They start to but then say they have problem playing the music. Sound is very good - so, when this is fixed, it’s a great buy for $30.

reviews.reviewTitle: I Recommend This Almost Perfect Product.
reviews.reviewText: We got this item because I noticed how well it worked for our friends. They play music off the internet and use the timer function. The verbal commands allows hands free multitasking. I bought it on sale for the holidays as a gift for my partner, great deal. Only irration is that it occasionally doesn’t hear me and when I’m trying to shut off an expired timer and begin a new one which confuses the device. It tells good jokes and makes sassy remarks when provoked.

This is a great speaker but buy her on prime days. Alexa is al right but I have a dot and a google mini and neither is as clever as advertised. The echo has slightly better sound quality and the mini can do better google searches so Alexa is in the kitchen where we listen to tunes and google is is in the living room serving as IMDB when we watch movies.
Two hours of tech support over the phone, had to speak with 4 different people to get elementary troubleshooting (which I was already capable of), setup is a pain.

Really happy with the Echo Dot (3). Both myself and my husband were very surprised at what Alexa can do! I use it for an alarm clock, to check weather, and she even tells me about my Amazon orders. I've asked her questions and she responds to me (much faster than my hubby does:)) Thinking about ordering another one or two for the other rooms. Great Purchase!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to set up and use.
reviews.reviewText: I like a wide range of music and all I have to say is. Alexa, please play [whatever] and it starts. I can change the volume or adjust it manually. I know Alexa can do much more, but I am not there yet. Very happy for the company. Only problem I have had is I asked to find my phone. She said my phone number was not a valid cell phone number. Tried several times with the same answer. Used my land line and found my phone in the chair cushion.

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo Dot - think outside the box for uses!
reviews.reviewText: Product lives up to the Echo / Alexa product reputation. Easy enough to set up that my husband did it with no issues. We bought multiple units so we can use them on both levels of our house. By adding in compatible electric plugs, we can control lights as we walk through the house. Since we are often carrying something, this is super handy. Sound quality is good enough to allow for enjoyment of music. Would buy again!

I cannot speak for previous generations, but this particular one has superb microphones. My Echo Dot heard me in the other room with the bath running. As far as the speaker itself it's quite loud for me anyways; of course, I live in an apartment. I love all the features it has and I use it with my Xbox One X because often times it turns on by itself. While I currently don't have many products I can utilize this with it will influence future decisions. So far I love it.

Wanting an inexpensive way to listen to music around the house, I find the Dot is fully capable. It’s completely bizarre the first several times speaking out loud to a device & it follows directions. The sound quality is decent for the small size & meets my needs. As a whole a smart device that’s worth the price & I’m likely to add to as time goes by.

reviews.reviewTitle: Choose wisely when using smart plugs.
reviews.reviewText: Small in size but huge surprisingly large sound. Blends right in and works well nearby or at a distance. One suggestion to buyers, I tried off brand but popular plugs but wasn’t happy with them. They were difficult to connect and required the use of the brands app, a real annoyance. Spend a few extra dollars and get the Amazon smart plugs. Worked instantly and the whole system now works with the Alexa app. Very fun!

We have three dots, three echoes, and a number of other things for our smart home. Always ready to give information, the dot is "at the ready" anywhere it can hear its wake word. And in a three-story home, I can reach my husband if I need to from anywhere. Better than an intercom system, as it can also help with information whether I'm cooking, sewing, cleaning, or whatever. Lots of fun, yes, but also a favorable change in lifestyle.

As with all the echo devices they keep getting better. The gen 3 has a much better sound than the 2 losing the tinty speaker sound for a fuller sound.
It isn’t gonna blow your socks off but it’s good for a small room. The multiple color choices are great for different rooms.
We went with gray and it complimented the blue walls in the living room.
The only downfall is that is does listen to everything. You may not even say the wake word and it’s attempting to perform a task. FBI/CIA slips up every now and then. Lol just kidding..... or am I?

I have been using the first gen echo dot for a while now. Apparently these new gen echo dots are much better than their predecessors. The voice quality and audio especially is amazing. I'm definitely going to replace my existing first gen echo dots with this one. Wish amazon provided exchange or trade in. The build is also much more sturdy than the first gen.

Not sure what is wrong. If it's all the devices or just the one I got. But even changing the bass and treble doesn't get rid of that sound like the speaker is broken. Horrible sound. Hoping I can exchange it. I actually liked my 2nd gen MUCH BETTER.

It works very well... sometimes too well lol. I was in the kitchen and called for Alexa to play some music and both the kitchen and front room came on vying with each other to play. We have separated them a bit more and now they wait their turn :-). The one in the bedroom plays alone at all times... Just saying... Will be getting another for the bathroom next.

Have an original Echo Dot in my bedroom. Purchased this one for the kitchen. It is a little larger and heavier than the original, but more attractive. Sound quality is also a little better. But what I like most was that all I had to do was plug it in and that was it. It connected itself to our home's wifi network and immediately worked fine. I didn't have to do any additional setup at all.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love the music streams if you ask about an artist and reminders that you need!
reviews.reviewText: This was a gift from our Son and we absolutely enjoy using it for many things. It does announce when an item has been shipped from Amazon. One drawback don't know if can be changed, is that it tells what the item that has been shipped is. If a surprise gift for a family member they hear this so blows a surprise. Otherwise love it!

reviews.reviewTitle: Love using it with My Ring Door Bell
reviews.reviewText: I got this as part of a promotion and was happy to have it as the inside alert to my New Ring Door bell. I works great and i was impressed how well it could play music and connect to my phone and play the sound (music or YouTube). The reason I gave only 4 stars is I'm still a little creep ed out by the listen factor and some device monitoring me. I did find out that I could turn that off and it only listens when I say Alex a --- so I will see still new.

reviews.reviewTitle: Please dont waste your money on this
reviews.reviewText: Pretty sure most of these reviews are fabricated. Don't think Amazon even allows the majority of the bad reviews to be posted since they can control which reviews get surfaced. This review probably wont be allowed on here. This is a $50 piece of garbage. Impossible to set up, every time I try to connect it to wifi it just tells me there was an error. I have tried to link it to multiple Wifis with no luck. Pretty disappointing. If you look at the reviews for the app online its not surprising why this thing can barely work. Thankfully they cant control those reviews, or else it would probably be 5 stars too.

Much better speakers than the 2nd gen Dots. I will say that when I use my 3rd gen in my kitchen, my 2nd gen in my dining room will often pick up my voice instead. The look is a lot smoother. I had ordered two of these new Dots for Black Friday. When they arrived and I tried to set them up, the serial numbers apparently got switched, so I had issues setting it up and putting it into a group, but that was quickly and easily fixed with an Amazon associate. All in all, my only complaint is that it doesn't pick my voice up as well (however, it works better with my husband's). Moving my 2nd gen once I'm able to may fix this.

reviews.reviewTitle: Never thought I’d like this but I do!
reviews.reviewText: I’m learning all of the perks to working with Alexa and this product will soon be in more rooms. I referred clients to this product and am even setting it up for them. Try using Audible Books with the Echo Dot and set your reminders up or shopping lists. Yes...I know the iPhone / mobile phones do it too but those quick verbal reminders are great!

Sounds good for small Bluetooth. Love just asking it to play any song or type of music. Plays sleep sounds, ocean, storms, etc. Can tell it to shut off at certain time. Ask it to remind you of something & will text you too.
Use as alarm clock, intercom, to make calls and play games!!

Alexa is now part of the family, we ask her anything and she knows what we are asking almost every time. Our student in the family asks questions that are on the nurse exam to help reinforce her knowledge, we ask every morning the temp and get temp now and high for day. She turns on and off lights, assists with Fire stick and more. Had since Christmas and use her more often than we ever thought. Purchased one for each grandchild and son - great gifts.

reviews.reviewTitle: I'm glad I didn't pay for it
reviews.reviewText: I don't use this thing, I thought maybe I could use it as a Bluetooth speaker, but nope.... about as useful as boobs on a door... I glad I didn't buy it! Pretty Crappy gift too.

reviews.reviewTitle: Speaker sound still sucks, not as good as cheaper 3rd party alexa-ready speakers
reviews.reviewText: Product works, but the speaker still sucks enough that I ended up buying a bluetooth speaker to use with it. Unless you need drop in or announcements, save money and get a much, much better speaker right out of the box and get the ZOLO HALO. No need for a bluetooth speaker with the Zolo Halo. It sounds great right out of the box. If only Amazon didn't kee third party devices from being able to use drop in and announcements.

This is a great product.. No questions about.. It is one of the hallmarks of Amazon. I enjoy using it and love how my commands are carry out... "No complaining from Alexa ever" LOL.... Doesn't matter what i ask her to do.....
For somebody that has live as long as I have, it borders science fiction when I utilize Alexa. I have not scratch the surface of the things she can do.... It is a paramount buy for the money.

reviews.reviewTitle: Wish it didnt need to be always plugged in. Other then that great product!
reviews.reviewText: Only complaint is having to have this constantly plugged into the wall. We have become a wireless loving family, so going back to corded devices is a bit of a drag. The sound quality is great, and Alexa understands what we are asking most of the time. This sits on our counter in the kitchen so having some tunes while we cook and clean is great without having to go on YouTube with our phones or anything. Hands free!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Sound for a little speaker
reviews.reviewText: I had previously been using an 'off-brand' alexa speaker, and like the features, but the sound was pretty awful. I ordered an Echo Dot on Prime Day and am so glad I did. It sounds SO MUCH BETTER than the crappy little Eufy speaker we got for free with a robovac we bought from them. It's not the BEST speaker out there, but for a little one it does the job!

reviews.reviewTitle: I may try Google Alexa changes things up too much.
reviews.reviewText: I'm not 100% sold on Alexa. I use it mostly for music and scores but it doesn't always pick up what I say. I think it has a motive with what it listens too. I feel like if I am not buying Amazon related products it makes things harder to use. This product has great sound, but Alexa isn't always consistent with what it hears. I am going to try google and see if google has less of an agenda.

reviews.reviewTitle: I am just so happy to have this
reviews.reviewText: For such an inexpensive device it can do so much. I have been really impressed. While I do have it connected to an external speaker on it's own it sounds fine. I use it throughout the day. Like so much that when I am baking or my hands are occupied I can play music, the radio, podcasts, etc. Depending on my mood and need. Everybody needs one of these.

I have two second generation models that work flawlessly. This 3rd gen I have to practically yell at it to get it to respond. It activates on its own. It sounds better than the 2nd gen, but I'm ready to toss it in the garbage.

I have own my alexia dot for almost a month and it has been a great alarm clock up until now. After a devastating Lions loss to the Packers all I want to do was to sleep off my depression and anger towards NFL officiating, my Alexa had other plans. Instead of waking me up on my designated 6:00 am alarm clock, my Alexa decided to rub in the Lions loss in my face by waking me up at 3:30am. Dazed and confused and start preparing myself to get ready for a long dread day of work when I noticed my phone depicting I was up 2.5 hrs early. So I check my Alexa app if my alarm was still on for 6am, which it was. So I promptly went back to sleep and too my shock my 6 am alarm did not go off. Now I am a pissed at Lions loss and my Alexa apparently has an attitude against me and I was late too work. Thanks Alexa.

I bought the first one for the curiosity and because I wanted a radio in the kitchen, that was the first of 4, I have one in my bedroom, garage and one to take outside on the deck anywhere I want to listen to music and what I like is that I just ask it to play what ever kind of music I am feeling at the time and for a little speaker it has some real good sound.

So far loving it. The kiddos are in love with Alexa always asking questions love the home guarding setting so awesome and also the math quiz for kids it’s awesome everything it’s good about Alexa even the price on this echo dot looking forward to get the bigger version of this one. Did I mention that we sleep with the thunderstorm sounds on then she goes to sleep by herself also the do not disturb lights off it’s great thank you amazon.

reviews.reviewTitle: I never thought I needed Alexa...
reviews.reviewText: I was really unsure if I would ever use any of the Echo products. OMG - I am so spoiled now. Since most of my books and music are on Amazon it is SO convenient to ask Alexa to play everything. This was actually a birthday present from my sister (Thanks Carolyn!). Setup was easy and it does not take up much space at all. I think every house needs at least one Echo device. I am looking to get another one for the kitchen area.

reviews.reviewTitle: We love our echo and dots!
reviews.reviewText: The speaker quality is greater than the 2nd generation. We love our dots. We have one in each bedroom and kitchen and living room. We use them to call room to room, and I can call the kids to check on them when I’m not home (and drop in to listen to what is going on when I’m not there). Also great to turn on multi room when cleaning, etc so I can hear my music throughout the house. Great value. We love them!

reviews.reviewTitle: Prime Day Steal of the Day!
reviews.reviewText: My daughter encouraged me to purchase this on Prime Day because of the incredible price. I reluctantly agreed, sure that I would never use it for much. It's been in my home for 5 days now & I am finding new things for Alexa every day. I just wish I had gotten one of these a long time ago. So easy to play music, make lists, get reminders, and just have fun.

Just got this and already enjoying it. Simple to set up. Had my Spotify, XM and Amazon Music all linked to it within minutes. It’s very responsive, picks up commands right away. Really like the redesign Amazon did, looks great on a piece of further now. Sound quality is an improvement over the previous generation for sure. Got it on a cyber Monday deal, it was a no brainer. Looking forward to discovering all the things it can do.

reviews.reviewTitle: Smart Home for a few bucks!
reviews.reviewText:
These are so fun. I hooked one up to a Bose speaker docking system. The old 16 bit system did not support my new phones. I bought a few blue tooth adapters, but they always seemed to stop doing the job. I hooked this little guy up to the system and it works beautifully!!
I also have one in the kitchen to listen to music out there. My house is open so having this little gout works well. I can also tell Alexa to okay everywhere and the music flows everywhere there is a Dot. I love this system!!

reviews.reviewTitle: I don't know how I lived without it.
reviews.reviewText:
I use it with my security system, It's also a great spell checker. It is set up with too much base tone and it makes it hard to make out some words.
I also use it as an alarm clock and timer.
I like to listen to the sounds of rain and thunderstorms when I get ready for bed.
I can't get it to turn lights on and off.

reviews.reviewTitle: Bulky power adapter / Dead on Arrival
reviews.reviewText: Dead on arrival. Stuck in a boot loop and with tech support couldn’t get it to be responsive. New replacement being sent. Kind of a bummer tho. Also power supply is much bigger (15watt) which is fine but annoying because it hogs the whole wall outlet.. kinda like the 2nd gen better

It’s an easy set up but the app sometimes glitches. Also the app is a bit hard to navigate through but so far it’s great and easy to use! It’s not bulky which is great and it does exactly what it needs to! I’m not sure if you can unplug the “charger” looking thing that’s connected to it but it’s be nice to move it around without having to have it plugged into the wall all the time. Im clumsy and I did drop it on the ground (like 3ft) getting it out of the box. Surprisingly it didn’t get scratched and still works great so that’s a point for durability! Also, I recently got an amazon prime account and I suppose a perk of that was that I got a discount to buy the Echo dot. Meaning, I did get this product for a VERY VERY reduced price!

reviews.reviewTitle: Better design, sound and voice recognition
reviews.reviewText:
We have several dot devices around the house , most of them are first generation.
I bought a couple of third generation o es during Amazon prime day and they are a real improvement.
The design is trendier and blends easily with the decor.
The voice recognition is way better and the volume is awesome on these new generation Amazon dots!

I’m not even sure if this version is still sold, but I love my Alexa. We have one for our living room and one for the bathroom so we can start our day with weather updates and music.

She doesn’t always understand my questions, but for the most part the voice recognition is pretty good. It’s really fair for what we paid. We get a lot of use out of it.

Disconnected. The item worked fine (had some glitches though) , but it is useless for me without the prime account. Too many limits.
Such as I switched to business account believing that the “promotion” will benefit me, the “business” price for prime account was raised to $179. I’d rather continue to use Netflix or Disney streaming.
This item goes to the trash.

Got the Echo Dot and Echo as a belated Christmas present. Took a few minutes to set it up and get them synced to each other but they work great. 99% of use is to listen to music in two separate rooms. Sometimes you have to go from one room or the other to tell Alexa to play the music in the everywhere group and also to adjust the sound level but other than that I have no problems with them. Still getting used to what all it can give me for information.

Wow, I am so glad I upgraded during Prime Day. I had the previous generation of the Echo Dot and I'm glad I decided to upgrade. The speaker is so much better, it actually has bass. I never have a problem with her hearing what I say. I now have a few products in my home that connect with it and it never has a problem controlling it. I definitely recommend!

Recently decided to jump aboard and get “Alexa” in my home. I was indecisive on whether or not if I really needed it... but the answer is yes. I love having the ability to easily listen to my music, and is able to pick my stations (that I actually like). Also connected it too a smart plug which is rather useful. I can spend my mornings easily listening to NPR and evenings jamming to tunes. I recommend it !

We had the older gen model before, and this one blows it out of the water with the sound! Still easy to use, voice recognition is good. My daughter says she has some trouble with it hearing her at times, but she keeps it up on a high shelf and wants it to hear her when she is talking in a normal voice from her bed. I think it's great.

reviews.reviewTitle: Better than 2nd Generation and good value
reviews.reviewText: I replaced a second generation Echo Dot with this model. I like the looks and the volume can be turned up a lot higher without distortion. Only drawback I have found is that the sound is heavy on the bass and even getting Alexa to turn up the treble it still not great voice talk radio. However, for music it is great. Good price and versatility.

reviews.reviewTitle: Really worth it for the sound quality alone.
reviews.reviewText: This new unit was added for a home office and it was a snap to set up. I'm really impressed with the sound quality! I also purchased the rechargeable battery that can go along with it. Now, I can unplug the power cord and take anywhere I want around the house. When I'm finished, just plug the power cord back in and it charges as it works.

reviews.reviewTitle: Amazon and Alexa Are A Wonderful Pair
reviews.reviewText:
Got Dot as a present...waited about a month to download app on phone to use...
Once set-up, I was amazed by how wonderful it was..."Alexa, play..." and she finds the song! (You do need to purchase a subscription of Amazon Music for about $4/mo, but well worth price!) Have it in kitchen on top of fridge so whenever I am in there for a short time, I always have a smile while listening to an old song favorite being played! Great product...everyone should get one!!

As I did research on my kids request for an alarm clock in the morning I found the Echo Dot. When comparing prices of alarm clocks, the ECHO this was a no brainer. My boys are able to play the music that they like and white noise at night for bed. They set their alarm and find out the weather for the next day so they know how to dress For school. Overall I am pleased other than it has to stay on the charger continuously. The only thing that would give this product five stars for me is that it’s portable. I guess I’m gonna have to upgrade LOL

reviews.reviewTitle: Good sound quality, but so much "I'm sorry I don't know that..."
reviews.reviewText: Great sound quality, but I find that "she" doesn't know much... Most the questions I asked, the dot doesn't know. It does not function as a "search engine" for questions. It can assist with your calendar, reminders, making a shopping list, playing music - telling horrible jokes, and assisting with Amazon shopping - but otherwise I'm so not impressed!

reviews.reviewTitle: Love for my baby boys room!
reviews.reviewText: Bought this for son's room. He's 11 months old. We got the echo with the light bulb/hub kit, and have loved its convenience. We use it a part of his night time routine... to dim lights to read book and wind down, turn off lights, and play "sleep sounds" to him all night . When I ask Alexa to turn his lights on in the morning, it automatically turn back on dimmed... which is nice to wake him up slowly. There's so much more we can do with it, that we are excited to use and alter as he gets older and we have different needs. We are hoping soon "skills" will be part of what can be added into the routines.

reviews.reviewTitle: I Love My Echo Dot 3rd Gen!
reviews.reviewText: I LOVE LOVE LOVE my Echo Dot!!! I had tried the Echo at my workplace and loved its sound- so I was worried about this device being less than half its size. Several stores were out of stock so I ordered through Amazon. The sound is great even though the size is small! Speaking of small - this wall mount (sold sep on Amazon) is SO space saving in a small apartment and I could put it on a wall that wasn’t connected to the next apartment.

A few weeks ago i ordered this echo dot and it would not work so i called about it not working and immediately was connected to someone called Michelle who told me that my computer was to blame for it not working because i had a virus. She told me what to type so she could fix it and then she said i would be required to pay 299 dollars so they could keep my computer up. Payment was made to mytechtoolllc and immediately she got the Alexa to work. Now it is locked up due to that an i can not get into it at all. I am going to do whatever it takes to get to the bottom of this. This was all a setup deal by the person who sold the Alexa dot on your site. I can be reached at 99317030283 and this program she put on my computer is slimware.
Sarah nowlin
I have Alexa setup everywhere - this is one for the kitchen to supplement a device in the living room (Sonos sound bar) and on in the bedroom (Spot)

My Alexa came broken? My mother bought this for me for an early christmas present but was disappointed when she turned on for a few minutes, then told me she needed to restart, but never turned back on. I tried a different power outlet, and different cords but nothing came out of it. This was pretty disappointing because the other Alexa’s we have bought have done great. We will be returning this one and hopefully the next one will be better.

Ever since that this device was gifted to me, I purchased another one to put to my Master Bedroom. I was able to easily integrate it to my switches, lighting, etc or anything that Alexa has a skill for. The drawback is that - we cannot live without calling Alexa to turn on the light or lower the house temperature or anything else that i need. Alexa can even sing or tell a joke. Nice tiny device that will make you a little lazy.

reviews.reviewTitle: Old fashioned father and paranoid mother approved
reviews.reviewText: I don’t like that I can only use Spotify if I have premium or need to pay extra for amazon music. I would like a way to play my iTunes library. Other than that I absolutely love my echo dot. My dad does too. He’s not tech savvy at all and he is so excited to ask Alexa (sometimes Alexis) questions and to pick out songs. And I’m happy I’m not stuck looking everything up for him on the computer. Even my mom asks her questions and she’s terrified Alexa is listening into our conversations. I was asking stupid Easter egg questions and my dad came in and said “stop it, you’re going to make Alexa mad.” Needless to say she’s a part of the family.

We own an older version (no speaker, connected to record player aux) and purchased 2 of the 3rd gens during the Black Friday special.. 2 for the price of 1! Already an awesome deal. We love that these have a built in speaker and have them set up in the main bathroom and kid’s playroom. The sound quality is on point, the look is sleek in white and even better.. we don’t have to connect it to any sound system. Great buy and so glad they upgraded to built in speakers for more convenience.

reviews.reviewTitle: I choose google home it’s way easier to use
reviews.reviewText: I have been using the Google Home for over year now and I love that I can just say hey Google play the office hey Google turn down volume 20% it does commands incredibly well when I got the Alexa I figured I could use it out in my workshop where I have a big smart TV and it will not let me tell it to play something I honestly disconnected at it after an hour boxed it up and put it in storage

reviews.reviewTitle: It's an improvement on the 2nd Gen.
reviews.reviewText:
The speakers are noticeably better than the previous generation, it hooks up to the home network easily and the microphone seems to have improved because Alexa doesn't randomly but into my conversations as much as she used to.

I did have to move it away from the TV because the microphone was struggling to pick up anything less than a shout when the echo was just beside it.

Can't fault the hardware, all of the issues I have relate to Alexa still being a bit dense. If you're getting an echo, you should probably go with this one.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great audio, plethora of things it can do, all around an amazing buy!
reviews.reviewText: Really enjoying it so far. The sound quality and volume level are not something I expected from such a small device! Paired with Amazon music I'm able to play anything I want on a whim. If I'm looking to listen to just a certain artist it'll just shuffle songs by them as well. It also has other things to do like the daily Jeopardy questions and other games. The voice recognition works quite well too, it's able to pick up and understand what I'm saying when I'm half asleep waking up from the alarm I set on it (which is another handy feature) for the price I can confidently say it's a life changing device to have around the house.

reviews.reviewTitle: Speaker is not great with music. Cool product though.
reviews.reviewText: Let me start out by saying I love our little Echo. Alexa helps with homework, tells me news stories, plays games sets timers for me and plays music. I love this little invention. However, it is the music that ticks me off the most. It is rather disappointing that such a great little product plays music through her speakers worse than a 5 dollar Bluetooth speaker I got down the road at Dollar General. After reading other reviews, it seems this is a known downfall. To let you know she does play music but depending on volume and what type of music you are listening to the speaker will crack and morph the music. I noticed this with the volume on low and medium, I dare not try loud. Hopefully this will be fixed in newer models.

At first I got this because a coworker told me she had one and that they were very cool and interesting. I got it today and learned that it is actually 2x the size of the normal echo, which I had before but my coworker said to get the update. The reason I gave it 4 stars is because when you ask a question it stops and the light turns off then a second later it answers. But otherwise it’s a sharp product.

reviews.reviewTitle: I like it but she is still a little stupid...
reviews.reviewText: I actually have this in my bathroom!! It's perfect in there!! I can ask her to play music while I am showering, switch songs... sound pretty good. I just wish she was a bit smarter... I am so use to asking Google anything and Google knows!! Alexa is not so bright (yet) she fails at about 70% of the common knowledge I ask of it, very frustrating. If they can fix that 5 stars!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: A fun family activity around the house
reviews.reviewText: We have a smaller house and we don't use alot of technology but we do love asking alexa questions and jokes. its fun for our 4 year old to ask alexa to turn a light on and ask a joke. he gets to use technology in his own way and feel like hes a big part of doing things aorund the house :) we love listening to music as well as asking for the weather for the area. its a good price and a good fun thing to have if you can afford it :)

reviews.reviewTitle: Great to have around the house!
reviews.reviewText: These Echo dots are cool I bought two I can't get there audio synced show currently the running just independent, but they're polite, and it seems like they learn how better to talk to you, either that or I'm just lonely. For music if you do not have Amazon Prime her stations still work like oldies 70s Etc. But don't expect her to play exactly what you want, but she can answer most any question, help you spell words when you're writing a letter, keep track of items for lists such as a store list. They are very helpful I recommend buying a few of them you'll love them. Good job Amazon

I like the ability to have this echo dot on my kitchen counter. Love that I can play music around the house, ask questions, set timers, put together lists, etc. The only annoying issues we've had is that some of the things we ask for (music for instance), gives us a long-winded explanation of how it's not included in prime, however, if you pay additionally for this or that service, blah blah blah. Everthing's an add on - but it works great for what it was designed to do.

reviews.reviewTitle: Originally thought I had ordered the wrong item
reviews.reviewText: I originally thought I had ordered the wrong item and had contacted the seller in order to return. I received a prompt reply and seller was very nice and courteous. Upon looking into it further, I realized that I did order the correct item. I have been using the Echo Dot for about 3 days and had thought previously I wouldn't use it much. I now find myself asking about the outside temperature, weather forecast, odd random questions that I would normally have to google. It's like having a new friend whose very smart, lol. I would order again. Very pleased with purchase and seller.

I absolutely LOVE this little assistant! I received one free and was amazed by how much it can do! I went out and purchased a second the day after I received my free Dot.
I didn't realize how many of my current electronics work with Alexa! My security cameras connect and the Dot gives motion alerts. I can control my tv, which is great because my kids are always losing the remote. I can listen to my favorite music.
I like this speaker so much, I need one in each room!

reviews.reviewTitle: Fav thing is lists that are saved!
reviews.reviewText: Love it. After awhile alexa learns the things you ask for and how you ask. Its pretty cool. I mean everyone in the reviews already said what's needed to be said. I do like though that sometimes I will remember to write something down I need from the store so I just tell alexa. Once I'm at the store I just bring my app and the list is there..its been a huge game changer for a working mother like myself.

reviews.reviewTitle: Check before you try to use it for a speaker phone
reviews.reviewText: Why? Why with all the other feature and the mandatory connection to smart phone will this device not work as speaker phone.
