It was purchased or my parents who are visually imperiled. We thought great say call your son and then they could both use the great sounding speaker. Nope. But ion the upside they like to ask it to play music.

This was exactly what I wanted. Never had the Alexa experience before and decided to pull the trigger since it was on sale. I'm so glad that I did. I'm able to play music and ask Alexa various questions. Since purchasing I've never had any issues with it. Sounds is good but not great. Good enough for a small room. I will consider purchasing another one for a different room.

We got the Echo Dot during Prime Day and got a great deal, already worth it. We love using it to play music or games, or ask basic questions. I like that I don't have to constantly use my phone for my 4 year old, she can ask it to play songs on her own. However, it's really a bummer that it has no battery situation and can't be moved without unplugging/plugging in (especially since we use it for music) and it's reliability is a little spotty. We've gotten plenty of "I don't know that" answers and she'll hear/understand something almost intelligible, but not something else said pretty clearly. Again, still worth it, but could be better.

reviews.reviewTitle: got for free with Ring Alarm
reviews.reviewText: got my Alexa for free with my Ring alarm system and truly love it. she fills our home with music, makes it easy to use connected devices, and looks sleek sitting on the TV stand! i plan on buying more to place in other rooms!

reviews.reviewTitle: Fun but not for entire music albums
reviews.reviewText: Loved Alexa's ability to time tasks since I can't see my time keeper well. Her jokes are a bit lame but getting better. She is not good if you want classical music but the sound quality is okay for old pop tunes. Great for weather & news & very handy for anyone with visual problems. Sometimes she stops playing without any explanation but she is great for reading books from Audible.

reviews.reviewTitle: Had Me, Then You Lost Me . . .
reviews.reviewText:
I received my first one free with a recent Ring Cam purchase. I was so impressed I ordered a second Echo. Haven’t yet received the 2nd one, I’m already unhappy with the first. Keeps having an issue playing SiriusXM. Just did a Google and it’s seems there is a recent and ongoing issue.

Very bad 2nd impression :(

Eh it’s fine. I use it in the bedroom for simple stuff and it’s convenient. However, like everyone else pointed out, the speakers are truly terrible. I thought others were sensitive and exaggerating. They are not. The speakers are intolerable. I never use it to listen to music or my audio books, even at a lower volume. Only use it to ask for weather or add to my to do list and basic stuff like that.

reviews.reviewTitle: Always unplug it prior to plowing the neighbors girlfriend while he's at work.
reviews.reviewText: Easy setup, does what it advertises, and clear sound. I know it's listening in, waiting on certain "key words". Not a big deal to me, but I always forget to pull the plug on it prior to banging chicks that come over. Curious as to why I haven't had any suggestions to purchase lubricants or books for women that have daddy issues.

reviews.reviewTitle: 3rd generation dot is a vast improvement
reviews.reviewText: I bought this mainly because my 2nd generation white Dot annoyingly came with a black power charger and cord. Yuck! Ordered this one in sandstone - it has a white top and the fabric covering is a soft white/light gray tweed. The 3rd generation charger is white, the cord is white, it looks more upscale and best yet it’s louder and sounds way better. It’s actually amazing how much better it sounds. Well worth the upgrade.

Well, we have a full size one at our other home and I was missing Alexa. I decided to take a chance with this little one and am totally amazed and love it. The sound is great. I just say, Alexia play me some '60's rock and on come the tunes. She has a great variety of music and she even tells jokes! You can ask for information like, what was Abe Lincon's middle name and find out the answer. Amazing product and Love the little size!

reviews.reviewTitle: I really enjoy using the Echo Dot
reviews.reviewText: I have only had my Echo Dot for a week, and I really enjoy using it. I am still discovering different features and fun things to do with it. The Dot is very reactive- I haven't had any issues with it hearing my prompt. The sound is good when listening to music, however, it is muffled when listening to audio books. I wish this weren't the case because I really enjoy listening to audio books at night as I am going to sleep.

This is our 6th and 7th Echo's. They are located on every floor and these 3rd generation Echo's have been placed in two of our bedrooms. The clocks are great, easy to read and automatically dim when the lights are off. Indeed increasing the number of units during the last year says volumes for how we feel about the Amazon Echo!

reviews.reviewTitle: Much better alarm clock than old Echo Show!
reviews.reviewText: Had an Echo Show as my bedside alarm clock. Never liked the always glowing screen (didn't like turning it off either). Screen started glitching a while back. Now this new Echo Dot is the perfect bedside clock. Does everything Alexa did with my Show but without the annoyingly bright screen! Plus is sounds just as good! Love it!

I absolutely love the echo dot 3. It took me a while to get it connect to wifi but I blame myself for most of that. Once I finally got it set up I have had no issues. I have fallen in love with it. The sound quality is fantastic and i have had no problem with commands. I recommend this to anyone who is looking for a little extra.

reviews.reviewTitle: It’s nice if you know how to work it
reviews.reviewText: Got this as a wedding gift. It’s very stylish and loud, which is a plus if you have small LOUD children. However, after we set it up and used it the first day with no problems, the second day, Alexa would t interact at all. I’m pretty impatient with the so called “smart technology” so after about ten minutes, I gave up and be decided to return it.

reviews.reviewTitle: It's an Echo. Of course it is amazing.
reviews.reviewText: The Alexa is one of the most widely compatible assistants out there for both commands and support for 3rd party devices. Nothing has chanced when it comes to this and the new generation of the Dot. However, what has changed was the quality of sound that comes from the Dot, which is much richer from the new 3rd Gen. Beyond that, we can't say anything new that we haven't already shared about the last gen model.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is worth buying .ask alexia to tell you a story
reviews.reviewText: I love my echo dot. Alexia is the best she controls the TV lights. I still plan on buying a thermostat she can control. She wakes me up with her alarm and set timers when .She even goes to red alert when I'm watching star trek. When I tell her thank you she says of course. I tried many time to get her to say your welcome she wouldn't I gave up one day out of the blue I said thank you and she replied your welcome I was shocked. It would be cool if when u ask her when her birthday is she would reply when she was made r where she was born she would reply where she was made. For the price this is a great buy.Also it would be great if Alexia informed of severe weather in the area watches warnings

I got this for my son who has Autism. He absolutely loves this thing and it's making him talk more then ever. However, as you may or may not know kids with special needs sometimes talk a bit different then others and are harder to understand. Well sometimes alexa has a hard time understanding him and then he gets very frustrated.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great sound. Doesn't always "get it right"
reviews.reviewText: The white color looks great in the kitchen. The design is nice; contemporary, compact and has a soft look. It has wonderful sound for playing music. As for the voice recognition, it does not always get it right. It integrates well with Music streaming services though, and it makes listening to my favorite Radio stations in the morning easy.

reviews.reviewTitle: Leery at first of security concerns, but I'm onboard now
reviews.reviewText: I have serious misgivings about the assistant products offered by Google, Amazon, and particularly Facebook. The usefulness of the Alexa / Echo system and integration with the Ring security system plus security / configuration options alleviate some of those concerns and I find myself enjoying using the Alexa / Echo products.

reviews.reviewTitle: Definite improvement over previous Echo Dots
reviews.reviewText: I am very pleased with the 3rd generation Echo Dot. The audio is much better and actually has decent bass. I use Alexa for turning our “smart” lights on/off. Alexa is also connected to our doorbell and announces when someone is at our front door. The “drop in” feature which can function as an intercom with our other Echo Dots is very nice. I definitely recommend the Echo Dot.

reviews.reviewTitle: Spell the letters for a station name on tunein fast
reviews.reviewText:
A small speaker with a big sound ???!,,!!!!
A technical wizardry the sound from a small speaker set??🤖🤖🤖🤖🤖🤖🤓🤓🤓🤓
The voip phone the sound is great
Alexa understands the phone number and the contact names
I haven't had much of a problem when I say a station name like ones with two letters in it like xx Ross
All I do is spell it fast xx9

The speaker quality is far superior to previous generations. However, where the hardware has improved...the software has declined. It drops internet connection constantly (I've had to reconnect it at least 20 times in the last week), and its notification sound for timers and alarms is practically silent when she's connected to bluetooth speakers (even with volume turned up to max via button and asking her to turn it up) to the point I cannot hear it. Neither of these was an issue for previous generations. I gave it some leniency though because I got this product for free, through their developer promotion last month.

reviews.reviewTitle: Speaker started crackling after 4 days. Defective, don't buy not worth the money
reviews.reviewText: I have had an older echo dot for quite some time and never had any problems. Bought this one March 17, 2019 didn't even take it out of the box until April 19th and started using it to listen to music softly, volume 6. 4 days later it started making a crackling noise I thought it was the song so I changed the station. Was not the song. Now that it is past the 30 days I am stuck with a new Dot that sounds terrible. Not worth the money.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very Happy With My Purchase - Highly Recommended!
reviews.reviewText: I have been a die hard loyal Apple customer forever. I use Apple Home to control the lights in my house and listen to music. I have Home Pod, Apple TV, iPads as touch screen control panels, etc. But my alarm system offered Alexa support not Apple. So I decided I would get the Echo Dot just to control my home alarm. I love this thing. It does SOOOOO much more than Home pod. Home Pod sounds way better, but that's a given since the Echo Dot only has a 1.5" speaker just for responses. Amazon has tons and tons of options on what you can do and control. Apple has very few. I can not only control my lights and my home alarm, but my TV, my robot vacuum, so on and so on. If I add another one I can use them as an intercom system. I can use my phone while Im at work and tell my cat to get off the furniture through it. I love it! Pretty much anything on my network can be controlled by this thing... well except my Apple devices. LOL. I highly recommend the Echo Dot. I have been very impressed so far.

reviews.reviewTitle: What did I ever do without this?
reviews.reviewText: I say that anyone who does not have an Echo Dot, should buy one immediately, ask for one as a gift, or save toward its purchase. I have worked in technical fields for decades and I can honestly say that I do not believe any device has given me so much pleasure. I do have Amazon Prime and with that I enjoy access too so much that it is almost scary. Wake up and become enlightened. we live in the 21st century and this device is definitely one of the perks.

Needless to say the 3rd gen was a winner. This was for my Granddaughter who after watching how we use our Alexa system wanted one for her room. It is endless with what it can be used for, but if all you want is the weather, someone to talk to or music then this is what you want. You don't need to pay for music just ask Alexa to play the type you are looking for and she will find it :-) GrandpaJake

reviews.reviewTitle: Life is better with Amazon smart devices in it ....
reviews.reviewText:
The amazing world of Amazon and ever helpfulness of these fantastic smart devices Amazon has created, what is there to complain about...nothing !!! Life is better with Amazon’s awesome smart devices... If you haven’t seen or used one of the numerous brilliant smart devices created by Amazon, but love shopping online at Amazon. You’re missing out on some the best things Amazon offers ! From the best online shopping on the planet to most useful smart devices, you can’t go wrong when purchasing Amazon products !
This is a must have buy !!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Speaker developed a distortion and scratchy sound quality .
reviews.reviewText: I really liked this, used to play the sound from my TV and music. After 2 months the speaker has developed a distortion and scratchy sound quality. I want to exchange it for another but the return form defaults to a phone call only, and then tells you to try resetting the thing. I tried this before deciding to return this product. It's a sound quality issue and requires a replacement not a reset.

After having the original Echo Dot in the living room area, I bought this new Echo Dot for the bedroom. Mostly for ambient noise at night. Wow! So much better than that first-generation Echo Dot. The microphone pick-up is exponentially better and the speaker as well. The sound is so much more robust! I've been very happy with it (especially because it was on sale at the time of purchase)!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great price for a better life
reviews.reviewText: I got this echo dot on Tuesday and this is my first time using it. I got it for just 99 cent plus 7.99 for one month amazon music subscription. Is it an unbelievable deal? Using echo dot make my life so easier and I feel like I’m lazy. I use it with smart plug. I can use my voice to control the light, change music stations, check the weather, set timer and alarm, call or message anybody in my contact and so on. But Alexa is not as smart as kids, I ask her to count from one to ten, she just couldn’t do it. Haha, just kidding. The one thing that I’m not completely satisfied is the voice recognition, sometime she just not recognize my voice and understand my command. Overall, it’s a good product for the price. Definitely will buy another one.

I love my Dots! , I actually have two. One in Master bedroom and one in Family room, great for time checking, alarms settings, weather checks, house guard, plays my Amazon music playlist, plays nature sounds, she tells me jokes, ...for the price.. it's definitely useful. Recently purchased a Kasa Wifi Smart Plug to use for appliances or a lamp. Its expandable. No real big issues, sometimes I have to unplug her to reset her when Alexia is having " one of those days". But hey, we all have them! Lol

I love my echo dot!! I have a 2nd generation and decided to upgrade since they were on sale for Prime Day. I’m so glad I did!! I love the newer design with the round edges and the solid white to match my lighter decor. But the thing I love most is the huge improvement in the sound quality!! Not just the sound quality but the volume as well. Very impressed!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great but careful if you have kids.
reviews.reviewText: This thing is pretty powerful for what it is. The volume goes up loud with no distortion at all (Now I'm sure if you are an audiophile you might notice some, but any speaker in this range will). We use it primary for music streaming. It came with a 90 day trial of amazon music unlimited which is nice. Be warned though, if you have young kids and the figure out what this is, you'll have a lot of baby shark music...

My daughter bought the Alexa for my wife's birthday. The unit is fine, we are a older couple. We used it a few times when we first got it and now it sits on the counter with the power off most days. The most we do is ask Alexa the weather or say good night and shut it off again. I use my laptop a lot and my wife is always on her I-Pad so we are using modern technology. Seems like Alexa is good for a quick answer if you aren't on your computer of I-Pad.....that is if she knows it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good product, too much amazon. Sorry.
reviews.reviewText: I like Alexa. And I like amazon. BUT, I don’t want it advertising products from amazon when I ask a question. And I don’t want this box interfering in my life. And I don’t want it blinking yellow all night when I’m trying to sleep because it wants to tell me my order from amazon came. I just want to be able to use the capabilities to play music, get information, and use it to call someone in an emergency. Maybe some day connect to other smart products.

I enjoyed my dot while it worked. Been using for about three months. Now the audio come out occasionally but wont stay on. For example it will cut out in the middle of a song but but come back on. I have to reset it for it to work again.

Alexa works better than I expected. I was slow to integrate this into my house but now I just love it! I can listen to musuc, find a song , play an audio book, check the weather just about anything . Super easy Robert up and use. I will be adding speakers since the sound needs a bit of a boost. It never claimed to replace speakers. Try it, vet you will love it!

I really like my Echo Dot. I like the fact that I don't have to hold the phone while talking to someone. I enjoy the information that Alexa finds for me. Asking what time it is and the weather. It's a great help. Plus I like the fact that Alexa will be on guard to hear any glass shatter at my house meaning there is a break in and alert me that she heard something. Finding new things Alexa can do every day just about. Weather forecast, reminders, and jokes. I need that in my life.She will even sing you a song LOL!

I had been hesitant about ever getting anything like this but decided to try this little gem. I have been very happy with it. I have had it playing music for my granddaughter and setting timers when I cook and the weather and I have only scratched the surface with what it will do. I have gotten a smart plug and am considering getting a second one.

reviews.reviewTitle: Pretty good. I bought a second one
reviews.reviewText: I have used it to put a couple orders in my shopping cart and it wakes me up every morning. Pretty decent sound from a small speaker. I downloaded a skill that lets Alexa control smart home enabled devices so I can turn off and on stuff in the house with voice commands. Pretty neat. There is way more this can do that I'm not even utilizing yet. Overall, I like it.

reviews.reviewTitle: A great addition to any home
reviews.reviewText: Have received my Echo Dot and running for a week now. It truly is an amazing product to have around. It is running off my PC as we don't use smart phones - works just fine. One question: it has a pulsing green circle light that is visible sometimes (a couple days at a time) and is off for periods of days. Alexa works fine when asked a question. Is this pulsing green circle light indication of a function?

I really love having the echo dot. I listen to music and I've played games on it. I played escape room and I played against someone in a "guess the song name" type game. I enjoyed the music guessing game more so the escape room. I ask the typical questions like weather, pro game results, etc. I just found out it gives stock market info. Also, I like the notification option where I can use the alexa app and type in what I want alexa to broadcast to my family.

I did have an initial issue setting up the dot on my network. I tried to go through my PC but actually ended up using my phone. I had to download the app onto my phone. I was a little upset that I had to have yet another app but with the notification function, it makes it better. Also, I can view the history of what was asked of Alexa, in case my kids are playing on it too much.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa is really helpful but be ready to purchase add-ons for extras
reviews.reviewText: Great product but you seem to need a lot of add-ons to really get good use of Alexa. For example, getting her to play music is awesome but you need a prime music subscription to use that and you need the smart plug to get Alexa to turn your lights on and off or the Phillips hue lights bulbs (which makes sense because how else is Alexa going to connect with the lamp to get it to turn off). It's a great product though I love asking Alexa to play thunder and rain sounds at night. I don't regret my purchase.

Very disappointed. Sound is quite a bit louder but the quality of the sound sucks. Sounds like a busted speaker especially when volume is is set low. Can't understand what it says. Went to the equalizer in the Alexa app. and turned up the treble and down the bass with minimal improvement. Very disappointing ...... My opinion, stick with the 2nd generation.
I didn't keep the original box so I guess I am stuck with it.

A bargain..for it's capabilities..only problem i have with it..is it does not understand what i am trying to tell it on occasion..and i have to repeat myself..other than that..a tiny ball of fun capabilities..hooked up a cheap set of usb driven speakers..and greatly enhanced the stereo effect..for less than 15 bucks..a great little device!

Love the product, do not like the amazon alexa app. Clunky software on Iphone. In app extensions that you have to install to get alexa to do other tasks.

Hard to get all the echos in the home to play the same thing. Have to go thru app platform. For instance, using the podcast app on the iphone, cannot get the 'play everywhere' to respond appropriately. Must use their sluggish and old generation platform. Had to listen to the same podcast from the beginning 3 times when I went from room to room. No fast tack and timeline function.

Better than expected. I use the device to control my Xbox One X and it does a fantastic job! I use my Xbox as media hub so being able to have basic controls - off/on getting into apps and controlling the Edge browser with Alexa through Cortana is awesome. Doesn’t however support some audio codecs to raise and lower volume on sound bars connected via optical. I say Alexa tell Xbox to raise volume, you will see the Xbox/Alexa logo on screen doing the command but nothing changes.

reviews.reviewTitle: Seems like a good choice so far
reviews.reviewText: I’ll admit it, this was an impulse buy. But once I downloaded the correct app (make sure not to get anything other than the Amazon Alexa App) the setup was easy and took very little time. So far so good, and I may start integrating other things to the device very soon. It’s living up to its reputation and I look forward to seeing how I up using it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Sorry, nothing like a google home mini
reviews.reviewText: I got my son the google home mini, and I got the Echo dot. He wins, I lose. The dot is far less capable, while the mini pretty much answers any "googleable" question. Alexa mostly says "Hmmmmm, I don't know that, but I'm getting smarter everyday", only she isn't. Probably good if you want to order stuff from amazon, and maybe for music. Both sound pretty good for their size by the way. Still, get the mini.

I have these throughout my home. They have changed my life. I can have Alexa turn on lights, turn on my coffeemaker, I can listen to the news and weather, and music before I get out of bed. I can play music throughout my house. I can play games, and podcasts before I go to sleep at night. I am going to add more Kasa products soon, to go along with my echo dots.

She talks too much when I'm watching a movie. lol... It doesn't stay connected to the devices very well. (Used to work TV now doesn't. Used to play through soundbar, now doesn't. Won't connect to DVD player.) Has issues understanding plain English (no accent or speech impediment). Her favorite statement is "I didn't get that".

My enjoys using his Echo Dot for listening to music, but the sound quality was closer to a clock radio. We upgraded to the 3rd gen version, and it is substantially improved. It sounds MUCH better and looks nicer. The previous Dot really needed an external speaker if you cared about audio quality, but this one is usable standalone. Apparently you can set up two of them as a stereo pair. Sounds interesting, have not tried it yet.

I have had this in the box for maybe seven months. Good price but I was not at the house where it was located. I have several alexas. The echo, dot and now this particular one. Sound is much richer with this one, almost like the echo. I wish Amazon made a dot for husbands. My husband needs a little blue circling light on his head so that i know when he is listening.

With these we now how a intercom system in our house. Just say "alexa brodcast" it is so cool because it will send the message to all echo devices. The sound quality is good as well. We have the lastest echo in our kitchen and this is pretty good compared but as much bass.

This is the fourth Echo product I've purchased -- and I can only give a rave review. Alexa works great and has become a big part of my daily routine. I don't know if this will ever be fixed or it is just part of the Echo products, but it in annerving when Alexa starts to talk to you without having been asked... A little creepy, but a small thing in comparison to all the things the Echos are good at doing.

I got my Echo in the mail and it was fairly easy to set up. I do wish the plug didn't look so beefy. The speaker is great and pretty loud and clear. It's also pretty heavy so you don't feel like it'll accidentally get knocked down by anything.
One thing I do not enjoy is the fact quite a few features require a subscription. I really want to listen to my Spotify without needing Premium, but that must be Spotify's decision.

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo Dot, simplicity of the future.
reviews.reviewText: Dot has a simple durable look with powerful mini Boombox sound took me beyond imagination... Alexa is very tenacious, polite, meticulous assistant. She goes beyond the ethics of artificial intelligence capacity and gives you any answer for a question. In a few hours of interacting with Alexa, she eneded up giving me many wrong answers or outdated informations. The initial installation of the Dot took many hours and more hours of migraine headache; possible bug in the app so, fix it to increase rating. Overall, Dot is that kind of devices that would simplifies the future. Great device 👏👏👏

reviews.reviewTitle: Much fuller sound and larger than Gen 2 Dot
reviews.reviewText: Much better sound than the Gen 2 Dot and Alexa App lets you adjust Bass, Mid & Treble. Sounds much fuller than Dot 1 or Dot 2. Still it’s a smaller speaker that is not meant to fill a room with audiophile sound but it does a pretty good job with decent sound output. The Echo is a much better choice if you’re looking for quality sound output, but that didn’t stop me from filling every room in the house with these Dots!

reviews.reviewTitle: Did my Echo come with the dumb Alexa?
reviews.reviewText: Extremely disappointed in this product. Finally decided to gives this thing a try and it was a major let down. Alexa will do what you say one time and the next do something different or say she can’t find that. I have checked the app to see what was heard and it records the exact same thing as the time before that worked. I even bought a more powerful wireless router thinking maybe it was losing connection with zero improvement. Most frustrating waste on money I have ever bought.

The 3rd generation of the dot is the best by far. This sounds so much better than the prior gen dots!

If the dot has too little or too much treble, mid-range or base, you can adjust these levels in the Alexa app so it’s more pleasing to your ears If you listen to music.

If you want a low priced Amizon Alexa device, this it it. Don’t let the price (I paid $24) fool you. It sounds good for how small it is.

reviews.reviewTitle: very good sound surprising beings it's size
reviews.reviewText: once I got it working it's a very convenient item to use but getting it in working condition was very difficult as I do not have a smart phone which I guess is a must and amazons tech support people tried to help but in the end they were not able to in the end I borrowed some ones smart phone and figured it out for myself so if you don't have a smart phone start out by borrowing ones in the end I'm glad to have this in my house

Honestly, I never thought of getting an Alexa dot, but now that we have one, I love it and plan to get another for our bedroom. It makes things easier when your hands are full/dirty to just ask a question or play music or read a book while you want some white noise. There are so many devices you can connect to it to as you evolve your house into a smart house which is nice. The disc is small and doesn’t take up much room on the counter either

So much fun and very helpful in everyday life! Also got a smart plug for the family room light so it can turn it on and off. Love "the question of the day", ability to set timers and reminders from either the echo or the app. Sometimes the speaker is fuzzy, but moving it slightly helps. Would love to be able to pick my own activation name, other than the few choices given. Maybe in the future!

My 12 year old wanted a "Clapper" to turn his bedroom lamp on. Instead, we got him an Alexa. Since Christmas, we've purchased 3 more and a few plugs to control lights off and on. Today purchased a Fire TV Cube!

Love the sound and the ability to listen to whatever we are in the mood for musically through Amazon Prime.

Thanks 12 year old brat kid for making me think outside the "box"!

This is the first disapppointment we have had with an Amazon device. We could not get the Echo to work properly. After spending too long with customer support my husband finally got the help person to acknowledge our device was defective and we returned it.
We could not get it to sync with our smart plugs and we never got Alexa respond to our requests.

reviews.reviewTitle: Brilliant sound; can fill up a whole room!
reviews.reviewText: The sound on this is amazing! It is head and shoulders above the last model. I would give it 5 stars, but I find that it’s consistently less sensitive to voice commands than the last model. Nothing that would keep me from purchasing it again, and I might not even notice if I didn’t have another Echo that responded better, but still slightly annoying. Overall, I really like it and would purchase it again.

reviews.reviewTitle: Lots of fun and a great smart home addition
reviews.reviewText:
A ton of fun and helpful through the house.
I can control the lights throughout my house, change channels and volume on all my fire connected TVs.
Music is constantly streaming throughout the house.
My son is figuring t out and it’s a lot of fun seeing him try to hold a conversation with Alexa.
So far it’s understood everything I’ve said and you just need to be direct and it’s no problem.

I got this as a premium from Sirius. What they don't tell you is you need to buy an additional subscription to stream your radio over Alexa.
She also has trouble staying connected to the internet, but that is probably an issue of my internet provider. It's a fun little gadget, but I guess I am of the age where I prefer to turn the lights on and off myself. I do like getting the weather report every morning.

So, it’s just a dot, like the old one, but the sound is amazing. It doesn’t do much new (other than basically getting getting out of its packaging, plugging itself in, setting itself up, and letting you know when it’s ready to go (at least that’s how easy it feels)). It’s a heavy little bugger so the bass sounds like bass...like...you almost don’t need to plug a better speaker into it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect speeker for a small room!
reviews.reviewText: I had been wanting an Amazon Alexia for a while and finally got around to purchasing one and I absolutely love it and should have gotten one sooner! I did not think I would use it that much but I use it way more often than I expected. For its size it easily fills a bedroom with sound. The clarity and bass will surprise you for the size of the speaker. It is a great buy!

reviews.reviewTitle: Way louder than Gen 2 Dot but has some quirks
reviews.reviewText: Way louder than Gen 2 Dot but drops out of Pandora whole home group playback at random. It will sometimes join back in 20 minutes later with no interference from me. I have 6 of them, 5 Gen 3, 1 Gen 2, and it isn't the same one that drops each time. One time it will be my master bedroom. Next day, it may be the kitchen. However, the Gen 2 Dot never drops out. It's completely random on which one of the other 5 drops and it gets aggravating. Even the one closest to the router will drop out. So I don't think it is my router or network.

We have several Alexa devices in our home. I have this one in my kitchen and I find it useful when I am cooking or eating dinner. I can have Alexa read the news, give me recipe instructions, or add things to my shopping list on the fly. If you don't have one in your kitchen I recommend getting one. It is a great product!

We want one for every level of our house. The fact I can check in on my oldest son to tell him dinner is ready is too hilarious. I get notified when I order a product from Amazon and it ships. My kids enjoy telling her what to sing and asking questions. Its great. Volume sounds great. We use the timer and alarm option daily for cooking or when we need reminded to leave somewhere etc.

Finally decided to get on the Alexa bandwagon. I liked the intercom feature so we have more than one in our house. Missed the days of playing the stereo while cleaning without getting the tv involved. Sound is decent but not mindblowing. I may upgrade soon to the taller option to get better sound quality but overall just a cool little device.

reviews.reviewTitle: Speaker Concerns ??? Suggestions what to do ????
reviews.reviewText:
Ive got a 1st gen Echo and Echo Dot and now this 3rd gen Dot. Arrived yesterday and got it hooked up, I do a lot of audiobook listening. I'm concerned with the sound with the new Dot. Right now I'd say the 1st gen devices sound much better than the new one. I've played around with the audio on the new Dot and I'm still not completely happy. Yet at times it seems after a bit, if I turn the volume up higher, the sound gets better, voices at least sound closer to what I'm used too. I've been turning it around to see if positioning has an impact. In part, it sound muffled, and I checked to see if I missed removing any plastic like you often see on new electronic items, the stuff they put on to prevent scratches and what not, you cant tell it's there at times; but nope.
I'm dissapointed - dredding having to send it back and end up a day or two without as I no longer have the 1st gen Dot.
Any others having any speaker issues as described that have found by chance they aren't lasting ???? Or it's just me ?? (doubtful I'm betting)
Thanks.

reviews.reviewTitle: The Amazon echo is a cool gadget.
reviews.reviewText: I picked up this echo during prime day cause you know, why not? I didn’t think I needed it until I started using it in my kitchen and honestly I think it’s a pretty cool gadget to have especially when connected to a Bluetooth speaker. Alexa can do a lot of things Siri can’t do which is great, and the ability to add a routine to do whatever you want, is a awesome feature to have.

This was a gift. After hooking it up, seems to work great. A ton of stuff it has no clue,(try asking about project blue book, or anything regarding the government, it gets dumb as a stump) . Do I need to ask it to go to Wikipedia first? I can look it up myself! Which is what I thought it did. Maybe my expectations were too high. When my son saw it he asked me when I got the surveillance equipment. It does come in handy.

My first Echo product was an Echo Spot and I wanted to extend the Alexa coverage in my home by adding an Echo Dot. I was pleasantly surprised that both the speaker and microphone on the 3rd gen Dot is much better than my much more expensive Spot plus I got a great Black Friday deal on it so it was a great deal. I wasn't expecting much based on other 2nd gen Dot reviews but it appears this gen is much improved.

We have been in love with our Echo Dog ever since it arrived. The kid’s have enjoyed making requests to Alexa and asking her questions, jokes and riddles. I love using her as an alarm clock and to add things to my shopping cart. I was really impressed with the sound quality and love the bass that this little speaker puts out, it fills the entire room with high quality sound. I highly recommend it ✨

I have many (all available) Echo devices (11 units, Show 1st & 5th gen., dots, spot, etc.). These work great. Sound is surprisingly good for the size. Price point is really good for what you get. I have 6 of these. They are easy to add to the group. You can set all your devices to play when listing to music which gives you access to every room.

Bathrooms have great acoustics and this small device really plays up its strengths in one. I listen to podcasts while showering/shaving and it sounds great. This is great because my situation doesn't allow for a full size echo in there. I have 2 dots for when I want to play music, (any music purchased through amazon can be played in stereo with two linked echo devices. Awesome device!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: This is my second Echo Dot!
reviews.reviewText: I first purchased an Echo Plus. I enjoyed it so much I later purchased and Echo Dot for my office at home. This enabled me to have Alexa add calendar events, to do list, and reminders. All I need to do is talk to her. I liked the Dot so much, I just purchased my second Dot for the bedroom. I now control bedroom lights, set my morning alarm and play music in the bedroom. This is a terrific personal assistant!

reviews.reviewTitle: Hope you learn a thing or two, NSA
reviews.reviewText: I utilize this in my classroom as I have a number of ESL kids who speak Spanish at home. I use it for translation and other aspects like music, etc. My boyfriend won't let me bring it home because he doesn't want the government listening in on our personal lives but I don't care if the NSA listens to my English lecture. I hope they learn something.

My husband and I love Alexa and our Echo Dots. We own two of them and haven't flipped a light switch since we received them.😊 Alexa is also helpful for lots of other things like alarms, getting the weather, general info on just about anything. Planning a trip? Just ask her how long it will take you to get there and she will give you an estimate and send directions to your phone. Helpful in so many ways.

This is my second Alexa purchase and I love them both, I have one in my bedroom and when I can't sleep at night I ask Alexa to turn on Soothing sounds for 30 minutes, I fall fast asleep before the sounds stop, my second Alexa is in my living room and what I love best about it, is the bluetooth feature, it connects to my speakers in my house and on Saturdays when I do a deep cleaning on my house I ask Alexa to turn on my Rock n Roll music on Pandora, my house gets clean in no time and it was also fun!

I could not get my echo dot connected. My daughter , who is quite good with electronics, had a difficult time but finally got it connected but it didn't work correctly. I was able to say Alexa, set my alarm for 6am and it seemed to be working but at some point the orange ring went round and round and at 6am, the alarm did not go off.

I’m replacing a 1st generation echo dot and am shocked by the difference in sound quality. It’s small but sounds like my other echoes. Unnoticeable but powerful. When I went to connect it, it did it all by itself. It’s easy anyway, but I didn’t have to go to settings , etc....it did the work for me. Love it and definitely recommend it.

I love my Echo Dot actually I bought two I love them both! I wish I had gotten them along time ago I actually feel the sound on them is better than my larger model. I bought one to use in my classroom I have a massive science lab and it has no problem hearing my voice and recognizing my voice and what I am saying from the other end of my room.

I have had nothing but trouble since my purchase. First, i could not get it connected to my wi fi and spent 75 minutes on the phone with Amazon Support who could not do it as well. My 13 year old grand daughter came over and did it in 10 minutes. The following night I asked Alexa to tell me when it was 11:30pm and I would go to sleep. She did inform me as asked but I was unable to shut it off saying Alexa shut off, close, stop etc. to no avail. I finally unplugged it and have not yet attempted to reconnect.

reviews.reviewTitle: My Echo hears me... hears me ... hears me
reviews.reviewText:
I love the echo Dot .I can ask Alexa so do so many things already and I haven’t really gotten started .
I can ask her to find a song. TV Show, or Movie .She will make a phone call for me and act as my speaker .I can ask how many people watch The World Series , or how to bake bread .Without a doubt , she is m friend!

I tried to set the Dot up using their ap and it won't connect. I contacted their support chat and talked to 6 different people and never got anything solved. Evidently, there is no support if you have problems. not for me. I finally called the voice support and they got it up and running. It cost me $106 but it's now working fine. I need to learn some how to's but can't afford another $100.

reviews.reviewTitle: You will have to buy some CDs twice to get them on your Echo
reviews.reviewText: The little Dot speaker does what it can. However, there are the privacy concerns associated with having your voice commands and conversations stored in the cloud. Worst of all, you will find that CDs purchased from Amazon in the past will not appear in your purchased list if they did not include the MP3 files at the time of purchase. Thus, you will have to re-purchase these CDs with the MP3 files. I was not pleased.

Not only is GEN3 Larger and Better sounding, it will find your Network and Bluetooth devices almost instantly. Sound is much Better than GEN2 and it has a dedicated power supply that does not rely on USB. I love the new look and the overall performance from the speaker and the power supply. GEN3 is Louder and Richer sounding. I am really glad to have upgraded from GEN2 !

reviews.reviewTitle: fix alexa app/ add back up battery option so power stays on
reviews.reviewText: The Alexa app is horrible. If I want to move the device I have to connect all over again. I wish it had a option for a back up battery so it stays on and connected. The app on my phone doesn't work well at all spendingm more time connecting then we should. Speaker started acting up and sounding weird song was distorted. Then it seemed to play fine not sure why.

We have three of the second generation dots, and wanted a fourth. I didn't really see the difference in the third gen, but since it was so inexpensive on Black Friday, I purchased it. Wow. The sound quality is incredible. We have this in our kitchen and we can clearly hear it all through the house- even upstairs- and our house isn't small. Crisp and clear sound and a huge difference between the second gen

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa is the best gift to give!
reviews.reviewText:
I can not tell you how much my family and I love our Alexas! I bought one for me and one for my partner and we fell in love. Alexa has clear sound quality for playing music! My niece loves to have Alexa sing Baby Shark.
The design is nice and modern. I hardly even notice it’s in the room most times!
I ended up buying three more! One for my partner’s mother, one for my mom with the smart bulb and one for my grandma with the smart bulb. Alexa works well in Spanish also and understands my family with ease! Absolutely love it

I have both this and Google now and in some ways I love this more. The colored lighting is fun and it's definitely more sturdy and pleasing to look at. My only complaint is the difficulty playing any of my playlists either on Amazon or another platform like Spotify. No matter what I say it always plays the wrong list. I have to manually open the app to play it. Then it doesn't play it in it's entirety. Otherwise it's a great little speaker. It picks up voice much better than Google and has better sound quality. I'll be buying more.
This thing is awful. Always disconnects from WIFI and needs to be re-set constantly. Only works 30% of the time. Throwing in the trash!

Read all the directions. Added app to my phone. Alexa would not listen to me. Did what she wanted, asked her to play CBC Radio, she played Maroon Five, not even close. Tried over and over again with no success. Wouldn’t even set a timer.

reviews.reviewTitle: Never worked correctly though and barely used it
reviews.reviewText: This device never worked correctly. The sound was always muffled. Then it stopped responding. I contacted customer service to replace it, but apparently I was too late. I didn't realize there was only a 90 day warranty (that's my fault - I figured it would be longer for something like this). My order page said replacement was possible through January 2020, so I guess I don't understand what that means. Very disappointed. Especially since I only used it a handful of times.

I can't get much of anything out of this other than weather, reminders and turn on music. I've put in locations, still it is way off on mileage to work, any restaurants, even simple questions get a "hummm, I'm not sure about that' I'm Afraid I invested in the wrong assistant. Even worse I bought a second one before I realized how bad it was :( And I've thrown out the packaging :(

For my mother in law in a different location. We thought we would have to walk her through the wifi setup but was very pleased to find out that it automatically connected to her wifi which made the setup process very easy. She wanted the dot with the time display to use as an alarm. We created a routine that she absolutely loves.

Alexa gets confused at times. With alarms I literally have to scream to get them to turn off. Alarms also will continue to go off every day if you delete them without first turning them off. Alexa also likes to request you to review features she has such as meditation radio or thunderstorms which can be very annoying when you’re trying to sleep or relax. Otherwise it works perfectly as expected and does what I need. I plan to get a few more and probably some smart plugs as well.

reviews.reviewTitle: Huge bang for your buck Small convenient to put anywhere and great sound quality
reviews.reviewText: I bought two of these and I will say this they are extremely responsive much better than any other Alexa product I’ve seen At friends homes Now with all fairness this is newer than theirs but there’s was also three times the amount at the time when bought Nothing bad to say at all the product is awesome the microphones are incredible and having it hooked up to some of my smart home devices is amazing

These cute little speakers are a huge improvement on the second generation dots! It is unbelievable how much sound they are capable of outputting, with some pretty sizable base. I was definitely pleasantly surprised. They also work great as a stereo pairing. If you really want power, they still have the option to bluetooth their audio to an outside speaker as well.

I will admit that I struggled with setting it up. I followed the directions that are included and even went onto youtube to gain more info. It did not want to connect to my wifi. But after a week of effort, it is now connected and I love having music played whenever I want with just the sound of my voice. It was worth the money

reviews.reviewTitle: Needs way too much personal info to setup
reviews.reviewText: The app kept giving me an error about enabling cookies in my browser? why? On my wife's iphone we got it to work, but then wanted a full access to her contacts and was not able to continue setup of the Alexa without accepting. sending Alexa back. Should require less person info to simply setup.

I got it as a gift from my kids. I am 76. They set it up and added Askmybuddy to it. Now if I am alone and have a medical issue I tell Alexa to askmybuddy to get help and my kids and grandkids will be called. I have one in kitchen area and one in my bedroom. I love that it will play my music and all sorts of other things. Very happy to have them. Best gift ever!

Haven't had this much fun for a long time. The unit works as described. Fast delivery. Easy set up. Still amazed at all the things we have found for Alexa to help with. Hubby had cataract surgery and used Alexa for reminders and timers to put in all the eye drops he had. She also plays music, gives you the weather forecast, football scores and game times, not to mention sending the Daily Crossword to my printer. Love Alexa!

reviews.reviewTitle: Very useful especially if you are disabled
reviews.reviewText: Works great, even ordered a 2ed one for the living room to stay in touch with everyone. I’m disabled and bedridden, so having this makes it a thousand times easier to get in touch with my caregiver/roommates. When they are in the living room. And has some pretty great App’s. Controls my Xbox One x nicely. Plus I picked em both up on sale for 21$ each. Was a good score.

reviews.reviewTitle: Does what it is expected to do.
reviews.reviewText: New to technology like this. Never has a device that could talk back or answer questions. So it’s neat. Just not happy that I can’t apply my playlists on my phone to it. Or use my Bluetooth at least I can’t find any solutions. It would be cool to ask alexa to play a song that I already purchased on Apple Music. Also with that music was included in the cost of the device. Pandora world but I like specific music. Overall good product, nice to have around when you live alone.

the echo dot was a gift...it was something I wouldn't buy myself as I thought I wouldn't really use it... I have not connected it to anything in my house but do ask Alexa questions all the time and now, use it for reminders like keeping my grocery list or my household "to do" list. There have only been a few times "she" couldn't answer the question or play the requested music. It's fun to have!

I originally got myself an Amazon Echo and loved it. So I bought two Dots, one as a gift and the other for myself. No issues. Alexa is a little tricky to communicate with but once you get used to her she is great fun. When the dots were on sale I bought two more so that I can have her read to me as I move from room to room, or have music throughout the house. One of them had a blown speaker. I got in touch with product support and the new one is on the way. In my opinion that is pretty good. I have bought 5, had issues with 1, and quick response and quick solution to the issues. Great devices, great customer service.

I started off loving Alexa, i wanted a small speaker in my kitchen and the ability the ask Alexa to change songs without having to go to my phone was great in my opinion. I've had the echo for less than two months and already the sound is muffled and grainy. I dont understand why as its never gotten wet and is not used for long periods of time. Im pretty upset and it feels like a waste to have the speakers sound damaged so soon.

+Fidelity surprisingly good and flexible. Set up a quick breeze!
+Excellent voice recognition
+Playlists, while well selected, can be short.
+Surprising amount of things can be answered.
-Can't figure how sync iOS calendar or contacts.
-No indoor temperature (ie does not contain a thermometer).
-Does not include a list of items that can connect.
All in all, a surprising pleasure.

I love my little echo, I put it in my bedroom. When I’m getting ready in the morning I ask for a flash briefing and Alexa informs me of the world news in five minutes or less. There is also the option to have her wake you up every morning and the wake up alarm is so pleasant compared to the iPhone alarm choices. Obviously there is so much more to this little gadget but these are my top two favorites.

reviews.reviewTitle: I bought 5 of theses so far I love them
reviews.reviewText: I think everyone know how amazing this product his. I am an Apple guy and have an iHome but these work with almost all my current products and more. I love the price point and the ease at which you can communicate with it. They control the whole house at this point. I will say it still needs a little work with the app compared to HomeKit app but it makes up for it with giving you far more access and capabilities .

I was very exited to receive this latest Echo Dot model and immediately found that the depth of sound vastly surpassed my Gen 1 model. However, their are issues. The device cannot seem to consistently pick up on my voice despite being in the same place as my older model, to which I experienced no such issues, and this continues despite my troubleshooting attempts. Also, the bass is so intense, the sound so deep, that certain songs and radio programs vibrate the whole device plus the dining table it sets on, and there is also noticeable static. Perhaps if I didn't have the older model to compare this to I wouldn't notice the difference, but its tremendous and not for the better. I'm going to contact the company in case to see if I possibly have a defective device.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good Device, Alexa is Just OK
reviews.reviewText: The device itself is nice and convenient, but Alexa isn't very helpful. About 1/3 of the questions I ask her, she doesn't know the answer to. The questions aren't difficult, so I'm surprised she doesn't know basic facts. In fact, I ask her questions about the operations of the Echo Dot, and she doesn't even know the answers to those questions. She just refers you to the manual. The sound quality on the device is acceptable. It's not superior quality, but it does the job. I did adjust the bass and treble, and that helped improve the sound to my liking.

I was surprised at how poor the sound quality is for a speaker that costs $50. I have a $10 speaker that sounds much better than this. If you are planning on playing music from this you might want to get a different one but if you just use basic commands such as asking for the weather, the sound quality is good enough.

This echo dot is amazing. I can't believe the sound and quality of sound that it produces. I use it every day. Once it's set up, the device is so easy to use. Just be careful about placing multiple connected devices near it as you have to be specific about which device you want to connect with.
I use it to listen to audio books and music, I haven't gone much further than that for connectivity.

reviews.reviewTitle: OK I am a believer and convert!
reviews.reviewText: we now have one in every single room the basement and by the pool (3 outside for stereo effect) - Amazon has absolutely nailed it when it comes to the ECHO ... works very well although it will take time to learn all capabilities and commands but so far everyone in the house and our friends are sold on it - highly recommended!

We bought this for our children's room. I love that you can make phone calls and they love to tell alexia what songs to play. The only thing that was disappointing was that it was damaged easily. The first day we put it up it accidentally slid down the wall a couple feet and it lost color in that area which surprised me with such a short drop.

This is my 5th Echo added to my home. One in the kitchen (Bose speaker, Alexa Enabled), full sized Alexa in living room, Echo Show in bedroom and a Dot in my office and downstairs den. I love it. Just ask Alexa to play ANY music since I have Amazon Prime Music subscription. Ask the weather, ask any question wherever I am in the house. I'm a little hooked on them. :-)

I really like my Alexa but I am a bit disappointed that to a lot of my questions to Alexa her response is always “hmmm I’m not quite sure” or “I don’t know about that” I thought she would be like Siri or something who could have an answer to every question or at least search for the answer online but it seems like she doesn’t really know much at all

reviews.reviewTitle: Had some difficulty connecting to our internet
reviews.reviewText: We have a few Amazon devices in our home. They have not given us any trouble connecting to our wifi until this one. I called customer support and they were great, especially for being on the phone for 2 hours- and not getting it figured out. Some how even after all of the failed attempts this device eventually connected and worked. I don't know what we did wrong or what we did right, but it is working! Maybe we just needed to wait longer. For some reason they said this one connects differently than the previous generation. But If you have a hard time, just have patience! Love all the devices and am excited for what's to come!

It’s tough when listening to music to scream over the top of the device. The music isn’t even loud and you really have to get close, almost walk up to it to get it to obey. I have better luck with my older version hearing my commands than the newest version. Sound quality is better than the older one but having to repay yourself several times is quite annoying.

reviews.reviewTitle: Making the Echo Dot even better.
reviews.reviewText:
I love the Echo Dot because it's small and convenient, but this generation makes it even better with a new and better design and improved audio.
This Echo is perfect if you want to try Alexa for the first time, or add her to a secondary room.
I love the 3 new colors, and how in design match the bigger Echo.

You won't regret adding this Dot to your household.

Sorry, this video is unsupported on this browser.
 Basically wanted this so I can tell Alexa to “play money by Cardi B” whenever I want. Works well. Actually super impressed with th quality of the speaker for it being a small unit. Honestly, this thing gets pretty loud and if you’re wanting a small device to play music on in your room or a room in your house, this is totally worth it for $30! Plus you can just get one for every room in your house (:

We have as second and third generation dot and there is a clear difference. The scecond gen works but the sound is weak and no bass, I used a Bluetooth receiver and connected it to our receiver, it works great for that.

The third generation sound is much better, louder and more range, high and low. I also noticed the third has better microphones, it hears better over loud music.

I purchased two dots during Prime days. I’ve set one up so far and I think it’s great. The reason I knocked off one star is because the power cord almost feels as if it was recently painted. To top it off, after I unraveled it, I had a bunch of white paint on my hands and shirt. What the heck?! Not sure what that’s all about. Hopefully the next one won’t have the same issue.

reviews.reviewTitle: Tech You'll Actually Use and Very Affordable
reviews.reviewText: I've bought several so far with an outlet accessory. I plan on buying at least one more for another room and more accessories. Very cool. Instead of yelling across the house, I can drop-in on my son's room and talk to him that way. I also like dropping in during the day to talk to my dog. If I have any questions, I just ask Alexa. Very cool tech. Creating routines is also fun. Grab one now while they're on sale.

Works okay for background noise while working or cleaning. Sound quality is below average but I was expecting that. I haven't really explored a lot of the features with Alexa but she really only gets what I say about half of the time. I got on a .99 promo or I would have never purchased at full price. Stick with JBL!

I don't use it as much as I thought I would ... it's in my office where I have other things going on. But I so enjoy Echos. Good sound for my Prime Music. Fun to keep time or set alarms. Also our number one source for weather reports. I know. Pretty trivial except that we're still adapting to the weather in the Ohio.

reviews.reviewTitle: Only 120V it won't work outside the USA
reviews.reviewText: It's useless the Amazon Smart Plug. It came 120V unlike the Echo Dot which is 120-220V and the plugs are not compatible worldwide . So it's a piece of junk.

For medical reasons I was having trouble turning on the living room light. So I decided to try Alexa. I bought the echo three on Black Friday and got a terrific price for it. I also received a smart plug with this bundle. The Alexa echo third-generation is a wonderful addition to my life. Alexa not only turns the lights on and off she has games that we have really enjoyed playing she tells jokes too. So much more to to the Alexa then just turning on and off appliances. I highly recommend Alexa and have told my friends about it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Awesome technology can’t beat Alexa or the Price for High Tech Items !!!
reviews.reviewText: But my daughter two Of them they work great she loves Them I Bought my Daughter a Echo , and She liked it So Much That She Bought Another One !!! The Echo is an Awesome Speaker with Alexa as an Helper and Very Informational Too ! And She Wanted Another One For The Shower Area Where She Loves to listen to Her Music in the Shower ! She Loves it and is Very Happy ! Great Products And Awesome Pricing !

reviews.reviewTitle: The Loop Of Death, The Manual-Connect Dead End...
reviews.reviewText: Changing wi-fi source leads into a very perplexing dead end using my cell-based Alexa app. After successfully connecting 'manually' to the Amazon-xxxx wi-fi source, the process relentlessly looped back to the seemingly inactive 'Manually Connect' dead end page. In checking online chats this seems to be a common problem with no specific solution. An extremely frustrating experience.

I love my echo 3. First amazon product I have purchased. Love the music and all the help it gives me, with my measurements when I'm cooking. I bought another one for me and five more for gifts. Thought the prices were good. Got them on sale, two for fifty dollars.

I bought this under the idea I could sync it with my Sonos Beam (since it has Echo capabilities in it). When I tried to pair them they did not work. This was disappointing however, that is not why I'm leaving 2 stars. When my dot arrived I was so excited. I went through the set up process and decided to put it in the kitchen for music while I cook/bake. When I began playing it I did notice the quality was not nearly as nice as our Sonos Beam or Play 1 speakers but that was as expected (you get what you pay for). As they played though a static noise began simultaneously with the music. I've purchased other cheap portable speakers that do not pick up static like the Dot. I'm deciding whether or not I want to keep it now but I am not that impressed.

I wanted to see what it was all about, & asked my husband to get it for me for Xmas ... & of course, he did!! I'm actually listening to some "ROCK & ROLL", provided by Alexa, while I write this!! SHE IS AMAZING ... helpful, entertaining, etc., etc., We are still learning all the things Alexa can do!! I love getting the emails that tell us all the NEW things to ask Alexa!! I'd highly recommend owning one for yourself!!

Ordered 2 of these during prime days. Turned around and ordered 3 more 9-1-19 because we liked them. Received on 9-3 and spent couple hours on our own plus half hour or more with tech support trying 2 get these 3 set up. Finally managed without tech 2 get two of the 3 setup by just doing it over and over. Never could even with tech support get the third to work. So lady said she was sending replacement for one that would not connect. Received 2 days later and spent 3 hours and it would not connect either. Original 2 took about 2 minutes total. They have changed something recently that is making them not want to connect. I may or may not try again later or I might just send them back and be done with it. If you have something that works and people like it DONT CHANGE IT !!!!
9 TIMES OUT OF 10 ITS WORSE.

All I wanted this for was to play white noise all night and I can’t even get it to do that. The app is extrememly un-user friendly. I tried to hook it up to my Honeywell WiFi thermostat and it never worked properly. I feel like I ask very simple things and get “sorry, I don’t know that” as a response quite often. If you want this for anything beyond setting timers and playing amazon music I wouldn’t waste your money.

reviews.reviewTitle: How to make a product worse
reviews.reviewText:
I have 1st gen, 2nd gen, and now this 3rd gen dot.

Side-by-side with the 2nd gen, this 3rd Gen dot is noticeably slower to respond, and has trouble picking up commands.

It looks better and sounds fuller than the 2nd gen. But I just need my Echo to be able to hear me and give me weather, play me the news, set temperature, etc. Not to look young and hot.

Returned.

I wanted a system that would run independent of my phone, that I could take room to room with me. Since it has to be plugged in 24/7 to use, kind of defeats that purpose. Wish it could just be plugged in and charged like other systems, then can be moved about the house.
When playing songs with heavy bass (using pandora app) the sound quality becomes very scratchy and sounds like its being played underwater.

reviews.reviewTitle: YOU ARE PROMPT WITH YOUR ORDERS. I APPRECIATE IT.
reviews.reviewText: I am amazed at the technology embedded in this device. From the first time I activated it, I have been intrigued with all I can do with it. Even though I am in my late 80's, I think I surprised my son when I wanted Alexa to put a "treble" on the voice that was coming over the machine. She told me the range of treble possibilities, and I kept giving commands till it reached the right range for me. It is wonderful.. My son said he would have never thought of that.

reviews.reviewTitle: 3rd Generation Echo Dot is better looking and sounds better with more range.
reviews.reviewText:
WOW, how these little hockey pucks have stepped up their game. I have an early Echo Dot that really looks like a hockey puck, and it works great. This 3rd generation one not only looks nicer but it also has better sound and a wider range (volume) of sound.

Connects and works well, like the others in the line.

We love all our Alexa products. The 3rd gen speaker is noticibly better than the 2nd gen. As with all electronics, we sometimes need to “reboot” to maintain connection. The biggest downfall is that Alexa has a hard time understanding my 5 year old. 😉

We use our Echo Dots daily as an alarm, music player, joke teller, and to get the weather forecast. I love that we can listen to Pandora or other radio stations in multiple rooms at the same time and yet each playlist is different.

reviews.reviewTitle: Meh... it still can't fetch the newspaper
reviews.reviewText:
3rd gen blah blah blah. Not much new in terms of functionality, though I believe they did add bluetooth low energy capability to this version, maybe some improvements to the speaker also.

I suppose it's worth the price if you're new to the smartspeaker market, but as an upgrade from an older version I'd say wait until it comes with a transporter... Not much to write home about otherwise.

reviews.reviewTitle: 3rd Gen DOT is a huge improvement in sound
reviews.reviewText: I recently replaced my Gen 2 DOT with the new Gen 3 and was blown away with the improvement in sound. Gone is the tinie little speakers and in with the full base in a small package. The extra microphones mean I repeat my requests less often. Overall a big improvement.

It sometimes has a hard time understanding commands if you are a non-native speaker (In my case around 10% of the time). Also kind of impossible to search non-English song (I tried south-Asian music, could be better for other languages). Google does a fantastic job in this area. In my case, Google does the job 100% of the time (I'm referring to Google assistant, I assume google home would have similar performance).

Sound wise it does a fantastic job. No other issues. You would need either prime subscription or Spotify premium to listen to music though.

To sum up, if you would want it to search and play non-English music for you, this may not be a great option. Other than that, this a great device.

reviews.reviewTitle: Sound quality is a lot better than the 2nd gen.
reviews.reviewText:
I’ve got the exho dot 2nd gen & 3rd gen.
Definitely the sound quality of the 3rd gen is better.

Comparing the echo dot (3rd gen) to google google home. Perosnally I think echo dot has better sound quality.

I wish the echo dot(3rd hen) also has a micro usb like the echo dot (2nd gen).

Using the alexa app is a jiffy.

Bought it for $30.00. Very good deal.

I love this thing. We have 3 - one in each bedroom and one in the family room. Our house is large and spread out, so it helps to be able to find one another without having to scream! I also use it with smart switches and bulbs. It is very convenient, and makes my life easier. Plus, we play Jeopardy on it, and other games, and it comes in hand for a lot of things. I find new uses for it everyday!

We purchased this item while it was on sale for a grandmother. She absolutely loves this purchase, and I would recommend this item for purchase to anyone older. Although we do have to write down the things for her to say to Alexa, she hasn't had any problems yet! She uses this product for music mostly. The sound that comes out of this product is surprisingly clear and loud.

reviews.reviewTitle: Second Echo too difficult to hook-up in another room
reviews.reviewText: Tried to put an additional Echo in my garage and found that the online instructions didn't match the settings in the app. At one point both Echos got confused, I lost my play list, and had to start over. This was a very frustrating experience. If Amazon truly wants to make working with an Echo easy experience they should streamline the app and keep the online instructions up to date. One other issue is connecting the Echo to my Prime account. It keeps defaulting back to iheart radio.

One of the best purchases till date. Echo Dot never fails to disappoint.
The best part of this product is that it is portable, and very easy to use.
I never faced any problem with its synchronization/compatibility.
Product looks good, feels good, and has a superior of voice recognition which makes the product very handy.
Overall, it is an ideal product to use at home for all age groups.

Love it! Great sound quality. We mostly use it for music and sleep sounds right now but it's got a lot of potential!

We were initially going to get another sleep/sounds machine but thought this was more wort it and better quality as our last noise machine lasted less than a year and the speakers started rattling. I'd like to order another for the living room. It works great, no issues so far.

Alexa is saving my days . She reminds me of things I would have forgotten. She even shares my daily bible text . I love her drop in feature. There are just so many things she can do that I am still exploring . Just have to be specify when speaking to her, she does not need a long drawn out bunch of words, just ask her direct and its done. I love her already. We are building a relationship as I learn all the amazing things she knows .

I love all the features that come along with having an echo dot but the one I use the most is the Amazon Unlimited Music. Listen to anything you could conceive of at any time. Also the shuffle genre is neat. I listen to it mostly in my Kitchen/living space but also plug it in the bedroom. Sound quality is amazing for the size. No complaints.

reviews.reviewTitle: Small but useful and sounds pretty good!
reviews.reviewText: I received this Echo Dot as a free add-on with a recent Amazon order for a "Ring" video doorbell system. Already having an full sized 2nd generation Echo, which is fantastic for music, it was very simple (literally 2-3 minutes) to add to my existing Alexa account. Currently have the Dot in my home office adding some nice music when I want it. Sounds pretty good for a regularly sized room. Highly reccomend!

Love it and have 3 in my home and dozen smart plugs. I also use Apple Home Pod but Alexa makes it easy with the Echo Dot. Great quality for the value. Highly recommend the Echo fit for seasoned or first timers. Bought my mom one for Christmas ;).

Very easy to setup and get started right out of the box. Less than 5 min to setup! No brainer... I’m definitely investing in more of the Amazon tech items.

This is one of the most sophisticated and best items I've ever owned! Very responsible and pairs very easily with other smart devices (I have a geenie smart bulb and smart plug connected to it). I can control the lights, fans, and my firetv using this little device and the sound quality is very impressive! For better responsiveness, place it on lower surfaces.

I held off for a long time before buying into this technology, but after switching from overpriced satellite to a firestick with Alexia and fell in love with the system. I then ordered two echo dots and love the systems. One in the kitchen and one in the master bathroom for morning news and music. So glad I purchased these systems. Fantastic system and have now ordered the Blink camera system.

I am having so much fun with the Dot! It is controlling my lights, with the additional smart plug. When I ask Alexa to play music, she does and the speaker is amazing. She will also play sounds which I find relaxing. And of course, I get news headlines, jokes, informational tidbits in the morning. So happy I purchased this item. I was able to set it up myself, it was so easy.

i was a bit leery of having one of these in my home. as I think they are always listening. after ordering the dot and removing my tin foil hat, set up was a breeze.. I also purchased amazons monthly music subscription and viola!
its ok, I have had trouble with Alexa finding me a lasagna recipe... but, I just re worded it and bingo! its a nifty lil thing and I will be adding more "smart" items in our home

We use ours to play music and check the weather almost daily. My daughter likes to ask jokes or other questions.

It’s great to have! We liked the first so much we got a second. The announce feature is cool! I can tell t to announce something and it’ll play through both so I can call my kid for dinner without yelling!

Couple of small negatives though.... it doesn’t always understand what I say, but 95% of times it does. When playing pandora it cuts off before the song is over and goes to the next one. It was super annoying. Switched to amazon music and haven’t had an issue (imagine that.... killing off the competition maybe? lol)

reviews.reviewTitle: Very easy to set up sounds great works great price is good
reviews.reviewText: This Echo dot 3rd generation is really good that sound is beautiful you can hear it in every room good quality sound it also picks up your voice almost from any room this is a great upgrade I would have to give it 5 Stars Plus I bought one for myself and I bought one for a gift I will highly recommended this product I soon maybe buying another one for myself it works great sounds great you can't go wrong very happy customer

reviews.reviewTitle: Works good with the ring doorbell
reviews.reviewText: I have a google one but it doesn't stand up as good as the Alexa. After linking my Alexa to the ring it sounds off for what sound I chose and it works good to let me know it someone is at the front door. It also works with my prime music. I just have to tell it to play my music. It tells me when my package I order would arrive and when its here.

Love it! Great for music streaming on multiple services. User friendly. Getting the "skills" apps you want installed can be a challenge to figure out but highly recommend this. Great for any age. Probably best for the non-tech crowd to have someone else do initial setup but afterwards operation is a breeze. Alexa's settings suggestions via email and voice prompts are extremely helpful on learning new things to add.

For a cheap speaker I was surprised at the sound. Not as bright as I would like but nice and warm. Kind of a pain to get it set up to work with the Echo Spot. Mostly the fault of a really dumb phone app. One thing I hate is that when you group it so that it plays along with the Echo Spot, you have to control the volume separately. Amazon has worked hard on their product but it could be way better. Has a long way to go.

I bought the Echo Dot during Prime Deal and I couldn't be more happy especially with the price I paid. I used it in place of my clock radio in the bedroom which took up too much space. It's great to be able to ask for the time and weather and to make a call all hands free. I did play music and can't wait to tell Alexa to implement other functions. I love the color too because it fits in with everything.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love my Echo, but speech is muffled
reviews.reviewText: I really like the convenience and fun of having Echo Dot in the house. The problem I have with it is the Alexa voice is muffled and unclear. If I ask the weather, I can't tell if it's saying 57 or 67, so not very helpful. Also can't understand the time it announces because the voice is not clear. I do really enjoy having it but don't understand why they can't make the voice more clear.

I've always been a gadget guy, nerd etc. Why it took me so long to jump on the Alexa/automation bandwagon I'll never know. These dots are simply amazing. Alarms to wake up by my music, weather and traffic reports as I'm getting ready for work in the morning, reading my kindle books to me, listening to podcasts/music playlists and controlling my slowly evolving smart home. Just get one..heck get one for every room in your house! You won't regret it.

I love my Echo Dot! I ask Alexa things all the time, and it is so convenient! You can set up a morning routine, use ambient noise while you sleep, play games, and have it tell you jokes. It’s a lot of fun to use! I didn’t think I would use it as much as I do. The only thing I don’t like is how quiet the alarm is. I have tried changing it, but it won’t work. Other than that, I have no issues with it.

reviews.reviewTitle: I was unsure; extremely happy with ECHO DOT
reviews.reviewText:
We absolutely love our echo dot! I ordered it on Black Friday deals sale.. I was unsure if I’d like it. I love the intercom option!
