I ended up buying another one for my father in law that is in a nursing home(he’s not able to use his hands some days—to operate his phone) I use it as a way of communicating with him as he is 2+ hours away.

The setup was time consuming for me but after the initial setup it’s a breeze!

We use ours for music—the speaker sound is pretty great especially for the price! If you get the amazon music app—the commercial say 55 million songs available, I believe it because we have Alexa to play songs from 30+ years ago and Alexa always comes up with the song!

reviews.reviewTitle: A good product made even better
reviews.reviewText: I love the Amazon Echo dot so much that I bought one for every room. I can listen to music everywhere at the same time. Page all my family members no matter what room they are in o can announce dinner is ready. I can have a private conversation (drop in) with another household member. There are so many things I can do with the echo dot such as, Alexa guard and away mode. I absolutely LOVE IT!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Didn't think I needed a digital assistant but she's proven useful as well as entertaining...
reviews.reviewText: ...although she needs even more 'skills' to completely entrench herself into family life (and maybe arms and legs). She can turn my Vizio TV on/off, change the volume and channel, pause a stream but not start to play a specific app (Hulu, Netflix, Amazon Prime, etc.) I'd like the dot to pair video with my Vizio and make it into a super Echo Show!... but not yet. Maybe someday.

reviews.reviewTitle: Mic sensitivity is not what it could be.
reviews.reviewText: Super satisfied with the product and how fast it arrived. The packaging was a little questionable because the box that it came in was not fully insulated to prevent damage. The microphone is not as sensitive as other devices I've used. When my music is playing over volume 6, it is difficult for Alexa to hear my command. This is not usually the case with these devices. As a matter of fact, it is an advertised feature used to promote this device over the competing devices. If you are to buy this device, I would go ahead and buy one that is brand new. Doing this, you can avoid damage to the device and have all of the original, working parts.

reviews.reviewTitle: It's a Dot but not as good as previous version
reviews.reviewText: I've owned many Alexa-enabled devices and currently have two 2nd gen and this 3rd gen. This one was replaced by Amazon due to sound quality but the replacement is no better. I contacted Amazon just after receiving it because the high frequencies were greatly reduced, sounding very muffled. They told me that the 3rd generation was capable of twice the sound (?!?) of the older model so I accepted a replacement. It is just like the first one. So I will just use the 2nd gen in the primary location instead of the newer one.

My daughter gave me two Echo Dot (3rd Gen) devices for my recent birthday, and I am thoroughly enjoying the experience. There are so many skills that I had not yet tried, but the ones I have started to use have been a true game changer. I love the fact that I can quickly and hands-free add events to my Google calendar, and I can have Alexa tell me of upcoming calendar events.

I have had my dot for a week now and I really love using it. Its not too difficult to learn how to use and navigate the Alexa App that connects to it. Amazon will also send you an email after you purchase an Alexa device sometime during your first week of owning for a 80 percent discount on a smart plug that connect to the device. The smart plug is amazing for connecting to things like lamps and stuff very fun to play with. Love my purcahse.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very Cool, with lots of features
reviews.reviewText: I didn't realize all the benefits of having Alexa and Echo Dot. I can ask Alexa to play any type of music, a particular band or song and even my favorite radio station. I have it paired with my blue tooth speaker for better sound quality. I can now control my lights, music and TV with a simple voice command. Plus its like having a encyclopedia sitting next to you.

Build and sound quality has improved a lot compared to 2nd generation Echo. Mic is very sensitive and it can pick my voice anywhere from 1BHK apartment. Ability to connect with external speaker is added advantage which is not supported by other smart speaker.
Response for general question could be better instead of reading from website. Hope Alexa would be able to catch up with software updates.

I have found nothing to dislike. I'm nearly 80 years old, so technology like this comes through my daughter, who sets it up for me. But, the directions for setup were clear. So far, I have used the Echo Dot for playing music mostly, but also for news briefs and timers. I'm sure that the more I learn about it, the more I'll like it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Didn't work as stated for bundled smart plug. Instructions not right. Tech support inept
reviews.reviewText: I returned it and bought a smart plug from Wal-Mart that worked with my Android phone and PC right away. I wasted about 5 hours of my life trying to get it to work simply because it's a ~45 minute drive for me to return things. Maybe in the future we could just smash such crap with a hammer on camera instead of returning.

reviews.reviewTitle: Quality & Price of the Echo dot
reviews.reviewText: I was seriously going back & Firth between the echo dot and the echo. I purchased the echo dot because it’s size & price. This little echo dot has been an excellent addition to our home. Poor Alexa! My kids keep asking her to help them with their homework. You honestly can’t go wrong with the price point and it’s a wonderful product. I loved it so much that I bought the echo dot kids edition for my little ones room.

I bought this primarily to use as a speaker - and it works great for that purpose. The sound quality is really something, considering how small the device is. Hooking it up to Spotify, Amazon Music, etc. is also super easy through the Alexa phone app.
Very satisfied with my purchase and excited to take advantage of other features!

I love my echo dot, I do. It’s useful and I can do everything while I’m busy across the room. I also like the app convenient. However, I wish that the sound quality was better. It’s good, but not great. I can’t turn the volume up without it turning scratchy and staticky, which is frustrating. When it’s in lower volume, it’s amazing. I also wish that it didn’t need to be plugged in 24/7, it makes it hard to place around my room.

I have several Echoes and by far the 3rd generation is the absolute best. The sound quality is amazing for such a small device. It responds well, sounds amazing, and it's super easy to pair up. I use mine every single day. Super compatible with all my other devices as well like the philips hue lights and Govee lights. I highly recommend it!

reviews.reviewTitle: BEWARE: Amazon randomly selects devices and LISTENS to your conversations
reviews.reviewText: Beware Buyers: Amazon Randomly Selects Devices and LISTENS to Your Conversations in an effort to improve the technology. You sacrifice your privacy as they can listen to any conversation at any time and guess what- the Echo is on all the time. I should have returned my units but now I'm stuck with them. Hope they update their privacy policy and allow users to decide if they are okay with it or prefer to opt out. For now- mine remain in the box.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great product but Amazon does not honor its warranty
reviews.reviewText: I honestly love my echo dot and have purchased three of them for around my house. I am very displeased with Amazon over their warranty though. I had an issue with one of my Dots after 5 months of owning it. When contacting customer service they told me my one year warranty was expired. I asked how a year warranty expires in 5 months. The service rep was polite and said he could not do anything because the computers say I am out of warranty even though he could see when I purchased this from Amazon (5 months), and that he had to elevate this to his supervisor. I am waiting to be contacted back, tomorrow but am upset that it had to be elevated this way. Why they say the device is not under warranty after only 5 months is frustrating.

The echo dots work great but. Don’t have more then one per account. I ordered 3 one for each person in the household and now amazon wants 14.99 per month for us to run them. So I would like to shove 2 of these up there ass but since I didn’t read the fine print that says you can only run one per prime account I guess I will sell them to someone else. Works good but don’t get screwed like I did.

I have the Echo Show in my den , the full size original echo next to my bed and the dot in my kitchen dining area. My house is a small one and I use these different reasons. The show for recipes and spelling etc the Dot and the one next to my bed for music and games AND most of all for emergency - I am a senior citizen and if I should fall I can shout out to ALEXA anywhere in my house and she will call someone for me to get help. I love all three of these and the Echo especially because it is small and out of the way and yet as function as the other ones. Thank you Amazon!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great sound for such a small unit.
reviews.reviewText:
Great look and sound for such a small speaker. Easy wifi setup. Great bachground for patio.
Only 4 stars on SOUND because, to me, a little too much bass, (I know most want that), but I would have liked a bass/treble adjustment. Still recommend it highly! FYI; The plugin holders make it a lot neater and easier to remove for transport.

We have had a large echo for 2 years and love it. I bought 5 dots in December and placed them around our 3-story multi-generational home to use as an intercom. They have improved communication and I'm glad I bought them. The sound quality is a bit garbled and sometimes static-y so the person I'm calling often has to repeat so I can understand them. The sound quality is good for music at the dot location.

Alexa is the best thing ever created!! I have 7 fire sticks and over 10 Alexa’s at my house!! The best feature is multi room music because they all connect together and even work with Sonos!! Every light in the house they control as well, and we can use them for home security with Arlo As well!! I love amazon and Alexa and always will!! It’s the future!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great, but with one flaw in 2019
reviews.reviewText: I'm not sure what else I can say that the thousands of reviews haven't already. It's a great little smart speaker. I took away a star for 2 reasons. It's 2019, and Amazon decides to 1) use DC power instead of usbc or at least micro USB and 2) has a power plug brick the size of my foot. Blocks off other plugs on my power strip. C'mon Amazon...

reviews.reviewTitle: A great product but don’t expect much documentation
reviews.reviewText:
I got this for my elderly mother to listen to her audio books. I can’t praise this device enough for it’s ease of setup. I think it took all of 15 minutes to get it up and running.

I marked the rating down one star because of the lack of documentation. It comes with very good documentation for hooking in to your network but that is where it ends. I never did find a list of built in functionality and I had to dig pretty hard to find a list of extensions that can be added.

Purchased for my teenager under the assumption that it would be "theirs". I was WRONG! This thing sucks. It wont connect to the internet.
*finally talked to a CSR that actually explained everything. This this is so limited that my 16 year oold cant even access it themselves without it being on my account. But if I opt to pay for an additional Prine Membership they can have full benefits.Im going Apple Home Pod!!

got this for free when i re-upped AARP for 2 years. Surprisingly robust sound for such a small footprint. The Jimmy Fallon jokes are cringeworthy but you can stop them by telling Alexa you miss her jokes. haven't used it for smart home yet as i use  home for that. Alexa has had no problem understanding any command i have uttered. for free totally worth it!

I got two of these for our home for our family for Christmas. I’ve never used an echo before. It was super easy to put together and install. I literally took it out of the box and plug it in. As soon as you plug it in, she gives you instructions on how to activate it. Now we have one in all three rooms. It’s great that it connects to all smart devices. Really don’t have anything to complain. It’s a great product!

We've enjoyed Echo Dot and Alexa ever since they came into our house. We have a 1st generation Dot and didn't think we needed a 3rd generation, but it was a gift and we love it! The sound quality of the speaker is so much better than the first generation. Listening to music is especially delightful. We highly recommend the upgrade if you don't already have one.

reviews.reviewTitle: Seems like it should be better on 3rd gen
reviews.reviewText: I dislike how only one account on a family music plan can cast to this (not at a time, that is a no brainer) but that one account is connected to ever be able to cast to it. Maybe I am missing it but this seems to be lacking for a family environment where family members have their own devices and want to have some level of control on their own. I can see how this could work fine for a single person but a family just seems to not work well.

I purchased the product in January but about a month ago it slowly started sounding awful almost like a busted speaker but even when not listening to music it did this. It’s a cool idea but not worth the money in my opinion if it can’t even last a year. No one at amazon had been willing to help with my issue expect offer 15% off a new one. Why buy another product that’s just gonna tear up?

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa is my new best friend
reviews.reviewText: I love my echo dot. It creates my grocery list, is my alarm clock, allows me to listen to music and set a timer to turn it off. I can listen to audiobooks, my granddaughter listens to nursery rhymes ans lullabies every night before bed. I can call my daughter on her echo dot. Alexa will even play games! What's not to love?

reviews.reviewTitle: Does exactly what it says it will do.
reviews.reviewText: The Dot is small enough to go almost anywhere and be rather unobtrusive. Does it job well and is a pleasure to have around. I have it my office area and appreciate the ability to get music when I want it and turn off when I do not such as when on the phone. Can also get answers to questions without stopping what I am doing on computer. Sound quality is very good for such a small thing.

Product was back ordered but came faster then it had stated. I always prefer a sooner date than a later date from what has been told or promised to me. The product is what I expected and only had a problem when the power went out unexpected by a storm, but power resumed quickly but Alexa did not. Had to reset. However, did just have a power surge recently and there was no problem.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great addition to the Amazon Smart Home Ecosystem
reviews.reviewText:
We are using a Amazon Echo Plus together with this Echo Dot in a second room and it works perfectly. Our system includes Philips Hue bulbs and a few smart plugs and it makes our everyday easier.

As a speaker it works good enough for our bedroom as the room is not too big and we dont need high volumes.
Of course it has little base but handles high tone relatively well (especially at this price). The design is perfectly minimalistic and just fits to anything. It is a pity it doesnt come with a battery, but that might have made the design bulkier or bigger.

I would say it understands our requests 9 out of 10 times. Connecting was tough due to a two-factor authentication in our building, but somehow worked out.

All in all totally worth it for 30 Dollars.

Good product, but my children are arguing frequently because of the Echo. See they both want to tell Alexa what to do, so there is rarely a command that doesn't get interrupted. I can't remember the last time a full song has played in my house. But, it is still new and receiving much attention. Hopefully as the days wear on, it will lose its luster as the "shiny new toy" and simply become a useful tool.

Horrible customer service. I have other Alexa products connected to my home. This new dot would not connect. I was told that I had to pay to have my security for my home service checked. I called a second time and was hung up on. SERIOUSLY AMAMZON. TAKE YOUR PORDUCT BACK AND GIVE ME A REFUND!!!!! I was told managers fot he customer care division do not work on weekends and then they hung up on me. GTFOH. MANAGERS DO NOT WORK ON WEEKENDS!!!!! I am junking all Alexa products and my amazon account after this BS.

I like listening to music in the shower and the Dot is perfect for that. Before I had to set up all my devices, then turn off my devices when I exited the bathroom. I use some external speakers for Amazon and the sound is great. I was using an Eufy but it kept dropping my music. The Dot seems to be a stronger device. I'm very happy with my Dot!!!!

I like having something to manage my shopping and to-do lists, to give me news when I ask and play almost any song I can think of. Didn't change my life or make me any more efficient.

Wish it (or I) was a little smarter. As of right now I haven't been able to ask one in the Living room to do anything to one in another room. Asking Alexia to change volume is tedious. Be nice if she could recognize who is speaking.

Absolutely love the Echo Dot. Our daughter bought us the Echo for Christmas which we have in the living room. I wanted one for the den so I bought the Echo Dot. Since I already had downloaded the app for the first one, it took all of three seconds to link the new one. Sound, versatility, and comparability is phenomenal. Great device!.

Well, this is a bad review for an Echo Dot. Received a few days ago, and glad I tried it before giving it to someone for Christmas!!! Powered it up, and there is no power!! Dead as a door nail. Followed instructions to fix, an no go. Contacted Amazon, and they'll be shipping one out...albeit, no Prime shipping, more like 5 business days. Will write another review when it arrives, and hopefully works.

I like everything about the Echo Dot except east of set up. Directions say to just go to the Alexa app and follow the prompts. The problem is that all kinds of pop up pop up and I'm not sure if I'm supposed to do something on them or not. When I was finally able to follow the app prompts, nowhere did it tell me to go to settings - I'm just supposed to know that. Once I got to settings, set up was easy. I had to call Amazon and get someone to help me which is ridiculous for something as simple as the Dot. Now that it's set up, I really like it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love Alexa, She is so helpful.
reviews.reviewText: I keep this in my kitchen & use it quite frequently, especially when cooking. I just tell Alexa to set timers. I also sync her up to my Amazon Music & she plays. Still learning what she does, but Alexa is one smart cookie. The only thing is she's not fond of Siri. Although I can blue tooth my iPhone to Alexa, I wish Alexa would sync up with it. Haven't yet tried it for grocery lists, but still learning. The sound is actually pretty good when listening to music.

reviews.reviewTitle: Stops working after 4 months and Amazon won’t stand behind it
reviews.reviewText: I bought this device in January. It worked about 2 months and stopped. We thought it was our network so we spent $450 replacing the wireless network. Come to find out it was the Amazon Echo and they won’t stand behind it because it only has a 90 warranty! I guess they know it’s not going to last much past 90 days! They offered me a 15% discount if I buy a new one. What a joke! Usually a big fan of Amazon but this is a huge disappointment!!

We got Alexa as a Deal of the Day and have been very pleased with her. We are still learning about all of the different thing she can do, but so far are very pleased. She recognizes both of our voices well and responds when we ask her questions. He accuracy in listening and finding what we are asking is overall pretty dang good.

This product has not worked since I got it. I loaded everything at work where I had WiFi and was going to connect to my hot spot at home and just use it there. It would never connect so I gave up and took it back to work. It will not stay online there now and we have great internet. It will play for a maximum of 4 minutes then shut off. I have to unplug it and plug it back up and it will still only play for the 4 minutes then shut off again. I would not recommend this product at all.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great item for an Alexa beginner
reviews.reviewText: I am a huge Alexa fan. In our house we have 4 total. We have the light bulbs, electric outlets, and connect it to our televisions and lamps. Our landlord needs help with some items and loves amazon so we bought her the echo. It was a hit, we got her an electric outlet do now living alone she can turn on lights faster by asking Alexa. It was a success and we were happy to catch it on sale.

We have had a full size Alexa Echo for almost a year and have really enjoyed "her and have found it very useful. Our Grandson wanted one for his "man cave." Rather than moving the one every time he wanted to use it in the basement, we bought the Dot. It is fantastic. He mostly uses it to listen to his playlist. The sound quality is amazing. It is as good as the full size. It was very simple and easy to set up and works great. We highly recommend.

Much like the cellphone and later, the smartphone, I did not know what I was missing until I purchased the Echo Dot. The learning curve is windy, but enjoyable and I like the challenge of figuring out how to "talk" to my Dot. No need for radio or stereo now., since I can hear just about anything I want simply by asking.

This is one technological "toy" which has quickly earned its place in our household.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa is a family member now
reviews.reviewText:
Revision: 1/28/19 -
We wrote the original review below last week. The same day an amazon customer support person reached out to us. She quickly advised us on ways we could fix the issues. We were mailed a replacement power cord in case that was the issue. Now Alexa is working AMAZINGLY! This speaker/assistant is a part of the household. She reminds us to water the houseplants, take out the trash/recycle, she sets the mood everyday by playing our favorite (Nash FM 94.7), and she turns off our television every night when we fall asleep and forget.

Original review: "While the speakers are AMAZING, the 3rd generation Alexa in my living room isn't responsive to us. She's a bit slow. This is the 4th Echo dot in our home and it's only this one that has been giving us issues. So maybe I got a defective one."

reviews.reviewTitle: Not as good as Google Home mini
reviews.reviewText: We were previously a Google home but the concept of "Drop in" was the deciding factor to switch. After using the Echo for a few weeks we have discovered that the voice recognition is not quite as good, the returned answers are not quite as good and 1/2 the time when we use the drop in features we end up standing next to the Echo yelling at it so the person on the other end can hear us. Overall disappointed.

reviews.reviewTitle: Really G R E A T !!
reviews.reviewText: I have to say that I didn’t know what I was really buying I had looked online and little by little loved the echo dot (3). Ordered it and 2 days into having it. I have to order a second to have the dual speaker feeling in my room. Wish I would had known that getting them both it would had been $50. So I paid $60 but still not bad for what you’re getting. I now just set my alarm on it and it wakes me up to my favorite radia station. And now it can play your Apple Music. Don’t get me wrong I’m a prime member but having the dot playing my list of music is pretty nice. Yes I know that it’s better than the google one but I feel it’s more stylish than the google one. Also the sound is really great now I have my nieces coming into my room asking the dot questions and laughing because she answers back

pretty much 1 star as to there is no mac address anywhere on the box ,paper instruction and or on device itself i use secure network that uses mac filter so all my devices has to be set up on list before connecting the device to network.

We originally purchased Echo Dots 2 as a gift for a son. He promptly configured his lights, his furnace and other devices to his Dots. That prompted my wife to buy me two and then I bought her one for her bathroom. I now hear music every morning coming from her bathroom. We did adjust the sound features on her unit. We quickly discovered that as a Prime member much of the Amazon music library is available to us at no extra charge. Plus, there is the added feature I now have my garage and pool area lights on demand! We are hooked!

reviews.reviewTitle: Fun. Substantially louder than first generation
reviews.reviewText: Much louder and sound quality is better than first gen. We combined ours with Kasa brand outlets to have voice control in house of lighting and such. I suggest also increasing the fun with free amazon blueprint to have your own funny question and answers.

I always go for the most expensive audio because I want sound quality. I went with the Dot because I heard it was excellent sound. Figured at the amazing price ($30), I could always upgrade to the plus ($149) and use the Dot as a satellite speaker. I think this is all I’ll need. Really excellent quality. May still upgrade at some point but no rush.

reviews.reviewTitle: Enjoying the turn off the light feature and setting an alarm
reviews.reviewText: I have an Android phone so it took a little bit of time to connect to my Internet as far as recognizing the Alexa and where I connect to the the WIFI since it was different than my AT&T. I did have to re-enter my AT&T Wifi and password. On the Smart light bulb I set up it took me a little time to figure out to swipe on the app as far as the scrolling feature I found directions on downloading the app on my phone. It's neat how I can turn off and on the light by my bed by my command to Alexa. Also like how I can set up reminders to take out the trash or other things and set up an alarm to wake up.

Bought 2 as 2018 Christmas gifts for my adult kids. They were easy to hook up and get started. They are a fun gadget to have and they will enjoy. The only issue that I had was that when they were delivered the Amazon delivery guy threw the box over 12 feet. I was worried that they would be broken. Caught the guy on my ring door bell so that was the only disappointing portion of the purchase.

I’m loving my 3rd gen echo! I mostly use it with Amazon music and song quiz. I love being able to ask Alexa to play specific songs. I connected the echo to my stereo via Bluetooth to enjoy sound from larger speakers. I’ve even tried stumping her with obscure titles and have been pleasantly surprised! I connected a smart plug for fun and Alexa can control a lamp. I shut the microphone off when not playing music.

reviews.reviewTitle: Awesome Home Automation Tool with Better Audio
reviews.reviewText:
These are a great way to add automation to your home. There's a huge range of home automation products that integrate quickly and easily. We use these for Amazon Music, alarms, timers and more.

We used the previous generation with connected bluetooth speakers. The audio in this model is good enough that I don't feel the need to connect to a better speaker.

I am still trying to learn how to use my echo dot. I don’t find it very user friendly and I keep having to google every function I am trying to use. I was disappointed to learn that even though you can pair the dot to Bluetooth speakers, they don’t play at the same time, so the dot can’t partake in multi room speakers over Bluetooth. Alexa is not as helpful or useful as Siri and can’t even simply start a book over from the beginning if you are in the middle of listening to one in audible. I don’t know how to give “her” the correct commands and I am constantly getting “I don’t know that one”. The only function I find her useful for is setting timers and using voice commands while playing music. I don’t know that I would purchase again.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great sound in a small package.
reviews.reviewText:
I bought this on prime day. This dot is much better than the earlier version, which I still love, and use. The sound is much clearer and bolder. I’m assuming it is because the speaker is larger. I’m looking forward to using her to make hand free phone calls.
I only wish we had more name options. echo and amazon are just not enough.

I did not realize when I ordered that amazon workers were on strike. i hope the ceo Jeff Bezos had the human decency to give his workers the resources they deserved, and to share with his workforce the reward for the fruits of THEIR LABOR, WITHOUT WHICH he would not have the tax-free fortune he has. PAY YOUR WORKERS JEFF. GIVE THEM SECURITY AND BENEFITS. YOU WOULD BE NOTHING WITHOUT THEM.

I like product except for the fact that you must speaker to Alexa to turn off alarm. If someone else is in the room, it wakes them with the noise. When you try to turn the alarm off, touching the top turns on a snooze alarm before you find a button. The snooze will eventually wake anyone else in the bed.
You should have a back-lighted button that can be pushed to stop alarm. This would allow me to find the button without engaging the snooze alarm.

I only got this product because it was free with the ring doorbell I bought on prime day. I didn’t think I would really like it and wasn’t at all interested. Turned out that I am SO glad to have it! Alexa makes cleaning and cooking in my kitchen so much better. I use her to make my grocery list, to listen to music, to set timers, do conversions while baking, check the weather, etc. I just wish it had a touch screen for viewing recipes! I want to get an echo product for every room in the house now.

I like the fact that I can ask Alexa anything that interests me and she always has an answer from past to present. From news, weather, sports recaps, to setting an alarm, and adding notification reminders Alexa is right on it. I also like the fact her updates on packages that are in transit from Amazon. She also has you know when your package is at it's destination and ready for pickup. Another pro is the sound, you wouldn't think you would get such a good deep sound as you do from something that looks like a hockey puck. The 3rd gen dot has been very useful from the day it arrived. If you don't have one I highly recommend you get one. Goodbye Google .... hello Alexa!

reviews.reviewTitle: excellent integration, lousy equalization for voice.
reviews.reviewText:
Totally dislike the lack of ability to adjust bass, mid-range, and treble, especially for voice...way too much bass, and mids really lacking...causes most male voices to be muffled.
However, interestingly, music quality is quite good, considering the small speakers.
Overall, a good bet at under $30.00.
Note: Amazon third-party cancelled my order, but I found it at Target, on-line for same price, less my 5% Target charge and I picked up at my local Target store...but the Amazon price is what caused me to consider buying the Echo Dot in the first place.

I have 3 3rd gen & 2 2nd gen dots. The music quality is excellent and I have two set up for stereo play in our great room. We use the drop-in feature as an intercom and one dot to make cellular calls between my wife and myself. Handy way to get weather, local news and local radio stations. Easy way to request a TV channel on Verizon Fios.

My second dot, first one still works fine. This 3rd generation is better. One area that really requires improvement is smart home software. Connecting is easy, but setting up routines and scenes is a nightmare. This area requires restructuring so one can navigate without testing * failing and retesting etc. Adding new devices to a routine or scene requires patience as you have to tryout and retry.

reviews.reviewTitle: Has some advantages over the google mini
reviews.reviewText: Love the fact that I can check my gmail with the echo dot, but cannot with the google mini. When I say "play all sports radio 94 FM" Google mini is flawless but the echo dot connects me to a different station all the time. Accessing directions and radio stations is much better with the google mini. Music wise, the echo dot has it all over the google mini.

It's louder. But I'm not liking how it sounds. It's almost tube sounding.
Also, The reason I bought 2 extra gen3 was for being louder but also so I could drop in from room to room. However When using drop in feature, we have to yell so loud to hear through the devices that we can hear each other yelling in the house better than in the echo. they all do the same. For that I take 3 stars. Very disapointed.

I have both an Echo Show and this Dot. I love both and they provide different functions for me. The Dot has all my reminders which I have found invaluable. The Dot also wakes me up and has lots of knowledge on different topics. I use the Show mainly for music and love that i can sing along with the lyrics. I also love the Show for recipes and news and events in the world and sports.

Huge improvement over the Gen2, by that the speaker on the Gen3 is so much better, and now Alexa allows ITunes music. We use this in the kitchen, and it comes in handy for us while baking and cooking for measurements and timer. We’re not even using the device to it’s full potential, but for the price, you can’t beat it. Also it’s better than Google Home, we have both, and the Echo Dot out performes it.

Great new speaker. This is my first echo, and the sound quality is good from what I can tell. Slightly better than my google home minis in terms of clarity and richness, but you’d really be hard pressed to say. Using it as my garage speaker, since I don’t have any other Alexa products in my google home system.

reviews.reviewTitle: Much better then the previous generation but could still improve
reviews.reviewText: This is much better than 2nd gen in regards to the sound quality. However, it still has some ways to go. I understand this is not a big booming speaker - I get it - but the mids and highs are still not there to allow for clear music quality. I'm not talking about booming bass - I just want clear sounding music. The build quality I like - it's heavier and a little fatter (in a good way).

reviews.reviewTitle: Not as good as you would think,.
reviews.reviewText: I was a little disappointed in the frequency of the speaker low range is good high range not so good kind of flat sounding. I thought if I got a second one so I could pair them up and listen in stereo with sound better but now it doesn't not sure it's worth it and for some reason sometimes one of them will cut out and then come back in so I don't even get to stereo at times.. little frustrated and aggravating..

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo Dot (3rd Gen) - Smart speaker with Alexa - Charcoal
reviews.reviewText: I gave my daughter this as a gift Dec 2018. She loved it so much it was her most favorite gift. It is now 11/05/2019 almost a whole year later. She is still in love with her Echo Dot 3. She has had no problems with it. It has kept her entertained this whole year. She wants me to buy her another one so she can use in other parts of the house.

For such a low price, you can't expect much, but I was still expecting better sound quality and more functionality from the Echo Dot. Alexa (obviously) doesn't integrate with your phone itself, but with the Alexa app. Which means she doesn't play music off your phone, but rather from Amazon music or another music service you have to set up through the app. I've also found Alexa isn't as accurate with her responses as Siri is. The speaker also has very mediocre sound quality and almost no bass.

I cannot get this xenophobic lump to recognize Hindi or Korean artists. It’s a big problem for me as I prefer non-USA music . I own music in both these languages but this dumb thing can’t manage to access it because apparently it only understands American names. Seriously, you sell the stuff. This lump on wires should at least recognize the names of artists you sell. Every time I ask it for Rain, it plays rain. I tried to get Itif Aslam..nothing. If as advertised Unlimited even is, there’s a lot of really great stuff out there not in American and you can’t get it if the dumb bunch of chips cannot understand non-western names.

Why does this device have so many bugs and issues? It never does what I ask it to. I tell it to turn off the music whenever it’s playing and it will completely ignore me half the time. It always has a problem with playing what I want on Apple Music or Spotify. I just don’t understand why this device is so technologically primitive.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa needs to have a well-defined list of commands and easy access to these commands
reviews.reviewText:
- Alexa hardly recognizes the commands, is quite wrong and does the wrong thing. It does not control the TV even though the fire tv controls it well. That is, there is no such integration.
- Alexa does not learn, she makes the same mistake over and over again. He should learn from her mistakes.
-Frequently loses the connection to the internet and this means that it does not control any device. And I have to configure it once and again. The app is not friendly to use. It needs improve his qquality.

I received this product exactly 14 days ago and have been so pleased. It even came automatically linked to my account. I got this because it was on sale for $20 off (and I wanted it badly.) BUT today I was listening to music with my brother when it just started to sound like static and got a lot quieter. Just in case it was just the music I said “Alexa Stop” then I said “Alexa what time is it?” And not only did yet again Alexa sound like static but even the sound I have set when a command starts sounded like static. I unplugged it and plugged it back in and it is fine but I think it is quieter by a bit. I’m worried that it could happen again and permanently if it happens again I will certainly return it and get a new one (in my 30 days)

reviews.reviewTitle: Great gadget. Volume control by voice is wonky
reviews.reviewText: I enjoy using this, specifically for requesting music, seeing timers, reminders, and checking my Amazon notifications. But, I wish there was a better way to control volume. When asked to turn volume down, the change is minimal. Needs a command such as "quarter volume" to turn it down without giving several repeating commands. Otherwise, I love this gizmo. It works well.

I have two of these and they are crap. First gen works much better. These lose connectivity often and there is a 5-10 second delay in response after saying Alexa. We have 3 other older dots and they work much better.

reviews.reviewTitle: Would definitely recommend and would definitely buy again
reviews.reviewText: I’ve had this echo dot less than one hour and I am in love. Set up was so simple —almost Plug and Go! So easy to add items to my shopping list, play music from my prime music library, and get the weather when I needed. At 30 bucks——-everybody should have one of these!!!! Would definitely recommend and would definitely buy again

I own and have purchased for friends and family about 25 Alexa devices. The Echo Dot 3rd Gen is much improved with better sound quality, louder volume and faster response. The Echo Dots just keep getting better and the skills make the Alexa products a much better value than the other personal assistants. Long live Alexa!

I got one of these as a gift and my mom liked it so I got one for her birthday. I like playing almost every kind of music even if you have to pay a little more, creating shopping lists, checking weather, all while being hands free. I haven’t unlocked the potential the little thing has but I’m still learning about it and so far it’s awesome.

reviews.reviewTitle: I have concerns about security with Alexia.
reviews.reviewText: Given that you have to agree to share your contacts with Alexia in order for it to function properly leads me to concerns over security. I don't want my contacts shared or harangued with sales propaganda. Consequently I've unplugged it when I am on the phone because I don't want someone listening to my personal conversations and logging away what info they scrape off my conversations.

Just started automating my apartment and I've got alarms and reminders all over the place. Echo can now turn on and off any of my lights, my computer system, and my TV. I use it to meditate (Headspace) and to play music (nice sound - I have two Echo Dots, one in bedroom and one in living room and they play music together) all without having to do a thing except ask my Echo. Fantastic!!!

It doesn't have all the answers, it's not like asking a computer, it more like asking Amazon, Alexa can answer simple questions and follow simple commands but for example I was asking Alexa to find a show called "Channel Zero" on syfy , and she kept telling me there was nothing under the name zero, I had to look it manually . And it's not that I'm being lazy but isn't it her job to find things for me?

Never can go wrong with an echo Dot. This is my second dot (I also have an Echo). I connect any of my Amazon devices to my Bose SoundTouch 300 sound bar via Bluetooth to play music, or just play music on the "Everywhere" setting so I can walk around my house and stay in the Christmas spirit wherever I go! lol.. Alexa also helps me control my lights, my Christmas tree, my thermostat, gives me weather and traffic reports, sports updates, etc.. and this new version of the Dot is awesome. The speaker is greatly improved..even has a little bass to it!!

Sounds better than our 2nd gen ones...these are great for the kids rooms for them to stream music on and for us adults to use as intercoms as well. I'd get an echo or echo plus for anywhere that sound is important to you though. We now have 3 gen 2 and 2 gen 3 dots as well as a few other echos in the house....never thought I'd use them as much as we actually do.

reviews.reviewTitle: AWESOME UPGRADE. DO IT... YOU WILL NOT BE DISAPPOINTED.
reviews.reviewText:
The differences between the Echo Dot 2 to the Echo Dot 3 are enough to make the jump.
Just in the speaker alone will make it worth it. You're not going to open a dance studio with it, but the sound quality is more fuller and louder that it can now be used as a standalone speaker in my toddler's room.
Looks. It looks more like the Echo Dot 2 and the Google Home Mini had a big baby, and it works.

I had a few 2nd generation dots. They worked great. I upgraded to the 3rd gen dots and I have to say I am impressed. The sound quality is great and they work well. They sync great too, which lets you basically have a whole home music system that is not expensive. I also use them to control my hue hub, Honeywell thermostat, and a few other smart light switches On my house (TP-link). They can even reboot my netgear router. I have 4 echo dots (3rd gen) and one echo plus (2nd gen), and thy work great.

This speaker was a crazy surprise to me in the first place, the audio was punchy for the size it has. However, my main issue is when using Spotify, the music would randomly cut off or music wouldn't play at all. I would fix for these issues, but they only work temporarily before the issue persists again. This is one issue I can live with since the whole package is a great experience in my overall opinion.

reviews.reviewTitle: Some ways an improvement, others not.
reviews.reviewText:
Keeping it short and sweet for those who have Echo products already...

I like the enhanced speaker in the newer Dot; it provides much richer sound than its predecessors. However, I'm not a fan of the 15W AC power adapter and the circle-and-pin connector on the Dot. I much preferred the older USB-based power system.

Hoping the Gen4 Dot preserves the improved sound profile, while shifting to a USB-C power system.

reviews.reviewTitle: If buying with installment plan choose color wisely cannot exchange
reviews.reviewText: I like them not crazy about the color . Purchased with installment option I tried to return and exchange for grey and black ones but the customer service rep was rude he stated they can cancel my agreement at any time , that he was supervisor and would not exchange . If I did I would lose my installment plan which made if affordable for me . Mahkan Darham was very rude, not helpful so I’m stuck with colors I do NOT like at all the sandstone. According to rep they have the right to cancel offer at any time .

I love my Echo Dot! So much so, within days ordered one for my son.
It wakes me up in the am and give me a compliment and a positive affirmation.
As we learn more of what it can do, will start integrating into other home systems.

The reminders stay pleasant unlike me after telling my son to wake up for the 5th time...

Love.

Sound quality is mind blowing!!!! But you lose your USB power (it's now a coaxal plug)... And if wall power block fails, the cord is all one piece.

For those of us who has custom installs or simply wanted to reuse our current USB cable... Your out of luck.

Outside of power cable issues... The sound quality will blow u away!

The product works great once its connected to the WiFi which was a bit difficult at first. I am tech savvy and it was a hard to navigate app (which has 3 stars) once its up and running it listens (do voice recognition steps in app) this helps Alexa learn the way you talk better. My accent is confused by voice recognition sometimes.
Shes also really good with playing my Spotify playlists

The description says the dot3 will control smart LED lights which it can, but not without the addition of a smart hub which costs more than the Alexa its self. Overall I am happy with the dot3 but would have liked knowing ahead of time that an additional hub would be required. The only workaround for this I found is to purchase bulbs that don't need a hub (roughly $24 per bulb) or buy the $150 Alexa with zigbee built in.

I wouldn’t say it’s actually worth the real price, but we got the echo dot for only $0.99 with purchase of Music Unlimited. We love Iy. It even understands the kids when they talk to it. Once in awhile she will mis-hear my 7yo son but she usually hears quite accurately. Not only does the echo play music there’s a bunch of fun games to play like Song Quiz and Jeopardy and Alexa tells knock knock jokes

I have always been skeptical about these sorts of devices but when they were on sale for $22, I took the plunge. I cannot say that I use it a lot but it is fun to ask it questions and play around with. Nothing else in my house (yet) is compatible with the Echo but I am sure that will change now that I see how it can be used.

I bought one for my boys room. They like to listen to nursery rhymes or kids bop while playing and reading . At night, listening to bedtime music is absolutely soothing. I also love the “ announce “ function, no more yelling, just send a message to echo dot, and Alexa will do the job! Haha, such as “ come down, dinner is ready!” Or “ please clean the room after you are done playing ” ! It makes our home a better place.

reviews.reviewTitle: Sound quality of blown speaker after using for two weeks
reviews.reviewText: I recently bought two of these and sounds have started crackling on both and am being given a hard time about returning them. Saying they have not had any problems with them but proceeded to send a used reman one if they have no problems how did I get a reman product if they are so new and flawless don’t waste your time get the bigger or the smaller but stay clear of echo dot gen3

One of my favorite purchases I've ever made on Amazon. My entire family has enjoyed having this in our home. It was such an easy setup. Everyone from my four-year-old all the way up to my husband and I are able to use this. My kids love asking it to tell them jokes and asking it questions. They are always laughing in my dining room while they sit and play with this Alexa.

So far so good . Sound is great, my brother has a 2nd gen. Echo and it def is much much better. Setup was pretty easy. I feel like I have a surround system now. I got the Echo for two main reasons, music and to enjoy relaxing sounds while I study or take exams(I am nursing student but taking gen eds right now online) . I used to play the sounds on my fone but I would distract myself if it stopped and I would grab it and start checking social media or so. With my Echo I have no need to get distracted. It did arrive late but thats ok and It still cant understand me sometimes where I have to repeat myself a couple times . I will say vs. the 2nd gen. It has improved my mom has a strong accent and it undestands her much better in my 3rd gen. Overall its been a good buy!

I love the Echo Dot 3rd Gen! It's so much better than the previous two versions! I used to have the 1st generation and the sound quality was crap, when I was playing music (which was most of the time), even if the music wasn't playing very loud I still had to yell at it in order for it to hear me. The 3rd generation is so much better. I can play music at a louder volume and Alexa can hear me just fine. And the sound quality is SUPREME!! Don't even get me started with the base! If you like AI and are looking for a small and very good smart speaker, I would 100% recommend the Echo Dot 3rd Generation!

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo Dot is so much fun; I don't know how I got along without it!
reviews.reviewText: I received Alexa for Christmas. It isn't anything that I would have thought I would ever want but I LOVE it! I ask her the weather, the correct time, she will play music, and I can ask her where my Amazon orders are. I'm hoping she can give me MLB scores once baseball season starts. She has a great sense of humor also, and it's so much easier to get information from her quickly than to use Google.

We are enjoying Alexa - music when we want to hear a specific song, temperatures outside, weather forecast, silly jokes, a timer for the kids - we even bought smart lightbulbs with a hub and smart plugs to sync with our Echo; I have the Echo app on my phone and tablet so we could turn on or off lights from anywhere (once we get everything synced.) Echo is more than just entertainment.

reviews.reviewTitle: DO NOT BUY INTELL THEY FIX APP
reviews.reviewText: If you buy the echo dots 3rd gen they will be somewhat useless when it comes to controlling the speakers volume, music app stability, and much more. I ordered a few because of other people’s reviews on the dots( looking back no reviewer showed the app needed to play speakers) that should have made me look into the google speakers smh.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works perfectly, and sound quality is AMAZING!
reviews.reviewText: I already had a first-generation Echo Dot in my living room, but I wanted to get another one for my bedroom. Since it was Prime Day and it was on sale, I decided to get a third-generation Dot, and I am SO happy I did. The sound quality is 1000x better than the one I already had; you can FEEL the bass, and it goes much louder than the first-gen. Additionally, I feel like the mike is much more receptive, so it always hears me the first time I say "Alexa." My biggest complaint was the CONSTANT ads for Amazon Music whenever I played a music station, but, once I linked my Pandora account to it, I didn't have to worry about that. All the skills work great, and I couldn't give a better review of a product. (Plus, the white color option is VERY nice-looking!)

Wow i cannot believe i have waited this long to get one. This product is awesome. It’s literally a helping hand at everything. I love the way i get the day started she will tell me the weather, transit to work and start some morning music while i drink my coffee. The timers and reminders help alot. Looking to get more in the future.

reviews.reviewTitle: Looks great in any environment, integrations to Phillips Hue is not working
reviews.reviewText: I love how the speaker looks, and the setup for it. Unfortunately, what I originally got my Echo Dot for isn't something that is currently working. I use my Phillips Hue lights daily and got the Echo Dot as a replacement to the Google Home. The Phillips Hue integration is not working on the Echo Dot, and it is pretty useless at this point in time. I will give it some more time to see if these issues get fixed, but currently I have not had a good experience with this device so far.

reviews.reviewTitle: So Happy i got the DOT!
reviews.reviewText: I live in a small town and getting reception here is not an option, so I decided to try the DOT out, the features I liked was it had a speaker and it can be turned off, if there was a chance someone maybe listening on the other side. Well it was my best purchase this year, I use it all the time mainly for music! I highly recommend it!

It was amusing for about half an hour and then turned into pretty much an endless string of "Hmm, I don't know that one" or telling me to subscribe to yet another service because having Prime isn't enough for it. Not customizable, can only choose between 3 names to address it and has no male voices. Used it for a day, just wasn't interesting enough to keep turned on. If they add some ways to customize it and make it less spammy in the ad department I might try it again.

I don't need to know the price of eggs in China or the latest knock-knock jokes. It came with another order and it works as described. I've had occasional problems with the thing beeping indiscriminately and on one occasion was beeping on my Windows 10 desktop w/ Chrome but no Alexa attachment that I've ever downloaded.

reviews.reviewTitle: Fun and somewhat useful. Needs some improvement though.
reviews.reviewText: Alexa is good at pulling up music, radio stations, recipes, keeping grocery lists, errands, reminders, and reading my kindle books. So, what is she not good at?... Basic web searches. For example... 'Alexa, how fast does an NFL linebacker run?" She'll respond..."I don't know the answer to that one." But if you just go to the web and search, the answer will pop up in either Yahoo or Google at the top.

We have now ordered five of these Alexis they are all great quality. This product is both great for adults and children we have one in almost every room in the house I would say the only downside to this Alexa is that if you are talking to one sometimes the other ones pick up on your voice but other than that great product we love it.

Own all three generations of the Echo Dot and this is by far the best one yet. Sound quality is quite a lot better than the last generation and what surprised be even more as just how simple set-up was! I didn't do anything! I plugged it in and it basicly set itself up found my wifi without me doing a thing and just worked! Best part I got it at black Friday pricing, a great deal for a great product

reviews.reviewTitle: A M A Z I N G !!!
reviews.reviewText: Definitely exceeded my expectations!! I can't believe how many fun apps and games there are available! Not to mention, all the skills and features like schedules, reminders, and routines! Sound quality is really really amazing considering the size, it sounds almost/is as loud my Bose mini color sound-link. You can make calls and send texts through Alexa and it's so awesome they've integrated apple music and other 3rd party music developers. My only complaint is that it does not have enough knowledge on AppleMusic,and often plays an incorrect song, or nothing at all.. BUT overall amazing amazing product and I will definitely be buying another one!

I'm retired and I wake up in the middle of the night or early morning all the time and it's so convenient to ask Alexa what time it is and then set a timer to wake me up when it's actually time to get up. I love the timer function for cooking, too. My most favorite thing is the music! I have Apple music on Alexa and she will play my playlists, Apple's playlist, pick an artist or album and it's played. Will even play entire albums. I have both Echos set up to pay music together (one upstairs and one downstairs) so it's great. I also have the Sengled light bulbs in my bedside lamps which can be controlled by Alexa. So when I turn off the lights downstairs, I'm not stumbling around trying to get to the upstairs bedroom. I just say "Alexa bedroom lights on" and she lights my way. Always finding new ways to use the Echo.

One MAJOR flaw that has still not been addressed since the release of any echo device. The volume only is adjustable in 10 increments which causes either too loud or too soft. I hate this. There is so much potential with this device and I have read so many complaints on this issue, but the issue is being ignored.

Not my favorite Echo device. The voice on this 3rd generation is either an old lady or a drugged up, overly calm woman. Either way, I prefer the peppy voice of the 2nd generation Echo. That's my only issue, other than that, it works great and is as receptive as any dot can be. The speaker is supposed to be improved, but I don't listen to music via it, so I can't comment on its quality for that.

reviews.reviewTitle: The sound is very good on this version.
reviews.reviewText: This is my second Echo Dot. Like the first, it was very affordable but now the sound is much improved for playing music. I used to connect my first one to my Bluetooth speaker when playing music because the sound wasn’t too impressive but I don’t bother with this new one as the sound is so much better. I bought it during Amazon Prime Days so it was a steal. I highly recommend this version of the Echo Dot.

I love it. I have created routines. I like the sound for such a small device. Things that I would change: I wish we could use another word other than the 3 provided to take Alexa. Next, I wish the voice could be different. I wish the Amazon smart plus were cheaper. I love it so that I've purchased the Echo speaker. Before it's over I will have these devices throughout.

Well, I never thought I would get this. Now I want another one. How many times a day to I ask a question? around 5 to 8 times a day. I like to learn as much as I can in life, this makes it so easy to ask what a word may mean that you just heard, it lets me ask the time of day, I don't use a watch, I can get a specific recipe for what ever I want to make in a second. My life just became easier.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not Able To Answer Basic Questions 😔
reviews.reviewText: I like The Design & Look of The Echo Dot 3rd Gen, It's Great For Playing Music From Spotify, etc. However.. For Everything Else... Not So Much 😔! It Couldn't Hear Me While Playing Music over Level 4. It Couldn't Answer Basic Questions (which is what I brought it for, it's assistant abilities.) It Makes You Download All These Skills in Order To Answer Your Questions, Verse Google Home, Just Answers Them with Ease. I Give It 2 Star, Only Because of The Bass Music Factor. It sounds way better Then Google Home. But The Google Home is The Better Device for Everyday Searches or Personal requests. I end up buying Two Google Home Mini's to Replace The Dot. I Then Just Moved The Echo Dot to The Kitchen To Use Just For Music, Nothing Else. I Tried To Ask It Other Simple Questions, She Continues To Fail. Google Home, Not Only Hears You Over Loud Music, But is Much More Functional.

reviews.reviewTitle: My fifth purchase of the Echo Dot 3rd Gen AAA+
reviews.reviewText: I love the Echo Dot 3rd Gen. Alexa is so smart. I'm trying to figure how to get her out of her box. Alexa plays my music playlists, spells words for me, will set alarms and reminders as well. Gets pretty lonely here late at night, Alexa even tells me bedtime stories. So many different uses/aspects of Alexa I haven't explored yet and she is always learning more new skills. Good deal for what can be done with an Echo Dot 3rd Gen. Intend to order more as well as more devices for the Echo Dot.

We have Echo 2nd gen in our kitchen, and just added dot in our living room. Works as well as the first one. On either echo, we sometimes need to repeat ourselves, word for word, even though we speak loudly. It seems to not recognize our command the first time. I'm used to repeating myself to my husband, so it's not a big problem,lol. All in all, we are loving our echos.

reviews.reviewTitle: Don't try to make this work with a ring doorbell
reviews.reviewText: I followed the steps to connect the echo dot to my ring doorbell, and it failed time after time. The dot's sound isn't good enough to bother playing music on it. If it hadn't come free with the doorbell, I would return it. Useless.

I purchased this Echo with the Amazon Music deal for .99 cents + the $8-10 for the monthly subscription. Definitely worth the purchase! I use my Echo at work-- it is able to hear my commands no matter how loud I am playing music-- and the music stays centralized to the room I am in so that I can hear it clearly but it is not disturbing those around me. The quality is far better than the original generation! (Would still prefer if it could be mobile and not have to be plugged in).

I don't like the "added bass" component to the audio sound. I listen to a lot of talk radio stations on my dot (radio reception is not good where I am) and the audio sounds muffled on the new dot. I have to shout in order for Alexa to respond when the dot is playing at a higher volume.
The 2nd generation dots playing the content that I listen to sound "cleaner" and "crisper" with more treble than the 3rd generation dots which sound muffled.

Also, the power cable on the new dot has been changed. It was convenient to use any micro-USB cable to power the dot. Now you must use the proprietary charging cable.

Huge upgrade of the hardware from Generation 1.

Amazon devices overall aren't worth the price (although this was free with my Echo Show) as a standalone. You need to have other smart home stuff to go with it or else it's a novelty where the fin wears off in 10 minutes.

Looks a ton better than the original too.

I didn't think I would use this as much as I do. I am extremely happy with my purchase, and just bought another one! I use it primarily for streaming Sirius XM radio, and the sound fills the kitchen. Speakers are a lot louder than I thought they would be. I can also hook it up to my JBL Flip 4 and use it that way too, but the sound from the dot itself is lough enough for my purposes. I would recommend it for everyone.

It was a difficult to get started but WOW! I love it! Due to Myasthenia Gravis my voice doesn't sound the same everyday. My voice weakens as the day goes on. Alexa still recognizes my voice! So cool! My vision is often blurry or doubled so my questions can be answered without having to wait until my vision improves to search. Game changer for me!

I bought 3 when they were on sale. I placed one in each bedroom and one in the kitchen. I love them. I found that Alexa will read my kindle books to me, not as good as audible, but still nice if my eyes are tired. One thing I do not like is Alexa recognizes my nephew's voice and I can not figure out how to get her to stop calling me Alex. Lol

I originally thought that it would be much more a novelty at this point. My insurance company actually paid for it, as they encourage the home automation integration aspects. I'm working on that for the future, but MAN, how did I do without Alexa before! Just really still playing with her skills, but I see a promising future. I had actually downloaded the Alexa app onto my Raspberry PI and when I finish some home improvements, I will automatically have my second Alexa interface already. The Echo, however, is far more convenient and when I can get a 2nd or 3rd gen again I probably will. I started with the 3rd and I understand the speaker is much better, and I certainly am satisfied at this point with that quality.

I have the Gen 2 Dot, which I really like but had to buy an external speaker because of the less than stellar sound quality. I bought this Gen 3 Dot for my boyfriend and he was thrilled! We tested it out and the sound is greatly improved. Easily paired with his phone at my apartment and then at his house. He plans on getting the thermostat option for it. We are BOTH satisfied with the new Dot.

reviews.reviewTitle: Doesn't have a battery, why make it look portable if it has to be glued to an outlet?
reviews.reviewText: Bought this because Amazon discontinued the Tap. Disappointing in every way. I don't need an "always listening" device, if rather have something that works everywhere and can just be put where I'm sitting without having to find an outlet for their social charger because for some insane reason they didn't just use a mini-usb charger like everyone else. Ridiculous.

I picked this up on sale and glad I did. It's got a new improved speaker and sound since the last generation of dots. I really love the look of it and the ability of having more then one dot in the house you can use as an intercom system from room to room. I am super glad I got another dot. Great product. I also ordered this at 7pm and got it next day by 11am. Doesn't get much faster then that.

bought one to try it out. the day it arrived i bought 6 more just like it. you can call out on alexa anywhere on my home and shes there for you.
sound quality is superb for a 30is speaker. and its always plugged in. no dead battery isues.

only con is there is no way for a kid to use alexa unless its with an adult account. cmon! all they want to do is listen to their music!

reviews.reviewTitle: maybe next gen has the capabilities to pause and play
reviews.reviewText: I was pretty excited about the echo dot and heard a lot of good things, however I found that it did not meet my needs. It wouldn't connect to my fire tv, remote or vizo bluetooth enabled soundbar. When playing podcasts if I paused and tried to resume playing again it wouldn't couldn't on two different podcasts. It doesn't know how to speed up the podcast and it seemed every other answer was, "hmm, I don't know that one." Not impressed with the capabilities. Maybe I'll try again on the next gen. It did tell the weather and sometimes found the correct the station I wanted it to play. I'd rather just google the answers I need. less frustrating and I don't have to repeat myself multiple times. It could set alarms and reminders which was a cool feature, but overall not what I was anticipating. For what it is, it almost got a 3star, but for what it couldn't do dropped it back down to a 2

Alexa in my opinion isn’t that great. I like Siri on my phone much better. She isn’t quick to respond and slow getting answers. She isn’t sassy as Siri with answers. I feel like I have to yell for her to hear me. Volume seems low after turning her up. I thought it would be great too have but in reality I don’t use it that much

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice device, but lacks AI training.
reviews.reviewText:
The new design and speaker option is nice. I found that "Alexa" can be very frustrating while using apps. For example: To listen to Slacker Radio you have to say... Alexa listen to Slacker Radio. She then proceeds with a maturity disclaimer, which you have to say Yes to. Then she asks what artist. You say.... play music from the artist... name of band. Alexa then attempts to play the artist on Amazon music or Spotify. So, you repeat yourself....over and over until the correct music type is played on Slacker Radio.
Overall the device is nice, but the service needs a lot of work.

reviews.reviewTitle: Horrible experience. Did not expect this
reviews.reviewText: Wow. No idea why but this worked a week then quit. Called echo service. They sent me a replacement after saying it was a technical issue. The second one they sent did not come in an echo box. No plug etc. And never worked. Returned them both today better get my refund. Very sad. Was very excited to have one in my room.

I got the echo dot 3rd gen for myself primarily to play my Amazon music. I have to say I have a lot of fun doing that, and asking Alexa random questions. Being able to get a news briefing, listen to white noise, or setting random alarms has been really helpful. I also like that I can now turn on my heater from work, and just tell Alexa to turn it off when I leave. There's a lot of skills I want to try, but I'm a still getting used to the Echo.

I have just about all the echo devices that have been made and I am blown away by the new dot! The sound quality is amazing. The first gen dots I have are all plugged into speakers because the sound was so small and tiny. This new one is great in a small room. Echos just keep getting better and better. In fact, all Amazon devices keep getting better. For the price these are miralcuous. Thanks Amazon!

We like the dots, but it is difficult at times to figure out how to do what you want with them. We are still trying to connect them to each other. It would be great if we could have more control of Freetime on the ones for the kids to be able to control them from the others without the kids being able to control back.

reviews.reviewTitle: Must have now to prep for the future of AI
reviews.reviewText: It started with this Dot. A single dot in the house. Wow what a great tool, and you can just imagine what the future of AI will bring to your home. It took us no time at all to decide we needed another. Then we got a couple Echo Show 5s. My wife is getting an Echo Auto for her birthday. She will be elated.

Dear Amazon Management,
1. I bought the Echo Plus and Echo Dot which was delivered to the USA Address at Portland, Oregon.
2. I brought back these two sets to Singapore for my family to use but when I registered for the Amazon Music using the Singapore Credit Card, it was rejected reasoning being that the Amazon Music only accept the USA Credit Card.
3. Being the owner of the Amazon Echo Plus and Echo Dot, I hope that I would not be deprived from using the privilege offered by Amazon.
4. One of the reasons that I purchased the two sets of Amazon Echos was the access to millions of music offered by Amazon.
5. Therefore, I look forward to favorable reply from the Amazon Management.
Thank you Sir,
G3orgeT
Singapore

reviews.reviewTitle: Little speaker with a big punch
reviews.reviewText: This little speaker is extremely entertaining. It will keep you and friends occupied for hours. The set up is easy and alexa is fairly smart in her responses. The speaker is clear and playing music is a positive experience. There are so many things alexa can do including games, telling joke, keeping you up to date on sports news, controlling smart devices, playing music, and keeping up with your to do list/shopping list, and even calling family. Great product for personal use or as a gift.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is our third echo dot.
reviews.reviewText: Now that we have three Echo Dots, I'm having fun finding out what new things I can do, such as making "announcements" that can be heard on all units - "Alexa - Announce 'It's dinner time!". Can also play the same music on all three units. Was a breeze to initialize - just plugged it in and waited a couple of minutes and Alexa was ready to go.

Alexa is a great source for information and entertainment. By entertainment I mean that I can listen to my favorite radio station without being in the car or using a process on my computer. The sound is clear and loud. Unfortunately, after having Alexa for about a week the device seem to stop recognizing that I am speaking. My words are slow, clear, and enunciation is distinct. Thus, Alexa has/is becoming unresponsive to my queries …. bummer …. the out-of-box functionality was perfect.

I've given Alexa the silent treatment until she can repair herself.

I got this as a promotion from Sirius XM radio, and that's what I mainly use it for - to listen to music in my apartment. But I also love that you can play white noise on a loop all night (it's been helping me sleep!), and it gives you a very accurate weather forecast when you ask. I know I haven't even touched the tip of the iceberg for what it can do, but I love what I've seen so far!

Ended up with the Dot as part of a Blink camera purchase. Probably would not have otherwise purchased independently, but we have been surprised at how much we have enjoyed having it! Alexa is great for playing different music sets while we cook, checking on the weather, freaking the cats out by meowing .... really is amazing the array of skills this little Dot possesses!

Well, setup has improved a lot. It's now pretty easy - but one can not get it to work with a Non-Broadcast SSID router. But the 3rd Gen unit, itself was a little disappointing vs. an older model I have. The sound quality is muffled - like the Alexa speaker is in a closed box. It's sometimes hard to understand, as such.

reviews.reviewTitle: Integration with other systems in the house lacks advice
reviews.reviewText:
It is great that it can be connected to other Echo devices but there are problems that you do not expalin:
1. You have to name it Echo or Amazon not to have it also respond if in hearing range- also the list of these only other two names is crazy stupid- what if you haver four in the house? What about Sam, Judy, Linda, Alex?
2. You cannot share a Pandora account unless you tie one unit to another phone but then you cannot use an "everywhere" command!
3. Where is the device that can hook up to old fashion speakers with the dual cord? I have two Bose outdoor speakers.
4. Units should be able to connect via bluetooth to another wireless speaker and continue playing- not just one or the other!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great sound in a small package!
reviews.reviewText: I have an Echo Plus (2nd Gen) in my bedroom, but I wanted something for my office. This is perfect! It takes up very little space and it sounds really great! True you don't get all the bass like you would from a Plus, but it has a really well-balanced sound that is perfect for something I don't need to blow-out the windows. The price is right and it does all things Alexa!

My daughter gave me Alexia for Mother’s Day. It was super easy to set up using the Amazon Alexia app. I’m still learning all that it can do. Right now I’m using Alexia more like a personal assistant, checking weather, reading email to me and placing calls. She and I are getting along great and she seems to like helping me with all of that stuff and more.

I won this item at a conference I was at. I really had no intention of purchasing a smart speaker. I just didn't see the point. I was so wrong. I LOVE having this to listen to music while in the kitchen. I've already thought of buying more throughout the house and buying some accessories. So far I've only utilized music and playing games (which is super fun while cooking). I can't wait to use it more!

I loved these little echos so much that I bought a few of them after I bought one during Prime Day and I have to say they are very neat and work alot better than I expected as far as understanding what your saying. If I have to say as far as what I did not like much well Im going to have to wait on that so far I like everything about it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love it, better than my Google assistant
reviews.reviewText:
Absolutely amazing unit of a smart assistant. I was lucky enough to buy this during Amazon prime day and I wish I had bought one for every room in my house!! It does so many things, waayyy to many to list on here so I'll just list my top 3.
1. Can control my smart TV with my fire stick.
2. Drop in feature for communication instantly with family and friends is amazing.
3. Makes list and transports them to my phone via the Alexa app.

reviews.reviewTitle: Had a small issue, but got resolved and works great now!
reviews.reviewText: This dot worked and sound great for some time. Then while playing some music via online services, I started to hear a scratching or hissing sounds during songs, mostly at mid to high ranges of sound. I was thinking I would have to initiate an exchange, but the helpful agent informed me of the reset-equalizer function on Alexa, and this fixed the problem! I would hope that these would go out with a good default equalization setting, but nonetheless it's now a great device

reviews.reviewTitle: It may be small but it's "big" in so many ways!
reviews.reviewText: This is a pretty amazing tool and it is a pleasant addition to the home and asking questions or searching for information is the fun part. I enjoy listening to music and getting the weather and just about anything that interests me. The sound is very good for something so small and very clear. Very happy with this purchase.

So we just moved into a new home, I bought this speaker as a present for the family. I honestly purchased it for music to play around the house. For music it’s a good speaker, the sound quality is good and Alexa hasn’t been too far off when I ask her to play certain things. The only issue really is that the calling function is not very consistent. It won’t call from the speaker and when I make a call it doesn’t want to connect that way either. I have been playing around with it for a few weeks and there is still a problem, it will call the person I asked but the person can’t hear me and I can’t hear them. It’s kind of annoying but since I didn’t buy the speaker for that purpose is why I gave it a 4. It works for what I needed it for. I guess that’s all that matters.

This little Echo Dot was a fantastic addition to my office. Any music I want is available at a quick request. News updates and weather are just a request away. I find I am now using it to intercom with my other Dots and Echo in different locations. I get the feeling I am just scratching the surface of what it can do. Obvious concerns about privacy and it listening. I don't know if I should believe the rumors that its listening all the time and using my conversations in some way. at least I hope not!

Purchased one of these for my grandson and my daughter was able to connect to our wi-fi in minutes. We were impressed and decided to get one for ourselves. Totally frustrating and customer support was very condescending and bored to the point of being rude. Wish I hadn't thrown out the box to return. As of now it is trash.
I wanted a bluetooth speaker that did not need recharging and would stay connected all the time. Echo Dot was my answer. Surprisingly great sound from a little speaker..

reviews.reviewTitle: WOW. How did I live without this?
reviews.reviewText: It was fairly easy to set up. The only thing I found slightly confusing were the many apps. I bought several smart plugs from different manufacturers and after trying a couple of app, some better than others, everything linked up. The Smart life app couldn't discern individual plugs on a dual and multi plug device on the first try, but got it on the second try. I don't know how I ever lived without this.

reviews.reviewTitle: Worth the price just for the entertainment of it!
