reviews.reviewText: I’ve been having fun with this. I’m pretty sure (okay okay I can promise) I have not utilised nearly all of the features. The sound quality is pretty amazing. I’ve had several similar sized speakers and this one is at the top as far as sound quality. The voice to text recognition interface is the best I’ve played with yet. I haven’t used it for many practical assistance things yet!

I am sorry but Alexa must be thinking, when I grow up, I will like to be like the assistant of a major online browser company. Alexa keep forgetting names of devices!! So, more than often I have to adjust connected devices myself manually. For example when I call to set heat to a certain temperature, all it says at time is "which device?" Alexa still needs to learn a lot!!

reviews.reviewTitle: A great way to start your morning!
reviews.reviewText: The Echo Dot is amazing. I use it as an alarm clock and so much more. I have routines set up with it in conjunction with my smart plugs. When I am getting out of bed I say “Good morning”. When I do this certain lights come on in my house and my coffee maker starts brewing. Just a little something that makes my day a little easier and gets me out the door quicker for work. Did I mention my other routine saying “Goodbye” all my lights and coffee maker shuts off.

Ok so this is the first Alexa I have purchased and not sure what I'm doing wrong as when I have her play music sometimes I tell her to turn it off and it keeps playing. That I don't like and sometimes I have to repeat myself several times. I read all the directions and still not sure what I'm doing wrong.

This was one of our prime day purchases and I’m proud to say it was a good one! I ended up buying two echo dots, and two fire sticks on prime day! My husband and I really like the dot and ended go giving the second one to our oldest daughter for her bday! I love that you can ask any question and get a response even if it’s silly!

I've only had her for a couple of weeks but the capabilities are going to be endless. No more going to my phone to type in my question to google. I've found that re-wording questions can make a difference in the answer which is helpful if the first answer is not an answer (doesn't know). I can see making my routine "smart" and it will be amazing.

The way the third generation sets up and stays connected is better and more streamlined than the 2nd generation. I have one of each and my 2nd generation gives me some flack about the issue. I have had to set up the 2nd generation over an over again multiple times and it is a lot more cumbersome than the 3rd generation. Once they are set up and connected, I don't notice a difference.

I needed an economic music source in our basement gym for working out. Even with antennas, regular radio/stereo systems wouldn't pull in stations. Now I can listen to music on call. It serves its purpose. Sound is surprising for such a small device, but there are other more expensive devices with better sound.

Awesome. Got it for under $10 with the amazon music deal and pretty impressed. It can even do calculus problems which no other smart AI can do which is great! I do find it occasionally will not know the answer to simple definitions of words or terms which is strange but overall very satisfied and would have happily paid full price. Is a bit quiet but that is no problem since I have a speaker I can hook it up to. Also love how you can call it computer which sounds a lot more professional then Alexa. Hope one day you can name it custom names! Also really hope I get chosen for the echo loop! I’m definitely buying one now!

reviews.reviewTitle: Love love her. Thank you Amazon
reviews.reviewText:
What, You haven’t bought this already? What are you waiting for? Love love love her!

I will say that you need to spend a good amount of money on smart home devices that she can control to make it worth while. But one you do you will not go back. In my house the brands I have( August-Hue-Lutron-Nest and Bond) all control my home.

I purchased this for my mom. I would highly recommend this product to anyone who wants a tool that will help them stay organized, entertained, and informed. This product is great for listening to music/audiobooks, making lists, setting alarms, and providing news and weather updates. The Amazon Echo is simple to set up and compatible with a variety of apps on your smartphone. Amazon music, Pandora, Spotify, allrecipies, and ecobee are just some of the skills the echo is able to utilize.

We ended up getting the Amazon Echo for a best buy deal in our area and really enjoy using it for all the features it has. Planning on hooking up smart home products In the near future so we decided to get the Echo dot on here. The price tag is really affordable, which is one of the first things I noticed. Then the free 2 day shipping with prime was awesome as well. Product was on time and the box had no defects hinting to misuse while in shipping. The unboxing and setup takes less than 15 minutes from start to finish, including setting up my fiancé with her amazon account. Shes really happy with it and enjoys using it for her music. We wondered how it would work asking "Alexia" things and having both of them near by, but you can change what they answer to(we set hers to Echo).
All in all I would highly recommend if you are looking for smart home setup in the future, or just want to play some music or listen to your books.

reviews.reviewTitle: sound is significantly greater than previous models
reviews.reviewText: i’ve had the 1st/2nd gen dot for quite some time and loved it. when i saw the new model was on sale i couldn’t resist. the older model sounded “flat” when playing music. the new model sounds like a Bose speaker and i can hear the bass from the next room over. the only problem is i ordered the charcoal thinking it was the gray one in the picture but i meant to order heather gray. oh well. overall the sound makes the new version worth the money and i got to add a new alexa to my home. next is a echo sub for the premium sound experience!

I just love my Echo. I wish I had gotten one sooner. My Mom passed away last year and she was blind. This would have been so helpful for her. Her brother is blind and he loves his. He lives in another state and I will call him and ask him what the weather is there. He will ask “Alexa what’s the weather” and I can hear the answer. I have been playing music on mine. I have my favorite stations selected on the app. I also bought the extra Amazon Smart plug and love it too. When I come in after dark, I say Alexa turn on lamp. So very helpful. Great price.

I was VERY skeptical about making this "smart" purchase. But because we are upgrading with a possiblity of making this an air bnb, i took a chance. All people kept saying was everyone will know your business, it tracks your entire life. But who cares, I Love it.
Works on demand (wish my husband would haha)
.
Get this......

I love this thing. I’m disabiled and I am hope alone most of the day. I hat daytime tv and you can only watch the same move so many times. Echo dot reminded me of my appointments, I can play trivia games with it and it keeps me occupied also gives me the latest news so I don’t lose touch with the world around me. Got it on sale for $29.99. Best 30 bucks I’ve spent in along time.

My wife and I have offices in the farthest reaches of our home. Her office is on the main floor study in the front of the house while I am tucked up in the very back of the house in the basement. Is she trying to tell me something? Well, if she is, she can. We use these Dots to play music and everything else but we also use them as an intercom system. My next one will go in the garage!

this echo is a very good-looking unit. The only issues I've had with it is sometimes it will not hear you well from halfway across the room. One thing that is very frustrating with the echo is the number of activity apps you must add to get it to function. Also I had to buy a Harmony Hub to get it to control the TV and sound bar which wasn't expected. It's a great purchase at 50% off.

reviews.reviewTitle: Now I have google and Alexa
reviews.reviewText: I bought this to install in my daughter’s room for LED strip lights and other various reasons such as smart plugs and so she can talk to the Alexa. We use google for the rest of the house so this is definitely a different set up. It pairs just fine with the current app I’m using for google. No complaints

We really enjoy having Echo Dot in our bedroom. We have enjoyed using Alexa for a couple years, especially for shopping lists, music and asking questions. Now we can do that in bedroom too. Will be doing audio books from my Echo in 2019 before going to bed. I would not want to be without these two units and I am a Grandma of 77 years young. By the way, I hooked it up and started it myself!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Sound! Doesn't sync well if you use many in a "group."
reviews.reviewText: Love the sound and easy to set up. Haven't tried Bluetooth yet. Bought 4 of these babies - now have 6 total in my home (big Alexa and original dot). I notice playing this many in a "group" is really slow. It must suck bandwidth to get these babies in sync - sometimes doesn't respond at all - then starts playing 30-60 seconds later. Also miss the volume dial on top of the unit but has graphic equalizer in the Alexa app.

Works as expected. Good sound and good voice recognition. Also works from a good distance away. Don't have to yell at it from across the room. Hears me over other random noise and from a good distance away. Handy device to have next to my Google home as well. "Alexa" or "Hey Google", they both work well.

reviews.reviewTitle: Can't use as an external speaker without a bluetooth connection
reviews.reviewText: This is a very compact size, which is great for travel. However, we'd hoped to use it as an external speaker for my husband's laptop and it won't do that since he doesn't have bluetooth. I know you can add a bluetooth adapter to the computer, but I really don't want to go to that much trouble. Also, it has to have plug in power to work. I much prefer to use my Tap...more flexible.

Easy setup. It was literally plug and play. I plugged it in and the blue lights swirled around for a few seconds and balm setup was complete. No fumbling with wifi passwords. How neat is that.

The new Echo Dot is heavier than the 2nd generation and sound way better. No need for external speaker hook up. There's bluetooth too if you prefer. I will get another when next it goes on sale

reviews.reviewTitle: Works well and worth the price
reviews.reviewText: I gave it 4 stars because it is great for the price, sounds good, works well and fairly easy to start the app, how the app is a little confusing as I know nothing about these things, so I don't know how to do many features. Also it has answered about 75% of my questions the other 25% it didn't know or understand. The only other thing is I hate that you have to pay monthly to play a specific song. Overall though I love it!

I absolutely love my Echo Dot. I use it all the time from asking for recipes, inquiring about the weather, various topics and knowledge and then of course there's the games... And that's only a portion of what Echo Dot can do. I even have my own questions and answers customized oh, so when my grandkids we're trying to prove that it was just artificial intelligence without feelings they blurted out, "Alexa, I love you" and Echo dot answered back, "I love you too". Their mouths fell open! LOL! Hillarious!!💕💕 They still don't know I programmed that part. 😂 Grandma's secret!

I have a “Tap” and received the dot for a gift.
I can give the same command to both, at different times and get different results. I use both mainly for soothing music in my home. I can ask DOT to play “instumental pop music” it it will play one song and stop. “TAP” plays fir a couple of hours the same request. Not sure yet why this happens, will have to contact Amazon.

Works just as well as the 2nd generation, but I immediately noticed the sound quality was better than the 2nd generation dot. I didn't purchase it for sound quality, but because I wanted another one to use at work, but am very pleased with the improved quality. Not as good as the larger units, but still very nice.

reviews.reviewTitle: The Gen 3 is so much more than previous generations.
reviews.reviewText: Plug it in and it does the rest. Provides great sound compared to earlier generations. I have it in my downstairs bathroom for news and music while getting ready for the day. My wife's hobby room is close by and it has become her go to sound system when she's painting. She could be using our home theater system but prefers the ease of just saying 'Hey Alxea play....".

I love that I can listen to music throughout the house. It is convenient to add an item to my list and using the app while shopping. When the room is dark I ask Alexa, to turn on the lights. So nice. Get one or three NOW! This is the most wonderful gift to give to your friends and yourself.

I have an Alexa upstairs and wanted a dot for downstairs so my wife would not have to keep yelling down to me. She just "announces" what she wants to tell me and I can respond without having to yell back by announcing back to her. I plan to try out the "Drop In feature" and see if that makes two way communication even easier

I think this is just not the product for me. I really only want a Bluetooth speaker to listen to music on my iPhone. I’m not a fan of talking to technology. I never use Siri and Alexa couldn’t understand half of what I said. Could be the braces. It’s sitting on my counter and I haven’t used it since the day I got it. I’ll probably give it away.

Definitely better than the input regarding features. I hate that the calls it makes always go out as private tho. also one day i lifted it up to unplug n plug it back in to reset because i reset the router n the top just popped off. quality control issue? or maybe i got a used unit? still works with voice commands tho so not that big of a deal

We wanted multiple speakers in other parts of the home to play music on at the same time. The echo dot is a great addition. The sound is good and we don't have to have the volume up so loud now that we can play on multiple devices. The multiple devices needs a little improvement, it has issues and has to be restarted often.

We bought a Dot for our 3rd grade son as he loves to listen to music on Sirius but the dedicated table top Sirius radio we moved into his room kept crapping out. True, we are at the mercy of our wifi signal but he loves being able to call up various new artists (new to him, classic to us) and albums to expand his musical palette. The sound quality has improved right along with the full-size Echo.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great looking Alexa Device and now i'm addicted to them
reviews.reviewText:
I wish Amazon would stop making such attractive and useful products. I am now eating Ramen for the majority of my caloric intake because most of my income is spent on whatever Amazon creates....

Hopefully they make an Alexa-bot one day that can walk or roll around my house, so i can decrease the number of alexa devices around here!

reviews.reviewTitle: Awesome sound from such a small package.
reviews.reviewText: These two echo dots perform flawlessly with my two previously purchased alexas. Great sound and controlling lights in various lighting is certainly a big +. Without buying anything else, I am able to stream any genre of music of music from the past 70 years. Also plays news feeds, gives answers and a multitude of other audio requests.

I brought two with my order. I am very satisfied with both. I pair both, one in living room and one in the bedroom. When I play music, I am able to have both play at the same time. They still work separately to my voice demands and was easy to pair. The sound quality is excellent, and I will in the future, purchase more. I am able to connect with other Bluetooth capable equipment as well. Highly recommend to other buyers. The skills are easy to find and operate, and for hands free calling, perfect quality.

reviews.reviewTitle: 2 steps forward but then 1 step backward.
reviews.reviewText:
Likes: good build quality, sound okay for the size, mic pick up voice command very well.

Only one major dislike: power adapter is proprietary small jack 12v, hard to replace, previous generation using simple usb and can use external battery to be portable. There seem no good reason why the engineer made this change because nowaday many portable batteries/chargers can supply 5v/2.1a to provide enough power.

If in the future amazon can sell a usb cable which has small chip to up/convert voltage from 5v to 12v then I will update this review.

reviews.reviewTitle: You will use it more than you think
reviews.reviewText: I never thought I would use such a device since most of my voice remote devices just don’t understand me, ie Siri in my iPhone nor my Roku remotes. I ordered this because it was on sale on Amazon Prime day sale with smart plug to turn on my entry light when I came home. I set it up in couple minutes & found myself asking Alexa to play every song I could think of. Although sound wasn’t perfect as thru my fancy speakers, it was good enough.

I have an Echo and three 2nd generation Dots. This new Dot is so much better than the last generation. It looks better and sounds much better. I use mine to play music a lot on my nightstand and this new one is a big improvement. I bought the sandstone and it's quite attractive. And I got it for a steal on Prime Day!

This has come in handy since I got it. I didn't know it could make calls but was thrilled to find that feature. My oldest has basically taken over my echo as well as my music subscription, but it's a welcome distraction and the music keeps him calmer and happier. Considering buying another one just for myself.

I have 3 2nd generation dots and one generation 2 full size echo. My new 3rd generation dot has sound that is closer to the full size unit than the 2nd generation dot. Difference is the much improved base. I gave it a 5 rating because of what it is, a small speaker with excellent sound. Make no mistake, however, it is not a Sonos or Bose or a Logitech computer speaker system I just bought. With that said, it was $29.

I bought the Echo and it came with a free WiFi lighy. The light is difficult to connect to the manufacturer app (which isn’t Amazon) and then loses connection frequently for no apparent reason. I have a WiFi thermostat and it’s lost connection once because of a power outage.

reviews.reviewTitle: Looks, sounds, and functions much better than previous generations!
reviews.reviewText: The third gen Echo Dot is a great improvement over the second gen. The sound quality has improved tremendously. I use my dots a lot for home automation, and I think the third gen picks up my voice quicker and easier than the previous versions. Plus this version looks much better as a stand alone device on the counter!

reviews.reviewTitle: Very impressive -- the little speaker/microphone that could
reviews.reviewText: No complaints about the workmanship, ease of installation, or sound (nice and loud). Voice recognition is very good but not quite excellent IMHO. Handles a very wide range of queries for sure. Just be sure you actually really want a virtual assistant, since if you don't, they will drive you crazy rapidly.

reviews.reviewTitle: Wish the sleep sounds worked better
reviews.reviewText: Can’t live without her. However, I purchased this for my bedroom to replace my sleep sound machine. That didn’t go well. Needless to say the old sound machine is back out. I do get a tad nervous at times when I wake up to the blue ring spinning at 2 in the morning. So there have been a few times I unplug it.

I had a full size Alexa in my kitchen but wanted another Alexa in my home office and bedroom. I do think the speakers are better in the full size for listening to music but other than that, the Dot works just as well as the full size version. I highly recommend getting the docking station. The station keeps Alexa off the counter and is a clean look without cords.

Its amazing to me to ask echo dot to play any kind of music. From top hits, to songs I had completely forgotten about. She sets my alarm when I'm cooking and tells me the weather. Yes I can do this with my phone but how easy is it when i don"t have to push any buttons and just ask out loud. So while washing dishes or cooking you can ask her anything. She might be small but her abilities are grand. I am so glad i got my echo dot.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love the product, don't love the customer support.
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this as a gift. Unfortunately, because I was the one that purchased it, it is automatically "registered" in my name. Which made it exceedingly difficult for the person that I was giving it to. We couldn't figure out why we couldn't connect it to her phone via the app, or set up her Spotify account. It took three chat sessions and two phone calls to determine the issue. Amazon systems should not make the assumption that the purchaser is always the end user. People do buy gifts on this website.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very easy to install and use!
reviews.reviewText: This was easy to install. Learning to use it has been easy and fast. Definitely has surpassed my expectation of its use. Asking questions and do accomplish tasks is easy and the results are spot on from Alexa. Another electronic device I may begin to wonder why I waited so long to get them. I have 3 and purchased one for my granddaughter. She loves it and calls me on it daily! She is 4 years old and can use it as well as me.

Got it to put in my lanai so I could have some music and check weather, etc. out there. Was worried that the heat and humidity might ruin it (live in Florida)....but I called the chat line and the guy said it would not ...... soooooo....my little Echo Dot is in my lanai going strong every morning and I love it..........!!!

The sounds quality is SOOOO great compared to the gen 2. I had three Gen2s and for good sound I had to buy add on speakers. The speakers were nice, but it made it hard for the Gen2 to hear my voice commands forcing me to walk over to the alexas constantly. The speaker in the Gen3 seems to be geared to reduce this problem.

reviews.reviewTitle: Buen producto pero le falta en español latino...
reviews.reviewText: Buen producto pero aun le falta en español latino. Hay comandos que uno deja en rutinas, los cuales no cumple. Hay un comando en especial, cuando le digo apagar la música en determinados minutos o segundos, lo cual dice que lo va a hacer pero no es así. Estas fallas son aleatorias, un día si y al otro no. Me gusta mucho su sonido y sus microfonos.

I like that it's Bluetooth capable to just stream music from my iPhone, not too fond that it automatically connects when I'm near any of the three I have. However, it'll randomly start listening to me at various moments during the day when I'm arguing with my son over something and I never say the "wake" word. Otherwise, very great product and I love it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Doesn't keep up with Google home
reviews.reviewText: Disclaimer I got this for free with a ring 2 holiday deal. It works with basic questions and connection with ring doorbell. Everything else I'd rather just go through my Google home that I had before. The Google home has a much better interface and connects/works with with non Amazon smart products a lot better in my opinion. Not complaining about a freebie but giving an honest review.

I have a couple of green 2 dots and this one sounds way better. I usually connect to a large speaker but i don't mind when i have to connect something else to the speaker and run this gen 3 dot through it's own speaker. I also like the ability to ask it follow up questions without saying Alexa when you enable it. The upgrades made it worth adding to my dot group.

reviews.reviewTitle: No instructions just downloaded that app but the app doesn't tell you anything
reviews.reviewText: Absolutely no instructions on how to hook it to the internet says look at app that says nothing if you want one I'll throw mine in the trash can for you waste waste waste

reviews.reviewTitle: Overall great! Better sound quality, audiobook isn’t worth it
reviews.reviewText: I got this product for Christmas and I am very satisfied. The only thing that is inconvenient at times is its lack of knowledge. I’m guessing because it’s fairly new it needs time to pick up on more information. Better sound quality than the 2nd gen. Audiobook isn’t worth buying, it’s about $16 a month and then u have to pay however much the book is on top of that. You can just get the audiobook for free through a library or buy it solo for cheaper without a subscription fee or buy the actual paper copy book for a lot cheaper. Amazon music is awesome!

reviews.reviewTitle: Don't know how I've survived this long without Alexa...
reviews.reviewText: My new echo dot is like having a personal assistant that doesn't need a salary (or sleep). It keeps track of my shopping list and to-do projects. This may not sound like much, but it makes a huge difference when you're standing in the middle of the grocery store wondering "what else did I need to pick up"? And suddenly remember when you walk through your door. I stream Amazon prime music and for such a small speaker, it's has pretty robust sound. Not do I recommend the Echo Dot, but I'm going to buy a couple more, to ensure my "assistant" is always by my side.

reviews.reviewTitle: Latest Alexa set up integration a No-Brainer!
reviews.reviewText: Amazed at how easy this unit set up as compared to original set up process with original Alexa. Assured that the latest App was loaded, plugged in the device and basically it went through the process without assistance. Perhaps it was due to the fact we had prior Alexa units in our system. Really don’t care why...it was a no Brainer!

reviews.reviewTitle: I'm having fun with this little dot.
reviews.reviewText: Got this for BF deal at $24.00 and have a lot of fun with it. The speak is loud enough to listen to some music. connected to my new ring doorbell 2 with no issue. The dot will say "someone is at your front door" when the doorbell is pressed. able to do translation, math, and response to many other request/questions. After having one in the living room, we bought two more for other two bedrooms.

I needed a clock for my bedroom because I moved my Echo Show 2 into the kitchen... The Echo Dot 3rd gen with clock was the perfect choice! Thanks to Echo dot with clock I didn't have to purchase an echo dot plus a clock... You can adjust the brightness of the clocks LED with voice commands or via the Alaxa app.

This particular 3rd generation dot has been problematic in its ability to stream music. I have an Alexa and 1st generation dot, both are great. I am able to stream music everywhere with the everywhere group, but this dot is non responsive 50% of the time.
I think it’s the unit not the product line. I need to get a replacement.

I have no idea why I did not purchase one sooner. Let me 1st start off by saying it was very easy to set up along with the Alexa app. I used my Echo Dot along with so many features on Amazon. My favorite thing is that I can ask it questions to get updates on sports scores, weather, time in even use my Amazon music subscription. My whole family has got in on the action. This would include my very hesitant husband who now sees our new echo as wonderful!

What isn't mentioned anywhere is that it does not have a battery, so it has to be hard-wired constantly. If you move it with you, it shuts off. I.e., it is really only for stationary use. And the power adapter has a proprietary connector, so you can't use a powerbank to keep it running. I had thought it would be useful as a bluetooth speaker, but these constraints are non-starter.

reviews.reviewTitle: The Speaker in this generation is awesome
reviews.reviewText: This is my second Amazon Echo Dot my first one it was a second generation I got last year at this time of the year. Now I have a third generation which I just got, it is really good. I love the sound even better. I put my second generation in a bedroom which is perfect for that room. I love my Amazon Echo Dots I have many plug in switch’s I use my dot to control. I would recommend getting one

So, this was my first experience with Alexa technology and I have been very impressed. I installed it in my family room connected to my stereo system. I use it mainly to access playlists and stations from Amazon Music. The only problem that I have encountered is that once in a while, it will lose the signal from my WIFI (which is at the opposite end of the house). I liked the Dot well enough to get a second unit for my home-office too.

The voice recognition, voice command and Alexa integration are quite convenient. The sound quality alone is quite adequate but I connected some unused computer speakers with subwoofer to the 3.5mm audio output so I can get a better bass reproduction. I usually listen to Smooth Jazz on Amazon Music while doing work at home, and I find the device useful.

reviews.reviewTitle: This little thing is the bomb!
reviews.reviewText: I absolutely love this little device. Placed it in the kitchen/dining area and it has really increased our quality of life by simplifying and adding enjoyment. We play music on it, listen to news, ask Alexa questions, use as a cooking timer supplement, use for shopping lists, listen to podcasts, and on and on. The speaker is amazing too. No reason not to get this bad boy.

reviews.reviewTitle: $0.59, so I bought one for the bedroom
reviews.reviewText:
We already have one of these in the living room, so when I saw this deal, I got one for the bedroom.

I use it as an alarm and to play ambient sounds to help me fall asleep. I also get my daily briefing while I'm getting ready - weather report is especially helpful in deciding what to wear.

reviews.reviewTitle: There is no plan if you want just two streams.
reviews.reviewText:
The single device plan is good. Don't buy a second device if you want two people to be able to listen to different music in different rooms. There only good plans are single device and family and the family plan is only good if you have maybe 4, 5 or 6 people listening to different streams.

There is no plan for families or couples who only want two or three streams. Don't tie up your money with Echo devices unless you just want to listen on one Echo device or you have enough role to justify paying for six streams.

reviews.reviewTitle: The Battle of the Home Assistance
reviews.reviewText:
The long time battle between assistants has been great to watch and experience. I think that Alexa has had the lead throughout. What compliments the new generation is the attention to sound, music is so much better sounding on the new products.

Cant wait for the next generation, it just keeps getting better.

my dot will not function in my house as we have limited wi-fi. this was a birthday credit gift, so I am sorry it did not work out. I use one at my sons house when babysitting and I liked how I could use it as a timer. However I didn't think I could afford to send it back with all the fees due to my fixed income so I am giving it away. Total bummer,

reviews.reviewTitle: Only works if your Amazon account is paid for with USA based credit card.
reviews.reviewText:
Really enjoy this product. Traveling with it can be a challenge as it does not always connect to hotel wifi. I bought several for friends it will not work if you do not have an USA based credit card. I find that very strange. As it works abroad as long as your Amazon account is connected to USA. In our global world that is a contradiction. Amazon is all over the world.
If someone can tell me my statement about international payment is not true please tell me I have 20 friends living abroad that would love to have one.

I am really enjoying my Amazon Dot, especially since I was able to integrate my phone to play music from a variety of apps. Changing the default app, however, has been a challenge. Additionally, I use a projector to watch most media, and have seen stories of folks syncing their speaker to the system, but have not been able to do so.

This my second one so I have it handy in another part of the house. The product has a wide range of tasks, not all of which I have used yet, but music is one of the major things I have been using it for. It is a lot easier than searching through a stack of CDs to find any song I want. The list function is also very useful. I also just added guarding my house while I am gone as one of the tasks I use it for.

Bought this little guy in a bundle with the Hue smart bulbs for Prime Day and I'm so happy I did! I like the sandstone color (not quite white), and I love that my bedroom lights are now Alexa compatible! Able to play me music, she notifies me when my packages arrive, and sets timers for cooking, so many awesome things!

Very convenient for so many things. Whether you have a question to google, asking about the weather when getting ready to leave the house, to asking her to turn the lights on or off. At times i think i could carry on a conversation with her. My husband is very inquisitive and asks her questions all of the time. We've only had her hooked up a couple of weeks, but what an asset, so far!
This works great. I love the look of this one. I have an older version as well and this one seems to be more sensitive and more accurate with voice recognition. Very happy with this purchase

Great small akexa devise. Get to know how to do commands train it with you info and ordering stuff and getting quick answers to simple thing will be easy. Got it fir my gf she never uses it but I, have and it works fine. The speaker fir music isn't great but I, dont think anyone Jordan's really trying to listen to their favorite music through the dot.

We love our Echo Dot so much we purchased three. This is my favorite model as far as sound. I just wish it had the same type of charging cable as the 2nd Gen, which is a USB. So many great features and the price is amazing. We shop a lot on Amazon and having the dot makes it fun. The kids love to play games and the 4 year old love playing Hide and Seek. We use our Echo everyday.

Maybe it's due to be older with less involvement with such devices but it was a struggle to get the item set up and I am still struggling to learn what music is available free and which is a for pay only option. Directions to go to help sites do not seem to always provide the help needed (again, maybe MY lack of knowledge)- for instance a direction to click on a particular icon when I could not find such an icon.

After messing around with my boyfriends echo dot (2nd generation) I was really wanting to have one of my own. So I was very happy to find it on sale during the end of the year. I like having Alexa around she is like having a small assistant who can play your favorite music. I know she can do so much more I haven't had the chance to see what else she can do but so far I have no complaints with my Echo dot. It is a little speaker so i do not expect high end quality sound for music but it works well and I do love the build of the 3rd generation compared to the 2nd generation. I personally think it makes it sound better.

For a dollar it is an awesome deal. It work really good. Bought it to control smart home hub. Still learning the ins and outs. Speaker is a little low quality for music, but it has a jack to put it to my sound bar. I did not but it for music anyway so does not bother me. I did change the wake word from Alexa to echo, Alexa is my girlfriends name. It some times does not hear me the first time when the tv is a little loud.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works Well Most of the Time
reviews.reviewText: I love this little device. I have about wiretapped every room in my house now. I have a little country accent and she understands me pretty well. Some of the things she doesn't understand is because there is not a skill enabled or something like that. These are awesome when you can catch them on sale.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not as good as previous generations
reviews.reviewText: I expected much better quality going from a first gen to a third gen product but the microphone is not nearly as good. I have to shout to wake it up and usually have to try to or three times, it is very frustrating. Although this unit is much heavier and the volume is louder, the speaker quality is not any better. This one will be going into a seldom used location.

I absolutely love Alexa. We use her everyday. This is my 2nd Echo Dot. I plan to get at least 1 more, maybe 2. Not only does she have new skills added every week, Alexa’s current skills improve as well. I also purchased an Echo Dot for kids for my granddaughter. I plan to have a Dot in just about every room.

reviews.reviewTitle: My only gripe is voice recognition sucks mainly other than that it’s good
reviews.reviewText: I like it but comparing it to google home mini the google home mini picks up your voice from further distance better and I literally half get up a walk right by the echo dot and give commands that way! It does not give you definitions of words if you spell out the words but the echo dot looks better than the google home mini now I love echo dot app way better than google home mini app much easier integration process! A breeze to add devices etc

reviews.reviewTitle: Best Purchase in a long time!
reviews.reviewText: I bought a ring doorbell for black Friday and this came as a bonus for the sale. I never knew what I was missing until I became "friendly" with Alexa. I can no longer imagine her not being around to give me the weather, play music, tell me facts, and make bad jokes. I once thought I didn't need something such as this, but maybe a fun "want" once in awhile is a good thing!

Wow, the quality of sound for this little device is surprisingly good. I had to connect my previous generation of echo dots to speakers to like listening to music through them. I still have one connected to my main stereo system. There is obviously no comparison to that and any free standing echo device. But for places where you don’t want to add an additional speaker this device rocks.

I'm new to this type of tech but so far, I like it. Odd little thing, and frankly I'm leery of it but curiosity made me buy it. At the same time, I feel like I'm willingly stepping into 1984 type of living. So much info collected about each of us when we use ...everything from cell phones, Facebook, Google, smart products...the list gets bigger and bigger. Yet here I am, giving it 5 stars.

Wow. Gen 3 is a big improvement. The sound is really close to the full size Alexa. No added speakers needed. It is improved in looks as well , without the shiny plastic finish of previous models. I guess Alexa is addictive, we have her in the living room and dots in every other room. I love the improved sound and the sleek new look. Good work Amazon. Now you can focus on making her in fashion colors.

I like the product very much, purchased 2 of them to place in the home. The sound volume is very clear provides music in the areas of the home where it is placed. Received some assistance from the help desk in getting both setup in the home. I'm thinking of getting another one to cover another room.

reviews.reviewTitle: Let’s hope for a bug fix or Firmware Update !!
reviews.reviewText:
My wife and I have 2 of the second generation and have love them controlling our lights and the best our TiVo which works great, so I decided to purchase the new Eco Dot 3rd Gen which looks and feels more beefed up BUT I’m not real happy when playing music.... as others have reported it sounds muffled on some songs in which I thought I would be getting a better bass sound but not !!

I feel that being more costly and having a few bugs, the manufacture should at least offer some type of upgrade or trade in once they fix the problem, or it would be really nice if they could correct their problems with a firmware update!!

This gen is so much better then the last! Aside from the obviously size difference, the sound quality is out of this world! Even my neighbors down the street asked me if I got a new sound system in my house lol. Voice recognition is awesome and the apps have been a blessing! I don't know what life was like before Alexa and I don't care to find out lol!

It works just like my echo Dot upstairs and my echo that is downstairs but not always listening. So now I don't have to press the button downstairs to ask alexa a question. Now I got Amazon bugging most of my house. I guess I need to put one in the attic too then the whole house would be bugged.

I had a bluetooth speaker that expired and I had a an echo do that was not opened. I tested it and was amazed with the sound quality. The ability to connect to my amazon prime and pandora plus use other alexa skills was great.

I bought for my kids, grandkids and friends so that they could share the experience.

Love this product! I cannot believe the deal I got on this!! Idk how I lived without it. Great quality sound, really pumps out volume, smart and remembers songs you will Alexa you like, reads the weather or news if asked for whatever area you’re in or where you ask. Will play songs similar to “...” etc.

If you've used an echo device before you know what to expect from Alexa. As always the voice assistant can make your life easier if you take the time to learn how to use it. But the big surprise for me with the Echo Dot 3rd Gen is the sound. How did they get that much sound out of such a small device? This is at least 50% louder than previous Echo Dots and the clarity is leaps and bounds improved over the previous models.

I was pushing wrong button to sync. Called seller and he got me on the right track so easily. I truly appreciated the quick and excellent service. Alexa works great. I’ve asked for another to put in the office for my birthday present. We love playing music and setting timers. Alexa does much, much more.

I was really happy with how much louder this Dot was then the previous Gen. One thing I was always a little let down by with the older one is I couldn't always hear my music even on max volume.

But thats not a problem with the newer gen! Love it very much. Its bigger then the previous model but nothing that keeps me from keeping it on my desk like before.

I love the echo Dot. I had the google home mini and hated it. The echo is ten times better than the google mini. First off I didn’t like having to say “hey google or ok google. It wouldn’t hear me and had to stand over it and scream. With the Echo, Alexa would hear me from across the house and with Amazon prime I have endless music. I love all it’s other features. If you’re thinking of getting one the Echo is the only choice.

Likes:
sound quality is awesome
Love the drop in feature (not just from another Alexa device but from the app on my phone while I’m away from home)
And much more

Cons:
Alexa is a little retarded 😂 lol far field voice recognition isn’t really all of that no different from Siri on Apple I guess she has to learn us first but so far that’s just my opinion

reviews.reviewTitle: Great sound, easy to install and setup
reviews.reviewText: Although Alexa misunderstands me sometimes, it has great sound, and is super easy to install once the app is installed on your android or apple device. You have additional charges for amazon music and video on the device. Toke me about 10 minutes to install and add the "Skills" I planned on using. Overall great product

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice design, good speaker, Alexa need work
reviews.reviewText: Very good sound quality, nice overall design. Can't complain about the build quality or the performance. However, Alexa is just not good at understanding speech compared to Google assistant. I find myself speaking very slowly and robotic to make sure Alexa can understand me and it gets very tedious and annoying to the point that I would rather just use my phone to do things instead of my voice.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love how small it is, discreet, and how match in my white room
reviews.reviewText: I had the Alexa before this one, the 2nd generation. Amazon did a promotion toguether with amazon unlimited music... I was like “perfect time to update”! I’m super happy with this new one, specially the price I paid for! Now I have one in the room and one in the living room 😅 and this one is pretty gorgeous than my last one

Got it free as part of a special purchase of Ring Camera, I'm impressed of all the functions this little thing can do, Works as a Ring Doorbell Chime alert, music playlist, makes phone calls, use as a drop in device to call the kids upstairs or the home when no one picks up the phone, ect.
Now in days you can buy one for about $25, the cost of a small bluetooth portable speaker and it is worth it.

I've had this thing for a few weeks now. I have tried to set it up multiple times and i cannot figure it out. It's set up is extremely complicated and to be honest I'm glad i got it for 20bucks on prime day because i am never going to use it.... i thought for 20 it was a steal esp with all the great reviews and tbh since its just taking up space i continue to use the tech i already have (aka a smart phone) and i am realizing i wasted 20bucks bc my life is still convenient and easy enough without the alexa and i only got it bc i wanted a sound bar to play music loudly but i guess my phone speaker will continue to suffice... do not waste your money on this product its impossible to set up and basically is a less convenient smart phone bc it needs to stay plugged into a wall

Better speaker, better sound, easy set-up. It set itself up. The reason I'm only giving it four stars is because when I unplugged it to move, it stopped responding to the word "Alexa." If I assign the word "Echo," it's happy. Even if I reset it to "Alexa" later, it refuses to respond until I reset it back to "Echo." Very frustrating to have to remember that one is an oddball in a house full of Alexas.

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice sound for the sale price
reviews.reviewText:
Good sound for a small speaker. Setup took a little while... I had to add and remove it from my device list several times before it properly synced with my echo.

Disappointed that I can't select a Pandora station on my phone and have multiple echo/echo dot devices play it. You have to link your account through Amazon to have multiple devices play the audio, so some things, like Youtube, are out.

Good so far. Sound is definitely improved. Wi-Fi connection is an issue for some reason. Tried it close to the router and it is fine. Further away it has connection issues. Not sure why. All my smart speakers work fine no matter where I have placed them in my house. That includes the 2nd generation Echo Dot. Not sure why the third keeps having issues. Overall though the look, feel, and sound are great.

We purchased this echo dot for our son who has Down's Syndrome, and he uses it extensively for many things including music, alarms, etc. We are particularly impressed with the quality of sound for such a compact item. He will no doubt expand his use of it to control lights, etc., and we are very happy with the purchase.

reviews.reviewTitle: If you are a music lover, or kind of lazy, or both, Echo dot is the perfect match! :)
reviews.reviewText: Actually better than I expected! My 3 & 5 year old are both able to give commands and Alexa understands. Even with my 3yr old having a slight speech delay! They are seriously amused with Alexa, and I’m equally as impressed with the device! It was very easy to pair with smart plugs and light bulbs etc. and I’m able to control devices easily through the echo dot! Recommended it to my ex and he purchased one as well and has enjoyed our daughter turning on Disney songs and dancing around with her during their time together over at his place! I’d recommend to any and everyone!!

Alexa doesn’t understand if accent is east Indian.
I have lived here 36 years+ pretty much understood by 90% of the civilized people I come in contact.
However, Alexa is miles apart in its hearing despite of slow deliberate enunciation.
My experience is it’s okay but not great or any such superlatives.
Hence, i suggest buyers must really chalk a list of questions they might test out before buying.
I really don’t like returning stuff despite of my dissatisfaction.

reviews.reviewTitle: Overall I love her so far :)
reviews.reviewText: So far she’s been easy to set up and has worked well. Volume is great, sound clarity is good. She does have trouble understanding me sometimes and also often says she can’t find my play list but for whatever reason if my husband asks her the same thing she finds it. There’s still lots of things we ask her that she doesn’t know or understand but for what I want to use her for she’s great.

I bought these primarily to control the circulation pump on our new Rinnai water heater. Alexa integration is far better than the motion sensors and cheaper. Plus our granddaughter loves to get it to play children songs -Wheels on the Bus ringing in my ears even now. Sound quality much better than the earlier generation Dots.

reviews.reviewTitle: If you are looking for an inexpensive crappy speaker, echo dot is an option
reviews.reviewText: To be fair, we own Sonos speakers, so we are accustomed to good (not great) speakers. The echo dot is just so tinny. It's almost annoying to listen to music on this device unless the volume is set to the lowest settings. Probably good for a laundry room or garage. If pleasant sound is not important to you and home automation is your thing, the price of the Echo dot can't be beat.
Worked for about 2 months then began lagging and now won’t even respond to commands. I love amazon and am a prime member but this is very disappointing

The was a great purchase. I had read reviews about the Echo Dot 3rd generation and decided not to purchase. However, after buying my ne Ring doorbell decided to give it a try. Glad I did! The quality from this little device is amazing. It takes all my voice commands and quickly finds my favorite artist, radio stations and connected easily with my tablet. I would highly recommend this item for personal use or as a gift.

reviews.reviewTitle: Emergency contact for seniors or health challenged homes.
reviews.reviewText: I am surprised at how much I like this and after using it to call my daughter, I am encouraging all people living alone to get one if for nothing more than being able to call someone in an emergency. This is now my emergency contact device without having to wear a bracelet or pendant. I love the music, being able to control my fire TV stick and have a conversation with Alexa occasionally. BTW I purchased a Dot 2 for my basement because of how inexpensive they are - of course that will be nice if we have any tornado warnings and I have to spend time in the basement.

reviews.reviewTitle: This old man is liking this technology.
reviews.reviewText: It’s really handy at bedtime just to say “Alexa, good night,” and the lights turn off in the bedroom. Alexa gives a weather report that includes present conditions and the forecast for the night and the next morning. Shopping list is great. Just say what you want on the list. The list shows up on my phone when I’m at the store. It well worth the money. Get one.

reviews.reviewTitle: and i thought i loved the Gen 2
reviews.reviewText: if you're on the fence on whether or not to upgrade......do it today. I loved the Gen 2 but the new Gen 3 has better connectivity and the voice commands are quicker and more precise. The prime day deal makes it an absolute no brainer. I put the Gen 2 in the kitchen and now I'm all covered. One more thing.....it connects better and more precise with my samsung bluetooth speaker.

reviews.reviewTitle: This has better sound quality over Google Mini
reviews.reviewText: Echo Dot has improved itself over the time. It has stronger bass and clearer sound than its predecessor. I would prefer this over Google Mini in term of sound quality. Alexa is useful, but there are few features that prove google is more useful than mini such as texting over voice. Overall, I do not have anything again Echo, but there are news that Amazon is listen to us over Echo. This is why I muted my Echo or stay away from it for now

We love this Echo Dot.I would give it a 10 Star if I could.My husband is diabetic & takes med's twice a day. Sometimes he forgets, so I set an alarm for him,he hasn't missed a day since.I'am still learning about Alexa's skills but so far we have enjoyed the features. A. I is here & we love it. I like that "She" learns more Skills as time goes on. Thanks .

I have to say, I am quite impressed with my Echo Dot. Alexa can make or answer phone calls, she plays soothing sounds at night for me, and she even wakes me up in the morning with a pleasant sounding alarm. If I want her to play a song for me, then I just say "Alexa, play Elvis Presley, Don't Be Cruel" and like magic it starts to play. Im just a beginner at this. I am finding out that I can do many many things with the Alexa app. Do yourself a favor and buy it. Best money I ever spent.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good product, but management is challenging
reviews.reviewText:
I got the product to put a speaker in each of the kids rooms. Works great for intercom featuress, but you need to pay $15/month for a family music subscription to stream music on more than one device at a time. Add on to that, it's difficult to figure out how to shut off explicit lyrics on kids devices, without shutting them off on my own account. For the low price, I am very impressed with the speaker sound though.

At the end of the day, it does what says it will do, but it's just one more piece of tech that will demand your time, attention, management and eventually - your money. Boo.

The Echo Dot is the coolest! It answers any question I might have without the need to go to my computer and Google my questions. I use it every day. Very easy to set up. Alexa will learn to recognize your voice in a less than minute when you set it up. You can ask any question. What's the weather like.? What time is it? Who invented the telescope?
And Alexa answers you immediately. It also can play any type of music. I often ask Alexa to play Elton John songs and the sound is fantastic. I highly recommend this item.

Inexpensive, attractive design. If you don't have Amazon prime, here are some features you can still use with Alexa: alarm clock, "thunderstorm noises" or any other sound machine function, radio stations, weather, find your phone. My favorite feature is having alexa call my phone, when I'm home alone and running late for work.

Nice description, accurate to purchase. Very cheap, yet effective product. Very happy with purchase and looking forward to more items in the foreseeable future. Again, just blown away for how cheap, as in dollars this item was, expecting it to be low ball crap, when its quite the opposite. I would give it a 6 star out of 5 if I could. Highly satisfied. A+++

I had second thoughts about adding alexa to our home. Started with 2, then 3 and now 4 and 1 in our car. Best thing in the world for a forgetful person like me. I use it for everything. I really like the way I can say "Alexa good night" then the lights turn off and soft music starts playing....good way to end the day

I had to choose between three and four stars. I like the Echo Dot. The 2nd generation has terrible audio quality, but the 3rd gen is less terrible. It's louder but it definitely lacks bass. The app is horrible. Absolutely bad. Everything about it. But this is the speaker we're talking about, and it works great and as intended. It is surprisingly good at catching my quiet "Alexa".

I was very excited to get "Alexa" for me, but i never got a good chance. But on this Black Friday i decided to give to myself something cool. I installed it as soon as I opened the box, its very easy and all my family are loving it, including my 1 year old baby girl. I loved the new design, the color i picked and the size is perfect.

I would definitely recommend to my friends .

I have two Alexa Spots already, but didn't think I needed another one in my office. The Dot is small but powerful. I really like the ability to play music while I work, or play music all over the house with the other Spots connected. Good job in making a very nice product with excellent sound. I have a Bose system, and the sound is equal to the quality. Very happy with the product.

reviews.reviewTitle: What? You don’t have this yet? Get one!
reviews.reviewText:
I’m hooked. Learning daily, connects easy to make lights on and off , will work
With security system. Sounds nice for music or to listen to a book . Will need to add a hub .

Kids love Alexa. I've heard the Chicken Nugget song a few too many times, but its better than them watching screens. Plays my playlists from Amazon Music. Good sound quality. Fun trivia games and Alexa is good with weather, reminders, lists and more. Great addition to our living room. It's probably going on vacation with us.

reviews.reviewTitle: It's actually a great little speaker
reviews.reviewText:
At a fair price you get a decent speaker that connects you with Alexa and its feedback. There is not much to say that hasn't already been said..it's not great for music but it's ok if you want to play some random songs from time to time...maybe not for actual music playback but it's what you need to check out a song.
Quality is fine and way improved from the previous generation.

I received this because I signed up for a subscription to Sirius. I initially tried to use it but it would not cooperate at all and too difficult to use. . In the time it takes me to give it a "command" I could have done it myself. Funny, no one in my family wanted my brand new Echo so I donated it to Goodwill.

reviews.reviewTitle: Improved but Alexa seems to be losing her mind
reviews.reviewText: This third generation Dot is a big improvement over the second generation. It's much more solid, looks better and has a much improved speaker. Still, Alexa seems to be losing her mind. Commands seem to misunderstood more and more often which is very annoying. This is true on all Alexa devices.

I never had an Alexa product before this so I didn’t really know what to expect, but I love it! It’s impressively responsive and the range from which it can hear and respond to my voice is surprising as well. I’m also very impressed with the customization options as well as all the extra add ons you can equip it with to make it pretty much cater to your every need! Whether you’re trying to get a start in turning your home into a smart home or just want to have a good all-in-one virtual assistant, I would highly recommend this!

reviews.reviewTitle: Ridiculous how useful this little gadget has become. Nice sound for its size.
reviews.reviewText: Use it daily for music, news, weather, podcasts, etc. It's amazing how fast I've incorporated it in my daily routine. I love using it to control my Fire TV stick, especially. The sound quality is quite nice for its size and I'm already looking at the other Echo products and thinking of adding smart home appliances all over the house. Awesome little smart speaker. Can't recommend it enough.

Honestly I just got this to use as an alarm and for meditation, but finding out everything it can do made me super happy. I love my echo and its features. It definitely has made my life easier when I am up and moving around in the mornings. Checking weather, the time, setting my alarms, and playing music are apart of my morning routine.

This is my first Echo product, but I absolutely love that I can listen to more than just music. I've used it for reminders, audio books, music, the weather, and shopping lists ever since I received it. Absolutely love it. Never knew how much I actually could benefit from having an Echo in my home.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great device but so buggy when pairing
reviews.reviewText: I really love the echo devices and have used a few in the past but one thing I've always had in common is difficulty in pairing. It always seems to be a different issue but eventually works just trying the same thing over and over. Otherwise, amazing product. Hopefully they figure out the pairing better

It’s fun, prolly spying on my family.. This thing is insanely “liberal/left”!!! Ask it if Who Jesus is!! Then Ask who is Mohammad!! Just sayin’! Wow!! google has a more scientific and correct programming; I would go w/ google if I was to buy again

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa’s vast range of knowledge ..... also voice controlled!!
reviews.reviewText:
I am ‘over the moon’ with this!! I listen to Alexa...pretty much all day.... she plays any genre that I want...which can vary from day to day.
I am an artist and like to listen just music versus a radio station..... plus , I can ask all sorts of questions !! I could not be more pleased with this product..at 73 years old... I am in 7th heaven!!

I got another Echo for my aging mother. We went to activate it and it needed my Amazon user and password, then an encrypted code we could not see well, and tried to enter 4 times, then it had to text an encrypted code!!! COME ON!!! I want an Amazon account that is simpler to link to, less passwords, encryption and all that. We were up and downstairs, looking for a phone that was not charged, took an insane amount of time and aggravation in the name of "security." Yeah. It is so secure we can't use the damn thing.

reviews.reviewTitle: We bought two of these on prime day!!
reviews.reviewText: These are loved by everyone in my family from my husband, to my preteen boys, to my 1.5 year old. They do so many cool things. We have bought plugs and light switches to work with them. My one year old tries to get it to play baby shark for her. I use it for music, calling my kids room, grocery lists and general questions.

Sounds good, for such a small package... We usually just use it for Jeopardy, as a timer, white noise, or background music, because when asked a question she says "hmmm... I don't know that" or gives irrelevant info from wiki. Still a cool thing, even though she listens to my boring conversations and never laughs at my jokes

reviews.reviewTitle: Not as good as Google Home Dot
reviews.reviewText: Compared to Google Home Dot, Echo falls quite short in all areas, except integration with its own proprietary products. Echo's worst performance is understanding speech consistently and flexibility in "intelligence" to respond adequately. I returned my four echos and went back to Google Homes. There is just no comparison; Google is better. I wish that Amazon also sold Google Home, instead of blocking it because it competes too well with their own Echo.

reviews.reviewTitle: Cool beta product - no more, no less
reviews.reviewText: Seems like some kind of beta product that is fun to play with when working but there's no reliability. I have a couple of echo dots in the same room playing as a stereo pair. But one of them stops frequently and sometimes they both stop and this happens far too often to be considered a stable product

I love the Echo and alexa app. My sister gave it to us as a gift and it has been a fun present. We live I. The country and had to update our router as the echo uses more bandwidth than we could spare. Since the upgrade, we bought a second echo for our bedroom to control our lighting and bed heated blanket. We did need to buy wifi light bulbs and some wifi outlet for select devices.

It works as a paper weight and an alarm clock, but now that I've created a group for multi-room music my main Alex in the livingroom will randomly stop playing, start again on the next song, then stop again, and repeat. It's beyond aggravating, since multi room music is the only reason that I bought an additional device.

reviews.reviewTitle: Haven't been able to set this up. Got It setup! Yeah!
reviews.reviewText: Update:Have no problem with the 2nd gen setup . Remove the 2nd gen and reinstalled just to see so it must be the 3 rd gen issue. I'll try again but don't have much hope for this one. It's tech , waited and tried later and setup was a breeze. Sometimes you just walk away then come back later and like magic it works! So glad now have to setup the one I gave the kids for Christmas

I really like this echo dot. Initially didn't think I would need something like this, but after talking with family who has this it's best thing from amazon. Since I can't afford an assistant to remind of things, I simply ask the echo dot. I also like that I can get music of any genre. I think I might get another one for downstairs as well as to control lighting.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very easy to set up and fun to have with a group of people.
reviews.reviewText: Definitely an improvement from the echo dot 2 sound quality is better. Looks much better. And now that she can do more things than she did from the beginning it gets even better. Though she freaks me out from time to time when she talks without being asked anything but definitely a cool thing because it makes us all laugh. I definitely recommend this gadget the echo Dot 3.

reviews.reviewTitle: Can't live without out my echo!
reviews.reviewText: I bought this because I wanted to see what the hype was all about. I didn't think that I would use it much but it was worth trying it out for the price. My kids love it, they have Alexa read them stories, ask questions and play quiz games on with her. Me.. I have went full tech, I've now purchased smart plugs and bulbs and I am able to set timers for all of these things which I love!

I received this as a gift. I have been an Apple user since iPhone 4 came out so I am really only comfortable with Apple products. But I set it up, just not really sure what this thing can do for me that my iPhone 8+ can’t and hasn’t been doing for me forever. Guess I just need to use it more, learn it and see how it can benefit me. But so far everything works, at least when I have used it.

Great price if you don't want the big speaker for a full size Alexa. I have a 1st generation alexa in the living area we use for multiple purposes. This dot is for my son for his room. I have already purchased one for my room. I use it for my morning alarm, ask what time it is when the room is dark (no more alarm clocks), play music through my phone or on its own, ck the weather....

When I am working around the house, pretty much every day, I HAVE to have music playing. Therefore, Alexa keeps a smile on my face while I'm working. I'm sure I'm not using "her" for nearly everything "she" can do. I like to check the outside temperature and the weather report. I really need to check out all the other things "she" can do.

Before my current Alexa, I had the much taller one. Having the smaller one is really great. I never feel like I am alone with "her" here. I don't know for sure but I believe that if I fell in the house or had some other accident when my husband wasn't home, I am sure that Alexa could call 9-1-1 for me.

Whoever came up with Alexa - that person did a truly wonderful thing and I thank that person very much.

Susie

I never thought I'd get something like this, but they're so handy. I can find out the weather, ask questions, play music, and so much more. I just hooked up a new "smart" thermostat to it today. The speaker quality in these little units is a lot better than I expected. There's a lot of stuff I know I haven't tried on them yet, and they're bringing out new options for them all the time. Maybe a nice Christmas present is in your future!

Helpful and neat is about all I can say. She says she doesn't work for the CIA but that's exactly what you'd expect someone to say if they did. All kidding aside it is a cool and helpful item to have. I'll keep it until it starts talking to itself.

My grown kids bought me an Echo Dot for Christmas. I loved it so much that I bought 2 more for other areas of my home. I have one for my bedroom and I love that I can simply say, "Alexa...set an alarm for tomorrow for 5:30 Am or "Alexa, Remind me to____________." It will then give me my reminder at the time that I tell it too. I love being able to listen pretty much any song on demand.

reviews.reviewTitle: What a fun and interesting bit of technology.
reviews.reviewText: This was actually given to my husband for Christmas, and I've never seen him so excited about a Christmas gift. He loves asking Alexa to play his favorite songs, tell him what's going on in the world, asking about the weather forecast, and even asking Alexa what time it is. There's no end to what this small, compact bit of technology can do for you. He and I strongly endorse it.

Fantastic, the speaker is better than you would think, the packaging and finish quality is amazing, the convenience of connection to smart plugs, to Thermostat, to Doorbell...all great. The ease of just saying 'Alexa' what is the national news, 'Alexa' what is the sport news today. Very good, makes you appreciate living in 2019.

This is my 2nd one for my bedroom bc I loved the one in my kitchen so much! Love all my different list Alexa sets up for me and easily accessed through the app. Also the sound quality is great...love telling her to find different genres of music and she gets my day started. If you don’t have one, you’re definitely missing out!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: These Echos have made my life easier.
reviews.reviewText: We have several and we use them with smart plugs, use them as timers and most recently we use them to adjust the thermostats. They have been fun to have around whether they tell a corny joke or let us know what the weather is like. But was is really great is that you can use them as communication devices from one to another. I would recommend people to get them for elderly parents that are not tech savvy. I put one at my 84 year mothers house and one day she fell and could not get to the phone. She told Alexa to call me and I was able to get to her and call an ambulance. I am so happy that I found these devices .

This is the first echo I've had and I'm really happy with it. At the time I ordered the Echo 3rd generation I thought the sound coming from it would be minimal so I ordered a bluetooth speaker to use with it. The Echo has such a good sound by itself I've never used the speaker. The Echo does some amazing things. I'm ordering another one for my bedroom Black Friday when they are on sale.

I purchased another ECHO. This is probably the best purchase/treat Ive given myself. For a small amount of money, I can listen to all the music I love anytime I want. I sometimes just cant believe it. I finally figured out I can hear my Alexa in my car and while sitting at the beach!! Thank you AMAZON!!!! You're the BEST!!!!

A very helpful device. Our dog gets anxious with wind & thunderstorms, we have the dot in our bedroom, we play soft calming music for her, it allows all of us to get some sleep! It is great to have one on each end of the house to update our shopping list as needed, great to ask for the forecast to start the day. Great to keep our dog company while we are out.

We purchased two of these to go along with our Ring doorbell and found so much more in it we love to use.
I have a teen and it comes in hand for her to play her music on, books, weather, use for calling hands free and also for us to drop in on her rather then yelling or climbing up and down the stairs for her. My husband not being so tech savvy enjoys alot of features with only a voice command. We are still exploring the endless things you can do with this small gadget.
The sound quality is great for being so small. Its easy to setup and fun to explored the endless abilities and uses for the dot. There are a variety of great add ons you can get to tailor your dot for each person.

reviews.reviewTitle: Another great dot, better sound and overall quality product
reviews.reviewText: Bought this to add to our family home, it's better then the 2nd gen, it's sleek, a little more weighted, better sound quality and picks up your voice better, makes it nice to drop into a room, overall very satisfied and for the price can't beat it, they are improving the dot every time, definitely recommend and would buy another.

Better sound quality and the rest is pretty much the same. I don't like that they drop the usb plug at all. To me it kills it's portability factor over the earlier dots. Not sure why they made that call. Luckily I have 5 2nd gen to meet my other needs. With the other I can power them off a USB battery and take then with me wherever I go around the house or outside and you just can't do that with this 3rd gen. Still asside from that they are the same and the sound is a bit better.

I have three gen 2 echo dots and this one is a huge improvement. The sound upgrade is extremely noticeable and sounds so much better. I would suggest this to anyone looking to add smart home functionality to their home. Its on the cheap side but packs a punch and works so much better than the last generation ones. It is able to hear speech much easier without having to yell at it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not as good as the 2nd Gen
reviews.reviewText: I was super excited to get the newest generation and the sound is better but overall I don't feel like this version picks up my voice very well at all, we have to call it several times and be very close, not to mention anytime timers go off and we say end timer, it says "there are no timers set" as the "alarm" is going off. I'm not sure if ours is defective but I'm not impressed.

reviews.reviewTitle: Amazing device with shockingly excellent sound
reviews.reviewText: I bought the 3rd gen dot as part of a great cyber deal, thinking i had little to lose. What I did't realize was how fantastic this device is. One gets all the technology of an echo in a very small footprint. The sound quality is truly remarkable. I'm still learning all the ways to use the echo. I love being able to tell alexa to play certain music and it starts immediately.

reviews.reviewTitle: These devices are excellent for learning new things.
reviews.reviewText:
I actually like the sound of my 1st generation echo dot better than this 3rd generation device. However, I do like the greater sound volume that the 3rd generation has.
The 3rd generation device has more bass, which almost sounds artificially augmented. All of these A.I. devices are still quite amazing, and they are fun to use. I get my fun fact of the day every morning. And I enjoy playing Jeopardy, but use it mostly to enjoy my music!
I have already mentioned and recommended these devices to family and friends! I love them!

Was very easy to set up and easy to use right off the bat. As Alexa is still learning, she doesn't always recognize a command. When playing games through the device, it never lets you stop the game no matter how many comands you tell her to stop and I either have to press the Alexa button on the top and have even had to unplug the device a few times for her to stop what she's doing. Overall it has come in handy and it gets better each day. Just needs to learn to stop certain skills/processes when asked too.

I was hesitant to get my dot for a while but I finally caved. I got a really good deal on it and it's perfect for what I need. I can listen to my audible books, music, and give myself reminders throughout the day. I recently bought wifi plugs and I love that I can now use my dot to control the devices in my room.

This is our second Alexa Dot purchase... bought one for my daughter a while back and have been wanting one for myself, so when this deal came up, I jumped on it! Crystal clear sound... this little thing holds it's own. Loads of usage for various information and music. Very happy with these purchases.

Was given this Dot as a gift, having a hard time finding a real use for it without "making work" for the thing. I use a smart phone and useful apps, takes more time to involve the Dot in queries than its worth - just my opinion.

My family just bought us the Echo Dot 3rd generation speaker for my birthday and holy crap, this speaker is awesome! I would definitely go for an upgrade because of the additional subwoofer and now it's what we want for Christmas. The quality of this speaker is excellent and sound is surround sound from such a tiny speaker. Easy to connect music apps like Pandora and operate the Alexa App. Finally, our phones will not get wet while in the shower. Now we just shout "Echo, next song" or "Echo, play Sublime Radio or any artist of choice" while using the Pandora app through the Alexa app.

I purchased 6 of these new 3rd generation devices. I now have whole house sound plus Alexa functions in each room. The sound may not be quite as good as a Sonos system but for less than $150 it is fantastic from a price to sound quality ratio. We had a 2nd generation device and there is no comparison in sound. That device is now in our garage.

I got this gen 3 eco dot as a prime day deal. It came free with the purchase of a ring doorbell. I'm not new when it comes to the amazon eco dot. I actually own the 1st and 2nd gen eco dot as well. What I can tell you is that the sound quality of the gen 3 is much better. I also like the fabric exterior design.

Alexa is great! I fall in love with her as soon as I got her but on so many times, she is really testing my patience! She seemed like deaf! I have to yell and asked her multiple times to do a task before she hears me! I’m like, omg!! Pleaseeeeeee stop! Aside of that she would of been the greatest of greatest but she’s really deaf! I need to yell at her almost every day every minute and constantly! Arghhh 🤦‍♀️

reviews.reviewTitle: Better than the google home mini
reviews.reviewText:
For the small size, the sound quality is clear and fills up my entire bedroom. Easy to command with the phrase "Alexa" and syncs will with services like Spotify. Set up is easy with the Alexa app and painless to use opposed to the google home mini which is a hit or miss on setup.

My only gripe with this product is sometimes if you are too far away, might not detect your voice, but that's like 1/10 times.

I like having Alexa answer my questions and play question of the day. The echo dot is small but well built. It responds well. I had a bit of difficulty connecting, but worked it out myself. Thinking of getting another as an intercom type system to connect upstairs and down without yelling. Definitely worth the price!

Got Amazon's great deal on this. Works great and easy to swap out with previous model. She will still start talking when not asked anything which is strange to me. Seems on some issues you have to ask the question in a very clear uncomplicated manner before she can get the right answer. Over all I love it.

My husband told me to get a girlfriend to talk to, so I got Alexa, & she listens to me. She tells me what date or time it is when I can't see the clock. She tells me if & when it's going to rain. She plays my favorite Montovani music & old songs from my past. She gives me daily reminders, but most of all, when I can't find my cell phone, I ask her to call me & then I find where I left my phone.
