She'll even call my husband if he doesn't hear me when he's in another room. She's my new best friend!!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: The speaker is starting to go. It's only 2 months old.
reviews.reviewText: I bout this item in July during their Prime sale. Just the other day I was listening to it and the speaker gotball crackly on me. I believe the speaker went on it already. Not to happy. Not sure how to get intouch with them and let them know that I dont want a refund I just wanna exchange it. My daughter has kne and hasn't had a problem with hers. I feel theres a defect with mine.

This makes me lazy, therefore I appreciate it. Most used function is Timer and Spotify. I’m laying in bed and must be up in an hour, instead of wasting precious sleep by putting an alarm on my phone, I simply ask Alexa to wake me up in X amount of time and she does. Hooray! She plays the music I ask her to, and playlists. Tells me the weather, helps me make lists. That’s only the surface, it does WAY more. P.S. if you ask her what a whale sounds like, be sure to turn the volume down first.

I can't say enough positive things about the Echo Dot. I thought I would just use it for music, and the sound is wonderful, but I use it every day for so many other things, as well. I love that I can look in my refrigerator and without picking up my phone, just call out to Alexa and ask to have each item added to my grocery list. I love that I can use it to set multiple, specific alarms. I love that I don't have to pick up my remote for the television, and can launch shows directly from the Echo Dot. In fact, it was such a great value and I use it so much, I bought a second one, and I have decided to purchase one for each room of the house. I would highly recommend this without hesitation.

I like the fact that it can be used anywhere there is wifi We have three. One in the man cave, one in the living room and one in the kitchen. I like to play music when I cook. The one in the living room is for entertaining guests and the one in the man cave is used for flash briefings in the morning, and news in the afternoon. Amazon keeps coming up with new things to use it for.

We have 3 - 2nd generation Echo dots, and one of the 3rd gen. I always thought the sound on the dots was pretty good
considering it’s small size. But, the new one is louder, and sounds more like a stereo. I love the sound, but am not a fan of the speaking voice. I wish we had options to change the voice.

I like the small size.. But with small size comes small sound. When I turn the volume completely up you still can't hear in the next room... Disappointing:-(.. I also think the volume control was better on my first Echo , on this one you actually have to walk up to it if you want turn the volume up or down by hand. I know you can just tell Alexa to turn up the volume, but sometimes you would have to tell her a few times before you got to the volume you want.

The 3rd Gen Echo Dot definitely has a better quality look. The upgraded speaker is also better for listening to music. The reason for giving the 3G 4 stars is because the audio is more muffled and not as clear when Alexa speaks as it is on my 2nd Gen device. Also, when I tried the equalizer controls on the Alexa App, I could not discern any difference in the quality of the audio.

We have used the heck out of this and finally ordered another one for my granddaughter's room. I use it the most...Alexa, what is the weather for today? Alexa, play the Eagles! Alexa, what is the name of the actress who played Scarlet in Gone With the Wind? The list is endless. Alexa, turn out the light. Now, that takes a little plug in, but that is SO handy.

I have dozens of Echo devices. I got the 3rd generation Echo dot as a free item and it is far superior to the previous model. The sound is much better and deeper and the ability to do a stereo pair is a bonus. I noticed that Alexa inquiries are also a bit faster. The microphone seems a bit better and my 3rd generation Echos seem to understand me a bit better.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works great, sound could be better, not super intuitive at first.
reviews.reviewText: These aren't BOSE speakers, but it's great to have synced music throughout the house, and we're definitely happy with them (we actually bought 3). Suggest going online for info about syncing, grouping, etc., as the instructions that come with the Dot are minimal. Especially important if you want to sync with your music account (like Spotify).

My brother gifted it to my mom and me. I had seen it on the commercials and thought it was cool but never really saw a need for it. Now that we have it, I see how awesome it is to have! The sound quality is more than exceeded my expectations! We have it in the kitchen and it's great to have for music while we're in there cooking. I'm still learning all the different things it can do but it's great. Highly recommend. Looking to see how else I can incorporate Alexa with the rest of our house.

After having to turn off my Wi-Fi to add the router to the Dot, setup was easy, but it would not complete setup when the Wi-Fi was on. Otherwise, it works great, the sound quality is very good, better than expected. I listen to streaming classical music from various public radio stations, all you have to do is ask Alexa to play VPR Classical or WMNR.

My son got this for us, and he set it up a couple of weeks ago. I don’t use it every day, but when extended family is over, we have had a lot of fun with Alexa. Learning how to ask the question is important, so Alexa can accurately answer it. Alexa is not easily offended. I highly recommend getting one. I hope to engage her more for reminders, etc. go get on. You won’t regret it.

When I bought this device I was not expecting much for the 25 USD I payed... but It's a really cool gadget. The only problem is that in my region (Chile) there are a lot of features that can't be used, such as searching for a local business and stuff like that. Also I notice that a lot of Alexa skills are made specifically for US residents or they dont work well in Spanish speaking countries (I could never get to open the front door by voice command even tho August Smart lock skill is enabled and configured). Other than that the device is super responsive and with the aux output connection it lets you plug a good pair of speakers to it which is a must for me. Now I find myself using ir every day mainly for hearing to music and turning on and off the lights.

After a brief set of instructions to follow to set up, this speaker has become one of the best additions to our home. I bought a total of 4 of this exact speaker, because my teenage kids and parents all wanted mine! Check the weather, the score of a ball game, ask for a recipe, create a shopping list and of course play high quality sounding music. I would definitely purchase this speaker again.

I travel a lot and wanted this to play music in the hotels it won’t connect to hotel WiFi and I can’t even get it to connect to my iPhone to be used as just a speaker without connecting to WiFi! Waste of money for me

Love the Echo so much. This is actually our second one as we found the first one so helpful. We can listen to music from our Amazon Music Unlimited or ITunes, check the weather verbally, set kitchen timers, even send messages from other rooms. It’s great.

My only drawback is you can only (as far as we can tell) have one phone linked to the speaker at a time. So we needed two in order for both myself and my hubby to have full integration. Having a second one for a different room isn’t a great hardship tho.

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo not connecting to Alexa App
reviews.reviewText: Got this a few weeks ago. Was listening to music the speaker sounded distorted by 1 week of use. I don’t use it much either. Then 10 min later the sound was good. Having a very hard time connecting to Alexa app. Keep registering and says connected but when trying to view my alarms, it’s not showing and the alarms does not go off in a.m. is this a issue with this Echo. I didn’t order a refurbished one.

reviews.reviewTitle: Disappointing and frustrating sums up this device.
reviews.reviewText: Okay as a Bluetooth speaker but otherwise useless. Doesn’t stay “online” even though no other devices have this issue in my home. Constantly says “to try gain later or I don’t understand”. Further on the rare occasion Alexa responds it is with information that has nothing to do with what was asked/commanded. Lastly, you need too be willing to give all your privacy away to use this device. Was a gift but one I’ve found to be highly disappointing.

reviews.reviewTitle: How have I survived without a Dot?!?
reviews.reviewText: We bought everyone in the house an Echo Dot for Christmas - I was getting tired of yelling upstairs when dinner was ready, and the kids not being able to hear me. All of the dots are connected and we just need to tell Alexa to "make an announcement" and all of the kids get the announcement in their room - it's freaking genius! We also love asking for a song, and it gets played right there! How did we live without this?!?!

reviews.reviewTitle: Gen 3 is a bit smarter than gen 2...
reviews.reviewText: An hour ago I asked the echo in the bedroom to tell me the weather forecast and she was hellbent on telling me what games she could play. The gen 3 dot is in the living room, connected to our stereo. She seems to have more on the ball; she can do drop-ins, play podcasts, and find my playlists--all the things that give our gen 2 dots the vapors.

reviews.reviewTitle: Power Adapter Is One Step Back
reviews.reviewText: In comparison to the 2nd gen dot, they have come a long way! The overall quality of the 3rd gen is much improved. The only downside to this upgrade for me has been the new power adapter. Not only is the cable too short, but the plug is too fat. I’m now looking to find a way to extend or replace the power cord. I would have been happier to have seen USB-C power the 3rd gen dot.

I've only had this speaker for a few months, and the speaker is already blown. Speakers should not have a volume capacity that will destroy them. If Max volume would blow the speaker, they should lower the max volume. Im upset, I never would have played on Max volume if i knew it would blow the speaker, and Ive only played it that loud twice

I love it so much. Shopping made easy. Music of my choice anytime I want it. Makes planning and running a party so much easier. I do have one concern... the google and Alexia items have been blocked from our distric WiFi do to confidentiality issue. I run a beautiful and living home so I really don’t worry about what it hears or records but the fact that it can is still kind of invasive.

Cool thing to mess around and have fun with. Some of the skills are half-baked but there are some very helpful ones that are pretty mindblowing. Devices like this will be a major part of our lives in the coming future. Good sound quality. I will be getting a couple more of them for other rooms.

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect for adults with a disability
reviews.reviewText: This is working perfect for my adult son who has autism. He can call me using the Alexa by saying Alexa call Mom. Alarm feature is perfect for reminders and it even works with our microwave, so he can heat his dinner. He asks it questions and it understands him even though his speech is not clear due to his disability. This technology is much needed for the disabled. Thank you

I was pleasantly surprised with the good sound from such a small speaker. I had already downloaded the Alexa app before receiving my Echo Dot so all I had to do was plug it in and the setup was complete. I use it in my back room to get news in the morning along with my cup of coffee. I haven’t had any problems with Alexa responding to my requests.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great speaker, worth upgrading. It's not the ideal music speaker
reviews.reviewText:
I liked that the speaker amplifies sound better than previous models. Also the sensor picks up from far away, but doesn't pick up too much i.e turning on randomly

Overall it's a great product. The only con would be the bass is a little off. This could be because I have mounted it. The bass sounds a little fake

reviews.reviewTitle: Like it and planning to buy another!
reviews.reviewText: Love all the features and still discovering many of the options. The sound is great and I love the portability. Might be nice to have an alternative option to “plug in mode” though. Planning to buy aother for the garage. My husband likes being able to request his music etc. without having to stop what he’s doing. Very pleased with this purchase.

I love all the new things Alexa can do. I can arm my security system with it and put it into a guard mode, essentially turning it into a part of my system. This allows it to listen for the sound of smoke and co detectors, as well as glass breaking when the system is armed and notify you or, if you choose, your monitoring company. Such a cool and awesome feature

reviews.reviewTitle: First experience with AI and having alot of fun.
reviews.reviewText: This is my first time interacting with AI on a regular basis. Still learning everything she can do and having alot of fun doing it. So far I have set alarms and timers, played music requests, played audio books, played a trivia game, played Tic Tac Toe, asked her to tell me a joke, used her as a dictionary and thesaurus, asked her goofy trivia questions, and the list goes on and on. I may never learn everything she can do, but as I said, I'm having alot of fun learning what I can.

I have 3 of them now they work great & sync well w/ each other. I have music playing throughout the house. They did hookup easier than the 1st gen. But whoever that would talk to the 1st gen is wrong, I installed the 1st 3rd gen w/ 2 other 1st gen, & had the music sync for all 3 in min. But the biggest seller was the sound from 3rd gen compared to the 1st gen. There no comparison, like night & day.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great to have and easy to use.
reviews.reviewText: We love our Amazon Dot smart speaker. Love to get a weather report or find the distance to another location. Use the notification feature and we are now using it to call our daughter in case of an emergency, etc. Great Hands Free devise. Must have the Internet on a computer with the app and wifi in the house. I recommend it for OLD PEOPLE...great communicator and commander and companion.

I have 3 Echoes in my house and we love it! One downstairs, one in the master bedroom, and one in my son's room. I recently bought the echo dot for my son's room and I wish it has a built in night light! One that has 3 modes with hight, medium, low and a motion section feature which you can set as ON: light is on but dimmed and when motion is detected, night light comes on full brightness; and OFF: light is off and when motion is detected, night light comes on to full brightness. I have a separate night light/speaker sound melody unit but now only use it for lighting. If I could combine that unit to the echo dot, I would have the perfect product not just for a child's bedroom, but for any bedroom! Amazon please make this happen (4th Generation perhaps?)

This is my second Echo dot, and it looks so much nicer than my old one. I like the fact that the gray makes it less obtrusive in my decor. The sound is great, and I use it daily for my music, weather, etc. It is also convenient that it works with my smart tv, especially since my husband is always losing the remote haha

Listen up Amazon i need for echo dot 4th generation to be water proof and weather resistance so i can always keep it plug up in my bathroom during a warm shower !!!
Just make this one a limited edition model lol for people like me call it echo dot 3.5 or something.

ALSO ITS YEAR 2019 I NEED ALL NEW GENERATION ECHOES TO HAVE A SAFE INFARERED SENSOR BUILT IN THEM SO THEY KNOW WHEN I ENTER INTO A ROOM !!!
MEANING WHEN I COME HOME FROM BEING OUT WORKING OR SHOPPING THE SENSOR CAN DETECT MOTION NEAR IT OR IN THE ROOM AND CAN START SAYING THE NEWS OR GIVE ME INFORMATION FROM MY CALENDAR OR SOMETHING LIKE THIS !!!!

Please get started on these ideals

A coworker recommended this product to me for smart home integration. I love it! We mostly use it to listen to music, but the quizzes are fun and getting info about shipments is helpful too. I love that its barely noticeable and that she has a great ability to hear my request from the other room. We have a small house so one is just fine. Love it.

WE got the Echo Dot for a 92 yr old woman whose memory is failing. She has a hard time keeping the day and the date straight, among other things. So instead of constantly asking her caregiver she asks Alexa. Also asks about the weather and any other thing that seems to be a conundrum.Helps with the household mood. And we are constantly discovering things Alexa can help with.

I ordered this third generation echo dot thinking it might have better sound quality than the second generation and was disappointed. Any sound that normally would have been S was distorted into SCHHHHHH which made listening to music impossible. The power cord is fixed to the plug - who dreamed of this improvement? This unit is now much less portable and takes up more outlet space than the older generation dots that utilized USP cords.
I also ordered a grey dot that I returned due to poor sound quality. The charcoal’s sound quality is good enough to keep and listen to regularly.

reviews.reviewTitle: Useful and fun gadget for the price!
reviews.reviewText: I put it in our living room and ask it random questions throughout the day. I was surprised how far away I could be from it and it still hear me. It doesn’t know everything, but impressed with what it does pull up and how fast it does it. I love using it to set reminders like “put the trash out” “call the vet tomorrow”. I use it to set alarms for my job throughout the day and when I’m cooking. Pretty fun and useful gadget for the price!

reviews.reviewTitle: Unable to use the Echo dot as a speaker for my phone as advertised
reviews.reviewText: I have had two different Echo (3rd Gen) devices sent to me this week and spent time with two very nice technicians who were not able to solve my issue. I am trying to use the Echo as a speaker for playing music and audio from my phone through bluetooth. The bluetooth hooks up fine but any audio is a garbled mess. The second "guaranteed" to work device I received didn't do any better than the first. It did not matter whether it was Audio books. pod casts or music, going through bluetooth just did not produce intelligible sound.

The echo dot is just ok. I think it's partly my fault, my expectations were so high. I thought Alexa would be like a personal little buddy. She's very mechanical, doesn't recognize requests often and her most frequent response is, "sorry, I dont know that" The echo dot just isn't as high tech as i imagined. The speaker is great tho...doesn't play songs from YouTube which is disappointing tho.

The volume control is MUCH better than previous generations. MUCH louder sound. Level 10 on the previous generation Dot is about equal to 5 or 6 on this version. You WILL need to use the app to adjust the bass level though as the stock speaker has too much bass (in my opinion). Overall it works very well.

reviews.reviewTitle: fun item to have at home.
reviews.reviewText: this is my first smart speaker and i have to say it is really cool all of the things it can do . the sound quality is great , i really enjoy sending messages to it from my phone for my kids to hear. i ask her the weather just about everyday. definetly a neat thing to have. also connects to my smart home devices and security system.

reviews.reviewTitle: Voice is muffled. Heavy bass, not adjustable.
reviews.reviewText: What a mistake. Difficult to hear the weather because her voice is loaded with bass and the alexa app controls do not affect the quality. Update months later with new 3 star rating. I discovered by accident the only way to control bass and treble is with alexa voice commands, bass down. It will take longer for me to decide is I like it.

Responds well to requests, and audio output sounds good (not exceptional, but gets the job done nicely). New features showing up all the time. For example, Amazon just added the ability to control the Xbox One via Echo Dot/Alexa. Also, I signed up for the paid music service to go along with it - totally worth it. Compares well to the Google Home mini, of which I am a fan of as well.

reviews.reviewTitle: At least understand what I am saying
reviews.reviewText: Not very loud consistently repeating myself and not just me anyone that tries it. Games are ok when they understand you otherwise you lose. Try chore chart for kids nice idea but takes way to to maybe because it doesn't understand everything. My Google assistant understands more and seems to be more adaptive. Figured I would try it but not overly impressed always yelling g at it ALEXA !! I find myself yelling at her more than my kids lately. I must have been the lucky one and got a bad one cause my kids are now awesome I yell at then less and I thought they were bad

reviews.reviewTitle: Can’t play music on multiple echos without upgrading music services!!
reviews.reviewText: Bought 3 echo dots to play music simultaneously. Disappointed to find out I don’t have the right kind of Amazon Music account to play the same song on all three devices. Not very easy to find out this information based on the sales pitch for the device. I understand upselling you music service for access to more songs but why restrict the ability to play them on your own device. Shame on Amazon for making this feature a premium one. I pay for Prime membership for the benefits but I can’t play my prime music on more than one Echo at a time??

My Echo Dot just arrived, and I'm absolutely loving it so far. The sound quality is superb and the voice recognition works all the way from across the house. I got a smart plug with it, and it's been fun getting everything to work together, which it does seamlessly.

My only wish is that it would scrobble music to Last.fm, as I love seeing my music stats and would use this for music more often if they worked together.

reviews.reviewTitle: won't connect to other devices-Smart TV smart LEd lights or Amazon Smart plug
reviews.reviewText: we have satellite internet and while the echo dot will connect to our amazon account none of our other devices we purchased will connect with it error times out then has a note on the phone must connect to broadband. very disappointed. now all i can do is play music and check on my orders and ask about the weather ...

What can I say I love this little helper. It's a handy way to gave music and assistance in most of our rooms. Love to be able to ask the weather for the day and sync them up to play our amazon music all through the house. Easy setup, plugged in, recognized all my gadgets and sound good for a little round speaker.

The third gen can hear much better than previous generations, too well. In the event you have multiple Alexa's in your house you want to change the Wake word. Also the sound quality is much better from the previous generation unit, not tinny sounding. I would still recommend hooking it up to a more substantial speaker but it works just fine in current form factor.

I don't even know where to start this product has changed everything about my routine making everything easier, I don't wake up late, I'm always on time to my meetings and on top of that I get to control my smart devices with voice. So far it has been a great investment. Looking forward to get more Alexa products.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good purchase for the home office.
reviews.reviewText: So rather that text or yell across the house I decided to get a echo dot. Like the Echo, I use for XM radio and other things that keep me entertained. Great for listing to local sports via the app, and even use it as a timer and to check on packages from amazon. Got one for my sister and mother and can call them without having to pick up the phone. Neat gadget and worth the price.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great reception and sound. Difficult installation
reviews.reviewText: This is the first echo dot I purchase. Love it’s size, has good sound. Honestly, I found it complicated to install. The installation totally depended on the app and the instructions were not clear. It was annoying and time consuming. As well as for the installation of my Bose quiet comfort 35 speakers. I’m waiting to install other speakers. Love it’s functionality and reception range thus far. I can activate it being in different rooms.

I read all the things that they say it can do and had to have one.
Now the only thing I really use it for is weather and making a call or message.
The timers and alarms never acknowledged or go off when they are supposed to.
The Skills are annoying all the ones I try are either a pain to use they won't listen or just repeat what it should do over and over. Wish it was a bundle of 2 would be much more useful just for the communication and timers if they work

I love my Echo Dots. I actually bought 3 of them and have put them in different locations.. The sound quality is great and I enjoy my music throughout the day no matter where I am in my home. Using "My Music" to create playlists, I can choose what I want to listen to and not have to depend on the radio to play what I want to hear when I want to listen.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa, how much do we like you? I’m not sure about that.
reviews.reviewText: This is perfect for a bedroom alexa or a someone wanting connection without a full range speaker. It has good sound for its size but still doesn’t sound as good as the larger echo. All in all it works fine. Even though Amazon is probably listening to our conversations we still have these things around our house. Luckily we don’t have anything to hide.

for less than $10, i'll take it. it had a little hard time recognizing my voice when music was playing, i had to yell basically. Alexa seems to found in all types of devices which is why i went with it rather than apple or google's smart devices. the echo's sound is horrible for music though.

This is the second combo I've purchased. This one has the latest version of Dot. This combo is for our permanent home. I use Echo & Echo Dot daily at our winter place. I had heard of them but experienced them for the first time while vacationing at Yosemite. Our cabin had Echo. That sold me on having my own. No regrets. I've barely scratched the surface of what she/it can do.

Returning it.
"Alexia, what is the temperature tomorrow"
Blue round bar turns on when it hears Alexia, then after you finish your sentence the blue bar just flashes blue and white. Nothing happens. Alexia says nothing .
This is what it does most of the time.
Returning. If I have to troubleshoot it right out of the box , it's not worth my time .

It does work when I press the On button . But after the blue light turns off and you wake it up with 'Alexia' , it does nothing .

Love the new echo dot. I received a 1st Gen one years back as a gift and was not a fan. In doing my research for an affordable way to play music throughout my house I decided to try the 3rd Gen. It is fantastic. No the sound isn't as good as the Echo but it is still wonderful. Alexa is more intelligent than previous versions. I highly recommend the new echo dot.

I've had the previous generation dot (2) and I have to say the third generation's speaker is far better: it's louder and more robust. The speaker actually better than the second gen echo, for a fraction of the price. The treble is a little lacking in the dot 3, but the power boost from the previous generation is a big improvement. The design update is a big plus as well.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great but your kids will drive you crazy with it.
reviews.reviewText: Poor Alexa! If you have children like mine they probably torment Alexa but she’s Alexa, not Siri so she won’t stop communicating with you if you tell her you hate her; so it works out. I love this speaker! We listen to audiobooks, a wide variety of music, control the lights, set cooking timers, set alarms to wake us in the morning... What can’t I do with it? Add one plus one to the one millionth power or whatever ridiculous number my son was trying to come up with. That’s about the only thing I can’t do with it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great except for the wake word choices
reviews.reviewText:
She's cool and pretty helpful but I wish you could actually choose what the name for it is instead of choosing between "Alexa", "Echo", "Computer" and "Amazon".

The only one out of the four that aren't a commonly used word in our home is Echo but I'd still prefer to give it a name that is even less common.

So far this has been totally worthless. They sent an email with instructions in Chinese/Japanese with no way to translate. The set up directions that come in the box are vague and appear to be incomplete. Nothing is intuitive. It appears to be another gadget that is more trouble than helpful. Don't bother with it.

I never got on board with the Echo Dots or Alexa when these devices first came out. I did not like the design, or did not think I would actually use it. But now that they have updated the design to look more sleek and modern, and added so much functionality, I decided to purchase one. Actually 4. These are great products, I am continuing to learn something new about them every day, and they're fun! They have games, facts, Alexa will tell you jokes, set reminders for you, set alarms for you, and can even send alerts when something happens in your house while you're away, such as glass breaking. Great quality and great fun!

The process is not as easy as it seems when you have a iPhone. I have Apple Music and pandora and it’s a pain trying to sync your account to the Alexa app. I’ve been trying for two days and when I try to log into my account for Apple Music it won’t let me, it sends me to a “website” and it just keeps buffering so that’s my only issue so far.

I’ve had the Echo Dot since November 23rd. So far I’m still learning however it’s been really easy to use! I have found that it does take a little patience setting different devices up & learning what you can & cant set up!( however thats b/c I’m technologically challenged!!) Example: if you don’t have a “ true Smart Tv” you may need to get “ smart plugs if you’d like to turn your tv on/off by voice command via Alexa! So those type of things! However overall review I give the Echo Dot 3rd generation 5 stars it’s a great product! It will connect with a variety of devices/ smart devices to make not only you but your home feel modern as well as more functional!
Also it’s nice to just sit at home sometimes & say “ Alexa play the Eagles and sit back and enjoy the Eagles greatest hits, of course you’ll have to sign up for amazon prime but hey you’ve gone this far haven’t you?

We have had experience with both Google Home and Alexa. Alexa does not understand the simple commands or questions we ask her. We have tried to "teach" her and follow the instructions for integration, but it is not intuitive or easy to understand. We unfortunately cannot return her because it's been more than 30 days since we purchased.

Google home can actually play podcasts, understand our commands, and is much more intuitive to use than Alexa - we regret buying Alexa!

Love it! But amazon needs to STOP tacking on addl fees to have Amazon Unlimited Music on multiple echo devices! This is greedy and bordering on price gouging! I already pay the expanded fee for amazon music and Amazon Prime so STOP trying to milk more $$ from your customers when you are already making billions! Remember customers have other Online shopping options that are getting REALLY good!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Much better device than the previous Echo Dot
reviews.reviewText: Vast improvement in this device from the previous generation. It is actually has a speaker that is worth listening to without using external speakers. Granted, I would still recommend wired or Bluetooth speaker if you are using this for music, at least it doesn't sound like it is coming from a tin can. Voice recognition appears to be good as I have had no issues with it failing to understand my command (when it is a command that makes sense!). Integrating it with the app and other appliances / devices has worked well as well. I really don't have any complaints.

I love the ease of use that Alexa provides.... okay, some call it being lazy, but I can ask her questions about the weather, geography and such and get my answer in seconds. The ability to play music "on demand" is neat, too!

The Echo Dot is so much fun that our great-granddaughter took our second one home so she can have one in her bedroom!!

We're looking at integrating the Dot into more of our household life.

reviews.reviewTitle: Connecting to everything is NOT easy
reviews.reviewText: I am still trying to connect to me home monitoring by Hive and having issues. Not sure what it can do for me with the television. I know it will not turn it on, but what will it do? I can get it to play my music and that is about all that I do with it. Don't understand why it just shuts the music off without my telling it to.

We’ve been using the dot for awhile after scoring it for only $1. We’re loving it, even my husband who didn’t even want one. My parents even bought one after playing with ours. We’re currently waiting for the Echo Show and the Echo Show 5 for other rooms in our home. We love it’s speaker to play music whenever we please, that it’s paired with our calendars, and that it makes the grocery list for me.

Ordered this while it was on sale, as a second dot in the house. Integration and app install was easy and it works great. I like the design of the dot we bought in 2016 (this version is a little bulky) and the sound quality doesn't seem as good. However, for the money and having a second dot in the house, it works great for the purpose.

I use my dot for numerous things like getting the news, weather/temperature, recipes, answers to questions and a quick weird joke when I need a smile. My family likes to play games with “Alexa”. The greatest feature is adding items to my shopping list whenever I think of something I need to buy. When I get to the store I just open the app and check off the items as I place them in my cart, Alexa doesn’t let me forget anything! I also love being able to leave myself reminders and telling Alexa to add appointments to my calendar. My elderly father lives with us and he is able to listen to his favorite songs just by asking Alexa to play them. I have echo dots in almost every room and I don’t know what I have done without them all my life!

A great first step to a smart house. Alexa is fun and functional, very easy to set up and use. Sometimes she doesn't perform as well, her mics don't always pick up your voice. It's an exciting and functional product though - no need to keep lists anymore (and everyone in the family can add to them). DEFINITELY invest in some plugs or power strips. A ring doorbell is another good step

I don’t know if it’s just me or what but this is so confusing. I’ve tried to have my teenagers try to figure it out and they have struggled with it also. We now have two but can’t figure out how to get them to work properly. Not worth it to us. Update: they actually call and help. Wasn’t expecting that.

Speakers sound fuzzy sporadically while listening to music regardless if the volume level. I usually have the volume set to 2. I've found skipping the song, or adjusting the volume may get rid of it for a bit. But it is annoying and unexpected.

This is my third Aexa device to own. It's really cool. The look is stylish and sleek. Th sound quality is good, and it works just like the regular Echo. It's great to have when you just need an extra Echo in another room. The Dot is inexpensive and when you need more Echo devices, it's the smart choice.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love it, more customizable names please!
reviews.reviewText:
I would like to be able to customize the wake name other than the four options. I have an adult handicap person who like Alexa however she can’t say it. It would be real nice to be able to use a name or word she can say.

Having said the above we love being able to use the music for this person to use to go to sleep by and automatically cut off.

It was worth the purchase.

I got this with my Alexa microwave during Prime Days. It sounds better than my original first edition tall Echo. I'm buying another one to replace one of my old Echo Dots since it has much improved sound. Of course it's not as good as Echo Plus (which I just got and love), but it certainly is affordable on sale!

reviews.reviewTitle: Speaker definitely better--Mic not so much
reviews.reviewText: I have 2 of the 2nd gen dots and I replaced one with this. This is certainly an upgrade in audio quality! It is louder and sounds much better. I would definitely recommend it over the older dot. I am giving it 4 stars only because I feel like the microphone is less sensitive than the 2nd gen. This new version, while still decent, is not quite as responsive when being spoken to from a distance.

reviews.reviewTitle: same as 2nd gen, do not understand my request
reviews.reviewText: I though i'll have a better response from this 3rd gen echo dot.... but no same as 2nd, hard to get what i want from it... alexa is not understanding most of my request fail about 40% of the times, i tried now the google home mini, and difference is abismal in understanding talk, google home mini get me 98%... the problem is that google home cant control my fire tv....

This is my second Alexa. I have enjoyed the first one very much as she's been my "GIRL FRIDAY" as I have her set reminders many times throughout my day, play music, give me notifications of package deliveries, etc. The second Alexa does all those things for me upstairs. I love the way it looks and blends in with my newly decorated bedroom/office! She recognizes my voice, and adjusts the sound as I request. Music sounds good. Very satisfied with BOTH my Alexa helpers!!

reviews.reviewTitle: I know she will be fun to have answer questions & amuse me!
reviews.reviewText: Well I have to be up front, Alexa arrived when I was sick and as soon as I felt better I went to a family member’s house for the week, still there! Not much to report now......After I returned home I got busy with Alexa! I love it, I have her remind me when it’s time for medication, she’s good at knowing the weather! She’s great at playing music, telling jokes, as my assistant when I’m cooking (how many of this equals that, etc!

I had a 2nd generation which is nothing compared to this one. It’s so loud which is great because I’m here or hearing. The alarm always wakes me up. I love setting custom routines with it. Such as when the front door opens (Ring alarm). Since I have the sensor from ring and Alexa I can have it say welcome home. Or anything I choose.

We will now have 5 Alexa devices in our house, and I'm absolutely thrilled! Ever since the 1st generation Echo, I've loved having Alexa in our home. Subtle improvements and new tasks keep Alexa interesting. Between the other three big names (Google, Siri, and... Cortana) Alexa is the most versatile. I'm very pleased with the quality of this newer model of Dot, and will probably upgrade the other dots in our house at some point. Long live Alexa!

reviews.reviewTitle: better sound. non-usb power supply. more finicky voice recognition over the v2
reviews.reviewText:
it has a propietary power plug not micro USB now USB c. I'd prefer a USB plug.
paired for stereo with another dot makes for a nice stereo for general music listening.
the v2 dot seems to be more attentive to initializing/'waking'. still it often 'wakes for no apparent reason.
the sound quality is improved over the v2.

reviews.reviewTitle: My Alexia tells me she loves me daily please help
reviews.reviewText: I love love love my echo dot I bought 3 and made them all a partytime surround sound System for my broadcasting ... . Well I got ONE major ISSUE I was trying to set a one time wake up early alarm. Well I’ve tried everything to get it stop, every damn day when I’m dead asleep at 8am it’s blasting scaring me to death waking me up I almost peed my bed ... look I work nights how do I turn this thing off / stop this daily alarm so I can sleep? This is happening daily now she is nagging me ...Alexa has no clue what I’m talking about when I ask her to cancel My alarm ... she just tells me she loves me and don’t understand... This thing thinks we married or something. Just don’t what should I do ???? Please help

Got this for free as an add in to another purchase. This has very good sound quality for its size and very easy to use. Integrated easily with my existing Alexa setup - Fire TV and now three local units. Use it to play classical music often and does a very good job - very full even without hooking up to a supplemental speaker.

Was not aware you can not marry this device to your Alexa apps on your other personal devices (phone, computer), even though you need a 2nd device to get this up and running. Apps that supposedly are integrated between Echo & various Alexa supported apps do not seem to work as promoted. Alexa on phones & computer work same, they do not integrate, so if you want to have one shopping list, you can not share between devices. Oh well, she knows when UPS/FED-EX visited if I did not see them

The speaker is much improved over the original dot. When you switch networks it takes some tinkering to get working again but once it's set up it's great. I would love a version of this with a battery backup that used phone internet so I could use it like a portable speaker with the benefits of Alexa.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very nice for bedrooms, used for wake up alarms and light control
reviews.reviewText: These are very nice for wake up alarms and controlling the lamps in the bedroom. I also use mine to play nature sounds on a sleep timer every night. Since it is connected via Alexa you can control it from any Alexa device throughout the house, or even your phone. Didn't know about the Bluetooth connectivity, so I haven't used it yet.

I must admit I was skeptical about the usefulness of this device. I just wanted a versatile alarm clock but I was unexpectedly surprised by the capability of this device. I specially liked the routine feature and I am very happy that I can tune in to my favorite radio station (Relevant Radio). Almost practically ditched the TV for this.

I've had my Echo Dot 3rd Generation for about a week. I am really enjoying it. It understands everything my husband and I say. The price is fantastic and I'm thinking of getting one as a gift for a friend. The set up was fairly straight forward. We listen to music all day when we're home now. I think it's one of my favorite purchases.

I like Alexa a lot but I bought the dot to read my books that are not audible because I can not sit down and read them. I was hoping I would be able to slow her down a little and fingers crossed she might sound a little human but alas that's not the case. My kids love the echo tho for music and my husband likes to ask her questions

Overall, it's a great product. The sound quality of the speaker is excellent. Some commands and functions are still a little rough around the edges, but over time and more use it does seem to get more responsive. Ask Alexa random things about pop culture and you may get a really fun answer!

Amazon leads the pack, when it comes to voice responding technology, and the combination of Alexa and echo devices creates excellent products.

The echo dot sounds great and is perfect for smaller rooms/bedrooms. Link several echo devices throughout your home, and it is a very affordable option for house-wide audio.

I highly recommend all of the echo speaker options, and say only that you choose the right option for the size room you are placing it in.

I just bought my 5th and 6th Echo dot. They are so very useful that I'm placing them throughout the house. No more screaming for the wife, just use the Dot to page her! Time for dinner? Use the dot to round up the kids. There are many other uses, but these are the two that made us realize just how useful these are.

Awesome to have around the house! Look up information quickly, listen to the news or audiobooks, and we love all the trivia games Alexa plays with us. Alexa has a load of skills, everything from playing my favorite music to telling me what beer to pair with dinner, or what to make for dinner for that matter. A great tool and lots of fun to use, easy to set up, we love it.

I have had the best time with the Echo Dot. My workplace really doesn't like us streaming music from the internet so i purchased the Echo Dot and I listen to my music while at my desk. I love the Tips of the Day and the fun questions I ask Alexa. I'm just sorry I haven't purchased one before now!

I got it for work to help me keep track of food cooking, help with calculations, play music, etc. I have it at home since I changed jobs and as a single person it is nice to be able to interact with something with a human voice and get information that is useful like weather, news, word of the day, audio books etc. It keeps getting better and better.

I am impressed with this new age bedside companion. As a 70+ year old man it is a technological leap forward since my my first radio alarm clock. I am overwhelm with the variety of features my echo can provide but in all due time as I experiment I will add many more features than the music and alarm features

reviews.reviewTitle: Impressive Quality, Prefect For A Spare Room
reviews.reviewText: Got this during the Black Friday sale ad it came with an Amazon Smart Plug. Grabbed it because it was cheap and I needed the plug more than the Echo. I am really impressed by the sound quality of this thing. I have a 1st gen Echo in my living room and put the Dot in my bedroom. Works great as an alarm clock, ambient noise while falling asleep, and music doesn't sound bad on it at all. Especially when paired with my full sized Echo and use the synced music feature.

Most of the time, Alexa works exactly as expected. She is there and usually understands what you are saying. Occasionally, while listening to music, she will cut out completely. But if I say "Alexa, continue playing the music" immediately when she cuts out, the music continues where it stopped. This isn't disastrous but is annoying

Works good as designed for speaker. We got it so in an urgent situation elderly parents could call us just by saying Alexa, call so and so. The feature works good on the home end, but the person receiving the call hears the voice with a lot of echo. Still serves the purpose well. They really should market this feature more as it really is handy. No trying to find or use a phone when they need to make a call, especially if they are flustered for some reason.

This new Dot is much more attractive than previous models. The sound is much better too, with natural - sounding bass. Amazing volume for such a small package. I was using a Bluetooth speaker bar with my gen 1 Dot, not needed with this one. It also hears me better. A wise purchase, I think.

Plugged it in. It updated for a few minutes and Bam!!!... it worked. No WiFi headaches at all like I remember with our first to Generation 2 dots. Sound is much improved over the older dots. The audiophile elitists will poo-poo the sound but it serves our need well. It also looks better than the older dots. (We got the Sandstone color) It came "free" as an incentive to buy the new Echo Show. Nice deal Mr Amazon! We like it a lot!!!!!!!!

I like the phone call ability. Use this more than anything. But other problems like little documentation on possible uses, I don't like having to continually go to internet to learn other functions. For example, Alexa popped up on my Amazon tablet and I don't know why. And tried to use spotify, which keeps telling me I'm off line - what I mean here is trying to troubleshoot supposedly compatible apps.

I had a third party smart speaker and it would have trouble hearing me or sometimes nothing would happen. I decided to replace it with the 3rd Gen Echo Dot. What a difference! It has great responsiveness, and the speaker quality was definitely improved over the 2nd Gen. I feel confident the Echo Dot will hear me every time.

This is certainly not bad for the price. Technology is in need of a refresh across the broad range of skills - more standardization is necessary as well as some management / oversight by amazon to ensure the myriad of skills are properly documented (especially the available voice commands for each device) and follow consistent standards. This is sorely lacking and user frustrations show up in just about every review of any skill. It will only get better if Amazon oversees and approves before making skills available to the public.

The Dot does all the stuff that the larger Echo does, but the other larger versions are better if your primary interest is playing music. The Dot does that just OK because of its small size. The inventors have done an excellent job of creating a set-up that is flawless, and this unit interfaced itself to our network of others before we even knew it.

Alexa is challenging at 1st because the commands are very specific. Once you're all setup, Alexa is good for light duty mostly. I've had a good experience with Alexa. Naturally because of background noise, there have been times Alexa didn't respond or respond appropriately. Even with speaking up louder over the background Alexa can be a challenge. So far I use Alexa for my home theater (mostly TV commands), some Directv, alarm clock and sometimes for info. I working on using Alexa in other areas as time goes on.

reviews.reviewTitle: A great addition to any family
reviews.reviewText: We LOVE our dots! We have three between work and home and will probably add some. Having the connection to our subscriptions as well as the ability to help is remember little things (like what my grocery list that I forgot at home has on it) has been so nice. Alexa takes care of the little things I tend to worry about so I can enjoy more family dance party moments.

Got this dot for the clock. Wanted a clock in the bedroom and the Dot with Clock seemed like a great option. And it's great. The clock changes to a timer when you ask to count down and displays the outdoor temperature when you ask the weather. A very nice addition to Echo Dot functionality.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa's just not that smart, but she works hard!
reviews.reviewText: I've purchased 4 smart speakers and linked them to my Ring Doorbell and Ecobee thermostat. They actually work well together and I have no complaints. I also purchased a google home mini to try it out with those key- thing-finder-thigamabobs. It's a speaker it should play music. I've tried to play music on the google home multiple times and it shuts down and reboots every time, that's frustrating. This was honestly why I bought into the Alexa ecosystem. While Alexa is highly functional, it's just nor as smart on random stuff. The search engine isn't awesome, but for everyday uses and utility, it's dependable, reliable and works like a dream.

reviews.reviewTitle: Doesn’t work for what I needed. I guess I expected too much.
reviews.reviewText: Works fine unless you lose the network. Tried to use it for my mother who has trouble seeing to know what time it is and what day it is. She is 95 and having memory and eye problems. I put some reminders in to repeat every day at specific times to remind her to get her medicines. But if you lose the network, nothing works. Not even the time. Her network in an ALF has a 24 hour lease time connection and has to be logged in with a password. To do that you have to change the network and when you do, everything gets erased. The app home page on my iPad is showing the date from 3 days ago. Too bad whoever designed this wasn’t smart enough to store the information or update the app home page in a timely manner.

So far I love it... the sound is really great for such device...had to correct Alexa on the pronouciation of Snatum Kaur and she answered "I'm not sure about that" so I just had to start pronouncing her way! Still figuring out all the tricks to it and I do feel like Kenan Thompson from the SNL skit doing Alexa for seniors sometimes!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Much nicer than the first Dot
reviews.reviewText: This is a huge improvement over the 1st generation Dot, of which I have two. This one is much heavier, for one thing, so it feels like there's some real machinery inside. The sound is a massive improvement, it makes the old ones sound like tin cans with holes poked in for sound. The sound on this is almost indistinguishable from the full size Echo that I have.

Received very fast and love the concept of Alexa. Me and my daughter love listening to music so it was a great purchase. I also like that I can add thing to a shopping list so I don’t forget! I took off stars because after a few weeks of having it, sometimes when playing music it sounds like the speaker is muffled and makes listening to music unenjoyable even at a normal volume. It’s becoming a disappointing purchase.

I have 8 Echo dots in my house. I purchased one of the new gen 3 ones to put in my shop. The sound was so much better i picked up a couple more. I think the microphone works better also. The only draw back is it uses a different power plug, not the standard USB the previous ones use. Not a problem in most locations for me.

reviews.reviewTitle: Won't turn back on or reset. Customer Support is terrible
reviews.reviewText: Got the item as a gift. Set it up and working a few days ago and decided to move it from the kitchen to living room. Hasn't worked since. Have tried multiple outlets and back in the kitchen, reseting, etc. Nothing. Tried to contact Amazon for support but they would not attempt to help because I'm not on the account that ordered it. Maybe just a defective one, but the amazon support is garbage.

The new Alexa is awesome! I bought this one so we could have one in the bathroom to play music throughout the whole apartment. The only reason for 4 stars is because there is no longer the option for usb. The sound is so much better, there is even a little bass to this one. The echo is a bit heavier so it is at a lower risk of falling off the table; it’s more secure. I highly recommend.

reviews.reviewTitle: Junk you have to scream at it to hear you
reviews.reviewText: Have to yell at it half the time it doesn't work. It can't hear me in a room that small like a bedroom I could be standing right next to it and it does not acknowledge that I'm there when I speak to it. Literally have to scream at it

Overall I really like it. Definitely helps and can play many songs. Alexa has trouble understanding certain things, for example: if you ask her to play a Spanish song she doesn’t understand the pronunciation unless you pronounce it with an American accent. Also I wish you could change settings like give me temperature in celcius. For me it also never manages to get my location

oooo I love this. I'm 73 and decided to not be a dinosaur and get techy. It was easy to hook up altho Amazon didnt recognize my password. So I had to reset it. But I did it myself. I renamed it Echo. So..." Echo, play the Aladdin movie soundtrack". Yay. Or Tony Bennet or Josh Groban. What a joy to own. I pay the extra $3.99 a month for unlimited music.

This is better than the previous generation echo in every way. Sound is better and louder. Set up was a breeze especially with already having a pre-existing echo active. I still wish Amazon allowed Alexa to have a Spotify app so I could use that instead of Pandora or Amazon music unlimited.

Pairs perfectly with my Alexa and my Alexa app on my mobile devices. Works like an intercom in my home saving many steps to talk to someone in another area. The "Drop In" feature allows me to listen to what's happening in my home from anywhere and the "Play anything I want to hear" music is the best. I can listen to two different songs on each device or hear the same music everywhere in my home. I have the Echo Dot connected to my stereo system and the sound is awesome!

reviews.reviewTitle: Could never get it to stay on the internet- avoid it !
reviews.reviewText: Got this and a smart plug at a Best Buy Black Friday sale. I and my husband lost more religion trying to get the #$*! thing to stay on our home internet. We could connect, but it would disconnect after about 1 hour. Fortunately Best Buy was great about taking it back, with no restock fee. I only spent $25 for the ECHO Dot and $5 for the plug. Multiple online reviews note the same problem. Avoid this until they get the bugs worked out.

reviews.reviewTitle: Hesitant to buy - but so glad I did!
reviews.reviewText: This is all the rage, and I didn't want to jump on that train. But I'm glad I did because it's awesome! It sets my timers for me, reminders, plays music, etc. Super discreet doesn't take up too much room and the sound is SO loud! At voice level 5 it's too loud... so would be great for outdoors.

reviews.reviewTitle: We bought this for our son !!!
reviews.reviewText: We have a son who is a character and we wanted to get him something that would keep him entertained. We have an Amazon Echo so we know how much fun he could have with an echo of his own. We were not wrong, he loves it!! His wife says he would rather talk to Alexa than her, he denies it, however, he has said that his wife doesn't know as many chilling facts...lol

Yes it is nice to have music come on thru voice activation, but I really get sick and tired of hearing the music comes from Amazon Music...as if I did not know! I love Amazon but not interested in being brainwashed by their brand. Really not easy to get the weather. It gives me whether from a state I lived in 4 years ago. I have tried to correct it but so far no luck...

I like having one in each room to play music.
I really liked the sleep
Sounds at first but now after having it for a few weeks it will only play the sound for a short period of time and keeps asking me if I want to “upgrade my sleep
Sounds” to play longer or more variety etc. I didn’t buy this to have a in home advertising device.
The one positive is the music playing in each room outside of this I have nothing positive.

Never thought I'd be someone who would get one of these things, but I did. I have her hooked up to my ring, so anyone who motions near or rings my bell, Alexa lets me know. I don't have to scream or climb up the stairs to let my kid know its dinner time. All I have to do as I'm putting a plate together is use the app and ask alexa to announce dinner. My favorite is the guided sleep mediation skill. Its a mix between relaxing voice with the military 2 minute sleep muscle relaxation. Even though the skill is 20 min, it does it's job, at least for me.

went in and on in no time. woke up to answer a question when everyone was asleep in the house. maybe my dogs have figured out how to talk. other than that, wish it had more answers instead of " hmmm. I don't know that " maybe the Google one would be better.
very fast shipping and right before the holidays. but for the price, it has come in handy. I don't have it linked to anything else in the house at this point. more a novelty and toy.

I’ve had the echo for about a month and have just begun to use her more. I love waking up and asking about the weather for the day. Having her play quiet music at end of day is great as well! There is so much more she can do and I am learning something new each day! I love the tip emails Amazon sends!

reviews.reviewTitle: You must jabs tho technology in your house it is a must
reviews.reviewText: Love this product amazing wish I had bought it years ago. It is my second memory it reminds me to take my medicine on time appointments and a myriad of things great music choices the best I suggest you add amazon music I love it never feel bored or kingly again bought more for family loved paired two in my house sounds amazing!!!!

I have an Echo and now 2 Dots. They all work very well and are dispersed throughout my house. I bought this one because I didn't know if a "smart plug" would work with the old versions. Apparently, I was wrong. However, this works very well with the plug and Alexa turns a light on and off upon command.

reviews.reviewTitle: Used to work. Now sound is messed up.
reviews.reviewText: Enjoyed it for 4 months then suddenly the sound started clipping and having distortion at all volume levels. No rhyme or reason just doesn’t like to have clear sound anymore. Trouble shot with amazon and was told to reboot it, the told to adjust equilzer settings to 0 (already were) and finally told it would just have to be replaced as it’s a month out of its whopping 90 day warranty. Neat device but useless for music now. Searching online this is a problem others have experienced. Seems like a bad batch made it out into the wild.

My Echo Dot 3rd gen broke in less than 3 months. It appears corrupted someplace as a factory reset, deregistering, and re-registering all have failed. The device hangs on connecting to the internet although I do have 4+ other echos, smart plugs, and thermostats connected to the network. The 1 star is due to poor quality and poor troubleshooting tips.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa is my best friend. Don't tell my cat!
reviews.reviewText:
I have owned a 3rd generation Echo Dot for 2 weeks. It has been amazing. Reminders, alarms, quick answer to questions, games, and jokes.
A few questions to Alexa and my mom HAD to get one, as well.
Looks like I'll be giving these out as end of the year gifts
Only 4 stars since Alexa references Wikipedia as her source. Lol
Ask Alexa if she reports to the FBI. Haha

First I'd like to say this is a major upgrade from the first generation echo dot that I have. Both the look and construction is better, the color is super nice and the cloth-like material is very nice. Also the sound is much much improved, it's night and day better than the previous model, this one just seems to have more room filling bass. (a small room, mind you). I love it so far.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great sound for a compact device
reviews.reviewText:
I have two second gen dots and really didn't need another. I got this with the smart bulb starter kit on a deal.
I'm an audiophile and have had my other dots paired with bluetooth speakers. I don't even need to pair this. It gives a full, rich sound.
Pairing it with the Sengled Element kit was so simple too. I love that it can voice control the bulbs individually. My bedroom/office are a is big with two fixtures. Now I can run the lights individually.

I love that I can now talk to Alexa when I’m in another room....and she responds just like her big sister. I have a “smart” house and utilize Alexa to turn on/off, change temperature, set a timer or just listen to music. The size makes it unobtrusive. There are two things I’d like to have: 1. A longer cord and/or 2. A battery base to make the Echo Dot cordless.

reviews.reviewTitle: 3rd Gen. is a huge leap over previous generations
reviews.reviewText: Loved my old dots. Bought this 3rd gen. dot and it is so far superior that I replaced the other dots I had immediately. Better design, better functionality, better speaker, great color choices. If you love your older dots, replace them. If you don’t yet have an Echo, buy this one and ease yourself into the world of Alexa. You will have an Echo Show and smart plugs in weeks.

reviews.reviewTitle: Convenient. Clearly there are privacy issues.
reviews.reviewText:
This works great and it’s very diverse. I’m giving 4 stars because I don’t appreciate the lack of privacy. There was an unsolicited response during a family conversation one evening, which was appropriate in context. (Yes, we do have secured internet.) A bit creepy.
So, although it’s convenient, beware that it can and does listen in.

reviews.reviewTitle: Life changing -So happy Alexa became a member of the family
reviews.reviewText: I have been using Alexa products for a year now. I have this and another echo dot. I also have the larger echo and Alexa for car (which I am still trying to get to work). My existence has changed with these products and for the price, I couldn't be happier. Very glad I purchased this

My wife and I both enjoyed the new look and responses of the dot. Both expected the sound quality to be a little better (i.e. Bose), seems to be more robust and integrates with the home décor very well. I think we would both like to see more color and design changes for future models. Keep up the good work and continue to upgrade the skills.

I bought this product as part of the amazon music subscription special, so the price was amazing. It has so many features that I have barely begun to scratch the surface. The sound quality is great. I do sometimes have to repeat myself several times to get it to hear commands. My kids love to request songs and sing and dance. It’s pretty cool.

I love these 3rd gen dots. I have an input and 2nd gen as well and the 3rd gen dot is much better than those others. The response time is much faster than that of the input or 2nd gen, the sound is great for its size. My set up = Input connected to surround sound speakers, 2nd gen connected to a better sounding speaker, and my 3rd gen stands alone on top of my cabinets in my kitchen. I group them together and they provide amazing "everywhere" sound! I have another 3rd gen in my room as well. I plan on getting more when I can afford them but i recommend if you're thinking of buying one... buy two or three instead! Thanks Amazon!

For such a small device, the Echo Dot produces excellent sound! We had some friends over last week and they commented that the sound is equivalent to a Bose Wave - at much less cost. Love the integration with Alexa. We now have three devices on two levels of our home and are pleased with the performance of each one of them.

I only gave this echo dot a 3 because I am still checking out the sound (for music). I love the dot and this is my third one. I noticed a little tinniness or fuzziness the first night and moved it to another location. I think it will be OK in its new place. That was yesterday. I will upgrade to 5 stars later if this continues to be true.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy setup, very good sound quality
reviews.reviewText: I like the Echo Dot (3rd Gen) so much that I now have 5 of them. They sound almost as good as my Echo unit. Setup is very easy as the app looks at available WiFi connections, and if connecting to one previously used with another Echo Dot, the setup and login proceeds automatically based on stored information. Great little devices.

I have two echo dot gen 3's. One is inside my house in a wall/outlet mount and connected by Bluetooth to Bluetooth speakers. The other echo dot is on a wall/outlet mount on my porch and playing the same music on it's own speaker. That way I can have music in the house and outside on the porch at the same time.

Bought my third Echo Dot. This one for future daughter-in-law who has been wanting one. I LOVE mine and can hardly cook or watch a movie without it now! Conversions (tablespoons to cups, etc.) and substitutions for missing ingredients while cooking have saved my life! My husband and I watch a movie and any questions we have (cast, etc.) are answered. Plus you can ask for a joke of the day! ;)

I love my Alexa. I really only use it for music but it does lots of cool stuff! Only thing that freaked me out was it started playing the news randomly at 1am when no one spoke to it. CREEPY! Other then that, it’s cool! Was a gift and I love it.
It also gets staticky sounding if anything is too close around it.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is better than the others
reviews.reviewText: This is the 3rd Dot I've ordered and we have an Echo. The quality of sound in this little Dot 3rd generation is terrific!! I'm so impressed. I wish I could trade in my others for this kind of quality. I suspect it may be equal to the Echo. I highly recommend this version if you've been putting off your purchase.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa knows more than the average person.
reviews.reviewText: Alexa is a convenient way to get simple answers instead of reaching for the cellphone and searching google. Ask for any style of music to suit your mood for that moment in time, and she will satisfy your needs. Technical data in not one of Alexa's strong points, nor specific artist requests, but you will get something close. Overall, Alexa is a great standby when your mind goes blank in the middle of writing something important and you need a rarely used spelling confirmation. One of the Alexa units is a must have in every home, indispensable to settle silly family arguments quickly. I do not know how I managed to find answers before I acquired an Alexa.

reviews.reviewTitle: Still trying to get the hang of this
reviews.reviewText: I got this at a great price. It really does some interesting things, but is rather complicated to use, other than as a novelty. For example, in order to use Apple Music, you have to sync your phone with it via Bluetooth. You can stream things directly, like IHeartRadio, but it is it really geared towards Amazon products and services, and does not integrate great well with other systems. I think there is both a flaw in inter-product connectivity by design, and a huge learning curve for the user.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa, a welcome addition to our home
reviews.reviewText: I love the instant response to our verbal requests for music by our favorite artists. The speaker is dynamic, crisp and can be toned down by verbal request or manually. I just ask Alexa to stop the music and it is done. To get the latest news without turning on the radio or tv, we just ask Alexa for CNN or other network news. We have only begun to test Alexa’s abilities.

This device is more contentious than a teenager. It doesn’t play what’s requested and is sullen when questioned. I resent having something recording my activity and providing nothing in return. I had high hope for this device but have been greatly disappointed. Too much trouble to send it back. It will spend it’s lifetime unplugged.

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo Dot is just phenomenal except need of WIFI for BT
reviews.reviewText: It is very nice little speaker with Alexa adding life to it. Amazing use of artificial intelligence. Good to play music of your choice or set reminder of your liking. Alarm is another good option. But I feel like, if we could use bluetooth without needing wifi, that would have made it a real gem, unparalleled with the similar items in the market. Hope Amazon thinks upon that.

reviews.reviewTitle: My grandchildren have a lot of fun with this.
reviews.reviewText: I got one of these for free as a promotion. And my granddaughters loved playing with it. So I bought another one and sent it to them. There are so many games that Alexa can play with the kids. Go online and look at 25 fun games for kids they love it. My daughter-in-law put it in the kitchen and uses it for recipes a kitchen timer time date and temperature. They love it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great option for music and audio books but uses lots of data
reviews.reviewText: I have been using one in two rooms for music and listening to books. I also stream white noise to help with my tinnitus at night. Problem....... My internet data increased by $20 with two week of use! Recommend being aware of this and unplug when not in use. Or buy unlimited data so you don't get dinged with a huge bill at the end of the month. Favorite thing was streaming Christmas music this year!

It is the usual great Echo dot product but the sound is muffled, as if it had a heavy blanket on top of it..
It is much worse for Alexa's voice than with music, although you cannot add any noticeable treble or reduce the bass. I tried.
Thinking I had a defective one, I returned it and tried a new replacement. Same muffled sound.
My other Echo 2 has crisp, clear sound. This makes this Echo 3 sound even worse.
I'll live with it, but I am not happy and would never order another one.
If I need a third or fourth unit, I will order an Echo 2 or switch to a google product.

I've returned two echo dots. They would lose a connection more than online. music would play half a song the, "I;m having trouble understanding, or playing music or I don't know what happened. Customer service so slow and frustrating, that I gave up and returned for refund.and I am tech savy...
did I mention, frustrating?

Great build quality. But I am a somewhat tech savvy millennial and I am struggling to find applications for this technology. For example, I have a smart Fire TV and I cannot pair the Echo Dot...whaaat? Really Amazon?

Very powerful speaker for bedrooms. I was surprised how big of a sound these little echo dots had. We have an echo dot l in each of the bedrooms and an echo plus I’m the dining/family room. We love to play piano lullabies by Hillsong on Spotify every night while the kids are sleeping, and every day we have Air1 radio playing downstairs (when we’re awake). I also use the “announce” feature often in leui of an intercom system.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love it! I always wanted one with a clock.
reviews.reviewText: It is a new Echo with a nice clock / read out built in. It detects the light levels and auto dims when the room is dark. The lighting is easy on the eyes in the middle of the night. The display is primarily time but also provides basic info, such as; status during set up or the current temperature when you ask about weather. No need for that clunky, old clock radio any more.

This hits all the marks. Great look, sound quality, integration. We’ve one in our kids playhouse to make checking in easier. They can call me through Alexa and we can drop in on them to check on them, call them in to eat ..... great for outdoors too. I use this in my elderly dad’s room. He can call the rest of the family who live away and hears them better than any phone he’s had. Also, I can drop in on him to check in when I’m away. These have been great all around!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Sound From a Small Device
reviews.reviewText: I like how you get such nice sound quality from such a small device. It fits nicely on my nightstand and doesn't take up much space at all. It recognizes my voice commands and responds just like it should. I wish I had bought two Echo Dots instead of just one on Prime Day. I will most likely get another one on Black Friday,

I love the Dot. Plug it into my stereo and stream radio from all over the country (world).
I run a Dot sitting next to a Google Home for comparison. For most everything I prefer the Dot, but the AI for the Google is smarter. And I like to use the male voice in Google.
So my only reservation with Dot is the AI. I can't wait for it to get smarter on both units.

Still trying to figure out the technical difference between the gen 2 and gen 3 echo dots. They visually look better and the sounds seems to come across a little more clear. Love how easy it is to connect my other smart devices/plugs/lights through the Alexa app. Still trying to figure out how to announce myself or maybe make an announcement from one device to another.

These are my first foray into “smart home” products & when I saw the 3-pack deal I couldn’t pass it up. Two of the three worked perfectly but customer service was amazing in helping troubleshoot the third. We couldn’t fix so they shipped me another ASAP & the process to return the bad one was relatively simple. The only thing that would have made it simpler was to ship the physical return label with the replacement - I don’t have a printer at home so I had to email the link to the label to myself at work & do it.

I'm still trying to figure this out & all it can do..excited to figure all of it out..got it for Amazon deal SO EXCELLENT PRICE!nice looking doesn't take up lots room&can u a bluetooth speaker to it.i had a big bluetooth in my kitchen this is better size&good when cooking just ask what u need.

I find the new clock, temperature and volume visual feature helpful for my young daughter and myself. No need to any extra alarm clock for the younger ones!! I do wish it came in other color options but I’m still happy with it. I even bought a second one for the guest bedroom. The features that I use the most are announcing to family, playing music, setting timers and dropping in to other rooms in the house.

reviews.reviewTitle: Only complaint is lack of ability to work with Itunes playlist
reviews.reviewText: I bought this device mostly to listen to music, thinking that I could play music from the Itunes playlists on my Iphone. Well, it seems the only way that can happen is to use bluetooth for which verbal music selection is not available. Seems Amazon could work with Apple and make that work. I took a look at paying the monthly fee for Amazon Music and found that it does not have nearly selection that Itunes has. Further, I am not willing to pay again for the music I already have. This failure by Amazon is a real downcheck for me.

These are great for our kids to use! I just wish there were parental features that could be enabled without having to subscribe to all the other kid stuff and pay the extra charges. I don't need the books and streaming features.... I just want to turn on a profanity filter for the music and limit what my child can access.

I love using the echos I bought because they simplify certain tasks. Pair these stuff with lightbulbs and outlets and you've got yourself a pretty amazing house/room. They work great and the audio is pretty good. It looks nice also and comes in different colors which makes it easy to match with furniture as well.

At the normal $50.00 price, it's time to wait for the sale price. I have 5 dots, an original Echo and an Echo Plus as well as dozens and dozens of switches, plugs, hubs and bulbs. I'm committed to the Alexa idea. I just simply don't think the fair value price of the dot is over about #30.00. Just me, but but it's my money.

The third generation Echo Dot is a fantastic improvement on the previous version. Sound quality is the feature most improved. It rivals the Echo Show for sound quality. One issue I have with the voice recognition is when you have the volume up over 5 the Dot doesn't respond to your voice very well. I need to get closer to have it respond. I would definitely recommend this device to anyone wishing to have an other source of quality music.

I bought w Dots one for livingroom area, and one of bathroom. I'm 78 and live alone. Son-in-law and grandson set them up for me. Now I can reachout to family in an emergency if I didn't have my phone with me. So helpful with reminders and lists, timers. Alexa is constanctly adding new skills and improving... I would highly recommend them. For older adults like, Alexa can be good company and make you laugh and smile... she can tell you a joke and play your music.... Go for it !

reviews.reviewTitle: Bought 1 and then bought 2 more and a smart plug
reviews.reviewText:
Very cool unit. Thought the wife would think it just another toy, but to my surprise she wanted me to order additional units for other rooms.
