The sound quality is some what muffled, but that can be adjusted from the app.
Very easy to set up. It was plug and play for me on all three units as well as the plug.

I just got this Generation 3 Echo Dot and I absolutely love the sound difference from The #2 which I had to purchase an Ancker Soundcore to enhance !! It paired to my other echo dot in minutes !! We put one in bedroom and now in kitchen ( for Timers and Alarms ) and music !! The only complaint I have is I wish that there was more (Wake) names you could use or even a custom one lol

May not sound like an exciting review but I have a collection of these devices forming, much to my husband's dismay, and they all work just as well as the others. I can't remember which versions are what but high end in the family room, mid at my office and this little guy in the bedroom so my lazy butt doesn't have to get up and turn out the lights, all work the same. No difference in quality. I have a new Tempur-pedic bed coming and the base we bought can be controlled by Alexa as well. Can't wait to try out "Alexa, toss my husband out of the bed" when he is snoring too loud.

Like everything about it except that if there’s a notification it flashes bright yellow and for the past few nights it’s been going off waking me up to where I’ve had to get outta bed and just plug it out. I’ve tried disabling it but not sure if I’m missing something. Otherwise I really like it for listening it music and making my shopping lists.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very useful, fun, and extremely easy to use.
reviews.reviewText: I bought this because it came with a free amazon smart plug, which is really what I originally wanted to purchase. I was really happy with ease of echo and the smart plug working side by side. It keeps my kids busy for hours with all of the games and skills that you can get with it. It connects to so many things just by simply asking it to connect. If it doesn’t do it automatically, it will simply explain step by step what to do. It integrates with IFTTT, which I have yet to try, but that’s a future plus I am sure. I really love the ability to have multi-room music, however I am bummed it doesn’t work with my fireTV stick. I would recommend this product, but I don’t think I will purchase another one unless I saw it on sale again.

Love it so far! I got mine the day after it was released. Alexa sings funny songs for me. I've made a call through the dot and I heard them great but my friend said he could barely hear me. Still getting used to it and figuring it out, but so far I love it

Ok so I got it because the price was right and didn't expect to be able to do everything that Alexa can do. It's more than just an assistant, it's more like a powerhouse virtual assistant that watches, automates whatever you need in your home (with smart plugs, skill sets etc).

It is hands down my best purchase this year and do not regret it. My wife and I are loving it. Definitely recommend over the Google thingy that's similar. Alexa hands down wins it due to all the home automation, not to mention the ever growing library of skills you can add. She's brilliant and learns everything about you, your music, your tasks, etc. If you're looking for a special holiday gift, this is it! Just get it, trust me, you'll thank me later.

How could you not love Alexia? When I first got it, I thought what I am going with this? OMG I do everything with it now! Shopping lists, playing relaxation music, telling me the news and weather, she tells jokes and plays games. Now that I have one, I can’t live without it. In fact, I got a second one for the upstairs. Alexia and the dot are FANTASTIC!!!

The new Echo dot is a nice upgrade from the previous version. I have 7 of the previous version and will probably swap out a few for the new model.
Sound quality is much better and the mic seems to be a little more responsive. "Big Brother can hear you more clearly."
Setup was the same as previous versions and went quickly with the Alexa app on my phone.
The increased physical size of the Dot means it won't fit in any of the mounting brackets you may be using for previous ones. All said, I like the upgrade.

reviews.reviewTitle: Wish I hadn't wasted the money.
reviews.reviewText: I don't like the non-stop marketing that comes with the purchase. I use it only for quiet background music and have turned off the one-stop shopping. If I want to buy anything, I'll use the laptop and not be hounded by Amazon.

The only improvement I am seeing from Gen 2 is that the speaker is louder, but iti s not as clear. The microphone is supposed to be able to hear you better from a longer distance and when there is music or a TV on but I don't see any of that happening. I have to scream above my TV (which isn't very loud) or pause it altogether so it will hear me, which kind of defeats the purpose when wanting to tell Alexa to pause the TV with my Fire TV.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is my 3rd eco dot and am really enjoying them.
reviews.reviewText: This is such a useful little device if you want to start to create a smart home. There are so many things you can do with this it's really an amazing piece of tech and it's works extremely well. The speakers on the 3rd gen. are much better than the previous 2nd gen. echo dot and this one (the 3rd gen.) looks much nicer too.

We have 3 other echos in my house and they all work fine but mine does not work sometimes. If I say something it lights up and then the lights go off and that’s it. I don’t know what it is about mine but when it doesn’t work it’s very annoying. And I have an alarm set for the morning and whenever I say Alexa stop it doesn’t stop! Woke up my whole family they were very annoyed. Ended up just unplugging it.

reviews.reviewTitle: NOT impressed, needs to be WIRELESS...
reviews.reviewText: Returned it! For the price , function & blue tooth tech now-a-days, this unit SHOULD BE wireless. And ALexa still needs improvement, you have to be VERY clear & keep it REAL simple for Alexa to understand what the hek u want her to do. So, i found myself repeating words. I felt like it was an episode of Sesame Street.

reviews.reviewTitle: Whatever would I do without my dot!
reviews.reviewText: I was able to get this for free as a promotion from Travelers so this is my second dot. It is easy to set up and syncs with my original dot. This generation has a softer voice which is great. I gave it another one of the 4 names provided so my “assistants” know which one is being addressed. :))

I have the 2nd generation and the 3rd generation dots. I like both of them and if you can't afford the 3rd generation the 2nd generation is still a good choice. But... the 3rd generation Dot has better sound quality. It's a little bigger than the 2nd generation. I also like the appearance of the 3rd generation better. I would purchase this again and probably will.

reviews.reviewTitle: Sound much better - Still doesn't understand what I say
reviews.reviewText: I have both Echo and Google devices in my home and I like them both for one or other reason. The only thing that I don't like about echo is that it still doesn't understand me. A lot of times it would say sorry I didn't get it or I don't know what you mean. Other than that it is amazing. Speaker is much better than the previous generation.

reviews.reviewTitle: How did we manage before getting our Dots?
reviews.reviewText: We love our Echo Dots (3rd Gen). We purchased one for our living room, our office, and for each of our daughters' bedrooms. Everyone enjoys streaming music through the Dot. They also work very well as an intercom system in our 2 story house. The Dots have become part of our daily routine and we love discovering new ways to use our Dots to make a life simpler.

reviews.reviewTitle: I got this as a gift
reviews.reviewText: In order to use this product I had to download an app onto my cellphone. Now my cellphone is constantly telling me that I am low on memory. I have only used this dot thing a couple of times and really cannot see any advantage in having it. I guess it is more of a conversation piece for people who don't want to look up stuff for themselves on their computer or cellphone.

reviews.reviewTitle: Sound quality 100% better than 2nd gen dot
reviews.reviewText: Absolutely love this product, night and day better than the second generation, I bought two with the $5 smart plug deal and love it. The sound quality is wonderful, old 2nd gen dot was nice but sounded like an old AM radio, was fine if you connected to external speaker but this is really great, its larger than the second generation but well worth it with the sale price going on right now.

reviews.reviewTitle: Awesome/ interactive/ smart/ easy to use
reviews.reviewText:
I have had the Echo dot for about 5 months now.. it is a game changer, makes my life a whole lot easier.
Not only does it make grocery lists for you.. finds interesting information when being asked a question.. playes music.. wakes you up with music or the news. And most importantly you can link it to Ring security. It is hands down HELPFUL

I already had a couple of 2nd generation Echo Dots and they worked fine, but the sound quality was lacking. To solve that problem, I connected them to my own speakers and everything was great. With the 3rd generation though, you can get away with not needing external speakers. It is much louder than the 2nd gen and even has some bass. I use it in my bathroom when I shower and don't have a problem hearing the music clearly over the shower noise.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great value and performed beyond my expectation
reviews.reviewText: I have integrated Alexa with my security system, my 2017 Genesis, my lighting, Sirius XM, Apple Music, my Samsung TV, Envida Shield and host of other things the family can use. I have five echos though out my home.pmus if you need someone to talk to she can help you with that. Buy and enjoy...

I seem to be enjoying the amazon ec(h)osystem. The products work well. The Alexa app is kinda hard to navigate in my perspective. Setting up rooms, mass updates to locations, searching for all things that appear to have the same name, just certain challenges but overall it is a good product at a great price.

HATE these. they do not play well with apple music AT ALL. that’s the main reason i bought them- for music around the house. i’d rather get some nice bluetooth speakers. don’t need all the “skills” and junk (or tracking/advertising). the app is NOT intuitive. it is NOT a plug and play device. AT. ALL.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great price, easy to use,very good speakers. I really enjoy using it.
reviews.reviewText:
This is just a great little device, I did not pair it with Alexa. The only suggestion I have would be the ability to name it myself instead of from the suggested list. It is every good as it’s big sister, and has a very good sound,which one can adjust from the app.
Highly recommende this fun little device.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa is my go to for almost everything!!
reviews.reviewText: Alexa is my go to for everything. I've gotten very forgetful as I've gotten older. she reminds me of appointments. at 10PM she reminds me to take my meds. at midnight to go to sleep (I get distracted reading and lose track of time) when I'm cooking she's my timer. I LOVE my Dot!! (I now have 2 of them one in the bedroom one in the Living room)

This looks very elegant and stylish. The speakers are way more powerful than the previous device thanks to the dedicated power adapter instead of being USB powered. The only complaint I have is that the sounds is not very natural like Google does. However, Alexa responds more often and faster than Google does

reviews.reviewTitle: Every day is a new day and Alexa tells me about it!
reviews.reviewText: I received the Alexa Echo Dot from my wonderful grandson for my birthday this year! How he knew I wanted one was beyond me, but he made me a very happy Gramma! He has checked in with me to make sure I'm still enjoying Alexa and I am. Being widowed makes each day a little more interesting with Alexa!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Could live without but I got it free so I'll give it a try!
reviews.reviewText: Got this free from making an insurance change. Haven't used it too much yet except to play music on my Sirius XM account and control one lamp from a smart plug I purchased. Is a little bit tinny sounding for music. I have a much better sounding mini-speaker that I may try to Bluetooth with it to improve sound quality. May get more out of it as I use it more.

reviews.reviewTitle: finally understand the buzz about Alexa
reviews.reviewText: It all started with this one little dot. Now we have dots or an echo plus in every room ....yes even the bathrooms. These little dots are perfect for small spaces or as a controller in rooms with aSonos play5. The sound is good enough to play music for very small rooms. Easy to pair with all smart devices. Responsive as well. very happy with quality!

Just wow. I upgraded from the 2nd Generation Dot and the difference is astounding. Mainly in the sound quality department. I put my 3rd gen dot in my bathroom with a wall mount so it’s easy to listen to music and such in the shower or in the bath. So far so good there! The sound is great for the price and is a MAJOR improvement from the second generation.

The voice recognition and such is as fantastic as it is with all my other Amazon Alexa devices. Same for smartphone abilities and skills. Very very satisfied with the new Dot!

reviews.reviewTitle: Makes phone calls! Every home needs one or a few!
reviews.reviewText:
Christmas gift to my kids. Daughter got her own (11) and the others got one to share in the media room.
They love it! Ask it weather questions, set timers for reading and dance parties any time they want! My favorite is that I can make announcements and the kids can call me directly from the Echo! So awesome if you don’t have a home phone!

I gave three dot's as gifts and kept one for myself. I am so impressed with the sound compared to the second generation. this latest version has an equalizer and much much more bass (thank you amazon). They sound so good with music, I no longer need the speaker adapters I used on the gen. 2. The new device achieves the better sound due to 360 degree sound and a built ins resonance chamber.

I got this as a gift. I am not that good with technology but fumbled thru the activation process using my Kindle, because you have to use a device on wifi to access the Echo Dot app. Anyway, it's fun to play with. Thinking about getting another one soon for the bedroom. I keep the one I have on the dining room table, and Alexa plays us "dinner music".

Use it for an alarm clock and also for music have 2 one in kitchen and bedroom. Play music on it all the time. Will turn up and down with voice command. You say play country music it plays what's current. Say 70's country or 60's you get old country Loretta Lynn Hank Williams Jr Willie Nelson. We think it great for music. 16 month old goes and just yells at it he knows we say something and get music so he goes over and yells at it. Funny!

3rd gen Exho dot is a lot buggier than the 2nd gen dot. Never had any issues until I got the 3rd gen. This one seems to work one minute and not work the next. Falls off line for no reason. Sometimes it works with Harmony and Fios skill, but there’s no telling when it will and when it won’t. My older dot gave me far less headaches and almost always worked. The sound on the new dot is was better but what’s the point if it’s not working correctly.

Well, sound is better, but its been 7 months and of course the speaker blown out. Didn't have the volume past 8 ,and still.
UPDATE 8/9/2019 - Now both speaker are busted and I don't play music on them at all. Now I hear Alexa take through the sound of a busted speaker. Might need to make the switch IKD.

reviews.reviewTitle: The Echo Dot filled the void in my upstairs bedroom.
reviews.reviewText:
The Echo Dot 3rd Gen is great! I have a 1st Gen Echo in the downstairs living room and it’s great!!
I recently purchased a Hue light for my bedside table upstairs in my bedroom. When I saw the Echo Dot on
Sale and in the sandstone color that matched my bedside table, I jumped on it quick!
I love that I’m now connected with Alexa all over my house.
Money well spent!! Love it!!

I have the original echo, a dot v2 and now the new dot v3. This dot v3 is awesome , almost as good as the original echo! I might buy another! Change might ... I just did a trade in on my dot v2 for a new dot v3 ... Amazon offered me a deal I could not pass up - didn't even know they offered trade upgrades! Now i will have the original echo, and two dot v3. Love Amazon!

We got this on sale (during Christmas). Was impressed with the speaker quality, seriously better than my new iMac which it sits with/under the screen. I end up using this instead, plus it looks great on my desk.

Alexa is pretty nice and def. better than Siri. You can ask her to tell a joke, and Jimmy Fallon will do the honors. You can set up alarms and have celebrities wake you up which is quite funny.

I would actually recommend this rather than buying speakers for a small room.

We are able to listen to all of our music - anywhere, anytime on our property. We take it poolside (protected of course), and have on in almost every room in the house. By combining an "everywhere" group, and our "playlists", we can play party music and - no more yelling "Alexa" across the house. I love gardening to my music.

I upgraded from a 1st Gen to this 3rd Gen... I am very happy with the product, however... for music, the sound quality is much better than the 1st Gen. Unfortunately, Alaxa's voice is now not as clear and somewhat muffled. Personally, it doesn't bother me much since i enjoy the sound quality so much more when playing music.

reviews.reviewTitle: Help making phone calls using iPhone 7 initiated by Alexa
reviews.reviewText: I was hoping to be able to use this with my iPhone to make phone calls. It connects to my Wi-Fi network and Bluetooth to my phone. But when I give a command Alexa call “one of my contacts” which did load in. The other person can hear the phone ringing but nothing when they answer it and I never hear anything

This little echo is awesome. I haven’t discovered all it does but so far it’s awesome. If your a prime member and you ask for music by a specific artist or genre, it goes to amazon music to find relative play lists. When I ask for weather it’s spot on. It even beat me at a game of jeopardy. Some reviewers said the speaker wasn’t goo but i found the quality quite good.

The Echo Dot has been a great addition to our home. We greatly enjoy being able to easily stream music from the device as well as all of the other Alexa abilities. My daughter has one in her room and it has FreeTime enabled. She uses it primarily to read stories and listen to music.

The biggest shortfall that I've noticed so far is that I am unable to use Spotify on multiple devices simultaneously. There is not an easy way to assign different Spotify accounts to different devices unless they are registered to different users. The problem with that is that you lose the drop in and messaging abilities that come with having multiple Alexa devices.

The sound quality is good, you can use numerous fun skills with Alexa, and it has a nice, modern design. The only thing I don’t really like is sometimes the wake word gets mistaken by a different word, which of course you can just mute it if you don’t want it to go off randomly, but other than that, great product!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great if you own newer smart appliances, thermostats and printers.
reviews.reviewText: I like that it can connect with a multitude of other devices. I would prefer it be able to connect to thermostats without needing a hub, connect to wireless printers without needing web printing, connect to ADT without needing to upgrade service that’s already a little overpriced (ADT Pulse) or connect with my dvr but ONLY if it’s the Hopper. A lot of potential but falls short because peripherals have to be brand new and their services have to be upgraded to a plus or pro tier. Having said that, I have a fancy device to read the internet to me and turn on and off a light.

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo Dots are great but 3rd gen sound is muffled.
reviews.reviewText: I replaced my 2nd gen with this 3rd gen. The functions are the same. This one is much louder than 2nd gen, but the 3rd gen sound is kind of muffled, which I find disappointing and annoying. But overall echo dots are such a fantastic invention. I keep them throughout my house. Hope the next model is loud AND clear.

reviews.reviewTitle: I never thought I'd get one of these things but..
reviews.reviewText:
...Here we are!! Lol
I actually like the Echo Dot..it's fun to ask her about stuff and also to play music from my playlist in Spotify, or in Amazon music.
I bought this in order to play music at work, and at home. I think that something like this can be an excellent way to learn more about how things are, work, etc. Pretty cool 😎

I went from a 2nd generation to a 3rd generation because of the deal I was offered. Basically it was the same price, just a year later. Anyways I put the 2nd Gen Dot in the bathroom to time my showers via songs, but I love the 3rd GenDot a bit more because the audio on the speaker is just a little bit better and louder.

The Echo Dot is leaving white rings on my furniture. It appears the company is aware of this issue but has not worked to resolve it
At the very least they should warn the consumer.
I am very unhappy with the condition of my sideboard.

This is what the original echo dot should have been.
Much better sound
No longer disconnects from wifi
I just wish that it would use a regular usb power adapter so I can use a shorter power cable. Right now I have my dot on the bathroom wall and the power cable is all bunched up and hanging to the side
PS Now you can change equalizer settings for the sound on the app!

reviews.reviewTitle: Caved in and made the plunge.
reviews.reviewText: I like this. its simple, set up is fast and its a great way to party when your drunk friends can yell out songs and she plays them. Bought some smart lights and set up when i say "Alexa intruder alert" she turns my lights green says " what are you doing in my swamp" then plays All star by smash mouth. Honestly this is what i live for at this point. I only bought this to be stupid with and i am 95% pleased. Shes a lil slow at times but she gets the job done.

What a nightmare owning these. I spend more time cursing them than using them. Multi-room music group is a total disaster. It's like every feature is still in Beta mode and Amazon just jumped the gun to be the first to market. Switching to Google Home soon.

reviews.reviewTitle: You have to be a tad louder
reviews.reviewText: I had originally purchased an Echo and loved the sound quality and ease of usage, i was surprised that Alexa could hear me easily from my bedroom. So i decided to purchase an Echo Dot for my children's room (as in I cannot hear what does the fox say over my music one more time) The Dot is still extremely to use though I feel the Dot cannot hear as clearly as the bigger one and the sound could be a tad clearer if not a tad louder compared to the big one, I am not displeased though as again this was for the kids

reviews.reviewTitle: Good Sound, a bit dumb compared to google home
reviews.reviewText: I decided to give alexa a try after having google for more than a year. Sound quality is much better than google mini but intelligence is less. I can tell google to switch on or off everything and it does that while alexa says “Can’t finda device named everything” . This is basic intellectual and device should have it. Hopefully Amazon build more intelligence into this.

I bought one of thes to turn some lights on and off. Now I have two and that says it all.

I am amazed at how well it integrates with my home entertainment system. My wife wanted nothing to do with it. Guess who wanted the second one? It lives in the kitchen and she always has it playing music.

Received this as a gift form our daughter for Christmas. Such a fun surprise. We are enjoying the ease of using it and how helpful it can be. I have it programmed to give me the weather in the morning along with any appointments we have that day. We also love to use it to play music. Our grandsons had fun having Alexa tell them stories when they came to visit.

I love the Echo! It’s in my Kitchen! Hands-free timers and music are awesome! I will say she has spoken out of turn a few times, which is creepy... but honestly, my smartphone is always with me anyways so if “they’re listening” they’re listening. I find the ease and overall helpfulness of the unit to be great! Especially when I’m elbows deep in the kitchen

I got this as a gift and was pleasantly surprised at the sound quality. It is much better than my old echo dot. The only thing I didn't like was that it doesn't connect via a USB cable. Instead it has its own power supply with power supply connector. This means it's not as portable as my old one, but that really doesn't bother me too much.

I own four of these echo and one for the car I like them a lot , I have automated my house and they are helpful . I didn't want to buy the bigger amazon products because of the pricing these are great for what it is , sound quality could be better but all I had to do is pair these with my Harmon kardon speakers !

The echo is a pretty good Device. Setup is pretty easy. It has a lot of good features. If you plan to listen to a lot of music from a specific artist then you'll want to get Amazon Music or Amazon Music unlimited 3.99 a month with echo owners (01/11/2019). Of you dont use Amazon then you can get other premium music players. I am planning on making my place a "smart' home with my echo and smart devices.

reviews.reviewTitle: Would only recommend if it is on 25$ sale and if you have prime
reviews.reviewText: When I ordered this it was on the 24.99 sale and the first thing I didn’t like was how they made it 24.99 and charged me shipping instead of having it 25 with free shipping. When it arrived it got set up easily but I couldn’t get it to play podcasts I wanted. After a little research I found out you have to say “play such and such podcast with tunein” which seems like a small thing but it gets annoying to say. You also can’t play a song you want if you don’t have prime which is another 100 a year and you can’t use Spotify unless you have premium that is 10-15 a month. All in all it an ok thing to have use it for alarms podcasts and radio mostly but it’s cool to have when I have a random question in my head I just ask it instead of searching it.

I bought this on sale for $30 as I didn't want to invest in the more expensive models without knowing if I'd like it but I do! I'm sure it might not be loud enough for some people but it's fine for me. I like to have a variety of music playing and it's great for that. voice recognition was perfect, I can get Reds games on the radio through it. All good.

This is my third echo dot, every room has one.. we literally have echo do do everything for us - turning on/off lights, play music, announcements, reading books, playing games, watering the lawn.. basically can’t think of life without it anymore.

The speech recognition has improved a lot and I feel it always keeps getting better, great product Amazon!

This has great sound quality, and was in addition to the other seven Alexa devices that we have spread throughout our 6000 square-foot home. I bought this on sale around Black Friday and I wish I would’ve bought a couple of more. I’ve also bought this for our kids and I think they will be very impressed. I prefer this over the original die the sound quality is much better.

We bought this for my 82 year old mother-in-law for Mother’s Day. She didn’t really know what to think at first but now she loves it! She likes to talk so she talks to Alexa when she doesn’t have any company over. She also likes to sing so she has music going also. I’m waiting for them to go back on sale so I can get me one.

I love this thing. The only dislike I found was I asked her to tell me a story and she wouldn't stop. I told her to stop about 2 times and then had to get up and be right on the speaker for her to stop. Other than that, it's pretty awesome. I've never had anything like this so I find it entertaining and helpful

reviews.reviewTitle: Don't know what I did without it. Seriously.
reviews.reviewText:
Excellent product. Unintended usage alert LOL I use it as an encyclopedia to learn things. Also helps me turn on all of my smart devices. Excellent for the elderly and handicapped.
I hope they do an update where it's as good as Google home mini for finding out about stores etc (opening times/movies playing) near me. So for now I have both.

ac wireless Wi-Fi connection is spectacular and the 360° full range audio is the best even over the Fire HD 10 tablet and Echo Show Find Generation. Unfortunately it isn't a carry around Bluetooth speaker. But as a no battery, FM RADIO or listening to police radio calls, great. I will probably be listening to music because it beats SoundLink Color II from Bose as true 360° audio.

I love the design and sound quality, both of which are better than previous generations in my opinion. The only thing I have noticed is that it does not seem to respond (wake up) as easily as the previous generation when I say "Alexa". Sometimes I have to say it twice whereas this was not the case previously.

reviews.reviewTitle: Keep volume below 3/4 and we are good
reviews.reviewText:
Works well. Sometimes it has trouble understanding direct tv channels that we use all the time. Drop in echo unless volume is turned down below half way. The dot 2 we have doesnt have that issue. Sound quality on music distorts when at 3/4 volume and up.

So why not less stars? Because it does work very well and if that was all I had to do was turn volume down it's great

The upgrade between the 2nd Gen a d 3rd Gen is so worth it. The sound is waaaaay better now, the speaker is loud, has great bass and the sound quality now is amazing. Voice recognition is faster and better. This in con inaction with the headlights from Phillips made the great combination for my apartment, specially that you don't require the Phillips hub. I just love my new dots. Totally recommended.

The sound is great as advertised but the power connection is not USB. It is a proprietary AC Adapter. This results in a lack of flexibility as to where I can install it. This should be highlighted first and foremost in any product description.
Works great with music apps (Spotify) and Alexa. Pair this with some smart home devices and I can control my lights with just my voice.

It takes a little bit of time to figure out how things operate and integrate. Once set up, it gets easier to integrate more IoT devices. My next purchase will be a unit with a screen.

I also have a Google device as well just to compare. As of this writing, Alexa has way much more to offer. They both work pretty much the same. It feels exactly like Betamax vs VHS. Who will get more of their product into the hands of users and which company do you trust more Not to monetize from your conversations.

Love my echo dot. Only problem is it doesn’t always understand me. Love my shopping list. Asked for potting soil but when I got to the store it said potty salt! Good laugh! I bought two so I could have them in each end of the house. I can have it play the sound of ocean waves on shore to go to sleep. Response time is fast for most questions.

I bought the Dot and a smart plug so I could turn the fan in my bedroom on and off with my voice. Not only does it do that, but it also does everything else my large Echo does. I am continually amazed at the sound quality from such a small speaker. The Dot, bought on an Amazon Prime day, was a good deal.

Love this little device! It was also nice to have a choice of colors! We already have the larger Alexa in our finished basement area. This Echo Dot does exactly the same thing, but takes up a smaller space on our kitchen counter....the price was fantastic! Easy to set up, and is used every day.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa performs superbly recognizing voices of many users
reviews.reviewText:
We use Alexa for radio and weather and music requests; it's hard to stump her!
Apart from listening in to all conversations, I think Alexa should be included in everyone's home. We may have to trust but verify that use of our information is not subjecting us to privacy intrusion or other use of our private information.

I've had the 2nd gen for over a year and love it. I didnt know what I was missing until I recieved the 3rd gen. The sound quality is some sort of magic. How can that sound come out of such a small speaker. 3rd gen has a much sleeker look than 2nd gen. Great purchase, you wont be sorry for buying this one.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great value with giveaway, excellent little speaker, great Alexa addition
reviews.reviewText: I took advantage of an Amazon promotion to try Amazon Music Unlimited and get one of these for $1, how can you go wrong? Alexa in the kitchen for a buck is sweet. Nice little speaker, will probably get one for the bathroom, too. Good for any room where you don't really need the best sound quality, in primary listening rooms it makes sense to go for better sound, but this is great for what it is.

reviews.reviewTitle: Whole house music is the best feature
reviews.reviewText: You will need to get one for every room so you can play the same music at the same time in your whole house. Sound quality is ok for this price

I have had an Echo Plus 1st Gen for a while now. I decided to expand my Smart Home with 3 Echo Dots 3rd Gen. It was a dual purpose, as we are currently having a house built. I plan to have an entirely Smart Home, so this was the perfect opportunity to stock up. I am now waiting for 4 additional 3rd Gen Echo Dots to arrive. This puts me at 8 Echos and 2 Fire Sticks. My next additions will include the Spots.

I love EVERYTHING about the echo dot except that the one I have won't reset or set up! AND this one shows it was delivered yesterday at 5:20 and it was NOT. Not only that I tracked it yesterday afternoon and it said I was only SIX DELIVERIES AWAY! And it was not delivered at all!!!

This is my first echo device and all I can say is WOW. I recieved this as a gift from Sirius XM, and am blown away at what this device can do. I can just do about anything from the comfort of my bed. Considering that the 4th gen is coming out soon, I will definitely be looking for another sooner rather than later. For those concerned with privacy settings, there is an entire section for setting up your privacy. Alexa will only know what you want it to know. Overall I'm impressed! Sound is great for the size of the device. Will definitely be leaving a future review once I have learned all the tricks to these devices!

I've been scoffing at these devices for years, never seeing the cost/benefit analysis working in their favor. Well, after getting one for a buck from a promotion, we are hooked and even bought a 2nd one for the workout room. Use them every day.

Taking a star off because the sound isn't stellar, but what can you really expect from such a small device and such a low price.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love it! Helps me stay organized.
reviews.reviewText: Easy set-up, however I bought the lifetime set-up app by accident and am still trying to get a refund. You DO NOT need that app to activate Alexa. Would have been helpful to have a link to the correct free set-up app. Helps me keep on top of events, to do's and other tasks. Would recommend.

It will serve the purpose for what you are probably looking for. It is really good, but over time I am sure it will get better and do more things than you expect from it. Would I buy it? Yes. Would I put it in a separate room and close the door to make sure it can't hear everything I am saying? Yes. As you should do with your cell phone and computer. Definitely try it out!

Alexa performs most of what I ask of her without issues. She does seem to have bugs/glitches about once a day though. Every time I try to go through the voice recognition steps something glitches and ends the process before we've begun. She also makes strange noises throughout the day lol. Overall though, I say a solid 4 stars because she answers my questions, reminds me to do things, and plays my music all day long.

This is my 8th echo in the house and I'm pretty much out of rooms to put them in. I've even had one mounted outside on the patio (covered by a roof) for over a year and it's worked flawlessly too!

I can tell a sound quality improvement over the previous generation Dot, so that's a nice bonus. Setup was the same as the rest of them - quick and easy.

Making my house smart was a great idea! I have added these and all over the kids rooms and the rest of the house. They use them for Music & Lights and I use them for an inner calm, calling other people, calling them , smart lights, and music. I bought 3 at once and got a discount which was perfect

Love the dot!! These smaller, less expensive items allow me to add to the echo I purchased a couple of years ago. This enables me to have Alexa (dot)downstairs in the den, and in my dressing room ( weather update while I’m dressing) and the main echo in the first floor living room.

I actually canceled my order because I already have an echo dot and wanted another for my mother. She felt it was too high-tech for her but it honestly is not. This is the easiest gadget to set up and the features it offers is worth going a little outside your comfort zone. Customizing it makes it that much more great. Great little product.

reviews.reviewTitle: I did not know I needed it, until I met it
reviews.reviewText: It's probably the main reason why I never bought it. Once you started to use it, a whole world of possibility will be opened in front of you. Day by day you will want to adds more and more devices and features and then exploit all of its capabilities. It's incredibly useful, gorgeous. Moreover it has a high fidelity sound. I highly recommend it.

I had a great experience with my older Alexa and decided to get this newer one in hopes the sound would be even better. Instead, this one has A LOT of static! It’s not all of the time but it comes and goes. Pretty disappointing!

My favorite thing to do with this is "alexa call my phone" so I can figure out where my phone is. lol But I can also call people in my contacts. Listen to music, listen to my audio books. I bought 3 of these with the smart plugs on Prime day and I'll be setting one up in each of the kids rooms as well.

your home computer has a VERY VERY SIMPLE set up...mine does not...amazon could not get the device to respond because it is inadequate to perform unless the connection is simplistic.
why do i doubt this review will get posted...

I use my Echo Dot for so many little things. Over the months I have found many more ways to use the Dot and Alexa, including control of lights in my home. And now with the recent purchase of a Fire TV, I have found another great use for the Dot and for Alexa. Controlling the television by voice is something that I never thought was essential, but now that I can, I use that capability all of the time. And I am certain that I will find many more ways of utilizing Alexa skills in future months. 20 years ago I never would have envisioned that a $39 purchase at Best Buy would bring a virtual helper into my home, but here we are.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works great. Super fun. Cool little bluetooth speaker
reviews.reviewText: Alexa integrated easily with our wifi, and is super fun to use. We use a couple wifi plugs and LED devices. All work without fail. The little Echo Dot easily grabs your voice command from within about 15 feet, or you have to yell. Also, people have complained about the bass response from the speaker. That's stupid. It's like 4" wide and $40; what do you expect? Works great for easy listening from a laptop or device.

reviews.reviewTitle: Just Buy it ! You won't be disappointed.
reviews.reviewText: I absolutely love these! A wonderful way to keep in touch with my 107 years old grandmother ( yes that's right and god willing 108 in august!) we have bought several of these so that the family is just a voice away from her and so easy for her to answer . This combined with the echo show is a security that we can count on.

I like Alexa and this is becoming more easier for me to use and help with everyday life. My only disappointment is I thought this and my 2nd gen echo dot could somehow sync together and I can use. Music in particular I was hoping I can use room to room. But other than that I like so far.

I mostly use Alexa to listen to music. Not cd quality but convenient and a huge selection. I'll say, "Alexa play <some song>" and afterward often say "Alexa, play more like that." Some categories are more limited than my old cd collection, but I almost always am introduced to new tunes.

I only use it hooked up to my stereo system. I was bummed to find the *week after* it arrived that Alexa Input exists. That would be better for my use. This is the number one reason in my mind that Alexa beats Google, the ability to hook it up to a sound system.

I have to say I love this Echo Dot. I had held off getting one as I figured why did I need another electronic..... but I'm so happy I did. This has eliminated my alarm clock and sound machine both of which took up a lot of space on my night stand. Right now I'm learning what it can do, but can say I'm very happy to have purchased it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to use, but WiFi connection issue
reviews.reviewText: I use the Dot for music, reminders, weather, and alarms. It's convenient and has well voice recognition. Sound quality is pretty good for a speaker of this size. But I have some issues with WiFi connection. I place this Dot and Fire TV stick at the same location where the Wifi signals works well. But some how it had troubles to connect my Wifi. I have to move my router or use a WiFi extender to get it connected. it's odd.

I purchase the echo Dot from my mother and myself my mother and father both enjoy it they are trivia people so they asked a lot of questions and my dad he's a curious man about a lot of things and I was skeptical about him using it but he uses it more than my mother they really enjoy it they're both in their 70s and they couldn't be happier with it was one of the best things I could have ever got them they said that it's used everyday but doesn't sit on a shelf and collect dust thank you Amazon for creating such a wonderful product that's making a difference in my family's life

The new echo dot 3rd generation is much better (design and sound quality) than the old 2nd generation. But honestly, the Google Assistant mini still has a better sound. I expected a little more power in this new version. The new dot allow to change the language to a many another language, like Spanish (Spain or Mexican version) that is so cool but NOT fair for the owners of Echo dot 2nd generation.

reviews.reviewTitle: Superior Audio in the Gen 3 Echo Dot
reviews.reviewText: This is the 5th Echo divice in the house and the 2nd 3rd generation Dot. The 1st full size Echo was a gift, to make it more than a novelty, this device was used for home automation. Next came a 2nd gen Dot which added intercom abilities to the bedroom as well as audio at each end of the house. Expanding on this was the purchase of three more Dots. With the purchase of the first gen 3 Dot the improved sound quality made it clear the extra $10 was money well spent. The only reason not to give a 3rd Gen Dot 3 a 5 Star rating is my disappointment of the departure from the micro USB to the property cord. The 6" cord admittedly does fit most application needs.

Bought this Echo Dot when on sale, $19.99. Cheaper than replacing my old alarm clock in the bedroom. Works great for that purpose, but I also have Alexa play some music while I am shaving or dressing. Love the integration with other Alexa in the family room as I can call my wife by doing the "drop in" function.

I really like it. You have to be in a very quiet environment for the voice integration or it won’t go all the way through. I’ve set my alarm with waking me up to music and it’s been great.
I’ve checked the weather.
I haven’t tried much else at this point. Any changes and I will right another review

So kudos to Amazon for this promotion! I paid $1.00 for my Echo Dot after subscribing for a free month of Prime Music, which incidentally isn't half bad itself... but the Echo Dot makes it more than worth it! This little gadget is awesome for abusing Alexa with random questions, or even just checking the weather before heading out in the morning. I couldn't be happier with this device.

reviews.reviewTitle: Always wondered if someday I'd join the "Alexa" parade...
reviews.reviewText: And I have. I now have 2 dots (one was a gift) and love being able to turn on the lights before I enter the room or turn them out as I leave. I've only used them for a couple of weeks, so I am sure that I will integrate it into life a little more. They are unobtrusive though, no one notices it sitting in the room.

Great addition to the smart home I have slowly been helping my parents build. They didn't need anything to listen to music so I though the Dot would better fit their lifestyle. The sound this little things provides though is pretty robust. They love using it to do basic stuff like turning on/off the lights and setting the thermostat. I showed them a few tricks that they can use to impress their friends.

reviews.reviewTitle: Little package, BIG Sound! Loved so much ordered two more!
reviews.reviewText: I love that this little version has a big sound. I have it sitting on my mantle and it fills my family room and adjacent kitchen with a rich sound. I wish I could turn up the volume by voice control. I use the Alexa app more than I thought I would have, I make calls from the echo dot when my cell is charging, I want one for every room!

I upgraded to the third generation version assuming the quality would be better...not so. The crisp, clear sound I had with my first Echo is missing.
The voice commands are delayed and slow, and I don't know how to reduce the base on the sound.
Amazon offered a credit for upgrading, but it may not have been the best move on my part.

I got this for my husband as an early anniversary gift. He loves music and was quite taken with the Amazon Echo 3 at my daughter’s home. He would like to be able to play it through our speakers, but doesn’t want to fuss with it. I’ve decided to get him a speaker for it for Christmas. He’s loving being able to play any music he wants at any time.

Bought this for my me and wife because we love music and she and I have several music apps on our phones. They sound remarkable on our Echo Dot. I also like that Alexa is a very fast learner too. I have my alarm set through our echo and I get weather forecasts and daily traffic reports for my commutes to work. We like it so much we bought 3 more for our children and my father in law.

I’ve only had my echo dot a few weeks. So far I love it. I haven’t learned everything she can do but am continually trying new things. My favorite thing is the shopping list. I never have to write down anything anymore. Also love using it with my Spotify. To get her to play my playlist I had to make Spotify my default player. Looking forward to learning more about it.

I returned the 2nd generation because the sound was awful when I played music, or anything else. This 3rd generation is so much better. Works great, pairs very easy with bluetooth. It's great having it on my night stand for audio books, sleep sounds, "good morning" routine for weather, news, This Day in History, and question of the day. Love it!
Worked 4 months and quit, will not connect or anything else. Amazon has some massive problems with these. I recommending do not buy. That’s for this model and any others. All are problematic.

Thank you. Yes, this product is just amazing, hears so much better than Siri on the iPhone. Rarely makes a mistake and the quality is outstanding. I don't have enough words to express what a wonderful product this is. It helped me modernize even further and took my living to the next step. Totally love it.

I've been an Alexa/Echo/Dot user for years and love how easy it is to use.
One thing both Echo & Dot took a step backwards on is the volume control. With the old models, I could get up at night and turn down the volume without turning on a light and waking my partner. I also kept my old Dot on the top of my medicine cabinet in the bathroom. I could reach up and change the volume without being able to see the top of the device. Now, I have to pull it down, look at it, press the right button, then put it back. (Yes, I could give a command, but I am listening to a book or music and I don't want to miss part of what I am listening to while Alexa listens to me.)
I realize the new buttons probably save 50 cents per device, but I'd spend the extra money to have the manual control.

reviews.reviewTitle: I love the Evho Dot and Alexa
reviews.reviewText: I love the Evho Dot and Alexa. It’s an easy to interface and affordable platform for those wishing to integrate smart home management and capabilities. I have no opinion regarding other competing options on the market, as I’ve no experience with them, but I have no complaints about Amazon Alexa and Echo Dot. They’ve only added to our quality of life and convenience.

I am an old person who used to be tech savvy but couldn't care less in my retirement. But echo is tre cool. Don't expect great sound quality but for a small speaker its good. Works well in my WiFi challenged house (plaster walls with mesh metal lathe), extender required. Absolutely love Amazon music service, asking for Judy Collins or Billy Joel as I feel the need. Next step to automate the lights in the house.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is an awesome item at a great price!
reviews.reviewText: The shipping was very fast, a lot quicker than initially quoted, and the item itself is awesome! I can't believe how fast it processes what you ask and how quickly it answers your command. And, the sound quality and volume are great! I read a review saying that it's not great to listen to music on, but I wholeheartedly disagree. It fills the room with crystal clear sound quality and great volume. If you're thinking of getting one, do it! You'll be glad you did!

Iam an apple guy ,I thought this speaker was wireless
Took outside was trying to turn on
It was all dead
I ask Siri to find info
She said really ??
Was disappointed .
I like te fact it recognizes your voice w/o pressing anything
But this is an Amazon devices
I’ll stay with my IPhone X

I love the routine features, in which I can set my morning routine by saying “Alexa, start my day” and through my pre-made selections from the app, she reports the weather, my commute info, all the news around the world, daily positivity reports, the Bible quote of the day, and then go right into my favorite music station. This has made waking up so much more enjoyable. Not only for myself, but also for my grumpy husband who is NOT a morning person! I absolutely love my Echo Dot!!

reviews.reviewTitle: I got a lemon I guess
reviews.reviewText: This is basically a voice activated speaker that can answer like 10 questions. I don't understand why it won't do any of the actual helpful things like order things, play songs that are not rated pg, give updates or anything Amazon suggests I try and say, literally not one of those has worked but the tell a joke.

Alexa, what is to say about the voice except I wish it could be changed to one that's not so irritating or annoying, all these devices are over priced for what it cost to make them in bulk.
This one seems to be alive, it starts up on it's own and the light ring blinks and tones emit from the speaker, the only reason for this I'm thinking is its updating itself. Other than this just another personal assistant..
Great to see how compatible it is with iPhone. Takes my calendar and my music and gives them to me while I get ready for work.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great sound for such a small device!
reviews.reviewText: Easy to use. Great sound quality. I am not sure that I like the idea of 'Big Brother' listening to all of my conversations, sending my words into the cloud for analysis, then sending me the information that I want. The permanence of my 'at home' conversations that exist in the cloud is strange and feels uncomfortable, but I love the convenience of the Echo Dot.

This worked well as a bluetooth speaker.
The Alexa app only recognizes my voice when I yell. It misunderstands a lot of what I say (I speak English fluently). Because this was frustrating me, I use the Echo Dot primarily as a speaker to play music.
I purchased this two months ago and it now refuses to connect to my Spotify, and sometimes glitches out when I connect it to my laptop via bluetooth, rendering it useless.

I’ve had 2 google dots for two years now. I mainly bought them because I was gifted a Chromecast, but after trying Alexa I will not buy a google assistant again. Google frustrates me, Alexa is nice and puts me in a good mood. Sound quality is good for a small speaker! Love the light ring

This is our second Echo Dot and the first 3rd Gen. The sound quality is noticeably better than the original when playing music. We like that you can play music on either device at a time, or we can choose to play on both devices at the same time by simply telling Alexa to play downstairs. In other words, you can set them up as a group which you name.

Got this to use in our master bath to listen to music while in the shower. Plays loud enough to hear over the running water and the sound quality is surprisingly clear with decent bass for it's size.

The only thing I don't like is that while you can have as many as you like in the house you can only use one at a time.

I don't know what the big deal is about the echo dot or the big one. I found this thing to be completely useless to for me because I don't have a provider. Apparently that's the only way to make Alexa work properly. It's sitting in my closet. Maybe sometime I'll try it again in a different place.

reviews.reviewTitle: Everyone needs to get a Echo Dot
reviews.reviewText: I love Alexa she exceeded my expectations and for the price I paid it was a steal. Literally if u bored u can talk back and forth with Alexa play games, set alarms, she can read out loud for u like a book or story. The sound quality out of this little device is pretty good. At night when I'm having a problem falling asleep I play gentle thunder and rain n helps me relax n goes to sleep. Now everyone in my house wants there own personal Alexa.

I received the echo dot as as a gift. The only thing I have found useful is to ask about the weather. Alexa does not seem to be well versed in pop culture items. She could not tell me which actor played Darrin Stevens first on Bewitched ( Dick York if you are now wondering) nor could she call Dr. Bombay for me. Also, bless her heart, she has a problem understanding my Southern accent. I've haven't tried asking her to define barbeque or pronouce pecan. Her answers might be fightin' words. I'll keep the echo dot around even though I'm pretty sure Alexa is trying to steal my mama's cheese biscuit recipe.

I'm finding new things every day that Alexa helps me with... and I can just tell her any song, album, artists and it starts playing. The speakers in this thing are phenomenal, it sounds great. My son whos in music publishing thought Alexa was so awesome yesterday when he visited me, I send him an Alexa last night also!

I guess I was expecting her to answer similar to Google - and she most definitely does NOT. Most times she cannot answer the question at all or gives an incorrect answer. She couldn't even tell me where we were (inside my own home). I do enjoy using it as a speaker to listen to my Amazon Music - much better than listening thru my cell phone.

reviews.reviewTitle: it was a Christmas gift for Tony my other half.
reviews.reviewText: NOTHING ITS JUST AS GOOD AS MY 2ND GEN. DOT. WE LOVE IT AND I USE MY 2ND GEN ALL THE TIME AND HIS IS FOR REMINDERS WHEN HE IS IN THE GREAT ROOM WHERE I HAVE HIS. MINE IS IN THE COMPUTER ROOM. I USE IT FOR ALL THINGS. LOVE BOTH ECHO DOT'S, AND TONY AND I HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT. i ALSO USE THEM TO PLAY EASY MUSIC FOR OUR CAT TO RELAX HIM AND HE LOVES IT ALSO.

We love the Echo Dot and Alexa. If there is any criticism, it's that Alexa cannot answer questions we think she should be able to, things that we could look up on Google ourselves if we needed to. So: The concept is super. It's very useful. Hopefully, Alexa will be programmed to be even smarter as time goes on.

The new speaker is noticeably louder yet you need to position it properly. The 2nd gen is less powerful but fits in snug spots with decent sounds, the 3rd gen... still learning placement. Microphone will pick up from FAR away... we do call it a spy (or computer) to remind humans it’s a machine, that may always listen, nobody knows... ooohhhhh.

Though there is a noticeable improvement in audio, this new version is noticeably slower responding than the previous generation. It is also less sensitive as an older unit in another room will often respond to a commamd while standing in front of the new unit. Though the new units I have sound better, all in all, I would rather have had the older unit.

This little speaker has great sound. It gets loud. It works great with Fire TV. Alexa is one of the best AI assistants. I like her better than Siri. The price is outstanding! You definitely get a bang for your buck. I plan to place these speakers all over the house while in the process of making the house smart. There are nice smart devices that work great with Alexa. I highly recommend this speaker.

reviews.reviewTitle: It does what Echo's do and sounds surprisingly good!
reviews.reviewText: We got this for our daughter's bedroom to serve as her alarm clock. We have a full size original Echo tower and a first gen Echo show. I was really surprised how good the sound is coming out of this little hockey puck. I guess they have done some acoustical magic because as good as our other much larger Echo's sound, this one hangs right in there with them.

I upgraded my bathroom Dot from the 2nd generation and it is SO much better! It is much louder, so I never have to worry about hearing my flash briefing over the shower. I had been considering getting a full size Echo for the bathroom for a while, but I like the size of the Dot since I can just Command Strip it to the wall. The sound quality is also an upgrade from the 2nd generation.

I love this device more than most of my other amazon devices. I am so excited it will work with apple music starting december 17th!!!! this made my day when i found that out. I had an echo gen 2 and this way out performs it and is way cheaper!!!! I love this so much i ordered a second one. I have sandstone and love how it looks feels and sounds. Good job amazon

I like that you can use your voice (from several feet away) to ask questions, play music, etc.
I wish I could get my local news on the echo-dot, but haven't gotten it so far. I guess since it's an Amazon product, that's probably why I can't. But I'm having a lot of fun with it. The music is nice and the echo has a great little speaker; nice sound!

I like this product for its response and the availability of info and music. I am trying to discover how to control my home theaters with Alexa. I have a 4K Fire Stick with Alexa that turns on my TV and Pioneer so I figured that my Echo Dot with Alexa should be able to do the same. What I am saying is that I am having fun exploring with it.

Keeps improving. Doing more stuff. I use it for:
Integrating with Ring Alarm
Playing Pandora through my Yamaha sound bars (Bluetooth)
Getting my news.
Checking the weather
Checking on hurricanes
Checking on my Amazon orders, "wheres my stuff"
Checking commodities prices.
Worth it for me...
Love the clock and automatic dimming. Works like the gen 2 model it replaced. Great product. Sound is good for a small speaker.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works great, rarely doesn’t know what I’m saying, and has all the information you need.
reviews.reviewText: Of course, the echo is fantastic. I absolutely recommend it. Some of my friends are even jealous that I have it lol. The speaker actually goes pretty loud. But as you can imagine sometimes it won’t understand what I say or exactly what I want. Also, I was surprised to find that it’s not wireless, it has to be plugged in to work. Oh and you can’t actually call/text anyone if they don’t have something set up with Alexa, idk it was confusing. Overall the echo is amazing and I will have it for a long time.

I like to talk to Alexa and just say something like "Alex turn the light on", sometime Alexa didn't recognize my voice or command.. Very annoying to repeat several time the same command.. But I guess she will learn more in deep my voice and the commands.. I am happy with the echo dot 3er generation.

I really enjoy this product, one of my favorite features include the routine you can set up and Alexa will start my day after using the wake up word by telling me weather, news, and then playing my radio station of choice automatically. Convenient- and although the programming makes Alexa knowledgeable- definitely needs consistent upgrades. Specific questions asked the program has difficulty with- general questions that are asked are readily defined by Alexa and much more easily answered.

Hookup was extremely easy. Looks really great. Unfortunately, after about 10 minutes of playing static poured over the music I was playing. The static was louder than the actual speaker. Not worth the buy if you're looking for a loud speaker. I was looking for a smart speaker that I could use at home and this one didn't cut it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa love you only 50% of the time
reviews.reviewText: I like this product when it turns on any light. However, if I ask for a particular genre of music. It gets confused with my previous choice and mixes the two genres. Not what I asked. I wish it was more detailed. If I want Christmas music. Then just Christmas. If I want Christian music, then just Christian. Unless, I ask for that mix. Also, it only hears you if you yell.

I like the voice quality in this dot and how it is so easy to set up. takes about 5 min and works so well. Its also fun to use and its like another person in the house with informative info at your fingertips. No more yelling to other people in the house, its an intercom system as well. a 3 story house and 2 dots on the upper floors and 1 alexa on the main floor. Music is so easy to play and she finds things in a split second. Weather, news etc all so fast.

reviews.reviewTitle: May need to add a router, to piggy back all your plugs and switches for smart home devices.
reviews.reviewText:
Very user friendly, fast shipping!
Download smart life,
Then the Alexa app.
Name your device,
Controls lights,
Sleep sounds,
Pandora,
Drop in for multi room interco,
Many more things to learn,
Reminder list and more.
Learn about 2.4 and 5ghz

reviews.reviewTitle: It just keeps getting better and better
reviews.reviewText: It just keeps getting better and better. I have an echo, a first generation Echo Dot and now this new Dot. The sound quality is very much better. I have Alexa in three rooms. Considering a third even though that room is very close to my original Echo. I love having them on hand to play news, music and answer questions.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great for listening to music and also other fun features
reviews.reviewText: I have two dots because I bought one for myself and my mom bought me one as well. I use one in my bedroom and the other in my bathroom. For a while my mom thought the dot couldn’t be used as a speaker, but it can. She does the same thing as regular size Echo. I think the regular Echo can just get louder. It’s good for a small room such as the bedroom or bathroom. If you want to use a speaker for the Living Room TV or something, my mom bought two Echos for the living room and uses it as surround sound.

I'm enjoying having alexa quite a bit, but I do find I have to yell at her to hear me a lot. I love, love, love having it connected to Pandora and just asking her to play random songs. It's great entertainment. My son talks to her like she is a real person, not sure that is a healthy thing...

The Echo Dot is pretty good, not bad with volume and quality for 20$
The only problem I have is that you need to keep it plugged in to work...
Also, if the volume is too loud on your speaker, alexa cant hear you very well.
Other than that, totally worth the buy for an at home speaker.

Great sound quality. This is so helpful if you are a mom of little ones. Being able to play music by a command of your voice when your hands are tied holding babies/cleaning is so convenient. I love using the dot to set reminders as well. My husband loves asking Alexa the score of on going spots games too.

We received the Echo Dot for a Christmas gift and absolutely LOVE it! I haven't begun to explore its capabilities yet, but the music alone is worth it. I just tell it what I want to listen to and, Bingo...I'm listening to it. I wish I had a couple more of them to keep in other rooms, although it's easy to transfer. No need for tapes and CD's anymore, so I can get rid of those and declutter.

I have an original Echo, but got tired of having to raise my voice because the Echo was so far away. Now I can talk in normal tones and get responses. I can't say much about sound quality, but the voice is very clear. I listen to music on a 7.2 stereo system, so definitely do not use Dots or Echos for music.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great device. Love having it. We have 4.
reviews.reviewText:
This is a great device and fun to use. Most wonderfully if someone (an elder, child, teen) is left home...they can still make calls out without a phone. This is huge for emergencies or “dropping in” on my wife when her phone is “on silent”.

Issues...
1) My daughter is “Alyssa”, sometimes when I’m yelling at her “Alexa” answers.

2) When I ask Alexa a question, sometimes all of the nearby rooms hear me. But, she seems to only answer in the correct room. (🤔😒 awkward!!)

3) It’s kind of weird knowing something is in the house always listening!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: So easy to operate a 5 year old can do it!
reviews.reviewText: Decent sound quality for its size and Alexas integration makes it So easy to use my 5 year old can operate it. Plays My Amazon music playlists, can play songs by singing the lyrics and Alexa will find the song and play it for you. Tells the kids bedtime stories and Jimmy Kimmel will tell you jokes if you ask. Great staple for any home. I absolutely love mine.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not worth the price or real estate it will consume.
reviews.reviewText:
Better sound than the second gen.

The plug this one comes from blocks both outlets. The device is quite a bit larger than the second gen. And it takes a different power source/adapter than the other generations. Annoying like when apple pulls that crap. So far hating this new dot.

Unhappy with the Gen 3 dots. We have 3 gen 2 and 2 gen 3. After about 1 month the gen 3 units started sounding raspy like a blown speaker or an Fm station with poor reception. The quality comes and goes but seems to get worst the longer they play. We love Alexa but no longer recommend to others especially at the Gen 3 prices

The Echo Dot is a must have! At least one if not more! I love that I can ask Alexa the weather for the day, do my shopping list, turn my lights on and off, listen to music,etc. There is so much more that it can do! Those are just a few things. The quality of the speakers amazed me for the size of the dot. I am completely satisfied with this product and have recommended to all of my friends!

Of course I should have known that the 1000 plus songs I have in my itunes library are not compatible with echo dot so if you think you can enjoy the songs you have already purchased over this glorified speaker you cannot. You can play itunes over blue tooth but you cannot use your voice to control what artists are playing. Absolutely ridiculous that these POS companies continue screwing over their customers by not having these media devices able to use one anothers music. This is going straight in the garbage,

A definite improvement over the 1st and second gen Echo Dots. It is much louder and a bit bigger than it’s predecessors. The sound quality may not be as good as what you would get from the normal sized Echo but this sized speaker works perfectly in smaller rooms. I love it.

The first thing that I noticed is the sound quality. This thing sounds great, just amazing sound quality from a tiny device. Everything else works as expected, and I'm enjoying using a number of smart plugs to operate holiday lights, lamps, etc., and just telling Alexa to turn them on or off. I've got a 2nd gen Dot also, and it's great too, but the sound quality is far superior in this newer model.

reviews.reviewTitle: Hit or miss when it comes to turning on my fire tv.
reviews.reviewText: Kind of a cool thing to have, but wont connect to my Firetv (Which was the whole reason i got the FireTv). Called amazon multiple times to figure out the issue. Nobody has been able to tell me how to get alexa to turn on and off the tv. The plug i got that goes with alexa works perfectly though, allows me to turn on and off my christmas lights with just my voice!

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect overall, except for a weird scratchy sound occasionally when listening to music
reviews.reviewText: The Echo Dot is super helpful for anything and practical for when you want to instantly listen to music on speaker, quickly make a to-do list, set a timer or alarm, etc. Finally, there is a feature called “Skills” in which one can add a bunch of different activities such as trivia games, self-help article readers, jeopardy games, and many others. These skills make the echo dot highly customizable and personal. The one complaint I have is that at random times when I am listening to Spotify the sound starts becoming really muffled and scratchy and I don’t know how to fix it. I am forced to simply turn it off for a few hours and then when i come back to the Echo Dot it goes back to normal. Perhaps it is just a bug but hopefully it will be fixed soon.

I had been fighting getting an Alexa device for months if not years, but finally decided to get this, as it was only 222 on Prime Day. It has helped immensely. Just being able to get the weather forecast when I dress made it worthwhile. And there are so many other features I have yet to try. One a day will be great.

reviews.reviewTitle: Much better sound than the generation 2 dot. :)
reviews.reviewText: I just received my first of two 3rd generation dot and the sound is superior from the dot 2nd generation by far. It remains to be seen if she is more knowlegeable than the generation 2. I get frustrated when the generation 2 keeps telling me, "I'm sorry but I don't know that one." I can't wait for my second one to get here. I bought them on a Black Friday special.

Great gadget to have around. Control all my lights with it an it my new alarm clock. Like the continual improvements and tips. Only down side is the sound quality for music. Very muffled. Mostly low and midrange and no high range. Needs tweeter bad. Clean up the sound and I'll rate 5+ stars.

reviews.reviewTitle: Amazon/Government spying on you has never been so good!
reviews.reviewText: Love this thing. Voice activation of all our smart home apps plus list management, weather reports, and talking through our ring doorbell. If you showed this to someone from 50 years ago their head would explode. Just dont say anything too incriminating because you know, big brother is listening.

My husband is fully paralyzed and uses a ventilator to breathe. No voice controlled systems have ever worked for him - including earlier versions of the Echo Dot. Today he called me on my telephone using his voice. This is the first phone call that he has made by himself in over 20 years! The more he used the system, the easier it became. He made phone calls and played his own music. Thank you so much!

Had a 2nd Gen. Replaced it with a 3rd Gen. Way more base. Can be much louder. However, quickly muffles out at higher volumes, and there's no volume normalizer so can go from quiet to really loud when switching from one thing to the next which is really abrupt. Also, more tinny sounding high notes too. Had for about 2 weeks now and not sure if I like it better or not.

Great product. Works like my other Alexas. Personally I don’t think you need to order the “big” Echo that is supposed to have better sound. This one sounds fine and is loud enough but you can also pair it with any other blue tooth comparable stereo device and/or blue tooth speaker

I really like Alexa. I was scared to buy one because I was worried that it listened to you, which it does. However, it’s worth it! My mom got one too. It entertains my little cousins because they like to ask her to play songs and get excited when she does. Alexa also has games on it. Great speaker sound as well. She helps me go hands free by controlling my Roku also. Great purchase.

So far I like everything about it. I haven't had it long enough to give it a proper review yet. Right now I'm listening to soft music on it and it's just great. I'm actually singing to it and the sound is so much better than my old one. I might get another one for my bedroom if this one keeps giving me great service.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great smart speaker in a small form factor
reviews.reviewText:
In my opinion, this the best (and also the cheapest) of the Echo products. As much as the smart features of my home to be easily controllable, I don't believe Amazon is there yet with Echo being the control center. However, the Dot offers the best value, does provide some nifty skills and provides decent sound from such a small speaker.

I regret purchasing two Echo Shows (one would have sufficed), but I don't regret owning more Dots.

Terrible purchase. Have tried for two days to get it to work with the Echo Show and the two are just bad purchases. I have already reviewed the other items and the review will not be any better. If it works by the end of the week, I will re-submit an updated review. Meanwhile, I am not a happy camper!!!!

Alexa is so helpful. Especially in the kitchen. I don’t have to run to my notebook to jot something down I need for groceries or the house. I just ask her to jot it down and I have easy access to it when I go to the store. I’d be lost without her haha! Music playlists are also great. Enjoy using this when I can.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love it, especially with smart plug
reviews.reviewText: Got it with the $0.99 deal and it has been great. I have a smart wifi plug which has Alexa enable and now I can control the lights with "Alexa, turn on the light". Pretty cool! The amazon music experience has been good with Alexa as well. Overall I'm really satisfied for now.

reviews.reviewTitle: Sorry, just terrible compared to Google home
reviews.reviewText: We basically only use this to tell us the weather, news, and some music. Google home is a far superior device in providing answers to questions and general info. Alexa will give you a canned response and just can't accurately answer a question. Very disappointing thus far.

I thought this devise would have a lot of information already installed like the google one. It does not. The google one answered way more questins and had a lot more information installed in it. Pretty much disappointed & I already gave the google one to my son, so I have a non intelligent devise.

It's the smart speaker to beat. Even with limited functions in my country (Trinidad) it's so to anything else in this price bracket.
I have a Google Home mini and it is outclassed by the Dot.
I'm a Google/Android fan and I think the Dot is a winner here. There are things Google does better such as voice recognition. But this speaker has more functions and pairs better with my other devices.

Night and day to the second generation dot in every way. The sound quality is superb in comparison. The design is so much nicer. Love everything about it. I just lower the bass in the app so there is less distortion. I feel like there is too much bass as is. I also increase the mid to half and treble to 70%. These settings work well for my listening needs.

Got 3 of these
Way better than 2nd gen. Have had some trouble with voice rec. The usual shouting to get alexa to rec me. Got one to recalibrate, one never had issues, one.is a moody teenager and won't listen to me. Sound quality is amazeballs can't wait for 4th gen sound.

I'm so glad I got in on this deal my only regret was not ordering more (not sure if I could have) I am no obsessed with my echo dot and s are my kids. The volume for music is just right for the kids not to loud but loud enough for them to jam out and I love how we cna personalize her

reviews.reviewTitle: can not connect. Finnally, Amazon help me solve the issue.
reviews.reviewText:
It's free but we can't make the connection, tried several times with the repeated error code...
too much time & effort to install a Smart Home device when it's actually NOT SMART. This is also the 2nd echo dot, the first one already dead by itself for almost the same issue - can not connect.
Update: Amazon helped me solve the issue.

I have to repeat most commands to Alexa. Even when there is no background noise I have to repeat myself sometimes. It also will randomly start saying weird stuff once in a blue moon. Probably because the TV activates the trigger words. Another thing is that Alexa is not very smart yet. She definitely doesn't know what google assistant knows.

reviews.reviewTitle: Speaker Blown with Modest Use within 90 days
reviews.reviewText:
I have three second-generation echo dots and one large echo.
The sound on the third generation was noticeably better, but shortly after owning and modest use, the speaker is now blown. Too bad

This is an amazing addition to our home. It can make you lazy real quick. You no longer have to spend a lot of time searching for answers when Alexa Echo Dot is here to help. She answers quick questions. She has a sense of humor. She's smart. She's quick. She's fun. She's easy to set up and use. She's knowledgeable and she keeps on learning.

I love my Echo Dot. It's fun, easy to use, and understands everything I say. I am also hard of hearing, but Alexa's voice is clear and volume accessible to your comfort. I'm finding out daily of new things to explore with on my Echo Dot. I recommend it to everyone of every age.

reviews.reviewTitle: It's good, but could be better
reviews.reviewText:
Generally works well and for a small speaker the sound quality is not bad, I have a larger Echo that I use more for music etc. I like that I can sync them to play the same playlist in different rooms so I don't have to carry my portable bluetooth speaker around the house anymore.
