I knocked a star off because I'm finding the Dot requires you to talk pretty loud and pretty close for it to register the wake up command - I have this on my bedside table and I would prefer not to have to raise my voice to ask it to turn the lights off when I'm only a foot or so away. Compared to the Echo, which will register my voice from across the room, the Dot has definite room for improvement.

I use this daily! For timers, for daily information such as weather or fact checking, I even use it to occasionally mess with friends and family! She's loud enough to be heard anywhere in our family of 4 house. She hasn't given us any trouble and works like she's brand new. Very responsive!

I'm just learning how powerful Alexa can be; and I've ordered a 2nd Echo Dot to add to another room. Even if the only thing I ever used "her" for was to replace a couple of old radios (which is what she has been doing for the first few days of her life here), the current discounted price made this a good deal. This is a great introduction to the power of "smart speakers" and their AI.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not as impressive as advertising makes it sound
reviews.reviewText: It is a small unit so bass was not expected to be heart pounding. Products that are Alexa certified are tough to get working consistently with it unless they are made by same company as dot. Annoying to have to say Alexa before each command even though you just asked it something it will not answer again without saying Alexa.

I gave this to my daughter-in-law for her birthday which happens to be on Christmas day. Within minutes she was playing all her favorite songs and each time I visit she has found some new thing she loves about Alexa. We have played Jeopardy, made lists, asked when our team was playing football etc. We are delighted so now I have ordered one for myself.

I personally love my new echo dot.its like having a friend that is super smart ready to help you ,by playing music ,researching ,checking the weather ,play games.its made really well and sounds good.there is a button to turn off the mic so Alexa wont record you.there is a new feature, you can now say Alexa please delete my recordings today and Alexa confirms its deleted. I am going to get more so all the rooms in my house has one.will also control smart products.i hope this review helps

Bought one as a fifth echo unit to my house. This is a much improved upgrade to the last version of the dot. The responsiveness of the mics and the quality of the speaker are 10 times better than my previous gen dots. It's acceptable for music while not as good as the echo plus or original echo. But for the Black Friday price of $24.99, I cannot complain. Wish I had bought two.

reviews.reviewTitle: You never stop learning with Alexa
reviews.reviewText: Really like the Dot. Very responsive and my wife even uses it. There is a learning curve and you have to remember the exact names given to other Alexa controlled devices. The only negative for me is the sound quality has too much base. Even making adjustments does not help much. However, my wife thinks it is fine. So what do I know. For the price, great product.

We bought our 12 year old one for Christmas and she LOVES it. We debated on buying her the kids version but with her being 12, we figured the kids one wouldn't suit her well. She plays her music, asks the weather each day before deciding what she's wearing to school and plays trivia on it when she's bored! Was by far one of her favorite gifts this year!

reviews.reviewTitle: The Dot is the perfect assistant. Wish I had waited for the version with the clock integrated.
reviews.reviewText: Love this girl. She works perfect. We play with the product dauly, and have integrated her as a device to listen to Amazon Music daily. We have her hooked up by a aux port to our receiver, and utilize her to play games, get weather, listen to music, and control our television volume.

I like this product but it has some random bugs that happen for what i use it for. I listen to Siriusxm and Spotify mostly and sometimes it just randomly can't find the channel I want to listen to or like on Spotify I'll want to listen to a specific playlist and it will only play a fraction of the songs in the playlist over and over again. I hope this gets fixed.

reviews.reviewTitle: I really like this Dot and the sound quality is really good.
reviews.reviewText: This is an upgrade from my last Echo Dot and I'm really happy with it. The sound quality is a lot better so I used this one in my bedroom/office so I can listen to music and I moved my other one downstairs. I would recommend this model to friends, family and anyone wanting this type of technology.

I really do love my echo, mostly for lists. Its so easy to make a shopping list now, and its always with me. It is really great with playing music, but it doesn't always have the original verson( which I don't fault the speaker for). I have more trouble with podcasts since a lot of mine are less popular, but the ones it does have, it doesn't want to play the particular episode I want to listen to. I ended up just connecting it to my Bluetooth and playing through my phone.

reviews.reviewTitle: Pick The Right Voice System Based on What you used the most.
reviews.reviewText:
I should have gotten the Google voice.
Alexa works great with All Amazon produce electronic's. My biggest issue is I should have got the Google one since all my music is thru Google and you can't stream Google music through Alexa. So make sure you get the product that Syncs with all your Electronic's and apps.

this is a game changer
isn't it amazing what technology can do????!!!!
i can listen to any music I can think of by genre, singer, or title.
I can set appts in my calendar, I can turn on lights, I can order things from amazon, etc
and all i have to do is plug it in and download an app!!
its amazing
daughter loved it so much I got her one

I got this with the Ring promotion, and it works as intended perfectly. Integrating it with other Alexa devices is easy, it picked them all up no troubleshooting needed. My kids are having fun with it playing music and listening to audio books and I am enjoying the ease of use arming/disarming my ring security system with the voice activation, amongst all the other neat skills it has. Thanks!

It was working fine for...3 months. Then one fine day (last week), the sound got very scratchy and Alexa wasn’t responsive anymore. I use this for my nursery brown noise and notice the scratchiness right away. Contacted customer service, got offered $15 promo to buy a new echo dot.
Waste of money!

This is the stupidest toy out there. Alexa can’t do anything unless you know exactly how to word your question. Want a lower volume? You can’t tell it to “turn down the volume.” You must say, “volume level 4.” I’m constantly changing the volume because music is loud but the Alexa voice is garbled. Totally useless piece of doo doo.

I have not had this long but so far it's interesting to say the least. It does allot in the way of answering questions playing games, giving the weather and more. The speaker for listening to music is also pretty nice considering how small it is and you can connect it to other Bluetooth speakers.
I will say that at times it will have glitches of understanding what you say but I'm guessing in time that may decrease. Very similar to Google or ciri.
It was pretty simple to set up, plug and play for the most part and it's easy to take with you and connect to another Wi-Fi too.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love my echos, but Can't stream different prime music from more than 1 device at a time
reviews.reviewText: We love our echos and have one in every room. Only downside is that you cant stream different music on prime on each device. Only 1 can stream it at any given time. You can stream from other carriers (pandora, sirrius) but for prime, only 1 device at a time. This has caused major conflicts between the kids.

This is my second Echo Dot. The first one is 2nd generation. I like this new one not only it has much better sound quality than the first one, the new design is very elegant and the gray color is much more sophisticated. I also bought the Sendleg Smart Bulbs, they are working very well with Alexa. I high recommend this device to anyone who wants to try Alexa - almost human device.

I bought 2 echoes and my brother got 2 more for our home, we live out of the US and now we find out Alexa doesn’t support any music app outside of US, specially Apple Music, I requested help by chat to Amazon but nothing was offered, even though No detail mentions that in the sale description! now I’m stuck with 4 ultra expensive Bluetooth speakers! Don’t buy if you live out of USA.

Aunque para Costa Rica, aun no tiene muchas funcionalidades, El echo me parece un gran producto,, puedo manejar mejor mi agenda, lo he programado para avisarme mis medicamentos, tomar agua cada dos horas, como despertador . Una excelente adquisicion y a muy buen precio
Actualización 1
Con las nuevas skill en español, ya puedo escuchar noticias, recetas en español. Las recetas de Costa Rica, son un éxito. Ya reconoce mi voz. Le doy 10 estrellas.

I bought this to use to listen to music while in the shower. I also bought the wall mount which is great. I like that all I have to do is ask Alexa to play my favorite music. I would recommend the dot to anyone who doesn't have a lot of room. I also have the full size echo and the dot sounds just as good. Great price also.

I bought this for my elderly mother that has trouble with dealing with three remotes to the TV. The voice recognition is great and she is able to tell Alexa what she wants to watch. She loves it because it’s so easy. She also loves having the ability to listen to music and finds she no longer uses the Bose Wave sound system I bought her. She loves Alexa!

not many things I have Alexa do that I can't do myself. Look up the weather? Play music? great speaker quality but such incredibly poor listening features it would be so much faster looking up the information myself. Alexa has such trouble understanding what is said, but the blue lights that dance with voice fluctuation show that she's always listening! Alexa can't do the simple things I ask it to do, and listens to everything I say. lack of privacy, poor voice recognition, good speakers. My dad however, loves alexa, despite the fact.

TERRIBLE QUALITY CONSTANTLY HAS CONNECTION PROBLEMS
STARTED OFF GOOD THEN COINCIDENTALLY ONCE THE WARRANTY RAN OUT
THE SOUND STARTED COMING OUT MUFFLED AND IT FAILED TO CONNECT TO MY INTERNET ALL TOGETHER
I HAVE NEVER DROPPED OR DAMAGED IT. IT IS NOT WORTH THE MONEY AT ALL DONT WASTE YOUR TIME!

I love this product. Set things in motion for the rest of my day, reads out reminders, and even motivated me to go to the gym(No joke, just Alexa to “motivate me”.)
This might be a little a bit picky but “Alexa” should be able to answer stuff like “Can you setup two alarms?” But it doesn’t,Which doesn’t make it a bad product. Some details have been overlooked, clearly.

Loooooooove my new dot. I received it for free as a promotion with SiriusXM radio. I already own an Alexa but wanted a dot for my bedroom. I couldn't be happier. I stream my radio subscription at night or a sleep sounds skill, which helps me sleep. I also enjoy the convient weather updates while deciding on attire for the day. I'm going to order another for the kitchen!

Echo . 3 has improved a lot compared to previous generations. It looks, sound really good. It’s build quality is amazing.
Physical design latest tech specs are very good, rest of the stuff is Alexa software, which is very superior than other AI in the market. I give 4 stars because it has to be plugged into power outlet all the time. It’s not mobile.

There's not much to say about this product for me, I only use it for one thing. To control the lights in my house using my voice. It does a fine job of that. It would be great if she could hold some form of conversation, but she can't. When she is able to do that, I'll bump it up to 5 stars.

I love saying, "Good Morning Alexa!" and hearing something about the history of that day. She's very funny. I asked her to bark like a dog and she did. My dogs were very confused. Haha! It was easy to set up. I love all the functions. Shopping list, Weather, Questions, Reminders, Especially timers! Great buy!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Sounds great but had a scratchy glitch I’m monitoring.
reviews.reviewText: I’ve had this for a month or so. Great sound. I had an instance of vocal scratchiness from streaming music. The other Echos around the house sounded fine but this one, was having issues. Sound level was under halfway and equalizer was all nominal/centered. It went away when I unplugged and plugged back in. We’ll see. If it happens again I’ll call Amazon and update this review.

Nice little AI device that can be placed anywhere near an electrical plug. Easy to setup as long as you have Wi-Fi and works along with all my other Echo devices. Alexa will read my kindle books, tell me the latest news and weather, and also control the smart plugs set up through out the house. Alexa does so much more than that.
It's a nice thing to have.

reviews.reviewTitle: has all the features of the original echo .. but ..
reviews.reviewText: Has all the features of the original Echo Dot, but with enhanced sound. The new sound has a fuller range... more base. This is good for music but creates a kind of muffling for voice ... so for just voice, it's a bit less clear, even if you boost the treble on the Alexa app.

My kids bought this for me for my birthday. They thought it would be a good idea to start with a simple version as I am not very technologically advanced. Great decision on their part. I have been having a lot of fun with it and look forward to using it more and more each day. Great gift!!

I'm able too turn on my lights on and off now. I'm disabled and cannot get up and down easy I cannot see in the dark so Alexa allow me to turn this on. It plays music and reads books to help me go to sleep. I can call dad if I need help. I like knowing I can get help when needed.

reviews.reviewTitle: I miss the old volume setting routine
reviews.reviewText:
The sound is good, not great. For some reason the old "Alexa, volume six" command does not work anymore. I think you have to say "Alexa, volume up (or down)" now. I just find this less intuitive than the old command.

No matter what, I am still a big fan of the Echo devices.

reviews.reviewTitle: Too smart for its own good
reviews.reviewText: The Echo Dot is an amazing piece of equipment. It’s nice to just tell Alexa to add stuff to my grocery list and never have write it down. The cool thing is, with the app on my phone, I can add things there too. Sound quality is great. Get the weather report anytime. This was a gift from one of my kids. I have to say, one of the best I got this Christmas.

I like the compact size and its a good sounding speaker. It has alot of features. It does have a few querks to it. I do wish i could change the wake name to something other then the preset ones. Also having to always start with the wake name make it feel non human. Its just that you dont always talk to others using their name with every sentence.

I love this little thing. I know a lot of people who don’t like the idea of an echo because “the mic is always on.” I don’t really care about that because I love that I can be getting ready in another room and call out for Alexa and she can here me and start playing my music. I have always used Prime music so it works great to say “Alexa play my hiphop playlist” and get the music I already have on my phone. I haven’t used it for much outside of music so i cant offer input there...but this little speaker is loud and clear as a bell. Love it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Updated Review: Thanks for the support Amazon!
reviews.reviewText: I spent several hours trying to get my echo dot device to connect to my premium Spotify account. I was super frustrated and ended up writing a 1-star review of this product. I was planning to return it but an Amazon rep reached out to me several minutes after I left my review. She patiently assisted me with doing a factory reset and helped me successfully connect my Echo Dot to Spotify. The sound quality is GREAT! I have a small apartment and this little speaker fills the entire place with sound. I also like how responsive Alexa is - I have no trouble with giving her commands or asking her questions.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great where a screen isn't needed
reviews.reviewText: These are great in places where you need to extend your smart home/Alexa commands and don't need a screen. Like if you are walking down a hallway and you need to turn on the lights to head into the garage. And then maybe you are doing something in the garage be it working out, organizing, cleaning, and you want to play some music.

reviews.reviewTitle: The Echo Dot is a great buy!
reviews.reviewText: From Mrs. S. Cook - Wow! I have 2, and have 2 more ordered for multiple rooms in my house. I love them. Not only have they made my life simpler while at home, my house is more secure while I'm away from home, and I feel safer when I arrive home, after being gone. When I'm home alone, I carry on conversations with Alexa - yes, she can carry on conversations! Just say, "Alexa, talk to me," and she will!

reviews.reviewTitle: Sometimes Alexa can turn into a "Blonde"
reviews.reviewText:
Alexa is pretty smart, fun to play with and a help when needing certain things. Her Jokes need some work, but they are still funny. Her games are fun, as I have become extremely masterful at "Song Quiz/80's decade". YES, I would highly recommend Her to all. Soon I will upgrade her to the higher model. She is very polite, extremely cordial and rather a sexy voice. It would now be hard to live without her, especially for my mornings.
The only thing I would improve is her ability to hear clearly. You must be pretty close and speak with great clarancy, otherwise she doesnt get it right sometimes. In them orning before coffee, that can hard to do. LoL
If you dont have one, buy one. If you do have one, upgrade or get another.
A True Fan, Maximus Bats Allen

reviews.reviewTitle: A much better speaker than previous generations
reviews.reviewText: I am an Alexa fan! I use Alexa units in a music group to fill my space with awesome music. However the gen1 and gen2 dots were terrible quality when compared to my larger units. This left gaps in the sound with the tinny gen1/gen2 units annoying your ear. I am happy to say the Gen3 sounds on par to the bigger units.

reviews.reviewTitle: Sound Quality is SO much better than 2nd Gen!
reviews.reviewText: We bought these to replace our echo dot 2nd gens and were not disappointed. Work as expected and sound SO much better it's crazy. Love not having to spend money on a full size echo but still have music sound good and be able to play it throughout the house across our multiple echo dots.

I got this to connect to my upstairs just so I could listen to music through my house.
It’s been an issue since I received it but tried trouble shooting instead of returning. Now apparently my warranty is up (not sure what happened to the one year, but who keeps paperwork for small purchases like this, and everything disappears on here) and it’s basically a hockey puck.
Doesn’t pick up my voice, when I play through the app, it works 30% of the time, the volume buttons don’t register...
Just more of a PITA than it was worth at all.

Oh well, it was a fun thought and now into the trash I guess!

This is the first devive I get with Alexa and let me just sau that I love it. For $22 on prime day it was totally worth the price! Reminders are great since im so forgetful and being able to change music with my voice is soooo helpful! I only wish I had gotten a second one while they were cheap.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not intuitive, does not serve a useful purpose.
reviews.reviewText: I got this Echo for free through a promotion from my homeowners insurance. I thought I could use it as a bluetooth speaker - nope. Didn't work with Apple Music. To set it up, you are required to put in your phone number, address, email address, credit cards, etc. Way too much information for Amazon to know. Then the only way to operate it is by voice command but it is not reliable. I use it as a "white noise machine" to play static, which it can barely handle. It often flashing yellow and blue lights which light up the whole bedroom for an unknown reason. I don't know what the point of this product is.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa Has Cotton in her Mouth
reviews.reviewText: The 3rd generation Alexa is not yet ready for prime time. It has more bass than the 2nd generation version (which we have). That would be a good thing if the speaker were tuned properly. But there is not a balance in the treble and midrange frequencies. So Alexa does not speak as clearly as the 2nd gen version. I tried to fix the distortion with the Alexa app but it made NO difference. The app needs to be fixed before the speaker sounds good enough. And so far the Echo has no feature advantages over the 2nd gen version to justify it's substantially higher price.

I needed it mostly to make an announcement to my hubs when I’m not home. His phone seems to lose service quite a lot and he doesn’t realize it. It works!! I am also impressed with all the skills especially the white noise. I move it to the baby’s room to help her sleep better. She seems to understand me well which is a challenge with other virtual assistants since I live in New Orleans and have a southern accent. I am pleased with my purchase.

Thank you Alexa - you showed my son there's more to life than a video game. Now we have family game night playing trivia, 21 questions and asking questions to test your knowledge. And the whole family is benefiting from "Alexa, Open Relax My Dog". Her whole personality becomes relaxed by the music.

Fun addition to our home! Very happy with the intercom ability! I did decide to turn off the ability to purchase via voice. Oh, the integration with WiFi outlets and setting up the command controls was my favorite part. I do wonder about the added WiFi radiation? I did chose to not have these near where people sleep or sit.

This my second echo product. I have an 1st generation echo that sounds great, but this little echo dot appears to have just as good of a sound as the bigger one. I also like that now I can play the same music in two places different places in the house. I have paired it with 4 sengled light bulbs and really enjoy the ability to just ask to turn on or off a light. Would definitely recommend this product.
Unless your whole home it is already connected, the product is worthless. I spent three hours trying to connect it to my web enabled TV and it still doesn’t work.

We got these to play bedtime music in our girls rooms but they work maybe half the time. We are constantly unplugging them to reset them and mess with them not working at least twice a week. Our regular Echo’s work without many issues however the dots seem to be riddled with bugs.

Need to do some tweaking 'cuz Alexa is way off on the weather. And She has become "you know who" in our house. However, if you do accidentally wake her up you can always tell her to go back to sleep. Finally someone listens to me!!!

I love this little jewel for small tasks. I thought I would use it to turn my TV on and off but found out I needed some other device. Alexa is good for weather updates, turning lights off and on and for setting alarm. I also used it to put an item in my cart on Amazon. I haven’t tried it for music purposes yet. I’m happy with my purchase.

Sounds a lot better than Gen 1, but I'm over this whole smart assistant thing. Alexa isn't improving enough to actually be useful and she doesn't have a clue what to do for most simple questions. I'm throwing them all out of my house. Don't need more people listening to my private life.

Our son gifted us with this. We have had fun discovering some of its features. Only complaint so far is listening to a local radio station voices seem to "wobble" for lack of a better word. Music sounds fine. Sometimes we have to ask twice to get it to perform. Giving it 4 stars at this time.

reviews.reviewTitle: Difficult to master, but easy to use
reviews.reviewText: I love how easy it is to access information, ask questions, play games, etc. However, in the world where user manuals are thin if they even exist, I do wish there was a dictionary telling all the possible reasons for each colored ring on the Echo Dot. The help site does provide some info, but it would be nice to have it a little more accessible. Maybe show Alexa how to tell you why the light is on? It took me a while to understand that the yellow blinking light was a notification. But overall it is very nice, I forget it's there unless I need to use it.

Once the volume goes above 5/6 the quality of sound goes down significantly. Having said that, I usually dont need to go over volume 5 so it’s not that big of a deal to me. Overall very happy with the product, got it while it was on sale as “deal of the day”.

I will be buying smart/compatable appliances to pair with the Echo Dot. Interested to see how easily things are (hopefully) able to be paired.

I have both a second and now third generation Echo Dot. I really like the 3rd generations new speaker. The sound quality is way better for listening to music. I do feel like the 2nd generation has better microphones that pick up your voice better. Definitely recommend if you want to listen to music on an Echo Dot.
Shuts off unexpectedly & doesn't respond to commands. Outside of return window but have only had month & half. Have another Echo & love it. Think I got a lemon device with this one. Can't recommend

reviews.reviewTitle: I LOVE this but with one exception...
reviews.reviewText: Even with a "flawless five-star rating" I do have one complaint. On occasion, I do have to rephrase a question and even then I still do not get the answer I want. I asked Alexa what time a business opened the following day and I was given the response of what time it closed on the present day. For weather, temperature, time (current and in others cities outside my locations timezone,) and various other relatively simple questions, this item is PERFECT. I would and have recommended people buy one.

We were given an Echo Dot for my son's graduation from high school so that he could use it in college. It was so wonderful, that my other son got one to help him get through his senior year. They have really enjoyed the many features. I am so glad that Alexa will tell them to get up in the morning :)

reviews.reviewTitle: This is a great little device with an excellent new speaker and sensitivity.
reviews.reviewText: I am sold on this newest generation Alexa Dot. The sound quality is very good and loud, the sensitivity is excellent and can be heard from another room. On sale it is 24.99 I paid full price which I still considered cheap. Great for listening to Audible books. Any problem installing, amazon will assist.

Bought this for my mother, and she just loves getting up in morning and saying...Good Morning Alexa....And all the other things you can do with her is just unbelievable. Weather, reminders, games, spelling, notifications, etc. SO MANY THINGS TO DO....We have the old one and really need to update...

I have avoided these for different reasons but a friend of mind bought me one as a gift and I absolutely love it! I use it primarily for music. My play list grows daily! The price is reasonable and with the Prime Members sale this week, I ordered 3 Echos. I'll have my music in lots of rooms now!

Love it! Bought it mainly to use for radio and podcasts in the kitchen and bedroom, but now use it for much more. It's handy for shopping and to-do lists, reminders, timers, and alarms. It was ready to set up and start using. We're still learning the correct ways to ask for what we need, so it doesn't always understand what we want.

reviews.reviewTitle: Better sound improvements, smoother, nice look.
reviews.reviewText: LOVE LOVE MY ALEXA DOT!!! We had the older ones, but when they had the promo for the Alexa with Amazon music we decided why not get the 3rd gen!! She is 5xs louder than our older ones, and the voice is so much smoother and more calming. The size is great. Love love the alexa!!

I have the ecco dot 2nd generation and that voice recognition picks up my voice better that the 3rs generation. It sounds great when playing music but it does sound as good when she is talking. I have whisper mode enabled on both of my ecco dots and the 2nd generation is still better at that. Maybe ihave a setting that i need to fix but i dont think so. I have to talk louder in order to get it to hear me.

reviews.reviewTitle: A great entertainment device for children and grand parents
reviews.reviewText: I really enjoy this device. It doesn't pick up my voice commands all the time. I just ordered a stand so hopefully it will take care of the problem. I also purchased Amazon Music which is great. I love seeing my granddaughter who is four enjoying it as well. She has Alexa play children's music and just sings and dance. I just bought a third echo because my granddaughter said we should also have another one in the spare bedroom. I just need to learn how to enjoy more things with the device.

reviews.reviewTitle: Tech help me set up and it all works great!
reviews.reviewText: I couldn't get Alexa to work. Today a technician called me and walked me through the process. Somehow we had different options that I didn't have when I was trying to set it up alone. Then we set up the plug I also bought. Everything work together, and it's really cool! Thank you Amazon Tech Guy. I'm enjoying having Alexa in the house.

Something worthy of mentioning, it's the first Echo device I purchase... The first of many.

The speaker is powerful, considering its size. Mic sensibility is amazing, sometimes I can even use it from the adjacent room. Alexa has some great "skills" (something like apps you can add to its interface). Something that I really like is that in the end you teak your assistant to be a personalized experience with the skills you add.

Adding skills to your Alexa might be a little complicated to people that are not "tech savy", but its basic usage is easy enough for anyone to enjoy it.

Great job amazon :)

This is my second echo. It is a useful tool. I have added other products in my home to connect to it. I use it for many things. I especially enjoy making my shopping list. I just tell her to add items and I can access my list from my phone. My grandchildren play with as well asking for stories and music.

I have a bit of a hearing impairment so sometimes I don’t always get what she’s saying. It’s certainly very easy to set up. I’ve added a number of skills and they are very easy to add when you find them. The difficulty is there are so many skills, it’s not easy to navigate to find ones that you might want to use.

Bought this as my boss has one for her blind dad and he loves his. I got one for our new house and we love it. My child especially my 4 year old loves that he can talk to Alexa lol. I also purchased the outlets to go in their rooms for the night lights and such. Trying to decided it we want more for Christmas lights lol.

I ordered 2 of these and my husband and I liked them so much I ordered 2 more. Now we have 2 in separate rooms downstairs and 2 in separate rooms upstairs which we can use as intercoms. We also enjoy listening to music, being able to ask questions, setting timers, checking on the latest news, getting weather updates, etc. These are definitely useful and also fun items, and not all that expensive.

reviews.reviewTitle: i definitely recommend buying this product
reviews.reviewText: i didn’t know what to think when i got this but after having it for awhile i like it as i can do all kind of things with it...you can ask alexa to turn on or off the lamp or tv or whatever you have it connected to with a smart plug..you will need a smart plug if you want elexa to control a tv or lamp or whatever...i suggest to do your homework if you are concidering of buying one or more...

reviews.reviewTitle: Do not buy if you liked the first gen dot!
reviews.reviewText: I am a minimalist traveler. I wanted a dot with a good speaker, but this one is much heavier and it has a big blocky power cube. I can't plug it into my international surge protector. I really need to go back to my old dot. I have ordered https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B004A9OWB0/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_asin_title_o00__o00_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1 I hope it works

Amazon Echo has been a fixture in our kitchen for awhile now and has been great in that location for many reasons. However, as the number of times that I found myself moving Alexa upstairs for use as a music alarm began to increase, it made sense to add an Echo Dot to the bedroom. Now I can listen to music while I read before bedtime and awaken to music in the morning! The speaker on the Dot is amazing :-)

reviews.reviewTitle: I really like this technology. Good value
reviews.reviewText: The voice recognition is very good. Used to pair with smart plugs and switches for primarily lighting. I really like that you can make calls to your contacts from a reasonable distance if for example an elderly person falls and can’t get up. Nice to be able to turn on lights without getting out of bed.

reviews.reviewTitle: 3rd gen connection drops often while 2nd gen never drops
reviews.reviewText: The 3rd gen echo is forever saying that something went wrong and drops offline and my other 2nd gen dots pick up the slack and take over... I have 4 echo shows and approx 10 2nd gen echos and none of them act up like the 3rd gen does. I haven’t opened up 3 of the new dots as the first one has been disappointing. If I keep the other 3, I will update my review once I test the rest of the units.

reviews.reviewTitle: Improved for music, not talk radio.
reviews.reviewText: I listen to talk radio in the morning while getting ready for work and I actually preferred the sound of my old Dot better than my new 3rd generation Dot for that purpose. The new 3rd generation Dot is very basey sounding, which is great for listening to music but not so much for hearing talk show voices.

First, I bought one for my disabled 94 year old mother. Then, I bought one for my granddaughter's birthday, then a kid's for my 2 great granddaughters. Finally, After using my granddaughter's while she was out of town, I got one for myself. I guess you can say that I am enthusiastic.

Echo Dot 3rd Gen is a good purchase at $25.
Great voice-activated radio. Handy for weather info, etc.
Searches for info provided by local merchants, like store hours and movie times, is spotty. Spotty too for integration with phone/computer app integration.
Commercial interruptions increase steeply with use of radio. NOT good. And it's creepy to hear ads that target your online activity (like an radio ad popup). Alexa should prominently and frequently seek approval for/opt-in for customized ads and tracking of personal activity.
Alexa needs a better set of integrated service providers and a significant Prime Membership subscription deal on an integrated subscripton services. (e.g., Audible, Spotify, etc.)

This is the first Alexa item I have owned and I love it !! I use it solely for music really. It’s been moved to my sons room since we have to listen to the same song at bedtime now. I can’t wait to have the extra money to get one for myself again . Sound quality is great for such a small speaker

It suits my needs. I'm happy with this purchase. I like that I can list my reminders, shopping lists and make calls and play music from my play list, etc. Meets my expectations. Best of all, it goes to sleep when not in use. Sometimes its been days when I don't use it but it wakes right up when I speak. I cannot wait to learn and put to use other skills.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not so easy to get started
reviews.reviewText: I received this item a week and a half ago... needless to say in a busy time before Thanksgiving. I downloaded the app and still have not been able to get it going. I will be contacting product support to troubleshoot this. I have a google home and purchased this because my daughter wanted to access prime music and I wanted to hear audible books. I hope this works out :)

I was shocked by the sound quality of this thing!! It's amazing! I keep it in the kitchen for when I'm cooking and listen to music. I love the drop in feature. The only thing I would change is to make it rechargeable instead of corded. I'd like to be able to move it around without stopping service and would love to have it on the patio with me.

Had two echo dots for 25. A piece (wow) what a great price. Placed them in the bedroom on end tables and link them in stereo! Can’t believe how wonderful they sound. You can adjust the sound just by saying a command, tell it to go off after a certain amount of time. Placed smart plugs to turn lights on and off. Love them! Now own three and will probably get some more. Great job amazon!!!

Easy install, works right away with no problems. I do wish you had an option of another wake word other than "Alexa" which wakes it from TV commercials, "Echo" which my police scanner wakes it for license checks. I'm now using the last wake word of "computer" - sounds like I'm on Star Trek deck. Overall good buy and surprisingly loud. Would definitely buy again.

Received these after a long delay. It took weeks for them to actually ship after placing my order, and then they were lost in the mail to only be found and finally delivered. Aside from the issues actually receiving my order, the product works great. It serves its purpose. My kids each have one and enjoy using them to check the weather, play their music, or to get a laugh out of Alexa.

reviews.reviewTitle: Did not want one. BUT NOW.............WOW
reviews.reviewText: Got my 1st Alexa for a gift and being polite I said thank you but didn’t want one of these. Had grandson sit it up. Was listening to the songs we had checked to listen to where to my left there was extra singing. My husband was singing along. What The wonder was is he has dementia and Parkinson’s. Does not talk very much and here he is singing loud for for him and all the words. I was sold. I now own 3 Alexa’s. It is a fantastic item to have and use. And you can ask her anything and get answers. I would give it ten stars or more. It is great

Just received my dot 3 and already don’t like it. They have reverted back to the old big box power adapter which covers to plug on a power strip. Response is not much better then 2nd gen. Amazon needs to either come out with a usb converter that will power this or a smaller power supply!!!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: My second Alexa, just a smaller body..
reviews.reviewText: What else can I say? I love Alexa. She controls my lights, tells me bedtime stories, starts my coffee in the morning and tells me the news update at the same time!! She is great, and the Dot is a great addition for additional rooms too far from the main area where her big sister is. Automate your home, you wont be sorry.

Love what all this Amazon Echo Dot can do. Lights on & off, Reminders, music, jokes, stories & etc! We have 5 of them! We put one in every room of our home & I can drop in on my husband should I need help or he needs help! hands free is awesome! Call people...its endless what Alexia can do! Love it! Thank you to Amazon and the developers of this product!

I don't know why I love this thing so much, but it truly has made my life better. I'm a college student, and my friends and I use this speaker all the time to study with the music. Alexa is awesome! if your thinking about getting one, I say you definitely should! I just wish they made an Alexa to have in your car. Great product overall, will for sure buy another soon!! Plus, It works great with Apple Music

It is an upgrade from Version 2 but on mine the voice sounds a bit muffled. Alexa does not respond as fast as my older version 2. Sometimes I have to say Alexa 2-3 times before she answers. Overall very though pleased.

Works great for large bathroom playing music while taking bath or getting ready to go out. Whats annoying is the additional Amazon Music requirement to play some songs that I can already get with my Echo installed downstairs. Sound quality is average, dont expect high fidelity, but gets the job done.

The most thing I loved about the new Echo Dot is how good is the sounds; it’s very bright and clear than the older generation. Even the volume level is being improved!

Perfectly done!

reviews.reviewTitle: New Echo dot 3d gen is of excellent quality responds well and easy to install.
reviews.reviewText: The new Echo Dot 3d gen is easy to blend with other Alexa products and the Ring doorbell 2. Extremely easy to install and can access it by voice locally or by the Alexa App from your smart phone, Very responsive and has excellent sound quality. Would highly recommend. Just say play music or ask question and Alexa is very responsive to start or stop by voice.

I love our echo dots more than I imagined I ever would and the 3rd gen is a thousand times better than the 2nd gen! The sound is much better, louder and better quality!
We use them for so many things! Reminders, timers, sleep sounds, music and my kids love to ask Alexa when they’re trying to prove one another wrong lol.

I LOVE the echo dot much more than I thought I would.. we keep ours in our kitchen and when I’m washing dishes.. it’s so convenient to play music on instead of having to dry my hands, get my phone, unlock it, pick pandora.. now I just say, “hey alexa”

There’s just one problem... every morning, my boys want to dance... to “Old Town Road” 15 thousand times.. and they know how to ask Alexa 😂

reviews.reviewTitle: Did not do what I thought it would do
reviews.reviewText:
Somehow it took over my cell phone, it stopped riging, and I had to get Amazon to release it, call 1-800-273-6239, if you have the same problem.
I have been unable to get it to provide the free music connected to my Prime account, it wants me to connect to the music for money account. I am disappointed and frustrated by it. Currently it is unplugged.

It was easy to set up to play by itself but had to call support (great help) to set up to play simultaneous with my other Echo devices. I now have 5 (Echo, Echo Plus & 3 Echo Dots) & hear my music all over the house. Love them.
I just bought a 4th Echo Dot for my workshop that works independent from the others & can listen to my Classic Country all I want.

I like that Alexa controls the lights as I enter the house.
Then when I go to bed Either I ask to turn them off or the go out through Alexa schedules I set.
I also like to play Pandora through them Its great once all turn on through the house.

I love the price and small footprint of the dot but the sound could be improved. At least for me I think they boosted the bass too much to compensate for the small speakers. The sound is a bit muddy and it can be difficult to adjust the volume to provide a pleasant sound.

Alexa. I check the time, the weather, listen to both music and audible books. I can play a trivia game, listen to a joke or add reminders. I appreciate adding to my shopping list as I check recipe or the pantry, better than searching for pen and paper. All in all, very satisfied.
Not even 24hours and this happened i had if sitting in my shelf and only god knows how this happened. The speaker is great but wtf is this

reviews.reviewTitle: No Fire TV integration with Routines
reviews.reviewText:
Was excited to get this but i have a couple issues.

1) alexa skills are limited. There's no big market for them and they can only be accessed through clunky pre programmed phrases and cannot be integrated into routines.

2) Alexa cannot integrate my Fire TV into routines

reviews.reviewTitle: Sound isn't the best... I'm not impressed.
reviews.reviewText: If you just want Alexa around for some conversation, this will work just fine. If you want to play music, I'd say pass. The sound is better than the older echo generations but still not great. Amazon needs to hire someone from Bose to get this right on the next gen one and I'll try it again. Music player - I'd Pass otherwise BUY IT!

I use Alexa to organize my hectic schedule as a student, and I find her particularly handy when writing essays and searching for words. I love her whisper response mode, Drop-in feature super useful and kind of fun, and I'm with it for the mute button. Of course she's not perfect, but she does what she was programmed to do-learn. god I just wish the cord was a little more discreet though!!!!111!! I had to coil it clumsily underneath the thing and sit it on top to hide the long obnoxious cord.

Our family loves our echo. It does a great job picking up all the voices in the house and does not have a problem understanding. The sound quality is amazing in such a small little device. The Echo has been a source of hours of entertainment for the whole family. Love how easy it was to pair to the app. With the drop in features it adds a level of security knowing I can check-in with my family anytime.

I like the look of the new echo dot but the sound is too muffled. The microphones in this aren't as good as the 2nd generation dot's. I have a 2nd gen in the dining room and this 3rd gen in the family room. I call for Alexa and the dining room heard me but not the family room? Makes no sense to me. I also have Google home minis and the 3rd gen dot's sound isn't as clear as the mini. It's just too muffled. Not sure if a software update can fix this because the equalizer doesn't really help

reviews.reviewTitle: Hockey puck wearing a winter coat and the sound is so much better
reviews.reviewText: Before I purchased this 3rd generation I read an article that said the sound was better. Well it is much better. its not a 500$ Bose speaker but the sound is so much better than the 2nd generation Dot. it also seems to pick up command requests better. SO I purchased two more to replace my other two second generation Dot's and the old ones are going upstairs.

We bought 2 of these on Prime day to accompany the Echo Show we've had for a few months. I placed on in our bedroom and the other in my wife's craft room so now we can use Alexa to do several things like listen to music and communicate with each other as well as control lighting in our home.

Due to the horrid reviews of the dot for kids, I got this one for my 9 year old. He loves the music, but the device feels really buggy— as a test, try asking your 3rd gen what 5 x 5 is, apparently basic math interpretation was re-written from gen 2, and not well, it thinks you are trying to add, then gives you the wrong addition answer, but the correct multiplication answer. I’m nitpicking, but this feels really basic to me.

I never thought I would want this, but it came with our Ring doorbell, and we love it. The kids can say, “Alexa, turn on music for kids” and jam out. Or turn on any music while doing dishes or when my hands are full/ busy in the kitchen (which seems to be always) and not feel like I have to stop what I’m doing to do the task. So far we love it!

reviews.reviewTitle: Occasionally works, but often becomes staticy
reviews.reviewText: Though it often works quite well as an Alexa device, from the second day it would often have static during audio. This is a feature that can be corrected by unplugging and plugging it back in, but it is annoying and (according to Google) a widespread problem among the third generation Dots. I returned it

reviews.reviewTitle: It’s pretty fun having Alexa around
reviews.reviewText: Alexa is pretty fun. I love how In the mornings you can greet her with a good morning, to which she’ll reply to and tell you an interesting daily fact. She has a surprising sense of humor. There are so many things you can have her help out with. One of my favorites being able to control lighting, and playing music through the house.

We have an Echo, so we decided to also get a couple of Dots. They are disappointing to say the least. The reminder volume is always way to loud, despite continually turning down the volume. Also, the command, "Alexa, stop" often has to be shouted twice when sitting only one foot away.

Love Alexa! My girls all have one in their rooms and we have one in the kitchen, shop and craft room too- love that you can “drop in” on other Alexa’s (good for telling the kids it’s time to go or reminding them to do chores. They are small but I think for the size they have a good speaker!

reviews.reviewTitle: Buy them you won't regret it
reviews.reviewText: I love our echo's I did how ever run into several complications when trying to but both on my acct since I'm a prime member. But I finally got a tech named Bryan who completely walked me thru. I wished I had got him in the beginning vs doing 2 previous chat sessions. Now that I'm able to use them both I love them.

reviews.reviewTitle: Thought Alexa was supposed to be awesome... bleh
reviews.reviewText: This equipment ended up breaking. Not able to connect to the WiFi properly. Then wasn’t able to sync with the streaming music app that I wanted to listen to. Then it started acknowledging when I asked for “google.” Clearly needs some troubleshooting. I need a replacement.

We bought the Dot (3rd gen) for our bedroom and hoped to group it to Echo. But unfortunately, we have learned the two do not group. We are disappointed with this however we are using Dot as a standalone Alexa. It is small, has nice sound and is very helpful. I need glasses to see the alarm clock - with Dot I just ask Alexa for the time!

This is my first time using a echo dot. I seriously had the worst trouble connecting it but once I got it connected now I cant get my son off of it hes having a blast asking 100 questions lol and he is playing music like crazy he even has my one year old babbling at Alexa. Lol

Our echo dot works great, plays our thunder storms when we go to bed and wakes me up for work the next day. Gives us notifications on our Amazon orders and with Amazons tech supports help we can now turn on/off the bedroom lights with voice commands. Takes very little space on the nightstand, we just love it.

I got the echo dot 3 for practical purposes, to use as speakers to play music and turn on and off lights....but really, it's tons of fun.... There are games, jokes, so much useful information. It was very easy to set up and different things linked to my Prime membership music, books, and I think could link to Apple music for various alarms...can program morning routines... my son didn't want one...and after watching interaction, he wants one too....so fun....

I can get over how much better the echo Dot is better than Google's home mini . the sound is better and voice recognition is faster and its response is more humorous and fun to toy with . we will definitely be replacing all our google minis and bace units in the house .

reviews.reviewTitle: Wonderful sound in a small package.
reviews.reviewText: We were planning to purchase another Amazon Tap to add to the two we already have. But after learning Amazon has discontinued the Tap, we read about the 3rd Gen Dot and read and watched several reviews that spoke very highly of the Dot sound quality. We're very pleased and would rate the Dot sound as approaching that in our Amazon Echos.

Thoroughly enjoy this produce. Easy to install and connect to my other devices. The Echo 3 sound is much better than the Echo 2. I have Amazon prime, so the appl is free, iHeartRadio is free as well. You can on,y connect to Dirius Radio if you have a full package, the basic radio and traffic on Sirius does not connect t with Echo 3.

I would recommend the Echo 3 for adults, perhaps the Echo 2 for young children. There’s only $10 difference in the cost of the two units while on sale through Amazon, so either purchase is good.

I really love my echo dot. It is so nice to just ask for music, news, or weather, and have her tell me. I’ve also used her to reorder items on Amazon. I got one for my teen daughter’s room. I use the drop in feature to talk to her. The speaker quality is very good. I’m very happy with my purchase. I plan to buy another one, for my bedroom, in the future.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa, How would you rate yourself????
reviews.reviewText:
I'd been kicking around the idea of joining the Borg and picking up one of these.
When I received a discount coupon from Amazon for the Dot, well at nearly half price, I couldn't resist.
It's Alexa, what can I say. We all know what it is and what it does.
Mine works as it should, the NSA, CIA, ETC can now monitor my boring ass life like the rest of us.....

I love my Echo Dot the sound is great when you really want to jam to some music the base is not all there other than that it's a great product it can hear me All the way outside all the way up the stairs too i am a mother also with an Autistic son And now he can ask alexa anything about the day he loves it too ☺️☺️☺️ It is not a beat pill but it really does the job

Everything worked well for the first couple days but now it keeps turning off. I keep having to unplug it and plug it back in to get it to work. I did appreciate the sound better than the 2nd generation and the updated look. I just wish it would continue to work. Seems like it would be a great little gadget compared to the second generation.

I have only had my Echo Dot for a day but I am already in love with Alexa. This is my first real go at using any kind of digital assistant, and laziness has never been easier. I can control my Fire TV without even having to move my dumb lazy fingers to grab the remote, I can fire up Spotify without having to dig out my phone or tablet, I can play Jeopardy, I can set alarms. The sound quality on my unit is crystal clear - I've seen a lot of complaints about that in reviews, but I haven't had that problem so far. Other than my concern that my arms may atrophy from lack of use, I have zero complaints.

That app which you need to setup the device doesn't work so you just got a paper weight. 12/17/18 update Amazon developers don't listen or are I'll equip. I had to uninstall app because is was crashing a lot now the communication section is not working again. Update 01/02/19 app still broken and I have a new note 8 amazon tech support sucks ask permission to delete my contacts and no response back

reviews.reviewTitle: Esay to setup and easy to use
reviews.reviewText: Takes up very little space. It's very easy to pair with my iPhone, network and SiriusXM. I haven't set up other connections yet, but this was so easy that I plan to purchase the outlets to connect a couple of lamps and also plan to connect to my home security system that is being installed soon.

Alexa has taken over! With 1 echo show, 1 echo, 1 echo plus and 4 echo dots I now have an Echo in every room in the house, Inquiries, music and intercom (whole house), life is good! I can control Alexa devices from anywhere, and the TV's in rooms with local only specific echo's in those rooms.

We use Alexa to add items to our shopping lists, set reminders, timers, and check weather all on a daily basis. The shopping’s list goes right to your phone app so it is convenient to reference while shopping. Alexa reminds my daughter in the mornings to grab her snack. We also use the timer function to manage screen time. For added family fun, play family trivia, call Elmo, or enable train sounds.

reviews.reviewTitle: The Echo Dot and Alexa are among my favorite things.
reviews.reviewText:
The Echo Dot has revolutionized my home and my daughter’s home as well. After I got mine, I like it so well that I bought one for her and each of the children. She claims that playing games with Alexa is bringing her closer to her children.

When I went to order I discovered that there is now a third generation Echo Dot and so I had to buy that for myself. I found that it is not compatible with the second generation however.

I got an email with the Internet address to set up Alexa the day AFTER I received it and struggled through trying to set it up. I still find this complicated and difficult to figure out. Unfortunately, I’m older and definitely NOT a techie! Maybe it makes more sense for someone with more tech skills.

I love that she'll give me tidbits from Wikipedia or a meaning of a word.

One thing I don't like: The ambient noise for sleep is a good thing, but the blinking blue light is counter-productive. That particular program should be re-written that when playing that or maybe even a bedtime story (haven't tried that one) but realize that the person is wanting to sleep so shut off the dang blinking lights.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great little addition to the house
reviews.reviewText: Got this for free when I bought some high priced Blue Tooth Headphones. My wife didn't like it a first, said someone is always listening to us, I said "so What, we are hiding anything". After a few weeks of me using it she now loves to use it to play music, ask for the weather forecast, and a thousand other things. Well worth the price, and a great addition to the household.

I have Echo in my kitchen. I have 3 dots. The thing I do not like is that we can't listen to different music on each one. My son has one in his room, I have one near my computer when I do work and now we have on in the bathroom. (its taking place of the clock radio) I would like to have it where it plays different music on each one.

reviews.reviewTitle: I didn’t think I wanted one, but...
reviews.reviewText: I didn’t think I wanted a smart device in my home, but I was wrong. The Echo Dot is incredibly helpful in all aspects of my day- it helps me with my tasks, my schedule, helps me relax with soothing music, plays my playlists from Spotify, and even plays stories and entertains with jokes. It is a device that everyone in the family can enjoy! It has so many different skills (similar to apps) that individuals and families can use for productivity, entertainment, etc. The sound quality is incredible- better than my Bluetooth speaker. It’s very user-friendly and easy to set up. Be sure to keep it away from walls or corners because that can hinder the device from picking up vocal sounds.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa is not good at umderstanding questions we ask.
reviews.reviewText:
I like the price of the device, the looks & the size, otherwise, I dislike everything else. My niece speaks perfect English, whereas I often mumble. Alexa often misunderstands herm and when it does it doesn't gove as much information as our Google Smart Assistant does. Apple's Siri is even worse. I don't have a house controlled by smart devices, so I can't evaluate Alexa. The sound
is acceptable for the small size of the unit. I thought the 3rd generation would have sounded better. The Echo Dot was a poor choice, but you don't know until you try. It's too early to determine the quality. We've had the Google device for several years, and have never had a problem.

i got the echo plus and couldn't wait to put these in the other rooms, but one just circles in blue and never set up and the other doesn't recognize much at all, i hope this gets better and the next time i mess with the one that wouldn't set up it will magically work but i doubt it. the look of them is very clean and pretty though.

I love my Eco Dots. it even plays my audio books and pauses them. I jumped from room to room listening to my audio books but I have to switch which echoed device to use it, at time it's a little confusing but I think I've got it mastered now. Can't live with out them. I wonder if I should have one in the bathroom.

We upgraded one of our dots after the toddler lost one (no, we still don't know where he put it, but we suspect the bin....watch your babies) and were blown away by how much better the sound quality is. We are an Alexa house anyway, now in the process of upgrading. Damn you Amazon, you have us, but you also have great offers so we're cool

I purchased this for my 18 year old daughter who keeps it in her room. reviews.reviewTitle: Would be 5 stars but account problems...

Purchased 4 two 3rd gen and two kids echo , 3 through Amazon would have purchased the 4th through Amazon but then it Automatically assigns the childs freetime with my Prime which only allows one parental control account so either the parents have access to my account including my credit cards , and purchase powers , or I have to manage the device . I was told by support to pay for free time and not use the cree year ruat came with the device if I wanted to separate it from my prime , which is frankly b.s poor choice in management of this issue .

reviews.reviewTitle: Great for use in Nursery Room - white noise + more
reviews.reviewText: Bought this for the babies nursery and I love it. Instead of a white noise machine. This little unit has a great response time and the voice recognition has been accurate over 99% of the time. The little speaker is sufficient for read back and radio or music, however, the option of adding wired or BT speakers is a great plus. Overall, I would recommend it.

I'm a fan of Alexa! I have the first generation model and wanted the dot for my office. The sound quality for the dot is truly impressive. The dot is a third generation model. I have Alexa connected to our security system and it's so wonderful to simply ask Alexa whatever I want, set timers, reminders, etc. Purchased one for my parents as well. They love "her".

My daughter has a hand-me-down 1st gen Dot in her room. She mostly listens to music on it. My son wanted one too so picked one up on prime day. What a huge sound difference from 1st to 3rs gen. I don’t like the size or look but man it sounds great and that’s the whole reason he wanted one.

This little speaker is the coolest thing!! Alexa will answer any question you have!! I'm addicted to this cute little thing!! I actually take mine from room to room till I can afford to get a whole lot more!! If Amazon would like to send me some of the others to try I would be more than happy to do that!!

I’m happy to say this one sounds much better then the original. It’s still great but it’s not bad. A little clearer and way less tinier sounding.

It does what it says it does, but I'm not finding it terribly useful yet. I thought it was an intercom thing for the Ring 2 doorbell it was sold with, but that doesn't appear to be the case. If I want to ask questions about the weather, etc., I can ask my tablet PC instead, which is likely to be closer by, but I hope I will eventually find a use for it.

Do not buy this! Just kidding but beware once you start noticing the ease in your life as Alexa can help with remembering you’ll want to add lights and other controls. You can get out of hand! I have lights in my house and barn she can turn off and on. I love the routines. I have morning and night routines she can become an extended helper who I teach my son with. It helps his speech as he has to speak clearly to her. He loves to dance so he asks for music, he’s 5. I have a routine for turning our turtle terrarium lights on in the morning and off at night. She even runs our Roomba... 🤷🏼‍♂️😆

So I got the one with the clock so my son can Have a clock in his room, plus with a smart bulb I can set his morning alarm to run and turn on to wake him up. Parental controls are a little tricky, wish there was more fine tune able controls but it’s an awesome machine

This old lady finally got an AI and Alexa is so much fun!! Nice to have her read my Audible books, her main job, but also tell me corny jokes or play meditation music. A beautiful little unit which looks great on my bedside table. I might have to buy more Dots for other rooms...!

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo Dot 3 an improvement over earlier Generation
reviews.reviewText: The Echo Dot three is a better version than the Gen 2 product. It's ability to hear, discern and execute voice commands is a welcome improvement. The grey fabric is also more aesthetically pleasing that the black plastic of the earlier version. The disappointing part is some industrial designer decided to make it ergonomic which means its bigger. The side wall surface is now curved outward (the previous one was straight) and it seems taller. If that's because (they think) the sound quality is improved, well I'm hear to tell you I can't tell the difference. If I want good sound, I Bluetooth link to my soundbar. Bottom line, at the discounted price of $19.95, get one, you can't go wrong. If it's 29>95 and you already have Echo and wan to augment your network, its still a good deal.

Alexa and I have been together for about a month now. She came into my life through an echo dot promotional thing with my homeowners insurance. At first, we started to talk a lot about music, although she never could quite understand any of the bands I was talking about or the albums. When I tried to use Apple Music she got a little bit controlling and would not allow me to actually play anything. I kept reenabling that music app as my default player and she kept switching it back. That was about when I had enough. I can’t just ask about weather all the time, Alexa. I need to be able to live my life how I want to live it!

I use this in our kitchen and it does the job. I rated 4 stars but the only downside to it is that I didn't know that it would cost an additional monthly fee to be able to ask "Alexa" to play a certain song. I have only used it for music "top hits" and no other features yet.

I love all my echo products and the fact that they keep improving makes them even better.

I want All audio to work. I want a networked mesh of echo audio sound system. If it can may be Bose cubes can roll over.

This version of the dot sounds much better! The speaker is good enough for a 10 x 12 room with no problem. If you want your ears to bleed, I don’t mean you ;)! It sounds so much better and listens better as well. I have a little trouble with it hearing when the roomba is doing it’s thing but other than that, it’s a great little product!

I was really hesitant when I was purchasing the Dot. I don't know what I did without it. Get yourself one. With the app on your phone, the possibilities are limitless.

reviews.reviewTitle: What it does, it does well
reviews.reviewText: This is a well designed product. It is not a replacement for Google search but it does some basic searching. We use ours extensively to manage lists for groceries, COSTCO, etc. Great for that. We also have it connected to our RING doorbell. We also use it for weather and sometimes as an alarm clock.

I discountes these because of the security of conversations. I eventually wanted one because we could play music from it. I have it connected to everything now. My thermostat, my fire TV, my Ring doorbell. It does it all. I just know I need a newer smart TV to get the full capacity now.

The most frustrating experience in a very long time.
Most skills work poorly if they work at all. Amazes me how many people were able to use this.
I guess I'm not as smart enough to set this up.
Took may hours just to connect the Phillips hue lights up. Alexa was able to find only one of my smart TV's.
I've invested way more time on this than I wanted to. If I had to do it over. I wouldn't

Set timers and bought smart bulbs. THe only I haven't figured out is how to automate Alexa to remind the kids to flush and wash.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not bad sound for an Echo Dot

Although, I did have trouble pairing it with my Bluetooth speaker either directly or through the app. I was eventually able to make that work after the Alexa App updated. The sound quality is better than that of my 2nd gen Echo Dot and would suffice for a smaller area.

reviews.reviewTitle: Can’t imagine what I was doing without it.
reviews.reviewText: I use it to control smart plugs and switches, use it to check weather, communication with family and friends, music, loud speaker for my iPhone, keep track of calendar, to do lists, shopping list, and purchase items I need, cooking timer, daily reminder, news, it’s an endless source of tools in my household.

Overall a great device. It just lags a little bit from when I give a command to it carrying it out, compared to my echo first gen and echo spot which respond immediately. It has nothing to do with distance from router. I have one dot about five feet from router, and another dot in another bedroom on same floor as my echo spot. Both echo dots lag a little. Not the end of the world.

I have a google assistant someone gave to me but wanted to try this too. I mostly use it for music so far but i like that when you ask for a specific artist, i get music by that artist. The google only plays some and then plays similar artists. It’s also easier to just say ALEXA instead of HEY GOOGLE. And i can have my Amazon shopping list with it.

I like being able to listen to music just by asking when I am unable to turn it on myself. I love asking Alexa questions particularly about calorie content as I am on a restricted diet. The weather reports are helpful but the jokes are just a little to corny. She needs to attend some comedy clubs and get a better routine.

reviews.reviewTitle: It's like having a personal assistant at all times love it

Every night I listen to thunderstorm music all night she does trivia games tells you whatever you want to know it's like having a friend LOL got it for a great price on Amazon

It’s ok for music and easy to set up and use. Probably worth the 50.00 bucks if you were to buy it but quite frankly I expected better since this is now the 3rd generation of this product.

However voice recognition works well as long as there is no background interference. With that being said I really do like this smart system.

reviews.reviewTitle: Just a few amazing things the Amazon Echo can do!
reviews.reviewText: I love the Alexa Echo 3rd generation for many reasons. You can text your Echo and have it send a message for example when you’re going to be home. You can make calls out from the Alexa. You can send announcements to other devices in your house for example: “Dinners ready”. You can drop in on the Alexa also like a call but instead of waiting for someone to answer the Alexa will automatically answer the call on any device in your house. Ask the weather, play any of your favorite music from SiriusXM, Pandora, Amazon Music, Spotify etc. You can set alarms, timers, reminders and even make a grocery list! I can even ask Alexa to have my vacuum bot start cleaning. That’s just a couple of the amazing things I’ve found my Alexa can do so far.

Rewiew is on Echo dot black (3rd gen) Both sound and recognizing my voice is better then had with previous version. Is louder and sounds overall better. Better at picking up what I say further away, even from other rooms and able to discern what I say with background noise like such as tv on. Looks better too, larger then I expected but not in a bad way.

reviews.reviewTitle: I ask Alexa about weather every morning.
reviews.reviewText:
It's good to hear about the weather before getting dressed if you don't watch TV or check weather frequently. I have alarm set on it too. When I say "Alexa stop" or "Alexa shut up", the alarm stops.

One morning I tried to stop the alarm by yelling "shut up / stop / turn off" one morning and the alarm continued and I got mad. After few hours, I realized I said "Angela" instead of Alexa...
